princesse queene elizabeth grace god queene englande france irelande defender faithe c benne greatly wished moste gracious soueraine lady god mercie hath geeuen v euer sithence first time maiesties moste happy gouernmente sutche successe al ciuile affaire sutche concorde quietnesse al estate father seldome haue seene harte like felicitie mighte thorowly haue consented profession one vndoubted truthe al willes whiche violently rente sunder farre distracted mighte fully haue ioined togeather vvil god al quarrelles contention set aparte wee might one mouthe one minde glorifie god father lorde iesus christe appeareth continual storie whole discourse holy scripture almighty god deepe iudgements secrete prouidence suffreth menne oftetimes delite darkenesse withstande gospel seeke occasion wilfully sette selues againste knowledge truthe god write moste gracious lady thintente make odious maiesties sighte daie procurer al trouble god hable euen harde vnsensible stone raise vp child vnto abraham make vessel mercie neuerthelesse paule teacheth v sutche menne haue benne time paste1 timoth haue conscience burnte hote iron speakinge maineteininge lie hypocrisieroman haue geeuen selues ouer reprobate wilful mindes haue despised vvisedome god within selues notwithstandinge sutche battailes dissension specially churche god whiche called house vnitie offensiue greeuous vnto godly therefore woorke greate hinderance vnto dewe passage gospel christe yet ende trouble hereof goddes electe recompensed abundantely greate aduantage goddes truthe mighty shal preuaile dagon shal falle downe headlonge arke darkenesse shal flee lighte fiercely mannes wisedome shal withstande glorious shal god victorie shortely discourse vnto maiestie particulare occasion hereof beginninge pleased almighty god firste entire maiesties reigne moste happy exchange meanes maiesties moste godly trauailes restoare vnto v lighte comforte gospel written published v litle booke latine tongue entitled apologie churche englande conteininge whole substance catholique faithe professed freely preached throughoute al maiesties dominion thereby al foreine nation might vnderstande consideration cause maiesties dooinges behalfe thus olde time quadratus melito iustinus martyr tertullian godly learned father vpon like occasion wel make knowen truthe god open groundes profession also put infidel silence stoppe mouthes wicked apologie beinge thus written firste latine afterwarde vpon comfortable reporte maiesties moste godly enterprise translated sundrie tongue made common moste parte al europe hath benne wel allowed liked learned godly plaine open testimony touchinge hath hitherto ought maie appeare benne anywhere openly reproued either latine otherwise either one mannes priuate writinge publique authoritie nation onely one hardinge longe sithence maiesties subiecte nowe mislikinge presente state resiante louaine hath late taken vpon againste saide apologie whole doctrine al partes publishe open confutation offer vnto maiestie wherin sheweth selfe vehemente sharpe busie findinge faultes doubteth seeke quarrelles againste v euen wee maineteine baptisme christian infantes proceeding godhedde holy ghoste faithe holy glorious trinitie general catholique profession common creede thus hath seuered selfe v beareth nowe worlde hande wee beleeue nothinge without erroure maigne grounde whole plea bishop rome euer shal like determine iudgementeconfu fol neuer erre alwaies vndoubtedly possessed goddes holy spriteconful fol b onely hande wee muste learne knowe vvil godconfuta b onely holinesse standeth vnitieconfut b safetie churche euer diuided himconfut b muste iudged heretique without obedience hope saluation yet though sufficiente vainely soothe man open erroures telleth v also sadly good earnest bishop onely bishop also kinge vnto belongeth authoritieconfut fol righte bothe swerdeset b wel temporal spiritual al kinges emperours receiue whole power handeconfu fol b ought sweare obedienceconfu fol b fealtie vnto woordes euen booke boldely dedicate vnto maiestieconfu fol b greate eie soare saithe hardinge minister antichriste see vicare christe realme placed pipinus roume loe saithe hardinge yee must needes confesse vvas diuine povver pope othervvise coulde neuer haue donne thus mutche esteemeth dishonouresconfutat fol ouerthrowes goddes patentes conueighed solemnely vnto albertus kinge romaine hardinge telleth maiestie al wel donne thintente thereby fraie kinge keepe avve reclaime minde disobedience nowconfut fol b touchinge maiesties moste noble progenitours kinges realme whereas wee oure loialtie allegiance bindeth v iustely complaine pope alexander violence tyrannie forced kinge henrie seconde surrender crowne emperial handes legate afterwarde certaine space contente selfe priuate estate greate indignation griefe louinge subiectes likewise pope innocentius thirde sturred vp noble common realme kinge iohn gaue enheritance possession al dominion vnto ludouicus frenche kinge misusinge maiesties moste deere father moste noble memorie kinge henrie eighth mutche smarte thereof yet freshe remembrance wil saie nothinge al like tyrannical iniuries iuste cause griefe hardinge shortely lighte manner thinketh sufficiente answeare thus vvhat though kinge henrie seconde vvere il entreated pope alexander harding fol b vvhat though kinge iohn vvere il entreated zelous learned pope innocentius vvhat though kinge henrie eighth vvere likevvise entreated pope time know right wel moste souer aine lady goodnesse graceous nature deliteth sutche rehearsalles neither doo make reporte hereof sutche thinges sommetimes haue benne donne thinges euen nowe time either lightely excused boldely defended sutche humble affection obedience menne open publique vvritinges teache maiesties true subiectes beare towardes natural prince shal mutche warrante honoure safetie roial estate maiestie shal sommetimes remember dishonour danger noble progenitours haue felte concerninge maiestie right kinges emperours hardinge telleth vsm harding fol b haue firste authoritie positiue lavve nation haue nomore povver people hath vvhome take temporal lurisdiction woulde saie emperours kinges haue none righte gouernmente hath pleased theire subiectes composition allowe vnto thus saithe saithe boldely god selfe neuer saideprouer per reges regnant mee authoritie kinges beare rule ouer theire subiectes christe saueour neuer saide vnto pilate lorde lieutenanteiohn thou shouldest haue povver ouer mee vvere geeuen thee aboue roman paule saide non est potestas nisi deo povver onely god yet whole studie fully bente deface authoritie maiestie al prince euen nowe one companie doubteth teache worldedorman fol pope heade kinges emperours feete like also faction saithe emperoures maiestie farre inferiour dignitie pope stanislaus chouius ch maera fol creature inferiour vnto god vvee diuise thinges malice moste graceous lady reporte truely wee finde proclaimed published daie theire vaine dangerous writinges whiche notwithstandinge woulde faine haue taken catholique doctrine maie take roote freely receiued emongest subiectes shalbe harde prince holde righte maiestie hath pleased almighty god mercie make instrumente glorie olde time made many godly noble prince refourme churche huge lothesome heape filthe rubble either b violence negligence benne throwen therefore hardinge euen selfe booke vnder certaine general threates chargeth disordred presumption example ozias wicked kingem harding fol vpon vvhom vntruely saithe god sente vengeance like abuse errours churche neuer many falles danger neuer greate priestes bishoppes neuer blinde yet doctrine maie neuer lawful prince neuer learned wise zelous goddes cause attempte manner reformation therefore thus saithe vnto maiestie al skil cunninge laboureth perswade maiesties subiectes one happily simplicitie wil beleeue godly lavves whiche maiestie plucke malice blasphemous harte b vvith sutche spitefulnesse vvoordes diuel hathe enrspired vvithal con b spiteth diuel raile reuel vvhile yee vvil yee raue crie b findes hel vvere yet let loose begate lutherians caluinistes confu b diuel comminge helle hathe carried avvaie b youre harte diuel hath made shop yee shalbe bounde hande foote vvith cordes diuels clevve diuel possesseth rideth prelate nevve gospel prelate iohn sarisburie b hovve saie yovve sir minister bishop b confusion goliathship prefa yee speake mutche ministershippes goodnesse b false sauing ministerships con b superintendenteshippes b maisterships pre masshippes hardinge confuta fol b thus wee comme within defender claspinge wring weapon hande ende strike downe harde v learninge ouerthrowe c viewe vntruthes wherewith hardinge thus chargeth aduersarie aristotle beinge asked common lier gained lieinge answeared thus telleth truthe noman wil beleeue confuta seeth almoste feeleth lie wil yee foresake schoole lieinge yee good arte lieinge b yee haue sworne belie al world wee haue taken tardie many manifeste lie beinge disposed lie woulde lie vantage b lie longe yee liste al menne doo espie lieinge b sumpe lie carteloades lie man life cannot finde one leafe without many lie lieinge felowe accidens inseparabile b make yee wil lie lie b number vntruthes vttered jewelles parte noted confuted others mee amounteth thousande odde hardinge preface reader reioinder b sarisburie good christian reader haue thought needefull thy better satisfaction geeue thee shorte viewe horrible shameful vntruthes sewe thou maiste hable iudge better reste vievve vntruthes reioinder fol b sarisburie appereth smal hope hardinge wil deale plainely reste thus maketh firste entrie cauil hardinge vntruthe cauil b sarisburie whereas mater knowen agreed vpon great olie pike quarrel vnto woorde mater meante priuate masse hardinge vntruthe knowen agreed vpon b sarisburie euery masse saithe hardinge common none priuate hardinge vntruthe saie addition whiche maketh certaine limitation b sarisburie priuate masse al priuate masse ye primitiue church whiche firste assertion hardinge vntruth saide priuate masse al priuate masse priuate taken sense b sarisburie harding article entreating accidentes breade wine c calleth thinge priuate disputed ope audience hearinge fiue hudred moe sette abroade knowledge worlde hardinge vntruthe place speake hereof iewelles fine laste article b sarisburie saithe mater neuer taught open audience priuately disputed schooles hardinge vntruthe saie otherwise b sarisburie masse sommetimes maketh sacrifice sommetime communion c hardinge vntruthe neuer saide communion masse b sarisburie sacrifice common doothe geeue priuate city liuinge deade c hardinge vntruther geeue sacrifice title b sarisburie saithe feaste therfore common thus salueth one errour wt hardinge vntruthe erroure saie comunion whiche masse feaste b sarisburie ye priestes wille woorke necromancie sorcerie reported pope hildebrande hardinge vntruthe veported graue true writer flattered emperoure time replie storie largely set beno cardinale churche rome vrspergensis saith manifestum necromanticu b sarisburie ye piestes wille poison body henrie emperoure poisoned communion breade hardinge vntruthe poisoned died otherwise replie vrspergensis saith quidam religiosus tradidit imperatori intoxicatam eucharistiam likewise saith auentinus bap egnatius supplementum chronicor raui textor carion c b sarisburie pope victor poisoned chalice hardinge vntruthe died otherwise replie died euen reade martinus polonus volaterranus matthaeus palmerius supplementu chronicorum fasciculus temporum raui textor anselmus rid massaeus cameracensis vrsperg pag b sarisburie lyra saithe many miracle wrought churche mocke people hardinge vntruthe lyra saithe vntruthe wocke people lyra replie woordes lyra plaine aliquando ecclesia fit maximum deceptio populi miraculis fictis sacerdotibus vel eis adhaeretibus propter lucrum sommetimes euen churche people shamefully deceiued feined miracle wrought either priestes el companion lukers sake daniel ca b sarisburie hierome saith dominica coena omnibus debet esse comunis hardinge vntruthe hierome authoure briefe commentary replie thes printed emonge hieromes woorkes commonly knowen name anthours name knowen fiftiene firste horrible greate lie hardinge hath aduisedly noted reioinder loste laboure proceede euen reste nowe good reader maie please thee take prouse vntruthes greate trauaile seekinge hath likewise founde apologie apologie parte cap diuis councel carthage prouided bishop shoulde called either highest bishop ye chiefe prieste hardinge sir defender yee plaie false yee taken false dice false plaie shameful falsifieinge false teachinge false sleight forginge canon lie falsehedde shame defender euer canon construed taketh place aphrica therefore cannot iustely alleged againste bishop rome replie woordes councel alleged gratian primae sedis episcopus non appelletur princeps sacerdotum vel summus sacerdos vel aliquid huiusmodi sed tantum primae sedis episcopus vniuersalis autem nec etiam romanus pontifex appelletur apologie parte cap diuis calixtus decreed consecration beinge finished al people shoulde communicate c hardinge vntruthe decree relation vnto priestes deacon subdeacon vnto people replie hardinge soone reproued euen owne doctours durandus hugo cochlaeus clichtoueus thus saie omnes olim tu sacerdotes tum laici cum sacrificante communicabant c hic vnicum hac de canonem recitabo qui calixto adscribitur apologie parte ca diuis gregorius nazianzenus saithe speakinge owne father good diligent bishop dooth serue ministerie neuer woorse married rather better hardinge vntruthe yee make manifeste lie yee vse accustomed figure pseudologia whiche lieinge plaine englishe c coulde saie bishop serueth ministerie neuer woorse rather better c replie erroure hardinges grewe ignorance nazianzenes woordes plaine meo patri mater mea data illi deo non tantum adiutrix facta est sed etiam dux princeps verbo facto que inducens illum ad re optimas c pietate non verebatur seipsam illi magistram exhibere epitaphio patris apologie parte ca diui pope liberius fauourer arian heretiques hardinge vntruthe saie liberius starke false neuer fauoured arians replie authoure hereof hierome de ecclesiasticis scriptoribus fortunatiano one hardinges owne principal doctoures saithe de liberio papa constat fuisse arianum apologie parte ca diui pope zosimus corrupted councel nice hardinge vntruthe yee belie zosimus corrupted councel nice replie matter moste plainely appeareth recordes councel aphrica apologie parte cap diuis pope iohn helde detestable opinion touchinge immortalitie soule hardinge vntruthe reporte pope iohn likewise moste false woorste marsilius ockam wrote taught openly soules luste see god vntil daie iudgemente detestable opinion immortalitie soule sutche opinion false sclaunder whiche wicked detestable maltce yee imagine deface authoritie holy see apostolique replie gerson sermone paschali pope iohn decreed soules wicked pounished ye daie laste iudgement whiche erroure vntuersitie parise condemned heresie caused pope recante concil constantien appendice primis quin imo iohannes papa dixit pertinaciter credidit anima hominis cum corpore humano mori extingui ad instar animalium brutorum dixit que mortuum semel etiam nouissimo die minime esse resurrecturum apologie parte ca diui canonistes sale pope doo mutche christe selfe doo hardinge vntruthe moste parte hereof false sclaunderous mentiris diuinitie verbe commune replie woordes moste manifeste al question excepto peccato papa potest quicquid deus ipse potest extra de translatione episcopi quanto hostien apologie parte ca diui somme haue saide pope lighte comme worlde il dooer fleeth lighte hardinge vntruthe yee hardely charged shewe saide wrote yee would founde lier many pointes yee founde already neuer wrote eloquente italian sermon set foorthe printe assured hath set foorthe nowe remaineth yee telle v saithe el confesse sclaunderous lie replie oration cornelius bishop bitonto pronounced councel tridente yee maie finde woordes papa lux venit mundum sed dilexerunt homines tenebras magi quam lucem apologie parte ca diui haue decreed prieste fornication ought remoued cure hardinge vntruthe foule lie herein menne moste shamefully haue sclaundered churche haue saide man maie appeare replie vnto beste learned canonistes appeareth farre otherwise panormitane saithe hodie ex simplici fornicatione clericus non deponitur extra de consangui affini non debet likewise solemnely noted great letter margine fornicationes causa hodie nemo est deponendus apologie parte ca diui councel chalcedon ciuile magistrate condened iij bishoppes dioscorus iuuenalis thalassius heretiques gaue iudgemente shoulde deposed hardinge vntruthe al three condemned councel wee finde mutche lesse condemned ciuile magistrate doo wee finde c vvhat impudencie vvhat licentious lieinge vvhat deceiteful dealinge replie woordes pronounced openly councel videtur nobis iustum esse eidem poenae dioscorum reuerendum episcopum alexandriae iuuenalem reuerendum episcopum hierosolymorum thalassium reuerendum episcopum caesariae cappadociae subiacere concil chalcedonen actione pag reioinder fol b b sarisburie harding healpeth forewarde litle prety false translation owne whereas written latine cum benedixisset sacta translateth thus cosecrated sacrament likewise woordes post finem orationum translateth thus donne ye praier consecration hardinge vntruthe gentle reader consider falsely iewel demeaneth selfe woordes post finem orationum thou findest al al diutision reproueth vsinge prety false translation prety grosse shamelesse kinde falsehed charge whiche saie replie next diuision therefore mater needed nothinge greate adoo apologie parte ca diui origen saithe breade whiche sanctified woorde god c hardinge vntruthe alleginge origen sir defender yee plaie accustomed false plaie corruptinge sentence falsifieinge woordes saith ille cibus ille panis replie yet origen place calleth seuen time panis therefore simple mater make sutche tragedie false plaie apologie parte ca diui augustine saithe although matestie godhedde christe euerywhere yet body wherein rose againe muste needes one place hardinge vntruthe augustine treatie hath woorde oportet woorde potest bookes haue corrupted mainteiners heresie replie gratian reportinge place augustine vseth woorde oportet thus saithe moste plaine wise corpus quo christus resurrexit vno loco esse oportet de consecr dist prima likewise saithe petrus lombardus reportinge vno loco esse oportet lib dist sunt item al peter saide oportet illum coelos capere v que ad tempora restitutionis omnium actorum trowe maineteiners heresie apologie parte ca diui olde councel carthage commaunded nothing readde congregation canonical scripture hardinge vntruthe booke ful lie falsified place olde councel newely falsified woordes vt praeter scripturas canonicas nihil ecclesia legatur sub nomine diuinarum scripturarum foloweth decree liceat etiam legi passiones martyrum cum anniuersarij dy eoru celebrantur replie obiection true albeit greatly pourpose decree cutteth al secrete vnlaweful scripture suffreth nothinge el read churche onely passion deathes martyr onely vpon martyr anniuersarie whiche one martyr onely one daie yeere nowe lette hardinge telle v howe mutche remained biside bee read churche sauinge onely canonical scripture howe thirde councel carthage bee woordes founde sommewhat plainer pregnante saide councel carthage councel hippo abbridged whiche abbridgemente decree read emogest others scripturae canonicae ecclesia legendae quae sunt praeter quas alia legantur woordes abbridged authorized saide thirde councel carthage plaine title concilij hipponensis abbreuiationes factae concilio carthaginensi tertio mistakinge whiche woordes muste needes confesse mine erroure ouersight thought councel carthage benne abbridged councel hippo maie appeare answeare booke fol whereas contrariwise councel hippo abbridged councel carthage deede parte erroure thanke dorman hathe geeuen mee occasion better consider notwithstandinge saide woordes plaine praeter quas scripturas alia non legantur apologie par cap diui canonistes date vse saie pope mutche lorde al benefice though sel bishoprikes monastery benefice spiritual promotion monie yet cannot committe simonie though would neuer faine hardinge vntruthe vvhereas written summa angelica curia romana titulus de simonia non habet locum selfe summe vseth distinction saieinge verum est ijs quae sunt simoniaca de iure positiuo solum sed non ijs quae sunt simoniaca de lure diuino vvhereby meaneth concerninge simonie whiche properly called pope lesse subiecte thereto man thus haue shamefully belied summa angelica replie hereby appeareth hardinge vnderstadeth owne summa simonia de iure positiuo meante sale bishoprikes benefice c whiche summa saithe pope maie freely selle monie without empeachemente manner simonie beter proufe whereof theodoricus saithe papa non potest committere simoniam sic tenent iuristae quia simonia excusatur per authoritatem papae de schismate inter vrban clemen lib cap saithe papa non committit simoniam recipiendo pecuni pro collatione beneficiorum shamefully wee belie summa gelica vntruthe fourthe parte chapter diuision booke touchinge vile shameful abusing franciscus dandalus gentleman venice driuen wallowe vnder ye pope table chaine like dogge reported hardinge saithe sabellicus first booke seconde decade haue answeared thought accordinge truthe sabellicus wrote decade onely enneades might appeare woorkes printed either basile heruagius otherwhere sithence vnderstande nowe extante booke sabellicus name decade set foorthe late basile coelius secundus curio vnderstande thou therefore good reader herein folowed sutche bookes sabellicus benne long abroade wel acquainted amog learned newe booke sabellicus printed afterwarde specially longe authours death coulde prophesie sutche good christian reader vntruthes many number sutche weighte hardinge thinketh selfe wel hable easily lode carteconfu fol al many many horrible blasphemous lie goddes holy name blessed wee maie truely saie paule cor tanquam seductores ecce veraces wee called deceiuers yet wee saie truthe doo warrante euery parcel writinges though nothinge therein conteined might safely iustified al respectes againste al quarrel sutche reuerence augustine iudgemente wee ought geeue onely vvoorde god nomans learninge memorie euer infinite al others acknowledge mine weakeste haue time mistaken either authoure authoure name name chapter chapter booke booke whereas allegatio pope leo steede woordes indiuiduam vnitate wrote indiuiduam trinitatem whereas steede woordes paulinus ad romanianum wrote paulinus ad augustinum saide epistle paulinus beinge mingled whole booke epistle augustine vpon like haue alleged either liberius athanasius arians euty one father doctoure sutche errours beinge bolde malice neuer hitherto accoumpted damnable beste learned haue oftentimes fallen prouse whereof easy saie yt cicero notwithstanding otherwise great learned man alleged aiax steede hector agamemnon steede vlysses eupolis steede aristophanes aristotle alleged calypso steede circe gratian allegeth aniceus anicetus ambrosius augustinus calixtus anacletus greeke latine nevve olde hippolytus allegeth apocalyps iohn steede daniel chrysostome nameth abacuk sophonias agar sara thou desirous see seueral errours proued maie please thee see mine answeare fol alleginge liberatus leaste woorde quodammodo onely erroure pourpose doo cause specially woorde bearinge place greatter weight hardinge alleginge woordes saugu psal augustine christus quodammodo ferebatur manibus suis hard answeare chalenge fol b erroure maie thought set pourpose leafte quodammodo knowinge one woorde reasted meaninge whole briefely euer like erroure shalbe found writinges wil discharge bothe clerke compositoure printer take whole vpon mee self speake thinke booke printed without erroure sutche number varietie allegation scarcely possible erroure euer shal escape doubte wil many proteste seeth harte walbe wholy againste wil yet maie menne charge others selues onely priuileged exempted al sutche danger hardinge maie remember selfe steede prophete osee confut hath alleged v noble iosua andconfuta b like ouersight hath alleged eighth booke socrates scholasticus whereas socrates neuer wrote seuen likewise also dorman allegeth seuenth booke storie theodoretus dorman fol whereas theodoretus selfe neuer wrote fiue againe fraieth al christian prince horrible example tvvoo kinges saithdorman fol ozias oza yet might easily haue learned oza poore priuate man neuer knowen kinge notwithstandinge one late litlewoorthe pamflettes confessinge ouersight herein stumbleth errouredorman requeste fol fowle first bewraieth ignorance nowe telleth v hath better remembred selfe saide oza kinge onely prophete yet yewis childe could haue tolde oza neither king prophete onely leuite let looke better bookes shal finde howe woulde either hardinge dorman shoulde thinke therefore charged ignorance errours wil creepe bitweene theire finger thei neuer watcheful heate drifte writinge minde wholy occupied fully bente substance cause easy mater somme confusion one waie disorder woorde displace number write either somme like whiche errour though light dooing yet reckeninge oftentimes greate leaue example hardinge selfe confutation apologie confut reioind fol steede luke hathe printed luke likewise reioinder reioind fol steede woordes nonlatin alphabet hath printed sente v quite contrarie nonlatin alphabet one booke newe testamente set colaine steede woordes1 corin neque scortatores regnum dei possidebunt yee shal finde erroure printed thus neque sacerdotes regnum dei possidebunt shorte hardinge selfe booke steede woordesconfut lulled sleepe erroure hath printed lulled sheepe al sutche childishe aduantages shoulde taken coulde writer escape vncontrolled thus good christian reader shorte viewe fewe vntruthes pleaseth menne calle thou maiste better weigh value substance tedious repetition hardinges often rehearsal doubling one thing hath forced mee sommetime doo like whiche thing good reader vnto thee shal seeme ouer wearisome praie thee consider occasion thereof meaninge onely doo thee good christian reader pitieth mee thy behalfe good christian reader see conscience thus assaulted daie contrarie doctrine religion specially thou haue zele folowe seeste wouldeste faine please eod knoweste howe findeste thee selfe sufficiently armed goddes holy sprite hable either discerue thy meate poison vnwinde thee selfe snares2 corin satan transfourmeth selfe angel light wicked watcheful vehemente godly falsehed oftentimes painted vewtified shineth glorious truthe thinges2 tim matthae tim iohan roman paule saithe woorke subuersion hearer meane whereof christe saithe possible bsecte god shoulde deceiued howe god knoweth owne power pusse hande god hable woorke comforte confusion force light shine darkenesse al thinges woorke vnto good vnto christe iesu falsehed neuer freashely coloured yet ende truthe wil conquere notwithstandinge god day hath amazed aduersaries gospel hath caused openly grossely laie abroade folie sight face al world noman nowe neuer ignorante thinke maie iustely excused deale nowe suttelly heretiques old time woont doo thei hide lothsomenesse errours cloke selues sheepeskinnes dissemble nothinge excuse nothing without either shame man feare god rake vp thinges buried themselues forsaken wise abhorred worlde lothed benne policie haue yeelded sommewhat haue staied reste might haue appeared somme plainenesie theire dealinges goddes iuste iudgemente wilfully withstande trutheesai shoulde geeuen ouer mainteine lie beeinge child vntruthe child wil heare lawe god trial whereof beseeche thee good reader aduisedly peruse fewe note truely taken hardinges late confutation iudge thereof thou shalt see cause let affection fantasie cause thinges seeme otherwise twoo principal groudes whole booke harding fol b first pope although maie erre personal errour owne priuate iudgement man particulare doctour owne opinion yet pope successour peter ye vicare christe earthe shepheard vniuersal churche publique judgement deliberation definitiue sentence neuer erreth neuer erred neuer erre woulde saie pope walkinge galerie one man fittinge consistorie iudgemente whiche thinge holde alphonsus de castro saithe alphons lib cap mere folie yet hardinges chiefest rather might manner saie onely grounde seconde confu fol b fol b churche rome whole onely catholique churche god euer obediente vnto muste iudged leretique twoo groundes beinge wel surely laied maie builde pleasure listeth pope better countenance estate saithe peter receiued thee beseeche thee consider indifferente iudgement harding woulde haue thee passe bitweene v firste saithe wee seeke truthereioind preface reader iij iiij iiij b ij let v onely beholde custome churche againe argumentes assegations shewe disproufe euer bringe againste thinges wee ought make smal accoumpte thereof againe would blesse mee selfe minister satan disciple antichriste goddes open professed enimie againe iewelles replie like hereticol bookes vnlawful readde order churche without special licence vtterly forebidden readde keapte vnder paine excommunication againe reioind preface iewel replie none waie wil serue throwe al fire side touching vvoorde god terrible woordes fraieth thee biddeth thee consider thinges behold knowe notconfu reioind preface reader yee prostitute scripture saith baudes doo harlottes vngodly vnlearned rascal people againe prentises light personnes rifferaffe people againe vnlearned people keapte reading scripture special prouidence god pretious stoanes throwen swine har answeare artic diui sutche regarde menne haue wel holy scripture also people god scripture resemble common harlottes vileste creature stewes people god calle vngodly rascalles rifferaffe filthy svvine thus suffereth thee reade either poore booke whereof thou shouldest iudge holy vvoorde god whereby thou mightest hable iudge onely biddeth thee folowe saie saithe al safe thus firste blindeth thine eies willeth thee looke aboute condemne thingehierony esaiam lib ca thou neuer kneweste saithe hierome isti tantam sibi assumunt authoritatem vt siue dextra doceant siue sinistra id est siue bona siue mala nolint discipulos ratione discutere sed se praecessores sequi menne take mutche vpon selues whether teache right hande lefte saie whether teache good thinges badde wil haue theire hearer learner enquire cause wherefore shoulde doo onely folowe beeing theire leader beware beseeche thee good christian reader simple eie soone beguiled course woolle yt wil take coloure desperate cause yt woordes eloquence maie smoothed deceiued remember mater aduersaries thou haste deale feace reuerence careful thine owne saluation laie downe al affection fauoure party iudge iustely shalbe alleged onlesse thou knowe thou canste iudge onlesse thou heare bothe side thou canste knowe thou like ought knowe thou likeste wise man eche thinge wil searche cause cannot iudge golde sounde insight yet maie trie poise thou canste weigh mater want learninge yet sensible grosse thou maiste feele thy finger thou maiste soone finde difference bitweene golde brasse bitweene iacob esau bitweene face visarde bitweene fuile body emptie shadowe saie thou arte settled thy beliefe thou know vaine faith faitheaugust de tempore sermon august quae ion veter testamen quaest augustine counsel good beleeu nomore christe christ hath willed thee beleeue nemo de christo credat nisi quod de se credi voluit christus likewise saithe fides stulta non prodest sed obest fonde faith hurtful dooth good hilarie saithe non minus est deum fingere quam negarehilar psal diuise fansies god horrible saie god anciente father tertullian speakinge enimies crosse christe disdeigned submitte theire willes wil god saithe thus amant ignorare tertull apologetico cum alij gaudeant cognouisse malunt nescire quod iam oderunt adeo quod nesciunt praeiudicant id esse quod si scirent odisse non possent desire ignorante whereas folkes desire knowe woulde knowe truthe bicause hate euer imagine thinge hate knewe deede thei coulde hate let reason leade thee let authoritie moue thee let truthe enforce thee vviseman saithe eccles feareth lorde wil wilful againste woorde god mercie confounde al errours geeue victorie truthe glorie holy name amen london octobris answeare certaine booke lately set foorth hardinge entituled confutation apologie churche englande title apologie apologie answeare defence churche englande briefe plaine declaration true religion professed vsed confutation hardinge whereas defender take vpon name churche englandethe de enders likened esopes asse settinge forth thereby face auctoritie muche like asse esope telleth whiche make beastes afrayed put lion skinne therewith ietted abroade terribly lion skinne lapped himthe vvonte herctiques heretiques likened ape name reputation churche chalenged heretiques grewe bodie beinge deede liuely member parte churche couer selues vnder title name churche rather begyle simple verely herein folowe wonte heretikes neuer secte heretikes hitherto whiche hath claimed accopted called church whiche cause certaine auncient father haue bene likened ape whose propertie though ape yet counterfeit men court seeme men nouatianus saithe cyprian manner ape woulde chalenge selfe auctoritie catholike churche himselfe churche contrariwise rebell churchein epist ad iubainu de haereticis baptizadis tooke vpon affirme al heretikes presumed tovpholde churche side irenaeus tertullian write heretikes made much adoo perswadede praescript haeret churche amonge selues onely feared call right beleuinge catholike churche hereticall schismaticall hilary declaringe patiently demeaned himselfe towardes arians enemiescontra constantium whome bannisshed writeth fiue yeares space while liued bannishment neuer spake wrote euill woorde themaugust contra epist parmen lib cap whiche falsely said selues churche christe synagoge antichrist donatisles whome augustine wrote muche saide christianitie quite loste gone many nation worlde remained onely aphrike churche onely therebernard cat sermo bernardes time also heretikes would called apostolikes time call themselues gospeller saide churche meane heretikes maye iudge couetinge muche seene whiche notapostolici vvhat meane heretiques chalenginge vnto name estimation churche forsooth meane none thinge father deuill meaneth goeth begile man dothe vseth policie chaunge owggly hewe put himselfe goodly shape angell light vnwittinge shewed himselfe owne forme suche euery one woulde flie none lightly woulde deceiued heretikes doo like although hate churche neuer deadly yet haue oportunitie hurte it2 cor pretende themselues churchethe estimation auctoritie church lucae matth tim ephes oseae psalm gene ignorant howe greate auctoritie churche whose gouernours christe saied heareth heareth despiseth despiseth againe tell churche consider credite churche christen people howe staye themselues beinge pillour grounde truthe howe loue euen common mother howe honour body fulnes christe spouse christe faithe accordinge written despouse thee faithe true syon whiche lorde hath chosen habitation restinge place euer safe arke keepe v drowninge dangerous sea worlde whiche nolesse arke noe nosaluation againe know churche must needes greatly esteemed amonge godly singular promiser christe hath made would day ende worlde would pray father holy ghost giuen spirite truthe remaine withit euer heretikes impugne lawe woordes lawein comment epist ad tir cap ambrose saithe ouer throwe churche presume take vnto name churche doo vrged wroonge force argumentes straighted driuen walle plainely proued face whiche sone done churche specially beinge heresie openly denouncedthe vvonte gospeller excommunicate church iust excommunication cutte churche case practise gospeller vtterly sette churche taught hote raging spirite defie saye themselues catholike churche catholikes papisticall churche churche antichrist deune theeues tell answeare bishop sarisburie answeare hardinge euery parcel booke beinge longe would tedious wherefore leauinge many impertinent speaches vnnecessarie waste woordes whiche sundrie frendes thinke might better haue spared wil touche onely mutche thereof shal beare somme shewe substance may way seeme woorthy answeared firste touchynge churche god beleue confesse al hardinge hath saide1 timot ephes otherwise saide piller truthe body fulnesse spouse christe al woordes vndoubtedly true certaine therefore hardinge blamewoorthy house god beyng glorious haue made caue theeues haue turned beutie sion confusion babylon true heretiques haue euermore apparelled selues name churche antichriste also shal procure selfe credite vnder name christe thus father harding loge agoe saide euen say nowiohan hierem hierem child abraham euheretours goddes promise haue temple god temple god lawe shal neuer passe fro prieste counsel wise woorde prophete thus coutinuinge wilfully open breache goddes commaundement neuerthelesse chearished selues doo nowe onely bare title churche whose name euer credit ye wise winne meaninge skilfully conueigh ouer wholy churche rome churche onely churche godde maior obedi vnam sanctam dist omnes without hope saluation therefore defende holde trueth churche hath authoritie aboue goddes woorde pope nicolas saithe denieth priuilege supremacie see rome hath renounced faithe heretique thus leo saitheleo epist ad palaestinos ecclesiae nomine armamini contra ecclesiam dimicatis ye arme selues name churche yet ye fight churche likewise saithe cypriancypri de simplicitate praela diabolus excogitauit nouam fraudem vt sub ipso nominis christiani titulo fallat incautos diuel hath diuised new kinde policie vnder title name christe deceiue simple nowe concerninge hote raginge sprite wherewith hardinge saithe gospeller deste churche set naught verily thinke harde matter gospeller neuer hote suche kinde eloquence matche hardinge neither yet maye wel condemne al suche like case haue bene hoteesa matth matthae iohan earnest esay prophete saithe ye prince sodome ye people gomorrha iohn baptist saithe scribe phariseis ye serpentes ye generation viper adder christe saithe vnto woe vnto ye scribe phariseis ye hypocrite ye father diuel eramples wee see sprite god sometimes hote earnest deceiuers people professed enimies crosse christe neither either esay prophete iohn baptiste christe desie churche god set naught hardinge imagineth v rather seruent speaches vttered vehement zele iuste griefe conceiued vnder name churche abused goddes people defaced churche al heretiques hardinge daie espie grosse palpable errours mourne god reformation augustine saithe non debet ouis pellem suam deponere august lib de sermon dom monte qu lupi aliquando se ea contegant reason sheepe therefore leaue fliese seeth woulfe sometime apparel likewise reason wee therfore geue ouer right enheritance wee haue churche god intrusion vniuste meanes haue intituled selues vnto sameiohan behooueth v rather searche scripture christe hath aduised v thereby assure selues churche god trial onely none maye knowenephe therfore paule calleth churche spouse christe ought al thinges geue eare voice bridegroom likewise calleth churche piller truthe1 timo shee staieth selfe onely woorde god without whiche woorde churche neuer bewtiful churcheirenae lib cap ancient father irenaeus saithe columna firmamentum ecclesiae est euangelium spritus vitae piller buttresse churche gospel august de vnita eccle cap sprite life augustine saithe sunt certi libri dominici quorum authoritari vtrique consentimus ibi quaeramus ecclesiam ibi discutiamus causam nostram certaine bookes lorde vnto authoritie whereof eche parte agreethe let v seeke churche thereby sette v examine trie mater againeaugust eode cap nolo humanis documentis sed diuinis oraculis sanctam ecclesiam demo strari wil ye shewe holy churche decree menne woorde god chrysostom opere imperfecto homi chrysostom eadem homilia likewise saithe chrysostome nullo modo cognoscitur quae sit vera ecclesia christi nisi tantummodo per scripturas waye knowen churche onely scripture againe christus mandat vt volentes firmitatem accipere verae fidei ad nullam rem fugiant nisi ad scripturas alioqui si ad alia respexerint scandalizabuntur peribunt non intelligentes quae sit vera ecclesia et per hoc incident abominatione desolationis quae stat locis sanctis ecclesiae christe commaundeth wil haue assurance true faithe seeke nothinge el vnto scripture otherwise looke thinge el shalbe offended shal perishe vnderstanding daniel matth whiche true churche meane shal fal abomination desolation whiche standeth holy place churche ancient learned father plaine churche god knowen godde woorde onely none otherwise therfore hardinge carefully flee condemne heresie often burne leste thereby deformity youre churche knoweniohan il dooer fleeth light nowe wel liketh hardinge cal v al heretiques pleasure sake liken v ape ass diuel notwithstanding might safely returne whole whence came yet thinke seemely greatly purpose answeare al suche intemperate humour salomon aduise goodprouerb answeare folie like folie notwithstandinge poore simple asse vnto whome wee compared hable sometime see angel godnumer open mouthe speake reproue lewde attempte balaam false prophete euer accoumpt pleaseth hardinge make v grace god wee wee yf wee hable beare christe crosse sufficient haue longe time ietted terribly vnder lion skinne onely painted visarde emptie name churche haue feared al cattel fielde needelesse speake worlde seeth longer dissembled euen lately bare selfe lion tribe iuda called selfeaugustinus steuchus de primatu kinge kinges andsee fifthe parte hereof cap diuision said power ouer angel god amased harte simple terrour lion pelte onely sate peter chaire reuefled better knowen esteemed woorthy may nowe iette vp downe ease lesse terrour poore ass whome hardinge muche disdeigneth haue stripte counterfeite skinne made hardy haue caused appeare euen apologie cap diuision hath bene olde complainte euen first time patriarkes prophetes confirmed writinges testimony euery age truthe wandereth straunger worldetertull apologetico dothe readily finde enimies sclaunderers amongst knowe albeit perchaunce may seeme vnto thinge harde beleeued meane suche haue scante wel narowly taken heede thereunto specially seing al mankinde nature motion without teacher doth coueite truthe owne accorde seinge saueour christe self earth would called truthe name moste fitte expresse al diuine power yet whiche haue bene exercised holy scripture whiche haue reade seene hath happened al godly menne commonly al time prophetes apostle holy martyres christe selfe rebuke reuilinges despite continually vexed while liued onely truthes sake wee saye doo see onely newe thinge harde beleued thinge already receiued commonly vsed age age nay truely might seeme muche rather merueileiohan beyonde al beliefe diuel father lie enimie al truthe would vpon suddaine chaunge nature hope truthe might otherwise suppressed belieinge would beginn establish owne kingdome vsinge nowe practises whiche hath euer vsed beginninge since man remembrance skante finde one time either religion first growe setled afreshe springe vp againe wherein truthe innocencie al vnwoorthy meanes despitefully intreated doubtlesse diuel wel seeth longe truthe good safetie selfe cannot safe yet maintaine owne estate letting passe auncient patriarkes prophetes haue said parte life free cotumelies sclaunders knowe certaine time paste whiche saide commonly preachedcornel tacit olde auncient iewes whome make doubte woorshippers onely true god worship either sowe asse goddes steede al religion nothinge el sacrilege plaine contempt al godlines know also sonne god saueour iesus christe taught truth coumpted sorcerer enchaunter samaritane beelzebub deceiur people drunkarde glutton againe woteth woordes spoken paule moste earnest vehement preacher maintainer truthe sometime seditious busie man raiser tumultes causer rebellion sometime againe heretique sometime mad sometime onely vpon strife stomake bothe blasphemer god lawe despiser father ordinance knoweth steuin throughly sincerely embraced truthe beganne frankly stoutly preache set forth ought doo immediately called answeare life one wickedly vttered disdainful haynous woordes lawe moyses temple god ignorant time past whiche reproued holy scripture falsehed sayinge conteined thinges bothe contrary quite one othermarion ex tertul howe apostle christe seuerally disagree betwixt selues paule varie alaelius e lactas make rehersal al endles laboureuseb li c knoweth sorte father railed vpon time pastetertul apologe whiche first began acknowledge professe name christe made priuate conspiracy deuised secrete counsel common wealth ende made early priuie meetinges darke killed yonge babe fedde selues men fleashe like sauage brute beastes drinke bloude conclusion put candels comitted adulterie betwene selues without regarde wrought incest one brethern laie sister sonnes mother without reuerence nature kinne without shame without difference wicked men without al care religion without opinion god enimies mankinde vnwoorthy suffered worlde vnwoorthy life al thinges spoken day people god christe iesus paule steuin al whosoeuer whiche firste beginninge imbraced truthe gospel contented called name christian whiche hateful name amonge common peopletertull apolo cap although thinges whiche saide true yet diuel thought sufficient least coulde bringe passe might beleued true christian might brought common hatred euery bodie haue death destruction sought al sortes herevpon kinges prince beinge ledde suche persuasion killed al prophetes god lettinge none escape esay sawe ieremie stone daniel lion amos iron barre paule swerde christe vpon crosse co demned al christian imprisonmentes tormentes pike throwne downe headlong fro rockes steepe placessuetonius tra quil nerone cast wilde beastes burnt made great fiers theyr quicke body onely purpose giue light night scorne mockynge stocke compte better vilest filthe ofscouringes laughinge game whole worlde thus ye see haue authours professours truthe euer bene entreated hardinge would thinke defender true men beginninge apologie speake muche truthe yet knoweth oftentimes euil meaninge hidde vnder good woordes hath hearde filthy queanes time place vse honest talke chaste matrones theefe commendeth iuste dealinges many time shewithe stomake false harlottes1 corinth noman amonge al none pretende truthe wordes muche heretiques feare saithe paule lest serpente beguiled eue sutteltie wittes corrupted fallen away plainenes whiche christe apostle feared craftie iewes rather deceiue mingled scripture owne tradition truthe fals head bringeth heretique hearer errour faithe coloure pretence truthe muche like manicheisde vtilita credendi ad honoratu lib ca cofess li ca matth promised hearer discusse set forthe truthe moste euidently vnto deliuer maner errours whiche faire promise augustine allured diligent scholar space nine yeres christe gaue v lesson howe discerne fruites ye shall knowe saithe nowe sir euen beginninge may saie foreheade apologie while examine diligently finde two foule faultes one rhetorike logike whiche two faultes bothe vns kil secretarie weakenes mater maie espied asse spake right nowe two eares staringe vnder lion skinne diuinitie nothinge el grosse lumpe lie errours heresy first touching rhetorike emongst many faultie proemes one woorst suche aduersary may vse whiche called exordium commune wite suche beginninge serue defendant lesse plaintife contrariwise sorte beginninge apologie declaringe large truthe hath euer beene persecuted saithe therein faultes amended may saie shipmaister accoumpted bad settinge hauen driueth ship rockes alleaginge tertullian healpe cause ye iniurie doctor alteringe wordes ye wise falsifiyng first sentence muche impaire credite tertullian saith truthe readily findeth enimies sclaunderers amongst knowe truthe sone findeth enimies inter extraneos amongst aliantes stranger christian catholikes ye call papistes respecte truthe aliantes stranger selues sundry place booke reproue resistinge truthe whiche knowe haue geuen tertullian newe liuerie owne badge haue made exchaunge extraneos ignotos tertullian meante aliantes infidel paynimes emonge christen people liued daily persecuted gospel benne sounded abrode apostle successours al earth emperours selues people euery receiued faithe truthe wanderer stranger pilgrime earthe bishop sarisburie touchinge comparison whoores theeues like hardinges vngentle speech haue protested wil saye nothinge doumbe speake litle cannot speake true hardinge saie lyers oftentimes pretende truthe none example maye soone appeare whole tenour substance bookes diuel selfe better founde lye beareth selfe oftentimes angel truthe example2 corinth ye bringe iewes saie rather deceiue mingled scripture owne tradition truthe falsehed maketh moste plainely selfe knowe general compiainte al godly daye throughout whole churche godmatth hierem haue mingled leade lordes goulde haue filled lordes haruest ful darnel haue broken goddes manifest comaundementes vpholde mainteine owne tradition haue damned vp springes water lifehierem haue broken vp puddle owne2 corinth suche hable holde water dreames sake haue caused people forgeat name god haue ledde simplicitie christ iesu mingling tradition scripture god marueile ye coulde freely vtter muche directly selfe example manicheis vtterly impertinent purpose yet good reader thou maiste vnderstande manner heretiques theise manicheis errours defended first thy forebade lawful mariage allowed fornication hardingessee answeared fourth pare herof ca di catholiques doo nowe saith augustine themin quaest nouum testam quae nuptiarum aditus intercludunt promiscu conuenire hortantur leo serm de quadragesima secondly receiued ministred holy mystery vnder one kinde contrary general order catholique churche doeth harding nowaug epist thirdly yelded credite owne diuises goddes holy woordeaugust con faustum lib cap scripture plaine saide euen asm hardinge fol b hardinge saithe scripture falsified ful errours augu de morib mantchae lib cap peregrinas exquisitas f uges multis ferculis variatas fourthly abstained fleashe yet faste vsed al manner delicate strange fruites sundrie sortes spice greate abundanceaug de morib manichae lib cap absteined wine yet vsed liquours deintie pretious wine thereof dranke belly would holde augustine woordes thereof distenti et crepantes leaue ye rest nowe iudge thou gentle reader whether partie seemeth best resemble manichets whereas thus vpbraideth v fruites ye shal knowe verily while bishop rome euen cittie rome mainteineth house ribaudrie open stewes hardinge ready hable eloquence diuinitie defende haue iuste cause greatly boaste selues fruites howe maye thought christ gaue v lesson thereby trie true doctrine false true professour hypocrite otherwise liues muste tried gospel gospel liues nowe let v examine horrible heresie hardinge hathe espied rule rhetorique whiche saithe secretary vnskil betraied euen foreheade booke entrie saithe hardinge touchinge complainte truthe indifferent common bothe party either maie vse wel whiche kinde beginninge saithe called exordium commune learned rhetorique misliked faultie first al hardinge seemeth strange kinde beginninge deepe disputation diuinitie make first quarrel vnto rhetorique bilike lacke better entrie ye thought good rushe might deede either v maie seeme stande defence truthe denie haue substance truthe selfe contente claime name far forthe truthe common v botheorigen contra celsum li lib wicked heathen celsus antiphon notwithstandinge published bookes truthe yet entituled nonlatin alphabet booke truthe hierome saithe mendacium semper imitatur veritatem falshed euermore beareth shewe truthe sorte truthe common either partieorigen matthae tract origen saithe veritas christus simulata veritas antichristus christ truth selfe antichrist truth countrefeite al notwithstandinge christ refused vse kinde entrie hardinge muche mistikethiohan roman saide vnto phariseis ye seeke minder man haue tolde truthe paule romaine saithe haue turned truthe god falshed like might saie tertullian cyprian father yet trowe hardinge wil therfore reproue either christ paule tertullian cyprian saie vsed suche beginninge aduersaries might haue vsed wel forgotten rule rhetorique lothe longe stande light mater marueile mutche harding great artificer smal case better eie owne entrie writing defence truthe faulte rhetorique beginne il intreatinge coplainte truthe may thinke defence manifest knowen errour beginne hardinge dooth whoores theeues ape ass child diuel many like vnseemely scoffes scornes rhetorique eloquence arte skil oratour euer vsed rhetorician sophiste greeke latine euer taught verily sometime accoupted old rule rhetorique seemeth hardinge quite forgottencic de orator lib scurrilis oratori dicacitas magnopere fugienda est secretary beginninge hardinges owne confession sutche either partie indifferently might wel haue vsed hardinges beginninge sutche neither partie modestie might haue vsed hardinge also might haue remembred skilful rhetorique mislike exordium commune cicer lib de inuentione argumentum co mune vitiosum est also mislike commune argumentum reason proufe common may indifferently serue bothe party whiche kinde proufes hardinge woulde haue weeded bookes haue lefte litle trouble printer saithe grosse apologie nothing el lumpe lye truthe therof trust shal appeare treatie meane season good christian reader may please thee consider hardinges mouth iuste measure behalfe men thinke wil oftentimes vtter vntruthe without measure saithe haue falsified tertullian meaninge placinge woorde ignotos steede extraneos pleasure makinge exchange woordes geuinge olde father newe liuerie thereby empairinge whole credite greate outcrie smal matter greate exchange woordes nothinge haynous pretended bothe ignotus extraneus extraneus also tertullian meaninge ignotus hardinge wel knoweth tertullian speaketh namely onely suche alien stranger knewe truthe god whether two woordes shal like leaue v sense al one forceth nothing wil needes refuse woorde ignotus yt receiue woorde extraneus graunte felowes stranger goddes truthe shalbe sufficiente howe addeth farther side nowe stranger knowe god deare frendes kinsfolke euen saide phariseis seluesiohan nunquid no coeci sumus blinde christe answeared yf ye blinde ye sinne ye say ye see therefor sinne remaineth stil iohan matthae againe come iudgemente worlde see maie made blinde againe child kingdome shalbe throwen foorthe vtter darknesse yet hardinge saithe gospel benne sounded abroade apostle theire successours truthe nomore stranger pilgrime earth whereby woulde closely conclude churche rome neuer erre vaine paradisedaniel chrysost opere imperfecto homi august de c uita dei li cap de ciuit li cap daniel speakinge later day saithe veritus prosternetur erra truthe shal ouerthrowen earthe chrysostome saithe abornihatio desolationis stabit sanctis locis ecclesiae abomination desolation shal stande holy place churche augustine saithe vsque ad huius eculi finem inter persecutiones mundi consolationes dei peregtinando procurrit ecclesia vntil worldes ende churche goeth foreward pilgrimage bytweene persecution worlde comfortes god againe tota ciuitas dei peregrinatur terris whole cittie god churche stranger pilgrime earthe verily longe satan prince darkenesse prince world longe truthe god passeth world stranger beinge emonge stranger tertullian saithe easily findeth enimies intreatedtertullian apologetico saithe caeterum vnum hoc gestit ne ignorata damnetur onely thinge truthe desireth noman condemne knowe apologie cap diuision wherfore ought beare quietly whiche haue taken vpon v professe gospel christe cause handled sorte forefather longe agoe likewise daye tormented baited raylinges spiteful dealinges lie desert owne onely bicause teache acknowledge truthe hardinge blessed folowers patriarkes prophetes apostle martires christe selfe suffer much persecution innocencie hauinge deserued nothinge onely bicause ye acknowledge teache truthe sir leaue foloweth vvherfore former common place largely treated fowle faulte whiche make logike howe proue ye argument truthe persecuted professours truthe haue euer bene euill treated wherefore wee ought beare quietly beinge likewise handled cause c make argument whiche ye seeme priuely make leauinge minor professours truthe persecuted truthes sake wee professours truthe therefore suffer persecution truthes sake yf ye saye thus embarre conclusion deniynge minor whiche ye neuer proue ye reason thus whiche waye also ye seeme vse professours truthe suffer persecution vvee suffer persecution ergo wee professours truthe vve graunt minor true argument naught might heretikes saye argument proue selues right beleuers vvherefore vntil ye proue ye succede patriarkes prophetes apostle martyr christe himselfe professinge truthe boast ye doo forefather whome ye name proeme hus vviklese peter bruse berengarius vvaldenses albingenses donatistes ae ians manichee suche like heretikes iustly condemned churche forefather b sarisburie hardinge pretendeth logique endeth sophistrie argument wee make wherewith playeth pleasantly founded vpon woordes christematth iohan scholare aboue maister seruant aboue lorde haue persecuted wil persecute al thinges shal doo vnto name sake bicause knowe neither father minor wee succede apostle martyr professours truthe whiche minor hardinges iudgement neuer proue goddes holy name blessed euer greatest parte christendome daye seeth minor true bothe professours goddes knowen truthe professours manifest salsehed touchinge donatistes manichee al like condemned heretiques heresy vtterly abhorre euen gate hel iohn wicklese iohn husse valdo reste ought wee knowe beleue settinge malice aside ought know godly mennealphonsus de haeresibus theire greatest heresie complained dissolute vitious liues cleregie woorshippinge image offeined miracle tyranical pride pope monkes freeres partans pilgrimagesbartholomae abramus concil ferrarien purgatorie like deceiuinge mockinge people wisshed reformation churche wee succede beare theire name wee succede whose woorde wee professe whose woorde hardinge side haue often condemned vnder colour false translation haue burnte heresie hereof fourme argument sorte christe sonne god persecuted carried lauuye vnto slauterhouse speakyng truthe therefore behooueth v cause sufferinge like take patieuce saithe peter1 peter christe died v leauing v example folowe steppe wee suffer patiently dooinge wel thinge thankes woorthy god holy father martyr ignatius comforted selfe middes tormenteseuseb lib cap tertull de fuga persecutione matth la incipio esse discipulus christi beginne christes disciple tertullian quid debeo nisi sanguinem quem pro fudit filius dei thinge owe el bloude whiche sonne god hath shedde like comforte like case christe geueth disciple reioice ye saithe gladde rewarde greate heauen thus haue persecuted prophetes apologie cap diuision crie vpon v present euerie al heretiques haue forsaken faith haue newe persuasion wicked learninge vtterly dissolued concorde church hardinge yf ye haue forsaken faithefaithe britaine ye baptized ye gonne faithe whiche eleutherius pope martyr first apostle britayne preached landevntruthe damianus fugatius within little one hundred yeres christes deathdamianus fugatius first apostle briton augustinus melitus englishe ye refuse faithe gregorie greate holy pope caused preached auncestours englishe nation augustinus melitus holy priestes haue thereby dissolued vnitie catholike churche leaue maineteine doctrine whereby vnitie dissolued presupposed wee see crie made vpon true ye heretikes deede b sarisburie wel reporte eleutherius also noted margin augustine one first apostle britannes englishe vntrue certaine churche britannie nowe called england receiued first faithe rome lucius kinge countrie receiued gospel christ baptized welneare one hundred fiftie yeres emperoure constantine constantine first christened emperoure borne ilande notwithstanding eleutherius bishop rome kinges special request sent hither fugatius damianus enforme bishopes cleregie bringe thinges theodoretus writeth paule apostle passinge waye spaine nicephorus saithe simon zel te greekes others augustine englande augustine learned doctour neither godly man hardinge maketh galfridus writeth cruel disoaineful prowde arrogant way meete called apostle neither first planter faithe englande faithe planted many hundred yeres commingean tertullian saithe timetertull contra iudaeos britannorum inaccessa romani loca subduntur christo country britannie whiche romaine coulde neuer atteine vnto anno subiecte christe origen saithe timeorigen ezechiel homi athanas apologia secunda terra britanniae consensit religionem christi lande britannie hath agreed christes religion athanasius time saitheanno episcopi aphricae vniuersae siciliae sardiniae hispaniarum galliarum britanniarum sese
