britannicarum episcopis cleregie tolouse anno bishoppes britannie chrysostome time saithe et iusulae britannicae extra hoc mare sitae ipso oceano positae senserut virtutem verbi dei ilandes britannie beinge ocean far sea haue felt power goddes woorde anno theodoretus time emperour iouinian saithe thus huic fidei consenserunt omnes ecclesiae quae que hispania sunt quae que britannia faith haue agreed al church bothe spaine britannie recordes may seeme sufficient please hardinge receiue al euery liued sundrie hundred yeeres arriual melitus augustine yf man shal happen replie faithe vtterly rooted inuasion englishe men beinge heathen art diuis beda li ca mater already answeared former replie hardinge certainely beda saithe queene englande christenedbeda li cap realme seuen bishoppes one archebishop moe greate learned christian menne touchinge augustine wee bounde al dooinges although hardinge allowe apostolike authoritie yet al heastes gospel churche time growen muche corruption may many way appeare sundrie place gregoriebeda li ca verily beda saithe bishoppes learned christian countrie vtterly refused receiue newe apostle religion yet right catholique godly menne galfridus saithegalfridus lib cap erant septem episcopatus archiepiscopatus religiosiscionis praesulibus muniti abbatiae complures quib grex domini rectum ordinem tenebat englande seuen bishoprikes one archebishoprike possessed godly prelate many abbies whiche lordes flocke helde right religion apologie cap diuision wee renewe fetche againe hel olde many daie condemned heresy wee sowe abroade newe sectes suche broyles neuer earst hearde also already diuided contrarie partes opinion could yet meanes agree wel amonge selues hardinge sith ye raise vp againe heresie aerius deniynge praier dead accopted heretike aboue leuen hundred yeres past sith ye raise vp heresie manichaeus liued himthat defender renevvers olde heresy taking awaire free sith ye raise vp heresie vigilantius refusinge praie sainctes honour holy reliques keepe lightes church honour god many heresy beside olde time condenmed sith ye raise vp heresie berengarius deniyng presence christes body blessed sacrament aultar sith ye adde mo heresy owne appointing supreme pastorship regiment churche thinges cause spiritual laye magistrate deniynge external sacrifice churche whiche wee cal masse maintenance breache vowes pouertie chastitie obedience againe sithe diuision sundrie sectes neither dissembled defended whereof shal speake hereafter largely al thinges beside sundrie like enormitic beinge true true crie made vpon true b sarisburie heape greate shewe light substance touching berengarius gentle readerarti diuis shortnesse sake must referre thee former replie hardinge aerius arian heretique breache vowes dissension iudgementes religion shalbe answeared god willinge hereafter eche mater seuerally place wee flatter prince newe imagined extraordinarie power onely geue prerogatiue chieftie euermore hath benne dewe vnto ordinanceesai woorde god say nurce goddes religion make lawes churche heare take vp case question faithe hable otherwise commit ouer authoritie vnto learned commaunde bishoppes priestes doo dewties punishe sutche offendersaugust contra cresc li ca thus godly emperoure constantinus sate iudgement cause ecclesiastical bitweene caecilianus donatus casis nigris ende selfe pronounced sentence greater authoritie constantinus emperoure vsed prince require none truste hitherto greate heresie hierome reproued vigilantius founde faulte vigil night wake vsed praieing sainctes woorshippinge reliques lightes suche like weighty mater touchinge whole controuersieerasm praefatio epistolam hieronymi contra vigilan erasmus geueth iudgement hunc ita conuitijs debacchatur hieronymus vt plusculum co modestiae cogar desiderare vtinam argumentis tantum egisset et conuitijs temperasset vigilantius hierome raileth wante peece sobrietie woulde rather dealte argumentes spared railinge praier sainctes lightes shal speake hereafter night wake afterward condemned remembre ye councel carthage sentence geuen churche greate heretique vigilantius hierome verily ye father former councel holden eliberis spaine decreed thusconcil eliberi cap placuit prohiberi ne foeminae coemiterio peruigilent quia saepe sub obtentu orationis scelera latenter committunt liketh v woman forbidden watche place burial often vnder pretense prayer priuily commit wickednesse shorte vigilantius heretique reprouinge night watch hath churche rome longe sithence condemned abolished watch agreeably vigilantius contrarie iudgement hierome reliques subiecte muche villanie welneare worne selfe manicheis emonge fantastical errours wonte say ye body man madeaugust de continent ca august contra duas epist pelagian li ca august ad quod vult deu god angel diuel whiche called gentem tenebratum man two soules contrarie nature one substance god substance diuel either soule contineweth stil cannot alter say good soule neuer il il soule neuer good sense saide man hath free wil al like errours wee abhorre detest frantique fury wee saie soule man substance creature god maie changed good il il good dauid maie fal paule maie rise god geueth v newe hart newe spirite within breastes touchinge freedome wil power selues saie augustine august deverb apostoli sermo malum liberum arbitrium sine deo euil free wil without god againe libero arbitrio male vtens homo se perdidit arbitrium man misusinge free wil spilte selfe wil againe quid tantum de naturae postibilitate praesumituraugusti enchiridio ca augusti de natura gratia cap vulnerata saucia vexata perdita est vera confessione non falsa defensione opus habet doo men mutche presume possibilitie nature woounded mangled troubled loste behoueth v rather truely confesse folsly defende againe liberum arbitrium captiuatum non nisi ad peccatum valet free wil made thralle auaileth nothinge sinne agayne quod bene viuimusaugusti ad boni faci li ca augusti de verbis aposto sermo quod recte intelligimus deo debemus nostrum nihil est nisi peccatum quod habemus wee liue wel wee vnderstande aright wee haue god selues wee haue nothinge onely sinne within v better cleare whole case thought good vse moe woordes thus may wee learne knowe selues humbly confesse imperfection geue whole glorie vnto god therefore conclude augusti de bono perseueran cap augustine saithe no volumus sed deus nobis operatur velle no operamur sed deus nobis operatur operari pro bona sua volutate hoc nobis expedit credere dicere hoc est pium hoc est verum vt sit humilis submissa confessio cap detur totum deo tutiores viuimus si totum deo damus non autem no illi ex parte nobis ex parte committimus wee wil god woorketh v wil vvee woorke god woorketh v woorke accordinge good pleasure behooueful v bothe beleeue speake godly true doctrine confession maye humble lowly god maye haue whole vvee liue safetie wee geue al vnto god rather wee commit selues partely selues partely apologie cap diuision wee accursed creature like gyauntes doo warre god selfe liue cleane without regarde woorshippinge god hardinge vvhat ye bee god knoweth owne conscience shoulde knowe lorde amende bothe v saye giltie minde imagineth vvorlde reporte take away abhorre external sacrifice wherein christe accordinge owne institutionlucae cor offered father make warre god whiche make christe minister shadowes signes token figure whiche feare breake solemne vowes made god defende wel done whiche assure selues saluation therefore liue dissolutely without due care feare god saye cursed creature like gyantes warre god ye cleare charge b sarisburie answeare ifs ifs woordes woordes greate folie therefore leauinge answeare vowes assurance saluation theire seueral place first wee denie ye sacrifice christe christe onely vpon crosse whole onely sacrifice sinne biside wee haue none itin arti haue spoken hereof large former replie hardinge neither make wee christe liketh hardinge saye minister signes figuresiohan wee knowe christe fulfillinge perfection lawe grace truthe wrought yet neuerthelesse wee saye sacramentes newe testamente signes figure olde father tertullian expoundeth christes woordes sorte hoc est corpus meum tertull contra mar ion lib augustin psalm augustin contra mantum cap hoc est figura corporis mei body saye figure body augustine saithe christus adhibuit iudam ad conuiuium quo corporis sanguinis sui figuram discipulis suis commendauit tradidit christe receiue iudas vnto banket whereat deliuered disciple figure body bloude againe non dubitauit dominus dicere hoc est corpus meum cum daret signum corporis sui christe doubted saye body whereas gaue token body leaue holy father like woordes sense welneare innumerable yet neither giantes rebelles god accursed creature neuer vsed woordes called sacramente figure token christes body might hardinge haue enne bolde saye somewhat leade awate reader tragical exclamation signes figure selfe haue shewed former answeare exposition woordes christearti ul diuision body like phrase incident vnto auoide one vsual common figure forc shifte selfe thirtie vnnecessarie childishe figure knowinge mutche open untruthes wel stande without figure apologie cap diuision wee despise al good deedes wee vse discipline vertuefastinge vvith fleashe lawes customes wee esteeme neither righte order equitie iustice wee geue brydel al naughtinesse prouoke people al licentiousnesse ust hardinge ye teache men faste policiefaste policie fol pa religion statute wednesday faste euer shal write saye forebearinge flea seruice god otherwise polytike lawes shal punished spreader false newes ought vvhen ye preache onely faithe remoue merite woorkes baptismeepist ad rom bridle geuen levvdnes nevve gospell paule meante also baptisme vvhen ye take awaye sacrament confession absolution geue ye brydel al naughtinesse gospelling maides london refuse serue except maye haue libertie heare sermon noone playe noone b sarisburie thought hardinge knowen difference bitweene fastinge abstinence choise meates true fastinge religiouse woorke ordeined testifie humilitie make fleashe obedient vnto sprite wee maye quicker praier al good woorkes abstinence meate opinion holinesse superstitious maye easily make man holy not1 corinth hebrae paule saithe cibus no non commendat deo meate maketh v acceptable vnto god againe good confirme harte grace meates wherein haue walked haue founde profite meate serueth belly corinth roman matth belly meate lorde wil destroye bothe againe kingedome god meate drinke likewise christe saithe thinge entreth mouthe defileth man hereby easie see fastinge one thinge abstinence fleashe nazareis old testamente absteined fleashe yet fasted3 regum matthae socrae li ca cassidor lib cap elia sedde fleashe iohn baptiste eate fleash locustes yet fasted socrates saithe many christian lente season eate fishe byrdes many absteined vntil three clocke noone receiued al kindes meate either fishe fleashe without difference likewise epiphanius saithe eate al kindes birdes fowle absteininge onely fro fleashe fower footed beastes epipha de haeres lib oratione de fide catholica nonlatin alphabet yet kepte lente truely fasted wel others wherfore abstinence one certaine kinde meate self woorke religion please god onely mere positiue policieaugustin augustine saithe non quaeto quo vescaris sed quo delecteris demounde thou eatest wherein thou haste pleasure hieronym ioelem cap hierome saithe manicheis ieiunant illi quidem sed illorum leiunium est saturitate deterius foste deede theire fastinge woorse filled theire belly onely faithe confession wee shal speake hereafter apologie cap diuision wee labour seeke ouerthrowe state monarchy kingdomes bringe al thinges vnder rule rashe inconstante people vnlearned multitude hardinge monarkes prince seeme mainteined sectes teache people rebel pretensed religion allow ye monarchie romaine empire muche complaine apologie pope made charlemaigne emperour vveste hathe queene scotland cause praise procedinges gospel occasion whereof ruleth subiectes rather ruled subiectes b sarisburie greate vntruthe emonge reste hardinge right wel knoweth wee neuer armed people taught rebel religion prince thinge haue time happened otherwise either wilful rage fatal furie counsel doctrine wee teache people paule doothe subiecte higher powersroman matth onely feare also conscience wee teache striketh swerde priuate authoritie shal perish ye swerd yf prince happen wicked cruel burthenous wee teache saye ambrose arma nostra sunt preces lachrymae teares praiers weapon ambrosius notwithstandinge rebellion hathe benne moued englande side late raignes kinge henrie eight kinge edward sixte defence religion ye maie wel remember displacinge emperour constantinople placinge charlemaigne frenche kinge serueth hardinge smal purpose onlesse disclose pope conspiracie emperour certainely man maye sensibly see aduauncinge pope strengtheninge saracenes turkes diuision dissolution state christendomeplatina adriano platyna saithe ab hoc tempore perijt potestas imperatorum virtu pontificum time power emperours holinesse pope bothe loste touchinge queene scotland wil saye nothinge kingedomes state worlde haue sundrie agreementes composition noble common neither drewe swerde attempted force prince sought onely continuance goddes vndoubted truthe defence theire owne liues barbarous cruel inuasions remembredat vassei anno bisides al warninges late dealinge vassei great number theire brother suddainely murthered beinge togeather theire praiers churche holdinge vp theire innocente handes heauen callinge vpon name god achab saide sometime prophete elia thou arte regum troublest whole countrie israel elia made answeare trouble countrie thou thy father house whiche houe foresaken commeundementes lorde houe folowed baalim subiecte bounde obey prince al thinges without exception far goddes glorie touched noble learned peteractor psal psalm better obey god man prophete dauid better truste god truste prince mortal shal die theire sprite shalbe taken shal returne earthe neither maye godly prince take dishonour estate see god obeied himleo de passione domi serm god minister god leo saithe christus quae dei sunt deo quae caesaris sunt caesari reddenda constituit c hoc est vere impugnare caesarem sed iuuare christe commaunded dewe vnto god b euen god dewe vnto caesor geuen caesar verily rebel helpe caesar likewise ambrose beinge selfe manner capitaine vnto people goddes quarrel valentinian emperourambros lib epist quid praesentius dici potuit christianis viris quam id quod hodie nobis spiritus sanctus ioquutus est rogamus auguste non pugnamus non timemus sed rogamus could boldly spoke christian menne holy ghoste spake daye thus ye saide wee beseeche thee noble emperour wee fight wee feare thee wee beseeche thee conclude queene scotlande stil quiet possession estate obeied subiectes far conuenient godly people obeye prince apologie cap diuision wee haue seditiously fallen catholique churche wicked schisme diuision haue shaken whole worlde troubled common peace vniuersal quiet churche dathan abiron conspired time past moyses aaron euen wee daye haue renounced bishop rome without cause reasonable hardinge luther time al christen people came togeather peaceably one churche vnder one heade shepe one folde vnder one shepeherd liued vnanimes domo one accorde sathadiuision schismefolovved vpon luther preachinge iohan beginninge begyled eue persuaded taste poisoned apple luther newe doctrine went fro v v ben v remained v forsooke catholike churche christ sorted selues synagoges antichriste withdrewe selues obedience warde theire pastor iudge sundred selues diuerse sectes schisme diuision conspiracie head shepherd nolesse wickednumer dathan abiron moyses aaron god commaunded moyses aaron obeyed child israelgreate vntruthes christe comaunded al shepe obeye heare voice himiohan peter succedinge peter made shepeherd ouer whole stocke b sarisburie time goddes holy wil doctour luther begin publishe gospel christe general quietnesse graunte sutche night season folke asleape yet thinke continewe sutche quietnesse wise man wil wish sleepe stil ye saye haue forsaken catholique churche went v v nay rather hardinge wee returned ye catholique churche christe haue forsaken bicause haue manifestly foresaken wayes god man would alitle put frendely remebrance sir longe sithence selfe owne catholique churche gonne selfe bicause selfe selfe selfe bene selfe would haue remained better selfe wisedome carpinge others offer occasion selfe beseche god geue grace maye redire ad cor returne againe selfe bringe great many vntruthes thronge togeather saye god commaunded people israel obey aaron christe commaunded al sheepe obey pope succedinge peter saye christe made pope shepheard ouer whole flocke cal pastour iudge cal head shepheard proufe hereof countenance truthe ye allege one twentith chapter iohn whiche whole chapter notwithstandinge ye able finde neither suche commaundement christe mention peter successour al sheepe shepheard ouer whole flocke pastour iudge headshepheard mutche reporte vntruthe man reporte vntruthe christe holy woorde willingly witingly without feare menne thinke sinne holy ghoste woordes feede sheepe feede lammes perteine wel apostlesmatthae cor peter christe saide generally al disciple goe ye al worlde preache gospel paule saithe selfe ego plus omnibus laboraui haue taken paine fedde flock al rest surely thinketh weake kinde reasoninge saie thus christe bade peter feede sheepe ergo made headshepheard ouer al worlde whole prerogatiue hange feedinge flocke pope feede neuer minde feede thinkinge parte office conclude vtterly ignorant many haue benne cannot feede yet must needes headshepheard ouer whole flocke must al sheepe obey heare voyce cannot speake verily augustine saithe qui hoc animo pascunt oues christi vt suas velint esse non christi se conuincuntur amare augustin iohan tracta non christum vel gloriandi vel dominandi vel acquirendi cupiditate euer feede sheepe ende make christes soue selues christe desire either glorie rule gaine apologie cap diuision set naught authoritie auncient father councels olde time haue rashly presumptuously disanulled olde ceremony whiche haue benne wel allowed father forefather many hundred yeeres past good customes also age puritie haue owne priuate head without authoritie sacred general councel brought newe tradition churche haue donne al thinges religion sake onely vpon desire contention strife parte haue chaunged manner thinge haue helde kepte stil sutche number yeres day al thinges deliuered apostle wel approued auncient father hardinge auncient father men please ye finde anie colour aduantage newe schoolemen ye make mutche owne opinion rule esteeme despise themcouncels councles ye admitte phansie pleasure leadeth sometimes three sometimes foure sometimes fiue sixe al ye would neuer admitte yet many general haue bene confirmed see apostolikeceremonies churche abolished gospeller al like authoritie concerninge ceremony ye shewe v vse chrisme church signe crosse borne procession wheres vsed holy vvater abolished lightes gospel communion peculiar vestimentes deacon priestes byshoppes taken awaie many suche like iudge ye whether ye haue duely kepte old ceremony churche newe tradition p ites ceremony tel make whether maye terme manner thinge haue changed necessitie either beleued obserued b sarisburie wee allowe auncient father credite selues haue euer desired augustine hereof writeth thus neque quorumuis disputationes quantumuis catholicorumaugust fortunatianum pist iii laudatorum hominum velut scripturas canonicas habere debemus vt nobis non liceat salua reuerentia quae illis debetur aliquid illorum scriptis improbare aut respuere si forte inuenerimus quod aliter senserint quam veritas habet talis sum ego scriptis aliorum tale volo esse intellectores meorum receiue disputation vvritinges menne neuer catholique praisewoorthy wee receiue canonical scripture sauinge reuerence dewe vnto wee may wel reproue refuse thinges theire writinges happen wee finde haue otherwise thought truthe may beare utche writinges others sutche would wishe others mine likewise writeth hierome non putoaugust ad hieronym epist frater te velle libros tuos legi tanquam apostolorum aut prophetarum recken brother ye would haue v reade bookes written apostle prophetes certaine tertullian eeyprian clemens alexandrinus papias irenaeus victorinus lactautius hilarius ancient father oftentimes mutch deceiued hierome ffeth ambrose commentary vpon luke calleth nugas trifle nicknameth ambrose picus mirandula apologia august contra cro onium li cap sometime callinge coruus sometime cornicula likewise augustine saithe ecclesiastici iudices vt homines plaerunque falluntur iudges doctours churche beinge men often deceiued thomas aquine saithe non tenemur de necessitate salutis credere solum doctoribus ecclesiae vt hieronymo aut augustino sed ne ipsi quidem ecclesiae nisi quae pertinent ad substantiam fideipicus mirandula apologia thomas wee bounde vpon necessitie saluation beleue onely doctours churche hierome augustine also neither churche selfe sauinge onely mater concerninge substane faithe touchinge authoritie councels quod ibet arti vltimo august contra donat ist lib cap augustine saithe ipsa plenaria concilia saepe priora posterioribus emendantur cum aliquo experimento aperitur quod clausum e general councels often corrected former later often trial experience thing opened shut likewise panormitane saithe plus credendum est vni priuato fideli quam toti concilio papae si meliorem habeat authoritatem vel rationem wee ought geue credite one priuate aye manabb panormit de electio electi potest cap significasii esai whose councel pope bringe better authoritie reason counsel wicked carried malice many haue benne specially within fewe late hundred yeres saie prophete esai saithe inite consilium dissipabitur loquimini verbum non stabit quia nobiscum est dominus take counsel togeather shalbe broken speake woorde shal holde lorde v late schole doctours selues weigh litle noman lesse say youre common talkes bernardus vidit omnia haue controlled doctour al doctours peter lombard common caueat margine hic magister non tenetur doctour doctour selfe hardinge hardinge fol b hardinge fol b hardinge fol youre booke apologie sate doctor gratian deceiued steede anacletus alleged calixtus youre selfe againe saie secrete pointe learninge augustine cyprian teache singularely wee folowe mutche lesse wee binde selues beeue soeuer lbertus pigghius hath written againe vvee binde selues neither woordes syluester pighius againe wee take vpon v defende al canonistes scholemen saie write companie saieth doctour gratian hath published great vntruthescopus dialogo pag wilfully falsified general councel nomen vniuer salis saithe assutum est gratiano thus hardinge ye vse doctours euen marchante vseth counter sometime stande hundred pounde sometime pennie nowe let v litle examine particular bil ye come procession lightes torch taper chrisme oile tunicles chisibles holy water holy breade knowe el al thinges descended directly apostle without churche god churche verilyoile hardinge wee hate al thinges wee know creature god haue misused rather se destled beraied superstition haue mocked deceiued goddes people wee longer continue without great conscience wil passe ouer rest speake onely oile whereof seeme make moste accoumptede consec olei pontifical thus ye taught blesse oile fiat domine hoc oleum te benedicente vnctio spiritualis ad purificationem mentis corporis lorde set oile thy blessinge made spiritual ointement purifie soule body againe emitte quaesumus sancte pater spiritum sanctum paracletum tuum de coelis hanc pinguedinem oliuae ad refectionem corporum sanationem animarum holy father wee beseche thee sende downe thy holy sprite comforter uen fatnesse oliue refresshinge body soule like sorte ye taught prate ouer sicke per hanc sanctam vnctionem suam prissimam misericordiam ignoscat tibi deus vt per hanc vnctionem habeas rem ssionem omnium peccatorum holy enointinge greate mercie god pardone thee enointing thou maiste haue remission al thy finnes thinges cannot denied written al panuals vsed practised al church ye cal holy oile oile saluation ye beare people hande thereby shal haue healthe body soule yet deede ye haue chrisme al pope innocentius saithe chrisma conficitur ex oleo balsamo extra de sacrum vnctions chrisme made oile balsame makinge thereof balsame necessarie oile many hundred yeres ye haue balsame hath benne therefore ye haue chrisme longe haue deceiued people quid pro quo geuinge one thinge nowe oile came apostle owne doctour panormitane witnesse panormitan de consuetud ca thus writeth apostoli olim conferebant spiritum sanctum sola manus impositione et quia hodie praelati non sunt ita beati fuit institutum vt illi conferrent hoc sacramentum cum chrismate apostle olde time gaue holy ghoste onely ieinge handes nowe day bicause bishoppes holy order hathe benne taken shoulde geue sacramente chrisme neither mater thorowly approued al antiquitie harding imagineth pope innocentius witnesse olde time someextra de sacrum vnction vngitur founde faulte dooinges woordes non ludaizat ecclesia cum vnctionis celebrat sacramentum sicut antiqui mentiuntur churche jewishe solemnizinge sacramente vnction elder haue misreported touching lightesin annotationi librum contra marcionem taper beatus rhenanus man greate learninge iudgemente doubteth ye borowed vse thereof heathen graunte christian olde time lightes theire church mette togeather common praiers appeareth ancient father lightes serued solace darkeaugu de tempo natali sermo vse religion augustine saith vouent alius oleum alius ceram ad luminaria noctis promise churche one oile waxe eusebius devita constan orat hieron aduer vigilantium hardinge fol b ca night lightes likewise saithe eusebius nonlatin alphabet ignis purus quantum satis esset praebendum lumen precantibus cleare light mutche might suffice people theire praiers likewise saithe hierome cereos non clara luce accendimus sed vt noctis tenebras hoc solatio temperemus vvee sight cut taper midde daie onely comfort ea darkenesse night therefore hardinge vnto set vp lightes church selfe saie honour god aunciente father lactantius saithe thus num mentis suae compos putandus est qui authori datori luminis candelarumlightes vvater cerarum lumen offert pro munere maie wee thinke wel wittes vnto god maker geuer light wil offer vp candels taper present verily tertullian saithe accendant quotidie lucernas quibus lux nulla est tertul de idololatria c illis competunt testimonia tenebrarum auspicia poenarum let haue sight god set vp taper euery daye c belongeth bothe testimonie darknesse beginninge paine shal saye holy water doubte must needes serue oile doothe saluation body soule augustinus steuchus principal doctour syde saitheaugu steucha librum numer cap non inane institutum est quod aqua sale orationibus sanctificamus vt ad eorum aspersum delicta nostra deleantur vaine inuention wee hallowe vvater salte prayer sprinkesinge thereof sinnes maye forgeuen thus profanely heathenlike writethe bloude christe quite dried vp beside al one doctours louaine tellethe v good sadnesse reporte one iesuitescopus dialo pa b nonlatin alphabet vlato timaeo theodoret de corrigedis graecorum affectibus lib india holy water wholesome driue awaye mise make barren woman conceiue faine mater place maye seene hardinge must needes saye companie one saide sometime grecian theise cal themselues catholiques euer child ye saye ye haue chaunged nothinge necessitie either beleeued obserued necessitie ye meane wel contecture liste holy water holy breade must needes necessitie deede ancient godly order churche ye haue manner leafte nothinge onlesse suche ye might best haue spared ye haue defaced withe superstition hathe nowe quite loste former vse certainely changed nothinge haue nowe priuate masse therfore wee maye iustly saye tertullian saide like case vnto romaine heathen tertull apologetico vbi religio vbi veneratio maioribus debita habitu victu instructu sensu ipso denique sermone proauis renutiastis laudatis semper antiquitatem noue de die viuitis per quod ostenditur dum bonis maiorum institutis deceditis ea vos retinere custodire quae non debuistis cum quae debuistis non custoditis religion reuerence dewe forefather haue forsaken apparel diet order meaning speeche ye change life daily yet ye praise antiquitie whereby appeareth ye seaue good order elder yee keepe thinges yee keepe seeinge ye keepe thinges ye keepe apologie cap diuision mater seeme donne vpon priuie sclaunder tossed fro corner onely spite v haue benne besides wilily procured bishop rome certaine person eloquence yenough vnlearned neither whiche put theire healpe cause nowe almost despaired shoulde polishe set foorthe bothe bookes withe longe tale ende mater trimly eloquently handled ignorant vnskilful person might suspecte somme greate thinge deede perceiued theire owne cause euery goe wracke steightes espied lesse esteemed theire healpes dayly faile theire mater stoode altogeather greate neede cunninge spokesman hardinge vvee cannot despaire causeconfidence catholikes touchinge cause lueae matthae johan catholike church assuredly defended ephes onlesse wee would forsake faithe ye haue beleuinge christe whiche faithe leadeth v vnto wee cannot mistruste continuance cause heauen earthe shal passe woordes shal passe saithe truthe selfe woordes tel v wil churche al day world ende hath besought father geue sprite truthe remaine euer wee moste assured cause vvee tel therefore standeth shal stande christes presence holy ghostes assistance ende cause yet standeth wauereth tottereth whiche paule termeth puffe doctrine doubtlesse shortely fall shall heresy haue fallen authours professours dead rotten helfire weepinge grintinge teeth like iudgement lookeye folowers haue ye repent reuoke heresy time b sarisburie wee cannot despaire saithe hardinge continuance cause heauen earthe shal passe christes vvoorde shal passe wil v al day world ende c woordes hardinge true certaine therefore hope firmer christe hath promised sprite truthe shal remaine euer pope cardinalles thereof made promise nay rather prophete esai saithe sprite god shal rest vpon pooreesaie meeke harted trembleth woorde lorde churche god shal stande stil yea though rome possessed antichristematthae true christe saithe euery plante whiche heauenly father hath planted shal rooted vp vpon whiche woordes hilarie saithe significat traditionem hominum cruendam esse hilar ca matthaei cuius fauore transgressi sunt praecepta legis meaneth tradition man whiche tradition sake haue broken lawe god shal taken vp rootes heauen earthe shal passe fantastes diuises hardinge shal passe lorde hath spoken woorde god churche shal endure euer hardinges almanake saithe doctrine shal fal shortly herein professe haue skil goddes wil donne cause euer shal happen name blessed euer like sorte heathen olde time augustine saithe vaunted selues faithe christe august psal ad certum tempus sunt christiani postea peribunt redibunt idola redibit quod erat antea verum tu cum expectas miser infidelis vt transtant christiani transis ipse sine christianis christian al shal shortly shal idol come againe shalbe thou miserable infidel thou lookest christian passe thou possest awaie thee selfe without christian againe saithe ecce veniet tempus vt finiantur non sint christiani augusti eundem psal sicut coeperunt ad aliquo tempore ita vsque ad certum tempus erunt sed cum ista dicunt sine fine moriuntur permanet ecclesia praedicans brachium domini omni generationi venturae saie behold daie wil come al christian shal haue ende time beginne shal haue time continewe make crake selues die without ende churche contineweth stil praisinge almighty arme god euery generation come ye saie authours professours doctrine damned hel fiere crie peccaui terrible kinde talke rashe parte harding suddainely skip goddes chaire pronounce sentence definitiue like iudge august psal par god wil iudge iudgemente augustine saithe alia est sella terrena aliud tribunal coelorum ab inferiori sententia accipitur superiori corona earthly chaier one thinge iudgemente seate heauen one wee receiue sentence receiue crowne hardinge god graunte maie crie peccaui lest time come ye shal crie written booke wisedome sapien wee sometime derision parable reproche vvee fooles thoughte theire life madnesse theire ende without honoure nowe coumpted emonge child god theire portion emonge sainctes apologie cap diuision nowe thinges whiche haue benne laide againste v parte manifestly false condemned theire owne iudgementes spake partly againe though false deede yet beare certaine shewe coolour truthe reader take good heede maie easily tripped brought errour specially theire fine cunninge tale added thereunto parte sutche sorte ought shunne crime faultes acknowledge confesse thinges wel done vpon good reason shortely saie truthe folke falsely accuse sclaunder al dooinges yea thinges selues cannot denie rightly orderly donne malice doo misconstrue depraue al saienges dooings though impossible thinge could rightly spoken donne v plainely sincerely haue gonne woorke would haue dealte truely nowe neither truely sincerely yet christianly darkely craftily charge batter v lie doe abuse blindenesse fondenesse people togeather ignorance prince cause v hated truthe suppressed lo ye power darkenesse men whiche leane amased wonderinge rude multitude darkenesse doo truthe light andhierony aduersus rufinum hierome saithe doo openly gainsaie truthe closinge vp theire eies wil see nonce geue thankes good mighty god sutche cause would fainest hable vtter despite whiche might wel wreasted holy father prophetes apostle peter paule christe selfe hardinge catholikes doo burden ought wherein owne iudgementes condemne themselues ye sclaunder onely oftentimes booke iudged otherwise would wittingly iudgemente special propertie heretike paule hiddeth al men voide knowinge suche peruertedtim seemeth euen condemned owne iudgement shewe bothe blasphemous heresy wicked actes luther ye knowe powred heresy villanies c robbinge church persecutinge men standinge edfastly faithe holy forefather incestuous mariages monkes frier nonnes breache solemne vowes fleashly pleasure prophaninge abandoninge holy sacramentes contempt auncient godly ordinaunces discipline churche suche thinges like estimation deede catholikes doo persecute suche deserued entreatinge euill person maye called persecution al good folk besides wee gr te shal doe longe love truthe keepe vnitie churche yet minde doo persecu e yougenes iohan sara agar christ iewes whipt temple eter nom magus b sarisburie yewis hardinge might please remember bartholomaeus latomus doctour side confesseth writinge al worlde ar latonus aduersus buceru request touchinge holy ministration vnder bothe kindes accordinge christes first institution iuste reasonable gerardus lorichius owne side saithe sunt pse docatholici qui reformationem ecclesiae quoquo modo remorari non verentur false catholiques erar lorichius de missa prorogand par canonis hardinge speaketh beinge one owne false catholiques hinder reformation churche al meanes hable saithe false catholiques far contrary common opinion concludeth ende wilful mainteinance sequel doctrine pointe calleth haeresis blasphemia pestilens execrabilis heresie blayhemie god pestilent cursed others de confesse vse ministration vnder one kindesteuin gard diuels sophist ie whiche nowe ye cal catholique began first christe apostle ancient learned father onely errour better termeth simple deuotion people albertus pighius stoutest gallante al campe graunteth haue bennealbertus ighius de missa p uata platina vio shidanus li many abuse passe notwithstandinge ye haue tolde v far otherwise pope pius oftentimes graunted vsed commonly saie sawe great cause priestes shoulde restoared libertie mariage pope adrian legate cheregatus confessed openly norenherg general diet al prince germanie al il churche came firste culmine pontificio toppe castle pope short hardinge might haue pleased remember selfe first booke harding fo b defence priuate passe haue written thus mary denie commendable godly church parte many well disposed examined woulde partaker blessed sacramente prieste al thinges hardinge s abuse reasonable vnreasonable right wronge better woorse neuer wicked neuer blasphemous neuer cursed yet stoutly defended stil hope offered amendement conscience parte onely eth eth conscience graunte ye persecute brother ye haue swerd maye persecute sara agargene iohn chrysost mat thae homi christe iewes otherwise verily hardinge christe sara persecutours haue greatly heard remember chrysostome saithe thus nunquid ouis lupum persequitur aliquando non sed lupus ouem sic enim caim persecutus est abel persequution loue non abel caim sic ismael persecutus est isaac non isaac ismael sic iudaei christum non christus iudaeos haeretici christianos non christiani haeresicos ergo ex fructibus corum cognoscetis eos doothe sheepe perscute woulfe time woulfe doothe persecute sheepe caim persecuted abel abel caim ismael persecuted isaac isaac ismael iewes persecuted christe christe iewes heretiques persequute christian christiaus heretiques ye shal knowe fruites augustine saithe august contra lite pe ili lib cap chrysost matthae homil non eo modo persecutionem passi sunt pseudoprophetae ab elia quomodo ipse elia rege nequissimo neither palse prophetes persecuted elia elia persecuted wicked kinge surely chrysostome saithe quem videris sanguine persequutionis gaudentem lupus est whome euer ye see eioicinge bloudde persequution vvoulfe yee pretende greate good wil saye ye persecute murder brother louein vespit christe persequuted iewes trowe aristophancs saithe philippides tooke cudgel beatte father al loue hardinge neither armed christe armed christe armed armed must saye augustine saithe vnto heretiques donatistesaugust contra liter per lta lib cap hanc formam ne ab ipsis quidem iudaeis persecutoribus accepistis illi enim persequuti sunt carnem ambulantis terra vos euangelium sedentis coelo ye learned fourme persequution iewes persequuted fleashe christe walkinge earthe persequute gospel christe sittinge heauen holcore se ten quaest arti dubi orig gene homi gene calat robert holcote emonge doubtes moueth question amor sit odium vvhether loue hatred yf nowe aliue sawe dealinge kindnesse loue beleue woulde put mater question saye vndoubtedly loue hatred loue moses saithe ismael plaied sported isaac paule saithe plaieinge sportinge persecution thus writeth fleashe persequuted sprite doubte thinke parte wel donne christe saithe vvho euer shal murder youiohan shal thinke offereth sacrifice vnto god selues haue sette note greate letter margine decree iudaei mortaliter peccassent dist item margine si christu crucifixissent iewes sinned deadly hinged christe vpon crosse benedictus deus qui non dedit no captionem dentibus eorum blessed god hath geuen v praie vnto teeth al reste sufficient hardinge saye blasphemous heresy wicked actes lutheres heresy villanies robbinge church breach vowes plea ely pleasure abandoninge holy sacramentes malice sclaunders lie bisides thinges effecte answeareth nothinge nowe answeare nothinge thinge woorthe nothinge apologie cap diuision nowe therefore leeful folkes eloquent finetongued speakinge euil surely becommeth v cause beinge good doumbe answearinge truely menne bee carelesse spoken theite owne mater neuer falsely sclaunderousely spoken especialy sutche maiestie god cause religion maye thereby dammaged parte doubtlesse dissolute retchelesse person whiche wickedly winke iniuries donne vnto name god although wronges ye oftentimes greate maye borne dissembled milde christian man yet goeth smoothely awaye dissembleth mater noted heresie ruffinus woont denie man christian wee therefore wil doo thinge whiche al lawes whiche nature owne voice doothe commaunde donne whiche christe selfe like case checked reuiled wee maye put v mennes sclaunderous accusation maye defende soberly truely owne cause innocencie hardinge yee haue proued truthe side euer shal able proue mainteininge doctrine lutheras zwinglians caluinistes ye doo nowe al dependeth pointe bicause yee haue truthe euer ye saye soone confuted euer ye bringe purpose b sarisburie issue case whether doctrine wee professe truethe whiche thinge goddes grace conference parte maye appare beseeche god authour al truthe father light open harte thinge truthe deede maye appeare v truthe apologie cap diuision christe verily phariseis charged sorcery one familiare sprite wrought many thinges theire helpe saide haue diuel doo glorifie father haue dishonoured put rebuke shame paule festus lieutenaunt scorned mad man saide moste deer festus mad thou thinkest speake ye woordes truth sobrenesse ancient christian sclaundered people mankillers adulterer committers incest disturber common weales perceiue sutche sclaunderous accusation religion whiche professed mighte brought question namely seeme holde peace manner confesse faulte lest might hinder free course gospel made oration put vp supplication made meanes emperours prince mighte defende selues theire felowes open audience hardinge benne often gnawinge sutche care nothinge cared write name necessarie wee haue name whole cleregie englande confirme faithe doctrine name hardinge wel remember emongst reste onlesse ye haue already torch ye haue famished ye haue drowned ye haue burnte ye haue sommoned beinge deade appeare theire graues ye haue ripte vp theire buried carkesses ye haue burnte ye haue throwen dunghil ye tooke poore comparison howe lightly euer shal please weigh reason yet youre forefather phariseis olde time seemed make accoumpte itiohan thus murmured misliked emong selues videtis no nihil proficere ecce mundus learned father martyr saithe thus selfe cum auditem christianos publice traduci exagicati ab omnibus videre autem eos ad mortem ad omnia quae ad terrorem excogitari possent esse intrepidos cogitabam wil aunsweare woordes hieron ad pammachium oceanum hierome quisquis e assertor ouorum dogmatum quaeso te vt parcas romani uribus parcas fidei quae apostolico ore laudatur cur post quadringentos annos praie thee spare romaine eares spare faithe commended apostle mouthe goest thou aboute nowe foure hundred yeeres teach v faithe wee neuer knewe bringest thou v foorthe thinge peter paule neuer vttered al countrie germanie fallen see apostolike fiue partes great countrie leaste twoo remaine catholique let v see make ye vp number many kinges ye speake realmes englande scotlande bicause goddes prouidence gouernement deuolued vvomen mutche kinges though haue ful right kinges speake onely twoo christened kinges remaine kinge denmarke kinge sweden geate nowe vp pulpites like bragginge cockes rowst flappe whinges crow aloude many free citties many kinges thinke al world daye vvere al citties al prouinces al country al kinges al prince c til freer luther came nunne tolde v newe doctrine controlled al old al mad vertuous menne societie iesus haue brought many country many kinges many prince faithe christe preachinge doctrine catholike churche vvee wil folowe folishnesse boastinge c faithe professed holy romayne churche preached peru kingdome ignamban kingdome monopotapa cambaia giapan cina tartaio basnaga taprobana ormaz ceilon zimor bacian macazar miracle wrought holy father whiche conuerted country trowe ye wil accoumpte madnesse thus vaine boast wickednesse wrought power satan put silence c b sarisburie faithe romaine churchegreekes saithe hardinge catholique faithe christe whiche foresakethe bee kinge emperour shalbe companion diuels euerlasting fire thus mutche trow hardinge learned countrefeite decree anacletus thus pleaseth gloseanaclet epist interlace woordes christe super hanc petram id est super ecclesiam romanam aedificabo ecclesiam meam vpon rocke saye vpon churche rome wil build churche therfore pope bonifacius ful resolution mater saithe thusextra de maior obedien vnam sanctam glossa eodem cap subesse romano pontifici omni humanae creaturae declaramus dicimus definimus pronuntiamus omnino esse de necessitate salutis wee declare saye determine pronounce necessitie saluation euery mortal creature subiecte vnto bishop rome glose likewise vpon quicquid saluatur est sub summo pontifice euer creature saued vnder highest bishop mention neither christe gospel saluation damnation hangeth onely b rome thing graunted case cleare pope selfe hathe resolued doubte wee neede better trialcornelius episc bitont conci tridentino notwithstading cornelius bishop bitonto late chapter tridente bishop holy see rome saithe thus vtinam religione ad superstitionem fide ad infidelitatem christo ad antichristum deo ad epicurum velut prorsus vnanimes non declinassent dicentes corde impio ore impudico non est deus would god pope cardinales fal en common consente altogeather true religion superstition faithe infidelitie christe antichriste god epicure saieinge wicked harte shamelesse mouthe psal bernard cantic canticor god like sense bishoppes see rome bernard saithe serui christi seruiunt antichristo seruauntes christe serue antichriste cornelius saithe bishoppes rome fallen superstition infidelitie antichriste epicure ashamed saye god yet saithe hardinge faithe rome catholique faithe departethe kinge emperour shalbe companion diuel helle fire thus saye meere madnesse prince free citties germanie euer persecuted v vtterly vntrue like reste tale reioice god behalfe beinge receiued v vnder theire protection offered v sutche freedome courtesie seldome offered like nation certaine owne confession haue already agreed al pointes doctrine none al one would euer suffer doctrine condemned grecian daye thinke v cannot telle notwithstandinge appeareth letter written purposely church bohemia allowe wel doctrine vtterly condemne thus writte vnto themepist ecclesiae constantinopolitanae ad ecclesia pragensem concil lateranen cap nonlatin alphabet vvherefore louing brother child wee heare hope make haste wee maie ioine togeather vnitie againe thus recorded late councel laterane graeci tantum coeperunt abominari latino vt si quando sacerdotes latini super eorum altaria celebrassent ipsi non vellent prius illis sacrificare quam ea tanquam per hoc inquinata lauissent greekes beganne mutche abhorre latines happened latine priestes ministred vpon theire aultars would afterwarde make oblation vpon wasshed thinkinge theire aultars defiled latines handeling wherefore hardinge euer grecian thinke v appeareth hereby vtterly refuse communion condemne heretiques would haue thought hardinge benne skilful proportion whole countrie germanie saithe beinge diuided equal portion twoo fiue remaine stil obedience see rome wee geue god thankes deede certaine townes subiecte bishoppes outwarde vsage theire church remaine stil yet neuerthelesse church popishe people al sortes protestantes loue truthe mutche ashamed folie goddes secrete prouidence certaine remaine emongst v season cananites remained emongst people israel otherwise within fewe yeres ye would denie euer disorder benne greate harde manner possible conuert whole people greate countrie al heares man bearde head neuer waxe white al togeatherluc christe compareth kingdome god vnto leauen whiche woman takethe laieth lumpe dowgh worketh laboureth litleeusebius vntil haue leauened al whole sorte eusebius seeme compare twoo partes romaine empire dissentinge iudgement religion east parte night weaste dayeiohan corin christe wil drawe al vnto selfe shal god al al matche many kinges many prince hardinge hath brought v manie newes ignamban monopotapa cambaia giapan bisnaga ormoz strange far country saithe many many kinges prince lately conuerted brought obedience see rome marueile saithe man moone likewise newly christened make vp muster howe al thinges muste needes true christes owne felowes hardinge vttereth better wise holy father societie iesus haue sente home woorde wel hereof also sundrie miracle wrought holy father verily name christe publisshed whether v light darkenes goddes holy name blessed many theire miracle haue skil thus holy father write saide holy water haue driuen mise countriecopus dialo c pa alexander de hale par quaes mem ar solut nicola lyra daniel ca made barren woman beare child sutche like marueilous miracle neither wee bounde necessitie beleue al sutche miracle euer without exception alexander hale saith sacrameto apparet caro interdu humana procuratione interdu operatione diabolica sacramente selfe appeareth fleash sometime conuciance men sometime woorkinge diuel likewise saithe nicolaus lyra aliquando ecclesia fit maximum deceptio populi miraculis fictis sacerdotibus vel eis adhaerentibus propter lucrum sometime euen churche people shamefully deceiued fained miracle wrought either priestes el theire companion lukers sake miracle euermore vndoubted proofes true doctrineaugusti contra faust li therefore augustine saithe vnto faustus manichee miracula non facitis quae si faceretis tamen ipsa vobis caueremus ye woorke miracle yet ye wrought handes wee would take heede hieremi prophete hieremie saithe seduxerunt populum meum mendacijs suis miraculis suis haue deceiued people theire lie theire miracle touchinge conuersion easte india vesputius writeth many godly bishoppes therevesputius sundrie whole country conuerted christened longe either portugales iesuites came thither yet neuer heard name bishop rome rest weast spanishe indie people liued onely without al manner knowledge god also wilde naked without ciuile gouernmente etr martyr mediolanen offeringe vp mennes body sacrifice drinkinge men bloud eatinge mennes fleash woorshipped sonne moone ancient olde tree euer sawe first morninge thought day theire god woorshipped certaine familiar diuels vnto sacrificed yonge boy girles beinge miserable state naturally sense iudgement common reason abhorringe lothinge theire owne blindnesse marueile easie leadde religion specially carrieing sutche shewe apparel holy ceremony greate kinge tartarie latevesputius nouo orbe fo findinge selfe people without manner selues greate multitude arnobius contra gens l vnto selues wee seeme many vnto god wee fewe vvee put difference bitweene nation nation vnto god whole worlde one house counsel hardinge wholesome either parte folowe wil reioice may reioice lorde apologie cap diuision although pope neuer hitherunto leasure consider diligently earnestly mater though care doo let diuers way pulle thoughe coumpt common trieflinge study nothinge appertaine pope worthinesse maketh mater ought seeme woorse perchaunce wil see whiche see deede rather wil withstande knowen cruthe ought wee therefore coumpted heretiques bicause wee obey theire wil pleasure hardinge sith christe hath geuen pope peteriohan whose laufull successour commission feede sheepe holesome feedinge beinge thend commission doubted ordeined thend hath also ordeined meanes belonginge thend therefore dutie good humble sheepe geue foorthe malicious surmise shepheard wil see seeth deede rather wil withstand knowen truthe euer sheepe disobedient refuse heare voice sheepeheard christe hath made ouer christes folde mainteininge contrary doctrine shepeheardes true doctrine iustly may accoumpted heretikes b sarisburie peter lauful successour sufficient leape peter stalle lauful succession standeth onely possession place also mutche rather doctrine diligence yet bishoppes rome nothinge el required euermore put v minde tel v many gaye tale theire succession pope symmachus saithe papa si desint bona acquisita per meritum distin non no sufficiunt quae locus praedecessore praestantur glosa ibid verb cum haereditatem pope wante vertues dis non est facile goodnesse owne alphonsus contra hare l yet vertues geuen peter predecessour cap sufficient glose vpon petrus fecit papam haeredem bonitatis suae peter hath made pope heire goodnesse hierome saithe farre otherwise non sanctorum filij sunt qui tenent loca sanctorum euermore holy mennes child sitte roumes holy menne likewise saithe alphonsus de castro special assistante syde quamuis teneamur x fide credere verum petri successorem esse supremum totius ecclesiae pastorem tamen non tenemur eadem fide credere leonem aut clementem esse verum petri successorem notwithstanding bounde faithe beleue true successour peter ye highest shepheard whole churche yet bounde faithe beleue leo clement eishoppes rome true successours peter woordesiohan christe spake vnto peter importe souerainetie common al resthead shepherd cyprian saithe hoc erant vti que coeteri apostoli quod fuit petrus pari cosortio praediti honoris potestatis cyprian de simplicita praelato rest apostle euen peter endewed like felowship honour power special priuilege pope claime succession peter talketh feeding whole flocke christe yt neuer feedeth parte therof wherin ye pope like peter wherein euer peter like ye pope yet hardinge doubteth geue definitiue sentence vvhat euer sheepe obedient headshepheard flocke christ pope also selfe boldely warranteth thus saithe selfe quicun que praeceptis nostris non obedierit dist si qui sunt glosa peccatum idololatriae paganitatis incurrit euer obeieth commaundementes falleth sinne idolatrie infidelite therefore pope steuin thus auanceth authoritie owne see sacrosancta domina nostra romana ecclesia dist opor ebat holy lady churche rome iohan christe speaking selfe saithe luc true sheepheard galat heareth woordes myne doeth wil liken wise man paule beinge one sheepe saithe thus withstoode peter hardinge saithe head sheepheard euen vnto face walked vprightly gospel christe yet sheepe flocke christe hostiensis case seemeth reasonable de concess praebendae proposuit hostien de rescriptis si quando ver sed nunquid woordes omnes debent obedi e papae quicquid praecipiat nisi sequi possit peccatum al men must obey pope euer commaunde folowe sinne commaundement likewise feliuus notable canoniste non obstante plenitudine potestatis quae est papa non est obediendum ei peccato imminente notwithstandinge fulnesse power pope sinne shal folowe biddinge may obey yf pope wil claime headpast ourship ouer whole flocke christe rather wilbe taken pastour al let feede flocke let breake breade life without leauen let speake woorde god truely without fable wee wil heare otherwise augustine hath warned vsaugusti iohan tracta sua si docere velint olite audire nolite facere certe enim tale sua quaerunt non quae sunt iesu christi wil teache would gladly called deede man either would accoumpt v brother least would take v men would first diligently haue examined reason would haue seene might saide v v would bul whereby lately pretended deede bishoppes al late couente trident euer glorious name pleaseth geue yet notwithstanding deede verily councel whether pope iulius bulie vtterly embarred diuines embassadours ye prince free citties germanie al audience disputation councel report pope iulius owne bulle touching woordes thesebreue iulij citatur caluino eri conciliu vt qui temere loquuti sunt aut dictum recantat veniant aut eorum maudita causa executionem iam ordinatarum constitutionu haeretici declarentur condemnenturi shalbe councel th haue spoken rashly either may recante theire saieinges el without farther hearing reasoning mater may denounced condemned heretiques according constitution already mode likewise saithe iohn sleidane iohan sleidan touchinge conference time augusta lib colloquio frequenter ad initium actionis hoc dicebantinolle se vel tantillum de opinione doctrina sua decedere sed quicquid facerent eo fieri vt sententiam suam no adducerent conference bitwene v told v firste would yelde one whit theire opinion doctrine euer onely intent bring v theire judgement could farther allege matthias flacius illyricus iohannis fabritius montanus petrus paulus vergerius bishop iustinopolis like purpose perhaps hardinge would refuse theire authority cal partial yet mater euident openly knowen ben great folie dissemble illyricus saitheillyri recusatione con tritini nostri audiri non potuerunt quamuis id amplissimi caesaris legati orarent diuines oratours coulde wise bee hearde notwithstandinge emperours moste woorthie embassadours hadde desired iohannes fabritius saithecouncel tridet fateor extensionem fuctam esse ad alias nationes iohan fabriti sed tamen additur eam formam non nisi ad illos pertine e qui resipiscere ad ecclesiae gremium redire velint graunt saue conduite extended nation added withal fourme libertie perteine none others onely would repe te returne bosome churche againe saith tantum aburant ab ce disputation vt ne ad vestibulum quidem accedere potuerint diuines prince germanie kept high castel disputation could suffered approche entrie petr paulus nergerius de concil trident petrus paulus uergerius saithe bishop uegla dalmatia shaken vp threatened depriuation extremity onely litle ling truthe authority noman herein plaine hard fo hardinge selfem h fo b determinate answearem h fo ful resolution casem h fo b reason hearde onlesse ye repente er rours againe doctrine hath ben approued longeth put day againe che wicked ye haue made ie lanful make neither councel without councel againe vve tel change religion heresy ought haue benne without bishop commanndemente commaundemente woordes hardinge say tel v plainely therefore trowe must beleue ye seeme conclude woordes written p yhete hieremiehieremi non audiemus verbum quod loquissus e nobis nomine domini sed faciendo faciemus omne verbu quod egredietur ex e nost vve wil beare vvoorde thou hast spoken v name lorde wil doo euery woord shal come owne mouthe may therefore say augustin epi ola augustine sometimes saide heretiques donatistes cum omnis suspensa expectares tanta collectione quid ageretu quare hoc nisi quia causam suam malam sciebant facillime se posse conuin si ageretur dubitare non poterant euery body looking carefully doone great assemblie donatistes heretiques laboured could nothing vtterly doone knew theire cause n ught could doubte conference disputation soone reproued apologie cap diuision although hierome would haue body patient suspected heresie yet wil deale herein neither bitterly brablingly yet caried away angre heate though ought reckened neither bitter brabler speaketh truth willingly leaue kind eloquence aduersaries euer say v neuer shrewdly despitefully said yet thinke said modestly comely yenough care nothing whether true false neede none shiftes maintaine truthe shewe plainely god holy gospel auncient bishoppes primitiue churche wake side haue without iust cause left men rather haue returned apostle olde catholique father shalbe founde colourably craftily good faith god truely honestly cleerely plainely theim selues whiche flie doctrine would bee called catholiques shal manifestly see howe al title antiquitie whereof boaste mutche quite shaken handes pith cause thought hope trust none wil negligent carelesse owne saluation wil length studie bethinke selfe whether parte best ioine vndoubtedly excepte one wil altogeather harden hart refuse heare shal repent geue good heede defence marke wel saie truely iustly agreeth christian religion hardinge see wel must looke finger ye spit foorth gal cholar first whole booke woorde ye pretend truthe zeale plainnes sober dealing deede power litle lieing spite scoffes immoderate railing effecte rest ye haue ioined selues synagog antichriste ye serue stage ye haue begonnt playe tragedie falsely shamefully darkely guilefully bragges promise crake goddes holy woorde errours heresy contagious poison sclaunders newe cleregies doctrine c b sarisburie saieing hierome auouched like saiyng ruffinus auncient writer thus saithe vnam notam haereseos qui dissimulat non est christianus dissembleth called heretique christian man rest blame good christian reader yf vse moe woordes neede requireth thought woorthy could answeare al thinges large trust whole apologie appeareth sutche immoderate kinde railing folow hardinges humoure write one halfe writeth perhappes might woorthily called railer apologie cap diuision cal v heretiques crime hainous onlesse maie seen vnlesse may felt manner may holden handes finger ought lightly iudged beleued laied charge christian heresie forsaking saluation renouncing god grace departing body sprite christe hardinge definition ye seeme make heresie sufficient ye define euery deadly sinne heresiethe defender definition heresie founde insufficient true definition heresie euery deadly sinne forsaking saluation renouncing god grace departing body sprite christe heresie false doctrine right beleefe professeth faithe stubbournly either auouched called doubte definition woorde stubbournly added bicause errour onely thinges faithe stubbournes errour maketh heretike augustine teacheth vvho saithe church christe sauer thing vnholsome crooked sharply admonished sauer hole right resist stubbournly wil amend venemous deadly doctrine stande defend heretikes lawe vpright dealing specially god cause requiringlib de ciui dei cap ye must pardon v among husbandman cal rake rake spade spade mattocke mattocke among diuines cal heresie heresie likewise falsehed lieing sclaundering crafte hypocrisie apostasie malice blasphemie euery crime proper name without al glosing b sarisburie ye saie right definition heresie verily hardinge simple quarrel minde place vtter definition heresie either right wronge knowe right wel sutche curiositie kinde writinge needeful sufficient woordes true although include definition iust proufe heresie three thinges necessarily required first errour secondly errour againste truthe goddes woorde otherwise euery errour maketh heresie thirdly stoutly wilfully maineteined otherwise errour goddes truthe without wilful mainteinance heresie augustine saith errare possum haereticus esse non possum augustinus errour may heretique cannot necessarie mater precisely seeke vp definition thought sufficient onely declare horrour heresie touchinge definition augustine saithe quid sit haeresis regulari quadam definitione comprehendi sicut ego existimo aut omnino non potest augustin ad quoduultdeum aut difficillim potest expresse orderly definition thinge maketh heretique iudge either impossible harde therefore hardinge felowes blame woorthy euery fantasy ye haue made heresie ludouicus viues one owne schoole thus complaineth thereofludouicus viues de corrupt artib haeresis nomen rebus leuissimis impingitur dis omnes idem facerent scotistae de thomistis nisi scholarum consuetudo aures emolliuisses name heresie laide vpon euery light mater would scotistes handle thomistes sauinge custome schooles hath brought theire eares vre thus pope nicolas saithe qui romanae ecclesiae priuilegium auferte conatur hic procul dubio labi ur haeresim euer goeth abrogate priuilege churche rome doubte heretique ye speake stubbernenesse defence heresie praye god hardinge doo ouer neare touche selfe praye god doo wilfully defende thinge wherein knowe see manifest open errour verily hierome saithe quaest haeresis est quicun que aliter scripturam intelligit quam sensus spiritus sancti flagitat quo scripta est licet ab ecclesia non recesserit tamen haereticus appellari potest vvho euer expoundeth scripture otherwise sense holy ghoste whome written dothe require although yet departed churche yet maye wel called heretique likewise old father tertullian saithe quicquid contra veritatem sapit haeresis est etiam vetus consuetudo vvhat euer thinge uoureth truthe tertull de virginib velandis vdalri u augustanus ipiscopus ad nicola papam heresie neuer mutche old custome hilari de trinitate li likewise tyrannical filthy restraininge priestes lauful mariage vdalricus bishop august calleth periculosum haeresis decretum dangerous decree heresie nowe touchinge simple errour wilful defence hilary saithe illis eo quod nesciunt potest adhuc tuto esse salus si credant tibi vero iam omnia ad salutem clausa sunt qui negas quod iam ignorare potes mutche knowe truthe maye haue theire saluation safetie afterwarde beleeue al hope health shut thee mutche thou deniest thinge thou canste chuse knowe conclude vnto hardinge oftentimes smal errours oftentimes vndoubted knowen truthes without regard definition haue fansied great alphonsus de castro de h li ca horrible heresy alphonsus de castro doctour owne saith thus idcirco sit vt hi qui tam leuiter de haeresi pronunciant non expendentes de qua loqua tur saepe sua ipsoru sagitta feriantur incidant que eam foueam quam alijs parabant nam velle humanas scripturas diuinarum ordinem connumerare hoc verius ego dixerim haeresim quod faciunt hi qui humanis scriptis diffentire impium autumant perinde ac diuinis fore happeneth rashly pronounce cal euery thing heresie considering wherof speake often striken dart fal pit yt selues haue digged others would rather cal heresie accoumpt men writinges emonges scripture god doo thinke wicked mater dissent writinges man nolesse judgement god apologie cap diuision euer olde solemne propertie forefather complaine errours faultes desired haue true religion restored streight waie condemne sutche heretiques men new fangled factious christe cause called samaritane onely thought haue fallen certaine new religion authour new secte paule apostle christe called iudgesact make answeare mater heresie therefore saide accordinge way whiche cal heresie doo worship god father beleeuinge althinges whiche written lawe prophetes hardinge yf ye meane hus hierome prague wickle almaricke abailard apostolikes peterbrusians berengariansthe defender predecessours waldenses albingenses imagebreakers suche like euer founde faulte churche time cried restoringe religion though ben quite lost would selues haue glory bringing heresie place catholique doctrine vnder name goddes woorde whiche hath alwaies ben propertie al heretikes say ye meane also cal heretikes wee condemne sir ye forget selues foulycontradiction founde defender agreeth ye saie hereafter oftentimes light truthe quite put luther zuinglius first brough gospel abroade worlde vvere true christe called samaritane cause ye assigne thereof conclude ye vve see ye go ye woulde seeme ioine christ paule first christian truely refuse companie tel yousamaritane christ true samaritane deedeiohan say keeper keeper mankinde therefore shunned name yet samaritane iewes ment paule likewise ye say speake properly called iudges make ausweare mater heresie accused felix tertullus secte heresie nazarens christian first called onely denieact openly confessed according way state life iewes called secte good part euil part tertullian vseth good part speaking christian calleth sectam apologeti c secta secte latine woord greeke woorde heresis turned example christ paule first christian serue defence reutled tertullian calleth christian people secte might without blemishe note euil case like ye charged heresie taken worst part b sarisburie howe many waste woordes hath hardinge spare againe comneth publisher gospel yet againe saie luther zuinglius firste wee haue forgotten selues fouly wee write contradiction selues wee would seeme toine christe paule truely refuse companie foorthe knowe verily hardinge wee neuer saied luther zuinglius firste publisher gospel yf wee saie wee reporte vntruthe doo often christe apostle firste woorthy learned father luther zuinglius like godly zelous men appointed god erecte newe churche reforme olde whereof made caue theeues kendle againe light quenched heare witnesse truthe god saie christ paule wil none companie priuie theire counsel perhappes hardinge clauis errans therefore neither openhieronym ca matthae shutte oriohan s1 pet hierome saithe par aliqua supercilij pharisaici parte high lookes phariseis christe selfe hath saide loueth wil keepe woorde father loueth father wil come dwel peter saithe trusteth shal confounded abailard almarik certaine strange name wee haue skil none iohn hus hierome prage berengarius like vertuous learned men wee haue cause ashamed theire doctrine standeth stil encreaseth daily bicause god bicause onely selues therefore falleth daily forsaken worlde saie simple name secte heresie wherewith paule charged infamous odious day tertullian called religion christe secte heresie without manner blemmishe note euil needelesse harding auouche vntruthe earnestly without cause graunte name heresie secte emonge philosopher infamouscicer paradox cicero saithe cato ea haeresi est quae nullum sequitur florem orationis case religion euermore emongst al men taken il parte condemned coumpted odious touchinge paule howe good parte iewes called heretiqueactor may easily appeare woordes tertullus accuser inuenimus hunc virum pestilentem mouentem seditionem omnibus iudaeis per vniuersum orbem ac principem sectae nazaraeorum haue founde man pestilent wicked felowe mouinge sedition emonge jewes throughout whole worlde captaine heresie nazareines sutche good parte saide vnto christeiohan arte thou greater father abraham thou arte false propheteiohan deceiuest people thou arte samaritane hast diuel like good parte christ promised afore hande disciplesiohan shal caste theire synagogesmatth ye shalbe hated al men name sake sutche good parte meaninge paule called heretique hardingenicola lyra cap actor bisides others owne doctour nicolaus lyra would soone haue tolde muche marueile ye vnaduisedly saye tertullian called christian people sectechristian faithe called heresie heresie good parte saye without blemishe note euil tertullian apologie saithe heathen commonly called christian factum est vulgi prouerbium pluuia defecit cause christianorum nowe become common prouerbe emonge people raine faileth v bicause christian eusebius saithe religion christe called impiorum de actibus apostolorum videtur esse relegendum fidem nostram christum ecclesiastica disciplina iam tunc peruersis hominibus haeresim nuncupatam wee maye marueile wee maye againe reade place actes apostle finde yt christian faithe ecclesiastical discipline euen wicked menne called heresie euen rightly hardinge vpon good groundes haue againe daye condemned gospel christe an good parte meaninge haue called heresie wee maye truely simply saye pauleactor accordinge secte whiche calle heresie wee woorship god father whiche father lorde iesus christe apologie cap diuision sore outragious crime heresie ought proued plaine stronge argumentes especially time menne beginne geue lesse credite theire woordes make diligent searche doctrine thei wonte doo people god otherwise instructed nowe time paste al bishoppes rome saieinges allowed gospel al religion depende onely vpon theire authoritie nowe dayes holy scripture abroade writinges apostle prophetes printe whereby al truthe catholique excellent whome haue benne confuted sithe publike sentence churche haue bene condemned bothe general prouincial councelsscriptures doctours therefore thinke noede againe prooue doctrine sufficiently space laste fiue hundred yeeres far vnlike augustine hierome ambrose chrysostome others ancient learned father doctours churche neither sufficient cause contrarie berengarius iohn wicklefe iohn hus doctour luther zwinglius oecolampadius others either learninge truthe iudgement scripture antiquitie maye wel safely compared least hope wee maye saie augustine saide doctours father timeaugust ad fortunarian epi neque quorumliber disputationes quamuis catholicorum laudatorum hominum velut scripturas canonicas habere debemus vt nobis non liceat salua honorificentia quae illis debetur aliquid eorum scriptis improbare aut respuere si forte inuenerimus quod aliter selfserint quam veritas habet neither weigh wee writinges al meane neuer woorthy catholique wee weighe canonical scripture sauinge reuerence dewe vnto maye wislike refuse somewhat writinges happen finde haue thought otherwise truthe maye beare likewise councelles ye meane newe therefore beare lesse authoritie many way contrary olde hereof hereafter large certainely none errours grosse palpable late councelles hath benne confirmed therefore wee maye iustly saie augustine sometime saide mariminus arian heretiqueaugust contrae maximin li cap nec ego nicenam synodum tibi nec tu mihi ariminensem debes tanquam praeiudicaturus obijcere scripturarum authoritatibus re cum causa cum causa ratio cu ratione conceuer neither maye saye thee councel nice maiste thou laye mee councel ariminum either v thinkinge thereby finde preuidice let v laye mater mater cause cause reason reason authoritie scripture ye graunte lighte knowledge nowe greatter either faulte folie hardinge broade daye open lighte busily set foorthe woorkes darkenesse chrysostome saithe chrysostom psalm hic est multo impudentior ex furibus enim leges eos grauius puniunt qui interdiu furantur shamelesse woorketh deceite open lighte al theeues lawe moste sharpely punisheth robbe daye time therefore cyprian saithe vnto ignosci poruit simpliciter erranti post inspirationem vero reuelationem factam cyprian qui eo quod errauerat perseuerat prudens sciens sine venia ignorantiae peccat praesumptione enim atque obstinatione superatur deceiuedpope aboue goddes vvoorde erieth simplicitie maye pordoned truthe reueled continueth neuerthelesse former errour witingly willingly sinneth without pardonne ignorance beinge ouercome presumption wilfulnesse saie withstandinge al greate light wee talke yet liues nothinge comparable liues haue benne v hardinge hathe euer benne olde complainte al age maye appeare cypriancyprian ad demetrianum august de ciuita dei ecclesiastes augustine ancient father common prouerbe olde time nonlatin alphabet thinges yeere paste euermore better thinges presente euery thinge v seemeth greatter seemeth nearest touche sens bicause wee feele father euilles therefore wee imagine euil al wise man saithe ne dixeris quae causa est quod priora tempora meliora fuerint quam praesentia stulta enim est huiusmodi interrogatio neuer demaunde wherefore time paste better time presente deede foolishe question hardinge wherefore doo thus condemne liues respecte father certainely must needes confesse fewer blasphemy fewer othes fewer breach matrimonie fewer stewes fewer concubine fewer fray fewer murthers emongst v daie commonly time emonge father let father passe shal please laye liues liues although acknowledge many imperfection yet goddes name blessed wee haue cause flee comparison pope woordes saie neuer taken gospel yes hardinge somewhat also aboue gospel proufe whereof maye please remember woordes certaine late doctours syluester prierias late ter pope leoes palaicesyluester prierias cotra lutherum writeth thus indulgentiae authoritate scripturae non innotuere nobis sed authoritate ecclesiae romanae romanorum que pontificum quae maior est pardonnes warrented vnto v authoritie goddes woorde authoritie romaine churche bishoppes rome whiche goddes vvoorde yf sufficient addeth farther doctrina romanae ecclesiae romani pontificis sacrum scriptura robur authbritatem trahit hosy scripture taketh strength authoritie doctrine bishop churche rome cardinal cusanus entituleth bookenicolaus cusanus de authoritate ecclesiae councilij supra contra scripturam authoritie churche councel aboue scripture greatest doctour albertus pigghius saithe albert pigghius hierarch lib cap apostoli quaedam conscripserunt non vt scripta illa praessene fidei religioni nostrae sed potius vt subessent apostle wrote certaine thinges ende sutche willinges shoulde ouer faithe religion rather shoulde vnder canonistes saie q quicun que clossa papa potest dispensare coira ius diuinum pope maye dispense lawe god15 q authoritate clossa papa potest dispensare contra ius naturae pope maye dispense lawe naturedist lector dist presbyter papa potest dispensare contra apostolum pope maye dispense pause apostleabbas panot extra de diuorijs cap fin papa porest dispensare contra nouum testamentum pope maye dispense againste newe testamentesumma angel dictione papa papa potest dispensare de omnibus praeceptis veteris noui testamenti pope maye dispense al commaudementes bothe olde also newe testamente hereof hereafter farther occasion shalbe offered owne doctours woordes hardinge truely reported scalunders therefore franciscus zarabelia cardinal rome saithe thusfranciscus zarabella de sectis persuaserunt pontificibus quod omnia possent sic quod facerent quicquid liberet etiam illicita sint plusquam deus haue made pope beleeue might doo al thinges euer sisted yea notwithstandinge thinges vnlawful thus haue made god saye pope common talke maye deceiued erre menue maye iudgemente seate sentence definitiue religion cannot erre ye would saye pope hath one sprite consistorie home mutche like one saide sometimes vnto cicero reproche inconstanciesalust cices ronem lucae aliud stans aliud sedens de republica loqueris touchinge common wease ye haue one minde sittinge standinge christe saide vnto peter haue praied thee thy faithe faile therefore saye wee receiue obediently euer pope speaketh place iudgemente hereby ye seeme geue v secretely vnderstande christes praiers auailable pope keepe errour churche pulpite closet common priuate place onely consistorie councel debatinge doubteful case religion holdeth argument christe praied peter faithe faileaugustin quaesti noui tesla quae iohan ergo pope cannot erre verily augustine saithe nunquid pro petro rogabat pro iohanne lacobo non rogabat vt de coeteris taceamus vvhat christe praie peter praie iohn iames wil speake reste neither christe praie peter onely apostle al faithful euer selfe saithe praie onely also al theire preachinge shal beleue mee saithe hardinge obediently receiueth pope decree yewis pope selues wil receiue platyna saithe acta priorum pontificum sequentes pontifex aut infringuntplatyna stephano romano aut omnino tollunt nihil enim aliud isti pontificuli cogitabant quam vt nomen dignitatem maiorum suorum extinguerent nexte pope either breaketh vtterly repeaseth predecessours decree litle petie pope none studie busie selues withal onely deface name dignitie former pope saye whole councel chalcedon esteemed voice pope leo benne voice peter selfe hardinge manifest vntruthe shal soone appeare graunte name leo greate learninge granitie mutche regarded ambrose like cause calledathanas ad heronem sozomen lib cap orbis terrarum oculus sacerdotum archisacerdos fundamentum fidei eie worlde head prieste al priestes fundation faithe paphnutius beinge pope hearde al reste councel nice hierome beinge neither pope bishop receiued whole councel chalcedon36 quaest quia legitima neither councel folowe leo alone vniuersal bishop head churche ioined together others esteeminge equal authoritieconcil chalcedon actio thus made theire general shoote omnes ita credimus leo papa ita credit gyrillus ita credit leo anatolius ita credunt thus wee al beleeue thus pope leo beleueth cyrillus thus beseueth leo anatolius thus beleeue credite hardinge saie whole councel chalcedon yelded vnto pope leo benne vnto peter selfe certaine whole councel decreed leo likewise leo councel councel decreed contrary olde canon bishop constantinople emonge foure patriarch shoulde seconde dignitie bishop constantinople haue enioie one authoritie like priuileges bishop rome woordes acqua sactisissmae sedi nouae romae priuilegia tribuerunt rationabile iudicantes concil chalcedon actio pa vrbem eam ornatam iam imperio senaru aequis senioris regiae romae priuilegijs frui ecclesiasticis sicut illa habet maiestatem habere negotijs father gane equal priuileges vnto holy see newe rome whiche constantinople thinkinge reasonable cittie constantinople beinge furnished empire councel churche depedeth pope enioie equal priuileges princely cittie olde rome al ecclesiastical affaire shoulde beare maiestie rome beareth thinge pope leo mutche misliked founde greate faulte councel would wise consente vnto thus writethleo epist quae per occasionem synodi male sunt attentata reprehenderam reproued thinges euil attempted councel chascedon leo epist
