againe nullum vnquam potuerunt nostrum obtinere consensum neuer hable geate consente mater paste consente al bishoppes lucentius pope leoes legate came whininge besought councel whole mater might repealed woordes written councel lucentius dixit concil chalcet actio sedes apostolica quae nobis praecepit praesentibus humiliati non debet et ideo quaecun que praeiudicium canonum hesterna die gesta sunt nob absentibus sublimitatem vestram petimus vt circunduci iubeatis viri illustrissimi ludices dixerunt quod interloquuri sumus tota synodus approbauit lucentius pope legate saide apostolique see rome whose commission wee haue maye dooinges defaced therefore wee beseche honour euer concluded yesterday absence preiudice canon ye wil commaunde blotted honorable iudges made aunsweare haue talkte whole councel hath allowed thus many way hardinge vntruthe tale plainely appeareth councel chalcedon esteemed voice leo benne voice peter saye rather contrariewise made lighte weighed none otherwise cause therefore liberatus saithe thus touchinge liberatus ca cum anatolius consentiente concilio primatum obtinuisset legati vero romani episcopi contradicerent ludicibus episcopis omnibus illa contradictio suscepta non est et licet sedes apostolica nune vsque contradicat tamen quod synodo firmatum est imperatorio patrocinio permanet anatolius bishop constantinople consente councel obteined primacie notwithstandinge bishop roomes legate stoode yet theire gainesaieinge coulde receiued neither iudges bishoppes al apostolique see rome withstande stil yet decree councel emperours warrante continueth force neuer taught v ye saye whole state churche dependeth pope doctrine neuer spake therefore wee railers sclaunderers reporte deede hardinge saye wherefore suffer cardinal cusanus write thus veritas adhaeret cathedrae nicolaus cusasnus de author eccl concil supra cotra scripturam quare mebra cathedrae vnita pontifici coniuncta efficiunt ecclesia truthe cleaueth faste pope chaire therefore member vnited chaire ioined pope make churche wherefore suffer iohannes de parisijs one catholique doctours write thus fiet vnum ouile vnus pastor quod quidem de christo intelligi non potest sed de aliquo alio ministro qui praesit loco cius iohan de parisijs de potestate regia papali cap shalbe one plocke one shepheard whiche thinge cannot taken christe must needes vnderstande minister ruleth steede wherefore suffer nosius grande captaine write thus vnum toti praecsse ecclesiae vsque adeo est necessarium vt absque hoc ecclesia vna esse non possit necessarie thinge hosius cofessione petricoui cap one onely man oueruse whole churche yt without churche cannot one wherefore suffer canonistes saie constat ecclesiam ideo esse vnam quia vniuersali ecclesia vnu est caput supremu scilicet papa plaine therefore churche one bicause whole vniuersal churche one supreme head clemen lib ad nostrum glossa pope shorte doo selfe hardinge allege hieromes woordes directly ye woulde haue v beleue purposem hard fo b hierony contra luciferianos ecclesiae salus summi sacerdotis dignitate pendet woordes englishe ye haue turned thus safetie churche hangeth vvoorship highe prieste meaneth pope peter successour whiche laste clause ye misconstrue racke hieromes woordes far contrary meaninge hierome meante bereby bishop rome euery seueral bishop within owne charge euery whiche bishop calleth highest prieste former replie declared largeart diul thinges true nowe deuied false condemned truste maye appeare fewe wee reporte truthe truely sclaunderers apologie cap diuision sithence bringe foorthe none selues cal v neuerthelesse heretiques whiche haue neither fallen christe apostle yet prophetes iniurious spiteful dealinge hardinge nay sir ye shal carie awaye conclusion lie contrarywise sithens wee bringe foorthe many scripture truthe whiche ye impugne selues shal see come confute doctrine whiche foloweth sithens withstandinge ye wil yeelde scripture peruert true meaninge gloses interpretation owne headesvntruthe frame newe opinion contrary ye haue receaued churche hathe euer taught catholikes wilful cal heretikes churche wil condemne heretikes accompt vntil ye recant repent ye haue fallen christethat defender fallen christe ye saye apostle yet prophetes though departe romaine churche whiche catholike churche diuerse time apologie ye confesse fell christe consequently apostle prophetesmath luke saithe christe gospel heareth churche let bee thee heathen publicane saieth also despiseth despiseth mee b sarisburie whether parte rightly reuerently vseth scripture god whether peruerteth shiftes gloses truste shal parte appeare conference deede hardinge great maisterie interpretation handelinges haue stoare yenough plenette scripture one special grounde diuinitieextra de translatione episcopi quato glossa papa potest ex nihilo facere aliquid sententiam quae nulla est facere aliquam pope hable nothinge make thinge sentence make sentence doctrine lawful good logique reason thusdist inferior sedes esai gloriabitur serra aduersus eum qui trahit illam shal sawe boaste draweth matthae concil roman sub syluestro non est seruus supra dominum seruant aboue lorde ergo noman maye dare iudge pope thusad titum dist proposuisti omnia munda mundis coinquinatis autem infidelibus mihil est mundum al thinges cleane cleane vnto filthy infidelles nothinge cleane ergo lawful priestes marry hardinge sometimes haue delited reasonmatthae hardinge former booke fol b nolite dare sanctum canibus geeue holy thinges dogges ergo laweful christian vulgare people reade scripture thus maye easily wel stoared ful freight scripture yenough ashieronym ad pammachium exepla captiua seruiunt ad victoriam hierome saithe maye carrie captiue serue turne hierome coulde also haue tolde youhierony cap ad galat non verbis scripturarum est euagelium cyprian ad notianum sed sensu gospel standeth bare woordes scripture meaninge therefore wee maye saye vnto cyprian saide nouatian heretiques audite nouatiani apud quos scripturae coelestes leguntur potius quam intelliguntur hearken hereto ye nouatian heretiques emongst whome heauenly scripture readde rather wel perceiued saye churche rome owne confession catholique churche whiche churche mutche wee haue forsaken wee haue forsalten christe apostlesmatth lucae saithe christe gospel saye heareth churche let vnto thee heathen publicane despiseth despisethe mee wee graunte hardinge name churche rome catholique errours abuse thereof catholique neither churche wee finde faulte withal greate corruption foule deformity haue brought churche howe policie herein apparent reader neuer simple maye soone see whole drifte ye magnifie churche al manner title authoritie special regarde ye beare churche deede onely settle selues infinite tyrannie make v beleue onely churche geue credite al fantasy yea although ye defacers enimies churche verily bare name churche sufficient paule saithe antichriste man sinne2 thess shal sitte temple god whereby doubte meante churche hardinge heare voice god leaue fable speake goddes holy woord speake truely ye faitheful minister truthe euer shalbe founde despise doctrine kinge emperour wee doubte calle heathen publicane heathen wil beare churche wil heare christeaeneas sylui gestis concil consiant aeneas syluius beinge afterwarde pope selfe saithe thus si romanus pontifex non audiet ecclesiam christum quoque non audiet tanquam ethnicus publicanus haberi debet bishop rome wil heare churche wil heare christe therefore muste taken heathen paral vrsperg pag publicane augustine saith oues meae vocem meam audiut sequuntur auferatur chartae humanae sonent vox diuinae sheepe heare voice aug de ouibus cap folowe awaie mannes vvrittinges let voice god sounde vnto v surely doctour luther selfe againste hardinge vehemently often inflamethe choler humble reuerent manner writethe thus no colimus romanam ecclefiam omnibus paral visperg pag tantum illis resistimus qui pro ecclesia obtrudunt babyloniam vvee honour churche rome al thinges onely wee withstand steede churche haue thruste cosusion babylon like sense cyprian saithe non est pax sed bellum nec ecclesiae iungitur cyprian sermone de lapsis qui ab euangelio separatur peace vvarre neither ioined churche dinided gospel nowe howe carefully churche rome leadde gospel christenicola cusanus de authoritate eccle contra supra scriptura aug contra literas petilianl lib cap wee maie easily learne nicolaus cusanus cardinal churche rome thus saithe sequuntur scripturae ecclesiam non e conuerso scripture god folowe churche contrary wise churche folowethe scripture conclude wee maye saye vnto augustine saide sometime petilian donatian heretique vtrum no schismatici simus vos nec ego nec tu sed christus interrogetur vt iudicet ecclesiam suam whether v sch matiques wee aske wil aske let christe asked maie shewe v owne churche apologie cap diuision swerde christe put diuel tempted weapon ought al presumption whiche doothe auaunce selfe againste god tim ouerthrowen conquered al scripture saithe paule commethe inspiration god profitable teache confute instructe reproue man god may perfite throughly framed euery good woorke thus holy father alwaie fight againste heretiques none force holy scripture hardinge holy father euer fight heretiques nowe force holy scripture wee denie father first general councel holden nice fight arius mainteiners heresie force scripture heretikes refused woorde homousion whereby signified sonne god one substance god father found scripture besides whiche stiffely denied ye doo thinge ought receiued caetholike bishoppes thother side flie ancient father thei appeale iudgementes father geuen sentence mater beinge controuersie arius helde side borne seconde councel assembled constantinoplehistor tripart lib cap heretikes sundry sectes wittie godly policie contriued betwene nectarius bishop theodosius emperour suggestion greate clerke stsinnius driuen receiue doctours liued theire heresy heard witness true christian doctrine woorthy credite macedonius councel condemnedmacedonius therefore denied holy ghost god bicause scripture geue vnto name bishop assembled photius learned bishop writeth declared teaching father diuines theire time holy ghost adored worshipped glorified beinge one nature substance togeather father sonne thirde councel kept ephesusnestorius euer called scripture heretikes daie doo vvhat euer secte bee epist tom deipara found scripture yet receiued kept heretike nestorius boasted ye doo scripture sayinge side would neither speake heare ought scripture scripture alleaginge place twoo gospel marie called mother iesus stoutely finde scripture quoth wher marie called mother god hereto said holy learned bishop cyrillus chiefe councel hanc nobis fidem diuini tradidere discipuli licet nullam fecerint dictionis huius mentionem ita tamen sentire sanctis patribus edocti sumus fatthe saith disciple god haue tradition lefte vnto v although haue made expresse mention woorde deipara yet thinke haue benne taught holy father reasoned rule touchinge faithe made saithe vincentius lirinensis writinge councel al bishoppes assembled number almost two hundred seemed catholike faitheful beste done sentence holy father brought foorthe amonge thend theire consente decrce religion olde doctrine confirmed blasphemie prophane nouel ie condemned behold sir weapon father haue vsed heresy besides holy scripture fourthe councel whiche celebrated chalcedon heretike eutyches ye al heretikes haue done c aked mutche scripture required matter discussed scripture tel quoth mockingly euery one reasoned scripture lie twoo natureseutyches claimed opinio tried scripture let v heare learned bishoppes councel saide thereto vvee finde first action councel cried aloude ea quae sunt patrum teneantur thinges father haue taughtthe teachinge father kept actio let kept againe come definitiue sentence saie sequentes igitur sanctos patres c folo winge holy father wee doo al one accorde teache men confesse one selfe sonne lorde iesus christe persite selfe godhead perfite himselfe manhood auctoritie father high pointes faith bishop reuered assemblie named eudoocius pronounced notable sentence sayeing thus euery one consentethe exposition holy fathersa notable sayinge learned father thexposition father doothe alienate selfe al pristely communion presence christe thus wee haue alleaged foure first general councels whiche gregorie honourethe foure gospel thinge beinge euident welkuorwen euen selues ye learned auctorit chief councels maie suffice b sarisburie hardinge ye haue taken hande needelesse labour knowe right wel wee despise authoritie holy father rather selfe place haue alleged togeather augustine hierome ambrose three moste auncient approued father throughout whole discourse apologie defence catholique truthe religion nexte vnto goddes holy woorde haue vsed prouse authoritie mutche exposition iudgementes holy father wee despise therefore rather geue god thankes theire behalfe hathe pleased prouide woorthy instrumentes churche therefore wee iustly reproue vnaduisedly without cause ye haue forsaken steppe holy father foure general councelles wherein dwel longe make nothinge v sundrie pointes fight expressely firste summoned emperours constantinus theodosius theodosius martianus right authoritie pope hereafter shalbe shewed place conuenient largesozo li ca iulius bishop rome summoned emperours write appeare councel nice wel othersconcil chalcedon actio fol pope leo afterwarde charged like authoritie appeare councel chalcedoneodem tenore leo vocauys est euseb de vita constan orat councel nice bishop rome president eustathius bishop antioche sametheodoretus lib cap con nicen councel nice bishop rome hathe authoritie iurisdiction made equal leuel three patriarkes concil chal cedon actio pag councel chalcedon bishop constantinople made equal authoritie bishop roome shorteliberat ca saide councel chalcedon laste like cause leo bishop rome would allowe thinge notwithstandinge councel standethe stil force whether pope wil foure fiste general councelles whiche hardinge comparethe authoritie foure euangelistes heretiques arius nestorius macedonius euiyches foure general councelles vtterly despised al auncient father boasted selues saithe hardinge scripture euermore cried scripture scripture touchinge arians alleged certaine doubteful darke place scripture serue theire purpose certaine manifeste either despised catholiques auouched eropsition authoritie father hardinges onely woorde muste warrante neither allegethe one author prouse hereof yet namethe al father notwithstandinge let v graunt heretiques cried hardinge saithe scripture scripture euen heretiques likewise crie euen nowe hardinge doothesocr li ca nonlatin alphabet father father socrates saithe et ariani originis libros citabant testimonium vt illi quidem iudicabant sui dogmatis arian heretikes alleged learned father origen bookesdoctours alleged heretiques thought proufe witnesse theire doctrine heretique eutyches saide ego legi scripta beati cypriani sanctorum patrumconcil chalced actio pag concil chalced actio pa sancti athanasii haue readde writinges cyprian holy father athanafius likewise eutychian heretique carosus saide ego secundum expositionem trecetorum octodecim patrum sic credo fic baptixatus sum aliud quid mihi dicas nescio faithe accordinge exposition three hundred eighteene father councel nice faithe baptized ye saye cannot telle euen saide eutyches selfe concil chalced actio pag sic progenitoribus mei accepi credidi hac fide baptizatus sum signatus v que hunc diem ea vixi ea opto moti thus haue receiued forefather thus haue beleeued faithe baptized signed haue liued vntil daye wish die thusaugustia contra cresco li ca conc pa augustine saithe donatian heretique cresconlus alleged authoritie cyprian thus nestorian heretiques alleged authoritie councel nice shorte thus heretique dioscorus cried open councel chalcedon concil chalced act pag ego habeo testimonia sanctorum patrum athanasij gregorij cyrilli non transgredior aliquo ego cum patribus cijcior ego defendo patrum dogma ego horum habeo testimonia non simpliciter aut transitorie sed ipsorum libris haue testimony holy father athanasius gregorius cyrillus alter pointe throwen foorthe bannished father defende father doctrine haue theire iudgementes vttered chaunce vnaduisedly remaininge expressed theire bookes doubte hardinge maye hereby easily see heretiques ye speake cried onely scripture scripture ye saye leasure also sometimes crie doo father father wel purpose rightly longe time haue vsed crie hauinge deede case wee speake neither scripture father come neare mater wee saie al case doubt manifeste open woordes plainely expressed scripture neede exposition wee saye case religion darke doubteful maie necessarily either proued reproued collection conference scripture hierome saithe hieron esai cap moris est scripturarum obscuris manifesta subnectere order scripture augu lib quaest q harde thinges ioine thinges bee plaine augustine like wise saithe solet circunstantia scripturarum illuminare sententiam circunstance scripture woonte geue light open meaninge like rule tertullian also geuethe tertull aduersus tra eam piphani lib de semiariani nonlatin alphabet oportet secundum plu intelligi pauclora fewer place muste expounded moe therefore touchinge woorde homousios whiche hardinge moueth whole contention arians epiphanius writethe thus nomen substantiae simpliciter nude veteri noua scriptura non proponitur sententia autem eius nominis vbi que oc urrie woorde substance plainely nakedly founde neither olde newe testamente sense meaninge woorde founde euerywhere conference iudgemente holy scripture wee neede oftentimes discretion wisedome learned father yet notwithstandinge maye wee geeue herein greater credi e conuenient selues offered would receiue wee maye reuerently saye seneca like case sommetime saide eneca non sunt domini sed duce nostri leader lordes scripture doctours truthe god selfe onely witness vnto truthe therfore augustine saithe august epist ad hieronym alios scriptores ita lego vt quan alibet sanctitate doctrina que praepolleant non ideo verum putem quod ipsi ita senserint sed quod id mihi vel per alios authores canonicos vel probabili ratione persuadere potuerint writer father bisides holy scripture reade sorte theire learninge holinesse neuer greate wil thinke true bicause haue thought bicause hable persuade either canonical writer el likely reason augusti contra faust lib ca likewise againe saithe hoc genus literatum cum credendi necessitate sed cum iudicandi libertate legendum est kinde writinges holy doctours father must readde necessitie beleeue eche thinge libertie iudge eche thinge aug de vnita eccle ca ende saithe ne catholicis quidem episcopis consentiendum est sicubi forte falluntur vt contra canonicas dei scripturas sentiant wee maie consente vnto bishoppes notwithstandinge catholique iudge contrarie holy canonical scripture authoritie credite wee haue ought haue holy father nowe let v see whether bishoppes others councelles confuted heretiques wee saye scripture el hardinge seemethe saye wante weakenesse scripture vsed therein authoritie fathersthedor li ca trip hi li ca nonlatin alphabet firste emperour constantinus councel nice instructinge bishoppes howe might beste debate theire quarrelles ende al striues saithe thus vnto euangelicae apostolicae literae veterum prophetarum oracula perspicue no instituunt quid oporteat sapere de voluntare sensu dei ponentes ergo contentionem ex diuinitus inspiraris oraculis quaeramus solutionem eorum quae proponuntur euangelistes apostle writinges saieinges olde prophetes doo clearely instructe v iudgemente wee ought haue meaninge wil god therefore saieinge fide al contention heauenly oracle let v seeke assoilinge question socrates also touchinge councel nice saithe thus arian heretiquessocrat li ca nonlatin alphabet explicantes sacrosanctas scripturas saepe illos euertimus openinge expoundinge holy scripture oftentimes wee ouerthrewe likewise augustine disputinge againste arians refusethe haue saide bothe councelles father appealethe onely scripture nec ego nicenam synodum tibi nec tu mihi ariminensem debes obijcere scripturarum authoritatibus re cum causa cum causa ratio cum ratione concertet neither wil allege councel nice augusti contra maxi li ca shal allege councel ariminum againste authoritie scripture let v weigh mater mater cause cause reason reason touchinge councel holden constantinople macedonius diuinitie holy ghoste athanasius saithe athanas ad serapion spirit sanct non esse creaturam uagrius ne interroges sed solum ex sacris literis condiscas sufficiunt enim documenta quae illis reperias neuer mooue question hereof onely learne holy scripture onely proufes ye shal finde sufficient warrant godhed holy ghoste likewise saithe euagrius twoo councelles ephesus chalcedon ex euangelicis apostolicis de domino vocibus scimus viros illos diuinos constituisse wee knowe godly father concluded mater suche woordes euangelistes apostle haue vttered lorde therefore auncient father origen saithe vide quam prope periculis illi sintorig ca ad rom lib qui negligut exerceri diuinis literis ex quibus solis examinationis huiusmodi agnoscenda discretio est consider daunger haue care reade holy scripture chrysost opere imperfec homi scripture onely iudgement trial must allowed euen saithe chrysostome etiamsi ipsis veris ecclesijs quae dei sunt dixerint christum apparuisse nolite eis credere dicentibus ista de non enim digna est diuinitatis meae haec notitia ostedens per haec quod ab ipsis saepe veris ecclesijs excunt seductores propterea ne ipsis quidem credendum est nisi ea vel dicant vel faciant quae conuenientia sint scripturis yea saie christe hathe appeared true church god yet beleeue woorthy sufficient knoweledge godhed sheweth true church oftentimes come foor deceiuers therefore wee maie beleeue speake vnto v name churche onlesse speake doo suche thinges agreeable scripture like manner againe saithe origen orig hiere hom necesse nobis est restimonium vocare sancras scripturas sensus quippe nostri enarrationes sine ijs restibus non habent fidem wee muste needes calle witnesse holy scripture iudgementes exposition without witness carrie credit leaue al like authority might alleged shorte conclusionaug de naturae cratia ca augustine saithe solis canonicis scripturis sine vlla recusatione cosensum debeo owe consente without gaine saieinge vnto doctours father onely vnto canonical scripture bishoppes councelles saithe hardinge brought foorthe folowed exposition auncient learned father wherefore might man euer taught saide contrarie yet notwithstandinge alleged fundations groundes onely approued uagrius libr cap nonlatin alphabet faitheful witness truthe whiche thinge hardinge happily wil denie maie easily appeare woordes cyrillus pronounced published openly councel chalcedon gratulamur nobis mutuo quod nostrae vestrae ecclesiae fidem habent consentientem diuinitus adspiratis scripturis traditionibus sanctorum patrum wee reioice togeather eche v others behalfe faithe bothe church also agreable bothe vnto heauenly inspired scripture also tradition exposition father whiche woordes cyrillus beinge hearde consente father knowen whole councel ioye made shoote togeather omnes ita credimus papa leo ita credit c thus wee al beleeue pope leo thus beleeuethe thus beleeuethe leo anatolius thus cyrillus beleeuethe faithe father faithe apostle thus haue apostle taught thus maye see hardinge wee saye doo v learned thereof haue doubte god graunte ye maie directe learninge glorie thus maye see ende bishoppes councelles ye speake alleged exposition ancient father howe farre weighed vnder authoritie scripture like sorte doo wee also day allege manifeste vndoubted agreeable iudgementes moste aunciente learned holy father thereby apapproued faitheful witness wee disclose infinite folie errours doctrine seeinge haue forsaken felowship saide holy father hereafter shal ully appeare wee saye vnto endoxius saide vnto heretique abbate eutyches councel chalcedon ye haue remoued selues bothe al priestly communion also presence christe apologie cap diuision sde vnitate eccle ca et contra maximinum arianoru pi li cap augustine disputed againste petilian donatian heretique let woordes quod hearde betweene v saye saye let v rather speake wise thus saithe lorde let v seeke churche let v boulte cause hardinge concerninge place augustine ought stretched al mater general questionmanifeste vntruthe though wee might vse testimony authority father againste heretikes perteinethe onely quaestion booke de vnitate ecclesiae treated whiche churche petilia donatist mainteiners heresie cotended churche onely aphrike furthest parte donati amonge onely helde donatus heresie went proue scripture augustine sawe howe weake theire proufes whiche brought scripture prouoked better ouerthrow come trial scripture deede scripture manifeste proufe matter nede doctours sense scripture obscure may wrested euil wittes maintenauce heresie exposition father al olde vvriters haue ben taken necessitie supplie scripture obscuritie declare sense churche whiche holy ghost hathe propted sutche case augustine himselfe vsethe testimony father seldome namely iulian pelagian vvhere beside scripture touchinge original sinne allegethe pelagians great number father length one place speakinge authoritie reuerence credite saithe thuscontra iulian pelagian lib quod credunt credo c vvhat beleue beleue holde holde teache teache preache preache special general negatiuely argumente holdethe ye knowe ye haue forgotten logike b sarisburie hardinge wel el thinkethe easy mater bolde asseueration smoothe vnlearned simple reader specially sutche one hathe eies looke woordes augustine saithe perteine onely vnto mater hande therefore maye forced remembrethe v profounde pointe logique negatiue coclusion special general cannot holde mater woorthy hearinge firste howe hardinge coulde enter deepely knowe mutche augustine meaninge next mutche respecte selfe euermore fansiethe v vnlearned howe hable teache v knowe assuerethe v vpon woorde woordes augustine muste needes pounded restreined one onely mater maie wise stretched farther imagineth augustine meaninge thus good reader hardinges handlinge thou haste meaninge augustine augustine himselfe neuer meante augustine mater heretique petilian although booke writethe thusaugusti contra liter petilian lib cap siue de christo siue de eius ecclesia siue de quacun que alia quae pertinet ad fidem vitam que nostra dicam si no sed si angelus de coelo nobis annuntiauerit praeterquam quod scripturis legalibus euagelicis accepistis anathema sit vvhether bee christe churche thinge el euer perteininge either life faithe wil saie mee selfe angel heauen shal teache v otherwise gala wee haue receiued bookes lawe gospelles holde accursed hardinge saithe augustine meante onely one mater augustine selfe saithe meante al manner mater touchinge either faithe life hardinge saithe augustine meante onely selfe augustine selfe saithede quacunque si angelus de coelo meante yea eue angel god shal wee thinke hardinge knoweth augustine meaninge augustine selfe knewe verily augustine case concerninge arians haue touched twise likewise refuseth determination al councelles father standeth onely scripturesaugusti contra maxi li ca neither wil saithe allege againste thee councel nice shalt thou allege againste mee councel ariminum c neither dothe augustine onely saye thus also yeeldeth reason saithe woordes auferantur de medio quae aduersus no inuicem non ex diuinis canonicis libris augu devnita iccle contra petilian cap sed aliunde recitamus quaerer fortasse aliquis cur vi ista auferri de medio quia nolo humanis documentis sed diuinis oraculis ecclesiam sanctam demostrari haue away al authority either v allegeth sauinge sutche onely taken heauenly canonical scripture perhaps somme man wil aske wherefore would ye haue al sutche authority put away answeare bicause would haue holy churche proued doctrine menne vvoorde god saithe augustine vnto donatistes augu psal auferantur de medio chartae nostrae procedat medium codex dei audi christum dicentem audi veritatem loquentem take waie emongst v bookes let booke god comme emongste v heare christe saithe herken truthe speaketh againe saithe audi dicit dominus non dicit donatus aut rogatus aut vincentius augu epist aut hilarius aut ambrosius aut augustinus sed dicit dominus heare lorde saithe heare donatus saithe rogatus saithe vincenius saithe hilarius saithe ambrose saithe augustine saithe herken lorde saithe like fourme woordes saithe ambrose nolo nobis credatur scriptura reciteturambros de incarnat domin sacramen ca chrysost ad corinth homi non ego dico principio erat verbum sed audio non ego effingo sed lego would ye beleeue v reade scripture saye mee selfe beginninge woorde heare make reade likewise saithe chrysostome oro vos omnes vt relinquatis quid huic aut illi videatur de scripturis haec omnia inquirite beseeche al weigh man man thinketh touching al thinges searche scripture nowe pleaseth hardinge telle v argumente negatiue special general cal v remembrance logique pleaseth also remeber argument wee grounde augustine woordes holdeth imagined fro special general fro imperfection weakenesse wisedome man stabilitie certainetie goddes holy woorde therefore olde learned father origen saitheorigen hieremi homi micro psal alleged sensus nostri enarrationes fine testibus non habent fidem iudgementes exposition without witness scripture haue credite like sorte hierome quamuis sactus sic aliquis post apostolos quamuis disertus sit non habet authoritatem apostle christe notwithstandinge somme man holy notwithstandinge eloquente yet wanteth authoritie therefore augustine saitheaugust de peccator merit r mi li ca cedamus consenuamus scripturae sacrae quae nec falli potest nec fallere let v yeeld consente holy scripture whiche neither deceiue deceiued cause hardinge augustine onely mater laye bitweene pettlianus also al mater soeuer often appealed al father councelles vnto scripture apologie cap diuision likewise hierome al thinges saithe whiche without testimonie scripture holden deliuered apostle throughly smitten downe swerde goddes woorde hardinge ye would falne remoue v good hold see wel whiche authoritie holy fa thers ancient tradition vniuersal churche al would ye force heretiques ye knowe father churche againste longe beleued doctrine shal receiued alwaies founde newe priuate deu se driuen ye doubt matche v wel yenough scripture ye would handle mater thinke selfe verely al authoritie iudgemente father churche shake quite cotrouersie whome shal tried scripture ye saie bothe ye alleage scripture contrary purpose vary sense scripture shal iudged perhaps ye wil referre iudgement doubtful mater holy ghoste vve refuse tharbitrement vmpiership holy ghoste hath ben promised christe churche remaine churche euer teache thinges euer saide lead men al truthe thus iudgemente trial truthe shalbe retourned churche father holy ghoste speaketh vnto v whose authoritie due estimation ye go aboute remooue v let v see force ye bringe driue v holde makinge batterie shoote ye vvinde paper artillerie makethe e geueth blowe laste allegation ye falsified sense augustine ye falsifie bothe sense woordes hierome woordes ye allege seeme spoken euer tradition apostle vvhiche woordes like sutche purpose neuer vtered catholike doctour churche mutche lesse hierome looke ye againe vewe better place ye shal saye selues finde faulte falsefyeinge without cause sagg cap hierome commentary vpon woordes prophete aggaeus et vocaui siccicitatem super ram super monte haue called drought come vpon earthe vpon hilles c first winge literal sense accordingly hebrew woorde noted signifieth siccitatem drought treatinge mystically seuenty interpreter haue turned woorde romphaeamgladius swerde vnderstandinge swerde vvoorde god thereof takethe occasion briefly saie swerde doothe destroieth negligent soule whiche expounded drie earthe howe plaguethe montaines lifte vp selues knowledge god whereby meanethe heretikes tellethe howe flatter deceiued people theire breade wine oile whiche meaneth theire heresy meates drinkes refection breade saithe man maie aptly cal bread vvaylinge theyr vvine madnesse dragon madnesse serpentes incurable theire oile promisinge heauenly thinges wherewith doo anointe theire disciple promise rewardes theire labour prophete detesteth sayeinge oile sinner shal anoint head folowe woordes hierome whiche ye haue falsified intent might seeme serue false meaninge sed alia quae absque authoritate testimonijs scripturarum quasi traditione apostolica reperiunt que cofingunt percutit gladius dei swerde god strikethe also thinges whiche heretiques speaketh deuise faine theire owne heades without authoritie witness scripture though came tradition apostle compareth place flsified allegation maie sone espie greate oddes betwene ye make hierome saie al thinges whiche without testimony scripture holde allowed interpreter tourneth asseruntur deliuered apostle throughly smitten downe swerde goddes vvoorde swerde goddes woorde ye woulde quite smite downe al apostolike tradition blowe thanked god swerde forged swerde paper swerde swerde neither edge cutteth weight beareth downe hierome putteth al thinges whiche haue tradition apostle without expresse scripture swerde goddes woordescriptures doctours speaketh generally woorde alia thinges ye make omnia al thinges againe speaketh sutche thinges deuised fained heretikes theire owne braine without authoritie testimony scripture vnto whiche geue estimation though came tradition apostle circumstance exaggeration doo ye omitte saye hierome putteth al apostolike tradition dreadful swerde goddes vvorde nowe hierome saithe wee holde allowe wel saienge refuse falsely fathered vpon hierome vvhat condemneth condemne neither place iustly alleaged againste v inuente fame thinges accorde owne heades though deliuered apostle besides scripture parte heretikes specially tatians place hierome saithe vve finde deuise faine nothinge catholike religion doo kepe mainteine thinges deuised holy ghoste leafte churche apostle apostolike men generall councelles whose authoritie churche healthful saithe austine concerninge force whiche consent father iudgement hierome appeareth epistle euagrius authoritie auncient doctours time proueth heretike melchisedech man lande chanaan holy ghost b sarisburie faine would hardinge haue reader beleeue wee vtterly despise al holy father wee despise hardinge maye partely appeare wee haue already saide wee reade theire woorkes wee reuerence wee geue god thankes wee calle pillers lightes father goddes churche wee despise thinge onely wee saye theire learninge holinesse neuer greate yet equal credite scripture god thus also saithe augustine augusti contra cresconi gram lib cap august ad hieron epist no nullam cypriano facimus iniuriam cum eius qua ibet literas canonica diuinarum scripturarum authoritate distinguimus wee offer wronge cyprian wee seuer letter writinges canonical authoritie holy scripture againe ioininge al doctours athers togeather saithe thus ipse mihi pro omnibus imo supra ho omnes apostolus paulus occurrit ad ipsum confugio ad ipsum ab omnibus qui aliter sentiunt literarum tractatoribus prouoco steede al learned father iather aboue al paule apostle commeth minde renne appeale al manner writer doctours father thinke otherwise likewise hieromehiero ad tranquillinum ego originem propter cruditionem sic interdum legendum arbitror quomodo tertullianum nouatum arnobium apollinarium nonnullos ecclesiasticos scriptores graecos pariter latino vt bona eorum eligamus vitemusque contraria thinke auncient father origen respecte learninge maye readde sometimes tertullian nouatus arnobius appollinarius sundrie ecclesiastical vvriters wel greekes latines wee maye take good flee contrarie iudgemente augustine hierome sundrie others whose woordes shortnesse passe ouer yet therefore condemned despisers holy learned father wee remoue saye holde hardinge nothinge el courrage countenaunce father ye speake trust appeareth already former writinges special case lie bitweene v ye haue fewe father holde ye saye wee euermore calle scripture faulte hope hainous christe hathe commaunded v doo searche ye saithe christe scripture iohan hilarie saithe vnto emperoure constantius fidem interpretation scripture imperator quaeris audi eam non denouis chartulis sed de dei libris doothe maiestie seeke faithe heare newe scrolles bookes god rather suspected fleeth light wil iudged scripture scripture darkehilarius ad imper constantium doubteful alleged bothe partes ye saie ye refuse vmpeereship iudgemente holy ghoste ye adde farther holy ghost promised onely churche nowe opinion churchepetrus de palude de potestate papae arti heruaeus de potest papae ca churche roome churche roome churche without pope one greate doctours saithe potestas papae solius excedit potestatem totius residuae ecclesiae pope onely power passethe al power whole churche bisides like doctour saithe papa virtualiter est tota ecclesia pope power vertue whole churche thus reason goethe round aboute primo ad vltimum ergo neither holy ghoste interpretation sense scripture onely pope summa summarum whiche thinge graunted man seeke farther whole mater ende true scripture written sprite god must expounded same2 petri matth apoc actor iohan without sprite wee haue neither eares heare eies see sprite openethe noman shuttethe shuttethe noman openethe sprite prepared opened silk woman harte shee shoulde geue eare consider thinges spoken paule respecte sprite prophete esai saithe erunt omnes docti deo shalbe al taught god god hathe bounde selfe sprite euermore dwel rome esai chrysostom de sancto adorando spiritu vpon lowly humble harted tremblethe woorde god chrysostome saithe qui propria loquuntur falso praetendunt spiritum sanctu speake selues falsely pretende holy ghoste againe si quid praeter euangelium sub titulo spiritus obtrudatur ne credamus quia sicut christus legis prophetarum impletio est ita est spiritus euangelij thinge brought vnto v vnder name holy ghoste bisides gospel let v beleue christe fulfillinge lawe prophetes holy ghoste fulfillinge gospel nowe sprite bishoppes rome haue expounded vnto v holy scripture god wee shal shewe hereafter fitter occasion shal require saye wee haue corrupted bothe woordes sense hierome haue taken omnia steede alia haue diuised made nothinge selues hierome meante heereby tradition apostle onely fonde fantastes dreames heretiques called tatians al thinges wee must needes confesse one thinge true deede wee tooke omnia steede alia ouersight gaue occasion vnto quareler howe doubt indifferente gentle reader wil soone pardonne faulte proceeded onely negligence malice notwithstandinge wante maie easily supplied sufficient commentarie matt omnis christe saith omnis plantatio quam non plantauerit pater meus coelestis eradicabitur euery plante heauenly father hathe planted shalbe rooted hardinge ye may borrowe omnia healpe hierome cyprian lib epist quodcun que like cyprian maye telle adulterum est impium est sacrilegum est quodcun que humano furore instituitur vt dispositio diuina violetur aduouterous wicked abominable euer ordered rashenesse man goddes order shoulde broken true hierome speakethe woordes tradition apostle true yet hardinge speakethe woordes sutche fantasy brought churche god magnified vnder name colour tradition apostleseuseb li ca nonlatin alphabet anno illyricus de sect pag confe petricouien de ceremoniis pag copus angl dial pag copus angl dial pag iohan cor eusebius saithe heretique cherinthus brought v owne monstrous diuises vnder pretense reuelations written greate apostle sutche hardinge inuentions wherewith ye haue longe time deceiued worlde one companion suffragane sidon late diete augusta presence whole empiere doubted saie whole canon woorde worde euen nowe vsed mass came directly apostle hosius polonia saithe apostle appointed order monkes side saithe christus dux signifer vitae monasticae christe captaine standerd bearer monkes life imagininge trowe christe abbate yet afterwarde doctour either obliuion el vpon somme better remembrance saithe thus elia elizaeus ce instituti benedictini elia elizaeus firste captaines benettes order hardinge haue tolde v often ye haue priuate masse halfe communion knowe el al apostle al ye prooue god wote ful simple coniectures bicause christe saithe apostle haue many thinges saye vnto ye hable beare yet bicause paule saithe corinthian wil order reste comme hereby ye beare v hande al moste triflinge vanity brought vnto paule euen thirde heauens although true ye saie ye haue diuised thinges selues haue receiued al apostle holy father whiche thinge conscience knowethe moste vntrue yet notwithstanding thinges receiued ye haue sithence fouly defaced sundry superstition ye haue made necessarie saluation ye haue bounde people lesse lawe god haue ye made snare christian conscience although thing selfe came father yet abuse therof came selues ye haue taught people breake goddes expresse commaundementesai matt matt thus haue blended goddes heauenly wine puddle water thus haue ye strained gnattes swalowed camelles leauen scribe phariseis whiche christe calleth hypocrisie therfore al thinge selfe ye haue thus receiued respecte substance al one yet beinge thus abused respecte superstition deformity one apostle holy father vsed oile yet vsed ye doo saluation body soule moses erected vp brasen serpente wildernessenum iohan ioel cap yet adoured godly honoure folowed afterwarde god commaunded people faste yet hypocrisie wicked fasted therefore god saithe vnto non est hoc leiunium quod ego elegi fastinge esai haue chosen god commaunded people kepe calendes newe moones yet sutche superstition abuse people kepte therfore god saide vnto themesai matth required thinges handes god commaunded sundrie bathinges wasshinges yet vnto moste precisely vsed christe saide vvoe vnto ye scribe phariseis vaine woorship mee teachinge commaundementes doctrine menne yet hardinge haue infeaffed apostle christe onely substance thinges whiche ye saye ye haue receiued tradition also al abuse superstition corruption idolatry whiche ye haue diuised selues therein ye wel resemble tatian heretiques whome onely ye saye hierome speaketh whether hierome meante onely knowe fantastical dreames tatians imagine onely selfe without proufe particulare naminge nothinge el also al sutche superstitious vanity wee haue often iustly reprooued maye soone appeare woordes immediately folowinge omnem laborem manuum hieronym aggae cap ieiunia corum obseruationes varias nonlatin alphabet id est humi dormitiones al theire hande labour theire fastinges obseruations vsages harde sleepinge grounde sutche like thinges whiche menne imagine came apostle striken consumed swerde goddes woorde thus hardinge notwithstandinge longe glose biside texte seemeth meaninge hierome yf ye wil yet force contrarie turne al selues tatians doo two line nexte folowinge muste needes make blushe owne errour woordes haec autem vniuersa quae dixi possunt de ecclesiae rectoribus intelligi al thinges haue spoken maye vnderstanded ruler churche tel v nomore therefore hardinge tatians hierome selfe telleth meante onely also bishoppes ruler churche little saithe inferrur gladius super monte eleuantes se aduersus scientiam dei swerde goddes woorde laide vpon mountaines lifte selues vp againste knowledge god sense writeth cyprian ad pompeium cyprian si ad diuinae traditionis caput originem reuertamur cessat omnis error humanus yf wee returne head beginninge lordes tradition al errour man muste needes geue place like sense also writeth tertullian tertull de praescrip haere ipsa doctrina haereticorum cum apostolica comparata ex diuersitate contrarietate sua pronuntiabit neque apostoli alicuius authoris esse ne que apostolici verie doctrine heretiques compared apostle doctrine diuersitie contrarietie bitweene wil soone pronounce sentence selfe yt neither apostle apostolique man authour euen thus fareth hardinge greate heape doctrine ye saie ye haue tradition apostle yet vtterly voide al authoritie testimonie scripture therefore hierome saithe consumed striken downe conscience godly onely swerde goddes holy woorde eies see daye beinge compared apostle doctrine difference contrarietie greate easily bewraieth selfe tertullian saithe neuer came apostle apostolique doctour churche apologie cap diuision ambrose also gratian emperour let scripture saithe asked question lette prophetes asked let christe asked time made catholique father bishoppes doubte religion mighte prooued holy scripture neither euer hardy take heretique whose errour coulde euidently apparantly reprooue selfe scripture wee verily doo make answeare wise paule accordinge waye whiche calle heresie wee doo woorshippe god father lorde iesus christe doo allowe al thinges whiche haue benne written either lawe prophetes apostle woorkes hardinge gratian emperour bucklinge selfe encounter heretike firste geueth meaninge al ware endeuoureth prooue false doctrine namely first pointe sonne vnlike father versutis disputationibus cap vvith suttel craftie reasoninges alleageth purpose paule colossian cauere ue quis vos depraedetur pe philosophiam beware man spoile philosophie vaine deceit c saithe heretikes put al force theire poison logike dialectical disputation whiche opinion philosopher desined haue power prooue earnest desire destroie disproue hauinge geuen holesome warninge lest selfe might seeme vse whiche counselleth others beware withde awe emperour al guileful logike ariusambres de fide lib cap firste entrie saithe wil thou geue credite holy emperour argument disputation folowe woordes whereof defender take holde scripturas interrogemus c let v aske scripture let v aske apostle let v aske prophetes let v aske christe vvhat neede many woordes let v aske father c pointe beleefe whiche highe secrete sayinge ambrose restrained confirmation truthe pointes whiche nearer common sense confutation heresy whiche lesse subteltie whiche sorte gospeller grosse errours ende wee ought vse testimony holy father heretikesvntruthe whiche purpose alleage place ambrose neither al booke neither al woorkes speaketh muche one woorde contrarie wise sundry place woorke alleageth auctoritie nicene councel testimonie good force arians declareth diuine mysterie haue benne signified suche special number father assembled sayinge sic nempe nostri secundum scripturas dixerunt patres euen thus accordinge scripture haue father saide seruemus praecepta maiorum c let v keepe preceptes forefather neither temeritie rude boldnes let v breake hereditarie seales meaneth doctrine sealed father left posteritie heritage vvhiche v wil hardy vnseale priestly booke sealed confessours nowe consecrated martyrdome many one lo heare ye sirsnothing howe muche ambrose though saye touchinge mystery let v aske scripture apostle prophetes christe yet thereby dothe quite exclude father saithe let v reiect father scripture father contrary therefore thallowinge disalowinge vvho euer maketh argumentvntruth whiche vvoorde implied scripture asked ergo holy father asked maketh foolishe argument b sarisburie greattest forte hereof answeared already ambrose ye saye appeale scripture excludeth iudgement learned father onely cau lations subtileties philosopher sophisters ambrose selfe treatie often allegeth authoritie father al hardinge true deede notwithstandinge certaine secrete vntruthe lapped ambrose allegeth father groundes principle fundations faithe onely interpreter witness consenters vnto faithe whiche thinge parte neuer denied nowe whether ambrose meante thusscriptures doctours let ambrose selfe iudgeambr ad cratia de fide li woordes sic nempe nostri secundum scripturas dixerunt patres thus haue father saide selues accordinge scripture allegeth father hauinge sufficient credite substance selues onely expounder interpreter scripture saithe godly father athanasius athanas de humanitate verbi no ista hausimus magistris diuinitus afflatis qui sacros libros euoluerunt thinges haue learned maisters father inspired heauen whiche haue readde perused holy scripture augustine wel saithe august contra cresconi gramma li ca hierony episto ad ephes lib cap secundum ho libros de coeteris literis vel fidelium vel infidelium libere iudicamus accordinge bookes scripture wee iudge frankely al writinges whether faitheful vnfaitheful therefore hierome saithe omni studio legendae nobis sunt scripturae lege domini meditandum die ac nocte vt probati trapezitae sciamus quis numus probus sit quis adulterinus wee muste reade scripture al diligence muste bee occupied lawe lorde bothe daie nighte wee maye become perfite exchanger hable rightly discerne monie lawful counterfaite hilarie saithe hoc proprium est apostolicae doctrinae deum ex lege ac prophetis euangelijs praedicare hilari psal order apostle doctrine gospel preache god lawe prophetes otherwise touchinge discourse natural reason ambrose saithe creature either earthe heauen hable reache deapthe thinges thus saithe men deficit vox silet non mea tantum sed angelorum supra potestates ambro ad gratianum de fide lib cap supra angelos supra cherub supra seraph supra omnem sensum est minde astonned voice faileth onely mine also angelles aboue power aboue angelles aboue cherubius aboue seraphins aboue al manner vnderstandinge therefore saithe alleaged nolo nobis credatur scriptura recitetur ambros de incarnationis dominicae sacracramen ca non ego dico principio erat verbum sed audio woulde ye shoulde beleeue mee lette scripture readde saye mee selfe beginninge vvas vvoorde heare spoken againe saithe booke vnto emperour gratian ambros ad gratian imperator lib cap facessat nostra sententia paulum interrogemus let iudgemente stande aparte let v aske paule question hardinge saithe vvhoso euer maketh argumente whiche vvoorde implied scripture asked ergo holy father asked maketh foolishe argumente seemeth greate pointe wisedome hardinge vpbraide others folie without cause god encrease bothe v al wisedome vnderstandinge christe iesu argumente howe euer hathe pleased fashon handle meante made sutche folie wherefore euer folie nowe come owne wee denie learned father exposition iudgementes doubteful case scripture wee reade selues wee folowe wee embrace saide wee moste humbly thanke god thus wee saie father opinion iudgementes mutche sometimes disagreeable one sometimes implie contrariety contradiction therefore alone selues without farther authoritie guidinge goddes woorde alwaies sufficient warrantes charge faithe thus learned catholique father themselues haue euermore taught v esteeme weighe father ancient father origen saithe thus reported ex solis scripturis examinationis nostrae discretio petenda est discussinge iudgemente muste taken onely scripture againe sensus nostri enarrationes sine scripturis testibus non habent fidemorigen epist ad rom lib cap ex solis origen hieremt homi august de natura gratia ca iudgementes exposition without witnesse scripture haue credite likewise augustine ego solis canonicis scripturis debeo sine vlla recusatione consensum consent without exception owe vnto father neuer wel learned onely holy canonical scripture reason nam cum dominus acuerit quis nostrum dicat illa vel illa sunt aut si dicere audet vnde probat lorde selfe hath spoken v saie dare saie howe prooue therefore concludeth directly like woordes ambrose augustin iohan tracta august de pastorib ca ego vocem pastoris inquiro lege hoc mihi de propheta lege de psalmo recita de lege recita de euangelio recita de apostolo require voice shephearde reade mater prophete reade mee psalmes reade lawe reade gospel reade apostle apologie cap diuision wherefore wee heretiques woulde faine called catholiques doo see father whiche catholique men haue alwaies donne doo conuince maister v diuine scripture doo calle v againe tried doo laye v howe wee haue gonne awaye christe prophetes apostle holy father sticke doo afraide goddes cause doubteful commit trial goddes woorde yf wee heretiques whiche referre al controuersies vnto holy scripture reporte v selfe woordes whiche wee knowe sealed god selfe comparison sette litle al thinges euer maye diuised menne shal wee saye folke praye manner men howe meete calle whiche feare iudgement holy scripture saie iudgement god selfe doo preferre theire owne dreames ful colde inuentions maintaine theire owne tradition haue defaced corrupted nowe many hundred yeeres ordinance christe apostle hardinge vve doo condemned went tradition father doo weeiohan scripture consiste inke paper sense vvhiche sense holy ghoste christes promise hath taught churche epiphanius refutinge heretikes whiche named selues apostolikeshaereei scripture nesdeth speculatio traditio necessa ie bicause scripture hathe al thinges recognition lib saithe scripture haue neede speculation witte wel studied considered ende force power euery argument maye knowen behoueth v also saithe vse tradition wee haue al thinges holy scripture thus epiphanius tradition without doubte meaneth sense vnderstandinge receiued father keie vvoorde god peter taught report clement sense vnderstandinge lawe minister lawe whome tradition moses elder came handes nowe wee require admitte tradition saye catholike sense vnderstandinge scripture whiche hathe benne deliuered vnto v holy father al age al country faithe hath benne receiued wil calle againe tried scripture haue catholikes layde oftentimes doo shewe confutationl c despiseth despiseth mee saithe christe churche ye despise catholike churche therefore ye despise christe neede many question sir hote rhetorike sheweth courage woorde victorie deede ye calle v foorthe scripturesgreat bragges made defender thassurance scripture fielde ye strike v downe woordes ye come encounter shewe brauerie mo stre ye referre controuersies vnto holy scripture ye reporte vnto woordes sealed god himselfe catholikes ye pretende sticke afraide doubte th mater feare iudgement holy scripture preferre owne dreames colde inuentions vvel nowe ye haue tolde lusty tale heare sober answeare often time true scripture stretched foorthe serue euil false purpose iewes went scripture prooue christe muche opheteiohan saidevntruth vvoordes othervvise searche scripture see prophete riseth galiley scripture would needes shewe woorthy dieiohan haue lawe quod lawe ought die hath made selfe sonne god diuel alleaginge scripture would haue deceiued sauiour selfe saide vnto scriptum est matth de fide li c marke written arians ful scripture ambrose writeth went prooue christe author al goodnesse good written quoth nemo bonus nisi vnus deus none good onely god likewise macedonian nestorian eutychians case selues dooinge like may wee doo better honour scripture seeke right sense vnderstandinge scriptum est scripture saith ambrose allegation arians acknowlege letter hath errour woulde god arians interpretation apex sine crimine sunt sensus crimine letter without crime sense crimehilari de trinita li vnderstanding commeth heresie scripture sense woorde becommeth crime saith hilary sithens al standeth sense let v agree first vpon sense interpretation scripture ready ye come foorth ye liste vpbraide v hardely say lustely ye doo sticke doo afraide true sense interpretation scripture shal wee finde wee saidematthae iohan esai catholike churche churche hauinge christe remaininge al day ende worlde hauinge promise christe sprite truethe remaininge euer hauing goddes owne ancient promise bothe woordes whiche father hath put mouthe christe sprite whiche putte whereby may vnderstand meaninge goddes woordes wee maie seeke true sense vnderstanding interpretation scripture churche owne doctour iohn caluine selfe epist ad h braeos ye folowe esteeme mutche admonisheth wel saithe specially noted churche light sounde vnderstandinge scripture ground beinge laide whiche eche parte must stande tried crowe againste v boast selues morevntruthe vve feare iudgement holy scripture nay selues feare iudgment owne conscience telleth ground ye weaker side yf ye stande v grounde ye shal neuer able defende maister iohn caluines doctrine touchinge baptismevntruthe debaseth sacrament baptisme whiche h aketh litle force manifest scripture let euery one saithe peter baptized name iesus christe remission sinnes keepinge groundevntruth ye shal borne doctrine touchinge absolution denyinge prieste haue power absolue penitentes priestly auctoritie preachinge gospel contrarie plaine scripture vvhose sinnes ye orgeue forgeuen vvhose ye retaine reteined yf ye refuse grounde ye shal forced restore sacrament extreme vnction vse holy oyle againe whiche ye haue abandoned haue ye saye scriptureiacob sicke amonge let cause priestes churche come anointinge oile name lorde ab dinge grounde ye shal driuen forsake zwinglian doctrine whiche putteth signes figure onely sacrament aultar true real body christe presentethree dente vntruthes contrarie cleare scripture bodie beinge grounde ye shal soone geue ouer maintenance doctrine special faithe iustification faithe onelyiacob beinge contrary plaine scripture man iustified woorkes faithe onely conclude shewe howe many pointes ye maye confuted euident scripture maner infinite ye wil admitte good grounde ye midste needes admitte shal ye mainteine presumptuous doctrine certaintie grace saluation contrary paule counsellethphilip vvith feare tremblinge woorke saluation b sarisburie whereas wee make reasonable request god maye vmpeere owne cause al controuersies maye iudged tried holy scripture hardinge thereto answeareth thus scripture standeth wordes sense sense continued tradition churche otherwise saithe iewes arians nestorian eutychians al heretiques alwaies hable claime scripture conclude maketh vp greate emptie heape force baptisme holy oile extreme unction absolution signes figure onely faithe liketh calle presumptuous doctrine certainetie saluation euery whiche thinges saithe scripture cleare side directly v answears al pointes particulare would require booke briefely touche mutche onely shalbe needeful first substance scripture standeth right sense meaninge onely naked bare woordes true generally graunted without exception needeth farther proufehiero contra luciferian hilari de triuitate li hierome saithe non legendo sed intelligendo scripturae consistunt scripture stande readinge vnderstandinge hilarie non diuinorum dictorum sed intelligentiae nostrae nobis ratio praestanda est wee muste yeelde accoumpte goddes diuine woordes owne exposition onely right meaninge sense scripture within fewe late hundred yeeres cropen churche rome al gospel euer bee arriueth thence al heretiques schismatiques despisers christe apostle uniuersal churche make staie canot receiue whole mater already concluded wee shal neede adoo ye saie iewes arians nestorian heretiques alleged scripture yea verily hardinge euen like faithe like sense like purpose allege nowe hereafter truste shal appeare waye example hereof place allege woordes pharise auouchinge scripturesiohan nonlatin alphabet chrysostom augustinus maye please remember either witingly errour ouersight ye haue manifestly corrupted scripture whereas haue translated place thus searche scripture phariseis saide nothinge el scrurare vide searche see spake one woorde scripture although mater importe mutche yet charge owne rule whiche muste needes good selfe smal faulte goddes woorde must counted greate deede chrysostome augustine seeme supplie woorde scripture although texte touchinge mater selfe oile figure signe nicolas lyra saithe nicol lyra cap iohan hoe verbum eorum simpliciter falsum est quia si intelligatur de prohetis generaliter aliqui fuerunt nati de galilaea videlicet elizaeus tobias debora prophetissa forte plures alij woorde phariseis plainely false taken generally al prophetes certaine borne galilei namely elizaeus tobias debora perchance others moe sutche sorte hardinge euen like faithe credite also haue vsed allege scripture whereto driue al longe tale wil ende conclude thus iewes heretiques alleged scripture ergo faitheful christian maye allege thus theeues haue sometimes armed selues ergo true menne maye armed nay wee maye rather saye thus vnto iewes heretiques alleged scripture accoumpte maye wee make flee condemne burne scripture certainely notwithstandinge phariseisiohan heretiques wickedly misalleged scripture ye sometimes doo scrue purpose yet al christe saide vnto scrutamini scripturas searche scripture andcap diuisi saide catholique learned father al theire case controuersies appealed euermore scripture saye scripture cleare side make directly againste v would god ye woulde deede vnfainedly stande trial fansies folie woulde soone come grounde touchinge greate heape example sacramente baptisme defaced saye caluine absolution extreme unction holy oile signes figure onely faithe certainetie saluation whiche calle presumptuous firste sacramente baptisme caluine euery writeth al manner reuerence callinge diuine heauenly mysterie sacramente redemption wherein also sometimes iustly reprooueth ye haue many way profanely vnreuerently abused absolution wee shal haue occasion saye hereafter touchinge oile deede shewe woordes iames seemeth make somewhat notwithstandinge neither doothe calle holy oile ye doo neither doothe calle sacramente churche doothe saye ye saie serue saluation body soule doothe teache salute speake vnto liuely reasonable creature aue sanctum oleum alhaile holy oile woordes minister vnto sicke per hanc sanctam vnctionem suam pijssima misericordiam ignoscat tibi deus holy enointinge deere mercie god pardonne thee shorte miraculous gifte healinge lastinge onely like miracle time necessary sacramente churche continewe euer obiection signes figure shortnesse timethe article muste referre thee gentle reader vnto former replie harding woordes christe whiche thought plaine anciente learned father tertullian expoundeth thustertullian contra marcion lib figure signe hoc est corpus meum hoc est figura corporis mei body saye figure body likewise augustine non dubitauit dominus dicere hoc est corpus meum cum daret signum corporis sui lorde doubted saye body gaue signe body rehearse al like ancient authority longe triumphes would hardinge make none al olde learned father coulde founde euer called sacrament signe figure christes body alleged imagined sense scripture without woordesonely faithe nowe allegeth woordes alone without sense shoulde haue remembred better hierome saithe ne putemus hierony pist ad gala cap verbis scripturarum esse euangelium sed sensu let v thinke gospel standeth vvoordes scripture meaninge twoo greate quarelles hardinge moueth one onely faithe calleth presumptuous certainetie saluation wherein iudge thou vprightly good christian reader iuste cause hath reprooue doctrine firste hereofroma paule saithe iustificamur gratis ex gratia ipsius wee iustified freely grace wee iudge man iustified faithe without vvorkes lawe wee knowe man iustified vvoorkes lawe faithe christe hardinge wil saie yet hitherto sola fides onely faithe wee heare nothinge notwithstandinge paule excludeth al manner woorkes bisides onely faithe el leaueth faithe alone horrible heresie saye wee iustified god onely faithe saie onely merites crosse christe let v see holy learned father churche many hundred yeeres agoe haue taught v thereof ambrose saithe ambros pist ad roman cap iustificati sunt gratis quia nihil operantes neque vicem reddentes sola fide iustificati sunt dono dei iustified freely bicause woorkinge nothinge requitinge nothingeambros eode loco iustified onely faithe gifte god againe sic decretum est deo vt cessante lege solam fidem gratia dei posceret ad salutem goddes determination lawe surceasinge grace god shoulde require onely faithe vnto saluationambros epist ad rom ca basil de humintlitate nonlatin alphabet theodorer de curandis graecorum affectibus lib nazia nonlatin alphabet origen epist ad rom c li hesychi leuiti li chrysost epist ad galat cap againe sola fides posita est ad salutem onely faithe saide appointed vnto saluation bastle saithe nouis se esse inopem verae iustitiae sola autem fide christum esse iustificatum knoweth selfe voide true righteousnesse iustified onely faithe christe theodoretus saithe non vllis operibus nostris sed per solam fidem mystica bona consequuti sumus vvoorkes onely faithe haue gotten mystical good thinges nazianzenus saithe nonlatin alphabet credere solum est iustitia onely beleeuinge righteousnesse origen saithe vbi est gloriario tua exclusa est dicit sufficere solius fidei iustificationem ita vt credens quis tantumodo iustificetur etiasi nihil boni operis fecerit vvhere nowe thy boastinge thy good woorkes shutte paule saithe iustification onely faithe sufficiente man onely beleeuinge maye iustified although haue donne good woorke al hesychius saithe gratia ex misericordia atque compassione praebetur fide comprehenditur sola grace god geuen onely mercie pauoure embraced receiued onely faithe leaue greate number others haue written like wel greekes latines steede al chrysostome saithe thus illi dicebant qui sola fide nititur execrabilis est hic contra demonstrat eum qui sola fide nititur benedictum esse saide staieth selfe onely faithe accursed contrar ewise paule prooueth stayeth selfe onely faithe blessed touchinge woordes iames yf hardinge wel considered equiuocation double vnderstanding woorde iustification might soone easily haue espied owne errourroma paule saithe abraham iustified faithe without vvoorkes lawe teacheth v abraham receiued fauour iustified god side iames saithecertainetie faithe abraham iustified vvoorkes faithe onely speaketh woorkes folowe iustification fruites faithe without whiche fruites abraham faithe benne faithe augustine saithe non sunt contrariae duorum apostolorum sententiaeaugust li quae quae iacob pauli iacobi cum dicit paulus iustificari hominem sine operibus iacobus dicit inanem esse fidem sine operibus quia paulus loquitur de operibus quae fidem praecedunt iacobus de ijs quae fidem sequntur saieinges twoo apostle paule iames contrarie paule saithe man iustified without woorkes iames saithe faithe without woorkes vaine paule speaketh vvorkes goe faithe james speaketh vvorkes folowe faithe yf hardinge shal thinke augustine authoritie herein sufficient thomas aquine wil auouche ye woordes thomas aquin epist iacobi cap iacobus hic loquitur de operibus sequentibus fidem quae dicuntur iustificare non secundum quod iustificare dicitur iustitiae infusio sed secundum quod dicitur iustitiae exercitatio vel ostensio vel consummatio re enim dicitur fieri quando perficitur vel innotescit iames place speaketh sutche woorkes folowe faithe whiche woorkes saide iustifie iustification procuring righteousnesse exercise shewinge perfitinge righteousnesse wee saye thinge donne perfited knowen donne nowe concerninge assurance certainetie saluation scripture fulle paule saithe damnation christe iesuroma sprite god beareth witnesse sprite wee child god knowe neither deathe life angel power principality thinges presente thinges come highth deapthe duy creature el shalbe hable remooue loue god beareth wardes mee christe iesu lorde mutche woordes perhaps haue sense churche roome without whiche hardinges iudgemente scripture god scripture let v see sense exposition holy father tertullian saithe vt certum esset no esse filios dei misit spiritum suum corda tra clamantem tertull contra marcion lib abba pater wee might certified bee child god hath sente holy ghoste harte crieinge abba father clemens alexandrinus saithe clemens paedagogo li c vera sanguis fidei est spes qua continetur vt fides anima cum autem spes expirauerit perinde acsi sanguis effluxerit vltalis fidei facultas dissoluitur deede hope bloudde faithe whiche faithe hope conteined euen faithe conteined soule hope gonne al liuely power faithe dissolued bloudde sheadde body cyprian saithe et tu dubitas fluctuas hoc est deum omnin non nosse cyprian de mortalita sermon hoc est christum credentium magistrum peccato incredulitatis offendere hoc est ecclesia constitutum fidem domo fidei non habere dooste thou stagger stande doubte thy saluation mutche knowe god mutche sinne vnbeliefe offende christe maister beleeuers mutche beinge churche house faithe haue faithe prosper saithe prosper de promiss praedictionib dei par ca securi diem iudicij expectant quibus cruce domini gloriantibus mundus crucifixus est ipsi mundo vnto whome worlde crucified crucified vnto worlde waite daye iudgemente without feare leaue ancient father olde time put mater quite doubte one antonius marinarius late councel tridente open audience saide thus si coelum ruat si terra euanescat si orbis illabatur praeceps concil tridentin act anno ego eum erectus ero si angelus de coelo aliud mihi persuadere contendat dicam illi anathema certainetie faithe foelicem christiani pectoris fiduciam yf heauen shoulde fal yf earthe shoulde vanishe yf whole worlde shoulde come downe headlonge yet woulde stande preste bolde god yf angel heauen woulde tel mee otherwise would accurse blessed truste certainetie christian harte certainely hardinge presumptuous parte saye father greekes latines newe olde owne al presumptuous yf presumptuous mater put affiance merites christe put affiance owne merites paule hath taught v sayegalat basil psal nonlatin alphabet god forebidde shoulde glorie onely crosse christe basile saithe qui non fidit suis meritis nec expectat ex operibus iustificati vna solam spem habet salutis suae misericordias domini trusteth owne merites looketh iustified owne woorkes hath onely hope saluation mercy lorde saithe iob al misery etiamfi occiderit sperabo eum veruntamen vias meas conspectu eius arguam iob psalm although kisse mee yet wil put trust notwithstandinge wil reprooue way sighte prophete dauid thee lorde haue trusted wil neuer confouded presumption patiente humble waitinge redemption child god moste truephilip paule saithe wee must woorke owne saluation feare tremblinge feare riseth consideration owne weakenesse vnwoorthinesse distruste doubte goddes mercie rather lesse cause wee finde truste selues cause wee haue truste godaugust de verbis domi sermo therefore augustine saithe praesume non de operatione tua sed de christi gratia gratia enim saluati estis inquit apostolus non ergo hic arrogantia est sed fides praedicare quod acceperis non est superbia sed deuotio presume thou thine owne woorkinge grace christe apostle saithe ye saued grace heere therefore presumption faithe proclaime thou haste receiued pride deuotion againe saithe august iohan tracta basil de humilitate nonlatin alphabet non mea praesumptione sed ipsius promissione iudicium non venio presumption promisse shal comme iudgemente basile saithe paulus gloriatur de contemptione iustitiae suae paule presumeth boasteth contempte owne righteousnesse saithe ambrose non gloriabor quia iustus sum sed quia redemptus sum gloriabor non quia vacuus sum peccatis sed quia mihi remissa sunt peccara non gloriabor quia profui neque quia profuit mihi quisquam sed quia pro aduocatus apud patrem christus est sed quia pro christi sanguis effusus est wil glorie iuste man redeemed th refore wil glorie voide sinne ambros de iacabo vita beata sinnes forgeeuen mee wil glorie haue donne good man man hath donne good wee christe aduocate father christes bloudde shead mee therefore augustine saithe august confess lib cap quid retribuam domino quod recolit haec memoria mea anima mea non meruit inde vvhat shal der vnto lorde calle remembrance al sinnes yet soule thereof afraide shorte thus saithe bernarde bernard ca ti cantico sermo vbi tura firma que infirmis securitas requies nisi vulneribus saluatoris tant illic securior hab quant ille potentior est ad saluandum c peccaui peccatum grande turbatur conscientia sed non perturbabitur quoniam vulnerum domini recordabor nempe vulneratus est propter iniquitates nostras safe teaste sur tie weake scule finde w de saueour mightier saue dwel safetie c haue committed greate since conscience troubled yet shal bee shaken downe bicause wil remember lordes woundes esai wounded sinnes thus hardinge assured saluation augustine saithe arrogante stoutenesse faithe pride deuotion presumption goddes promisse whole doctine truste mennes merites leadeth directly desperation therefore cyprian saithe wel cyprian de simpli praela asserunt noctem pro die interitum pro salute desperationem sub obtent spei perfidiani sub praetex u fidel antichristum sub vocabulo christi teach v nighte steede daie dei struction tleede healthe desperation vnder coloure hope infidelitie vnder pretense faithe antichriste vnder name christe nowe litle viewe groundes hardinges longe discourse whereas often earnestly telleth v sense scripture wee scripture without sense meaninge thereby onely leade v awaye sense churche romealberius piggh hierar li ca ecki de ecclesia whiche sense albertus pigghius saithe infallible inflexible rule truthe echius saithe scriptura nisi ecclesiae authoritate non est authentica scripture god authentical credite onely warrante authoritie churche hosius like manner apostoli hosius confessione vetricouien ca cum symbolum traderem nunquam dixerunt credo sanctum biblia aut sanctum euangelium sed dixerunt credo sanctam ecclesiam apostle deliuered crede neuer saide beleeue holy bible holy gospel saide beleeue holy churche thus nowe mater sure yenough euer wee haue neither scripture sense scripture onely rome wil reporte vnsauerie sens haue imagined scripture one example twoo taste maye sufficient pope boniface saithe thusde maior obedien vnam sanctam psalm antonen summa par titu ca hebraeo ecce duo gladij h c beholde twoo swerdes saye pope hath power bothe spiritual swerde temporal saithe omnia subiecisti sub pedibus eius id est papae pecora campi id est homines viuentes terra pisces mari id est anima purgatorio volueres coeli id est anima beatorum woordes paule applieth onely vnto christe meaninge thereby god hath auanced aboue al power dominion al thinges subiecte vnto romaine sense far otherwise thou haste made al thinges subiecte vnto saye pope cattaile fielde saye menne liuinge earthe fish sea saye soules purgatory birdes heauens saye soules blessed heauen leaue hardinges owne peculiar expositionsm hard former answeare artic hardinge articulo drinke ye al saye geathereth conclusion drinke ye al substance saye accidens sutche prety sens wil saie hierome saithe de euangelio christi facitis hominis euangelium aut quod peius est diaboli gospel christe ye make gospel man woorse gospel diuel wil saye hieronym epi ad gala cap thus maye saye prophete esal ye make lighte darkenesse darkenesse lighte yet muste wee needes beleeue vpon hardinges woorde scripture without sense churche rome scripture esai hosius de expresso verbo dei therefore hasius saithe si quis ha eat interpretationem ecclesiae romanae de loco aliquo scripturae etiamsi nec sciat nec intelligat quomodo cum scripturae verbis conueniat tamen habet ipsissimum verbum dei man haue exposition churche rome touchinge place scripture although neither knowe vnderstande whether howe agreeth woordes scripture yet hath verie woorde god saithe rabbi abraham hispanusrabbi abraha speakinge exposition rabbines licet videantur nobis verba nostra esse vera rectum nobis tamen veritas abijcienda est terram quia veritas cum illis est withstanding exposition seeme v neuer true rightescripture traditio yet muste wee throwe truthe grounde truthe deede lyra likewise reporteth common opinion iewes rabines lyra deuteron cap recipiendu r est quicquid hoc modo proponatur etiamsi dicant dextrant esse sinistram wee muste needes receiue euer laye vnto v yea although tel v righte hande lefte nowe gentle reader thou maiste better see constancie certainetie sens exposition whereunto hardinge laboureth earnestly haue thee bounde maye please thee consider woordes nicolaus cusanus sometime cardinal churche rome nicolaus cusanus de author eccle cocil supra con scripturam non est mirum si praxis ecclesiae vno tempore interpre atur scripturam vno modo alio tempore alio modo nam lntellectus currit cum praxi intellectus enim qui cum praxi concurrit est spiritus viuificans sequuntur ergo scripturae ecclesiam non e conuerso marueile though practise churche expounde scripture one time one waye time waie vnderstandinge sense scripture renneth practise sense agreeinge practise quickeninge sprite therefore scripture folowe churche contrariewise churche foloweth scripture sutche kindes exposition scripture hilarie saide sometime vnto arians fides ergo temporum magi est quam euangeliorum faithe therefore foloweth time gospel sense churche rome whereby onely hardinge willeth v measure weighe woorde god ancient father origen saithe origen matthae homil sicut omne aurum quodcunque fuerit extra templum non est sanctificatum sic omnis sensus qui fuerit extra diuinam scripturam quamuis admirabilis videatur quibusdam non est sanctus quia non continetur sensu scripturae euer golde without temple sanctified euer sense without holy scripture although vnto seeme wounderful yet holy bicause conteined sense scripture conclude hardinge saithe wee cannot vnderstande scripture without tradition ancient father irenaeus saithe one special marke whereby wee maye knowe heretique woordes haeretici cum arguuntur ex scripturis ire li ca accusationem scripturarum conuertuntur quasi non recte habeant nec sint ex authoritate quod varie fint dictae quod ex non possit inueniri veritas ab illis qui traditionem nesciunt heretiques reprooued scripture falle accusinge scripture though either wel perfite wanted authoritie doubtefully vttered knowe tradition neuer hable scripture finde truthe apologie cap diuision menne saie sophocles tragical poete old day owne sonnes accused iudges dotinge sottishe man one fondely wasted owne substance seemed neede gouernour see vnto intent might cleere self faulte came place iudgemente rehearsed tragedie called oedipus colonaeus whiche written time accusation marueilous exactely cunningly aske iudges owne behalfe whether thought sottishe dotinge man coulde doo like peece woorke like manner bicause menne take v madde appeache v heretiques menne whiche haue nothinge doo neither christe churche god wee haue iudged good purpose vnprofitable wee doo openly frankely set foorthe faithe wherein wee stande shewe al confidence whiche wee haue christe iesu intent al menne maye see iudgement euery parte christian religion maye resolue selues whether faithe whiche shal see confirmed woordes christe writinges apostle testimony catholique father example many age certaine rage furious madde menne conspiracie heretiques therefore beliefe hardinge comparison whiche ye make betweene selues sophocles gladly admitte yet acknowledge many respectes ye like vnlike sophocles poet saie fainer deuiser thinges true fabulous ye also fainers deuisers nouelties folowers newe deuises false sophocles tragicall poet ye tragical diuines tragedie setteth foorthe thouerthrowes kingdomes murder noble personage greate trouble endethe woful lamentation gospel inuadeth christes heauenly kingdome churche murdereth soules bought moste deere price causethe hellishe garbotle mennes conscience ende bringethe euerlastinge weepinge gnasshinge teethe vve take madde vvould god ye woorse madde vvere ye madde ye tied vp el ye suffered goo abroad feare folke would flie ye doo little hurte nowe while ye offer venemous kiss sugered lippes while ye couer woluishe crueltie vnder lambes skinnes while ye hurte vnder pretece benefite wounde vnder colour medicine begyle vnstable soules resemblance truth
