maisters truthe sclaunder vnto blinde doctours light becomme darkenesse saithe augustine kinge dauid insanire videbatur sed regi achis insanire videbatur id est stultis ignorantibus dauid seemed madde vnto kinge achis seemed madde saye vnto fooles idiotes parteactor wee remember answeare paule made vnto festus like case good festus madde vtter vnto thee woordes truthe hiero epitaphio paulae sobrietie therefore may comforte selues vertuous gentlewoman paula likewise supposed madde no stulti propter christum sed stultum dei sapientius est hominibus wee iudged fooles madde folkes christes sake foolishenesse god wiser menne cyprian ad cornelium hardinge cyprian wil telle thus haec est frater vera dementia non cogitare nec scire quod mendacia non diu fallant noctem tam diu esse quam diu illuce scat dy brother madnesse deede thinke knowe lie cannot longe deceiue v night longer vntil daye springe deede madnesse therefore chrysostome saithe qui manifestam foueam cadit non negligens dicitur sed insanus falleth pitte liethe wide open saide bee negligente starke madde ende firste parte seconde parte apologie first chapter diuision wee beleeuespan one certaine nature diuine power whiche wee calle god diuided three equal person father sonne holy ghoste al one power one maiestie one eternitie one godhed one substance although three person diuided neither father sonne sonne holy paineful tormentes cruel kinde deathe wherein rose againe wherein ascended right hande father aboue al rule aboue al power al force al dominion aboue euery name named onely worldeactor also worlde humaine nature hath leafte v touchinge diuine naturetulgent ad thras mudum christe thoughe absent v concerning manhed yet euer present v concerninge godhed place also wee beleeue christe shal come againe execute general iudgement wel shal finde aliue body shal already dead hardinge father dayes change religion thought vpon christen people lyued togeather perfite vnitieneither man ashamed apostle creede accoumpt belife ben demaunded none ashamed common apostle crede euery one constantly confessed beleue god father almighty maker heauen earthe iesus christe foorthe sithens luther brought avntruthe vvas olde newe gospel worlde wee haue sene greate diuersitie amoge men onely ceremony administration sacramentes also themanifeste vntruthe vvee keepe al one creede publike confession faithe sundrie ruler country common weales receiued newe doctrine theire preacher minister haue sette foorthe sundrie credes confession theire faithe hilarie time complaininge ofs hilaries complaint many faithes one god one faithe nowe dayes saithe many faithes willes many doctrine maners many cause blaspemies springe vp vice while faithes either written wee list vnderstanded list one god one lorde one baptisme accordinge thereto one faithe wee steppe aside whiche onely faithe while mo faithes made beginne come point faithe al maner vtterance faithe strange christen earesthe maner vtterance defender faithe strange christe eares haue ben accustomed heare credo deum credo iesum christum credo spiritum sanctum beleue god beleue iesus christe beleue holy ghoste forme woordes whiche vse soundeth christianlike beleue god beleue iesus christe sonne father b liue holy ghoste god although forme woordes expresse right faithe yet beinge sutche maye vttered deuils hathevntruthe heretiques saide beleue god vvel catholiques alwaies ben vttered heretikes theire minister auncient holy father haue liked better olde forme maner whiche euery christen man saithe beleue god beleue iesus christe beleue holy ghoste importeth signification faithe hope charitie faithe onely whiche deuils haue trembleiacob iames saithe wherein many thinges defender resemble augustine sundrie place putting differece betwen two formes wordes vpos iohn alleaging paules wordes one beleueth iustifieth wicked faithe imputed rightuousnesse demaodeth beleue answeare credendo amare credendo diligere credendo eum ire eius membris incorporari beleuinge loue beleuinge goe incorporate member made member body defender procedeth declaringe belefe newe englishe churche grateth mutche vppon article christes ascensionthe article christes ascensio mutche grated vpon defender euil purpose iohan tract oportet potest maner al zwinglians theire minde geueth thereby shal able bringe leste many simpler sorte sacramentarie heresie thinke body christe wherein ascended heauen suteth right hande father absent fro earthe may beleued present sacrament aulter thereto alleagethe augustine makinge saye christes body wherein rose againe must nedes stil one place treatise holy father hathe wordevntruthe augustine vvoorde oportet augustine knevve sutche body sacramente oportet must nedes defender alleageth worde potest maye bookes haue corrupted mainteiners heresie saithe ad dardanum alleaged defender though christe hathe geuen maiestie vnto body yet hathe taken awaye nature body stretched christes body sacrament condition nature almightie power worde although hathe taken awaye body nature body yet may please body god nolesse man whiche besides aboue nature bodymatthae pleased said body pleaseth donevutruthe neither sutche institution sutche commasidemet whesoeuer body offered daily sacrifice churche according comandement institutiondiuersitie creedes vigilius saithecontra eutyche lib hovve christe hathe lefte novv earthe ioan christe hathe lefte v touching humaine nature hathe left v touching diuine nature vnderstaded visible shape whiche shewed humaine nature whe walked earthe co uersant men sensibly iohn writethe heard theire eares saw theire eies behelde touched withe theire handes touchinge humaine nature sensible wiseexpositionis epist iohan tract christe hathe left v whiche augustine saithe iam non inuenis christum loqui terra nowe thou findest christe speake earthe maner christes humaine nature beinge taken v withstandeth may haue substance natural body bloud present blessed sacrament mysterie almighty power word whiche faithe defender trauatle impugne god would penneman apologie bringeth vn ware semethe confirmation sacramentarie doctrine ulgetiusad thrasymundum regem whiche ouerthroweth al wet builde real presence father alleaged saithe christum cum absit nobis per forma serui tamen semper esse nobiscum per forma dei whereas christe absent v accordinge forme seruant yet euer present v accordinge forme god vvhereby meaneth christe nomore amonge men deathe forme shape man sutche wise see men liue earthe vvhiche woordes bicause seme dasshe theire whole purposevntruthe forme substance bothe one prelate newe englishe churche haue altered sense shifting worde manhed stede forme shape seruant whiche latine hathe worde godhed stede forme god b sarisburie marueile hardinge ye publishe manifeste vntruthe without blusshinge ye saie fewe late yeeres one fourme faithe throughout world yet beinge learned hauinge trauailed auncient writer muste needes haue seene apostle creede nic ne creede basiles creede damasus creede hieromes creede cyprias rufines creede gregory creede creede called quicun que vult written thinke athanasius others eusebius vercellensis creede conteined hymne called te deum whether written augustine ambrose euery vnder seueral sundrie fourmes knowe diuers oldest councelles occasion offered somewhat either added creede diminished altered may appeare eusebius socrates theodoretus sozomenus euagrius nicephorus others know augustine vnto laurentius hierome vnto cyrilius ambrose vnto emperour gratianus others moe declaration christian faithe haue alwaies vsed one precise fourme woordes emperoure constantine maketh open protestation faithe recorded countrefeite donation sense substance agreeing al others catholique woordes far disagreeinge al others peculiar onely selfe shorte knowe betweene masse creede people common creede touching woordes greate difference longe rehearse al neither necessarie say mutche sauinge onely shewe manifeste vanitie talke expresse one substance faithe sundrie fourmes woordes neuer heard forbidden sauinge onely nowe laste late decree hardinge saie whole people fewe late yeeres one faithe ye shoulde rather haue saide al taught straunge vnknowen tongue pronounce could strange vnknowe fourme faithe god knowethe vnderstoode one woorde saide scarcely one article theire beleeue hilarie saithe people deceiued arians haue benne youto beleue god credunt quod non credunt intelligunt quod non intelligunt beleeue hilari ad constantium imperatore coelius rhodigin antiquitat lib cap august de cap contra dona ist lib cap whiche thei beleeue vnderstande whiche vnderstand cardinal ascanius popiniay taught say distinctly al article creede beginninge ende yet trowe ye wil say popiniay beleeued god vnderstoode christian faithe faithe harte tonge augustine saithe fieri potest vt integra quis teneat verba symboli tamen non recte credat possible man may pronounce whole woordes creede yet haue right faithe deede hilarie ye speake woorthily reproued arian retiques altered whole faithe christe onely woor e also substance wee hauinge published sundrie confession religion multitude abuse errours offered occasio sundrie country kingdomes sutche distance place diuersitie speaches yet notwithstanding substance groundes truthe haue euermore ioined togeather neuer altered wee saie wee beleeue one god hardinge answeareth cannot wel allow fourme speache wee rather haue said saithe wee beleeue god controller importune sutche simple petite quarcelles answeared could neuer haue thought ben great sinne beleeue god god verily hardinge euery ur pope cardinalles beleeued mutche trow cornelius bishop bito late councel tridente woulde bitterly open sorte haue cried themcornelius bitontinus concil trident vtinam non fide ad infidelitate deo ad epicurum velut prorsus vnanimes declinassent dicentes corde impio ore impudico non est deus would god gonne one consent faithe infidelitie god epicure saieing wicked h rte shamelesse mouthe god catholique writer euer vsed selfe fourme speache might hardinges quarrel seeme haue reasonable ground bothe paule also many catholique father haue often vsed paule saithehebrae accedentem ad deum oportet credere deum esse commeth god must beleeue god hermes paules scholar commonly called pastor nuntius pastor nuntius origen nonlatin alphabet prooemio hilar de rinitat lib symbolum carolus magni ante omnia crede vnum deum esse qui condidit omnia al thinges beleeue one god hathe made al origen saithe primum credendus est deus qui omnia creauit firste w e must beleeue god hathe created al thinges hilarie saithe absoluto nobis facilis est acternitas iesum christum mortuis suscitatum credere euerlastinge life ready casi beleeue iesus christe risen againe deade likewise charles greate creede published name praedicandum est omnibus vt credant patrem filium spiritum sanctum vnum esse deum omnipotentem gospel must preached vnto al ende may knowe father sonne holy ghoste one god almighty shorte euen late father day counted catholique fourme faithe commonly taught al scholes vnum crede deum beleeue one god wel deum mosen people beleeued god moses god selfe saide vnto moses likewise noted ye hebrewe descendam vt populus te credat wil goe downe people mai beleeue thee basile saithe baptizati sunt mosen spiritu sancto paule teache v wee may also wel beleeue sainctes hardinges side haue euermore wel liked fourme speache credo sanctam ecclesiam beleeue holy churche wherein also perhappes wil allege wel stande togeather construction one crede v wee haue saide nothinge herein hath often ben saide auouched holy learned father damasus bishoppe rome creede grateth hereon mutche wee woordes deuicto mortis imperio symbolum damasi apud hierony cum ea carne qua natus passus mortuus fuerat resurrexit ascendit ad patrem sedet que ad dextram eius gloria hauinge ouercome empiere deathe fleashe wherein borne suffred died rose againe ascended vnto father sitteth right hande glorie whiche woordes hierome larger manner expoundeth thus ascendit ad coelu sedet ad dextram dei patris hierony explicatione symboli manente ea natura carnis qua natus passus est qua resurrexit non enim exinanita est humanitatis substantia sed glorificata christe ascended heauen sitteth right hande father nature fleash wherein borne suffred rose againe remaininge stil substance humaine nature donne away glorified howe gentle reader thy better satisfaction hereinin sixthe article muste referre thee ouer former replie hardinge foloweth piteous outcrie wee haue shamefully corrupted augustine woordes shiftinge oporter steede potest newe fansie suddainely fallen hardinges heade cannot tel augustine woordes alleged gratiande consecra dis prima oportet potest corpus quo resurrexit vno loco esse oportet body wherein christe rose againe muste needes one place oportet steede potest hardinge saithe oportet oportet haue benne corruption wrought herein hath benne wrought gratian welneare foure hundred yeres agoe vschristes body one place yet gratian one highest doctours hardinges side wil hardinge make v beleeue owne catholique doctours would bolde corrupte augustine verbe oportet wanting place alleged yet might wel easily supplied place peter saithe oportet illum coelos capere v que ad tempora restitutionis omnium actor cyrill iohan li ca augustin contra faustem li ca augustin ad dardan epist heauens must conteine hold vntil time al thinges restored saithe cyrillus christus non poterat cum apostolis versari carne postquam ascendisset ad patrem christe could conuersante apostle fleash ascended vnto father likewise saithe augustine christus secundu praesentia corporale sole luna cruce simul esse non potuit christe according presence body could moone crosse one time againe ne dubites christum esse aliquo loco coeli propter veri corporis modum doubt christ one place heauen bicause measure fourm body therefore olde learned father origen saithe non est homo qui est vbicun que duo vel tres eius nomine fuerint congregati origen matthae tracta neque homo nobiscum est omnibus diebus vsque ad consu matione saeculi neque congregatis vbique fidelibus homo est praesens sed virtu diuina quae erat christo christe man euer twoo three geathered together name neither christe man v al day vntil worldes end christ man present faithful euery geathered together diuine power nature christe cause augustine saithe augustin psalm videte ascendentem credite absentem sperate venientem sed tamen per mi ricordiam occultam etiam sentite praesentem see christe ascending heauen beleeue absent trust christe come yet secrete mercie feele present thus hardinge thus haue olde catholique learned father vsed hath sutche change diuers body one manner sacrament manner heauen christes blessed body borne virgine died rose againe ascended heauen one vniforme became afterward diuerse vnlike selfe either christe apostle anciente father haue thus taught alleged haue thus taught came knowledge ye saie ye know knewe wil beleeue ye tel v body christe heauen hath whole stature fourme proportion man true doctrine apostle anciente doctours churche ye tel v farther selfe body christe sacrament vtterly voyde al manner either stature fourme proportion saie neither longe short high low thicke thinne say natural body yet hath neither likenesse shape body doctrine hardinge vnlikely true likely sutche fantastical imagination arian heretiques sometime godhed christeathanas contra arianos sermane thus wrote thereof saithe athanasius creatura est sed non vt vlla ex rebus creatis opus est sed non vt vllum ex operibus re condita est sed non vt vlla ex rebus conditis creature thinges created thinge wrought thinge euer wrought c saith athanasius selfe al fantasy answeare iam videtis vafritiem dolos istius haereseos quae non ignara quam amarulenta sit ista sua malitia fourme substance fotos quaerit nocinium sibi ex verborum disertitudine nowe ye see crookednesse subtletie haresae whiche knowinge owne malice howe borowith wa colo e sleight woordes flauianus repreneth heretique eutyches epistola flauiani ad leon inter leon epistolas adiecit aliam corpus domini quod en maria factum est non esse nostrae substantiae added wickednesse saieinge body christe borne mary nowe substance er thus caro christi ipsa est per essentiam non ipsa per gloria leo de resurrect domini sermo fleash christe substance nowe glorie noman hereof writeth either plainely directely augustine augustin ad dardanum epiststol woordes christus sic venturus est quemadmodum ire visus est ceolum id est eadem carnis forma atque substantia cui profecto immortalitatem dedit na turam non abstulit secundum hanc formam non est putandus vbique diffusus cauendum est enim ne ita diuinitatem astruamus hominis vt veritatem corporis auferamus christe shal come againe iudge euen seene goinge heauen saie selfe fourme substance fleash vnto whiche fleash vndoubtedly hathe geuen immortalitie hathe taken nature fleashe wee muste take heede wee doo maineteine godhead christes humanitie denie truthe body ye fantasie body christe sacramente hathe selfe neither fourme proportion limitation place distinction partesaugustin ead epist ad dardanum augustine telleth spatia locorum tolle corporibus nusquam erunt quia nusquam erunt nec erunt tolle ipsa corpota qualitatibus corporu non erit vbi sint ideo necesse est vt non sint take awaye bodyes limitation place bodyes wil bicause nowhere wil nothing take awaye bodyes quality bodyes wil place therefore body muste needes body al hereof wee maye conclude body christe whiche haue imagined conteined grossely carnally sacramente mutche owne confession hathe neither qualitie quantitie fourme place proportion body therefore augustine doctrine body worlde see prety sporte hardinge maketh selfe poore penneman apologie god woulde simple body vnwares alleged fulgentius cleane againste selfe woordes fulgentius christus cum absit nobis per formam serui tamen semper est nobiscum per formam dei whereas christe absent v fourme seruaunte yet euermore present v fourme god whereby saithe hardinges commentarie meaneth christe nomore emonge v fourme shape man sutche wise wee see menne liue earthe woordes saithe dasshe theire whole purpose therefore prelate newe englishe churche assured perhappes would take daie consider better thus man might put minde groundes religion sir ye know god omnipotent power infinite ye maie make thral subiect sens natural reason infidelitie wil saie learning vertue grauitie certainly far al vnwoomanly presumption wh rwith ye rudely touch al manly modestie ought maie appeare toy trifle ye haue sent v ouer ful wisedome folie beseeche cal woordes againe minde without blushing roughly handle softe creature phrase speeche frendes haue mutche misliked deede plaine woordes cal ruffianrie vertue although mutche agreable profession yet gentle reader thou wilt looke answeare al hardinges ordinarie idle talke lose good time without cause ouer troublesome thine eates saithe vvhat world see defender whiche haue keapt vnitie sprite band charitie whiche paule requireth haue seuered selues body churche tel v nowe soothe beleeue one churche god hardinge wee haue herein saide il beare witnesse il wee haue saide wel wherefore make vitter outcry euer ye haue conceiued v yet might ye suffer v quietly saie truthe specially sutche truthe imagine maketh mutche selfe ye say wee confesse churche beganne onely fourtie yeeres sithence neuer hardinge wee confesse selfe wel knowe wee confesse tale wee saie haue sufficiently proued knowe right wel ye would knowen ye know doctrine olde newe yf ye wil needes force selfe denial may easily proued sutch authoritie selfe may wel denie onlesse ye wil againe ye haue twise done wee saie doctrine order church older fiue hundred whole yeeres ye wil beleeue v yet beleeue hardingem hardinge foli wil tel euen marke wel woordes standeth christe promise made churche suffer church continue darkenesse thousand yeeres past thus secrete confession leaueth v fiuehundred three score sixe whole yeeres least saie whole time christe apostle al godly learned doctours father primitiue churche whiche time notwithstanding thought great deale better purer al time hath folowed afterwarde diuision hardinge attente eger vpon cause claiming mutche thought modestie might hable hath claimed selfe onely thousand yeeres night hath leafte v welneare sixe hundred yeeres daie owne witnesse harding consider wel owne therefore ye doo selfe great wronge mutche deface owne credite suddainely saie doctrine newe god name blessed hath testimonie onely christe apostle also olde learned catholique father churche mutche greeueth wee refourme church nowe according paterne samplar christes apostle firste institution thereby disorder deformitie church appeareth lirinensis saithevincentius lirinensis thing must holden catholique euerywhere euermore al menne hath benne beleeued general note must limited special restraintecatholique many fevve vvhere church vvere corrupted otherwise neuer doctrine catholique ne confessed doctrine christe selfe hath benne receiued euermore eueryvvhere al menne without exception hardinge selfe note lirinests vtterly euerthrowe greatest part whole doctrine would saine haue counted catholique neither reacheth within fiue hundred yeeres apostle time hath antiquitte indeed face countenance pretended plaine owne former confession euer vniuersally receiued herafter particulares shal proued neuer vniuersalitie neither al time age al place country euer vniuersally receiued allowed al men therefore euer ye cal ye cannot owne definition cal catholique catholique churche god standeth multitude persones weight truthe otherwise christe selfe apostle ben catholique flocke litle catholique vniuersal consent world stoode churche god compared moone waxethe waneth moone dothe sometime ful sometime emptieaugustin de gene ad liter cap therefore augustine saith called catholica quia vniuersaliter perfecta est nullo claudicat per totum orbem diffusa est bicause vniuersally perfite halteth nothing shut vp one onely countrie churche iewes powred throughout whole world though harte men haue often change yet god truthe euermore one many fewe euer catholique thus hardinge written one owne sidefortalitium fidei li etsi non nisi duo homines remanerent mundo tamen eis saluaretur ecclesia quae est vnitas fidelium although two men remaining world yet euen two churche whiche vnitie faithful soued luther dogge eloquence hardinge liketh modestie cal neuer rough vehement iust zele god glorie holy temple whiche miserably defaced enforcing yet neuer thing comparable eloquence beseeche ye maie haue leasure harken litle heare selfe talke behold owne woordes many vaine bitter firie furious al togeather one place newe churche ye saie set vp sathan martine luther apostate companion babylonical tower luther seditious heretical preaching luther brinced germanie poisoned cuppe heresy blasphemy sathnismes zuing lius rable gutter doctrine runne luther sincke luther would stamp rage whette dogge eloquence vpon synagog antichriste figure flower speache yet must thinke ye neither stampe rage vse onely angelles eloquence trust wise man wil iudge cause worse tongue readily serue speake il mater ye saie touching influence erace christe onely head churche touching direction gouernment pope onely head al owne tale hardinge ye speake onely selfe authoritie scripture doctour ye bringe venone yet notwithstanding ye haue alleged scripture god wote euen ye haue vsed doo place ye saie2 corin corin paule saithe yf forgaue thing sake forgaue personne christe wee embassadours steede christe euen though god exhorte v hereof ye conclude ergo pope vnder christe steede christe heade churche yf ye conclude thus ye wander idlely speake vaine condlude nothing woordes paule nothing touche pope onely faithful zelous preacher gospel wherein dothe pope resemble pauleheade wherein doothe reprosente personne christe exhorteth teacheth saithe doothe yet would one part whole duetie might argument stand good paule cittie philippi maerdonia exhorted corinthian personne christe ergo pope rome italie although neither exhorte preache yet head vniuersal churche although diuinitie goe harde yet ye shoulde haue seens better logique graunte bishoppes may called heades theire seneral church chrysostome calleth chrysostom epist ad rom hom elia caput prophetarum head prophetee amos saith amos prince heades people saul called regum head tribe israel dauid made psalm caput gentiu head nation sondrie sutch like example alleged former articul diui replie hardinge cyrillius bishop alexandria councel ephesus called cyrill tomo epist caput episcoporum congregatotum head bishoppes assembled gregorie saith gregor regum lib cap paulus ad christum conuersus caput effectus est natlonum paule conuerted christe made head nation prudentius saithe prudentius enchiridio sanctum bethlem capur eitorbis holy bethlem head world sense optatus saithe optatus li foure sortes heades churche bishop priestes deacon faithful al onely certaine kinde phrase manner speache deede verily augustine saithe augustin contra liter petil li ca paulus ipse non poterat caput esse eorum quos plantauerat paule selfe could head planted therefore gregorie saithe gregor li epist petrus apostolus primum membru sanctae vniuersalis ecclesiae est paulus andreas iohannes quid aliud quam singulariu sunt plebium caput tamen sub vno capite omnes membra sunt ecclesiae arque cuncta breui cingulo locutionis astringam sancti ante legem sacti lege sancti sub gratia omnes hi perficientes corpus domini membris sunt ecclesiae constituti et nemo se vnquam vniueisalem vocari voluit peter apostle head chiefe member holy vniuersal churche paule andrewe iohn el heades seueral nation yet notwithstandinge vnder one head christe al member churche speake shortely sainctes lawepeter member churche heade sainctes time grace al accomplisshing lordes body placed emonge member churche neuer yet one would haue selfe called vniuersal bishop therfore hardinge saithe al christian people haue euer taken successour peter heade catholique churche vnder christ speaketh onely selfe iohan though comparison odious yet christe saithe cum loquitur mendacium ex proprijs loquitur speakethe vntruthe speaketh owne gregorie saithe peter chiefe member churche christe head bishop romede election ca licet abb hired proctours haue taught v farre otherwise panormitane saithe christus papa faciunt vnum consistortum excepto peccaio papa potest quicquid deus ipse potest christe pope make one consistone keepe one courte sinne onely excepted pope doo euer god selfe doo trowe head direction gouernmente hardinge meaneth reste churche kingedome christe pope prince thereofextra noult ille gloss hardinge special woordes answeareth nothinge notwithstandinge others haue saide petro coelestis terreni imperij iura commissa sunt vnto peter committed right heauenly also earthely empiere last al doubteth notorders pope maye called spouse bridegrome vniuersal churche yet without authoritie doctour allegeth onely bernarde bernarde selfe place saithe hardinges owne confession pope bridegrome churche therefore faine expounde meaninge weigh downe side prety glose bernarde without glose saithe plainely non sunt omnes amici spousi qui hodie sunt sponsi ecclesae bernard concil remensi bernard ad euigeni de considera li al bridegromes frendes daye spouse churche miserandain sponsam ralibus creditam paranymohis non accici sponsi sed aemuli sunt miserable spouse committed sutche leader frendes enimies bridegrome wee neede greatly recke style title pope vouchesaue allowe selfe may called heade prince spouse euen like authoritie truthe may called light life saueour god churche god geue harte vnderstande hee maie although heade yet member body although prince yet subiecte kingedome although bridegrome yet childe churche god apologie cap diuision furthermore wee beleeue diuers degree minister churche whereof deacon priestes bishoppes committed office instructe people whole charge settinge foorthe religion hardinge ben parte haue declared faithe touching holy sacrament caesariensis ecclesiastical historie epiphanius ende booke contra haereses b sarisburie gentle reader leaue like hardinges woordes vnansweared thou mightest happily thinke saide somewhat saithe benne parte haue tolde thee seuen order churche three greatter foure lesse hauing deede selfe cleane forgotten owne parte notwithstandinge controlment accoumpte many order yet nameth moe order wee haue named verily would haue folowed owne authority benne hard good order haue made vp owne accoumpte owne anacletus saithe amplius quam isti duo ordines sacerdotum episcopi presbyteri nec nobis deo collati sunt anacletus epistola hieronym ad euagrium nec apostoli docuerunt two order priestes bishoppes elder neither hathe god appointed v haue apostle tought v yet two seueral order hierome semeth make onely one order thus writeth audio quendam tantam erupisse vecordiam order vt diaconos presbyteris id est episcopis anteferret heare saye man broken vnto sutche wilful furie hieronym eadem epistola placeth deacon priestes saye bishop againe apostolus praecipue docer eosdem esse presbyteros quos episcopos apostle paule specially teacheth v priestes bishoppes al one hierony esai cap catechumeni hierome writinge vpon prophete esai reckenethe onely fiue order degree whole churche bishoppes priestes deacon entrers beginner faitheful order churche knoweth none clemens saithe clemens deacon vnto minister yet deacon minister touchinge name al one dionysius likewise hathe three ordersdionysi eccle hierar cap rekenethe bishoppes priestes deacon whereas hardinge maketh accoumpte foure lesse inferiour order meaning thereby ostiarios lectores exorcistas acoluthos doore keeper reader conuerers waiter folowers ignatius ad antiochen nonlatin alphabet hierony de ordinibus eccl owne benne haue shewed iuste seuen order churche three greate foure lesse withoute doubte question gentle reader benne hardinges parte haue shewed v reason groundes diuinitie alleged beste sidepetrus lombar senten lib distin christe saith doore ergo muste churche order doore keeper christe saithe light world hereupon haue thei founded order acolutes carrie taper reste thus mutche maie serue taste man whiche may haue whole superioritie vuiuersal state christe euer presente assiste churche needeth man supplie roome onely heire al substance ca one mortal creature whiche hable comprehend conceiue mind vniuersal churche wite al partes world mutche lesse hable rightly duely put order gouerne b sarisburie hardinges answeare hereto longe tedious substance therof short wee saie one mortal man hable wealde burthen whole churche god hardinge answeareth vvhere thinge deede whether may discusse needlesse therefore whether one man superiour chiefe ouer whole churche wee leaue speake thus wee proue euery parrishe hathe seueral vicare1 personne euery dioces owne bishop ergo reason one chiefe gouernoure whole christen people vvhen question moued mater faithe2 throughe diuersities iudgementes churche diuided onlesse authoritie one kepte vnitie they3 saie otherwise take christe glorie prouidence praise greate loue towardes churche peace churche conueniently procured one4 many moste meete churche militante touchinge gouernment5 resemble churche triumphante triumphante churche one gouernoure ouer whole god therfore churche militant order requireth one beare rule ouer al accordinge holy captaine iosue seemeth speakeiosue child iuda child israel shal aessemble togeathera greate ouerfight vvoordes captaine iosua prophete osee shal make selues one head thereof lord saithe iohniohan shalbe one folde one shephearde deede christe heade body yet neede mutche christe nowe dwelleth v visible presence churche haue one man doo steede outwarde rulinge earthe therefore saide vnto peter feede flocke confirme brother thus wee see defender negatiue doctrine one man maie haue superioritie ouer whole state churche disproued vtterly false theire seconde reasonloe graunt christe needed man supplie roome succede whole substance neither man capacitie sutche successionvntruthe panormitane saithe papa potest quic quid deus ipse potest neither hathe sutche fonde saieinge ben vttered diuines bicause christe sawe knot vnitie moste surely kepte knit gouernmente one hevntruthe committed regimet whole churche vnto one whoes visible ministerie might vse steede selfe thirde saye man onely hable comprehende minde conceiue vniuersal churche also put order gouerne far expedient laste al euer wil fedde ruled one shepheard breaketh one folde flocke christe hearde antichriste gentle reader hardinge hathe brought thee authoritie one catholique doctour learned father onely colde reason owne certaine scripture vnaduisedly alleged violently forced theire meaninge shal soone appeare firste reason concludeth weakely euery parishe gouerned one vicare1 personne euery diocese gouerned one seueral bishop ergo ther one vniuersal gouernour ouer whole churche christe neither order reason sequele nature therefore man woulde denie argument hardinge neuer hable make good might wel good order reason thus euery kingdome common weale hathe one prince magistrate rule ouer ergo one vniuersal prince rule ouer whole worlde thus euery flocke sheepe bathe one seueral shephearde ouersee ergo al flockes world ouerseene one general shephearde otherwise hardinge imagineth fowle absurditie muste needes folowe parte better gouerned whole three reasons2 fourthe article touchinge prouidence god debatinge question faithe conseruinge peace vnitie churche answeared already former replie hardingediuisions deede remember auouche al mde maior obedien vnam sanctam glossa hardinge hathe saide one sometimes wel inclined side saide thus non videretur dominus discretus fuisse vt cum reuerentia eius loquar nisi vnicum post se talem vicarium reliquisset qui haec omnia posset christe lorde haue seemed haue dealte discretely speake reuerence onlesse leafte one sutche vicare behinde vnitie one pope might haue donne al thinges graunte dissension quarrelles sooner ended al thinges put ouer one man one man maye liue euer stil continewe one minde neuer alter oftentimes one pope sounde contrarie otherplatyna sabini ano sabellicus enneade lib platyna stephano sexto platyna romano sometimes one pope hathe benne found contrarie selfe pope sabinianus would haue burnte al pope gregory bookes saide pope romanus vtterly abolished al actes predecessour pope steuin pope steuin vnburied predecessour pope formosus defaced mangled naked carkesse vtterly condemned al benne donne platina geuethe general iudgemente nihil aliud isti pontificuli cogitabant quam vt nomen dignitatem maiorum suorum extinguerent litle petite pope none care world howe deface name estimation pope benne thus one pope liketh misliketh one alloweth condemneth yet hardinges iudgement wee haue none rule staie doubtful case onely wil pleasure pope howe trowe readieste waie procure peace mainteine vnitie churche therefore gregorie saithe iohn bishop constantinoplegregori lib claimed selfe vniuersal powerepist si hanc causam aequanimiter portamus gregori lib totius ecclesiae fidem corrumpimus epist corruit vniuersa ecclesia statu suo si qui vniuersalis dicitur cadit wee quietly suffer mater thus procede one man shal called vniuersal bishop wee seeke way mainteine vnitie wee ouerthrowe faithe whole churche yf called vniuersal bishop happen falle whole churche fallethe state thus therefore allowe one man vniuersal authoritie ouer whole churche mater behoueful profitable hardinge fansieth gregorie saithe doubteful dangerous churche althoughe al world either would could geue eare credite one man yet therefore alwaies christian vnitieaugust de vera relig ione ca augustine saithe habet superbia appetitum quendam vnitatis omnipotentiae pride selfe hathe certaine desire vnitie vniuersal power hardinges reason churche labouringe earthe must resemble churche sainctes triumphing heaue heauen god onely gouernoure ouer whole therefore churche beneathe pope likewise muste needes gouernoure ouer whole thus god muste rated gouerne aboue pope beneath one sometime saide diuisum imperium cum loue caesar habet valiante kinde argument holdeth heauen earthe angelles menne god pope knoweth hardinge order angelles archangelles heauen doo howe deale ruleth ruled lawes policy haue emongste saie thei would frame theire churche accordinge samplar yet good menne neuer knewe sawe samplar onely selues imagine common weales order heauen accordinge woulde shape fashon theire owne churche earthe better waye hardinge benne seeinge whole mater hangeth onely vppon fantasy saie god hathe appointed one principal archangel pope heauen al power angelles dominion subiectes thus might ye easily haue made frame agree paterne one fansies answeare saie iosua osee saie churche triumphante militate god ruleth al heauen aboue therefore pope must rule al worlde beneath sclender kinde reasoninge augustine saithe quid aliud pompa huius mundi homo appetit nisi solus esse si fieri possit cui multa subiecta sint august de v ra religione ca peruersa scil et imitatione omnipotentis dei vaine pompe worlde thinge el man doothe desire possible make selfe alone sutche one vnto many thinges maye obedient peeuishe countrefeitinge god omnipotente gregorie saithe iohn bishop constantinople illum videlicet imitatur qui spreta angelorum societate ascendere conatus est ad culmen singularitatis gregori lib foloweth lucifer epist despisinge felowship angelles laboured geate vp toppe singularitie seemeth speake howe one errour maie better dissembled emongst many deede prophete osee holy captaine iosua speaketh woordes hardinge imagineth state al christendome vnder one pope vnitie consente al faithful worlde wel iewes gentile haue vnder one christe moste euident whole discourse texte thus lie woordes osee cap number child israel shalbe sande sea shoare cannot numbred shal comme passe place saide vnto ye people mine shal saide vnto ye child liuinge god child juda child israel shal assemble togeather shal appointe vnto selues one heade vppon whiche woordes hierome writethe thus haec omnia fient quia magnus est dy seminis dei hierony ose cap qui interpretatur christus al thinges shal comme passe bicause greate daye seede god whiche seede expounded pope christe likewise nicolas lyra congregabuntur filij iuda id est apostoli filij israel id est nicol lyra osee cap gentile conuersi pariter id est vna ecclesia ponent sibi caput vnum id est christum shal assemble togeather child iuda saie apostle child israel saie heathen conuerted togeather saie one churche shal appointe vnto selues one head saie one pope hardinge woulde haue one christe augustine expoundinge wordes saithe thusone shepheard c augu de ciuitate li ca recolatur lapis ille angularis duo illi paries vnus ex iudaeis alter ex gentibus let v remember corner stone christe pope twoo vvalles one iewes heathen woordes iohan whiche hardinge allegeth iohn christe selfe expoundeth pope selfe good shephearde yelde life sheepe knowe sheepe knowen haue sheepe flocke muste bringe maye heare voice shal one shepheard one flocke woordes chrysostome expoundeth woordes paule ephes chrysost iohan homil vt duo conderet semetipso vnum nouum hominem might woorke twoo people one newe man pope selfe augustine expoundinge saithe thus augu iohan tract duobus istis gregibus taquam duobus parietibus christus factus est lapis augularis vnto twoo flockes vnto twoo vvalles pope christe made corner stone allege olde fathersnicolaus lyra iohan ca nicolas lyra simple interpreter yet likewise saithe fiet vnus pastor id est christus shalbe one shephearde saie pope christe neither hardinge hable shewe v learned allowed interpreter olde newe hathe expounded place otherwise al thinges notwithstandinge wel woordes christe also prophete osee hardinge applieth onely pope pope muste heade pope muste shephearde bothe christe osee prophesied thinges glorie kingdome pope iuda israel shal chuse christe theire heade al faitheful worlde one flocke christe shephearde ergo pope general heade vniuersal churche god sutche logique hardinge hable teache v sutche feare reuerence vse goddes holy woordes e traquil caligula like emperour caligula sometimes tooke heade greate god iuppiter set head owne euen interpretation gloses hardinge smiteth christe onely heade churche setteth pope iohannes de parisijs somme like hathe borowed whole mater nothinge doubteth telle v christe cannot heade bodyiohan de parisi de potestate regia papal cap shephearde flocke leste hardinge charge vntrue reporte woordes congregabutur filij iuda filij israel vt ponat sibi caput vnum et iohan fiet vnu ouile vnus pastor quod quide de christo intelligi potest sed de alio aliquo ministro qui praesit loco eius child juda child isral shal assemble togeather appointe vnto selues one heade tenthe iohn shalbe made one folde one shephearde whiche thinge doubtelesse cannot expounded christe muste taken minister maye rule steede thus wee taught christe neither heade owne body churche shephearde owne flocke onely pope yet chrysostome saithe qui non vtitur sacrum scriptura sed ascendit aliunde id est non concessa via chrysost iohan honal hic non pastor est sed fur vvho euer vseth holy scripture commeth waie lawful whiche false gloses corruption shephearde flocke theefe saithe augustine augusti contra donatist lib q vocantur cane ipsum characterem multi lupi lupis imprimunt note marke bishop many geue vnto wolues vvolues selues hardinge saithe farther mutche christe ascendedinto heauen nowe nomore conuersante emongst v visible formefeede sheepe behooued one man put commission bearinge charge takinge care whole churche therefore saide vnto peter feede flocke confirme thy brother firste ancient learned father euer thus scanned woordes pope commission dothe hardinge auouche greate mater selfe onely without farther authoritie large commission feede feede many doothe pope feede litle rather feedeth nothinge al howe claime feedinge neuer feedeth againe learned hardinge reason thus christe ascended heauen ergo pope heade whole worlde thus christe saide peter feede flocke ergo pope hath vniuersal power ouer whole churche god make argumentes holde wil saie diuinitie reasonable shifte logique ye saie god speaketh nowe vnto v mouthe mouthe sendeth v downe angel heauen instructeth v nowe vision others olde time wil therefore folowe al worlde muste geue eare pope nay hardinge chrysostome saithe mutche betterchrysost genesin homil bicause god speaketh nowe vnto v sutche familiare sorte ergo suam erga homines amicitiam innouare volens quasi longe absentibus literas mittit conciliaturus sibi vniuersam hominum naturam therefore god mindinge renewe fauour wardes man sente holy scripture letter thereby reconcile selfe al mankinde god speaketh nowe vnto v angel hath already spoken vnto vshebrae paule saithecala mouthe presence onely sonne therefore saithe againe yf angel heauen woulde nowe preache vnto v otherwise wee haue receiued wee shoulde holde accursed vnitie quiet gouernmente churche god paule saithe ephes christe ascendinge aboue al heauens hathe geuen one vniuersal pope rule whole apostle prophetes euangelistes pastours doctours perfitinge sainctes woorke ministerie buildinge vp body christe wee maye al comme vnitie faithe knowledge sonne god meanes god thought sufficient preserue churche vnitie neuer made mention one vniuersal pope therefore cyprian saithecyprian de simplicit praelatorum vnus est episcopatus cuius singulis solidum par tenetur one bishoprike parte whereof euery seueral bishop holden whole againe ideo plures sunt ecclesia sacerdotes vt vno haeresim faciente coeteri subueniant therefore many bishoppes churche one fal heresie cyprian lib reste maye healpe epist thus peter walked vprightly gospelgalat paule came healpeeuseb li ca reproued openly euen faceaugusti episto thus irenaeus reprooued pope victor thus sundrie godly father haue reprooued others therefore augustine saithe deus docuit petrum per posteriorem paulum quocunque enim verum dicitur illo donante dicitur qui est ipsa veritas thus god instructed peter paule p n e called euer truthe spoken spoken gifte truthe selfe ye saye pope succedeth christe al substance yt saie al powerin concil lateran sub iulio neither hath sutche fonde sayinge benne vttered saie time diuines yf true wherefore woordes written wel allowed councel lateranein concil lateranen sub leone oratione stephani patracensis tibi data est omnis potestas coelo terra vnto holinesse al power geuen wel heeuen earth wherefore bernarde wel allowed force farther woordes qui totum dedit nihil excludit hath geue thee al hath excepted nothinge wherefore panormitane allowed saieto foresake pope papa potest omnia quae deus ipse potest pope hable power doo euer god selfe doo restepanormitan de electio ca licet hardinge saithe one kinge hable rule one kingedome ergo one pope hable rule whole churche reason simple answeared gouernmente prince wee haue dayly practise pope euer exercised vniuersal dominion ouer whole churche god hardinge hable shewe v one wel member christes body sheepe flocke gregorie saide sometime iohn bishop constantinople claiminge vnto selfe title thinkinge selfe hable yenough rule wholegregor lib epist quid tu christo vniuersalis ecclesiae capiti extremi iudicij responsurus e examine qui cuncta eius membra tibimet conaris vniuersalis appellatione supponere answeare wilt thou make trial laste iudgemente vnto christe head vniuersal churche thus name vniuersal pishop seekest bringe vnder thee al member body laste al harding concludeth without premiss euer wil ruled shepheard pope hearde antichriste saithe one pope hired proctoursde maiorlt obedient vnam sanct gloss quicquid saluatur est sub summo pontifice vvhat euer soule saued vnder pope one thinge beinge graunted hardinges whole cause passeth cleare god thanked appeareth already al haue eles see wee haue departed seruile obedience see vpon iuste cause good aduise sutche sorte pope selfe wil denie lawful churche dissente churche rome woordesdist non decet whiche muste holden lawe quicquid sine discretione iustitiae contra romanae ecclesiae disciplina actum fuerit ratum haberi nulla ratio permittit vvhat euer thinge donne without discretion iustice againste order churche rome maye meanes allowed whiche woordes appeareth ex contrario sensu argument contrarie euer donne discretion iustice notwithstandinge order churche rome yet ought wel allowed augustine saithe august de vnitate eccle catholica ca ne catholicis quidem episcopis consentiendum est sicubi forte falluntur vt contra canonicas scripturas aliquid sentiant vvee maye geue consente vnto bishoppes neuer catholique happen deceiued determine centrarie scripture pope pius abbas vrsper pag selfe saithe resistendum est quibuscunque faciem siue paulus siue petrus sit qui ad veritatem non ambulat euangelij vvee bounde withstande man face peter pause yf walke truthe gospel conclude woulfe broken beste poore sheepe breake woulfe broken beside cruel spoile raueninge christian bloude plaine woordes bernarde thus speaketh thereof open councel presence sundrie bishoppes non custodiunt gregem domini bernardus concil remen eodem concilio numer s mactant deuorant keepe lordes flocke kille deuoure againe saithe propterea relinquamus istos quia non sunt pastores sed traditores therefore set v leaue postours traitours therefore god thus warneth v like case exite de medio horum hominum ne cum illis pereatis goe foorthe middes menne leste perishe al togeather apologie cap diuision al apostlesthe apostle equal vvith peter cyprian saithe like power emong selues rest peter hardinge power doublepeters povver ordinarie apostle povver extraordinarie peter shepheard apostle sheepe manifest mere vntruthes one ordinary priuilege extraordinary ordinary power whiche contineweth one course euer accordinge whiche power peter head churche successours power priuilege extraordinary whiche geuen besides common course waie dispensation apostle shoulde haue receiued ordinarely theire power peter commission ouer al bothe lambes sheepe amonge whome apostle theire place chrisie special grace preuenteth ordinarie course maketh time person equal peter office apostleship thus concerninge ordinarie power peter head apostle reason subiecte vnto sheepe vnto shepheard priuilege true cyprian saithe like power amonge seluespeter hath povver heires euer apostle haue povver onely terme life nowe oddes berwixt ordinarie auctoritie iudginge geuen officer selfe successours office euer special commission life time onely mutche berwixte peter reste apostle b sarisburie cyprian woordes plaine hoc erant vtique coeteri apostoli quod fuit petrus cyprian de simplicita praelatorum pari consortio praediti honoris potestatis sed exordium ab vnitate proficiscitur vt ecclesia vna monstretur reste apostle peter al endewed one felowship bothe honour power yet beginninge taken one shewe churche one al woordes e neuer plaine soone shifted prety distinction sutche neither cyprian learned father doctour euer knewe wee taught vnderstande twoo power one ordinarie ertraordinarie ordinarie power saithe harindge saie order common course peter appointed al reste apostle gaue authoritie christe also likewise gaue authoritie extraordinarie power sate bistoes order course vtter mater plainer wise peter gaue power apostle vsual authoritie dowe fourme lawe christe gaue power hardinge saithe onely time waie dispensation bisides lawe thus peter ordinarie heade apostle christe theire head like sorte extraordinarie touchinge order gouernmente peter shephearde apostle sheepe al apostle holde theire power copie terme life peter onely holdeth fee simple heires euer good christian reader least thou shouldest thinke haue scorne willfully wreasted hardinges woordes whiche otherwise might vttered sober meaninge maye please thee fewe consider certaine others side haue vttered published touchinge petrus de palude saithe thus petrus de palude de potestae apostolor ar petr de palade eodem arti dico quod nullus apostolorum praeter perrum factus est christo episcopus saie none apostle sauinge onely peter made bishop christe againe videretur nouo testamento quod alij apostoli christo nullam potestatem iurisdictionis receperunt per consequens relinguitur quod omnis potestas iurisdictionis quam habuerunt apostoli specialiter post christi ascensum fuit collata eis petro woulde appeare newe testament reste apostle receiued manner power jurisdiction christes hades consequently foloweth al power jurisdiction apostle specially christes ascension geuen vnto peter againe imagineth god father thus saie vnto christe petr de palude eodem cap petr de palude de potestate curator ar constitues eos principe non per te sed per tuum vicarium thou shalte make apostle gouernours ouer al earth thee selfe peter thy vicare againe paulus alij apostoli petro non debuerunt praedicare ecclesia specialiter petro commissa nisi de eius licentia vnde christo habuerunt idoneitatem petro autem authoritatem paule apostle mighte preache churche committed vnto pet r peter licence christe onely habilitie peter receiued authoritie like manner writeth pope nicolas extra de elect electi potest fundameta petrum consortium indiuiduae trinitatis assumptum id quod ipse erat dominus voluit nominari lorde tooke peter felowship holy trinitie would haue called selfe sutche amplification outrage speache woulde appeare christe peter vicare peter vicare vnto christe sense meaninge hardinge seemeth saie ordinarie common course lawe apostle al theire power christe onely peter hardinge vnwares falleth marueilous inconuenience thinges thus graunted muste needes folowe duringe time christes aboade earthe apostle manner ordinarie power al neither preache baptize binde loose heruaeus doctour hardinges side saithe thushernaeus de potestate papae ca sciendum quod cum christus conuersabatur cum hominibus non fuit alius papa praeter ipsum nec petrus tunc habuit potestatem papalem wee muste vnderstande christe conuersante emongst menne earthe none pope alone neither peter pope authoritie likewise saithe petrus de paludepetr de palude de potesta postolorwn non decebat esse simul nisi vnum summum pontificem vnde christo ascensuro debuit petrus fieri episcopus summus non antea meete shoulde one highest bishop one time therefore christe ready ascende heaven conuenient make peter highest bishop longe time christe coulde geue apostle ordinarie authoritie hardinge telleth v power herein onely ertraordinarie side peter coulde geue none heruaeus paladensis saie vntil christes ascension pope leaue vaine fantasy woorth hearinge paule wil soone remooue al doubtes gala thus writeth selfe paule apostle menne appointed menne jesus christe god father chrysostome hereof writeth thus chrysost epi ad galat ca paulus nihil opus habebat petro nec illius egebat voce sed honore par erat illi nihil enim hic dicam amplius paule manner lacke peter stoode neede voice allowance honour felowe wil saie meaninge better howe neede woordes set contention aparte case cleare peter breathed ouer apostle peter saide vnto themiohn marke goe loste sheepe house israel receiue holy ghoste goe al worlde preache gospel al power geuen christe alone peter nowe hardinge teacheth v peter shephearde apostle sheepe makinge al mutche inferiour vnto peter sheepe inferiour vnto shepheard apostle equal vvith peter hierome saithe dice super petrum fundatur ecclesia licerid ipsum alio loco super omnes apostolos fiat cuncti claues regni coelorum accipiant ex aequo super eos ecclesiae fortitudo solidetur ye wil saye churche founded vpon peter notwithstandinge place thinge donne vpon al apostle al receiue key kingdome heauenhierony aduer ioui tan li origen matthae tracta strengthe churche founded equally vpon al likewise learned father origen saithe quod si super vnum illum petrum tantum existimas aedisicari toram ecclesiam quid dicturus e de iohanne filio tonitrui apostolorum vnoquoque yf thou thinke whole churche builded onely vpon peter wilt thou saie iohn sonne thunder euery apostle therefore chrysostome peter saithe thus chrysost matthae homil duplex crimen erat ium quia repugnauit tum quia coeteris seipsum praeposuit peter double faulte bothe withstoode christe also set selfe reste augustine maketh peter felowe equal apostle inter se concorditer vixerunt petrus august epist condiscipuli eius peter felowes liued agreeably togeather againe christus sine personarum acceptione hoc dedit paulo vt ministraret gentibus quod etiam petro dederat august epist ad galat ca vt ministraret iudaeis christe without choise personnes gaue authoritie paule minister emongst heathen gaue peter minister emongst iewes ordinarie glose geoeth woordes paule non didici ab alijs tanquam maioribus sed contuli cu illis tanquam cum amicis gloss galat paribus learned peter others better conference equalles frendes likewise paule selfe saithe iacobus petrus iohannes qui videbantur columnae esse dextras dederunt mihi gala barnabae societatis james peter john seemed pillers gaue vnto barnabas righte handes felowship whiche glose expoundeth thus societatis id est aequalitatis felowship saye equalitie therefore notwithstandinge hardinges ordinarie extraordinarie distinction cyprian woordes plaine true reste apostle euen authoritie peter al end wed one felowship bothe honoure power apologie cap diuision saide indifferently al feede ye indifferently al goe vvhole vvorlde indifferently al teache ye gospel hardinge wee denie saide indifferently al feede ye yea saide al feede yevntruthe vaine manifest peter none el saide feede lambes feede sheepeiohn vvhiche woorde feedinge singularly spoken peter presence apostle prooueth indifferently saide al feede ye sente whole vvorlde commaunded teachemarke respect also feede wee confesse vnder distinction ordinarie extraordinarie power mentioned b sarisburie forceth greately hardinge denie graunte hauinge neither reason authoritie onely owne power geuen indifferently al apostle tel v wherein oddes peter others lesse olde doctour learned father euer sawe difference christe saide equally vnto al rece holy ghoste whose sinnes yee forge ue forgeeuen goe whole worlde preache gospel euery creature woordes perteine equally vnto al peter nomore holy ghost nomore power forgeeue sinnes nomore commission goe whole worlde nomore authoritie preache gospel others hardinge saithe reste apostle saide al feede yeiohn marc peter none el saide feede lambes feede sheepe yet christe selfe saithe quod vni dico omnibus dico saie one saie alhierony contra jouinian li cor hierome saithe alleged al apostle receiued key kingedome heauen strength churche builte equally vpon al paule saithe peter paule minister christe whome ye haue beleeued paule hath planted apollo hath watered plantethchryso epist ad gala ca nothinge watreth nothinge chrysostome saithe angeli quamliber magni tamen serui sunt ac ministri angel god neuer greate yet seruantes minister therefore conclude saithe ne paulo quidem obedire oportet chrysosto epist ad timoth homi si quid proprium dixerit si quid humanum sed apostolo christum se loquentem circumferenti wee maye beleeue paule selfe speake thinge owne worldly reason wee muste beleeue apostle bearinge aboute christe speakinge within apologie cap diuision andad euagrium hierome saithe al bishoppes euer rome eugubium constantinople rhegium al like bishoprike therefore bishoprike vnto particular bishoppes sunne roote fountainevatruth impudente aboue measure vvhat fountaine roote sunne bishoprike cyprian declareth litle winge saide peter thee wil geue ketes kingdome heauen feede sheepe b sarisburie hardinge chargeth v twoo owne common faultes first corruption nexte ignorance corruption woordes sense hierome ignorance place cyprian wee hable sufficiently truely answeare bothe truste hardinge shal haue great cause mutche vaunte selfe either plaine dealinge herein knowledge dissemble childishe causilati n altering number singulare plural changinge woorde merite woorde preeminence whiche greate faulte hardinges owne confession proceeded onely interpreter authour saie dissemble passe al seely quarrel hierome meante hereby erasmus man great learninge iudgement expoundeth thus rasm schol epist ad euagrium hieronymus aequare videtur omnes episcopos inter se perinde quasi omnes ex aequo apostolis successerint nec putat vllum episcopum alio minorem esse quod sit humilior aut maiorem quod sit opulentior nam aequat eugubiensem episcopum cum romano deinde non putat episcopum quouis presbytero praestantiorem esse nisi quod ius habeat ordinandi hierome seemeth matche al bishoppes togeather al equally apostle successours thinketh bishop sesse poorer greatter richer maketh bishop eugubium poore towne equal bishop rome farther thinketh bishop better prieste sauinge bishop hath authoritie order minister hieromes woordes plaine selfe haue neede expositour hierony ad euagrium thus writeth quid facit excepta ordinatione episcopus quod presbyter non faciat nec altera romanae vibis ecclesia altera totius orbis existimanda est et galliae britannia aphrica persis oriens india omnes barbarae nationes vnum christum adorant vnam obseruant regulam veritatis si authoritas quaeritur orbis maior est vrbe vbicunque fuerit episcopus siue eugubij siue constantinopoli siue alexendriae siue tanai eiusdem meriti eiusdem est sacerdotij potentia diuitiarum paupertatis humilitas vel sublimiorem vel inferiorem episcopum non facit coeterum omnes apostolorum successores sunt quid mihi profers vnius vrbis consuetudinem doothe bishop sau nge onely orderinge minister prieste maye doo neither maye wee thinke churche rome one churche al worlde biside another fraunce englande aphrica persia leu nte india al barbarous nation woorship one christe keepe one rule truthe vvee seeke authoritie whole worlde greater cittie rome euer bishop eugubium rome constantinople rhegium alexandria tanais al one woorthinesse al one bishoprike power richesse basenesse pouertie maketh bishop either higher lower al apostle successours bringe custome rome beinge one cittie nowe hardinge wil steale awaie darke manner saie hierome spake onely merite life office priesthoode sette man telle parte neither question mooued answeare hierome hierome plaine expresse woordes saithe si authoritas quaeritur vvee seeke merite life authoritie gouernmente therein whole worlde greatte cittie rome hardinge imagineth hierome spake onely knowe hierome selfe saithe speaketh namely authoritie whereas hardinge highly offended chaunginge woorde merite woorde preeminence saithe farther false plater thought thereby winne game maye please remember howe euer game goe hierome selfe plainely plaide selfe game meane hierome vsinge woorde merite without question meante preeminence thus saithe potentia diuitiarum paupertatis humilitas vel sublimiorem vel inferiorem episcopum non facit power richesse basenesse pouertie maketh bishop either higher lower hardinge mighte easily haue seene higher lower perteine merite life preeminence therefore lette looke better vpon booke thus lightly condemne others corruption graunt true hardinge saithe quarrel first beganne aboute particulare custome churche rome dra ons vaunted selues would placed aboue priestes hardinge manner willingly dissembleth suppresseth somewhat augustine liuelyaugust quaes veter noui testament quae fully expresseth thereof writeth thus quidam qui nomen liabet falcidij duce stultitia romanae ciuitatis iactantia leuitas sacerdotibus diaconos presbyteris coaequare contendit one falcidius foolishnesse pride cittie rome leadinge thereto laboureth make deacon equal priestes lewde disorder hierome controlleth example church saithe therein authoritie whole worlde greatter authoritie churche rome whiche also seemeth speake scornefully disdeigne thus saithe quid mihi profers vnius vrbis consuerudinem bringe custome rome beinge one cittie whiche woordes seemethpope leo made smal accoumpte cittie rome hardinge saithe primate authoritie ouer inferiour bishop graunte thei agreemente custome neither christe peter paule kighte goddes woorde hieronym epist ad titum cap hierome saith nouerint episcopi se magi consuetudine quam dispofitionis dominicae veritate presbyteris esse maiotes comune debere ecclesiam egere let bishoppes vnderstande aboue priestes rather custome truthe right christes institution ought rule churche al togeather againe idem ergo est presbyter hieronym eod loco qui episcopus etantequam diaboli instinctustudia religione fierent diceretur populis ego sum pauli ego apollo ego cephae comuni presbyterorum consilio ecclesiae gubernabantur therefore prieste bishop bothe one thinge inflaiminge diuel partes taken religion woordes vttered emonge people holde paule holde apollo holde peter church gouerned common aduise priestesaugust epist augustine saithe secundum honorum vocabula quae iam ecclesiae vsus obtinuit episcopatus cause cannot greate emperoure saithe nemo debet sibiius dicere noman maie minister lowe vnto selfe noted thus decree papa non debet esse iudex causa propria pope maie iudge owne cause wel knowen16 q christe lorde peter apostle deo inspirante beatissimo petro apostolo inspiration god peter apostle deus petro velut quodam capite dona sua velut corpus omne diffudit god fro peter heade leo sermo de natali petri pauli hath powred cut giftes al body nihil erit ligatum aut solutum nisi quod petrus ligauerit aut soluerit shalbe nothinge bounde loosed peter shal binde loose nunc quoque petrus pascit oues mandatum domini pius pastor exequitur leo sermo anniucrsario die assumptionis euen nowe peter feedeth sheepe godly shephearde fulfilleth commoundement maister sutche immoderate ambitious dignitie leo contente yeelde peter thende possession fruite thereof might redounde whelely vnto selfe others haue thought wel epistle leo also others moeequalitie bishoppes ancient bishoppes rome haue benne
