name pope iulius partely vnder name pope nicolas also pope zosimus whiche fifthe leo saide doubted aduantage falsifie holy councel nice verily councel chalcedon offered vnto leo title vniversal bishop gregorie witnesseth vtterly refused woulde none nowe touchinge hierome saithe poore bishop eugubium bishop rome bothe one authoritie authoritie speakethcyprian lib epist nisi paucis desperatis perditis prooued cyrian also saithe authoritie bishoppes aphrica good authoritie bishop rome calleth al lewd desperate personnes wil hardinge doothe safe contrarie therefore whereas hardinge saithe order christe selfe hath benne ordeined mater touchinge faithe religion referred one prince pastours sitteth chaire peter highest bishop hath alwaies benne donne obserued apostle time vntil day bringeth v twoo manifest vntruthes togeather without manner proufe al onely auouched vpon selfe appeareth christe euer tooke order euer made sutche mention either sutche prince pastours peter chaire councel aphrica decreed mater shoulde remooued thence romeconcil aphrican cap woordes councel ad transmarina iudicia qui pu auerit appellandum nullo intra aphricam communionem suscipiatur euer shal thinke ought appeale judgementes beyond sea bishop rome let man within aphrica receiue communion touchinge hardinge calleth pope prince pastours mighte haue remembred righte name belongeth onely vnto christe1 petr peter saithe christe prince pastours shal appeare ye maie receiue vncorruptible crowne nowe infea fe p pe christes peculiare title man mighte thinke greate blasphemie certainely cyprian saithein concil carthaginen concil constantinop ca nonlatin alphabet cyprian de simpl praelator nemo nostrum episcopum se esse episcoporum constituit none v appointeth selfe bishop bishoppes mutche lesse prince al pastours councel constantinople decreed bishop shoulde haue euen equal authoritie bishop rome authoritie cyprian hardinge saithe wee vnderstoode therefore willeth v looke better vpon bookes counsel good hardinge wil graunte cyprian selfe knew selfe wrote vnderstoode owne meaninge shalbe sufficient verily woordes vseth seeme darke thus writeth episcopatus vnus est cuius singulis solidum par tenetur ecclesia vna est quae multiudinem lat incremento foecunditatis ex enditur quomodo solis multi radij sed lumen vnum ramiarboris multi sed robur vnum bishoprike one parte whereof euery seueral bishop possessed whole churche one whiche greate increase extended vnto many sonne beames many lighte one tree boughes many body one appeare greate darkenesse doubte woordes cyprian self place thus expoundeth owne meaning plainer wise vna est ecclesia christo per totum mundum plura membra diuisaone bishoprike item episcopatus vnuscyprian lib epist episcoporum multorum concordi numerositate diffusus one churche diuided christe many member throughout worlde likewise one bishoprike powred farre abroade agreeable multitude many bishoppes againe ecclesia vna estcyprian lib epist connexa cohaerentium sibi inuicem sacerdotum glutino copulata one churche ioined fastened one consente bishoppes agreei ge togeather againe quando oramus non pro vno oramus sed pro toto populocyprian oration dominicam quia totus populus vnum sumus wee praie praie one whole people wee whole people one againe immediately woordes whiche hardinge saithe wee hable vnderstande saithe hanc vnitatem firmiter tenerecyprian de simpli praelat vendicare debemus maxime episcopi qui ecclesia prae idemus vt episcopatum quoque ipsum vnum indiuisum probemus vnitie muste wee holde specially bishoppes fitte ruler churche wee maye declare bishoprike one cyprian lib epist without diuision againe etsi pastores multi sumus vnum tamen gregem pascimus oues vniuersas quas christus sangume suo passione quaesiuit colligere fouere debemus notwithstandinge wee many shepheardes yet wee feede one flocke wee al bounde geather vp nourrishe al sheepe christe hath wonne bloude passion either authour apologie interpreter vnderstoode cyprian yet hardinge ye maye geue cyprian leaue vnderstande selfe sense hierome saithe hieronym epist ad tit ca communi presbyterorum consilio ecclesiae gubernabantur church ordred vniuersal authoritie bishop rome common aduise priestes likewise cyprian saithe cyprian lib epist ideirco copiosum est corpus sacerdotum cocordiae mutuae glutine atque vniratis vinculo copulatum vt si quis ex collegio nostro haeresim facere gregem christi laccrare ac vastare tentauerit subueniant coeteri therefore body companie priestes copious ioined togeather consente concorde vnitie one companie entreprise raise heresie scatter waste flocke christebasili ad neocaesarienses reste shoulde healpe likewise basile interrogate patres vestros renuntiabunt vobis quod etiamsi locus situ diuisae inter se sint paroeciae tamen veluti coronamento quodam vnitae vna que sententia gubernatae fuerunt assidua quidem populi fuit inter se commixtio ipsi vero pastores tanta praediti fuerunt mutua inter ipsos charitate vt alius alio praeceptore ac duce vsi fuerint aske father wil telle although bishoprikes diuided sundred distance place yet euer knitte togeather garlande euer ruled one aduise deede people euer mingled togeather bishoppes al ioined charitie euery contente taught leadde therefore many faithes sundrie faithefulles one faithe many church one churche many baptismes one baptisme euen saithe cyprian many bishoprikes one bishoprike therein wel bishop rome also euery seucral bishop hath portion saie bishoprike rome whole bishoprike parte body sunne beame stemme tree braunche thus cyprian minde neither doothe one bishop holde one bishop heade whole one bishop al al al bishoppes onely one apologie cap diuision accordinge iudgement nicene councel wee saie bishop rome hath iurisdiction ouer churche god reste patriarkes either alexandria antioche haue hardinge shame belie deuil accordinge olde prouerbe belie churche god represented nicene councel sixth canon amonge al others nicene councel grounde surmise vponthe sixth canon nicene councel declared make againste defender knowe wel hath benne wreasted purpose certaine side rightly construedvntruth expresse vvordes plaine contrarie maketh moste againste seemeth acknowledge bishoppe rome supremacie soueraigntie iudgement ouer patriarkes woordes canon rightly englished hed let auncient custome continewe force whiche egypte lybia pentapoli bishop alexandria haue power ouer al quandoquidem etiam episcopo romano hoc consuetum est nonlatin alphabet asmuch b rome hath thus vsed likewise antiochia also prouinces let church keepe theire prerogatiue vvhat gathered woordes canon ratefiynge iurisdiction patriarkes alexandria antiochia father nicene councel thought good alter nothinge folowe auncient custome olde time vsed allowed b rome asmuche saie asmuche asvntruth vaine childishe b rome hath benne wonte beginninge graunt b alexandria iurisdiction ouer egypte lybia pentapoli thethis exposition like sick mannes dreame nicene councel folowinge authoritie rule least vsage willeth graunteth saide bishop retaine keepe auncient right b alexandria receiued sutche iurisdiction auctoritie graunt b rome olde time reason shoulde haue moued father confirmation thereof alleage custome b rome case folie vvordes plaine quia episcopo romano parilis mo est whereto perteined additio cause quia episcopus romanus hoc consueuit bicause bishop rome custome benne theire meaninge would neuer haue spoken custome othervntruthe b rome neuer povver allotte prouinces selfe prouince allotted vvel others ne recipiatur allotte prouinces b alexandria thinge alleaged haue benne maner custome besides woordes canon beare benne purpose euer cause confirmation b alexandria iurisdiction ouer egypte lybia pentapoli alleage defender olde custome b rome elles liste make violence canon thereupon make argument inferringe allegation conclusion ergo b alexandria ought haue iurisdiction ouer egypte lybia pentapoli shal finde suche argument sotte woulde ashamed make shal like replie wee warne neither ye take aduantage doubteful interpretation knowe canon founde diuerse bookes plainely translated therefore require stande original greeke neither ye defende lie wrested exposition theodore balsamontheodore balsamon hath written greeke commentary vpon canon councels sithens schisme greekes selfe beinge schismatike beinge greeke borne prick hatred nation latine churche specially see rome thexposition sixth canon nicene councel swarueth bothe learninge also reason b sarisburie deede shame belie creature lieinge shameful selfe therefore hardinge ye mighte doo mutche better vse lesse haue brought v exposition councel nice sutche thinke time vntil time hath seldome benne hearde saie bishop rome custome wastheconn cel nice geue iurisdiction patriarkes alexandria antioche hierusalem thei none authoritie gouernmente onely mutche limited allowed saye onely vndoubted meaninge councel fantasie auouched auncient doctour learned father therefore wee muste thinke euer owne weighinge strangenesse muste needes saie yow hierome saide sometime one rheticius like casehieronym ad marcellam rheticius eloquens quidem est sed ineptus interpres rheticius eloquente man deede yet fonde interpreter certaine knowen euen vnto child bishop rome councel nice neither sutche custome superioritie sutche dealinge iurisdictions pope pius secundus saitheaeneas syluius epist ante nicenam synodum vnusquisque sibi vixit paruus respectus ad romana ecclesiam halebatur councel nice euery bishop liued selfe smal regarde churche rome sortishe argumentes sutche iudgemente sorte would ashamed make maye leaue wel hardinge ye lacke greately appeare bookes ye knowe beste howe vse touchinge sixthe canon councel whiche imagine darke doubteful truste shalbe plainely clearely opened neuer hitherto accounted sottishe woordes thereof plaine yenough sense whole body christendome diuided foure patriarkshippes wherof first rome seconde alexandria thirde antioche fourthe hierusalem eche limited bounded within selfe alexandria haue ouersight ouer egypte pentapolis antioche ouer syria hierusalem ouer iurie romelipomanus praefatione copus dial balsamonem virum cerie docte ouer italie church weaste herein wee haue exposition theodorus balsamon liued fiue hundred yeeres agoe patriarke antioche somme hardinges trendes haue thought man greate learninge yet mutche hardinge vtterly refuseth onely schismatique also man bothe learninge reason let v therefore see somme others nilus greeke authour hereof writeth thus sed vt etiam liquidius appareat nilus de primatu romani pontificis nonlatin alphabet papam non imperare alijs omnibus episcopis legatur sextus canon synodi nicenae quo diserte praecipitur vt alijs ecclesijs alexandrinus alijs romanus alijs antiochenus praesit vt non liceat alteri alterius prouinciam inuadere maie plainely appeare pope hathe gouernment ouer al bishoppes reade six canon councel nice expressely commaunded bishop alexandria shal haue rule ouer certaine church bishop rome ouer certaine bishop antioche likewise ouer certaine lawful one inuade others iurisdiction farther saithe quod si quis suis non contentus aliena appetit ille san merito consuetudinis sanctorum canonum violator haberi debet yf one patriarkes contented owne craue dominion ouer others doothe pope ought right called breaker bothe custome also holy canon hardinge wil yet saie ruffinus eccle historiae lib cap exposition sottishe let v see sorte others haue expounded rufinus openinge canon saithe thus statutum est concilio niceno vt apud alexandriam v rom vetusta cosue udo seruetur suburbicaru ecclesiarum vt vel ille aegypti vel hic suburbicarum ecclesiarum solicitudinem gerat decreed councel nice alexandria rome olde custome kepte bishop alexandria rule ouer egypte bishop rome ouer al world ouer church suburb likewise afterwarde ordred councel holden constantinople definimus sedi costantinopolitanae paria iura concil constantinopo cap nonlatin alphabet nicepho lib cap priuilegia cum sede veteris romae wee decree see constantinople shal haue rightes priuiseges equal one see olde rome therefore nicephorus saithe romano constantinopolitano episcopo ex aequo paria sunt dignitatis praemia honorum iura title dignity rightes honour geuen bishop rome bishop constantinople one equal cause athanasius saitheathanas ad solitariam vitam agentes cod de sacrosanctis ecclesijs omni innouatione concil aphrica cap nilus de primatii papa rom erat meeopolis romanae ditionis rome moother churche whole worlde romaine iurisdiction like sorte emporour iustinian saithe ecclesia vrbis constantinopolitanae romae veteris praerogatiua laetatur churche constantinople enioieth prerogatiue priuilege churche olde rome likewise augustine learned godly bishoppes councel aphrica vnderstoode canon therefore called pope presumption crauinge vniuersal iurisdiction ouer al worlde fumosum saeculi typhum smoky pride world conclude nilus saithe thus nunc cum aliae regiones assigna ae sint romano aliae alexandrino aliae constantinopolitano non magi hi sub illo sunt quam ille sub hisce seeinge certaine country appointed bishop rome certaine bishop alexandria certaine bishop constantinople nowe nomore subiecte vnto vnto al perhaps sottes theire saieinges ttishe noman hable rightly vnderstande mater saie consuetudo latine commission mo parilis vniuersal iurisdiction apologie cap diuision bishop rome nowe calleth al mater selfe alone except doo duetie ought doo except minister sacramentes except instructe people excepte warne teache wee saye ought right called bishop mutche elder bishop saithe augustine name labour honour man seeketh haue preeminence profite maye vnderstande selfe bishop hardinge neither bishop romean euil bishop loseth name bishop though lose metite bishop vide augustin lib contra epist parmen cap tom tim bishop worthy name bishop except duetie bishop al wee graunt ought right called hathe charge ouer case omittinge duetie thereto saie although respect domeanou worthy called bishop yet respecte vocation degree preeminence though leaue duetie vndone whiche incurreth daunger damnation title perteineth vnto good right continually ought acknowleged bishop though euil vnworthy bishop likewise priest whereas augustine saithe bishop name labour honour vnderstand scripture vvhiche place speakinge two thinges bothe dede affirmed one beinge importance denieth one comparison c yet semeth secrete preparation towarde purpose againste sutche time prince gouernemente shal mislike theire phantasy learned opinion concerning bishop learned also like concerninge ciuil magistrate meane vvicklef amonge whose heretical article condemned churche councel constancea bishop bishop rekened fiftenth nullus est dominus ciuilis nullus est praelatus nullus est episcopus dum est peccato mortali saie none temporal lorde none prelate none bishop longe deadly sinne b sarisburie mater shal neede greate contention like woordes haue benne vttered sundrie holy father chrysostome saithe multi sacerdotes chryso matthae homil chrysost eod homil pauci sacerdotes multi nomine pauci opere many priestes priestes many name fewe laboure againe quomodo potest esse magister qui discipulum non habet acquire discipulum esto magister howe maisterambro de dignita sacerdotali cap gregor lib epist ath scholare geate thee scholar maister ambrose saithe nisi bonum opus amplectaris episcopus esse non potes oulesse thou embrace good labour bishop thou canste gregorie saithe sacerdotes nominamur non sumus priestes wee called priestes wee vvicklefe expoundeth plainely owne meaninge hardinges owne construction woordes euen alleged enimies papa concil constatien session vel praelatus malus praescitus est aequiuoce pastor vere fur latro pope wicked prelate double doubteful speache postour deede theefe murtherer chrysostome saithe qui ab hominibus ordinatus est chrysost matthae homil quantum ad deu artinet est sacerdos aut diaconus appointed menne god god neither priest deacon vvicklefe vpon iuste zele house god sawe bishoppes either knew nothing nothinge cared nothinge either spake meante truthe maie beare wee defende notwithstandinge touchinge obiected deadly sinne seemeth folowed therein councel valentia franceconcil valentin sub dama ca woordes quicunque sub ordinatione vel diaconatus vel presbyterij vel episcopatus mortali crimine dixerint se esse pollusos supradictis ordinationibus submoueatur eues order either deaconship priesthoode bishoprike shal saie haue benne defiled mortal sinne let remoued foresaide order augustine saithe alleged gratian2 quae qui nec regiminis qui nec sua crimina detersit nec filiorum crimen correxit canis impudicus dicendus est magi quam episcopus neither hath wiped owne finnes corrected sinnes child ought rather called shamelesse dogge bishop yet notwithstanding remoue al strife euer bishop rome euer doo let hardly called bishop bicause hardinge saithe standeth roome bishop vvicklefe saithe let called aequiuoce saie woorde double meaning vnsauery salte called salte prophetes baal called prophetes painted man called man gregorie saithe let called prieste although deede prieste let called teacher although teache let called feeder although feede cyprian saith paule ipsum cyprian lib epist concil trident de sacramente ordinis athanasius ad solitariam vitam agentes hieron soph niam cap quamuis inane nomen vmbram quandam sacerdotis cogitans expauit paule afroide consideringe onely emptie name shadowe bishop late councel tridente mater concluded thus qui dicit co qui non exercent ministerium verbi sacramentorum non esse sacerdotes anathema sit euer saie minister neither woorde god sacramentes priestes accursed athanasius saithe quid opus est hominibus titulo episcopis neede haue wee menne beare onely name eishoppes therefore hierome saithe auferet dominus nomina vanae gloriae admirationis falsae quae versantur ecclesia sed nomina sacerdotum cum sacerdotibus dotibus aufere provvde name qui frustra sibi applaudunt episcopali presbyterij dignitate non opere lord shal take awaie name vaine glorie ined woo dering whiche churche yea shal take awaie bothe name priestes priestes withal whiche vaunte selues dignitie bishoprike priestehoode laboure apologie cap diuision neither pope worldly creature nomore head whole churche bishop ouer al bridegome light saluation life churche priuileges name belonge onely christe properly onely sfitte alone bishop rome euer suffer selfe called sutche proude name title phoca emperours time know killing owne soueraine mauritius emperoure traiterous villanie aspire empire whiche aboute sixthe hundreth thirteenth yeere christe borne hardinge name vniuersal bishopvniuersal bishop interpreter meaneth beinge taken right sense proude name respecte himvntruthe belogeth vnto pope belongeth vvhether bishop rome euer suffered himselfe called name denie proue forceth whether refused humilitie proueth vnla ful b sarisburie name vniuersal bishop prowde name others may also prowde name bishop rome hath bishop sutche special priuilege pride aboue al others may pride humilitie humilitie pride onely respecte diuerse personnes saie title right belonged bishop rome therefore pride harding fowle vntruthe shal appeare nexte diuision woordes councel carthage gratian allegeth vniuersalis autem episcopus nec ipse romanus pontifex appelletur distin primae sedis bishop rome selfe maie called vniuersal bishop olde learned godly bishoppes rome refused name prowde arrogante plaine gregorie marueile learned man woulde calle question woordes thereof nullus decessorum meorum hoc tam profano vocabulo vti consensit gregor lib epist nullus romanorum pontificum hoc singularitatis nomen assumpsit no hunc honorem nolumus oblatum suscipere none predecessours bishoppes rome euer consented vse vngodly name bishop rome euer toke vpon name singularitie wee bishoppes rome wil receiue honour beinge offred vnto v bishoppes rome olde time refused name wante right onely hardinge saithe humilitie wherefore theire successours folowed afterwarde ambitiously laboure geate platina saitheplatina bonifa io bonifacius tertius obtinuit phoca magna tamen contentione pope bonifacius thirde obteined emperour phoca rome called heade al church greate contention mutche adoo wherefore dooth augustine whole councel aphrica condemne attempt vsurped iurisdictionprovvde name calle fumosum saeculi typhum smoky pride vvorlde euen bishoppes rome bishop rome fulle humilitie wee borne hande auaunceth selfe high aboue al general councelles saithe creature may iudge dooinges claimeth swerde scepter al world saithe christes consistorie consistorie al one doo al god selfe doo doothe saye emperoure proctour bailife churche romedistinct si imperator gloss procurator sfiue defensor romanae ecclesiae doothe suffer kinges emperours holde stirope leade palfrai kisse foote verily kinde humilitie place might goe pride hesychius saithehesychius sen lib curerg dist mul vbi superbia regnat hypocrisis humilitas locum non habet pride hypocrisie beare swaie humilitie haue place likewise chrysostome saithe quicunque desiderauerit primatum terra inuenie coelo confusionem nec inter seruos christi computabitur qui de primatu tractauerit euer defireth primacie earthe heauen shal finde confusion neither shal accumpted emong seruauntes christe wil intreate primacie conclude learned man one hardinges owne side hereupon hathe noted thus heruaeus de potes ate papae cap bonifacius obtinuit phoca vt ecclesia romana esset caput omnium ecclesiarum ex quo posset modo consimili sumi argumentum qu ad imperatorem pertineat primatum ecclesiae transferre de ecclesijs ordinare pope bonifacius thirde obteined emperour phoca churche rome head al church whereof wee maye like case geather argumente belongeth emperour translate primacie churche take order church apologie cap diuision also councel carthage circumspectly prouide bishop called either highest bishop chiefe prieste hardinge leaue syr defender playe false taken false dyse therefore ye ought iustly lose al ye haue vniustly wonne false playefalsefieinge councel false dyse meane shameful falsefieinge councel alleaged falsehed right lose credite whiche vniustly bicause false teachinge haue wonne amonge vnlearnedm harding mery man false plaie might sone espted doo like mais er iuel though father sonne false sleight vseth euer readde haue seuen councelles carthage nether shewe whiche alleage geue notice number canon maye founde contrariwise lap winge busie crie leadeth man neste leade v place puttinge margent booke number findinge noteiohan geue ouer lookinge vvho dothe euil hateth light saithe christe falsefieingvntruthe canon vvil soone founde forginge canon councel would faine walke clowdes lieing might deprehended c ben done circumspectly furtherance fals hed matter neuer come trial learninge nowe euer examineth place truly must nedes crie shame defender thauctourthe canon third councel carthage discus sed woordes listed haue alleged without falshed vvhiche finde canon thirde councel carthage whiche councel authorized sixth general councel holden constantinople trullo vt primae sedis episcopus non appelletur princeps sacerdotu aut summus sacerdos aut aliquid huiusmodi sed tatum primae sedis episcopus thus englished hathe liked v saie father councel bishop first see called prince priestes highest priest sutche thingehigheste bishop prince priestes onely bishop firste see nowe commeth iotly defender saith councel carthage hathe expresse wordes mutche latine foundeth bishop called either highest bishop chiefe pr est whiche canon thus vntruely vttered thought deprtue pope thisvntruthe shal appeare auncient title al worlde hathe euer ributed vnto called nomore summus pontifex right vnderstandinge canon two thinges consideredvile epistolam ad petrum iohannem aph ic episcopos howe farre authoritie councel ought extended meant firste seevntruthe councel namely restreineth b rome decree councel perteined prouince aphrike prouinc al councelles binde onely prouinces whiche order whiche kepte onely general councelles receiued al two woordesprima sedes vvhat meaneth prima sedes father vnderstode citie whiche patriarke primate one office though diuerse name hathe see cal first see rather might permitted primate seevntruthe grounded vpon fable greate citties highest courtes iustice keptdistin de primatibus chiefe pagane priestes latines named primo flamen resident comminge christe christes comminge patriarkes primate placed weighte matter bishop decidedvntruthe grounded former vvhiche order taken firste commaundement peterdist c proninciae clement writeth apostle clement anacletus witnesseth apostle theire successours afterward lucius pope saithe nowe councel carthage defender alleaged likewise aphrican councel ordeined willed bishop primate see aphr ke shoulde called princeps sacerdotum aut summus sacerdos prince chiefe priestes high st prieste whiche woorde bishop signified onely bishop primate see whereof primate whiche decree willedmoste manifeste moste vaine vntruthe vvoordes councel vniuersalis autem nec etiam romanus pontifex appelletur theire primate aphrike kepe themselues within theire limites presumptuously take vpon gloriouse title iurisdictio pertetned lest surely might seme preiudicate pope supremacie thus euident thauctoritie charthage councel restrained phrike onely canon pope prima ie title whit dim n shed disproued al defender remaineth hathea greate vntruthe euer highest bishop b sarisburie hardinge mutche falsehed vpon v one time falsifieinge councelles shameful falsifieinge false teachinge false sleight false dise false plaie al false yet christe saithe selfe truthe god geue grace credite errour quotation margin wherin spende many woordes maye please knowe neither printer coulde presente printinge reste one pointe falsehed founde touchinge allegation councel carthage wil refuse stande charged whole euery horrible falseheddes found euident plaine truthe maye please take home al prety title selfe againe euery woordes often doubled heapte togeather hauing selfe committed seueral falsehedde herein trial courteous dealinge contente selfe shal fit iudge notwithstanding thought many ye dissemble deepely wil bestowe voice saie truthe yet doubte mater ye haue eles ye maye easily looke vp see truthe saye sir defender hathe falsely alleged councel carthage saithe councel decreed expresse woordes bishop rome called vniuersal bishop saie forged falsified parte councel indifferent trial bothe truthe falsehed herein beseche beholde woordes councelhigheste bishop prince priestes disti primae euen thei alleged doctour gratia thei primae sedis episcopus non appelletur princeps sacerdotum vel summus sacerdos vel aliquid huiusmodi sed tantum primae sedis episcopus vniuersalis autem nec etiam romanus pontifex appelletur let bishop firste see called prince priestes highest prieste like name onely bishop firste see let bishop rome selfe called vniuersal bishop ye glose thereupon noted thus hac distinctione dicitur quod papa non debet dici vniuersalis distinction saide pope ought called vniuersal bishop nowe hardinge compare woordes councelles wordes bothe togeather wee saie none otherwise councel saithe bishop rome selfe ought called vniuersal bishop herein wee doo neither adde minishe reporte woordes playnely wee finde lookte better booke would haue tried mater saye learninge ye might wel haue reserued vnciuile reproches falsehedde selfe haue spared crieinge shame vpon defender touchinge pleasantly cheare selfe woordes doo like iewel father sonne muste answeare augustine sometime heretique cresconiusaugust contra cresc li ca serua potius puerilia pueris keepe sutche childishe toy plaie child god make v bothe like vnto father heauen saie selfe onely without farther witnesse title pope auncient right euer geeuen al world doubte vntruthe hereof former replieartic gregor lib epist touching maie soone appeare certainely title offered gregorie refused vtterly none deede councel carthage notwithstanding title highest bishop sometimes geuen onely bishop rome patriarkes also vnto al bishoppesm hardinge amphilochius rufinus lib cap hardinges owne amphilochius calleth bastle principem sacerdotum prince chiefe bishoppes rufinus calleth athanasius pontificem maximum highest bishop nazianzenus calleth athanasius archisacerdotem sacerdotum chiefe bishop bishoppes lactantius calleth euery bishoprike summum sacerdotiu nazian ad h ronem likewise hierome saith ecclesiae salus summi sacerdotis dignitate pendet safetie churche standeth dignitie highest priest lactan lib cap whiche highest prieste hardinge selfe saithe meante euery seueral bishop within owne diocese augustine saithehieron contra luciferianos hardinge answeare apologie fol b quid est episcopus nisi primus presbyter hoc est summus sacerdos bishop first chiefe prieste saie highest prieste therefore wee may safely spare pope title highest bishop peculiar alone hardinge imagineth common general al bishoppes al ye haue alleged iurisdiction flamen mere fantasie grounded onely vpo vnsauery fable anacletus clemens neither hable findein quaest ex vtro que testamen mixtim qu either name archiflamines protoflamines whiche imagined ancient allowed writer sutche vniuersal iurisdiction belonginge firste principal mother see limited flamen princeconcil chalced cap written councel chalcedon quascunque ciuitates per literas regias metropolitico nomine honorarunt primate see vvhat citties euer prince charter honoured name mother see therefore emperour theodosius vpon displeasure conceiuedchrys ad popul antiochen homi tooke name honoure cittie antioche mindinge shoulde called nomore cause cittie rome chosen emongest others primate principal mother see either christe peter appointed hardinge telleth v moste noble cittie greattest renoume al worldconcil chalced ca woordes plaine sedi veteris romae patres merito dederunt primatum quod illa ciuitas aliis imperaret father woorthily gaue chiefetie see olde rome bicause cittie princehood ouer others nowe concerninge decree councel carthage touched wel bishop rome primate therefore pope adriane afterward alleging corrupting added thereto special prouiso selfe nullus archiepiscoporum nisi qui prima sedes renent appelletur prima aut princeps sacerdotumadri papa capitulis ex synodis canonib diuer collec pag aut summus sacerdos aut aliquid huiusmodi c salua semper omnibus authoritate beati petri apostoli let archebishop sauinge sutche heue principal firste see called either primate prince priestes highest prieste like name c sauinge alwaies al thinges authoritie blessed peter apostle apologie cap diuision therefore sithence bishop rome wil nowe day called chalengeth vnto selfe authoritie none bisides dothe plainely contrarie ancient councelles contrarie olde father wee beleue dothe geue selfe written owne companion gregorie presumptuouse prophaneal vvoordes gregorie sacrilegious antichristian name also kinge pride lucifer whiche preferreth selfe bretherne hathe forsaken faith forerunner antichriste hardinge mutche adoo aboute nought number bitter woordes pyked gregorio epistle pretended writte bishop rome purpose wee say vntruthe platina saithe bonifacius obtinuit phoca magna tame contentione wee may saie truely chalengeth selfe sutche name hath defender saie let shew v many bishop see euer tooke name vniuersal bishop vpon specially gregorie vnderstandeth signifie shewe none blotteth mutche paper impudent lie appeareth sutche mater al counc l deede six hundred thirty father general councel chalcedon gaue pope leo name gregorie three sundrie epistle writeth certaine theire writinges haue attributed pope either leo successourvntruthe appear th former authoritie platina affected called gregorie denieth vntruthe appeareth answeare since gregory time dayes euer called wrote selfe vniuersal bishop denie vvhereas pelagius gregorie writinge againste presumption iohn bishop constantinople takinge vpon name mutche alleged enimies vnitie againste authoritie peter successour ouer whole churche saye folowinge sleppes theire predecessours refused name vniuersal bishop sutche sense pelagius specially gregorie oftentimes declareth one called vniuersal bishop semeth called vntruthe vaine fantasie bishop consta tinople euer dreamed sutche authoritie bishop alonevniuersal bishoprike taken away al others refused called meaninge though refusal auctoritie bishop rome restrained extende ouer whole churche denie man might vniuersal bishop also peculiar ruler gouernour euery particular churche al bishop ben vaine contrary christes institution ordeined al apostle bishop saie al refused name might odiously taken refused primacievntruthe christe neuer erected sutche primacie whiche christe committed therefore gregorie writinge morice emperour alleaginge woordes make peter auctoritie ouer whole flocke christe saithe peterthe like vvhole charge vvas geuen paule iohn mathevve shal appeare charge whole churche principalitie committed yet called vniuersal apostle vvhere plaine gregorie doth affirme charge whole denieth name vniuersal let defender graunte thinge striue name b sarisburie pleasethe hardinge courtesie saye wee haue blotted paper many many impudente lie whole discourse standeth onely construction woorde vniuersal sense maye either refused claimed vnderstand thou getle reader al hardinges owne onely commetarie doctour father allegeth none firste saide gregorie woorde vniuersal bishop meante woulde bishop alone ouer al worlde excludinge al others exposition onely strange also vaine fonde voide reason bishop constantinople euer called selfe bishop excluded al others doubtelesse iohn firste laide claime vnto name called selfe vniuersal bishop wrote letter vnto others neuer refused calle bishoppes leaue gloses fantasy title vniuersal bishop gregorie meante sutche one would bishop alone woulde claime infinite authoritie vniuersal iurisdiction ouer al bishoppes throughout worlde cyprian saithe woulde calle selfe episcopum episcoporum bishop bishoppes therefore scyprian con cil carthagin gregor lib epist gregorie thus writeth vnto iohn bishop constantinople firste vsurper title quid tu christo vniuersalis ecclesiae capiti extremi iudicij responsurus e examine qui cuncta eius membra tibimet conaris vniuersalis appellatione supponere answeare wilt thou make vnto christe heade vniuersal churche thou shalt examined laste judgement thou haste called thee selfe onely bishop thus goest aboute name vniuersal bishop make al member subiecte vnto thee immoderate vniuersal iurisdiction gregorie reproued makinge selfe bishop alone excludinge al others likewise writeth selfe vnto eulogiusgregor lib epist beatitudo vestra mihi sic loquitur sicut iussistis quod verbum iussionis peto meo auditu remouete iussi sed quae vtilia visa sunt indicare curaui holinesse saithe thus vnto beinge bishop rome haue commaunded haue awaye woorde commaundinge hearinge beseeche commaunded tooke beste thought good shewe faulte therefore gregorie findeth iohn bishop constantinople stoode calling selfe onely bishop neuer bidding commaunding claiming vniuersalitie iurisdiction ouer whole churche christe cause saithe vnto eulogiusgregor lib epist ecce praefatione epistolae quam ad eipsum qui prohibui direxistis superbae appellationis verbum vniuersalem papam dicentes imprimere curastisvniuersal quod peto dulcissima mihi sanctitas vestra vltra non faciat quia vobis subtrahitur quod alteri plusquam ratio exigit praebetur beholde euen title letter ye haue written prowde posee naminge vniuersal pope notwithstanding haue forbidden beseche holinesse doo nomore euer geuen vnto aboue reason taken selues hardinge saithe gregorie affirmeth charge whole denieth name vniuersal let defender saithe graunte thinge wee striue name verily plaie benne vaine childre allow thinge selfe cauil onely name receiue body shunne shadowema appianus nonlatin alphabet christe saithe swalowe camel straine gnatte app saithe iulius caesar nicely refused called kinge yet al manner authoritie gouernmente bare selfe none otherwise kinge bare name vniuersal bishop mutche offended holy father pride tyrannie vniuersal gouernmente iurisdiction signified name name naught vsurpation thinge selfe greate deale woorse gregorie saithe charge principalitie whole churche committed vnto peter denied like sorte chrysostome saithe like charge principalitie churche committed vnto paule thus writeth chrys sermo de eleemosy chrysost act homili paulo totus orbis creditus est paulus gubernat orbis ecclesiam paulus vniuersum gubernat orbem vnto paule whole world committed paule gouerneth churche vvorld paule ruleth vvhole vvorld yet chrysostome meant hereby paule vniuersal gouernmente whole care charge general chrysost de laudibus pauli homil bound limited vnto one place indifferente co mo vnto al saithe paulus ta anxi omniu salute curabat c si totus mundus vnica esset domus paule careful saluation al menne whole worlde benne one housechrys homil de profectu euangelij chrysost ad popul antioche homil againe paulum tangebat solicitudo omnium ecclesiarum non vn u aut duarum aut trium sed omnium quae erant per orbem terrarum paule moued care al church one two three al church throughout world likewise saithe iohn columna erat omniu quae orbe sunt ecclesia um piller al church worlde likewise againe mathewe matthaeus vniuersi orbis curam gerebat whole vvorlde vnder mathewes chargechrysost prologo iohan chrys matthae homil therefore hardinge wil geather three woordes gregorie totius ecclesiae cura peter vniuersal iurisdiction ouer al muste needes folowe woordes paule iohn mathewe iurisdiction ouer al thinge hopeth gaine woordes gregorie cannot tel onlesse happily wil founde reason thus gregorie saithe petrus vniuersalis apostolus non vocatur peter called vniuersal apostle ergo pope vniuersal bishop handsomely thinges geathered togeather serue pourpose pope leo ye saie humilitie refused name openly councel chalcedon deede pope gregorie reporteth notwithstandinge appeareth thinge donne coucel title euer offered refuse thinge offered greate pointe humilitie shorte beste wee geather hereof iohn bishop constantinople ambitiously craued name pope leo godly refused offered vnto pope afterward gladly receiued without offering good namevniuersal refused il name receiued nowe let v see hardinges side haue meante woorde vniuersal humilitie pope haue receiued thus therefore write abbas de co ce praeben quia diuersita papa est ordinarius totius mundi pope ordinarie al vvorld extra de appel debitus gloss papa est ordinarius omnium hominum pope ordinarie al menne extra de statu regulari periculoso gloss papa totius orbis obtinet principatum pope hathe princehood al vvorlde pope consecrate chiefe minister saith vnto ceremoniar lib cap ego inuestio te de papatu vt praesis vrbi orbi doo inueste thee popedome thou maiste rule cittie vvorlde whereas hardinge demaundeth many pope haue claimed name may please remember late councel constance onely claimed also published article faithe woordes theseparalipome vrspergen de disputatione lipsica de necessitate salutis est credere papam esse inferiores praelati sint pro nihilo pope hathe nowe gotten right al inferiour church inferiour prelate stande nowe nothinge cause gregorie callethe name vniuersal bishop prophane presumptuous wicked antichristian name comparinge vsurper thereof lucifer antichriste apologie cap diuision wee saye minister ought laufully duely orderly preferred office churche god noman hathe power wreaste selfe holy hauevntruthe vvee haue abandoned neither priesthoode sacrifice christe appointed abandoned thexternal sacrifice priesthood newe testamente haue secte consecrated bishop therefore beinge without priestes made lawful laieinge handes scripture requireth al holy order beinge geuen bishop onely howe ye saie amonge lawfully minister ye haue lawful minister al beinge let haue leaue oppose one defender conscience better vnderstandinge maye directe woordes certaine person let authour apologie bicause name vnknowen let iewel gladly woulde reason point rather acquaintance beareth name bishop
