recesserit c hilary asmutche went churche beinge deacon onely thinketh multitude worlde neither consecrate sacramente thaulter beinge without bishop priestes deliuer baptisme without uchariste whereas nowe man deadesuccession man also secte ended beinge deacon coulde consecrate clerke shoulde remaine churche nonesacerdote whiche hath prieste lettinge goe fewe litle regarde selues bothe laie bishoppes listen thought churche thus hierome whome leauinge thinges note churche prieste vvhere churche like becomem hardinges brother apostate apostate nowe fledde v shalbe departed life therefore beinge true remaineth iewel tel v whether vocation ordinarie extraordinarie ordinarie shewe v letter order least shewe v haue receiued power doo office presume exercise due order laieinge handes consecrationa manifest vntruthe vvee haue bothe order co secration order consecration haue coulde geue al newe minister euer el cal whiche hath selfe extraordinarie al ye haue done hitherto besides al good order shewe v signe miracle faile al ought put awaie finally answeare thatli epist whiche maye obiected cyprian epistle magnus touchinge nouatian day question whether nouatian baptized offered specially vsed forme maner ceremony churche cyprian denieth saithe compred bishop settinge nought tradition gospeleusebius eccles hist li ca graeco apostle nemini succedens seipso ordinatus est succedinge man ordeined bishop selfe meanes maye one haue holde churche ordeined churche beinge doo wronge ye complaine tellinge declaringe vvorlde touchinge exercise ministerie ye doo nothinge orderly comely al thinges troublesomely without order onlesse ye meane suche order comelinesse theeues ob rue amonge selues distribution robbery lastlym hardinges modestie ye allowe euery man yea euery vvoman prieste driue ye felowes recantean odious vntruthe touchinge ministerie churche vvee haue neither preached vvritten haue preached vvhy allow ye bookes newe euangelistes haue written b sarisburie hath hardinge taken paine ordinarie thought coulde coloure make worlde beleeue wee haue neither bishoppes priestes deacon daie churche englande might easily claime whole right vnto himselfe deede certaine religion truthe god passeth euermore orderly succession none otherwise succession whereof hath tolde v longe tale good substantial argumente truthe christe saithematthael cathedra mosi sedent scribae pharisaei order succession scribe phariseis sitte moses chaire anna ca p touchinge succession wel bishoppes aaron eleazar succession paule saithe faithful ephesus actor scio qu post discessum meum intrabunt lupirapaces ex vobis ipsis exurgent viri peruersa loquentes knowe departure hence r ueninge woulues shal enter succede selues shal succession springe vp menne speakinge peruersely therefore hierome saithedist non est facile non sanctorum filij sunt qui tenent loca sanctorum alwaies child holy menne succession haue place holy menne notwithstandinge pope selfe wil saie alleged papa si desint bona acquisita per merirum dist non no sufficiunt quae locus praedecessore praestantur pope wante good thinges gotten owne merites good thinges whiche hath succession peter predecessour sufficient glose thereupon petrus fecit papa haeredes bouitatis suaesuccession peter made pope heires goodnesse succession dist sic omn gloss againe papa sanctitatem recipit cathedra pope receiueth holinesse succession chaire sutche affiance sometime scribe phariseis succession therefore saideiohan iohan vvee child abraham vnto v hath god made promise arte thou greatter father abraham christe wee knowe whence came shewe succession christe beganne refourme abuse errours saide vnto power dooest thou thinges lucae mare beda luc lib ca cyrill cathena luc gaue thee authoritie thy succession vpon whiche woordes beda saithe intelligi volunt diaboli esse quod faci woulde haue people vnderstande solemne succession al diuel cyrillus frameth woordes sorte tu ortus ex iuda commissos nobis fasces vsurpas thou beinge tribe juda therefore hauinge right succession vnto priesthoode takest vpon thee office committed vnto v likewise chrysostome imagineth phariseis thus saiechrysost matthae homi tu de sacerdotali familia natus non e senatus tibi hoc non coucessit caesar non donauit thou arte house priestes councel hath graunted thee emperour hath geeuen thee thus maineteine selues credite succession continuance aaron sate moses chaire kepte christe quite possession saide vnto euen hardinge saithe nowe vnto v euer taught v thinges thee ordinarie succession vocation haste thou bishop admitted thee confirmed thee allowed thee therefore good christian reader lette hardinges greate woordes mutche abasshe thee scribe phariseis like case vsed like language longe agoe touchinge churche rome wil saie nomore presente onely spoken openly cornelius bishop bitonto late councel tridentecornel episco bitontin concil triden vtinam non religione ad superstitionem fide ad infidelitatem christo ad antichristum velut prorsus vnanimes declinassent vvoulde god al gonne consente togeather religion superstition faithe jufidelitie christe antichriste fewe woordes consideringe either speaker place spoken maye seeme sufficient gonne faithe infidelitie christe antichriste yet al thinges failinge muste holde onely succession onely bicause sitte moses chaire muste claime possession whole right vertue succession woordes tertullian hardinge whiche haue alleged spoken certaine ancient father raised vp newe religion selues haue also donne without either woorde god example apostle holy father therefore saithe vnto v vnto sutche edant origines ecclesiarum suarum lette shewe foorthe originalles theire church euen wee saie vnto shewe v originalles doctrine shewe v one apostle christe learned catholique doctours churche euer saide priuate masse shewe one leaste either greeke latine augustine saitheaugust epist many bishoppes rome coulde one founde benne donatiste euen like sorte saie wee al bishoppes rome cannot one founde euer agreed hardinge saieinge masse sutche shewe v name circumstance witness dooinge shewe v originallessuccessio confirmation hardinge confesse truthe deceiue v lenger newe diuise ye haue onely selues succession apostle wherefore telleth v hardinge longe tale succession haue menne owne succession safe recorde bishop rome nexte succession vnto peter seconde thirdeirenae li ca euseb li cap epiphan l b de corpoerat optat contra donatist lib fourthe irenaeus reckeneth togeather order petrus linus anacletus clemens epiphanius thus petrus linus cletus clemens optatus thus petrus linus clemens anacletus clemens saithe selfe nexte vnto peter muste reckeninge goe thus petrus clemens linus anacletus hereby cleare foure firste bishoppes rome hardinge cannot certainely telle v order succeded thus talkinge mutche succession wel hable blase owne succession might farther saie peter see apostolike ouer iewes rome ouer heathenecalat paule saithe mihi concreditum est euangelium praepuiij sicut petro circumcisionis qui potens erat petro apostolatu circumcisionis potens erat inter gens gospel vncircumcision committed vnto gospel circumcision vnto peter god mighty peter apostleship circumcision mighty emonge heathen therfore pope daie wil claime onely peter title require nomore peter muste seeke primacie emongst iewes peter iurisdiction limited rome emonge heathen christian emonge whome paule saithe mutche doo saie accordinge ecclesiastical canon euer apostle time bishoppes haue euermore benne consecrate three bishoppes confirmation bishop rome without noman might allowed bishop ye shoulde vnaduisedly reporte manifest vntruthe beseche ecclesiastical canon diuised made gaue pope singulare priuilege bishop shoulde admitted al worlde onely remember canonistes haue saidefelin de constitu ca canonum atuta colum ver fallit papa potest solo verbo facere episcopum pope maye make bishop onely vvoorde without farther consecration abbate panormitane moueth doubte whether pope fulnesse power maye depriue al bishoppes worlde one time thus saie care greatly saie verilypanor de constitution translato nilus greeke writer saithe thus constantinopolitanus caesa iensem episcopum alios que sibi subiectos ordina romanus vero nec constantinopolitanum nec alium quenquam metropolitanum bishop constantinople doothe order bishop caesaria nilus de primatu romani pontificis bishoppes vnder bishop rome doothe order neither bishop constantinople metropolitane hereof haue spoken large former replie hardinge certainely cyprian willethartic diu cyprian lib epist sabinus beinge lawfully elected consecrate bishop spaine contine bishop stil yea although cornelius beinge bishop rome would confirme deede touchinge euery metropolitanes seueral iurisdiction gratianus noteth thus dist cap illud generaliter clarum est qu si quis praeter sententiam metropolitani fuerit factus episcopus hunc magna synodus definiuit episcopum esse non oportere generally cleare man made bishop without consente metropolitane greate councel nice hath decreed sutche one maye bishop likewise saithe socrates bishop constantinopleconfirmation consecration praeter sententiam episcopi constantinopolitani electio episcopi ne fiat vvithout consente bishop constantinople let noman chosen bishop right specially reserued bishop constantinoplesocrates lib cap nonlatin alphabet euery metropolitane within owne prouince bishop rome vniuersal right confirmation heare nothinge neither doothe hardinges countrefeite anacletus claime al bishoppes worlde belonginge admission onely parte woordes omnes episcopi qui huius apostolicae sedis ordinationi subiacent ana let episto dist iuxta sanctorum al bishoppes vnder orderinge confirmation apostolike see likewise writeth damasus bishoppes illyricum par est omnes qui sunt orbe romano magistros consentire meete al teacher within romaine jurisdiction sozomen lib cap agree togeather againe saye bishop hath alwaies benne consecrate three bishoppes whether true maye wel called question beinge parte hitherto weakely affirmed surely petrus de palude one owne doctours petr de palude de potestate apost l woulde haue tolde thus ecclesia vnus episcopus suff cit ad alium consecrandum nec est nisi propter solennitatem ab ecclesia inuentum vt tres concurrant churche one bishop sufficient consecrate nothinge el solemnitie mater churche hath diuised three bishoppes shoulde ioine togeather likewise ioha e maior owne doctours woulde haue saide vnto iohannes maior sen dist q quis ordinauit petrum non dabunt tres ordinatores dico ergo esse constitutionem humanam qu episcopus ordinetur tribus paulus enim non quaesiuit duo pro ordinatione titi timothei ordered peter made bishop cannot shewe three bishoppes ordered therefore saie bishop ordered three bishoppes ordinance made man paule ordered titus timotheus sought aboute twoo bishoppes whereas farther pleaseth calle letter order demaunde somme authoritie whether prieste handes laide ouer order made answeare prieste made longe sithence order ordinance thinke also man handes hardinge made prieste late time moste vertuous prince kinge edward sixthe therefore ye cannot wel doubte priesthoode without like doubtinge owne farther ye metropolitane ye demaunde whether bishoppe answeare bishop free accustomed canonical election whole chapter sarisburie assembled solemnely togeather purpose whiche companie hardinge one enfourmed beinge presente owne personne emongest brother gaue free open consente vnto election deite take heede owne breathe blowe impertinente tale ischyras zacchaeus touche v nothinge none knowe bishoppes made fourme order haue benne euer free election chapter consecration archebishop three bishoppes admission prince sorte longe sithence pope selfe admitted andplatina e erino papa platina saithe without emperours letter patentes pope hereafter shalbe shewed large therefore wee neither haue bishoppes without churche churche without bishoppes neither doothe churche englande daie depend themsuccession whome often calle apostate churche churche without apostate hardinge rather owne name good righte belongeth vnto greate parte learned graue godly menne mutche ashamed see folie notwithstandinge one neither v leafte aliue yet woulde therefore whole churche englande fice louai e tertullian saithe nonne laici sacerdotes sumus scriptum est regnum quoque sacerdotes deo tertullian exhorta ad castitatem patri suo no fecit differentiam inter ordinem plebem constituit ecclesiae authoritas honor per ordinis consessum sanctificatus deo vbi ecclesiastici ordinis non est consessus offert g sacerdos qui est ibi solus sed vbi tres sunt ecclesia est licet laici vnusquisque enim de sua fide viuit wee beinge laiemenne wee priestes written christe hath made v bothe kingedome priestes vnto god father authoritie churche honour assemblie councel order sanctified god hath made difference bitwene laie cleregie assemblie ecclesiastical order prieste beinge alone without companie priestes doothe bothe minister oblation also baptize yea three togeather though latemenne yet churche euery man liueth owne faithe againe ye demaunde bishoppe sacisburie euer sithence augostines time maineteined doctrine might likewise good authoritie demaunde bishop rome euer englishe augustine time maineteined doctrine saide bishop rome euer time either saide knewe priuate masse touchinge bishoppes sarisburie selfe haue already named twoo bishop shaxton bishop capon bothe learned graue father bothe preacher professours gospel reste bishop faithe helde either liked misliked writinges sermon dothe greately appeare truste helde fundation liued died faithe christe liued day seene see would haue benne partaker wilfulnesse shorte wee succede bishoppes haue benne day wee elected consecrate confirmed admitted deceiued thinge wee succede place errour predecessours rule standardes faithe rather sette aparte al comparison personnes doctrine christe daie hardinge succedeth doctrine daie succedeth nighte lighte succedeth darkenesse truthe succedeth errour nowe mutche ye haue thought good examine petite degree bishoppes sarisburie truste ye wil thinke il al tle touche like bishoppes rome wee maye thereby better hable see branch succession therefore shortly saie knowe pope marcellinus committed idolatrie pope syluester coniurer gaue selfe whole body soule vnto diuel diuels procuremente made pope pope zosimus ambition claime gouernmente corrupted holy councel nice pope liberius arian heretique pope leo appeareth legende likewise arian pope coelestinus nestorian heretique pope honorius monothelite heretique pope iohn reprooued gerson schole parise heretique petrarcha saithe rome sanctuarie al heresiessuccessio pope lyra saithe many pope haue fallen heresiesnicol lyra matthae ca know pope hildebrande charged councel brixia aduouterer churcherobber periured man mankiller sorcerer renegate faithe platina calleth pope sometimes scorneplatina romano pontificulos litle petite pope sometimes monstra portenta monster vnnatural il shapen creature pope adrian fourthe woonte saie succedimus non petro pascendo sed romulo parricidio vvee succede peter feedinge romulus killinge leaue dame iohane woman pope many others moe like vertue holinesse hauinge pleasure rehersal mutche hardinge began mater sarisburie ende sameiohan sarisburien polycratico iohannes sarisburiensis saithe romana ecclesia sedent scribae pharisaei churche rome succession sitte scribe phariseis hardinges holy succession though faithe faile yet succession muste holde vnto sutche succession god hath bounde holy ghoste lacke succession see church englande wee finde many idolater necromancer heretiques aduouterours churchrobbers periured personnes mankillers renegates monster scribe pharisies wee maie easily finde churche rome therefore trowe hardinge saithe wee haue succession wee bishoppes wee haue churche al paule saithe faithe commeth succession hearinge hearinge commeth legacie enheritance bishop bishop woorde god alwaies godly succede godly manasses succeded ezechias hieroboam succeded dauid succession turke daie possesseth holdeth foure greate patriarkal see churche constantinople alexandria antioche hierusalem succession christe saithematthae desolation shal fitte holy place antichriste shal presse roume christe sufficient claime succession place behooueth v rather haue regarde succession doctrine bernard concilio remen bernarde saithe quid prodest si canonice eligantur non canonice viuant auaileth chosen order liue ordere saithe augustine august contra donatist li q vocantur cane ipsum characterem multi lupi lupis imprimunt outwarde marke right bishop manie geue woulues woulues selues therefore ancient father irenaeus geueth v good councel eis qui sunt ecclesia presbyteris obaudire oportet qui successionem habent ab apostolis irenae li cap qui cum episcopatus successione charisma veritatis certum secundum beneplacitum patris acceperunt becommeth v obeie priestes churche whiche haue succession apostle togeather succession bishoprikes accordinge good wil god father haue receiued vndoubted gifte truthe cyprian beinge likewise charged dissentinge predecessours answeareth thus si quis de antecessoribus mei non hoc obseruauit tenuit quod no dominus exemplo magisterio suo docuit potest simplicitati eius venia concedi nobis ver ignoici non potest qui nunc domino admoniti instructi sumus predecessours haue obserued kepte lorde hath taught v bothe example also commaundemente simplicitie maie pardoned wee wee doo like hope pardonne beinge nowe admonished instructed lorde compare vse order church hardinge primitiue churche god ye shal easily see right succession cyprian saithe confession necessary si canalis aqua quae copiose prius la g r proflu ba subit deficiat none adfonte pergitur c hoc nuc facere oporte dei sacerdotes praecepta diuina seruantes vt aliquo si nutaueritcyprian ad pompeium contra epist stephani vacillauerit veritas ad originem dominicam euangelicam que apostolicam traditionem reuertamur inde surgat actus nostri ratio vnde ordo origo surrexit pipe conduit ranne abundance happen faile doo wee vse searche head c priestes god keepinge goddes commaundementes must truthe haue fainted failed pointe vvee returne original lorde tradition gospel apostle ther hence wee maie take discretion dooinges whence order selfe original firste beganne apologie cap diuision moreouer wee saie christe hathe geuen minister power binde loose open shutte b sarisburie difference bitweene v aduersaries whole mater great sauinge liketh wel hardinge buste selfe needelesse quarrel without cause three kindes confession expressed vnto v scripture first made secretely vnto god alone seconde openly whole congregation thirde priuately vnto brother twoo former kindes question touchinge thirde discretely vsed greatter comforte satisfaction penitente without superstition il wise v reproued abuse errours sette aparte wee doo nomore mislike priuate confession priuate sermon thus mutche onely wee saie priuate confession made vnto minister neither commaunded christechrysost ad hebraeos homil necessarie saluation therefore chrysostome saithe non dico tibi vt te prodas publicum ne que vt te accuses apud alios sed obedire te volo propherae dicenti reuela domino viam tuam wil thee bewraye thee selfe openly accuse thee selfe others counsel thee obeie prophete saieinge open thy waye vnto lorde gratian hauinge thorowly disputed debated whole mater bothe side de poeniten di quamuit plenitudo ende leaueth thus large cui harum sententiarum poti adhaerendu sit lectoris iudicio reseruatur vtra que enim fautores habet sapientes religiosos viros whether twoo opinion better folowe leafte discretion reader either side fauoured bothe wise also godly menne therefore glose concludeth thus de poeniten dist poenitentia glos meli dicitur confessionem institutam fuisse quadam vniuersalis ecclesiae traditione potius quam ex noui vel veteris testamenti authoritate better saie confession ordeined somme tradition vniuersal churche authoritie newe olde testamente likewise saithe theodorus sometime archebishop canturburie greeke borne de poeniten dist quidam quidam deo solummodo confiteri debe e peccata dicunt vt graeci saie wee bounde confesse sinnes onely god doo greci sde poeniten dist poeniten whereupon glose noteth thus apud graecos confessio non est necessaria quia non emanauit ad illos traditio talis emonge grecian confession necessarie sutche tradition euer came emongest neede many woordes hardinge selfe discourse hereof forced confessem har solo expresse terme auriculare secrete confession seldome mentioned ancient father tale benne truer saide thus expresse terme auriculare secrete confession neuer mentioned ancient father nowe passe ouer certaine hardinges vnnecessarie talkes hee groweth mater sorte hardinge concerninge minister churche wee saie open shutte dispensinge sacramentes haue theire vertue merites christe sacramentes haue issued flowed side sauiour christe sleepinge crosse allusion wee maie vse woordes olde figure wherewith churche buylded therefore sacramentes churche efficacie passion remaineth cause minister also churchethe keie church dispensours sacramentes certaine power geeuen remoue barre excludeth v goddes fauour owne goddes vertue power merite christes passion power called metaphore keie churche whiche keie ministerie whereof shal speake hereafter power muche concerneth releasse sinnes exercised sacramente penaunce benefite themfor vvhom serueth sacramente penance nouatians denied penance baptisme relapsed fallen sinne againe whiche power christen man doubteth onlesse holde heresie nouatians condemned heretikes churche denied priestes churche authoritie remitte sinnesthis sauoureth vntruth nouatus denied priuate open penaunce denied sacramente penaunce b sarisburie dewly receiuinge holy sacramentes ordeined christe wee receiue also remission sinnes way denied substance al sacramentes woorde god2 corin whiche paule calleth verbum reconciliationis woorde atonemente woorde instrumente remission sinne sacramentes seales affixed vnto prieste meaneaugustin iohan tracta augustine saithe aqua verbum mundat detrahe verbum quid est aqua nisi aqua water vvoorde god maketh cleane take vvoorde awaye vvater el vvater hereof wee shal haue cause saie hereafter al brought touchinge nouatus vtterly purpose nouatus neuer denied sinner might confesse sinnes either secretely god alone publiquely openly whole congregation auriculare confession prieste ought maie appeare neuer heard herein stoode whole erroure thought euer committed great notorious sinne baptisme notwithstandinge submission satisfaction hable make yet might neuer reconciled vnto brother receiued againe churche would hereby driue penitent sorowful sinner despaire goddes mercie somme learned menne haue thought onely example terrour vnto others therefore beatus rhenanus saitheb rhenanus argumento libelli tertull de poenitent hac sententia veterum permulti fuerunt ijs etiam augustinus augustine saithe caut salub ter que prouisum est vt locus illius humilimae poenitentiae semel ecclesia concedatur ne medicina vilis minus utilis esset aegrotis hath benne discretelyaugustinus epistola wholesomely prouided graunted man doo moste humble open penaunce onely churche neuer afterwarde leaste medicine beinge made ouer common bee profitable sicke thus mutche difference therfore wee see bitweene churche nouatus churche graunteth open sinner one onely time open reconciliation neuer nouatus graunteth none al therefore whole mater nouatus might haue serued hardinge purpose confession whether priuate publique parte erroure apologie cap diuision wee saie office loosing consisteth pointe minister either preachinge gospel offereth merites christe ful pardon sutche haue lowely contrite harte doo vnfainedly repente selues pronouncinge vnto sure vndoubted forgeeuenesse theire sinnes hope euerlastinge saluation el minister haue offended theire brother mindes somme greate offence notable open crime whereby haue vannished made selues straungers common felowship body christe perfite amendement sutche personnes dothe reconcile bring home againe restore companie vnitie faithful hardinge summe gaye woordes abbridged dothe attribute loosinge absolution firste preachinge nexte assotlinge sutche excomminicate touchinge firste defender confounde office preachinge absolution preacher teacheth hearer reporteth woordes christe mouthe christe saieinge thus saithe christe c priest whiche minister absolution accordinge authoritie geuen christe owne person assoileth penitente saieingevntruthe christe neuer gaue prieste sutch commission assoile thee name father cvntruthe hierome saithe soluunt sermone dei testimoniis scripturarum preacher preacheth onely dothe assoile sinner neither geueth merites christe full pardon pronouncinge vnto gospellvntruthe hardinges ovvne doctrine reade ansvveare greate benefite consiste pronouncinge denouncinge gospell might euery laye man yea womenne yea yonge boyes gyrles assoile sinner yea might euery man assoile selfe woulde ye sir appointe vnto v suche iudges constituted christe woordes christe plaine cannot violently wrested christe saide ye offer preachinge gospel merites pardon whose sinnes ye pronounce gospell remitted quorumcunque remiseritis soeuers sinnes ye remitte remitted sonne man remitted sinnes sicke palsyeiohan mary maudelen ye maye knowe saithe sonne man hathe power remitte sinnesli de dignitate sacerdotali c euen hathe transferredthe povver bicause haue woorde othervvise power vnto priestes saithe chrysostome vvhiche priestes hathe sente father sente absolution consiste pronouncinge gospell whiche profiteth muche beleeuedvntruthe ioined vvith vaine folie power key whiche christe hathe geuen churche consisteth muche minister sinner heareth beleeueth forgeuen luther opinion meanes prieste hathe speciall power wee saie churche sacramente hath efficacie institution christe adhibited sense catholike churche christe hath euer taughte god woorketh saluation sacramentes faithe hathe alwayes baptized infantes sinnes beinge remitted mighte made child godvntruthe churche assoiled mad menne pronounced assoiled vvhen vvere sober like wise keyes churche hathe assoiled personnes berefte vse speache reason learned auncient holy father leo teacheth epistle ad theodorum episcopum foroiuliensem augustine de adulterinis conlugijs lib cap vltimo finally office loosinge absolution consisted preachinge gospell offeringe merites christe pronouncinge woordes whiche remission sinnes expressed denfender teacheth catechumen olde time neither nowe shoulde danger shoulde dye without baptisme grace reconciliation beinge assoiled lacked preachinge nowe lacke suche bee contrarie whereof churche hathe euer taught witnesse sametract iohan besides father wee haue plaine doctrine augustine saithe catechumen howe mutche euer profitethe beareth still burthen iniquitie longe baptized denie case iuste necessitie excepted one hauinge right firme willes desire eche case vvhen contempte religion pointe necessitie excludethe mysterie baptisme augustine saithe dangerous pernicious doctrine defender newe ministringe prelate sweete holy woordes withe truthe teache christen people office loosinge consisteth offeringe preachinge gospell call merites christe full pardon pronouncinge knowe howe sure vndoubted forgeeuenesse sinnes hope euerlasting saluation sucheo dangerous doctrine soothe haue lowly contrite harte doe vnfainedly repente contrition harte seeme speake sufficethe loosinge sinnes onlesse contrition formed charitie diuines teache vvhiche charitie seeketh requireth sacrament penaunce grace reconciliation whiche cannot ministred priestevntruthe reade aunsvveare neither possible prieste iudge truly lowly contrite harte repente vnfainedly forasmutche cannot searche harte onlesse penitentes humble selues vnto declare theire repentaunce simple lowly confession sinneslib homiliaru homi vvhiche confession newe gospeller haue abandoned theire congregation howe mutche catholike holesome doctrine smanifest vntruthe augustine speaketh vvoordes open confession people augustine embraced folowed whiche vttereth woordes doo ye penaunce sutche done churche churche maie praie let noman saie selfe penaunce secretely god god forgeeueth knoweth doo harte saith augustine hereunto vvhy saithe saide vaine thinges ye loose earthemat shalbe loosed heauen without cause key geeuen churche vve make voide gospell god wee make frustrate woordes christe augustine saithe doo ye penaunce sutche liketh selues sutche newe fangled selfe pleasinge preacher teache sutche done churche whiche consisteth contrition harte confession mouthe satisfaction worke ye maie assoiled perfitely reconciled touchinge seconde pointe wee doo attribute loosinge sutche excommunicate offeringe christes merites pronouncinge gospell vnto doo power iurisdiction christe geeuen churche father excommunication consideration necessitee called neruus ecclesiasticae disciplinae sinnowe churchely discipline canon mucro episcopi swerde bishop augustine episcopalis iudicij damnatio qua poena nulla ecclesia maior est condemnation man bishoply iudgemente whiche greater punishmente churche b sarisburie wee commit key kingedome heauen onely vnto priesteand none onely wee saie euer thou bindeste earthe shalbe bounde heauen yet neuerthelesse hath euery prieste vse key peter lombarde selfe saithe sane dici potest quod alteram istarum clauium senten dist id est scientiam discernendi non habent omnes sacerdotes wee maie safely saye al priestes haue one twoo key meane knowledge discerne yf haue key neither open shutte neither doothe folowe doctrine either child laye menne doo laiman remitteth sinne maie forgeeue sinnes yet god woorde maie mighty pronouncer neuer simple augustine saithe cum christus petro dicerer augustin iohan tracta tibi dabo claues regni coelorum vniuersam significabat ecclesiam christe saide vnto peter vnto thee wil geeue key kingdome heauen signified thereby whole churche againe quaecun que ligaueris super terram erunt ligara coelo augustin de verb dom secund matthae sermo coepisti habere fratrem tuum tanquam publicanum ligas illum terra cum autem correxeris concordaueris cum fratre tuo soluisti illum terra cum solueris terra solutus erit coelo euer thinges thou shalt binde earthe shalbe bounde heauen thou beinge lateman hast begonne haue thy brother publicane thou bindest earthe thou hast corrected hast agreed thy brother thou hast loosed earthe thou haste loosed earthe shalbe loosed heauen likewise theophylacte saithe theophylact matthae cap si tu offensus habes eum qui te affecit iniuria sicut publicanum gentilem erit ille coelo talis si autem solueris eum hoc est si illi condonaueris erit illi coelo condonatum non enim solum quae soluunt sacerdotes sunt soluta sed quaecun que no iniutia affecti vel ligamus vel soluimus ipsa erunt ligata vel soluta thou beinge offended haue hathe donne thee wronge publicane heathen sutche shal also heauen thou loose saie thou pardonne shalbe pardonned also heauen onely thinges priestes loose loosed also euer wee laimonne hauinge taken wronge doo binde loose thinges shal also bounde loosed doctrine maie seeme strange hardinge onlesse stranger emongest owne order owne churche rome olde wife yonge gyrle maie minister sacramente baptisme trowe wil saie maie minister baptisme without remission sinnes churche rome power key lapped vp oftentimes bulle lead sente abroade world laye pardoner thought neuerthelesse good sufficient vnto receiuer remission sinnes notwithstandinge messenger priest somme late doctours saide churche haue taught vsde poeniten di quem poenitet man maie make confession bille hande receiue absolution trusheman broker peter lombarde grande maister theire whole schole saithescotus sente dis arti senten dis nunc priusquam si tamen defuerit sacerdos proximo vel socio est facienda confessio thou wante prieste thou muste make thy confession vnto thy neighboure vnto thy felowe beda saithe alleged saide peter lombarde coaequalibus quotidiana leuia grauiora vero sacerdoti pandamus let v open smal daily sinnes vnto felowes greatter vnto prieste short senten eadem dist vpon decretales noted thus necessitate laicus potest audire confessiones absoluere case necessitie laie man maie bothe heare confession absolue orderextra de offi iudicis ordinar pastoralis glossa doctrine hardinges owne churche owne doctours tel laye menne weemenne maie absolue penitente forgeeue sinnes therefore hee hathe lesse cause mislike hardinge saithe christe saithe ye offer preaching gospel merites pardonne whose sinnes ye pronounce gospel remitted quorumcunque remiseritis whose euer sinnes ye remitte remitted yf hardinge wil conclude negatiue ergo sinnes forgeuen preachinge gospel sinnes remitted bi hearing vvord god trowe wil simple argumente chrysostome saithe clauicularij sunt sacerdotes quibus creditum est verbum docendi interpretandi scriptutas keiebearers priestes committed vvoorde teachinge expoundinge scripture hierome saithe chrysost matthae opere imperfect ca quaecun que solueritis super terram erunt soluta coelo soluunt autem eos apostoli sermone dei testimonijs scripturarum exhortatione virtutum euer thinges ye loose vpon earthe shalbe loosed also heauen apostle loose vvoorde god testimony scripture exhortation vnto vertuehierony esai li ca augustin iohan tracta likewise augustine saithe iam vos mundi estis propter verbum quod ioquutus sum vobis quare non ait mundi estis propter baptismum quo loti estis nisi quia aqua verbum mundat cleane bicause vvoorde haue spoken vvhy saithe cleane bicause baptisme wherewith ye wasshed sauinge euen vvater vvoorde maketh cleane likewise ambrose ambrosi de cain abel cap roman corin remittuntur peccata per verbu dei cuius leuites est interpres sinnes forgeeuen vvoorde god expounder whereof leuite prieste al power woorde god whiche paule calleth power god vnto saluation verbum reconciliationis vvorde whereby wee reconciled vnto god cause chrysostome saithechrysost de sacerdot li alleged hardinge prieste hathe power christe preacheth woorde god christe preached sense christe saithe vnto disciplesiohan liuinge father sente euen like commission doo sende otherwise power christe farre surmounteth passeth al creature onely earthematthae also heauen christe selfe thereof saithe thus al thinges deliuered father prophete esai saithe ponam clauem domus dauid super humerum eius aperiet nemo claudet claudet nemo aperiet esai cap wil set keie house dauid vpon shoulder hee shal open noman shal shutte hee shal shutte noman shal open doctrine saithe hardinge foloweth greate inconuenience saithe power key consisteth mutche minister sinner heareth beleeueth inconuenience nothinge greate pretended errour hereof standeth equiuocation doubtful taking one woorde one thing maie sundrie way remission sinnes maie prieste messenger woorde god instrument penitente partie receiuer offeringe hereof minister effecte force sinner therefore luke saithe god opened harte silck woman geue eare vnto woordes act marke sent dist sed quaritur clemens paraenetico augustin iohan tracta spoken paule christe saithe vvho euer shal beleeue baptized shalbe saued beleeueth shalbe damned likewise peter lombarde selfe saithe ex aperte ostenditur quod deus ipse poenitentem soluit quando intus illuminat inspirando veram cordis contritionem hereby plainely appeareth god selfe looseth penitente geeuinge warde lighte hee inspireth true contrition harte therefore clemens alexandrinus saithe fides nostra est clauis regni coelorum faithe keie kingedome heauen augustine likewise saithe cor clausum habent quia clauem fidei non habent haue theire harte shutte bicause lacke keie faithe augustin psalm againe saithe suscitari mortuus nisi int clamante domino non potest deade man cannot raised againe onlesse lorde crie within absolutio madde menne comme neare pourpose gratian selfe saithe voluntas sacerdotis nec prodesse quaes dictum est nec obesse potest sed meritum benedictionem poscentis wil prieste neither hinder merite desireth absolution touchinge obiection frantique personnes maddemenne sorte howe farre absolution taketh place mutche extraordinarie caseextra de baptismo etus effectu maiores ecclesiae s item quaeritur thinke neither needeful easy define deede question moued pope innocentius thirde whether sorte man either maddenesse sleepe maye baptized augustine seemeth witnesse child sommetime baptized theire mother wombe likewise writeth freende owne cum iaceret sine sensu dolore laetali augustin contra iulian li cap desperaretur baptizatus est nesciens whereas hee laye traunse without sense deadly paine despaired hee baptized knewe bonauentura addeth somme force vnto materaugustin confession li cap demaundeth question aliquis possit absolui inuitus vvhether man maie absolued againste wil concerninge absolution madde menne time theire phrenesiebonauenturae senten distin quaest seemeth bothe meaninge leo godly discretion churche time man standinge excommunicate happened berefte sens beinge case benne likely departe life vpon proufe former repentance restoared might departe peace member churche god practise hereof wee finde councel carthage woordes si concil carthaeginen cap qui poenitentiam infirmitate petit phrenesim versus fuerit dent testimonium qui eum audiuerunt accipiat poenitentiam desired reconciliation penaunce sicknesse afterward fal madde let hearde beare witnesse let receiue penance onely publike testimonie vnto churche partie excommunicate repentante minde quiet thinge el hardinge geather hereof cannot tel certainely order manner restoared onely madde menne also deade menne vnto churche24 quae de communione glossa noted vpon decree ex quo cum per eum non stabat el communicare debemus et ita est absoluendus post mortem vvherefore seeinge lacke parte wee ought communicate muste absolued deathe woordes augustine often vseth vnto beginner entrers faithe called catechumeni vttred rather terrour others rigoure trutheaugustin de peccator meritis remiss li cap augustin ad catechumen li cap shal appeare otherwheres writeth thus catechumeni secundum quendam modum per signum christi sanctificantur catechumeni beginner sorte sanctified signe christe againe saith non dum renati estis sed per crucis signum vtero sanctae matris ecclesiae iam concepti estis ye yet borne newe signe crosse ye already conceiued vvombe holy churche mother therefore hauinge thus entred ye faithe christe although happened afterwarde departe life without baptisme yet churche oftentimes thought goodambrosi de obitu valentiniani iudge wel ambrose doubted emperour valentinian departed hence goddes fauoure yet emperoure beginner nouice faithe departed hence without baptisme hardinge saithe furtherthe iudge sinne onlesse penitente make particulare rehearsal al sinnes prieste minister iudge vnto adde also furtheraugustin confession li cap notwithstandinge rehearsal maye made yet prieste neuer doubteful iudge augustine saithe quid ergo mihi est cum hominibus vt audiant confessiones meas quasi sanaturi sint omnes languores meos vnde sciunt cum meipso de meipso audiunt verum dicam quandoquidem nemo scit hominum quid agatur homine nisi spiritus hominis qui est homine vvhat haue doo menne heare confession weare bable beale al griefes vvhen heare speake mee selfe tel whether doo saie truthe noman knoweth donne man sprite man man hereof haue growen many vnnecessarie curious question yeeresbeat rhenanus tertull de poenitentia vt sacerdotes poenitentialem librum bene calleant monethes day houres manner order penance serue euer seueral sinne resolution whiche doubtes stoode iudgement prieste therefore carolus magnus lawes straitely commaundeth priestes skilful booke penance touchinge iudge sinnes chrysostome saithe ante deum confitere peccata tua apud verum iudicem cum oratione delicta rua pronuntia confesse sinnes god chrysost ad hebrae homil chrysost sermo de confessione poenitentia true iudge praier pronounce thine offense againe cogitatione fiat delictorum exquisitio sine teste sit hoc iudicium solus te deus confitentem uideat let examination thy sinnes wrought thy harte let iudgement vvithout vvitnesse let god onely heare thee thou makest thy confession againe saithe medicinae locus hic est non iudicij non poenas sed peccatorum remissionem tribuens deo solo dic peccatum tuumchrysost homil de poenitentia heere place medicine iudgement geuinge punishement remission sinnes open thy sinne god alone therefore hardinges owne canon noted thus confessio fit ad ostensionem poenitentiaede poeniten dis omnes qui non ad impetrationem veniae confession made vnto prieste thereby obteine forgeuenesse declare repentance againe confessio sacerdoti offertur signum veniae acceprae non causam remissionis accipiendae confession made vnto prieste token remission already obteined eod capite cause whereby procure remission yet prieste iudge al notwithstandinge pronounceth sentence iudge doctrine open sinne ye offence churche humilitie heauinesse penitent iudge togeather elder congregation hath authoritie bothe condemne absolue4 senten dist non autem peter lombarde selfe saithe etsi aliquis apud deum sit solutus non tamen facie ecclesiae solutus habetur nisi per indicium sacerdotis al man absolued god yet accoumpted absolued face churche iudgemente prieste likewise saithe augustine augustin de ecclesiasti dogmatib li ca horror pritis publica poenitentia satisfacere sacerdotis iudicio reconciliatum communioni sociari exhorte first make satisfaction vnto churche open penance restoared communion discretion prieste order hereofcyprian li epist set foorthe cyprian firste sinner many outwarde gesture token shewed selfe penitent sorowful sinne made humble confession thereof whole congregationorigen psal desired brother praie lastly bishop cleregie laide theire handes ouer reconciled saithe origen qui lapsus est procedit medium exomologesin facit hathe offended commeth foorthe middes people maketh confession sozomenus likewise describinge order saithe thusopen confession rei ad terram sese pronos abijciunt cum planctu lamentatione episcopus ex aduerso occurrit cum lachrymis sozomen li cap ipse ad pauimentum lamentando prouoluitur vniuersa ecclesiae multitudo lachrymis suffunditur haue offended fal downe flat weepinge lamentation grounde bishoppe commeth teares selfe likewise falleth downe whole multitude churche powred ouer ouer teares vse moe woordes herein whole mater longe sithence growen vtterly vse notwithstandinge confession penance augustine speaketh open confession hardinge hee saithe key geeuen churche vaine open confession hee saithe vvhat euer ye loose earthe shalbe loosed heauen open confession speaketh al woordes auriculare priuate dealinge yf hardinge happen doubte hereof let looke better vpon bookes shal finde euen verie place hathe alleged woordes partely goeinge beforeaugustin li homiliarum homil partely folowinge agite poenitentiam qualis agitur ecclesia vt oret pro uobis ecclesia iob dicit si erubui conspectu populi confiteri peccata mea propterea deus uoluit vt theodosius ageret poenitentiam publicam conspectu populi nolite permittere viros vestros fornicari interpellate contra eos ecclesiam doo penaunce sutche donne churche churche maie praie iob saithe ashamed sight al people confesse sinnes therefore god would theodosius beinge emperoure worlde doo open penaunce euen presence al people ye wiues suffer husbandes liue fornication comme congregation crie confession augustine speaketh secrete priuate eare publique open sight hearing al peopleambros de poenitentia li ca like manner saithe ambrose multos necesse est vt ambias obsecres vt dignentur interuenire fleat pro te mater ecclesia culpam tuam lachymis lauet thou muste needes humble thee selfe desire many intreate thee let churche thy mother weepe thee let washe thy offence teares therefore hardinge plaine dealinge sutche sleight turne publique priuate open audience whole people one onely mannes secrete eare mutche abuse simplicitie reader certainely woordes augustine open penaunce confesse openly sight al people vvhole churche maie praie woordes saye wil easily serue proue pourpose priuate confession apologie cap diuision wee saie also minister doth execute authoritie binding shutting often shutteth vp gate kingdome heauen vnbeleeuing stubborne person denouncing vnto god vengeaunce euerlasting punishment el dooth quite shut bosome churche open excommunication doubte sentence euer minister god shal geue sorte god selfe doth wel alowe euer earthe theire meanes loosed bounde god selfe wil loose binde confirme saine heauen hardinge vntruthe vve coufounde heare againe confounde power bindinge office preachinge speaking power loosinge vvhereto wee saye wee saide bindinge shuttinge consisteth denouncinge goddes engeaunce exercise keie iurisdiction committed churche minister whereof binde sinner iust cause loose knowe loosed keie perteineth excommunication exercised vvhat euer thus loosed bounde earthe god selfe alloweth loosed bounde heauenvntruthes fiue togeather maie appeare ansvveare suche priestes ye haue newe churche least wise vsinge priestly auctoritie none wil suffer made suche auctoritie exercised ye defraude faithful people greate benefite sacrament penaunce kepinge faste bounde sinnes baptisme committed ye cause euerlasting damnation christe hath shed bloud price redemption b sarisburie wee confounde key hardinge speake plainely distinctely either wee saie power wel loosinge also bindinge standeth god woorde exercise execution standeth either preaching el sentence correction ecclesiastical discipline later hereof question former harding pronounceth precisely although appeareth moste aduisedly bindinge saithe shuttinge standeth denouncinge goddes vengeaunce hereof certainely assureth v vndoubted veritie saieinge seemeth consider power weight woorde god christe selfe saithe iohn man shal heare woordes shal beleeue condemne refusethe receiueth woordes hath one condemneth woorde haue spoken shal iudge last daie like wise saithe paule corin vve good sauour christe saued perishe vnto perishe wee sauoure death vnto deathe saued2 corin wee sauour life vnto life againe gospel hidden hidden perishe saith god vnto prophete ezechiel thou geue warninge wickedezechiel wil turned wickednesse shal perishe yet haste thou discharged thine owne soule shorteaugustin epist ad deogratias whole scripture ful hereof therefore augustine saithe praedicatur euangelium quibusdam ad praemium quibusdam ad iudicium gospel preached somme vnto rewarde somme vnto iudgemente rest hardinge saithe suche priestes bicause ye haue newe churche leaste wise vsinge priestly auctoritie none suffer made suche auctoritie exercised ye defraude faitheful people great benefite sacramente penance keepinge fast bounde theire sinnes baptisme committed ye cause theire euerlastinge damnation christe hathe shead bloud price redemption great woordes wel seasoned bigge sounde smal weight ful terroure voide witte churche englande hath authoritie daie goddes woorde binde lose mutche euer christe gaue apostle authoritie hable binde onely hardinge felowes peter bound simon magussinne forgeuen vvithout confession paule bounde elymas false prophet also pope himselfe open offender paule saithe deliuer ouer vnto sathan vndoubtedly beeinge bound earthe shal also stande bounde heauen people remaine bounde perishe theire sinnes menne vncharitably fondly haue imagined certaine remission theire sinnes bloude christe christe himselfe presente spake them1 iohan actor taught knowe bloude christe sonne god hath made v cleane al sinnes name vnder heauen whereby wee shalbe saued onely name iesus christe priuate confession abuse errours set aparte saide wee condemne leaue libertie therein wee maie seeme folowe aduise charles emperoure late interim interim carolus anno thus writeth confessio peccatorum enumeratio vt non nimis laxanda est ita uicissim non nimis est astringenda touchinge priestes makinge hardinge ye seeme make great accoumpte4 senten dist post owne peter lombard saith saide sane dici potest quod alteram clauem id est scientiam discernendi multi sacerdotes non habent bonauent senten dist quae e like manner saithe owne bonauentura omnes fere ita sunt simplices idiotae post susceptionem sacerdotij ficut ante al priestes parte simple vnlearned receiuinge order graunted priest fully furnished al key yet de poeniten dist quis aliqua authoritie forgeueth sinnes owne gratian saithe euidentissime datur intelligi quod sine confessione oris peccata possunt deleri euidently geeuen v vnderstande vvithout confession mouthe sinnes maie forgeeuen de poenit dist conuertimin againe ore tacente veniam consequi possumus though vvee saie nothinge yet wee maye haue pardonne againe luce clarius constat cordis contritione non oris confessione peccata dimitti apparente cleare light sinnes forgeeuen contrition harte confession mouthe againe dominus ostendit quod non sacerdotali iudicio sed largitate diuina peccator mundatur lorde hathe taught v sinner made cleane iudgement prieste mercie god thus hardinge plaine iudgemente owne doctours auriculare confession quite abolished yet might people notwithstandinge haue ful remission theire sinnes maie verified christe saide vnto phariseisluk ye haue taken awaye key kingedome heauen neither doo ye enter selues wil suffer others would enter veselus de subditis superiorib key veselus saide longe sithence claues papae praelatorum non aperiunt regnum dei sed claudunt potius pope prelate key doo open kingedome god rather shutte apologie cap diuision touchinge key wherewith maie either shutte open kingdome heauen wee chrysostome saye knowledge scripture tertullian saie interpretation lawe eusebius wee cal woorde god hardinge letthe vvoord keie whole nature man shutte heauen sinne firste parent taken wait passion christe benefite receiued heauen yet remaineth shutte bothe sinne originall contracted sinne actual committed wee haue neede sacramentes key churche holy father good consideration grounded vpon scripture haue diuided key keie order keie iurisdiction either keie knowledge whiche call also keie discretion keie power defender wee saie confounde key seme knowe key verely onely knowledge scripture interpretation lawe vvorde god although also doo open shute kingedome heauen kinde chrysostome tertullian eusebius maye well saye onely also miracle plague thinges whiche prepare vnderstandinge man whereby hee maye receiue benefite moste principall key nowe wee speake b sarisburie gentle reader better vnderstandinge hereof may please thee consider woorde god according sundrie effectes property thereof hath sundrie name example encreaseth multiplieth called seede cutteth harte diuideth fleash sprite called swerde taketh encloseth v bringeth v togeather called nette wassheth v cleane called water enflameth v called fire feedeth v called breade euen openeth geueth v entrie house called keie house kingedome heauen christe doore woorde god keie thus saieinge hardinge telleth v wee confounde mater seeme knowe wee saie notwithstandinge herein imagine nothinge owne onely reporte woordes sentence ancient learned catholique father tertullian saithe tertull contra marc li quam clauem habebant legis doctores nisi interpretationem legis keie doctours lawe sauinge exposition lawe hierome saithe duce ecclesiae habent claues scientiae vt aperiant scripturas creditis sibi populis hieromy esaiam li ca vnde praecipitur vt magistri aperiant discipuli ingrediantur captaines churche haue key knowledge open scripture vnto people committed therefore commaundement geuen maisters openambros de cain abel li scholar shoulde enter ambrose saithe remittuntur peccata per dei verbum cuius leuites est interpres sinnes forgeuen woord god expounder whereof priest thus like ancient father haue opened meaninge keieschrysost matthae homil yet neuer therfore condemned ignorance menne wiste saide certainely chrysostome saithe clauis est scientia scripturarum per quam aperitur ianua veritatis keie knowledge scripture whereby opened gate truthe augustine saithe clauis est dicenda augusti de sanctis homil qua ad fidem pectorum dura reserantur ought called keie hardnesse mennes harte opened vnto faithe hath hardinge wel multiplied encreased key hathe brought v foorthe whole bunche altogeathermultiplication key key order key iurisdiction key discretion key power key moste principal key principal thus hath key order without iurisdiction key iurisdiction without order key discretion without power key power without discretion al prety shiftes key hath diuised auoide confusion make vp tale pope crosse key sufficient plague miracle knowe thinge el brought foorthe vnto v likenesse key distinction limitation key saithe hath vpon good consideration benne diuised holy father yet al holy father modesty sake nameth none answeare beste make sutche vanity deede right keie knowledge loste gonne time diuise pretie pikelockes woorke feate bonauentura hereof writeth thus partely alleged bonauen sentent dist quae e omnes fere sacerdotes ita sunt simplices idiotae post susceptionem sacerdotij sicut ante dicendum ergo quod scientia non est clauis principalis nec per se sed prout iuncta est authoritati ligandi vel soluendi et haec clauis non est de esse ordinis sed de bene esse al priestes moste parte simple iude receiuinge priesthoode therefore must saie knowledge principal keie keie al selfe ioined authoritie bindinge loosinge keie knowledge substance order priesthoode better beinge therefore encrease hardinges number key saithe quidam habent scientiam clauium eodem loco quidam clauiculam quidam nullam somme haue knowledge key somme pretie litle keie somme keie al case good hardinge resolue reader prieste hath nothinge el pretie litle keie keie al authoritie hath either open shutte hardinge replieth farther vvee haue remission sinnes ministration sacramentes therefore wee haue onely hearinge vvoorde god obiection touched partely answeared litle augustine calleth sacramentesaugustin contra faustum li cap verba visibilia woordes visible liuely image deathe christe sensibly sette eies woorde god substance life al sacramentes without sacramentes euer sacramentes therefore augustine saithe alleged beforeaugust iohan tracta quare non ait vos mundi estis propter baptismum quo lot estis sed ait propter verbum quod locutus sum vobis nisi quia aqua verbum mundat detralie verbum quid est aqua nisi aqua saithe christe cleane bicause baptisme wherewith ye wasshed bicause woorde haue spoken sauinge woorde cleanseth vvater take vvoorde awaie vvater el vvater apologie cap diuision moreouer christes disciple receiue authoritie heare priuate confession people listen whishperinges common massinge priestes doo euerywhere nowe adaies doo though one point laye al vertue vse key ende shoulde goe teache publishe abroade gospel vnto beleuinge sweete sauour life vnto life vnto vnbeleuinge vnfaitheful sauour deathe vnto deathe mindes godly person beinge brought lowe remorse theire former life errours begonne looke vp vnto light gospel beleue christe might opened woorde god euen dore opened keie contrarie wise wicked wilful sutche would beleeue returne right way leafte stil faste locked2 timoth shutte vp paule saithe waxe woorse woorse take wee meaninge key sorte mennes conscience either opened shutte hardinge ye harpe muche vpon one stringe whiche iarreth eares hearer confuse harmonie like noman onlesse minstrel owne secte auctoritie power key consisteth altogeather principally preachinge pronouncinge gospel already haue proued vvhat maye wee iudge procedeth malice ignorance thus ye confounde key power ministeries preachinge one thinge gouerne churche remitte reteine sinnes distribute sacramentes dothe paule cleare woordes speake seuerally distinctly ministeries1 corin saithe sent christe baptise preache gospel doctrine whereby ye confounde key power ministeries dothe onely obscure scripture bringe people greate errours also vnder pretence loue towarde preachinge gospel leadeth contempt sacramentes specially sacrament penaunce without baptisme haue sinned beinge letted case necessitie wherein vvil desire vowe acceptedvntruthe ansvveare maye appeare attaine saluation folow caluine maister sundrie false perilous doctrine feared wicked temeritie suffered proceede length hauinge brought al religion bare preachinge ye wil abandon al sacramentes churche thinges necessarie wicked maister teachethcaluines vvicked doctrine againste sacramets christes death maye remembred otherwise therea greate vntruthe ioined vvith sclaunder reade ansvveare al sacramentes superfluous seeme sclaunder remitte commentary vpon firste epistle paule corinthian expoundinge wooordes doo remembraunce saithe thus supper token remembrance ordeined lifte vp helpe infirmitie otherwise mindeful inoughe christes deathe helpe meaneth blessed sacrament aultar superfluous whiche common al sacramentes healpes infirmitte lo caluines doctrine remember deathe christe bothe euchariste al holy sacramentes voide superfluous thinge bringeth remembrance deathe christe preachinge purpose serue al sacramentes thus defender maister caluine haue founde shorter waie heauen knowen place seemeth derogate muche necessitie baptisme christen men childrencontra interim vvhere saithe reason god promise issue whiche commeth faitheful paretesthese caluines vvoordes paules filij vestri sancti sunt corin borne holy holy progenie childre suche beinge yet enclosed wombe drawe breathe life neuerthelesse chosen couenaunt life euerlastinge doctrine shal take place defender sette good furtherance shal looke necessarie sacrament baptisme without whiche compted christen man moste blessed confortable sacramente aultar holesome sacrament penancequid coelum ruat absolution reste sacramentes shal nomore esteemed vsed nowe ye esteeme vse masse holy breade holy vvater beinge brought passe shal people easely induced either receiue mahometes religion somme farre god allowe pleasant trade life theothervvise called romaine epicurean moste parte beinge already thereto inclined smal number wel entread returne againe key whiche seme haue force ne vse preachinge first touchinge scorneful scoffer vttered sir defender latine interpreter englishe againste priuate confession minister churche appointed god grace reconciliation imparted penitentes light mockinge sprite deliteth selues muche pitieth amonge sundry effectes whiche christe gaue key apostle successours one power remittemat reteine sinnes himselfe saide vvhose sinnes ye remitte remitted vnto whose sinnes ye reteine reteinedvntruthes tvvo togeather see ansvveare sinnes duely remitted reteined onlesse knowen himiohan hath auctoritie thereto knowledge sinnes specially suche priuie man see harte man confession sinner vvherefore consequently foloweth receiued auctoritie heare confession christen people desirous assolted reconciled vvherefore confessio yea secrete sinnes necessary saluatio byvntruthe hardinges ovvne doctours saie vvas ordeined tradition christe thinstitution christe instituted ende instituted also meanes whiche shoulde necessarie obteininge ende onlesse woulde make christe lawemaker haue failed churche thinges necessarie sinnes either remitted reteined excepte prieste knowe themmat comment mat bolde saye father specially hierome sovntruthe mistakinge abbridginge hieromes vvoordes vnderstoode woordes christe promised key kingedome heauen peter sacerdos pro officio suo cum peccatorum audierit varietates scit qui ligandus sit qui soluendus prieste saithe accordinge office hath hearde diuersities sinnes knoweth bounde loosed right time moses lawe pronounced cleane lepre vewed colour bunch al token disease thus foloweth woordes christe confession al sinnes leaste deadly muste made prieste remitted vvhiche prieste minister sacramente hath auctoritie absolue either ordinarie commission superiour againe proufe confession necessarie wee sate remitte reteine sinnes committed againste god binde loose iudicial actes therefore woordes christe ordeined courtethis consistorie stoode sometime excommunication sometime preachinge consistorie seate iudgemente churche appointed apostle successours iudges maye appeare fantasie owne heades augustine expoundeth woordes iohn reuelation et vidi lede c sawe seates sittinge iudgement geuen vve muste thinke aithe spoken laste iudgement muste vnderstande seates ruler ruler themselues whome nowe churche gouerned iudgement geuen semeth taken whereof saide vvhat thinges yee binde earthe shalbe boude also heauen thinges ye loose earthe shal loosed also heauen sundrie father haue vttered writinges doctrinein mat cap hilarius vpon sixtenth chapter matthewe saithe beatus coeli ianitor c blessed porter heauen whose earthly iudgement saie whiche geuen earthe foreiudged auctoritie heauen thinges boundeli epi de dignit sacerd li loosed earthe haue condition statute also heauen cyprian hath like sayinge epistle cornelius chrysostome saithe christe hath translated al iudgemente whiche receiued father vnto apostle priestes gregorie nazianzene oration emperour prince saithe emperour ouis mea e no habemus tribunalia saieinge perteineth confession authoritie god vvoorde thou arte sheepe haue seates iudgement gregorie pope compareth sacrament penaunce courte iustice cause first examined tried afterwarde iudged donne prieste bernarde sheweth vvho also learned father hugo de victore afraide saie cyprian hilarie chrysostome sentence peter remittinge sinnes goeth sentence heauen ordinance christe requireth al trespass
