schole satan beinge lothe sinnes people whereby holdeth kingdome shoulde remitted christes disciple receiued auctoritie key shoulde heare priuate confession people listen whisperinges vve tel confession al deadly sinnes thevntruthe prooued confession grounded vpon natural reason institution god man concerninge maner confessinge secretely prieste alone moste agreable natural reason secrete sinnes confessed secretely vaine forgerie clement amongest thinges acknowledgeth selfe haue receiued peter one writeth firste epistle translated rufine prieste fortune either enuie infidelitie priuely crepe man harte like euil whiche regardeth soule ashamed confesse thinges office ouer ende woorde god holesome counsel maye healed perfite faithe good woorkes maye escape paine euerlastinge fire come rewardes life endureth euer man speaketh plainely secrete confession vntruthe speaketh onely open confession origen sundry place whiche breuities sake remitte reader ca leuitici homil de principijs lib psal homil vvhere compareth state sinner man hath euil vndigested humour stomake saithe remaininge suche euil matter man feleth selfe sicke vomitinge foorthe eased sinner keepinge sinnes secrete greuousely charged owne conscience standeth daunger choked fleume humour sinnes accuse selfe confesse faultes bothe vomiteth foorthe sinnesal belongeth open confession digesteth cause cyprian many place moste plainely speaketh secrete confession sermone de lapsis although saithe certaine deuoute person entangled greate sinneconfession euil thought yet leaste thought vnto priestes god confesse sorowfully simply make confession conscience laie foorthe burthen minde c augustine treatinge power key many place specially confession psal vvhere speakinge muche necessitie confession saithe thus vvhy fearest thou confessed beinge confessed thou remaine hidden beinge confessed thou shalt damned afterwardes thus ende god requireth confession deliuer humble ende damneth confesseth punishe proude therefore thou sorie thou confessed beinge confessed reioyse thou shalt hole many holy father whome doubte holy ghoste teacher prompter al truthe catholike churche hath benne persuaded recital rehersinge ofvntruthe reade ansvveare al sinnes prieste necessarie saluation onlesse necessitie lacke prieste wise exclude v avntruthes many manifeste shal appeare general confession wise suffiseth true faithe acknowlegeth confession made al sinnes commaunded christe apostle commended v father primitiue churche al learned doctours general vse whole churche expresse terme secrete auricular cofession bevntruthe neuer founde othervvise let shevve seldome metioned auncient father publike confession often time nicene councel sundry place nothinge repugnant doctrine catholike churche b sarisburie al greate shewe authority father doctours hardinge selfe ende dischargeth easily one woorde notwithstandinge al coulde beste diuise saie herein conclusion laste expresse terme secrete auriculare confession seldome mentioned ancient father seldome saithe sometimes vsed although seldome leafte seldome saide neuer trowe tale benne truer reste wee saie wee make confusion key doctrine plaine twoo key churche god one instruction correction whereof one woorketh inwardly outwardly one god congregation yet either standeth wholy woorde god therefore paule saithe2 timoth omnis scriptura diuinitus inspirata vtilis est ad doctrina ad redargutionem ad correctionem ad institutionem c al scripture inspired god profitable teache truthe reprooue falsehedde correcte wicked nourtoure infourme godly former key paule saithe actor beleeue lorde iesus thou shalt safe al thy house saith corinth weapon warfare fleashely mighty god throwe downe holdes castinge downe euery highe thinge builded vp againste knowledge god bringe al vnderstandinge captiue obedience christe doctrine seemeth simple plaine without confusion touchinge caluine great wronge vntruely reporte reuerende father woorthie ornamente churche god euer knowen order churche geneua seene foure thousande people moe receiuinge holy mystery togeather one communion ye coulde without great shame wante modestie thus vntruely haue published worlde caluines doctrine sacramentes christe superfluous certainely leaue al hath otherwise spoken sacramentes general sacramente christes laste supper writeth thus magnum consolationis institution cap ac suauitatis fructum ex hoc sacramento colligere possunt piae animae quod illic testimonium habeant christum sic nobis adunatum esse sic no illi vicissim insertos adeo que vnum corpus cum ipso coaluisse vt quicquid ipsius est nostrum vocare liceat godly mindes maye take greate fruite pleasure comforte sacramente therein haue witnesse christe made one v wee graffed growen bothe one bodie euer wee maie nowe calle saithe supper token remebrance lifte vp healpe infirmitie otherwise mindeful yenough christes deathe healpe superfluous hardinge howe farre maie malice beare man bicause caluine saithe wee weake haue neede warde sacramentes quicken dulnesse sens saithe therefore sacramentes superfluous likewise saide body weake haue neede refreashed meate drinke would ye geather thereof meate drinke superfluous nay contrariewise concludeth wee haue neede sacramentes therefore sacramentes needeful greatter weakenesse neede haue wee sutche remedy woordes emongst many others like sense sic est exigua nostra fides institution cap vt nisi vndique fulciatur atque omnibus modis sustentetur statim concutiatur fluctuet vacillet smal faithe onlesse borne vp euery side al meanes mainteined shaketh wauereth like falle dangerous doctrine telle v ancient catholique father suffered holde maineteine dionysius whome often calle paules scholar writeth thus eclesiast hicrarch cap no imaginibus sensibilibus quantum fieri potest ad diuinas adducimur contemplationes wee mutche maie sensible image sacramentes brought vnto diuine contemplation likewise augustine saithe quaestion vet testamen sacramenta propter carnales visibilia instituta sunt vt ab illis quae oculis cernuntur ad illa quae intelliguntur sacramentorum gradibus transferamur visible sacramentes ordeined carnal menne steppe sacramentes maie leadde thinges wee see eie vnto thinges wee vnderstandecap ian de coena domini chrysost ad pop l antiochen homil saithe cyprian fidei nostrae infirmitas symboli argumento edocta est c weakenesse faithe taught vnderstandinge sacramente c chrysostome si incorporei essemus nuda incorporea nobis haec ipsa daret nunc quia corporibus insertas habemus anima sub visibilibus spiritualia tradit wee bodilesse god woulde geue v thinges bare bodilesse mutche wee haue soules fastened vnto body therefore god geueth v thinges spiritual vnder thinges visiblechrysost matthae homil againe saithe rectis fidelibus scripturae non sunt necessariae dicente apostolo lex iustis non est posita godly faithful scripture necessarie apostle saithe lawe prouided iuste againe oportuerat quidem no nihil indigere auxilio literarum sed tam nudam omnibus vitam exhiberechryso matthae homi vt librorum vice gratia spiritus vteremur behooued v haue neede scripture al thinges shewe liues pure cleane steede bookes wee mighte vse grace holy ghostehieron pro mio lamen hieremiae like manner hierome saithe cum meruerimus esse cum christo simile angelis fuerimus tunc librorum doctrina cessabit wee shal obteine christe shalbe like vnto angel doctrine bookes shal geue place nowe tel v hardinge muste wee hereof conclude doo holy father cyprian augustine hierome chrysostome helde false perillous doctrine wicked temeritie woulde abandonne bothe scripture sacramentes thinges necessarie certainely ful resolution hereof caluine selfe saithe thus iohan caluinus antidoto ad sessionem co cisij tridentini facile patior vt quae christus nobis dedit salutis adiumenta eorum vsus necessarius dicatur quando scilicet datur facultas quanquam semper admonendi sunt fideles non aliam esse cuiusuis sacramenti necessitatem quam instrumentalis causae cui nequaquam alliganda est dei vittus vocem sane illam nemo pius est qui non toto pectore exhorreat sacramenta re esse superfluas wel suffer euer healpes saluation christe hath geuen v vse thereof coumpted necessarie meane maye haue oportunitie time vse thus mutche faitheful muste warned necessitie sacramente none otherwise cause instrumental vnto whiche cause wee maye wise binde power god sacramentes thinges superfluous godly man abide heare charge caluine saieinge child faithful borne holy ye shoulde rather herewith haue charged paule thus saithe1 corinth nunc liberi vestri sancti sunt nowe child holy ye haue remembred hardinge paules woordes caluines meaninge child faitheful notwithstandinge nature child anger yet goddes free election pure holy paules vndoubted doctrine whiche notwithstandinge neuer neither despised sacramentes christe leadde people saie mahomete epicure laste hardinge returne saithe key first beginneth spiteful woordes scorneful scoffes light sprite sir defender whiche saithe learned schoole sathan nowe lieth bound sathans fetter answeare al tche hardinges vanity vaine wise menne wil greatly weigh childishe tragedy saithe prieste holdeth consistorie iudge ouer sinnes people beinge iudge cannot discerne sinnes onlesse knowe neither knowe confession therfore saithe harding vvee tel institution venial confession al deadly sinnes institution god man mary saithe touchinge manner confession secretely priest alone moste agreeable natural reason secrete sinnes confessed secretely beseche thee good christian reader note one thinge waye hardinge contrarie common order hathe brought v institution god without manner woorde god thus saithe wee tel bare tellinge stande proufe verily notwithstandinge christe gaue apostle power bindinge loosing yet appeareth spake one woord secrete confession gratian famouse doctour side doubteth sayede poenit dist quis aliquado de poenit disi conuertimini latentia peccata non probantur necessario sacerdoti confitenda proued priuie sinnes ought necessitie confessed vnto prieste againe datur intelligi quod etiam ore tacente veniam consequi possumus wee geuen vnderstande although wee vtter nothing vvith mouthe yet wee may obteine pardonne absolution sinnes therefore notwithstanding al hardinges tellinge owne doctour gratian telleth auriculare confession goddes institution wherefore speaketh hardinge precisely specially deadly sinnes maie venial sinnes comme likewise rekeninge welconcil trident cap de confessione rob holcot senten qu senten qu artic others deede specially prouided late chapter tridente litle petite sinnes neede vttered confession rob holcote saithe de venialibus confiteri magi est supererogationis quam necessitatis make confession venial sinnes deuotion necessitie thomas aquine saithe quidam probabiliter dicunt quod per ingressum ecclesiae consecratae homo cosequitur remissionem peccatoru venialium somme saie without good reason man maye obteine remission venial sinnes onely entri churche consecrate extra de p niten remiss omnis vtrius que loss pourposely noted glose vpo decretales venialia tolluntur vel per orationem dominica vel per aquam benedictam venial sinnes may remoued either pater noster holy water therefore perhaps hardinge wil saie accordinge iudgemente others owne doctours litle prety venial sinnes ought dewtie rekened maie otherwise remitted haue neede christes bloude shorter waie heauen either christe apostle euer taught v howe al errour seemeth firste haue growen mistakinge woordes bedabeda cap iacobi citatur magistro senten distin coaequalibus quotidiana leuia grauiora vero sacerdoti pandamus let v open smal daily sinnes vnto felowes greate sinnes vnto prieste reste hardinges resolution maie stande withe good fauoure seeing auricular confession holde better diuinitie may seeme holde somme wel saye holdeth wel natural reason hardinge saithe prieste iudge without particulare knowledge euery sinne knowe without hearing heare without confession answeare hereto chrysostome saithe alleged medicinae locus hic est chrysostom de poenit homil non iudicij non poenas sed peccatorum remissionem tribuens deo solo die peccatum tuum place medicine iudgemente rendring punishement remission sinnes open thine offence god onely prieste iudge without knowledge doubtelesse hardinge priestes parte iudges owne peter lombarde saithe4 senten dist posiquam scientiam discernendi omnes sacerdotes non habent al priestes haue knowledge discerne bitwene sinne iudge ouer sinne sinne many vtterly ignorant knowe nothinge notwithstandinge prieste neuer wise wel learned yet howe hable enter breaste man knowe secretes harte s1 cor regum rom augusti confession lib ca paule saithe man knoweth man sprite man within salomon saithe god onely knoweth thoughtes menne paule saithe god onely searcheth harte reines augustine pourposely speakinge hereof saide saithe thus vnde sciunt cum ipso de ipso audiunt verum dicam howe knowe heare speake mee selfe whether saie truthe therefore prieste iudginge cannot knowmuste needes wander vncertainely doubteful iudge neuerthelesse admittinge prieste iudge yet may proued either maye iudge ouer sinnes people without particulare knowledge may comme certaine particulare knowledge therof without manner auriculare confession trust whole mater wil soone answeared firste therefore saye prieste hauinge authoritie pronounce woorde god thereby iudge ouer sinne woorde speaketh power god vnto saluatio rom hebrae nonlatin alphabet twoo edged swerd hable sunder soule sprite marie bone hable iudge paule saith thoughtes cogitation harte thus harding selfe grau teth prieste pronouncinge goddes woorde maye therewithe bothe binde loose case doo office iudge augustine saithe clauis ea dicenda est qua pectorum dura referantur thinge ought called keie august de sanctis homil tertullian de pudicitia actor wherewith hardnesse harte opened saithe tertullian ipse clauem imbuit vides quam viri israelitae auribus mandate quae dico iesum nazarenum virum deo nobis destinatum endewed keie knowe keie keie meane ye menne israel make saie iesus nazareth man appointed vnto god saith augustine loquimur auribus vestris vnde scimus quid agatur cordibus vestris quod autem intus agitur nobis sed ab illo agitur prospexit ergo deus vt soluat filios mortificatorum wee speake earesaugustin psalm howe knowe wee wrought harte euer wrought within wrought v god god therefore hathe looked foorthe loose child appointed death thus prieste iudge bindethe loosethe withoute hearinge priuate confession side say open crime publike penance priest like wise appointed iudge notwithstandinge primitiue churche either whole people elder congregation authoritie herein yet direction iudgemente rested euermore prieste sense s2 tim paule saithe vnto timothee receiue accusation againste elder onlesse vnder twoo three witness notwithstandinge order greatest parte thereof nowe vtterly vse yet truste shal neither impertinente mater vnpleasante vnto reader consider ye vsed olde time therefore learnedly noted beatus rhenanus sinner beganne mislike selfe penitente wicked life offended god churche came firste vnto bishop priestes vnto mouthes churche opened vnto whole burthen harte afterwarde brought congregation made confession openly brother appointed make satisfaction open penance whiche penance dewly humbly donne restored againe openly vnto churche laieinge handes priestes elder hereof paule saithe vnto corinthian cor haue forgeeuen thinge man haue likewise foregeeuen mee selfe euer haue foregeeuen haue foregeeuen sake personne christe limitation penance leste thing passe vnaduisedly order prieste appointed iudge basili quae nonlatin alphabet augu enchirid ad laurentium cap basile saith modus conuersionis debet esse conueniens illi qui peccauit order conuersion open penance must agreeable vnto hathe offended therefore augustine saithe quia plaerun que c mutche moste parte griefe one mannes harte vnknowen vnto neither commeth foorthe knowledge others either woordes token beinge vnto saide mourninge hidde thee therefore wel haue ouersight churche certaine time penance appointed congregation maye satisfied againe saithe hortor prius publica poenitentia satisfacere augusti de ecclesiast dogmatib cap cassiodor lib cap ita sacerdotis iudicio reconciliatum communioni sociari counsel firste make satisfaction open penance reconciled maie afterwarde restored vnto communion iudgement discretion prieste likewise saithe cassiodorus rei expectant communionis tempus quod decreuit episcopus peintente party waite communion time appointed vnto bishop ambrose demaunded emperoure theodosius beinge excommunicate quibus medicamentis incurabilia vulnera tua cassiodor lib cap plagas que curasti medicine haue healed woundes cuttes incurable emperoure answeared tuum opus est docere medicamenta temperare meum vero oblata sucipere parte instructe minister medicine parte receiue minister4 senten dist non autem therefore peter lombarde saithe etsi aliquis apud deum sit solutus non tamen facie ecclesiae solutus habetur nisi per iudicium sacerdotis although man assoiled god yet accoumpted assoiled face sight churche iudgement prieste theise hardinge doubte ye maie see priest maie iudge ouer sinne notwithstandinge neither heare priuate confession haue particulare knowledge euery seueral sinne confession holy father haue often spoken made secretely corner publiquely openly sight congregationorigen psalm hereof origen saithe reported si quis sibi sit conscius procedat medium ipse sui accusator existat man finde selfe guilty let comme foorth middes churche let owne accuser likewise tertullian saithetertullian de poenitentia aduolui presbyteris aris dei adgeniculari omnibus fratribus legationes deprecationis suae iniugere false priestes kneele aultar communion table desire al brother praie touchinge hierome hardinge ye laie woordes faithefully ananias sometime laide monie apostle feete ye serue v parcel holde backe reste true hierome saithe priestes parte discerne diuersitie bitweene sinne sinne case excommunication publique offence wherefore could ye espie rather woulde closely dissemble many plaine woordes goeinge immediately thus hierome writeth power keiesheronym matthae cap vse confession istum locum episcopi presbyteri non intelligentes aliquid sibi de pharisaeorum assumunt supercilio vt vel damnent innocentes vel soluere se noxios arbitrentur cum apud deum non sententia sacerdotum sed reorum vita quaeratur place bishoppes priestes vnderstandinge take vnto somme parte proude looke phariseis thinkinge selues hable either condemne innocente absolue guiltie vvhereas deede absolution prieste life sinner vveighed god woordes hardinge woulde thus haue benne dissembled ye meante simple dealinge hierome saithe plainely bishoppes priestes vnderstande vse key ye haue taken vpon somme parte proude lookes phariseis absolution prieste life partie accepted god ende concludeth thus alligat vel soluit episcopus vel presbyter non eos qui insontes sunt vel noxij sed pro officio suo cum peccatorum audierit varietates scit qui ligandus sit qui soluendus bishop prieste neither bindeth innocente loosethe guiltie accordinge office hathe heard diuersitie sinnes publique offence knoweth ought bounde ought loosed senten dist nec ideo like sorte writeth peter lombarde dominus tribuit sacerdotibus potestatem ligandi soluendi id est ostendendi hominibus ligatos vel solutos god hath geuen priestes power binde loose saie declare vnto menne penitentes either bounde loosed al notwithstandinge al hardinge hable proue father sommewhere made mention confession secrete yet greately either pourpose hinder abuse errours remoued specially prieste beinge learned wee haue saide wee mislike manner confession whether priuate publike wee thinke vnlawful make open confession many wee thinke vnlawful abuse alwaies excepted make like confession priuate either fewe one alone holy father vpon good consideration forced remoue vse open confession euen wee saye vpon like good consideration priuate confession also maye remoued onely wee saie christe sente disciple worlde gaue authoritie binde loose made manner mention sutche hearinge confession onely bade goe preache gospel hilarie bernarde huge ye haue alleged seeme saye iudgemente man goethe iudgemente god like rather vehemente speaches ye might haue founde chrysostomechrysost esai homil coelum accipit authoritatem ludicandi terra index seder terris dominus sequitur seruum heauen taketh authoritie iudgemente earthe earthe sitteth iudge lorde followeth seruante sutche like extraordinarie speaches good construction maie comfortable afflicted minde one saide sommetime muste receiued graine salte otherwise selues vnsauerie hierome saithe haue alleged beforehierony matthae cap quaest tunc vera apud deum non sententia sacerdotis sed reorum vita quaeritur sentence absolution prieste life penitente accepted god againe tunc vera est sententia praesidentis quando aeterni sequitur sententiam iudicis iudgemente presidente prieste true goeth folowethe iudgement euerlastinge iudge gratian selfe saithede poenit dist conuertimini non sacerdotali iudicio sed largitate diuinae gratiae peccator emundatur sinner made cleane iudgemente prieste abundance heauenly grace nazianzene alleged saide vnto emperour ouis nostra e thou arte oure sheepe confession commaunded marueile meante emperoure one flocke folde christe ambrose saide sometime vnto emperoure valentinian quid honorificentius quam vt ecclesiae filius dicatur imperator imperator enim bonus intra ecclesiam ambros ad valetinian epist chrysostom de verbis esaiae homil non supra ecclesiam est thinge honourable emperour called childe churche good mperour within churche aboue churche chrysostome saithe deus ipse subiecit caput principis manui sacerdotis god selfe hathe set heade prince vnder hande prieste touchinge faithe obedience gospel highest prince subiecte al proueth wel authoritie dignitie goddes woorde maketh nothinge confession conclude hardinge saithe hath benne persuaded recitinge rehearsal al sinnes prieste necessarie saluatio general confession wise sufficient againe saithe true faithe acknowledgeth confession made al sinnes commaunded christe apostle commended vnto v father primitiue churche al learned doctours general vse whole churche good reader thou wouldest thinke emongest many greate woordes somme truthe hardinge modestie credites sake would speake boldly without somme ground beseche thee consider fewe thereby iudge indifferently reste chrysostome saithe chrysostom psal homil chrysostom homil de poeniten confessione beat rhenan argum libelli tertull de poenitentia non dico vt confitearis conseruo tuo peccata tua dicito deo qui curet ea wil thee confesse thy sinnes vnto prieste thy felowe seruante confesse vnto god maie heale againe cogitatione tua fiat delictorum exquisitio sine teste sit hoc iudicium solus deus te consitentem videat examine thy sinnes thy harte within thee let iudgemente vvithout vvitnesse let god onely see thee makinge thy confession beatus rhenanus man greate readinge singulare iudgemente hereof writeth thus tertullianus de clancularia ista confessione admissorum nihil loquitur neque eam vsquam olim praeceptam legimus tertullian priuie confession sinnes saithe nothinge neither doo wee reade kinde priuie confession olde time vvas euer commaunded hardinge saith vvas commaunded rhenanus saith vvas commaunded rhenanus woordes true deede hardinges woordes vntrue likewise noted glose vpon hardinges owne decree de poenit dist petrus gloss forte tunc tempore ambrosij non erat facta institutio confessionis quae modo est perhaps time ambrose whiche foure hudred yeres christe manner confession vsed appointed de poenit disc conuertimini gratian saith antequam sacerdoti os nostra ostendamus id est peccata nostra confiteamur lepra peccati mundamur wee open mouthe vnto prieste saie vvee make confession sinnes leprosie sinne made cleane de poenit dist quidam theodorus saithe quidam deo solummodo confiteri debere peccata dicunt vt graeci somme saie wee ought confesse sinnes onely vnto god doo grecian peter lombarde chiefe founder hardinges diuinitie senten dist quid ergo saithe thus sane dici potest quod sine confessione oris solutione poenae exterioris peccata delentur per contritionem humilitatem cordis wee maie safely saye vvithout confession mouthe absolution warde paine sinnes foregeeuen contrition humilitie harte briefely gratian hauinge thorowly debated mater bothe side saie bothe confession againste confession ende concludeth thus saide de poenit dist quamuis cui harum sententiarum potius adhaerendum sit lectoris iudicio reseruatur vtra que enim sententia fautores habet sapientes religiosos viros whether saieinges beste folowe leafte iudgemente reader either saieinge mainteined fauoured vvise godly menne whereas hardinge saithe confession al sinnes commaunded christe apostle owne glose vpon owne decree openly reproueth erroure de poenit dist poenitentia gloss teacheth contrarie woordes melius dicitur confessionem institutam fuisse quadam vniuersalis ecclesiae traditione potius quam ex noui vel veteris testamenti authoritate better saide confession appointed somme tradition vniuersal churche authoritie comm undemente newe olde testamente nowe good christian reader beseche thee examine alitle truthe hardinges tale firste saithe recitinge rehearsal al sinnes prieste necessarie saluation chrysostome answeareth let god onely heare thy confession one vntruthe hardinge saithe general confession sufficiente peter lombarde answeareth sine confessione oris c vvithout confession made mouthe sinnes maie foregeeuen twoo vntruthes hardinge saith3 confession al sinnes commaunded christe apostle owne glose saithe onely tradition churche commaunded neither olde testamente newe three vntruthes4 hardinge saithe commended vnto v doctours father primitiue churche rhenanus saithe wee reade kinde priuie confession olde time vvas euer commaunded owne glose saithe time ambrose whiche foure hundred yeeres christe perhaps vsed foure fiue vntruthes m6 harding saithe hathe euer ben allovved al learned doctours owne gratian answeareth contrarie hath benne mainteined fauoured bothe bi vvise godly father sixe vntruthes shorte hardinge saithe hathe benne commended vnto v general vse vvhole churche theodorus answeareth vvhole churche grecia vseth seuen apparente greate vntruthes disclosed hardinges owne doctours coulde haue comprised mutche vntruthe narrowe roome without somme studie erasmus man greate iudgemente saithe thus erasm schol epitaphium fabiolae apparet tempore hieronymi nondum institutam fuisse secretam admissorum confessionem quam posted ecclesia salubriter instituit si modo recte vtantur ea sacerdotes laici verum hoc labuntur theologi quidam parum attenti quod quae veteres scribunt de hurusmodi publica generali confessione ea trahunt ad hanc occultam longe diuersi generis appeareth time hierome whiche foure hundred yeeres christe secrete confession sinnes vvas yet ordeyned whiche notwithstandinge afterwarde wholesomely profitably appointed churche wel vsed wel priestes people herein certaine diuines consideringe aduisedly saie mutche deceiued euer auncient father write general open confession wreaste drawe priuie secrete kinde whiche far sorte hardinge erasmus telleth yee fowly deceiued sheweth also cause erroure saithe ye consider aduisedly ye either reade write euer ye heare worde confession ye imagine streight waie muste needes owne auriculare confession none laste al ye graunte expresse terme auriculare secrete confession seldome mentioned aunciente father hardinge wanteth somme parte simplicitie ye would haue reader beleeue youauthoritie povver ye shoulde haue alleged certaine auncient father one leaste ye coulde haue founde many time vsed expresse terme auriculare secrete confession otherwise benne better plainer waie haue confessed expressely expresse terme neuer vsed one al ancient father howe auriculare secrete confession benne vsed coulde neuer longe haue lackte name apologie cap diuision wee saie prieste deede iudge case yet hath manner right chalenge authoritie power saithe ambrose hardinge vvhereas ye make preachinge gospel key howe cal ye prieste iudge case preache ye neuer mutche conscience man beinge secrete thinge howe ye iudge wardly throughly repenteth repenteth though one repente sory haue remorse former life though looke vnto light gospel ye say beleue christe howe ye iudge sutche personeand doo ye knovv harte tootinge eare ye knowe harte lokinge face prieste dewly vsinge keie knowledge discretion doth office iudge seethe cause either looseth bindeth touchinge priestes authoritie power chalenge hath rightde poenit dist c verbu dei interpreter maketh speake impute ambrose denie ambrose saieth vntruthe vvord nullius potestatis iura exercet euen maye gather woordes meaneth prieste exerciseth right owne proper power remittinge sinnes place alleaged saith contrary doctrine right loosinge bindinge saieth graunted priestes onely therefore churche chalengeth rightly whiche hath true priestes lo vseth woorde chalenge againe place auoucheth whiche receiueth holy ghoste priestes receiue consecrated sacrament order receiue also power loose binde sinnes prouse thereof alleageth scriptureiohan take ye holy ghoste whole sinnes ye remitte remitted whose sinnes ye reteine reteined defender accustomed make humble confessio assoiled heare ghostly father saie certaine woordes auctoritate mihi commissa ego te absoluo c b sarisburie sense prieste without hearinge confession maie iudge wee haue sufficiently saide neither knowe fansie hardinge haue often rehearsal one thinge woordes coloure commission hardinge furnishe authoritie forceth greately verily without somme shew countenance credite would holde deede hugo bernarde saie iudgemente god foloweth iudgemente man pope iulius saitheconcil tom de primatis rom ecclesiae habet sacrosancta romana ecclesia potestatem singulari sibi priuilegio concessam aperire claudere ianuas regni coelestis quibus voluerit holy churche rome hath power grounted vnto singul priuilege open shutte gate kingedome heauen vvhom listeth cardinal cusanus saithenicol cusanus de aut eccle supra contra scripturam haee ligandi oluendi potestas non minor est ecclesia quam christo power bindinge loosing lesse churche christe greate wisedome geue ouer mutche credite vnto often haue deceiued v theire authoritie greate make let shewe woordes theire commission saieing ambrose cleare plaine verbum dei dimittit peccata sacerdos est iudexde poenit dis verbum dei sacerdos quide officium suum exhibet sed nullius potestatis iura exercet woorde god foregeeueth sinnes prieste judge prieste executeth office exerciseth right povver ende place allegeth woordes prophete esai spoken person god ego sumambros de noe arca ca esaiae augu de scalis paradisi ego sum qui deleo iniquitates tuas put waie thine iniquity laie weight ambrose woordes augustine saithe like sense officium baptizandi dominus concessit multis potestatem vero authoritatem baptismo remittendi peccata sibi solo reseruauit lorde hath graunted office baptizinge vnto many power authoritie baptisme foregeeue sinnes hath reserued onely selfeambros de poeviten li ca saithe ambrose nostrum est onera remittere illius est resuscitare illius est educere de sepulchro parte remoue stone graue preachinge counsel exhortation lordes woorke raise vp deade lordes woorke bring pitteambros lib epist likewise againe saithe neque legatus neque nuntius sed ipse dominus saluum fecit populum suum solus remanet quia non potest hoc cuiquam hominum cum christo esse commune vt peccata condonet solius hoc munus est christi qui tulit peccata mundi embassadoure messenger lorde selfe hath saued people lorde remaineth alone noman partener vvith god foregeeuinge sinnes christes onely office hath taken awaie sinnes world yet priestes office voide power hath power commission open wil god2 corin tertull de baptismo augustinus paule saith speake vnto people euen person christe tertullian saithe dandi baptismi ius habet summus sacerdos id est episcopus chiefe prieste yt saie bishop hath right power geeue baptisme augustine saithe ministerium dedit seruis potestatem sibi retinuit god gone ministerie remission sinnes vnto seru untes luk nonlatin alphabet povver thereof reteined selfe christe sent disciple preache gospel gaue authoritie power hardinge wil saie power authoritie reading publishinge goddes woorde owne doctour hosius wil telle bishop ordereth reader euen manner churche rome saithe vnto himhosius confessione petricouien cap habe potestatem legendi epistolas ecclesia sanctum dei tam pro viuis quam pro defunctis haue thou power reade epistle holy churche god wel quicke deade deede special power sutche trowe christe apostle neuer taught v neither woulde haue noted place sauing hosius profoundest proctour side thought mater woorthe notinge sutche power therefore belongeth priestes minister churche god power geuinge remission sinne belongeth god alone none otherhieronym matthae cap man wil presume hierome saithe alleged hath put proude looke phariseis saithe sutche priestes bishoppes vnderstande woordes christe saithe iudgemente absolution prieste life penitente regarded god therefore augustine saith inde nata sunt schismata august de fide operibus cap cum homines dicunt no sanctificamus immundos no iustificamus impios no petimus no impetramus hereof grow schismes diuisions churche menne saie wee sanctifie vncleane wee justifie wicked wee desire wee obteine howe commeth richardus de sancto victore god wate ful colde distinction thus saithe christus potuit dimittere peccara no vero non possumus dimittere peccata sed tantum remittere peter lombarde saithe mutche better richa de sacte victore de potesta ligan soluen par cap christus sacerdotibus tribuit potestatem ligandi soluendi id est ostendendi hominibus ligatos vel solutos christe hath geuen power vnto priestes binde loose saie declare vnto menne whoe bounde whoe loose sa saithe bonauentura priestes vnder lawe ma senten dist nec ideo bonauen sen dist prooemio qu dictu est de ioenit dist verbum dei mundare dicebantur quia mundatum ostendebant saide cleanse leprosie bicouse shewed cleansed saith augustine nec voluntas sacerdotis obesse vel prodesse potest sed meritum benedictionem poscentis vvil prieste neither hinder merite desueth absolutio thus therfore ambrose meaneth prieste iudge discerne bitweene sinne sinne wel priuate publique right power authoritie foregeeue fianes hath none apologie cap diuision therefore saueour iesus christe reproue negligence scribe phariseis teachinge woordes rebuke saieing woe vnto scribe phariseis whiche haue taken away keyes knowledge haue shutte vp kingedome heauen menne seeinge keie whereby way entrie kingdome god opened vnto v woorde gospel expoundinge lawe scripture wee saie plainely woorde keie hardinge wee induced grauntethe knovvledge scripture keie knowledge scripture keie whereby gate truthe opened vse whereof consisieth expoundinge lawe prophetes shewe christe wee say special key whiche christe gaue church one keie alone christe calleth rebuked scribe phariseis though haue put otherwise gospel hath plural number keie common lawe gospel key whiche speake another thinge name ley vnderstande whole spiritual power whiche christe firste promised peter afterwarde gaue apostle transferred al bishoppes priestes whiche power priestes teache gospel consecrate body bloude christe minister sacramentes auctoritie vvoorde absolue penitetes excommunicate publike hainous sinner keie confusely speake naminge vvoorde gospel expoundinge lawe scripture one parte perteininge spiritual power whole power vvoorde saie scripture taught gospel preached keie saie ye exercise keie saie yet ther spiritual power witte ther key ye say simple priestevntruth keie knovveledge vvithout knowledge though haue greate learninge yet hath key though might better worthely vse hauinge learninge knowledge b sarisburie hardinge mutche often complaineth confusion key wee appointe distinctly eche keie seueral office marke therefore beseche thee gentle reader hewe distinctly plainely hardinge selfe intreateth firsteconfusion key twoo key christe hath deliuered v gospel hathe made greate many key keie knowledge keie order keie power keie discretion keie sacramentes mutche sacramentes doctrine seuen number muste also sorte seuen seueral key yet ouer bisides al key beeing many pope hath also one special maister keie afterward sleight nimblenesse finger conueigheth al heape key twoo onely key whereof one calleth keie knowledge keie power whiche twoo key notwithstandinge ende suddainely consumed one onely keie keie knowledge lost hardinges iudgement power onely remaineth without knowledge keie alone dischargeth al office vtterly al al keie power without knowledge muste needes keie ignorance selues haue vsed cal clauis errans keie errour whiche keie vndoubtedly christe saide sommetimeluk senten dist postquam alexand de hale par qu hoc est tempus vestrum potestas tenebrarum time power darkenesse peter lombarde selfe saithe many priestes ignorante haue keie knowledge alexander hale saithe scientia non est clauis knowledge keie al yet hardinge answeareth v simple ignorant prieste knoweth nothinge hath onely one keie key calleth plural number saie wel keie knowledge keie power thus haue forged keie knowledge without knowledge keie expounde open scripture minister sacramentes binde loose breake vp way kingedome heauen yet muste wee beleue speake simply plainely key without confusion apologie cap diuision seeinge one manner woorde geuen al one onely keie belongeth al wee say one onely power al minister concerning openinge shuttinge touchinge bishop rome al flatteringe parasite singe woordes eares thee wil geue key kingedome heauen though key fitte alone body el excepte goe woorke mennes conscience maie made pliaunte subdued woorde god wee denie doth either open shutte hath key al although taught instructed people woulde god might truely doo perswade selfe leaste peece dewtie yet wee thinke keie neuer white better greater force mennes hath seuered reste hath taught conningely open better absolue bretherne hardinge grounde beinge false ye buylde thereon faileth whole power key pardy howe often time muste tell one thinge standeth preachinge onely sundry excellent ministeries also wee haue proued bishop rome preache doth neis open shut preachinge wee graunte yet men conscience beinge made plaint subdued vvoorde god otherspreache deputie preache appointement maie vertue key either open shut loose binde discretion seeth cause whereas christe saide peter therefore bishop rome peter successour thee wil geue key kingdome heauenmatthae wil ye call flatteringe parisites yelde whiche christe gaue sutche vomite sheweth humour stomake charged withal denyinge b rome al spite ye beare towarde ye must acknowledge bishop haue key al onlesse preache personne ye declare greate ignorance fowle temeritie know ye power annexed order vocation taken away one exercisinge owne person b sarisburie effecte hereof besides ordinarie idle talke standeth twoo pointes firste harding saithe pope though doo nothing selfe owne personne yet maye sufficiently feede flocke christe binde loose discharge al dewties deputy vnderuicars saye cardinalles bishoppes whiche careful zelous office tender theire charge mutch ground trow false therefore euer harding shal builde thereon neuer faile notwithstanding doo remember either christe apostle euer vsed doo like one saide sommetimetitus liuius decade lib impudens est imperator qui cum alienis oculis omnia ei agenda sint postulat sibi aliorum caput fortuna comitti shamelesse captaine whereas must guide al thinges eies others wil require mennes liues ad goodes committed handes pope damasus saithe damasus papa epistola illi episcopi qui talia sibi praesumunt videntur mihi simile esse meretricibus quae starim vt pariunt infantes suos al nutricibus tradunt educandos vt suam citius libidinem explere valeant sic isti infantes suos id est populos sibi commissos alijs educan do tradunt vt ipsi suas libidines expleant id est vt pro suo libitu saecularibus curis inhient quod cuique visum fuerit liberitis agant sutche bishoppes takinge sutche mater vpon selues seeme like vnto h rsottes whiche soone deliuered streight waie deliuer theire child vnto n urces maie rather folow pleasure euen bishoppes diliuer ouer theire child saie people committed theire charge reared brought vp others maie better accomplishe theire pleasure saie maie geeue selues ouer worldly care doo euer shal like beste saith harding christ said vnto peter thee wil geeue key feede sheepe confirme thy brother ergo pope lorde paramounte hathe power pierclesse ouer al world peter palus hereof writeth thus christus dixit apostolispetrus de palude de potestate collata apostolis arti quaecunque ligaueritis terra erunt ligata coelo non dixit coelis sicut petro dixerat sed coelo vno vnde non sunt tantae perfectionis sicut petrus christe saide vnto apostle euer ye shal binde earthe shalbe bounde heauen saide shalbe bounde heauens saide peter one heauen therefore apostle sutche perfection peter againe saithe petr de palude illa verba quaecunque ligaueris intelliguntur de vtro que foro de vtra que potestate illa autem verba quorumcun que ligaueritis intelliguntur anum de foro conscientiae woordes spoken vnto peter vvhat euer thou shalt binde vnderstoode bothe courtes wel courte judgemente courte conscience woordes spoken vnto apostle vvhat euer shal binde c vnderstoode onely courte conscience fantasie equal povver seemeth learned woordes origen non modica differentia estorizen mattha tractatu quod petro quidem datae sunt claues non vnius coeli sed multorum caelorum vt quaecuque gauerit super tertam sint ligata non tantum vno caelo sed euam omnibus coelis ad alios dicit vt soluant ligent non coelis sicut petrus sed vno caelo quia sunt tanta perfectione sicut petrus vt liget soluat omnibus coelis difference greate vnto peter geeuen key one heauen many heauens euer bindeth earth shalbe bound onely one heauen also al heauens vnto reste geeueth power binde loose heauens peter doo one heauen sutche perfection peter binde loose al heauens multiplication heauens haue saide fantasie yet hardinges pourpose maketh nothing origen woorde peter meante peter apostle godly learned prieste bishop expresseth vnder name peter foloweth immediately ergo quanto melior fuerit qui soluit tanto beatior erit qui soluitur quoniam omnibus solutus est coelis therefore better man looseth moore blessed loosed origen matthae tracta loosed al heauens againe saithe quod si no idem loquimur quod petrus locutus est efficimur petrus et nobis dicetur tu e petrus petra enim est quisquis est discipulus christi wee speake peter spake wee made peter vnto v shalbe saide thou arte peter rocke disciple christe againe saithe eodem tractatu hoc dictum tibi dabo claues regni coelorum coeteris quoque commune est et quae sequuntur velut ad petrum dictum sunt omnium communia saieinge thee wil geue key kingdome heauen common reste apostle woordes folow spoken vnto peter common vnto al saith augustine augu iohan tracta basili vtia solitaria ca petrus quando accepit claues ecclesiam sanctum significauit peter receiued key signified holy churche saithe basile petre inquit amas pasce oues meas et consequenter omnibus pastoribus doctoribus eandem potestatem tribuit cuius signum est quod omnes ex aequo ligant absoluunt quemadmodum ille christe saide vnto peter ouest thou feede sheepe like sorte vnto al pastours doctours gaue povver toke wherof al others binde loose equally vvel likewise saithe ambrose ambros de dign ta sacerdotali cap dominus dixit petro pasce oues meas quas oues quem gregem non solum tune beatus petrus suscepit sed nobiscum ea suscepit cum illo ca no suscepimus omnes lorde saide vnto peter feede sheepe whiche sheepe flocke onely blessed peter receiued receiued sa ne togeather vvith v al wee haue receiued togeather vvith likewise cyprian cyprian de sim peicetrate praetatorum beda homil uangel que ine dicunt christus eandem dedit apostolis omnibus potestatem christe gaue vnto al apostle like equal power likewise saithe beda potestas ligandi soluedi quamuis solo petro domino data videatur tamen absque vlla dubietate noscendum est quod coeteris apostolis data est power bindinge loosinge notwithstanding seeme geeuen onely vnto peter yet without al doubte wee muste vnderstande geeuen also reste apostle briefly hardinges owne scholastical doctours confesse power apostle one equal saye whole multitude churche committed onely vnto peter likewise therein onely standeth al differenceheruaeus de potestate papae cap heruaeus saithe quamuis apostoli eandem habuerint christo aequalem potestatem clauium iurisdictionis tamen iurisdictionem equal povver siue materiam subiectam non habuit nisi petrus cui eam petrus committere voluit notwithstandinge apostle receiued christe equal povver key iurisdiction yet iurisdiction mater wherein vse power none onely peter whome euer peter woulde commit thus imagineth al apostle sauinge onely peter key geuen house open iurisdiction people gouerne verily alphonsus de castro saithe alphonsus aduersus haeres li de absolutione quando absoluit simplex sacerdos tantum absoluit de culpa sicut papa vvhen simple prieste absolueth absolueth mutche touchinge sinne doothe pope touchinge pope howe greate euer fansie keie aboue al others neuer vse either knowe vtter woorde god wee saie wel maie shut vp kingedome god menneorigen matthae tracta open cannot origen saithe qui funibus peccatorum suorum constringitur frustra vel ligar vel soluit bounde bandes owne sinnes bindeth looseth vaine conclude augustine saithe augustin de agone christiano ca august de agone christiano ca cum petro dicitur omnibus dicitur amas pasce oues meas woordes christe louest thou mee feede sheepe spoken vnto peter spoken vnto al priestes minister addeth traque miseri dum petro petram non intelligunt nolunt credere data ecclesiae claues regni coelorum ipsi ea de manibus amiserunt therefore wretched menne peter vnderstande christe rocke wil beleeue key kingedome heauen geuen vnto peter alone vnto churche haue quite loste key handes apologie cap diuision wee saie matrimonie holy honorable al sortes state personnes patriarch prophetes apostle holy martyr minister churche bishoppes honest lawful thinge chrysostome saithe man liuinge matrimonie take vpon therewith dignitie bishop hardinge matrimonie holy honorable al personshebre vndefiled bedde saithe paule yet lauful marievntruthes tvvo togeather better appeareth ansvveare whiche either haue deliberate vowe dedicated al maner chastitie vnto godvntruthes tvvo togeather better appearcth ansvveare haue receiued holy order vowed forbidden mariage expresse vvoorde god haue taken holy order tradition apostle auncient ordinaunce churche touchinge firstepsal scripture plaine vowe performed vouete reddite domino deo vestro vowe ye paye render ye vowe lorde god christe also saithe gospelmatth eunuch haue made selues eunuch kingedome heauens sake take let take againe paule speakinge younge vvidowes whiche haue vowed promised chastitie saithe waxe wanton christe wil mariethe first faith hierome expoundeth faithe baptisme see ansvveare hauinge danmation haue broken firste faithe vvhether scripture perteine hereto thus vnderstanded referre v primitiue churche al holy father sutche mariages rather slidinges falles holier chastitie vowed god augustine doubteth woorse aduoutries cyprian calleth case plaine inceste basile accompteth mariages vailed virgin voide force sacrilegious hath despoused selfe lorde saithe basile free husbande deade shee maye marie whome liste while immortal husbande liueth shee shal called aduoutresse whiche lustes fleashe hath brought mortal man lordes chamber touchinge secondeclerkes bounde continecie lib c paphoutius li ca apostle forbidde come single cleregie marie excepte suche remaine inferiour order procede greater finde canon paphnutius socrates sozomenus recorde ecclesiastical storie saide nicene councel olde tradition churche suche come degree order priesthood single marie wiues holy bishop paphnutius whome euangelicall vowebreakers pretende proctour theire vnlauful mariages reade liste epistle siricius ad himerium tarraconensem cap pope siricius shamefully abeseth vvoordes paule condemneth al marriage seconde epistle innocentius victricius bishop roen cap thirde episitle exuperius b tolouse cap weighi ge wel place shal perceiue holy pope forbad minister churche vse vvedlocke reason whiche priestes moses lawe forebidden come within owne house time course came serue holy ministeries1 corin reason also whiche paule requireth maried folke time forbeare vse wiues might attende prayinge place chrysostomeansvvere chrysostomes place cap ad timo homil alleaged defender wel considered disproueth parte catholike doctrine behalfe condemneth bothe doctrine common practise companion newe fleashly gospeller woordes vpon saieinge paule bishop ought without crime husbande one wife apostle saithe stoppeth mouthes heretikes whiche condemne mariage winge vncleane thinge reuerend man maye ascende holy throne seate meaneth state bishop herewith chastiseth restraineth vnchaste person permittinge haue twise maried attaine suche roumetvvise married maye bishopes vvhy whereas kepeth beneuolence towarde wifevntruthe hardinge fovvly mistaketh chrysostomes meaninge deceased good gouernour yea greeuous accusation shal subiecte vnto daielie ye al knowe righte wel albeit lawes seconde mariages permitted yet mater lieth open many accusation therefore would bishop geue occasion euil vnder putteth begamievntruthe standigne false exposition witte maryinge firste vvidowe lauful rather commendable see impure bigamie holy gospeller condemned bothe chrysostome paule whome many beinge priestes saye bishop least presuminge occupie holy seate custodie chastitie former olde yoke fellowes decease solace selues newe strompetesstropetes better name would cal wishe shoulde offende woman euer coupleth selfe suche damnable yokinge appeare either honest haue care soule healthe simple deceiued importunitie crafte lurdens borne withal yet thinke pitied defender presse v chrysostome answeare though chrysostome graunte maried man maie ascende holy seate yet saithe man maye descende holy seate bride beddeafter holy order receiued mariage neuer coumpted lavvful amonge catholikes priest maried englande time anselmus wee denie vtterly man hath receiued holy order maie marievntruthe vvas vndoubtedly coumpted lavvful neither shewed mariage suche euer accompted lawful catholike churche deede knowe germanie englande certaine prouinces dissolute time discipline churche shaken priestes haue benne maried reade time whiche anselinus bishop cantorbury disorder alwaies bythat allovvinge concubine due correction bishoppes punished readressed b sarisburie graunte hardinge like finde good aduantage hauinge vndoubtedly greate number holy father side single life eies politique wise menne many cause seemeth woorthie fauoure good christian reader thou maiste better hable see iudge vprightly indifferently father haue dealte herein either auancinge virginitiemarriage condemned el disgracinge lawful matrimonie maie please thee consider fourme manner saieinges deede origen saithe origen epist ad roman cap lib hierony malachi ca vos autem recessistis potest aliquis de castitate plus sapere quam oporteat sapere man maie thinke chastitie conuenient likewise saithe hierome declinare ad dextram est abstinere cibis quos deus creauit condemnare matrimonium incurrere illud quod dictum est noli iustus esse nimium turne righte hande absteine meates whiche god hath made condemne matrimonie false daunger woordes written wiseman neuer ouer iuste firste therefore tertullian disproufe matrimonie saithe thus eccle tertull exhorta ad castitatem eodem loco ecquid tibi videtur stupri affine esse matrimonium quonia illo deprehendo quae stupro competunt doest thou thinke matrimonie like vnto fornication certainely finde thiinges one finde farther saithe ergo inquies iam prima id est vnas nuptias destruis nec immerito quoniam ipsae ex eo constant quod est stuprum thou wilte saie thou condemnest also firste marriage yea verily without cause bothe matrimonie fornication consiste bothe one thinge chrysostome saithe haec ipsa coniunctio maritalis malum est ante deumchrysost matthae homi non dico peccatum sed malum copulation matrimonie euil thinge god saie sinne saie euil thinge yet immediately saithe si maritis adulteris vna est libido quomodo potest fieri vt vna eadem que re pro dimidia parte sit iustitia pro dimidia autem sit peccatum aut enim tota est iustitia aut rota est peccatum quia re vna est married man aduouterer haue one kinde pleasme one selfe thinge one halfe shoulde righteousnesse halfe shoulde sinne either al sinne al righteousnesse thinge selfe one hierome saithe hieronym aduer iouinian lib ibidem si bonum est mulierem non tangere malum est ergo tangere nihil enim bono contrarium est nisi malum good man touche wife euil touche vvife nothinge contrarie good euil againe saithe quam diu impleo mariti officium non impleo christiani longe doo duetie husbande doo duetie christian man againe non negamus vidua non negamus maritatas sanctas mulieres inueniri sed quae vxores esse desierinthieronym contra heluidium quae ipsa necessitate coniugij virginum imitentur castitatem wee denie widowes married wemen maie holy sutche haue leafte foresaken vviues dueties necessitie matrimonie doo countrefeite chastitie maiden like accoumpte wee maie make sundrie others fewe maye suffice presente nowe thouchinge marriage widower widowes greate many ancient father seeme expressely vtterly condemne athenagoras saithe athenagoras apologia pro christianis hieronym ad ceron iam hieronym contra iouinian lib eod libr secundae nuptiae decorum quoddam sunt adulterium seconde marriage widower widowes faire kinde aduouterie hierome calleth widowes married harlottes naughty vveemen malas prostitutas saithe digamia non nascitur terra bona seconde marriage groweth good soile againe saithe tolerabilius est vni prostitutam esse quam multis tolerable concubine vnto one vnto many againe vbi numerus maritorum est ibi vir qui proprie vnus est esse desijt number husbandes husbande proper speache one husbande likewise againe non damno digamos etiam scortatorem recipio poenitentem quicquid aequaliter licet aequa lance pensandum est condemne widower widowes haue married againe seconde marriage refuse fornicatoure vpon repentance bishop priestes married vvhat euer equally lavvful muste vveighed one condemne seconde marriage twoo christes one twoo husbandes twoo wiues origen saithe nunc secundae tertiae quartae nuptiae repetuntur non ignoramus quod tale coniugium eijciet no de regno dei nowe reuerence tertullian hierome witnesseth married prieste spiridion bishop cyprus sometime famouse councel nice married child hilarie bishop poit r appeareth epistle daughter abra gregorie basiles
