mearum come irremota rerum holy father cheremon bishop nilus eusebius writeth sente bannishment wife polycrates beinge likewise bishop sometime saide seuen father ancesters benne bishoppes greeke woorde nonlatin alphabet ruffinus translateth patres iustinianus emperour seemeth esteeme epiphanius bishop constantinople father ancesters benne priestes bishoppes ignatius iohn euangelistes scholar saithe peter apostle christe married menne writeth clemens alexandrinus writeth eusebius origen saithe paule vvife called faithe bothe one time ambrose saithe omnes apostoli excepto iohanne paulo vxores habuerunt al apostle wiues onely iohn paule excepted clemens alexandrinus saithe perfecti christiani edunt bibunt contrahunt matrimonium perfite christian menne doo eate drinke contracte matrimonie hierome writinge againste iouinian saithe thus quasi non hodie quo que plurimi sacerdotes habeant matrimonia though nowe day verie many priestes married therefore saithe alleged gratian legant episcopi presbyteri qui filios suos saecularibus literis erudiunt let bishoppes priestes reade thinges bringe vp child worldly learninge scripture god pope damasus sheweth v greate number bishoppes rome priestes sonnes pope syluerius pope deusdedit pope adrianus pope iohn pope felix pope hosius pope agapetus pope gelasius pope bonifaciusbishops married pope iohn pope theodorus concludeth thus complures etiam alij inueniuntur qui de sacerdotibus nati apostolicae sedi praefuerunt many others biside founde beinge priestes sonnes ruled apostolique see romeaeneas syluius de gestis concil basihen lib pope pius saithe married man hauinge vvife aliue maie chosen pope woordes cur enim disputant doctores electus papam vxori suae debitu soluere teneatur c wherefore doo canonistes moue doubte vvhether man chosen pope bounde yelde marriage duetie vvife onlesse married man maie chosen roumepolydorus historia anglor lib anno dom polydorus de inuentoribus rer lib dom fabian pag polydorus vergilius saithe restrainte priestes marriage firste attempted englande aboute yeere lorde neenehundred three score tenne afterwarde concluded weaste churche aboute yeere lorde thousande hundred neuer fabian saithe bishoppes priestes liued thousande yeeres togeather vvith theire vviues lavve beinge contrarie twoo principle beinge thus laide one immoderate extraordinarie speech holy father continual ordinarie practise churche wee maie nowe better hable consider substance hardinges reason firste al obiection vowes nothinge toucheth cleregie englande knowen confessed priestes englande neuer votary yet answeare wee graunte reason conuenient hath made vowe vnto god shoulde keepe promise cyrillus saithe si castitatem promiserit cyrill leuiticum lib seruare non poterit pronuntier peccatum suum haue promised vowed chastitie cannot keepe let pronounce confesse sinne touchinge virginitie chastitie wee saie standeth choise matthae iustinus apologia vowe singulare gifte god christe selfe saithe al menne take woorde vnto whome geeuen iustinus martyr saithe multi castrauerunt se propter regnum coelorum verum hoc non cuius datum est many haue ghelded themselues kingedome heauen thinge geeuen al menne32 q integritas hieronym matthae ca ambrose saithe sola virginitas est quae suaderi potest imperari non potest onely virginitie thinge maie counselled commaunded maie hierome vnde infert dominus qui potest capere capiat vt vnusquisque consideret vires suas vtrum possit virginalia pudicitiae praecepta implere perse enim castitas blande est quemlibea ad se alliciens setd considerandae sunt vires vt qui potest capere capiat lorde addeth take let take euery man maie consider owne strengthe whether hable accomplishe lawes virginitie chastitie chastitie selfe faire pleasante hable alluere man vnto selfe vvee muste vveighe habilitie maie take take hereof anciente father origen began complaine longe agoe time origen matthae tracta non solum quae docent non faciunt sed etiam crudeliter sine misericordia iniungunt alijs maiora virtute ipsorum non habentes rationem virium vniuscuiusque vt qui prohibent nubere ab eo quod expedit ad immoderatam munditiem compellunt onely doo teache also crueily without mercie commaunde others doo hable consideringe weighinge eche mannes strengthe sutche forbidde menne marrie thinge lavvful driue force menne immoderate kinde cleanenesse hierome saithe gifte chastitie si quis consideret virginem suamhieronym aduersus iouinian lib id est carnem suamvovves lasciuire ebullire libidinem nec refraenare se potest duplex illi incumbit necessitas aut capiendae coniugis aut ruendi man consider owne virgine saie owne fleashe groweth prowde boileth vnto luste cannot staie laide vpon double necessitie either take vvife falle case cyril saithe cyrill leuiticum lib oportet compati commetiri doctrinam pro virium qualitate huiusmodi qui non possunt capere sermonem de castitate concedere nuptias vvee muste haue consideration menne measure doctrine accordinge euery mannes habilitie vnto sutche menne cannot take vvoorde chastitie vvee ought graunte marriage hardinge wil replie counsel maie take place al others haue vowed promised contrarie lette vnderstande owne rule22 quae mali written pope owne decree mali promissis rescinde fidem turpi voto muta decretum quod incaute vouisti ne facia impia est promissio quae sc lere impletur euil promise breake thy faithe vnhonest vovve change thy pourpose thou haste vnaduisedly vowed see thou doo euil promisse keapte wickednesse cyprian hauinge occasion write certaine maides cyprian lib epist vowed virginitie liued disorder saithe thus quod si perseuerare nolunt vel non possunt melius est vt nubant quam vt ignem delicijs suis cadant certe nullum fratribus aut sororibus scudalum faciant either cannot vvil contrinevve better marrie falle fire helle pleasure least let breede sclaunder brother sister augustine saithe august de bono coniugali dist quidam quidam nubentes post votum asserunt adulteros esse ego autem dico vobis quod grauiter peccant qui tale diuidunt menne saie aduouterers marrie haue made vowe telle sinne greuously put sutche asunder epiphanius likewise saithe epiphan contra apostolic lib nonlatin alphabet melius est vnum habere peccatum quam multa melius est cadentem stadio aperte sibi vxorem asciscere secundum leges c et virginitate longo tempore agere poenitentiam c et non quotidie occultis iaculis vuluerari better haue one sinne many sinnes better man fallinge course openly take vnto vvife accordinge lavve c longe time repente selfe breache virginitie c wounded priuie dortes euerie daie hierome saithe hieronym ad virginem demetriadem sanctum virginum propofitum coelestis angelorum que familiae gloriam quarundam non bene se agentium nomen infamat quibus aperte dicendum est vt aut nubant si se non possunt continere aut contineant si nolunt nubere name certaine virgin wel behauinge selues defameth shameth holy pourpose virgin glorie heauenly angelical p n lie whome wee muste plainely charge either marrie cannot conteine conteine wil marrie like purpose augustine saithe august de sanctum virginitate cap multas earum reuocat nubendo non amor praeclati propositus sed aperti dedecotis timor veniens ipse superbia qua formidatur hominibus magi displicere quam deo nubere nolunt ideo non nubunt quia impune non possunt quae melius nuberent quam vrerentur id est quam occulta flamma concupiscentiae ipsa conscientia vastarentur quas poenitet professionis piget confessionis many keapte marriage loue goodly pourpose virginitie feare open shame shame also proceedeth pride afraide displease man god vvil marrie therefore marrie bicause cannot vvithout rebuke yet better vvere marrie burne saie flame concupiscence owne conscience wasted soary profession yet greeueth confesse c vovves sufficient saiemarke haue vowed herode vowed iohn baptistes headeactor ievves vowed paules death hubaldus noted gratian decrees22 quae inter coetera made vowe would neuer healpe owne mother brother neede neuer greate alphonsus de castroalphonsus philippica one hardinges greatest doctours saithe thus si quis vouerit continere non possit omnia expertus nihil promouerit ego illi author essem non vt proprio consilio sed vt authoritate pontificis saluti suae consulat per matrimonium man haue vowed cannot conteine hauinge assaied al meanes yet neuer neare would aduise prouide safetie soule marriage yet owne counsel licence authoritie pope likewise thomas aquine saithe thomas q arti potest contingere quod aliquo casu sit vel simpliciter malum vel inutile vel maioris boni impeditiuum et ideo necesse est quod determinetur talus casu votum non esse seruandum maie happen somme case vowe maie either vtterly il vnprofitable hinderance vnto somme good thinge weight therefore muste necessitie determined sutche case vovve ought keapte therefore thus decreed councel toledo concil toletan non est seruandum sacramentum quod male incaute promittitur vowe il vnaduisedly promised ought keapte heere hardinge ye crie inordinate heate fleashely gospeller euangelical vowebreakers impure bigamie filthy railinge rabble lordaines strumpettes wote onely waie winne victorie vnto kinde eloquence wil make none answeare demetrius sometime made vnto lysimachus scortum apud no modestius viuit quam apud vos penelope one whome liketh calle strumpettes liueth soberly emongest v dooth emongest chaste penelope appeareth augustine hardinge errour ancient beganne longe agoe saithe euen time somme maineteined answeared wee doo nowe spake fondly vnaduisedly vnderstoode saide woordes theseaugust de bono viduitatis cap qui dicunt talium nuptias non esse nuptias sed potius adulteria mihi non videntur satis acute ac diligenter considerare quid dicant saie marriage sutche menne vvemen haue vowed chastitie marriage rather aduouterie seeme vnto cosider discretely wisely saie againe fit per hanc minus consideratam opinionem eod capite vt cum volunt ea separatas reddere continentiae faciant maritos earum adulteros veros cum suis vxoribus viuis alteras duxerint commeth passe vnaduised opinion whereas wil remooue weemen haue vowed husbandes force continewe single life make husbandes aduouterers deede case marrie againe owne wiues beinge stil aliue thus therefore hardinge maie imagine augustine saithe vnto vnto ye speake fondely vnaduisedly vnderstande ye speake yet one companion telleth vsdorman fol vndoubtedly diuelles minister wil saie augustine saithe marriage sutche personnes true verie marriage thus iudgemente late louanian cleregie augustine becomme minister diuel hardinge hath saie augustine calleth kinde marriage vvoorse aduouterie calleth inceste sacrilege ancient father haue thus written true denied itvvoorse aduouterie good reader haue partely shewed like woordes haue proceeded zele heate minde profounde consideration iudgemente cause neither maie wee alwaies straine sutche saicinges vttermoste whereas augustine saithe sutche marriage woorse aduouterie saithe neuerthelesse immediately place true marriage deede god man aduouterie woordes theseaugust de bono viduitatis ca non quod ipsae nuptiae vel talium damnandae iudicentur damnatur propositus frau damnatur fracta voti fides c damnantur tale non quia coniugalem fidem posterius inierunt sed quia continentiae primam fidem irritam fecerunt marriage sutche personnes blamed defraudinge theire pourpose breache theire vowe blamed sutche blamed haue entred faithe matrimonie haue broken firste faithe promisse continente life likewise augustine saithe womanaugust de doctrina christiana lib ca vsed painte face etsi impudica circa homines non si tamen corruptis violatis que quae dei sunt peior adultera detineris although thou euil woman touchinge menne yet thus colouringe corruptinge thy face whiche thou haste god thou arte vvoorse aduoutresse waie comparison heate speeche augustine saithe paintinge face woorse aduouterie cyprian de singularitate clericorum like sense cyprian saithe diabolo peior est qui foeminarum aspectibus feritur striken moued sighte wemen vvoorse diuel likewise againe saithe multo grauior peior est moechi causa cyprian lib epist quam libellatici aduouterers case vvoorse case hath betraied faithe sutche comparison haue saide maie wel rackte al pourposes must taken far foorthe onely meante otherwise cyprian saithecyprian de singularitate clericorum peius est quam moechari continentiam ducere criminosam liue vnchastely vnder coloure chaste life cleregie dooeth vvoorse aduouterie hardinge cyprian saithe vnchaste chastitie coloured vaunte virginitie vvoorse aduouterie ambrose saide shee haue minde marrie shee committeth aduouterie shee made handmaide deathe addeth greater euil ambros ad virginem lapsam cap si hoc ita est quid de illa dicendum est quae occulta fortiua turpitudine constupratur fingit se esse quod non est bi adultera est beinge vvhat shal vvee saie defiled secrete priuie filthinesse faineth selfe deede shee shee tvvise aduoutresse ambrose calleth painted virginitie double aduouterie chrysostome virginitas ista cum viris plus ab omnibus arguiturchrysost quod regulares foeminae cum viris cohabitent quam stuprum ipsum virginitie weemen emongest menne reprooued al menne fornication selfe fewe wee maie better vnderstande place hardinge hath alleaged paule vnto timothee1 timot waxe wanton christe wil marrie hauinge damnation bicause haue broken firste faithe notwithstandinge deede paule spake woordes neither vowes vowebreakers widowes appointed attende vpon olde sicke personnes therefore reliued founde churche let v imagine hardinge would haue v paule spake al breache vowes let prima fides firste faithe vowe chastitie deede firste faithe faithe wee promise baptismehierony proc nto epist ad titum none hierome seemeth take thus writeth non nt digni fide qui primam fidem irritam fecerunt marcionem loquor basilidem woorthy beleeued haue foresaken firste faithe meane marcion basilides two famouse heretiques marcion basilidesvovv annexed c condemned breakinge vowe chastitie refusinge faithe christe whiche hierome calleth firste faithe paule maketh mention vowe onely rebuketh sutche light waueringe wemen beinge longe time founde charge congregation pourposely reliue sicke feeble afterwarde foresooke bothe congregation christe became heathen folowed diuel paule saithe nonnullae iam deflexerunt post satanam many sutche wemen already gonne sathan paule spake breache vowes eies hardinge doo reade woordes aduantage hope finde sutche authority doo expressely crie againste selfe1 timoth paule saithe euen place vidua eligatur non minor annis sexaginta iuniores vidua reijce volo iuniores vidua nubere liberos gignere domum administrare nullam occasionem dare aduersario vt habeat maledicendi causam let widowe chosen vnder threescore yeeres age refuse yonge vvidovves vvil yonge vvidovves married bringe vp theire child ouersee theire house geue occasion aduersarie speake il woordes paule muste deedes taken vowes none otherwise doo violently contrarie paules commaundemente either force suffer yonge maides girles receiue vowes doo ye staie vntil striken age maie threescore yeeres olde vowe reason ye one place claime one woorde breake many saiefol b vowe chastitie annexed vnto holy order ancient constitution churche apostle christe trial truthe herein beseeche consider sewe steede many owne allowed q sors principal doctour gratian saithe thus copula sacerdotalis vel consanguineorum nec legali nec euangelica nec apostolica authoritate prohibetur priestes marriage forebidden authoritie either lavve moses gospel apostle clemens alexandrinus saithe clemens stromat lib omnes apostoli epistolae quae moderationem docent continentiam cum de matrimonio de liberorum procreatione de domus administratione innumerabilia praecepta contineant nunquam tamen honestum moderatum que matrimonium prohibuerunt al epistle apostle whiche teache sobrietie continente life whereas conteine innumerable preceptes touchinge matrimonie bringinge vp child gouernemente house yet neuer forebade honeste sober marriage car inal caictanus saithe cardin caletan quodlibetis contra lutherum nec ratione nec authoritate probari potest quod absolute loquendo sacerdos peccet contrahendo matrimonium nam nec ordo quantum ordo nec ordo quantum sacer est impeditiuus matrimonij siquidem sacerdotium non dirimit matrimonium contractum siue ante siue post seclusis omnibus legibus ecclesiasticis stando tantum ijs quae habemus christo apostolis cannot proued neither reason authoritie speakinge absolutely prieste sinneth marrieinge wife neither order priesthoode order order holy hinderance matrimonie priesthoode breaketh marriage whether contracted priesthoode aftervvarde settinge al ecclisiastical lawes aparte standinge onely vnto thinges vvee haue christe apostle abbate panormitane saithe panormitan de clericus coniuga cum olim antonin su par ti ca continentia non est de substantia ordinis nec de iure diuino single life substance order priesthoode lavve god likewise antoninus saithe episcopatus ex natura sua non habet opponi ad matrimonium office degree bishop substance nature selfe contrarie matrimonieletteth praier hereby ye maie easily see hardinge howe true saie vowe chastitie annexed holy order apostle ancient constitution order saie taken hauinge vse wedlocke wee cannot praie ende ye allege authoritie paule also ye might haue alleged name saieinges sundrie fathersorigen numer homil extra de probationib glossa origen saithe holy ghoste time copulation forsaketh man yea although prophete god saithe virginitas sola potest anima hominum praesentare deo onely virginitie hable presente soule man vnto god hierome saith quotiescunque vxori debitum reddo orare non possum often doo duetie wife cannot praie pourpose pope siricius vndiscretely fondely abuseth holy woorde godhierony aduer iouinian lib inter decreta siricij cap rom thus saithe qui carne sunt deo placere non possunt pleashe cannot please god woordes seeme harde sounde mutche derogation goddes ordinance therefore ignatius iohns scholare saithe si quis legitimam commixtionem filiorum procreationem corruptionem coinquinationem vocat ille habet cohabitatorem daemonem apostatam man calle lawful copulation begeattinge child ignatius ad philadelphien corruption filthinesse hath diuel felle god dvvellinge vvithin like manner saie learned godly bishoppes councel gangra si quis discernit presbyterum coniugatumconcil gangren cap tanquam occasione nuptiarum quod offerre non debeat ab eius oblatione abstinet anathema sit man make difference married prieste maie minister oblation holy communion bicause marriage absteineth oblation accursed likewise written councel constantinople dist quoniam si quis praesumpserit contra apostolicos canones aliquos presbyterorum diaconoru priuare contactu communione legalis vxoris suae deponatur similiter presbyter aut diaconus qui religionis causa vxorem suam expellit excommunicetur man contrarie apostle canon presume remooue either prieste deacon vse companie lavvful vvife let depriued like manner let prieste deacon excommunicate yt putteth avvaie vvife vnder colour religion touchinge place paule1 corin defraude selues one onlesse consente season ye maie attende vnto fastinge praier speaketh kinde praier commonly daiely vsed al faitheful wel married vnmarried onely general solemne praier whole congregation whiche time persecution feare enimies keapte onely night al whole multitude faitheful charged presente whiche time necessarie bothe man wife leaue one others companie resorte praier written prophete ioel ioel blowe vp trumpe sion proclaime solemne faste cal togeather congregation people let breedegroome leaue bedde let spouse comme chamber let priestes minister god weepe bitweene entire aultar let saie lorde spare thy people geue ouer thine enheritance vnto confusion like kinde general solemne praier tertullian ad vxorem lib tertullian saithe thus quis solennibus paschae abnoctantem vxorem securus sustinebit man beinge heathen without mistruste suffer wife beinge christian woman awaie solemnitie easter praier sutche solemne seldome meetinges paule speaketh daiely vsual common praiers al christian otherwise paphnutius touchinge puritie holinesse married people augustine saithe quod paulus aitaugust de bono coniugali li cap quae innupta est cogitat ea quae sunt dni vt sit sanctum corpore spiritu non sic accipiendu est vt putemus non esse sanctam corpore christianam coniugem castam omnibus quippe fidelibus dictum est nescitis quoniam corpus vestra templum sunt spiritus sancti sanctum sunt etiam corpus coniugatorum fidem sibi domino seruantium whereas paule saithe shee vnmarried thinketh thinges perteine vnto lorde shee maie holy bothe body sprite maie taken though wee thinke christian wife liuinge chastely husbande holy body generally saide vnto al faitheful knowe ye body temple holy ghoste therefore man vvife keepe faithe bothe bitweene selues lorde body holy euangelical vowbreakers saithe hardinge pretende paphnutius proctoure whether proctoure forceth greately notwithstandinge plaine onely proctoure truthe againste general consente al whole councel bisides although one man alone yet whole councel gaue place vnto sozomenus saithesozomen lib cap synodus laudauit sententiam paphnutij nihil ex hac parte sanciuit sed hoc vniuscuiusque voluntate sine vlla necessitate reliquit councel commended paphnutius iudgement touchinge mater marriage made decree al leafte eche mannes owne wil without force necessitie side thus mutche paphnutius saithe nonlatin alphabet marriage honorable companie man wife filthinesse menne seeme saie cleanenesse chastitie hardinge holy father paphnutius weighe mutche side pretende wherefore dothe one companion louaine lightly disdainefully controlle whole storie vtter discredite condemnation writer thus hath doubted publishe iudgemente therein al worlde copus dialog pagi mihi nescio quomodo dubium venit fides huius historiae de paphnutio sunt enim quae suspicionem important eam esse arianorum aut impudicorum hominum commentum tota enim haec re socrate pendet sozomeno quorum alter nouatianus fuit alter theodorum mopsuestensem quinta synodo damnatum magnis laudibus extulit knowe howe storie paphnutius seemeth mee doubteful credite mater make mee suspecte vaine forged tale either arian heretiques somme filthy personnes whole mater hangeth socrates sozomenus whiche twoo one nouatian heretique highly commendeth theodorus mopsuesta beinge condemned fifthe councel thus felowes make whole storie vaine fable authours writer thereof socrates sozomenus heretiques nouatians arians vnhoneste shamelesse personnes therefore trowe ye wil saie proctours wereas chrysostome saithe chrysost epist ad titum homil marriage reuerende thinge man maie therewith ascende holy throne made bishop notwithstandinge haue wife paule suffereth haue twise married atteine sutche roume woordes saithe hardinge chrysostome condemneth impure bigamie holy gospeller againe saithe defender presse v chrysostome wee answeare although chrysostome graunte married man maie ascende holy seate yet saithe man maie descende holy seate bridebedde wee denie vtterly man hath receiued holy order maie marrie neither shewed marriage sutche euer accoumpted lawful catholique churche doubte nothusbande one vvife good reader shal easily appeare hardinge either twoo partes fowly deceiued firste chrysostome plaine woordestimo whiche hardinge translation hath pourposely falsified expoundeth woordes paule husbande one vvife man neuer one wife al time man hath one wife one time hardinge shal thinke exposition strange vnlikely let remember chrysostome selfe thereof writeth thuschrysost epist ad timotheum homil vnius vxoris virum non hoc veluti sanciens dicit quasi non liceat ab que vxore episcopum fieri sed eius rei modum constituens iudaeis quippe licitum erat etiam secundo matrimonio iungi duas itidem simul habere vxores husbande one vvife paule writeth makinge lawe lawful man made bishop without wife appointeth order behalfe lawful jewes coupled seconde matrimonie haue tvvoo vviues one time like sorte saithe hierome hieronym epist ad titum cap quidam de hoc loco ita sentiunt iudaicae inquiunt consuetudinis fuit vel binas vxores habere vel plures et hoc nunc volunt esse praeceptum ne qui episcopus eligendus est vno tempore duas pariter vxores habeat touchinge place somme men thinke thus custome jewes lawful man haue tvvo vviues moe take apostle commaundement chosen bishop haue tvvoo vviueshieronym epist ad timothe cap moe togeather one time againe saithe diaconi sint vnius vxoris viri non vt si non habuerint ducant sed ne duas habeant let deacon husbandes one vvife needes marrie wife haue none shoulde haue tvvoo vviues togeathercatharinus contra errores caietani errore likewise saithe cardinal caietane apostolus episcopis permittit vnam vxorem coeteris plures apostle suffreth bishop haue one vvife others suffreth haue moe pourpose isidorus seemeth saie castimoniam non violati corporis perpetuo obseruare studeantdist igitur aut certe vnius matrimonij vinculo foederentur let studie keepe continewe chastitie body vndefiled el let coupled bande one marriage sutche one pope leo wrote sometime vnto bishop mauritania leo ad episcopos mauritaniae sicut ad no relatum est duarum simul est maritus vxorum wee enfourmed one time husbande tvvoo vviues therefore addeth iudgemente priuandum honore decernimus wee thinke meete depriued promotion kinde seconde marriage chrysostome speaketh meane hauinge two wiues aliue togeather marrieinge seconde wife death former quae hac ratione therefore saithe secundam quidem accipere secundum praeceptum apostoli licitum est secundum autem veritatis rationem vere fornicatio est sed cum permittente deo publice licenter permittitur fit honesta fornicatio take seconde vvife firste aliue accordinge apostle commaundemente lawful judgemente truthe deede fornication goddes permission openly lawfully suffered fornication made honeste laste clause glose expoundeth thus fornicatio cum ea quam permisit moses post repudiatam assumi fornication meane whome moses suffered taken wife diuorce firste thus therefore chrysostome saithe sutche man twoo wiues togeather one time diuorced one wife married might chosen bishoptertullian de monogamia otherwise tertullian saithe vnto bishoppes catholique churche apud vos episcopi sunt digami bishoppes emonge meaneth emonge catholiques haue married tvvoo vviues one deathe al wil suffise marriage holy order referre mee selfe chrysostomes owne omes woordes thus writeth paule restreineth vnchaste personnes permitting haue married tvvoo vviues chosen gouernmente churche reason chrysos epist ad tit homil nonlatin alphabet nam qui vxori quae decessit se beneuolentiam nullam seruasse deprehenditur quo pacto potest ille esse bonus praeceptor ecclesiae imo quibus criminibus non subijcitur dy nostis enim quod etsi per leges secundae nuptiae permittuntur tamen ea re accusationibus multis patet founde haue borne good wil vnto wife deade gonne howe meete maister churche god nai rather quarrelles accusation meane twoo wiues shal subiect euery daie know although lawe marriage seconde vvife diuorce firste suffered yet mater lieth open many offence appeareth saithe chrysostome bare good wil towardes former wife nowe deade diuorced departed therefore oftentimes growe many accusation griefes bitweene wiues child frendes others partinge goodes restoaringe dower like quarrelles haue spoken good vvil affection towardes former wife deade benne impertinent pourpose thus mutche toouchinge chrysostomes iudgement vpon woordes paule husband one vvife notwithstandinge denie certaine auncient learned father haue taken otherwise laste al hardinge vnwares falleth negatiue diuinitie often mutche abhorreth thus saithe wee denie vtterly man hath receiued holy order maye marrie neither shewed marriage sutche euer accoumpted lawful catholique churche tale true al greeke priestes votary wel latines noted vpon decreesdist quonia margine graeci continentiam non promittunt vel tacite vel expresse greekes make promisse continente single life neither secretely expressely councel holden ancyra concluded thus diaconi conci ancyran quicunque ordinantur si ipsa ordinatione protestati sunt dixerunt velle se coiugio copulari quia sic manere non possunt hi si postmodum vxores duxerint ministerio maneant propterea quod episcopus illis licentiam dederit deacon many ordred time receiuinge order made protestation saide vvoulde marrie finde selues hable continewe without marriage aftervvarde marrie let continewe ministerie mutche bishop hath geuen licence hardinge trowe wil denie deaconship one holy order yet deacon time theire consecration makinge protestation solemnely bishop licenced councel marrie time afterward marriage contrarie hardinges position euermore catholique churche accoumpted lawful saithe pope steuin dist aliter graecorum sacerdotes diaconi aut subdiaconi matrimonio copulantur greeke priestes deacon subdeacon coupled matrimoniegloss dist aliter vpon whiche woordes glose noteth thus multi ex hac litera dixerunt quod orientales possunt contrahere sacris ordinibus many haue saide vpon occasion texte priestes easte churche contrarie hardinge certainely assureth v maye marrie beinge vvithin holy order priestes weaste churche cardinal caietane saithe catharinus co tra error caietani errore papa potest dispensare cum sacerdote occidentalis ecclesiae vt vxorem ducat nulla existente causa publicae vtilitatis pope maie dispense withe priste vveaste churche marrie vvife although manner cause common profite athanasius saithe athanasius ad dracontium multi quoque ex episcopis matrimonia non inierunt monachi contra parentes liberorum facti sunt many bishoppes saithe al many haue married whiche woordes geueth v vnderstande somme haue married contrarievvise monkes haue becomme father child cassiodorus writeth thus cassiodo lib cap illo tempore ferunt martyrio vitam finisse eupsychium caesariensem episcopum ducta nuper vxore dum adhuc quasi sponsus esse videretur time saie eupsychius bishop caesaria died martyrdome hauing married vvife litle beinge yet manner newe married man likewise hardinge mighte haue founde noted owne glose dicunt quod olim sacerdotes poterant contraheredist cum praeterito gloss ante siricium saie olde time pope siricius whiche foure hundred yeeres christe vvas lavvful priestes marrie wee shal haue occasion speake hereof hereafter meane season good christian reader taste thou maiste easily iudge howe true hardinge telleth thee marriage receiued holy order neuer thought lawful catholique churche apologie cap diuision sozomenus saithe spiridion nazianzene saithe owne father wee saie good diligente bishop dothe serue ministerie neuer woorse married rather better hablenes doo goode hardinge vvere weight mater required vpright plaine dealinge ciuilities sake could contente sommetimes spare ye make manifeste lye vse softer worde terme fittens nowe tel vse accustomed figure pseudologia whiche lyinge plaine englishe truste wil beare plainenes amend owne faulte consider power truthe causeth bolde hardinge assured knovve suer neither sozomenus gregorie nazienzene eusebius li cap haue caused bookes latine englishe noted margent ye mistake eusebius rufinusan vnaduised vntruth reade ansvveare nazianzene either monodia note also margentsozomen gregorie naziazene eusebius belied authour apologie funeral oration made father hath sutche sayeinge ye reporte howe could thei say bishop serueth ministerie neuer worse rather better hablenesse doo good maried scripture beinge plaine contrary vvhat ye either ignorante forgetful mutche inclined promote carnal doctrine priestes mariages say notwithstandinge paule writeth corinthian saithe marieds paule vvriteth thus priestes bishoppes al christian menne sutche shal haue tribulation fleshe sayeth without vvife careth thinges lorde howe may please god hath vvife saieth careth forthe thinges worldes may please wife diuided finally saieth tel thing profite tangle snare whiche honest comely vnto whiche maye geue readines praie god without lette vvherefore recant shame fowle erroure bishop serueth better ministerie able good maried sutche menm hardinges modestie sutche doctrine fleashly men fleashly doctrine nowe therefore see great impudencie lye selfe father sutche fowle lye vpon sozomenusli ca light world time gregorie nazianzene wordes sozomenus nonlatin alphabet saie spiridion husbandman hauinge vvife child yet al vvas neuer vvoorse goddes seruice place grauntneuer vvorse ye maie saie sozomenus spiridion serued god neuer vvoorie maried howe whereof gather ye serued god better able good bicause mariage spiridion obteined priuiledge throughvntruthe chrysostome maketh case general especial grace excedinge vertue whiche graunted fewe priuileges fewe make law al general ye knowe nazianzene saieth furthermore woordes sozomenusthe place sozomenus alleaged defender maket vtterly naziazenes vvordes retourned vpon defender ye builde carnal doctrine vpon wel examined ye shal finde maketh signifieing vvife child addeth nonlatin alphabet yet al neuer woorse goddes seruice reuocation exception negatiue yet al c implieth confession affirmatiue contrarie neither maketh place gregorie nazianzene whit sozomenus doth whose woordes traslation raphael volaterranus varyinge mutche fro greekean erroure hardinge taketh one place hic basilij pater basilius item appellatus etsi matrimonio se vinxit ita tamen eo vixit vt nihil propterea ad perfectam virtutem ac philosophiam consequendam impediretur basiles father named also basile although put selfe bondes matrimonie yet liued herein vvas letted vvhit atteininge perfite vertue holy knovvledge vvere marriage lette hinderaunce perfection requisite bishopnothinge hi dered learned man coulde rightly haue saide ita tamen eo vixit c yet al liued c right easi put holde taketh chrysostome chrysostome selfe least man thinketimoth whereas paule saieth bishop oughte husbande one vvife order contineweth stil churche thereto saithe seconde homilie de patientia iob reade ansvveare ea ratione quod id nunc ecclesia obseruetur oportet enim omni prorsus castitate sacerdotem ornatum esse paule saieth required consideration nowe obserued churche behooueth bishop garnished al manner chastitie b sarisburie commeth hardinge lofte io triumphe hauinge beatten downe al world vnder feete beinge already sure possession victorie crieth impudencies levvde lie fovvle faultes pretie fittens ful terribly chargeth v like conqueroure render selues recante shame newe courrage suddainely blowen vpon thinketh wee haue intruded vpon office saithe haue corrupted falsified holy father woorthy mater knowe wherein forsooth wee saie reporte sozomenus gregorius nazianzenus spiridion gregorie father vnto nazianzene beinge bothe married bishoppes notwithstanding theire marriage vvere neuer vvoorse hable doo theire ecclesiastical office rather better hardinge selfe freely confesseth holy father neuer vvoorse hable doo theire office mutche woordes sozomenus importe nonlatin alphabet better hable doo theire office bicause theire wiues denieth vtterly herein saithe wee corrupters falsifier father thus whole difference bitweene hardinge v touchinge mater standeth onely twoo poore woordes rather better neuer vvoorse nowemarriage healpeth gentle reader thou maiste better hable iudge bitweene v beseeche thee indifferently weigh woordes gregorie nazianzene hereof nazianzen pitaphto patris helpe father beinge bishop nazianzum wife writeth thus illa quae dara est adamo c eua geuen adam helper mutche good man alone steede helper became enimie foloweth meo autem patri mater mea data illi deo nonlatin alphabet non tantumm adiutrix facta est id enim minus esset mirum sed etiam dux princeps verbo facto que inducens illum ad re optimas et alijs quidem rebus quamuis optimum esset subditam esse viro propter iura coniugij tamen pietate non verebatur seipsam illi magistram exhibere mother beinge geeuen father god became onely helper benne great woonder also leader captaine bothe vvoorde deede traiinge vnto beste albeit thinges beste subiecte vnto husbande right marriage nonlatin alphabet yet religion godlinesse shee doubted becomme maistresse woordes hardinge plaine cleare without fitton gregarie nazianzene saithe owne mother vnto father bishop nazianzum helper directour bothe vvoorde deede leade beste al thinges beinge inferiour yet religio godlinesse shee vvas maistresse yet must al woordes open plaine cleare drowned simple distinction rather better neuer vvoorse maie wee allow fauour take al ye cal fittons lie corruption falsifieinges home againe vnto selfe yowe neuer readde thinges greate marueile yowe muste remember al trueth maie measured readinge deede marriage also al like outwarde thinges selfe neither good cor il vsed paule saithe virgine marrie shee finneth marrieth virgine finneth therefore gregorie nazianzene saith neutrum horumnazianzen epitaphio gorgoniae nonlatin alphabet nec matrimonium nec coelebs vita prorsus aut deo no mundoue conciliat aut deo aut mundo alienat vt alterum natura sua omnino fugiendum sit alterum absolute laudandum antmus est qui virginitati nuptijs recte imperat neither theise twoo matrimonie single life doothe either ioine v god world withdrawe v god world one ought refused absolutely selfe ought praised minde ruleth boothe marriage virginitie graunte moe occasion let hinderance matrimonie virginitie specially time persecution natural affection wife child often mollifieth melteth harte causeth man looke backewarde ambrose saithe bona vincula nuptiatum sed tamen vincula etsi vincula tamen vincula charitatis bonum coniugium sed tame iugo tractum good bandes matrimonie yet bandes although bandes yet thei bandes charitie coniugium vvedlocke good yet taketh name yoke tribulation fleasheambrosius de virgini lib paule speaketh al care withdrawe oppresse mynde haue saide oftentimes greate lettes godly pourposes yet wel appeareth example gregorie nazianzene spiridion godly man hinder nothinge neither sutche singulare priuilege hardinge imagineth graunted onely two bishoppes gregorie spiri ion none chrysostome saithe generally al menne quamuis nuptiae plurimum difficultatis se habeantchryso tom epist ad tim homil ita tamen assumi possunt vt perfectiori vitae impedimento non sint notwithstandinge marriage haue mutche trouble selfe yet maie taken vsed shalbe hinderance perfite life againe saithe ne excuse te propter nuptias dominus tuus nuptijs interfuit nuptias cohonestauitchrysost contra iudaeos gentales haereticos pag et tu nuptias arguis et dicis nuptias esse impedimentum ad pietatem nullum enim ad pietatem est obstaculum vi cognoscere quod nihil obsit habere vxorem liberos moses nonne vxorem habuit liberos vide petrum columnam ecclesiae quod ipse vxorem habuit ne accuses nuptias excuse thee selfe thy marriage thy lorde marriage feaste honoured marriage presence yet doost thou blame marriage saiste thou marriage hinderance vnto godlinesse telle thee marriage manner hinderance vnto godlinesse wilt thou know hindreth haue vvife child moses wife child beholde peter piller churche vvife therefore finde faulte vvith marriage againe chryso esaia illa verba vidi dominum tom homil writinge vpon wordes prophete esai vidi dominu c saithe thus quis ista lo uitur esaias ille spectator coelestium seraph qui cum coniugio commercium habuit nec tamen extinxit gratiam speaketh vvoordes esaias beholder coelestial seraphims notwithstandinge companie vvith vvife yet quenched grace god againe filium habebat vxorem vt intelligas non esse malas nuptias sed malam esse scortationem esai sonne vvife thou maiste vnderstande marriage il pornication il againe num obsiabat matrimonium adiutrix tibi data est vxor non insidiatrix vvhat marriage hinder thee thy vvife geeuen thee thy healper deceiue thee likewise saithe augustineaugust quaestionibus noui veter testamen quae sanctissimus samuel filios genuit non tamen ustitiae suae merita minuit zacharias sacerdos vir lustus senectute sua genuit filium qua ergo ratione accusatur quod minime obesse probatur moste holy samuel begate child yet nothinge abated merites righteousnesse zacharios prieste olde age begate childe vvherefore thinge accused proued doo manner hurte nicephorus writinge gregorie basiles brother nicephor li cap bishop nyssa saithe thus quamuis haberet coniugem alijs tamen rebus non cessit fratri although vvife yet thinges nothinge inferiour basile brother augustine saithe august de bono coniugali ca alleged sanctum sunt etiam corpus coniugatorum fidem sibi domino seruantium vvhere married people keepe theire faithe bothe selues god theire body holy likewise nazianzenenazianzen gorgoniae etiam illa quae nupsit de ijs quae sunt mariti de ijs quae sunt domini solicita est vt sit sanctum corpore spiritu eu n shee married careful bothe thinges perteine husbande also thinges perteine god shee maie holy bothe body spriteambros cor likewise ambrose videmus virgines de saeculo cogitare matrimonio iunctos dominicis studere operibus wee see bothe virgin careful world married menne careful vvoorkes lord trouble marriage cannot denied also trouble single life specially feare iudgementes god haue gifte chastitie chrysost gene homil chrysostome saith matrimonium non solum nihil nobis obstat ad philosophandum deo si voluerimus esse sobrij sed magnam adfert consolationem comprimit enim insanum naturae impetum nec turbari sint quasi mare sed efficit vt seapha foeliciter portum appellat et ideo deus consolationem hanc tribuit humano generi marriage onely hindreth nothing towardes knowledge seruice god wee wil sober also bringeth v greate comforte oppresseth raginge furie nature suffreth v dashte toste waues sea causeth shippe maie luckily arriue hauen cause hath god geuen comforte vnto mankind therefore gregorie nazianzene saith nazianzen funere gorgoniae nuptiae sunt laudabiles propter eam quae nuptijs est animi tranquillitatem marriage woorthy praise quietnesse contentation minde marriage shorte nonlatin alphabet clemens alexandrinus saith habet vt castitas ita etiam matrimonium propria munera ministeria quae ad dominum pertinent wel matrimonie chastitie hath either theire peculiare office perteinge vnto god chrysostome saithe ne quis praetexat vxorem vel liberos c haec excusatio hic praetextus diaboli sunt insidiae let noman make excuse wife child c excuse pretence crafte deceitefulnesse diuel thus hardinge conclude chrysostomes woordes grounde fundation doctrine behalfe crafte deceitefulnesse diuel thinges considered doubte courtesie ye wil take backe fittons vnto selfe conclusion summe whole talke spiridion serued god neuer vvoorse vvithstandinge vvife marriage let hinderance perfite godlinesse apologie cap diuision wee saie lawe whiche constraint taketh awaye libertie menne compelleth againste willes liue single doctrine diuelles paule saith euer sithence time lawe woonderful vncleanesse life manner goddes minister sundrie horrible enormity haue folowed bishop augusta faber abbas panormitanus latomus tripartite vvoorke whiche annexed second tome councelles champion pope bande yea matter selfe al history doo confesse rightly saide pius seconde bishop rome savve many cause vvhy vviues shoulde taken avvaie priestes savve many moe vveightie cause vvhy ought restoared againe hardinge ismanifeste vntruthe al priestes restreined marriage priestes menne lawe churche constrainte taketh awaye men libertie marie paules woordes plaine1 cor voluntarie vovve imbarreth libertie contrary thou take wife thou sinnest likewise virgine marie shee sinneth person haue theire owne wil deuotion vowed god chastitie haue imbarred selues general libertie theire voluntarie promise haue bounde themselues neuer marie sutche onely marriage selfe also wil marie damnable paule saithe vvidowes whiche haue vowed liue chaste haue theire damnation marie wil marie gospeller alleage doctrine woordes paule virgine marie shee sinneth vvee answeare chrysostome father virgine vowe chastitie dedicated god marrie1 cor ad virgine lapsam ca doubtlesse sinneth mutche beside christe shee hathe surmaried aduouterer obiecte better marrie burne let ambrose answeare vvho saith saieinge perteineth hath promised yet vailed restraininge marriagethe doctrine deuils churche vseth tyrannic teache sutche ought forebeare marriage accoumpted doctrine diuels holy ghoste whereby men kepte wilful dammation forebidde marriage wholy vniuersally altogeather doctrine deuils iudge marriage somme state order lesse conuenience single life vowe chastitie made require perpetual continencie doctrine diuels paule selfe bothe defender wil admitte answere beinge lothe forsake theire fleashly pleasure pretende moued auctoritie paule calleth forebiddinge marriage doctrine diuels sende augustine answere thirteenthe booke six chapter againste faustus maniche vvhere sufficient solutton theire obiection shal finde plaine woordes ille prohibet qui hoc malum esse dicit non qui huic bono aliud melius anteponit sate forebiddethe marriage whiche saithe euil whiche preferreth better thinge good thinge nowe may shewe time person lawe single life ordeined breuities sake wil content selfe witnes one onely councel vvhiche seconde councel carthage holden time valentinian theodosius emperours vvhere finde order taken vntruthe vvoordes apostle canos episcopus aut presbyter aut diaconus vxore suam praetextu religionis ne abijciat aut si abiecerit co munione segregetur canone apostle selues antiquitie obserued kepte woordes councel canone aurelius episcopus dixit c aurelius bishop saide vvhereas councel treated rule continencie chastitie three degree consecration annexed chastitte certaine decree written witte bishoppes priestes deacon vvhom thought good becometh holy prelate priestes god likewise leuites suche attende vpon holy sacramentes continent chaste euery condition thintente thei may simply obteine pray god keepe obserue whichevntruthe reade ansvveare hardinge fouly mistaketh councel apos le haue taught antiquitie hath kepte lo sir defender vvhat bishop augusta finde faulte priestes liues vvhiche augusta whiche bishop ye meane knowe neither wel knowe excepte sawe notebooke abbot panormitane one faber one latomus men time trow zelous man whiche wrote litle tripartite treatise annexed laterane councel euer al saie moued zeale beinge desirous clergy reformation lamentably complaine theire loose life gette fairer painted better filled box el shal ye al taken poore potticartes touchinge pius platina ye shal finde wordes one pope saieinges sacerdo ibus magna ratione sublatas nuptias maiori restituendas videri mutche saie english marriage taken priestes greate reason semed restoared againe greater saieinge reporteth vviues taken waie priestes reporte neither vviues ought restored priestes againea sage exposition vvhat benne pius meaninge speaketh onely marriage whiche man enter holy order vowe beinge made lawful order taken vowe chast tie beinge solemly made vtterly vnlawful saieinge made mutche pretensed marriage ye would men beleuevntruthe vvee falsified vvordes yee vvould simply haue touched ye would neuer haue falsified sutch chauge woordes vvhether expedient sutche come clergy required leade single life bind themselues thereto vowes enioie common libertie mariagenovve laste doctour stand doubte mira vero mili ti quae placeant leaue churche discusse order pius sawe many weightier cause priestes haue vviues theire single life ye pretende steede shewe v substantial better felowes haue vttered sermon w inge hitherto worthe pipt nootte saieing pius wel weighed scanned b sarisburie euer shal wel consider fruites haue growen treedoctrine diuels maie easily iudge planted certainely paule geeuen rule touching cleregie bishoppes deacon husbandes one wife immediately afterwarde tenoure course speache saith thus1 tim sprite saithe plainely later time somme shal departe geeuinge eare vnto lieinge sprite doctrine diuels vttering lie vnder hypocrisie hauing theire conscience burnte hote yron therby made vnsensible forebiddinge marriage c hardinge saithe lawe churche restraine marriage marriage nowe condemned side thought vnlawful vniuersally al menne saithe heresie valentinus marcion montanus others onely forebidden thought vnlawful fewe answeare harding maie seeme make selfe sommewhat better valentinus marcion olde heretiques healpe thorowly cleare doctrine wil serue commo knowen rule scholes magi minus non mutant specie verily killeth fewe menne called mankiller euen condemneth marriage fewe muste likewise called condemner marriage neither dooth paule prophesieth hereof say somme condemne al kinde marriage vniuersally al manner menne onely saithe shalbe somme shal forebidde marriage neither al heretiques condemne marriage one sorte somme condemned generally thorowly altogeather somme others condemned onely fewe euen hardinge felowes doo thus augustine writeth heretiques named manichee auditores qui appellantur apud eos august epist carnibus vescuntur agros colunt si voluerint vxores habent quorum nihil faciunt illi qui vocantur electi thei emonge called hearer doo bothe eate pleashe tille grownde marrie wiues liste sutche thing maie doo called electi auditores hearer emonge manichee laie people electi chosen cleregie heretiques manichee condemned marriage generally al sortes degree menne onely hardinge doothe fewe yet heretiques notwithstandinge theire doctrine doctrine diuels augustine saithe vnto august de moribus mantchae lib cap woulde also saie vnto hardinge non concubitum sed vt longe ante ab apostolo dictum est vere nuptias prohibetis ye forebidde copulation cocubines euen apostle prophesied log verily deede ye forebidde marriage albeit hardinge notwithstanding maie plainely appeare whoes doctrine ye teache chrysost opere imperfecto hom l shalbe good form pourpose briefely disclose somme parte passe ouer woordes chrysostome haec ipsa coniunctio maritalis malum est ante deumhierony aduersus iouintan lib copulation man vvife euil god hierome quam diu impleo mariti officium non impleo officium christiani longe doo de wtie husband doo devvtie christian like saieinges authority alleged pope innocentius condemnation marriage saithe thus dist proposuisti rom tit qui carne sunt deo placere non possunt fleashe saie marriage cannot please god pourpose allegeth woordes paule cleane al thinges cleane filthy infidelles wherby ye innocentius vnderstandeth married people nothinge cleanedist pluri boothe theire minde theire conscience defiledcopus dialog pag graecos solo hac impudicit lae schola magistros sequuntur pope siricius calleth marriage virium luxuriam foedas cupiditates vice lecherie end filthy lustes one late englishe doctours louaine saith whole easte churche mainteining lawful marriage priestes euermore continewed apostle time vntil daye mainteineth contineweth schole filthinesse maie remember rule written booke owne doctrinecon othonis licet ad profuga gloss geuen secrete special lesson vnto cleregie si non caste tamen caute thou deale chastely yet deale charily whence doctrine hardinge set firste abroche taught cofirmed allowed ye say doctrine diuel yet verily beleeue ye cannot saie pointe like doctrine god hierony danielem cap tim hierome hauinge occasion speake antichriste saith thus simulabit castiratem vt plurimos decipiat shal make countrefeite shewe chastitie maie deceiue many euen paule saith habentes speciem pietatis virtutem autem eius abnegantes hauinge colour godlinesse ye power therof denieing vtterly sommewhat reliue selfe ye allege woordes augustine ille prohibet matrimonium august contra eaust li ca matrimonium qui illud malum esse dicit non qui huic bono aliud melius anteponit forebiddeth marriage saithe marriage euil thinge beinge good setteth thinge better hardinge beseeche indifferente iudgement vseth woordes saithe saie liue matrimonie cannot please god thei filthy thei infidelles vnto nothing cleane theire vvhole minde conscience defiled saith matrimonie vice lecherie filthy pleasure saith matrimonie euil thing thus say thus write woordes apparente allowed bookes euen bookes whereby ye woulde haue v order directe liues manner briefely substance doctrine behalfe therefore euen augustine iudgemente doctrine doctrine diuels whereas ye would seeme vtterly condemne state matrimonie onely sette single life better thinge good maie please vnderstande notwithstandinge thinge selfe beste yet therefore vniuersally beste euery man notwithstanding scarlet fairest al coloures face fairest parte al body yet recke hardinge make selfe faire ye woulde haue face died scarlet single life many cause beste graunte yet beste euery body onely hath gifte chastitie quiet minde vpright conscience liue single otherwise matrimonie mutche better therefore god hath leafte v indifferently free bothe euer cannot vse one1 cor may chuse paule saith volo omnes esse sicut meipsum woulde euery man woulde liue single doo addeth withal special prouiso vnusquis que proprium donum habet deo alius autem sic euery man hath owne gifte god one therefore saith although single life better state yet euer continente let marrie better marrie burne although otherwise weigh single life marriage yet case saith better marrie liue single hardinge hereto replieth haue vowed haue loste libertie ambrose augustine iudgemente maye marrie hereof haue partely spoken partely shal haue occasion offered saie hereafter meane season wee taught hardinge take paules woordes toppe turne quite backwardes thus frame newe rule lifethe apostle doctrine saie contrarie paule melius est vri quam nubere better burne concupiscence marrie yet augustine saithe euen haue vowed alleged quae nubere voluntaugu de sacta virginit ca ideo non nubunt quia impune non possant melius nuberet quam vrerentur id est quam occulta flamma concupiscentiae ipsa conscientia vastarentur haue minde marrie yet marrie bicause cannot marrie without reproche better vvere marrie burne saye priuie flame theire coucupiscence wasted theire conscience hardinge saithe order single life taken apostle selues therefore saithe diuels apostle doctrine true deede mater thorowly concluded order taken apostle writinge recorde tradition maie appeare likely apostle beinge married menne selues would force menne liue single haue already shewed ignatius ambro cor clemens eusebius ambrose apostle iohn onely excepted al married clemens saith peter saw owne wife carried officer suffer deathe christes sakeeuseb li ca nonlatin alphabet ignatius ad philadelphien cried vnto comfortably name wooman remember lord ignatius iohns disciple saithe opto deo dignus inueniri sicut petrus paulus reliqui apostoli qui nuptijs fuerunt sociati qui non libidinis causa sed posteritatis surrogandae gratia coniuges habuerunt wishe founde meete god peter paule apostle vvere married pleasure posterity sake vviues chrysostome saithe chryso priorem ad timoth homil cur non ait oportet episcopum angelum esse nulli humanae perturbationi vitioue subiectum ne ecclesiae negotia fructus que perirent idcirco moderatam virtutem proposuit non supremam illam atque coelestem vvhy saithe paule bishop ought angel subiecte neither worldly affection vice leste affaire fruites churche perishe beinge without gouernoure therefore required bishoppes moderate reasonable kinde vertue willinge husbandes one wife vertue high heauenly saye vtterly liue vnmaried againe saithe chrysost eadem homil idcirco ait vnius vxoris virum ne nimis angustum rem eam concluderet si exactissimam virtutem experisset idcireo moderatiori admonitione maluit vti ne ex desperatione perfectae illius inueniendae virtutis ecclesiae sine episcopis essent therefore paule saith let bishop husbande one vvife leste shoulde shut vp mater greate straite required moste perfite puritie therefore woulde rather vse reasonable moderation meane bishop shoulde husbande one wife leste despaire findinge excellencie vertue liue vnmarried church shoulde leafte without bishoppes paule cor tim tit leo epist saithe touchinge virgin haue commaundemente lorde better marrie burne let bishop husbande one vvife whiche laste woordes pope leo expoundeth thus episcopus ordinetur quem vnius vxoris virum fuisse aut esse constiterit let consecrate bishop may wel appeare either hath benne husbande one vvife ambrose expoundinge woordes paule ambros cor touchinge virgin haue commaundemente lord saith thus si doctor gentium non habuit habere quis potuit doctour gentile commaundement lorde touching virgin man el coulde euer haue emonge rule whiche commonly called apostle canon written thus episcopus aut presbyter aut diaconus vxorem sua praetextu religionis ne abijciat aut si abiecerit communione segregetur si perseueret deponatur let either bishop prieste deacon put awaie wife vnder coloure religion doo let put communion faithful continew let vtterly deposed office hierome expounding woordes paule let euery man remaine vocationhierony contra iouinian lib vvherein vvas called saithe thus ex hoc habentibus vxores ollit licentiam dimittendi ea hereby paule forebiddeth married menne put awaye theire wiues sixth councel holden constantinople written thus antiquum sequentes canonem apostolicae diligentiaedist quonia constitutiones sanctorum virorum legales nuptias posthac valere volumus nullo modo cum vxoribus suis eorum connubia dissoluentes folowing olde order apostle diligence constitution lawes holy father frohence foorth wee wil lavvful marriage bishoppes priestes shal stande force vvise dissoluinge vvedlocke haue vvith theire vviues herein say folowe olde canon order apostle gratian saithe quae sor alleged copula sacerdotalis nec legali nec euangelica nec apostolica authoritate prohibetur marriage priestes forebidden authoritie either lawe gospel apostle cardinal caietane saith catharinus co tra error caietani errore clemens stroma lib dominus discipulis suis nullum indixit votum lord appointed vnto disciple manner vovve clemens alexandrinus saithe saide epistolae apostoli nusquam honestum moderatum que matrimonium prohibuerunt epistle paule apostle neuer forebade honeste sobre marriage al thinges wel considered beseche thee gentle reader indifferently weigh hardinges woordes demaunde countenance coulde thus tel thee order single life taken apostle selues therefore muste holden apostle doctrine happen tel thee written councel carthage tel againe deceiued saie tel apostle christe neuer neither made law gaue order single life minister therefore tel hardly deceiued wil say woordes councel plaine quod apostoli docuerunt concil carthag cap ipsa seruauit antiquitas whiche thinge apostle haue taught antiquitie selfe hath obserued woordes plaine deede peruersly glosed therfore tel againe better haue learned bothe maner apostle teaching also scope reache antiquitie certainely thus mutche owne glose could haue told apostoli nihil instituerunt dist cum praeterito glossa de non vtendo matrimonio iam contracto apostle tooke order touchinge vsinge matrimonie already contracted whereas councel saithe apostoli docuerunt apostle taught glose saithe apostoli docuerunt exemplo non institutione vel constitutione apostle taught theire example appointemene commaundemente perhaps hardinge wil saie apostle example sufficiente clemens stroma lib thereto wil answeare clemens alexandrinus sommetime answeared certaine olde heretiques like case dicunt gloriosi isti iactactores se imitari dominum qui vxorem duxit illis dicit scriptura deus superbis resistit humilibus aute dat gratiam glorious bragger saie wil folow example lord married vvife vnto scripture saith god withstandeth prowd geueth grace vnto humble like pourpose ambrose saith praeceptum quidem apostolus non habuit habuit exemplum deede apostle paule commaundemente geeue virginitie example againe whereas councel allegeth antiquitie quod ipsa seruault antiquitas glose expoundeth thus tempore siricij papae hic vocat antiquitate woorde antiquitie councel meaneth time pope siricius whiche foure hundred yeeres christe againe alleged ante tempora siricij papae sacerdotes poterant contrahere matrimonium time pope siricius vvas lavvful priestes contracte matrimonie sutche good lucke hardinge hath doctours councelles owne glose hath loste foure hundred yeeeres antiquitie panormitane saide commaundemente single life law god added extra de clericis coniugatis cum olim quia alias graeci peccarent non enim excusaret eos consuetudo quia illa non valet cotra legem dei otherwise graecians offender custome coulde excuse mutche custome preuaileth lawe god touchinge councel carthage notwithstandinge benne truely construed yet authoritie therof muste needes seeme mutche lesse decreeth set pourpose quite contrarie councel nice father nicene councel durste remoue priestes andsozomen lib cap bishoppes theire wiues written god hath ioined let noman sunder father councel carthage without stickinge doubtinge mater onely one woorde vtterly remoued force violence contrarie commaundemente christe sundred diuided god ioined whiche thing holy paphnutius saith lawful man doo touchinge bishop hulderichus panormitanus la omus iacobus faber sutche others haue spoken written behalfe priestes marriage hardinge thinketh sufficiente answeare complaine loose life cleregie saie cleregie liue professed shame open filthinesse sutche simple authority woorthy none answeare yet hulderichus sommetime bishop augusta germanie welneare sixe hundred yeeres agoe vertue holinesse coumpted saincte abbas vrspergensis storie writeth sorteabbas vrsperg anno pagina hiltinus augustanus episcopus obijt cui sanctus vdalrichus qui idem est hulderichus successit histine bishop augusta died succeded saincte hulderichus abbas panormitanus famouse canoniste iudgement equal faber latomus bothe time accoumpted learned either special champion hardinges side verily woorste vileste al greate deale bothe sounder iudgement deeper learning either amphilochius hardinge highly esteemeth abdias hippolytus leontius haue lately rakte duste clement rome often calleth apostle felowe neither writer onely complaine loosenesse priestes liues hardinge telleth v also remouinge publique shame sclaunder churche god wished libertie marriage might restoared whiche thinge hardinge closely dissembleth touchinge pope pius commonly woonte say marriage vvas taken avvaie priestes vpon greate consideration euen novve vpon greater consideration vvere restoared againe hardinge mutche needelesse talke fruites single life saithe thus steede shewe v substantial consideration good christian reader lothe disclose publishe thinge maie sounde shame one man mutche lesse open shame greate number hardinge ouer heauily presseth v importunitie requireth v vpon credite shewe cause therefore reporte hereof shal seeme vnpleasant faulte hardinges mine wil onely shew foorthe simply truely finde written sundrie bothe ancient learned father also others owne side whiche neuerthelesse hardinge benne mighte mutche better haue benne concealed firste al ancient father origen time whiche welneare foureteene hundred yeeres agoe hereof complaineth thus non solum quae docentorigen marthae tracta non faciunt sed etiam crudeliter sine misericordia non secundum aestimationem vitium vniuscuiusque iniungunt vt qui prohibent nubere ab eo quod expedit ad immoderatam munditiem compellunt alligant onera grauia faciunt homines cadere sub eis et frequenter videmus eos qui talia docent contraria facere sermonibus suis castitatem docent castitatem non seruant c omnia faciunt propter persona hominum glorias vanas vt videantur ab hominibus et plaerunque sunt tale qui diligunt primo accubitus conuiuijs salutationes foro vocari ab hominibus rabbi qui volunt vocari episcopi presbyteri diaconi onely doo teache also cruelly without mercie laie theire iniunctions vpon others consideringe eche mannes habilitie sutche forbidde menne marrie thinge lawful donne driue force menne vnreasonable puritie binde laie heauy burthen cause menne fal vnder oftentimes wee see teache sutche thinges doo contrarie theire owne saieinges teache chastitie yet keepe chastitie c doo al thinges commendation menne vaine glorie maye seene noted people commonly sutche loue highest place feastes banquette saluted euseb li ca nonlatin alphabet honoured market place people called rabbi wil called bishoppes priestes deacon verie firste attempte hereof dionysius bishop corinthe wrote thus vnto pinytus bishop gnosus noli graue illud onus necessariae castitatis imponere fratribus laie heauy burthen necessitie chaste life vpon brother neither nothinge cyprian time wrote thus vt quid sibi adhibuit mulieremcypria de singularitate clericorum qui ducere contempsit vxorem peius est quam moechari continentiam ducere criminosam wherefore tooke woman vnto disdeined marrie wife liue continente life reproche vvoorse aduouterie nothinge epiphan contra origenian haeresi nonlatin alphabet chrysostom quod regulares foeminae cum vi cohabitent epiphanius writeth repudiant nuptias non libidinem honore enim est apud illos non castitas sed hypocrisis quam tamen appellari volunt castitie refuse marriage luste pleasure esteeme chastitie hypocri ie yet hypocrise wil haue called chastitie nothinge chrysostome writeth vowed chaste wemen time nuptias magi dicere beatas licet c posthac melius esset ne virgines quidem esse c perseuerat adhuc nomen appellatio rei nego ium totum corpore sublatum est c delicijs magi viuunt quam mulieres fornice c frequens quotidianus est concursus obstetricum ad virginum domos c virginitas ista cum viris plus ab omnibus arguitur quam stuprum ipsum wee maie saie marriage greate deale better sutche virginitie herea r vvere better virgin al na e virginitie continueth stil virginitie selfe body quite gonne liue pleasure harlottes stevves often daiely renninge midvviues virgin house manner virginitie vvemen emongest menne reproued al menne fornication selfe nothinge sulpitius seuerus dialog sulpitius seuerus saithe hierome hieronymus de familiaritatibus virginum monachorum clericorum quam vera quam fottia disputauit vnde quibusdam quos nominare nolo dicitur non amari howe truely stoutely hath hierome written familiaritie virgin haue vvith monkes priestes therefore saide somme menne whome wil name lesse beloued neither nothinge saluianus de prouidentia lib ibidem saluianus saithe time aboute thousande yeeres agoe sub specie religionis vitijs saecularibus mancipantur vnder coloure religion holinesse made slones worldly vice againe nouum prorsus conuersionis genus licita non faciunt illicita committunt strange kinde conuersion maie doo doo doo maie doo al like thinges written longe agoe olde time fruites single life thorowly knowen pope hildebrande crueltie tyrannie fully established mater brought perfection auentinus saithe many godly learned menne vtterly foresooke ministerie auentinus hildebrando et falsi prophetae falsi apostoli falsi sacerdotes emerserunt qui simulata religione populum deceperunt maximum par sub honesto nomine castimoniae stupra incestus adulteria passim impune committunt false prophetes false apostle false priestes sprange vp vnder cou trefeite religion deceiued people moste parte vnder honeste name chastitie commit whoredome aduouterie inceste commonly without punishment bernarde saithe bernardus concilio remensi episcopi sacerdotes huius temporis castitatis sanctimoniam sine qua nemo videbit deum tam corde quam corpore quomodo student obseruare traditi reprobum sensum faciunt quae non conueniunt quae enim occulto fiunt ab episcopis turpe est dicere bishoppes priestes time doo endeuoure keepe either harte body holinesse chastitie without whiche noman shal see god geuen ouer reprobate minde doo thinges conuenient shame vtter vvhat bishoppes doo secrete againe saithe bernard de conuersione ad clericos ca opere triparti li ca abstinentes remedio coniugali postea omne flagitium effluunt absteininge remedie marriage afterwarde flowe ouer al kinde wickednesse wrote litle booke called opus tripartitum ioined councel laterane saithe thus tanta immunditia luxuriae notoria est multis partibus mundi non solum clericis sed etiam sacerdotibus imo quod horribile est audire praelatis maioribus c sutche notorious filthinesse lecherie many partes worlde onely inferiour clerkes also priestes yea greatter prelate whiche thinge horrible hearde c glose vpon constitution legantine englande written thus de concubinis cleri remouendis licet ad profligandum paralipomena vrspergen pag clerici huiusmodi concubinas tenent comuniter apparatu honesto nomine appellationis sororiae clerkes commonly holde haue sutche concubine honeste haueour vnder name sister nicolaus de clauengijs complaininge hereof saithe thus capellani canonici simile episcopis indocti ebrij scortatores chaplaines canon like bishoppes vnlearned dronken fornicatours robert holcote saithe rob holcot librum sapientiae lectione sacerdotes moderni sunt daemones incubus per luxuriam sacerdotes priapi vel beelphegor angeli abyssi priestes time lecherie like sprite called incubus priestes priap beelphegor angel pitte helle hulderichus olde time bishop augusta germanie hulderichus episcopus augustan wrote sharpely hereof pope nicolas wise decreta tua super clericorum continentia discretione inueni aliena multos confilij tui assentatores hominibus non deo sub falsa specie continentiae placere volentes grauiora vides committere haue founde thy decree touchinge single life priestes voide discretion thou seest many folowers thy counsel willinge vnder fained colour continente life rather please man god commit hainous actes ende concludeth thus qua nosti discretionis disciplina pharisaicam ab ouili dei extirpa doctrinam sutche discipline discretion knowe beste roote pharisaical doctrine goddes folde mutchevvo phgangus vvissenburgius praefatione antiologiam papae hardinge hath skil epistle hulderichus maie vnderstande owne pope pius otherwise called aeneas syluius maketh euident mention mantuanus poete saithe petriue domus polluta fluenti marcescit luxu nulla hic arcanum reuelo sanctus ager scurris venerabilis ara cynaedis seruit honorandae diuum ganymedibus aedes matter hereof sutche woorthy englished pleasure stande longe vnsauery place themselues saie thus2 quae lator glossa fornicatio simplex non est digna depositione ple fornication prieste iuste cause depriuation cause thereof glose alleged thus quia pauci sine illo vitio inueniuntur dist maximianus glossa bicause fevve priestes founde vvithout faulte shorte polydorus vergilius saithe nullius delicti crimen maius ordini dede uspolyd vergil de inuentorib rer lib ca plus mali religioni plus doloris bonis attulit kinde crime euer brought either shame order priesthoode hinderance religion griefe godly life single priestes hardinge vvere cause moued pope pius commonly saie alleged marriage vpon good greate consideration vvas taken priestes novve vpon better greatter consideration vvere restoared againe therefore saithe discourse councel basileaeneas syluiu de con basil lib fortasse non esset peius sacerdotes complures vxorari quoniam multi saluarentur sacerdotio coniugato qui nunc sterili presbyterio damnantur perhaps woorste many priestes vvere married many might saued married priesthoode whiche nowe barren priesthoode condemned former twoo saieinges doubteful yet later plaine cleare voide doubte like sense sorte writeth vpon good aduise aeneas syluius epist ad iohan fontem deliberation frende quoniam huc ventum est vt legi carnis resistere nequeas melius est nubere quam vri mutche mater growen far ye cannot withstande lawe fleashe better marrie burne saithe panormitaneextra de clericis coniugatis cum olim credo pro bono salute animarum quod esset salubre statutum vt non valentes continere possint contrahere quia experientia docente contrarius prorsus effectus sequitur ex illa lege continentiae cum hodie non viuant spiritualiter nec sint mundi sed maculentur illicito coitu cum ipsorum grauissimo peccato vbi cum propria vxore esset castitas vnde deberet ecclesia facere sicut bonus medicus vt si medicina experientia docente potitis officiat quam profit eam tollat et vtinam idem esset omnibus constitutionibus positiuis beleeue vvere good lavve wealthe safetie soules sutche cannot liue chaste maie contracte matrimonie wee learne experience lawe continente single life contrarie effecte hath folovved mutche nowe day liue spiritually cleane chaste greate sinne defiled vnlawful copulation vvhereas vvith theire ovvne vviues liue chastely therefore churche ought doo skilful physician vseth doo see experience medicine hurteth rather doothe good taketh cleane awaie woulde god waie taken al positiue constitution saithe durandusdurandus de modo celebrandi concilium titul vtile esset vt concilio matrimonium sacerdotibus romittatur frustra enim hactenus coacti sunt ad castitatem vvere good councel priestes marriage set libertie hitherto hath benne vaine force chastitie saithe martinus peresiusmartinus peresius multis pij visum est vt leges de coelibatu tollerentur propter scandala many godly menne haue thought good lavves single life abolished auoidinge offence people hardinge wil saie prieste hathe vowed muste keepe vowe pope pius saide gaue counsel marriage vnto prieste made vowe appeareth right wel bothe hath benne already alleged also common experience practise world vowe importeth alwaies chaste lifeoptatus contra parmenianum donatist lib hierony hieremi lib ca ambro de virginib lib optatus mileuitanus saithe mirella signum est voluntatis non castitatis auxilium apparel token wil healpe towardes chastitie hierome saithe quid prodest corporis pudicitia animo constuprato vvhen minde harte defloured auaileth chastitie body ambrose saithe non imperari potest virginitas sed optari nam quae supra no sunt voto magi sunt quam magisterio wee maie vvishe virginitie commaunde wee cannot thinges aboue v power rather desire commaundement hereof epiphanius maketh conclusion epiphani lib haeresi vt ne confundantur apud homines occulte scortantur sub solitudinis aut continentiae specie libidinem exercent melius est itaque lapsum cursu palam sibi vxorem accipere secundum leges leste shamed menne keepe harlottes priuily vnder colour solitarie continent life practise theire filthy pleasure better therefore man beinge fallen course openly take vnto selfe vvife accordinge lavve saithe hierome haue alleged huiusmodi virginibus aperte dicendum esthieronym ad demetriadem vt aut nubant si se non possunt continere aut contineant si nolunt nubere sutche virgin wee muste saie plainely either marrie cannot conteine el conteine wil marrie bernardus ad sororem de modo bene viuendi sermo saithe bernard vnto sister quod incaute vouisti ne impleas impia est promissio quae scelere adimpletur thou haste vnaduisedly vowed see thou keepe vvicked promisse perfourmed vvith vvickednesse shorte senten dist quaest iohannes scotus saithe si votum continentiae est annexum ordini sacro solum ex praecepto ecclesiae sequitur quod non simpliciter illegitimat ad contrahendum vowe promisse chastitie annexed vnto holy order onely force constitution commaundement churche dooth necessitie fine force vnhable man contracte matrimonie hereof wee haue saide already mutche reasonable man maie seeme sufficient apologie cap diuision wee receiue embrace al canonical scripture bothe olde newe testament geuinge thankes god hath raised vp vnto v light whiche wee might euer haue eies leaste either suttletie man snare diuel wee carried awaie errours lie also heauenly voice whereby god hath opened vnto v wil onely mannes harte haue settled reste aboundantly fully comprehended al thinges euer needeful healthe origene augustine chrysostome cyrillus haue taught mighte strength god attaine saluation fundations prophetes apostle whereupon builte churche god sure infallible rule whereby maie tried whether churche doo swarue erre whereunto al ecclesiastical doctrine ought called accoumpte scripture neither lawe ordinaunce custome ought hearde though paule selfe angel heauen comme teache contrarie hardinge doo yee plainely declare whiche bookes scripture ye allowe whiche theyvntruthe vvee reiecte parte al scripture ye reiecte general ye saie ye embrace al canonical scripture macha iacob yet man presse place machabees praier made deade woordes iames epistle againste iustification faithe onely likewise certaine place scripture whiche accompted canon churche againste certaine false doctrine casevntruthe vvee denie augustine hierome holy father haue denied wonte denie scripture canonical yet ye beare worlde hande ye allowe al vvould god either truthe lesse crafte vvel ye geue thankes god scripture hauinge eies ye staied truthe assured suttelty man snare diuel ye caried awaie errours lie deede praie syrs secte ye whiche secte eche one dare boldely saye worlde seethe yee agree al one yee saie yee lutheran muste demaunde whiche sorte lutheran puddle runneth many sinckes yee zuinglians arians osiandrines libertine adiaphoristes anabaptistes caluinistes sathanis e vvhat priuiledge haue ye felowes matche beinge made betwene meane newe cleregie englande sectes time c yee haue lighte scripture eies ye agree within selues yea eche one oftentimes disagreeth selfe howe thatchildishe fonde vntruthe communion booke vvas neuer changed see often change masse many time ye haue chaunged vvoorthy doubte vvhat pleased god neuer benne letter written olde newe testament shoulde god frendes haue founde peace passeth al sensephilip paule saieth paule antony hilarion pambus many holy men liuinge vvildernessevntruthe augustine saithe antonius scripturas diuinas memoriter audiendo tenuit c without letter reste ne quiet harte nay like whereas saie al thinges needeful saluation abundantly fully coprehended scripture also false sundry partes doctrine al thinges necessary saluation conteined scripture euer conteined necessarie necessarie shoulde laden vnnecessarie burden awaie al tradition clappe neuer apostolike neuer auncient neuer healthful neuer longe time churche continued remember moste renoumed father haue written necessitie tradition remember thought wrote thus let nowe yet euery woorde god woorde god light vnto feete greate stoare better mater trowe hardinge thus chargeth v often changinge communion booke one onely change cannot tel v benne lesse benne change al yet one change selfe meane season hath changed thrise holy communion booke order holy ministration standeth goddes mercie shal stand stil without change itplatin sixto polydor vergil de inuentorib legem potius ad testimonium si non responderint secundum verbum hoc non erit illis lux matutina lawe rather testimonie answeare accordinge vvoorde shal haue morninge light hardinge saithe quietnesse conscience comme vvoorde god onely abel quietnesse conscience wicked restlesse cain paule eremite antonie hilarion pambus holy menne liuinge wildernesse without letter haue reste ne quiet theire harte bicause woorde written woulde thinke hardinge bearinge sutche countenance diuinitie woulde thus goe aboute deceiue selfe pointe sophistrie chrysostome saithechrysostom gene homil hebrae deus conditor
