old time god spake many vvaies sundrie sortes vnto father doothe hardinge thinke god selfe owne personne presently spake vnto abel abel bearde woorde god wee speake precisely nicely goddes woorde written paper creature corruptible shal consume perishe corruptible creature doo vvoorde god whiche wee speake endureth euer hierome saithe hieronym iobum ca quomodo aeternae erunt scripturae diuinae si mundus certo fine est terminandus verum est quidem quod librorum pelliculae cum ipsis literis abolendae sunt sed quia subiungit dns verba vero mea non praeteribunt proculdubio quod illis apicibus pollicetur erit aeternum howe shal holy scripture euerlastinge seeinge worlde shal haue ende true parchement leaues bookes letter al tradition shal abolished mutche lorde addeth woordes shal neuer passe doubtelesse though paper letter perishe yet thinge promised letter shal laste euerchrysostom corin homil chrysostome saithe paulus praedicationem non scrip appellat euangelium preachinge vvritten paule calleth gospel hardinge addeth antonius paulus hilarion eremite liued wildernesse vvithout letter therefore presumeth liued vvithout vvoorde god vnaduisedly spoken vtterly vntrue proufe whereof name onely one steede reste augustine saithe antonius eremite notably learned perfite scripturesaugust de doctrina christiana lib prologo woordes antonius sine vlla scientia literarum scripturas diuinas memoriter audiendo tenuisse prudenter cogitando intellexisse praedicatur reported antonius without knowledge letter bothe learned holy scripture bare vvel minde hearinge also wisedome studie vnderstoode whereas hardinge woulde seeme make sutche accoumpte praieraugus de scalic paradisi cap holinesse without knowledge augustine saithe lectio sine meditatione arida est meditatio sine lectione erronea est oratio sine meditatione tepida est readinge without meditation studie drie barren meditation studie vvithout readinge erroneous praier without cogitation studie halfe colde vnfruiteful thus wee see augustine iudgement force substance bothe praier meditation dependeth readinge comforte peace conscience wee haue hearinge woorde god paule tel v somewhat better hardinge thus saitherom quaecunque scripta sunt c euer thinges written written learninge patience comforte scripture maye haue hope euen saithe christe selfeiohan father euerlastinge life maye know thee onely god iesus christe whome thou haste sente paule saithe2 thessalon basili de spiritu sancto ca keepe tradition whiche ye haue receiued either epistle vvoorde basile reckeneth tradition one equal woorde god firste basile worte woordes rather zele iudgement maie easily appeare selfe tradition specially nameth highely commendeth greattest parte already abolished quite foregotten yea euen churche rome yet woorde god endureth stil shal endure euer example one basiles necessarie tradition lawful man kneele churche vpon sonnedaie nonlatin alphabet euery man bounde tradition sermon praier communion stande vpright saithe geuen vnto v secrete charge apostle christe necessarie apostolique tradition dissolued broken vtterly foregotten onely louaine also rome augustine saitheaugustinus ad casulanum tradition apostle bitweene easter witsondaie lavvful man faste yet wee faste within day forebidden kinde faste thought lawful apostle tradition contrarie notwithstandinge reste basiles tradition stande halowinge vvater blessinge oile nonlatin alphabet praieinge towardes easte vtteringe certaine woordes inuocation shewinge foorthe breade thankesgeuinge vnto people thinges beleeue hardinge selfe neuer thought equiualente woorde god like tradition weighty necessarie seemeth make themtraditions let tel v good soothe without fable mystical solemne vvoordes inuocation ba le saithe spoken prieste openinge shewinge foorthe sacrament necessarie vsed continued churche god hath whole romaine cleregie quite foregotten cleregie haue foregotten vse care saie maie wee thinke necessarie saluation simplicitie plainenesse hardinges dealinge telleth v many tale apostle tradition selfe manifeste despiser breaker tradition touchinge woordes paule marueile hardinge could easily deceiued paule selfe euen woordes selfe line would haue tolde name tradition meante vnvvritten verity liuelesse ceremony supposeth selfe substance religion doctrine vttered vnto thessaloniens either epistle preachinge woordes thessalon holde tradition whiche ye haue receiued either epistle woorde calleth tradition although conteined epistle deliuered writinge apostle preachinge writinge nicephor lib cap grounde substance al one nicephorus saithe paulus quae praesens oratione sua dilucide docuerat eadem absens per compendium memoriam scripta epistola reuocare voluit paule thinges beinge presente plainely taught mouthe thinges afterwarde beinge absente shortely called remembrance writinge epistle like writeth also mathewe nicephor lib cap matthaeus discedens alio praedicatum absentiam suam scripto praesenti compensauit mathewe departinge preache place recompensed absence presente vvritinge paule vnto philippian saithe thus philippen eadem scribere mihi quidem non pigrum vobis au em necessarium write vnto selfe thinges vnto paineful behalfe necessarie woordes hierome expoundeth thus hieronym epistol ad philippen cap theophylact lucam cap eadem scribere hoc est eadem repetere quae praesens dixeram write thinges saie make rehearsal thinges tolde mouthe whe presente saithe theophylacte speakinge personne luke prius te sine scripto institui nunc scriptum tibi trado euangelium atque ita mentem tuam munio vt ne obliuiscatur eorum quae prius sine scriptis tradita sunt time haue instructed thee vvithout vvritinge nowe deliuer vnto thee vvritten gospel furnishe thy minde forgeate thinges vvere deliuered thee vvithout vvritinge saithe irenaeusirenae lib ca apostoli tunc euangelium praeconiauerunt postea vero per dei voluntatem illud scripturis nobis tradiderunt fundamentum columnam fidei nostrae futurum apostle preached gospel afterwarde goddes wil deliuered v vvritinge fundation piller vnto faithe therefore chrysostome saithe chrysostom corin homil paulus etiam non scriptam praedicationem vocat euangelium paule calleth preachinge vvritten name gospel thinketh hardinge stoutely striuinge bare name tradition better haue learned hieromes lesson touchinge samehieronym thessalon thus writeth vpon woordes paule holde tradition whiche ye haue learned either epistle vvoorde quando sua vult teneri non vult extranea superaddi whereas paule wil haue ovvne thinges keapte wil haue strange thinges thereto added tradition paule woorde tradition meante ceremony certaine secrete vnknowen verity substance gospel christe saide hardinge wil beleue v yet let beleeue paule selfe1 corinth thus writeth tradidi vobis primis quod etiam accepi quod christus mortuus est pro peccatis nostris secundum scripturas firste haue deliuered geuen tradition thinge receiued christe died sinnes accordinge scripture paules woordes deathe christe called tradition saithe basilebasilius de spiritu sancto nonlatin alphabet hoc palam impugnat salutaris baptismatis traditionem baptismus noster iuxta ipsam domini traditionem est nomine patris filij spiritus sancti per ipsam baptismi traditionem habemus confessionem fidei thinge plainely againste tradition healtheful baptisme baptisme accordinge tradition lorde name father sonne holy ghoste tradition baptisme wee haue confession faithe cyprian saithe cyprian ad pompeium contra epi lam stephani vnde est ista traditio vtrum ne de dominica euangeliea authoritate descendens de apostolorum mandatis atque epistolis veniens c si igitur aut euangelio praecipitur aut apostolorum epistolis actis continetur obseruetur etiam haec sanctum traditio whence haue wee tradition whether commeth authoritie lorde gospel el commaundementes epistle apostle c therefore either commaunded gospel conteined epistle actes apostle let v keepe tradition likewise eusebius saithe polycarpuseuseb li ca nonlatin alphabet c recepisset ea ab illis qui ipsi viderant vitam verbi nuntiauit eadem omnia scripturis consona polycarpus receiued thinges seene life woorde vtteted shewed beinge al agreeable vnto scripture sutche tradition plaine paule speaketh nowe therefore iudge thou gentle reader howe truely handsomely hardinge allegeth woordes paule serue purpose lenten faste superstition onely excepted wee condemne vse stil hardinge saie either lente necessarie maketh el tradition apostle verily augustine saitheaugustin epist quibus diebus non oporteat ieiunare quibus oporteat praecepto domini vel apostolorum non inuenio definitum vpon day wee ought faste vpon day ought faste finde appointed limited commaundement either lorde apostle saithe socratessocrates lib cap euangelia non imposuerunt iugum seruitutis sed homines ipsi suis quisque locis propter remissionem memoriam passionis pascha alios dy festos sicut voluerunt ex consuetudine quadam celebrarunt non enim hoc vel seruator vel apostoli lege aliqua obseruandum esse mandauerunt gospel hath laide vpon v yoke bondage menne selues country vvhere dvvelte release laboure remembrance passion christe certaine custome keapte easter holy day eche man vvoulde neither saueour apostle lavve commaunded thinges likewise saithe cassiodoruscassidor lib ca alij pisces solummodo comedunt alij vna cum piscibus vtuntur etia volatilibus alij v que ad einnantes sine discretione ciborum reficiuntur puto apostolos singulorum hoc reliquisse sententiae vt vnusquis que operetur non timore aut necessitate quod bonum est somme menne time lenten faste eate onely fishe others vse bothe fish foule somme others haue fasted vntil three clocke afternoone afterward refreashe theire body vvithout difference choise meates lenten faste thinke apostle leafte mater euery mannes discretion euery man maye doo good without feare superstition necessitie tertullian likewise saithe tertull de ieiunio contra physichos de coetero indifferenter ieiunandum ex arbitrio non ex imperio nouae disciplinae pro temporibus causis vniuscuiusque sic apostolos obseruasse nullum aliud imponentes iugum certorum commune omnibus obeundorum ieiuniorum hencefoorth wee muste foste vvithout compulsion free vvil commaundemente newe discipline accordingly euery man shal see time cause appeareth apostle keapte laieinge none yoke certaine appointed fastes obserued common al menne altogeather therefore augustine saith augusti contra faustum li cap per quadragesimam fere omnes abstinent non solum carnibus verum etiam quibusdam fructibus quanto magi quis que vel minus seu voluerit seu potuerit lente season al menne moste parte absteine onely fleashe also certaine fruites euery man either vvil hable doo lesse al thinges beinge true certaine question howe hardinge thus assure v lenten faste vndoubted tradition commaundemente apostle certainely whereas often tel v wee ought faste fourtie day christe selfe like gaue v example doo chrysostome saithechrysostom matthae homil christus non iubet vt leiunium suum imitemur christe commaundeth v folow fastinge faste fasted touchinge number day eusebius saithe quidam putant ieiunare oportere vnum tantum diemeusebius li cap alij duo alij plures alij quadraginta horas diurnas noctumas que somme thinke ought faste onely one daie others tvvo day others moe others fourtie vvhole houres night daie togeather meante hardinge comme difference bitweene priestes bishoppes thinketh priestes bishoppes holde onely tradition horrible heresie maketh saie scripture god bishop prieste one knoweth howe far vnto reacheth name heretique verily chrysostome saith chrysost timoth hom hieronym ad euagrium inter episcopum presbyterum interest ferme nihil bitweene bishop prieste manner difference hierome saith sommewhat rougher sorte audio quendam tantam erupisse vecordiam vt diaconos presbyteris id est episcopis anteferret cum apostolus perspicue doceat eosdem esse presbyteros quos episcopos heare saie one becomme peeuishe setteth deacon priestes saie bi hoppes apostle plainely teacheth v priestes bishoppes al one augustine saith augustin quaestiontb ui veter testamen qu ol ambros de dignitate sacerdot ali cor iohan quid est episcopus nisi primus presbyter hoc est summus sacerdos bishop firste prieste soie highest prieste saithe ambrose episcopi presbyteri vna ordinatio est vter que enim sacerdos est sed episcopus primus est one consecration prieste bishop bothe priestes bishop firste al moe holy father togeather paule apostle thus sateinge hardinges aduise muste holden heretiques paule saithe corinthian coetera cum venero disponam reste wil take order comme iohn saithe wil write paper inke truste mee selfe speake vnto vpon sewe woordes hardinge hable builde dimi communion priuate masse tradition euer listeth bisides augustine saithe augu iohan tract omnes insipientissimi haeretici qui se christianos vocari volunt audacias figmentorum suorum quas maxime exhorret sensus humanus hac occasione euangelicae sententiae colorare conantur vbi dominus ait adhuc multa vobis habeo dicere sed ea non potestis portare modo al moste peeuishe heretiques faine would called christian goe aboute coloure bolde vanity theire inucntions whiche sense reason man doothe moste abhorre vvith pretense saieinge gospel lorde saithe thus haue many thinges saie vnto nowe ye hable beare euen saithe tertullian eadem dementia confitentur apostolos quidem nihil ignorassetertul de praescription cotra haereticos nec diuersa inter se praedicasse sed non omnia volunt illos omnibus reuelasse sed quaedam palam vniuersis quaedam secreto paucis demandasse like kinde madnesse confesse apostle deede ignorante thinge taught contrarie doctrine emonge themselues saie apostle reucied al thinges al menne shewed certaine thinges openly al certaine thinges secretely vnto fevve sutche right helde sommetime greate heretique arius euen saide thenathanasius co tra arian oratione hardinge saithe nowe ex electis dei secundum fidem peritis dei rectigradis oui sanctum dei spiritum acceperunt ego ita didici thinges haue learned scripture chosen god according faithe skilful godly vnderstandinge walkte vprightly receiued sprite god sale tradition epiphanius saitheepiphani lib haeres heretiques called caiani auouched al theire solies heresy scripture tradition saide paule tooke vpon knowe al secrete woordes paule hearde thirde heauen hardinge maie haue leaue handle weapon doubte wil soone hable proue bothe holy breade holy vvater euer shal please el came tradition directly apostle christe selfe paule cor saide vvil comme take order meante diuise scripture newe verity knowen onely appointe place time order circumstance holy ministration like ecclesiastical office vsed fantasy hardinge felowes haue imagined augustine saitheaugu iohan tracta cum christus ipse tacuerit quis nostrum dicat ista vel illa sunt aut si dicere audeat vnde probat quis enim est tam vanus aut tam temeratius qui cum dixerit etiam vera quibas voluerit quae voluerit fine vllo testimonio diuino affirmet ea esse quae tunc dominus dicere noluit mutche christe selfe hath reuesed thinges whiche v wil saie saie hovve proue either vaine rashe notwithstanding speake truthe listeth listeth wil affirme vvithout testimonie scripture thinges lorde vvould open sutche thinges behieronym aggaeum cap hierome saithe cutte swerde saie woorde god hardinge saithe expresse woordes persona ingenitus homousios found scripture saide arian heretiques wel foreeth epiphan lib hare nonlatin alphabet epiphanius saith nomen substantiae non ponitur nude nec veteri nec nouo testamento sensus autem eius nominis vbi que est woorde forged scripture substantia plainely expressed neither newe olde temente sense meaninge vvoorde eueryvvhere saith anthanasiusathanas tom quod decreta ni enae synodi commodis piys verbis sint exposita tametfi haec vox scriptura non reperiuntur tamen habent earn sententiam quam scripturae volunt notwithstanding woordes founde expressed scripture yet haue sense meaninge scripture willeth touchinge perpetual virginitie blessed virgine mother christe whiche hardinge saithe cannot proued scripture gennadius writeth thus gennadius catalogo illustri virorum heluidij prauitatem arguens hieronymus libellum documentis scripturarum sufficienter factum aduersus cum edidu hierome repreuinge wilful lewdnesse heretique heluidius denieinge perpetual virginitie christes mother sette foorth booke furnished vvith sufficiete testimomonies scripture gennadius saithe perpetual virginitie lady proued sufficiently scripture hardinge onely mainteine quarrel saith cannot proued scripture standeth onely tradition hierome selfe vaine contention moued heretique thought sufficient answeare thushieronym contra heluidium mariam nupsisse post partum non credimus quia non legimus wee beleeue marie married againe childebearinge bicause vvee reade hardinge thinketh oppresse v olde heretiques ordinarie question hovve knovve saith scripture scripture hovv knovve gospel thomas bartholomewe nicodeme scripture thus laboure pulle al credite woorde god sende v onely theire tradition god woorde would euermore haue v stande doubte pope woorde say wise wee male doubtehosius de expresso verbo dei hosius special proctoure side saithe quod ecclesia docet id est expressum verbum dei euer churche teacheth meaneth churche rome expresse vvoorde god man might wel demaunde like question hardinge hovv knovv sonne sonne moene moene hovve knovve churche churche congregation wicked churche sutche idle question olde heretiques manichee demaunded augustineaugust contra paustum lib cap augustine answeared si quaeratis nob vnde no sciamus apostolorum esse istas literas breuiter vobis respondemus inde no scire vnde vos scitis illas literas esse manichaei demaunde v hovve vvee knovve apostle writinges wee make shorte answeare euen wee knowe oure writinges apostle knowe writinges heretique manichee answeare recken hardinge cannot ignorant gospel thomas bartholomevve nicodeme sutche others neuer written whoes name beare wickedly falsely countrefeited vnder name sundrie heretiques ambrose saithe euseb li ca ambro luca prooemio erant pseudopropherae c erat autem populi gratia discernere spiritus vt cogno scerer quos referre deberet numerum propherarum quos autem quasi bonus nummularius reprobare sic nunc nouo testamento multi euagelia scribere conati sunt quae boni nummularij non probauerunt false prophetes c people grace geeuen discerne sprite iudge thei receiue number prophetes skilful exchanger forged scripture shoulde refuse euen nowe time newe testamente many haue taken hande vvrite gospel skilful exchanger trier coines haue allowed saithe augustineaugusti contra faustum lib cap manichaei legunt scripturas apocrypha nescio quibus sutoribus fabularum sub nomine apostolorum scriptas manichee reade secrete hidden scripture written knowe cobbler fable vnder name apostle saithe eusebius gospel countrefeited vnder name peter no petrumeuseb li ca reliquos apostolos sicut christum recipimus sed pseudepigrapha reijcimus veluti gnari eorum sensus sententiae scientes quod talia non recipimus tradita ab apostolis wee receiue peter reste apostle wee woulde receiue christe selfe countrefeite vvritinges vnder theire name wee refuse vttersy hauinge vnderstandinge sense nonlatin alphabet meaninge knowinge wel wee haue receiued sutche thinges deliuered apostle thus churche god sprite wisedome whereby discerne true scripture false yet male wee geather hereof authoritie churche ouer aboue scripture dist istis augustine saith istis temporalibus legibus quamuis de illis homines iudicent cum ea instituunt tamen cum fuerint institutae firmatae non licebit ludici de illis iudicare sed secundum ea temporal worldly iawes although menne iudges ouer making yet lawes made established senger lawful iudge iudge onely lawful iudge likewise againe saithe august confess lib cap spirituales siue qui praesunt siue qui obtemperant spiritualiter iudicant non de cognitionibus spiritualibus quae lucent firmamento id est de scripturis non enim oportet de tam sublimi authoritate iudicare c homo enim licet spiritualis factor ramen legis esse debet non iudex de illis dicitur iudicare quibus potestatem habet corrigendi menne spiritual whether thei ruse ruled iudge accordinge sprite iudge spiritual knowledge shineth firmamente saie scripture lawful man iudge ouer high authoritie man never mutche spiritual yet muste dooer iudge lavve man saide iudge hath power authoritie correcte apologie cap diuision moreouer wee allowe sacramentes churche saie certaine holy signes ceremony whiche christe woulde wee shoulde vse might sette eies mystery saluation might strongely confirme faithe whiche wee haue bloude might seale grace harte sacramentes togeather tertullian origen ambrose augustine hierome chrysostome basile dionysius catholique father wee doe calle figure signes markes badge printes copy fourmes seales signettes similitude paternes representation remembraunces memory wee make doubt togeather doctours saie bee certaine visible vvoordes seales righteousnes token grace hardinge vvith face saie ye ye allowe sacramentes churchevntruthe thinges vveehaue leafte vvere sacram churche haue ye abandot ned almoste al sacramentes churche retaine ye mo name sacramentes two baptisme supper lorde whiche one doctrine taught ministred auaileth nothinge condemnation sounde true doctrine whiche catholike churche holdeth beleueth touching point thisthe sounde true doctrine sacramentes seuen sacramentes vnder coouer visible thinges thevntruthe shal appeare power god worketh man helth baptisme confirmation sacrament aulter penaunce extreme vnction order vvedlocke cal sacramentes neuertheles acknowledge name sacrament may extended many thinges knowen sacrament woorde sacrament signifieth sommetime holy thingeseuen samentes sometime signe holy thinge instituted godsacramente vvhat signifieth taken signe found generally newe lawe also olde lawe newe lawe signes peculiar special manner called sacramentes whiche signifie holy thinge also sanctifie make holy thei adhibited institution christe conteine grace power sanctifie vntruthe onely certaine late scholastical sophisters vvhereof sacrament best learned diuines defined visible signe inuisible gracedefinition sacrament beare image cause plaine vnderstading definition sacrament beareth forme signe image inuisible grace appeareth euidently baptisme washinge body sheweth clensinge sowle also sacramente aultervntruthe vaine childishe learned father euer saide formes breade vvine wardly represent spiritual nourishing soule like appeareth sacramentes neither new straung doctrine say sacrametes gospel conteine grace father teache seldom chrysostome expounding mysterie poole called bethesda hebrewe ierusalem saith sicke folke healed mouing water intent men might brought vnderstande vertue baptisme comming passe saith baptisme shoulde ful power gracecap ambrose booke de sacramentis speaking baptisme saith euery water healeth water healeth whiche hath grace christe cyrillus vpon foresaide chapter iohn saith baptisme vvater simply worketh hathe receiued grace holy ghostesermone dominicae intra octauas epiphaeniae augustine sermon saith vvater baptisme enriched gifte maner virgine mary saith deserued chastitie selfe hath geuen v sanctification deserued sinned might purge sinnes saide vniuersally cyprian al sacramentes fatte god anointinge powereth fulnes grace ministerial sanctificationsin sermone de baptismo christi whereby meaneth sacramentes yet meane conteine grace power sanctifie suche maner speakinge saie potion drinkes prepared sicke person thei conteine health workinge whereof effectual saide sacramentes thei conteine grace likewise saide theire vertue whiche thei haue god institution thei signifie defender doctrine semeth theire special office also significationvntruthe see ansvveare worke cause instrumental cause effecte whiche signifie whiche manerpovver gede sacramentes vvorke thei signifie god ordinance god hath geuen sacramentes newe testamente thei worke thinge signified vertue geuen god ordinance special effectes grace b sarisburie number sacramentes wee shal haue conueniente time speake hereafter gentle reader trust thou shalt see hardinges great question easily answeared face wee saye wee allowe sacramentes churche meane season maie please thee weigh woordes cardinal bessarion bishop tusculum one hardinges especial catholique doctoursbessarion de sacramen eucharistiae haec duo sola sacramenta euangelijs manifeste tradita legimus onely tvvo sacramentes wee reade deliuered v plainely ye gospel bessarion namethbaptisme seuen sacramentes harding dooth onely tvvo certainely wee refuse sacramente euer either ordeined christe vsed practised apostle lordes supper saithe hardinge auaileth nothing condenation must needes bicause harding saith shal tragical terrours fit onely frale child date lorde eche mannes woorke shal appeare simpleste people vnderstandeth nature meaning ye holy mysterie lordes supper therfore receiue togeather theire greate consolation lady masse simple people vnderstandeth nothing heareth nothing sauing fewe vnseemely ceremony seeth nothing therfore seldome communicate onely custome without zele comforte conscience hauinge sense feeling al dooingesorigen luc homil orige saith nisi circuncisionis reddatur ratio nutus est opus mutum pascha aliae solenuitates nutus magi sunt quam veritas v que hodie populus israel surdus mutus est onlesse reason cause circumcisio opened circumcision gesture doumbe kinde vvoorke easter feaste like solemnity rather ceremony truthe selfe euen stil vntil daie ambros cor people israel deafe doumbe ambrose saithe indignus est domino qui aliter mysterium celebrat quam christo traditum est non enim potest deuotus esse qui aliter praesumit quam datum est ab authore vnwoorthy lorde ministreth sacramente othervvise christe deliuered cannot deuoute presumeth vse othervvise firste deliuered christe authoure wordes seeme sommewhat touche hardinge companie contented allowe v sacramente true vse baptisme vailable force remission sinnes whereby vnaduisedly vnwares confesseth wee haue true catholique churche god augustine saithe truely baptismus ecclesiae potest esse extra ecclesiam de con dist ecclesia munus autem beatae vitae non nisi intra ecclesiam inuenitur baptisme churche maie without churche gifte blessed life founde vvithin churche alloweth v sacramente rather harde mater discusse neither may iustly require reason speaketh mutche without reason perhaps wil sate baptisme light sacramente maie ministred laie personne euen olde woman gyrle shee speake latine vnderstande shee saie otherwise trowe dooinge maie stande good certainely whereas hardinge speaketh dewe fourme woordes according christes institution owne doctours telle vsde conse dist si non auouche greate truthe prieste saie thus ego te baptizo nomine patris filij spiritus sancti diaboli baptize thee name father de conse dist retulerunt sonne holy ghoste diuel saie thus one ignorante prieste sommetime saide ego te baptizo nomine patria filia spirita sanctum yet fourme baptisme good one greate faulte hardinge findeth dooinges wee haue leafte greate many holie rite chrisme oile salte spittle sutche like thinges wee minister sacramente plainely simply christe commaunded obiection beinge greater weight may easily discharge selfe therefore maie passe wel without farther answeare hardinge saithe seuen sacramentes whiche saithe doo onely signifie holy thinge also doo sanctifie make holy adhibited sutche institution christe conteine grace power sanctifie leaus reste might demaunded howe matrimonie sanctifie man make holyto conteine grace institution christe conteineth grace selfe power sanctific cannot sanctifie haue sutche grace howe called sacramente graunt ancient learned father entreating sacramentes haue often vsed vehement concil nicen greate woordes written councel nice vides aquam considera vim diuinam quae aquis latet puta aquam esse plenum ignis diuini seest thou water consider ye diuine povver lieth hidde water imagin water ful heauenly fiere ambrose spiritus sanctus descenditambros de saman li cap tertul de batismo aquam consecrat adest praesentia trinitatis holy ghoste commeth downe haloweth water presence trinitie saith tertullian baptismo tingimur passione christi baptisme wee vvasshed vvith passion christe saith chrysostome hardinge hath alleged baptisme ful povver grace saith cyprian saie others al like vehemente speaches harding mitigateth qualifieth wise vvee meane saith sacramentes conteine grace sutche manner speakinge wee saie potion drinkes conteine healthe saie sacramentes verily deede conteine grace god drinkes potion verily reg deede conteine health ye patiente manner speache ye child prophetes saide elizaeus prophete mors olla vir deiprou iohan thou man god death potte salomon saithe death life handes tongue christe saithe vnto phariseis searche scritures thinke haue euerlastinge life therefore one hardinges schoole doctous saithe iohan de parisijs de potestate regia cap sacramentis ecclesiae specialis virtu passionis christi continetur sicut virtu agentis instrumento special grace passion christe conteined sacramentes churche power woorkes conteined instrumente wherewith woorketh deede soule man creature breade water receiueth grace god wee haue neede goddes grace corruptible elementes neede without faith parte sacramentes onely vnprofitable vschryso matthae operis imperfe homil also hurtful chrysostame saith vbi est virtu euangelij figuris literarum intellectu sensuu vvhere povver gospel fourmes letter el vnderstandinge meaninge likewise bonauentura saithe bonauen sen dist qu nullo modo dicendum est quod gratia continetur ipsis sacramentis essentialiter tanquam aqua vase vel medicina pyxide imo hoc intelligere est erroneum sed dicuntur continere gratiam quia eam signicant vvee maye wise saie grace god conteined substantially verily sacramentes vvater conteined vessel medicine boxe saie enoneous wee saie sacramentes conteine grace godeodem loco bicause thei signifie grace god againe saith gratia est anima non signis visibilibus grace god visible signes soule againe saithe ad illud quod obijcitur quod remissio peceatorum latet baptismo dicendum est quod hoc intelligiturede latentia signati signo quod quidem habet vlteriorem rationem quam rationem significandi non tamen essentialiter continendi se sed quia ipsum quod signat continetur anima obiection made romission sinnes hidde baptisme wee muste answeare thus must taken thinge signified hidde signe vvhiche thinge neuerthelesse hath farther meaninge signifie yet conteine remission sinnes verily substantially selfe grace signified thereby conteined soule mystical significationfourmes accidentes harding hath imagined shevves accidentes fourmes breade wine outwardely represente spiritual nourishinge soule vaine fantastical without witnesse anciente doctour father confirmed onely authoritie selfe manner feedinge accidentes holy fourmes thinge feedeth body represente vnto v spiritual feedinge soule mater plaine yenough selfe needeth cauil signification substance sacrament shewe v wee fedde body christe like material breade feedeth body body christe nailed crosse embraced eaten faithe feedeth soule like representation also made sacramente baptisme body wasshed cleane withe water soule wasshed cleane christes bloudeaugustin epist therefore augustine saithe nisi sacramenta similitudinem quandam earum rerum quarum sacramenta sunt haberent omnino sacramenta non essent yf sacramentes certaine likenesse representation thinges wherof sacramentes deede sacramentes representation rabanus maurus expoundeth thusrabanus li cap quia panis corpus confirmat ideo ille congruenter corpus christi nuncupatur et quia vinum sanguinem operatur carne ideo refertur ad sanguinem bicause accidentes fourmes breade breade selfe confirmeth body therefore conueniently called body christe bicause wine woorketh bloude fleashe therefore hath relation vnto bloude likewise saithe druthmarusdruthmarus matthae ca vinum laetificat sanguinem auget ideo non inconuenienter sanguis christi per hoc figuratur accidentes fourmes wine vvine selfe reioiceth harte increaseth bloude therefore bloude christe conueniently thereby signified hardinge cannot vtterly denie mater beinge plaine therefore contented graunte sacrament figure christes body helpe shifte mater hath diuised sutche strange kinde figure seldome hathe benne hearde notwithstandinge holy learned father speake plainely simply vse kinde sutche gloses hierony aduersus ruffinum hierome saithe ad tropicam intelligentiam sermo referatur quando dico tropicam docco verum non esse quod dicitur sed allegoriae nubilo figuratum let sateinge expounded figure saie figure saie thing spoken true deede figured vnder clowde allegorie likewise chrysostome saithe chrysostom genesin homi audisti fuisse figuram ne ergo mirare ne que omnia require typo ne que enim typus esset si omnia quae veritati accidunt haberentur ye haue hearde figure therefore maiueise beinge figure require al thinges agreeaugustin de doctrinae christiana li ca otherwise figure likewise augustine saithe principio cauendum est ne figuratam locutionem ad literam accipias ad hoc enim pertinet quod ait apostolus litera occidit cum enim figurate dictum sic accipitur tanquam prorie dictum sit carnaliter sapitur ne que ulla mors animae congruentius appellatur firste al thou muste take heede thou take figuratiue speache accordinge letter whereof paule saithe letter killeth thinges promised saueoure saie thou haste promisses already perfourmed wee haue alreadie receiued euerlastinge life christe alreadie comme promised prophetes therefore augustine saithe sacramentes haereticis ecclesijs illis vel illis apparuit christus sed etiam si ipsis veris ecclesijs quae dei sunt id est domus vestrae dixerint vobis christum apparuisse nolite eis credere dicentibus ista de quia non est digna diuinitatis meae notitla haec ostendens per haec quomodo ex ipsis ecclesijs veris frequenter exeunt seductores propterea nec ipsis omnino credendu est nisi ea dicant vel faciant sacramenta nouae legis non fuisse omnia iesu christo domino nostro instituta aut esse plura vel pauciora quam septem aut etiam aliquod horum non esse vere proprie sacramentum anathema sit man shal saie sacramentes newe lawe al ordeined lorde jesus christe fevver moe seuen one verily proper vse speache sacramente accursed ye saie luther germaines admitte three sacramentes baptisme lordes supper penance philip melancthon afterwarde founde fourthe hardinge thus enflameth tongue speake vntruthe yf pleased haue seene luther melancthon plainely expressed theire owne meaninge vtterly remoued al manner occasion sutche cauilles captiuitate babylonica luther writeth thus proprie ea visum est vocare sacramenta quae annexis signis promissa sunt coetera quia signis alligata non sunt nuda promissa sum quo fit ut si rigide loqui velimus tantum duo sint ecclesia dei sacramenta baptismus panis cum solis institutum diuinitus signum promissionem remissionis peccatorum videamus proper speache wee cal sacramentes whiche promissed signes annexed reste haue signes bare promisses wherefore speakinge hereof precisely strictely onely tvvo sacramentes churche god baptisme breade mutche onely finde bothe signe ordeined god also promisse remission sinnesin apologia confessionis augustinae likewise melancthon saithe wel cal order sacrament knowen baptisme supper whiche proper speache verily called sacramentes apologie cap diuision wee saie baptisme sacramente remission sinnes wasshing haue bloud christe person whiche wil professe christes name ought restreined keapte backe therfrom babe christian forsomutche borne sinne doo perteine vnto people godbaptisme sclenderly spoke defender baptisme taught nevve cleregie signe seale nevve birth hardinge ye acknowldege fewe sacramentes ye speake slenderly baptisme ye saie sacramente remission sinnes wasshinge whiche wee haue bloude christe whereas ye meane within fewe line ye declare name sacramente vntruthe vve saie token signe specially sith ye teache article baptisme best signe seale newe birthe ye seme attribute baptisme mutche scripture dothe neither baptisme onely signe toke sinnes remitted wee beleeue catholique churche according scripture teacheth baptisme sinnes fully truely remittedthat baptisme sinnes fully truly forgeuen cap timot put awaie faithethis talke needelesse season onely geuer receiuer though hereunto necessarie th se come age discretion power vertue sacrament god promise therefore geuen rightly saide baptized remission sinnes scripture plaine firste ezechiel speakinge holy sacrament saithe person god wilshed vpon cleane water ye shal made cleane al defilinges idol wil clense nexte paule saithe god hath saued v wasshinge regeneration renewing holy ghoste hath powred vpon v aboundantly iesus christe sauiour maie adde manifest scripture auctoritie learned father whereby strengthen truthe witnesse right vnderstandinge augustine lib contra duas epist pelagian cap shewinge sclaunder pelagians againste catholikes saithe thus theire persone againe theire meaninge catholikes auouche baptisme maketh deede newe menne againe witte geueth ful remission sinnes c thereto eftsones answearinge augustine saithe vvoordes maie vvel perteine har selfe vve sai thus mentiuntur pelagians belied catholikes sacramentaries also novve iusidiantur tergiuersantur lye studye howe deceiue seeke shiftes wee saie certaine sentence retourninge baptisme concludeth thus vvherefore baptisme wassheth awaie al sinnes vtterly al dedes wordes thoughtes original actual done ignorantly wittingly taketh awaie infirmitie whiche regenerate resisteth c vvhiche place doth onely set foorthe vertue baptisme alsovntruthe ioined vvith grosse ignorance har fouly mistaketh augustine minde destroieth doctrine new gospeller affirme concupiscence whiche remaineth baptisme verily sinne vntruthe fond vaine reade ansvveare vvherein erre manifestly againste scripture sense father b sarisburie il wil euer plenetiful ili wordes hardinge maketh selfe mutche mater without cause teacheth newe cleregie baptisme onely signe token remission sinnes telleth v faithe geeuer faithe receiuer povver sacramente concupiscence sinne trowe would haue saide presently comme minde verily poore newe cleregie speaketh one woorde al whole place neither signe token receiuer geeuer povver sacrament concupiscence whether sinne sinne like thinge yet ende taketh augustine vvoordes vvithout meaninge crieth againste v lie studie deceiue seke shiftes certainely bicause wee saie baptisme sacrament remission sinnes child faitheful borne sinne perteine people god ought therefore baptized cause woordes finde none true sacramente dependeth neither minister receiuer augustin iohan tracta de conse dist baptismus talis iohan though al child sinne yet baptisme sacramente remission sinne augustine saithe securum fecit magister meus de quo spiritus eius dicit hic est qui baptizat christe maister hath assured owne sprite saithe baptizeth neuerthelesse concerninge faithe parentesaugustin de libero arbitrio li ca augustin de verbis apostol sermo others holy doctours haue sommetimes written otherwise augustine saithe satis pie recte que creditur prodesse paruulo eorum fidem quibus consecrandus offertur good godly beleue child holpen faithe offered brought vnto baptisme againe saithe accommodat illis mater ecclesia aliorum pes vt veniant aliorum cor vt credant mother churche lendeth mennes fecte maie comme mennes hartesthe faith infantes maie beleeue like saieings might alleged iustinus martyr cyprian hierome others thus write howe truely wil saie theire woordes plaine prophet abacuc saithe iustus ex fide sua viuet juste man shal liue faithe parentes ovvne faithe faith hierome saith hieronym ezechiel ca de consecra dist verus actor petri qui plenum fide non suscipiunt salutare baptisma accipiunt quidem aquam sed non accipiunt spiritum receiue baptisme perfite faithe receiue vvater holy ghoste receiue augustine saithe verus baptismus constat non tam ablutione corporis quam fide cordis sicut apostolica doctrina tradidit dicens fide mundans corda eorum et alibi saluos facit baptisma non carnis depositio sordiu sed conscientiae bonae interrogatio deum per resurrectionem iesu christi true baptisme standeth mutche wasshinge body faithe harte doctrine apostle hathe tought v saieinge faithe purifieinge theire harte place baptisme maketh v safe putting awaie filth fleash examining good conscience god resurrection jesus christe likewise againe saith vnde ista tanta virtu aquaeaugustin iohan tracta vt corpus tangat cor abluat nisi faciente verbo non quia dicitur sed quia creditur vvhence al greate vertue power vvater toucheth body wassheth harte woorkinge vvoord spoken minister beleeued faitheful somme man wil saie child infantes beleeue nothinge vtterly voide faithe augustine answeareth augustin epist qui non crediderit condemnabitur sicut eos renasci per ministerium baptizantium ita etiam eos credere per corda os confitentium confitemur beleeueth shalbe damned vvee confesse borne againe ministerie baptizers beleue harte mouthes confessours augustin epist eadem episto againe saithe habent fidem propter fidei sacramentum theie haue faithe bicause haue baptisme whiche sacrament faithe saithe quemadmodum sacramentum corporis christi secundum quendam modum corpus christi est ita sacramentum fidei fides est sacramente christes body verily deede certaine manner speeche christes body baptisme faithe bicause sacrament faithe therfore cardinal caietane woorthily blamed catharinuscatharinus contra caietanum errore saith infante wanteth instruction faithe therefore hathe perfite baptisme touchinge vertue power sacramente hardinge mean thereby outwarde elemente water knoweth maye easily know common resolution emongest al owne schole doctours gratia dei non est alligata sacramentis grace god tied sacramentes meaning thereof god hable woorke saluation bothe without augustin iohan tracta augustine saithe alleged iam vos mundi estis propter sermonem quem locutus sum vobis quare non ait mundi estis propter baptismum quo loti estis nisi quia etiam aqua verbum mundat detrahe verbum quid est aquade con dis aliud est nisi aqua nowe ye cleane bicause vvoorde haue spoken saithe nowe ye cleane bicause baptisme wherwith ye wasshed sauing bicause vvater vvoord maketh cleane take awaie vvoorde vvhat vvater vvater therefore saithe augusti epist aqua exhibet forinsecus sacramentum gratiae vvater geueeth v outvvardly sacramente grace notwithstandinge wee muste consider learned father theire treaty sacramentes sommetime vse outwarde signe steede thinge selfe signified sommetime vse thinge signified steede signe examplethe povver baptisme sommetimes name christes bloude steede vvater sommetime name vvater steede christes bloude figure called metonymia saie exchange name mutche vsed emongst learned specially speakinge sacramentes augustine vsinge vvater place bloude christe signified water saithe thus august epist soluit vinculum culpae reconciliat bonum naturae regenerat hominem vno christo breaketh bande sinne reconcileth goodnesse nature dooth renewe man one christe notwithstanding deede precise manner speache saluation muste sought christe alone outwarde signes christe lambe godiohan iohan cyprian de baptismo christi taketh awaie sinnes worlde bloude christe maketh v cleane al sinnes cyprian saithe remi io peccatorum iue per baptismum siue per alia sacramenta donetur proprie spiritus sancti est ipsi solo huius efficientiae priuilegium mane verborum solennitas sacri inuocatio nominis signa apostolicis institutionibus attribura visibile celebrat sacramentum rem vero ipsam spiritius sanctus format efficit remission sinne whether geeuen baptisme sacramente deede holy ghoste holy ghoste onely priuilege woorke dooth appertaine solemnitie woordes inuocation goddes holy name outwarde signes appointed ministerie priestes institution apostle wooorke visible outwarde sacramente touchinge substance thereof whiche remission sinnes holy ghoste woorketh likewise saithe hierome hieronym esa cap homo aquam tantum tribuit deus autem dat spiritum sanctum quo sordes abluuntur minister man geeueth onely vvater god geeueth holy ghoste whereby sinnes washte awaie againe hierony ad galat cap si quis corporeum quod oculis carnis aspicitur aqua tantum accipit lauacrum non est indutus dominum iesum christum man haue receiued onely bodily vvasshinge vvater outwardly seene eie hath put lorde jesus christe concerninge concupiscence remaininge faitheful baptisme whether sinne sinne greate cause hardinge shoulde place moue question sauinge hath hitherto denied falshedde falshedde woulde nowe denie sinne sinne vndoubtedly paule feelinge concupiscence selfe forced moorne roman crie see lawe member fightinge againste lawe minde leadinge prisoner lavve sinne againe wretched man shal deliuer body deathe therefore ambrose saithe ambros lib epist non iuuenitur vllo hominum tanta concordia vt legi mentis lex quae membris est insita non repugnet propter quod ex omnium sanctorum persona accipitur quod iohannes apostolus ait si dixerimus quod pecca um non habemus no ipsos seducimus veritas nobis non est found man sutche concorde bitweene fleashe sprite lawe concupiscence whiche planted member fighteth lawe minde cause woordes john apostle taken spoken persone al sainctes1 iohan wee saie wee haue sinne wee deceiue selues truthe v leaue al others augustine saithe moste plaine wise concupiscentia carnisaugust contra iulian li ca aduersus quam bonus concupiscit spiritus peccatum est poena peccati causa peccati concupiscence fleashe whiche good sprite lusteth bothe sinne paine sinne cause sinneaugu iohan tracta againe saithe quamdiu viuis necesse est peccatum esse membris ruisconcupiscence sinne longe thou liuest muste needes sinne thy member hardinge saie wee wreaste racke augustine take woordes otherwise meante albertus pighius owne principal doctour wil control albertus pighiin controuer de peccato originis thus writeth augustinus tradit hanc ipsam concupiscentiam corpori nostro inspersam que innatam nondum renatis vere proprie peccatum esse quae ignoscatur quidem sed non tollatur baptismo augustine teacheth v concupiscence planted body regenerate baptisme verily plaine manner speache sinne concupiscence foregeeuen baptisme vtterly taken avvaie yet late blessed chapter tridente spite augustine hathe published contrarie concil trident session hanc concupiscentiam quam apostolus aliquando appellat peccatum sanctum synodus declarat ecclesiam catholicam nunquam intellexisse quod vere proprie renatis peccatum sit sed quia ex peccato est ad peccatum inclinat si quis autem contrarium senserit anathema sit concupiscence whiche apostle paule sommetime calleth sinne holy councel declareth cathosique churche neuer vnderstoode called sinne deede proper manner speache baptized bicause sinne enclineth v vnto sinne man thinke contrarie accused thus wee see decree woorthy couente ambrose augustine holy father haue written al accursed quotidie christus immolatur ex ipsis reliquijs cogitationis nostrae id est ex ipsa memoria christus quotidie nobis sic immolatur quasi quotidie no innouet wee foregeate ye gifte saueoure christe desire christe thy readinge christe thy reate likewise ambrose ambros de virginib lib animis vestris quotidie pro redemptione corporis christus offertur mindes christe daily offered redemption body saie howe breade vvine bringe v hope resurrection euerlasting life maie man like manner demaunde haw fewe droppes colde vvater bringe v hope resurrection vvater maie doo maie breade vvine likewise doo touchinge vvaterbasilius de sa cto baptismo basile saith baptismus est potentia dei ad resurrectionem baptisme povver god resurrection againe saith resurrectionis gratiam die resurrectionis recipiamus vpon daie resurrection let v receiue baptisme hieronym cor whiche grace resurrection hierome saith non solum propter remissionem peccatorum baptizamur sed etiam propter resurrectionem carnis nostrae augustine saith august epist ad bonifacium alleged nisi sacramenta similitudinem quandam earum rerum quatum sacramenta sunt haberent omnino sacramenta essent ex hac autem similitudine plaerun que rerum ipsarum nomina accipiunt ite que secundum quendam modum sacramentum corporis christi corpus christi est onlesse sacramentes certaine likenesse thinges wherof thei sacramentes without question thei sacramentes consideration likenesse oftentimes beare name thinges selues therefore certaine manner speache otherwise sacramente body christe christes body hereof haue written large articulo occasion offered former replie harding ambrose noting differece saith thus non iste panis qui vadit ventremde conse dist non iste sed panis vitae aeternae qui animae nostrae substantiam fulci breade wicked person pagan neither christian time whiche communicate alone while looked calixtus time paste decree consecration finished al communicate excepte rather stande without churche doores thus saithe apostle appointe holy churche rome keepeth stil hardinge let banket dight ought bee let best dishe made readie due sorte whiche bodie sauiour christe let ghestes tolde set holy table let taught beleue rightly proue prepare themselues behoueth thinke moste conuenient people god bidden thereto thereby communicate amonge themselues onely also rather communicate god incorporate christe made anaclet discussed spiritually onely hath receiued alone holy thinges hath offered neither decree anacletus whiche ye beinge deceaued gratianvntruthes three togeather shal appeare vntruely father vpon calixtus requireth al people present shoulde communicate prieste masse vvhiche thinge ye shoulde haue obiected churche seeinge obserued owne newe order congregation reade epistle anacletus whence decree taken selues wil confesse holy father martyr prescribeth order whiche would kepte bishoppes priestes saye masse vvhiche done place consecrated god bishop masse haue witness moe prieste thevntruthe three togeather shal appeare solemne feastes requireth seuen fiue three deacon likewise subdeacon minister al cloathed hallowed vestimentes attende vppon stande euery side contrite hartethe beste disshe humble spirite lookinge downewarde kepinge malicious mennethis commaudemes receiuing comunion geuen anacket perteineth minister church solemne feastes geuinge consente sacrifice thus muche beinge declared epistle foloweth immediatly peracta autem consecratione c consecration ended let al communicate wil kepte without churche doores apostle haue ordeined holy churche rome obserueth vvho seeth request receiuinge communion referredvntruthe plaine manifest reade ansvveare priestes deacon subdeacon minister solemne feastes seruinge bishop masse place anacletus speaketh neuer woorde expressely lay people therefore ye deceiue vnlearned reader lie better vnderstandinge decree specially whereas anacletus alleageth apostle ordinaunce ninthe canon apostle considered whiche require vntruthe apostle canon vvritten thus quicun que fideles ingrediutur ecclesia c canone euery ecclesiastical person partaker sacrifice offered excluded communionsee canon apostle onelsse shewe iuste cause contrary reason whereof canon expressed leaste clearkes absteininge communion occasion offence people thereby raise euil suspicion sacrificed though made oblation ought b sarisburie let banket deight saithe hardinge ought let beste disshe made ready good christian reader best wholesomest moste pleasant comfortable disshe table death christe lambe god hath taken awaie sinnes worlde thus christe selfe maister feaste hath willed v dresse dinner doo saith remembraunce likewise paule often ye shal eate breade drinke cuppe corinth ye shal shewe foorthe publishe lordes deathe vntil comme banket therefore outwarde bare sacramente christes body bloude represented vnto v sacramente alleged ambrose de con dist non iste hieronym ad hedibiam breade sacramente passeth belly breade euerlastinge life whiche reliueth substance soule therefore hierome saithe iudaicas fabulas repellamus ascendamus cum domino coenaculum magnum stratum atque mundatum accipiamus ab eo sursum calicem noui testamenti lette v abandonne v iewishe fable set v ascende vp lorde heauen great parlar dreste made cleane aboue let v receiue cuppe newe testamente cyprian de coena domini sense cyprian saithe vident haec sacramenta pauperes spiritu hoc vno contenti ferculo omnes huius mundi delicias aspernantur possidentes christum aliquam huius mundi possidere supellectilem dedignantur poore sprite see sacrametes beinge contented onely disshe despise al deinty fare worlde hauinge possession christe disdeigne possesse worldly substance like sorte speakinge birthe christe saithe thus cyprian de natiuitate christi ea quae licita sunt concessa tangamus circa incunabula saluatoris prima infantiae eius fercula degustemus let v touche thinges lawful v touche standinge aboute cradle saueoure set v taste firste disshe childehoodeaugust psalmum likewise saithe augustine coecus interius panem christum non videt et beatus est hoc non dicit nisi pariter coecus blinde harte within seethe christe breade blessed noman wil saie onlesse one blinde manner feaste hardinge prepareth people seasoned dreste firste vncourteous vnciuile dealinge withdraweth one halfe cuppe nevve testament reserueth seuerally selfe yet woulde make people beleeue haue wholepriuate masse thus doothe hath greattest companie suppe feaste beste furnished otherwise suffereth gheastes stande aluffe consumeth al prouision selfe alone neither deede hath thinge set sauinge onely colde surcharge dead shevves doumbe ceremony poore people heareth nothinge understandeth nothinge eateth nothinge drinketh nothinge tasteth nothinge publishe lordes deathe knowe lordes supper sutche banket pasetes iuggler vsed sometimes calle frendessuidas greate shewe varietie plenetie al manner meates drinkes table fulle gheastes would haue touched thinge vanished suddainely awaie turned nothinge eies ful put vp theire kniues rose ahungred euen thus hardinge feedeth feasteth people god shewes ceremony suffereth meane sterue hungre euen prophete saithe shalbe like dreame hungrie man beholde eateth maketh mery awakte esai soule emptie good menne saithe hardinge withdrawe selues contented presente onely stande receiue sacramente chrysostome saithe sutche good deuoute manchrysost ad ephes homil thou stande doo communicate thou arte vvicked thou arte shamelesse thou arte impudente thou wilte saie vnvvoorthy partaker holy mystery impudens improbus arte thou vnvoorthy partaker praiers thou maiste stande heathen neuer christened gentle reader maiste thou see marueilous change churche god thinge olde time coumpted heathenishe impudencie vvickednesse nowe hardinges newe diuinitie becomme godlinesse greate deuotion butnot seldome god wote foloweth colde asseueration seldome ye saie prieste masse whan none disposed receiued alone hardinge worlde wel seethe woorde gospel appeareth many vntruthes ye care greately saie thus yee tel v seldome prieste receiued alone seldome speake nicely meaneth colde doubteful eloquence specially otherwise hath acquainted voice speake bigge saie prieste vsed daiely commonly doo yee coulde auouche great vntruthe shame saide prieste oftentimes certaine time receiued alone leaste foure three tvvoo sundrie time within space sixe hundred yeeres woorste yee saide benne somwhat seldomme base simple disgraceth whole course pleadinge plaine speache soundeth mutche neuer rather benne parte takinge vpon countenance credite grauitie haue tolde v substantially plainely manner man prieste dwelte name companie saide masse sawe hearde bare witnesse recorde authoritie maie proued matter beinge great sutche antiquitie noman leafte behinde witnesse hardinge former answeare ye bringe v boy girles sicke folke laie people vvemen vpon sutche groundes ye sticke founde priuate masse doubtelesse example might haue seemed stande somme prety steede yf day boy anacletus calixtus vvemen benne priestes prieste bishop euer receiued sacrament alone churche people ye yet hable shewe v one leontius amphilochius basiles masse midnight like folie fable seemeth silence ye vse late reioinder ye contented wisely quietly geue ouer yee saie wee deceiued gratian haue placed calixtus steede anacletus firste al ye confesse gratian greate rabbin father fountaine decree might deceiued verily sutche plainenesse dealinge ye would vouchesaue vse oftener woorthy commendation deede gratian man great readinge smal iudgement allegeth oftetimes knoweth hierome origen cyprian augustine beda ambrose iuuencus vincentius greeke latine newe olde authoritie wherein saiede con dist episcopus de con dist peracta wee deceiued allegeth twoo sundrie place firste vnder name anacletus nexte vnder name calixtus meaninge trowe yf errour one leaste redresse therefore hardinge yf ye looked better vpon booke euer opinion ye haue gratian ye haue founde wee nothinge deceiued haw gratian steede one errour hath made twoo deede true woordes neuer written calixtus side likewise true neuer written anacletus manifestly forged falsified others folowed afterwardeartic diui former replie haue declared large world see wile shiftes menne finde beare erroure firste ye saie woordes spoken priestes deacon subdeacon seruinge prieste masse vpon solemne feastes pardonne hardinge saie truthe verily notwithstandinge solemne tale seemeth ye knowe ye saie maie please remember anacletus whose forged authoritie ye haue alleged bishop rome time peter shortely vpon deathe christe churche euerywhere vnder persecution ful bloude nowe praie euer tolde either office subdeacon holy ministerie greate highe holy day duplex magi duplex principal solemne feastes churche god al time maye wee thinke blessed virgin apostle day keapte highe holy blessed virgin apostle yet aliue though ye none regarde either god selfe yet shame shoulde force foresee aduisedly yee saie greattest folie appeareth shiftinge glostnge woordes saie calixtus anacletus speaketh onely priestes deacon subdeacon neuer woorde expressely laie people therefore ye saie w e deceiue vnlearned reader lie touchinge vncourteous speache weigh none otherwise truthe wilbe hable euermore beare selfe woordes anacletus calixtus touche laie people onely priestes minister gloser selfe neuer either vnskilful impudent saie whereas woordes let al communicate onlesse wilbe remoued churche setteth exposition hoc antiquum est nam hoc hodie relictum videtur arbitrio cuiuslibet de con dist peracta glossa vvas olde manner novve adaies free euery man doo therein vvhat vvil like decree founde vnder name apostle canon quicun que fideles ingrediuntur ecclesiamanacletus calixtus scripturas audiunt non autem persuerant orationecanon apostol canon nec sanctam communionem percipiunt velut qui ordinis perturbationem commouent ab ecclesiae comunione arceri conuenit many onely priestes minister faitheful comme churche heare scripture continewe praiers receiue holy communion let put communion churche menne woorke breache order likewise noted margin vpon canon canon apost margine omnes olim qui intererant communicabant olde time al vvere presente communicate councel antioche decreed thus omnes qui ingrediuntur ecclesiam indifferent iudgement hereof owne knowledge conscience whether v twoo hath deceiued reader lie apologie cap diuision ouer people commeth holy communion sacrament ought geue bothe kindes bothe christe hath commaunded apostle euery place haue ordeined al ancient father catholique bishoppes haue folowed doothe contrarie gelasius saithed consec dist comperio committeth sacrilege therefore wee saie apostle thatvntruthes three togeather boldely presumed neither christe euer commaunded apostle ordeined al ancient father obserued sacrament geuen people none otherwise vnder bothe kindes onely negatiue folie shal neuer proue affirmatiue shal ye neuer able proue touchinge whole pointe litle ye alleage celasius maketh concerninge masse omitted lacke companie communicate sacramentally feblenesse sidean vnshamefaste sclaunderouse lie haue violently thruste quite forbidden holy communion onlesse ye meane owne schismaticall mutable polluted communion sparke shame harted liynge ye woulde neuer impute vnto v god dothe knowe worlde vnwittingevntruthe sensible grosse man maie feele vvith finger muche howe often earnestly catholike churche exhorteth child prepare themselues receiue theirvntruthe learned father euer called sacramente god maker maker though people englande late yeeres resorted commonly thereto yet deuotion christen folke countrie base almaigne fraunce italy spaine sundrie christen prouinces feruent frequentinge holy communion ye sawe ye would ashamed sclaunderous reporte let wise men good men iudge whether churcherobbers ye vnshamefaste liers b sarisburie nothinge answeared amisse replie nothinge hardinge onely vouchesaue calle v sclaund rous reporter vnshamefast liersinstitution bothe kindes lordes supper schismatical mutable pollutted communion sufficient mater needeth farther proufe whole matter hardinge saithe hath sufficiently answeared iewel hath answeared graunte sufficiently mater selfe wil declare maie wise forgeate twoo shorte treaty jewel conteininge onely twoo fourtie litle leaues paper hath sente v ouer published threescore foure notable greate vntruthes whereof thinke hath greate cause mutche glorie saithe sacramente shoulde deliuered peple bothe kindes neither christe euer commaunded apostle euer ordeined thus hardinge saithe onely bicause liketh thus saie yet owne catholique doctours chiefe champion side saie far otherwise de miss publica proroganda gerardius lorichius saithe ipsius sacramenti institutio vult vt omnes vna manducemus bibamus institution sacramente selfe willeth vvee eate drinke al togeather ruardus tapper deane louaine saithe thus cassander vira que specie pa habito respectu ad sacramentum eius que perfectionem magi conueniret sub vtra que specie fieri communionem quam sub altera tantum hoc enim magi consonum est eius institutioni integritati refectioni corporali imo exemplo christi patrum primitiuae ecclesiae consideration vnto sacramente perfection conuenient communion ministred vnder bothe kindes vnder one alone agreable institution fulnesse thereof outwarde refection body yea example bothe christe also father primitiue churche certainely woordes christe drinke ye al doo remembrance plaine woordes commaundemente institution therefore chrysostome saithe et panechrysost corin homi calice christus dixit hoc facite meam commemorationem christe bothe breade also cuppe saide doo remembrance mee likewise theophylactus tremendus calix pari cunctis conditione traditus esttheophylact corinth paschasius reuerende cuppe equal manner deliuered al whereas christe saithe drinke ye al paschasius make mater plainer putteth thereto woordes tam ministri quam reliqui credentes wel minister reste faitheful like manner augustine saithe de con dist quia passus simul hoc sumimus simul bibimus quia simul viuimus vvee receiue togeather vvee drinke togeather bicause liue togeather notwithstandinge promisse constancie made contrarie yet truste hardinge courtesie wil beleeue either chrysostome augustine theophylacte paschasius lorichius tapper nevve doctours olde owne others otherwise fully determined beleeue noman reason noman beleeue perhaps wil saie notwithstandinge christes woordes plaine yet force sufficient binde v euer writeth cardinal cusanus scripturae ad tempus adaptanturnicola cusanus epist ad bohaemos varie intelliguntur ita vt vno tempore secundum currentem ecclesiae ritum exponantur mutato vera ritu iterum sententia mutetur scripture applied state diuers time taken diuers sens one time expounded accordinge currente order churche order churche beinge changed sense scripture like wise changed augustine saithe heretiques manichee expendunt istaaugust contra epist parmeniani lib cap hilar de trinitaae lib non statera aequa diuinarum scripturarum sed statera dolosa consuetudinum suarum weighe mater equal balance diuine scripture ye deceiteful balance ovvne customes ye like sorte tiques hilarie saith qui ea quae scripta sunt negas quid testat nisi vt ea quae non scripta sunt credas seeinge thou deniest thinges written scripture remaineth thou must beleeue sutche thinges written scripture haue menne institution theire halfe communion ordeined commaunded apostle ancient doctour holy father euer vsed itm hardinge pag b leo sermon de quadragesima hardinge selfe forced confesse reporte leo firste knowen diuisers authours olde heretiques called manichee sutche institution antiquitie doctrine sprange firste heresie founded heretiques touchinge gelasius haue already former replie saide mutche vnto seemed sufficient woordes plaine yenough selfe neede commentariede co dist comperimus aut integra sacramenta percipiant aut ab integris ceantur quia diuisio vnius eiusdem que mysterij sine grandi
