sacramentes leste hardinge shoulde thinke take greate aduantage woordes thus vttered others side haue often donne augustine moste plaine wise expoundeth si ad ipsas re visibiles quibus sacramenta tractanturaugust de baptismo contra donatist lib cap animum conferamus quis nesciat ea esse corruptibiles si autem ad id quod per illas re agitur quis non videat non posse corrumpi wee beholde visible creature breade wine water wherein sacramentes ministred seeth corruptible wee consider thinges wrought thereby seeth cannot corrupted iudge thou good christian reader childishely quarrelles sought againste v without cause mystical catholique eares hardinge hath cannot abide phrase speaches anciente father hardinge man presse owne woordesvvhat presence christe sacrament doo defender acknovvledge demaunde maner presence ye teache affirminge christe selfe presently geuen weene ye would founde haltinge saie ye christe presently geuen vnto v breade vvine sacramente christe present present whiche ye muste needes graunt tell v howe present accordinge substance body grace accordinge maiestie godhed first shiftes euer ye seeke ye wil graunt therefore owne apostle martin luther fowle defiance maisters zuinglius occolampadius caluine disciple ioachimus vvestphalus epinus pomeran shusius brentius illyricus many others ye knowe ye wil saie present grace presente al good men onely sacrament ministred also al timesabsente body againe ye make good faithe receiue body bloud faith receiue grace merites death suffered body sheddinge bloud body bloude selfe veryvntruthes tvvo togeather properly substace vvee receiue reade ansvveare substance body bloude tel v faithe vntruthes tvvo togeather properly substace vvee receiue reade ansvveare properly truely speake sate faithe made presentthe body christe receiued faithe onely receiue furthermorevve ansvveare peeuishe question haue ye answeare question wee receiue body bloud christe verely faithe ye saie demaude whether receiue faithe onely without body office body thoffice body required receiuinge christes body sacrament christe selfevntruthe christe meante suche thing appeareth father certainely meante el obeyed disciple commaundement whome saide supper take eate body likewise cuppe take drinke whiche cannot donne seruice body hereof foloweth body verely present receiued faithe onely thus proue owne doctrinea sophistical childishe cauil reade ansvveare receiued present present bread vvine ye saie ergo receiued bread vvine conclude breade vvine faithe onely vvil ye geue leaue saie thinke verely seemeth vaine ianglinge paule saieth suche like ye vnderstande ye speake whereof ye affirme b sarisburie sense wee maie truely saie christe either presente v absente v mater doubteful dangerous answeared onlesse hardinge haue foregotten article creede thus wee taught beeeue christe ascended heaue fitte right hande god whiche article augustine expoundeth thus august epist ad dardan noli dubitare ibi nunc esse hominem christum iesum vnde venturus est memoriter que recole fideliter tene christianam confessionem quoniam resurrexit mortuis ascendit ad coelum sedet ad dextram patris nec aliunde quam inde venturus est ad viuos mortuo que iudicandos doubte thou christe jesus man nowe whence shal comme heare thou wel minde faithefully beleeue christian confession christe risen againe deade ascended heauen sitteth right hande father shal comme againe thence vvhere el judge quicke deade againe saithe homo secundum corpus coelo estaugust iohan tracta de loco migrat cum ad alium locum venerit eo loco vnde venit non est christe man accordinge body heauen passeth place place vvhen commeth place place vvhence came likewise againe secundum praesentiam maiestatisaugust iohan tractat semper habemus christum nobiscum secundum praesentiam carnis recte dictum est discipulis autem non semper habebitis accordinge presence maiestie wee haue christe euermore v accordinge presence fleashe true christe saide disciple shal haue alvvaies vvith saithe holy father martyr vigiliusvigilius contra eutychen lib del filius secundum humanitatem suam recessit nobis secundum diuinitatem ait ecce ego vobiscum sum vsque ad consummationem saeculi sonne god accordinge manhoode gonne v accordinge godhed saithe beholde vntil ende worlde againe et nobiscum est non est nobiscum quia quos reliquit humanitate non deseruit diuinitate christe v yet vvith v vvhome leafte touchinge humaine nature body touchinge godhead leafte againe verbum vbi que est caro autem eius vbi que non est woorde godhed christe euerywhere fleashe body eueryvvhere saithe cyril etsi corpore abfuerocyrill iohannem li ca praesens tamen ero vt deus although absente touchinge body yet god wil presente leaue infinite number learned catholique father faithe eateth haue written like origen matthae homi origen saithe thus secundum diuinitatis naturam non peregrinatur nobis peregrinatur secundum dispensationem corporis quod suscepit christe accordinge godhed stranger v stranger accordinge dispensation body receiued thus christe bothe absente presente presente maiestie absente body sense chrysostome saithe chrysost corinth homil semper nobiscum est christus neque enim nisi nobiscum esset christus superesset ecclesia christe euermore presente v onlesse presente churche god coulde continewe hardinge saithe howe yee make good faithe wee receiue body bloude faithe wee receiue grace c question shoulde rather haue benne demaunded augustine learned doctours ancient father churche augustin iohanem tract tertull de resurrectione carnis coulde augustine saie quid para dentem ventrem crede manducasti preparest thou thy toothe thy belly beleeue thou haste eaten coulde tertullian saie christus auditu deuorandus est intellectu ruminandus est fide digerendus est christe muste deuoured hearinge chevved vnderstandinge digested faithe coulde origen saie origen matthae tracta cyprian de coena domini sanguis tesamenti infusus est corda nostra bloude testamente povvred harte howe coulde cyprian saie esus huius carnis est quaedam auiditas quoddam defiderium manendi christo quod est esca carni hoc est animae fides non dentes ad mordendum acuimus sed fide sincera panem sanctum frangimus eatinge fleashe certaine greedinesse certaine desire tarrie christe meate vnto fleashe faithe vnto soules wee sharpen teeth bite withal vvith pure faithe vvee breake holy breade shorte howe could augustine saie august iohan tracta credere christum hoc est manducare panem viuum beleeue christe eatinge breade life againe nolite parare fauces sed cor prepare mouthes eate breade prepare harte like ancient catholique father hardinge haue saide ye make good faithe receiue christes body bloude thus witnesse thus write thus saie therefore onlesse hardinge finde vntruthe theire woordes make good force onwarde mater saithe properly truely speake howe wee eate christes body faithe might haue pleased hardinge remember phrase eate christe drinke christe digeste christe fedde vvith christe dvvelle christe cladde vvith christe grafte christe like plaine ordinarie vsual common speaches mystically couertly vttered vnder figure thereby geeue v vnderstande christe spiritual meate spiritual drinke spiritual sustenance spiritual house spiritual robe spiritual stocke therefore augustine saithe nisi manducaueritis carnem filij hominis sanguinem biberitis non habebitis vitam vobisaugust de doctrina christiana lib ca facinus vel flagitium videtur iubere figura ergo est praecipiens passioni domini esse communicandum suauiter que vtiliter recondendum memoria quod pro nobis caro eius crucifixa vulnerata sit onlesse ye eate fleashe sonne man drinke bloude ye shal haue life seemeth woordes commaunde v doo horrible wickednesse horrible mater eate mannes fleashe drinke mannes bloude therefore figure manner speache commaundinge v partaker christes passion comfortably laie vp minde fleashe crucified wounded sake saith gratian de conse dist specie touching quidam improbabiliter exponunt carnis sanguinis veritatem ipsam earundem rerum efficientiam id est remissionem peccatorum touchinge woordes truthe christes fleashe bloude somme menne vnaptely vnderstande thereby effecte force christes fleashe bloude saie remission sinnes augustine saithe lauerunt stolas suas sanguine agniaugu apoc homil hoc est gratia dei per christum washte theire cote bloude lambe saie grace god christe grace flowinge christes body vpon crosse geuen faithful ministration holy mystery oftentimes beareth name christes body grounde substance sacrament euer partetaker grace also partetaker christes body therefore augustine saith cum essent omnibus communia sacramentaaug psal non communis erat omnibus gratia quae est virtu sacramentorum whereas sacramentes common al yet grace thereof common al povver strength sacramentes likewise ambrose similitudinem quidem accipis sacramentum sed verae naturae gratiam virtutem que consequerisambros de sacramen li ca yee take sacramente representation remembrance ye obteine thereby grace povver christes nature harding againe moueth needelesse question vvee demaunde saithe whether wee receiue body christe faithe onely without body office body childe might soone hable assoile reddle rabanus maurus saithe rabanus maurus lib ca alleged sacramentum ore percipitur virtute vero sacramenti interior homo satiatur sacramente receiued bodily mouth vvithe vertue sacramente whiche body christe inner man body soule filled saithe augustine cum videbitis filium hominis alcendentem vbi erat prius certe vel tunc videbitisaugu iohan tracta quia non eo modo quo putatis erogat corpus suum certe vel tunc intelligetis quia gratia eius non consumitur morsibus ye shal see sonne man ascendinge thither leaste ye shal see geeueth body sutche sorte imagine shal vnderstande grace consumed vvith bitte moutheaugu iohan tracta againe saithe qui manducat intus non foris qui manducat corde non qui premit dente eateth christes body vvardly eateth sacramente outvvardly eateth body christe selfe harte presseth sacramente vvith toothe hardinge argueth farther christes body receiued presente presente bread vvine ye saie ergo receiued bread vvine conclude bread vvine faithe onely hardinge better considered rule olde sophistrie might soone haue seene wantes deformity theis reason emongest child called ignoratio elenchi whiche simplest fallax al reste true parte either hande mouthe faith onely receiueth body christe body christe offered represented vnto faithe meane sacramentes wee speake sutche instrumentes receiuinge selfe within v hardinge answeareth sacramentes external instrumentes wholy without v baptisme notwithstandinge wee haue christe presente parte onely faithe yet augustine saithe saide habemus christum presenti per baptismatis sacramentum wee haue christe presently sacramente baptisme thus christe presente vnto v parte onely grace parte onely faithe sacramentes onely certainetie doctrine meane outwarde instrumentes moue sens light childishe errour haue saide called ignoratio elenchi therefore seemeth procede ignorance hardinge haue better examined force argumentes thus suddainely sente abroade touchinge mater selfe bodily mouthe faithe alone receiueth embraceth christes body augustine saithe panis iste interioris hominis quaerit esuriem augu iohan tracta qui credit eum manducat breade requireth hunger inner man beleeuth eateth body tangling saie hardinge auncient catholique doctrine churche god wee wel assured knowe certainely wee saie touching certainetie doctrine point haue briefely touched former replie mutche thought might seeme sufficiete somme hold christes body passeth stomake somme entreth onely mouthe goeth somme others saie quam cito specie terutur dentibus de conse dist tribus gradib glossa tam cito coelum rapitur corpus christi soone fourmes breade grated teeth streight waie body christe caught vp heauen saithe mouse eateth body christe saithe nay mouse cannot eate peter lombarde grande maister al schoole piteously confounded case cannot imagine saie4 senten dist selfe moued question quid igitur sumit mu vel quid manducat mouse receiueth eateth answeareth deus nouit novve god knovveth parte cannot tel sutche doctours hardinge sutche doctrine therefore conclude owne woordes appeareth agreemente answeares ye vnderstande thinges ye speake affirme denie ye knowe hardinge ye procede foorth ye geue warninge reader take though ye held transubstantiation ye speake thereof best becommeth scoffinge sprite callinge dreame men later time whereof coulde neuer yet agree within selues whiche woordes eloquence hath set foorth spite lieing albeit terme transubstantiation bemarke antiquitie councel vvas holden tvveluehundred fifteene yeeres christe greater antiquitietransubsta tiatio councel laterane vnder innocentius thirde holy ghoste father deuised fitte opening truthe impugned berengarians yet doctrine thereof lesse auncient gospel selfe maugre malice deuil al sacramentaries olde truthe shal preuaile whiche taught whiche breade mystical blessinge beas mysterie sacramente substance othervvise greate vntruthe made christes body whiche wine made bloude haue wheres sufficiently declared churche hathvntruthe manifeste shal appeare alwaies hereupon perfitely accorded touchinge substance though certaine schoolemen scholastical disputation oftentimes victorie sought faith impugned discussion somme schoole point haue without preiudice belefe disagreede b sarisburie scoffes spite lie ye speake hardinge let haue hath beste deserued verily without greate wronge cannot lose touching new fatasie transubstantiation whether dreame whether dreamer selues euer yet hable rightly expoud theire owne dreame appeareth partely owne confession ye graunte name terme thereof neuer knowen hearde al worlde vntil late councel laterane holde rome vnder pope innocentius thirdetransubstantiation nevve doubteful yeere lorde thousande two hundred fifteeneanno time kinge iohn kinge england neuer longe churche god hable wel stande without transubstantiation al ye tel v notwithstandinge newnesse name yet neuerthelesse doctrine thereof hath stil continewed churche hathe benne euermore receiued confessed al faitheful maugre malice diuel al sacramentaries ancient gospel christe selfe yet side ye cofesse plainely space twelue hundred yeeres roman wiste name calle mutche thinke lawful auouthe affirme liste true false without controlmente whereas ye saie late faithe auncient gospel knowe somme beste learned owne side haue saide nevve pointe religion therefore auncient seeme make doubteful conclusion therefore faithe alcutberbertue tonstallus de eucharistia lib pag tonstal thereof saithe thus de modo quo id fieret fortasse satius erat curiosum quen que suae relinquere coniecturae sicut liberu fuit ante concilium lateranum manner meane howe might whether transubstantiation otherwise perhaps benne better leaue euery man woulde curious owne coniecture councel laterane vvas leafte libertie saie auncient gospel tonstal saith new came twelue hundred yeeres gospel saie catholique faith tonstal saithe coniecture gheasse whiche differeth mutch dreame saide late councel laterane noman vvas bounde beleeue maie please consider indifferently selfe leafte libertie tonstal saithe man either receiue refuse thought good could catholique faithe catholique faithe saie maugre malice diuel howe could many hundred yeeres leafte libertie hereof ye saie ye haue written sufficiently otherwheres al graunt bookes knowen woulde haue written nomore truethe ye might haue saued mutche time spared somme paper shal mislike againe aduisedly viewe ye shal finde firste diuision thereof three greate vntruthes togeather al within space foureteene line nowe whether fantasie transubstantiation dreame constancie certainetie thereof agreemente doctours founded firste maie appeare petrus lombardus onely general al campsenten dist si autem c herof vseth speaches quibusdam ita videtur quida dicunt quida tradunt quidam concedunt alij putauerunt substantiam ibi panis vini remanere somme menne iudge thus somme saie thus somme haue vvritten thus somme graunte somme others haue thought thus substance breade wine remaineth stil strange agreemente learned menne specially case catholique faith hereto saithe peter lombarde selfe taketh vpon iudge determine doubtes resolued howe agreethe iudgemente selfe answeare si autem quaeritur qualis sit illa conuersio formalis substantialis alterius generis definire non sufficio question moued manner conuersion change whether fourme substance somme sorte hable discusse wee maie see blinde leadeth blinde setteth selfe al reste transubstantiation nevve douteful woulde taken guide knoweth sette owne foot gabriel biel saithe quomodo sit ibi corpus christi vtrum per conuersionem alicuius ipsum sine conuersine incipiat esse corpus christi cum pane manentibus substatia accidentibus panis non inuenitur expressum canone bibliae howe body christe whether changinge somme thinge gabriel canonem lect christes body beginne togeather breade substance accidentes breade remaininge stil vvithout changinge founde expreste canon bible leaue innocentius scotus sundrie others scholastical doctours theire doubteful dreames gheasses like pourpose whether dreames leue hardinge consider verily innocentius saithe fuetunt qui dicerent quod sicut post consecrationem vera panis remanent accidentia ita panis remanet vera substantia somme saide consecration remaine accidentes fourmes bread likewise substance breade remaineth stil iudgemente durandus although selfe holde yet wil haue wise condemned nowe hardinge dissemble beleeue constantly saye cannot thinges stande without preiudice whole obiection fully answeared saie theophylactes reason standeth thus god cannot eaten bicause cannot comprehended either vvith eies vvith teethe christes body maie eaten eate god therefore muste nature incorporate god maiestie god far surmounteth capacitie man selfe nature godhedde mortal creature hable conceiue onely face hebr sight iesus christe sonne god therefore paule saithe christus est howe doest thou touche god answeareth bicause woorde became fleashe augu iohan tracta dwelte v againe saithe si christus sic veniret vt deus non agnosceretur christe came god noman coulde knovve gregorie saithe grego ezech lib homil dominus murus nobis non esset si forinsecus non fuisset intus no non protegeret si exterius non appareret lorde wal vnto v benne fourme man coulde inwardely defende v outvvardely appeared eccles hierar cap saithe dionysius si cupimus communionem habere cum deo oportet no diuinissimam illius vitam quam egit carne intueri wee desire haue communion god wee muste beholde heauenly life leadde fleashe thus god god maiestie selfe wee vnderstande wee conceiue wee knovve saie wee haue fruition augustin psalm vvee eate therefore augustine saithe iesum christum secundum id quod erat verbum apud deum paruuli non capiunt quomodo ergo capiunt qui lac capiunt iesum christum inquit hunc crucifixum suge quod pro te factus est cresces ad id quod est litle one vnderstande iesus christe accordinge woorde father doo receiue receiue milke paule saithe receiue iesus christe crucified sucke thinge vvas made thee thou shalt growe thus holy mystery represented vnto v diuine nature christe whereby equal father death humilitie whereby abased selfe made equal vnto v spiritual meate drinke onely feedinge soule thereof paule saithe1 cor often ye shal eate breade drinke cuppe ye shal publishe diuine nature godhedde lordes deathe vntil comme saithe hesychius hesych leut lib cap ambrosi cor comedimus hunc cibum sumentes eius memoriam passionis wee eate foode receiuinge memorie glorie passion saith ambrose quia morte domini liberati sumus huius rei memores ededo potando carnem sanguinem quae pro nobis oblata sunt significamus bicause wee deliuered lordes deathe beinge mindeful thereof eatinge drinkinge vve signifie represente fleashe bloude vvere offered vp v thus holy mystery wee eate drinke sacramente christe crucified humilitie fleashe diuine nature godhed christes body geeueth life maiestie cannot represented expressed sacramentes al vaine loste laboure hardinge earnestly proue christes body quickeneth geueeth life wee knowe wee confesse itiohan wee feele christe selfe saithe breade life eateth breade shal liue euer talke empeacheth noman selfe tel v woulde haue holden article faithe onely wicked man without faith also doumbe creature voide reason maie receiue body christe substantially verily deede thus diuide sunder christes body sprite contrarie theophylacte al ancient father christe selfe ye saie maie really receiued vvithout life wee saie ambros de benedictionib patriarch cap ambrose qui accipit hunc panem non moritur morte peccatoris quia hic panis est remissio peccatorum vvho eateth breade sacramente christes body christes body selfe diethe death sinner breade remission sinnes wee saye augustine qui carnem domini non sumit non habet vitam qui eam sumit habet vitamaugu iohan tracta hanc vtique aeternam receiueth fleashe lorde hath life receiueth hath life euerlasting againe wee saie augustineaugu iohan tracta eodem huius rei sacramentum de mensa dominica sumitur quibusdam ad vitam quibusdam ad mortem re vero ipsa cuius sacramentum est omni homini ad vitam nulli ad exitium quicunque eius particeps fuerit sacramente christes body receiued lordes table somme vnto life somme vnto death thinge selfe body christe whereof sacramente al menne vnto life noman vnto deathe soeuer shalbe partetaker somme declaration hereof appeareth witnesse anciente learned doctours father wee really corporally ioined vnited vnto christe onely mystery holy supper also faithe baptisme sprite god loue way faithe augustine saith thusaugust epist per fidem adcorporamur iesu christo domino nostro faithe vvee incorporate christe iesu lorde againe qui venit ad augu iohan tracta incorporatur mihi commeth vnto incorporate chryso epist ad rom hom chryso epist ad colos hom chrysostome saith quid nobis esse non vult omnibus modis no sibi conglutinans coniungens wil christe vnto v al manner meanes cleaueth fasteneth selfe vnto v againe plainer sorte saithe dominum ipsum amplecteris commisceris subuectus coniungeris corpori illi quod sursum sedet coelis thou embraceste lorde selfe arte mingled vvith beinge benea arte ioiued body sitteth heauen aboue like manner writteth sacramente baptisme chryso epist ad ephe hom quomodo ex carne eius sumus ex ossibus eius quemadmodum ille fine virili congressu natus est ex spiritu sancto ita no illud efficimur lauacro wee fleash bone answeareth christe borne holy ghoste without knowledge man euen fonte baptisme vvee made fleashe bone saithe leoleo de natiuitate domi sermo sicut dominus factus est caro nostra nascendo ita no facti sumus ipsius caro renascendo lorde made fleash borne vvee made fleashe wee newe borne saith hieromehieronym viro perfecta de carne eius sumus de ossibus eius ipse enim est caput corporis ecclesiae wee fleashe bone heade body quodammodo whiche churche thus harding wee ioined togeather temp ared christe onely holy mystery also sacramente baptisme faith chrysostome saithechrysostom cor hom ne simpliciter teneamus christum sed etiam illi conglutinemur nam si quicquam secesserimus ab eo perimus let v onely holde christe also let v faste glevved vnto wee falle thinge wee vtterly loste muste wee therefore conclude hardinge vvater baptisme transubstantiate parte substaunce thereof remaininge stil christes body really grossely presente sacramente haue imagined ye finde greate fanlte oecolampadius corruptinge ye saie sounde doctrine theophylacte forged quodammodo breakinge congruitie latine speache puttinge thirde personne place firste latine congruitie wil saie nothinge learned thinke oecolampadius skilful bothe latine tongue greeke hardinge forginge quodammodo doo wel finde faulte theophylacte selfe forgerie selfe hath likewise forged quodammodo maie called corruption hath also corrupted owne doctrine traijciens quodammodo manducauit christe killed paule voice cyrill ad calosyrium sorte eate swalowinge body finde ye faulte cyrillus writing thus decebat ergo eum quodammodo vniri corporibus nostris meete sorte christe shoulde vnited vnto body chrysost matthae homil chrysostome writinge like christus no secum vnam vt ita dicam massam reducit christe mouldeth v maie saie one lumpe selfe saie ye like holy father sacramentaries heretiques saie ye augustine cyril chrysostome theire forged quodammodo corrupted sounde catholique doctrine churche woulde ye rather better facinge colouringe doctrine wee shoulde strike oute forged quodammodo amende thus qui manducat reipsa miscetur mihi transelementatur woulde ye haue v beleeue wee wholy thorowly changed christes body wee made christe god man homil sumus alter alterius membra vvee member one cyrillus saithe no inter no vnimur corporaliter wee corporally vnited togeather emonge selues chrysostome saithe si quis exuat impudicarum mulierum anima videbit malum daemonem illis admixtum man wil open soules vnchaste filthy wemen shal see diuel tempered togeather mingled thinke hardinge like speaches holy father cannot stande without transubstantiation real presence godly substantially deede theire body ioined togeather vngodly verily vnited mingled diuel might rather haue remembred touchinge vnspeakeable vnitie bitweene christe faitheful saie bitweene heade body cyprian de coena domini cyprian writeth thus nostra christi coniunctio nec miscet persona nec vnit substantias sed affectus consociat confoederat voluntates coniunction bitweene v christe neither mingleth personnes vniteth substance ioineth affection knitteth vvilles likewise saithe cyrilcyrill iohan lib cap initium fundamentum sanctificatione christus est per fidem scilicet non aliter hoc enim modo nobis habitat beginninge fundation holinesse christe faithe meane none othervvise sorte christe dwelleth v likewise lyra one owns late doctours quantum per sacramentum eucharistiae unimur deonicol lyra iohan cap viuimus spiritualiter nostra autem vnio apud ipsum est per fidem dilectionem far foorth wee vnited vnto god sacramente thankesgeeuinge wee liue spiritually vnion bitvveene v faithe loue expoundinge woordes paulenicol lira cor qui adhaeret deo vnus spiritus est eleueth vnto god one sprite god saithe vnus non secundum rem sed secundum affectionem one sprite god one deede accordinge truthe one loue accordinge affection yet somme farther remoue fantaste real presencechryso epist ad colos hom chrysostome saithe alleged dominum ipsum amplecteris cum illo commisceris subuectus coniungeris corpori illi quod sursum sedet coelis thou embraceste lorde selfe thou arte tempered beinge carried vp faithe affection thou arte ioined body fitteth heauen leo de ascensione domini sermon like sense saithe leo christus ineffabili modi coepit esse diuinitate praesentior qui factus est humanitate loginquior christe vnspeakable meanes beganne neare v diuinitie made v humanitie doubte harding ye maye easily see hitherto real presence weakely proued hardinge againe maruel face ye dare allege theophylacte younot figure fleashe selfe lorde transubstantiatio moste euident woordes ouerthroweth figuratiue tropical energical doctrine touchinge blessed sacramente saith vppon sixthe chapter iohn marke wel breade whiche eaten v mysteriesvntruthe manifestely affirmeth figure vvordes onely figure ergo graunteth figure onely certaine figure lordes fleash fleash selfe lorde saide breade shal geue figure fleashe fleashe breade secrete woordes mystical blessinge comminge vppon holy ghoste changed fleashe lorde b sarisburie theophylacte saithe breade onely certaine figure lordes fleashe fleashe selfe lorde obiection former replie many wheres answeared wee graunte breade bare naked figure waie sacramente mysterie body christe selfe water baptisme emptie figure bloude christe christes bloude selfe bicause sacramente christes bloudebernard super missus est hom augusti contra maximi lib therefore bernarde saithe lauemur sanguine eius let v wasshed water bloude christe augustine geueth general rule haue often reported sacramentis videndum est non quid sint sed quid significent sacramentes wee muste consider vvhat thei substace nature vvhat thei signifie tertullian saith christus acceptum panem tertull contra marcion lib discipulis suis distributum corpus suum illum fecit dicedo hoc est corpus meum hoc est figura corporis mei christe hauing taken breade hauinge deliuered disciple made body saieinge body saie figure body appointe corruptible creature vse make effectual instrumente sutche high hidden mystery woorke mortal man onely power woorkinge holy ghoste shal farther appeare nexte clause mine answeare woordes ambrose beda saithe thusbeda octauis epiphaniae panis vini creatura sacramentum carnis saguinis christi ineffabili spiritus sanctificatione transfertur creature breade wine vnspeakeable sanctification holy ghoste changed real body bloude sacramente body bloude christe hardinge neither maketh ambrose whiche also ye bringe better vvoulde god ye woulde admitte vmpeere pointe verily booke chapter ye referre v vnto disputeth pourpose againste though foresawe time churche shoulde troubled heresie sacramentaries tu forte dicis c perhappes thou sayestde sacr li ca de pane consecration breade common breade breade woordes sacramentes soone consecration commeth breade made fleashe christe let v auouche howe whiche breade maye body christe consecration woordes speaches consecration made euen lorde iesus euer el saide meaneth masse praisegeuinge god prayinge people kinges reste vvhen prieste commeth consecration honorable sacramente vseth owne woordes vvoordes christe therefore woorde christe maketh sacramentegod maie vvel omnipotete without either transubstantiation real presence vvhat woorde christe soothely woorde whereby al thinges made lorde commaunded heauen made lorde commaunded earthe made lorde commaunded sea made lorde commaunded euery creature engendred seest thou howe woorkeful woorde christeoperatori vvordes alleaged defender vvel greate power woorde lorde iesus thinges beganne whiche howe mutche woorkefuls ambrose saith bread vvine thinges vvere co secration notvvithstandinge novve made sacramente vt sint quae erant aliud commutentur thinges whiche chaunged thinge sir defender constrewe wordes sense draw foorth workinge power lordes woorde thinges haue beinge whiche nothinge beinge al heauen earthe sea howe mutche power hath woorke thinges whiche beinge nowe also haue beinge changed thinge aliud vntrue exposition vvere contrarie ambrose vvere thinges vvere thinge substaunce phrase signified substantial chaungingeomnipotente povver whiche aptly called transubstantiation praie good sirthe elementes consecration haue beinge saieth elementes meane breade vvine passe quite awaie go nothinge though belie v saie god forbid vve saie consecration fonde folio vvhat haue thinges vvhen e substance gonne theselsesame whereby former substance excluded body bloude lorde againe saye ambrose aliud commutantur chaunged thinge foloweth thereof good logike ergo vvil argumente holde schole verbe passiue beinge resolueda truthe modestie sunt commutata ergo sunt whiche ceasseth goeth nothinge ye cannot properly saye chaunged rather ended perisheth nowe syr reporte euery man hath sense whether maie lawfully geue menti manner sake maye vse italian terme chalenge plaine termes lye vtteringe vntruthe vppon holy doctours ambrose specially speakinge englishe translation selfe allowed thus saide plainely whiche ambrose saithe breade vvine remaine stil yet chaunged thinge zeale moueth saie beyonde modestie natural disposition vvhat iuggling lieing falshed falsefieinge wickednes falsaries neither saieinge wherewith defender belyeth ambrose al onely false contrary catholike faithe also absurde vnreasonable foolishe breade vvine remaine stil consecration howe chaunged thinge b sarisburie hardinge onlesse ye made ambrose prophete ye thought coulde handesomely haue serued tourne prophesied far sawe wee shal see hereafter verily heresie imagine needed greately sprite prophesie behalfe foretolde v newe heresie comme rather tolde v owne heresie presente doubtelesse woordes wee reprote owne ambrose saithe omnipotente povver vvoorde wherewith god made heauen earthe omnipotente povver woorde vseth nowe consecration sacramente therefore saithe hardinge muste needes geathered meante transubstantiation real presence without newe fantasy god coulde omnipotente maye wel answeare menne ambrose vpon like occasion sommetime answeared wilful blindenesse iewesambros de noe arca atramentum vident spiritum dei non vident see inke letter written sprite god see euen hardinge others side weigh woordes ambrose sense meaninge weigh certainely god sheweth omnipotente povver wel sacramente baptisme sacramente thankesgeuinge haue saide sommewhat occasion offered former replie harding leo saithe thus articulo diuision leo natiuitate domini sermon chrysosto iohan homil christus originem quam sumpsit vtero virginis posuit fonte baptismatis dedit aqua quod dedit matri christe laide fonte baptisme beginninge tooke virgin wombe gaue preeminence vvater gaue mother euen chrysostome angeli qui adfuerunt baptismo tam inenarrabilis operis modum minime possunt enarrare adfuerunt tantum viderunt nihil tamen operati sunt sed pater tantum filius spiritus sanctus angel presente baptisme h ble vtter manner vnspeakeable vvoorke presente onely sawe nothinge onely father sonne holy ghoste likewise saithe chrysost iohan homil ex spiritu sensibili aqua omnia haec admirabilia humanam excedentia cogitationem exoriuntur al vvoonderful woorkes wrought baptisme far excedinge thought man springe sprite sensible water thus holy father vsed oftentimes auance magnifie holy mystery better bringe theire hearer deepe inwarde consideration sameaugust ad bonifaciu epist therefore augustine saithe sacramenta tantae rei non nisi eiusdem rei vocabulo nuncuparunt expressed sacramenta greate thinge none otherwise name thinge paule saithe1 cor pachymer cap hierarch germanus de corpor sangui christi chrysostom psalm rocke vvas christe saithe haue otherwheres alleged oile christe manna erat christus qui descendit de coelo manna rained wildernesse vvas christe came downe heauen saithe chrysostome reportinge storie dauid accipiens aquam allatam bibere noluit sed semetipsum reprehendit domino eam libauit non enim aqua erat sed sanguis dauid receiuinge vvater menne gotten greate daunger middes theire enimies woulde drinke founde faulte selfe powred vnto lorde vvas vvater bloude beseche thee2 reg good christian reader marke wel woordes storie cleare deede onely cuppe water nothinge el yet chrysostome saith vvas bloude vvas vvater dayes daunger thus saie people instructed wel acquainted phrase manner speache knewe meaninge taught rocke oile manna wildernesse onely sacramentes christe notwithstandinge called thy name christe yet deede substance christe therefore maye answeare hardinge herein augustine sommetime answeared pelagian heretiquesaugust contra iulianum lib vobis pelagianis nondum litigantibus securius loquebantur patres de articulis pelagians beganne quarrel father doctours spake without feare freely article athanasius saithe arian heretiquesathanasi contra arian sermon incorporalia corporaliter excipientes quae probe dictum erant interpretationibus deprauauerunt takinge spiritual thinges corporal fleashely meaninge doothe hardinge felowes theire interpretation haue depraued thinges rightly spoken ambrose saithe bread wine sunt quae erant aliud mutantur remaine vvere changed thinge nowe filde woonne hardinge bloweth maigne triumphe saithe sir defender construe vvoordes soothely good reader distruste greately poore defender might easily construe vvordes neuer simple clerke natural creature breade wine supper lord saith ambrose remaine stil substance yet changed thinge saie made sacramente body bloude christe whiche notwithstandinge shorte construction beinge cleare plaine maye seeme sufficient yet hardinge deepely apposeth v willeth v construe vvordes wee wil bothe construe par pleasure therefore augu iohan tracta warrante former construction augustine saithe thus accedat verbum ad elementum fit sacramentum let vvorde added elemente changed thinge outwarde creature made sacramente saie thinge againe saithe sacramenta sunt signa rerum aliud existentia aliud significantia sacramentes signes token thinges beinge substance one thingeaugust contra maximi lib cap signifieinge thinge saithe chrysostome water baptisme cum hoc elementum acceperit spiritum sanctum fit sacramentum et iam non erit aqua potationis sed sanctificationis non erit aqua communis sed refectionischrysostom psalm creature water hath receiued holy ghoste made sacramente nowe water drinke water sanctifie common water water refreshe thus elemente outwarde creature bothe remaineth changed remaineth proper plaine kinde speache changed vnproperly saie waie sacramente mysterie hardinges owne glose saithe vpon decree de con dist hoc est glosae coeleste sacramentum dicitur corpus christi sed improprie vnde dicitur suo modo non rei veritate sed significante mysterio vt sit sensus vocatur corpus christi id est significat corpus christi heauenly sacramente called body christe vnproperly saie plaine simple manner speache therefore augustine saithe called sorte truthe mater mysterie signifieinge sense maie called body christe saie signifieth body christeaugust de doctrina christia lib cap saithe augustine de signis differens hoc dico ne quis eis attendat quod sunt sed potius quod signa sunt id est quod significant intreatinge signes sacramentes thus saie lette noman consider thei substance rather signes saie thei signifie somme thinge sense meaninge augustine saithe againe dominus aitaugustin iohan tracta ipse iohannes est elia iohannes autem ipse ait ego non sum elia recte ergo iohannes proprie respondit nam dominus figurate lorde saide iohn baptiste elia iohn selfe saithe elia therefore iohn answeared wel plaine manner vvoordes lorde spake figure thus sundrie sortes speache iohn elia iohn elian bothe true better expositoure ambrose finde ambrose selfe truste hardinge wil saie holy father falsifier lier specially declaringe owne minde thus therefore saithe ante benedictionem verborum coelestiumambros de ijs qui initiantur cap alia specie nominatur post consecrationem corpus christi significatur comedendo potando carnem sanguinem quae pro nobis oblata sunt significamus similitudinem accipis sacramentum est figura corporisambros corinth ambros de sacrament lib cap sanguinis domini similitudinem pretiosi sanguinis bibis blessinge heauenly woordes called kinde woordes consecration body christe signified eatinge drinkinge wee signifie body bloude offered v thou receiuest sacramente similitude likenesse figure body bloude lorde thou drinkest likenesse pretious bloude thus like fourme woordes ambrose vseth sacramente baptisme ambros de sacramen lib cap vidisti aquam sed non omnis aqua sanat sed aqua sanat quae habet gratiam dei aliud est elementum aliud consecratio haste thou seene vvater vvater healeth vvater healeth hath grace god elemente creature water one thinge consecration thinge thus breade remaineth thus changed remaineth substance changed mysterie hardinge heauily presseth woordes mutantur aliud saithe hechanged thinge thinge substance phrase signified substantial changinge whiche aptely called transubstantiation vse courteous eloquence hardinge saie vnto saie others praie good sir thus saie praie hardinge gaue rule taught lesson de coelo est ex hominibus came heauen menne haue holy father thus taught onely owne fantasie grammar logique philosophie diuinitie euer tolde aliud euermore signifieth thinge substance ye haue authour comme without onely selfe wee beleeue aliud signifie onely substance nothinge el doothe augustine saieaugust contra imi lib cap alleged sacramenta sunt signa terum aliud existentia aliud significantia saithe augustine againe aliud est sacramentum aliud virtu sacramenti saithe ambrose aliud est elementum aliud consecratio august iohan tracta ambros de sacram lib ca diuinitie sacramente fourme consecration accidentes onely maie taken substance verily ought learne aliud nothinge el re alia thinge whether substance accidente thinke ye haue forgotten olde rule vnumquod que suo genere est quid wee saie nature substance breade wine clearely changed cosumed nothinge many haue dreamed later day hardinge commeth roughly manner saithe ye belie v vvee saie god forebid thus crieth striken salomon saitheprouerb impius fugit nemine persequente gilty fleeth chased notwithstandinge multitude folie doctrine yet folie wee charge whether felowes haue saide no4 senten dist quidam reporte maister peter lombarde woordes quid ergo fit de substantia panis vini illi dicunt vel praeiacentem materiam resolui vel nihilum redigi becommeth substance breade vvine saie either resolued mater el consumed nothinge mary god forebid saithe hardinge coye careful holy fourmes kingedome accidentes saithe whole substance breade cleane abolished one parte thereof remaininge yet maie turned nothinge mater wel woorthe somewhat assureth sadly greate detestation god forebid hereof somethinge might saide thinge woorthe hearinge good reader thou shalt lose nothinge silence assure thee verily woorthe nothinge yet hardinge firste geueth v courteous menti afterwarde familiar manner chargeth v plaine termes lie suddainely crieth saith beyonde modestie natural disposition iuggsinge lieinge falsehedde falsifieinge wickednesse falsaries might saie sir holde man good christian reader al whattes thou wilte happily thinke somewhat deede pangue hardinges rhetorique leste thou shouldest thinke hauinge spente many waste woordes ende saide nothinge mater hardinge moueth make piteous outcrie soothe bicause wee saie breade vvine remaine ambrose owne woordes wee make wee change reporte simply wee finde written latine authour panis vinum sunt quae erant changed thinge aliud mutantur breade vvine vvere changed thinge therefore appeareth al exclamation vvhat lugglinge vvhat lieinge c perteine vnto ambrose authoure hereof vnto v nowe mutche hath pleased hardinge earnestly calle v foorthe construe vvoordes beseeche thee good reader marke wel construction felowes haue imagined fansied vpon firste al lanfrancus chiefest champion side thought wisest waie lanfrancur de eucharist vtterly denie woordes saie neuer written ambrose thus stormeth berengarius mentem amentem hominem impudenter mentientem puniendam temeritatem ambrosium accire testem praesumis quod panis vinum altaris per consecrationem non definant esse quoderant sed commutentur aliud quod non erant et quidem si de sacramentis seu de coeteris de quibus ambrosius scripsit omnes reuoluat libros quos ecclesia vsu nunc habet tale quid ab ambrosio dictum taliter que expositum nusquam repetire valebit madde minde impudent lier rashenesse woorthy pounishement darest thou allege ambrose witnesse breade wine aultar leaue consecration changed thinge nowe truely peruse al bookes ambrose hath written either sacramentes mater meane sutche bookes churche hath vse shal neuer finde thinge vvritten ambrose expounded hardinge thought might wel thus doo without empeachement modestie woordes founde extante apparent euery booke therefore allowinge woordes thought beste folowe maister peter soto delaie qualifie construction thus therefore saithe sunt quae erant aliud mutantur doothe folowe good logike mutata sunt ergo sunt changed ergo louaine perhaps vniuersities doubte whether haue hitherto benne allowed logique hierome saithe superbia mutata est humilitatem hieronym matthae cap hardinge maie conclude doothe nowe superbia mutata est ergo est pride changed humilitie ergo pride roman remaineth stil whereas paule saithe commutauerunt veritatem dei mendacium logique hardinge maie saie mutata est ergo est truthe god changed lie ergo goddes truthe stil notwithstandinge take viewe hardinges construction thus saithe panis vinum sunt quae erant id est qualia erant breade vvine substance saie quality accidentes changed aliud thinge substance thei changed thei transubstantiate vvere vvere thus substance accidens accidens substance beinge beinge beinge beinge remaininge remaininge changinge changinge thinge sutche prety construction hardinge teache v expounde anciente father key kingedome heauen herewith nothinge cluse shutte open nothinge open shut might conclude hardinges owne woordes rightly saie saithe vvhat iugglinge vvhat lieinge c shalbe beste leaue owne eloquence modestie selfe hardinge place gelasius theodorite apparence seeme make mutche doctours though twoo doctours altogeather opinion consecration substance breade vvine remaineth reason onely greate matter shoulde preiudicate holy learned father whiche general councels andvntruthe fantasie vvas neuer allovved vvhole churche christe shal appeare whole churche christe catholike faithe finde bothe within fewe line woordes defender obiection firste gelasius thus expressed sacramenta corporis sanguinis domini diuinam transeunt spiritu sancto perficiente substantiam permanent tamen suae proprietate naturae sacramentes saithe body bloude lorde passe ouer diuine substance woorkinge holy ghoste yet remaine stil proprietie owne nature diuine substance meaneth lea lorde assumpted vvoordethe truthe cofessed theodorit dialog nowe saithe theodoritus mystical token vnderstanded thinges whiche made beleeued adored beinge thinges whiche beleeued euery man knoweth beleeued made body bloude christe therefore duely adored woorshipped minde theodorite body bloude deede breade vvine consecration substance nature breade vvine ceasseth saithe gelasius vvhereas interpreter addeth owne heade woorde sovntruthe vvithout question vvoordes non definit esse substantia panis telle theodorite u ergo remaineth saye ye vvee graunte substance nature breade vvine remaineth consecration gelasius vnderstandeth name substancea peeuishe vntruthe benne great folie whiche nothinge elles nature commonly speake nature saienature gelasius substance theodorite taken naturall propertie dialog logi cap natural property breade vvine expoundeth selfe afterwarde sayinge yet remaine proprietie owne nature remaine likewise saithe theodorite former substance figure forme seene felte maie damascene definition substance perteine saieth substance euery euer selfe beinge hath beinge thereforevntruthe manifeste reade ansvveare sht accidentes haue beinge themselues sacramente staied thinge consideration substance maye reported selues substance vvhichesubstantial consistinge accidentes folie substantiall consistinge accidentes lackinge propre name mighty extraordinary hande god also extraordinarely called gelasius theodoritus name whiche thinge witte substance breade vvine maruell spake ino exacte folie heape vntruthes vvithout sense exacte wise secrete pointe doctrine fourmes accidentes time yet churche clerely fully discussed neuer pet vntil daie sithens schoolemen ignorante fantastical sophisters hathe benne distinctly named existence accidentes without subiect without thinge whereupon mighte staye againe whereas breade vvine theire nature doo nourrishevntruthe harding one dreame expou deth another vertue also remaineth accidentes geuen almightie vvoorde god changeth creature theire betteringe theire impairinge meaninge gelasius doritus saye breade vvine remaine theire former substance nature otherwise shoulde contrary selues whiche also doo acknowledge nature breade vvine changed excellent substance workefull woorde christe b sarisburie two father gelasius theodoretus notwithstandinge hardinge would saeme make smal accoumpte saithe onely twoo yet rather catcheth holde somme darke doubteful woorde vttered woulde seeme vtterly geue ouer gelasius saithe sacramentes passe ouer diuine substance saide passe ouer diuine accidente woulde somewhat better haue shadowed mennes purpose diuine substance hardinge imagine none sauinge onely christes body substantially really conteined vnder fourmes breade wine fantaste notwithstandinge gelasius neuer knewe muste needes allowed againste al gelasius selfe saie contrarie hardinge better remembred placinge meaninge woorde substantia wel gelasius learned father vse diuines natural philosopher easily haue founde owne errour maie please thee therefore good christian reader vnderstande promise mercie grace god faithe christe goddes woorde holy sacramentes aide healpes faithe holy anciente writer called substance cyprian de simplicit praelatorum cyprian saithe substantiam salutis amittunt lose substance saluation saithe irenaeus quamuis sint operibus materialibus tamen putant se non amittere spiritualem substantiam although liue worldly irenae lia ca eodem cap nonlatin alphabet chrysostom epist ad hebrae homil filthy woorkes yet wey thinke lose spiritual substance likewise againe saithe folie vanity valentinian heretiques insubstantiuum ostendit figmentum ipsorum shewed theire inuentions diuises voide substance chrysostome fides dat substantiam rebus imo potius non dat substantiam sed ipsa est substantia earum faithe geueth thinges theire substance rather geueth substance vnto thinges selfe theire substance like manner saithe tertullian deus idololatriae substantiam cohibuit tertull aduersus marcion lib god forebade substance idolatrie saithe abbate panormitane continentia non est de substantia ordinis single lose life substance holy order saitheabbas extrae de clericis coniugatis cu olim pupilla oculus pag enim non est de substantia consecrationis woorde enim substance consecration like example maie appeare case religion substance euermore taken christes body couered accidentes al example wil yet suffise growe neare purpose ambrose saithe ambros de elia ieiunio cap quid est ieiunium nisi substantia imago coelestis vvhat fastinge substance image heauen likewise tertullian calleth baptisme diuinam substantiam diuine substance woordes tertull de baptismo one tertullian errours quid festinat innocens aetas ad remissionem peccatorum cautius agitur saecularibus vt cui substantia terrena non creditur diuina credatur vvhy hasteth innocente age meaneth child remission sinnes vvee mutche wary worldely thinges meete wee shoulde committe sacramente baptisme whiche diuine substance vnto vnto whome wee woulde committe substance earthe wee maie see sense gelasius calleth sacramente thankesgeuinge diuine substance verily none otherwise euen ambrose calleth fastinge heauenly substance tertullian calleth sacramente baptisme woordes diuine substance al auaile hardinge proue either transubstantiation real presence dealeth doubly wherefore dissembleth woordes gelasius immediatly sentence wente gelasius selfe clearely plainely expoundeth owne minde louanian doctour doo better getasius contra eutychetem thus saithe non desinit esse substantia panis vel natura vini et certe imago similitudo corporis sanguinis christi actione mysteriorum celebratur leaueth substance breade nature vvine deede image representation likenesse body bloude christe published ministration mystery againe woordes nexte immediately folowinge sacramenta transeunt diuinam spiritu sancto perficiente substantiam permanent tamen suae proprietate naturae sacramentes woorkinge holy ghoste passe diuine substance yet notwithstandinge remaine stil propertie ovvne nature image representation likenesse memorie body bloude christe gelasius calleth diuine substance like sense augustine calleth coelestem panem heauenly breade thus writeth alleged gratian coelestis panisde con dist hoc est quod dici u qui caro christi est suo modo vocatur corpus christi cum reuera sit sacramentum corporis christicyprian de vnctione chrismatis heauenly breade sacramente whiche fleashe christe sorte called body christe whereas deede sacramente christes body likewise saithe cyprian diuersa nomina vel specie ad vnam reducuntur essentiam significantia significata eisdem vocabulis censentur diuerse name kindes thinges brought vnto one substance saie thinges doo signifie thinges signified reckened bothe one name body christe called breade breade called christes body shorte gelasius calleth sacramente diuine substance euen gratian saithe purpose quidam non improbabiliter exponunt hoc loco carnisde con dist specie sanguinis veritatem ipsam earundem efficientiam id est peccatorum remissionem somme place without good reason woordes truthe christes fleashe bloude vnderstande effecte vvoorkinge saie remission sinnes answeare vnto theodoretus maie please thee sparinge time reade former replie hardingearti diul et articul diuis true theodorete saithe mystical token saie sacramentes vnderstoode thinges whiche made beleeued mystery christes body mysterie waie sacramente body christe true also saithe bothe immediately folowinge place also signa mystica post sanctificationem non recedunt natura sua theodoret dialogo inconfusus august contra maximin lib cap manent enim priori substantia figura forma mystical token sacramentes consecration departe ovvne nature remaine stil former substance fourme figure haue often alleged orte augustine sacramentis videndum est non quid sint sed quid significent sacramentes wee muste consider vvhat deede theire owne nature signifie saithe chrysostome antequam panis sanctificetur panem eum nominamus chrysostom ad caesarium diuina autem illum gratia sanctificante mediante sacerdote liberatus est quidem ab appellatione panis dignus autem habitus est dominici corporis appellatione etiamsi natura panis illo remanserit breade sanctified wee calle breade meane prieste heauenly grace hath hallowed discharged name breade vouchesaued called name lordes body notvvithstandinge nature breade remaine stil saith theodorete selfe seruator noster commutauit nomina corpori quidem symboli nomen dedit theodoret dialo symbolo vero nomen corporis saueour hath made exchange name vnto body hath geuen name breade whiche sacrament vnto sacrament hath geuen name body neuerthelesse notwithstandinge woordes bothe theodoretus gelasius one good reader thou maiste thinke man either wel aduised learned woulde saie like father saithe spake hereof moste exacte vvise perhaps learned theire logique rule vnderstoode principle natural reason mutche childe maie easily vnderstand vsed substance accidentes accidentes substance one thinge menne knewe saide deede hardinge saie exacte vvise seemeth rather exacte folie ye adde damascene saithe substance euery euer selfe beinge hathe beinge needed allege damascene child know aristotle others longe wrote like notwithstandinge maior ye set minor owne accidentes saie haue theire beinge selues staide thinge hardinge thinge woulde haue somme better proufe allege either augustine ambrose chrysostome hierome somme catholique father pourpose simple woorde good warrante ye proue thinge vniuersally confessed needed proufe ye shoulde proue ye leaue vnproued sophistrie called petitio principij simplest shifte vsed damascene maior confessed true minor conclusion bothe vntrue whereas saie selfe accidentes haue beinge selues wee saie accidentes haue theire beinge breade wine theire subiectes sundrie owne felowes haue saidede con dis specie gloss accidentia illa sunt aere tanquam subiecto accidentes aire theire subiecte therefore theire iudgement haue theire beinge saie selues maie also remember maister selfe neuer durste precisely determine mater onely passeth ouer darkely doubtefully beinge wel resolued saie wordes mihi videtur fatendum accidentia illa existere sine subiecto seemeth vnto senten dis si autem e gheasse accidentes haue theire without subiect hardinge vvee muste beholde saithe euthymius greeke doctour nature thinges whiche set vsvvhat vertue povver accidente vertue power b sarisburie euthymius although one meanest doctours saithe right wel learned bloude substantially really deede vvhy shoulde vvee consider nature haue offended youcyrill iohan lib cap imperfection finde cyrillus saithe caro christi natura viuifica est fleashe christe nature hath power geue life came destroie christe selfe saithe fleashe verily meate bloude verily drinke therefore nature hereof wel woorthy considered nothinge set foorthe onely bare naked accidentes povver vertue doctoure father euer taught v wee haue remission sinne saued accidentes saide euthymius writeth wel folowinge herein doctrine ancient learned father basilius de spiritu sancto cap nonlatin alphabet basile saithe si qua gratia est aqua ea non est ex natura aqua sed ex praesentia spiritus grace vvater baptisme nature vvater presence sprite cyprian speaking oile saith thus sanctificatis elementis iam non propria natura praebet effectum sed virtu diuina potentius operatur nature geueth effecte force vnto elementes beinge sanctified diuine povver woorketh mightily cyprian de vnction others catholique father allege one steede many augustine saithe alleged si ad re ipsas quibus sacramenta tractantur animum conferamus quis nesciat ea esse corruptibiles si ad id quod per illas re fruite generation vine leaue vnfruiteful gheasses vntil hardinge haue better agreed selfe vpon somme certainetie wee saie cuppe blessinge whiche christe calleth cuppe newe testamente withstandinge made mysterie sacramente christes blonde yet nature substance wine stil christe selfe lleth fruite generation grape woordes euangeliste matthae mathewe pl ne hee tooke cuppe hee geuen thankes hee gaue saieinge drinke ye al loude newe testamente shedde many remission sinnes saie vnto wil drinke hencef ourthe fruite vine vntil daye shal drinke newe kingedome father auoide manifeste truthe rehearsal hardinge saithe mathewe vttered one thinge later former cuppe consecrate cuppe vnconsecrate placed mater order poore shifte thinketh storie gospel fully answeared let v see learned father haue iudged written behalfe shal weight coniectural gheasses face hardinges truthe whiche mutche magnifieth without cause better appeare clemens dagogo li cap clemens alexandrinus hereof writeth thus quod vinum esset quod benedictu est christus ostendit dicens discipulis non bibam ex fructu vitis huius donec bibe ipsum vobiscum regno patris mei vvas vvine blessed supper christe selfe shewed discipses saieinge vvil nomore drinke fruite vine vntil shal drinke kingedome father euer shal please hardinge thinke sense hereof muste needes confesse woordes plaine likewis saithe cyprian dominus sanguinem suum vinum appellauit de botris acinis plurimis expressum atque vinum coactumcyprian lib epist vvine pressed cluster manie grape made vvine lorde called bloude augustine saithe et vinum fuit redemptionis nostrae mysterio cum dominus diceretaugustin de eccles ast dogmatibus ca non bibam amodo de hoc genimine vitis vvas vvine mysterie acramente redemption lorde saide vvil nomore drinke hencefoorthe fruite vine note thou good reader howe handsomely augustine hardinge agree togeather augustine saithe plainely vvas sacramente hardinge saithe plainely vvas sacramente augustine saithe vvoordes vvere spoken consecration hardinge findeth faulte mathewes order saithe vvere spoken consecration augustine folowing plaine woordes christ saithe vvas vvine hardinge folowinge owne woordes againste bothe augustine christe saithe vndoubtedly vvas vvine againe augusti quae euangelicar li cap augustine saithe dominus per vini sacramentum commendat sanguinem suum quid enim aliud nouum vinum nisi immortalitatem renouandorum corporum intelligere debemus lorde sacramente fourmes accidentes vvine commendeth vnto v bloude thinge maie wee vnderstande nevve vvine immortalitie bodyes shalbe reuewed chrysostome saithe cum dominus hoc mysterium traderer vinum tradiditchrysost mat homi etiam post resurrectionem sine mysterijs simplici mensa vino vsus est ex genimine ait vitis quae certe vinum non aquam producit lorde deliuered mysterie deliuered accidentes vvine resurrection plaine table without mystery vsed vvine saithe fruite vine vvhiche vine surely beareth vvatercyprian lib dionysius lyra matth ca vvine hardinge saithe euer expoundeth woordes spoken mystery belieth bothe holy father christe selfe chrysostome expoundeth woordes spoken mystery p urpose applieth woordes christe therfore hardinges conclusion belieth bothe holy father christe selfe like manner hierome saithe christus typo sanguinis sui non obtulit aquam hiero aduersus iouinian lib sed vinum christe signification bloude offered water wine fewe truste maie easily appeare indifferent reader howe iuste cause hardinge thus proclaime publishe face saithe truthe sutche courrage countenance crie wee haue wilfully corrupted woordes christe hardinge saithe defender adde owne heades vvel knovven fruite vine vvine bloude thoughte hardinge would haue piked simple quarrel woordes whose heade euer benne added trowe hathe seldome hearde seene natural vine hath borne natural bloude woordes proceded altogeather owne heades chrysost mat homi chrysostome also heade vttered thus writeth ex genimine vitis quae cert vinum producit aquam fruite vine whiche vine verily bringeth foorthe vvatercyprian epist dionysius lyra matth ca vvine cyprian saithe inuenimus vinum fuisse quod dominus sanguinem suum dixit wee finde vvine lorde called bloude dionysius lyra like doctours hardinges owne side saye de hoc genimine vitis id est de vini quod generatur vinea fruite vine saie vvine groweth vine againe hardinge saithe noted christe saide wil drinke nomore fruite vine wil hencefoorthe drinke generation vine somme maruilous greate difference bitweene twoo woordes fruite generation thinge hee saith wel woorthy noted verily difference bitwene two woordes greate difference bitweene ensis gladius liber codex bitweene woordes sound onely excepted harde discerne whether hardinge saithe noted christe saide wil drinke nomore fruite vine hilari mat canon yet hilarie saithe bibentes ex vitis istius fructu drinkinge fruite vine woordes beinge doubtefully spoken maie shifted sense yet clemens alexandrinus clemens paedagogo lib cap alleged translated gentianus heruetus saithe plainely non bibam de hoc fructu vitis wil nomore drinke fruite vine cyprian somewhat plainer wise saithe non bibam ex ista creatura vitis wil nomore drinke creature vine therefore thinke hardinge selfe wil saie note greately woorthe notinge yet farther saithcyprian lib epist defender seeme ignorante holy scripture vvhere might haue founde fruite somme vine called bloude iacob saide christe shal washe robe vvine cloke bloude grape harde shifte hardinge suddainely conueie ye mater ordinarie vse speache vnto allegorie wee speake natural grovvinge vine whiche wee saie beareth bloude onely wine touchinge ye saie christe called vine holy scripture onely allegorie figure speache although christe certaine property maie resembled vnto vine yet therefore verily deede natural grovvinge vine therefore greate violence thus force yewoordes scripture purpose otherwise ye like phrase speache one saithe lachryma est quidam animae sanguis teare certaine bloude ye soule augustine saith vident sanguine corpoiu animarum sanguinem non vident see ye bloude ye body bloude soules thei see androcides called wine terrae sanguinem bloude earthe yet maie hardinge saie either soule man moulde earthe deede hath natural real bloude onely certaine figure fourmes speache christe saide wil nomore drinke fruite vine spake plainely simply without figure therefore chrysostome saith alleged ex genimine vitis quae certe vinum producit chrysostom matthae homil non aquam fruite vine whiche vine verily bringeth foorthe water wine chrysostome saithe wine yt shedde christes body saie bloude christe cuppechrysostom corin true mysterie figure speache bicause christes bloude represented cuppe otherwise wee speake simply plainely without figure chrysostome saith vasis sanctificatis non est ipsum corpus christi sed mysterium corporis eius continetur chrysostom matthae homil sanctified vessel body christe deede mysterie body therein conteined apologie cap diuision speakinge thus wee meane abase lordes supper teache colde ceremonie onely nothinge wrought therin many falsely sclaunder v teache affirme christe dooth truely presently geeue self wholy sacramentes baptisme maie put supper wee maie eate faithe sprite maie haue euerlastinge life crosse bloude wee saie donne sleightly coldely effectually truely although wee doo touche body christe teethe mouthe yet wee holde faste eate faithe vnderstandinge sprite vaine faithe comprehendeth christe neither receiued colde deuotion receiued vnderstandinge faithe sprite christe selfe altogeather offered geeuen v mystery wee maie certainely knowe wee fleashe fleashe bone bone christe continueth v wee hardinge easy perceiuedby vvhome oure lordes supper abased defender catholikes abaseth lordes supper whether ye teache veryvntruthes tvvo togeather vvee neuer called either baker bread onely figure baker breade vvine thevvhat euer corruptible creature honoured god idole onely figure christes body bloude beleeue true body bloude onely fourmes breade vvine whiche fourmes neither christe apostle euer tolde v one woorde vvether ye wil haue figure christes whole body absent wee wil haue christes body present deede figure deathe whichevntruthe christes deathe presente body deathe absente onely vvhether ye cal vntruthe grounded vpon dreame learned doctour euer saide thus idol worshipped according dueitie adore roial body chrysostome saith whiche set vsvntruthe sta ding vvronge exposition chrysostome saithe ascende ad coeli porta imo non coeli sed coeli coelorum seene earthe woorthy highe honour whether two colder ceremonie simple supper haue breade vvine signe onely fleashe bloude haue reall fleashe bloude suche formes breade vvine asvntruthe grounded vpon dreame learned doctour euer saide thus power god nolesse bodily nourishe v substance selfe would haue done wee doubte wise men iudgement ye haue carnal bankettes fatte full inoughe beste fleashe superstitious eate drie lenten meates ye wil haue spiritual bankettes leane carreine man maye wel discerne whether ye haue phantasie fleashe spirite ye writethe sacramentaries teache nothing vvrought lordes supper corin vvhat supper properly many falsely sclaunder sayinge ye teache nothinge wrought lordes supper whereas ye affirme christe dothe truely presently geue owne selfe supper may eate faith spirite worke lordes supper ye shewe none whiche ye shewe man may doubte whether thinge wrought lordes supper vvel may ye saie thinge wrought whiche come supper wrought supper selfe ye shewe supper beinge called coena witte meate recetued coenatio whiche acte suppinge sith supper nothinge el meate drinke set vpo table receiued suche come vnto whiche wrought lordes supper must wroughtthe breade v vvee breade meate drinke lorde hath table matter whereof lordes supper made breade vvine supper made thereof lordes body bloude whiche breade vvine almighty power vvoorde changed ye wil shewe christe selfe bechriste made christ vvroughte straunge diuinitie made vntruthe harding vvel knovveth fonde folie vvas neuer catholique wrought lordes supper ye muste shewe breade vvine changed christe selfe eaten faithfull table whereas three thinges christe taht makth supper communicantes receiue supper supper selfe ye saye christe parte geueth owne selfe verily presente likewise comunicantes parte eate faithe spirite ye shewe maker supper worketh comunicates worke al ye shew v wrought matter supper saie breade vvine made great sclaumder ye charged withal whiche muche owne woorde ye discharged howe muche sounder thesutche vnchristian scornes christes ordinance vnseemely catholike doctrinethe proper vvorke lordes supper whiche reacheth proper woorke lordes supper turninge substance breade vvine body bloude vvhiche woorke bicause ye wil confesse yee haue deuised woorke owne workinge whiche propre lordes supper receiue christe house home faithe spirite workechrist offereth selfe vnto faithe faithe receiued proper supper whiche maye wrought without supper beleeue christe lifte vp spirite vnto himsuthche unchristian scornes christes ordinance geueth owne selfe verily presently interpreter telleth tale christ offereth selfe vnto faithe faithe receiued dooth exhibite geue himselfe wilbe receiued dothe shewe one hande piece breade strike v heade stone geue v selfe verily present ye saie wee take verily presente onlesse ye meane selfe grace christe christe selfe eate verily presente onely faithe sprite takinge intothis caniballes named grace spiritual effected workinge lordes supper scripture requireth special peculiar presence christe witte fleashe maye eaten geeue selfe verely present ye saie present owne person god man body supper supper filleth heauen earthe remaineth either ye vnderstande selues wilfully deceiue infinite number soules whose sake christe hath shedde bloude vntruthe finest beste learned father haue maineteined shal appeare errour makinge presence christe baptisme like presence supper grossethe presence christe baptisme supper distincte vvhiche defender make like although christe woorke bothe regeneration nourrishment diuine sacramentes yet baptisme regeneration name attributed gospell holy ghoste also shewe christes presence spirituall supper consisteth body bloude whiche vnited christe peculiar seconde persone godhed againe asmuche receiued v foode nourrishe body resurrection vntruthe sutche worde al gospel gospell saieth nomans body otherwise nourished eatinge deede meate whereof nourrished fleashe christe selfe saithe i cyprian saithe cibus mentis non ventris meate deede bloude drinke deede vve forced beleue maner presence sacramente aulter baptisme therefore ye haue handled matter sleightly coldely vvhere ye saie wee touche body christe teeth mouthheathenishe vnchristian scoffinge ye accustomed swallowe downe whole morsellesthat vvee touche christes body eate vvith mouthe hovv corin homi ye neuer touche teeth haue ye learned eate whiche ye touche mouthe christe saide take eate body apostle tooke eate neither coulde take eate without touchinge semeth ye handle eatinge sleightly coldely ye wil haue without touching chrysostome substanital handler thinges saieth christes body quod omnium maximum est que praecipuum terra non conspicaris tantum sed tangis ne que sliontangis sed comedis accepto domum redis al thinges earthe greatest chiefestas see christes body sacramente euen yee touche yee eat none othervvise ambrose saithe fide christus tangitur non tangitur corpore doest thou onely see touchest neither onely doest thou touche also eate hauinge receiued thou goest home againe touche knowe mortall corruptible body wherein maie fasten teeth glorious immortall vntruthe childishe vnsauerie learned father neuer knevve folie therefore touche reason accidentes breade vvine whose formes augustine speaketh couered vailedin lib sentent prosp defender imaginarie holdinge christe holdeth christe sacrament matth commeth teethe mouthe nourrisheth bothe body soules life euerlastinge nay saie ye holde faste eate faith vnderstanding spirite praie e holde ye haue came ye grace geueth diuerse way selfe bodely presently man neuer promised geue otherwise saide take eate body iudasiudas meane faithe meane faithe receiued sacramente receiued also blessed lady although shee moste persitte faithe receiued sorte shee receiued sacramente ye assure selues faithe takeht body christevntruthe shal appeare vvhere vvas christes body promised mouthe whiche neuer promised faithe faithe take sacramente faithe holde faste ye haue saide muche proued litle reall presence wrestinge stretchinge certaine father sentence scripture selfe purpose wholy faithfully piecemeale p tchedly alleaged ye might beste make serue mainetenance false doctrine right conclusion parte apologie like grace ye heape number mangled auctorities together wherby perswade
