bringe father againste true presence christe blessed sacramente b sarisburie hardinge conscience knoweth wil testifie selfe wee neuer called holy sacramente christes body baker breade nomore wee cal sacramente baptisme paile vvater wee haue alwaies spoken honourably reuerently hereof meate wee shoulde speake mystery deathe christe holy catholique father haue euermore vsed speake v wilde wanton vnseemely speaches agree rather doctrine cal owne woordes alitle remembrance firste answeare hardinge articulo ye cal holy sacramente vsed ministred v accordinge order holy father peece breade vvoorthe pointe place ye cal holy ministration vsed v leane carrien banket nexte diuision ye cat toie woordes hardinge maie wel stande bothe sobrietie sprite also whole substance tendure religion wee cal sacramente thankesgeuinge sacramente christes body bloude holy father augustine wee saie sacramentis videndum estaugust contra maximin lib cap non quid sint sed quid significent sacramentes wee muste consider vvhat thei selues signifie wee haue special regarde breade wine water creature corruptible wel consecration wee directe faithe onely vnto body bloude christe beinge really fleashel presente ye haue imagined sittinge heauen righthande god father holy father chrysostome saith although general woordes speakinge specially sacramente oculus fideichrysost gene homil quando vident haec ineffabilia bona ne sentiunt quidem haec visibilia tantum inter haec illa interest eies faithe beholde vnspeakeable good thinges doo mutche marke warde thinges see bodily eies greate difference bitvvene thinges herein resteth grossenesse errour ye diuide one thinge augustine saithe august iohan tracta augustin de doctrina christiana lib cap origen prologo cantica canticor aliud est sacramentum aliud re sacramenti sacramente christes body one thinge substance sacramente christes body represented sacramente thinge againe saithe ea demum est miserabilis animae seruitus signa pro rebus accipere take signes sacramentes steede thinges selues signified miserable bondage soule like manner origen saithe simpliciores nescientes distinguere ac secernere quae sint quae scripturis diuinis interiori homini quae vero exteriori deputanda sint vocabulorum similitudinibus falsi ad ineptas quasdam fabulas figmenta inania se contulerunt simple menne hable discerne holy scripture thinges ought applied vtter man inner beinge deceiued likenesse woordes haue turned selues sorte peeuishe fable vaine fantasy ye cal doctrine nakedfigure christes deathe absente presente colde wee saie sacramente figure yet bicause ye cannot wise denie woorde figure purpose commonly vsed al anciente catholike father doctours churche therefore ye thought good qualifie mince matter saie figure body deathe christe worlde see howe pitifully ye trouble selfe varietie change shifte figure firste saie sacramente iudgemente damascene called figure consecrationm hard artic diuision saie sacramente sacramente afterwarde vpon better aduise ye saie fourmes onely shewes accidentes figure christes body againe saie christes body inuisible figure christes body visible saie thinge vncertaine figure thinge moste certaine nowe laste al ye saie thinke noman euer saide body christe selfe figure deathe christe thus many prety strange vnknowen figure ye drtuen diuise thereby auoide one simple plaine vsual common figure leaue infinite number anciente fathersaugustin psalm augustine saithe dominus figuram corporis sui discipulis suis commendauit tradidit lorde commended deliuered disciple figure ye saie death body whereas saie body christe present deede deathe absente onely ye liste cauille yee doo maner idlely plaie woordes phrase ancient father ye might wel good warrante saie christes deathe presente body cyprian saithecyprian lib epist chrysotom acta homil hieronym psalm de con dist quid sit passio christi est sacrificium quod offerimus sacrifice wee offer passion christe chrysostome saith mysterijs mors christi perficitur deathe christe vvrought mystery hierome saithe christus nobis quotidie crucifigitur vnto v christe crucified euery daie gregorie saithe christus iterum hoc mysterio moritur mysterie ye holy communion christe put deathe againe woordes thus pressed rackte manner ye maie easily proue onely christes body also passion deathe bloude sheddinge verily presente ye saie ye adore sacramente godly honour wee answeare christe sometime answeared ye woman samaria vos adoratis quod nescitis ye adore iohan woorship ye know euer willed thus adore sacramente taught bade doo prophete apostle father doctour churche hardinge ye doo v great wronge saie wee cal christes body idole chrysost corin homil wee knowe haue euermore confessed chrysostome body christe woorthy highest honoure wee adore woorship euen body sonne god saide christes body one thinge sacramente sacramente earthe christes body heauen right hande god fatherchrysostom eadem homilia therefore chrysostome saith place scende ergo ad coeli porta diligenter attende imo non coeli sed coeli coelorum tunc quod dicimus intueberis mounte vp therefore vnto gate heauen diligently consider naie saie vnto gate heauen vnto gate heauen heauens shal ye see thinges wee speake meante hardinge thus season presse lenten argumente saie superstitious eate drie lemen meates ye saie superstition choise meates either yee deceiued selfe el seeke occasion waie deceiue others tertullian saithe lenten meates tertull epistola de cibis iudaicis deus ventre non colitur nec cibis quos dominus dicit perire secessu naturali lege purgari nam qui per escas dominum colit prope est vt dominum habeat ventrem suum god honoured belly vvith meates whiche lorde christe saithe doo perishe purged conueiance natural order vvho meates honoureth lorde manner maketh belly lordehilari psal um hilarie saithe haeretici sicco panis cibo viuunt sed quis tandem oriosi huius propositus profectus est totum hoc inane que ridiculum est cum ipsis superstitionis causis miserabile heretiques liue drie breade profit idle purpose altogeather vaine foolishe respecte cause superstition also miserable hierome saithe hieronym ad nepotianum quid prodest oleo non vesci molestias quasdam difficultates que ciborum quaerere carica piper nuces palmarum fructus similam mel pistacia audio praeterea quosdam contra regulam hominum que naturam aquam non bibere nec vesci pane sed sorbitiunculas delicatas contrita olera betarum que succum non calice sorbere sed concha pro pudor non erubescimus istiusmodi ineptijs nec taedet superstitionis insuper etiam famam abstinentiae delicijs quaerimus auaileth eate oile paine mutche adoo curiousely seeke meates figges peper nuttes date fine white breade hoony pistacia biside heare saie somme whiche contrarle common order nature menne wil neither drinke water eate breade seeke delicate suppinges herbes shridde togeather iuice beetes receiue cuppe shelle phy shame doo vvee blusshe sutche foolishnesse vvee vveery sutche superstition yet biside al liuinge sutche curiouse delicacie wee looke praysed fastinge leaue al others erasmuserasm anno ad rom man greate iudgemente saithe maior est rebus superstitio apud christianos quam vnquam fuit inter iudaeos superstition herein emonge christian euer emonge iewes wee weighe choise fishe fleashe burthen minde snare conscience passe ouer needelesse lenten talke feaste wee sette people neither drie carrien notwithstandinge liketh vnciuile termes cal spiritual holy heauenly meane body iesus christe sonne god comforte reliuinge body soule yet mutche wel deliteth eares calle carrien wee refuse name chrysostome likewise although reuerende ciuile sense calleth carrien woordes vbi est cadauer ibi sunt aquilae chrysostom corin homi cadauer domini corpus est propter mortem aquila autem appellat vt ostendat ad alta eum opotere contendere qui ad hoc corpus accedit nihil cum terra debere illum habere commune nec ad inferiora trahi repere sed ad superiora semper volare solem iustitiae intueri mentis que oculum habere acutissimum aquilarum enim non graculorum est haec mensa carrien egles carrien body christe respecte deathe nameth egles shewe wil approche body muste mounte alofte haue dealinge earthe dravven creepe dovvnevvarde must euer flee vp beholde sonne iustice haue eie minde quicke sharpe table egles flee highe iaies creepe beneathe ye adde saie ye lordes supper christe geueth selfe verily presente purpose praie wee maie eate saie ye faithe sprite vvel reasoned forsoothe forsoothe hardinge hicke scorner logique farre vnmeete man grauitie haue ye foregotten saie geuinge eate verily presente eating whiche geuen relatiues one hauing relation christe doo exhibite selfe verily presente dooth exhibite geue selfe wilbe receiued geue selfe verily present wee take verily presente wee eate verily presente onely faithe sprite takinge mouth belly verily hardinge parte wel reasoned man maie haue christe verily presente although haue mouthaugu iohan tracta augustine saithe habes christum praesenti per signum praesenti per fidem praesenti per baptismatis sacramentum thou haste christe time presente signe token time presente faithe time presente sacramente baptisme augustine imagineth christe thus saie vnto people caper aumaugu psal non hoc corpus quod videris manducaturi estis ye shal eate bodily mouthe body mine see wee remember wel relation bitweene geuing receiuing therefore wee marueile mutche vnskilfully woulde abuse christe offereth body spiritually faith sprite euen spiritually faithe sprite wee receiue ye saie wee take christes body mouthes body hauing foregotten christe saithe woordes haue spoken sprite life augustine woulde soone haue remoued grosse errour thus saithe vnto quid para dentem ventrem crede manducasti pre arest thou thy tooth thy belly eatinge spiritual beleeue christe thou haste eaten ambrose saithe ambros lucam li ca fide tangitur christus fide videtur non tangitur corpore non oculis comprehenditur faithe christe touched faithe seene touched vvith body seene eie likewise saithe gregorius nyssenus basiles brothergregor nyssen de creatione hominis cap ego aliam escam agnosco quae similitudinem quandam proportionis escae huis corporis gerat cuius voluptas atque suauitas ad animum solummodo transeat knowe kinde meate bearing likenesse resemblance bodily meate inwardly feedeth minde outwardely feedeth body pleasure sweetenesse whereof goeth mouth belly passeth onely soule thus wee vnderstande selues hardinge deceiue saie soules christe hath bought god foregeeue others haue donne bloude many required handes errour ye saie makinge presence christe baptisme like presence supper grosse one erroure learned catholique father euer noted chrysostome saithe sacramente baptisme wee made fleashe christes fleashe chryso epist ad ephe hom bernard super missus est hom leo sermon de feria ca bone bone bernarde saithe lauemur sanguine eius let v vvasshed bloude leo saith christi sanguine rigaris quando mortem ipsius baptizaris thou arte vvashte bloude christe thou arte baptized death fewe maie appeare christe presente sacramente baptisme euen presente holy supper onlesse ye wil saie wee maie made fleashe christes fleashe washte bloude part taker haue presente without presence therefore chrysostome hath spoken vehemently sacramente supper concludeth thus sic baptismo euen also sacramente baptisme body christe likewise presente bothe cause beda saithebeda cor nulli est aliquatenus ambigendum tunc vnumquen que fidelium corporis sanguinis que dominici participem fieri quando baptismate membrum christi efficitur noman maie doubte euery faitheful man made partetaker body bloude christe spiritual eatinge vvhen baptisme made member christe real fleashely presence hath benne often talkte parte neuer proued wee saie wee touche christes body mouthe teeth vvhat saie ye vsed swallowe whole morselles sutche childishe waton talke hardinge specially debatinge mater religion woulde better becomme somme lighter personne wee knowe augustine saithe gratia christi non consumitur morsibus augu iohan tracta augu iohan tracta grace christe consumed moreselles ye might haue made like answeare augustine saith haue alleaged prepareste thou thy toothe thy belly hardinge eatinge body christe woorke spiritual needeth neither brusinge toothe swallowinge throte healpe owtwarde bodily mouthe ye know thus mutche doo dissemble ye know ye comme rathe speake thinges basile saith basili psal nonlatin alphabet basili eund psalmum nonlatin alphabet cyprian de coena domini augu psal augu iohan tracta senten dist secundum ho chryso cor homil est spirituale o interioris hominis quod nutritur recipiens verbum vitae quod verbum est panis qui descendit de coelo spiritual mouthe inner man whiche nourished receiuinge christe woorde life whiche breade came heauen againe saith gustare vide e quod suauis est dominus saepe obseruauimus vires animi habere nomina ab aliqua similitudine membrorum corporis quoniam ergo dominus noster est verus panis eius caro est verus cibus necesse est eam voluptate quae ex illius panis delectatione affertur nobis per gustum existere spiritualem taste ye see lorde groceous wee haue oftentimes marked power minde haue theire name somme likenesse partes body therefore seeinge lorde breade deede fleashe verily meate cannot chosen pleasure sweetenesse breade muste wrought v bodily mouthe spiritual taste soule cyprian saith esus carnis eius quaedam est auiditas quoddam desiderium manendi eo eating fleashe certaine greedinesse certaine desire dwelle augustine saith ipse est panis cordis nostri christe breade belly harte againe intus esuri intus siti hunger thou vvithin thirste thou vvithin likewise againe saithe vide e fratres panem coelestem spirituali ore manducate brother beholde heauenly breade eate spiritual inner mouthe minde thus wee taught eate spiritual meate without chewinge swallowinge vse office bodily mouthe therefore augustine saith non manducans manducat manducans non manducat eateth eateth eateth eateth chrysostome saith quod omnium maximum est atque praecipuum terra non conspicaris tantum sed etiam tangis nec tangis tantum sed etiam comedis greattest woorthiest thinge thou dooste onely beholde earthe also toucheste neither dooste thou onely touche also catest beseche hardinge dissemble l nger speake plainely howe doo beholde body christe sacramente sens eies doo see ye saie bodily eies saie christes body inuisible couered accidentes cannot seene ye saie deede yee see body onely spiritual eies minde ye allege chrysostome directely plainely againste selfe augustine saithe habet fides oculos suos faithe hath eies see vvithalaugust epist bernard meditation cap bernarde saithe visio animae intellectus est seeinge soule vnderstandinge eies wee see christe saie wee vnderstande christe beleeue christe augustine saith velamen positum erat contra faciem eorumiudas ne viderent christum scripturisaugu euaengelium secund lucam serm chry osto genesim homil vele laide ouer theire face shoulde see christe scripture chrysostome saithe non tantum praestare possunt corporales oculus qui visibilia cernunt quantum oculus piritus qui ea quae non videntur neque subsistunt videre possunt bodily eies see thinges visible cannot doo mutche eies sprite theise eye hable see thinges seene haue beeinge likewise againe saithe chryso de verb esai vidi domi homil oculus animi etiamsi paries etiami moenia etiamsi montium mole etiami coelorum corpus compererint obstantia omnia facile praetercurrunt eies minde notwithstandinge finde vvalles mountaines body heauens stande againste yet wil easily passe al eies saithe chrysostome wee see moste woorthy chryso marcum homil hierony amos lib ca ambros oratione de fide resurrectionis moste glorious body christe therefore saithe credamus videmus praesentem iesum let v beleeue vvee see iesus presente v likewise hierome saithe est intelligentia spiritualis qua christus cernitur spiritual vnderstandinge vvherevvith christe seene otherwise ambrose saithe christum nunc secundum veritatem videre non possumus according truthe bodily sight vvee cannot see christe nowe body christe seene touched touched eaten seene bodily eies touched bodily fingersambros lucam li ca ambrose saith fide tangitur christus fide christus videtur faithe christe touched faithe christe seene therefore body christe eaten bodily mouthe onely faith whiche spiritual mouthe soule iudas ye saye meane faithe bicause receiued sacramente receiued also howe mutche poore iudas beholden menne christe calleth childe perdition iohan iohan iohn saithe diuel entred againe christe saithe diuel therefore meane faithe allowe muste needes litle prety faithe euen sutche faithe ye might wel allowe diuel yet meane faith ye saie receiuinge sacrament receiued christe also firste wel thorowly agreed vpon iudas receiued sacrament present al laste supper hilarie saithe plainely gonne foorthe aboute wicked pourpose hilar matth canon receiued hilarie deceiued iudas receiued sacramente yet saide christes body one thinge sacramente christes body thinge augustine saithe discipuli manducabant panem dominum iudas panem dominiaugu iohan tracta contra dominum disciple eate breade vvhiche lord juda eate lorde sacrament whiche breade lordeaugu psal lorde yet plainer sorte saithe christus adhibui iudam ad conuiuium quo corporis sanguinis sui figuram discipulis suis commendauit tradidit christe admitted juda vnto table whereat gaue deliuered vnto disciple figure body againe augustine saithe personne christe augu de ciuita li cap qui non manet quo ego non manco ne se dicat aut existimet manducare corpus meum aut sanguinem meum bibere abideth let saie thinke either eateth body drinketh bloude obiection ye make resurrection body light vaine smal pourpose noman shal haue parte resurrection onely haue receiued sacramente christes body al holy father patriarch prophetes olde testamente abraham isaac iacob moses aaron sutche others infinite number christian childrenpromisse made faithe many godly martyr whiche beinge baptized bloude christe taken life coulde receiue sacramente vtterly excluded euer al hope resurrection christe spake woordes meante reciuinge sacramente spiritual eatinge body spiritual drinkinge bloude whereof made partetaker vnto resurrection life euerlastinge euer beleeueth death christe therefore basile saith sacramente baptisme basilius de ancto baptismate nonlatin alphabet baptisma est vi efficacia ad resurrectionem baptisme povver strength vnto resurrection hereof wee shal haue occasion offered saie hereafter howe ye assure selues saye faithe receiueth body christe vvhiche neuer promised faithe waie beseeche hardinge christes body euer promised mouthe verily christe promised body receiued faithe faithe onely none othervvise iohan thus saithe ego sum panis ille vitae qui venit ad non esurier qui credit non sitiet vnquam breade life commeth vnto shal neuer hunger beleeueth shal neuer thirste haue hardinge plaine promisse made vnto faithe mouthe wee heare nothinge haue ought shewe scripture doctours councelles let appeare plaine woordes without coloure otherwise ye cauil woordes wee muste saie ye haue nothinge therefore auncient father origen saith idcirco dicitur panis vitae vt habeat gustus animae quod deguster origen cantica homil therefore christe called breade life faithe whiche taste soule maie houe taste clemens alexandrinus saithe clemens paedagog lib cap comedite carnes meas bibite sanguinem meum euidenter fidei promissionis quod est esculentum poculentum dicens allegorice eate fleashe drinke bloude meaninge hereby vnder allegorie vvaie figure meate drinke faithe promisse tertullian saith tertullian de resurrectione carnis eundem sermonem christus etiam carnem suam dixit quia sermo caro factus est proinde causa vitae recipien dus deuorandus auditu ruminandus intellectu fide digerendus est woorde christe called fleashe woorde made fleashe therefore muste receiued cause life muste deuoured hearing muste chevved vnderstandinge muste digested faithe cyprian saithe cyprian de coena domini augu iohan tracta augu de verb apostol serm quod est esca carni hoc est animae fides meate fleashe faithe nowe shewe euidente promisse made mouthe belly reader happily wil beleeue apologie cap diuision therefore celebratinge mystery people good pourpose exhorted comme receiue holy communion lifte ye meane owne newe deuised toye thereof ye cannot bringe sufficient reason againste churche pardy whiche condemneth ye meane holy mystery catholike churche ye misreporte mater exhortation ye speake ofvntruth hardinge misreporteth ovvne massebooke people prepared receiue communion onely chifely dispose selues accordingly becommeth praie ende woordes sursum corda vp harte pronounced prieste vnto lorde likewise againe inter sacrum mysteria cor habere sursum iubemur time holy mystery wee commaunded lifte vp harte neede wee rehearse ancient father late new doctours haue saide like leaue reste manipulus curatorum saie ordinarie direction al whole cleregie saith thus sacerdos ante canonem dicit sursum corda quasi dicat quod volens sumere istud sacramentum debet habere cor suum eleuatum ad deum canon prieste saithe lifte vp harte vvoulde saie vvho vvil receiue sacramente ought haue harte lifted vp vnto god woordes plaine wise denied wisedome hardinge sutche case auouche nomore ye concluded ende christe onely bare natural man al respectes others benne could wee haue benne saued deathe christe nomore deathe codrus decius beinge nothinge el natural mennehieronym ad ephesios cap gaue selues deathe safetie theire country neither could wee beleeue christe crucified saie wee coulde eate feede vpon body christe cyrillus ad regina ex epist ad hebrae haue life cyrillus saithe quomodo purgabi no ab operibus mortuis sanguis enim communis hominis nihil habet maius quam sanguis tauri aut hirci howe shal christe deliuer v deadly woorkes bloude common man hath nothinge woorke saluation bloude bulle goate therefore cyril imagineth christe saie thuscyrill iohan lib cap mortalem carnem assumpsi sed quia naturaliter vita existens habito ea totam ad meam vitam reformauli haue taken mortal fleashe vpon selfe mutche naturally beinge life dwel haue refourmed vvhole fleash vnto life leo de passion domi sermo saithe leo verus venerator dominicae passionis sic crucifixum iesum oculis cordis aspiciat vt illius carnem suam esse cognoscat let true woorshipper lordes passion behold christ crucified eies harte yt maie vnderstande fleashe christe fleashe hereof trowe hardinge wil moue greate question fully confessed either side wee faithe eate body christe body common natural man body sonne god body eaten faithe none otherwise geeueth life body maie eaten therein standeth whole doubte hereunto cyril answeareth thus num hominis comestione hoc nostrum sacramentum pronuntias cyrill anathematismo et irreligiose ad crassas cogitationes vrges mentem corum qui crediderunt et attentas humanis rationibus tractare ea quae sola pura exquisita fide accipiuntur dooste thou saie sacramente eating man doost thou vnreuerently without religion force mind faithful vnto grosse fleashely cogitation goest thou natural imagination deale thinges receiued onely pure perfite faithe woordes seeme plaine free quarrel yet hereof maie grow doubte hardinge iudgement thinke christes body receiued mouthes belly manner grosse imagination wee saie cyrillus saith auoide al sutche vncomely fleashly vanity christes body bloude spiritual eatinge spiritual foode muste receiued mouthe teethe onely pure perfite faithe concerninge hardinges fantasie pope nicolas vnder solemne protestation woulde haue v saie de conse dist ego beregarius ego corde ore profi eor non tantum sacramentum sed etia corpus christi veritate sensualiter manibus sacerdotum tractari frangi dentibus fidelium atteri professe harte mouthe onely sacramente also body christe selfe truthe deede sensibly touched broken priestes handes torne vvith teeth faithful talke fonde vtterly voide discretion barbarous glose faine cotrol sort nisi sane intelligas ista verba berengarij maiorem incides haeresim quam ipse habuit onlesse thou wisely vnderstand woordes berengarius thou wilte fal greatter heresie euer helde cyril woordes plaine sola pura exquisita fide sola pura exquisita fide accipiuntur thinges receiued mouthe onely pure perfite faithe likewise againe saith initium fundamentum sanctificationem iustitiam christus estcyrill iohan lib cap per fidem scilicet non aliter hoc enim modo nobis habitat christe esse incorruptionis eius drinkinge bloude iesus made partetaker immortalitie origen saith est ergo ipse vulneratus cuius no sanguine bibimus id estorigen numer homi athana illud euangelij quicun que dixerit verbum doctrinae eius verba suscipimus woounded whoes bloude vvee drinke saie vvoordes vvhoes doctrine vvee receiue plaine woordes athanasius quot hominibus suffecisset corpus eius ad cibu vt vniuersi mundi alimonia fieret propterea ascensionis suae coelum mentionem fecit vt eos corporali intellectu abstraheret vnto howe many menne coulde christes body haue suffised meate foode al worlde therefore made mention ascension heauen might vvithdravve corporal fleashely vnderstanding hardinge beseche tel v waie ye teache v christes body fleashely presente receiued mouthe chevved brused teethe passeth belly howe doo withdrawe mindes fleashely corporal vnderstandinge eatinge spiritual eatinge maye coumpted corporal hereof augustine saith thus cum videritis filium hominis ascendentem vbi erat priusaugustin iohan tractat certe vel tunc videbitis quod non eo modo quo putatis erogat corpus suum certe vel tunc intelligetis quod gratia eius non consumitur morsibus ye shal see sonne man ascendinge vp shal ye see geeueth body eaten sutche sorte imagine shal ye vnderstande grace consumed morselles therefore againe saithe august de verbis domi secud uc sermon nolite pauces parare sed cor prepare iavves harte true spiritual onely eating christes body euer fantasie hardinge hath diuised bisides mouth teethe cyril saithe vaine vnreuerente grosse fleashely imagination apologie cap diuision councel nice alleged somme greeke plainely forebiddeth v basely affectioned bent towarde breade wine whiche sette v hardinge former parte sentence whiche ye bringe nicene councelvntruthes two togeather read ansvveare soundeth nothing catholikes also teache samevntruthes two togeather read ansvveare later parte directly contrary doctrine ye thought good leaue lest thereby ye haue marred whole matter sutche nippinga marke knovve heretikes vvordes nicene councel vvhiche make plainely catholike doctrine touchinge sacrament aulter roundinge sentence hath euer ben taken marke know heretikes amonge wise men sutche practrise worthely bringeth suspicion vntruthe wordes councel truely reported let v diuine table basely behold bread cuppe sette v liftinge vp minde let v faithe vnderstande holy table laide lambe god taketh awaie sinnes vvorlde priestes sacrificed vnbloudely receiuing precious body bloude verily let v beleue pledge resurrection consideration hereof take mutche litle may knowe receiue fillinge body sanctimonie take ende beginninge maketh decree holy councel defence sacramentarie doctrine basely affectioned bent towarde thinges set table ye make breade vvine wee consecration beleue vnder formes breade vvine verily made presente body bloude christe vvhether baser exercise feede onvntruth vile lau rous vvee ee e vpon ommon brea vvine vvee fe de vpon body bloud christ common breade vvine dwel iudgement sens eate fleashe christe breade life came downe heauen immortalitie body soule forsake sens folowethe vnderstandinge ofyour faith without goddes vvoord faithe taithe vvel agree ouer basely intent breade cuppe ye performe foloweth owne allegation councel vvhy ye holy father whole churche christe vnderstande faithe holy table laide lambe god taketh awaie sinnes vvorlde vvhy ye recante wicked doctrine againste blessed sacrifice masse reade whole sentence ioyninge ende beginninge saie al holy learned father lambe god sacred table thei meane aulter sacrificed priestes vnbloudely againe bringe ye christen people body christe whereby redemed avntruthe vvee ache either bare bread bare figure reade ansvveare bare piece breadeal trope figure sacramentaries excluded verdite nicene councel teachinge bevntruthe learned doctours father vsed commonly trope figure figure body saieth councel wee receiue precious body bloude lordevvee receiue christe verily dee e although neither fleashely vvith bodily mouthe nonlatin alphabet verily deede vntruthe learned doctours father vsed commonly trope figure whereby dede al trope figure quite excluded againe breade vvine ye teache woulde councel saie take sacietie sanctimonie holynes vvhat holynes haue breade vvine vvhat holynes obteine eatinge body christe beinge proper body vvorde god vvordes owne body hathe power viuificate quicken al thinges thus come within defender claspinge wringe youro braue captaine weapon handes tother end stricke downe harde v learninge ouerthrowe beseche god strike prideact stubbernes harte paule wherewith ye resiste manifeste truthe b sarisburie wee allege place although briefely yet simply truely without manner fraude guile roundinge clippinge holy father marke heretique auouched haue wee one marke whereby knowe hardinge ordinarie vsage practise course touchinge either beginninge ende decree cause wherefore woorde therein written shoulde parte dissembled holy father councel teache v vtterly withdrawe eie breade wine beinge nothing el creature transitorie corruptible faithe beholde body christe whiche represented mystery like pourpose augustine saithe alleged ea demum est miserabilis animae seruitus labe laide vpon table signa pro rebus accipere august de doctrina christiana lib cap supra creaturam corpoream oculum mentis ad hautiendum aeternum lumen leuare non posse miserable bondage soule take signes steede thinges signified hable lifte vp eie minde aboue corporal creature receiue light euerlastinge therefore immediately holy ministration prieste saith vnto v saide lifte vp harte sorte father speake water baptismeconcil nicen nonlatin alphabet baptisma nostrum oculis sensibilibus spectandum non est sed oculis intellectus vides aquam cogita vim potestate dei quae aquis latet baptisme maie considered sensible bodily eies inner eies minde seeste thou water thinke might power god lieth hidden vvater thus one sacramente withdrawe v water euen sacramente withdrawe v breade foloweth decree let v faithe vnderstande holy table laide lambe god taketh awaie sinnes world auncient father end sturre vp enflame harte people sommetimes vsed vehemente phrase extraordinarie kindes speache hardinge might many time spare penne keepe silence dooth father greate wronge presseth onely theire woordes dissembleth meaninge gregorie nyssene basiles brother discreetely learnedly openeth whole mater thus writethgregor nyssen de anima ca cum habitudine locus alicuius vel negorij loco existentis intelligibiliu aliquod extiterit abusiue id ibi esse dicimus propter operatione eius quae ibi est locum pro habitudine operatione accipientes cum enim dicere deberemus ibi operatur dicimus ibi est spiritual thing ye consideratio somme place el consideratio somme mater place wee saie spiritual thing abuse extraordinarie vse speache bicause effecte spiritual thinge vvrought taking place steede consideration workinge ye place wee saie vvoorketh thus wee saie euen father haue saide effectes grace wee haue christes body laid v vpon table abuse speache saie body christe laid vpo tablede conse dist specie likewise saith gratia quida improbabiliter exponut carnis sanguinis veritatem ipsam orundem efficientiam hoc est remissionem peccatorum somme menne without good reason truthe christes fleashe bloude vnderstande effecte vvoorkinge saie remission sinnes father saie christe laid vpon table euen like phrase speache de conse dist quid sit gregorie saith christe killed vpon table christus iterum hoc mysterio moritur eius caro populi salutem patitur christe dieth againe mysterie fleashe suffereth saluation people saith chrysostome vt coelo coelatur deuschrys matth homil sic scripturis absconditur non omnes intelligunt deum veritatis positum scripturis god couered heauen couered scripture al menne vnderstande god laide scripture saithe athanasiusathanas de interpreta psalm hieronym de vita eremitica hieronym ad gaudentium est etiam verbis scripturarum dominus lorde vvoordes scripture saithe hierome supra nudam metuis humum ex esa ieiunijs membra collidere sed dominus tecum iacet thou arte fraide laie thy body worne fasting vpon bare ground yet lord lieth vvith thee againe nudus que esuriens ante fore nostras christus paupere moritur christe naked hungrie lieinge gate dieth poore leaue like saieinges sentence ancient father pope adrian saithe late councel nicethe lambe laide vpon table scripturis sanctarum imaginum agnus praecursoris digito ostensus depingitur de con dist sextam sanctum scripture holy image painted lambe god john baptiste shewed finger saieinges muste qualified gentle exposition maie rackte extreemely sounde rigour letter chrysostome thus expoundeth woordes paule galathianschrysost epist ad gala cap quibus christus ante oculos prius depictus erat vobis crucifixus atqui christus non apud galathas sed hierosolymis fuit crucifixus quomodo igitur dicit vobis vt ostendat vim fidei quae potest etiam procul dissita cernere indicans quod illi oculis fidei exactius cernerent quam nonnulli qui praesentes adfuerant ea que quae gerebantur conspexerant vnto whome christe painted crucified emonge eies yet christe crucified galathia hierusalem saithe paule vnto galathians christe crucified emongst meaninge shewe strengthe faithe vvhiche hable see thinges though thei far avvaie eies faithe sawe deathe christe plainely perfitely many presente deathe sawe thinges donne thus father councel saide christes body laide foorthe vpon communion table vnto bodily eies sens vnto eies faithe meane waie mysterie sacramente verily deede sense augustine saithe vnto people vos estis mensa de con dist quia passus vos estis calice laide vpon table cuppe people laide vpon table christes body laide vpon table people cuppe christes bloude cuppe people waie mysterie euen christes body bloude waie mysterie none otherwise thus hardinge wee withdrawe people god ye vntruely saie christes body peece breade rather wee leade ancient father euer creature breade beholdinge receiuinge eatinge christes body bloude sorte sense christe nowe vnbloudily sacrificed prieste shortnesse sakearti diui gentle reader muste referre thee vnto former replie hardinge holy mystery pledge resurrection hath partely bene saide partely shalbe saide hereafter large wee maie receiue body christe deede verily without either transubstantiation real presence haue bothe touched treatie also former replieartic diui certainely augustine saithe receiuinge christes body deede receiuinge sacramente sundrie thinges thus writeth ostendit christus quid sit non sacramentotenus sed vera corpus christi manducare august de ciuit li ca eius sanguinem bibere christe sheweth eate body drinke bloude vvaie sacramente verily deede eatinge sacramente mouthe toothe true eatinge christes body token mysterie augustine saithe qui manducat intus non foris qui manducat corde augustin iohan tractat non qui premit dente eateth vvithin eateth vvithout eateth christes body harte yt bruseth sacramente vvith toothe faithe receiueth body christe receiueth substantially really verily deede dwelleth christe christe thus christes body receiued holy father saie fillinge contentation body vnto holinesse sanctification minde thus ye comme within v hardinge ye saie clospe v ouerthrow v learninge wringe weapon handes ende thereof ye strike v downethraso lunucho thinketh heare one saie deni que metuebant omnes iam gnato stoode trowe wee shoulde haue prety plaie vnsensible menne wee feele none deadly blowes wil answeare augustine sometime answeared pascentius arian heretique facile est vt quisque augustinum vincat august ad pascent epist videris vtrum veritate clamore easy mater ouercome augustine see whether truthe noise vvoordes againe non bonum homini est hominem vincere sed bonum est homini vt cum veritas vincat volentem quia malum est homini vt eum veritas vincat muitum nam ipsa vincat necesse est fiue negantem siue confitentem good man conquere man good man truthe maie conquere vvith good vvil il man truthe shoulde conquere againste wil whether wil wil truthe muste needes conquere apologie cap diuision chrysostome aptely writeth wee saie body christe deade carkesse wee selues muste egles meaninge thereby wee muste flie highe wee wil come body christe table chrysostome saithe table egles iaies cyprian also breade saithe foode soule meate belly hardinge deede chrysostome saithe ye reporte sir meane ye eate body christe whiche dead awaie beames whiche vaile temple rente asunder stone earthe quaked body made bloudyto receiue beare christe beinge thruste speare powred foorthe fountaines bloude vvater worlde healthfull thus ye see racketh presseth woordes father writinges neuer vsed kinde figure wee bounde vnder paine damnation receiue sentence euer haue spoken accordinge rigoure extremitie letter better disclose sensible christum baptizati estis christum industis man geeuen thee princely robe crowne wouldest thou set gold wil geeue thee princely robe prince selfe put vpon thee thou wilte saie howe maie man put christe eius corpore saturantur carkesse shalbe thither shal egles resorte togeather saie heauen thither shal egles resorte togeather spoken spiritual faitheful menne folowinge passion humilitie filled vvith body saithe leode con dist quibus circa hoc corpus aquilae sunt quae ali circumuolant spiritualibus aboute body egles flee aboute vvith spiritual vvhinges thus faitheful made egles thus earthe become heauen christes body pulled downe hardinge imagineth mindes affection lifted vp chrysostome selfe expoundeth owne meaninge chrysost homil de pentecoste hodie nobis terra facta est coelum non stellis de coelo terram descendentibus sed apostolis ad coelum ascendentibus quia effusa est copiosa gratia spiritus sancti vniuersum orbem operata est coelum non immutans naturam sed voluntatem emendans daie earthe made heauen starres comminge downe vpon earthe goeinge vp apostle heauen abundante grace holy ghoste powred hath turned vvhole vvorlde heauen changinge nature correctinge vvil manchrysost ad hebraeos homil likewise againe saithe apostoli terra constituti coelo conuersabantur et quid dico coelo altiores erant coelo etiam al coelo et ad ipsum dominum peruenerunt apostle dwellinge earthe conuersation heauen saie heauen higher heauen yea seconde heauen came euen vnto lorde selfe againe saithe chrysost de foenit n homil chrysost corinth homil dauid terram coelum vertit homines facit angelos dauid turneth earthe heauen menne maketh angel againe saithe selfe place hardinge alleged vt terra nobis coelum sit facit hoc mysterium ascende igitur ad coeli porta diligenter attende imo non coeli sed coeli coelorum tunc quod dicimus intueberis mysterie couseth vnto v earthe heauen ascende vp therefore vnto gate heauen marke diligently naie saie vnto gate heauen vnto gate heauen heauens shalt thou see thinges tel thee nowe iudge thou good christian reader true howe agreeable chrysostomes doctrine hardinge saithe muste wee flee highe looke finde body earthe wee eate body excepte wee
