mouthe teethe onely sendeth v force woorkinge faitheto touch holde christe sprite whereby onely waie el wee receiue eate deede verily body christe apologie cap diuision augustine saithe shal holde beinge absent howe shal reache hande vp heauenin iohan tracta laie holde vpon sittinge answeareth reache thither thy faithe thou haste laide holde hardinge vpon woordes iohniohan bishoppes phariseis gaue commaundement knewe iesus shoulde shewe mighte apprehende augustine expoundinge contrary sense saithe let v nowe shewe iewes christe woulde god woulde heares augustine speaketh receiuinge christe sacramente faithe onely laie holde vvhere speaketh receiuinge christe receiue sacramenteand faithe onely vvee receiue christe sacramente receiuinge faithe onely wisheth exhorteth iewes come faithe teacheth maie profitably laye holde christe whome forefather laide holde violent handes damnation let come churche saithe let heare christe laie holde certaine woordes maketh obiection selfe vvel iewe answereth howe shal holde absent howe shal reache vp hande heauen maie laie holde whiche sitteth reache thither thy faithe saithe augustine thou haste laide holde foloweth line whiche plainely declareth meante layinge holde christe faithehe speaketh receiuinge sacrament speaketh receiuinge body christ vvhich vvrought onely faithe receiuinge communion parentes tui tenuerunt carne tu tene corde thy forefather thou iewe tooke holde christe fleashe take thou holde thy harte sheweth howe christe maye holden though concerninge visible sensible presence body heauen right hande father euer saide vpon texte recited implieth muche colour argument againste truthe christes body moste blessed sacramente thus allegation reason concerninge mater besufficiently answeared b sarisburie true hardinge saithe augustine place speaketh nothinge purpose specially sacramente certainely benne great vanitie wil hearer seeke sacramente heauen aboue speaketh embracinge holdinge body christe beinge nowe heauen whiche thinge wrought onely faithe none otherwise whether sacramente without sacramente infinite sentence haue benne vttered holy father like purpose august aduersus iudaeos ca augustine saithe accedite ad eum illuminamini quid est accedite nisi credite comme vnto receiue light comme vnto beleeue againe ambulando non laborabitis ibi enim acceditis vbi creditis walkinge shal paineful ye comme ye beleeue augustin iohan tracta augustin iohan tracta august de natura gra ca againe saithe exijt de manibus eorum non enim apprehendere eum potuerunt quia manus fidei non habuerunt christe departed handes coulde laie holde bicause handes faithe againe christus non recte tangitur id est non recte eum creditur christe vvel touched saie christe wel beleeued likewise againe saith sunt corde spirituales manus certaine spiritual handes harte therefore ambrose saithe stephanus terris positus christum tangit coeloambrosius sermone steuin beinge earthe faithe toucheth christe beinge heauen faithe receiueth c augustine often saithe wee embrace holde christe faithe hardinge able shewe euer saide wee holde christe mouthe teethe receiue downe belly therefore ambrosius lucam lib cap ambrose saithe non corporali tactu christum sed fide tangimus vvee touche christe bodily touchinge vvee touche faithe againe fide christus tangitur fide christus videtur non corpore tangitur non oculis comprehenditurambrosius lucam lib cap faithe christe touched faithe christe seene touched body holden eies likewise augustine saithe dominus consolatur no qui ipsum iam coelo sedentem manu contrectare non possumusaugust epist iohan tracta sed fide contingere possumus lorde comforteth v cannot novve touche vvith hande sittinge heauen faithe vvee maie touche nowe mutche hardinge saithe augustine place maketh mention receiuinge christes body sacramente shal purpose consider hath written otherwheres touchinge augustin iohan tracta thus saithe christus est cibus noster quo nihil dulcius sed si quis habeat palatum sanum corde christe selfe oure meate whiche nothinge sauerie man haue sounde taste harte againe saithe augustin iohan tracta dominus dixit se panem qui de coelo descendit hortans vt credamus eum credere enim eum hoc est manducare panem viuum qui credit eum manducat inuisibiliter saginatur quia inuisibiliter renascitur infans intus est nouus intus est vbi nouellatur ibi satiatur lorde called selfe breade came heauen exhortinge v beleue beleue eate breade life eateth beleeueth fedde inuisibly bicause newe borne inuisibly wardely infante inwardely newe renewed filled saithe eusebius emissenusde con dist quia corpus alleged gratian cum ad reuerendum altare coelestibus cibis satiandus accedis sacrum dei tui corpus sanguinem respice honora mirare mente continge cordis manu suscipe maxime haustu interiori assume vvhen thou commest vnto reuerende aultare communion table fedde heauenly meates beholde holy body bloude thy god honoure woonder touche thy bodily mouthe vvith thy minde receiue thy bodily hande vvith hande thy harte specially take thy inner taste therefore august feria paschatis augustine saithe quisquis cum fide timore verbum dei audis consolatur te fractio panis absentia domini non est absens habeto fidem tecum est quem non vides ideo dominus absentauit se corpore ab omni ecclesia ascendit coelum vt fides aedificetur vvho euer thou faithe feare hearest ye woorde god breakinge breade doothe comforte thee absence lorde absente haue thou faithe thou seest thee therefore lorde touchinge body hath absented selfe al churche ascended heauen faithe maie edified selfe place hardinge saithe maketh litle purpose saithe thus quomodo tenebo absentem quomodo coelum manum mittamaugustin iohan tracta vt ibi sendentem teneam fidem mitte tenuisti parentes tui tenuerunt carne tu tene corde quoniam christus absens etiam praesens est nisi praesens esset nobis ipsis teneri non posset sed quoniam verum est quod ait ecce ego vobiscum sum vsque ad consummationem saeculi abijt hic est et redijt no non deseruit corpus enim suum intulit coelo maiestatem autem non abstulit mundo shal holde christe beinge absent howe shal thruste hande heauen maie holde sittinge sende vp thy faithe thou holdest thy father iewes helde fleashe holde thou thy harte christe beinge absente also presente onlesse presente wee coulde holde mutche true saithe beholde vntil ende worlde therefore gonne yet comme againe hath forsaken v hath auanced body heauen hath vvithdravven maiestie vvorlde al thinges wel considered whereas hardinge ende concludeth woordes thus al allegation reason concerninge mater sufficiently answeared doubte discrete indifferent reader wil thinke crewe longe daie apologie cap diuision neither wee awaie church shewes sale markettes mass carrieinge woorshippinge breade sutche idolatrous blasphemous fondnesse whiche none proue christe apostle euer ordeined leafte vnto v wee iustly blame bishoppes rome without woorde god without authoritie holy father without example antiquitiein ceremoniario rom eccles newe guise doo onely set people sacramental breade woorshipped god doo also carrie aboute vpon amblinge palfraie whither euer selues iourney sutche sorte olde time persian fier reliques goddesse isi solemnely carried aboute procession haue brought sacramentes christe vsed stage plaie solemne sighte ende mennes eies fedde nothinge el madde gasinges foolishe gaudes selfe mater wherein death christe ought diligently beaten harte wherein also mystery redemption ought al holinesse reuerence executed hardinge thinges whiche liketh sathanical sprite blasphemous woordes tovntruthe vvee honour holy mystery profanely dishonoure dishonour bringe contempt suche neither praise make praise woorthy vpbraidinges whit lesse estimation stinkinge breath vile woordes puffed awaie damned sidematth luc prieste maye iustly enioy necessary liuinge seruinge thaulter sayinge masse vve knovv vvoorshippers breade euer shewe selues haue benne light chaffe sounde wheate yet good folkes sake maie leaue vile eloquence selues answeare matter railed belied wise disproued praie good sir thevntruthe novve vsed viler dishonour greatter bla phemie masse beinge highest moste honorable seruice donne god churche whiche wheres beinge already proued treate place prieste whome onely maie donnevntruthe christe neuer called disciple sente abroade saie masse beinge called vocation state life haue rewarde liuinge raile againste masse priestes seruinge aulter god vntil tongue burne head hell fire vve tell priestes catholike churche sellalas haue othervvise moonie avvaie fruite merite christes bloude offered masse onely ministerie labour require necessarie sustenance life defence yee confesse ye cannot awaie carryinge woorshippinge breade cannot wee whose charge laye ye suche idolater nowe woorship breade woulde knowengod forebid shoulde vvater sea god forbid shoulde suffer idolater liue amongest v soothely catholike churche wee knowe none ye cannot away honour whichevntruthes moste fonde blasphemous folie deuoute christen people doo blessed sacramente wee meane christes body christe selfe presente substance vnder forme breade take christian mocke scoffe ieste raile v iewes dare honour lorde christe euer faithe findeth verily substance presente feruent zeale sometimes happeneth abuse certaine place haue crepte good catholike manyet one catholique prelate amedeth defendeth mary wee knowe abrogated misliketh corrupte tastevntruthe fonde heathenishe god selfe saithe vaine woorship mee c muche righte holy deuotion pleasant sighte god therefore allowed churche whiche hote sprite calleth idolatrous blasphemous fondnesse though ceremonie manner whereby sutche deuotion shewed cannot prooued ordinance christe apostle expressed scripture yet christen people doubte god accepteth good harte bishop rome ye blame vniustly might saie also proudely procuringevntruthes foure together dishonoureth christe hath neither goddes vvorde authoritie al father example antiquitie honour worship christe blessed sacrament hath woorde god authoritie al holy father example antiquitie asnote one litle article hardinge hathe sente v tvvelue greate vntruthes haue large proued answeare companion maister iuel eight negatiue article amblinge horse offendeth vvhy ye also offended asse fole bare thevntruthe onely sacramente body body ierusalem whiche horse beareth rome visible weightie nowe inuisible weight donne pompe honour christe ye saie done new guise neither true whiche ye saie bishoppes rome doo carrie sacramente whither euer iourneydoo hardinge scoffe game speaketh earnest ye might haue learned booke whiche ye alleage matter scoffe atlib ceremoniarum ecclesiae ro sectione ca baldachinu suche solemnitie vsed specially pope rideth pontificalibus booke telleth white palfrey trapped gentill faier cleare soundinge bell hanginge necke lead carrieth monstrance pixe holy body christe ouer whiche noble citizen shal beare canopie thus booke ceremony vvhy vvise man speake fondely reade ansvveare praie euill good carry moste holy body whiche christe redeemed v deuotely honoured faithefull people carried abrode brought certaine place hath olde time yet also dothe continually greate comforte helpe sundry person beinge distresse wrought miraculousely healthfull remedy israelite founde healpe god hande bythey againste goddes vvil spedde thereafter read ansvveare bringinge arke fielde marched forewarde againste philistians1 reg reg philistians cried feare perceiued arke israelite armie saide venit deus castra vae nobis god come tentes ala vndone c concerninge order ceremonie whereasgraue consideration people desirous beholde body redeemer faithe carnall ete directed forme breadein order ceremonie nothinge appeareth christen man vnseemely vnreasonable man able holde vp hie sacramente conuenient donne bothe satisfie deuotion mainetaine faithe pope selfe commonly aged man therefore ouer weakea horse supplieth pope e ice seruice specially arraied pontificalibus suche solemnity againe instrument serueth purpose greate weighty apperteineth honour christe waie longe ayer parte hote man well able lacke strength beare meete borne case may horse put seruice supplie whiche naturall weakenesse faileth man vvherein serueth one beareth male asse bare christe kine drewe arke neither ought custome bearinge moste holy body christethe custome carryinge sacramet vvhere pope goeth neither nevve strange pope goeth seeme newe strange reade life blessed martyr steuen firste pope rome aboue thirtene hundred yeres past tharsitius deacon length also suffred death christe bare lordes body time attended vpon blessed man pope steuen went martyrdome vvho desireth see described large maie finde greate fonde fabulare simeon metaphrasies greeke writer wel approued highly esteemed greeke churche vita stephani primo witnesse whereof haue ssale mass ambrose describeth certaine faithful person caried vvas greate abuse sacramente yet vvithout either pyxe pompe therefore vvas aftervvarde vtterly take avvaie throughout vvhole churche god blessed sacrament themin oratione funebri satyrum fratrem innocent de mysterijs missae lib wente sea whome brother satyrus obteined shipwracke helpe thereof hanginge stole necke seekinge none succoure caste selfe sea miraculously escaped safe lande neither done without speciall mysterie though vnknowen parte although saithe learned pope reason cannot geuen al thinges euer haue benne brought vre forefather yet thinke quoth therein lie hidden profounde mystery reporte nowe secrete conscience good christen people whether bishoppes rome vse blessed sacrament reuerently bonorably nothis defender folovveth iulian lucian porphyriabus celsus suche vvicked infidel ratherif yee game thence tel v vvhence yee persian fire reliques goddesse isi stage plaie madde gasinges foolishe gaudes liketh wicked chammes broode raile vvherein folowe sheppes whiche iulian apostata lucian porphyrius celsus sutche prophane helhoundes haue trodden like manner railed holy mysieries christen religion namely celsus origen writeth obiected christian sacrifice mithra whiche idoll persian woorshipped called name sunne whence saide taken sacramentescotra celsum lib de mithra vide suidam dictione rite ceremony righte finde augustine writinge manichee payn me founde faulte christen people formoste vaine vntruthes augustine speaketh neither honour adoration christes body fourmes honour donne body bloude christe vnder formes breade vvine saitinge honoured bacchus cere b sarisburie concerninge satanical sprite stinkinge breathes vile woordes sutche like flower eloquence hardinge confesse selfe far inferiour neuer hable make answeare true ye saie woorkeman woorthy hiere2 corinth paule saith lorde hath appointed preacheth gospel shoulde liue gospel christe euer saie vnto goe al worlde saie priuate masse offer vp vnto father remission sinnes apostle prophete doctour father euer taught doo ye sette selfe woorke without commission renne foorthe noman biddeth ye owne menne reason ought paie selues mass saie neuer sette open sale wherefore decree written councel oxforde constitution othonis legat inae folio venalitatem missarum districte inhibemus vvee streitly forbidde sale mass thinke many wise father would forebidde thinge ye neuer vsed late conference holden vvoormes bishop sidon beinge presente durste saie dare saie sutche vnlawful sale onely saidein colloquio vvormatien con essis vvas season talke thereof woordes quid attinebat de missis venalibus de mercatu indulgentiarum c mentionem intempestinam inducere purpose speake sellinge mass pardonnes season priestes ye saie catholique churche sel fruite merite christes bloude marueile thei haue sel ye christe selfe ye would sette sale father haue donne sutche one hegregor lib epist gregorie writeth iesum christum dominum nostrum haeretico accepta pecunia venundedit tooke monie solde iesus christe lorde vnto heretique bishop rome selleth pardonnes thinge woulde seeme sel onely fruites merites bloude christe ye saie god forebidde wee shoulde suffer idolater liue emongest v yet neare frendes haue thought ye haue benne far mainteinance idolatrievaine deuotion polydorus vergilius intreatinge woorshippinge image saithe thuspolydor de inuentorib rer lib cap eo insaniae deuentum est vt haec par pietatis parum differat ab impietate far proceded madnesse parte holinesse far vvickednesse ludouicus viues saithe seeth greate difference bitweene certaine christian woorshippinge image olde heathen adouringe idolles ye saie carrieinge aboute sacrament right holy deuotion pleasante sight god christian people doubt god accepteth good harte euen doubte saide sometime vnto iewes esai quis requisiuit ista de manibus vestris required thinges handes august de consen euangelist lib cap august quae ex veteri testament quae chrysostom acta homil gabriel lect augustine saithe socratis sententia est vnumquen que deum sic coli oportere quomodo se ipse colendum esse praeceperit judgement socrates euery god ought woorshipped selfe hath commaunded againe saithe constat fidem stultam non solum minime prodesse sed etiam obesse certaine foolishe faithe onely dothe good also hurteth chrysostome saith tale sunt diabolo venadi artes qui praetextu pietatis laqueos tegit sutche sleightes huntinge hath diuel vnder colour holinesse hideth snare touchinge solemnitte carrieinge ye sacrament owne doctour gabriel biel coulde haue tolde christus dedit discipulis sacramentum vt ipsum honorifice conseruarent sed dedit sui vsum dicens accipite manducate christe gaue socramente disciple ende thei shoulde keepe vvith honour gaue vse saienge take eate likewise saithe humbertuscitatur cassandro liturgijs christus non tantum benedixit panem reseruauit frangendu crastinum nec fregit tantum reposuit sed fractum statim distribuit christe onely blesse breade reserue broken nexte daie onely breake laie vp beinge broken streight vvaie deliuered al strange solemne festiual guise pope vrbanus fourthe learned christe paule onely reuelation dame eua ancharesse good aduise founded newe feaste corpus christi caused sacramente borne aboute procession ancientechrysost matthae homil woorthy father chrysostome saithe discamus christum ex ipsius voluntate honorare nam qui honoratur eo maxime honore laetatur quem ipse vult non quem no optamus let v learne honour christe ovvne vvil honoured deliteth moste honour selfe vvoulde haue honoure wee fa sie notwithstandinge ye sacramental breade carried onely vpon horse pope selfe borne alofte chaire golde vpon shoulder sixe eight noble menne praie whether hath greatter honour reste pope saithe hardinge olde man rideth pontificalibus loden apparel pyxe weighty vveather hoate none creature supplie roome therefore lately concluded louaine greate solemne sadnesse horse muste plaie pope parte carrie monstrance mutche hardinge hath purposely made mention pope ridinge pontificalibus solemnitie pompe thereof knowen fewe shal impertinente briefely disclose order thereof thus therefore written ceremoniarie romeceremoniar section cap sic papa equitat pontificalibus aliquam ciuitatem cardinales descendunt ex equis accedunt reuerenter ad papam osculantur illi pedem episcopus ciuitatis accedit ad papam cum debitis reuerentijs offer illi crucem osculandam quam pontifex reuerenter cum mitra tamen osculabitur non enim commode poterit ei abstrahi equiti ab equestribus miracle si tamen placuerit mitram deponere non erit inconueniens deinde praelatus incipiat antiphonam ecce sacerdos magnus thus pope holinesse rideth cittie pontificalibus cardinalles lighte horse comme reuerently vnto pope kisse foote bishop cittie commeth likewise pope dewe reuerence offereth crosse kisse whiche pope shal kisse reuerently keepinge miter notvvithstandinge sitteth horse backe horsemenne cannot easily take miter sette againe howbeit shal like put miter shalbe greate inconuenience afterwarde bishop shal beginne antheme beholde greate prieste pricketh foorthe pontificalibus carrieinge arke god fielde time eli highe prieste1 regum boadeth good argumente carrieinge sacramente time armie israel ouerthrowen thertie thousande souldiers slaine emongest twoo sonnes eli arke taken eli selfe fel backe chaire brake necke therefore hardinge ye shal haue mutche adoo make good procession example mater ye saie hath benne proued sundrie miracle firste whether haue benne sutche miracle wrought vncertaine graunted yet maie miracle alwaies stande good proufes owne doctour alexander de hale saithealexand halen parte quae mem arti miracula fiunt aliquando humana procuratione aliquando diabolica operatione miracle wrought sometime woorkinge procurement menne sometime conueiance diuel saithe nicolaus lyra owne doctours speakinge likewise owne miraclesnicol lyra ca danielis fit aliquando ecclesia maximum deceptio populi miraculis fictis sacerdotibus vel eis adhaerentibus propter lucrum temporale et talia extirpanda sunt bonis praelatis sicut ista extirpata sunt daniele churche god people oftentimes mutche deceiued feined miracle either priestes priestes familiar temporal gaine sutche miracle must rooted good bishoppes rooted daniel woordes willinge rehearse placereioinder pag augustin iohan tracta liketh carpe pike quarrel reioinder like purpose augustine saithe contra istos vt sic loquar mirabiliarios cautum fecit deus meus dicens nouissimis temporibus exurget pseudopropherae facientes signa portenta vt errorem inducant si fieri potest etiam electos ecce praedixi vobis ergo cautos no fecit sponsus quia miraculis decipi non debemus god hath warned ware moungers miracle saieinge laste day shal rise vp false prophetes woorkinge signes woonders ende possible bringe electe erroure beholde haue fore warned therefore bridegrome hath willed v beware vvee maie deceiued miracle tale ye allege tharsitius satyrus make nothinge either adoration sacramente el pope palfraie wemen child laie menne vsed carrie home sacramente naptekinnesarticulo keepe forcelettes former replie largely shewed abuse mysterie therefore afterwarde abolished greeueth mutche wee saie pope causeth sacramental breade carried vpon horse kinges persia vsed olde time carrie fiere whiche called orimasda imagined god therefore ye crie passion chammes broode helhoundes euer might serue beste euen like sobrietie modestiethe carricinge sacramente whoe sommetime like case cried magna diana ephesiorum great diana ephesian howe example agreeable resemble folie wee coulde finde none neither maie iustly actor truely saie ye haue receiued none order vsages heathen owne glose noteth vpon decree clerici euntes ad tumulos mortuorum portabant secum sacramenta corporisde con dist non oportet glosa sanguinis christi super tumulos ea distribuebant et haec consuetudo facta fuit gentibus clerkes priestes goeing graues deade carried sacramentes body bloude christe made distribution thereof ouer graues custome vvas vsed emong heathen nicolaus leonicenus saith nicola leonicenus varia historia libr cap isidis sacerdotes aegypto vtebatur lineis vestibus semper erat deronso capillo quod etiam per manus traditum ad nostra v que tempora peruenisse videtur siquidem ij qui apud no diuino cultui sacris altaribus praesident barbam comam que nutrire prohibentur sacris vtuntur lineis amictibus priestes ye goddesse isi egypte vsed weare linen surplesses euermore theire heade shauen whiche thinge seemeth haue benne deriued vnto time hande hande emonge v minister goddes seruice serue holy aultars forebidden suffer heare theire heade theire bearde growe theire diuine seruice vse linen garmentes epiphani lib haeresi de collyridienis nonlatin alphabet nazianzen ad heronem epiphanius saithe heretiques called collyridiani vsed set foorth carrie breade doubte sacramente ye honoure ye blessed virgine marie nazianzenus seemeth thus coplaine somme sutche vnseemely behaueours time quid referam saithe nonlatin alphabet shal speake holy mystery turned plaie comedie claudius du sainctes owne doctour expoundeth woordes mysteria comoedias conuersa like disorder heathen apuleius seemeth saie dicimus deos incedere humanis pedibus wee tel goddes goe mennes feete whole difference bitweene behalfe standeth onely god goeth horse feeteclaud du sainctes de liturgijs praefat apuleius lib theire mannes feete holy sacramente christes deathe neuer appointed vnto v ende carried thus aboute open shewe onely receiued christe selfe commaunded remembrance body bloude therefore scyprian de coena domini augusti contra faustum lib cap cyprian saithe recipitur non includitur receiued shut vp ye allege augustine painimes founde faulte withe christian people honoure donne body bloude christe vnder fourmes breade wine open manifeste vntruthe augustine place speaketh one woorde neither body bloude christe fourmes accidentes manner adoration honoure donne vnto sacramente shal behoue write hereafter aduisedly otherwise learned wil saie ye either knowe care notartic diui ye write obiection augustine answeared large former replie touchinge mater augu de ciuitate dei lib cap augustine saith deus meus vbi que praesens est vbi que totus nusquam inclusus qui possit adesse secretus abesse non motus god euerywhere presente euerywhere whole shut vp inclosed novvhere hable secretely presente chrysost de ieiunijs lectione geneseos absente without mouinge chrysostome saith magnum crede mihi bonum est scire quid sit creatura quid sit creator quae sint opera quis vero opifex si enim hoc diligenter scirent discernere haeretici nunquam vti que omnia confunderent quae sursum sunt facerent deorsum non dico quod coelum stella deorsum terram autem sursum ducerent sed quod regem ab excelsis sedibus deducentes cum creaturis operibus collocauerint creaturam vero diuinis honoribus affecerint beleeue greate matter vnderstande creature god creatoure woorkes vvoorkeman theise heretiques coulde make diligente difference hereof would thus make confusion al thinges place thinges beneathe aboue meane either pulle heauen starres set vp earthe theire place pulle downe kinge selfe high throne place emongest vvoorkes creature side vvoorshippe creature vvith godly honoure apologie cap diuision bisides saie sommetime doo persuade fooles hable theire mass distribute applie vnto mennes commoditie al merites christes deathe yea although many time party thinke nothing mater vnderstande ful litle donne mockerie heathenishe fansie ioie faith applieth deathe crosse christe benefite acte massinge prieste faithe sacramentes saithe augustine doth iustifie sacramentes origen ad rom li cap origen saithe christe prieste propitiation sacrifice vvhiche propitiation commeth euery one meane faithe reckeninge wee saie sacramentes christe without faithe doo profite liue greate deale lesse doo profite deade hardinge vntruthe enclosed catholique doctrine shal appeare leaste piece apologie without witnes proufe ye child father lie ye make v affirme mass distribute applie men indifferently euer disposed ye meane appeareth partely ye saie special doctrine wheres vttered al merites christes deathe tel vsyour ovvne scholastical catholique doctoures harding reade ansvveare euer taught doctrine catholike churche yea god good prone bestowe mercie onely man faithe prepared geueth abundantly vnto also though owne parte haue faithe presently yet others sake whiche god derely beloued frendes farethe better hath gifte obteigned hima per shifte vvee speake sacramentes hardinge ansvveareth v praier steuen praied deathe persecuted prayed faithe al christe grace geuen vnto theire iewishnes came faith christe shal exclude blessed martyr worship honoure throughe praier one special meane grace applied vnto vvhat effecte praier tookethe effecte steues praier act serm de sanctis co tra duas epist pelagian ad bonifacium lib ca heb man thereof doubte maye thinke haue wrought mutche benefite others lesse malice seinge mutche paule vvho scripture saithe yet breathinge threatninges slaughter againste christes disciple chaunged conuerted persecutour became apostle augustine writeth si sanctus stephanus sic non orasset ecclesia paulum non haberet steuen praied churche shoulde haue paule nowe priestes without publike auctoritie consecrating body bloude christe yet waie praier doo obteine men conuerted faithe whiche applyinge one fruite christes merites mutche publike minister bishop whiche assumpted amonge men ordeined men matter belonginge god may offer vp giftes sacrifice sinnes nowe ye liste learne kinde applyinge vse massesthe applieing christes deathe doo offer vp vnto god firstevvhat kinde applying sacrifice masse lib de vocat gentium ca vntruthe p asphemous horrible sonne representinge passion celebratinge memorie samevntruthe christe eu bade offer vp vnto father accordinge christes institution measure good procure god onely knowen learned bishop prosper saithe grace sauiour passe ouer person see happen praier churche wherein sacrifice conteined augustine minde admitted referred secrete iudgementes goddes iustice acknowledged depth secrete may opened life b sarisburie thus ye saie hardinge ye make v affirme mass wee distribute applie menne indifferently merites christes deathe howe euer disposed token ye child father lie therefore ye saie tel v euer taught doctrine catholike churche ye vnskilful hardinge far seeke owne doctours maie please vnderstande moste catholique pillers catholique churche haue euen thus taught v thomas de vio otherwise called caietanus catholique cardinal catholique churche rome conference augusta germanie doctour luther saide thus fides non est necessaria accessuro ad eucharistiamparalip vrsper anno faith necessarie wil receiue sacramente thankes geuinge notwithstandinge otherwheres acknowledgeth errour confesseth commonly receiued beleeued many euen catholique churche rome thus writeth hoc videtur communis multorum errorcardinal caie anus de vsis spiritualium quae quod putant hoc sacrificium ex solo opere operato habere certum meritum vel certam satisfactionem quae applicatur huic vel illi herein standeth common errour many thei thinke sacrifice hath certaine mente satisfactio whiche applied man man meane faithe receiuer onely meane woorke wrought prieste biel lection iacob de valentia sermo de epiphania gabriel biel saith prieste receiueth sacramente vertue thereof passeth al member churche iacobus de valentia saithe prieste mouthe body therefore prieste receiueth sacramente al member refreased againe saithe no communicamus ore sacerdotis wee people doo communicate receiue sacramente mouthe priestethom de venerabil sacramet aliar cap thomas aquine youre angelical doctour saithe thus sicut corpus domini semel oblatum est cruce pro debito originali ita offertur iugiter pro quotidianis delictis altari body lorde offered vpon crosse debte original sinne daily offered vpon aultare debte daily sinnes doctrine longe sithence holden catholique strongly mainteined catholique doctours catharinus one woorthies late chapter tridentecatharinus de incruento sacrificio noui aeterni testamentes saith apparet quod pro peccatis sub nouo testamento post acceptam salutaris hostiae baptismo efficaciam commissis non habemus pro peccato hostiam illam quam christus obtulit pro peccato mundi pro delictis baptismum praecedentibus non enim nisi semel ille mortuus est et ideo semel duntaxat hostia illa ad hunc effectum applicatur appeareth sinnes committed vnder newe testamente wee haue receiued baptisme power healthful sacrifice vvee haue nomore sacrifice sinne vvhiche christe offered sinne vvorlde sinnes committed baptisme christe neuer died therefore sacrifice christe crucified applied vnto v onely effecte hereby hardinge ye maie see doctrine lacketh defence emongest catholiquesthe applieing christes deathe summe meaninge hereof sinnes committed baptisme foregeeuen death christe onely sacrifice masse whiche thinge seemeth cannot tel vnto al godly eares seemeth horrible greate blasphemie speake praiers specially large sorte far impertinente pourpose beinge vtterly parte question merites christes deathe whereof wee entreate conueied vnto v god receiued v god conueieth v onely mercie wee receiue onely faithe way whereby either procure goddes mercie enkendle faithe many sundrie goddes mercie procured sommetime praier sommetime meanes breede encrease faith v moe way reckened somme menne moued onely hearinge goddes woorde somme others beholdingeeuseb li ca weighinge goddes miracle iustinus martyr firste alluered faithe crueltie tyrannes constancie patience goddes sainctescyprian de laude martyrij cyprian saith tanta est vi martyrij vt per illam credere etiam cogatur qui te vult occidere greate power martyrdome thereby euen forced beleeue woulde kille thee augustine saitheaugust confes lib cap sturred vp comme christe readinge heathen booke written cicero called hortensius thus saithe ille liber mutauit affectum meum ad eipsum domine mutauit preces meas heathen booke changed minde turned praiers lorde vnto thee emonge cause sacramentes serue specially directe aide faitheaugust contra faustum lib cap augustine calleth verba visibilia visible vvoordes scale testimony gospel notwithstandinge wee saie neither woorke prieste nature sacramente selfe maketh v partetakers christes deatheaugu iohan tracta onely faithe receiuer augustine saithe vnde est ista tanta virtu aqua vt corpus tangat cor abluat nisi faciente verbo non quia dicitur sed quia creditur whence hathe water greate power toucheth body wassheth harte sauinge vvoorkinge vvoorde pronounced beleeued saithe hesychiushelych leuit lib cap cyrill leuit lib gratia dei comprehenditur sola fide grace god parte receiued onely faithe saithe cyrillus siclus fidei nostrae formam habet si enim fidem obtuleris taquam pretium christo velut ariete immaculato hostiam dato accipies remissionem peccatorum sicle hath fourme faithe thou offer vp thy faithe price thou shalt receiue remission thy sinnes christe vnspotted ramme geeuen sacrifice ye saie ye offer vp christe sonne godde really substantially vnto god father ye speake dreame pleasante phantasie ye awake knowe ye saie greate blasphemie former replie maie appeare largeart eul apologie cap diuision theire bragges woonte make theire purgatorie though know thing late risen emogest yet better blockishe olde wiues deuise hardinge purgatorie semeth v thinge wee shoulde mutche bragge ye wil bragge helpovver ouer purgatorie vve tremble remembrance rather bragge vvel howe euer bepurgatory acknovvleged defender antiquitie apoc wil ye nil ye seeno marueile vvas receiued painimes longe ere apostle vvere borne ye driuen confesse newe thinge deede cal papistes among doctrine praieing deadevntruthe reade ansvveare whereof necessarely foloweth doctrine purgatorie deliuered taught holden apostle deliuered tradition chrysostome damascene reporte papistes firstethis fantasie vvere sommevvhat vvee purgation christes bloud forasmutche nothing defiled commeth kingdome heauen departe life though faithe christe child euerlastinge kingdome yet throughly perfitly cleane remaineth sutche life come place euerlastinge ioye2 cor haue theire purgation furthermore apostle saithe seeinge haue promise derely beloued leta doughty argumente proue purgatorie v cleanse selues al filthines fleashe spirite makinge perfite satisfaction feare god vvho seeth hereof folowe many whiche iustified somewhat satisfaction holynes lacketh vvhiche taken hence atteine measure holynes requisite life state purged cleansed b sarisburie wee comme paper vvalles painted fieres purgatorie liked harding longe sithence pleasantly sport pulpites bugge meete onely fraie child yet vpon better aduise deeper studie tremblethe god wote quaketh feare remember tormentes somme body hath sithence tolde howe let mutche dismaie selfe pope either firste made receiued hande heathen firste allowed euen hathe whole iurisdiction power ouer commaundeth pleasure whether ye make bragges hereof leaue question certainely thispanormi de electione cap licet like cause one felowes saithe papa potest quicquid deus ipse potest pope doo vvhat euer god selfe doo saith animae existentes purgatorio sunt de iurisdictione papae papa si vellet iohan angelus posset totum purgatorium euacuare soules purgatorie pope peculiare vnder pope iurisdiction pope might stande pleasure hable make gaole deliuerie auoide al purgatorie pourposeclemens pap bulla pope selfe commaundeth chargeth angel god fetche foorthe thence euer howe many euer wil haue deliuered hereafter place conuenient shal better appeare seeme bragges let hardly called somme name maie seeme please better ye take good holde wee confesse imagination purgatorie newe fansie howe aduantage herein greate haue benne errours great errours beginninge augustine saith origenes ipsum diabolum que angelos eius post grauiora pro meritis diuturniora supplicia august de cluitate dei lib cap ex illis cruciatibus eruendos atque sociandos sanctis angelis credidit ancient learned father origen beleued diuel selfe angel greate long pounishement suffered theire wickednesse shalbe deliuered theire tormentes shalbe placed heauen holy angel god origen pist ad roman ca lib origen selfe saith somme thought christe goe helle crucified againe saue preachinge former death could saued againe ye origen saith selfe ego puto quod post resurrectione ex mortuis indigebimus sacramento cluente no origen luca homil que purgante thinke vvee shal rise againe deade wee shal haue neede sacramente baptisme washe v purge v cleane augustine saithe antiquitie purgatorie quidam nullas poenas nisi purgatorias volunt esse post mortem somme menne wil haue pounishemente bee deathe onely paine purgatorie euen paules time somme august de cluitate dei lib cap cor concil cartha canon aliue baptized deade councel carthage appeareth somme vsed thruste sacramente mouthe deade body meaninge thereby maie thought procure somme relife soule woordes placuit vt corporibus defunctorum eucharistia non detur dictum est enim domino accipite edite cadauera autem nec accipere possunt nec edere wee thinke good yt sacramente geuen body deade lorde saithe take eate deade body neither take eate ancient errours olde time easy seene fantasie purgatorie sprange firste heathen receiued emongest time darkenesse long comming christe maie plainely appeare plato vergile ye shal finde described largeplato timaeo aeneid august de ciuita li ca whole common weale al order degree purgatorie augustine saithe olde heathen romaine sacrifice whiche called sacrum purgatorium purgatorie sacrifice saie papistes defende purgatorie muste christes apostle needes papistes haue taught v purgatorie woorde euer wrote tradition true peter saide masse rome golden cope triple crovvne onlesse perhaps somme man wil thinke1 tim paule saith homines priuati veritate existimantes quaestum esse pietatem menne voide truthe thinkinge theire gaine godlinesse pet peter saithe per auaritiam fictis sermonibus nego iabuntur de vobis couetousnesse fained talke shal make sale woordes gaue v warninge fourme doctrine purgatorie better authority recken ye lightly finde none praier deade whiche ye saie ye haue receiued tradition apostle notwithstandinge graunted true yet dooth euermore importe purgatorie chrysostome basile theire liturgy make theire publike solemne prater sorte offerimus tibi rationalem hunc cultubasil chrys liturgijs pro fide requiescetibus maioribus patribus patriarchis prophetis apostolis praeconibus euangelistis martyribus confessoribus c praecipue vero pro sanctissima immaculata super omnes benedicta domina nostra deipara semper virgine maria wee offer lorde vnto thee reasonable seruice reaste faithe elder father patriarkes prophetes apostle preacher euangelistes martyr confessours c specially moste holy without spotte blessed aboue al lady goddes mother euer virgine marie cyprian saithe like manner sacrificamus pro martyribuscyprian lib epist vvee make sacrifice martyr yet trowe ye wil conclude hereof patriarkes prophetes apostle preacher euangelistes martyr confessours blessed virgine marie al purgatorie otherwise ye woulde mutche enlarge pope dominion side mass deade ye haue vsed praie thus libera eos tartaro e profundo lacu ex ore leonis deliuer lorde purgatorie hel deepe doungeon lion mouthe trowe ye mutche thral vnto pope ye wil turne lion mouthe deepe doungeon al worlde helle selfe purgatorie thus ye see hardinge owne doctrine ye maie praie deadevncleansed yet neuer neare purgatorie healpe forewarde mater leaste somme natural reason ye saie thus mutche nothinge defiled commeth kingdome heauen somme departe oute life though faithe christe child euerlastinge kingdome yet throughly perfitely cleane remaineth sutche life comme place euerlastinge toie haue theire purgation warrante minor argumente ye bringe woordes paule rightly wel pourpose manner otherwise commonly handle scripture though outwarde man corrupted2 cor weakened whiche woordes ambrose expoundeth thus oppression stripe hunger thirste colde nakednesse yet soule renewed made stronger daie daie againe let v cleanse selues al filthinesse fleashe2 cor sprite ergo saie ye vve must confesse force theise vvoordes muste needes place wherein purge v cleane life maie wee litle put remembrance waie wee cleanse selues accordinge woordes paule al manner filthinesse bothe fleashe sprite beseeche remaineth purged purgatorie howe proue imperfection corruption nature euermore hangethe fleashe ye might iudgemente haue alleged many authoritiesesai iob far pregnante clearer esai saithe al righteousnesse like vnto fowle stained cloute iob saithe inter sanctos eius nemo est fidelis et coeli non sunt mundi conspectu eius emonge sainctes god none faitheful roman augu psal heauens cleane sight paule saithe knovve good thinge fleashe augustine saithe let apostle christe selues saie lorde foregeeue v offence sutche imperfection corruption wee liue wee euermore carrie fleashe therefore saie purged hereof wee maie cleane fitte enter heauen wee muste needes passe thoroughe fieres purgatorie meane ye haue wel enlarged pope iurisdiction beinge true neither neuer creature neither prophete apostle martyr angel archangel heauen selfe christe onely excepted force muste cleansed purgatorie origen psal homil therefore origen greate fautoure erroure saith thus vt ego arbitror omnes no necesse est venire illum ignem etiamsi paulus aliquis sit vel petrus suppose al vvee muste needes comme fiere yea althoughe paule peterorigen luca homil therefore saithe alleged ego puto quod post resurrectionem ex mortuis indigebimus sacramento eluente no atque purgante nemo enim ab que sordibus resurgere poterit neque vllam puto posse animam reperiri quae vniuersis statim vitijs careat thinke resurrection deade vvee shal neede sacramente baptisme vvashe v make v cleane noman rise againe vvithout filthe neither doo thinke soule founde voide al manner sinne al vaine fantasy meane wel hardinge also origen1 iohan iohn saith sanguis iesu christi filij dei purgat no ab omni peccato bloude iesus christe sonne god purgeth v maketh v cleane al sinnes prophete saithe hourre euer sinner shal repente mourne sinnes shalbe safe esai saithe sinnes shalbe redde scarlet esai hebrae yet shal made white snowe paule saithe christus purgationem peccatorum nostrorum fecit christe bloude hathe vvrought purgation sinnesvncleansed therefore cyprian saithe cyprian de passione christi sanguis tuus domine non quaerit vltionem sanguis tuus lauat crimina peccata condonat thy bloud lorde seketh reuenge thy bloude vvassheth sinnes pardoneth trespass whereas telle v somme heathenishe fantasie sinnes cannot washte awaie longe tracte time paine purgatorie cyprian saithe cyprian de coena domini eodem articulo temporis cum iam anima festinet ad exitum egrediens ad labium expirantis emerserit poenitentiam clementissimi dei benignitas non aspernatur nec serum est quod verum est moment time euen vvhen soule ready passe euen lippes partie ready yelde vp sprite goodnesse moste merciful god refuseth repentance vvhat euer truely donne neuer late chrysostome saithe chrysost gene homil latro cruce ne que vno die opus habebat et quid dico vno die ne que breui hora tanta est dei erga no misericordia thiefe crosse needed mutch one daie repete selfe speake one daie needed one houre greate mercie god towarde v side man departe hence without repentance augustine saithe august epist imparatum inueniet illum dy domini quem imparatum inuenerit suae vitae huius vltimus dy shal daie lorde finde vnprouided laste daie life findeth vnprouided ambrosi de bono mortis ambrose saithe qui hic non accipit remissionem peccatorum ibi non erit life receiueth remission sinnes shal hierome expoundinge woordes christe thou shalt goe foorthe thence vntil thou haue paide laste farthinge saithe thus hierony lamentationes hieremiae li cap august de sermon domini monte lib significat semper non exiturum else quia semper soluat nouissimum quadrantem dum sempiternas poenas terrenorum peccatorum luit christes meaninge shal neuer comme muste euermore paie laste farthinge while suffereth euerlastinge pounishemente sinnes committed worlde saithe augustine donec soluas nouissimum quadrantem miror si non cam significat poenam quae vocatur aeterna vntil thou paie laste farthing marueile eth paine vvhiche called euerlastinge hereby hardinge thinke maie partely appeare mainteine painted fire paper vvalles painted authority paper reason verily christian people easte churche god whiche sommetime greate famous churche weast notwithstandinge beleeued god christe knewe boothe hel heauen yet purgatorie thei skil one doctoures saithealphonsus de haeresibus li de indulgetijs v que hodiernum diem purgatorium non est graecis creditum vntil daie grecian easte churche purgatorie vvas neuer beleued therefore ye cannot iustely saie fantasie herein euermore accoumpted vniuersal catholique apologie cap diuision augustine deede sommetime saithaugu psal sutch certaine place sommetime denieth maie sutch one sommetime doubteth sommetime againe vtterly denieth al thinketh menne therein deceiued certaine natural good wil beare theire frendes departed yet one erroure hathe growen vp sutche haruest massemongers mass beinge solde abroade commonly euery corner temple god became shoppes geate monei selie soules borne hande nothing necessarie bought deede nothinge gaineful menne selle hardinge vvel railed reason authority piththy mockes scoffes spiteful ye hearde thankes god sutche shrewed beastes haue shorte hornesact nowe augustine festus sayde paule haste thou appealed caesar caesar shalt thou goe saie wee though hauinge auctoritie ouer whiche festus ouer paule augustine ye referre mater augustine shall ye iudged woulde alleage vnto sundrie place theit vvas good pointe skil vvith good countenance passe ouer scripture whiche maie sufficiently proue purgatorie christen man contentious wil doo hereafter occasion serueth nowe saincte augustine augustine affirmeth purgatorie plaine expresse vvoordes cor vve saie plainely augustine affirmeth purgatorie itvntruthe shalbe shevved reade ansvveare cannot shewed doubteth mutche lesse vtterly denyeth sutche sundry place woorkes expoundeth woordes paule corinthian purgatorie apostle saithe woorkes whiche builded vpon fundation whiche christe shalbe tried fire booke de ciuitate dei hathe declared iudgemente touchinge paine diuerse sortes whiche men suffer sinnes committed saithe thus paine temporal suffer life onely theire death also yet moste seuere laste iudgemente may therefore please syrs reade augustine sutche place reade al hathe written ende mutcheo careful good man care greate lette domestical care thinke verily ye wil secretly agree iudgemente v thoughe shame consideration stage ye plaie parte openly ye wil confesse therefore booke de haeresibus ad quoduultdeum condemneth aerius haeresie consequently al others opinion heresy arians added also none ought praie make oblation deade vvhere ye make augustine vncertaine pointe though saide sommetime sutche certain place sometime maie sutche one sometime doubted sometime plainely denied sutche either ye vnderstande augustine ye saie contrary owne knowledge verily ye bolde himvntruthe manifeste reade augustine vvoordes ansvveare firste denieth purgatory false ye alleage hypognostica margent booke reade againe request selues wil saie place proueth purposelib hypognostic n author woorke whether augustine whiche erasmus beleueth euer denieth purgatory daie general iudgemente place euerlastinge rest paine kingdome heauen hel denieth vvhiche also denie speaketh againste pelagianshaeres augustine writeth ad quoduultdeum promised infantes dyinge without baptisme certaine euerlastinge blessed life without besides kingedome god vvhiche heresie sundry place reproueth seemeth woorde purgatorium noted margent bookevntruthe margine vvas noted erasmus thunlearned printer begiled vvhiche sheweth howe profoundely ye seene doctoresvvhat augustine doubted touchinge purgatory thinge doubted touchinge matter vvhether temporal paine onely punishe thevntruth blasphemo bloude christe reade ansvveare satisfaction iustice god also purge correcte soules deade sutche wise temporal paine wont life nowe whether smarte sorowe thinges lefte behinde whiche proceded life carnal affection remaine also soules theire departure body whereof augustine sheweth selfe stande doubte enchiridio ad laurent cap whether fyre whiche soules feele purgatory paineth themo graue commentarie vvi e mater called question also degree diminishe correcte venial secular affection whiche carried theire deathe whether deathe selfe ende remaine correction minde yet beinge viciousscriptures proue purgatorie onely punishemente sinne paste thinge whereof augustinethis vvhole mater concluded vvith seeminge likely hoode semeth haue doubted effecte question redargno de ciuita dei lib cap quia forsitan verum est saye againste per aduenture true b sarisburie wee raite hardinge euen christe railed certaine others whoes steppe ye seeme treade made house god caue theeues place scripture whiche ye thought beste passe ouer whereby purgatorie iudgemente vndoubtedly maie proued man contentious iohan trowe verily verily saie vnto heareth woorde beleeueth sente hath euerlastinge life shal comme damnation hathe passed deathe vnto life esai prophete saithe christe esai wounded transgression broken iniquity chastisemente peace vpon stripe wee made whole paule saith christe hath taken obligation againste vscoloss apocal hathe fastened vnto crosse iohn saith blessed deade die lorde euen saithe sprite reste theire laboures theire woorkes folowe saithe purgatorie reste theire laboures apocal againe shal hunger nomore shal thirste nomore lambe whiche middes throne shal gouerne shal leade purgatorie vnto liuely fountaines vvaters god shal wipe waie al teares theire eies sutche like place trowe whereby ye assure selfe certainely purgatorie vnto augustine wee haue appealed augustine ye saie wee shal goe howe ye consider mater wel ye shal finde appeale liethe vnto augustine benne indi ferente dealinge haue saide bernarde bernard cantica serm ad euangelium appellasti ad euangelium ibis ye haue appealed vnto gospel vnto gospel ye shal goe augustine notwithstandinge authoritie greate learninge deepe yet case shal wel appeare doubteful iudge doubteful iudge far foorthe doubteth iudgeaugust ad laurenti ca dist sciendu owne canon telleth erroris labyrinthum nonnulli intricando impingunt cum ante iudicant quam intelligant many menne geuinge iudgemente vnderstande entanglinge selues fal maze errour howe pronounce sentence confesseth knoweth assure vsaugust qu ad dulcitiu q hable assure selfe touchinge certainetie doctrine alleage one twoo place many augustine writeth thus tale aliquid etiam post hanc vitam fieri incredibile non est vtrum ita sit quaeri potest somme sutch thing meaneth fire purgatorie life augu de ciuit lib cap incredible vvhether noit maie question maie question againe quod spiritus defunctorum c ignem transitoriae tribulationis inueniant non redarguo quia forsitan verum est sprite deade finde fire transitorie tribulation reproue perhaps true perhaps trueaugu de fide operib ca againe siue ergo hac vita tantum homines ista patiuntur siue etiam post hanc vitam talia quaedam iudicia subsequuntur non abhorret quantum arbitrorquantum arbitror ratione veritatis iste intellectus huius sententiaes augustine doubteth therefore whether menne suffer sutch thinges onely life el somme sutche iudgementes folowe euen life mutche thinke mutche thinke augu de ciuit lib cap vnderstandinge sentence disagreeth order truthe againe saithe quis sit iste modus quae sint ista peccata quae ita impediant peruentionem ad regnum dei vt tamen sanctorum amicorum meritis imperrent indulgentiam difficillimum est inuenire periculosissimum definire ego certe v que ad hoc tempus cum inde atagerem ad eorum indaginem peruenireno potui non potui vvhat meane sinnes whiche lette man comming vnto kingdome god yt thei maie notwithstanding obteine pardonne merites holy frendes harde finde dangerous determine certainely mee selfe notwithstandinge greate studie coulde neuer attaine knowledge trauaile taken behalfe coulde neuer attaine knovvledge plaine augustine stoode doubte hereof whether sutche purgatorie fire therefore vndoubtedly tooke neither article christian faith thereof benne lawful doubte tradition apostle ye saie augustine neuer doubted whether sutche place purgatorie sutche fire onely whether tormentes doo satis ie iustice god sinne whether tormentes doo degree diminishe venial sinnes seculare affection whiche ye party carried notwithstandinge shoulde question raised hereof plato vergile heathen writer doctrine first flowed abroade woulde soone haue put quite doubte vergile hereof emongest others saithe thus quin supremo cum lumine vita reliquitaeneid non tamen omne malum miseris nec funditus omnes corporeae excedunt pestes penitus ue necesse est multa diu concreta modis inolescere miri ergo exercentur poenis veterum ue malorum supplicia expendunt aliae panduntur inanes suspensae ad ventos alijs sub gurgite vasto infectum eluitur scelus aut exuritur igni reade gustine hardinge saie vse owne woordes profoundely seene al doctours ye maie boldely despise al others euer reade saie augustine examine better place weigh woordes ye shal finde neuer neither mentioneth toucheth prety fantasy saithe plainely vvhether maie question reproue perhaps true ye profoundely seene al doctoures scripture harding ye thinke either fire water creature wherewith satisfie iustice god againste sinne sauinge onely bloude lambe god taketh awaie sinne worlde thinke augustine woulde turne v satisfaction christe sende v seeke certainely augustine selfe saithe valeat mihi ad perfectionem liberationis tantum pretium sanguinis domini mei augustin psalm let onely price bloude lorde auaile perfection deliuerie againe saithe double fiere quando aliquis se conuerterit ad deum prorsus illi omnia dimittuntur nemo sit sollicitusaugu de verbis domini serm quod aliquid ei non dimittatur euer man turneth selfe vnto god al thinges vtterly foregeeuen let noman doubteful leste thinge happily foregeeuen chrysostome imagineth god thus saie sinner chrysost gene homil vnum tantum requiro vt confiteatur peccata ab eis desistat nec vltra infero poenam peccatis thinge onely saithe god require sinner yt cofesse sinnes vnto leaue ye aftervvard laie nomore pounishemente vpon sinneschrysost de b philogonio likewise againe saithe ego fideiubeo si quis nostrum recedat peccatis ex animo vere promittat deo se ad illa non rediturum nihil deum requisiturum ad satisfactionem wil stande bounde goddes behalfe v foresake sinnes al harte make true promisse vnto god wil nomore returne vnto god shal require nothinge el vnto satisfaction knoweth thus mutche hath greate cause vaunte selfe profound knowledge doctours god iustice againste sinne fully satisfied bloude christe onely price lordes bloude haue vvrought perfection deliuerie remaine nothinge vnforegeeuen god require pounishemente shoulde seeke satisfaction painted fire smoke purgatorie conclude ye saie thus effecte augustine question whether fire purgatorie double hardinge ye simple meante simply ye woulde vainely double pointe beseche double fire purgatorie meante augustine euer double dealinge double diuinitie profounde knowledge doctoures ye haue laste skilfully founde double purgatorie fire double purgatorie howe nowe troubled fire purgatorie somme others frendes long sithence mutche troubled aboute vvater sir thomas moore zachar sir thomas moore saide helde certaine al purgatorie vvater one droppe saide would proue wordes prophete zacharie eduxisti vinctos tuos de lacu quo non erat aqua thou haste deliuered thy prisoner doungeon wherein vvater sidethe bishop rochester psalm roffensis saith yes purgatorie good stoare vvater saith proue prophete dauid transiuimus per ignem aquam eduxisti no handesomely dreames agree togeather returne mater ye saye wee mutche mistooke place augustine deceiued ignorante note margine also ye pleasantly sporte selfe profounde knovvledge doctoures woordes augustineaugust hypognosti lib ye meane primum locum fides catholicorum diuina authoritate regnum credit esse coelorum vnde non baptizatus excipitur secundum gehennam vbi omnis apostata christi fide alienus aeterna supplicia experietur tertiu penitus ignoramus imo nec esse scripturis sactis inueniemus first place catholique faithe goddes authoritie beleeueth kingdome heaune whence euer baptized excluded seconde place catholique faithe beleueth hel al renegates euer without faithe christe shal taste euerlasting pounishement thirde place vvee vtterly knovve none neither shal vvee finde holy scripture sutches augustine denieth purgatorie woordes make purgatorie yet truely appearance make sclenderly purgatorie augustine saithe thirde place life bisides heauen helle vvee vtterly knovve none neither vve finde holy scripture sutche al three place heauen hel purgatorie benne certainely knowen vniuersally receiued churche yet bisides three place pelagian heretiques would haue diuised imagine seueral place receiue soules sutche child departed life without baptisme coulde augustine haue truely saide tertium locum ignoramus vvee knovve thirde place rather shoulde haue saidefourthe place quartum locum ignoramus fourthe place wee knowe none iudgemente doubte benne thirde place fourthe benne greate ouersight augustine reckeninge onely foure place haue forgotten one specially sutche one hath benne founde gaineful late yeeres three woordes plaine heauen vvee knovve hel vvee knovve thirde place bisides heauen hel vvee knovve none woorde purgatorium noted margine printer saie erasmus man famouse memorie whose name learninge iudgemente hath al time emonge learned benne mutche esteemed yonge louanian cleregie maie wel compare profounde knowledge ye doctours without great blusshinge thus mutche touchinge one place augustine wherein hath pleased deepely charge v grosse ignorance better trial iudgemente herein ye haue considered hath written otherwheres like purpose epistle hesychius saithe thus august epist quo quen que inuenerit suus nouissimus dy hoc eum comprehendet mundi nouissimus dy quoniam qualis die isto quisque moritur talis die illo iudicabitur state ovvne laste daie shal finde eche man state laste daie vvorlde shal finde sutche euery man daie shal die eue sutche daie shal iudged againe qualem inuenit dominusaugust apocalyp homil august ad petrum diacon cap cum hinc vocat talem iudicat lorde findeth man vvhen calleth hence euen iudgeth againe qui hac vita deo placuerit habebit quidem poenitentiam futuro soeculo de mali suis sed indulgentiam conspectu dei non inueniet quia etsi erit ibi stimulus poenitudinis nulla tamen erit correctio voluntatis life shal please god shal worlde comme haue repentance sinnes pardonne sighte god shal finde although shalbe pricke repentance augustin iohan tracta olympiodorus ecclesiast ca yet shalbe amendemente wil againe saithe vnusquisque cum causa sua dormiet cum causa sua resurget euery man shal die owne cause rise againe vvith ovvne cause olympiodorus saith quocun que loco c deprehendetur homo cum moritur eo gradu que ordine permanet aeternum place state euer man shalbe founde dieth state degree shal remaine euer recken vp al might saide behalfe woulde longe simple man harding without profounde knovvledge ye doctoures maie easily see saieinges wil hardly stande doctrine purgatorie owne roffensis saithe polydor de inuentorib lib cap nemo nunc dubitat orthodoxus purgatorium sit de quo tamen apud priscos vel nulla vel quam rarissima fiebat mentio sed graecis ad hunc v que diem non est creditum quamdiu enim nulla esset cura de purgatorio nemo quaesiuit indulgentias catholique man doubteth purgatorie ceremony whereof notwithstandinge emonge ancient father either metion al seldome yea euen vntil daie grecian beleue longe vvas care purgatorie noman sought pardonnes whiche witnesse appeareth pardonnes purgatorie brought iointely bothe togeather case nowe standeth moste menne thinke pope could contented lose bothe heauen helle saue purgatorie apologie cap diuision touchinge multitude vaine superfluous ceremony wee knowe augustine greuousely complaine owne time therefore haue cutte great number bicause wee knowe mennes conscience encumbred aboute church god ouerladen neuerthelesse wee keepe stil esteeme onely ceremony whiche wee sure deliuered v apostle somme others bisides whiche wee thought mighte suffered without hurte churche god desire al thinges holy congregation might paule commaundeth donne comelinesse good order al thinges whiche wee sawe either superstitious vtterly vnprofitable noisome mockery contrarie holy scripture el vnseemely sober discreete people whereof infinite numbres nowe day romaine religion vsed saie wee haue vtterly refused without al manner exception bicause would haue right worshippinge god lenger defiled withsutche folie hardinge augustine ye alleage wrongfully ceremony catholique churche speaketh onely cuttinge awaie suche manner rite crepte one particulare countrie neither conteined holy scripture established councels bishop confirmed custome whole churche howe proue place maie pul downe aultars image disallowe vowe pouertie lente oile c augustine referreth taking awaie custome manner vnto dewe authoritie exhortinge donne vbi faculras tribuitur vvhere power geuen doo neither el may donne lawfully al c ye thinke wee haue many ridiculous fonde thinges ceremony hadvntruthe augustine speakinge time saithe tam multis praesumptionibus ita plenum sunt omnia c deede wee haue would ye laugh cham nakednesse father noe c laugh ye cursed chananees wee wil daunce arke willthen yee circumcised paule vvas vvas onely ievvishe ceremonie shire heade paule c b sarisburie mater benne ouer colde hardinge litle enflamed choler ende cried vpon cursed chananees aultars image vowes lentes otles answeared sufficiently otherwheres augustine woordes august epist concerninge mater pregnante plaine h cnimis doleo quia multa quae diuinis libris saluberrime praecepta sunt minus curantur tam multis praesumptionibus sic plenum sunt omnia c thinge greeueth many thinges whole somely commaunded holy scripture regarded thinges ful many presumptionsaugust ead epistol c againe quamuis ista contra fidem non sint tamen ipsam religionem quam paucissimis manifestissimis celebrationum sacramentis misericordia dei liberam esse voluit seruilibus oneribus ita premunt vt tolerabilior sit conditio iudaeorum qui etsi tempus libertatis non agnouerint legalibus tamen sarcinis non humanis praesumptionibus subijciuntur al thinges faithe yet seruile burthen oppresse religion whiche god mercie woulde haue bee free vnder fevve moste manifeste sacramentes diuine seruice state ievves mutche tolerable state churche christe jewes notwithstandinge knewe time libertie yet subiecte packes burthen lawe god vnto diuises presumption menne sutche diuiseschrysost matthae homil presumption chrysostome saithe non dicunt cur legem mosi sed cur traditionem seniorum transgrediuntur vnde patet eos multa innouasse cum deus contra vetuisset ne quid adderent aut minuerent sed illi cum timerent ne principatum amitterent ceu legum latores vt maiores esse viderentur plurima innouarunt quae re ad tantam peruenir nequitiam vt praecepta sua custodirent magi quam praecepta dei phariseis saie vnto christe wherefore doo thy disciple breake lawe moses wherefore doo breake tradition elder whereby appeareth altered many thinges whereas god commaunded shoulde neither adde diminishe fearinge leste shoulde lose authoritie benne lawe maker thende mighte seeme greatter altered mutche vvhiche thinge ende grewe sutche wickednesse keapte ovvne commaundementes commaundementes god like manner saithe cyrilcyrill iohan lib cap vellent suam doctrinam paternas traditiones ab hominibus potius suscipi atque admiratione honore que haberi quicquid igitur christo credentium accesserit sibi detractum putant phariseis woulde menne receiue magnifie doctrine tradition father therefore howe many euer faitheful came vnto christe thought many loste true yt ye saie tradition maie changed abolished without general consente whole churche ceremony thei neuer grew togeather one time al place lightly abolished togeather one time al place socrates lib cap nonlatin alphabet socrates eod loco socrates saithe plainely videtur mihi multa modo regionibus modo illis consuetudinem obtinuisse seemeth vnto many thinges haue benne receiued custome novve one countrie novve againe saithe vniuersum certee omnibus obseruationibus piarum precum non possunt duae ecclesiae inueniri quae prorsus inter se consentiant verily speake vniuersally al maner obseruations fourmes common praier cannot tvvo church founde agree thorovvly bitvvene selues augustine saithe plainely omnia talia c vbi facultas tribuitur sine omni dubitatione resecanda existimo al sutche thinges iudgemente ought cut august epist dist quia sanctum soone iuste occasion power geeuen vvithout manner doubtinge saithe pope steuin si nonnulli ex praedecessoribus maioribus nostris fecerunt aliqua quae illo tempore potuerunt esse fine culpa postea vertuntur errorem superstitionem sine tarditate aliqua cum magna authoritate posteris destruantur sundrie predecessours elder haue donne certaine thinges whiche time might wel donne without hurte afterwarde turned errour superstition vvithout staggeringe vvith greate authoritie let destroied abolished successours laugh ye saie nakednesse father hardinge father heauen father light god glorie nakednesse wee laugh thinges wee saie augustine alleged hoc nimis doleo c thinge mutche greeueth august epist many thinges wholesomely commaunded holy scripture regarded al thinges ful many presumption chrysostome saithechrysost matthae homil hieremi thinges called vpon regarded lawes commaundementes father father saithe felowes volunt facere vt obliuiscatur populus meus nominis mei propter somnia sua wil cause people shal foregeate name loue dreames father saithehieremi twoeuils haue people donne haue foresaken fountaine water life haue ripte vp selues broken cesternes yt holde water father saithehieremi esai matthae chaffe vnto corne hath required thinges handes shorte hereof christe selfe saithe thus euery plante heauenly father hath planted shal pluckte vp rootes apologie cap diuision wee make praiers tongue whiche al people meete maie vnderstande thende maie paule counselleth v take common commoditie common praier euen al holy father catholique bishoppes bothe olde newe testamente vse praie selues taught people praie leste augustine saithe like parottes ouselles vvee shoulde seeme speake vvee vnderstande neither haue mediatour intercessour wee maie haue accesse god father onely iesus christe whose onely name al thinges obteined father hande shameful parte ful infidelitie wee see euery vsed church aduersaries onely thei wil haue innumerable sortes mediatoures vtterly without authoritie goddes woorde ieremie saithe sainctes nowe many numbreierem cap rather aboue numbre city poore menne cannot tel whiche saincte beste turne firste though many cannot tolde yet euery one hath peculiare duetie office assigned vnto folkes thinge ought aske geeue bringe passe bisides also doo onely wickedly also shamefully calle vpon blessed virgine christes mother haue remember mother commaunde sonne vse mother authoritie ouer himthere one mediatour saluation vvho christe onely sainctes frendes mediatours intercession corin hardinge vvee haue onely one mediatour saluation iesus christe whose merites god reconciled vnto v ye saie besides one mediatour ye haue none thatthis harding legierdumaine vvee speake onely sutche mediatours vvee ought praie vnto may prai make intercession pointe false beleefe ye may keepe selues vve rather holde withas paule euer vvilled v praie sainctes paule praied al christen menne doubted saie corinthian hoped escape danger diuuantibus vobis oratione pro nobis helpe praier v one good man maye helpe life praier while hath yet owne careful muche sainctes whiche dissolued raigne christe healpe v perfite praier ye tell trowe hierome made argumente within litle twelue hundred yeeres pastemediatour saluation neither make god ye woulde seeme saie place whiche beinge spoken prophete hieremie idolles ye applie frendes christepsalm commet lucam sicut angeli praesunt ita ij qui vitam meruerint angelorum angel ouer nation also whiche deserue life angel concerninge office ye saie wee appointe vnto sainctes ye muste vnderstande god hath shewed miracle good woorke hath wrought saincte rather people desire obteigne god sainctes praier thinge wherein maiethis certainetie hardinges praier hangeth blinde coniecture coniecture god hath geuen moste grace lady blessed virgine mary hath grace geuen herintercession blessed virgin mary creature excepte ye nameit greatter grace childe god greater grace mother god therefore christen nation moste bolde desire praier reliued intercession mediation praier made sonne iesus christe doubte heareth moste gladly nolesse intendinge doo good continually v sure hath done v greate benefites whiche continually doo receiue muche tooke fleashe seinge christe firste begotten amonge many brothersroman marie mother al loue christe iohan spiritual familiaritie vvith mother god excesse minde soueraine deuotion wee called one heretage maie take harte accompt christes mother mother specially whereas saide vnto iohn disciple child grace beholde thy mother nowe spirituall man suche bernarde deepely consideringe greate honour dignitie christes mother doo excesse mindeopen blasphemie spiritual dalliance vvheu vvil hardinge confesse faulte spiritually sporte dally biddinge remember mother thereby hath certaine right commaunde sonne require moste sweete manner shee vse righte either impiously impudently spoken rather moste impious impudent findeth faulte euer practised contemplation swetenes whiche canticis canticorum ye shoulde haue founde spiritual soule bolder god creator spouse bernarde euer lady beinge creature member churche b sarisburie ye saie one onely mediatoure saluation many mediatoures intercession thus prety simple distinction ye conueigh selfe awaie inuisible clowde cutte quarrel hardinge let v haue one onely mediatoure saluation afterwarde take mediatoures intercession pleasure howe christe onely mediatoure saluation wherefore doo thus cal vpon blessed virgine christes mother salua omnes qui te glorificant saue thou al glorifie thee ye intrude vpon christes office make holy virgine mediatoure onely intercession also saluation wherefore saie ye thus thomas becket whose saincthoode ought knowe ye maie wel stande doubte tu per thomae sanguinem quem pro te impendit fac no christe scandere qu thomas ascendit christe make v ascende vnto heauen whither thomas ascended euen bloude thomasmediatour intercessio sheadde thy sake seeke onely intercession also saluation bloude thomas wherefore doothe ambrose saie ambrosi sermone de margareta ambrose wrote booke reddere debemus sanctis honorificentiam qui nobis salutem profusione sui sanguinis pepererunt qui tam sacrum hostia pro nostra propitiatione domino sunt oblati wee muste yelde honoure vnto sainctes vvhiche haue procured saluation v sheaddinge bloude whiche also offered vp vnto lorde holy sacrifice saluation wee haue saluation bloude sainctes christe onely mediatoure saluation indifferente vmpeere firste diuideth office equally bitweene twoo afterwarde alloteth bothe office one alone notwithstandinge ende office wel intercession also saluation reconcile v vnto god procure v mercie christes onely office reconcileth v vnto god presenteth v vnto throne gracerom timoth therefore paule saithe euermore maketh intercession v cause also saithe vnus est mediator dei hominum homo christus iesus one mediatoure bitweene god man christe iesus beinge man paule requireth people make intercession praie true god hath commaunded al faitheful praie one paule neuer required people praie sainctes augustine saithe augustin contra epist parmeniant lib cap augustin eod lib paulus non facit se mediatorem inter populum deum sed rogat vt pro se orent inuicem omnia membra coporis christi paule maketh selfe mediatoure bitweene god people requireth praie al one beinge al member body christe againe saithe iohn si iohannes ita diceret hoc scripsi vobis vt non peccetis et si quis peccauerit mediatorem habetis apud deum ego exoro pro peccatis vestris sicut parmenianus quodam loco mediatorem posuit episcopum inter populum deu quis eum ferret bonorum atque fidelium christianorum quis sicut apostolum christi non sicut antichristum intueretur iohn woulde saie haue written vnto ye sinne ye sinne ye haue mediatoure god vvil intreate sinnes parmenian heretique certaine place made bishop mediatoure bitweene god people good faitheful christian man coulde abide woulde looke vpon apostle christe rather thinke antichriste hardinge sely distinction intercession saluation cannot saue parmenian neuer thought bishop mediatoure saluation yet augustine saithe iohn woulde haue saide mutche selfe benne apostle christe rather shoulde haue benne iudged taken antichriste ye thinke woordes prophete hieremie spoken idolles false goddes maie iustely applied sainctes idolles haue multiplied encreased number hath far passed number al townes citties therefore anciente father epiphanius applieth like woordes prophete hieremie vnto blessed virgin marie beinge idolatrousely abused heretiques called collyridianidistincte office euen blessed virgin sainctes abused nowe thus writteth epiphani li hare ne quis comedat de errore qui est propter mariam tametsi praeparant mensam diabolo non deo quemadmodum scriptum est pascuntur cibo impietatis et rursus foeminae terunt pollinem filij colligunt ligna vt faciant placenta oleo subactas reginae coeli per hunc itur ad christum vvee maie come christ saincte vnder image freere dominike wrote thus sed magi per istum yet mutche rather saincte whereby meante freere dominikes office authoritie god sommewhat better paules whereas ye teache people thus praie vnto blessed virgin monstra te esse matrem commaunde thy sonne vse thy motherly authoritie ouer let knovve thee mother saie blasphemie spiritual dallicinge nowe verily hardinge muste needes blessed kinde diuinitie turne praier dalliance one beaupeeres louaine man carrieing face hand saith boldelycopus dialog pag wordes neuer vsed paule meaneth woordes sedit populus ad manducandum bibendum surrexerunt ad ludendum people sate downe eate drinke rose vp againe plaie dallie saie committe idolatrie saie lady blessed virgine hathe grace geuen creature excepte ye name greatter grace saie mother god verily hardinge childe god greate deale greatter grace augustin de sanctum virginitate cap mother god augustine saithe beatior ergo maria fuit percipiendo fidem christi quam concipiendo carnem christi materna propinquitas nihil mariae profusset nisi foelicius christum corde quam carne gestasset marie blessed suller grace receiued faithe christe conceiued fleashe christe motherly kinreade coulde haue doone marie good onlesse borne christe blessedly harteaugustin iohan tracta bare fleashe againe saithe mater mea quam appellastis foelicem inde foelix est quia verbum dei custodtuit non quia illa verbum caro factum est mother ye haue called blessed therefore blessed bicause hathe keapte vvoorde god bicause vvoorde vvas made fleashe therefore saithe epiphaniusepiphani li hare contra collyridian christus dixit quid mihi tibi est mulier non dum venit hora mea qu non putarent aliqui magi eximiam esse sanctam virginem mulierem eam appellauit veluti prophetans quae essent futura terra sectarum haerese n genus vt ne aliqui nimium admirati sanctam hanc haeresim eius que deliramenta dilabantur est enim ludibrium tota re anicularum fabula vt ita dicam tota haeresis tractatio christe saide vnto mother vvoman haue doo thee houre yet comme left man thinke lady vvas greatter excellencie called vvoman prophesieing kindes sectes heresy comme world lest man hauinge great opinion holy saincte fal heresie dotage dede whole materis mockerie olde vviues tale soothely saie nothinge el handelinge heresieorigen lucam homil origen hereof saithe si mensuram transcenderit charitatis qui diligit qui diligitur peccato est loue passe measure charitie wel loueth also loued sinne touchinge mater selfe ambros ad rom cap ambrose saithe ide ad reges itur per tribunos comites quia homo vtique est rex nescit quibus debeat rempublicam credere ad deum autem quem nihil later omnium enim merita nouit promerendum suffragatore non est opus sed mente deuota vbicunque enim talis loquutus fuerit ei respondebit illi therefore wee brought vnto presence kinges lordes officer bicause kinge man knoweth maie committe realme obtaine goddes fauoure nothinge secrete knowinge euery man meete haue vve neede spokesman deuoute minde euer sutche one speaketh vnto god god wil answeare apologie cap diuision wee saie also euery person borne sinne leadeth life sinne body able truely saie harte cleane moste righteous person vnprofitable seruaunte lawe god perfite requireth v perfite ful obedience wee able meanes fulfil lawe worldly life one mortal creature whiche iustified owne desertes god sight therefore onely succour refuge flie mercie father iesu christe assuredly perswade mindes obteiner forgeuenesse sinnes bloude al spottes sinne vvasshed cleane hath pacified set one al thinges bloude crosse one onely sacrifice whiche offered vpon crosse hathe brought effecte fulfilled al thinges cause said gaue vp ye ghoste finished though woulde signifie price ransomme nowe ful paide sinne al mankinde thinke sacrifice sufficient let goe goddes name seeke better wee verily bicause wee knowe onely sacrifice wel contente alone looke none forasmutche offered commaunde renewed againe bicause ful perfite al pointes partes doo ordeine place thereof continual succession offeringes hardinge ye make sophistical argumente ye teache lawe god requireth v ful obedience therefore cannot satisfied life meanes ye saie requireth v ful obedience ye meanea vaine folie god lavve vvas vvritten men earth angel heauen suche ful obedience required onely life conclude ye falsely wee meanes satisfie ye meane suche ful obedience onely perfourmed heauen ye conclude wel wee life cannot fulfil suche perfection required heauen haue ye saide nothinge purpose wee knowegod commaundeth vvhiche impossible man grace marke ye shoote doctrine vttered place meaninge horrible heresie augustine saithe deus iubet aliquae quae non possumus facere man life able grace god fulfil commaundementes vvee beleeue god commaundeth v nothinge impossible vsa fonde question god punisheth infantes theire original sinne yet theie meanes hable avoide otherwise howe coulde iustly punishe doinge commaundemente whiche meanes wee able fulfil vvee sure god punisheth noman vniustly non est apud dominum deum nostrum iniquitas iniquitie lorde god moises
