speakinge fulfillinge commaundementes goddeut rom whiche also paule repeteth saithe aboue v heauen neither farre v beyonde sea harde thee saithe woorde thy mouthe thy harte thou maiste doo christe saithematthae n iohn iugum meum suaue est onus meum leue cause hereof god mercie augustine saithe omniae mandata facta deputantur quando quicquid non factum est ignoscitur yoke sweete burden light iohn commaundementes heauie saithe meanes fulfil lawe god makethvntruthe vve make god vniuste vve confesse selues finners god vniust euil impotent able geue mutche grace maie helpe fulfil lawe let discrete reader iudge blasphemie woordes conteine belye v nomore hereafter doctrine better founded worde god tradition apostle custome whole churche ye shal euer able ouerthrowe blaspheme barke againste ye maie ouercome ye cannot b sarisburie al thinges touched hardinge wil passe ouer thinkinge sufficient note fewe woordes possibilitie perfourmance lawe mutche ye seeme therein somme parte renewe pelagian heretiques olde condemned erroure touchinge ful perfite obedience required v lawe ye answeare sundrie sortes perfection namely perfection child perfection menne perfection angel perfection god ye saie life wee cannot fulfil sutche perfection required angel god heauen answeare ye make touchinge obedience perfourminge lawe ye would saie lawe god geeuen angel perfourmed earth onely heauen god said blessed sprite thou shalt kil thou shalt commit aduouterie thou shalt steale thou shalt couete c sundrie perfection child menne angel god haue skil apologie meante onely perfection required man euery kinde saie perfectum est cui nihil deest thinge perfite ful absolute wanteth nothinge leste ye shoulde deceiue selfe wronge measure god selfe hathe shewed deuter matthae deuter deuteron calat iacob matthae perfection requireth thus saithe thou shalt loue lorde thy god al thy harte al thy soule al thy power ye shal turne neither right hand lefte accursed standeth euery thinge written lawe perfourme iames saithe vvho offendeth one commaundemente guilty al christe saithe ye perfite measuring selues owne habilitie father perfite whiche heauen yet hereby meaneth perfection god angel onely perfection required man hierome saithe pelagian heretiques olde time vsed shiftes vse nowe catholique learned father saide noman perfite voide sinne answeared euen sutche sorte doo nowe hieronym ad c esiphons contra pelagianos noman perfite sutche degree perfection god perfite hieromes woordes aiunt ad comparationem dei nullum esse perfectumpossibilitie lavve quasi scriptura hoc dixerit saie euen hardinge saie comparison god noman perfite asthough saieinge scripture therefore saithe vnto nunquid praecepit mihi deus vt essem quod deus est vt nihil inter esset dominum creatorem vt maior essem angelorum fastigio vt haberem quod angeli non habent beseeche hathe god commaunded shoulde bee god shoulde difference perfection bitweene lorde creatoure shoulde aboue highnesse angel shoulde haue angel haue vaine therefore hardinge thus borrowe pelagians weapon make mater perfection wee speake angel onely menne tointreate perfite fulfillinge accomplisshinge lawe meane farre lawe requirethe pelagian heretiques herein also saide augustin de ati libero arbitr cap euen saie none otherwise augustine thereof reporteth thus magnum aliquid pelagiani se scire putam quando dicunt non iuberet deus quod sciret ab homine non posse fieri quis hoc nesciat sed ide iubet aliqua quae non possumus vt nouerimus quid ab ipso petere debeamus pelagians thinke selues cunninge menne saie god vvoulde commaunde thinge knovveth man hable doo knoweth therefore god commaundeth v doo somme thinges vvee hable doo wee maie vnderstande wee ought craue hierome saithe vnto one pelagianshieronym ad ctesiphont contra pelagianos facilia esse dicis dei mandata tamen nullum proferre potes qui vniuersa compleuerit ye saie goddes commaundementes easy yet ye hable shewe v noman euer fulfilled al togeather therefore againe saithe vnto hieronym cotra pelagianos li noli ponere coelum o tuum vt per esse esse posse stultorum auribus illudas quis enim tibi concedit posse hominem facere quod nullus vnquam hominum potuerit sette thy face againste heauen mocke fooles eares woordes wil graunte man doo thinge noman euer vvas hable doo likewise augustine saithe augustin de spiritu litera cap dixi fieri posse vt sit homo sine peccato si voluntas ei non desit ope diuina adiuuante sed tamen praeter vnum quo omnes uiuificabuntur neminem vel fuisse vel fore quo hic viuente esset ista perfectio saide possible man maie bee vvithout sinne wante wil power god assistinge yet saide bisides onely christe al menne shalbe quickened life vvas neuer man neuer shalbe beinge life shal haue perfection augustine saithe noman atteine perfection speaketh perfection required angel menne ye wil saie pelagians wherefore doothe christe saie ye perfitematthae philip hieronym aduersus pelagian lib wherefore doothe paule saie many v perfite c hereto hierome answeareth thus quid ergo sapimus imo quid sapere debemus qui perfecti non sumus imperfectos no esse confiteri nondum comprehendisse nec dun acccepisse haec est hominis vera sapientia imperfectum esse se nosse que vt ita loquar cunctorum carne iustorum imperfecta perfectio est vvhat doo wee thinke ought wee thinke perfite wee ought confesse vvee vnperfite wee haue yet gotten taken perfection required true wisedome man knowe selfe vnperfite might saie perfection al iuste menne liuinge pleashe vnperfitevnperfite perfectio againe saithe iusti appellantur non quod omni vitio careanthieronym ad c esiphont augustin ad bonifacium li cap sed quod maiori parte virtutum commendentur called juste menne voide al manner sinne furnisshed greatter parte vertues likewise saithe augustine virtu quae nunc est homine iusto hactenus perfecta nominatur vt ad eius perfectionem pertineat etiam ipsius imperfectionis veritate agnitio humilitate confessio vertue nowe iuste man farre foorthe called perfite perteineth perfection thereof bothe truthe knovve humilitie confesse vnperfite againe saithe omnia mandata facta deputanturaugustin retracta li ca augustin de spiritu litera cap quando quicquid non fit ignoscitur al commaundementes god accoumpted donne thinge downe forgeeuen conclude saithe multum hac vita ille profecit qui quam longe sit perfectione iustitiae proficiendo cognouit hathe mutche profited life profitinge hathe learned howe farre perfection righteousenesse yet neuerthelesse wee maie truely vse hieromes woordes vttered defence right cause haec dicentes non adulamur vitijs sed authoriratem sequimur scripturarumhieronymus ad gasiam quod nullus homo sit absque peccato sed conclusit deus omnia sub peccato vt omnium misereatur notwithstandinge saie thus yet wee flatter vice wee folowe authoritie scripture nothinge vvithout sinne god hathe shutte vp al thinges vnder sinne maie haue mercie al hieronym ezechiel li cap againe saithe perspicuum est omnem hominem quamuis ad perfectionem venerit tamen indigere misericordia dei plenam perfectionem ex gratia non ex merito possidere moste certaine euery man yea although hee growen perfection yet needeth mercie god enioieth ful perfection ovvne deseruinge grace euen augustine saithe augustin de ciuita lib cap ipsa iustitia nostra tanta est hac vita vt potius peccatorum remissione constet quam perfectione virtutum righteousenesse selfe greete life standeth rather forgeeuenesse sinnes perfection righteousenesse apologie cap diuision bisides though wee saie wee haue meede al owne woorkes deedes appointe al meanes saluation christe alone yet saie cause menne ought liue loosely dissolutely yenough christian baptized onely beleeue though nothinge el required hande true faithe liuely wise idle thus therefore teache wee people god hathe called v folowe riot wantonnesse paule saithe vnto good vvoorkes vvalke deliuered povver darkenesse end vvee shoulde serue liuinge god cutte awaie al remnauntes sinne vvoorke saluation feare tremblinge maie appeare sprite sanctification body christe selfe dwelleth harte hardinge vvith face defender affirmemerite mercie teache people walke good woorkes whereas beginninge treatise woorkes presente apologie saie wee haueno aide helpe vnto saluation othervvise report vntrue helpe aide woorkes deedes latine woorde praesidium doothe signifie whiche englishe tourned meede vvhat maisters waie make menne woorke wel tel hande woorkes nothing worth helpe neuer whitte vvhy let labourer prouerbe take place rather plaie nothinge woorke nothingenazianzen si mercenarius e tantum expecta mercedem de sancto baptism labourer madde woorke nothinge firste ye tell labourer helpe woorkes ye crie vnto laboureis folie hard goddes truthe mockerie yea forsoothe harde thei liste mocke god worlde vvhereas ye speake christian menne baptized suche haue faithe yet ye tel maie woorke mutche wilvntruthe vve saie vvith paule vvoorkes shal vaine lorde al vaine c ergo although liuely faithe cannot idle somme true faithe liuely yet sensevntruthe reade ansvveare true faithe whiche liuely idle vvhiche true faithe shal become liuely haue great aide woorkes wel learne leaue idlenesse practise harte whiche beleeueth vnderstandinge whereas defender woulde helpe aide christian mennes woorkes vntruthe heresie faithe christ reade ansvveare heresie maie escapethat good vvoorkes helpe v matthae christe beinge demaunded one good shoulde doo obteine euerlastinge life saide thou wilte enter life keepe commaundementes keepe commaundementes woorke enter life somme helpe man therefore falsely spoken woorkes helpe v againe christe saithe vvho euer forsaketh house brother sister father mother wife child landes sake shal receiue hundred folde shal inherite life euerlastinge paule saithe god wil render euery man accordinge woorke seeke glorie honour incorruption accordinge sufferance good woorkes wil render life euerlastinge b sarisburie ye trifle hardinge although mutche bisides common woonte yet sommewhat aboue ordinarie doctrine herein grounded vpon woordes christeluc ye haue donne al saie ye vnprofitable seruauntes therefore haue deserued nothinge deede late yeeres hath ben general doctrine scholes vita aeterna est merces debita pro nostris meritis vita aeterna nisi esset merces debita esset incerta quia debitum certum est misericordia incerta euerlastinge life rewarde dewe deseruinges euerlastinge life dewe rewarde vncertaine dewe debte certaine mercie sauoure vncertaine thus haue vtterly drowned grace god saluation haue onely iesu christe haue turned comfortable doctrine gospel doungeon desperation thengregori nazia de sancto baptismate nonlatin alphabet saie lette labourer prouerbe take place rather plate nothinge woorke nothinge verily hardinge reason coulde serue reason labourer idle reason shoulde take place howe ye wil doo nothinge goddes requeste good wil without rewarde muste hyered onely penny maie labourer neuer simple easily tel ye childe god onely hyrelinge labourer natural louinge childe wil obey father rewarde loue onely bicause hee father gregorie nazianzene saithe si seruus e time plagas si mercenarius tantum specta mercedem si supra ho e etiam filius reuerere tanquam patrem tuu bene facito quia pulchrum est obsequi patri et quamuis nihil aliud futurum sitmerite mercie tamen vel hoc ipsum erit merces tua fecisse quod gratum esset patri thou bonde slaue feare whippe thou hyrelinge looke onely thy rewarde ouer bisides thou natural childe reuerence god thy father doo vvel bicause good obey thy father yea although thou shalt haue nothinge el yet euen shalbe thy revvarde thou haste benne obediente thy father hilarie saithe hilari psalm no si semel ieiunamus satisfecisse no arbitramur si aliquid ex horreo domesticarum facultatum inopi damus implenisse no iustitiam credimus c sed propheta totum deo sperat totum misericordia eius expectat wee faste wee thinke wee haue satisfied barnes housholde stoare wee geeue sommewhat poore wee beleeue wee haue fulfilled measure righteousenesse prophete hopeth al god trusteth al mercie christe saithe disciple matthae augustin confession let light shine menne ye maie rewarded maie see good woorkes glorifie yur father whiche heauen augustine saithe minus diligit te qui diligit aliud praeter te god basil psal nonlatin alphabet lesse loueth thee loueth thinge bisides thee likewise basile saithe qui non fidit suis recte factis nec expectat ex operibus iustificari sola habet spem salutis misericordias dei trusteth ovvne good deedes hopeth iustified vvoorkes hathe onely hope saluation mercy god ye saie true faithe maie idle vtterly without woorkes therefore ye thinke true wee saie true faithe liuely wise idle perhaps ye wil set faithe vpon laste racke larger ise latomus one felowes saithe socrates plato heathen philosopher good vnderstandinge faithe christe abraham andradius felowes saithe heathen infidel philosopher righteousnesse faithe euerlasting lifeillyricus de sectis pag kemnitius examine tridet concilij pag copus dialo pag wordes philosophi qui ab inani deorum multitudine abhorruerunt c illos tu illa fide dei que cognitione destitutos dice per quam scilicet impius iustificatur ex qua iustus viuit philosopher abhorred shunned vaine multitude goddes c wilte thou saie lacked faithe knovvledge god whereby wicked iustified whereby righteouse liueth neare felowes saith petrus non fidem christi sed christu salua fide negauit peter denied faithe christe denied christe faithe neuerthelesse beinge safe ye cal true faithe hardinge maie founde heathen infidel maie wel safely stande abiuringe christe without question true faithe maie without good woorkes1 timothe fidem abnegauit paule whose woordes wee ought rather credite saithe farre otherwise hathe regarde owne specially sutche bee housholde hathe denied faithe woorse infidel againe saithetit iohn iacob saie knowe god theire woorkes denie god iohn saithe vvho saithe hee knoweth god keepeth commaundementes lyer truthe iames saithe faithe without woorkes deade diuel beleeueth tremblethe feare deade faithe nomore true perfite faithe deade man true perfite man faithe diuels deede verily faithe certainely augustine saithe augustin euangel iohan sermo augustin de fide operib cap qui fidem habet sine spe dilectione christum esse credit non christum credit hathe faithe without hope charitie beleueth christe hee beleueth christe againe saithe inseparabilis est bona uita fide quae per dilectionem operatur imo vero ea ipsa est bona vita good life neuer diuided faithe whiche woorketh loue naie rather faithe selfe good life ambrose saithe ambros li epist vbi quis coeperit luxuriari incipit deuiare vera fide soone man beginneth liue wantonly beginneth flee true faithe origen saithe origen epist ad roman li cap omnis qui credit cum non crubescit erubescit autem omnis qui peccat ergo qui adhuc ruborem peccati incurrit credere non videtur vvho euer beleeueth god blussheth euery man blussheth woorketh sinne therefore yet blussheth sinne origen ezechiel homil seemeth beleeue againe saithe male credit quicun que peccat vvho euer sinneth beleeueth il shorte cyprian saithe quomodo dicit se credere christum qui non facit quod christus facere praecepit howe doothe hee saie beleeueth christe doothe thinge christe commaunded hereby plaine true faithe liuely woorkeful idle faithe deede faithe al saie good vvoorkes haue theire rewarde therefore ye saie heresie maie esc pe whether good woorkes shalbe rewarded parte question wee vndoubtedly beleue wordes written iohn apocalyp matthae opera illorum sequuntur illos theire vvoorkes folowe wee beleeue woordes christe saithe disciple geeueth cuppe colde water litle one sake shal lose rewarde beleeue that1 corin paule saithe woorke shal vaine lorde wee graunte good woorkes haue theire rewarde rewarde standeth mercie fauoure dewtie thus therefore saie consideringe weakenesse sinful corruption nature woorkes v pure perfite maie thereby right dewtie deserue euerlastinge life hardinge heresie plaine sense substance goddes woorde vndoubted doctrine anciente catholique father churche iob saithe iob si homo velit contendere cum deo non poterit ei respondere vnum pro mille man wil dispute god hable answeare one thousande therefore saithe verebar omnia opera mea stoode doubte afraide al woorkesiob againe saithe although perfite yet soule shal know itesai woulde iustifie mee selfe myne owne mouthe shal condemne prophete esai saithe al righteousenesse like fowle stained clowte therefore augustine saithe augustine de tempore sermo non intres iudicium cum seruo tuo quid est non intres iudicium cum seruo tuo non stes mecum iudicio exigendo omnia quae praecepisti omnia quae iussisti nam inuenies reum iudicium intraueris mecum opus ergo est misericordia tua potius quam liquidissimo iudicio tuo lorde enter iudgemente thy seruaunte meaneth enter iudgemente thy seruaunte thus mutche meaneth stande iudgemente requiringe al thou haste commaunded thou enter iudgemente thou shalt finde guilty haue neede therefore thy vpright iudgementeaugustin epist ad mac thy mercie againe saithe merita quorumlibet hominum quae sunt quandoquidem ille qui non cum mercede debita sed cum gratuita gratia venit omnes peccatores solus peccato liber liberator inueuit vvhat merites menne christe came vvith devve revvarde vvith grace vvas devve founde al menne sinner selfe onely free sinne augustin de spiritu litera cap deliuerer sinner againe hee saithe coronat te misericordia miserationibus hoc fiet iudicio vbi cum rex iustus sederit thro redditurus vnicuique secundum opera eius quis gloriabitur castum se habere cor aut quis gloriabitur mundum se esse peccatis ideo illie necessarium fuit comemorare miseratione misericordiam domini c god crowneth fauour mercie shalbe doune laste iudgemente juste kinge shal sit throne render euery man accordinge woorkes shal boaste harte chaste shal boaste cleane sinne therefore needeful make mention pitie mercie lorde againe augustin psalm opera manuum mearum non commendo timeo enim ne cum inspexeris plura inuenias peccata quam merita lorde commende woorkes handes afraide leste thou shalte beholde thou shalt finde moe sinnes good deseruinges saithe hieromehieronym esai cap origen ad rom li cap origen matt tracta si consideremus nostra merita desperandum est vvee beholde ovvne merites vvee muste driuen desperation saithe origen ego vix mihi persuadeo vllum opus esse posse quod ex debito remunerationem deposcat doo scarcely beleue woorke maie devvtie require revvarde againe saithe dicite vos esse seruos inutiles nam etsi omnia fecerimus quae praecepta sunt non tamen bonum aliquod fecimus nec enim si vere bona essent essemus inutiles omne autem bonum nostrum non proprie sed abusiue bonum dicitur saie ye saithe christe ye vnprofitable seruauntes notwithstandinge wee haue donne al thinges commaunded yet haue vve donne good thinge dooinges good deede wee vnprofitable good deede oures called good rightly devvlyaugustin psalm vvalden contra vviclefum abuse speache saith augustine si deus vellet pro meritis agere non inueniret nisi quod damnaret god would deale v according haue deserued shoulde finde nothinge might condemne therefore hardinge vvaldensis one greate doctours hauinge wel circumspectely weighed mater euery side laste concludeth thus quid dignum facimusroman vt participes coelestibus fieri inueniamur apostolo dicente existimo quod non sut condignae passiones huius temporis ad futuram gloriam quae reuelabitur nobis reputo igitur saniorem theologum fideliorem catholicum scripturia sanctis magi concordem qui tale meritum simpliciter abnegat vvhat woorthy thinge doo wee wee maie founde felowshippe heauenly sprite apostle saithe judge affliction time woorthy glorie shalbe reueled v therefore take ounder diuine faithefuller catholique agreeable holy scripture vtterly denieth al sutche kinde merite ye wil saie wee finde selues voide merite howe shal wee standapocalyp iustified god iohn saithe blessed haue wasshed theire roabes theire owne merites bloude lambe apocalyp god saithe wil geeue thirsty drinke vvel life desertes nothinge ancient father origen saith origen ad roman li ca quia omnia conclusa sunt sub peccato nunc non meritis sed misericordia dei salus humana consistit mutche al menne shutte vp closed vnder sinne novve saluation man standeth man merites goddes mercie augustine saithe augustin epist ad sixtum deus fine coronabit no misericordia miserationibus god ende wil crowne v price deseruinges vvith fauour mercy againe saithe augustin de verbis apostoli sermo pro nihilo saluos facies eos quid est pro nihilo saluos facies eos nihil eis inuenis vnde salues tamen saluas quia nihil inuenis vnde salues multum inuenis vnde damnes nothinge thou shalt saue vvhat meante worde nothing thou shalt saue meaninge thou findeste nothinge vvherefore thou shouldest saue yet thou sauest thou findest nothinge wherefore thou shouldeste saue thou findest mutche wherfore thou shouldest condemne againe omnes mortem poena debita praecipites ageretaugustin de ciuitate li cap nisi inde quosdam indebita dei gratia liberaret deserued paine woulde throwe al menne deathe onlesse vndeserued grace god deliuered somme frome basile saithe basil psal non erit iudicium sine misericordia quia non potest homo purus inueniti sorde ne si vnus quidem tantum dy sit ab eius natali iudgement shal vvithout mercie noman founde pure cleane al filthe though one daie olde basil de humilitate againe saithe haec est nostra integra perfecta gloriatio deo quando propriae iustitiae no inopes agnoscimus sola autem fide christu iustificari oure ful perfite reioicing god acknowledge wee voide owne righteousenesse iustified onely faithe christe saithe hierome christo iesu domino nostro quo habemus fiduciamhieron epist ad ephes cap accessum confidenttiam per fidem eius non per nostram iustitiam sed per eum cuius fide nobis peccata dimittuntur christe jesu lorde wee haue boldenesse libertie comme god truste affiance faithe righteousenesse whose name sinnes forgeuen hereof bernarde moste godly bernard psal qui habitat comfortable wise concludeth thus meritum meum miserationes domini non sum ego inops meriti quam diu ille non est inops miserationum si miserationes eius multae multus ego sum meritis hoc totum est hominis meritum si totam spem suam ponat domino merite mercie god longe god poore mercie longe cannot poore merite mercy greate great merites vvhole merite man put vvhole affiance lorde defender horrible heresie hardinge whiche saie mought escape handed apologie cap diuision conclude beleue selfe fleashe wherein liue although die comme duste yet laste shal returne againe life meanes christes sprite whiche dwelleth v verily whatsoeuer suffer meane sake christe wil wipe awaie al teares heauinesse eies shal enioie euerlastinge life shal euer glorie hardinge last al beleue ye saie fleashe shal returne life spirite christe whiche dwelleth v doubte spirite christe sufficient raise vp body dwelleth wee saie raising fleashe also assigned holy scripturevntruthe father old lavve al christan infantes shoulde vtterly excluded resurrection real substantial eatinge christes fleashe written eateth fleashe drinketh bloude hathe life euerlastinge wil raise againe laste daie therefore resurrection fleashe onely assigned holy scripture spirite christe also woorthy eatinge fleashe thus haue confuted doctrine wherein ye declare faithe chiefe groundes whereon ye buylde new gospel haue disproued b sarisburie woordesthe cause resurrection wherein ye finde faulte hardinge oures paules false write true doo blame ye seeme checke paule onely v ye saie raising fleash also assigned holy scripture realle substantial eating christes fleashe whence ye woordes hardinge founde ye scripture dissemble longer deale plainely simply god cause sheweiohn ye allege woordes christe written iohn eateth fleashe drinketh bloude hathe life euerlastinge wil raise vp againe laste daie woordes wee knowe eatinge christes fleashe know real substantial carnal eatinge iohn euer tel christes body eaten vvith teethe conueied sutche grosseaugustin iohan tracta idem tracta fleashely wise belly augustine expoundinge woordes saithe thus crede manducasti credere christum hoc est manducare panem viuum iste panis interioris hominis quaerit esuriem beleeue thou christe thou haste eaten christe beleeue christe eatinge breade life breade requireth hunger inner man nicola lyra psalm nicolas lyra one owne doctours saithe woordes iohn perteine nothinge sacramente thus saithe hoc verbum nihil directe pertinet ad sacramentalem vel corporalem manducationem saieinge sixthe iohn perteineth nothinge directely sacramental corporal eatinge somme ouersight parte hardinge seeke proue eatinge sacramente woordes owne doctours iudgemente perteine nothinge sacramente christe saithe furtheriohn onlesse ye eate fleashe sonne man drinke blonde ye shal haue life none eating christes body whereby wee shal liue onely fantastical fleashely eatinge mouthe teethe beseeche life hathe abraham isaac iacob moses aaron holy patriarkes prophetes comming christ life haue great number holy martyr life haue christian child baptized bloud christe departe life receiue sacramente saie strange exposition haue really substantially eaten fleashe christe wil ye saie haue life wil ye condemne al euerlasting deathe muste wee thinke shal neuer rise againe certainely augustine saithe preciselyaugustin iohan tracta qui manducat habet vitam qui non manducar non habet vitam vvho eateth fleashe christe hathe life eateth hathe life hereof wee muste needes conclude diuinitie abraham isaac iacob moses godly father neuer receiued sacramente haue life deade euer without hope resurrection leaue fantasy hardinge cause resurrection paule saithe corin origen ad rom ca li augustin meditation cap sprite god dwelleth v origen saithe resurgemus propter spiritum habitantem nobis necesse est enim spiritui reddi habitaculum suum vvee shal rise againe bicause sprite dwelleth within v necessitie sprite muste haue house resto red vnto augustine saithe haec mea tota spes est omnis fiducia est enim ipso iesu christo domino nostro vniuscuius que nostrum portio caro sanguis vbi ergo portio mea regnat ibi ego regnare credo whole hope al truste christe jesu lorde fleashe bloude whiche portion eche v therefore vvhere portion mine reigneth beleeue reigne cyril saithe quamuis mors propter peccatum naturam nostram insilijt tamencyrill iohan li ca cyril iohan lib cap quia filius dei homo factus est omnes profecto resurgemus although deathe fallen nature yet bicause sonne god made man doubtelesse wee shal al rise againe likewise againe saithe sic vos effeci participes diuinae naturae cum spiritum meum fecerim habitare vobis christus enim nobis est per spiritum corruptionem nostram incorruptionem comutans made partetakers diuine nature vvhen caused sprite dvvel christe v sprite changinge corruption incorruption thus sprite god cause woorker resurrection comme neare vnto sacramentes christe also meanes instrumentes seales hereof cause cyril saithe quod mystica communio resurrectionis quaedam fit confessiocyril iohan lib cap verbis christi ipsius probatur ait enim hoc est corpus meum hoc memoriam mei facite mystical comunion certaine confession resurrection proued woordes christe selfe saithe body doo remembrance mee therefore councel niceconcil nicen holy mystery called resurrectionis nostrae symbola pleadges token resurrection ambrosede con dist non iste speakinge distinctely hereof saithe non iste panis qui vadit corpus sed panis vitae aeternae qui animae nostrae substantiam fulcit breade sacramente passeth body breade euerlastinge life susteineth substance soule put mater doubte force vnto resurrection applied vnto sacramente christes body also ample sorte geuen sacramente baptisme basil de sancto baptismate nonlatin alphabet ignatius ad trallien concil vvormatien cap basile saithe dy paschatis est pignus resurrectionis baptisma vero est potentia vi ad resurrectionem easter daie pleadge resurrection baptisme povver strengthe vnto resurrection againe saithe resurrectionis gratiam die resurrectionis excipiamus vpon daie christes resurrection let v receiue baptisme whiche grace resurrection ignatius saithe vt credentes mortem eius per baptismum participes eius resurrectionis efficiamini beleeuinge deathe baptisme ye maie made partetakers resurrection therefore councel vvoormes written thus aqua demersio infernum descensio est et rursus ab aquis emersio resurrectio est dippinge water goeinge downe hel comminge vvater resurrection ende hardinge ye blowe vp merily owne conquest thus yee saie vvee haue confuted doctrine wherein yee declare faithe chiefe groundes whereon ye builde newe gospell vvee haue disproued simple proufes many vntruthes honour sake maie wel shewed triumphe endeth seconde parte thirde parte apologie cap diuision beholde horrible heresy whiche good parte worlde daie condemned bishop rome yet neuer hearde pleade cause shoulde haue commenced suite rather againste christe apostle againste holy father thinges onely procede also appointed excepte perhaps menne wil saie thinke thei wil deede christe neuer instituted holy communion diuided emongest faitheful christes apostle auncient father saide priuate mass euery corner temple tenne nowe twentie togeather one daie christe apostle bannished al common people sacrament bloude thinge selues doo daie euery doo thei condemne heretique whiche dothe otherwise called gelasius theire owne doctoure plaine sacrilege woordes ambrose augustine gelasius theodorete chrysostome origene breade vvine sacramentes remaine stil thei vvere thinge vvhiche seene vpon holy table breade ceaseth stil substance breade nature vvine substance nature breade changed selfe breade touchinge material substance goeth bely caste priuie christe apostle holy father praied tongue whiche people might vnderstande christe hath perfourmed al thinges one offeringe whiche offered vpon crosse sacrifice vnperfite haue neede hardinge vvhat crake ye good parte vvorlde greater number ye haue seduced greeuous shal iudgement yet many yeeres paste ye boasted poore small flocke alludinge fewnesse flocke liued christe fleashe made fewnesse argumente sincere truthe nowe euil teachinge vvho vvanteth dissolutio vvickednesse maie seeke rome worlde groweth dissolute wicked ye boast number certaine touchinge groundes truthe churche erreth whiche enioyeth christes promise congregation teachinge contrary muste therefore taken child father lie though tenne twenty mass saide one daie christe apostle father ye scoffe faithe firste preachedvntruthe time augustine ambrose hierome c vvere moe christian vvorlde presente fewe beleued church whiche without prophane malice ye name temple yet beinge builie sufficient reason maie nowefevve many faithe generally receiued haue sundry mass one churche one daie ye make muche doo bothe kindes aggrauate matter ye vse odious terme bannishinge people cuppe vve teache people forgood cause god good cause contente one kinde doinge vnderstande receiue whole body ofone dreame proue christe fleashe bloude lesse receiued bothe kindes sacriledge whiche gelasius speaketh consistethvntruthe stoode diuidinge sacrament diuidinge christe imputeth manichee haue declaredto iuelles chalenge artic therefore toucheth v doo diuide christe sacramente geue people whole christe sheweth either sclaunderous ignorant tongue churche seruicehovv euer christe apostle didde pope cleregie doo amisse euer christe apostle holy father praied vse latine tongue vsed seruice latine churche reason auctoritie ye bringe yet farre disproued churche ought condemne order vntruthe plaine sensible order vvas beginninge beginninge receiued hitherto continewed b sarisburie wee make crake number hardinge humbly geeue god thankes maugre al practises policy hath published proclaimed name sonne euery place worlde foorth force thereof greeueth nowe others father cried agonieiohn shal wee doo al worlde renneth cyril saithecyrill iohan lib ca quicquid christo credentium accesserit sibi detractum putant many faitheful beleeuers gotten christe many thinke loste selues notwithstandinge truthe god hangeth neither many fewe liberius bishop rome saide sometime arian emperour constantius theodoret li cap nonlatin alphabet non si ego solus sum idcirco minor est ratio fidei although alone yet accoumpte faithe therefore white lesse christe compareth kingedome god vnto peece leauen whiche beinge litle quantitie woman taketh laiethe greate lumpe dough vntil whole al leauened chrysostome saithe nemo paucitatem vestram deploret magna enim est virtu praedicationis matthae chrysostom matthae homil et quod semel fermentatum est rursus fermentum ad coetera efficitur let noman bewaile smal number greate vertue preachinge leauened selfe made leauen leauen others noted glose vpon clementine veritas pedetentim cognoscitur truthe knowen litle litle prooemio clemen gloss ambros de noe arca ca origen psal homil ambrose constat diluuium eodem numero quo cumulatum est esse diminutum knowen loudde time noe grewe degree degree abated origen saithe ego concitabo eos non gentem no sumus non gen qui pauci ex ista ciuitate credimus alij ex alia et nusquam gen integra ab initio credulitatis videtur assumpta shal prouoke people vvee people beleeue christe fewe cittie fewe neuer nation taken whole first beginninge faithe meaninge hereof god calleth menne al togeather nowe fewe nowe moe vnto secrete wisedome seemeth beste writen late councel basile con basil episto synodali pag spiritus sanctus non illuminat omnes eodem tempore sed vbi vult quando vult spirat holy ghoste doothe geeue light al menne one time breatheth wil wil counsel hande god hardinge wee maie saie vnto tertull apolog tertullian saide sometime vnto heathen exquisitior quae que crudelitas vestra illecebra est magi sectae plures efficimur quoties imur vobis semen est sanguis christianorum earnest crueltie entisemente prouocation vnto secte often ye recken v ye finde v moe moe seede hereof christian bloude fevve many churche temple arnobius saide sometime vnto enimies crosse christe nonne haec saltem fidem vobis faciunt argumenta credendi qu iam per omnes terras tam breui tempore paruo immensa nominis huius sacrameta diffusa sunt leaste arnobius aduer gens li prouerb doo proufes make beleeue ye see greate secretes name christe powred abroade shorte space al country fighte againste god hardinge wisedome counsel againste lorde certaine ye saie touchinge ye groundes faithe churche erreth whether churche haue erred groundes shal better appeare hereafter truely bernarde saithe churche euen churche rome bernard ad cle concil rhemen intestina insanabilis facta est plaga ecclesiae wounde churche within bowelles paste recouerie againe haec sunt infoelicissima tempora quae praeuidit apostolus quibus homines sanam doctrinam non sustinent bernard super salue regina vnhappy day apostle sawe menne cannot abide sounde doctrine bernardes iudgemente churche woulde heare sounde doctrine cause seemed vtterly paste recouerie therefore certainely assure selfe thinge vncertaine wisedome wee maie saie pope bishoppes whome onely ye meane name churche hierome saide sometime certaine others father longe agoehieronym sophoni ca non tam indignentur obi haec exponentibus prophetis vaticinantibus quam dominum deprecentur studio agant ne de sacerdo ibus qui violant sanctum domini esse mereantur let take stomake againste v expounde thinges againste prophetes foretolde thinges let praie vnto god take good heede priestes defile holy thinges lorde church ye saie without profane malice ye cal temple malice comme vnto hardinge malice meaneth prophete dauid saithe lorde holy temple psalm corinth paule saithe body temple holy ghoste know ye ye temple god man defile temple god corinth lorde wil destroie ye temple liuinge god agreemente bitweene temple god idole many time paule nameth temple togeather one place yet thinke without greate profane malice shalbe lawful hardinge make newe sinnes saie apostle christe malicious wicked onely called churche god name temple would god ye turned goddes temple synagoge sathan wee see practise truechrysostom matthae homil chrysostome saithe sicut de templo omne bonum egreditur ita etiam de templo omne malum procedit euery good thinge proceedeth temple euery il thinge proceedeth likewise temple defence halfe communion ye saie good cause ye teache people contente one kinde thus ye force poore people contrarie expresse woorde christe contrarie example apostle al holy father primitiue churche contrarie general vse order whole thousande yeeres geeue care good cause cause doubte greate woorthy otherwise yee would weigh againste godalphons aduersus hare li de eucharist wherefore dissembled tolde v owne doctours alphonsus de castro iohn gerson haue laide wise particularely large daunger sheaddinge carriei ge place place section vltima iohan gerson de communione laico fowlinge cuppes trouble mennes beardes reseruinge sicke turninge vvine vineger engendringe plees corruption putrefaction lothesomenesse maie happen many drinke one cuppe halfecom munion impossibilitie prouidinge one cuppe maie sufficiente serue al people somme place vvine deare somme place vvine wil frorne hardinge fairest greattest good cause yet haue thus concluded late chapter tridente si quis dixerit concil trident de commun sub vna specie sanctam ecclesiam catholicam non iustis causis rationibus adductam fuisse vt laicos atque etiam clericos non conficientes sub panis tantummod specie communicaret aut eo errasse anathema sit man shal saie holy catholique churche without iuste cause reason mouinge doothe communicate bothe laitie also priestes onlesse minister vnder onely fourme breade tertul de praescription churche hath erred accursed therefore tertullian saithe rightly credunt sine scripturis vt credant contra scripturas beleeue vvithout scripture maie beleeue againste scripture specially beseche hardinge consider wel woordes hieromehieronym sophoni cap see whether ye maie applie selues consummatione mundi scrutabitur dominus hierusalem id est ecclesiam suam cum lucerna vlciscetur super viros contemptores qui noluerunt seruare custodias suas id est mandata domini contempserunt insuper ratione se peccare dicentes blasphemauerunt cordibus suis ende vvorlde lorde shal searche hierusalem saie churche candel shal wreake selfe vpon despisers woulde keepe watch saie despised commaundementes god ouer bisides saieinge hadde good cause reason vvherefore shoulde offende breake goddes commaundementes blasphemed harte ye surmise gelasius moste vntrue speaketh one woorde diuidinge christe imagine cause speake saithe moste plaine wise sacrilege doo thinge doo saie diuide sacramente minister one parte ye doo without looke better bookes confesse truthede consecrat dist comperimus ye shal finde woordes aut integra sacramenta percipiant aut ab integris arceantur quia diuisio vnius eiusdem que mysterij sine grandi sacrilegio non potest peruenire either lette receiue vvhole sacramentes el let driuen vvhole diuision ofone mysterie sacramente cannot happen without greate sacrilege speaketh diuision one christe tel v diuision one mysterie otherwise touchinge christe1 corinth euagri lib cap wee saie paule vnus dominus iesus christus one lorde iesus christe wee proteste bishoppes easte councel chalcedon accursed parteth christe accursed concil chalcedon actio nonlatin alphabet diuideth saie order latine seruice hath euermore benne vsed latine churche beginning vtterly vntrue proufe whereof remitte former replie thirde article fifteenth diuision reste ye allege woorthe answearinge apologie cap diuision al thinges muste necessitie saie onlesse perchaunce thei rather saie thus al lavve right locked vp treasurie pope breaste one soothinge page clawbackes sticke saie pope hable dispense againste apostle againste councel againste canon rule apostle bounde stande neither examplesdispense againste goddes vvoorde ordinaunces lawes christe hardinge saie al lawe right latine terme fa locked vp treasurie pope breas te absurde vnreasonable mary saie lawes reste pope breasteit reason diuines required make good vvhat euer vvritten canonistes schoolemen certaine meaninge hereafter shalbe declared isnot altogeather biside truthe colde defence altogeather beside truthe reason sir meane writer gloser vpon canon lawe speake somewhere square al exactly tried scripture wil ye laie charge shal faithe catholike churche thereby called doubte question vve take vpon v defende al canonistes schooleme saie write c kinde order many thing whiche may rather called rule maners principle terme axiomata faithe although founde written scripture asmuche haue benne commaunded occasion cause maie cause occasion finde c lector necessitie god depute vicare supplied holpen expounded case require certaine cause certaine persone certaine time certaine circumstance maye dispense spirite firste founded instituted withal intention witte speciall good furtherance godlinesse suche administration god lawe suche dispensation thereof precious treasure free libertie pleasure euen iuste good dispensation attribute god vicare whome defender calleth pope parasite page clawbackes selfe page slaue clawbacke diuel b sarisburie hardinge ye rome wander goe masket man benighted loste waie somme case ye saie pope maie dispense goddes vvoorde somme case maie faine woulde ye shame somewhat limite restraine immoderate authoritie ye knowe laie boundes15 q authoritatem glossa dist presbyter ye make smal accompte schoole doctoures canonistes saie principal pillers catholique churche thinke woorthy guide laboure cannot al loste wil thinke light butfelin de constitutionib cap statuta canonum colum q quicunabque clossa mutche ye saie flatter pope page parasite speake roundely tel owne shal mutche amisse herken litle saie one saithe thus papa potest dispensare contra ius naturale pope maie dispense againste lavve nature saith papa dispensat contra canones apostolorum pope dispenseth canon rule apostlespanormi extra de diuortijs ca fin saithe papa potest mutare formam verborum baptismo pope maie change fourme vvoordes baptisme saithe priuilegium dari potest contra ius diuinum pope priuilege maie graunted againste lavve godsumma angel dictione papa saithe papa ex maximum causa potest dispensare contra nouum testamentu pope vpon great cause maie dispense againste nevve testamente saith papa potest dispensare de omnibus praeceptis veterisfelin de constitution ca statuta canonum felin de maioritate obedient ca noui testamenti pope maie dispense commaundemente olde nevve testamente saithe papa potest dispensare contra epistolas pauli pope maie dispense againste epistle paule somewhat qualifie outrage mater saithe papa potest dispensare contra ius diuinum particulari non vniuersali pope maie dispense lavve god particulare general idem de maioritate obedien ca fin againe papa potest tollere ius diuinum ex parte non totum pope maie abolishe lavve god parte vvhole saithe dispense againste goddes vvoord martinus papa dispensauit cum quodam qui acceperat germanam suam vxorem pope martine dispensed man taken vvife ovvne sister whether reporte true false referre mee selfe credite authoure summa angel dictione pp panormita extra de electione electi potest venerabile saith papa potest dispensare cum omnibus personis nisi cum patre matre pope maie dispense vvith al personnes touchinge marriage sauinge onely vvith father mother marrie married theire child saith papa potest supra ius dispensare et de iniustitia potest facere iustitia sententiam quae nulla est facere aliquam et de nihilo facere aliquid pope maie dispense aboue lawe ye pope vvronge maie make rightde translatione episco quanto hostien de translatione episcop quato heruaeus de potestate papae pope sentence maie make sentence pope nothinge maie make somme thinge cause hereof saith quia papa potest excepto peccato quicquid deus ipse potest sinne onely excepted pope maie doo vvhat euer god selfe maie doo saithe papa habet authoritatem declarandi scripturas ita vt non liceat oppositum tenere vel opinari pope hath authoritie expounde declare scripture maie lawful man hold thinke contrarie cardinalis cusanus saithe cardina cusan de authoritat eccle conci supra cotra scripturam saide scripturae ad tempus adaptatae sunt varie intellectae ita vt vno tempore secundu currente vniuersalem ritum exponatur mutato ritu iterum sententia mutetur scripture applied vnto time diuersly derstanded one time taken accordinge vniuersal currente order whiche order changed meaninge scripture changed demaundeth question francis de maron dist q articul quae nemo glossa vtrum papa ex plenitudine potestatis possit omnia whether pope fulnesse power maie doo al thinges saithe si totus mundus sententict contra papam videtur quod standum esse sententiae papae al vvorlde vvoulde geue sentence contrarie pope yet seemeth vvee ought stande sentence pope hardinge iudgemente neither page parasite good sadde earnest frendes sutche loue roughly plainely vtter theire minde without flatterie doubtelesse daniel longe prophesied dabitur illi o loquens grandiadaniel shal haue mouthe geuen vtteringe greate presumptuous mater deede notwithstandinge al glorious glitteringe painted authoritie iohan andreas de iudicijs cum venissent yet one pope owne menne saithe papa non potest facere de quadrato rotundum pope canot make square thing roude bernarde saith regula non concordat cum euangelio vel apostolo alioqui regularam non est regulabernar apologia ad guliel abbatem quia non est rectum dooth rule agree gospel apostle otherwise rule rule al crooked streight therefore pope zosimus sober wise saithe thus contra statuta patrum condere aliquidinter decr ta zosimi vel mutare ne huius quidem sedis authoritas potest authoritie see cannot order change thinge contrarie order father isidorus saithe qui praeest si praeter voluntatem vel praeter quod scripturis sanctis euidenter praecipitur11 q si qui vel dicitaliquid vel imperat tanquam falsus testis dei sacrilegus habeatur authoritie speake commaunde thinge besides wil meaninge goddes woorde otherwise expressely commaunded scripture let taken churcherobber false vvitnesse god apologie cap diuision wee parte haue learned thinges christe apostle deuoute father doo sincerely good faithe teache people god whiche thinge onely cause wee daie called heretiques chiefe prelate doubte religion immortal god hath christe selfe apostle many father al gonne astraie origene ambrose augustine chrysostome gelasius theodoretus foresakers catholique faithe notable consent many auncient bishoppes learned menne nothinge el conspiracie heretiques nowe condemned v whiche commended thing alteration onely mennes affectios sodainely becomme schismatique whiche coumpted catholique shal whiche time paste vndoubtedly true bicause liketh menne iudged false let bringe foorth gospel let shewe cause thinges whiche longe haue openly benne obserued wel allowed churche god ought nowe ende called againe wee know wel yenough woorde whiche opened christe spreadde abroade apoistles sufficiente bothe saluation also vphold mainteine al truthe confound al maner heresie woorde onely doo wee condemne al sortes olde heretiques menne saie wee haue called hel againe arians eutychias marcionites ebionite valentinians carpocratians tatians nouatians shortely al whiche haue wicked opinion either god father christe holy ghost pointe christian religion mutche confuted gospel christe wee plainely pronounce destable damned personnes defie euen vnto diuel neither doo wee leaue wee also seuerely streitely hold lawful politique pounishementes fortune breake bewraie selues hardinge vve parte knowe nowe haue proued ye haue learned thinges christe apostle father luther zwinglius oecolampadius caluine peter martyr bucer sutche apostate ye moste falsely wickedly leade people pitte therefore ye iustly condemned churche demed heretikes c condemne ye donatistes seinge ye breake throwe holy aulters god whiche optatus writeth body bloude christe wonte laid c b sarisburie hereto hardinge whole grosse summe answeare effecte ye falsely wickedly leade people ye apostate ye heretiques ye impupudente rebellious child ye despisers god mocker mother peruerters apostle ye vtter lie ye speake blasphemy laste ye saie diuel dwelleth harte shoppe hasty kinde logique harding muste needes harde harted wil yelde sutche argumentes leaue waste woordesauttars vigilantius iouinian manichee aerius sutche others ende ye pronounce definitiue sentence iudge condemne v heretiques wee haue taken downe shoppes gaineful boothes whiche ye cal holy aultars god verily muste needes thought either extreme rigoure greate folie remoninge stone make heresie sutche heresy trowe augustine ambrose optatus learned father knewe fewe neither good sufficiente reason shewed wherefore heresie v take downe needelesse superstitious walles whiche ye erected selues without commission lately teare sunder burne communion table erection vse whereof wee vndoubted example bothe christe selfe also aunciente catholique father saie nothinge crueltie burninge many bible bookes goddes holy woorde many bretherns body many temple holy ghoste aultars whiche optatus saithe donatistes brake downe certainely table vvood sutche wee haue heapes stone artic diui august epist ad bonifacium athanasi epist ad solitaria vitam agentes sutche ye haue former replie made vnto maie better appeare augustine reportinge storie saithe donatistes theire furie brake downe aultare bourdes woordes lignis eiusdem altaris effractis likewise saithe athanasius like furie arians subsellia thronum mensam ligneam tabulas ecclesiae coetera quae poterant foras elata combusserunt carried foorthe burnte seates pulpite vvoodden bourde churche table sutche thinges coulde g ate touchinge stone aultars beatus rhenanus saithe b rhenan epistola praefixa liturgiae chrysostom nostris basilicis ararum superaddititia structura nouitatem prae se sert church buildinge vp aultars added reste declareth noueltie wee haue sutche aultars hardinge christe apostle augustine optatus catholique holy father vsed whoes example folowe wee neuer thought sutche heresie optatus saithe body bloude christe woonte laide vpon aultare woordes ye would faine affonne simple reader christes body laie really fleashely verily deede ye shouldaugu ad bonifaci epistiol remember augustine saithe sacramentum corporis christi secundum quendam modum corpus christi est et sacramentum sanguinis christi secundum quendam modum sanguis christi est sacramente christes body verily deede certaine manner speache christes body sacramente christes bloude certaine manner speache bloude christe de conse dist hoc est quod glossa manner speache owne glose thus expoundethe vocatur corpus christi id est significat corpus christe called ody christe saie signifieth body christe optatus saith christes body bloude laide vpon aultare communion table euen aug stine saithe whole people communion cuppe laide vpon holy tableaugust ad infantes citatur beda cor woordes vos estis mensa vos estis calice vpon table cuppe people vpon table christes body vpon table people laide verily deede onely mysterie euen body christe op u saith laide verily deede real fleashly presence mysterie apologie cap diuision deede wee graunte certaine new strange sectes anabaptistes libertine menonians zvvenckfeldians haue benne stirringe world euer sithence gospel firste springe worlde seeth nowe right wel thankes geeuen god wee haue neither breadde taught keapte vp monster good folowship praie thee euer thou reade bookes solde euery place hath euer benne written companie might plainely beare madnesse heretiques naie saie vnto countrie daie free theire pestilent infection wherein gospel freely commonly preached weigh mater earnest vpright aduisemente thinge greate argument doctrine whiche wee teache truthe gospel christe lightly neither cockle woont growe without wheate yet chaffe without corne apostle time knoweth howe many heresy rise vp euen togeather soone gospel firste spreadde abroade euer hearde tel simon menander saturninus basilides carpocrates cherinthus ebion valetinus secundus marcosius colorbasius heracleo lucianus seuerus like apostle sent abroade stande wee reckeninge vp epiphanius rehearseth vp foure score sundrie heresy augustine many moe whiche springe vp euen togeather gospel gospel therefore gospel bicause heresy sprange vp withal christe therefore christe yet wee saide dothe greate croppe heape heresy growe vp emongest v whiche doo openly abroade frankely teache gospel poisonnes take theire beginninges theire encreasinges strength emongest adnersaries blindenesse darkenesse emongest truthe tyrannie cruelty keapte vnder cannot hearde corner secrete meetinges let make proufe let geeue gospel free passage let truthe iesus christe geue cleare light stretche foorthe bright beames al partes shal foorthwith see howe al shadowes streight wil vanishe passe awaie light gospel euen thicke miste night consumeth sight sonne whilest menne sitte stil make mery doo nothinge wee continually represse put backe al heresy whiche falsely charge v nurrishe mainteine hardinge libertine substance hath gospellibertie bisides carnal libertie licentious liuingelibertines doctrine libertine gospel breake vowe chastitie solemly made god whose grace endeuoure might wel haue benne kepte breake wantonnesse satisfie luste proper libertine geue ouer fastinge watchinge prayer confession sinnes whiche shoulde made prieste bymoste vaine vntruthe see ansvveare onely excepte case necessitie god promiseth forgeuenes regarde tradition though came apostle briefly teache al kinde outwarde godlines superstitious pharisaical euery must without staggaring doubting beleue selfe shalbe saued haue faithvntruthe ioined vvith vile sclaunder doo liste pointe libertie vvhat made many malepert prentises pleasante courtier discoursinge parlamente machiauellistes al euer fleash wormes merchates idle artificer embrace gospel rather grauer deuouter sorte men whiche weaned pleasure life plausible vvorlde pleasant fleashe whiche kinde men moste hardly drawen yet foresoothe doo ye foster vp libertine vvho recken sectes germanybemelande silesia morauia beingfoure greate vntruthes al togeather sixteene moe professed one towne bemelande almoste ful heresy house silesia bad morauia countrie adioininge neuer whit better yet sectes bud gospel freely openly preached b sarisburie harding haue purposely leafte greate heape talke thinkinge needeful answeare al voide woordes hauing nomore regarde ye saie harde mater cal v libertine saie gospel wee preache hathe none substance carnal libertie licenceous liuinge ye remembred either cittie rome ye haue benne towne anwarpe louaine ye nowe dwelle ye coulde wel without blusshinge haue charged v carnal libertie vvantons fleashevvoormes liketh cal haue benne contented forsake father mother wiues child goodes liuinges meekely submit selues extreme terroure al cruelty yelde theire body vnto deathe sterued hunger burnte fiere onely name gospel iesus christe ye wil saie woonte ye haue nothinge el saie died stubbernly wilful erroure yet recken yee wil saie died greate pleasance carnal libertie strage kinde fleashely vvantonnesse man denie selfe take vp crosse folowe christe yet vvhole substance gospel iustinus martyr notwithstandinge heathen thought euen doo nowe professours name christe nothinge el sorte vvanton vvilful people yet sawe howe constantely died howe patiently suffred euer laied vpon length conuerted selfe theire example became christianeuseb li ca nonlatin alphabet sozom li ca nonlatin alphabet thus eusebius reporteth woordes ego ipse platonis disciplinis delectatus c mee selfe takinge pleasure platoes doctrine hearinge christian spoken seeinge goe courrageously boldely theire deathe suffer al sutche thinges thought moste terrible thought thinge impossible sutche menne shoulde liue wickedly wantonnesse likewise writeth sozomenus touchinge christian beinge spoiled theire goodes regardinge nothinge hadde beinge h nged gibbett suffering al manner tormentes without care sense theire body benne theire owneone head one iudge neither allured flatterie amazed threates gaue al menne hereby vnderstande nonlatin alphabet psal suffered thinges wantonnesse somme greate rewarde prophete dauid saithe quo corriget adolescens viam suam custodiendo sermones tuos whereby shal yonge man grow fleashely wanton amende life correcte waie answeareth lorde keepinge thy woordes therefore wee maie iustly saie cyrill contra iulian lib pag cyrillus saide sommetime iulianus renegate like case etiam pueri sacris literis enutriti statim fiunt religiosissimi etiamsi minus eloquentes euen child beeing brought vp holy scripture streight waie becomme moste godly although eloquente welspoken sutche fleashe vvoormes vvantons daie gospeller whiche woorde mutche offendeth hardinge professours mocker wilful despisers gospel ye saie cofession made vnto prieste onely ye saie god hath promised forgeuenesse sinne beseche finde promisse shewe woordes allege place regarde credite otherwise ye wil noted vntruthe god christe euer saie forgeeuenesse sinne geeuen onely prieste deede doothe chrysostome saiechrysost de poeniten confession nunc necessarium non est praesentibus testibus confiteri solus deus te confitentem videat nowe needeful make confession presence vvitnesses let god onely see thee makinge thy confession dooth hierome saiehieron matthae cap apud deum non sententia sacerdotum sed reorum vita quaeritur sentence absolution prieste life sinner regarded god hereof wee haue sufficiently saide luther ye saie firste procured menne acknowledge one head iudge reporte cyprian saithe might obeie vicare christe one heade one iudge neither christe apostle euer told v cypriancypria de sim praelatorum chrysostom matthae hom saide saithe thus christus parem dedit apostolis omnibus potestatem christe gaue vnto al apostle equal povver chrysostome saithe quicun que desiderat primatum terra inueniet caelo confusionem vvho euer seeketh primacie earthe heauen shal finde confusion place cyprian touching one heade one iudge wel alleged hardinge il applied true cyprian saithe people ought obeie one iudge one heade vicare christe one heade iudge meante either byshop rome one certaine seueral bishop moste vntrue cyprian meanynge isin former replie artic diui haue otherwhere largely declared euery diocese people ought knowe one bishop head iudge obeie vicare christ one head iudge saie euery diocese one vniuersal heade ouer al worlde proufe whereof harding reade cyprian epistle vnto florentinus pupianus ye shal finde vseth selfe woordes selfe pope doubte ye wil mutche marueile mislike owne errour woordes vnde schismata haereses obortae sunt cyprian lib epist oriuntur nisi dum episcopus qui vnus est ecclesiae praeest superba quorundam praesumptione contemnitur hence haue schismes heresy spronge vp wherehence doo springe onlesse bishop whiche one uleth churche prowde presumption certaine despised cyprian calleth selfe one bishop one heade iudge churche dissension emog father yet onely bishop carthage aphrica pope bishop rome hereof haue spoken large former replie touching pope artic diui wherein maie knowen christes vicare harde saie onlesse euer ye pope presente christe awaie chrysost matthae homil chrysostome saithe qui vanam gloriam non desiderat ille debet christi vicarius factus christi iustitiam praedicare desireth vaine glorie beinge made christes vicare ought preache justice christe apologie cap diuision saie wee haue fallen sundrie sectes would called somme v lutheran somme v zuinglians canot yet wel agree emog selues touching whole substace doctrine would mene haue saide thei benne firste time apostle holy father one saide holde paule holde cephas holde apollo paule sharpely rebuke peter vpon fallinge barnabas departed fro paule origen mentioneth christian diuided many faction thei keapte nomore name christian common emong manner thing el like christian socrates saith theire dissension sundrie sectes laughed iested openly people theire stage common gameplaies constantine emperour affirmeth sutch number variance braulinges churche yt might iustly seeme miserie farre passing al former misery whe also theophilus epiphanius chrysostome augustine ruffine hierome al christias al father al catholiques quarrelled one moste bitter remedilesse contention without ende saithe nazianzene partes one body consumed wasted one whole easte parte churche diuided fro weast onely leauened breade onely keepinge easter daie whiche deede greate mater striued al councelles newe creedes newe decree continually diuised b sarisburie summe hardinges answeare hereto bitter dissension olde time fel emongest learned godly father stoode rathera manifeste vntruthe hardinges mater manner smal quarrel case question faithe trial truethe herein maie please consider wel fewe papias hieronym hierem lib irenae li ca clemens stromat lib iustinus apologia apollinarius victorinus tertullianus irenaeus lactantius others desended heresie chiliastae saide christe general iudgemente shoulde dwel thousande yeeres togeather vpon earthe irenae u helde man beginninge firste created vnperfite clemens alexandrinus iustinus helde angel fel effended god desired companie woemen shalbe vaine stande longe hereindissensions emog father sutche example greate stoare comme neare purpose theophilus calleth epiphanius haeresiarcham grande captaine father heretiques gennadius saith augustine far heretique hieromeerasm vita chrysostomi writinge vnto augustine saith thus epistola tua quaedam haeretica esse iudicaui iudged certaine heretical errours epistle gennadius de ecclesiast scriptoribus pope bonifacius saide aurelius bishop carthage augustine godly learned father councel aphrica prickte inspired diuel augustine willeth hierome acknowledge erroure hieronym epistola ad augu bonifac epist ad eulaltu august ad hieronym epist recante thus saithe accipe seueritatem christianam ad illud opus corrigendum atque emendandum nonlatin alphabet vt dicitur cane take vnto christian seueritie correcte amende booke recante erroure thus mutche thought good briefely touche meaninge thereby deface authoritie aunciente father sommewhat open truthe hardinges tale shewe like bishoppes father notwithstandinge learned godly woorthy member churche god yet voide theire infirmity erasmus erasm praef tom hieronymi ibidem man greate iudgemente saith thus illis temporibus ingeniosa re fuit esse christianum day greate pointe wisedome knowe christian man againe illa aetate chartis erat fides potius quam animo ac pene tot erant symbola quot professores time auncient father faith bookes rather harte manner many sundrie creedes vvere professours faith therefore clemens alexandrinus saithe heathen thus vpbraided christian clemens stromat lib striues dissension emong vos christiani dissidetis inter vos tot sectas habetis quae licet omnes christianismi titulum sibi vendicent tamen alia aliam execratur condemnat quare vestra religio vera non est nec deo originem ducit yee christian dissente emonge selues mainteine many sectes whiche sectes notwithstandinge al claime title christian religion yet one curseth condemneth therefore religion true hath beginninge grounde god apologie cap diuision woulde menne trowe ye haue saide day whiche side would specially haue take whiche would haue foresaken whiche gospel would haue beleeued would haue accoumpted heretiques catholiques yet stirre reuel keepe daie onely vpon twoo poore name luther zvvinglius bicause twoo menne yet fully resolued vpon somme one certaine pointe doctrine therefore would needes haue v thinke bothe deceiued neither gospel neither taught truthe aright hardinge many thinges defender alleaged proufe dissension haue ben amonge apostle faithful people paules time bishop holy father primitiue church whereby woulde perswade coulde theire owne diuision sectes dissension marke false doctrine length though wonne filde tried selues proper men triuphing ouer v though nothing saie great courage thei demaude question v whiche though one effecte yet kinde brauerie seme diuide sundry braches thus saie vvhat would men meane papistes trowe ye haue saide day vvhiche side woulde haue taken whiche woulde haue foresaken vvhiche gospel woulde haue beleeued vvhom woulde haue accoumpted heretikes catholikes touchinge foure interrogatoriesa fourefold ansvveare foure question ben aliue beinge minde nowe would haue requirred foure answeares holy moste learned father hierome woulde haue saide like state time learned epistle saide learned pope damasus touchinge heresy whiche founde syria firste cominge thither romeepistolaru tomo firste ansvveare firste mihi cathedram petri fidem apostolico ore laudatam censui consulendam inde nunc meae animae postulans cibum vnde olim christi vestimenta suscepi vvhiche woordes taking vpon person al faithful catholike folkes thus englishe controuersies haue thought good counsel ought beleeue repaire chaire peter faithe romaine churche praised paule apostle owne mouthe thence require foode soule whence receiued garmentes christe speake shortely plainely catholike churche looke haue foode soule euerlastinge life whiche firste christened secondely woulde haue saide one speakinge al directinge woordes catholike faithethe second ansvveare ye cal papistes vos estis lux mundi vos sal terrae vos aurea vas argentea h c testacea vas vel lignea virgam ferream aeternum operiuntur incendium ye light vvorlde ye salte earth ye golden siluerne vessel emonge gospeller earthen vvoodden vessel must abide yron rodde flame euerlastinge thirdly one likewise bearing person al would haue saide pius fourth nowe sitteth peter chairethe thirde ansvveare saide damasus ego nullum primum nisi christum sequens beatitudini tuae id est cathedrae petri communione consocior super illam petram aedificatam ecclesiam scio quicunque extra hanc domum agnum comederit prophanus est si quis arca noe non fuerit peribit regnante diluuio makinge none christe firste al folowe ioine felowship communion thy holines saie see peter vpon rocke knowe churche builded vvho euer eateth lambe without compasse house prophane remaine without arke noe shalbe loste floud raigneth fourthly touchinge authours new gospelthe fourth ansvveare hierome saie al vnder person one non noui vitalem meletium respuo ignoro paulinum quicunque tecum non colligit spargit hoc est qui christi non est antichristi est vitalis know meleri refuse paulinus wote head heretikes hieromes time vvho euer gathereth togeather thee holy pastour scattereth abroade witte christes side antichristes side transferre selues name changed case remaininge like answeare gospel prelate saye luther knowe zuinglius oecolampadius bucer peter martyr latimer ridly cranmer hooper reiecte refuse caluine beza iuel pilkinton grindal horne theire felowes wote vve see gatherer withe supreme pastor catholike churche scatterers b sarisburie appeareth hath benne already saide gospel christe misliked doubted olde time infidel heathen chryso acta homil chrysostome saithe thus venit gentilis dicit vellem fieri christianus sed nescio cui adhaeream multae inter vos sunt pugnae seditiones ac tumuitus nesciodissensions emog father quod dogma eligam quod praeferam singuli dicunt ego verum dico infidel heathen commeth saithe vvoulde christian man knovve vvhom folovve mutche strife dissenssion trouble emongest cannot tel vvhat doctrine chuse set euery one vvil saie saie truthe ye agree wel fourme woordes praie god ye agree faith sprite contempte god chrysostome speaking onely heretiques also faithful christian time saith thus chryso epist ad galat cap hanc ob causam ridiculi facti sumus gentibus iudaeis dum ecclesia mille partes discinditur cause wee scorned laught bothe iewes gentile churche thus rente thousande partes therefore amisse hardinge demaunde question whiche side ye woulde haue folowed whiche al gospelles ye would haue beleeued maie wel thought minded ye woulde haue answeared ye saie yee woulde rather haue saide hierome sommetime saide pope damasus touchinge heresy whiche founde syria ye woulde vse hieromes answeare hardinge saie vnto pope hierome saide perhaps ye shoulde deserue greate thankes laboure hierome selfe place biside sundrie others vtterly denieth primacie bishop romehieronym ad damasum nullum primu woordes plaine ego nullum primum nisi christum sequens beatitudini tuae id est cathedrae petri communione consocior folovving first man saie heade chiefe onely christe ioined felovve communion vnto thy blessednesse saie peter chaire hierome telleth pope knoweth firste chiefe heade pope selfe onely christe againe saithe thral subiecte thy commaundementes ioinedbeatitudini tuae communione consoctor felovve communion vnto thy blessednesse felowship wil hardly stande vniuersal power whiche imagine pope ought haue ouer whole churche god verily pope selfe would take scorne daie woulde folowe hierome cal felowe hierome saithe agreeth faithe religion damasus greate marueile beinge godly learned man woulde leaue vitalis meletius heretiques ioine selfe bishop knewe godly catholique hereof writeth thus selfe vineam christi exterminant vulpes vt inter lacus contritos qui aquam non habent difficilehieronym ad damasum vbi fons signatus horrus ille conclusus sit possit intelligi ideo mihi cathedram petri fidem apostoli ore laudatam censui consulendam fox destroie vineyarde christe emonge broken cesternes haue water harde vnderstande sealed fountaine enclosed orchard therefore thought good herken peter chaire faithe whiche commended apostle mouthe hierome youthe brought vp rome christened rome benne studente rome taught schole rome benne secretarie damasus bishop rome prieste rome late haue furnished cardinalles hatte benne cardinal rome vita hieron thought somme sauinge somme displeasure certaine cleregie conceiued like chosen bishop rome greate maruelle therefore somme special affection see rome alphonsus de castro sa franciscane freers sworne dun recourse peter chaire hearde dominicane freere saie openly sermon suspected heretiquealphonsus aduers haeres li cap thinge dissented thomas aquine noman lightly hathe special credite somme one man al others holdeth argumente hardinge hierome ioined godly bishop ergo wee muste ioine wicked bishop hierome agreed faithe religion damasus ergo wee muste agree one doothe al thinges pourpose contrarie damasus might saie godly people iewes bounde obeie aaron moses ergo al others folowed afterwarde likewise bounde obeie anna caiphas faithe christe hardinge goeth alwaies succession bishoppes rome haue benne arians nestorian monothelites otherwise founde horrible heresy hereafter shalbe shewed woulde ye sutche case haue recourse sitteth peter chaire would ye saie sutch one salte earthe light worlde woulde ye saie faithe commended apostle mouthe truely hierome selfe saw abuse errours mainteined churche rome made smal accoumpte peter chaire thus saithe hierony ad euagrium quid mihi profers vnius vrbis consuetudinem potentia diuitiarum paupertatis humilitas vel sublimiorem vel inferiorem episcopum non facit coeterum omnes apostolorum successores sunt vvhat telleste thou custome one cittie rome power richesse humilitie pouertie cannot make bishop either higher lower al bishoppes successours apostle luther zuinglius peter martyr caluine others ye saie ye know neither dooth greatly force liste knowe god geeue grace knowe sel s2 tim lorde hable knowe owne touching dissension religion ye imagine emongest v wil saie nothinge greeueth ful soare see al article faithe whole substance doctrine wee doo quietly ioine togeather ancient father leo leo epiphania sermo like case saith thus diabolus gentium vocatione cruciatur quotidiana potestatis suae destructione torquetur dolens vtique se deseri verum regem locis omnibus adorari parat fraudes fingit dissensiones diuel soare greeued callinge heathen faithe daily decreasinge power sorowing see selfe foresaken christe true kinge woorshipped al place therefore diuiseth guile imagineth dissension apologie cap diuision good god manner felowes whiche blame v disagreeing doo al selues weene agree wel togeather euery one fully resolued folowe haue benne striues quarrelles debate emongest selues time doo scotistes thomistes cal meritum congrui meritu condigni better agree togeather agree better emonge selues cocerning original sinne blessed virgine concerninge solemne vovv single vovve saie theire canonistes auriculare confession appointed positiue lawe man theire scholemen contrariwise appointed lawe god dothe albertus pius dissente caietanus dothe thomas dissente lombardus scotus thomas occamus scotus alliacensis occamus doo theire nominalles disagree theire realles yet saie nothinge many diuersities freres monkes howe somme put greate holinesse eatinge fishe somme eatinge hearbes somme wearinge shooes somme wearinge sandalles somme goeinge linnen garmente somme woollen somme called white somme blacke somme beinge shauen broade somme narrowe somme stalkinge vpon patens somme goeinge barefooted somme girte somme vngirte ought yewis remember somme theire owne companie whiche saie body christe supper naturally contrarie somme selfe companie denie vtterly againe others saie body christe holy communion rente torne vvith teethe somme againe denie somme also whiche write body christe sacramente quantum saie hath perfite quantitie sacramente somme others againe saie naie others whiche saie christe consecrate certaine diuine power somme blessinge somme againe saie vttering fiue solemne chosen woordes somme rehearsinge woordes afterwarde againe somme wil haue christe speake fiue woordes material wheate bread pointed vnto demostratiue pronoune hoc somme rather haue certaine vagum indiuiduu terme meante thereby againe others saie dogges mise maye truely deede eate body christe others againe stedfastly denie others whiche saie accidentes breade wine maie nourishe others againe saie substance breade retourneth againe miracle neede saie ouer longe tedious recken vp al vncertaine ful doubtes yet whole fourme mennes religion doctrine euen emongest selues sprange grewe vp firste hardly time doo wel agree betweene selues except peraduenture time paste phariseis saduceis herode pilare accorded togeather againste christe hardinge vvhat euer ye bringe dissension vvith vvhiche defender charge catholike churche shewe diuersitie dissension founde emong caetholikes maie reduced two heades one conteineth diuersitie pointes lerninge trade life concerninge matter lerninge thanked lorde enemy catholike churche canot charge catholikes dissension groudes article faithe smal matter question disputable bothe side maie therein dissent one learned man without blame faithe remaininge inuiolated good sir defender meante name nominal real vnderstande man shoulde vpon sudda ne demaunde questiona greate doubteful question euery poore logician maie easily knovve perhaps would seekinge answere sir oxforde man suppose maie remember euer learned logike trade taught resorted paruis adoo made daily disputation exercise younge wittes aboute genus specie reste vniuersals vvhether terminus primae secundae intentionis whether entia realia rationis vvhiche matter perteigninge logike diuinitie nowe schoolemen opinion fiue vniuersals terminus nomina secundae intentionis called thereof nominal holde opinion entia realia thereof named real c behalfe holy religious mennethe catholike religious men put holinesse outvvarde obseruaces tell ye blame belie discipline order life euer haue addicted selues vnto better oportunitie serue god truthe truthe put greate holinesse ye saie eatinge fishe hearbes shoe sandal linnen vvollen garmentes white blacke broade narrowe crownes goinge patens bare grounde girdinge selues beinge vngirded ignorant put holinesse suche outwarde thinges though obedience performed humble obseruation outwarde thinges accordinge ruleto vvhat ende obseruances religious elia holy thinge thinges vse restrainte discipline accordinge order rule vnder whiche better serue god haue promised obediently humbly liue neither put holinesse thinges scoffed elia mantell letherne girdle wherewith girded loines iohn baptist eatinge locustes wilde honie wearinge garmente camelles heare girdinge selfe aboute loines skinne praie you4 reg iohn baptist sir ye woulde folowe lightnes haue like matter diuersitie outwarde thingesmatth twite withall diuersitie breache due order lawe religious men accordinge order rule ye thinke diuersitie thinges owne nature indifferent meates apparell shauinge c woorthy reprehended deduce thence argumente mutuall dissension amonge ministringe cleregie likewise diuersitie founde amonge weare square cappes rounde cappes butten cappes onely hattes doo weare side gownes hauinge large sleeues tippettes whiche wel liked secte perfection turkey gownes gaberdeines frockes night gownes moste laye fashion auoidinge superstition thinge indifferent maye yelded vnto saithe one secte pope ragges maie worne saith thother secte therefore rather iustly put whiche iustely cannot keepe yelde one iote neither maiesties commaundement metropolitan decree care rather seeme people whome vse clawebackes whose iudgement stande fall stoute champion owne gospell meeke folowers christes gospell suche mighty samson suche constant laurences ioyly gospell breedeth saiechristes body torne vvith teeth hovv vnderstanded body christe communion torne crusshed teethe denie yea forsothe bothe meane right well hundred thirtene bishoppes assembled councell rome vnder pope nicolaus seconde prescribed suche forme recantation berengarius firste auctor sacramentarie heresie openly pronounce acknowledge subscription ratifie confesse true body christe onely sacramente thereofberengarius recantation sensibly veritie handled handes priestesthis vvas blasphemous horrible erroure broken crusshed teethe faithefull whiche woordes father minde expresse veritie reall presencethe true eatinge christes body spiritual imagined eatinge vvith mouthe teeth heathenishe fantastical hath truthe true eatinge christes body deede exclude onely spirituall eatinge olde father eate christe manna neither thus doctrine dissonant fathersnominales real specially fro chrysostome hath like woordes homilia iohan euer sauiour christe consecratedcurious question defined holy churche councell certaine diuine power almightie blessinge vtterance woordes repetinge woordes euer pronoune hoc pointeth signifieth woordes consecration euer dogges mise haue eaten selues haue troden vnder wicked feete whether accidentes doo nourrishe substance retourne narrow pointes euer schoolemen tossinge argumentes fro manner haue agreed disagreed vpon matter subtile curious neither determined definitiue sentence churche councell therefore sith conteineth article faithe let v offended whettinge sharpeninge subtile wittes matter neither truthe god woorde preiudiciall vnderstandinge iudgement man hurtefull b sarisburie touchinge nominalles realles hardinge ye benne cunninge skilful ye make selfe ye would haue sente v backe learne firste seconde intention emongest child ye maie vnderstande owne erroure certainely see twoo house nominalles realles haue heretofore keapt sturre onely logique also scholastical mater diuinitie without searchinge bottome thereof praie onely consider fewe authority veselusveselus sometime greate fame learninge named lux mundi writeth thus nominalibus si quid fidei contrarium putarem hodie remearem vel ad formales vel ad realles thought thinge nominalles contrarie faith would presently leaue goe either formalles reallesillyricus de sectis pag saithe ex sententiarijs alij terminales aut nominales
