esse volunt alij real doctours scholastical diuinitie somme wilbe called terminales nominales somme real saithe citius e labyrinthis temet expliceserasm moria quam ex inuolucris realium nominalium c quibus omnibus tantum est cruditionis vt putem apostolis ipsis opus fore alio spiritu si cogerentur istis de rebus cum hoc nouo theologorum genere conserere manus ye maie sooner winde selfe maze shiftes corner realles nominalles c sutche abundance learninge thinke apostle selues haue neede sprite time driuen encounter nevve kinde diuines harding nominalles realles called nevve kinde logician diuinesvdal zasius de generum obligatione ye consider wel vdalrichus zasius ye shal finde saide nominalles realles haue intruded selues onely diuinitie also ciuile lavve therefore somewhat season tel v tale seconde firste intention concerninge apparel ye saie ye sette greate holinesse neither shooes sandales c whereby ye would seeme geeue v vnderstande ye sette somme holinesse thinges although greate neither doothe appeare phariseis euer made greate accoumpte holinesse garmentes yet notwithstandinge vnder coloure shadowe thereof deceiued people therefore christe saithe vnto woe vnto ye scribe matthae marc luk seneca macrobius phariseis vnto people saithe beware loue goe longe roobes sutche menne seneca saithe personam habere malunt quam faciem wil rather weare visarde natural face saithe dolosi hominis dolosae vestes crafty man crafty cote noman euer reckened holinesse apparel wherefore decree longe agoe written councel gangra si quis virorum putauerit sancto propositoobedience id est continentiae conuenire vt pallio v aturholinesse apparel tanquam ex eo iustitiam habiturus c anathema sit man thinke agreeable holy purpose concil cangren cap chrysostom matthae homil continente life weare cloke though thereby maie iustified c accursed wherefore doothe chrysostome crie againste sutche folie vsed maie appeare time impietatem maiorem sanctitatem vestimentis suis volunt ostendere quam corpore christi c vt desperans de misericordia dei confidat veste hominis wickednesse hereof wil shewe holinesse ovvne apparel body christe c despaireth goddes mercie put truste garmente man wherefore doothe thomas aquine tel v certainelythom aquinas wearinge francise dominikes cowle power remoue sinne wel sacramente baptisme wherefore doothe bishop halowinge priestes vestimentesin pontifical benedic ad vestimenta sacerdotal saie thus vt sacerdotes tui hac sacrum veste induti ab omnibus impulsionibus seu tentationibus malignorum spirituum muniti defensi esse mereantur thy priestes wearinge holy vesture maie deserue shielded defended al assaultes tentations vvicked sprite doctoure durande furnisheth prieste masse complete harnessedurand rationali lib cap capo pie amictus est pro galea c amice saithe headpeece albe coate maile gyrdle bowe subcingle quiuer stole speare maniple clubbe chisible targette ende saithe haec sunt arma quibus pontifex vel sacerdos armari debet contra spirituales nequitias pugnaturus piece wherewith bishop prieste muste harnessed vvil fight againste spiritual vvickednesse thus mutche trowe would haue saide without somme opinion special holinesse thorte wherefore doo doctours keepe sutche hote schooles emongest seluesextra de conse eccle vel allaris quod dubijs whether sextine happen mende halowed vestimente threede vnhalowed whole vestimente thereby becomme vnhalowed could doubteful mater euer haue fallen question emongest felowes ye benne fully thorowly persuaded holinesse apparellactant lib cap anciente father lactantius saithe vestes gemma coetera quae habentur pretio si quis puret deo chara plane quid deus sit nescit man thinke apparel pretious stone like thinges wee haue estimation pleasant delectable vnto god vndoubtedly knoweth god ye saie euer apparel yet obedience holy obedience vita iohannis damasceni ye meane euer abbate shal bidde doo carrie baskettes palestina damasco sitte seuen yeeres togeather silence without speakinge woorde space tweluemoonethes twise euery daie water deade tree briefelycassand lib cap doo euer fonde businesse ye commaunded written one commaundemente abbate threwe childe streame trowe obedience ye commende holy paule saithe corinth ambros corinth esai ye bought price make selues sclaues vnto menne ambrose saithe scrui hominum sunt qui humanis se subijciunt superstitionibus sclaues menne make selues subiecte vnto mennes superstition god selfe saithe vnto required thinges handes hieronym ad lustochium de virginitate seruanda hierome saithe viros fuge quos videris cathenatos quibus foeminei contra apostolum sunt crines hircorum barba nigrum pallium nudi patientia frigoris pes haec omnia argumenta sunt diaboli plee menne thou shalte see goe chaines contrarie apostle commaundemente weare longe heare weemen choise apparel bearded like goates haue vpon blacke cloke goe barefoote patiently bearinge colde al token diuel alphonsus de castroalphonsus aduer haeres lib cap one owne saith paulus quidem iussit captiuare intellectum nostrum sed obsequium christi non autem obsequium hominum deede paule bath commaunded v submitte vnderstandinge vnto obedience christe vnto obedience menne godly learned menne whose personnes pleaseth rudely scoffe refuse either goe apparel otherwise shewe selues like vnto haue age sufficient answeare selues notwithstandinge thus mutche maie saie behalfe neither doo commende manner apparel holy doo condemne apparel vnholy proper peculiare erroure hardinge make deepe accoumpte outwarde shewes knowe euseb lib cap nonlatin alphabet eusebius saithe iustinus martyr preached gospel christe beeinge apparelled heathen philosopher know iohn euangelist preached goddes woorde ephesus wearinge vpon bishoppes brouche benne bishop iewes augustine saithe nihil sane ad istam pertinet ciuitatem quo habitu vel viuendi si non est contra diuina praecepta istam fidem qua peruenitur ad deum quisque sectetur vnde ipsos quo que philosophoseuseb li ca nonlatin alphabet augustin de ciuita lib cap helar psalmum quando christiani fiunt habitum vel consuetudinem victus quae nihil impedit religionem sed falsa dogma mutare compellit perteineth nothinge vnto cittie god vvhat kinde apparel vvhat order life againste god man folowe faithe whereby wee comme vnto god therefore philosopher becomme christian churche compelleth change apparel manner liuinge whiche nothinge hinder religion onely shee compelleth change false opinion hilarie saithe ad ecclesiae decus detracta diabolo gentium spolia diuiduntur spoiles heathen taken diuel diuided furniture ornamente churche god hierome saithe hieronym aduersus pelagia lib episcopus presbyter diaconus reliquus ordo ecclesiasticus administratione sacrificiorum candida veste procedit bishop prieste deo ecclesiastical companie administration sacrifice comme foorthe vvhite apparel chrysostome vnto priestes deacon saithe thus chrysostom matth homi haec est dignitas vestra haec corona non quia induti tunicam candidissimam per ecclesiam ambulatis dignitie garlande ye walke churche vvhite apparel thei saie therefore apparel either holy vnholy maie truely saie apparel parte hath benne fowly abused filthy purpose maie iustly saie woulde gladly appearance shewe selues like vnto haue vntruely longe deceiued worlde herein without sundrie authority example godly fathersaugust confess lib cap quod superstitioni gentilium essent suntlima regor lib epist augustine saith mother leafte bringinge vvine cake churche vngodly vnlawful selfe doo onely shee warned resemblance superstition heathen gregorie speakinge three sprinklinges dippinges holy fonte saith thus vna fide nihil efficit consuetudo ecclesiae diuersa tamen quod haeretici id facerent negant idem esse catholicis faciendum faithe beinge one diuersitie customes hurteth nothinge yet mutche heretiques haue thus donne saie catholiques maie wise doo thinge selfe il would seeme folowe heretiques gabriel biel saith churche rome thought good vse common leauened breade ministration holy mystery leste vsinge vnleauened breadegabriel lectio thought folowe ebion heretique tertullian reasoneth vehemently tertul de corona militis christian man ought goe laurel garlande vpon heade none cause onely heathen vsed goe wherupon beatus rhenanus geueth note non solum ab temperandum fuitb rhenan librum de corona militis quae manifestam prae se ferrent impietatem sed etiam ab illis quae possent indifferentia vocari hoc est quae essent ne que bona neque mala partim ne quisquam infirmior ex christianis offenderetur partim ne ethnici suis erroribus confirmarentur dum rectius putant esse quod etiam christianos obseruare vident meete refraine onely sutche thinges haue manifeste shewe wickednesse also sutche thinges mighte called indifferent saie neither good il partely leste vveaker christian shoulde offended partely also leste heathen encourraged errours thinkinge thinge christian selues doo better tertul de idololatria againe tertullian saithe de hoc primo consistam cum ipsis quo que nationibus communicare huiusmodi seruus dei debeat siue habitu siue victu vel quo alio genere laetitiae eorum herein wil firste stande whether lawful seruaunte god communicate whole nation sutche thinges either apparel diet kinde theire mirthe basile saithe nonlatin alphabet let needelesse basil de natali christi origen hieremi homil superfluous thinges put silence churche god shorte origen saithe quaerendum est quid hoc sit quod sequitur non fiant ei reliquiae ne aliqua inquit rescindatis chaldaeorum aliqua reseruetis ob id iubet ne pusillum quidem relinquatur ea vvee muste examine meante foloweth leaue manner remnante meaninge abolishe certaine superstition chaldee reseruinge certaine therefore commaundeth nothinge leaste neuer litle take vpon enter conscience others roman let eche man abounde owne sense yet hardinge mutche ye make sutche reckeninge antiquitie al order ceremony vndoubtedly benne conueied ouer vnto christe selfe apostle maie therefore please vnderstande beginninge appeareth sutche distinction difference apparel ministerie valafredus abbas saithe veteres communi indumento vtentes celebrabant missas olde father saide masse saie ministred holy communion hauinge ovvne common apparel augustine rule clerkes august regula monachor hieronym ad marcellam vt commigret bethleem monkes writeth thus ne sit notabilis habitus vester let apparel notable hierome describinge order churche bethleem saithe thus veste nulla discretio nulla admiratio vtcunque placuerit incedere nec detractionis est nec laudis apparel difference woonderinge euer man liste goe neither sclandered praised pope coelestinus firste saithe discernendi sumus plebecoelestin episto ad episcopas gallia ca doctrina non veste conuersatione non habitu mentis puritate non cultu si enim studere incipiemus nouitati traditum nobis patribus ordinem calcabimus vt iocum vacuum superstitionibus faciamus docendi potius sunt rudium animi quam illudendi nec imponendum est illorum oculis sed mentibus infundenda praecepta sunt vvee muste knowen laie people doctrine coate conuersation apparel purenesse minde attiere body wee beginne diuise nouelties wee shal treade father order vnder foote make roome superstition mindes ignorante ought taught mocked neither maie wee goe aboute dosel y rather ought powre wholesome doctrine harte conclude noted owne glose vpon clementine choise apparel clerici saeculares non habent certum habitum cl p ct cap gloss vl m cum non fit expressum iure de colore vel forma per quae vel quorum alterum oportet habitum discerni seculare priestes haue certaine apparel appointed mutche expresse mention made neither coloure fourme whiche twoo difference one apparel muste discerned goddes name blessed religion christe maie stande bothe without thinges without sutche proppes whole rooffe religion muste needes comme downe hauinge nothinge el shewes vanity beare vp leste ye conceiue ouer greate opinion smal mater thinke none apparel meete comely cleregie onely youres without whole churche christe must needes goe waste maie like therfore remember ancient father origen hath written behalfe origen matthae tracta non solum apud iudaeos sed etiam apud no multos est inuenire peccata huiusmodi peccantes glutientes camelos eo quod maximum delicta committunt et oportet huiusmodi homines frequenter considerare quomodo rebus minimis religionem suam ostendant et bene eos hypocritas appellat wee maie finde onely emongest iewes also emongest selues menne offende sutche faultes swalowinge downe whole camel commit greate offense wee ought wel marke sutche manner menne howe countenance religion smal mater vvel iustly christe calleth hypocrite posidoniusposidoni vita august writinge life augustine saithe thus vestis eius calceamenta lectualia ex moderato compe enu habitu erant nec nitida nimi mx nec abiecta plurimum quia plerun que vel iactare se nimium homines solent vel abijcere ex vtro que non quae iesu christi sed quae sua sunt quaerentes augustine apparel shooes beddinge competente meane makinge neither ouer freashe ouer homely sutche thinges menne vse oftentimes either vaunte abase selues aboue measure either side seekinge ovvne perteineth iesus christe augustine saithe august de serm domini onte lib ex coeteris eius operibus potest conijci vtrum hoc cotemptu superflui cultus ambitione aliqua faciat quia sub ouina pelle cauendos lupos dominus praecepit wee maie geather reste woorkes whether doo thus attiere selfe contempte superfluous apparel el ambition aie noted lorde hath commaunded v bevvare vvoulfe euen vnder sheepes skinneaugust eodem libro againe saithe illum parcum habitum ac necessarium etiam simulatores saepius vsurpant vt incautos decipiant homely kinde apparel standinge onely necessary hypocrite dissembler doo parte countrefcite ende maie deceiue menne bew thus mutche onely waie leste yee thinke coate woorthy saie body christe sacrament torne crusshed teethe somme denie yea forsoothe saie bothe meane right wel thus would ye saie hardinge ye knowe eate body christe cyprian saithecyprian de coena domini est cibus mentis non ventris meate minde belly wee eate spiritual toothe faithe material toothe body glose neuer blinde able see woordes teare crusshe christes body vvith bodily teethe hardly haue catholique good meaninge imaginede conse dist ego berenga glossa woordes thereof nisi sane intelligas verba berengarij maiorem incides haeresim quam ipse habuit et ideo omnia referas ad specie ip onlesse thou discretely vnderstande woordes berengarius dog mise christes body torne crusshed vvith teethe thou shalte fal greater heresie therefore woordes muste haue relation fourmes vnto christes body foloweth therefore catholique construction geather hereof muste needes christes body crusshed torne teethe saie christes body crusshed torne teethe german lippes farre sunder ye maie easily ioine togeather sutche construction chrysostome saith like wise dentes inserimus carnes christi wee thrust teethe fleashe christe hardinge ignorante chrysostomes extraordinariechrysostomus encaenijs vehement manner speache therefore yee blame thus purpose witingly abuse reader chrysostome saithe vvee thruste teethe christes fleashe saithe likewise christe slaine vpon communion table bloude povvred side likewise saithe vnto sclaunderer neighbourechrysostom ad roman homil linguam tuam humano sanguine rubefecisti thou haste died thy tongue redde mannes bloude hierome saithe detractores viuis carnibus saturantur sclaunderers filled liue fleashe saithe cyprian cruci haeremus hierony iobum cap cyprian de coena domini sanguinem sugimus intra ipsa redemptoris nostri vulnera linguam figimus wee cleaue crosse sucke bloude wee fasten tongue within woundes redeemer like phrase commonly vsed anciente father maie racked extremitie woordes rather ought fauourably applied meaninge whiche material toothe tongue body expresse spiritual inwarde eatinge suckinge mindeaugust de doctrin christian lib cap augustine saithe figura ergo est praecipiens passioni domini communicandum suauiter atque vtiliter recondendum memoria quod caro christi crucifixa pro nobis vulnerata sit therefore figure figuratiue phrase speache commaundinge v partaker christes passion comfortably profitably laie vp harte fleashe crucified wounded sake consecration corpus quantum non quantum non per modum quanti indiuiduum vagum c whiche lately substantiallest pointes al doctrine sufficient saie article faithe sutche grace haue aduantage make faithe lesse pleasure touchinge dogges mise whether eate body christe substantially uerily deede ye seeme stil staie doubte yet beinge wel assured article faithe moste certaine vndoubted article faithe creature eate body christe member christes body augustine saithe hoc est manducare illam escam augustin iohan tracta illum potum bibere christo manere christum manentem se habere eatinge meate drinkinge drinke man dwel christe haue christe dwellinge within therefore wee saie euer wil holde dogge mouse maie eate body christe really deede staggereth doubteth whether maie accursed saie contention bitwene twoo contrarie army thomistes scotistes schoolemenne stande onely certaine termes metaphysical vtrum en vnum differant ratione reipsa truthe whereof agreeable reste doctrine leaue whole worlde endlesse contention emong alphonsus one owne doctours saithethomistes scotistes one thomistes doubted pronounce openly behouse maister quisquis b thomae sententia discesserit suspectus de haeresi est censendus alphons de haeresib li ca euer foresaketh iudgement thomas aquine muste taken suspected heresie thinke ye vse place heresy termes metaphysical erasmus liued age vnderstoode fury schooles saithe thus erasmus contra latomum qui thomam sequuntur scoto gersone dissentiunt eos pene habent pro haereticis folowe thomas dissente dun gerson accompte manner good heretiques petrus soto catharinus bothe learned menne bothe side bothe sworne pope bothe presente late chapter tridente yet thus doothe one greete otherpetrus soto contra catharinum tu permanes sensu damnato per synodum thou remainest stil sense condemned councel catharinus condemneth cardinal caietan twoo hundred sundrie errours somme calleth vvicked antichristian termes must needes metaphysical hardinge yelde sutche heretical antichristian errours apologie cap diuision beste therfore goe sette peace home rather amonge selues truthe vnitie concorde doothe best becomme religion yet vnitie sure certaine marke whereby know churche god greatest vnitie might bee amongest woorshipped golden calfe amonge whiche one voice iointly cried saueour iesus christe crucifie neither bicause corinthian vnquieted priuate dissension bicause paule square peter barnabas paule bicause christian vpon beginninge gospel mutual discorde touchinge one mater may wee therefore thinke churche god amongest personnes whome vpon spite cal zuinglians lutheran deede bothe side christian good frendes brother varie bitwixte selues vpon principle fundations oure religion touchinge god christe holy ghoste meanes iustification euerlastinge life vpon one onely question whiche neither weighty greate neither mistruste wee make doubte al wil shortely agreed bee whiche haue opinion meete doubte ere bee longe wil put aparte al affection name party god wil reuele truthe vnto better consideringe searchinge matter came passe councel chalcedon al cause seedes dissension shal bee throughly plucte vp roote buried quite foregotten euer whiche god graunte hardinge defender like condition suche honest woman commonly call scoldes vnitie pleaseth beinge lacke whereof newe churche al good men detested meanest muche suspected ye saie sure certaine marke whereby know churche god yea maisters amonge note markes true churche vnitie one euery vnitie vnitie holy ghost whiche geueth life one body churche whereof euery faithful member christe head powring charitie abroade harte linketh al right beleeuers togeather bonde peace al saie one thing thinke one thing sauer one thing vnitie note marke true church whereof wee speake whiche churche called one beinge gathered knitte togeather professeth vnitie faithe good wil mutual love togeather sacramentes vnitie worshipped golden calfe one consent againste sauiour cried crucifige farre distant vnitie whiche note churche woorke holy ghost suche vnitie deuils conspire christ al one consente vnitie oftentimes theeues vnitie founde sectes ye neuer diuerse variaunce within selues yet ye io ne togeather wicked amitie vnitie church christ therefore augustine compareth ye samson foxe sundred head tied togeather tayles neither saie amonge vary small pointes thinges perteininge groundes faithe1 corin gal act churche certaine corinthian primitiue churche square howe euer paule tolde peter thought good though barnabas paule agreed iohn marke yet christes churche el ye bringe excuse luth rans zwinglians sectes spronge cause like pardye saie ye liste lie longe ye liste dissension dessembled muche lesse accorded c yet lest whose fortune see ought thereof written el mistrust reporte espie lyinge woordes nicolaus gallus owne doctor luther scoole rehearsein thesibus hypotyposibus fol vlt non sunt leues inter no concertationes de rebus leuibus sed de sublimibus doctrinae christianae articulis de lege euangelio de iustificatione bonis operibus de sacramentis c strife sateth amongest v light light matter highe article christian octrine namely lawe gospel iustification good woorkes sacramentes c ye see rekeneth vp greate many weightiest pointes religion whereof ssent amonge themselues doubte maye call weighty great seinge good felowes call controuersie whiche betwixte lutheran zwinglians concerninge body saucour christe neither weighty greate make foule lie therein also sayinge vary betwixte selues vpon one onely question dissension betweene lutheran zwinglians thus pittifully complaineth nicolaus amsdorffius booke entituled publica confessio purae doctrinae selfe beinge earnest lutheran worlde goeth v worse worse dayly thinges doo prognosticase vtter ruine gospell place gospell shall haue nothinge mere errours notable fewe woordes nowe brenttus saithe adiaphoristes speciall secte lutheran beinge communication conference vvormes would condemne zwinglius osiander rimme men tongue well seene humanitie v side refused agree vnto communication onlesse condemned dressed v vily theire scoffes railinges thrust v communication compelled v goe awaie c item fewe saie condemne zuinglianisme preface brentius maister iames minister goppingen booke witnesseth farre otherwise goe god name conciliat good father luther zuinglius make friendes one quod plane impossibile est quis enim vnquam audiuit contradictoria posse redigi concordiam vvhiche impossible euer hearde contradiction maye accorded maisters apologie make doubte wil shortly aggreed suche childishe impossible thinges sticke set foorthevnitie would compted teacher worlde though blockes ass heresy errours zuinglius osiander quiet conscience embrace neither subscribe yelde departinge away newe guegawes whiche haue diuided selues luther thus far amsdorffius muche purpose leaue blot paper withall conclude thus men may plainely see maisters defence conuinced foule lyinge owne doctours scholefelowes beside thinge selfe geueth manifest euidence againste stuffe writinges preachinges geason leauinge others reporte iuelles late sermon made paules crosse sondaie ascension daye laste whiche vniforme reporte made sundry present true abused certaine honorable woorshipfull personage common people greate multitude lie woorthy rather chastised lawes confuted woordes writtenapocal qui sordibus est sordescat adhuc b sarisburie pitieth hardinge see trifling e ye thought good skil aduantage cause compare v scoldes wherefore although whole booke yet leaste selfe place ye deepely charge v scoldinge refraine better sutche wilde speaches might seeme proue selfe scolde beseche cal woordes litle remembrance consider indifferently weemen commonly vse like thus ye saie euen good sir proudely wickedly fondely yee obiecte yee shewe clerkely prowes yee bragge yee boaste haue tolde scoldinge tale yee ioine wicked amitie againste churche christe founder churche apostle gospel yee conuinced foule lieinge al menne doo espie lieinge lie longe yee liste filthy let filthy stil woordes hardinge altogeather one place finde many like al whole apologie condemne v hardly cal v scoldes vnitie wee loue honoure greatest comforte christian harte vnitie onely vndoubted token churche god woe felowes token agreeinge il emongest selues yee shoulde seeme haue churche wee haue saide al thei agree togeather therefore euermore churcheluk psalm herode pilate made frendes agreed togeather dauid saithe kinges prince earthe haue mette agreed togeather againste lorde againste christe iohn saithe frendesapocalyp fauourers antichriste hi vnum consilium habent vires ac potestatem suam tradent bestiae hi pugnabunt cum agno shal haue al one counsel one minde shal deliuer ouer strength power vnto beaste shal fight lambe chrysostome saithe chrysostom matthae homil expedit ipsis daemonibus obaudire sibi inuicem schismate good euen diuels selues obediente one vnto diuision symmachus like maineteiners heathenishe idolatrie ambros lib epist saide aequum est quicquid omnes colunt vnum putari meete euer al menne woorship counted one thus woulde seeme holde vnitie vnitie hardinge sounde certaine ye woulde seeme make doo condemne selues one heresie certainely heresie importeth diuision greate vnitie whole shewe substance vnitie standeth geeue eare selues put christe silence true christian vnitie whole flocke christeiohn heare voice onely shephearde folowe bande vnitie simple veritie whiche hardinge mutche yee haue forsaken ye haue greate cause talke mutche vnitie sampsons foxetailes seemeth ye lackte somewhat plaie withal otherwise serue greate purpose dissension emongest v article faithe onely somme particulare pointe learninge like whereof hath benne bitweene augustine hierome others learned godly catholique father churche thus contrarie sampsons fox notwithstandinge one haue benne diuided somme certaine conclusion tailes yet wee ioine thorowly al togeather one heade one gospel one waie saluation one summe religion al togeather one mouthe one sprite glorifie god father lorde iesus christe concerninge disagreemente bitweene lutheran zuinglians touchinge beeinge body christe one onely place many wee saie respecte either saluation article god father sonne holy ghoste groundes principle christian faithe weighty respecte wee speake onely otherwise wee saie erroure weighty sutche errours sundrie anciente father haue benne dissembled paste silence hilarie seemeth saiehilar de trinita lib hominis habitus est origo non hominis christe receiued fleashe blessed virgin fleashe christe impassible coulde feele griefe origen saithe quidam putant christu futuro saeculo iterum pati oportere c somme menne thinke worlde comme christe muste suffer body crucified againe naturam non habens ad dole dum brentius seemeth holde christes body infinite al place godhedde whiche erroure seemeth defended somme augustine time therefore saithe cauendum est origen ad roman ca li brentius ne ita diuinitatem astruamus hominis vt veritate corporis auferamus must take heede wee doo maineteine diuine nature christe beinge man vvee take avvaie truthe body errours notwithstandinge greate selues yet respecte greater errours haue benne dissembledaugustin epist ad dardan iacob andreae de authori scripturae pag therefore iacobus andreas al coulde ignorant dissension beinge selfe partie yet saithe qu vociferantur nostros de summa euangelij nondum consentire mendacium est whereas crie wee cannot agree emonge selues aboute substance gospel greate vntruthe saie maisters apologie telle v doubte party wilbe reconciled yet nicolaus amsdorfius whose woordes ye ashamed blotte paper taketh matter impossible ye thinke ye haue driuen v neare wal specially findinge v far disagreeinge iudgemente doctoure cal owne hardinge ye might better haue considered amsdorfius wee speake sundrie mater therefore saieinges maie wel stande togeather amsdorfius saithe doctrine termes standinge stil doo possible manner construction make party agree truste god deceiued shal finde owne erroure alter termes correcte iudgementes submit selues vnto truthe ioine togeather al one augustine saithe augustin secunda disputatione contra fortunatum recte dicitur glacialem niuem calidam esse non posse nullo enim pacto quam diu nix est calida esse potest wel saide snowe frorne r congcled neuer hote longe snowe possible make hote likewise saithe heretiques named manichee lutheran zuinglians sic delirant manichaei sed resipiscant non sint manichaei thus fonde manichee august contra faustum lib cap let amende errours manichee contrarie iudgemente ievve christian yet god hath promised wil turne harte father iewes vnto childrenmalach harte child christian vnto father paule saitheroman iudaei si non permanserint incredulitate inserentur potens enim est deus iterum inserere eos iewes shalbe graffed tree abide vnbeliefe god able graffe againe contrarie light psalm darkenesse yet prophete saithe illumina tenebras meas lorde sighten thou darkenesse conclude contrarie kingedome pope kingedome christe yet wee truste impossible pope selfe maie turne god confesse errours professe gospel christe nowe oppresseth thinges considered hardinge deadly sinne saie wee truste mater variance bitweene lutheran zuinglians wil accorded al cause seedes dissension shalbe thorowly pulled vp rootes buried quite foregotten euer change god hath already begonne woorke onely sundrie learned menne also greate citties good vniuersities whole country therefore wee truste hope vaine lie whiche liketh wel saie ievvel made openly poules crosse doubte modestie ye woulde haue blased better ye thought woorthe colour sutche general greate exclamation vpon simple reportes stande alwaies greatest wisedome rasshe iudge pronounceth knowe cause saide mutche ye touche nothinge particulare needelesse make rehearsal wel remember might truely haue saide hardinge commonly misallegeth misreporteth misconstrueth corrupteth vvreasteth falsifieth anciente councels holy father coulde haue saide hardinge oftentimes directely contrarie selfe coulde haue saide hardinge one booke hath vttered twoo hundred fiue fiftie greate vntruthes hardinge conscience knoweth benne lie therefore meete chastifed lawes apologie cap diuision heauiest moste greeuous parte sclaunders cal v wicked vngodly men saie wee haue throwne awaie al care religion though ought trouble v mutche while selues thus haue charged v knowe ful wel howe spiteful vntrue theire sclaunder iustine martyr witnesse al christian called nonlatin alphabet godlesse soone gospel firste beganne bee published name christe openly declared polycarpus stoode iudged people stirred vp president slea murder al whiche professed gospel woordes nonlatin alphabet saie ridde waie wicked godlesse creature bicause true christian godlesse deede bicause woulde worship stone stockes whiche honoured god whole worlde seeth plainely yenough already wee oures haue endured mennes handes religion onely goddes cause haue throwne v prison water fier haue embrued selues bloude bicause wee either adulterer robber murtherers onely confessed gospel iesus christe put confidence liuinge god wee complained iustly truely lorde thou knowest breake lawe god theire owne vaine tradition aduersaries foe gospel enimies christes crosse witingly willingly obstinately despisinge goddes commaundementes wherefore menne sawe coulde rightly finde faulte doctrine woulde needes pike quarrel inueigh raile manner surmising wee doo condemne al wel doinges wee settte open doore al licentiousnesse luste leade awaie people al loue vertue deede life al men euen deuoutest moste christian bothe euermore hath sutche one maie alwaies finde somme lacke euen beste purest conuersation sutche inclination al creature vnto euil readinesse al menne suspecte thinges whiche neither haue donne meant donne yet maie easily bothe hearde credited true like smal spotte soone espied neatest whitest garmente euen leaste staine dishonestie easily founde purest sincerest life neither take al haue daie embraced doctrine gospel angel liue clearely without wrinkle yet thinke wee menne neither blinde thinge maie noted v able perceiue euen leaste creuie frendly wil construe ought beste yet honeste nature courteous thei wil looke backe vpon selues weigh liues theire owne yf wee liste searche matter bottome know yt apostle time christian name lorde blasphemed euil spoken emonge gentile constantius emperoure bewaileth written sozomenus many waxed woorse fallen religion christe cyprian lamentable oration setteth ye corrupt manner time vvholsome discipline saithe vvhiche apostle leafte vnto v hath idlenesse longe reste novv vtterly marred euery one studied encrease liuely hode cleane forgeatinge either vvhat donne vvhiles thei vvere vnder apostle vvhat thei ought continually doo hauinge receiued faithe thei earnestly laboured make greate theire ovvne vvealth vvith vnsatiable desire coue ousnesse deuoute religion saith hee priestes sounde faithe minister charitie shevved good vvoorkes fourme godlinesse theire condition menne become effeminate vveemens bevvtie countrefeited without recitinge many moe writer gregorie naziazene speaketh thus pitieful state owne time vvee saith hatred emonge heathen ovvne vice sake vve also becomme novve vvoonder onely angel menne euen al vngodly case churche god gospel firste beganne shine furie tyrannes yet cooled swerde taken christian neckes surely new thinge menne bee menne although thei bee called name christian hardinge loe greeuous heauy case worlde calleth wicked vngodly menne twis blame cal theeues whiche come promoted tiborne r god knoweth litle haue deserued called c b sarisburie al reste onely hicke scorner eloquence woorthy answeare endeth thirde parte fourth parte apologie cap diuision bvt wil men praie thinke nothing al selues while accuse v maliciously hauinge leasure beholde farre see donne bothe germanie englande haue either foregotten see donne rome wil thei accuse v theire owne life beinge sutch man hable make mention thereof shame pourpose take hande presente bringe lighte open worlde thinges meete rather hidde buried woorkers beseemeth neither religion modestie shamefastenesse yet whiche geeueth commaundemente shoulde called vicare christe heade churche also heareth sutche thinges donne rome seeth suffereth wee wil goe maie easily consider selfe manner thinges let goddes name cal minde let remembre owne canonistes whiche haue taught people fornication bitweene single folke sinne though fette doctrine mitio terence whose wordes sinne beleeue yonge man haunte harlottes let remembre owne whiche haue decreed prieste oughte put cure fornication let remembre also cardinal campegius albertus pighius others many moe owne haue taughte prieste whiche keepeth concubine dooth liue holily chastely whiche hath wife matrimonie truste hathe yet forgotten many thousandes common harlottes rome self dooth geather yeerely harlottes aboute thirtie thousande ducates waie annual pension neither foregeate selfe dooth mainteine openly brothel house moste filthy lucre dooth filthily lewdly serue owne luste al thinges pure holy rome iohane vvoman rather perfite age perfite life pope bare selfe heade churche twoo whole yeres holy see plaide naughty packe laste going procession aboute cittie sight al cardinal bishoppes fel trauaile openly stretes hardinge firste seeth notby ansvveare vvil appeare lie plaine truthe notorius lye make preface entrie matter saie take vpon time bringe light shewe world doinges whiche ought rather togeather auctours buried doo theire religion theire shamefastnes theire blusshinge dooth beare vvhat lie doo deede denie woorde yea saie thinge whiche affirme saie b sarisburie doubte good reader perusinge fewe folowinge thou shalte plainely see authours apologie spake al might wel haue spoken thou happen reade dante petrarcha boccase mantuan valla others like thou wilte certainely saie euen beinge thus chalenged called foorth required speake yet wee haue rather geeuen inklinge hereof opened particulare secretes mater thereof sbernard ad clerum synodo rhemen po em loco fran petrar epist bernarde saithe thus quae occulto fiunt ab episcopis turpe est vel dicere shame vtter thinges bishoppes doo theire secretes therefore saithe euen writer apologie melius itaque arbitror super hoc dissimulate touchinge sutche matter thinke better dissemble franciscus petrarcha calleth rome vvhoore babylon mother al idolatrie fornication fran petrar cantilena onde jugita ogni vergogno baptij mantuanus saithe al shame reuerence quite departed thence baptista mantuanus saithe viuere qui sancte cupitis discedite rom omnia cum liceant non licet esse bonum al ye woulde liue godly packinge rome al thinges el lawful good lawful againe alleaged sanctus ager scurris venerabilis ara cynaedis seruit honorandae diuum ganymedibus aedes hereby hardinge ye maie easily see wee pourpose dissembled couered shame spake mutche lesse far otherwise wee might haue spoken erasmus writing augustine dealinge againste manichee saith thus obscoena mysteria manichaeorum protraxit lucem nam haec prodidisse erat vicisse erasmus vita augustini opened published filthy mystery manichee openinge thereof sufficiente ouerthrowe happy liue sutche sorte man maie wel reuele theire life without blusshinge hardinge yee charge v pleintiefully fable sclaunders heapes lie greate fowle lewde shameful one companie al togeather wherein greate maisterie liberal hereof ye want stoare wee shalbe hable clearely plainely anouche iustifie eche thinge wee haue spoken wee doubte ye wil take al lie home againe bestowe freely emongest fellowes hardinge pope canonistes saie haue taught peoplecrimes laid pope charge defender simple fornication sinne greuous offence woorthy punished verily pope euer knewe learned men canon lawe haue taught people sutche heathenish deuilishe doctrine vntruthe canonistes selues co fesse councel maie iudge depose pope though man earthe iudge yet maie thought vn woorthy roome greate charge pope neuer knewe sutche doctrine preached canonistes time haue ben sutche cleare ye proued slaunderers false backebyters vve denie vtterly proue ye mary sir saie ye looke margent apologie shal ye finde one iohn de magistris noted offender behalfe vvel one man ye speake canonistes whiche worde signifieth number howe proue ye saide iohn de magistris nowe wil spare wil saie taught people simple fornication sinne c nowe tel youioannes de magistris blamed defender martinus de magistris cannot finde euer iohannes de magistris wrote impiously ye reporte martinus de magistris ye meane greate rashenesse ye haue reade selues beliue sutchethis peltinge vvriter alpho sus de castro one hardinges greatiest doctoures pelting writer sectes ye ye seme mooste shamefully moste dangerously deceiued c vvhat wil thought saide shewe plainely ye haue forged fowle lie moste false slaunder vpon martinus de magistris wil cal vntil ye proue iohannes martinus de magistris canonistea fovvle slaundero lie made defender ye saye doctour diuinitie wel learned time order studie schooleman treatise made de temperantia de luxuria disputeth sutche manner scholastical doctours commonly vse vvherefore saieth taught people sought vntruthe make matter detestable teacheth ai scholes teacher teacher disputinge schooles teachinge people farre asunder saithe doctour martin guise schooles quaeritur vtrum simplex fornicatio sit peccatum mortale saie question whether simple fornication mortal sinnenote vvaie hardinges secrete conclusion fornicatio mortal venial sinne defender knewe lefte woorde mortal beinge disposed lie thought beste lye vantagethe maner schole doctours nowe vnderstanded howe manner scholastical doctours firste propounde question nexte argue obiecte reason againste truthe question auouche proue truthe soile obiections brought againste truthe lastly bringe conclusion confirmation truthe prosecutinge question arguitur quod non reason againste saithe argue schoole manner maketh argumente againste truthe vvhiche argumente euer taketh purpose alloweth admitteth doctor goeth againste disproueth commeth proue truthemartinus de magistris cleared crime defender obiected foloweth oppositum simplex fornicatio excludit c contrary saith simple fornication excludeth kingdome god ergo mortal sinne saithe noted ergo likelihoode opinion others vvas othervvise opinion thomas simple fornication vndoubtedly mortal sinne vvho euer readeth martinus shal find hath wel disputed pro con terme scholes saie againste truthe putteth six conclusion whiche fourthe beginneth thus ideo c therefore simple fornication mortal sinne bicause forbidden god lawe c ende sixthe saithe hereof falsehed theire opinion made euident saie simple fornication mortal sinne vvhiche opinion condemned article paris errore clxxxvi saith guido carmelite saithe chapter contra errores graecorum errour grekes saieing simple fornication betwene single man single woman mortal sinne openly conteineth heresie againste holy scripture proueth foure reason c mutche expressed sufficiently proued martinus de magistris scholastical disputation saide treatisefor trial conclusion see ansvveare saithe simple fornication sinne mutche lesse ca reasonably coloure honestie saide taught people therefore falsely slaunderously imputed vnto b sarisburie ye sayesimple fornication wee lie wee backebite wee sclaunder c answeare whereunto first wee saie new diuise make light simple accoumpt simple fornication epiphan lib haeresi aetius olde heretique vsed thus saie dormire cum muliere extra coniungium non magi est peccatum quam aurem scalpere haue companie wooman marriage sinne man clawe care clemens stromat lib likewise heretique prodicus saide licet palam aperte fornicari lavvful commit open fornication likewise longe sithence wrote laurentius valla earneste game cannot tel thus wrote wrote romelaurent valla de voluptate lib cap richar de sancto victore par fol beinge selfe one canon omnino nihil interest vtrum cum marito coeat mulier cum amatore vndoubtedly difference whether wooman keepe companie husbande louer richardus de sancto victore saith paulus praeuidebat multos fore qui fornicationis malum non adeo damnabile putarent paule foresawe shoulde many would thinke il fornication damnable mater like purpose socrates writeth corrupte iudgemente sundrie timesocrat li ca scortationem indifferentem esse putant de festis vero diebus perinde atque pro animabus suis dimicant inuertentes mandata dei c take fornication vvhooredome thinge indifferente saie neither good il leafte libertie fight keepinge theire holydaies theire soules father appeareth issued pope romaine cleregie haue learned readily swalowe camel nicely solemnely straine gnatte ye wil saie al hitherto perteineth nothinge vnto canonistes specially plural number let v therefore see practise churche rome whiche life soule al canonistes dist qui thus therefore noted decree qui non habet vxorem parisijs loco illius concubinam debet habere hath wife steede muste haue concubine ye wil saie erroure printe yet thus extant many copy wel agreable common practiseconcil toletan cap beste make place qui non habet vxorem pro vxore concubinam habet communione non repellatur hath wife steede vvife hathe concubine let remoued communion likewise noted glose vpon constitution otho bonusconstit othonis boni de concubinis clericor remouedis licet ad profagandu glossa eade glossa extra de immunit ecclesia petr rauennas videtur quod crimen meretricij ecclesia sub dissimulatione transire debeat seemeth churche ought passe ouer crime vvhooredome vnder dissimulation see whiche glose ye shal finde woordes si non caste tamen caute ye doo chastely yet doo charily likewise saith petrus rauennas one notable canonistes vpon decretalles quamuis tactus oscula sint praeludia incontinentiae laicis secus tamen est clericis nam clericus praesumitur ista facere pro charitate bono zelo notwithstanding handeling kissing laie personnes occasion beginninges incontinente behaueoure yet priestes far otherwise prieste presumed doo thinges charitie good zele likewise noted glose11 quae absit glossa si clericus amplectitur mulierem laicus interpretabitur quod causa benedicendi eam hoc faciat prieste embrace wooman laie man muste iudge thus dooth thintente blesse also ye shal finde special note sette margine pourpose clericus amplectens mulierem praesumitur bene agereibidem margine prieste embracinge vvooman presumed doo vvel canonistes simple fornication scholemaisters doctoures hardinge thus write onely singulare also dual plural number would neuer lightly haue iudged hereof thought simple fornication benne sinne augustin en chiridio ad lauren ca augustine saithe clamor sodomorum gomorrhaeorum multiplicatus est quia non solum iam apud eos non punicbantur illa flagitia verum etiam publice velut lege frequentabantur crie sodome gomorrha multiplied sutche vice onely punished also openly vsed benne aide authoritie lawe sommewhat muste needes concil basil session erasmus enchirid mili christiani ca late councel basile enforced bishoppes decree fornication sinne erasmus man singulare learning iudgemente saithe meaneth somme beste romaine cleregie iacobus de valentia psal antoninus sum par titu ca s alexander halensis par quae mem ambrosius timoth augusti quae exod quae bona par eorum quos vulgus integros incorruptos appellat simplicem fornicationem moderatu voluptatis vsum vt leue commissum neutiquam refugiunt greate many common sorte taketh good godly menne white abhorre simple fornication sober vse pleasure reckeninge litle petite faulte saithe iacobus de valentia tam iudaei quam saraceni mali christiani vt detestabilem vitam suam excusent defendant asserunt fornicationem simplicem esse licitam wel jewes saracenes also il christian menne intent excuse defende theire wicked life saie simple fornication maie lavvefully vsed saithe antoninus archebishop florence confutatur error dicentium simplicem fornicationem non esse peccatum hereby reproued errour saie simple fornication sinne alexander hale waie disputation doubtethe allege woordes ambrose pourpose etiamsi aliquis lubricum carnis patiatur sine dubio vapulabit sed non peribit man suffer frailtie fleashe without doubte shalbe pounished perishe shal likewise augustine illa fornicatio quam faciunt qui vxores non habent cum foeminis quae viros non habent prohibita inueniri possit ignoro kinde fornication whiche single menne committe single womenne vvhether forbidden cannot tel thus haue hardinge onely canonistes also schole doctoures haue taught thought simple fornication noted margine apologie iohannes de magistris steede martinus har pag ae reade b vvinchester vnto fecknam pag hereof haue ye made selfe pleasaunte conqueste wee reade bookes selues wee beleeue sutche peltinge writer sectes wee shamefully daungerousely deceiued hardinge require indifferent iudgement speake vprightly wherfore dradely sin v name iohannes steede martinus selfe bookevint con cantur li de euchar name captaine iosue steede prophete osee one brother allege hosius athanasius sreuin gardiner stede theophylactus allege theophilus cicero allegeth aiax steede hector har pag chrysostome ad romanos chrysost ad gala agamemnon steede vlysses eupolis stede aristophanes aristotle allegeth calypso steede circe gratian allegeth aniceus anicetus ambrosius augustinus owne confession calixtus anacletus chrysostome nameth abacuk sophonias agar steede sara marke allegeth abiathar abimelech mathevv nameth hieremias hieronym marcum ca matthae de rescriptis significante abb zacharias benne great preiudice vnto cause haue dissembled smal mater specially findinge selfe often guilty owne doctours saie error nomine non habet vitiare modo constet de corpore errour name marreth mater body partie knowen martinussimple fornication ye saie neuer denied fornication deadly sinne expresse woordes affirmeth contrarie trial hereof maie please geue credite alphonsus de castro owne doctoure alphonsus contrae haeres li coltus woordes graeci vt guido illis impingit dicunt simplicem fornicationem non esse peccatum martinus de magistris suo libro de temperantia quaestione secunda de luxuria dicit se fateri fornicationem simplicem esse peccatum mortale tamen dicit insuper quod oppositum credere non sit haereticum quia vt dicit testimonia scripturae sacrae non sunt expressa greekes guido chargeth saie simple fornication sinne martinus de magistris booke temperance seconde question disputinge lecherie graunteth deede simple fornication deadly sinne yet saithe heresie beleeue contrarie saithe testimony scripture touching mater plaine hardinge ye haue owne doctours minde martinus saithe heresie beleeue simple fornication sinne saithe euen booke hath written de temperantia daungerously hardinge shamefully deceiued alleginge peltinge doctours therefore alphonsus concludeth thus sed cum pace illius dixerim ego credo martinum alioqui virum doctum hac parte errasse speake fauour beleeue martinus de magistris behalfe mutche deceiued hardinge fowle lye foloweth anvntruthe vvil sone founde truthe let remember say defender men haue decreed priest fornication ought remoued cure may saye although depriued cure yet may punished wise let v see would proue sayevvho bestovved quotation margine cannot tel lav e plaine shal appeare note margent send v proufe canon lawe quaest lata extra de bigamis quia circa touching chapter lata decree finde none suche causa quast nothinge purpose paragraphe quia circa extra vnderstanded state bigamie promoted holy order one already made priest fornication remoued vnderstande donne priest committed fornication order lawethis vvas olde time novv quite foregotten case bishop priest deacon degree deaconship taken benne conuict fornication aducutrie deposed castout churche enioined doo penaunce amonge lartie vvhiche thinge syluester length mercifully changed enioininge hypocritical folie maie redeeme al vvhole tenne yers faste pa einge penny reade ansvveare ten yeres penaunce prescript forme whiche oure newe cleregie woulde seeme harde straite yea lawe churche case litle beareth sinnefull life clerkes thatvntruthe manifest canon hardinges ovvne makinge bishop dioces consented borne fornication priestes deacon crime incest money praier auctoritie bishoply office duly punished sutche faultes committed shoulde suspended office muche wee haue shewed touchinge remouinge prieste onely benefice also office cause fornication wherein menne moste falsely haue slaundered churche man mayfal clearely god vvote see ansvveare dis presbyter appeere b sarisburie hardinge ye shewe selfe mutche vnskilful owne canon simpleste proctour courtes coulde soone haue tolde yee ouer farre deceiued thus written expresse woordes owne glose vpon decree dicunt neminem hodie propter fornicationem esse deponendum nisi ea perdurat saie fornication noman ought daie deposed deposed fornication onlesse continewe leste ye shoulde wise mistrust doubte glose also thus noted pourpose faire great letter margine fornicationis causa hodie nemo est deponendus novv day noman maie deposed fornication nothinge el saide yet thinge onely sufficiente panormitane also greateste canoniste like wise saithe extra de sanguinita affinita non debet abb dist maximianus clos ad varietate temporu debent mutari statuta humana ideo hodie ex simplici fornicatione clericus non deponitur lawes menne ought altered accordinge change time therefore nowe day simple fornication prieste deposed benefice likewise ye haue noted vpon decree communiter dicitur quod pro simplici fornicatione clericus deponi non debet quia pauci sine illo vitio inueniuntur commonly saide simple fornication prieste ought depriued fevve priestes founde vvithout faulte againe panormitane saithe like effecte extra de cohabita clericor mulier si autem abb clericus concubinarius officijs vitandus non est nisi sit notorius prieste keepeth concubine onlesse notorious maie refused seruice sundrie sutche like authority pooreste proctoure coulde haue brought howe saie syluester sutche case enioineth tenne yeeres penance true deede hardinge true olde forne yeeres aboute twelue hundred yeeres agoe nowe syluester paste quite minde lawe owne folke nowe saie nunc aliud tempus alij pro tempore more martinus poenitentiarius saith martinus poeniten dictionario ecclesia multos huiusmodi canones exufflauit quia onerosi sunt churche hathe blowen awaie many sutche canon thei burthenous looke better bookes hardinge owne lawe saithe fornicationis causa nemo hodie deponendus est quia corpus hodie sunt fragiliora di prebyter glossa noman nowe day ought depriued fornication bicause body frailer woonte therefore touchinge cruel tenne yeeres faste appointed syluesters constitution glose saithe thus potest ieiunare per alium vel potest dare numum pro ieiunio hee maie paste somme man el mai geeue good penny redeeme whole tenne yeeres faste graciousely added special prouiso behalfe shal receiue penny sed debet iste donarius esse talis quod non euincatur ab illo cui donatur alias non contingeret liberatio muste sutche penny neuer euicted againe lawe receiued otherwise shoulde discharged penance like manner saithe pope pelagius defectus nostri temporis quibus corpus ipsa hominum defecerunt dis fraternitatis districtionis illius non patitur manere censuram weakenesse time meane whereof body menne decaied doothe suffer rigoure lawe continewe otho bonus constitution legantine saithe de concubinis clericor remouendis licet ad profugandum remoueant ipsas intra mensem vel ipsas vel alias de coetero nullatenus detenturi let priestes put awaie concubine within monethes iespite afterward holde neither others wise wherevpon glose great conscience ful discretely saithe thus detenturi scilicet per mensem alioqui diceremus quod propter quancun que momentaneam possessionis detentionem sequentem hanc grauem poenam incurreret quod nimis esset rigorosum attenta fragilitate nostri temporis maie afterward holde neither concubine whiche woordes muste thus vnderstand space whole mooneth togeather maie holde deposed fornication otherwise wee shoulde saie prieste shoulde renne greeuous pounishemente shorte holdinge concubine possession folowinge afterwarde vvhiche thing deede marueilous rigorous specially consideringe frailtie time againe otho saithe eodem titulo ordinamus vt si contra hoc praesumpserint venire ab officio beneficio sint suspensi vvee ordaine prieste doo contrarie hereunto liuinge incontinently contrarie constitution suspended wel benefice office hereunto glose addethe rigorosa quoque esset haec poena nisi esset pro adulterio vel incestu etiamsi episcopus esset huiusmodi labens pounishemente also ouer rigorous onlesse aduoutrie inceste maie pounished fornication yea although partie fallinge bishop againe glose propter solam simplicem fornicationem de benignitate canonica non debet clericus deponi vel priuari licet secus forte de canonis rigore courtesie canon onely simple fornication priest maie deposed office depruied benefice al perhaps rigoure extremitie canon woulde otherwise extra de purgatione canonica accepimus glossa true cause hereof plainely expressed owne glose vpon decretalles quia pauci sine vitio carnis inueniuntur without vice fleashe fewe priestes founde al notwithstandinge ye saie bishop winke dissemble beare wickednesse prieste behalfe selfe ought pounished suspension office hardinge canon owne makinge authoritie ye allege none howe maie seeme likely ye cruelly pounishe bishoppes fauourable dealinge herein seeinge highe alonely bishop bishop al bishoppes wel contente vpon agreemente monie licence bothe bishoppes priestes keepe concubine ye mistruste truthe hereof extra de iudicijs ca s de adulterijs bisides common practise knowe owne pope gregorie selfe wil soone tel de adulterio alijs minoribus criminibus episcopus potest cum clericis post poenitentiam dispensare touchinge aduoutrie smal faultes bishop penance donne maie dispense prieste also noted aduoutrie diuinitie reckened emonge petite sinnes likewise againe noted gloseextra de bigamis quia circa glossa authen de trien semi colla extra de bigamis quia circa glossa cum presbyteris habentibus plures concubinas episcopus potest dispensare vt suum officium exequantur vvith priestes hauinge sundrie concubine bishop maie dispense maie neuerthelesse theire office wherein ye seeme sommewhat ouerreache emperours courteste touchinge thus writeth vnam concubinam qui habet non plures caste viuit hee keepeth one concubine onely moe liueth chastely saide former glose ye shal finde special note owne wel woorthy written pope priuie galerie letter golde nota quod plures concubinas habens non incurrit irregularitatem marke wel keepeth sundrie concubine thereby made irregulare againe nota mirabilein eade glossa quod cum eo qui peccat dispensatur cum eo qui peccat non dispensatur marke wel marueilous strange reckeninge bishop dispenseth offendeth hauinge sundrie concubine offendeth hauinge married two wiues dispenseth saithe plus habet hic luxuriain eadem gloss quam castitas lecherie hath priuilege chastitie againe decree written thus dist quidam clerici gloss quaecunque clericis taliter coniunctae sunt auferantur ab episcopo venundentur vvhat euer weemen haue sutche companie priestes let remoued bishop solde made slaues vnto lawe beinge selfe ouer rigorous deposed fornication glose addeth fauourable construction venundentur verum est si contrahunt cum illis tanquam cum vxoribus alias non concedo posse vendi propter simplicem fornicationem let solde made slaues true priestes marrie vvith vvith theire vviues otherwise graunte simple fornication maie solde likewise againe noted glose dist igitur glossa nota frequentationem tantum viduarum virginum prohiberi marke wel comminge widowes maides often hauntinge vnto forebidden otho legantines saithe thus qui detinet publice concubinas c prieste openly keepeth concubinesconstitu ochonis de concubini clericor remouendis licet ad profugandum let deposed hereupon glose saithe thus tu dic publice quando multitudini se patere non expauet secus ergo si secrete intra domum propriam vel altenam detineat hanc concubinam nam tunc poenam huius constitutionis non incurret domus enim rem secretam non autem publicam denotat dic ergo publice id est communiter coram multis non ergo sufficit quod semel vel bi talis publice videatur openly keepeth concubine c vnderstande thou woorde openly afraide though appeare vnto people otherwise keepe concubine secretely whether man house owne commeth within danger lawe house betokeneth n open ter secrete thus therefore expounde thou constitution hee keepe concubine openly saie keepe commonly sight many therefore sutche concubine wise thrise seene openly sufficiente lose ye haue woordes haue alleged si non caste tamen caute whereas saie bishop shewe fauoure herein hee selfe shalbe suspended owne doctoure abbate panormitane woulde haue tolde contrarie de cohabitae cleruorum mulier autem abb episcopus non tenetur deponere clericum concubinarium bishop bounde depriue prieste keepeth concubine make shorte ye haue also great prouidence diuised special premunire embolden priestes fornication warrante free al daunger lawes2 quae laici made behalfe thus saie si laicus instigante diabolo accuset clericum incontinentiae statim repellitur laici accusatione episcopi audiendi non sunt laieman instigation diuel accuse prieste incontinent life streight waie thruste backe put silence late sorte maie hearde accusation bishop againe laicus non potest clericum de fornicatione accusare dist maximianus glossa laieman maie accuse prieste fornication extremitie vnmerciful rigoure hardinge ye shewe priestes case laieman maie accuse bishop maie depriue lavve maie touche hardinge thirde lye cardinal campegius albertus pighius certaine others haue taught prieste liueth holily chastely keepeth concubine hathe taken wife matrimonie vvhy doo ye tell v haue taught vvill ye wee beleeue bare woorde howe wee hauinge taken tardy many manifestlye aristotel asked common lyer gained lyeingethis ansvveare mutche toucheth hardinge selfe quoth hee telleth truthe man beleeue vvisedome woulde syrs yee tooke good heede yee proue suche gayners nowe wee require bringe foorthe proufe ye charge learned menne withal vvee sure ye cannot woordes pighius put case saithe hee whiche haue vowed chastitie doo maie ought doofornication better mariage atteine grace continencie therefore onely tempted also ouercome temptation parte vvhat shall lesse euill marie saie better thou maiest whiche apostle imputeth damnation breake firste faithe saie shall lesse euill lesse damnable marie ouercome lustes therefore ye impute vnto maketh kepinge concubine holy chaste life prieste takinge wife matrimonie fowle lie false slaunder neither doctrine filthinesse al whiche philip melanchthon ye folow chargeth withall touchinge pointe doctrine selfe paule confirmeth mariage bounde vowe continencie seemed wicked hainous sinne pronounceth marie damnable coniunctions yokefellowes meane onely many haue vowed chastitie vntruthe augustine saithe qui dicunt talium nuptias non esse nuptias sed potius adulieria mihi non videntur satis acute ac diligenter considerare quid dicant de bono viduita cap deede vvedlockes incestuous aduoutries righte finde named cyprian basil chrysostome ambrose hierome photius holy learned father perhaps ye saie bothe aduoutries whether vowed person marie committe fornication let soo sage confiderations yet sinne greeuous man committeth set determined purpose falleth humaine frailtie euill contineweth muche worse hath intermission ende b sarisburie apologie saithe campegius pighius others moe side haue tolde v prieste keepinge concubine liueth holily chastely prieste hath wife liueth matrimonie ye crie woonte sclaunders lie foule lie knowe thus onely saie saie fornication case lesse il matris monie hardinge laieinge al cauilles shiftes aside lesse il vse speache commonly called greatter good sense writteneccle eccle petri better die wante againe better iniquitie man woman dooinge wel ionas saithe deathe vnto better life peter saithe better benne haue knowen waie righteousnesse knowinge turned backe holy commaundemente geuen vnto like phrase often vsed holy scripture deathe iniquitie ignorance goddes iustice good deede comparison woorse thinges seeme importe somme lesse il fornication ye saie better mariage mariage vvoorse fornication thus seemeth good shadowe mater shifte woordes vvoorse better better vvoorse yet al plaine mennes iudgementes mariage vvoorse fornication fornication better mariage lette vnderstande hulderichus episcop augustanus epistle founde anciente recorde vnder name volusianus episcopus carthaginensis wee haue dealte simply plainely herein hulderichus bishop augusta germanie writinge vnto pope nicolas againste restrainte priestes mariage aboue seuen hundred yeeres paste vseth like manner speache wee haue vsed thus saithe huius imperij ne dicam confilij tam fatuam tam que turpem addunt suggestionem vt dicant honestius est pluribus occulte implicari quam aperte hominum vultu conscientia cum vna ligari quod profecto non dicerent si ex illo illo essent qui dicit vae vobis pharisaeis qui omnia facitis propter homines vnto commaundemente wil saie vnto counsel sette foolishe shameful suggestion saie fornication better mariage anan honester thinge honester thinge prieste entangled vvith many concubine secrete priuily openly light knovvledge vvorlde ioined mariage vvith one vvife whiche thinge verit woulde vtter either saithe woe vnto ye phariseis doo al thinges please menne like sorte councel vvormes wrote sommetime againste pope hildebrande diuised greate rigoure tyrannie sunder priestes theire wiuesconcil vvormaetien ex auentino scorta pudicis coniugibus stupra incestus adulteria casto connubio praefert pleaceth strumpettes honeste wiues fornication inceste aduoutesie chaste mariage hosius petricouen confess cap notwithstandinge doctoure hosius saithe turpis philippo videtur haec oratio catholicis autem honestissima woordes vnto philip melancthon seeme shameful vnto catholiques seeme moste honeste neede wee many woordes cleare case whole practise churche hardinge professeth prieste marie wife ye suspende ye excommunicate ye depriue ye disquiet trouble whole churche keepe concubine one twoo moe yee contented ready onely dissemble also fauoure excuse ye saie alleged clericus concubinarius officijs vitandus non est extra de cohabita clerico mutier ca final abb nisi sit notorius prieste keepeth concubine onlesse notorious maie eschewed seruice againe ye shal finde lesson specially noted rubrike dist qui saide qui non habet vxorem loco illius concubinam debet habere hath wife steede ought haue concubine ye wil saie errour print whiche thing maie easily graunted specially whole booke beinge otherwise ful errours would god errours life doctrine greatter howe foloweth immediatly decree qui non habet vxorem pro vxore concubinam habet communione non repellatur vvho hath vvife steede vvife hath concubine let remoued communion woordes trowe ye wil saie erroure vpon legantine constitution otho bonus ye maie finde woordes noted gloseconsti othonis de concubinis clericor remouen licet ad profugandum augusti de moribus manichaeorum li ca nunquid compelli potest clericus concubinam abiurare videtur quod non resolutio si clericus duxit vxorem de facto eo casu iuramentum exigitur whether maie prieste forced fore sweare concubine seemeth maie resolution hereof prieste haue deede maried wife case forced foresake othe therefore wee maie saie augustine saide sommetime manichee non concubitum sed vt longe ante ab apostolo dictum est vere nuptias prohibetis ye forebidde copulation longe agoe forespoken apostle deede ye forebidde mariage nowe mutche ye saie ye angel infirmity ought considered shal amisse shortely see owne frendes haue thought infirmity passe ouer authority owne doctour bishop bitonto beinge presente late chapter tridente whole single life whiche ye cal chastitie pronounceth thus quibus turpitudinum monstris concil triden session qua sordium colluuie qua peste non sunt corrupti non foedati ecclesia sanctum dei populus sacerdos sanctuario dei incipite patres si vllus iam pudor si vlla pudicitia c dicut corde impio ore impuro est deus monster filthinesse wt villanie pestilence corrupted defiled churche god bothe people prieste lordes beginne euen sanctuarie god shame honeste life saie wicked haste filthy mouthe god saithe hermannus riddus de vita hone cleri paralip vrspergen clemen propter multitudinem luxuriae alia vitia quasi non peccata reputantur multitude lecherie priestes faultes taken sinne saithe defecit iam omnis disciplina religio cardinalibus et tres radix vitiorum superbia auaritia luxuria validissime dominantur cardinalles nowe al discipline religion decaied three rootes sinnes pride couetousnesse lecherie doo mooste mightily preuaile bernarde saith finguntbernar cantic serm se amore castitatis ista dicere cum ea magi causa turpitudinis fouendae multiplicandae adinuenerint beate v hande speake thinges loue chastitie whereas deede haue diuised ende nourrishe encrease theire fil thinesse hardinge infirmitie whiche iudgemente courtesie charitie wee ought beare withal place cyprian parte chapter diuision dist quida basile chrysostome ambrose hierome others maie seeme mutche make case condemne kinde marriage weighed answeared place conuen ente verily augustine saithe rauiter peccant qui tale diuidunt sinne greeuously diuide ried hardinge vvhere ye saie many thousandes common harlottes rome wee thinke many deede vvhether many thousandes wee doubte vvhat number soeuer many courteghianes churche rome doothenot nourrishe tolerate proper excuse soare pounishemente open vvhooredome tolerate nourrishe trustinge lookinge sermon exhortation conuenient meanes may called backe repentance waie saluation pope gathereth thirty thousande ducates yeerely courteghianes waye annuall pension whiche defender affirmevntruthe moste true shal appeare vtterly false cornelius agrippa fauoured see rome imbrued heresy sprange vp time firste authour slaunder paye common tax leuied pope onely hathe ciuil dominion ouer cittie theyvntruthe manifeste onlesse paie shal occupie paie maie suffered continewe sinneful trade life whole cittie paieth polles haue abode habitation firste common al great citties hote country bannishe amonge filthy generation harlottes waie sufferinge thinge commendable selfe auoidinge greatter mischiefe asthe pope maie dispense vvel god god suffered harde necked iewes hate enemy pinche vsuries likewise moises permitted libell diuorce thinges honeste thintent meanes yet might rather loue theire brethrene lende money freely absteine murderinge wiues euen men nowe adaies litle applie theire endeuour restraine pronesse whiche fleashe riot carnall concupiscence waie least concerninge outwarde ciuil punishementthis ioily catholique diui ie wincked whereby fleashely men might obteine parte theire vnruly desire likely greate decaie vertue generall furious rage vice would leaue neither wedlocke vndefiled virginitie vnassaul ed worse enterprise whiche nature abhorreth vnattempted vvoulde god experience taught many country true obseruation augustine hereof saithes augustine rote bookes de ordine vvas baptized quid sordidius c vvhat saide vncleane voide comelinesse ful turpitude harlottes baudes suche like pestilence take harlottes amonge menstevves rome ye shal disturbe al thinges lecherous lustes put steede matrones ye shal dishonest thinges spotte sha bishop rome blamed rome frenche kinge kinge spaine prince sufferinge dominion remaineth wee seeke whether haue also lowest vilest place citie lest perhaps although aa vile vntruthe thei necessarie necessarie euil yet beinge promoted aboue degree make euil shewe body rest place maie considered two way respect temporal ecclesiastical order lawe temporal order thus stande haue free libertie dwellinge haunted streetes palaices list butvntruthe cardinalles selues say habitant insignes aedes onely suche corner bylanes smal outhouse fitte shoppes vile marchandize suche occupier againe without great forfeit ride invntruthe cardinalles saie mula vehuntur coches chariot matrones doo constrained either keepe homely home walke foote streetes also order must bevntruthe cardinalles saie incedunt vt matronae suche apparel iewe theire red cappes theire shorte vailes note dishonestie knowen al subiect shrewdnes boy streetes vse commonly mocke reuile mislike malice whiche appeareth maker apologie forthis one cardinalle vertues rome take tolle baudrie vertue prince set greate burden paimentes vpon filthy profession ende maie feare woman make soner weary c good soothe maisters ye yonge controll cittie rome doinges besides al sinneful state continewe ende without repentance vntruthe sea ansvveare lauful make testamente last bestowinge goodes condemned infamous person must leaue al confiscated disposed prince pleasure thother side turne repent house called monastery conuertites speciall prouision discipline taught howe waile vnchaste life sinnefully past ouer b sarisburie touchinge number courteghianes rome whether twentie thousande lesse wee wil striue leased see farme pope rente alwaies certaine fornication fineable rome goode aleable kinde sinne saie lie false sclounderous reste ye saie paie yeerely pension theire sufferance trade life onely common tax whiche likewise raised vpon citizen whether hardinge sufficiente saie otherwise raiseth sutche fine vpon baudrie might wel bee thought baude howe owne doctours herein wil soone condemne thus written owne glose videturconstitu othonis de concubinis clericor remouendis quod crimen meretricij ecclesia sub dissimulatione transire debeat nam mareschallus papae de facto exigit tributu meretricibus seemeth churche ought dissemble fault whooredome pope marshal deede receiueth tribute pension vvhoores whereas ye saie cornelius agrippa first authour sclaunder vntrue owne glose laste alleged auoucheth authoritie iohannes andreas iohan andreas mortuus est notable canoniste liued welneare twoo hundred yeeres agrippa borne nicolaus de clauengijs liued time emperour sigismunde booke intituled de corrupto ecclesiae statu nicolaus de clauengijs paralipomen vrspergen ann hathe one special chapter de exactionibus pro concubinis tolerandis exaction sufferinge concubine al ye wipe awaie easily one woorde ye saie courteghianes rome paie imposition portion theire vnthrifty gaistes onely pounishemente theire wicked life laweful commit sinne freely without paiemente thus mater wel defended noted vpon decree quod dicitur sacerdos non potest percipere mercedem prostibuli14 quae quod vero glossa et dis oblationes glossa potest dici quod non debet recipi oblatio meretricis licet eleemosyna possit inde fieri whereas saide prieste maie receiue revvarde oblation stevves wee maie saie oblation harlo maie receiued notwithstandinge wee maie make almouse saie harlottes monie maie taken waie almouse waie oblation thus wee taught behooueth v beleeue pope maie liue oblation courteghianes theire almouse nowe mutche hardinge woulde faine haue mater passe name pounishemente il weemenne beseeche thee good reader consider howe greeuousely extremitie rigoure lawe haue diuisedconstitu prouin edmundi cantuar archiepiscopi haue pounished prouincial councel holden oxforde written thus concubinae sacerdotum moneantur ab archidiacono c let priestes concubine vvarned archedeacon c vvil amende let forebidden kisse pax take holy breade churche sutche extremitie crueltie keepe people dooinge il neither profession hardinge grauitie become proctoure stevves although might wel becomme leontium heathen courteghiane lewde condition wai bestow witte eloquence againste theophrastus defence filthy state yet may likewise becomme christian man professoure diuinitie ye cal courteghianes necessarie euil authoritie scripture cannot tel whole trade life il take graunte thei necessarie christian common wealth recken harde proue yee allege heate countrie weere sufficiente warrante stewes yet trowe towne louaine countrie brabante ye nowe inhabite hote heates ievvrie thought farre passe al heates italie yet god saithe vnto ievves deutero non erit vlla meretrix de filiabus israel nec scortator de filijs israel shalbe whoore daughter israel whoorekeeper sonnes israel euen nowe euer gospel christe openly freely receiued notwithstandinge heate countrie stewes bordelles flee awaie night clowdes sonne priestes forbidden laweful marriage needeful necessarie il shoulde comme place howe itroman paule saithe let v doo il good maie folowe iuste damnation saie augustine standeth ful side augustine hath written behoufe stewes augustine saithe take harlottes awaie emonge menne augustin de ordine li ye fil al countrie ribaudrie villanie deede name augustine great reuerende augustine wrote woordes augustine wrote booke de ordine beinge yet yonge man nouice faithe yet wel instructed yet baytized name christe selfe yet keepinge concubine liuinge whooredome shal sutche one yonge youthful goe saincte shal bare name vnseasoned fantasy stande steede proue stewes verily augustine beinge afterwarde fully instructed christened saith thus augustin de ciuitate li cap istam vsu scortatorum terrena ciuitas licitam fecit turpitudinem worldly citie church god hath made filthinesse harlottes laweful ludouicus viues writing vpon saithe satis aperte augustinus estatur ludo viues librum de ciuitate lib cap lure ciuili veteri romano multa esse permissa quae sint contra ia legibus diuinis hoc isti volunt qui dum gentilitatem coniungere coaptare christianismo laborant corrupto vtro que alterius impatiente nec gentilitatem nec christianismum retinent augustine plainely witnesseth olde ciuile romaine heathen lawe many thinges suffered whiche contrarie lawes god thinge wil menne allowe whoe studie hardinge doo ioine heathennesse christianitie bothe togeather bothe beinge corrupted one standinge keepe nowe neither heathennesse christianitie therefore wee maie mutche better exchange woordes augustine spoken youthe wel learned speake e mutche better saie thus permitte lupanaria implebis omnia libidinibus suffer allowe stewes ye shal fil al countrie ribaudrie villanie sense bernarde saithe bernard cantic sermo tolle de ecclesia honorabile coniugium thorum immaculatum nonne reples eam concubina ijs incestuosis seminifluis mollibus masculoru concubitoribus omni denique genere immundorum take churche honourable bedde vndefiled doeste thou fil churche ful brothelles keepinge concubine c al te filthy personnes ye saie wherefore bishop rome blamed mainteinance stewes frenche kinge kinge spaine simple reason doctour diuinitie olde saieinge nil iuuat exemplum quod litem lite resoluit christe bade apostle leadde example worldly prince il mutche woorse woulde called vicare christe heade churche holy one israel parte theire paunishemente tel v maie ride sumptuousely coches charettes dwel open faire streetes sight cittie forced goe foote hide selues corner house bylanes description sutche simple poore beggerly sorte vileste ougleste al people good clowte couer theire body certainely hardinge courteghianes vnderstoode hereof woulde thinke selues litle beholden sutche proctoure doctoure peter martyr cannot speake without great reuerence hauinge good cause knowe state rome fewe menne better hereof wrteth thus petrus martyr li iudicu cap none deus bone quomodo romae coercentur meretrices habent ornatissimas domos vehuntur per publicum habitu principum sedent equis gradarijs habent secum torquatos laruatos comites interdum etiam cardinales praesertim noctu ancillarum sumptuosissimum gregem nowe day good god howe courteghianes pounished rome dvvel fairest house caried vvith honoure cittie vvere lady mounted amblinge palfraies attended chaines golde personnes disguised sometimes cardinalles specially night season haue sumptuous sorte maides waite vpon ye shal happen doubte martyr reporte behalfe concilium delectorum cardinalium concil tom pag yet truste ye wil geue somme credite owne frendes cardinalles churche rome theire woordes hereof hac etiam vrbe meretrices vt matronae incedunt per vrbem seu mula vehuntur quas affectantur de medium die nobiles familiares cardinalium cleric que nulla vrbe vidimus hanc corruptionem praeterquam hac omnium exemplari habitant etiam insignes aedes cittie rome courteghianes passe streetes ride mule like honeste matrones lady middest daie noble menne cardinalles deere frendes priestes attend vpon wee neuer saw sutche corruption onely cittie whiche example paterne al others moreouer dwel faire notable house anno information presented vnto pope paule thirde certaine graueste cardinalles appointed thereto special commission nowe good christian reader beseeche thee consider conformitie tale hardinge saithe courteghianes rome goe onely foote cardinalles saie ride mule hardinge saithe haue special apparel dishonestie knowen cardinalles saie goe ride honeste matrones great lady noble wemenne hardinge saithe despised reuiled people cardinalles saie haue priestes noble menne cardinalles frendes attende vpon hardinge saithe dwel onely house backe lane cardinalles saie habitant insignes aedes dwel faire notable house many vntruthes harde mater hardinge vtter shorte tale nowe beinge fine dame richely attired great sclaunder saie serue onely v rlettes common rascalles reporte true vpon twelueth daie night yere lorde seene seuenteene coches courteghianes arriuing togeather euen pope owne palaiceanno man shal thinke reporte incredible yet luitprandus luitprandus li cap like hereof saith thus lateranense palatium
