sanctorum quondam hospitium nunc est prostibulum meretricum pope palaice laterane sommetime harbour holy sainctes nowe becomme stewe whoores parte theire pounishemente ye saie condemned infamous personnes theire ende make testamente take order haue true good token pope couetous haue goodes desirous saue soules best learned notable canonistes ye haue affirme contrari prouse whereof reade cynus pistoriensis l cum te c de condictione ob turpem causam cynus pistorien baldus bartholus de immunita ecclesiar ca abb reade baldus l c eodem capite reade bartholus l idem ff eodem ca abbas panormitane longe disputation touchinge mater thus saithe iudgemente ende conclude ergo ex omnibus premissis quod meretrix turpiter non recipit dona vel promissionem quod potest de illis ad libitum disponere al premiss conclude thus harlot maie receiue rewardes promisses without infamie shame lawe shee maie dispose pleasure therefore hardinge tale woulde haue benne better studied pounishemente ye haue imagined iudgemente learned pounishemente good soothe sir ye saie ye yonge controlle cittie rome dooinges yet rebuking open vice noman ought thought yonge age hardinge hable thus defende cittie rome open whooredome primasius ad roman cap ephes primasius saithe nemo periculosius peccat quam qui peccata defendit noman sinneth danger standeth defence sinne paule saithe let noman deceiue vaine woordes bicause hereof anger god commeth vpon child infidelitie therefore partaker whereas saie policie thought necessarie eschewinge greatter il extra de celebra miss de homine lawe telleth abijcienda sunt falsa remedia quae veris manifestis periculis sunt grauiora vvee muste abandon vaine remedy greeuous true manifeste danger augustine saithe non vult deus tale lucrum compensari talus damno god wil haue sutche gaine recompensed sutche losse paule saith wee haue alleged roman tertullian de anima anthen de l nonibus saie let v doo il good maie folowe addeth withal therefore iuste theire damnation tertullian saith lupanaria execrabilia sunt coram deo stevves accursed god therefore conclude emperour iustinian streitely commaundeth harlottes bannished al townes good christian reader one thinge beseeche vprightly indifferently consider thinge wil menne defende thus boldely defende confessed filthinesse wil refourme churche god longe time cannot yet refourme theire open stewes harlottes ye saie sommetimes repente amende theire liues god mercie graunte hardinge maie doo likehierem matthae leste woordes prophete falle vpon frons meretricis facta est tibi god graunte harlottes sinner goe kingedome god hardinge ye tel vvoman named ioane bearinge worlde hande pope rome fonde avaine fable vvere ye wise ye malicious ye woulde neuer haue brought credite hazard reportinge sutche vanitie accoumpte one accustomed lie men maie iudge litle stoare true thinges ye haue obiecte againste v vvho listeth see learned discourse written hereof maie please reade annotation onuphrius yet liuing hired pourpose face mater onuphrius pauinius vpo platina de vitis pontificum vita iohan printed venis shal easely beleue whole matter fabulous anastasius theire vvhose manner writinge consider wee shal finde vaine nothinge like true beginneth thus iohannes anglicus natione maguntinus sedit annos duo mensem vnum dy quatuor c iohn englishe man nation maguntia saie romaine see twoo yeeres one moneth foure dayes alias fiue monethes three day vvhat foolishe speache english man maguntine maguntia foloweth fable saide martine telleth saide vvomandame iohane pope younge age girle brought athene one louer man apparel profited mutche diuerse science none founde compared athene brought saithe fable learning wel vvhereas timevntruthes tvvoo togeather neither athene stoode neither place lerning lenger al countrie attica became barbarous vtterly voide learninge vnderstande writer time authour reporteth thence came rome professed learninge openly greate doctours scholers opinion learninge good life one consente al made pope vvhiche soone confuted false vntruthes reade ansvveare learninge dayes openly professed rome story declare foloweth fable beinge popedome begotten childe seruaunt knowinge time delyueraunce wente peter laterane streined paine betweene colosseo clementes churche brought foorthe died saie buried marked howe thethis diuiser dvvelt rome liued aboue fiue hundred yeeres agoe deuiser fable bewrayeth himselfe thinketh matter harde beleued therefore beginninge saithe vvoman vt asseritur folkes saie nowe saith buried vt dicitur said dothe affirme true referreth al heresaie whiche testimonie lie commonly soothed false euer sutche pope true ye note margent booke touchinge image whiche ye saie sene yet rome resemblinge woman pope lieinge trauaile image whiche ye meane haue sene selfe rome grauen stone manner tombe stone pitched vpright farre colosseo resembleth sutche thinge ye speake neither truthe whiche haue ignorantly written pope refraininge go waie goeth thereby solemne procession whiche haue reade yourvntruthe liued yeeres v vvere beste vvriters time schoolefelowes peuishe bookes stoole easemente laterane made faire porphyry stone whiche haue reported kepte vnsemely vse creation pope proufe theire humanitie thus truste haue brought great matter pope ioane nought b sarisburie iudgemente fowle shameful accustomed lie ye proue authoritie one onuphrius one pope late page specially hired procured healpe mater truthe certainetie hereof wee shal consider ende nowe let v examine newe coniectural doctour gheassesnot registred firste saithe dame iohane registred calendare emonge pope ergo vaine fable euer dame iohane pope rome coniecture hardinge simple doubte ye maie wel remember bishoppes name wel rome otherwheres haue vpon sundrie occasion benne oftentimes quite striken calendare chrysostomes name vpon displeasure quite striken table bishoppes constantinople vita chryso chrys epist ad cyriacum neuer benne bishoppe chrysostome selfe writinge vnto cyriacus owne defence saithe thus siquidem hoc feci expungatur nomen meum ex albo episcoporum non scribatur libro orthodoxae fidei haue thus donne let name rased bishoppes calendare let registred booke catholike faithe afterwarde name beinge defaced rased restoared againe theodotus vehemente requestenicepho li cap gelesius ad episcopos dardaniae instaunce people acacius bishop constantinople rased name pope foelix rome innocentius bishop rome rased name arsacius bishop constantinople augustine meaneth writinge people hippo nicephor li cap quid obest homini quod ex illa tabula non vult eum recitari humana ignorantia si de libro viuorum non eum delet iniqua conscientia hurte vnto man augu epist ignorante people wil suffer name readde table wicked conscience blotte booke life writeth iohannes de parisijs pope cyriacusiohan de parisijs de potesta regia papali cyriacus papa renuntiauit officio vt cum vrsula virginibus palmam martyrij susciperet sed iste cyriacus catalogo paparum non annumeratur quia credebant ipsum non propter deuotionem sed propter oblectamentum virginum dimisisse episcopatum pope cyriacus gaue ouer bishoprike vrsula maides might receiue crowne martyrdome cyriacus reckened calendare pope beleeued geuen ouer bishoprike deuotion somme fantasie towardes maides comme neare pourpose force gheasses therefore pope iohanes name leafte calendare bishoppes rome neuer sutche pope onely shame leste shoulde appeare recorde afterwarde reported euer vvooman sutch vvooman benne bishop rome bishop rome benne vvith childe saithe marianus scotusmarian scotus huius iohannae nomen authores pontificij non ponunt propter turpitudinem rei muliebrem sexum chronicler write pope leaue name pope iohane shame mater also wooman kinde martinus polonus saithe martinus iohanna non ponitur catalogo sanctorum pontificum tam propter muliebrem sexum quam propter deformitatem facti pope iohane reckened calendare holy pope wel shee wooman sabellicus ennead lib pag also shame mater saithe sabellicus nullus defunctae honor habitus fama tenet ob tam foedae rei memoriam honoure bestowed burial iohan de parisijs de potesta regia papali reporte remembrance filthy acte saithe iohannes de parisijs saithe fasciculus temporum therefore firste reason blinde coniecture beareth force gheasses thisknovvinge vvooma man menne benne bewitched distracted theire wittes fasciculus temporum could haue knowen vvoman man reason hardinge beareth greate weight substance former owne amphilochius hardinges amphilochius wrote life thomas becket coulde haue tolde euphrosyna holy maide dwelte six thirtie yeeres monkes apparel emonge monkes neuer otherwise taken monke likewise vincentius vincentius li cap petrus de natalibus others writer recorder fable coulde haue tolde tecla sommetime addressed selfe mannes apparelpetr de natalib lib ca rauisius textor officina mulieres virilem habitu mentitae simeon metaph eugenia benne forebidden paule would haue folowed companie man rauisius textor writeth like one marina dissemblinge liued many yeeres abbie monke like writeth lasthenia axiothea others beinge weemen came schoole mannes apparel heare plato like writeth owne fabulare simeon metaphrastes eugenia ye lacke authority truste credite one owne companion louaine auoucheth melania papula yet thinkecopus dialo pag bewitched saie thorowly berefte wittes quarrel ye pike name surname nothinge el childishe cauil called iohane englishe name countrieanglicus englishe wooman borne englande ful fondely imagine onely surname father many knowen daie name scot irishe frenche vvelshe vvestfalinge norman gascoingne brabante holande yet borne al country onely englande matthias parisiensis supposed notwithstandinge name borne bohemia therefore whereas ye woulde haue woordes vainely without sense readde pointed thus iohannes anglicus natione mogutinus c iohn englishe man nation moguntia c ye plaie toie trifle vnseemely mocke reader woordes cleare plaine lie thus iohannes anglicus natione moguntinus c iohn english surnamed borne men ye saiegoddes sufferance god would neuer haue foresaken peter chaire suffer polluted wooman whiche capacitie holy order gheasse hardinge presumeth ouer far goddes prouidence therefore antoninus archebishop florence opened w ole storie pope iohane beinge astonned strangenesse admiration materantonin par ti ca s could refraine selfe crieinge altitudo sapientiae scientiae dei quam incredibilia sunt iudicia eius deapthe vvisedome knovvledge god hovve vncredible iudgementes like manner prophete esaie crieth outeesai quomodo facta est meretrix ciuitas fidelis hovve faithful cittie becomme ha ot might pope iohane beinge wooman haue good right interest vnto see rome epistola othonis imper ad iohan pp platyn iohan afterwarde pope iohn pope wicked companie twoo owne sister others theire horrible vice wickednesse platyna calleth monstra portenta monster againste kinde ilshapen creature luitprandus saithe reported lateranense palatium nunc est prostibulum meretricum pope palaice laterane rome luitprand li cap novve becomme stevve vvhoores al notwithstandinge saithe antoninus nulli ex hoc salutis praeiudicium fuitantonin par ti ca s quia nec ecclesia tunc fuit sine capite quod est christus vnde percipit influxum gratiae noman binderance saluation meane hereof although pope wooman yet churche without heade heade christe shee receiueth influence grace yea although antichriste geate selfe see rome yet shal churche god neuerthelesse continewe stil although horrible confusion vnder greate persecution ye saie athene brought saithe fable learninge wel vvhereas th time neither athene stoode place learninge lenger al countrie attica became barbarous wee vnderstande writer time cittie athene ouerthrowenathenes ye saie learning vtterly decaied therefore al fable good reason wee beleeue youre onuphrius hath tolde credites sake hardinge leste al menne espie vanitie tel v noble populous mighty cittie athene thus laide waste kinge captaine foraine nation time longe agoe hauing one poore authour allege could ye pretende name many without blusshinge cittie athene continewed welneare twelue hundred yeeres knowledge philosophie renowme learning called eie vniuersitie al graecia lumen nonlatin alphabet ruffinus apologia pro origine apud hierony georgius patriar vita iohannis origen writeth selfe sommetime student athene chrysostome beinge eighteene yeeres olde learninges sake sente athene basile brother gregorie afterwarde bishop nyssa studentes athene togeather thirteene yeeres owne amphilochius whoes authoritie ye maie wise denie saithe thus basile apprehendit matrem literarum athena came athene vvhiche mother learninge boethius rome planted selfe athene learninges sake yeere lorde yeere lorde bishop athene presente councel holden constantinople ruffin ca hardinges amphilo ius theod vi r epist ad called synodus sexta yeere lord seconde councel nice greate number bishoppes graecia presente theire personnes al togeather within fewe yeeres whiche time folowed pope iohane yeere lorde hitherto whole countrie churche graecia continewed safetie emperours christendome made theire cotinual aboade partes haue youit appeareth subscriptios nicene conc anno hardinge suddainely throwen downe al togeather bothe churche countrie towne castle onely keepe pope iohane studie ye saie whole countrie attica becomme barbarous tale owne hangeth onely vpon owne credite yet platyna sabellicus others moe wrote storie knewe wrote barbarous barbarous harding wil beleeue simple woorde without warrante time ye saie cittie athene vvas standinge paulus aemylius saith paulus aemylius lib longe time reigne philip frenche kingeann domi gottofredus one house tricasses appointed made dux athenarum princeps achaiae duke athene prince achaia benne athene standinge time telle v could gottofredus haue benne made duke athene ye saye ye maie doo mutche coniectures notwithstandinge cittie athene rased made waste yet dignitie name honoure remained stil yet wil aemylius againe reproue erroure writinge afterwarde certaine pirate inuaded countrie graecia saithe thus paulus aemylius lib terram atticam delati athenarum ducem brennae nobilitatis virum occiderunt vrbem que ceperunt inuadinge countrie attica tookean domini slevve duke athene one house brennus tooke cittie thinges happened easy recken welneare foure hundred fiftie yeeres time pope iohane nowe therefore besech hardinge consider indifferently selfe benne cittie athene standinge howe coulde pirate inuade take cittie athene shal wee saie leuied armie disquieted countrie troubled selues came far catche shadowe thus hitherto appeareth dame iohane woulde haue gonne athene roome sufficiente receiue shee came rome professed learninge openly thisno vniuersitie rome saie soone confuted false learninge day professed rome story doo declare soone confuted hardinge specially recketh litle saie leaue hypocrisie dissemble nomore manlydame iohane pope tel v good soothe writer story declare thinges credite faileth ouer mutche woorde sufficiente warrante ye saie learninge day professed rome wil ye nowe saie rome ye earste saide athene wil ye saie cittie rome standinge wil ye saie learninge vtterly decaied whole countrie becomme barbarous studie place learninge rome studie al christendome vniuersities parise orleance tolouse salerne padua bononia praga salamanca vvere erected longe aftervvarde therefore ye seeme saie al whole worlde barbarous ye maie better see ouersight hierome writtinge victorinus donatushierony appendice annalium eusebij saithe thus victorinus rhetorician donatus grammarian schoolemaisters accoumpted notable rome againe saithe victorinus natione apher romae sub constantio principe rhetoricam docuithierony catalogo scriptor illustrium victorinus borne aphrica taught rhetorique rome time emperoure constantius erasmus writtinge life hierome saithe thus romam missus est velut ad primariam eo saeculo tum religioniserasmus vita hieronym tum eruditionis magistram liberalibus studijs erudiedus quod ipse declarat enarrans caput ezechielis hierome vvas sente rome principal schoolemaistresse day religion also learning selfe declareth expounding eleuenth chapter ezechiel august confess lib cap augustine saith egisti mecum deus vt mihi persuaderetur romam pergere potius ibi docere quod docebam carthagine god thou mouedst minde goe rome rather professe openly learninge professed carthage saithe audiebam quietiusst udere ibi adolescentes ordinatiore disciplinae correctione sedari heard saie yonge menne vvente quietly theire bookes vvere keapte orderly obedience theire study tripartite vvoorke ioined vnto councel laterane ye maie finde storie hereof recorded thus opere tripar li ca primo athenis romam translatum est studium philosophicum deinde rom parisios tempore carolus vt dicunt historiae firste studie philosophie translated athene rome afterwarde story saie time emperoure charles translated rome parise shal saie pope selfe owne decretalles saithe rome vniuersitieextra de priuilegijs li cum de diuersis sexto wordes curia romana habet studium generale eius priuilegia courte rome hath vniuersal studie priuileges againe pope clemens saithe studijs romanae curia parisijs oxonij bononiae salamancae debent esse professores linguarum hebraicaeclemen lib de magistris chaldaicae arabicae vniuersities rome parise oxforde bononie salamanca muste professours hebrewe chaldee arabike tongue shorte theodoricus niemus sommetime pope secretarie therefore hauinge good cause knowe trueth hereof ought knowe cause dissemble whole mater writeth thus et nunc est titulus cardinalis praedictae scholaetheodoric niemus citatur ab illyrico testia bus veritatis et olim ea legebantur septem artes liberales praecipue rhetorica etia ea legit quando que beatus augustinus iohannes vocatus de anglia et fuit mulier de maguntia nata quae studuit athenis sub virili habitu tantum profecit artibus vt tandem veniens romam per biennium eadem schola artes liberales legerit adeo sufficiens fuit vt etiam maiores nobiliores vrbis eius lectiones frequenter audiuerintdame iohane pope et postea papam eligitur c euen nowe cardinal beareth title saide schoole vniuersitie rome olde time seuen liberal science specially rhetorique readde also sometime readde augustine one called iohn englande iohn woman borne men germanie studied athene apparel man profited artes laste comminge rome twoo yeeres togeather professed liberal science schoole gifte teachinge sutche elder noble cittie resorted often heare reade afterwarde chosen pope c thus manie way hardinge haue wee founde vniuersitie schole rome cause contrarie dame iohane beinge wel learned saide might wel reader ye saiethe pope time trauaile keapte selfe midwife might better answeare question suddainely preueted time many god would haue sutche mater openly knowen euerlastinge detestation either persone place certainely antoninus archebishop florence beinge astonied horrour hereof saide beforeantomin par titulo cap s crieth deapthe wisedome knowledge god howe vnsearcheable iudgementes authour hereof vt asseritur saie durste auouche mater vndoubted truthe onely saithe vt asseritur saide referreth al whole hearesaie notwithstandinge hardinge many write storie certaine truthe without doubtinge credite hearesaie platyna al would seeme auouche ouer mutche honour see rome yet thus saitheplatyna iohan quod fere omnes affirmant whiche thinge manner al menne doo affirme rauisius textor saithe scitum est ex chronicis maioribus scriptum knovven chronicle officina written elder knovven saithe one affirmed manner al menne saithe space eight hundred yeeres writer trowe impudente woulde condemne fable doo vtterly denie true touchinge marble image representinge vvoman childe bearingethe marble image pope suddaine breakinge vvaie solemne procession let eche man weighe listeth ye compare image one greate ragge stoanes stonage longe compton vtterly vnwrought without shape ye seeme wilfully auouche manner greate vntruthe theodoricus niemus verily theodoricus niemus pope secretarie saithe et adhuc vetus statua marmorea illic posita figuratiue monstrat hoc factum vnde summi pontifex dum ad lateranum de basilica principis apostolorum contra vadunt illud iter rectum non faciunt imo per alias vias per indirectum transeunt illud aliquantulum prolongando euen vnto daie olde marble image erected vnder figure sheweth mater therefore yt pope passe fro peter churche laterane backewarde take iorney streight foorthe passe vndirectly streetes makinge waie longer therefore olde wiues dreame saie iudgemente sundrie wiseste beste learned rome might beste knowe matter chaire porphyrie stoane whiche otherwheres ye cal chaire easethe holovv chaire vile answeared sabellicus saithe spectatur adhuc pontificia domo marmorea sellasabellicus enneadis li circa medium inanis qua nouus pontifex continuo ab eius creatione residet vt sedentis genitalia ab vltimo diacono attrectentur let truthe falsehedde let story fable yet hardinge maie please rememberdame iohane pope fable raised firste rome thence onely place el published abroade worlde let pope owne secretary al people deceiued shadowe shame see let rome selfe mother lie let noman know certaine truthe mater onely onuphrius pope paraste hardinge yet neither woulde many chronicle haue recorded would whole world vniuersally haue beleeued thinges pope bishop benne woonderful corruption manner dissolution life open horrour filthinesse onely see aboue al others good christian reader thou maiste wel clearely vnderstande dealinge herein plaine simple wee haue imagined mate parcel thereof selues maie please thee reade platyna iohanne proufe pope iohane sabellicus enneadis li leonicus chalcondyla greeke writer li marianus scotus liued aboute yeere lorde sigibertus gemblacensis liued aboute yeere lorde mar u polonus pope penitentiarie whome hardinge mutche defaceth liued yeere lorde rauisius textor officina ca foeminae habitum virilem mentitae antoninus archebishop florence par ti volaterranus nauclerus carion constantinus phrygio christianus massaeus matthaeus palmerius florentinus supplementum chronicorum chronica chronicarum fasciculus temporum others moe somme liued foure hundred somme fiue hundred yeeres agoe haue euer benne coumpted woorthy somme authoritie notwithstandinge dame iohanes sake hardinge beginne nowe clippe credite euer certaine lutheranes notwithstandinge somme owne felowes louaine coulde haue taught haue dealte herein discretely precisely peremptorily haue denied whole storie specially beinge sente frendes rome confirmed many therefore one louaniens would seeme handesomely excuse shifte mater possibilitie nature thus saithe effecte pope hermaphrodi herkinalson hermaphroditus saie man vvoman bothe one healpe wil serue seemeth saie pope beinge firste man vvere aftervvarde changed vvoman thus wante better diuinitie forceth ouides metamorphosis serue turne yee would haue taken mannes aduise doubte sutche prety vvhat ye might soone haue put v countenancecopus dialogo pag woordes neque ego hic quicquam dico de hermaphroditis nonlatin alphabet de quibus veterum libri pleni sunt et ne nostri tempo memoria longius abeam non ignoro monumentis literarum esse traditum mulierem quandam nomine acmyliam antonio spensae ciui ebulano nuptam post duodecimu nuptijs annum virum transijsse legi etiam alteram mulierem vbi puerum peperisset marem fuisse mutatam wil saie nothinge sutche personnes called hermaphroditi bothe man vvoman al one whereof olde writer wee finde mutche mention goe remembrance owne time knowe written certaine woman named aemylia married vnto one antonius spensa citizen ebulum tenne yeeres shee benne married turned man haue likewise readde woman benne brought abedde aftervvarde became man notable story allegeth answeare mater pope iohane thus thinketh greate deale safer waie make pope herkinalson miracle turne man vvoman simply plainely confesse euer dame iohane pope rome taken waie al storie benne fable woman benne man wee vtterly benne confounded apologie cap diuision neede rehearse concubine bawdes ordinarie gaineful sinne rome harlottes sitte nowe daiesgenes time paste without cittie walles face hid couered dwel palaices faire house thei stray aboute courte market bare open face would saie maie onely lawfully doo ought also praised dooinge saie vicious abominable life nowe thoroughly knowen whole worlde bernarde writeth roundely truely bishop rome house yea bishop rome selfe thy palaice saithe taketh good menne maketh none naughty persones thriue good decaie euer whiche wrote tripartite vvoorke annexed councel larerane saithe thus excessiue daie riote asvvel prelares bishoppes also clerkes priestes horrible tolde thinges onely growen vre custome continuance time wel allowed al reste dooinges manner bee nowe waxen olde rotten ripe hath hearde hainous acte peter aloisius pope paule thirdes sonne committed againste cosmus cherius bishop fanum iohn casa archebishop beneuentum pope legate venice wrote commendation moste abominable filthinesse set foorthe moste lothesome woordes wicked eloquence mater whiche ought proceede body mouthe whose eares hath comme alphonsus diazius spaniarde beinge pourposely sente rome germanie shamefully diuelishely murthered owne brother iohn diazius moste innocente moste godly man onely bicause embraced eospel iesus christe woulde returne againe rome maie chaunce wil saie thinges maie sometime happen beste gouerned common wealthes yea magistrate willes bisides good lawes made pounishe sutche graunt good lawes would know haue great mischieues benne pounished emongest petrus aloisius donne notorious acte spake alwaies chearished father bosome pope paule thirde made dearlinge diazius murthered owne brotherpetrus aloisius pope sonne deliuered pope meanes thende might pounished good lawes iohn casa archebishop beneuentum yet aliue yea liueth rome euen eie sighte moste holy father hardinge courtisanes wente abroade matrones doo rode mule dwelled goodly house vvhiche particulare disordersvntruthes greate notorious continewed many yeeres day haue benne reformed vvherein ye folowe father haeresies schoolemaister malice deuillapocal scripture called accusator fratrum nostrorum accuser brother sir leape ye rome placentia cleregy temporall duke whome ye call pope sonne though sonne beinge pope lawful matrimonie holy order taken suche one peter aloisius ye speake euill man vvhat maketh churcheiohan casa defence newe gospell iohannes casa beinge yet younge spring came clerke longe either bishop legateo faire boonegrace bevvtifie open knovven vvickednesse made certaine amorous sonettes italian rime foloweinge italian poete petrarcha whiche kinde exercise good wittes italy youth muche geuen without naminge persone flatteringly smoothed heinous facte rather praised wherein neuerthelesse euill confesse ouersight youth notwithstandinge excellent quality kepte backe dignitie cardinalship duringe life beinge graunted considered hindereth estimation christes churche furthereth false doctrine schismes heresy touchinge deathe iohn diazius spaniarde ye tellvntruthe vvee tel lie reade ansvveare many lie b sarisburie wee leapte lightly placentia hardinge rather reaste verona saie truthe pope paulus haue pounished wicked sonne haue burnte deathe abominable outrage remoued placentia iohan sleidan li remained stil rome iohannes sleidanus saithe yonge gentleman bishop fanum vpon whome petrus aloisius pope sonne shewed horrible villanie shortely died shame heauinesse yet saithe thought somme petrus aloisius wicked acte committed gaue poison killed leaste make complainte thereof vnto emperoure addeth paulus nihil secius impense amabat filium ad ipsius amplificationem omne studium conuertit et cum de eius flagitijs nonnunquam audiret fertur non admodum aegre tulisse hoc solum consueuisse dicere haec illum vitia non se commonstratore didicisse pope paule neuerthelesse fauoured sonne aboue measure bestowed al care encrease honoure whereas hearde sometime shamful actes reporte mutche offended therewith vsed onely thus saie wel yevv neuer learned vice example cruel terrible pope repressinge sinne god iustice would suffer sutche abomination escape vnpounished certaine noble owne cittie longe arose againste slewe owne palaice hunge vile carkesse shameful sorte chaine ouer walles afterwarde threwe ouer mote people al sortes ranne gladly sight stabbe euery side theire dagger trodde filthily vnder theire feete yee saie particulare disorder courteghianes day laste haue benne refourmed yet credible reporte euen within twoo yeeres whiche yeere lorde diazius persite viewe taken founde rome number eight twentie thousande weemen sorte reformation churche rome thus refourmed moste horrible booke iohannes casa vile lothesome heathen eares coulde abide heare howe fauourably howe frendely excused ye saie yonge man springal bishop clerke named personne kinde exercise ouersighte amorous sonette good wittes italie muche geuen praised faulte onely smoothed hardinge abomination vnder heauen ye diuise way howe smoothe pounished ye saie ful soare ouersight coulde neuer made cardinal duringe life yea good hardinge al muste wee beleeue bicause speake pope made archebishop beneuentum legate latere thereby one secrete councel parte cruel pounishmente though vpon somme occasion keapte backe beinge cardinal yet others made cardinalles al respectes hadandre alciatus epist praefixa historiae pauli iouij reade andreas alciatus notable ciuilian ye shal finde minion made bishop comum paulus iouius put biside reade paulus iouius life clemens learne prety folkes made cardinalles cause owne onuphrius speaketh parable casteth colour woulde seeme meane hereofpaulus iouius onuphrius iulio durste vtter emperour tiberius sommetime placed nouellius tricongius highe honorable roome made proconsul parte recompense good seruicesueton tranquil tiberio tricongium vno spiritu able drinke three pottle wine togeather one breathe woorthiest cause promotinge sutche magistrate suche roome yet honoure honestie cause prefermente hath benne thought preferringe sundrie cardinalles touchinge murtheringe iohannes diazius owne brother alphonsus wherein ye saie wee haue tolde many lie wee referre ourselues storie thereof truely written iohannes sleidanus iohan sleidan lib effecte whereof shorte one iohannes diazius spaniarde doctour sorbona parise god geuen grace vnderstande truthe gospelan departed thence came germanie reasted nuburge dominion otho henricus countie palatine brother alphonsus diazius beinge rome vnderstandinge hereof immediately tooke horse al speede came germanie mindinge withdrawe brother pourpose findinge constante steadfaste likely way remoued ende fained selfe weight reason persuaded religion desired returne italie doo good could germanie seeinge sundrie cause firmely bente staie tooke leaue departed thence exhorted continewe constante truthe came augusta sixe dutche mile nuburge nexte daie hauinge foregotten special mater saie brother retourned backe againe thence nuburge waie bought carpenter axe entringe towne vpon marche came brother lodginge breake daie selfe watchinge beneath sente vp seruante axe doo deede seruante called foorthe iohannes diazius deliuered letter brother alphonsus sawe turned towardes lighte reade came suddainely behinde strooke heade axe leauinge stickinge wounde came awaie togeather alphonsus maister true storie hereof hardinge al woordes lie touchinge courteghianes yee saie pope late hathe made general reformation thei bothe remoued faire palaices wherein dwelte also put mule faulte benne onely mule house rather whole trede life certainely weemen continewe stil euen cittie rome vnto number eight twentie thousande saide sutche reformation churche rome apologie cap diuision haue killed infinite number brethrene onely bicause beleeued truely sincerely iesus christe great foule number harlottes fornicatours adulterer one haue time saie put deathe either excommunicate attached volupteousnesse adulterie ribaudrie whoredome murtheringe kinne ineeste others abominable partes coupted sinne rome thei sinne ought christes vicar peter successour moste holy father lightly stiely beare though sinne cittie rome principal tower al holinesse holy scribe phariseis whiche neuer knewe kinde holinesse holinesse catholique faithe peter thus teache rome paule liue rome practise brothelrie doo openly made yeerely reuenewe profite harlottes suffered common adulterours wicked murtherers goe vnpounished receiue theire familiaritie councel householde yet companie christen men menne ought therefore vnreasonably triumphe againste liuinge benne wisedome either firste haue proued good owne life worlde leaste haue cloked litle cunningly wee doo vse stil olde auncient lawes asmuche men maie doo manner vsed day al thinges beinge wholy corrupte diligently earnestly put execution ecclesiastical discipline wee haue common brothel house strumpettes yet flockes concubine heardes harlotte haunters neither doo wee preferre adulterie matrimonie neither doo wee exercise beastly sensualitie neither doo wee geather ordinarie rente stipendes stewes doo wee suffer inceste abominable naughtinesse yet sutche aloisians casians diazians escape vnpunished thinges would haue pleased v wee needed haue departed mennes felowship emongest sutche enormity chiefe pride price neither needed leauinge renne hatred menne moste wilful daungers paule fourthe many monethes sithence hadde rome prison certaine augustine freers many bishop greate nubre deuoute menne religion sake hee racked tormented make confesse hee leafte meanes vnassaied ende many brothel howe many whoremonger many adulterer many incestuous persones coulde finde al hardinge yee denie impudently ye affirmed matter diazius falsely vvherefore pounishement due slaunderers ought defender haue false slaunder commeth secretarie praiseth selfe holie companion besides witte modestie saithe muche commendation ministershippes goodnesse ye keepe vse still olde auncient lawes forsoothe discipline churche shamea braue lusty kinde eloquence conscience regarde worlde feare god wrathe auoidinge euerlastinge fyre retourne catholike churche whence ye broken like faite bulles basan put awaie moste vnlawfull yokefellowes leaue selues abominable suche spitefull railinge ye reprehende ourfornication open stewes inceste hardinges infirmity infirmitie apologie cap diuision god thanked although menne ought professe yet whosoeuer compare v menne euen owne life innocencie wil soone proue vntrue condemne maliceouse surmise exhorte people al vertue wel dooinge onely bookes preachinges also example behaueour wee also teache gospel boastinge bragginge knowledge lawe life christian man tertullian saithe ought speake honorably ought liue honorably hearer lavve dooers lavve vvhiche iustified god hardinge nay nay syrs thinge ye crake muche hastie thanke god vvhat peculiare god ye meane knowe phrase secretarie muche vseth though ye god beside god compare selues ye list owne life innocencie wel knowen reprouinge vice horrible sinnes man lightly shal seme slaunderer deede continuall aduoutrie incest laufull matrimonie filthy yoke fellowes true wedded wiues robbinge throwinge downe church almose buildinge place praier encrease god honour ignorant rashenesse godly discretion woorde lorde god woorde pretensed gospel christes true gospel biblebable railing holsome preachinge sprite sathan also beinge lyinge sprite mouthes coulde meeke humbleis modestic sprite god obedient woulde tell truthe finally euill good darkenesse light sower sweeteour god lord fruites naughty tree good would also soothe vpholde immoderate crake vvee saie plainely one woorde whiche watche woorde christen people beware doctrine heresie life iniquitie endeuour tendeth subuersion soules b sarisburie greate crake hardinge geeue god thankes vncourteous dealinge parte sir defender felovves muste comme learne speake notwithstandinge ought maie appeare yee yet wel aduised howe speake selfe nowe bicause wee saie vvee thanke god secretarie hath made selfe seueral god maie saie lorde thinke catholique wil saie otherwise yet make selues thereby seueral lorde god geue grace ye seuered lorde wherefore shoulde lawful saie lorde v saie god thinke highe pointe cunninge open thus ye woulde haue v sommetimes saie lorde sometimes lorde sommetimes neither skilful cooke knewe diete howe itpsalm prophete dauid saithepsalm deus noster refugium psalm vrtius psalm god refuge psalm strengthe psalm singe psalmes vnto god corinth god god saluationphilip god heauen corinth god god wake earely vnto thee thou arte god truste thee lotes thy handes paule saithe thanke god alwaies geeue thankes vnto god thus lawful apostle propehtes speake without rebuke neither hardinge vncourteous saie made selues peculiar god paule saithe wee iustified name iesus christe lorde sprite god augustine saithe contra istos mirabiliarios cautum fecit deus meusaugustin iohan tracta august de ci li cap chrysostom psalm dicens nouissimis diebus surgent falsi prophetae god hath willed beware mungers miracle tellinge laste day shal rise vp false prophetes againe saithe deus meus vbique praesens est vbique totus nusquam inclusus god euerywhere presente euerywhere whole nowhere inclosed shut vp chrysostome saithe christo meo testificabantur venti mare bothe windes sea bare witnesse christe hierome saithehierony aduersus error iohan hierosoly mitan cyprian de bono poenitentiae sedulius corinth ego non patrem non matrem non germanum aduersus christum meum audiam wil heare neither father mother brother christe cyprian saithe hic est deus noster id est non omnium sed credentium fidelium deus god saie god al god beleeuers faitheful sedulius saithe deus natura omnium est voluntate vero paucorum god nature god al wil god fewe shal wee neede many doctours case beinge cleare selfe hardinge selfe booke either pourpose vpon somme better aduise vnwares haue written consider wel owne woordes hard fol b galat thus ye saie iniquitie lorde god yet trowe woordes ye make selfe peculiare god paule saithe liue faithe sonne god whiche hath loued hath geeuen selfe sake whiche woordes chrysostome writinge vpon genesischrysostom genesim homi expoundeth thus qui dilexit c vt proprium vsurpas commune beneficium profecto inquit nam licet pro omni hominum genere sacrificium oblatum sit tamen propter amorem eum id quod factum est omnibus proprium mihi facio ita prophetis mo est facere dicere deus deus meus quamuis totius orbis sit deus sed peculiare hoc est amori vt ex communibus propria faciat qui dilexit quid dicis te dilexit solum omnem inquit hominum naturam dilexit sed ego illi gratias debeo quasi solum dilexisset tradidisset semetipsum pro solo paule saithe christe hath loued paule benefite common al thou vsest peculiare thee selfe yea verily saithe paule al sacrifice offered al mankinde yet loue beare towardes thinge donne al accoumpte proper seueral mee selfe alone thus manner prophetes doo saie god god notwithstandinge god al worlde special alonely office loue thinges common make thinges peculiare thou saiste christe hath loued mee saistet thou hath christe loued thee onely oman el saithe paule hath loued al mankinde ovve thankes loued mee alone geuen selfe onely hencefoorthe hardinge maie please geeue v leaue speake prophetes apostle holy father doctours haue spoken v apologie cap diuision bisides al mater wherewith charge v woont also adde one thinge thei enlarge al kinde spite wee menne trouble plucke sworde scepter kinges handes arme people ouerthrowe iudgement place destroie lawes make hauoke possession seeke make people prince turne al thinges vpside downe shorte woulde haue nothinge good frame common wealthe good lorde often haue set fiere prince harte woordes ende thei mighte quenche lighte gospel firste appearinge menne might beginne hate ere euer able knowe ende euery magistrate mighte thinke sawe deadly enimie often sawe v surely shoulde excedingly greeue v malitiously accused moste hainous treasone onlesse knewe christe selfe apostle number good christian menne time paste blamed reuiled like sorte although christe taught shoulde geeue vnto cesar whiche cesars yet charged sedition accused diuise conspiracie seeke way geate kingedome thereupon cried open mouthe againste place iudgemente yf thou let man escape thou arte cesars frende though apostle likewise euermore stedfastly teache magistrate ought obeied euery soule ought subiect higher power onely feare wrathe punishemente euen conscience sake yet bare name disquiet people stirre vp multitude rebelle sorte haman specially bringe natio iewes hatred kinge assuerus bicause saide vvere rebellious stubborne people boures germanie despised ordinaunces commaundementes prince reg wicked kinge achab saide elie prophete god thou troublest israel amasias prieste bethel amos laide conspiracie prophete amos charge kinge ieroboam saieinge see amos hath made conspiracie againste thee middest house israel bee briefetertul apologetico tertullian saithe general accusation al christian while liued thei traitours thei rebelles enimies mankinde wherefore adaies truthe likewise euil spoken beinge truthe like despitefully vsed time paste though greuous vnkinde dealinge yet seeme vnto v newe vnwoonted matter hardinge howe farre ye haue attempted meane sectes brotherhed sundry country wreaste swoorde prince handes transpose scepter pleasure alter state signory though wee holde peacevntruthe notorious manifeste al vvorlde worlde iudgeth bloudde many thousandes slaine speaketh englande repenteth scotlande mourneth germanie roareth fraunce bewaileth sauoie weepeth christendome lamenteththese boures greatest parte vvere enimies vnto luther vvere hundred thousande boures germanie consumed swoorde nobilitie obedience duke saxonie lantgraue hesse ouerthrowen fielde taken captiue standinge defence soueraigne vvere greate multitude people destroied munster loyaltie sacramentarie suitzers berna robbed quiet olde duke sauoye townes country farther side lake geneua vnto alpes mainetenance righte set reste litle vvhat meante ye ye laide heades togeather beinge geneua queene mary day faithfullal greate multitude englande scotland stoode onely tvvoo personnes vvee knovve moe brother englande scotlande deuised seditious traiterous booke againste monstrous regiment vvomen b sarisburie hardinge wante mater ye thought good policie furnishe tale stoare woordes vvorlde iudgeth bloude speaketh englande repenteth scotlande mourneth germanie roareth fraunce bewaileth sauoie weepeth christendome lamenteth ye wel studied copia verborum ye coulde neuer haue benne halte copious haue benne hable many way vtter nothinge yee might happily haue saide cardinalles crie pope roareth frendes stande aluffe teare heare saie written apocalypsapocalyp vae vae babylon ciuitas illa magna ala ala babylon greate cittie god thanked kingedomes princehoodes worlde stande nowe safe quiet florishinge state euer therefore tragical rhetorique might better haue serued somme boures germanie whome ye speake greattest parte aduersaries vnto doctour luther vnderstoode parte gospel conspired togeather saide onely crueltie tyrannie lordes donne twoo twentie yeeres countrie conspiracieliga sotularia called liga sotularia fifteen yeeres doctour luther beganne preache parteners whiche conspiracie watche woorde name lady honoure herregiment vveemen bounde saie fiue aue mary euery daied luther began preache certainely touchinge later rebelles knowen luther sharpely vehemently wrote againste selues beinge demaunded thereofiohan sleidan lib vtterly denied bothe partetakinge also knowledge gospel prince germanie raised theire power ye saie againste emperoure charles fiftheparalipomen vrspergen anno beinge wrongefully contrarie lawe armes inuaded forced beinge free prince lawe nature drawe swoorde owne defence rebelles mounster gospellersnicola gerbellius phortzensis yee seeme meane frantique anabaptistes heretiques yee therefore enimies vnto gospel lordes berna neuer subiectes duke sauoie tooke certaine castle confines rightly lawe armes beinge forced thereto daiely inuasions robbery hable otherwise liue reaste deede saide poore duke thorowly spoiled whole dominion one halfe brother lavve emperour charles halfe neuevve francise frenche kinge counsel pope clemens great enterviewe marsiles thereof diuised prety pasquil declaringe miserable case poore duke diuiserunt sibi vestimenta mea super vestem meam miserunt sortem haue diuided apparel emongest selues haue caste lotes coate heades englande scotlande ye saie laide togeather geneua touchinge gouernemente weemen beinge wel accoumpted nothinge many ye woulde seeme imagine benne one lesse ought haue hearde benne one al sutche hoate amplification liketh make smal number wee wil defende noman erroure let euery man beare owne guilte caluine martyr musculus bullinger others cal faithful brother englande misliked enterprise wrote againste wee knowe god hath determined mater longe sithence thus saith numer si homo moriatur ab que filio ad filiam eius transibit haereditas man die without sonne enheritance shal passe vnto daughter augustine saithe august de ciuita li ca lata est romae lex illa voconia ne quis haeredem foeminam faceret nec vnicam filiam qua lege quid iniquis dici aut cogitari possit ignoro lawe made rome called lex voconia noman conueie enheritaunce vnto vvoman vnto onely daughter vvhiche lavve knovve vvhat maie vvickedly thought spoken god thanked mercie hath nowe raised vp vnto v woman sutche wisedome learninge clemencie grauitie iudgement gouernement noble princely vertues haue benne seene many menne god encrease dayly holy sprite make olde mother israel amen sturdy blastes secrete breathinges hardinge wil saie nothinge yee maie yet remember whiche companie time noble prince blessed memorie kinge edvvarde saide open parlamente woe kingedome prince whereof childe afterwarde seeinge queenes maiestie nowe placed estate boldely openly confessed greate euersighte mutche folie former dooinges late time vnruely gouernmente ye hewen downe boughes leafte stocke standinge stil goddes secrete prouidence hardinge breathed againste confounded dooinges power onely ye lacked good wil yee lacked none hardinge answeare ye ioine selues christe apostle though yee gilty herein presumptuously saide matter answeared yet yee runne large common place vainely rather luciferlike compare selues apostle sir staie runne farther yee soone stopped case like pardie woordes apostle truthe deede holy prophetes firste blessed men churche truthe yee boaste crake muche truthe talke lesse like rhetorician proue v yee haue truthe like honest men talke ye neuer doo longe ye remaine churche ennemies churcheo vaine brauerie spende woordes vaine harte hardened eies blinded eares stopped b sarisburie profounde stuffe hardinge doctour diuinitie answeare owne vaine woordes deede ye spende woordes vaine apologie cap diuision fourtie yeeres agoe vpwarde easy thinge diuise v accursed speaches soarer middest darkenesse age firste beganne springe geeue shine somme one glimmeringe beame truthe vnknowen time vnhearde also martine luther hulderike zvvinglius beinge excellente menne euen sente god geeue lighte whole worlde firste came vnto knowlege preachinge gospel yet thinge newe successe thereof vncertaine men mindes stoode doubtful amased eares open al sclaunderous tale coulde bee imagined againste v facte detestable people woulde soone beleeue noueltie strangenesse matter symmachus celsus iulianus porphyrius olde foe gospel attempte time past accuse al christian sedition treason either prince people able knowe christian thei professed beleeued meaninge hardinge ye runne foorthe race lieinge amplification boaste bragge truthe doctrine innocencie demeanour yee fall greate inconuenience ouersighte vvas lighte extinguished israell till lewde friere came zwingliusvntruthe malicious sclaunderous zainglius vvas godly preacher rutter swarte rutter shall change olde songe micheas prophete sion shal come lawemiche woorde lorde ierusalem singe new songe ofthis blasphemie toucheth goddes prouidence vvhy vvel vvittenberg rome vvittenberg come gospel woorde lorde zurich geneua luther zwinglius firste came knowledge preachinge gospelvvittenberg churche inuisible meante christe breake promise saide wil al day til ende worlde againe howe forgate ye olde prouerbe lier behoueth mindeful remember ye howe isvntruth fond childishe contrary al owne doctrine saie ye wheres god alwaies number electe inuisible churche therefore muste ye recante cal backe againe el shal ye pul al rable sundry owne sectes vpon shoulder whose filthy railingesthis hardinges sobrietie vile vpbraidinges poore soules ye shal neuer able abide b sarisburie woorthe answeare saithe nothinge sion whence ye saie lawe god issued firste day mutche disdeigned fathersorigen contr celsum lib daie geneua wittenberg origen saith celsus heathen christianum dogma affirmat barbaris cepisse ortum hoc est iudaeis saithe christian faith tooke first beginning barbarous people cicero de prouin consul saie ievves cicero saithe iudaei syri gens natae seruituti ievves syrian nation borne bondage chrysostomechrysost contra gens speaking iulianus renegate saith thus galilaeos no pro christianis edictis suis appellauit proclamatios steede christian called v scornefully galilean notinge thereby vilenesse place whence gospel christe firste proceded nazianzene saith honora paruam bethleemnazianzen de natali christi nonlatin alphabet quae te induxit paradisum despise rather honour litle bethleem hath leadde thee paradise sounde simple barbarous despised people hearde throughout whole worlde god causeth light shine darke holy sprite breatheth thinketh good hath regarde personnes choise placespsal actor peter saide vnto cornelius euery nation euer feareth iohan woorketh righteousnesse accepted god chuseth weake thinges world confounde stronge goddes holy name blessed litle simple despised mustard seedematth hath raised vp greate tree triumpheth gospel christe sonnne euery place throughout worlde cor vvhat meant christe saie breake promisse nay meante hardinge shamefully breake christes commaundemente yet charge promisse god true al promisses shal preuaile lewdely iudged faulte god christe faulte haue made house god caue theeues christe neuer made sutche special promisse vnto pope euer please saie doo hee shoulde neuer erre doo amisse yee presume ouer mutche goddes promisses nay though antichriste pope yet christes promisses true stil true god hath alwaies churche inuisible number electe knowen onely selfe alone neither onely saieing paule also saithe same2 tim firmum stat fundamentum dei habens hoc sigillum nouit dominus qui sint sui fundation standeth sounde firme heuinge seale lorde knovveth vvhoo ovvne elia thought al godly israel benne slaine one leafte aliue god saide vnto haue soued vnto selfe seuen thousand menne reg neuer bowed theire knee baal rom god knewe elia knewe iudgemente man inuisible augu iohan tracta therefore augustine saithe secundum occultam dei praedestinationem plurimae sunt foris oues plurimi lupi intus nouit enim ac signatos habet qui nec eum nec se norunt accordinge goddes secrete predestinatio many sheepe without church many woolues within churche knoweth hath marked knowe neither selues god neither thus number goddes electe yea comminge christe time darkenesse euermore certaine yet afterwarde knowledge gospel mouthes apostle abundantly carried abroade endes al worlde bothe partes harding maie stande wel togeather nothinge contrarie doctrine number faithful lesse yet truthe god one euer apologie cap diuision sithence enimies doo see cannot denie wee euer al woordes writinges haue diligently put people minde theire deutie obeie theire prince magistrate yea though wicked dooth trial experience sufficiently teache al mennes eies euer euer doo wel see witnesse v foule parte charge v thinges seinge could finde newe late faultes therefore seeke procure v enuie onely stale outworne lie geeue lord god thankes whose onely cause hathe yet time sutche example al realmes dominion common weales haue receiued gospel wee haue ouerthrowen kingdome wee haue decaied man power right wee haue disordered common wealthe continue theire owne accustomed state aunciente dignitie kinges countrie england kinges denmarke kinges suecia duke saxonie county palatine marquess brandeburgh lantsgraues hessia common wealthes heluetians rhetians free citties argentine basile franckford vlme augusta norenberg doe al saie abide authoritie estate wherein haue benne heretofore rather mutche better meanes gospel haue theire people obediente vnto lette goe praie place presente goddes goodnesse mercie gospel taught maiestie lesse arrogancie tyrannie prince honoured people lesse vnruly hathe time either commo wealth churche benne quiet perhaps ye wil saie firste beginning doctrine common sorte euerywhere beganne rage rise throughout germanie allow yet martine luther publisher setter forewarde doctrine didde write marueilous vehemently sharpely againste reclaimed home peace obedience hardinge impudencie lieinge hathe measure ende wil saie litle hauinge saide yenough already reproufe falsehedciuile magistrate vve leaue wide worlde seeth almoste feeleth lie maruel litle place specially ye speake good order gospel breedeth ye ashamed make mention martin luther good god howe mutche could disposed alleage seditious heretical bookes himvntruthe malicious sclaunderous reade ansvveare writen power lawful magistratesin libro de saeculari potestate time let one place suffise al luther wordes inter christianos nullus neque potest ne que debet esse magistratus sed c amonge christen men none ought magistrate eche one equally subiecte apostle saieingeluther admitteth ciuil magistrate thinkinge al others better selues c againe ye humble al one vvhereto christe accordeth saithe vvhen thou arte called mariage feaste goe sitte downe lowest al amonge christen men none superiour saue one onely christe superioritie magistrate al equal haue right power rich honour al alike furthermore none coueteth ouer al wilbe vnder one another vvhere sutche men though one woulde yet make magistrare beare rule ouer others sithe nature suffereth haue superiours man wil may superiour sutche kinde men christen men true sorte christen men farre martin luther persuaded peace scarsly lefte coulde beare clubbe firste henothinge el mere vntruthe luther called preacher satan stirred vp disciple thomas munzer thuringia rebelles preacher excused seditious preachinge duke saxonie prince electour trusting munzer let alone matter wel goe forewarde b sarisburie dissemble reste vntruthes immoderate vnciuile bitternesse hardinge procedinge vnquiet vnsauery humoures harte ye saie doctor luther admitteth ciuile magistrate note specially margine marueile mutche paper blusshed behalfe reade bookes throughout consider quiet gouernement bothe common wealthes also church germanie ye shal finde noman euer neither woorde example auaunced authoritie ciuile magistrate leaue al notable sentence pourpose againste rebelles ye speake beinge fielde againste theire lordes wrote thus god commaundeth al menne vniuersally obeie magistrate feare iohan sleidanus lib reuerence c againe ye take swerde withstande magistrate vvhom god hath appointed rashly abuse name god saithe emonge christian neither maie ought magistrate hardinge nothinge coulde haue founde faulte herewith onely intemperate mere malice luther speaketh woordes outwarde ciuile gouernement onely inwarde bande obedience towardes god respecte kinge prince deede maie sense paule saithe levve gentile lorde galat seruaunte man vvooman coloss al one christe jesu paule denieth ievve gentile lorde seruaunte man vvooman remaine stil theire seueral state kindes christe iesu saithe regarde sutche difference ciuile gouernmente kinge kinge hath god commaunded knowen wee comme reuerence obedience goddes wil god onely kinge kinge neuer mighty subiecte saith ambrose emperoure valenti ian noli te extollere bros lib epist imperator sed si vi diutius imperare esto deo subditus scriptum est ciuile magistrate quae dei deo quae caesaris caesari lorde auance selfe ye wil remaine long empiere subiecte vnto god written geeue god belongeth god geeue caesar belongeth caesar saithe emperoure valentinian elder selfe sozom li ca ego sum sorte plebis respecte one people like pourpose iulius caesar beinge heathen prince saide sommetime selfe rome councel house dion lib nonlatin alphabet sozom li ca equidem ad alia omnia quae pro vobis gerenda sunt consul sum dictator quod autem ad iniuriam cuiquam faciendum attinet sum priuatus touchinge al affaire ought taken hande sake bothe consul dictator touchinge wronge donne man priuate man without office said heathen renegate iulianus emperour principe vbi ad limen delubri venerint perinde sunt atque priuati prince magistrate comme within entrie temple none priuate menne al traiterous horrible iudgement pleaseth saie luther ciuile magistrate ye saie sturred vp disciple thomas munzer thuringia preacher rebelles strang mater see tonge renne riot luther selfe writinge thereof vnto rebelles saithe thus satanas sub euangelij praetextuiohan sleidanus lib multos hoc tempore seditiosos plane sanguinarios doctores excitauit satan vnder pretense gospel hath sturred vp day many seditious bloudy doctours meaninge thereby munzer like companion apologie cap diuision whereas woonte sommetime obiected personnes wantinge skil touchinge heluetians chaunge state killing leopoldus duke austria restoringe force theire countrie libertie al donne appeareth plainely al story twoo hundred threescore yeeres paste aboue time pope boniface eight authoritie bishop rome greatest iolitie aboute twoo hundred yeeres huldericus zuinglius either beganne teache gospel yet borne euer sithence time thei haue al thinges stil quite onely foreine enimies also al ciuile dissension sinne heluetians deliuer theire owne countrie foreine gouernement specially proudely tyrannously oppressed yet burthen v mennes faultes faultes theire forefather againste al right reason hardinge nowe sprite contente withe ye haue railed already againste pope holy churche moueth againe raue crie whether malice reason let v indifferently consider apologie cap diuision immortal god wil bishoppe rome accuse v treasone wil teache people obeie folowe theire magistrate hath regarde al maiestie prince doothe hee none olde bishoppes rome euer diddeaugustin steuchus suffer selfe bee called flatterer lord lordes though hee woulde haue al kinges prince whoe euer bee vnderlinges doothe hee vaunte selfe bee kinge kinges antonius de rosellis haue kingely roialtie ouer subiectes compelleth al emperours prince sweare fealtie true obedience dooth hee boaste emperours maiestie thousandfolde inferioure himde maior obedien solitae de maior obedien vnam sanctum sexto reason specially bicause god hath made two lightes heauen bicause heauen earth created twoo beginninges one hathe hee felowes like anabaptistes libertine ende might runne licenceously carelessy shaken yoke exempted selues beinge vnder al ciuil power hathe hee legate asmutche saie moste suttle spy lieinge waite al kinges courtes councelles priuie chamber doothe liste sette christian prince one againste owne pleasure trouble whole worlde debate discorde dooth hee excommunicate commaunde taken heathen pagan christian prince renounceth authoritie promiseth indulgence pardon largely wil waie euer kil enimies doothe hee maintaine empire kingedomes doothe hee desire common quiete shoulde bee prouided muste pardonne v good reader though wee seeme vtter thinges bitterly bitingly becommeth diuines doo bothe shamefulnesse matter also desire rule bishoppe rome excedinge outrageous coulde wel vttered woordes mildelyclemens concil viennen leo papa ashamed saie open assemblie al iurisdiction al kinges dependeth selfe feede ambition greedinesse rule hee hathe pulled peeces empiere rome vexed rent whole christedome asunder falsely traiterously also release romaine italian selfe othe whereby thei hee streitly bounde bee true emperour graecia stirred vp emperoures subiectes forsake callinge carolus magnus fraunce italie made emperour sutche thingezacharias pp neuer seene put chilpericus frenche kinge beinge euil prince biside realme onely bicause fansied wrongefully placed pipine roume againe cast kinge philip could haue brought passe determined appointed kingedome fraunce albertus king romaine vtterly destroied state florishinge cittie common weale florence owne natiue countrieclemens brought free peaceable state gouerned pleasure one manidem clemens hee brought passe procurement whole sauoye one side miserably spoiled emperoure charles fifthe side frenche kinge poore vnfortunate duke scante one cittie leafte hide heade hardinge greate eie sore ministres antichriste see vicare christe aboue lordes kinges vvorlde see prince emperours promise svveare obedience vnto faithful subiectes churche god thinke absurditie shepherd set onely aboue lambes ewe churche also aboue vvethers rammes selues greate folie finde faulte superioritie bishop rome neuer proue vicare christematth vicare yet beinge bishop aboue temporal princeso euery simple prieste concerninge priestly office sith christe saide peter vpon rocke wil build churche hel gate shal preuaile againste ita litle vvitte benne better al greate doo barke vntil belly breake ye helhovvndes luther zuinglius litour rather sathans theire chiefe maister shal preuaile againste apostolike see peter hath withstanded al diuels heretikes thousande fiue hundred yeeres thinke ye selues stronger arius greeueth pope higher emperour loue ye beare emperour hatred ye haue pope person ye knowe quarrel againste christe whose person pope beareth tel v praie dooth cal selfe prince emperours vicegerent rather theso calleth selfe vvhen christ euer cal vicare christe alone vvhom impugne ye christe vicareluke haue ye readen qui vos spernit spernit despiseth despiseth ye thought pope better text primacie supreme auctoritie two lightes god made heauen malice blinded chapter innocetius thirde whence like spider ye sucked ye thought worste ye might haue seene reason goinge beforedistin duo sunt saide pontifex spiritualibus antecellit quae tant sunt temporalibus digniora quant anima praefertur corpori bishop saide innocentius spiritual matter passeth emperour whiche spiritual thinges mutche aboue temporal howe mutche soule preferred bodie howe like ye reason vvithin litle innocentius bringeth forth proufe vvhere saide ieremie prophete came hieremie benne pope priestes racehierem prieste selfea profounde reason reade ansvveare behold haue set thee ouer natios kingdomes intente thou maiest pul vp scater builde plante innocentius hadby natural reason natural folie natural reason holy scripture proued highest bishop superioritie aboue prince commeth thirde place nowe proue make former saieinge already proued plaine alludinge written beginning genesis vvhere moyses declareth god made two lightes firmamente heauen greater lesser cannot sounde eares newe preacher woulde haue guide heauenly thinges aboue guide earthly care loue earth fleash worlde wel minde therefore aske pope rome like anabaptistes libertine haue shaken yoke exempted selues al ciuile power vvhat yoke meane ye yoke infidel paynimes b sarisburie wee minister antichriste hardinge witness truthe christe antichriste paule sheweth sitteth temple god auanceth selfe aboue al called god speake particularely mater gregory iudgement antichriste pope aboue kinges emperours forerenner antichriste calleth selfe vniuersal bishop vaunteth selfe king pride hath armie priestes prepared setteth selfe lucifer aboue al brother cardinal franciscus zarabella saithe thus papa facit quicquid libet gregor lib epist etiam illicita est plusquam deus pope doothe vvhat listeth yea though vnlavvful god antichriste hardingegrego lib epist iudgemente wise godly supporter euerfrancis zarabel euer minister antichriste greate arrogancie auance bishop aboue kinge notwithstandinge somme good meaninge maie true iudge knowledge lawe doctoure physique profession pilote knowledge sea guidinge shippe captaine martial affaire aboue kinge behoueth kinge neuer wise mighty euery seueral faculty guided thus kinge inferioure onely bishop saie also euery inferiour prieste chrysostome saith christes apostle chrys psal omnem terrarum orbem peruaserunt omnibus principibus fuerunt magi proprie principe regibus potentiores apostle roaued ouer whole worlde princelike deede prince selues puissante mighty kinges saide emperoure valentinian vnto people millainetheodoretus lib cap nonlatin alphabet eum collocate pontificali solio cui no quo que moderatores imperij nostra caput submittamus place ye sutche man bishoppes chaire vnto wee selues goueine empiere maie stoope heade prince bounde obedience goddes vvoorde lesse priuate subiecte refuse heare reuerence declaration goddes holy wil accursed hardinge pourpose woulde therefore kinge shoulde sweare obedience vnto bishop respecte owne learninge simple prieste maie wel aboue pope saithe owne doctoure panormitane papa tenetur confiteri eo actu sacerdos est maior illo pope bounde confesse selfe acte confession extra de poeniten remiss omnis vtrius que abbas prieste aboue againe papa non potest cogere sacerdotem vt reuelet confessionem quia illo actu sacerdos est maior quam papa pope cannot compel prieste open hath benne saide vnto confession acte prieste greater pope yet trowe yee woulde therefore pope shoulde sweare obedience prieste therefore hardinge greeueth v see poore stoole humilitie whereon peter sate blowen vp nowe mounte pride pope require homage fealtie kinges emperours subiectes greeueth v see others felowes respecte pope mutche onely abase also vilely abuse maiestie vnto christe apostle alwaies obediente remember one hath written published worlde behalfe stanislaus orichonius saithe thusstanislaus orichonius chimera fol tantum sacerdos praestat regi quantum homo praestat bestiae quantum deus praestat sacerdoti tantum sacerdos praestat regi qui regem anteponit sacerdoti anteponit creaturam creatori prieste mutche aboue kinge man aboue beaste mutche god better prieste mutche prieste better kinge setteth kinge prieste setteth creature creatoure greeueth v pope aboue kinges emperours see gregory woordes gregory successours proudely broken thus wrote welneare thousande yeeres sithence vnto emperoure mauritius againste iohn bishop constantinople claiminge vniuersal authoritie nowe vsurped popegregor li epist ille coercendes est qui sanctae vniuersali ecclesiae iniuriam facit qui corde tumet qui gaudere de nomine singularitatis appetit qui honori quoque imperij vestri se per priuatum vocabulum superponit maiestie muste represse wronge vnto holy vniuersal churche swelleth harte desireth enioie name singularitie also priuate title callinge selfe vniuersal bishop placeth selfe ouer aboue honoure empiere touchinge knowledge goddes woorde case religion certaine kinge inferiour bishop bishop negligente doo office wilful doo rightly ignorante cannot doo bishop vnder prince subiecte checke maie pounished writeth emperoure constantinus vnto people nicomedia theodoretus lib cap si quis episcoporu consulte tumultuatus sit ministri dei hoc est mea executione illius audacia coercebitur bishop vnaduisedly woorke trouble boldenesse shalbe repressed order goddes minister saie rom execution therefore paule saithe let euery soule subiecte higher power whereunto chrysostome addeth woordes etiamsi apostolus si chrysost ad roman homil etiamsi euangelista etiamsi propheta siue quisquis tandem fueris neque enim pietatem subuertit ista subiectio although thou apostle although thou euangeliste although thou prophete one euer thou yet thou subiecte higher power godlinesse hindered sutche subiection quarrel ye saie againste christe personne pope beareth haue ye readen despiseth despiseth tel v praie saie doothe pope cal selfe prince emperours vicegerent rather vicare christe alone forceth greately title pope liste claime cannot lightly wante authoritie maie penne owne commission trows wee maie saie cicero saide sommetime one rome asinius senator voluntarius lectus ipse ase asinius vvillinge senatour selfe appointed chosen selfe thess verily antichriste shal sit temple god euen place christe beare selfe christes vicare howe let pope doo duetie bishop let exhorte let preache let dispense goddes mystery let fulfil office let doo parte euangeliste wee wil loue reuerence although christes vicare general yet leaste bishop otherwise wee muste saie vnto gregorie saide sommetime cyriacus bishop constantinople gregor lib epist omnes magnos esse honorabiles cupio quorum tamen honor honori omnipotentis dei non detrahat nam quisquis se contra deum honorari appetit mihi honorabilis non est wishe al menne shoulde greate honorable theire honoure preiudicial honoure almighty god euer shal desire selfe honoured againste god shal honourable vnto mee one highe woorthy reason wee alleged pope innocentius thirde sonne higher greater moone ergo pope higherde maior obedien solita carion inno en greater emperoure pope innocentius saide either would lose miter el would pul emperoure philip emperial crovvne heade malice ye saiepope aboue kinges emperours blinded v otherwise wee might haue seene substantial better reason needeful hardinge certainely reason simple beste reason ye finde soule aboue body ergo pope aboue emperoure howe like ye reason saie uerily reason without sense reason sutche many makinge like reason maie saie cooke alwaies aboute fire fire highest al elementes ergo al science cooke occupation highest reason ye maie proue highest emperoure subiects onely pope also euery simple prieste yea reason muste needes folowe greate inconuenience pope selfe mutche ministreth sacramentes teacheth exhorteth occupieth selfe spiritual affaire leaste al others therefore lowest baseste al cleregie nowe hardinge beseeche consider weight drifte owne reason pope charge spiritual saie ergo emperoure bounde sv veare obedience pope reason maie reason proued uerily good reason ye maie saie euery priestes charge spiritual ergo kinge bounde svveare obedience euery prieste yet sutche proper reason pope hath auanced selfe aboue al state prince worlde holy father innocentius leste shoulde seeme wante scripture proufe hereof allegeth also woordes god spoken vnto prophete hieremie hierem beholde haue set thee ouer nation kingedomes intente thou maiste pulle vp scatter builde plante ergo saithe emperoure subiecte vnto pope proufes ye saye defender coulde find ye saie sober maner vvhen wil forsake schole lieing truely sutch schole hardinge maie claime good right maister wee far fro lieinge saieing truthe make woordes hieremie bishop rome wil ye saie prophete hieremie pope kinge sworne subiecte loial vnto kinge prince hieremie subdue people countrie euer ouerthrowe one owne doctours saithe heruaeus de potesta papa ca hieremias nullum regem deposuit sed intelligitur positus supra centes regna quasi habens authoritatem super ea annuntiando praedicando vera de destructione regum mundi sed de destructione vitiorum plantatione fidei morum1 cor vt illud pauli dei aedificatio estis dei agricultura estis hieremie deposed kinge wee vnderstande placed ouer nation kingedomes hauinge authoritie ouer openinge preachinge truthe speaketh non ouerthrowinge kingedomes world ouerthrowinge vice planting faith manner sense paule saith corinthian ye goddes buildinge ye goddes tillage glose selfe saithe vt euellas regnum satanae vt plantes bona vt aedifices ecclesiam haue placed thee roote vp kingedomes worlde state common weales kingedome satan plante good thinges builde vp churche whole commission limited woordes posui verbum meum ore tuo hierem haue put woorde thy mouthe sutche authoritie elia ouer kinge achab therefore saide vnto pope aboue kinges emperours trouble israel thou thy father house sutche authoritie iohn baptiste ouer kinge herode therefore saide vnto lawful thee haue thy brother wife true reg ye woulde seeme saie pope superioritie standet onely thinges spiritual wherefore doothe pope nicolas saie christus beato petro terreni simuldist mediolanensis coelestis imperij iura commisit christe bath geuen blessed peter right wel worldly also heauenly empiere wherefore pope adrian thus write vnto emperoure fredericus romae nostra sedes estauentinus adrian anno imperatoris est quis arduenna quae est sylua galliae imperator quod habet totum habet nobis sicut zacharias transtulit imperium graecis ad teutonicos ita no possumus illud transferre ab alemanis ad graecos ecce potestare nostra est vt demus illud cui volumus propterea constituti sumus deo super gens regna vt destruamus euellamus aedificemus plantemus seate cittie rome emperours seate acon ardenne whiche foreste fraunce vvhat euer emperoure hath hath v pope zacharias translated empiere graecia germanie maie wee againe translate germaines greekes behold power bestowe empiere vpon wee liste therefore wee appointed god ouer nation kingdomes pulle downe roote vp builde plante againe authoritie trowe reacheth sommewhat onely cause spiritual one doctours saith heruaeus de potesta papae ca magi esset acceptum deo quod per solum potificem mundus omnibus regeretur acceptable vnto god worlde al mater spiritual temporal gouerned onely pope innocentius addeth sonne moone yee saye reason similitude thinge maie easily graunted deede similitude vtterly voide either vvitte reason taught pope childishly plaie similitude thereby auance selfe abase empiere world tolde pope sonne emperoure moone emperoure far inferioure pope moone inferiour sonne isidorus liued sixe hundred yeeres pope innocentiusin glossa gene cap heruaeus de potesta papae ca saithe quite contrarie per solem intelligitur regnum per lunam intelligitur sacerdotium sonne vvee vnderstande kingdome moone vve vnderstande priesthoode whereby geueth v consider contrarie iudgemente good father pope innocentius moone inferioure sonne pope inferioure emperoure hardinge constantine baptized gaue place tovntruth fond peeuishe syluester vvas deade long costantinus vvas christened syluester bishop rome al successours peter irketh haries great emperour first openly professed christianitie shoulde holy ghoste called faithe christe made tovntruthe vaine childe vvhy har vaine one true vvorde al talc departe cittie whiche ruled worlde yelde owne palaice partly churche sauiour christe partely dwellinge house bishop rome aske constantine submitted necke syluester vve haue cause thinke constantius heretike sonne constantine glad father dooinge yet god suffered retourne dwel rome leaue cittie free ruler churche b sarisburie constantine ye saie gaue ouer cittie rome al vveaste parte empiere pope successours euer thing erye saie donation constantine yrketh harte ful soare yea verily hardinge irketh v mutche behalfe see man wisedome learninge warrante sutche folie without blusshinge whole donation constantine wherevpon ye builde pope vvhole kingdome hath shewe sufficient mocke childe effecte sense thereof constantinus emperoure thirde daie christened honoure peter willingly leafte al weaste parte empiere departed byzantium nowe called constantinople dwel easte gaue whole emperial ciuile dominion onely cittie rome also italie france spaine arragone portugal englande germanie scotlande irelande pole denmarke sueden hungarie pope doubtelesse true ben toily liberal heruaeus de potesta papae ca princely gifte one frendes saithe volunt aliqui quod ratione huius doni summus pontifex imperator est quod potest instituere destituere reges sicut imperator somme saie meane gifte pope emperoure maie set vp pulle downe kinges emperoure pius secundus beinge selfe afterwarde bishop rome saithe dictum palea constantinus falsa est saide decree named constantinus conteining constantine emperours donation pius dialog fol chartar vtterly false saith antoninus archebishop florence valla volaterrane hieronymus cathalanus otho frisingensis others moe fable wee shal haue occasion speake hereafter constantius heretique sonne vnto constantinus saie mutche misliked father dooinge nai hardinge constantius aliue would rather finde faulte discretion reporte sutche folie father dooinges ye saie god suffered returne dwel rome palleth deepthe diuinitie searche vp cause secretes goddes sufferance althoughe constantius beinge encumbred dangerous warres greate affaire forced staie country could haue leasure returne rome yet stil continued lorde rome also greate number emperours folovved therefore pope bonifacius thus wrote vnto emperoure honorius dist ecclesia rom est vrbs vestrae mansuetudinis rome maiesties cittie likewise pope agatho writeth vnto emperoure constantinus sexta synodo constan act eadem synodo actione haec est vrbs seruilis maiestatis vestrae maiesties bonde cittie constantinus emperour selfe saithe dono archiepiscopo antiquae nostrae romae donus arche bishop cittie olde rome neede moe woordes case cleare man learninge cal question briefely touchinge fonde fable constantine donation cardinal cusanus saithe thusnicol cusanus de donatione constantini donationem diligenter expendens reperi ipsamet scriptura manifesta argumenta confictionis falsitatis diligently weighinge donation constantine haue founde penninge thereof manifeste argumentes ginge falshedde hardinge recordes presidentes moste certaine ancient memorie ye would haue publisshed vnto world sutche monumentes pope claimeth right possession empiere frendes marueile ye defende sutche falshedde forgerie wel knowen manifeste shame hardinge pope legate ambassadours prince courtes thing nolesse conuenient meete hath cure many flockes shepe set seruauntes watchman euery part sutcheflockes feede b sarisburie steede legate stande churche godlegates pardones maie appeare fewe vttered thereof camotensis citatur ab agrippa de vanita scientiar nicol machiauel historia legati papae ita debacchantur prouincijs acsi ad flagellandum ecclesiam satan egressus esset facie domini pope legate doo rage al country satan gonne oute face god scourge churche machiauel saithe haue benne fewe warres commotion enflamed many late yeeres meane whisperinge legate doctrine teache good doo harde saie therefore father councel aphrica refused vtterly haue sutche legate sente emongest thus write vnto pope concil aphrica cap vt aliqui tanquam tuae sanctitatis latere mittantur nulla inuenimus patrum synodo constitutu legate shoulde sente vnto v fro holinesse side finde appointed councel father againe saie executores clericos vestros quibus que pontentibus nolite mittere ne fumosum se culi typhu ecclesiam christi videamur inducere send clerkes cardinalles put mater execution noble man mighty prince leste wee seeme bringe smoky pride vvorlde churche christe hardinge vntruthe depende deceitfulnesse man povver god indulgence pardon depend vpon power bindinge loosinge whiche christe gaue peter successoursmatth ye muste demaunde christevntruthe christe neuer gaue pope povver deale pardonnes gaue power angry vicare vsinge b sarisburie hardinge shoulde meane al uanities ye fully bente graunte kinde erroure neither purgatory pardon stewes god geue humilitie harte leste ye vnfitte vessel receiue goddes pardonne hardinge ye finde faulte leo thirde makinge emperour vvest dare saie greueth youvntruthe ioined vvith open folie vvas onely vvaie strengthen saracenes benne none vvest turke might haue ben emperour er barbarous wicked tyrannie might haue subdued parte worlde specially germanie hath subdued grece asia egypte syria al easte churche whiche mischefe vicare christe maisters merciful warninge prince vvest made prouision length planted empire order see nowe b sarisburie policie practised pope loosed whole power christendome empiere beinge vnited ioined one stronge mighty beinge afterwarde
