diuided twoo easte parte beinge sundred weaste became lame weake hable healpe selfe meane whereof gate opened receiue turke al christia dominion whiche nowe holdeth without resistance otherwise empiere beinge one whole selfe coulde neuer haue growen sutche power al wrought practise policie pope notwithstandinge pope selfe bargaine loste nothinge thereof marsilius patauinus writeth thusmarsilius pataninus pipinus sonne vnto charles frenche kinge conquered aristulphus kinge lumbardie tooke rauenna al fiue citties romandiola togeather emperours lieutenantes territorie called exarchatus gaue al pope pope steuin findinge selfe wel contented benefites seeinge weakenesse greeke emperoure procured empiere translated greekes vnto frenche hauinge vtterly forgotten benefitesthe true cause uision empiere platyna leone receiued emperoure intente greekes beinge vtterly oppressed frenche litle caringe thinges alone might rule italie pleasure touchinge pope leo thirde whose prouidence policie ye mutche commende true reporte storie saide leo beinge violence depriued bishoprike rome fledde aide charles frenche kinge restoared consideration whiche benefite proclaimed charles emperoure vveaste sithence whiche time empiere christendome hath benne diuided weakened pope enriched saracenes turkes aboue al measure encreased hardinge pope zacharias deposed childerike finde commonly named kinge fraunce onely vpon owne pleasure displeasure ye saie placed pipine ye tell storie see strength auctoritie see whiche able woorde place displace mightiest kinge europe vvith woorde saie sure ye shewe v armie sente execute power man trowe ye appointe kingedomes deuill selfe pleasure set vp depose kinges surely vntruthe gregorie saithe antichristus ipsas summas huius saeculi potestates obtinebit muche lesse member doo remember ye christe saide iewes obiected caste deuils name prince deuilsa nevve sinne holy ghoste beware ye sinne holy ghoste confesse pope hath pulled downe set vp kinges vvhiche thinge vndoubtedly coulde profitably peaceably greate power god yet line pipine charles greate whiche pope set vpvntruthe easy seene reade ansvveare florishe aboue stocke ye name sence inclination romaine empire vvhiche transposed state greate kingedome maketh obscure argument heauenly approbation diuine prouidence neither pope zacharias depose childerike fansied ye slaunder onely consented loose subiectes bonde othe made generall moste earnest request sute nobilitie communaltie whole realme fraunce findinge vnprofitable vnmeete kingedome one beinge witte therefore commonly named stupidus muche saie dolte altogeather besides like sardanapalus geuen wholly belly chere filthy loue vvomen therefore owne woordes ye confesse aa diuine povver pope diuine power pope whome cod directeth willes faithfull prince earthe suche example ye bringe woorse ye make cause woulde yer ease labour prouinge suche notable facte b sarisburie pope zacharias deposed childericus calle somme cal chilpericus frenche kinge therefore ye saie wee muste needes acknowlege diuine power pope seinge hable woorde place displace mightiest kinge europe diuel saie pleasure sette vp depose kinges verilyiohn harding christe selfe calleth diuel prince worlde therefore woe maie imagine maie doo somewhat worlde diuel ye wi beleeue woorde sette christe highe vpo mounte shewed al kingedomes worldedepofinge kinge saide vnto al thinges wil geue thee matthae thou wilte falle downe woorship power iohn saitheapocalyp shoulde geuen antichriste reges terrae vires potestatem suam tradent bestiac c vt consentiant dent que regnum suum bestiae donec compleantur verba dei kinges barthe shal geue strength power vnto beaste c maie agree togeather geue theire kingedome vnto beaste vntil woordes god fulfilled eodem cap againe saithe mulier ea quam vidisti est vrbs illa magna quae habet regnum super reges terrae woman thou sawest greate cittie hath kingedome ouer kinges worlde againe saithapocalyp data est illi potestas omne tribum gentem adorabunt eam bestiam omnes incolae terrae quorum nomina non sunt scripta libro vitae agni power geuen vnto beaste ouer euery tribe language nation al dweller earth shal woorship beaste whiche antichriste whose name written lambes booke life augustine saithe augustin psalm quia antichristus ad tantum culmen inanis gloriae venturus creditur tanta ei licebit facere omnes homines sanctos dei vt nonnulli infirmi arbitrentur deum re humanas negligere wee beleue antichriste shal comme vnto sutche higth vaine glorie shalbe lawful doo sutche thinges bothe towardes al menne prince others also towardes sainctes god many weake menne shal thinke god hath foresaken care worlde againe saithe august eundem psalm ita traditur de antichristo quod omnes reges superaturus sit solus regnum obtenturus thus written antichriste shal conquere al kinges obteine kingedome selfe alone saith gregoriegregor iob ca lib ca antichristus veniens ipsas etiam summas huius saeculi potestates obtinebit antichriste shal comme shal conquere highest estate power worlde al shal comme passe chrysostome saithe dissolution empiere whereof wee haue spoken woordes donec imprij illius timor fueritchrysostom thessaloni homil nemo antichristo statim subdetur quando vero istud imperium destructum fuerit vacantem imperij principatum inuadet tentabit ad se rapere hominum dei imperium longe empiere shalbe awe noman shal streightwaie submitte selfe antichriste empiere shalbe dissolued antichriste shal inuade state empiere standinge voide shal laboure pulle vnto selfe empiere bothe man god clemen lib de appellationib pastoralis distin omnes trowe pope proclaimeth selfe heire apparente al kingedomes pope nicolas saithe christus beato petro aeternae vitae clauigero terreni simul coelestis imperij iura commisit christe hath committed vnto blessed peter keiebearer euerlastinge life righte bothe worldly also heauenly empiere somme bolde saie sexto li ti de statu regularium antonius de rosellis auentinus adriano papa totius mundi obtinet principatum pope hath princehoode al whole worlde somme others haue saide papa est rex regum dominus dominantium pope kinge kinges lorde lordes pope adrian saithe selfe alleged imperator quod habet totum habet nobis ecce potestate nostra est vt demus imperium cui volumus euer emperoure hath hath v power bestowe empiere vpon wee liste hardinge diuine povver saie geuen pope iohn augustine chrysostome gregorie saie selfe diuine povver geue also antichriste therefore wel noted owne glose papa stupor mundiclemen pro mi glossa pope vvoondermente vvorlde saie pope maketh al worlde fooles seeme greate mater pope depose kinge doubte ye maie wel remember emperours sommetimes haue deposed pope emperoure constantius arian platyna liberio graunte yet emperoure deposed pope liberius afterwarde restoringe liberius deposed pope foelix emperoure otho firste deposed pope iohn emperoure iustinian deposed twoo pope order2 tomo conciliorum vita syluerij vigilij firste pope syluerius afterwarde pope vigilius al without leuieinge armie without raisinge power without disquiet trouble people doctoure owne seeminge fully determine mater booke case saithe thus imperator requisitus cardinalibus heruaeus de potest papae ca debet procedere contra papam emperoure beinge required cardinalles bounde procede depriuation againste pope saithe thus si quando imperialis legatus mitteretur principe vt romanus pontifex proficisceretur constantinopolim ad imperatorem appendix eutropij syluerio omni neglecta occasione ibat etiamsi pro certo sciret se iturum exilium time emperours embassadoure benne sente prince wil pope comme constantinople emperoure al occasion set aparte wente streight waie notwithstandinge certainely knewe shoulde bannished vrspergensis saithe henricus rex italiam ingressus vrspergen anno tres papa indigne constitutos synodaliter deposuit henry emperoure comminge italie deposed three pope vnlawfully made order synode hardinge rhetorical furniture maie crie oute diuine povver pope thus coulde depose kinge maie wee likewise saie diuine power emperoure thus could depose many pope ye maie better see woonderful diuinitie heauenly povver wherewith ye would faine enfeaffe pope witnesse owne saith thus heruaeus de potest papae ca quod dicitur papam deposuisse regem francoru loco eius instituisse pipinum glosa ordinaria exponit deposuit id est deponentibus consensit non enim legitur quod papa zacharias regem franciae deposuerit saide pope deposed frenche kinge placed pipinus roume ordinarie glose expoundeth thus deposed saie consented depose wee reade pope zacharie deede euer deposed frenche kinge truthe storie mutche chilpericus kinge seemed voide princely grauitie geuen selfe ouer pleasure wantonnesse pipinus lorde marshal man ful wisedome actiuttie gouernmente burthen al realme noble france hauinge agreed emongest selues depose one set vp sente vnto pope zacharie vnto wise man haue answeare question vvhether vvere meeter kinge paulus aemylius lib gaguinus carried onely name nothinge bare burthen vvhole pope soone persuaded geue sentence pipinus lorde marshal againste kinge whereupon kinge shorne abbie made moncke pipinus auanced vnto state gaue pope exarchate princehoode rauenna parte recompense good wil whether kinge hauinge niene yeeres ruled realme afterwarde depriued right wronge wil reason fasciculus temporum saithe kingedome remoued right heires line kinge pipine endured florished longe ye saie obscure argumente heauenly approbation diuine prouidence sutche approbation prouidence turke maie claime hath bothe longer continued mutche floorished encreased estate euer house pipine plutarch catone vticen cato woonte saie multum est caliginis rebus diuinis greate darkenesse goddes mater yet leste man ignorance happen herein deceiued true descente floorishinge fortune kinge pipines race firste thereof charles greate benuenutus imolensis augustali time saithe benuenutus imolensis laceratum est imperium state empiere torne sunder seconde ludouicus pius againste owne sonne lotharius arosepaulus aemylius lib caused shorne moncke thruste abb e owne mother empresse made nonne third lotharius oppressed owne brother violence afterwarde deposed made monke fourthe ludouicus vnfortunate al dooinges shamefully conquered brother fifthe ludouicus aemylius chronice doughty deedes commonly calle ludouicus nihili mutche saie levves nobody sixth carolus named caluus benuenutus saithe vir lepore timidior man feareful cowardely hare shortly slaine poison seuenthe carolus benuenutus saithe vir deficiens animo corpore man wantinge bothe strength body wisedome minde saie bothe cowarde foole eighth arnulphus benuenutus imolen augustali eaten vp life nienthe ludouicus reporte benuenutus man better fortune father house ende noble pipines racenihilo foelicior patre eo defecit imperium gente carolorum hardinge coulde stande floorishe saie without special heauenly approbation diuine prouidence hardinge concerninge ye saie kinge philip surnamed le bel maie beleue paulus aemylius beste writer frenche chronicle cause suche betwene pope bonifacius kinge onely excommunicate also offered gifte kingedome albert emperour platina authour herein writeth maie seeme therein haue done altogeather euil proper qualification altogeather euill ye pretende bothe aemilius platine doo witnesse cause fallinge whereas pope first sued vnto cassanus christian prince greate conquerour easte ioine recouery holy lande sente bishop apamea frenche kinge necessary aide common quarell al christendome beinge offended either sute firste made either saide bishop done ambassade auctoritie kinge thought became vpon priuate grudge onely vtterly refuse sende healpe towarde voiage also contemptuously beside common order cruelly committed pope legate prison kepte vntill suche time pope interdict kinge compelled set libertie nowe geuinge awaie kingedome chiefe frenche historiographer maketh mention pope maie seme haue done ita ioily vvaie fraie kinge rather feare reclaime minde disobedience verely platina writinge declareth howe pope proceded extremitie frenche kinge laieby diuinitie kingedome refuse subiecte thral see rome pope maie geue avvaie pleasure withdrawe people fraunce obedience churche see apostolike b sarisburie hardinge ye stammer tale knowe wel saie pope gaue awaie kingedome france prince ye saie intent feare prety diuisephilippus bonifacius fraie kinge pulle crowne emperial heade firste pope bonifacius saide intrauit vt vulpes regnauit vt lupus mortuus est vt canis entred popedome foxe reigned woulfe died prison dogge solemne procession wente attired crovvne emperialparalip vrspergen robe maiestie emperoure commaunded naked svverde borne storie life ioined owne booke vita bonifacij sexto idem platyna named sextus bonifacij written thus moritur hoc modo bonifacius qui imperatoribus regibus principibus nationibus populis terrorem potius quam religionem inijcere conabatur thus died pope bonifacius man sought strike terroure emperours kinges prince people nation true religion bonifacius sabel aenead lib saithe sabellicus sente frenche kinge monie pretended towardes recouerie hierusalem bishop apamea beinge legate behalfe vttered certaine greate woordes presence kinge threatened onlesse woulde graunte kinge quietly bearinge sutche presumptuous boldenesse commaunded apostolique legate vnto warde iniurie inflamed pope choler immediately sente archebishop narbon kinge require set legate libertie otherwise tel wickednesse righte kingedome fallen churche rome thus sabellicus fauoure pope thought good somewhat shadowe mater others thereof haue written thus martinus polonus bonifacius mandat regi se esse dominum spiritualibus temporalibus vniuerso mundo vt que rex recognoscat regnum franciae se contrarium enim sentire tenere haereticum esse bonifacius sente vnto frenche kinge tolde lorde bothe spiritual also temporal mater throughout worlde therefore yt kinge shoulde holde kingedome hande otherwise thinke holde saide heresie name pope noted glosedist si qui glossa quicun que praeceptis nostris non obedierit peccatum idololatriae paganitatis incurrit euer obeieth commaundementes falleth sinne idolatrieabbas vrspergen infidelitie hereof vrspergensis writeth thus habes rom quod sitisti decanta canticum quia per malitiam non per religionem orbem vicisti rome thou haste nowe thou haste longe thirsted nowe singe menly thy malice religion thou haste conquered worlde kinge beinge moued herewith commaunded none cleregie shoulde comme pope councel paulus aemyl platyna sabellicus nauclerus openly burnte pope vvrites commaunded pope legate departe realme forebade monie shoulde made thence pope gaue proclamation none subiectes shoulde goe rome synode parise charged pope pride ambition murder simonie heresie thus mutche dealinge crowne france vnto stranger saie faithe reuerence pope beareth kinges prince folowed sommewhat spoilinge duke sauoie alteringe state florence whiche thinges thought beste passe ouer woorthy answeare apologie cap diuision wee accloied example behalfe tedious recke vp al notorious practises bishoppes rome whiche side beseche poisoned henrie emperoure poison sacramente euen receiuinge sacramente whiche poisoned victor pope euen receiuinge chalice whiche poisoned kinge iohn kinge england drinkinge cuppe whoe euer least secte euer sure neither lutheran zvvinglians hardinge findes hell yet let loose begate lutheran zwinglians caluinistes hereof vnderstande youthe churche whiche hauinge diuided selfe olde catholike churche malignante churche synagoge satan answeare demaundes vvho euer poisoned greate personage poisoned good men neither doer counsailours henry luxenburg poisoned reporte vvhome latine booke printed amonge huguenot calleth henry seuenth doctor haddon answeare osorius accompteth fourthe bothe englishe translation haue seene called onely henry laide siege citie florence brought citizen despaire safetie manly courage might serue betooke cowardly malice firste poysoned saide minde frier dominican golde afterwarde shoulde aduentere poison emperours body venime paulus aemilius saith died sickenesse whiche fell bonconuetolib scholij platina iournied pisa thither onuphrius writing death saith died bonconuento town territorie siena maketh metion poisoning cornelius cornepolita writing storie semeth geue litle credite vnto addeth heare saie vt aiunt chronographia saie though matter auouched certainetie hearesaie nauclerus reporteth order religius men saide haue testimoniall writinge witnessinge foresaide friere haue benne innocent whole fained tale victor thirde pope mentioned martinus polonus haue benne poisoned malicious procurement emperoure henry thirde bicause stoode defence gregory seuenth emperour muche hated persecuted vincentius holdeth contrary opinion died dysentery platina reciteth touchinge kinge iohn englande write poisoned drinkinge cuppe monkes selues make better fable euer write referre selues hearesaie popular fame author actes monumentes reporteth many opinion amonge chronicle writer deathe ye procede malicious railinge pope ye spitte poison demaudinge certaine question shorte woordes full stuffed false cankered slaunders b sarisburie poisoninge noble emperoure henrie lucenburg sacramente whereby appeareth farre foorthe state worlde ought truste ye would haue v passe lightly ouer fable onuphrius cornelius like parasite wee make reckeninge truthe storie reported manyparalipom vrsperg ann bapt egnatius auentinus carion supplementum chron vrspergensis saithe quidam religiosus porrexit imperatori intoxicatam eucharistiam c certaine religious man ministred vnto emperoure sacramente poisoned emperoure hauinge receiued returninge againe vnto place thought peece colde ise paste alonge body baptista egnatius saithe wrought policie robertus kinge sicilia moued therto auentinus saithe pope clemente ye shal finde recorded cariontextor officina veneno extincti supplemento chronicorum rauisius textor sundrie others like recorde founde poisoninge victor chalice credite whereof maie please reade martinus polonus pope penitentiarie volaterranus matthaeus palmerius supplie chronicle fasciculus temporum textor others touchinge deathe kinge iohn whether poisoned monke wil striue referringe mee selfe therein credite chronicle common reporte whereof togeather general opinion people destroied poison euer cause deathmatthias parisien matthias parisiensis saithe thus papa innocentius sententionaliter definiuit c pope innocentius determined sentence kinge iohn deposed estate enioined execution thereof frenche kinge remission sinnes promisinge also faithfully successours enioie kingedome englande euer mutche englande bounde reuerence obeie pope apologie cap diuision daie whiche alloweth mightiest kinges monarch worlde kisse blessed feete hardinge saie humbly owne persone refuseth suche honour calleth thinketh selfe seruum seruorum dei seruant seruantes god seeth greate power prince worlde humble selues christe lorde lordes kinge kinges person whose vicare earthe chiefe deputie thinges god warde vnmindefull selfe roomes sake beareth honour whose vicegerent rather also forum proper schole humilitie example humilitie obedience taken learned others inferiour degree suffereth honour done whiche mere man require neither pride pope day onely ye obiect example suche humilitie prince proue auncient greate kinge charlemaigne afterwarde create emperoure coulde withholden pope adrian firsteplatina vita adriani firste meetinge woulde kisse feete many emperours kinges haue olde time done likewise lest soueraintie suche honour exhibited vnto shoulde owne conceite lifte higher degree humaine conditionphy forshame cannot pope learne humilitie draughte purpose serueth stoole naturall easement creation whereof surmise isvntruthe sur mised v recorded ovvne vvriters sabellicus saithe vt sedentis genitalia ab vltimo diacono attrectentur vile temper highnesse vocation base consideration humaine infirmity necessity b sarisburie thinge either vile horrible sutche proper excuse maie soone smoothed chrysostome saithe haec etsi minimum esse videantur tamen magnorum sunt causae malorumchrysostom matthae homil nam ciuitates ecclesias saepe numero euerterunt propterea nec lachrymis abstinere possum cum primo istos consessus salutationes audiam ac mentem veniat quot quantum hinc mala ecclesia die orta sint thinges notwithstandinge seeme smal yet cause greate euils oftentimes haue ouerthrowen bothe citties church therefore cannot absteine weepinge heare superiority salutation consider many howe greate euils haue growen thereof churche god hieronym epist ad galathas cap hierome mutche mislikinge state time saithe thus episcopi velut aliqua sublimi speculum constituti vix dignantur videre mortales alloqui conserous suos bishoppes thei placed somme high castle scarce vouchesaue looke vpon poore mortal menne speake vnto felowe seruantes touchinge bishop romekisse pope foote nought gregorie saith rex superbiae foribus est kinge pride euen hande pope ovvne booke ceremony rome gregor lib epist written thus electus imperator cum suis omnibus seruato ordine per gradus ascendit suggestum et vt primum videt pontificem detecto capiteceremoniar li sectio ca deuote osculatur illum genu terram contingens veneratur iterum cum appropinquat ad gradus sedis genuflectit demum vbi ad pontificis pes peruenit illos reuerentiam saluatoris deuote osculatur emperoure electe goeinge arraie al traine passeth vp staires scaffolde soone seethe pope woorshippeth bare heade touchinge grounde knee againe commeth foote pope throne kneeleth downe laste al commeth vnto pope feete kisseth deuoutely reuerence saueour ordered special ceremonie appointed vnto emperoure parte duetie likewise written empresse concerninge duetie imperatrix coronataceremoniar li sectio ca ceremoniarium lib cap mox osculatur pedem pontificis empresse beinge crowned immediately kisseth pope foote againe pope selfe written thus papa nemini omnino mortalium reuerentiam facit assurgendo manifeste aut caput inclinando seu detegendo pope selfe geeueth manner reuerence man aliue either openly standinge vp bowinge downe vncoueringe heade pope saie humbly owne personne refuseth sutche honoure hereby teacheth kinges emperours al subiectes humble strange case teache humilitie schole pride sutche humilitie taught iulius caesar diocletian maximinus iulius caesar raughte oute foote pompeius poenus kisse folkes might see golden slipper sette stoanesseneca pomponius laetus diocletiano pomponius laetus saithe diocletianus edicto sanxit c diocletian commaunded proclamation al menne shoulde fal downe kisse feete whereunto also added certaine reuerence adourninge shoe golde alexander ab alexandro thessalon diamondes maximinus also afterwarde like sutche humilitie shal antichriste teache auancinge selfe aboue al woorshipped called god sutche humilitie diuel tooke vpon teache saide christe wil geue thee al thinges matthae thou wilte fal downe woorship thus maie pope cal selfe lorde lordes kinge kinges sette foote emperours neckes yet neuerthelesse frame newe title saie seruus seruorum dei seruante goddes seruantes pride humilitie antoninus saith antoninus summa par ti ca s non minor honor debetur papae quam angelis vnde papa recipit fidelibus adorationes prostrationes oscula pedum quod non permisit angelus iohanne euangelista sibi fieri lesse honour dewe vnto pope vnto angel god therefore pope suffereth faitheful vvoorship fal downe kisse feete whiche thinges angel god woulde suffer iohn euangeliste doo vnto hardinge maliceous railinge yee cal spite poison vntruthe stuffed false cankered sclaunders reporte owne doctours owne confession truthe porphyrie stoole easemente serueth ye saie put pope minde humanitie saie maie remember selfe middes al glorie man hardinge owne authours story tel stoole serueth put pope remembrance virilitie worlde maie knowe woman let imagination stande true yet maie wee thinke pope forgeatful dulheaded blockishe haue neede taught vile example knowe selues certainely mystical kinde stoole easemente wee cannot lightly lacke mystery handes homely place ful mystery kinge alexander greate vnderstoode selfe man mortalplutarch alexandr sommetimes natural necessitie forced sleepe christes vicare peter successoure doctoure al doctoures father al father maister teacher al worlde stoole casemente woulde quite forgeate owne humanitie coulde neuer remember selfe man apologie cap diuision commaundeth emperoure goe horse bridle frenche kinge holde stirope hardinge vvhat isvntruthes tvvoo togeather reade ansvveare knowe neither sir defender knowe woordes moste impudently belie pope neuer pope commaunded either frenche kinge emperoure doo seruice speake parte haue readen perteininge hereunto recite woorthiest greatest prince euer earthe constantine greate witnesse openly reuerence whiche bare harte christe sauiour peter whose successoure pope likewise christes vicar earthe disdained honour syluester pope time doingeal great vntruthe shamelesse fable office footeman leadinge horse bridle vvherein seemeth firste emperours professed faithe christe openly firste prince haue geuen posteritie example humilitie man doubte muche finde recorded olde father greeke churche matthaeus hierom nac hus vttered constantine selfe nonlatin alphabet greeke euen pope nonlatin alphabet vvhiche n englishe muche submittinge selfe office foote man holdinge horse bridle wee leade foorthe sacred palais woorship reuerence peter sithens bothe emperoures frenche kinges humilitie deuotion witnesse humble obedience christe vicar haue donne like seruice yea though pope shewed selfe neuer vnwillinge thereto wee finde reported sundrie good recordes vntruthe manifeste thus ordred pope ovvne pontifical ovvne booke ceremony euer commaunded suche seruice donne vnto ye neuer indifferente credible witnesse paulus aemylius italian verona seconde booke chronicle whiche bothe diligently eloquently wrote fraunce describeth howe honorably pipine woorthy kinge fraunce receiued steuen pope succeded zacharias came realme bothe killed feete wente horse bridell like honour holdinge stirope would charles fifthe late greate emperoure haue downe b non pope clement seuenth pope mutche adoo put b sarisburie thinge sir defender knoweth notwithstandinge hardinge dissemble cunningely wil knowen ye knowe neither dooth sir defender saie woordes impudently belie pope trial hereof referreth pope owne booke holy ceremony wherein particularely appointedthe pope bridle laide order auoide confusion eche estate oughtthe pope stirope bounde doo thus therefore appointed cum papa per scalam ascendit c pope taketh staires mounte horsebackeceremoniarium lib cap greattest prince presente vvhether kinge emperoure holdeth stirope afterwarde leadeth horse litle waie forewarde bridle tvvoo kinges presence honorable shoulde holde bridle rightside leaste happen kinge presente lette woorthiest personnes leade horseetiamsi imperator aut quiuts maximus princeps adesset sellam ipsam cum pontifice humeris aliquantulum portare debet ceremoniar li sectio ca dum imperator haec vtilitatis officia vult exhebere c tandem cum aliquibus bonis verbis recipiedo permittit c ceremoniarium lib cap pope woulde ride borne mennes shoulder chaire muste foure woorthiest prince yea emperoure selfe mighty monarche presente beare chaire pope al litle waie forewarde vpon theire shoulder againe imperator traditis pomo sceptro c emperoure deliueringe ouer goulden apple sceptre one menne commeth vnto pope horse honoure lorde iesus christe whole personne earthe pope heareth holdeth stirope vntil pope mounted afterwarde taketh bridle leadeth foorthe horse vvhile emperoure doothe profitable office pope ought modestly litle refuse yet afterwarde certaine good gentle woordes takinge honoure donne christe vnto selfe holdeth selfe contented appointed thus caudam pluuialis portabit nobilior laicus qui erit curia etiamsi esset imperator aut rex moste noble laie man shal courte shal beare vp traine pope cope yea though emperoure kinge againe ceremoniar li sectio let moste noble laic man whether kinge emperoure bringe water wasshe pope handes pope wassheth let al bishoppes laie menne kneele downe againe pontifice sedente c ceremoniar lib cap etiamsi rex aut imperator sit pope yet sittinge table noblest man within courte emperoure kinge shalbe broughte pope credence geue water againe ceremoniar li sectio primum ferculum portabit nobilior princeps siue imperator sit siue rex firste disshe noblest prince shal carrie vvhether emperoure kinge againe ceremonia li sectio ca rex collatione portabit primum potum pope breakefaste kinge shal beare firste cuppe againe pocula portentur c let pope cuppes borne noble menne oratours beinge presente let clerke ceremony beginne woorthiest estate yea though kinge emperoure nowe truste hardinge courteste ye wil confesse sir defender woordes hath impudently belied pope pope owne booke ordinance ceremony directeth al order saithe thus emperoure shal holde pope stirope let emperoure leade pope horse emperoure muste beare pope chaire shoulder emperoure shal beare vp pope traine let emperoure bringe bason evver pope emperoure shal geue pope vvater emperoure shal carrie pope firste disshe emperoure shal carrie pope firste cuppe excuse hereof perhaps yee wil saie abuse olde time nowe al sutche disorder wel refourmed therefore maie please remember selfe ceremony touchinge kinges emperours dueties haue benne lately renewed confirmed published abroade worlde woorde woorde without manner alteration euen pope owne pontifical euen nowe newly printed venice yeere lorde thousande fiue hundred three scoare one whereby maie appeare yee ashamed nothinge neuer shameful truthe therefore hardinge woorde countenance coulde ye boldely saie pope euer commaunded sutche seruice donne vnto emperoure yee neuer shewe indifferent credible witnesse doubte pope owne witnesse vnto sufficiente credite owne case muste needes selfe seeme indifferente hereby plainely appeareth al office seruices pope vseth emperoure man therefore auentinus reporteth twoo verse written sometime emperoure lotharius seconde rex venit ad foresauentinus fredericho iurans per vrbis honores post homo fit papac sumit quo dante coronam kinge emperoure commeth gate sweareth honoure cittie afterwarde becommeth pope man whose handes receiueth crowne pipinus mutche abased selfe pope steuin marueile prouerbe common one hande clavveth pope auanced pipine pipine likewise auanced pope hereof haue spoken ye saie emperoure constantine greate vvas footeman pope mutche ashamed vanitie beinge man wisedome learninge ye thus seeke mocke worlde childishe fable ye allege matthaeus hieromonachus proue fable fable yee woulde da e reader eies ye allege woordes greeke vnderstande peeuishe greeke taken peeuishe latine yet greeke fonde ful folie ye ashamed truely turne englishe thus standeth nonlatin alphabet woorship feare lorde blessed peter ye durste make emperoure constantine rude saie peter lorde therefore ye thought better corrupte alter authours woordes yet sutche vaine fable trifle muste ye bringe put v ye saie quite oute doubte hereof wee shal saie hereafter apologie cap diuision hurled vnder table frauncise dandalus duke venice kinge creta cypre faste bounde chaines feede bone amonge dogges hardinge vvere defender passed shame woulde make many shamelesse lie malice hath farre blinded seemeth see becommeth man though feare accompted lier yet shoulde lothe accompted vnhonest man yea specially foolein one litle marginal note hardinge hath vttered foure vntruthes altogeather reade ansvveare let truthe honestie goe deede litle felowes foolishnesse man bringe doctrine saieinges touchinge thinges would fame beleuedsabellicus decadis li historiae rerum ven taru lib great certaine discredite suche open manifest lie truthe hereof finde witnessed sabellicus chiefest chronicle venettars haue writte noble venis named petrus iustinianus citie venus interdicted pope fraucys dandalus sente duke lordes counceil sue absolution time neither kinge cretafranciscus dandalus cypre duke venis pleaseth liinge defender write defence englishe churche written worlde iohannes superantius duke frauncys dandalus wasvntruthe vvas senatour greate honour nexte election vvas chosen duke priuate man time others ambassadour frauncys dandalus findinge pope firste comminge well inclined graunte petition wished thethe offence stoode onely healpinge neighbour beinge bannished man countrie qualitie offence deseruinge moue clemencie pitie aduised selfe plaie pagent caused yron chaine tied aboute necke therewith came pope te dinner put selfe crepe foure like dogge laide downe vnder table longe vntill pope displeasure beinge assuaged obteined pardone countrie vvhereof saie afterwarde surname dogge geuen iustinianus writeth vvho desireth see whole storie shal finde well written saide petrus iustinianus historiae rerum venetarum libro quarto nowe let v see syr defender howe many lye ye make one sentence frauncys dandalus pope hurled vnder table one lie duke venis kinge creta cipres two lie beside notable lie seeme ignorant state venis make duke ambassadour beinge created duke goeth citieyet right state bothe kingedomes hande neither euer state kinge candy cipres state admitteth none kinge amonge time frauncys dandalus candy rebelled cipres yet come vnder gouernement venetian might haue learned eloquent historie petrus bembus wrote venis countrie faste bounde chaines three lie fast boundeal mater ful solemnely proued vvoorthy publisshed proclamation onely caste chaine aboute owne necke whiche mighte haue taken pleasure throwen vnder table gnawe boanes amonge pope doggesal mater ful solemnely proued vvoorthy publisshed proclamation foure lie pope dogges feedinge boanes vnder table al mater ful solemnely proued vvoorthy publisshed proclamation doubte lie vvhether fiue lie ynough one litle sentence three line reporte whosoeuer owne fellowes lieth best game thinke verely defender shamelesse wisheth thicker bearde hide slike chekes blusshinge suche false cause must defended lyinge proctours belied story onely taught also false doctrine chiefe pointes faith lying lesse hurtfull b sarisburie many lie hardinge ye saie farre paste shame sutche hote tragedy cause greatter sturre woulde ye haue keapte benne mater woorthy hearinge authoure apologie benne ouerseene reporte one yeere twoo somme like circumstance substance storie neuerthelesse stil reserued yee remembred somme owne often ouersightes ye coulde shame haue benne terrible againste others appeareth wel al yee haue hitherto sente v ouer insighte matter deepe yee maie often fouly deceiued selfe hardinge bothe selfe place selfe storie reporte one poore note haue committed foure foule grosse errours one breathe altogeather selfe saie hardinge speake none selfe ye thinke beames knowledge shine cleare neuer ouercaste clowde erroure beseche consider wel note specially marked marginefolio thus ye directe v authour storie sabellicus decadis li one litle shorte note saie ye haue sente v foure errours firstedecades euery childe knoweth sabellicus neuer wrote decade onely enneades therefore better acquainted learninge might seeme haue iuste cause saie either yee neuer sawe sabellicus bookes el yee neuer readde wil keepe audite doo saie saieseconde decade one lie ye saie written seconde decade sabellicus authoure selfe saithfranciscus dandalus firste booke writte nienth enneade wil saie saie tvvoo lie againe saie firste booke sabellicus selfe saithe seuenthe booke yet wil folowe saie three lie surplussage likelihoode taleanno ye note also yeere lorde good discretion reste time neither pope clemens francise dandalus yet borne thinge happened moste plainely appeareth al story aboute yeere lorde al notwithstandinge wil hunte greedily aduantages saie saie foruthe lie neither wil saie saie withstandinge somme man perhaps might happen saie hardinge defender hereof either vnhoneste man paste shame lier foole woordes hardinge neither mannerly manly notwithstandinge seeme wel contente pleasante humoure hierome saithehierony aduersus error iohan hierosolymit non aeque inimici audiunt amici qui inimicus est etiam scirpo nodum quaerit enimie frende heare bothe one sorte enimie wil cauil quarrel seeke knotte russhe substance goddes religion standeth reportinge storie hierome saithe sutche captious quarreller audiant non periclitari ecclesiarum statum si ego celeritate dictandi verba aliqua dimiserim hierony de optimo genere interpretandi let vnderstande al haste penninge haue let escape woorde twoo yet shal hazarde state churche god francise dandalus ye saie time duke venice selfe tied chaine aboute owne neckenot duke came owne accorde vpon al foure benne dogge laie downe willingly vnder pope table laie gnawe boanes founde dogge lie therefore ye saie defender vnhoneste man paste al shame lier foole sutche cholerique conclusion hardinge maie wel beseeme doctoure diuinitie howe faireste coloure ye laie vpon matter embassadoure noble common vveale venice laie dogge chaine vnderneathe pope table saie vvillingly vvith al harte sutche submission appease pope ighe indignation recouer fauoure towardes countrie seemeth either arrogante man marueilous angrie pope woulde none submission reconciled dandalus time duke neither harde mater knowe hardinge greate heresie cal duke shortely made dukeaugust de consensu euangelist lib cap augustine saithe dicimus apostolum paulum tharso ciliciae natum ille tunc iam non erat apostolus ita cum audimus discipulos christi inuitatos ad nuptias non iam discipulos sed qui futuri erant discipuli intelligere debemus wee saie paule apostle borne tharsus cilicia yet paule time borne apostle euen iohan wee heare christes disciple bidden mariage feaste cana galilee wee muste vnderstande disciple became afterwarde disciple hierome calleth pamphilus martyr yet time whereof meante hierony de errorib origenis pamphilus deede martyr therefore saith concedamus vt pamphili sit sed nondum martyris ante enim scripsit quam martyrium perpeteretur let v graunte pamphilus booke pamphilus yet martyr wrote booke firste martyr afterwarde likewise againe saithe hierony ezechielem lib cap no pro alexandriam posuimus per anticipationem quae graece nonlatin alphabet appellatur wee steede cittie haue translated cittie alexandriafranciscus dandalus figure called anticipation cittie whiche called afterwarde called alexandria augustine saithe gene augu quaest super genesim quaest written booke genesis hi sunt filij israel qui nati sunt ei mesoporamia cum beniamin longe postea natus sit cum iam transissent bethel appropinquarent bethleem child israel borne mesopotamia yet beniamin reckened one child borne mesopotamia longe afterwarde paste bethel drew towardes bethleem iewrie yet bath benne man hitherto vncourteous euer woulde vse eloquence hardinge calle either moses augustine hierome fooles liers ye woulde indifferently haue weighed mater ye might wel haue thought wee called dandalus duke venice soone afterwarde chosen duke venice wee maie saie doctoure hardinge freely fully professed gospel preached vehemently againste pope neuerthelesse thus preached yet knowen name doctoure let v graunte somme erroure reporte storie yet muste euery man condemned foole lier maie taken like erroure wil hardinge trouble godfather cause geue newe name chrysostome saithematth chrysost matthae homil clemens stromat tvvelue magi vvisemenne came christe yet ye holde commonly three clemens alexandrinus saithe christe preached one yeere yet others saie preached three yeeres others saie preached foure somme saie christe three thirtie yeeres olde somme saie foure thirtie suffered yet tertullian saithetertul contra iud co irenaeus lib onely thirtie yeeres olde irenaeus saithe fourtie christe saithe father hable geue tvvelue legion angel hilarie reporte thereof greate deale auanceth numbercap matth hilarius psalm reckeneth duodecim millia legionum tvvelue thousande legion owne blessed donation constantine whiche ye saie mutche irketh v commaundeth patriarke constantinople subiecte obediente bishop rome yet time imagination fable diuiseddonatio constantini neither patriarke churche constantinople cittie yet builte knowen name folowe dorman allegeth ful solemnely seuenth booke theodoretus dorman fol yet theodoretus selfe neuer wrote onely iue leapte twoo whole bookes beyonde authouredorman fol againe telleth v proper tale terrible example twoo kinges ozias oza yet bothe felowes might soone haue learned oza onely poore leuite kinge selfem hardinge fol b hardinge selfe booke saie councel nice keapte time pope syluester yet athanasius presente councel athanasi apolog hardinge fol saithe syluester time aliue councel summoned emperoure holden time pope iulius againe saie time councel holden nice pope syluester helde likewise councel rome iudgemente athanasius ye saie pope syluester helde councel deade muste al like tale hardinge passe vnder name lie folie gentleman ye saie faste bounde wee imagine fel meekely vvillingly himselfe willingly doubte hardinge knoweth italian courage wil soone beleue francise dandalus gentleman sutche nobilitie embassadoure noble common wealthe soone easily willingly woonne comme creeping yron chaine necke wallow vnder pope table dogge owne immortal shame euerlastinge dishonoure countrie verily woulde neuer haue yeelded selfe sutche villanie benne auoide somme greatter villanie beseeche whether crueltie renne vpon poore man swerde drawen strike kille el force laie cruel handes vpon owne body kille selfe chrysostome saith poore man oftentimes contente woounde feaster owne fleashe ende mooue riche man somme pitie alij capiti suo clauos acutos infigunt alij per ipsum gelu nudo corpore mendicantes petunt chrysostom corin homil alij hisce etiam grauiora ferentes miserabile de se praebent spectaculum dice no illorum caput non configimus vtinam vero tu configeres non enim tam grauis fuisset calamitas nam qui alium interimit longe leuius peccat quam qui iubet aliquem seipsum interficere somme sticke nayles theire owne heades somme goe begginge naked body colde froste somme others suffer thinges greatter crueltie shewe selues miserable behold thou wilt saie sticke nailes theire heades woulde god thou stickedst theire miserie greeuous owne hand killeth committeth greate deale lesse faulte forceth man kil selfe saie wee far greatter greefe vnto noble gentleman vilely dishonoure abase selfe benne driuen thereto force violence enimie sorte emperoure henrie fourthe wel contentevrspergen sabellicus ennead lib willingly waite vpon pope hildebrande canusium three day togeather stande batcheaded barefoote harde froste gate one saith gastinge stocke bothe menne angel might haue licence comme neare emperoure frederichus aenobarbus contented willingely laie necke vnder pope foote wee shal declare hereafterbeno cardinalis poore gentlevvoman contente caste halter aboute owne sonnes necke presente pope hildebrand offended sutche humble subiection craue pardon respecte wereof pope pardoned life commaunded foote striken whiche woounde poore yonge gentleman soone died ye saie lie francise dandalus noble gentleman driuen gnawe boanesgnavve boanes thinke wel hardinge therefore wil rather saie laie togeather vp crummes fel lordes table vnder pope tableno dogges vnder pope table ye saie dogges ye saie lie notwithstanding negatiue harde proue hereat wil greatly striue yet benne seemely sight iudgemente see dogge lieinge man specially noble gentleman embassadoure noble cittie conclude pope clemens fifthe thus pronounced selfe proclaimed vnto whole worlde lawe no superioritatem habemus ad imperium no vacante imperio imperatori succedimus vvee haue soueraintie ouer empiere clem lib de senten iudica cap empiere beinge voide heires apparente emperoure venetian geuen aide restoare one friscus bannished man vnto dukedome ferrara therefore pope clemens interdited al signified pleasure vnto al worlde whither euer came shoulde lawful man onely take theire body selle slaues spoile theire goodes also kille whether right wrog sabellicus writethsabellicus ennead lib vt eos fa esset vnicui que iure iniuria interficere cause al greate doo highe indignation neuer benne slaked noble personage abased selfe tied necke chaine creepe vnder pope table vpon al foure like dogge laste al liketh ende refreashe wittes defender thinne cheekes blusshinge verily hardinge blussheth deede mutche ashamed behalfe see folie god geue grace maie blusshe misusing goddes people lesse ye haue face prophete saith paste blusshing trust defender shal neuer blusshe saierom hierony aduersus pelagianos lib either paule non pudet euangelij christi est enim virtu dei ad salutem ashamed gospel christe power god vnto saluation hierome non pudet nescire quod nescio ashamed thinge knowe graunte mine ignorance apologie cap diuision set emperial crowne vpon emeroure henry si thes heade hande foote foote againe caste crowne saieinge withal hee povver make emperours vnmake againe pleasure hardinge vve denie celestinus note bokes margent pope thisvntruthe story plaine reade ansvveare varne fable deuised rather malice witte ye haue done wel shew v foo e pope set crowne vpon henr e heade rigit lefte standinge sittinge leninge lieinge barefooted vsinge healpe greate toe shodde whether iymme iamme made take vp holde put handsomly raised vp henrie fifth henrie fourth saie sonne againste father ye might haue easily founde owne recordes gregorius heimbur thus gregor heimburgen paschalis papa principe contra henricum concitauit imo roprium filium quem etiam contra patrem fecit per multos episcopos rhem ege coronari vocari henricum quintum pope paschalis raised vp prince germanie againste henrie fourthe nai rather raised vp ovvne sonne also caused many bishoppes adioining rhiene crowned emperoure againste owne father called henrie fifthe case beinge cleare one authoritie maie stand steede many hereof henrie father pitieously complaineth letter written french kingecarion carion saithe hunc henricum filium solicitarunt episcopi vt aduersus patrem insurgeret eum que imperio pelleret bishoppes entised yonge state al christendomeauentinus auentinus saithe multi tum priuatim tum pub louse c many bothe priuately openly cursed pope hildebrande saide hatred ambition troubled worlde vnder coloure christe wrought seates antichriste emperoure tooke longe iourney italie submit selfe vnto pope vrspergen pag sabellicus enneadis lib carion helmoldus beinge canusium saide deapthe winter harde froste waited patiently three day togeather bare heade bare foote pope gate winne fauoure end pope hildebrande beinge sicke findinge selfe case liue sente vnto emperoure besoughte pardonne al iniuries pope succeded neuerthelesse continewed quarrel stil thus pope entisemente sonne raised power deposed father bishoppes discobed weede state pulled crovvne emperial head auncient reuerende prince hauing nowe continewed empiere fiftie whole yeeres bare al thinges quietly saide vnto videat deus iudicet let god see judge dooings laste beinge leaste naked al turned selfe bishop spira saide vnto novve beseeche goddes sake geue prebeude churche hable reade matth palmer doo somme good quiere keapte stil close prison leodium vntil died beinge deade keapte fiue whole yeeres togeather aboue grounde pope commaundemente might buried sutche courtesie founde woorthy emperoure pope hande onely claiminge right pope hildebrande commended many sundrie vertues man saie hathe set foorth woorthinesse onuphrius man yet aliue one al menne would right lothe pointe displease pope perhaps thought winne somme credite aduenturinge wittes desperate cause hesynesius plato bestowed mutche eloquence praise baldenesse apologie cap diuision ilfauouredly monstrously put emperoure frederikes necke vnder feete though sufficiente added texte psalmes thou shalt goe vpon adder cockatrice shalt treade lion dragon vnder thy feete sutche example scorninge contemninge maiestie prince neuer time hearde telle remembrance excepte weene either tamerlane king scythia wilde barbarous creature el sapor kinge persian al notwithstanding pope al peter successours al holy father whose seueral wordes wee muste take good seueral gosples hardinge ye aske put emperoure frederikes necke vnder feete c verily knowe neither selues beleue ye bringe good authoritie farre man doth euil pope bishop emperour king euer defende pope selues men though moste parte liued like angelles al time behaue selues like angel purpose matter quaestio iuris non facti praescriptio cotra haeret muste tel faulte pope acknoweledge tertullian saithe vitium conuersationis non predicationis faulte conuersation doctrinevvhat faulte ye finde pope preachinge neuer preacheth preached al though ye scoffe neuer muche popestreadinge emperours necke al peter successours withstandinge thinge ye saie contrary without makinge lievntruthe shamelesse shal appeare al holy father theire seueral woordes bounde esteme good seueral gospel neuer lesse theire publike decree acknowledge reuerence thinke ought obeied b sarisburie whole storie hereof thus reported carioncarion vsus est frederichus deiectione summa humilitate c emperour frederike vsed al maner submissio humilitie came venice gate churche fallinge downe grouelinge pope suffered selfe trodden pope feete meane pope caused proclamation made woordes prophete dauid spoken christe thou shalt vvalke vpon venemous aspe basiliske thou shalt treade dovvne lion dragon laste absolued non tibi sed petro et mihi petro emperoure meane saide shewed humilitie vnto pope alexander vnto peter thereunto pope answeared et mihi petro bothe peter placinge selfe peter thus carion declareth whole storie somme particulare circumstaces whether fauoure hatred wil iudge neither maie wel thought pope vsed emperoure thus greate fauoure thinke noble cittie venice caused whole tragedie set foorthe imagerie markes churche euerlastinge remembrance facte carried awaie either loue one side hatred woulde openly haue recorded knowen vntruthe thus sapores sommetimeaurelius victor pomponius letus proude kinge persia conquered valerianus romaine emperoure taken prisoner vsed afterwarde moste villanously footestocke made lie downe grouelinge vpon grounde might set foote necke euer shoulde please mounte horsbacke sesostris greate kinge egypte yokte kingesbudaeus de asse matthias michouia de sarmatia cap prince togeather chaines forced violence drawe wagon emperour henrie thirde vpon daie coronation caused foure kinges vindelicia beinge prisoner carrie pannes cauldron kitchin ye saie far man dooth euil pope bishop ye defende pope themselues ye saie menne doo alwaies behaue themselues angel yet notwithstandinge immediately ye saie al vvere pope peter successours holy father beinge true harde mater pope holy platyna textor officina platyna platyna syluestro constantien concilium pope iohn slaine aduouterie pope benedictus liued without either lawe reason defiled peter chaire al kinde shame sine lege ratione vixit petri sedem omnibus probris foedauit ende tooke mon e yenoughe solde popedome platyna saithe pope elected theire learninge holinesse respecte monie frendship bishoppes councel constance pronouce thus pope iohn tepore iuuentutis suae fuit homo malae indolis inuerecudus impudicus c et adhuc dicitur tenetur creditur reputatur pro talus vt talis time youth hath euermore benne man il disposition vnshamefaste vnchaste vnhoneste c stilhitherto named holden beleeued taken reputed sutche one pope euer holy sutche one somme haue liued filthily theire owne daughter somme woorse beastly disorder platyna calleth monstra portenta monster ougle horrible il shapen creature yet saie al peter successours holy father muste needes coumpted although benne great deale woorse dame iohane trowe ye wil haue foreprised number notwithstandinge shee holy mother yet ye maie wel calle holy father deede de maior obedien vnam sanctam glossa thus ye haue prouidentely noted vpon decre talles est quaedam spiritualitas secundum statum quando est statu sanctissimo spiritualissimo hoc statu est solus summus pontifex certaine spiritual holinesse according state moste holy moste spiritual state onely highest bishop pope special statute premunire pope behalfe written thus papa de homicidiodist non glossa vel adulterio accusari non potest vnde sacrilegij instar esset disputare de facto suo nam facta papae excusantur vt homicidia samsonis furta hebraeoru adulteria iacob pope maie neuer accused neither aduouterie murther therefore badde churcherobbinge reason moue mater dooinges euer doo excused murthers committed samson robbery egypte jewes aduouteries iacob againe dist non papa si defint bona acquisita per meritum sufficiunt quae locus praedecessore praestantut pope want good deedes gotten inerites yet good deedes donne peter predecessoure place sufficiente hierome saithe far otherwise diff non est facile non sanctorum filij sunt qui tenent loca sanctorum sed qui exercent opera eorum alwaies child holy menne fitte place holy menne doo woorkes holy menne therefore maie saie harding augustine saith emeritus heretique noli frateraugustin epist ad emeritu noli obsecro te decet eisi alique forte deceat si tame quicqua deceat malos emeritum certe non decet defendere optatum doo brother doo praie commeth although happily maie becomme somme man thing maie becomme wicked yet verily becommeth emeritus defende optatus open wickenesse hierome saith hieron epist ad philemonein si quis hominem qui sanctus non est sanctum esse crediderit dei eum iunxerit socierari christum violat cuius corporis omnes membra sumus qui dicit inquit iustum iniustum iniustum iustum abominabilis est vter que apud deum et rursus qui dicit sanctum non esse sanctum rursus non sanctum esse sanctumprouerb est abominabilis apud deum beleeueth man holy holy ioineth man felowship god dooth villanie christe al member body written bothe calleth iuste man wicked calleth wicked man iuste bothe abominable god likewise saith holy man holy vnholy man holy abominable god apologie cap diuision yf counted traitours whiche doo honoure prince geue al obedience mutche due god woorde doo praie kinde men bee whiche haue onely donne al thinges saide also allowe specially wel donne doo either waie instructe people wee doo reuerence theire magistrate thei honestie appeach v seditious personnes breaker common quiete despisers prince maiestie truely neither put yoke obedience v neither doo disorder realmes doo set vp pulle downe kinges doo wee translate gouernementes geeue wee kinges poison drinke yet holde foorth feete kisse opprobriously triumphe ouer leape theire neckes feete rather profession doctrine euery soulechryso ca ad romanos callinge euer bee bee monke bee preacher prophete apostle ought subiecte kinges magistrate yea bishop rome selfe onlesse wil seeme greater euangelistes prophetes apostle ought bothe acknoweledge cal emperour lorde maister gregor saepe epist olde bishoppes rome liued time grace euer common teachinge also ought obeie prince menne sent god withstandeth withstandeth goddes ordinance doctrine wel seene bookes preachinges also manner modeste behaueour people hardinge doctrine obedience apperteineth specially subiectes bishop rome sittinge due succession chaire petervntruthe manifeste shal appeare spiritual cause haue superiour temporal matter maie one age hath acknowledged emperoure lorde prouince liuedvntruthe enclosed vvere subiecte likevvise aftervvarde constantine al pope liue subiection age maie lorde thereof selfe likewise gregorie might cal mauritius lorde either courtesie custome yet holy father pius fourth shal bounde like ino graue consideration consideration custome hath longe sence ben discontinewed neither gregorie title honour preiudicate vnto selfe spiritual iurisdiction name notwithstandinge gouerned thevntruthe euidente vnto childe whole churche complained maximus made bishop salonae cittie illyrico without auctoritie regarding mauritius emperoure thought haue willed donnelib epistol therefore writeth constantia empresse mutche neither depute made priuie thinge benne donne whiche neuer donne prince emperours predecessours b sarisburie neede speake precisely nicely cause spiritual harding ye knowe pope hath claimed yet claimeth souerainetie onely spiritual cause also teporal shal appeare wil saie ye il proctoure doo wronge goe aboute abridge right wil lightly exclude thinge greedily wil haue included saie pope haue superioure spiritual cause yet iudgement sundrie doctours euen cause spiritual councel superioure pope concil constant concil basilien dist anastasius glossa maie summone iudge geeue sentence againste depose hereafter shalbe declared large thus noted pourpose vpon owne decree cum agitur de fide tunc synodus maior est quam papa case mooued mater faithe saie cause spiritual councel greater pope owne panormitane saithethe pope inferioure prince alleged papa tenetur confiteri illo actu sacerdos est maior illo pope bound make confession dooinge prieste aboue pope againe saithe papa non potest cogere sacerdotem extra de oeniten remiss omnis vtriusque abb vt reuelet cofessionem quia illo actu sacerdos est maior quam papa child knowe faithe confession spiritual cause temporal ye see therefore hardinge iudgemente owne doctoures pope maie haue superioure euen spiritual cause nowe let v weighe greate force reason thus saie pope sitteth peter chaire ergo spiritual cause haue superioure taught thus piece argument childe sophister woulde reason euer gaue sutche power vertue peter chaire temporal mater ye saie maie one age pope hath acknowledged emperoure lorde prouince liued graceously considered pope courtesie humilitie doubte duetie aaron highe bishop israel contented submit selfe moses duetie calle lorde tertullian saith thus exod tertullian ad scapulam colimus imperatorem vt hominem deo secundum solo deo minorem sic enim imperator omnibus maior est dum solo vero deo minor est wee honoure emperours maiestie man nexte vnto god emperoure greater al menne leasse onely true god origen saithe petrusorigen ad roman ca li iohannes nihil habebant quod caesari redderent dixit enim petrus aurum argenium non habeo qui hoc non habet nec caesari habet quod reddat nec vnde sublimioribus potestatibus subiaceat qui vero habet pecunia aut possessiones aut aliquid hoc saeculo audiat omnis anima potestatibus sublimioribus subiaceat peter actor iohn nothing geue vnto emperoure peter saide golde siluer haue none whiche hath hath nothing geeue caesar wherein shoulde subiecte higher power euer hath either monie landes thinge worlde let heare paule saith let euery soule submit selfe higher power proufe practise hereof q no si pope leo thus submitteth selfe humbly vnto levves emperoure no si incomperenter aliquid egimus subditis iustae legis tramitem non conseruauimus vestro admissorum nostroru cuncta volumus emendare iudicio wee haue donne thinge disorderly ouer subiectes haue keapte dewe trade course lawe maiesties iudgemente vve vvil redresse al faultes likewise long pope leo pope gregorie wrote vnto emperoure mauritiusgregor lib epi ad mau ritium impera ecce per seruum vltimum suum vestrum respondebit christus sacerdotes meos manui tuae commisi c ego quidem vestrae iussioni subiectus legem vestra per diuersas terrarum partes trasmitti feci behold thus wil christe answeare beinge humble seruante haue committed priestes vnto thy hand parte subiecte vnto youre maiesties commaundemente haue caused order proclaimed diuers partes worlde gregor lib epist againe saithe christus dominari imperatorem non solum militibus sed etiam sacerdotibus concessit christe hath geuen power vnto emperoure beare rule onely ouer souldiers also ouer priestes againe saithe grego ad maurittum impera et imperatori obedientiam praebui pro deo quod sensi minime tacni haue shewed duetie towardes lorde emperoure touchinge god haue conceled thought paule saithe et euery soule subiecte higher power vpon whiche woordes chrysostome saithe pope inferioure emperoure etiamsi si apostolus etiamsi euangelista etiamsi propheta fiue quisquis tadem fueris neque enim pietatem subuertit ista subiectio thoughe thou apostle though thou euangelist though thou prophete one euer el thou chrysost ad roman homil yet thou subiecte heigher power subiection hinderance godlinesse afterwarde pope beganne looke alofte bothe saie selues also cause others theire parasite saie iohan maior sent q dist sex lib ti glossa romanus pontifex supra reges temporalibus bishop rome aboue kinges euen thinges temporal againe papa totius orbis obtinet potestatem pope hath power al worlde againe solus papa est verus dominus temporalium onely pope true lorde temporal thingesiohan de parisijs de potestate papae againe omnis potestes secularis immediate data est papae al manner temporal povver geuen immediately pope ye saieheruaeus de potesta pap ca pope gregorie might cal emperoure mauritius lorde deutie either custome courtesie yet saie holy father pope pius fourth shal bound like beseech hardinge strange kinde spiritual povver hath pope pius nowe g tte pope gregorie learninge vertue woorthinesse holynesse good reason ca ye allege wherefore christe apostle al holy father martyr shoulde subiect prince onely late pope cardinales shoulde stande free ye saie custome hath longe sithence benne discontinewed one age pope maie acknowledge emperour lorde land dwelleth age maie lorde thereof selfe saie one age pope maie subiecte emperoure age emperoure maie subiecte pope whole onely reason thus wee see obedience towardes prince goeth goddes vvoorde onely age therefore wee maie saie hilarie sommetime saide arian heretiques fides temporum esthilarius ad constantium impera psal non euangeliorum faithe passeth age gospel yet written veritas domini manet aeternum truth lorde endureth one age euer highe pointe learning astronomer skilfully prognosticate betweene emperour pope whether shoulde dominus anni maie wel iustly answeare woordes bernarde omnis anima potestatibus sublimioribus subdita sitbernar epist ad archiepisco senonens si omnis vestra quis vos excepit ab vniuersitate si quis tentat excipere conatur decipere noli illorum acquiescere consilijs qui cum sint christiani christi tamen vel sequi facta vel obsequi dictis probro ducunt ipsi sunt qui vobis dicere solent seruate vestrae sedis honorem c estis vos vestro praedecessore impotentior si non crescit per vos non decrescat per vos hae illi christus aliter iussit gessit reddite inquit quae sunt caesaris caesari que sunt dei deo let euery soule subiecte higher power euery soule soule subiecte wel others notwithstanding dignitie yet hath excepted generalitie would excepte obedience prince seeketh deceiue geue eare theire counselles notwithstandinge christian yet thinke shame either folow christes deedes obeie christes woordes vse saie vnto sir mainteine honoure see c good youre predecessoure see auaunced yet let abased thus saie christe hath bothe taught wrought far otherwise saithe geeue caesar belongeth caesar geeue god belongeth god likewise saithe againe vnto pope eugeniusthe pope limited parte te tamen mosiste vel potius mors ista non coepit vtinam te desinat vides omnem ecclesiasticum zelum feruere sola pro dignitate tuendabernar de consideratione li honori totum datur sanctitati nihil vel parum si causa requirente paulo submissius agere ac socialius te habere teniaueris absit inquiunt non decet tempori non congruit maiestati non conuenit quam geras personam attendito ye wil saie manner rather deathe beganne woulde god mighte ende doo ye see al ecclesiastical zele care standeth onely mainteinance honoure vpon honoure al togeather bestowed vpon holinesse either nothinge litle vpon occasion ye woulde sommewhat submit selfe deale familiarely doo saie meete agreeable time conuenient maiestie consider vvel vvhat state ye beare sutche good lesson yee haue nourture traine pope happen selfe foole sutche schoolinge yee hable make madde gregorie gregor lib epist artic diu ye saie beinge pope gouerned whole churche god complaineth maximus made bishop salonae illyrico without allowance authoritie answered former replie holdeth argument hardinge gregorie complaineth maximus vvas made bishop salonae illyrico vvithout allovvance ergo gregorie ruled vvhole churche schole wil allowe sutche conclusion knowen nicene councel charge whole churche committed three principal patriarkes whereof patriarke rome firste seconde alexandria thirde antioche eche three limited seuerally owne peculiare portion nilus de primatu rom pon nilus greeke writer saithe cum aliae regiones assignatae sint romano aliae alexandrino aliae constantinopolitano prima haberet locum sedis apostolicae romae vt que esset caput sibi ipsi cum plenum potestatenicephor lib cap iustinianus emperoure appointed cittie called iustiniatia prima shoulde haue place apostolique see rome ful power head vnto selfe neither durste forged countrefeite anacletus claime iurisdiction al whole worlde onely portion thus saithe anaclet epist dist iuxta sanctorum omnes episcopi qui huius apostolicae sedis ordinationi subiacent al bishoppes worlde subiecte ordination apostolique see rome likewise gregorie complainte vnto empresse touchinge maximus ye bishop salonae speaketh al bishoppes throughout whole churche god onely sutche bishoppes limited vnto particulare charge thus maketh complainte gregor lib epist si episcopi mei despiciant c mine owne bishoppes lieinge within mine owne peculiare iurisdiction shal despice therefore diuinitie wanted logique hardinge ye framed argument sorte gregorie complained maximus c ergo gregorie gouerned vvhole churche apologie cap diuision saie haue gonne awaie vnitie catholique churche onely matter malice bisides though bee vntrue yet hath somme shewe appearance truthe common people ignorante multitude geeue credite onely thinges true certainetie euen sutche thinges also chaunce whiche maie seeme haue resemblaunce truthe therefore see suttle crafty persones truthe side haue euer contended hotely argued thing likely true intent thei able espie grounde mater mighte caried away least somme pretense probabilitie likelihoode truthe time paste whereas firste christian oure forefather makinge praiers god turne selues towardes easte saide woorshipped sonnetertull apologetico reckened god againe oure forefather saide touchinge immortal euerlastinge life liued none meanes fleashe bloude lambe without spotte saie oure saueour iesus christe enuious creature enimies christes crosse whose onely care bringe christian religion sclaunder al manner way made people beleeue wicked personnes thei sacrificed wanted menne whiche forged false tale vpon saieinge christian made difference amonge selues either age kinde like brute beastes without regarde doo one otheribidem whereas praie heare gospel mette often togeather secrete byplaces bicause rebelles sometime woonte doo like therefore rumour euery spreadde abroade made priuie confederacy tooke counsel togeather either kil magistrate subuerte common wealthe whereas celebratinge holy mystery christes institution tooke breade vvine thei therefore thought manyaugustin contra faust lib cap woorship christe bacchus cere somuche vaine goddes woorshipped heathen like sorte prophane superstition breade vvine thinges beleeued many bicause thei true deede coulde vntrue bicause like bee true certaine shadowe truthe mighte easily deceiue simple fashon likewise doo menne sclaunder v heretiques saie wee haue leafte churche felowship christe bicause thei thinke true doo mutche force bicause ignoraunte folke mighte perhaps somme waie appeare true wee haue deede put oure selues aparte heretiques woonte churche christe al good menne oughte doo infection naughty personnes hypocrite neuerthelesse pointe triumphe maruciloully bee churche churche christes spouse piller truthe arke noe without hope saluation contrariewise saie wee bee renegates haue torne christes seate wee plucked quite body christe haue foresaken catholique faithe leaue nothinge vnspoken maie neuer falsely malitious saide againste v yet one thinge neuer hable truely saie haue swarued either woorde god apostle christe primitiue churche surely wee haue euer iudged primitiue churche christes time apostle holy father catholique churche neither make wee doubte name no arke christes spouse piller vpholder al truthe yet fixe therein whole meane oure saluation doubtlesse odious mater one leaue felowship whereunto hathe benne accustomed specially menne whoe though yet leaste seeme called christian saie truely wee doo despise churche men euer ordered day partely name sake selfe partely gospel iesus christe hath benne therein truely purely set oorthe neither departed therefrom necessitie mutche againste willes hardinge vvee graunt olde time slaunders made vpon faithefull like slaunder made v vpon matter whereof ye speake let v graunt ye haue deede put selues aparte gone contagion naughtie person hypocrite thinge laie charge though suche great number ye shall neuer able prooue yet christes owne sentence ye muste doo thatthe scribe phariseis commaunded people refuse christes companie iohan vvas people bounde folovve whiche sit chaire moses bid doo although hypocrite scribe phariseis whome christe spake c shal inoughe doo successours peter bid doo folowe saieinges dooinges primitiue churche continewed time successours peter whose faithe neuer faile christe praied whomevntruthe christe neuer gaue peter sutche special priuilege onely made shepeherde feede flocke sheepe lambes christea strange kinde diuinitie sutche peter paul neuer knevve requireth obeie peter paule obeie sitteth chaire vvhere ye saie odious matter forsake v yet haue foresaken v ye confesse ye despise churche yet graunt ye haue departed standeth togeather remember ye ye saie knowe ye ye doo vvho regarde woorde whiche one breathe saie vnsaie odious doo ye ye despise churche departe ye b sarisburie christe saithe departing pope scribe phariseis sitte moses chaire doo saie doo doo ergo saie wee maie departe awaie pope euer fare conclusion hardinge verily premiss yee compare pope cardinalles scribe phariseis yet scribe phariseis sate chaire taught lavve pope cardinalles sitte stil teache nothinge notwithstandinge let v wel allowe comparison matth ye maie remember christe also saithe woe vnto yee scribe phariseis shutte vp kingedome heauen menne neither doo enter selues wil suffer faine woulde enter woe vnto yee blinde guide woe vnto haue taken awaie keie knovvledge likewise saithe vnto disciple beware leauen scribe phariseis let goe matth matth blinde leader blinde sitte moses chaire truely rightly instructe people open vnto lawe mosesaugust de sermone domi monte lib augustine saithe hoc ipsum quod bona dicebant ea quae dicebant vtiliter audiebantur fiebant non erat ipsorum cathedram enim inquit mosi sedent spake good thinges vnto people thinges saide profitable hearer dooers selues christe saithe sitte vpon moses chaire againe saithe sedendo super cathedram mosis legem dei docent augustin iohan tracta ergo per illos deus docet sua vero illi si velint docere nolite audire nolite facere certe enim tale sua quaerunt non quae iesu christi sittinge vpon moses chaire teache lawe god therefore god teacheth meane wil teache thinges owne heare doo certainely sutche menne seeke owne thinges perteine christe jesus ye see therefore hardinge wee bounde heare pope cardinalles like scribe phariseis absolutely without exception euer liste saie onely longe teache lavve god augustine saithe vvee maie neither heare folovve theire counsel hereunto ye thought good adde force supplie aide youre wantes christe saide vnto peter haue praied thee thy faithe shal neuer faile ergo saie pope neuer erre waie reasoninge trowe yee learned peter de palude woorthy doctoure side reasoneth ego rogaui pro tepetrus de palude de potestate pp articul petre vt fides tua non deficiat ex quo habetur quod romana ecclesia fide errare non potest nec de eius fide dubitare licet sed omnibus est sequenda peter haue praied thee thy faithe maie faile woordes wee taught churche rome cannot erre faithe neither lawful doubte faithe churche al cause wee bounde folowe augu de quaest noui testamen quae augustine saithe nunquid pro petro rogabat pro iohanne iacobo non rogabat vt coeteros raceam leaue reste christe praie peter praie iohn iames againe saithe august de verbis domini euange secund lucam sermo hac nocte postulauit satanas vexare vos ficut triticum egorogaui patrem pro vobis ne deficiat fides vestra nighte hath satan begged threashe wheate haue praied father peter onely faithe maie faile saithe origen nunquid audebimus dicere quod aduersus vnum petrum non praeualiturae sint portae inferorum aduersus coeteros autem apostolosorigen matth tract ac praefectos ecclesiae sint praeualiturae petro solo dantur christo claues regni coelorum nec alius beatorum quisquam ea accepturus est omnia quae que prius dictum sunt quae que sequuntur velut ad petrum dictum sunt omnium communia maie wee dare saie gate helle shal preuaile onely againste peter shal preuaile againste apostle ruler churche key kingedome heauen geuen onely peter shal holy man el receiue nay al thinges bothe saide also folowe spoken peter common belonge vnto al therefore ye saie churche rome maie wee saie likewise churche hierusalem iames churche ephesus iohn like apostolique church notwithstandinge possession turke haue receiued religion mahomete yet bicause christe hathe praied faithe shal neuer faile ye tel v shalbe yenough doo successoures peter bid doo christe requireth obeie peter paule obeie sitteth chaire waie sure shorte doubte al wel though wee beleeue neither peter paule euer writte goddes woorde yet saie vve folovve pope vvee cannot erre thus mutche harding ye hable warrante v gospel christe requireth v obedient peter paule onely pope holinesse keepeth residence theire chaire diuinitie woordes ye euer recante ye marre flower market wee neede saie thus saithe lorde shalbe sufficient vsgalat saie thus saithe pope yet paule far aduentureth truthe certainetie doctrine doubteth saie angel heauen preache vnto gospel wee haue preached accursed chrysost caput ad galat vpon whiche woordes chrysostome hathe noted thus non dixit si contraria annuntiauerint aut totu euangelium subuerterint verum si paulum euangelizauerint praeter euangelium quod accepistis etiamsi quiduis labefactauerint anathema sint paule saithe preache contrarie gospel ouerthrowe whole gospel preache little thinge bisides gospel ye haue receiued ouerthrovve thinge vvhat euer accursed dist ca final therefore hierome saithe ea doceat episcopus quae deo didicerit non ex proprio corde c let bishop teache thinges hath learned god owne harte fansie chrysostome saithe chrysostom timoth homi plus aliquid dicam ne paulo quidem obedire oporret si quid dixerit proprium si quid humanum sed apostolo christum se loquentem circumferenti wil telle greatter mater wee maie obeie paule selfe speake thinge owne speake onely man wee muste beleeue apostle christe carrieinge christe aboute speakinge within therefore panormitane saithe de electio elec potesta significasti abb concernentibus fidem etiam dictum vnius priuati esset praeferendum dicto papae si ille moueretur melioribus rationibus noui veteris testamenti quam papa mater concerninge faithe saieinge one priuate man hearde saieinge pope priuate man moued better reasones newe olde testamente pope vvee lenger obeie peter paule geeue eare onely cropen theire chaire suche diuinitie neither peter paule euer taught v laste al vpon somme good aduauantage ye beginne triumphe remember yee saie ye ye saie knowe yee ye doo wil regarde youre woorde whiche one breathe saie vnsaie odious leaue felowship doo yee yee despise churche departe ye saie vnsaie propertie harding oures yee haue saide vnsaide yet shame thought yee woulde contente saie againe wee despise churche house god mislike defacinge disorderinge churche christe reproued priestes phariseis turned temple god caue theeues matth yet neuerthelesse despised saide father house leaue wicked felowship beare name shewe selfe saith comme people leste ye partetakers sinnes leste ye receiue plague apologie cap diuision put case idole sette vp churche god desolation whiche christe prophesied comme stoode openly holy prodigalitie fonde expense vtterly wasted whole stocke treasurie yet neuer thinge wicked farre reason lightely mighte couered defended name churche waspes also make honycombes wel bee wicked men haue company like churche god yet al streight vvaie people god vvhiche called people god neither al israelite many comme israel father august sermon contra arianos arians notwithstanding heretiques yet bragged alone catholiques augustinus ep ad vince epiphani lib haere calling al reste ambrosians nowe athanasians nowe iohannites nestorius saith theodorete al heretique yet couered selfe nonlatin alphabet witesozomen lib cap certaine cloke colour true right faith ebion though agreed opinion samaritanes yet saith epiphanius woulde needes called christian mahometistes daie al al history make death bicause fel bishoppes priestes must thinke fro catholique churche bicause made newe alteration religion contrarie bishoppes priestes willes yea al spurninge earnestly hardinge vvhat foolishe theire palladium remained emongest tolde straunge newesto sit place christe harding made pope christes vicare general throughout whole churche2 thess bade keepe possession steede christe muste wee needes thinke whole state christes churche hangeth onely pope pope pope churche christe churche muste youre simple woorde nowe taken prophesie antichriste shal neuer enter goddes temple pope bee throwen oute fable woulde haue benne better furnished credite verily whereas saie vvee put case idole set vp churche god vvhat somme theefe pirate inuade possesse no arke neither vvhat fonde woulde seeme make put case impossible paule saithe antichriste shal sitte churche god shewe selfe aboue al worshipped called god saie beinge theefe pirate shal enter perforce no arke nowe hardinge antichriste maie sitte place god mutche maie sitte place peter wil saie pope antichriste god wil reuele timeapocalyp shalbe knowen iohn saithe wisedome hath vnderstandinge let recken number beaste vpon whiche woordesirenaeus li cap vltimo irenaeus welneare fifteene hundred yeeres agoe saithe thus name antichriste expressed number shalbe latinus addeth hoc valde verisimile est quoniam verissimum regnum hoc habet vocabulum gregor lib epist sacerdotum paratus est exercitus irenae lib cap penulti ioachimus abbas gregorie saith antichriste shal claime called vniuersal bishop shal haue garde priestes attende vpon againe irenaeus saithe antichristus cum sit seruus tamen adorari vult vt deus antichriste notwithstandinge slaue yet wilbe woorshipped god ioachimus abbas saithe antichristus iampridem natus est romae altius extolletur sede apostolica antichriste longe sithence borne rome yet shal higher anaunced apostolique see thus described shal sitte place christe shal maineteine possession againste christe thess christe shal comme vvith holy angel shal destroie vvith breath mouthe ye allege priesthoode melchisedech serueth smal pourpose wee knowe pope christe alone prieste euer augustin lib quaesti quae accordinge order melchisedech augustine saithe ipse est sacerdos noster aeternum secundum ordinem melchisedech qui semetipsum obtulit holocaustum pro peccatis nostris eius sacrificii similitudinem celebrandam suae passionis memoriam commendauit christe oure prieste euer order melchisedech whiche hath offered vp selfe sacrifice oure sinnes hath deliuered vnto v similitude likenesse sacrifice donne remembraunce passion likewise againe saithe eadem quaestione holocausti eius imaginem ad memoriam passionis suae ecclesia celebrandam dedit vt esset sacerdos
