aeternum non secundum ordinem aaron sed secundum ordinem melchisedech christe hathe geuen image resemblaunce sacrifice bee keapte churche remembraunce passion might prieste euer order aaron order melchisedech howe itarticul diuision touchinge whole mater haue answeared large former replie apologie cap diuision wherefore like written hercules olde time forced striuing antaeus huge giant lifte quite vp earth mother ere coulde conquert euen muste aduersaries heaued mother vaine colour shadowe churche wherewith disguise defende selues otherwise bee brought yelde vnto woorde god therefore saithe ieremie prophete make sutche great boaste temple lorde vaine confidence lie angel also saithe apocalyps saie ievves bee synagog sathan christe said phariseis vaunted selues kinrediohn bloude abraham ye father diuel resemble father abraha mutche saie ye menne yee would faine called ye beguile people vaine title abuse name churche ouerthrowing churche hardinge heaue v while ye wil while ye may ye shal neuer remoue v whiche stedfastnes truste stande god grace last breath heaue v al force cunning malice flatterie policy euer ingens ye haue ye shal neuer able ouerthrowe house conscience builded vpon sure rockemath let gourders raine come downe al heretikes let floudes worldly rage thrust let windes sathans temptation blowe worste house shal ouerthrowen b sarisburie mrom hardinge paule saith vnto noli altum sapere sed time presume selfe stande awe sutche woordes woulde rather haue becommed themhierem said sommetime vnto prophete hieremie verbum quod locutus e nobis nomine domini non audiemus sed faciendo faciemus omne verbum quod egredietur de ore nostro wee wil neuer heare woorde thou speakest vnto v name lorde luke nonlatin alphabet wee wil surely doo euer thing shal passe owne mouthes thus written saide lorde shal beare rule ouer maister v like mildenesse spirite wilful philosopher saide non persuadebis etiamsi persuaseris ye shal make beleue though doo beleue constancie good thinges vertue frowardnesse wilfulnesse vice vowe thus youre owne destruction fallen maie rise againe lorde hable raise vp make vessel glorie ye knowe good pourpose god hath appointed speake ouer mutche strength mounte knowe vpon howe light occasion hath benne moued folowe rather paules counsel feare tremblinge woorke youre owne saluation philip hieremi luke waie ye walke youre owne harte hande god suffer goddes truthe preuaile vnderstand kingedome god come vnto apologie cap diuision mennes parte beni haue praied thee peter c first haue clearely truely proued romishe churche true right instructed churche god doo order daie doothe agree primitiue churche christe apostle holy father whiche wee doubte deede true catholique churche hardinge ye would v proue romaine churche true churche god ye graunt true churche god gospel sheweth christe praied peter made successours thereluke vaine hope christe praied apostle lesse peter vvhat followeth hereof must needes abide true euer except christes praier heard paule likewise wttnesseth romaine faithe preached vniuersal worlderom li epi geuing manifest prophecie romaine faithe catholique faithe alone cyprian calleth agreing bishop rome communicating catholicae ecclesiae vnitatem c allowing firme holding vnitie catholique churche writing antonianus booke accompteth one thing communicate cornelius b rome communicate catholique churche vaine saie hath erredvntruthe vvhere holy ghost euer make sutche promisse holy ghost hath signified erre b sarisburie wil saie youre wittes hardinge yee wrote theise thinges wel maie saie logique diuinitie appeareth youre reckening ye make greate accoumpte christe saie praied peter ergo romaine faithe neuer faile fewe child woulde willingly make sutche argumentes ye presume mutche simplicitie ignoraunce youre reader thinke christe praied onely peter body el thinke christes praiers tooke place none al apostle onely peter awake shame shake dreames christe selfe saithe father praie onely iohn also woorde shal beleue augustine thus reporteth praier alleaged ego rogaui paitem pro vobis augustin de verbis euangelio secun lucam serm augusti quae nou testam quae origen mat tracta rom ne deficiat fides vestra haue praied vnto father peter onely youre faithe maie faile againe saithe nunquid pro petro rogabat pro iohanne iacobo non rogabat christe praie peter praie iohn iames certainely origen saithe likewise haue alleged omnia quae que prius dictum sunt quae que sequuntur velut ad petrum dictum sunt omnium communia al thinges either paste folowe spoken vnto peter common vnto al apostle paule saithe vnto romaine youre faithe spoken throughout worlde cyprian saithe agreeing bishop rome vnitie catholique churche yet maie please remembred waie cyprian reproued cornelius stephanus bothe bishoppes rome tolde bothe deceiued therefore woulde agree vnto neuerthelesse hereof ye conclude thus ergo holy ghoste hath signified churche rome cannot erre pitieth harding youre behalfe see howe streite miserable hole ye faine creepe faithe constancie romaine olde time nobilitie empiere cittie published throughout whole worlde yet holy ghoste euer tel therefore churche rome shoulde neuer erre woorde promisse reuelation yee saie faithe romaine heard throughoute whole worlde greate capitol bewtie princely buildinges whiche notwithstanding nowe made smoothe euen groundeesai likewise written hierusalem de sion exibit lex verbum domini de hierusalem lawe shal comme foorth sion woorde god hierusalem cittie antioche faithful firste called christian chrysostom ad popul antio homi nazian epist nazian ad heronem therefore chrysostome calleth cittie caput totius orbis head whole worlde thus eusebius samosatensis called regula fidei rule standerde faithe thus athanasius called orbis oculus fundamentu fidei eie world fundation faithe would ye hereof conclude harding therfore faithe church neuer faile ye knowe al notwithstandinge church wel hierusalem antioche also asia syria graecia al easte nowe subiecte turke scarcely fewe leafte dare professe name christe fonde paradise saie bicause ye faith christe therefore nowe ye neuer erre sutche fantastical paradise built vnto selueshierem math cried olde time euen temple god temple god vvee child abraham euer wel cosidereth storie time shal soone finde cried moste temple god moste shamefully abused defaced temple god claimed moste called child abraham forsaken bothe faithe life abraham christe saithe vnto themiohan becomme child diuel sutche fantasie saide non peribit lex sacerdote nec consilium sapiente hierem nec verbum propheta lawe shal departe prieste counsel wise vvoorde prophete god saith vnto obstupescent sacerdotes prophetae terrebuntur lex peribit sacerdote consilium senioribus nox vobis erit pro visione tenebrae pro diuinatione youre priestes shalbe amased youre prophetes shalbe wittes ende lawe shal perishe priestehieremi ezechiel miche galat pet esai counsel shal wante elder ye shal haue nighte steede vision darkenesse steede prophesie paule saithe vnto galathians ye beganne wel hathe thus bewitched yee shoulde obeie truthe peter saithe false prophetes emongest people olde time euen emong shalbe false prophetes bringing sectes perdition sutche chaunge prophete esaie coplaineth quomodo facta est meretrix ciuitas fidelis howe faithful cittie become harlot deceiue thus youre selfe harding vaine hope harken rather voice lorde put nothing worde take nothing turne neither right hande leafte shal ye sure ye shal erre apologie cap diuision partes wee could haue iudged ignoraunce error superstition idolatrie mennes inuentions commonly disagreeing holy scripture either please god sufficient thobteining euerlasting saluation could ascertaine selues woorde god written time onely afterwarde againe ought abrogated put away el saienges comaundementes god ought subiecte man wilgoddes vvoorde mutable whatsoeuer god saithe commaundethe excepte bishop rome wil commaunde must taken voide vnspoken coulde haue brought selues beleue thinges graut benne cause al shoulde haue leafte mennes companie hardinge god forbid either ye christen man shoulde iudge ignorance errour superstition idolatrie mennes inuentions contrarie scripture either pleased god sufficient saluation bicause ye laie catholique churchevntruthe inclosed knovve vvilful reade ansvveare saie lesse ye false liers diuelishe slaunderers andthus partely hardinges doctours saie partely hardinge selfe shal appeare teacheth god worde written time onely commaundementes subiecte man wil god saienges preceptes voide except bishop rome ratifie would saie vnto least fie shame thinke preuaile saide impudent common harlotierem fie shame vvho maie plainely see scripture verified frons mulieris meretricis facta est vobis ye haue gotten impudent face harlot b sarisburie hardinge hath pleased bestowe large liueries youre false liers diuelishe sclaunderers impudent face common harlot fies shame c wherein man may iustly grudge liberal youre owne first youre doctrine ignorance highly pleaseth god sufficient saluation bisides general practise youre whole churche yee maie soone cal minde one youre dearest frendes honourable audience long sithence openly published name behoufe al brother secrete mysterie bottome youre diuinitie ignorance mother deuotion knowe harding greate many bothe worthy honourable hable witnesse neither false lie diuelishe sclaunder concerninge superstition idolatrie neede many wordes thinge selfe wel hable proue selfe looketh youre church maie easily onely see eies also feele finger goddes holy vvorde youre learning mutable serueth onely time youre owne doctoure cardinalis cusanus woulde soone haue taught notwithstandinge maie scarcely seeme lawful beinge learned man substance youre owne doctrinecardinal cusanus de authoritate eccle concilij supra cotra scripturam pleade ignorance cardinal cusanus woordes scripturae adaptatae sunt ad tempus varie intelliguntur ita vt vno tempore secundum currentem vniuersalem ritum exponantur mutato ritu iterum sententia mutetur scripture applied vnto time maie haue sundrie vnderstandinges one time maie expouded one waie accordinge vniuersal current order churche order broken meaning scripture maie chaunged looke better bookes hardinge ye shal see herein neither lie sclaunder holy scripture god youre diuinitie authentical farther ratified pope ye might haue learned syluester prierias syluester prieria contra lutherum maister pope palaice thus writeth doctrina romanae ecclesiae romani pontificis sacrum scriptura robur trahit authoritatem holy scripture taketh strengthe authoritie doctrine romaine churche bishop rome againe saithe indulgentiae authoritate scripturae non innotuere nobis sed authoritate romanae ecclesiae romanorum que pontificum quae maior est pardonnes knowen v authoritie scripture authoritie romaine churche bishoppes rome whiche greater authoritie scripture ye saie lie sclaunders ye offer greate wronge owne doctours neuerthelesse ye shal happen crie impatience choler fy shame impudente face common harlottes remember selfe haue written immediately touching owne wordes recante yee maie denie yee maie thus saie h fol b christe novve requireth obeie peter paule saie worde god obe e vvho sitteth theire chaire wee forge wordes hardinge youre owne folkes wil thinke yee haue modeste matrones face ye speake willingly youre selfe nowe ye see hardinge teacheth goddes vvoorde vvas vvritten onely time goddes commaundementes authentical ratified pope therefore hencefoorth ye maie spare lie sclaunders crie oute fy shame somme occasion shalbe offeredcardin cusan de authorita eccle concil supra contra scripturam deede cardinal cusanus saithe veritas adhaeret cathedrae quare membra cathedrae vnita pontifici coniuncta efficiunt ecclesiam truthe cleaueth faste pope chaire therefore member vnited vnto chaire ioined vnto pope make churche apologie cap diuision touching haue donne departe fro churche whoes errours proued made manifest worlde whiche churche also already euidently departed goddes worde yet depart mutche selfe fro errours thereof doo disorderly wickedly quietly soberly haue donne nothing herein doctrine either christe apostle neither churche god sutche maie dusked somme spot asketh sometime reparation el neede many assembly councelles without whichein concil lateranens sub iulio saithe egidius christian faithe hable stande looke saithe hovve often councelles discontinued often churche destitute christe hardinge churche pointes faith necessarie saluation erreth denie andvntruthe ye make youre ovvne vvarrante christe neuer made sutche promisse churche rome vpon warrant christes promise tel al assuredly ye shal neuer able proue councels kept bishoppes bee made prouidence god whiche prouideth partly meanes partly romaine faithe chaire rocke shal stande euer ad quos saithe cyprian speaking rome perfidia non potest habere accessum vntruthe grounded vpon grosse ignorance hard fovvly mistaketh cyprian vvhole meaning whiche vnfaithfulnes haue accesse saithe onely shal haue accesse haue accesse b sarisburie seemeth hardinge ye haue benne brought vp vnder somme poore vnskilful surgian applie one salue euery soare soeuer bee alleged sufficient answeare churche rome erreth hath erred erre pourpose ye haue brought v certaine wordes cyprian farre bisides authours meaninge whereby appereth sommetimes ye allege authority father considering neither ende spake meante cyprian saithe vnto romaine vnfaithfulnesse haue accesse speaketh vnfaithfulnesse faithe doctrine erroure haue imagined onely vnfaithfulnesse reporte cause writinge epistle shorte certaine lewde felowes refusinge stande iudgemente bishoppes owne countrie aphrica churche rome erre appealed fledde rome many vntrue forged tale winne somme credite cause hereunto cyprian saithe romaine godly wise men wil soone hable espie falsehedde vnfaitheful reportes lewde tale haue accesse vnto ye considered either occasion writting whole drifte lettercyprian lib epist bare woordes lie ye mighte easily haue seene onely cyprian meaning woordes post ista adhuc insuper pseudoepiscopo sibi ab haereticis constituto nauigare audent ad petri cathedram vnde vnitas sacerdotalis exorta est schismaticis profanis literas ferre nec cogitare eos esse romanos quorum fides apostolo praedicante laudata est ad quos perfidia habere non possit accessum hauing false bishop appointed vnto heretiques dare take shipping vnto peter chaire vnto principal churche whence priestely vnitie grewe firste carrie letter schismatiques lewde menne neither cosider romaine people whose faith praised paule apostle vnto vvhome vnfaithfulnesse reportes tale haue accesse yee doubte exposition reade woordes touchinge goeinge epistle eadem epist roman cum mendaciorum suorum merce nauigarunt quasi veritas post eos nauigare non posset quae mendaces lingua rei certa probatione conuinceret saile rome marchandise lie though truethe coulde saile proufe certaintie might controlle lieing tongue vnfaithfulnesse cyprian speaketh vnfaithefulnesse faithe doctrine nowe touchinge appealinge fleeing rome leste yee shoulde thinke occasion woordes cyprian alloweth thinketh wel ye shal finde epistle vtterly misliketh condeneth thus saithecyprian eade epist acquum est pariter iustu vt vniuscuius que causa illic audiatur vbi crimen admissum est meete right euery mannes cause pleaded countrie faulte committed c againe oportet eos quibus praesumus non circumcursare meete ouer whome wee haue jurisdiction renne aboute worlde meaneth rome againe nisi paucis desperatis perditis minor videtur esse authoritas episcoporum aphrica constitutorum c onlesse fewe desperate wicked menne thinke authoritie bishoppes aphrica lesse authoritie bishoppes rome woordes cyprian maketh bishop rome equal authoritie vvith selfe bishoppes wherefore muste conclude woordes cyprian epistle haec est frater vera dementia non cogitare quod mendacia non diu fallant nocte tam diu esse quoad illucescat dy brother deede madnesse thinke lie cannot longe deceiue nighte lasteth longer vntil daie beginne springe apologie cap diuision perile harme maie come churche neede reteine pourpose name bishoppes nowe commonly vsed among sheepe maie straie bee called shepeheardes cittie maie bee betraied bee called vvarchemenne bee nothing maie renne ruine bee called pillers anon firste creation worlde churche god began spreade abroade instructed heauenly worde whiche god selfe pronounced owne mouthe also furnished diuine ceremony taught sprite god patriarch prophetes cotinued euen til time christe shewed selfe v fleshe notwithstanding often good god meane howe horribly churche darkened decaied churche al fleashe vpon earthe defiled owne waie amongest numbre vvhole vvorlde onely eight persones neither al chaste good neither goddes wil shoulde saued aliue vniuersal destruction mortalitie elie prophete lametabldy bitterly made moane3 reg onely selfe leafte al whole worlde whiche truely dewly worship godesai esaie saide siluer goddes people churche vvas become drosse cittie vvhiche aforetime ben faithful vvas novv become harlot vvas parte sounde throughout vvhole body head foote el christe selfe saide house god vvas made phariseis priestes math denne theues truthe churche euen cornefilde except bee eared manured tilled trimmed wil stede wheate bringe foorthe thistle darnel nettels cause god sende euer among bothe prophetes apostle laste al sonne might bringe home people right waie repaire anewe tottering churche erred hardinge like place haue ben already alleaged olde time catholiques donatistes augustine sheweth late yeeres youre scholemaister iohn caluine geneua vve neede studie newe answeres argument made suche place mutche fitter purpose sithe wel answered augustine oftentimes saithe goddes worde rebuketh wicked sortes churche sode vnitate eccle ca though al suche none al remained good thereby warned certaine number called al mutche sale al child hel sir churche beginning worlde general drowning smal number synagog sometime quite extinguished must therefore folowe church also god hath geuen christe sonne endes worlde possessionpsalm maie nowe brought fewe faile altogether vvhere churche saie ye al worlde eight person onely saued aliue vniuersal destruction forsooth no arke nowe haue webut arke churche rome no arke also whiche euer abideth drowned neither prophetes apostle sent christe came selfe repaire newe churche whiche faithe wholy erred sent came shoulde wholly erre b sarisburie truethe churche fevve ye saie holy scripture woorde al often vsed steede many thus ye saie fared synagog ievves faithful sommetimes broughte vnto smal number sommetimes vtterly decaied consumed nought sense ye saie elia coplained3 regum prophetes god al slaine onely le te aliue nowe ye saie churche maie brought fevve god hath geuen christe sonne endes worlde bee possession yet christe selfe beste knewe reache limites possession saithe thus sonne manne shal comme luke ambrosi lucam lib apocalyp thinke shal finde faithe worlde whereupon ambrose saithe tunc fides rara vt ipse quasi addubitans dominus ista dixerit shal faithe geason lorde spake woordes doubting therof whether faithful leaft iohn reuelatios saith mulier fugit solitudinem vbi habet locum paratum deo wooman whereby meante synagog ievves churche christe fleeth wildernesse hath place prouided god whiche woordes meante time ignorance persecution churche without countenaunce thessal vnknowen paule saithe daie lorde shalbe departing faithe christe appeareth decaie churche shalbe vniuersal remanentes shal bee many vincentius lirinensis therefore vincentius lirinensis putteth case wise quid si nouella aliqua contagio iam non portiuncula tantum sed totam pariter ecclesiam commaculare conetur tunc item prouidebit vt antiquitati inhaereat somme newe corruption goe aboute inuade onely somme portion churche also whole vniuersal churche altogeather must christian man settle selfe cleaue antiquitie saie folowe primitiue churche apostle ancient father case would neuer haue moued onlesse thought vvhole vniuersal churche might happen somme erroure corrupted surely chrysostomechrysostom ad corinth homil speakinge state churche sawe time saithe thus videtur ecclesia hodie mulieri quae mansuetudine veteri exciderit similis quae que symbola tantum foelicitatis illius quaedam referat arca scrinia rerum pretiosissimarum adhuc retinens thesauro destituta huic mulieri ecclesia hodie videtur similis churche daie like vnto woman hath quite loste al olde modestie beareth onely certaine badge token former felicitie beinge vtterly berefte treasure keepeth onely case box pretious thinges suche vvoman churche daie maie likenedhieronym vita malchi likewise hierome speaking sawe experience time saithe thus ecclesia postquam ad christianos principe peruenit potentia quidem diuitijs maior sed virtutibus minor facta est churche comme christian prince deede greatter wealth richesse vertue holinesse lesse therefore saith chrysostome haec dicochrysostom ad populum antioch homil ne quis miretur ecclesiam propter multitudinem sed vt ipsam probatam reddere studeamus thus mutche tel wee shoulde auaunce churche bicause multitude encrease people wee shoulde endeuour adourne vertue nowe bernard conuersione pauli sermo ye saie churche nowe neuer brought fewe bernarde saithe thus vnto god waie moane coniurasse videtur contra te vniuersitas populi christiani minimo v que ad maximum planta pedis v que ad verticem non est sanitas vlla egressa est iniquitas senioribus iudicibus vicarijs tuis qui videntur regere populum tuum lorde vniuersal companie christian people seemeth haue conspired againste thee lovvest vnto highest sole foote vnto croune heade whole place iniquitie wickednesse gonne foorthe thy elder iudges ci ur ab holco sapier lectio thy vicares thought rule thy people againe saithe intestinalis insanabilis est plaga ecclesiae wounde churche inwarde paste recouer likewise baptista mantuane complaineth vnto pope leo sancte pater succurre leo baptis mantuanus fastor respublica christi labitur aegrotat que fides iam proxima morti healpe holy father leo christes common wealth churche falling downe faithe sicke like die likewise saithe fortalitium fidei lib wrote forte faithe et si hoc daemonum bello cadant religiosi principe milites praelati ecclesiastici subditi tamen semper manent aliqui quibus saluatur veritas fidei iustificatio bonae conscientiae et si non nisi duo homines remanerent mundo eis saluaretur ecclesia quae est vnitas fidelium battel diuelles notwithstandinge godly prince souldiers ecclesiastical prelate subiectes ouerthrowen yet euermore somme remaine whome truethe faithe righteousnesse good conscience preserued although remained tvvo menne vvorlde yet twoo churche god shoulde saued vvhiche churche vnitie faitheful churche god often compared mooneaugust epist sometimes ful round bright glorious sommetimes wholy shadowed drowned darkenesse yet notwithstanding consumed substance remaineth stil augustine saith aliquando solo abel ecclesia erat et expugnatus est fratre malo perdito caimaugust psal aliquando solo enoch ecclesia erat translatus est ab iniquis sommetime churche onely abel destroied brother vvicked caim sommetime churche onely noch translated wicked owne panormitane saithe extra de electione significas abb possibile est quod vera fides christi remaneret vno solo atque ita verum est dicete quod fides non deficit ecclesia hoc patuit post passionem christi nam fides remansit tantum beata virgine quia omnes alij scandalizati sunt tamen christus ante passionem orauerat pro petro vt non deficeret fides sua ergo ecclesia non dicitur deficere nec etiam errare si remanet vera fides vno solo possible trewe faithe christe maie remaine one alone true saie faithe faileth churche thinge appeared christes passion faithe remained onely blessed virgin al reste bothe apostle others offended yet christe praied peter passion faithe shoulde faile therefore vve maie saie churche faileth erreth faithe remaine one alone againe august psal augustine saithe non tamen propter ho remanebit christus sine haereditate nouit dominus qui sint sui c yet shal christe bicause wicked remaine without enheritance lord knovveth vvho ovvn apologie cap diuision leste somme man saie foresaid thinges happened onely time lawe shadowes infancie truth lay hid vnder figure ceremony nothing yet brought perfection lawe grauen mennes harte stone yet foolishe distinctio euen day god nowe spirite christe faith doctrinethe churche rome maie erre hope enheritaunce couenaunt efficacie vertue god woorde eusebius also saith al faithful euen adam vntil christe dede christian though termed said leste menne thus saie stil paule apostle founde like faultes falles euen prime chiefe gospel greattest perfection light compelled write sorte galathians wel instructed feare quod leste haue laboured amongest smal pourpose leste ye haue heard gospel vaine litle child vvhom trauaile anevve til christe fashoned againe churche corinthias fowlely defiled nothing needeful rehearse tel might church galathians corinthian goe amisse churche rome alone may faile goe amisse hardinge vve aunswere partes churche faultes may founde sundrie men seme churche churche deede maie fal perish al grauntvve speake vvhole vniuersal church onely churche rome whole catholique vniuersal churche whose faith professe may erre fall faile denie vtterly whiche ben defender part proue el talketh purpose paule rebuketh al galathians general though al forsaken faith doth wonte prophetes epistle greater partes sake reprehending al though deserue praise corinthian though many among faulty yet considereth beginneth epistle shal finde hebut churche daie subiect religion mahomete churche acknowleged churche among thus writeth paule vocation apostle c churche god corinth c b sarisburie particulare churche faultes may founde ye saie ye wil confesse whole catholique vniuersal churche may erre faile saie ye denie vtterly notwithstandinge certaine church corinthe galatia sundrie others nowe particulare portion thorowly departed faith nowe wholy subiecte turke therfore muste needes meaning al al particulare church throughout worlde happen erre yet churche rome saie pope cardinalles neuer erre lesson trowepet de palude de potestate curatorum ar ye learned petrus de palude neither christe apostle euer taught woorthy doctour saith thus tota ecclesia petri non potest fide deficere omnes autem ecclesiae apostoloru omniu possunt deficere fide totaliter indigentes ab ecclesia petri confirmari whole churche peter cannot wholy faile faithe al church al apostle may faile wholy faithe hauinge neede confirmed churche peter hard fo b ende selfe cal romaine faith catholique faith making maner difference betweene either otherdist omnes therefore pope nicolas thus auaunceth thundreth owne authoritie non quaelibet terrena sententia sed illud verbum quo constructum est coelum terra per quod denique omnia condita sunt elementa romanam fundauit ecclesiam worldly sectence selfe woorde heauen earthe made whereby al elementes created founded churche rome whiche woordes meaneth romaine faithe shal stande faste fundations heauen earthe euen peter assured promisse vnto christe although matthae saide al others denie thee yet alone wil denie thee though shoulde presently die thee yet onely wil neuer denie thee neuerthelesse came trial peter denied firste nowe church rome whiche cal catholique churche maie erre foresaken god euident plaine woordes paule thus writeth euen vnto churche rome roman quod si aliqui ex ramis fracti sunt c boughes broken thou beinge wilde oliue tree arte graffed natural oliue made partaker roote fatnesse thereof boaste thee selfe againste boughes thou boaste remember thou bearest roote roote beareth thee thou wilte saie boughes broken might graffed wel broken theire infidelitie thou standest faste faithe highe minded stande awe seeinge god hath spared natural boughes leste happily spare thee see therefore goodnesse sharpenesse god sharpenesse towardes fallen awaie goodnesse towardes thee thou continewealioqui tu excideris remaine goodnesse othervvise thou beinge churche rome shalte likevvise smitten hereby plaine churche rome maie faile fal god lesse like church otherwise aduertisement paule benne vaine therefore hormisdahormisda pp ad episcopos hispaniae beinge selfe bishop rome writeth thus dilectissimi fratres continuas preces ad dominum fundamus iugi deprecatione poscamus vt institutione opere illi cuius esse membra cupimus adhaereamus nec vnquam ab illa via quae christus est deuio tramite declinemus ne ab eo iuste quem impie reliquerimus deseramur dearely beloued brother let v praie vnto god bothe profession order life maie cleaue whose member desire crooked path neuer turne waie whiche christe leste vvee beinge churche rome iustely forsaken vvhom vvickedly vvee haue forsaken thus would pope selfe haue written behoufe churche rome yf thought churche coulde neuer haue erred chrysostom de varijs locis matth homi shorte chrysostome saithe ecclesia quocun que modo egerit contra voluntatem christi abijci digna est non autem abijcitur propter longanimitatem christi nisi sola causa transgressionis churche waie euer shee doo againste wil christe woorthy geuen ouer yet patience christe shee neuer geuen ouer onely breakinge commaundementes apologie cap diuision surely christe prophesied longe churche time shoulde comme desolation shoulde stande holy place2 thessal daniel paule saith antichriste shoulde set vp owne tabernacle stately seate temple god time vvhen menne avvaie vvith holsome doctrine turned backe vnto fable lie within churche petri daniel peter likewise telleth shoulde teacher lie churche christe daniel prophete speakinge later time antichriste truthe saithe season shalbe throvven vnder foote trodden vpo vvorld christe saitheabomination desolation calamitie confusion thinges shalbe excedinge greatematth euen chosen vvere possible shalbe broughte erroure thinges shal comme passe emongest gentile turkes euen holy place temple god churche companie felovvship whiche professe name christe hardinge prophecie daniel concerninge abomination desolation whereof christe spake gospell wee thinke thevntruthe beste learned diuines haue thought othervvise shal appeare best learned diuines referred ende worldedaniel matth driuinge away faithe antichriste ye imagine consummation final endinge synagog touchinge ye saie antichriste maketh nothinge againste catholikes whose faithe preuaileth mary many good menne thinke hath already begonne set vp tabernacle stately seate harte many whiche ought temple god foreronners martine luther zuinglius caluine scholers reste wicked rable vvhere ye adde within churche isvntruthe paule saithe plainely shal sit temple god thessal ye founde paule vnderstande good though wee finde without euer good reason ye wee graunte1 oan ye came v iohn saithe yee v ye benne v yee woulde haue taried v maie saieinge peter referred likewise daniel whiche ye alleage though woordes daniel schoolemaisters limme antichriste ye labour ye ouerthrowe treade vnder foote true faithe churche catholike religion b sarisburie needed you2 thessalon nicol lyra hieronym ad algasiam hippolytus hardinge talke mutche fauoure antichriste greeued heare called abomination desolation paule calleth antichriste man sinne somme saie shalbe wholy possessed diuel owne hippolytus saithe shal diuel selfe yet haue fewe menne founde selues greeued sutche saieinges knowe woordes christe daniel diuers exposition haue beene diuersly applied yet maie ye wel thus condemne al iudgementes haue applied antichriste origen one moste ancient father churche entreatinge antichriste contrarie exposition saith thusorigen matthae tracta chrysost opere imperfecto homil ipse est abominatio desolationis antichriste abomination desolation chrysostome saithe hic antichristus dicitur abominatio desolationis quia multorum christianorum anima facturus est desolatas deo antichriste called abomination desolation shal cause soules many christianes desolate foresaken god gregorius nazianzenus saithe antichristus veniet desolatione mundigregor nazian significatio ezechielem nonlatin alphabet est enim abominatio desolationis antichriste shal comme desolation worlde abomination desolation hierome saithe abominatio desolationis intelligi potest omne dogma peruersum abomination desolation maie vnderstande manner peruerse doctrine whereof doubte antichriste shal wante stoare againe speakinge namely man vvickednesse aduersarie christe vvhiche antichriste lifteth vp selfe aboue al hieronym matth cap eodem loco ambrasi lucam lib ca called god saithe abominatio desolationum erit templo v que ad consummationem temporis abomination desolation shal stande churche vntil consummation ende time ambrose saithe abominatio desolationis execrabilis aduentus antichristi est abomination desolation cursed comminge antichriste hilarie expounding selfe woordes christe ye shal see ye abomination desolation standinge holy place saith thus de antichristi temporibus haec loquutus est hilari matthae canon theodoret daniel ca eusebius emissen christe spake woordes time antichriste likewise saith theodoretus writinge vpon prophete daniel abominationem desolationis ipsum vocat antichristum bisides others moste ancient catholique father likewise saithe eusebius emissenus special homilie purpose hardinge whereas ye certainely assure selfe woordes christe maie wise taken confusion horroure shalbe ende worlde bisides al learned godly father beseche consider whole driftematthae circumstance place woordes christe spake immediately apostle demaunded question token thy comminge iudgement ende worlde question christe answeareth wise take heede yt noman deceiue many shal comme name shal saie christe shal deceiue many yee shal heare warres talkes warres yee troubled al thinges must happen yet ende c many passe prophetes shal rise shal deceiue many iniquitie shal encrease charitie shal waxe colde continueth vnto ende shalbe saued gospel kingedome shalbe preached al worlde witnesse vnto al nation shal come ende nexte woordes folowe therefore ye shal see abomination desolation yt spoken daniel c thus maie yee see harding course te oure christes answeare yt iudgemente iudgemente ende ende vvorlde vvorlde must woordes needes haue relation ende vvorlde euer beste learned diuines ye haue hitherto named none haue taught saide contrarieantichriste standinge churche god whereas wee saie antichriste shal stande euen vvithin churche ye saie finde paule notwithstandinge oure good wil ye saie ye vnderstande although ye finde v neuer good reason goodnesse reason wee wil striue whether paule saie antichriste shal stande churche let v iudged paule woordes plaine adeo thessalon vt templo dei sedeat tanquam deus wil sitte churche god god churche god churche dothe paule saie antichriste shal sitte vvithin churche like sense christe saith antichriste shal sitte holy place matthae august de ciuita dei li cap eodem cap whiche woordes many best learned father haue expounded churche augustine saith non enim templum alicuius idoli aut daemonis templum dei apostolus diceret temple idole diuel apostle would neuer cal temple god addeth quidam putant rectius latine dici sicut graeco est templo dei sed templum dei sedeat tanquam ipse sit templum dei quod est ecclesia sicut dicimus sedet amicum id est velut amicus somme menne thinke better reade latine thessalon nonlatin alphabet greeke sitteth temple god sitteth teple god selfe vvere temple god vvhiche churche saie sitteth frende yt sitteth frende augustine saithe antichriste shal onely sitte churche also shal shewe selfe outwarde appearanceherueus de potestate pap ca selfe churche selfe hardinge shoulde reporte owne doctoures one hath written thus papa quodammodo virtualiter est tota ecclesia pope maner waie vertue power hieronym ca matthaei chrysostom opere imperfecto homil whole vniuersal churche hierome saith antichristus stabit loco sancto id est ecclesia se ostendet vt deum antichriste shal stande holy place saie churche shal shewe selfe god chrysostome saithe incident abominationem desolationis quae stat sanctis ecclesiae locis shal fal abomination desolation standeth holy place churche hilarie saithe hilarius contra auxentium vnum moneo cauete antichristum male enim vos parietu ch coepit abomination desolation thessal male ecclesiam dei tectis aedificijs que veneramini anne ambiguum est ijs antichristum esse sessurum one thinge reade beware antichriste wel ye thus loue walles wel ye honoure churche house buildinges doubte antichriste shal sitte paule saithe mysterium iniquitatis operatur sathan woorketh mysterie iniquitie saie openeth selfe euer doothe doothe couerte vpo whiche woordes anselmus saith anselmus iniquitas eorum est mystica id est pietatis nomine pallium iniquitie mystical saie cloked coered name godlinesse therefore chrysostom opere imperfe homil chrysostome saithe christiani qui sunt christianitate volentes accipere firmitatem fidei verae ad nullam rem fugiant nisi ad scripturas c christianes christendome willinge haue stedfastnesse true faithe let flee none thinge onely scripture otherwise looke thinge el shal offended perishe knowinge whiche true churche shal fal abomination desolation standeth holy place churche apologie cap diuision albeit warninges alone maie suffice wiseman take heede doo suffer selfe rashely deceiued name churche staie make inquisition thereof goddes woorde yet biside al many father also many learned godly menne haue often carefully complained al thinges haue chaunced life time euen middest thicke miste darkenesse god would yet somme whoe though gaue cleare brighte light yet kendle somme sparke whiche menne beinge darkenesse might espie hilarius thinges yet almoste vncorrupte good case contra auxentium yee il deceiued saith vvith loue vvalles ye doo il vvoorship churche ye vvoorship house buildinges yee doo il bringe name peace vnder roofes doubte antichriste vvil haue seate vnder rather recken hilles vvoodes pooles marishes prison quauemires place safetie prophetes either abidinge accorde forced thither violence didde prophesie spirite god gregorie one whiche perceiued foresawe minde wracke al thinges wrote thus iohan bishop constantinople firste al others commaunded selfe bee called newe name vniuersal bishop vvhole christes church gregor lib ad mauritium yf churche saith shal depende vpon one manne vvil soone fal dovvne grounde seeth comme passe longe sithence longe agone hath bishop rome willed haue whole churche depende vpon selfe alone wherefore marueile though cleane fallen downe longe agone hardinge ye make foule lie syr defender vpon gregorie woordes recite owne inough lie selfe doo often father lie also vpon doctoursi thankes god ye bewraie weakenesse causevntruthe vvriteth often reade ansvveare neither epistle iohn bishop constantinople saie apologie mauritius emperoure haue noted margent writeth gregorievntruthe pee former churche shall depende vpon one whole shal fall grounde see well would faine gregorie written yet argument benne naught take right minor whiche haue benne church doth depende vpo one man would make reason good rule logike minor speaketh onely pope thereof conclusion foloweth dispose proposition forme syllogisme shall espie owne feble reason make minor graunte whiche denie woordes whereof gather pretensed saieinge gregorieepist lib ad maurit epist suppose man hath caught vnto himselfe name vniuersall bishop churche constantinople whole churche whiche god forbid fell state called vniuersal fell gregorie vnderstandeth name vniuersall bishop selfe declareth many place manifeste vntruthe vvithout vvitte suche one bishop altogether onely bishop besides graunted bishop constantinople one onely vniuersal bishop inconuenience would folowe fall vniuersall bishop vniuersall churche also fell churche bishoppes bishoppes churche vntruthe christe neuer gaue sutche commission bishop vniuersall gregorie muche bishoppes beinge graunted whole churche fallen faithe thus proueth saithe bishoppes constant inople haue fallen goulfe great detestable heresy nestorius thinkinge christe two persones beleuinge god coulde made man ranne iewishe infidelitie macedonius denied holy ghost god vvherefore b constantinople vniuersall bishop accordinge sense aforesaide fall faithe two named fell churche also falleth reason bishop fell thus reasoneth gregorie epistle mauritius gregorie semeth farre reason incredible churche fall faithe faile therefore enucigheth againste iohn bishop constantinople chalenginge name vniuersal bishop concludeth thevntruthe fonde vvilful gregorie speaketh vvoordes nomore b constantinople b rome bishop see wise woorde vn uersall signifie soueraintie charge supremacie gouernement ouer whole churchehere hard recanteth errour saide vvoordes belonge onely pope whiche christe committed peter peter successours bishoppes romeiohn saide feede shepe sense impious erroneus contrary minde gregorie call successour peter christes vicare earth vniuersal bishop vvas gregorie reproued thus vvriteth cuncta christi membra tibi conaris vniuersalis appellatione supponere gregor lib epist saie highest al hauinge power ouer bishoppes bishop vniuersall churche christe gaue peter successours benefite churche supreme auctoritie power church sakeiohn whose loue deliuered selfe deathluke petition made father obteined successours priuilege supreme moste excellente grace faithe shoulde neuer faile consideration whiche singular priuilege obteined christe andvntruthe vtterly voide shame graunted see apostolike none gregorie rebuketh iohn bishop costantinople much one presumptuously vsurped newe name vniuersal bishop statute gospel decree canon conclude either gregorie man shoulde sa e churche dependeth vpon one man mighte seeme saie truthe meaninge rightly alone without good authoritiecontra luciferian suche saieinge finde vttered ierome safetie churche saithe dependeth vpon dignitie highest priesie haue auctoritie peerlesse aboue many schismes churche priestes vvhich peerlesse auctoritie aboue hierome place dothe attribute bishop euery dioces directlyiohn consequently peter successor saide feede sheepe reason eche dioces behoueth one prieste highes ouer priestesthe vniuersal churche falleth like proportion nolesse behoueth whole churche one bishop highest ouer bishoppes meane auoidinge schismes b sarisburie yf yee better looked bookes hardinge ye woulde haue benne hasty dealinge lie wee falsifie good father woordes reporte truely wee finde thus writeth sundrie place iohn bishop constantinople firste auanced selfe aboue al brother required called vniuersal bishop al worlde vniuersa ecclesia statu suo corruit gregor lib epist quando qui appellatur vniuersalis cadit whole vniuersal churche falleth state falleth called vniuersal bishop lie hardinge conferre place yee shal finde woordes wee reporte standeth neither profession modestie vncourteously vse tongue neither lie selues father lie vpon doctoures god thanked cause sutche maie wel maineteined without lie put oute doubte sense woordes ye maie finde often vttered gregorie place vnto anastasius bishop antiochegregor lib episto writeth thus vt de honoris vestri iniuria taceam si vnus episcopus vocatur vniuersalis vniuersa ecclesia corruit si vnus vniuersus cadit dissemble iniurie donne honoure one bishop called vniuersal one vniuersal bishop fal whole vniuersal churche goeth grounde againe saithe epistle gregor eade epistola vos eandem causam nullam dicere non debetis quia si hanc aequanimiter portamus vniuersae ecclesiae fidem corrumpimus ye maie saie mater importance wee patiently beare thinges wee destroie faithe vniuersal churche againe saithe gregor lib epistol isto scelesto vocabulo consentire nihil aliud est quam fidem perdere consente vnto wicked name nothinge el lose faithe againe gregor li epist flens dico gemens denuntio quia cum sacerdotalis ordo intus cecidit foris diu stare non poterit speake teares tel sighe harte seeinge order priesthoode fallen within cannot nowe stande longe without againe gregor lib epist diabolus ita valide quibusdam ecclesiae necessarijs membris dentes figit vt nulli sit dubium quin nisi vnanimiter fauente domino cunctorum prouida pastorum turba concurrat omne quod absit citius ouile dilaniet diuel strongely fasteneth teeth necessarie member churche onlesse goddes grace prouident companie al bishoppes ioine togeather doubte wil soone destroie whole flocke whiche god forbid againe compareth pride name pride antichriste saithe one shal woorke confusion churche gregor lib epist lesse thus saith nunquid cum se antichristus veniens deum dixerit deus friuolum vald erit sed ramen nimis perniciosum si quantitatem vocis attendimus duae sunt syllabae si pondus iniquitatis vniuersa pernicies antichriste shal comme cal selfe god shal trifle yet shal marueilous hurteful churche ye weigh quantitie woorde standeth twoo syllable ye consider weight wickednesse vniuersal destruction lie liketh calle harding plaine woordes vndoubted meaninge gregorie therefore calleth claime vniuersal povver superstitio profane vngodly wicked title name hypocrisie name blasphemie auoide authority beinge pregnat cleare ye faine tansie sundrie prety shiftes sutche neither iohn gregorie euer hable vnderstande firste ye saie one onely bishop iohn bishop constantinople meante title vtterly disgrade al bishoppes patriarkes euer make selfe onely bishop al world childish laboure seeke knotte russhe imagine doubtes case cleare certaine bishop constantinople meante none vniuersal authoritie claimed pope therefore thus noted booke called chronicon eusebijchronicon eusebij anno institntum fuit vt romana ecclesia caput esset ecclesiarum omnium cum prius constantinopolitana id vsurpare tentasset order taken churche rome head al church whereas churche constantinople attempted vsurpe whiche thinge also noted matthias palmerius florence without manner difference change woordes matthias palmerius sabellicus saithe bonifaciusz egit ab initio administrationis suae cum phocasabellicus ennead lib vt romana ecclesia esset omniu aliarum caput est que id aegre nec sine multa contentione apostolicae sedi datum graeci id ad se decus trahentes ibi christianae pietatis arcem esse oportere aiebant vbi imperij bonifacius thirde firste enitre office earneste suiter vnto emperoure phoca churche rome might heade al church whiche thinge hardely greate laboure graunted apostolique see rome grecian drawinge honoure vnto selues saide necessarie heade christian religion shoulde heade empiere whiche constantinople likewise writeth vrspergensis vrspergensis phoca requeste suite pope boniface phoca emperoure appointed see apostolique churche rome heade al church time churche constantinople wrote selfe first chiefe al others maie appeare hardinge greate folie thus ca l name power iurisdiction claimed bishop constantinople afterwarde vsurped bishoppes rome al one therefore gregorie saithe iohn bishop constantinoplegregor lib epist tu quid christo vniuersalis ecclesiae capiti extremi iudicij dicturus e examine qui cuncta cius membra tibimet conaris vniuersalis appellatione supponere answeare wilte thou make trial laste judgement vnto christe head vniuersal churche whiche thus name vniuersal bishop seekeste make al member subiecte vnto thee euen selfe vniuersal povver claimeth nowe bishop rome seeketh make al bishoppes world whole vniuersal churche christe thral subiecte vnto bishoppes constantinople felle sommetimes heresy deceiued christe hath praied peter faithe shoulde faise ergo saie bishop rome neuer possibly deceiued hardinge let shame force refraine vanity doubte hereafter place conuenient shalbe hable shewe haue benne mee heretiques placed peter chaire eue see rome hable finde one see within europe verily gregory reason touching danger confusion churche weigheth nomore againste bishop constantinople againste bishop rome thus saithe called vniuersal bishop happen erre needes must whole vniuersal churche fal togeather erroure therefore ye perused councel basile ye shoulde haue founde selfe reason alleged againste bishop constantinople prideconcil basilien epist synodal arrogancie bishop rome woordes alioqui errante pontifice sicut saepe contigit contingere potest erraret ecclesia pope selfe disclaimeth c otherwise euer pope erreth hath often erred maie erre againe vvhole churche erre thus wrote bishoppes owne iudgemente catholike bishoppes councel basile yet forgotten praier christe made peter therefore franciscus zarabella notable canoniste cardinal churche rome seeinge greate enormity grewe hereof saithe thus papae faciunt quicquid libetfrancis zarabella c atur ab illyrico de sectis etiam illicita sunt plusquam deus ex hoc infiniti sequuti sunt errores quia papa occupauit omnia iura inferiorum ecclesiarum ita vt inferiores praelati fint pro nihilo et nisi deus succurrat statui ecclesiae vniuersalis ecclesia periclitatur pope doo euer liste doo yea although vnlawfultand becomme god hereof haue folowed infinite erroures pope hath inuaded entred vpon al right inferioure church inferiour bishoppes maie goe nought onlesse god healpe state churche vniuersal churche danger thus hitherto harding ye haue founde lie nowe ye woulde seeme saie gregorie reproued bishop constantinople neuerthelesse claimed title vniuersal authoritie selfe maie therefore please herein stand iudgemet gregorie selfe recken ye doo doubte vnderstood owne meaninge doubtelesse ye diligentely considered gregorie ye beare v hande ye haue found touchinge owne right herein disclaimeth title refuseth vtterly writeth emperour mauritius gregor lib epist eadem epist nunquid ego hac pijssime domine propriam causam defend moste graceouse lord doo herein quarrel myne owne right againe saith non mea causa sed dei est ego solus sed tota turbatur ecclesia quia piae leges quia venerandae synodi quia ipsa domini nostri lesu mandata superbi que pompatici cuiusdam sermonis inuentione tuibantur goddes cause mine onely troubled therewith also whole churche godly lawes reuerende synodes commaundementes oure lorde iesu broken inuention certaine prowde eadem pompouse name againe nullus romanorum pontificum hoc singularitatis nome assumpsit nullus decessorum meorum hoc tam profano vocabulo vti consensit no hunc honorem nolumus oblatum recipere gregor lib epist none al bishoppes rome euer tooke vpon name singularitie none predecessours euer consented vse vngodly style wee selues wil receiue honoure though offered thus appeareth iudgemente gregorie vniuersal authoritie vtterly vnlawful onely bishoppes also euen bishop rome touchinge place hierome see ye contente geue ouer recante youre former erroure firste booke ye saie woordes notable aboue others therefore might dissembled hierome saithem hard fol safetie churche hangeth dignitie highe prieste meaninge thereby euery seueral bishop within owne limites ye thought good thus lard proper parethesis certaine special stuffe owne prouision meaneth pope peter successour highe prieste hierome writeth could none bishop rome vpon somme better aduise waie retractation ye saie thus peerelesse authoritie aboue al hierome dooth attribute bishop euery diocese whiche deede meaninge hierome certainely hierome woordes meante onely bishop rome ye tolde v meant particulare bishop euery diocese ye tel v nowe therefore ye muste needes confesse either nowe ye haue soughte meanes beguile reader pope peter successour meante nomore bishop shal likewise hereafter please cal like ouersightes ye shal publishe truthe encumber reader lesse erroure apologie cap diuision bernarde abbate aboue foure hundred yeeres paste writeth thus nothinge novve sincere pure emongest cleregie vvherefore resteth man sinne shoulde reueled bernarde treatie conuersion paule seemeth novve saithe persecution hath ceased persecution seemeth novve beginne euen vvhich haue chiefe preeminence church thy frendes neighbour god haue dravven neere stood vp thee fro sole foor crovvn head part vvhole iniquitie proceded elder ludges deputees vvhiche pretende rule thy people vvee cannot saie novve looke hovve people prieste people il prieste ala ala lorde god self persones chiefe persecu ing thee vvhich seeme loue highest place beare moste rule thy churche bernarde againe vpon canticle writeth thus al thei thy frendes yet thei al thy foe al thy kinnesfolke yet thei al thy aduersaries beinge christes seruauntes thei serue antichriste beholde reste bitternesse moste bitter apologie cap diuision roger bacon alsoin likello de idiomate linguarum man greate fame vehemente oration touched quicke woeful state owne time many errours saith require looke antichriste gerson complaineth day al substance efficacie sacred diuinitie brought vnto glorious contention oftentatio wittes sophistrie poore menne called pauperes lugduno menne touching manner theire life misliked woonte boldely affirme romishe churche whence alone al counsel order sought halot babylon rovvte diuels whereof prophesied plainely apocalyps hardinge commeth newe band consisteth tagge ragge weake companie god knoweth shewe theire face againste catholike churche whiche holy ghoste speaketh salomon terrible like armie men set bataile raie firste frier bacon coniurer negromanser commonly saie set forewarde man greate fame forsoothe commeth good plaine father gerson writer graundfathers time complaineth frier studentes gaue selues mutche vnprofitable subtilitie scholastical question vvhat maketh againste faithe churche defender placeth winge falle brethern lyon commonly called vvaldenses pauperes de lugduno notorius heretikes condemned churche beinge detestable heretikes condemned churche recke saie luther saieth zuinglius caluine defender selues saie antichriste sathan saieth enimies god truthe maie admitted geue witnes againste truthe b sarisburie laste authority whiche ye calle tagge ragge wee neuer made greate accoumpte notwithstandinge bothe iohannes gerson rogerus bacon notable famouse theire time al respectes comparable beste plaine father gerson sutche woordes ye thought beste quaile credite beinge otherwise coumpted suttle disputer profounde schole doctoure vvas chauncellar vniuersitie parise wisedome learninge thought woorthy directoure al bishoppes councel constance rogerus bacon appeareth booke de idiomate linguarum hable iudge latine greeke hebrevve tongue difides diuerse bookes writeth also sundrie epistle vnto pope clemente wherein mutche complaineth ruine confusion churche certainely weakest bothe hath weight substance either amphilochius abdias hippolytus leontius youre anacletus pope clemens ye often cal apostle felovve howe man simple maie beare witnesse truthe clemens alexandrinus lactantius arnobius eusebius augustine holy father thought preiudice theire cause allege witnesse frantique sibylles paule allegeth authority heathen poetes aratus menander epimenides neuer knewe god christe thought scorne receiue witnesse infantes mouthes refused diuels bare witnesse saide knowe thou arte christe sonne liuinge god pauperes lugduno founde faulte pride pope aeneas syluius historia boemica lewde life cleregie purgatorie holy water pardonnes like deceiuinges people translated bible praied theire natural knowen mother tongue theire erroures therefore called detestable heretiques therefore codemned churche rome goddes name blessed euer sithence time pope painted power hath stil abated poore detestable condemned heretiques haue stil encreased apologie cap diuision knowe wel yenough authoritie foresaid persones wilbe lightly regarded amongest men howe cal foorth witness selues haue vsed honoure saie adrian bishop rome frankly confesse al mischieues braste firste high throne pope hardinge haue wee man strawe set vprome roote il defender nameth adrian bishop rome geueth waze strawe hande farre semeth sore weapon taken armorie platinaa greate solic platyna vvas deade threescoare yeeres adrian vvas pope pretended ye come neare beholde felow conferre platina touchinge weapon ye see fained thinge sutche saieinge platina attributed thevntruthe vaine vnaduised platyna vvriteth one vvorde adriane sixthe six adrian bishoppes rome whose liues writeth mo therefore saie saie adrian c answere thereto saie saie false lie b sarisburie touchinge pretie fansie man cloutes vvaze stravve see wel hardinge ye thoughte good policie clowte vp matter satisfie reader stravven ansvveare stravve eies hardinge man ye stoode far aluffe eies daseled therefore ye knewe ye sawe ye drawen neare ye soone haue founde owne erroure man stravve pope adrian sixthe laste wee spake onlesse ye thinke pope holinesse man stravve thus pronounced norinberg germanie great assemblie empiere mouthe cheregatus legate latere sacerdotibus iniquitatem populi dimanare multis nunc annis grauiter multis que modis peccatum esse romae iohan sleidanus lib ann inde pontificio culmine malum hoc atque luem ad inferiores omnes ecclesiarum praefectos defluxisse thus pope adrian bade legate saie iniquitie people grewe priestes nowe space many yeeres haue benne greate greuous offense committed rome al plague mischiefe hath flowed vnto al inferioure ruler churche euen highe throne pope holinesse storie also extantefasciculus reru sciendarum printed colaine booke called fasciculus rerum sciendarum thus therefore againe wee saie hardinge pope adrian frankly confessed al mischiefes proceeded firste euen throne seate pope holinesse saieinge notwithstandinge vnciuile speache wee saie lie leste ye shoulde thinke legate cheregatus either foregeatefulnesse malice errante otherwise commission like woordes haue sithece bene vttered owne late chapter tridente cornelius bishop bitoto woordes effecerunt tandem vt pieta fucumcornel bitontinus concil tridenti hypocrisim c haue brought passe godlinesse turned hypocrisie sauoure life turned sauoure deathe woulde god gonne wholy general consente religion superstition faithe infidelitie christe antichriste god epicure saieing wicked harte filthy mouthe god neither hath benne greate vvhile pastoure pope regarded thinges al bothe pope others sought theire ovvne mutche one neither pope cardinal sought thinges perteine iesus christe therefore hardinge ye maie hencefoorthe spare vnsauery bitter speaches reportes lie apologie cap diuision pighius acknowlegeth herein faulte many abuse brought inerrours masse euen masse whiche masse otherwise woulde haue se e moste reuerend matter gerson saithe number moste fonde ceremony al vertue holy ghoste whiche ought haue ful operation v al true godlinesse vtterly quenched deade whole graecia asia complaine howe bishoppes rome martes theire purgatory pardon haue tormented mennes conscience piked theire purse hardinge deede pighius sixth cotrouersie speaking priuate mass denieth certaine abuse crept holy helthful thing speaketh adding snow saith man men perteineth correcte let eche man acknowledge owne measure vnderstande dutie shoulde saie meere euery man take vpon amend thinge amisse masse meaneth masse selfe erroneus ful wel declareth men faulty abusinge moste holy sacrifice many come aulter vnworthely many presente ought come within churche dores priestes lewde liues vnreuerent behauiour better abstained albeit thinke meante rather sutche abuse learned father prouincial councel coulen woulde amended witte certaine peculiar office mass deuised men late yeeres besides ordinance ancient forefather greate troupe ye bringe grece asia firste require make agree selues catholike churche aboute procession holy ghoste shal answere concerning greuous matter purgatorie pardon manner take saieinges heretikes good sufficient auctoritie b sarisburie deede hardinge ye hewe ouer highe ye take vpon make v vnderstande pigghius meaninge yet owne confession appeareth yee neuer knewe selfe meante ye saie founde faulte vnwoorthinesse either priestes people ye knowe whether el noted late chapter colaine ye knowe yet euer shal please imagine ye thinke haue wronge wee beleeue immediately vpon youre woorde pigghius selfe whoes tale ye would fame telle saithe woulde make saie abuse haue creapte prieste people plainely simply saithe erroures haue creapte masse howe erroures ye saie euer man maie redresse onely pope extra de translatione episcopi quato gloss extra de concess praebendae proposuit glossa good cause doctoures saie papa ex nihilo potest facere aliquid pope nothinge make somme thinge euer doo noman maie saie vnto domine cur ita facis sir vvhy doo harte roote al diuinitie louaine christe hath praied peter ergo pope neuer erre ye meane plainely dissimulation hypocrisie woordes tel befeche euen desire beleeued al errours ye phigghius meante space fourtie yeeres one erroure hathe pope redressed theire plainenesse dealinge harding minde seeke redresse faulte neuer euident stil continewe selues credite worlde erroure al christian graeciagraecia asia asia ye saie heretiques therefore ye recke saie doubte saie pope heade churchedist omnes whiche thinge euer denieth saith pope nicolas muste needes holden heretique thomas aquinas good affection reuerence bare towardes pope saithe thus dicere papam non habere vniuersalis ecclesiae primatum est error similis errori dicentium spiritum sanctum filio non procedere saie pope hath primacie vniuersal churche erroure like vnto erroure mainteine heresie touchinge holy trinitie saie holy ghoste procedeth sonne god readinesse herein ludouicus viues writeth thus augustinum vetustas sua tuetur qui si reuiuisceret cum paulo certe ille contemptui esset rhetorculuslodouicus viuet li de iuitate dei ca aut grammaticulus paulus vero vel insanire vel haereticus videretur augustine safe nowe bicause age paule aliue againe shoulde shaken bad rhetorician poore grammarian paule taken either madde man heretique nowe iudge hardinge churche paule apostle christe vvere novv aliue goe heretique vesputius remeber trauailed far seene manner religion many country saithe thus graeci implicati sunt multis erroribus greekes entangled many errours addeth withal faxit deus ne latinis multae irrepserint stultitiae god grount many folie entred also churche rome surely christian menne daie graecia asia vtterly abhorre pope paulus aemylius pantaleon al deformity churche greeke emperour michael palaeologus submitted selfe pope late councel florence therefore afterward abhorred hated people liued beinge deade forebidden christian burial isidorus archebishop kiouia russia beinge returned said councel beganne vnities sakematthias michouia nouo orbe moue people like submission therfore deposed bishoprike put deathe apologie cap diuision touchinge tyrannie bishoppes rome theire barbarous persianlike pride leaue others perchaunce recken enimies bicause freely liberally finde faulte theire vice menne whiche haue leadde theire life rome holy cittie face moste holy father also hable see al theire secretes time departed catholique faithe example laurentius valla marsilius patauinus frauncis petrarke hierome sauanorola abbat ioakim baptiste mantua al bernarde abbate haue many time mutche complained geuinge world also sommetime vnderstande bishop rome selfe leaue antichriste whether spake truely falsely let goe sure spake plainely neither canne man allege authours luther zuinglius scholar liued onely certaine yeeres also certaine age ere euer luther zuinglius name hearde hardinge defender compared mad dogge perhappes woulde thinke rude vnmanerly comparison let man euer verely manner fashion bothe like howe euer contente person honoured due regard man mad dogge runneth vp downe nowe byteth one thinge snappeth man beaste resteth one place defender deface churche sheweth selfe haue vnquiet heade nowe ronneth bishop rome whole cleregie nowe barketh errours doctrine sheweth none snappereth manner backebiteth mennes liues nowe bringeth foorth scripture stretcheth racketh reache home commeth doctoures maketh side whether wil doctoures runneth coniurers riminge poetes heretikes themselues thinke rather ronne turkes catholike faithe shoulde receiued leauinge tooke hande proue churche erreth necessary doctrine flingeth tyrannie pride bishoppes rome bringeth witnes againste white blacke good bad hurte careth howe meanes ne person firste geate credite vttereth manifeste lie saieinge al leadde theire life rome holy cittie vnder nose moste holy father might see al secretes neuer foresooke catholike faithe witness laurence valla marsilius padua francis petrarch hierome sauonarol ioachim abbot baptiste mantua bernarde spite calleth bernarde abbot nowe let v see howe many lie made vvhereas al thesevntruthe mantuane dvvelt rome petrarcha vvas made poete rome sauanorola vvas often rome c neuer one leadde life rome laurence valla canon laterane defender saieth al one lie al might see pope secretes two lie none foresooke catholike faithevntruthe othervvise shevve vvherein foresooke faithe three lie laurence valla euery pointe sounde appeareth booke free wil annotation vpon newe testamente althinges handled shewed selfe newe fangled rather groundedly lerned wel grammer logike diuinitie mar lius padua please emperouve ludouicus bauarus liued aboue twoo hundred yeeres paste malice conceiued againste pope iohn xxij saide ludouicus iuste cause excommunicate went farre schismevntruthe othervvise shevve vvhat article vvas heretique length fel heresie abbot ioachim while reproued peter lombardethis vncerra ne reade luther touchinge vttered heresie contrarie catholike faithe touchinge trinitie therefore booke condemned churche though person condemned submitted selfe writinges iudgemente holy romaine churche finde decretals al haue greately often complained bishoppes rome theire tyrannie pridevntruthe vvil soone appeare foure liesextra de summa nit fide cathol cap declared pope selfe antichristevntruthe moste expresse woordes calle antichriste fiue lie whereas make shameles lie aske leaue aske leaue tel challenge lie saieplainely vnto speaking al belie shal neuer able proue saie francis petrarch italian poete baptiste mantua latine poete speake like poetes eche theire woorkes againste euil manner courte rome proufe maketh al romaine churche saie weast churche whiche onely remaineth euer hath remained whole sound faithe erreth doctrine argumente gather al wil saie againste life againste office auctoritie dignitie bishop rome argumente make hereupon poetes reprehende vice courte rome ergo pope antichriste ergo catholike churche erreth foresaken vvhat force reason euery reasonable man neuer meane witte may soone iudge b sarisburie comparison madde dogges hardinge becommeth wel rest courteous eloquenceantichriste shal marke howe vainely snappe euer ye imagine waie nowe logique nowe rhetorique nowe greeke nowe latine nowe lamenesse nowe leane cheekes nowe oure thinne beardes nowe superintendenteshippes nowe ministershippes nowe oure maistershippes nowe mashippes sobrietie grauitie speache howe greedily egrely ye fasten teeth feede selfe winde stil snappinge catche nothinge although regarde manhood spare cal madde dogge liketh calle others yet maie wel thinke scarcely sober man christe founde faulte sommetime bishoppes sommetime priestes sommetime scribe sommetimes phariseis sommetime people sommetime theire religion sommetime theire tradition sommetime theire ignorance sommetime theire praiers sommetime theire fastinges sommetime theire life sommetime theire hypocrisie sommetime theire crueltie thus fantasie ranne hither thither vp downe yet trowe ye wil touche comparison saie therfore ye saie v vnquiet heade hath eies see considereth miserable abuse churche rome touchinge either life religion cannot lightly wante iuste mater reproue ye remember churche whereof bernarde saithe bernardus conuersione pauli sermo planta pedis vsque ad verticem capitis non est sanitas vlla non est iam dicere vt populus sic sacerdos quia nec sic populus vt sacerdos one whole place sole foote toppe heade wee maie nowe saie people prieste people nothinge il prieste ye saie witness dwelt rome smal matter ye haue noted great lie howe bernarde abbate dwelte furtheste twise romegulielm abb vita bernard raphael volaterran chiefe councel pope innocentius greateste affaire franciscus petrarcha made poete capitol keapte laura concubine eie pope moste aboade rome laurentius valla vvas cauon cathedral churche laterane leadde life died rome briefely bernarde onely excepted al reste italian dwelte neuer far rome maie appeare plainenesse theire speache vnderstoode somme parte deepeste secretes churche rome marsilius patauinus ye saie heretique one heresie defended iudge conuicted either abturedmarsilius patauinus pounisshed neither al felowes haue hitherto tolde v therefore wee muste thinke vvas heretique vvithout heresie ioachimus abb extra de summa trinitate fide catholica danamus apocal somme menne doctoures vvithout diuinitie ioachimus abbas founde faulte bishop rome therefore muste needes heretique charged pope decretalles erroure touchinge trinitie greate vntruthe ye maie clearely perceiue booke martin luther hath pourposely written defence butvergil septem que vna sibi muro circundabit arces iren li cavlt comme neare matter speake thinge moste misliketh iohn saith antichriste shal fitte cittie builte vpon seuen hilles cittie rome irenaeus saith number antichristes name shalbe expressed woorde latinus sibylla saith greateste terroure furie empieresibylla oratione nonlatin alphabet hieronymus ad algasiam gregor lib epist greateste woe shal woorke shal bankes tyber whiche circumstance seeme plainely painte cittie rome hierome saithe antichristus fedebit templo dei vel hierosolymi vt quidam putant vel ecclesia vt verius arbitramur antichriste shal fit temple god either hierusalem somme thinke el churche god selfe vvhiche vvee take truer meaninge gregorie saithe ego fidenter dico quod quisquis se vniuersalem sacerdotem vocat vel vocari defiderat elatione sua antichristum praecurrit speake boldely euer calleth selfe vniuersal prieste desireth called doth pope pride harte forerenner antichriste iohn bishop constantinople firste entred claime vnto title gregor lib epist gregorie made answeare vnto ex hac eius superbia quid aliud nisi propinqua iam esse antichristi tempora designantur pride thinge el signified time antichriste euen hande againe saithe vpon occasion rex soperbiae prope est quod dici nefas est sacerdotum est praeparatus exercitus kinge pride antichriste comminge v armie priestes prepared whiche thinge wicked spokenhieronym ad algasiam hierome saithe antichristus omnem religionem suae subijciet potestati antichriste shal cause al religion subiecte power wil take vpon discrie either person dwelling place antichriste hath eies see let see circustances agree vnto many s2 thessal paule saith antichriste woorketh mysterie secrete practise iuiquitie whereupon glose saith mystica est impietas antichristi id est pieratis nomine palliata wickednesse antichriste mystical saie plaine open easy espied euery body cloked vnder name godlinesse mutche hardinge thinketh wee misallege writer violently force side whether thei wil bernarde saithe thus bernardus epist pag bestia illa de apocalypsi cui datum lest o loquens blasphemias bellum gerere cum sanctis petri cathedram occupat tanquam leo paratus ad praedam beaste spoken booke reuelations vnto whiche beaste geuen mouthe speake blashemies keepe warre againste sainctes god novve gotten peter chaire lion prepared praie ioachimus abbas saide aboue three hundred yeeres sithence ioachimus abbas antichristus iam pridem natus est romae altius se extollet sede apostolica antichriste already borne rome shal auaunce selfe higher apostolique see arnulphusin concilio remensi inter opera bernardi councel remes saith thus quid hunc reueredi patres sublimi solio residentem veste purpurea aurea radiantem quid hunc inquam esse censeris nimirum si charitate destituitur sola que scientia inflatur extollitur antichristus est templo dersedens sese oftendens tanquam sit deus thinke reuerend father man meaneth pope sittinge highe throne glitteringe purple clothe golde thinke verily voide charitie blowen vp auaunced onely wt knowledge antichrist sitting temple god shewing selfe god bishoppes councel reinspurg saie thus auentinus hildebrandus papa sub specie religionis iecit fundamenta antichristi pope hildebrande vnder coloure holinesse forebiddinge priestes mariage hath saide fundation antichristedantes cantione dante italian poete expresse woordes calleth rome whoore babylon fanciscus petrarcha likewise saithe rome whoore babylon mother al idolatriefrancis petrarcha epist fornication sanctuarie heresie schole errour knowe woordes wil seeme odious vnto many therefore wil staie spare reste pope selfe sawe whoes person credite thinges belonged therefore late councel laterane gaue straite commaundemente al preacher concil lateran sub iulio leone session noman shoulde dare speake comminge antichriste apologie cap diuision marueile churche carried awaie errours time specially neither bishop rome onely ruled roste almoste either didde duetie vnderstoode duetie harde beleeued while idle faste asleepe diuel also al either fel asleepe el continually laie idle howe occupied meane time faithfulnesse tooke care goddes house though holde peace yet praie let heare bernarde theire owne frende bishoppes saith vvho novve haue charge goddes churche teacher deceiuers feeder beguiler prelate pilate wordes spake bernarde bishop named selfe higheste bishop al bishoppes likewise whiche hadde place gouernemente bernarde lutherane bernarde heretike forsaken catholike churche yet neuerthelesse lette cal bishoppes deceiuers beguiler pilate nowe people openly deceiued christian mennes eies craftily bleared pilate sate iudgement place condemned christe christes member swerde fiere good lorde case christes churche yet tel many grosse errours one erroure haue menne time refourmed faulte haue acknowledged confessed hardinge vvhy sir ye wel learned holy life selues ye take vpon iudge bishop rome christes chiefe officer earthe al men time apostate renegate frters haue ben impious theire dutie ignorant knowinge theire dutie vvas al vertue farre bannished al necessarie knowledge christian learninge cleane put wee muste nowe beginne learne beleue howe liue christian life sutche light preachersthe sprite modestie wicked vowbreakers lewde lecherous lurdens detestable blasphemer deuilishe rable bernardes wordes eugenius age indagemus adhuc diligentius quis si c vvel goe toolib de consideratione let v somewhat diligently examine manner man thou art person thou bearest presente time churche god vvho art thou greate preieste highest bishop thou arte chiefe al bishoppes thou arte heire apostle primacie thou arte abel gouernement noe patriarkship abraham holy order melchiscdech dignitie aaron auctoritie moyses iudgemente samuel power peterthe pope christe thy anointinge christe thou art key deliuered shepe committed also porter heauen pastours flockes thou mutche farre passinge al thou haste inherited bothe name mutche indifferent haue theire flockes assigned vnto ech man one al committed thee one whole flocke one neither arte thou onely pastour al sheepe also onely pastour al pastours vvherefore accordinge thine owne canonsthe state churche rome called parte care thou falnes power auctoritie others restrained certaine prescripte boundes thine extended euen vpon haue receiued power ouer others canst thou cause close vp heauen gate againste bishop depriue bishoprike geue vp deuil nowe heare reason whiche confirmeth prerogatiue thee wel disciple rowediohan lorde appeared vnto shore body nowe againe restored vnto life whiche confortable vnto peter knowing lorde leapte sea peter leapeth popedome came vnto reste came bote vvhat meaneth forsooth signe singulare popedome peter whiche tooke gouernemente one onely one shippe eche man owne whole worlde b sarisburie apostate renegates lecherous lurdaines detestable diuelishe rable hardinge vessel helde liquoure cleane wee condemne cleregie either life learning onely reporte therein iudgemente others youre special frendes therefore thinge mislike herein faulte v bernarde saith bishoppes time doctoures deceiuers feeder defrauder prelate pilate iudge nowe case churche god stoode bishoppes guide leader people might compared pilate gaue sentece iudgement christe iohannes vitalis cardinal rome therefore wise parte refused iohan vitalis de praelatis sacerdot hiere saithe thus de sacerdotibus modernis dicit hieremias stupor mirabilia facta sunt terra prophetae praedicabant mendacium sacerdotes applaudebant manibus et populus meus dilexit talia concerninge priestes nowe hieremie saith honoure woonders wrought vpon earth prophetes haue preached lie priestes haue clapte theire handes ioie liked wel people hath loued sutche thinges albertus magnus saith albertus iohanne ca ee illi qui modo praesunt ecclesijs plurimum sunt fures latrones plus exactores quam pastores plus spoliatores quam tutores plus mactatores quam custodes plus peruersores quam doctores plus seductores quam ductores isti sunt nuntij antichristi subuersores ouiu christi nowe gouerne churche parte theeues murtherers catch feeder spoiler defender killer keeper deceiuers doctoures beguiler cuiders vauntcurrers antichriste subuerters sheepe christe vvilliam holcote saithe guliel holcote li sapientiae lectio sacerdotes moderni sunt simile sacerdotibus baal sunt angeli apostatici sunt simile sacerdotibus dagon sunt sacerdotes priapi sunt angeli abyssi priestes time like priestes baal thei renegate angel like priestes dagon priestes priapus angel hellebernard concilio remensi bernarde saithe dicimini pastores cum sitis raptores fratres iesus hodie elegit sibi multos diabolos episcopos non sunt pastores sed traditores ye called bishoppes ye rauenners brother iesus time hath chosen vnto many diuels bishoppes thei feeder thei traitoursiohan sarisburien polycratico li ca iohannes sarisburiensis saide boldely vnto pope adrian fourth ideo mea opinione papae frequentius moriutur ne totam corrumpant ecclesiam therefore iudgemente pope die oftener leste continew longe shoulde infecte whole churche againe bernard cantica sermo bernarde saithe pudeat successores apostolorum lucem non esse mundi sed modij mundi autem tenebras dicamus eis vos estis tenebrae mundi let shame successours apostle ye lighte worlde light busshel rather darkenesse vvorlde let v therefore saie vnto yee darkenesse vvorlde spectacle wee maie beholde state churche rome christe saithe matthae lighte selfe thee made darkenesse greate wil darkenesse selfe cittie keapte safetie watcheman blinde see nothinge blinde leade blinde bothe falle pittematthae matthae hilari matthae canon christe saithe dormientibus illis creuerunt zizania husbandemenne asleepe cokle darnel grewe hilarie saithe ecclesiae intra quas verbum non vigilat naufragae sunt church wherein goddes vvoorde watcheth suffer shipwracke drowned bernarde ye saie stoutely maineteineth pope supremacie graunte neither wee euer allege proue contrarie defendeth also greate grosse errours liuinge time deepest darkenesse reasonbernar de consideratione ad eugeni lib iohan vseth seeme weake specially winne great mater thus saithe peter leapte vvater came christe reste disciple came bote ergo pope hath iurisdiction al vvorlde sutche prety reason made pope behalfe ye maie finde many peter crab concil pagin matthae iohan luc mark luc iohan matthae lately compiled bookes councelles reasoneth thus peter paide tribute monie christe selfe christe saide vnto peter folowe thou againe saide lanche foorthe deepe againe peter arte thou asleepe couldest thou watche one houre againe hencefoorthe thy name shalbe peter peter drewe swerde cutte malchus eare ergo saithe pope hath vniuersal authoritie ouer whole churche god notwithstandinge euer reason holde bernarde saithe pope heades churche true againe bernard saith heades minister antichriste deceiuers defrauder rauenners traitours darkenesse worlde
