vvoulfes pilate diuels sufficient pourpose gregor homil illa verba messis quidem multa gregorie saithe considerate quid de gregibus agatur quando lupi sunt pastores vvoulfe becomme sheephearde consider maie becomme flocke bernarde saithe pope abel pope noe pope abraham pope melchisedek pope aaron pope moses pope christe pope samuel pope peter pope christe doubte owne conscience wil answeare mutche yet greate deale likely others haue saide haue alleged pope antichriste bothe heauen earthe knoweth christe apologie cap diuision forsomutche menne auouche vniuersal possession catholique churche owne cal v heretiques bicause agree iudgemente let v know beseeche proper marke badge hathe churche whereby maie knowen bee churche god yewis harde matter finde goddes churche manne wil seeke earnestly diligently churche god sette vpon highe glisteringe place toppe hille builte vpon fundation apostle prophetes augustin de vnitate eccle catholicae saithe augustine lette v seeke churche lette v trie oure mater saithe againe place churche muste shevved holy canonical scripture vvhiche shevved churche yet al wote whether feare conscience despaire victorie menne alwaie abhorre flee vvoorde god euen theefe fleeth gallowes woonder truely like menne saie cantharus perisheth dieth soone laide baulme notwithstandinge baulme otherwise moste sweete smellinge ointemente euen men wel see owne matte damped destroied vvoorde god poison therefore holy scripture whiche oure saueour iesus christe onely vse authoritie al speache also laste seale vp owne bloude menne entent mighte lesse businesse driue people thinge daungerous deadly haue vsed cal theim bare letter albertus pighius controuer de ecclesia vncertaine vnprofitable doube killinge deade whiche seemeth v al one shoulde saie scripture pourpose good none al hereunto adde also similitude agreeable scripture like nose vvaxe shipmans hose thei may fashioned plied al manner way serue al mennes turnes hardinge vvhere ye saie churche builded vpon fundation apostle prophetes shewed holy canonicall scripture confesse augustine vvhen ye adde churche whiche shewed scripture churche saie though vntruthe augustine place elsvvhere oftentimes saith augustine haue suche woordes chapter whiche ye alleage margent yet neuer muche graunted woordes place shoulde make nothinge pourpose augustine booke disputeth againste donatistes would restraine catholike churche onely countrie aphrike denieinge christen menne member thereof augustine refutinge heresie declareth sonne god heade true faithfull body churche sufficient holde head alone body alone muste holde bothe together saued donatistes graunte heade iesus christe denied body churche cause saithe augusiine ipsum caput de quo consentimus ostedat nobis corpus suum de quo dissentimus let heade vpon agree shewe vnto v body whereupon disagree head christe spake firste prophetes afterwarde selfe laste apostle igitur omnibus quaerenda est ecclesia saithe churche muste soughtvvhere churche sought thou marke good reader whiche haue rehersed augustine seene bindeth proufe churche simply holy scripturesvntruthe augustine vvoordes general onely case hath doo heretike wil admitte auctoritie churche thereforehere hardinge secretely confesseth churche rome cannot shevved scripture true churche maie founde whiche shewed scripture contrarie thereof shewed scriptureschurche knovven goddes vvoorde defender haue churche shewed scripture shall vnderstande therein plaie donatistes must needes folows augustine bringinge scripture thevntruthe chrysostome saithe nunc nullo modo cognoscitur quae sit vera ecclesia nisi tantummodo per scripturas onely proufe deede whiche falsely saie good chiefe kinde proufe moste profitable case necessary suche time aduersarie admitte none proufe c vvherefore remaineth synagog antichriste lucifer vvho fell heauen like lightninge maketh blase shewe churche earthe time tell borne shall longe god power vanishe awaie dispersed scattered lightsome maiestie christes true churche whiche peter time daie florisheth head bishop rome member throughout worldein vnitie b rome vvhiche abide vnitie bishop vvee esteeme vnderstande scripture sense woorde pretende bare woorde thinke themselues good inough make sense owne vvhiche bare woorde misuse pighius perhaps compareth nose waxe scripture neuer meante dishonour similitude lawfull v vse scripture owne interpretation doo shoulde lacke sufficient matter holy bookes ouerthrowe owne applieinge theire false opinion heresiesvntruthe manif st shamelesse hard knovveth greattest case lie question allege neither scripture doctoure bounde religious awe reuerence excepte haue authour auouche sense whereof take holde dare bringe foorthe nothinge yet reade bookes shall lacke neither scripture witness interpretation controuersie age let agreed decision controuersies suche sense scripture taken scripture whiche holy ghost hath taught churche let worlde iudge flieth woorde god theefe dothe gallowes b sarisburie contrarie wee haue alleged augustine ye saie true churche maie founde whiche shewed scripture whereby appeareth ye lothe churche shoulde comme trial standerde mutche quarrel groweth augustine let augustine selfe iudge allege fewe woordes steede many thus saithe vtrum ipsi ecclesiam teneant augustin de vnitate eccle ca diuinarum scripturarum canonicis libris ostendant ecclesiam christi sicut ipsum caput christum scripturis sanctis canonicis debemus agnoscere vvhether haue churche let shewe canonical bookes holy scripture vvee muste knowe churche christe euen wee likewise knowe christe whiche heade churche holy canonical scripture againe saithe august contra cresconium cram lib ca ecclesiam sine vlla ambiguitate sanctum scriptura demonstrat holy scripture sheweth churche without doubtefulnesse againe quaestio est vhi sit ecclesia quid ergo facturi sumus vtrum verbis nostris eam quaesituri verbis capitis sui domini nostri iesu christi futo quod illius potius verbis eam quaerere debemus august de vnita ecclesi ca qui veritas est optime nouit corpus suum question doubte churche shal doo vvhether shal wee seeke churche owne woordes vvoordes heade whiche oure lorde iesus christe iudgemente wee ought rather seeke churche vvoordes truthe beste knoweth owne body againe august eodem li ca non audiamus haec dico haec dicis sed audiamus haec dicit dominus lbi quaeramus ecclesiam ibi discutiamus causam nostram let v heare woordes saie saiste thou woordes set v heare thus saithe lorde let v seeke churche let v discusse oure cause againe eode capite nolo humanis documentis sed diuinis oraculis sanctam ecclesiam demonstrari wil haue holy churche shewed mannes iudgemente goddes vvoorde likewise saithe vnitie churche one pope chrysostome nunc nullo modo cognoscitur quae sit vera ecclesia christi nisi tantummodo per scripturas noman knowe whiche true churche christe onely scripture againe saithe like fourme woordes volens ergo quis cognoscere quae sit vera ecclesia christi vnde cognoscat tanta confusione similitudinischrysost opere imperfe homil eadem hom nifi tantummodo per scripturas man desirous knowe whiche true churche christe know sutche confusion likenesse onely scripture woordes euident plaine noman modestie maie wel denie whereas saie al notwithstandinge true churche maie founde whiche shewed scripture ambrose saithe ambrosi hexameron li ca ecclesia fulget non suo sed christi lumine churche shineth knowen owne lighte light christe whiche vvoorde god chrysostome saithe chrysost iohan homil qui sacrum non vtitur scriptura sed ascendit aliunde id est non concessa via hic fur est latro vseth scripture geateth vp waie waie lawful theefe murtheier againe saithe chrysost matthae homil hierusalem hic semper ecclesiam intellige quae dicitur ciuitas pacis cuius fundamenta posita sunt super monte scripturarum hierusalem euermore vnderstande thou churche whiche called cittie peace fundations whereof saide vpon mountaines scripture ye magnifie churche rome saie shieth highe vpon mounte yet bernarde saithe pope cleregie alleged vos estis tenebrae mundi ye darkenesse vvorlde therefore ye maie wel vaunte selues mutche brightnesse beames ye cal churche synagoge lucifer antichriste maie wel suffer blowe euer vaine vnsauery smoke somme impatiente cholerique humoure cause woorse hardinge iudgemente wise haue learned readily speake il louanian vanitie saie member churche christe abide vnitie pope scripture doctoure father euer tolde sutche vnitie paule saith wee alone pope christe iesu greate vnitie saie hathe benne pope platyna stephano platyna saithe post stephanum semper haec consuetudo seruata est vt acta priorum pontificum sequentes ant infringereat aut omnino tollerent hathe benne ordinarie custome emonge pope euer sithence time pope steuin pope folowed afterworde would euermore either breake abolishe actes popeserasmus annotationib corin benne erasmus saith iohannes nicolaus totis decretis inter se pugnat id que quae videntur ad fidei negotium pertinere pope iohn pope nicolas theire whole decree contrarie one againste yea mater seeme belonge case faithe shorte pope haue fouly corrupted scripture haue corrupted decree canon councelles haue benne sorcerer idolater scribe phariseis thei haue benne arian heretiques nestorian heretiques monothelite heretiques montaniste heretiques thei haue mainteined damnable heresy godhed christe personne christe vvil christe immortalitie soule haue henne contrarie themselues one directly expressely againste yet muste pope beare vp whole churche god euen atlas beareth vy heauens onlesse al worlde abide vnitie churche thus saith hosiushosius petricouien confess ca vnum praeesse toti ecclesiae v que ade est necessarium vt ab que hoc ecclesia vna esse non possit necessarie thinge one haue gouernmente whole otherwise churche god cannot one likewise noted pope ovvne gloses vpon decretalles constat ecclesiam ideo esse vnam quia vniuersali ecclesia vnum est caput supremum scilicet papa plaine churche one vniuersal churche one supreme heade pope doctours doubteth steppe yet litle farther clemen ad nostrum glossa iohan de parisijs de potestate regia papali ca thus expounde woordes christe fiet vnu ouile vnus pastor quod quidem de christo intelligi non potest sed de aliquo alio ministro qui praesit loco eius shalbe one folde one shepehearde vvoordes vvee maie vnderstande christe somme minister ruleth roome whiche doctours catholique iudgemente wee finde vnitie churche hangeth christe pope ouer vaine grosse vanity though pope pope yea though antichriste pope yet christe hable holde churche perfite vnitie phesi paule saithe christus est caput ex quo totum corpus coagmentatur connectitur christe heade whole body churche framed faste ioined togeather therefore chrysostome saithechrysost ad colossen homi citatur cathena cap iohannis ex hoc capite corpus habet vt sit vt bene sir quid relicto capite membris adhaeres heade christe body hathe bothe also wel cleauest thou member leauest heade vnitie churche whole flocke maie heare voice one shepehearde folowe one shepehearde christe sonne god pope therefore augustine saithe per hanc potestatem quam solum sibi christus retinuit stat vnitas ecclesiae de qua dictum est vna est columba mea power whiche christe saithe hath geuen ouer pope hath reserued onely selfe standeth vnitie churche whiche vnitie saide dooue one ye saie appeareth bookes sufficient abundance scripture touchinge controuersie age accordinge sense meaninge togeather consente iudgemente holy father v ye saie wee builde onely vpon bare woordes make meaninge oure owne deede greate maisterie arme selfe somme shew scripturesmatthae con chalcedon actione athanas contra arianos oratione tertullian de baptismo diuel altogeather voide sutche furniture came tempte christe cyril saithe omnes haeretici de scriptura diuinitus inspirata sui colligunt erroris occasiones al herotiques heauenly inspired scripture geather occasion erroure athanasius saithe haeretici scriptutarum verbis pro esca vtuntur heretiques vse woordes scripture baite tertullian saithe fidem ex impugnat ex quibus constat heretique assausteth faithe woordes god breede faithe mutche ye saie yee beare sutche awe reuerence vnto vvoorde god interpretation thereof folowe onely sense holy ghoste iudgemente doctours father churche somme trial truthe herein let v see discretely reuerently ye haue vsed late councel holden laterane rome one simon begnius bishop modrusiaconcil lateran session pag saith thus vnto pope leo ecce venit leo de tribu iuda radix dauid c te leo beatissime saluatorem expectauimus c beholde lion comme tribe iuda roote deuind c moste blessed leo wee haue looked thee oure saueour late chapter tridente cornelius bishop bitonto saide thus concil trident cornelius bitont inus papa lux venit mundum dilexerunt homines tenebras magi quam lucem omnis qui male agit odit lucem non venit ad lucem abusinge scripture pope beinge lighte comme vvorlde menne haue loued darkenesse light euery man doothe euil hateth pope lighte commeth lighte pope adrian saith concil decreta collecta per adrianum pag papa non iudicabitur quoquam quia scriptum est non est discipulus supra magistrum man shal iudge pope written scholar aboue maister pope suffered embassadours sicilia lie prostrate grounde paulus aemylius lib thus crie vnto benne vnto christe qui tollis peccata mundi miserere nostri qui tollis peccata mundi dona nobis pacem thou holy father takest awaie sinnes worlde haue mercie vpon v thou takest awaie sinnes worlde geue v peace pope sixtus saithe accuseth pope neuer forgeuen reason thisconcil tomo purgatione sixti quia qui peccat spiritum sanctum non remittetur ei neque hac vita neque futura sinneth againste holy ghoste shal neuer foregeuen neither vvorlde vvorlde comme woordes scripture wel applied concludeth noman maie accuse pope leaue heape example infinite selfe hardinge haue often vsed scripture like sorte thus ye saie hard fo sonne man came destroie soules menne saue ergo substance breade sacramente annihilate consumed nothinge yee saie sense meaninge holy ghoste iudgemente al doctours holy father sutche religious awe reuerence ye beare towardes vvoorde god yet saithe doctoure hosius hosius contra brentium li fol scripture alleged v vvoorde diuel alleged handled onely vvoorde god yee vtterly wypte al shame face yee woulde neither make sutche mockery goddes holy woorde lewdely abuse people god apologie cap diuision woteth bishop rome thinges spoken owne minion vnderstandeth hathe sutche chapions fighte let herken holily ho godly one hosius writeth matter bishop polonia testifieth selfe man doubtlesse wel spoken vnlearned sharpe sto te mainteinour side thou wilt marueile suppose good man could either conceiue wickedly write despitefully woordes whiche knew proceeded goddes mouthe specially sutche sorte hee woulde haue seeme owne priuate opinion alone common opinion al bande dissembleth graunte deede hideth hee setteth foorthe matter though hehosius de expresso verbo dei side zvvenkfeldian heretiques speake vvee saithe vvil bidde avvaie vvith scripture vvhereof vve see brought onely diuerse also contrarie interpretation vve vvil heare god speake rather vvee vvil resorte naked elementes bare vvoordes scripture appointe oure saluation reaste behoueth man experte lavve scripture bee taught god loste laboure manne bestovveth scripture scripture creature certaine bare letter hosius saieinge vttered altogeather sprite minde wherewith time paste heretiques montanus marcion moued whoe written vsed saie contempte thei reiected holy scripture selues knewe many moe better thinges either christe apostle euer knewe shal saie heere ye principal postes religion ye archegouernours christes churche reuerence whiche yee geue goddes vvoorde holy scripture whiche paule saithe came inspiration god whiche god commende many miracle wherein moste perfite printes christes owne steppe whiche al holy father apostle angel whiche christe selfe sonne god often needeful allege testimonie proufe wil ye though vilwoorthy heare auaunt wil ye enioine god keepe silence speaketh moste clearely owne mouthe scripture vvoorde whereby alone paule saithe reconciled god whiche prophete dauid saithe holy pure shal laste euer wil ye cal bare deade letter wil ye saie al laboure loste whiche bestowed thinge whiche christe hath commaunded v diligently searche haue euermore eies wil ye saie christe apostle meante suttletie deceiue people exhorted reade holy scripture thereby might flowe al wisedome knowledge marueile al though men despise v al dooinges seeinge set litle god selfe infallible saieinges yet wante witte intent mighte hurte v doo extreme iniurie vvoorde god hosius wil make exclamation saie wee doo wronge owne woordes woordes heretique zvvenkfeldius zvvenkfeldius make exclamation side saie woordes hosius owne woordes tel hath zvvenkfeldius euer written haue written hosius haue iudged wicked hath hosius spoken mutche one woorde confute euer mater goe although hosius peraduenture wil allowe woordes yet dothe disallow meaninge woordes welueare al controuersies namely touchinge vse holy communion vnder bothe kindes although woordes christe plaine euident yet dothe hosius disdeinefully reiecte better colde dead elementes commaundeth v geeue faithe certaine newe lesson appointed churche wote reuelations holy ghoste pighius saith mene ought beleue cleare manifeste woordes scripture onlesse allowed good interpretation authoritie churche whereby meaneth churche rome hardinge ignorantly wickedly stubbornely authour apologie burdeneth reuerent father god honourable prelate cardinall hosius neuer saide vnknowen al men haue readen booke whiche wrote de expresso verbo dei expresse vvoorde god aske muche pardon detecte hereticall touche twoo make direct answeare foule slaunderinge hosius firste note fidelitie newe holy brother doo thinges maie thought secretary newe clergie penninge apologie sawe hosius booke expresse woorde god haue benne conuersant augustine hierome chrysostome auncient father vse hosius time saie reade neither olde father diligence neither writer time snappes piece either selues write line two vse whiche owne secte hath taken moste parte neuer knowe true meaninge place whiche alleage vsinge patched note bookes bringinge scattered authority deceiued themselues deceiue others tooke note knewe well woordes hosius onely put name hosius vnto taken booke writer apologie knowinge remembringe muche founde note booke name hosius suche woordes rashely put printe owne greate shame discredite excuse true wee muste needes laie maruelous malice saide writer wittingly set purpose impute woordes hosius whiche reported waie mislikinge shewinge whose heresie conteined let defender chose whether haue secretarie condemned ignorance malice euer marke yet thirde pointe whiche hereof wil gather apologie skant printed published grosse errour hande espied woorde thereof brought authour meane penned confesse deceiued crie hosius mercie woonte heretikes wil go forewarde matter begonne euer come vvhat vvhen shoulde set foorthe englishe woorde came thereof made excuse warraunt meete heretike whose propertie proficere peius paule saithe proceede worse worse take degree backewarde great faulte make farre greatter whereas charitiemoueth thinke made errour supposinge hosius haue saide whiche warde stubborne mainteininge sheweth spirite mighte reasonably haue excused ignorance chose rather spitefully discouer malice shall manifestly appeare circumstance thinge laieth hosius charge persone charge esteeme holy scripture proueth certaine woordes alleaged treatise made hosius de expresso verbo dei woordes put apologie reader maie see true argumente hosius booke shewe heretikes haue alleaged woordes god written none haue taken righte vnderstandinge goddes woordes doo deede signifie onely catholike churche atteineth vnto onely hath holy ghoste heretikes haue brought opinion written vvoorde god longe vntill laste saithe hosius founde woordes scripture toke vpon take away al auctoritie scripture natum est saithe nouum quoddam prophetarum genus qui non sunt veriti scripturarum auctoritate scripturis auctoritatem omnem detrahere en quo perduxit rem tandem saranas certaine newe kinde prophetes risen sticke authoritie scripture take away al auctoritie scripture see whither length deuill hath brought matter afterwarde expoundinge matter large declareth capitaine heresie haue benne zwenkfeldius sheweth texte scripture dauid saithe heare lorde speaketh zwenkfeldius wente aboute wil men heare god telleth euery man inspiration rather geue attendance written woorde god while hosius reporteth zwenkfeldius saide maintenance fonde heresie amonge woordes brought apologie hosius againste catholikes whereas neither hosius catholike speaketh onely zwenkfeldius selfe hitherto haue shewed woordes alleaged apologie vnder name hosius make neither againste v beinge woordes onely woordes zwenkfeldius vvell credite maie geue man expoundinge vvoorde god whose true meaninge maie falsisie pleasure bringe foorthe god selfe declare woordes seeinge dareth burthen hosius woordes whiche hosius selfe beinge yet aliue declare haue another meaninge booke selfe doothe witnesse liste reade greate faulte impure horrible heresie hosius vniustly greate ignorance charge heresie whiche refuteth impugneth greate crime yet suche might ri e misreporte ignorance tolde shoulde reason haue corrected haue repented peter despaired cain iudas vnderstoode erred addeth glose farre malicious former errour graun inge hosius setteth matter though neither side heretikes zwenkfeldians spake withstandinge burtheneth bothe catholikes saieinge dissembleth hideth syr waie amende faulte graunt hosius spake zwenkfeldians yet beare men hande fauoured fauoured heresie needed refell saie hosius dissembleth hideth sith euen two place moste plaine woordes laie zwenkfeldian heresie charge reade owne booke allegation zwenkfeldius heresie saie thus vve saithe bid away c allegation haue woordes hosius saieinge standeth togeather haue forgotten prouerbe biddeth lier mindefull tell howe name kinde dealinge lieinge detraction slaunderinge malicious speakinge sir hosius haue spoken euill geue witnesse euill haue spoken well euen owne confession reputinge zwenkfeldians heretikes finde faulte good woordes suche saie selfe confesse good reprooue speaketh zwenkfeldius againe graunt speaketh yet reproued contine without reason learninge witte must needes without pertinacie man either perfite heretike perfite slaunderer yet stande defence worlde accompte desperate persone man euer sawe hosius woorkes thinke gilty burthen man might thinke deceiued mistooke hosius sith graunt doo mistake yet charge auouchinge whiche holdeth heresie vnderstandeth thus muche maye assure selfe disposed belie slaunder hosius though coste damnation soule shame man repente reuoke whiche owne conscience stinteth barke hosius saie peraduenture allowe woordes zuenkfeldiusthe mistakinge hosius yet doothe disallowe meaninge woordes vvell clerkely reasoned though woordes allowed disallowed principall cause theire meaninge therefore disalloweth woordes hath muche disallowed meaninge yet saie holy communion vnder bothe kindes reiecteth plaine woordes christe deade colde elementes verely man mighte thinke booke set foorthe ennemie newe englishe clergie mutche defacinge theselues diuerse time acknowleged whelpe owne littour life finde one leafe without many lie b sarisburie cannot greately blame hardinge though yee shewe selfe hote vehement defence hosius somme felowes maie saie carneades saide sommetime chrysippus nisi chrysippus fuisset ego non essem chrysippus benne neuer benne hosius benne good vnto spared parte furniture sutche diuinitie benne ful bare ye saie wee reade neither olde writer newe vtterly ignorante voide al learninge respecte beames knowlege knowe nothinge ambitious childishe vanitie make vauntes learninge motche ye seeme desirous greate readinge ye shal haue whole praise glorie hardinge without contention wee wil rather saie paule wee knowe nothinge onely iesus christe crucified vpon crosse yet notwithstandinge wee neither ignorant idle wee hable haue leasure reade wel olde doctours father churche also lighte vnciuile pamflettes blotted paper whiche god wote al respectes newe either wee mutche ashamed behalfe olde doctours father see parte either wilfulnesse forgeatefulnesse ignorance fowly misused owne paper nouelties see vntruthe vncourteous speache fully freighted touchinge hosius yee condemne v vtterly either ignorance malice woordes wherein wee finde sutche faulte vttered saie parte owne iudgemente onely personne heretique zuenkfeldius therefore ye saie wee charge wrongefully allowinge thinge whiche expressely plainely reproueth firste al authour apologie protesteth ouersight herein proceeded onely erroure malice maie wel appeare yt deceiued alone deceiued mistakinge woordes diuerse others beste learned age haue benne deceiued therein wel henicolaus gallus nicolaus gallus hereof writeth thus hosius cardinalis legatus sanctissimi praesidens concili tridentini suo libro de expresso verbo dei ait no vero dei de coelo sententiam potius expectabimus c non oportet legis aut scripturae esse peritum sed deo doctum vanus est labor qui scripturis impenditur scriptura enim creatura est egenum quoddam elementum cardinal hosius legate vnto holy father president councel trident booke de expresso verbo dei saithe thus wil rather waite goddes wil heauen c behooueth man skilful lawe god scripture taught god loste laboure spente scripture scripture creature poore kinde warde elemente thus nicolaus gallus burdeneth owne catholique frende hosius woordes heretique zuenkfeldius likewise saithe flacius illyricusthe mistakinge hosius speakinge woordes hosius vnum locum ex plurimis proferam quo hosius alterius cuiusdam sententiam de hac citansflacius illyricus norma concilij comprobat no dei de coelo sententiam potius expectabimus c vanus est labor qui scripturis impenditur one place wil allege many hosius bringinge saieinge one certaine man meaninge zuenkfeldius allovveth vvel woordes saithe illyricus hosius vttereth name personne zuenkfeldius yet neuerthelesse alloweth owne like pourpose writeth iacobus andreae reported al foresaide woordes iacob andreae de authorita sacrae scripturae ende concludeth thus hactenus hosius quae verba siue hosius suo siue aliorum nomine recitet certe hanc else asoti hosij de sacrum scriptura sententiam non est obscurum thus farre hosius whiche woordes euer hosius reporte either owne name name somme without al doubte judgemente bothe asotus hosius haue holy scripture likewise saith moste graue learned father iohannes brentius interea vociferantur iohan b pra lac dreae contra hosium sacram scripturam else dubiam ambigua praeceptorem mutum litera occidentem literam mortuam adeo que fi reuerendis illis patribus libuerit aesopi fabulas meane crie holy scripture blinde doubteful doube scholemaister killinge vvrite deade letter yea shal like reuerende father better esopes fable perhaps ye wil saie learned menne yee saie others thei vsed onely patched notebookes scattered authority snappes peeces line twoo vnderstoode wrote notwithstandinge euer shal please saie therein grace greate yet see fewe muste needes confesse authoure apologie thouchinge place hosius happily ouerseene erroure yet many beste learned age keepe companie erroure verily saie saie thus saithe zuenkfeldius saie wee saie thus saith hosius hosius hable blinde many wee must thinke skilful writer fairest coloure ye laie hereon euer woordes vttered hosiusiacob andreae yet parte meaninge yet iacobus andreae saith hanc else asoti hosij sententiam non est obscurum without doubte meaninge alotusflaci illyricus alterius cuiusdam sententiam de hac citans comprobat hosius illyricus saith hosius alleginge ye saieinge one certaine man whereby meaneth heretique zuenkfeldius allovveth vvel mutche yee saie glose maliceous former erroure therein wee spitefully discouer malice without reason without learninge without vvitte require v repente shame sinne againste hosius againste holy ghoste beseche therefore indifferently consider reuerence modestie onely hosius also sundrie others frendes side haue vsed speake write vvoorde god ludouicus canon ye churche laterane rome oration openly pronounced late chapter tridenteludouicus citatur ab illyrico norma concilij saithe thus ecclesia est viuum pectus christi scriptura autem est quasi mortuum atramentum churche liuely breaste christe scripture deade inke likewise saide bishop poiters chapter scriptura est re manimis mutaiohan sleidanus lib sicut etiam sunt reliquae leges politicae scripture deade doumbe thinge al politique lawes albertus pigghius saithe si dixeris haec referri oportere ad iudicium scripturarumalbert pigghius controuer de ecclesia communis sensus ignarum esse comprobas sunt enim scripturae muti iudices thou saie mater muste put ouer iudgemente scripture thou west thee selfe voide common reason scripture doumbe iudges cannot speake eckius calleth scripture mistakinge hosius euangelium nigrum theologiam atramentariam blacke gospel inken diuinitie againe pigghius saithe ecclesia habet illam potestatemmartinus kemnitius examine con tridentini pag martin kemnitius eodem examine pag vt possit scriptis quibusdam impertiri canonicam authoritatem quam nec ex se nec ex suis authoribus habent churche hath power geeue canonical authoritie vnto certaine writinges whiche otherwise haue neither selues authours maie certaine bookes allowed scripture saithe yt haue credite authoritie selues therefore meaninge hereof must needes churche rome hath authoritie make scripture againe saithe sunt scripturae vt non minus vere quam festiue dixit quidam velut nasus cereus qui se horsum illorsum quancunque volueris partempigghius hierar li cap fol trahi retrahi fingi que facile permittit one man bothe truely merily saide scripture like nose vvaxe easily suffereth selfe drawen backewarde forewarde moulded falshioned waie waie euer yee liste thus harding yee teache people reuerence weighe vvoorde god ye calle deade inke liuelesse mater doumbe iudge cannot speake blacke gospel inken diuinitie nose vvaxe thinge vtterly voide authoritie selfe examine place weigh woordes lie sclaunders iudge vprightly remoue affection ye shal finde hosius zuenkfeldius touchinge authoritie credite goddes vvoorde accorde one proufe whereof obiection made kinge dauid beinge bishop onely temporal prince written psalmes saie kete scripture hosius made answearehosius lib contra brentium quid ni scriberet scribimus indocti docti que poemata passim vvrote dauid psalmes shoulde write horace saith vvee write ballade euery body learned vnlearned tagge ragge vnreuerently like heathen scorneth scoffeth scripture god likeneth heauenly ditty holy ghoste vile heathenishe wanton ballade zuenkfeldius benne great blasphemie yee allowe hosius vertue luke luke saithe pharisaei iurisperiti spreuerunt consilium dei semetipsis phariseis learned lawe despised ye councel god selues irenaeus saithe irenae li ca haeretici accusant scripturas quasi recte habeant necsint ex authoritate c heretiques finde faulte scripture wel written sufficient authoritie c thus doo ende cause people lothe doubte woorde life becomme captiue owne traditionscardinal cusan de authorita ecclesiae concilij supra cotra scripturam therefore cardinal cusanus saithe thus haec est omnium sane intelligentium sententia qui scripturarum authoritatem intellectum ecclesiae approbatione fundant non e conuerso ecclesiae fundamentum scripturarum authoritate locant c dico nulla else christi praecepta nisi quae per ecclesiam pro talibus accepta sunt iudgemente al meane wel whiche founde authoritie vnderstandinge scripture allowance churche contrarie wise laie ye fundation churche authoritie scripture thus saie comaundementes christe onely sutche ye churche allowed christes commaundementes albert pigghius hierar lib ca saithe highest doctoure albertus pigghius postoli quaedam conscripserunt non vt scripta illa praeessent fidei religioni nostrae sed potius vt subessent apostle wrote certaine thinges writinges shoulde aboue faithe iohan maria verractus editus hosius de expresso verbo dei pa religion rather shoulde vnder iohannes maria verractus saithe determinatio ecclesiae appellatur euangelium determination churche called gospel therefore hosius episcopal authoritie pronounceth sentence definitiue wise quod ecclesia docet expressum dei verbum est quod contra sensum mistakinge hosius consensum ecclesiae docetur expressum diaboli verbum est euer churche teacheth churche meaneth pope cardinalles churche rome c expresse vvoorde god euer taught againste meaninge consente churche expresse vvoorde diuel sommetime ordinarie practise sundrie olde heretiques scorne disdeigne scripures god grounde selues vpon conclusion imagination theire owne heretique carpocrates saideepiphani lib haere tertullian de praescription knewe either christe selfe apostle tertullian saithe discipuli montani dicunt paracletum plura montano dixisse quam christum euangelio protulisse nec tantum plura sed etiam meliora que maiora disciple montanus heretique said holy ghoste vttered moe thinges montanus theire maister euer christe vttered gospel onely moethinges also greatter better thinges againe saide paulus ex parte sciebat ex parte prophetabat nondum enim venerat quod perfectum est paule knewe parte augustin ad quoduulideum prophesied parte perfection afterwarde montanus yet comme therefore vniuersally true hardinge saie al heretiques haue alleged scripture somme heretiques whoes steppe ye seeme treade haue made lighte disdeigned scripture wel somme heretiques haue alleged scripture doo without sense euen al heretiques euermore reproued scripture bee cause felowes parte fearefully shunne scripture dooth euil fleeth light therefore wereas ye cal v foorthe bidde v humbly crie mercie firste bidde hosius scholemaister recante errours wil speake reuerently goddes vvoorde holy let confesse repente blasphemie comparing scripture god heathenishe ballade recante errours pigghius cusanus eckius others doctoures felowes haue set abroade authoure apologie shal doo euer shal behoue remember also howe vniuste vntrue reportes selfe felowes haue witingly willingly published blased writinge sparinge man pleased touche sclaunder selfe selfe booke haue written thusm har fol b learned gospeller sea townes saxonie teache helle al companie thus moste vniustly sclaundereth godly father doctoure peter martyr copus dialo pag petrus martyr negat christum else nostrum deprecatorem peter martyr denieth christe intercessoure likewise againe one general sclaunder misreporteth al professours gospel euercopus dialo pag omnes euangelici pseudomartyres negant christum venisse carne al gospeller thought better calle false witness gospel denie christe euer came fleashe wil presse example immoderate sclaunders vncourteous tongue hath bridle waste woordes haue ende al like reportes conscience knoweth moste vntrue yet haue ye doubted thus hasarde whole credite vainely feede world suffer therefore hardinge answeare owne woordes shame man repente reuoke whiche owne conscience stinteth barke againste selfe apologie cap diuision yet though litle also burne holy scripture time paste wicked kinge aza antiochus maximinus woonte name heretiques bookes eusebius lib cap doubt seemeth thei would doo herode olde time ievvrie hee might surety keepe stil vsurped dominion idumean borne straunger stocke kinred ievves yet couetinge mutche taken iewe thende might establishe posteritie kingdome countrie whiche gotten augustus caesar commaunded al gen alogies petigrees burnt made waie remaine recorde whereby might knowen came alien bloude whereas euen abraham time monumetes benne safely keapte amongest ievves laide vp theire treasurie bicause might easily moste assuredly founde linage euery one descende good faithe doo menne woulde haue al theire owne dooinges estimation though benne deliuered v euen apostle christe selfe thende might founde thinge hable conuince sutche theire dreames lie either burne holy scripture el craftily conueigh people hardinge pardon praie thee reader vse woordes vehemente cause requiringe defender crieth ye pillours religion mutche iustly crie againe thou captaine lier moste woorthy rewarde whetstone iudgemente abackebiter slaunderer cursed speaker mocker accuser brother blasphemer regarde thou hasteal hardinges sobrietie railinge saie god christen men thine owne estimation common honestie man canste thou persuade thy selfe greate credite lieinge seme sober railinge honeste villanie charitable slaunderinge vpright deceit iuste impietie saiest thou v general saie catholike churche despise hate caste awaie burne holy scripture loued kepte scripture howe couldest thou thy fellowes haue comme ye v apostle time daie haue kepte themvntruthe olde latine texte hath infinite corruptios vnspotted vndefiled ye within fifty yeres haue vulgare translation vntruthe othervvise let hirdinge shevve one pointe corruption corrupted lamentable consider burned corrupte translation parte thereof heretical treatise burned scripturesbut foolishe man burneth dovvne bothe tree caterpillers al togeather one dothe apple tree burneth caterpillers scripture honoure kepe moste reuerently diligently therefore comparinge v wicked kinges aza antiochus maximinus herode false slaunderous saie sir captaine liersyou library poore people scripture euery monasterie cathedral church college euery priuate library lerned like thinge obiected augustine catholikes time donatistes beinge heretikes ye nowe answeareth wil answeare certe ille ignibus tradidisse credatur qui eis lectis non consentire conuincitur let thought haue caste holy scripture fire reade conuict consente vnto vve reade holy scripture christe said body vvho beleueth itburninge scripture yevntruthe vve denie denie contente die defence real body blessed sacramente iames saithe man iustified woorkes faithe onely vvho beleueth thus whiche saie onely faith iustifieth whiche saie woorkes required also iustifie ionioan christ saitha vvoorthy argumente ful vvisely applied reade ansvveare qui maducat hunc panem viuet aeternum eateth breade shal liue euer vvho beleueth saie kindes necessarie laie men commaundement christe saie one kinde sufficiente saluation concerninge eatinge sacramente b sarisburie ye maie soone pardoned hardinge speakinge il mutche ought maie appeare youre speache ye haue yet learned speake wel whether ye haue burnte scripture god bothe heauen earthe sea lande maie beare witnesse poore excuse ye saie ye haue burnte errours heretical translation scripture housbandeman vseth burn caterpillers howe maie thought vnwise housbandeman burneth vp caterpillers tree bothe togeather wreake selfe one contente destroie al bookes conteininge erroure burnte louanian nouelles goe wracke yewis hardinge contention vaine glorie set part ye know right wel thei ful errours moreouer ye knowe errours augustine errours orige tertullia ambrose hierome errours euery ye aunciente father ye greekes latines one errours schole doctoures errours canonistes briefely holy father decree decretalles voide errours yet booke woorthy burnte respecte erroure onely booke scripture sutche errours vulgare translation ye shoulde haue discried although al yet credites sake one least ye haue remoued errour haue restoared scripture vse comforte people troubleth soare scripture published common knowen tongue simple people al sortes otherwise ye cal dogges svvine filthy brute beastes voide reason maie vnderstande hardinge greate horrible errrour erroure al errours therefore irenaeus saithe alleged beforeirenae li ca haeretici cum ex scripturis arguuntur accusationem vertuntur scripturarum heretiques reproued scripture beginne finde faulte scripture ambros luca lib cap therefore ambrose saith herodes conscius ignobilitatis suae scripturas incendit ne qua posteris suis vel de praescripto veteri quaestio moueretur existimas quod si indicia de publico sustulisset nullis alijs testimonijs clarere posset quin de patriarcharum proselytoru veterum genere emanaret king herode wel vnderstoode basenesse house therefore burnte scripture leaste meane sutche ancient recordes somme doubte might afterwarde moued posteritie thought remoued sutche monumentes could neuer proued manner witnesse came descente stocke patriarkes olde proselyte whereas deede amere altene stranger house israel tyrannous vsurper crowne beinge lineally descended iacob esau ye saie haue keapte preserued scripture library veleme trowe letter golde euen like sorte like truthe ye might saie haue keapte sonne moone benne keepinge benne loste god hardinge mercie preserued holy vvorde eue preserued daniel caue lion ionas whale bellykeepinge scripture three child middes flaming fire yee keepe scripture dogge keepeth haie whiche neither eateth selfe suffereth poore hungrie cattle faine woulde eate yee keepe warde duste moulde ievves time kinge iosias keapte booke deuteronomie closely corners2 regum emongest treasure ye temple noman knewe finde benne goddes special prouidence notwithstandinge keepinge might haue perished chrysostome saithe chrysost epi ad hebraeos homil nunc ne que sint scripturae quidam sciunt spiritus tamen ita dispesauit vt custodiantur day somme cannot tel whether scripture yet hath sprite god prouided stil preserued thus ievves made theire vauntes keeper lavve christian al augustine saith iudaei dicut non nostra no lege vti august quaestionibus ex veteri testament quaest paulus phagius deuter ca sed sua ievves saie wee haue lawe owne onely theires likewise eue daie iewes keepe vse lavve god al reuerence neuer laie booke vpon bible thei wasshe theire handes touche wil sit vpon benche bible lieth often either open shutte vse kisse ye pope goeth rome palace laterane ievves meete vpo waie offer bible desire reuerently embrace though pope coulde haue bible onely al thinges notwithstandinge pope answeareth course euen wee maie answeare sanctam legem viri hebraei laudamus veneramur obseruantia vero vestram ceremoniar li cap vanam interpretationem damnamus improbamus ye menne ievves profession wee praise honoure holy lavve tradition vaine interpretation wee vtterly condemne reproue chrysostome saithe chryso matt homil nihil nunc apud iudaeos remansit nisi sola scriptura librorum omni legis obseruantia pereunte remaineth nowe nothinge emonge ievves onely writinge conteined bookes al obseruation lavve paste chrysosto cenesim homil chrysostom psalm againe saithe literae quidem legis apud illos sunt sensus autem est apud no letter lavve ievves sense meaninge v likewise saith vnto ievves vos complicatis membranas animaltum mortuorum no possidemus spiritum viuificautem turne leaues scripture made skinnes deade cattle haue sprite geeueth life august de fide rerum inuisibil cap august contra fausiu mantchae lib cap saithe augustine iudaei libris suffragatores nostri sunt cordibus hostes nostri iewes healpe v aide v theire bookes thei enimies theire harte againe saith magnum aliquid actum est vsum nostrum de infidelirate iudaeorum vt ijdem ipsi qui haec propter se non haberent cordibus ea propter no haberent codicibus somme greate good thinge wrought vse infidelitie iewes doo selues good thinges theire harte yet sake doo v good shoulde haue thinges theire bookes speake therefore mutche hardinge safe keepinge ye scripture jevves haue keapte vntil daie doo keepe safely yae keapte scripture augures rome sommetime keapte sibylles bookes saie yee keapte selues close prisonne secresie people knowe nothing al case forced seeke thus ye keapte light darknesse paule saitheroman chryso matt homil ye keapte truthe god vvickednesse chrysostome saithe quando vides scripturas prophetarum euangelij apostolorum traditas esse manus falsorum sacerdotum num intelligis quod verbum veritatis traditum est principibus iniquis scribis thou seeste scripture prophetes gospel apostle deliuered handes false priestesthis body dooste thou vnderstande woorde truthe deliuered vnto wicked prince vnto scribe short maie answeare woordes chrysostome arca scrinia rerum pretiosissimarum adhuc seruatischrysostom corin homi sauro destituti yee keepe stil cheastes box moste pretious thinges iewelles treasure cleane gonne therefore safe keeping scripture notwithstandinge wee maie saie augustine sommetime said heretique petilian iudas christum carnalem tradidit tu spiritualem furens euangelium sanctum flammis sacrilegis tradidistiaugusti contra literas petilia lib cap iudas betraiede christe carnal thou haste betraied christe spiritual thou thy rage haste deliuered holy gospel vnto wicked fire yee replie rather haue burnte gospel denie woordes gospel example ye allege woordes christe body vvhiche vvoordes ye saie part denied god thaked wee haue burnte haue wee denied woorde parcel gospel touchinge wordes alleged wee embrace reuerence beleue euen vvoordes christe wee embrace haue fondely rackte wreasted fowly abused vaine construction christe meante aunciente catholique father olde time haue expounded chrysostom iohan homi chrysostome saithe sacrae scripturae verba non vult deus vt simpliciter sed multa cum prudetia intelligantur god wil shoulde vnderstande vvoordes holy scripture simply plainely thei lie greate wisedome chrysosto iohan homil discretion againe saithe diligenter inuigilandum est vel potius diuina gratia opus est ne nudis verbis insistamus ita haeretici errorem incidunt wee must take great heede rather haue neede grace god wee reaste vpon bare vvoordes scripture meanes heretiques fal erroureaugust ad consentiu li ca hierony ad galat cap augustine saithe omne figurate aut factum aut dictum hoc enuntiat quod significat euery thinge either donne spoken figure sheweth foorth thinge signifieth hierome saithe ne puremus verbis scripturarum esse euangelium sed sensu let v thinke gospel standeth vvoordes scripture meaninge againe saithe hieron matt cap cum seniores putentur ecclesijs principe sacerdotum simplicem sequentes literam occidunt filium dei whereas thei taken elder churche chiefe priestes folowinge plaine letter written regardinge meaninge kille sonne god let v see therefore sense holy catholique father haue olde time expounded woordes christe first tertullian saithe thus christus acceptum panem distributum discipulis corpus suum illum fecittertullian contra marcionem lib augusti contra adiman cap hoc est corpus meum hoc est figura corporis mei christe taking breade diuiding disciple made body saieing body saie figure body augustine saith non dubitauit dominus dicere hoc est corpus meum cum daret signum corporis sui lorde doubted saie body gaue token body leaue infinite authority like pourpose fewe maie easily perceiue sense holy father olde time vnderstoode wordes christe body yet thei neuer therefore condemned heresie thought denie parcel scripture augustine saith august quaessionib leuit quaest solet re quae significat eius rei nomine quam significat nucupari hinc est quod dictum est petra erat christus non enim dicit petra significat christum sed tanquam hoc esset quood vtique per substantiam non erat sed per significatione thinge signifieth commonly called name thinge signifieth therefore paule saithe rocke vvas christe saithe rocke signified christe body rocke christe rocke benne christe deede whereas touchinge substance signification sorte breade christes body verily deede augustine saithe certaine phrase manner speache noted euen owne glosede con dist hoc est gloss vocatur corpus christi id est significat corpus christi breade called body christe saie breade signifieth body christe thus wee denie christes woordes hardinge denie fonde fantastical sens haue imagined christes vvoordes therefore allege woordes spoken augustine burner scripture consenteth vnto scripture yee might haue remembred augu epist augustine likewise saithe ille credatur testamentum tradidisse flammis qui contra voluntatem litigat testatoris thought haue deliuered testamente fire quarrelleth doo againste wil meaninge made testamente gregorie saithe facile verbis agnoscimus aliud esse quod intimant aliud quod sonant tanto autem quis que notitiae illius extraneus redditurgregorius iob lib ca quato sola eius superficie ligatur wordes wee doo wel perceiue one thing signifie thing sound man bindeth selfe ovvtvvarde sight shevve letter vnderstandinge obiection difference ye make bitweene iames paule augustine saithe made vnderstand neither iames augu lib quaestionu q parte ca diui paule whole force thereof answeared easy see paule speaketh one kinde vvoorkes iames againe paule one kinde iustification iames therefore difference soone auoided certainely wee denie neither paule iames thinke one contrarie touchinge woordes christe ye haue alleged iohn appeareth ye somme basteiohan therefore faine take came firste hande wil saie hardinge doctoure father drifte discretion common sense euer taught reason thus christe saithe eateth breade shal liue euer ergo people muste receiue communion vnder one kinde remnitius examine conci triden pag freere eckius felow reasoneth like discretion like pourpose geue v saithe daily breade ergo vvee maie restraine people cuppe perhaps ye wil saie name breade belongeth eatinge onely drinkinge maie graunted wel without preiudice notwithstandinge cyprian doubted saiecyprian de coena domini eodem serm manducauerunt biberunt de eodem pane bothe eate drinke one breade againe saithe manducamus bibimus eius sanguinem wee eate drinke bloude deede woordes christe sixthe iohn belonge onely spiritual eatinge drinkinge christes body bloude wrought mouthe onely faith nothinge outward ministration sacramentenicolaus lyra psalm owne doctoure nicolas lyra saith haec verba nihil directe pertinent ad sacramentalem vel corporalem manducationem nam hoc verbum dictum fuit antequam sacramentum eucharistiae esset institutum ex illa igitur litera de sacramentali communione non potest fieri argumentum efficax woordes christe sixth chapter iohn directely perteine nothing sacramental corporal eatinge woordes spoken longe sacramente ordeined therefore place made good sufficiente argumente touching sacramental communion saie proufe taken woordes sufficient communion vnder one kinde therewith ye deceiue ignorant lyra saithe sufficient let indifferente reader iudge whether twoo deceiued whereas ye woulde seeme saie christe gaue commaundemente bothe kindes receiued people euen lyke truethe yee might also saie christe gaue commaundemente one kinde al receiued people man present onely apostle institution wel one kinde therefore people maie claime one parte sacramente haue right onely youre mere free liberalitie otherwise dewtie youre iudgemete shoulde haue nothinge notwithstandinge christe saithe bibite ex hoc omnes drinke ye onely apostle drinke ye al whiche woordes paschasius expoundeth thus paschasius bibite ex hoc omnes hoc est tam ministri quam reliqui credentes drinke ye al saie vvel minister reste faithfulglossa citatura cassandro de vtra que specie saithe thus bibite ex hoc omnes omnes scilicet sine personarum acceptione drinke ye al al saie without difference choise personnes hereof haue spoken large place apologie cap diuision rightely aptely doth chrysostome write menne heretikes saithe shutte vp gate truethe knowe ful wel gate open churche shoulde none theires theophylacte also goddes vvoorde saithe candel whereby theefe espied apologie cap diuision tertullian saith holy scripture manifestly findeth fraude theafte heretiques doo hide doo keepe vnder gospel whiche christe woulde haue preached alowde house toppe whealme light vnder busshel whiche ought stande candelsticke hardinge scripture saithe shalbe menne standing owne conceite vnchaste louing pleasure god2 tim vvho vnchaste exhorte al menne tothis chastitie part open filthinesse forebidde marriage suffer concubine better meane serue god math chastitie selues abstaine wedlocke better meane serue god ye bidde menne whiche haue vowed chastitie breake vowes b sarisburie leaue youre chastitie iudgemente worlde yet maie remember somme olde time whome christe likened painted graues outwardely appearance faire glorious inwardly ful stinking boanes appeareth whole course order youre liues single life hierony daniel cap chastitie sundrie thinges hierome saithe thus super concupiscentiam foeminarum non intelliget de antichristo facilior interpretatio est quood ideo simulet castitatem vt plurimos decipiat shal haue skil touching desiere weemen countrefeite chastitie better exposition hereof applie woordes antichriste shal countrefeite chastitie ende deceiue many augustine saithe heretiques called manicheesaugustin de moribus ecclesiae cathol li cap ambro de noe arca ca vitae castae memorabilis continentiae imaginem praeferunt beare countenance continent life notable chastitie ambrose saithe multi sunt haereticorum qui praetendere volunt corporis continentiam many heretiques wil countrefeite pretende chastitie body witnesse thereof maie winne credit theire doctrine therefore hardinge thus vaunte selues coloure chastitie ye make boaste thing heretiques antichriste selfe shal haue wel paule foretelleth v disciple antichriste emongest markes whereby maie knowen saithe thus prohibentes nubere tim hierony hieremi cap lib whereby meante antichriste shoulde geue greate shine chaste life forbidde marriage sutche hierome saithe iactant pudicitiam suam impudenti facie make bragges chastitie whoorishe countenance apologie cap diuision truste blindenesse vnskilful multitude ignorance goodnesse cause thinke sleightes already perceiued walke nowe vnspied though hadde gyges ring goe inuisible vpon finger apologie cap diuision al menne see nowe wel wel againe good stuffe cheste bishop rome bosome thing alone selfe maie argument sufficient woorke vprightly truely hardinge mutche troubled cheste pope bosome wherein thought haue al lawes scoffe foure fiue time apologie medlinge matter vnderstande lawiers phrase vvho presupposeth prince euery common weale knowe lawe lesse written breaste therefore maketh newe lawe repealeth former lawe whereunto latter contrary b sarisburie mutche matter pope breaste deepe full darkenesse specially saie lavviers phrase man maie safely enter onely neuer student lavve lette v therefore see owne canonistes lavviers selues haue meante hereby firste albaldus baldus perusium saithe papa est doctor vtrius que iuris authoritate non scientia pope doctour bothe lawes wel ciuile canon authoritie knowledge wee finde howe euer pope stoared learninge yet leaste doctoure authoritie youre glose saithe quae ne que ab augusto dis si romanorum gloss etsi totus mundus sententiaret aliquo negotio contra papam tamen videtur quod standum fit sententiae papae iura enim omnia scrinio pectoris sui habere videtur quod ergo papa approbat vel reprobat no approbate vel reprobare debemus quisquis ergo non obedit statutis romanae ecclesiae haereticus est censendus cheaste pope bosome et sacrilegij instar esset disputare de facto papae although al worlde woulde iudge mater againste pope yet seemeth wee ought stande iudgemente pope seemeth haue al lavves cheaste bosomedist si papa glossa therefore euer pope either alloweth disalloweth wee bounde likewise allowe disallowe euer obedient lawes churche rome muste deemed heretique great sinne churcherobbinge reason pope dooinges extra de trasta episcopi quato glossa felin de rescriptis ad audientiam ver youre lavviers saie thus papa dicitur habere coeleste arbitrium vnde quae vult est ei pro ratione voluntas nec est qui dicat illi domine cur ita facis quia sicut ex sola voluntate potest per papam lex creari ita per solam voluntatem potest cum ea dispensari pope saide haue heauenly iudgemente therefore sutche thinges willeth wil standeth steede reason neither maie man saie vnto sir vvhy doo yovv thus like lavve maie made onely vvil pope maie lavv bee dispensed withal onely vvil pope hardinge exposition youre lavviers phrase theise treasure wee taughte seeke closet pope breaste thus maie wee set aparte scripture doctoures councelles euer biside pope breaste maie serue al apologie cap diuision worthily ought mater seeme suspicious whiche fleeth trial afraide light dooth euil christe saith seketh darkenesse hateth light coscience knovveth selfe cleere commeth vvillingly open shevve vvoorkes vvhiche proceede god maie seene neither bee blinde see wel yenough theire kingdome streightwaie pointe scripture haue vpper hande like menne saie idolles diuelles time paste whome menne doubtful mater woonte receiue answeares suddainly striken doumbe sight christe borne came worlde euen see nowe al suttle practises wil soone fal downe hedlonge euen vpon sight gospel antichriste ouerthrowen brightnesse christes comming apologie cap diuision v wee renne succour fire mennes guise wee renne scripture neither doo wee reason swerde vvorde god therewith saithe tertullian doo vvee feede faithe doo vvee stirre vp oure hope strengthen confidence hardinge ye flie fire wee doo saie ye vnto scripture neither doo ye reason v sworde vvoorde god ah good woorde god thou seruest many purpose deede woorde god sir keepeth many reuerende father prison many yeeresheretiques death woorde god hath depriued many menne liuingesal novve extreme crueltie long sithence hadde benne taken greate mercie theire country whose life ye blame woorde god crueltie imprisonmente late yeeres gaue moste certaine occasion death holy learned worshipful menne singular vertue beinge wel knowen neede named woorde god made mutche adoo youre late parlament establishinge youre bloudy lawe whereby ye woulde haue power put menne deathvntruthe either idolatrie open folie part faith christedome faithe christendome turkes saracenes haue alwaies suffered liue dominion gospeller woorde god taught kil blessed god hath geuen noble moste clement queene elizabeth better spirite vnderstande woorde pointvvhat sprite harding youre felovves burnt many gospeller haue yet attained vnto doo saie newe superintendentes doo keepe olde bishoppes leanred clergie prison lawe realme answere firste lawe crabbe owne stocke next neither bishoppes time burnt heretiques lawe realme lawe prince lawe al christendome neither made papistes late yeres ye woulde youre deceiued disciple beleue olde time thoughtthis mater thus vttered generalitie greate vntruth necessarie prince enacted better maintenance quiet dominion b sarisburie newe practise ye saie kille heretiques graunte neither newe practise condemne godly menne name heretiques youre father sommetime cried againste christe sonne god wee haue laweiohan lawe ought die christe selfe saide sommetime hierusalem cittie bloudeluke hierusalem hierusalem killest prophetes stoanest death sent vnto thee augustine saithe nullis bonis catholica hoc placet augustin contra crescon gram li ca si v que ad mortem quenquam licet haereticum saeuiatur seemeth good vnto good man catholique churche crueltie vnto death shewed vnto man though heretique notwithstanding agreeth wel youre religion hardinge though mouthes mousled yet rampe gape stil bloude fulfil ye measure youre father let greeue heare salomon saithemath prouerb viscera impiorum crudelia bowelles wicked ful crueltie youre fable folie espied ye flee swerde fire whiche beeinge wreasted youre whole religion muste needes comme grounde hierome saithe youre peeres pugnant epicherematis ex carnificum officinis fighte argumentes taken bouchers shoppes ye haue wreakte youre angre longe yenough vpon innocente bloude beginne knowe hande god harde kike stil pricke wee maie truely saie vnto cyprian sacerdos dei euangelium tenens christi praecepta custodienscyprian ad cornel occidi potest vinci non potest prieste god holding gospel keeping commoundementes christe maie wel killed conquered cannot tertull ad scapulam tertul apologetico esdr prouer hacron esai lib cap augustin confessi li ca wee maie saie tertullian crudelitas vestra gloria nostra est plures efficimur quoties metimur vobis youre crueltie oure glorie ye comme recken v ye finde v moe moe truethe aboue al thinges vvil preuaile counsel againste lorde oure part wee neuer yet guilty one droppe youre bloude wee seeke aide fire swerde wee wil rather saie hierome vtiuam filios haereucorum omnium qui decepti sunt interficiamus sagittis spiritualibus id est testimonijs scripturarum woulde god wee maie rather kille child heretiques al deceiued spiritual arrowes saie testimony scripture augustine fi occidas eos de gladio bi acuto angel heaue c non sint hostes tui sic enim amo eos occidi sibi vt vitrani tibi woulde god thou wouldest kille lorde twoo edged sworde thy holy woorde maie lenger thine enimies wisshe bee killed vnto selues maie liue vnto thee againe vindicet no deus de vobis vt ipsum errorem vestrum vobis occidat nobiscum de veritate gaudeatisaugustin epist god reuenge oute cause againste maie kille youre erroure ye maie reioice togeather v truethe apologie cap diuision knowe gospel iesus christe power god vnto saluation therein consisteth eternal life paule warneth v doo heare angel god though came heauen goe aboute pul v parte doctrine hardinge boaste gospel vve meane catholique churche keapte vnderstode ye borne youre heresie hearde deuil comminge hel authour diuision satan hath caried awaie gospel whereas deede one true gospel let indifferent man consider howe vprightly alleage paule write paule warneth geue eare angel comming heauengalat goe drawe parte doctrine whiche doctrine meane whiche haue declared apologieand paul euer reade late chapter trente paule euer reade youre pologie howe pronounced sentence vvee meane saie doctrine doctrine gospel meane wee saie wee tel paule spake euery gospel generally certaine gospel qualified saieth si quis vobis euangelizauerit praerer id quod accepistis anathema sit man preache gospel vnto besides ye haue receiued accursed heare gospel paule speaketh euery gospel gospel preached receiued ye preache gospel whiche ye receiued ioine handes ye preach gospel whiche ye haue receiued apostle apostoiique preacher whiche hearde earth luther ranne cloister forsooke religion ye assured ye menne holden accursed paule b sarisburie hardinge ye woulde faine scape awaie childishe cauil paul ye saie speaketh gospel qualified whereby ye meane gospel deliuered receiued ye woulde saie gospel christe onlesse deliuered gospel paule meante doctrine deliuered hande hande pope pope doctrine deliuered receiued scripture sense saithe selfe quod accept domino hoc tradidi vobis thinge haue receiued lorde haue deliuered vnto like sorte calleth selfe apostle menne cor galat menne iesus christe howe neede many wordes case cleare augustine saithe plainely paulus ait si angelus de coelo vobis annuntiauerit august contra literas petilia lib cap praeterquam quod scripturis legalibus euangelicis accepistis anathema sit angel heauen preache vnto thinge ye haue receiued tradition deliuerie youre elder scripture lavve gospel accursed wordes plaine hardinge quite disgrace al gloses hereto chrysostome addeth non dixit paulus si contraria annuntiauerint chrysost epi ad galat cap aut totum euangelium subuerterint coucelles verum si vel paulum euangelizauerint praeter euangelium quod accepistis etiamsi quiduis labefactauerint anathema sint paule saithe teache contrarie ouerthrowe whole gospel saithe preache little smal thinge besides gospel ye haue receiued loose shake downe thinge whatsoeuer bee accursed bee woordes hardinge touche neare ye haue altered whole fourme churche god therefore repente youre selues leste ye remaine stil within daunger curse augustine saithe august de bono viduitatis ca rom sanctum scriptura nostae doctrinae regulam figit ne audeamus plus sapere quam oporteat sapere holy scripture hath laide rule vnto oure doctrine dare vnderstand meete v vnderstand apologie cap diuision menne bid holy scripture away doumbe frutelesse procure v comme god selfe rather speaketh churche theire councelles saie beleue fansies opinion waie finding truthe vncertaine exceeding dangerous manner fantastical madde waie meanes allowed holy father hardinge vvhere saie passe litle scripture dumbe vnprofitable therein vntruthe youre ovvne felovves vvoordes reade ansvveare slaunder v thinges vve saie euery act parlament must executed lawful iudge holy scripture haue execution lauful iudges bishoppes father wel place specially laufully assembled general councelles saie men way vncertaine dangerous maner mad allowed father vvho euer heard men thought haue right wittes talke loose sorte fathersgregorius naziazen saith neuer savve good comme councel disproue order comming together general councelles thought way men soner deceiued many maie deceiued moste diligent studie mature iudgement conferring together howe mutche soner may one two alone leadde priuate phansie self wil caried away errour nicene councel came together bishop first costantinople ephesme coucel chalcedo al foure councelles sundry ancient father namely gregorie estemed foure gospel yea saith haue word god farre holier better learned men saie hath let reader iudge saith meete iudge suche cause scholers maie reade iudge maisters maie christes doctrinemath said non est discipulus supra magistrum scholer aboue maister vvhy al saie holy ghost inspire sir thought god doth assist churche represented sutche solemne assembly three hundred moe father gouernours christen people rather one man b sarisburie whether ye cal scripture god dumbe thingcap diui ludouicus con triden episcop pictauien con triden albert pigghi controuer eckius reporte saide one calleth mortuum atramentum dead inke saith scriptura est re inanimis muta scripture dead dumbe thinge calleth scripture nigrum euangelium blacke gospel nowe scripture dead doumbe speake must needes folowe vnprofitable neither doo despise authoritie councelles good councelles graue reuerende thus saie councelles often councelles wee make rekening number arian heretiques haue moe councelles christian hierome saithethe people cannot iudge spiritus sancti doctrina est quae canonicis literis prodita est contra quam si quid statuant concilia nefas duco doctrine holy goste set abroade canonical scriptureshierom epist ad galath chrysost ad timoth hom againste whiche doctrine councelles determine thing thinke vvicked chrysostome saithe earneste sorte plus aliquid dicam ne paulo quidem obedire oportet si quid dixerit proprium si quid humanum wil saie wee ought beleeue paule selfe speake thinge owne speake onely man encrease vncertaintie hereof whole weighte iudgemente councelles hangeth nowe euermore vpon pope maie appeare woordes conclusion late chapter trident saluasemper omnibus sedis apostolicae authoritate concil triden session platyna stephano authoritie apostolique see al thinges euermore reserued platyna saithe alleged acta priorum pontificum sequentes pontifex semper aut infringunt aut omnino tollunt pope folowe doo euermore either breake wholy abrogate decree pope whether scripture bee wel alleged otherwise thereof ye saie people maie iudge christe saithe scholar aboue maister certainely hardinge simplest al people notwithstandinge youre restrainte maie iudge scripture yet maie easily iudge either ye vnderstande ye vnaduisedly abuse scripture whether woorde god people ye saie maie judge ye proue euen scripture god knoweth ful handsomely ful discretely applied scholar ye saie aboue maister thus maie learne logique louaine populus latine scholar scripture latine maister thus youre vaine premiss without sense ye proceede vainely conclude nothinge hardinge haue regarde ye write simpleste maie soone espie dooinges ye longer thus mocke worlde shewes woordes christe spake woordes vnderstandinge scripture persequution scripture thus woordes lie togeather shal persecute one cittie flee c scholar aboue maister seruant aboue lorde haue called maister house beelzebub matthae howe mutche wil cal housholde seruauntes ala learned frame sutche argumentes apostle beeing scholar nomore escape persecutio could christe vvas maister ergo people cannot vnderstande vvhat reade scripture neither antecedente consequente sequele reason honour vniuersitie haue better regarde vnto logique ye bewraie weakenesse youre cause yee sclenderly abuse scripture apologie cap diuision chrysostome saithe many oftentimes vvhiche boaste selues holy ghoste truely vvho speake ovvn head falsely boast thei haue sprite god like saith christe denied spake selfe vvhen spake lavve prophetes euen novve tiauerint coucelles aut totum euangelium subuerterint verum si vel paulum euangelizauerint praeter euangelium quod accepistis etiamsi quiduis labefactauerint anathema sint paule saithe teache contrarie ouerthrowe whole gospel saithe preache little smal thinge besides gospel ye haue receiued loose shake downe thinge whatsoeuer bee accursed bee woordes hardinge touche neare ye haue altered whole fourme churche god therefore repente youre selues leste ye remaine stil within aunger curse august de bono viduit atis ca rom augustine saithe sanctum scriptura nostae doctrinae regulam figit ne audeamus plus sapere quam opor eat sapere holy scripture hath laide rule vnto oure doctrine dare vnderstand meete v vnderstand apologie cap diuision menne bid holy scripture away doumbeand frutelesse procure v comme god selfe rather speaketh churche theire councelles saie beleue fansies opinion waie finding truthe vncertaine exceeding dangerous manner fantastical madde waie meanes allowed holy father hardinge vvhere saie passe litle scripture dumbe vnprofitable therein vntruthe youre ovvne felovves vvoordes reade ansvveare slaunder v thinges vve saie euery act parlament must executed lawful iudge holy scripture haue execution lauful iudges bishoppes father wel place specially laufully assembled general councelles saie men way vncertaine dangerous maner mad allowed father vvho euer heard men thought haue right wittes talke loose sorte fathersgregorius naziazen saith neuer savve good comme councel disproue order comming together general councelles thought way men soner deceiued many maie deceiued moste diligent studie mature iudgement conferring together howe mutche soner may one two alone eadde priuate phansie self wil caried away errour nicene councel came together bishop first costantinople ephesine coucel chalcedo al foure councelles sundry ancient father namely gregorie estemed foure gospel yea saith haue word god farre holier better learned men saie hath let reader iudge saith meete iudge suche cause scholers maie reade iudge maisters maie christes doctrinemath said non est discipulus supra magistrum scholer aboue maister vvhy al saie holy ghost inspire sir thought god doth assist churche represented sutche solemne assembly three hundred moe father gouernours christen people rather one man b sarisburie whether ye cal scripture god dumbe thing cap diui ludouicus con triden episcop pictauien con triden albert pigghi controuer eckius reporte saide one calleth mortuum atramentum dead inke saith scriptura est re inanimis muta scripture dead dumbe thinge calleth scripture nigrum euangelium blacke gospel nowe scripture dead doumbe speake must needes folowe vnprofitable neither doo despise authoritie councelles good councelles graue reuerende thus saie councelles often councelles wee make rekening number arian heretiques haue moe councelles christian hierome saithe people cannot iudge spiritus sancti doctrina est quae canonicis literis prodita est contra quam si quid statuant concilia nefas duco doctrine holy goste set abroade canonical scriptureshierom epist ad galath againste whiche doctrine councelles determine thing thinke vvicked chrysost ad timoth hom chrysostome saithe earneste sorte plus aliquid dicam ne paulo quidem obedire oportet si quid dixerit proprium si quid humanum wil saie wee ought beleeue paule selfe speake thinge owne speake onely man encrease vncertaintie hereof whole weighte iudgemente councelles hangeth nowe euermore vpon pope maie appeare woordes conclusion late chapter trident concil triden session platyna stephano salua semper omnibus sedis apostolicae authoritate authoritie apostolique see al thinges euermore reserued platyna saithe alleged acta priorum pontificum sequentes pontifex semper aut infringunt aut omnino tollunt pope folowe doo euermore either breake wholy abrogate decree pope whether scripture bee wel alleged otherwise thereof ye saie people maie iudge christe saithe scholar aboue maister certainely hardinge simplest al people notwithstandinge youre restrainte maie iudge scripture yet maie easily iudge either ye vnderstande ye vnaduifedly abuse scripture whether woorde god people ye saie maie iudge ye proue euen scripture god knoweth ful handsomely ful discretely applied scholar ye saie aboue maister thus maie learne logique louaine populus latine scholar scripture latine maister thus youre vaine premiss without sense ye proceede vainely conclude nothinge hardinge haue regarde ye write simpleste maie soone espie dooinges ye longer thus mocke worlde shewes woordes christe spake woordes vnderstandinge scripture persequution scripture thus woordes lie togeather shal persecute one cittie flee c scholar aboue maister seruant aboue lorde haue called maister house beelzebub howe mutche wil cal housholde seruountes matthae ala learned frame sutche argumentes apostle beeing scholar nomore escape persecutio could christe vvas maister ergo people cannot vnderstande vvhat reade scripture neither antecedente consequente sequele reason honour yv uniuersitie haue better regarde vnto logique ye bewraie weakenesse youre cause yee sclenderly abuse scripture apologie cap diuision chrysostome saithe many oftentimes vvhiche boaste selues holy ghoste truely vvho speake ovvn head falsely boast thei haue sprite god like saith christe denied spake selfe vvhen spake lavve prophetes euen novve thinge pressed vpon v name holy ghost saue gospel vve ought beleue christe fulfillinge lavve prophetes holy ghost fulfillinge gospel thus farre goeth chrysostome hardinge alleage chrysostome euer speake owne doo vntruely attribute selues spirite god remember howe gathered together name christemath doo speake owne christe truthe hath promised middest nowe tel v father trent gathered together name christe howe mutche truly maie wee reply temporal menne assembled together auspurg marpurg vvormes smalcald baden vvestminster el came together name christe require man common sense sitte iudge cause possibly bringe thinge scripture auncient father maintenance great case b sarisburie ye builde ouer boldely hardinge christes promise god true euer promise oftentimes menne false christe hath promised presentpsal actor michaeas euer twoo three geathered togeather name appeareth woordes prophete dauid councelles oftentimes meete togeather againste god againste christe prophete michaeas saithe sic dicit dominus de prophetis qui errare faciunt populum meum abominantur iudicium omne rectum peruertunt super dominum requiescebant dicentes nunquid non est dominus medio nostri thus saithe lorde prophetes deceiue people abborre iudgement ouerthrowe al right yet reaste selues vpon oure lorde saienge oure lorde middest emongest v youre defence hardinge whether vvorde god againste yet ye saie ye haue stil sprite god oure lorde selfe middest emongest youchrysostom de sancto adorando spiritu august ioha tractae boldnesse chrysostomes iudgement presumptuous daungerous therefore counsel thing pressed vpon v name holy ghoste sauinge onely gospel christe wee shoulde beleeue like sense augustine saithe sua illi si docere veliut nolite audire nolite facere bringe decree fantasie theire owne heare doo thus olde frenetique fanatical heretiques founde selues conuinced euident testimony goddes vvoorde appealed spirite god whiche saide euen saie euermore assisted august contra austum manichae li ca coulde faile hereof augustine writeth thus videris ergo id vos agere vt omnis de medio scripturarum authoritas auferatur suus cui que animus author sit quid qua que scriptura probet quid improbet id est vt non authorirati scripturarum subijciatur ad fidem sed sibi scripturas ipse subijciat non vt ideo illi placeat aliquid quia hoc sublimi authoritate scriptum legitur sed ideo recte scriptum videatur quia hoc illi placuit ye see therefore youre drifte al authoritie scripture remoued eche man maie leadde owne fantasie liste either allowe holy scripture disallowe saie submitte selfe touchinge faithe authoritie scripture make scripture subiecte vnto wil allowe thing bicause written high authoritie scripture wil thinke wel written bicause alloweth meane hereof commeth passe hilarie writeth qui quae scripta sunt negas quid superest nisi vthilari de trinitate li quae non scripta sunt probe muche thou deniest thinges written remaineth thou muste allowe thinges written concerninge authoritie credite councelles wee shal haue cause saie hereafter ye require man common sense sitte iudge cause appeareth either ye remember el ye weighe ye immediately said selfe chapter ye saie people maie iudge theire bishoppes ye tel v christes doctrine scholar aboue maister yet suddainely hauinge foregotten youre owne woordes ye cal foorthe scholare yea maie thought one meanest al youre schole man onely endewed common sense sitte iudgement ouer maister notwithstandingeactor iohan extra de electi electi potastat significasti abb god accepter personnes goddes holy sprite bounde councelles company breatheth freely listeth therefore youre owne doctour panormitane saithe case religion iudgement one simple plaine man ought sommetimes bee receiued iudgemente pope endeth fourth parte fifthe parte apologie cap diuision bvt hereolde nevve looke wil saie though haue scripture yet maie chaunce haue auncient doctours holy father high bragge haue euer made howe al antiquitie continual consent al age dooth make side al case newe yester day woorke vntil fewe late yeeres neuer hearde questionlesse nothing spitefully spoken religion god accuse noueltie mater lately founde chaunge god selfe ought chaunge religion yet neuerthelesse wote meanes haue euer seene come passe firste beginninge often god geeue somme light open truthe vnto menne though truthe onely greatest antiquitie also fro euerlasting yet wicked menne aduersaries called newfangled late diuised vngraceous bloudthirsty haman sought procure kinge assuerus displeasure ievves esther accusation thou hast saithe kinde people vseth certaine nevve lavves ovvne stifnecked rebellious againste al thy lavves paule also began firste preacheactor expounde gospel athene called tidinges bringer nevve goddes mutche saie nevve religion saide athenian maie wee knowe thee nevve doctrine celsus likewise set pourpose wrote againste christe ende might scornefully scoffe gospel name noueltie vvhat origen contra celsum saithe hath god many age novve laste late bethought selfe eusebius also writeth christian religion beginning spite called nonlatin alphabet saie nevve strange like sorte menne condemne al mater strange nevve wil haue owne whatsoeuer praised thinges longe continuance hardinge saide somme proued doctrinea vaine distinction neither doo vvee cal doctrine nevve christe benne called nowe professours folowers nowe reportinge gentils knewe god man athenian celsus ethnike suche like called right true religion god newe saie nothing purpose let shewe comminge christe suche religion allowed newe sithens christes incarnation amonge christian menne euer religion shunned reiected heretical whiche newe domme yet shewe learning matter necessarie bringe foorth store declare doctrine religion truthe newe whiche knewe god christe sonne god whiche man denieth thus al menne iudgement maie see fondly reason vvevvee tel ye haue lost right name thinges cal nevve
