deede olde tel al nevve doctrine nowe churche christe naught proue infidel haue time moses lawe first preachinge gospel impugned goddes euerlastinge truthe odious terme reproche newnes newe doctrine good v firste conuersion infidelitie since receiued true faithe gregorie bishop romevntruthe true faithe christe benne planted stil continued realme foure hundred yeeres comming augustine conuerted realme englande faithe augustine legate others sent godly purpose worthely shunne abhorre al new gospel new faithes new doctrine new religion b sarisburie truthe god neither furthered face antiquitie hindered opinion noueltie oftentimes thinge deede nevve commended olde thinge dede olde condemned nevve nevvnesse religion al respectes euery waie il christe would haue resembled doctrine nevve vvine math ioh luke arnobius contra gens li woulde haue saide disciple geue nevve commaundemente neither woulde haue called cuppe thankesgeuinge nevve testamente bloude arnobius saithe religionis authoritas non est tempore aestimanda sed numine nec quo die sed quid colere coeperis intueri conuenit quod verum est serum non est authoritie religion muste weighed god time behoueth v consider vpon daie thinge wee beganne worship thinge true neuer late saugu quaest noui veteris testamenti quaest augustin de ciuita li ca augustine saithe quod anterius est inquiunt ethnici falsum esse non potest quasi antiquitas vetus consuetudo praeiudicet veritati heathen saie religion firste false though antiquitie olde custome coulde preuaile againste truethe againe saithe nec dici debet quare modo quare sero quoniam mittentis consilium non est humano ingenio penetrabile neither maie saie commeth nowe commeth late counsel god sente vnsearcheable wisedome man ye saie infidelles onely charged religion christe noueltie ye saie wee tel al newe doctrine nowe churche christe naught hereto hardinge soone agree therefore wel tel youre nevve fantasy whiche ye haue painted coloure auncientie therewith haue deceiued worlde vaine naught v wee haue planted nevve religion onely haue renewed olde vndoubtedly founded vsed apostle christe holy father primitiue churche longe late time meane multitude tradition vanity hath benne drowned therefore wee maie saie bernardus de vita solitaria bernarde nouitatem dico propter lingua hominum impiorum qui cum manifestum lumen obnubilare non queunt de solo nouitatis nomine cauillantur c sed haec nouitas non est nouella vanitas re enim est antiquae religionis perfecte fundatae christo pietatis antiqua haereditas ecclesiae dei cal noueltie bicause tongue wicked menne hable shadowe manifest light truth finde cauillations vpon onely name noueltie noueltie nevve vanitie late vpstarte religion rome mater olde religion perfite godlinesse founded christe auncient enheritance churche godtertullian de virginibus velandi olde learned father tertullian saithe viderint ergo quibus nouum est quod sibi est vetus haereses non tam nouitas quam veritas reuincitaugustine englande quodcun que contra veritatem sapit hoc est haeresis etiam vetus consuetudo let therfore take heede whiche coumpte thinge newe selfe olde herefie reproued wel noueltie veritie euer thinge sauereth againste truthe heresie yea although custome neuer oldeignatius ad philadelphien ignatius saithe antiquitas mea iesus christus est antiquitie christe iesus otherwise religion christe time coumpted nevve respecte ancient religion heathen vniuersally al menne condemned augustine monker rome broughte firste faithe lande vtterly vntrue haue saide appeareth plainely sundrie ancient father origen tertullian chrysostome hilarie theodoretus eusebius others faithe christe benne vniuersally receiued perfitely rooted realme many hundred yeeres augustine monke borne indeede broughte greate heapes strange nouelties superstition candels candelstickes banner holy vvater like shewes whereof churche god great neede yet haue sithence benne encreased newe diuises vanity aboue measure mutche certaine hardinges beaupecres louaine haue lately founde selues talke keapte greate mootes behoufe theire augustine italian monke cal apostle englande wil needes haue receiued honoured saincte haue thought therefore good briefely waie note fewe wordes touching seemeth mutche offended vertuous man holy saincte shoulde charged pride crueltie pride disdeignefully despisinge brother bishoppes ilelande britaine crueltie procuringe deathe bothe many thousandes christian people also specially innocente vnarmed monkes bangor al refused receiue theire metropolitane agree certaine smal pointes romaine religion howe pride wel blased beda writinge pourposely sate stil thronebeda septem britannor epi plures viri doctissimi disdeigned rise vp geue token reuerence vnto seuen bishoppes learned graue menne britannes makinge theire appearance councel therefore saide woulde hearken demaundes take theire archebishop hauinge otherwise olde archebishop theire owne whome ought theire obedience theire woordes reported beda theise si modo nobis assurgere noluit beda lib ca quanto magi si ei subdi coeperimus iam no pro nihilo conteinner euen nowe disdeigne rise vp vnto v howe mutche wil hee despise v regarde v nothinge wee shal vnder iurisdiction excuse augustine shameful crueltie leste shoulde seeme accessorie murthering many theire owne lawes irregulare man bloude saie neither enkendled warre againste britaines presente fight deade longe whiche thinge also thinke maie proued expresse woordes beda thus saithebeda eodem loco quamuis ipso augustino iam multo ante tempore ad coelestia regna sublato notwithstandinge augustine selfe longe time warre taken vp kingdome heauen truthe certaintie hereof maie please thee good christian reader vnderstande theise laste woordes beda concerninge deathe augustine manifestely forged haue benne violently thruste texte guileful parenthesis sithence haue benne ashamed crueltieaugustine englad neuer written authoure euidente proufes shal plainely appeare first al olde chronicle written frenche aboue twoo hundred yeeres paste thomas graie augustine inflamer vvarre thomas graie yee shal finde recorded thus augustine beinge thus refused bishoppes others learned britaines made sutche complainte thereof ethelberte kinge kente foorth leuied power marched againste slewe moste cruel wise hauinge saithe regarde mercie woulfe hath vpon sheepe hereby appeareth augustine inflamer warre causer slaughter whereas woordes beda commonly extant latine wee told augustine deade long warre beganne appeareth plainely true beda deedethe true storie beda translated kinge alfrede augustine aliue time vvarre translated aboue seuen hundred yeeres agoe old english saxon tongue alfredus aluredus kinge lande augustine yet aliue warre ended afterwarde consecrated twoo bishoppes mellitus iustus mellitus bishop london iustus bishop rochester thinges thus declared foloweth orderly storie warres ended bishoppes consecrated aftervvarde died beloued father augustine warre died saithe haue sithence altered latine trwo harding yee mutch amazed admiration augustine yee wil saie power consecrate bishoppes vse archiepiscopal authoritie beinge deade woordes wee find reported parenthesis latine written beda quamuis augustino iam multo ante tempore ad coelestia regna sublato mutche quite contrarie course order storie specially touched aunciente saxon translation sundrie copy whereof presente extante seene sutche reuerende antiquitie maie iustely called question therefore wee haue good cause iudge saide woordes haue benne sithence forced shifted somme good skille policie leste augustine holy man founde guiltie greate crueltiean dom august commeth englande august receiueth palle august consecrateth mellitus iustus gregorie dieth vvarre britaines saxon chronicle peterburrough august dieth flores historiar verily abstracte chronicle vvritten olde englishe chronicle recorded onely augustine italian monke complainte caused king kente arme people true faithful christian countrie beinge wale aliue time ye battaile also self presente personne goeinge towarde woordes augustine came againe tolde kinge ethelberte britaines woulde obeie wherefore kinge wrothe sente elfrede king northumberland comme healpe distresse britaines vvales augustine archebishop canturburie mette vvith leicester augustine aliue companie vvith kinges marchinge tovvardes filde king leicester time called brocuale beinge afraide twoo kinges fledde lande came neuer againe twoo kinges seised al landes departed bitweene selues afterward thei went wardes wale britaines heard sente menne shirtes harefoote aske mercie cruel pitie c hereby appeareth augustine onely enkendled cruel warre also aliue present armie therefore hardinge shal hencefoorth good bothe felowes aduenture rasshely iudgemente yee knowe thus mutche briefely anweare vnto faine woulde haue augustine acquited pride crueltie apologie cap diuision wherein thei doo mutche like coniurers sorcerer day whiche woorkinge diuels vse saie haue theire bookes al theire holy hid mystery athanasius cyprian moses abel adam archangel raphael ende conninge thought comme sutche patrones founder might iudged high holy manner menne bicause woulde haue theire owne religion whiche themselues longe sithence haue brought foorth world easily rather accepted foolishe personnes sutche cast little whereabout others doo goe woonte saie augustine hierome chrysostome apostle christe selfe ful wel knowe nothinge people fauoure better liketh common sorte name hardinge nay sir selues maie reason likened enchaunters necromancer vvitches saie haue bookes mystery doctours firste father raphael archangel cannot shewe deliuery thereof succession hand hande example receiued raphael adam abel c kept time time ye saie also ye haue gospel euery part doctrine apostle christe prophetes patriarkes heauen god owne bosomeiacob father lightes ye cannot shewes v lauful succession whose preachinge handes came downe alonge christe apostle vnto youit laie scripture bookes holy father vvhere laie sacramentary doctrine hidden bitwene time prophete zuinglius patriarke berengarius howe deliuery hande hand continewed fiue hundred yeeres v succession vvhere bishop church doctrine whiche catholikes countrie holde professevntruthes impudente reade ansvveare wel touchinge blessed sacramente al pointes faithe haue receiued theire bishop predecessours order vntil reache augustine augustine receiued gregorie others al one continual aescente vnto peter receiued christe christ god father doctrine finde taught plainely set forth bookes thatvntruthe al shevve emptie name nothinge augustine hierome chrysostome ambrose basile cyprian dionyse holy father haue leafte posteritie witness truth doctrine bishop haue taught v preache ye crie ye neuer mutche make many lawes parlamentes ye liste imbrue swordes bloude catholike christian ye crie pulpites yet shal rocke whereon staie harde neither shal ye euer able ouerthrowe catholike churche builded thereupon certaine neither al power hel gate shal preuaile againste itmatth b sarisburie marcus varro woonte saie vtile est ciuitatibus vt se viri fortes etiamsi falsum fitpretense antiquitie dijs genitos esse credant behoueful city common weales menne valiante courage beleue selues ye child ye goddes yea although deede vntrue augusti de ciuitate li ca vnto whiche woordes augustine addeth haec sententia cernis quam latum locum aperiat falsitati ye see howe large scope saieing dooth open mainteinance falsehedde many vaine menne auance nobilitie theire bloud haue fette petite degree somme fro achilles somme fro aeneas somme hercules somme arke noe heretique dioscorus geate somme credite doctrine woulde seeme bringe descente thereof al ancient father churche thus saide open councel concil chalced actio pa ego testimonia habeo sanctorum patrum athanasij gregorij cyrilli multis locis ego cum patribus eijcior ego defendo patrum dogma non trasgredior aliquo et horum testimonia non simpliciter ne que transitorie sed libris habeo haue witnesse holy father athanasius gregorius cyrillus many place throwen foorth father defende father doctrine swarue fro pointe haue theire witnesse barely waie theire bookes saide heretique eutyches ego legi scripta beati cyrilli sanctorum patrumconcil chalced actio pa concil chalced actio pa sancti athanasij haue readde bookes cyrillus holy father athanasius saide heretique carosus ego secundum expositionem trecentorum decem octo patrum sic credo sic baptizatus sum thus doo beleue thus baptized according ye exposition three hundred eighteene father councel nice thus arian heretiques alleged authoritie ancient father origen thus pelagian heretiques alleged authoritie augustine vpon occasion hath benne saide euen sutche truthe hardinge woonte blase armes religion toie vaine fabulous ye hable conninge bring lineally either christe selfe apostle one ancient father bishop sidon late diete empiere holden augusta anno auouched openly ye whole canon apostle christe woord woord euen peeuishely written masse bookes andreas barbatius proueth antiquitie cardinalles rome regum polydorus de inuentorib li cap woordes written firste booke kinges domini sunt cardines terrae et posuit super eos orbem corner earth lordes vpon hath sette world abbate panormitane saithe cardinalatus est de iure diuino quia papa per sacerdotes leuiticos intelligit cardinales cardinalship standeth law god extra qui filij sint legitimi per venerabile abb pope leuitical priestes vnderstandeth cardinalles mutche hereof alleged hosius seemeth saie monkes haue theire beginning euen apostle meaninge thereby one companion doothe fauoure trowe religion christe selfe vvas abbat thus saithhosius confessione petricouien cap copus dialo pag christus dux exemplar vitae monasticae christe captaine samplar monkes life yet man afterwarde hauinge forgotten former dreame vtterly displaceth christe geueth whole honoure hereof vnto elia elizaeus woordes elia elizaeus duce instituti benedictini elia elizaeus captaines benettes order saie thei blacke monkes like wisedome ye would seeme fetche holy water augustine sommetime ioily good waie winne credite specially while euer ye said people ready geue care olde arcade saide commendation theire antiquitie thei daie twoo elder moone saturnus nonlatin alphabet beinge italie stranger man knew fro whece came therefore called filius caeli thought come fro heauen romulus alexander thei borne bastardie neuer knewe theire owne father therefore magnifie nobilitie theire bloude woulde called child goddes one mar iuppitter sutche truthepretense antiquitie fidelitie hardinge woonte painte al partes member doctrine neuer vaine childishe lately diuised yet ye beare v hande predecessours receiued saie theire bishoppes others theire predecessours order vntil reache augustine monke rome ye haue ful woorthily made sainte augustine yee saie receiued gregorie gregorie others al one continual ascente vnto peter peter christe christe god father heralde coulde lightly haue saide mater trowe ye woulde proue ascente descente god father made holy vvater said masse deede wel herein also emptie name augustine hierome chrysostome ambrose basile cyprian dionyse c tolde ye bringe v onely vaine shewe painted box nothinge al holy father finde either priuate masse halfe communion accidentes without subiecte reste like vanity wherewith ye haue longe time deceiued worlde leaue dissimulation set aparte confectures blinde gheasses credites sake shewe v thinges ancient holy father shew plainely deede wee maie thinke somme weight woorde owne glose speakinge ministration holy communion whiche church manner wholy abolisshed saith thus hoc antiquum est de conse dist per acta gloss doc tonstallus de eucharistia lib pag anno erasm corin nam hodie videtur esse relictum olde order seemeth nowe leafte doctoure tonstal saithe heresie denie transubstantiation late councel laterane erasmus whoes iudgement thinke ye wil refuse saith thus synaxi transubstantiationee ser definiuit ecclesia holy ministration longe ere churche determined article transubstantiation al notwithstandinge hardinge ye blusshe saie bothe al fantasy haue benne conueighed vnto moste certaine succession hand hand englishe augustine gregorie father apostle christe bosome god selfe apologie cap diuision howe thinges whiche menne desirous haue seeme newe founde greatest antiquitie contrariwise howe al thinges wel nighe whiche greatly set name antiquitie hauinge benne wel throughly examined length found newe diuised late soothely saie man hath true right consideration woulde thinke iewes lawes ceremony newe deede al hammans accusation grauen aunciente cable greatest antiquitie although many take christe haue swarued abraham olde father haue brought certaine newe religion owne name yet aunsweared hee directly ye beleeued moses ye vvoulde beleeue also doctrine nevve make moses authoure greatest antiquitie one ye geue al honoure hath spoken paule likewise though gospel iesus christe many counted new yet hath saith testimonie old lavv prophetes doctrine maie rightly cal christes catholique doctrine farre newe god aboue al auncient father lorde iesus christe hath leafte vnto v gospel prophetes apostle woorkes beinge monumentes greatest age noman nowe thinke doctrine newe onlesse thinke either prophetes faithe gospel el christe selfe newe apologie cap diuision theire religion longe continuance woulde haue menne wene doo proue example primitiue chruche father councels olde time lieth auncient cause thus longe duste destitute aduocate fire swerde haue alwaies ready hande olde councels father al mum worde surely againste al reason beginne firste bloudy extreme meanes coulde haue founde easy gentle way thei truste fully antiquitie vse dissimulation didde iohn clemente countrie manne oures fewe yeeres paste presence certaine honeste menne good credite teare caste fire certaine leaues theodorete moste auncient father greeke bishop wherein plainely euidently taught nature breade communion changed abolished brought nothinge didde pourpose bicause thought copie thereof founde hardinge touchinge matter haue deuised vpon clemente dothe onely denie word euer burnte otherwise destroied leafe theodoritus also declareth whole order life special regard loue beareth tonge learned bishop wrote hath euer ben yet farre wil burne destroie scrappe syllable letter greeke mutche certaine leaues learned father theodoritus sutche thinge written imagin nay wel ye haue trouthe dede saieth sutche waie godly graue man maie auouche trouth protesteth neuer hitherto parte booke neither greeke latine written hand b sarisburie reporte made presence hearinge peter martyr sundrie learned menne certaine yet aliue reporter learned man graue father longe sithence bishop englande saide presente sawe thinge donne eies saie hereof hable apologie cap diuision saithe albertus pigghius ancient father augustine wrong opinion original sinne dis quidam augusti de bono viduita cap erred lied vsed false logique touching case matrimonie concluded vowe made whiche matrimonie augustine affirmeth perfite deede maie vndonne againe hardinge hardinge refuseth augustine authoritie vve neuer tooke selues bounde priuate opinion euer doctoure al faithe catholike saie vniuersal sutche one doctour alonethis vntruth ouer colde vaine hardinge vvel knovveth substance doctrine standeth doctoures vniuersal number doctoures haue taught christen people haue receiued secrete pointe learninge augustine cyprian teache singulerly folowe mutche lesse binde selues mainteine euer albertus pighius hath written doctrine original sinne readen fifth session late tridentine councelsub paulo pighius dissent dissenteth v stande onely vpon pointe yet determined churche opinion maie tollerated vntil churche define question vvhen note pointe many pointes doctrine wil shewe minde therein mariage whiche made simple vowe chastitie standeth force reason mariage bare vowepromisse made vnto god vvithout deliuerie folie al folie simple vowe nothinge promise made god without deliuerance thinge whiche promised mariage man woman present acceptation eche others bonde make matter extende beyonde nature promise therefore likewise vowe made god simple promise also deliueringe thinge promised cannot mariage folowinge make voide vowe whiche onely promised also performeda vovve made bishop abbate force vovve made god alone performance voweth doth professe selfe handes superiour taking habite religion receiuinge holy order bishop solemne acte deliuereth vp al owne right power maister selfe geue body person mariage otherwise shoulde knowe lawe nature woulde consider promise horse one man afterwarde promise deliuer seconde man true lorde horse although haue donne iniurie made firste promise promise deliuery vaileable transferre right horse promise alone euen greate sinne breake simple vowe chastitie made god b sarisburie howe lightly captaine general albertus pigghius weigheth authoritie augustine maie appeare woordes thus writeth quod non solum incertaalbert pigghi controuer de peccato originis sed etiam falsa sit augustini sententia ita mihi demostrari posse videtur thus thinketh hable proue augustine iudgemente herein onely vncertaine also false againe afterwarde conclusion quod augustini sententia non solum incerta sed etiam certo falsa sit satis mihi demonstratum videtur augustine judgemente onely vncertaine also certainely false alber pigghius eadem controuersia mee thinketh haue sufficiently proued againe non multum mouet augustini sententia mihi non placet augustini ea de definitio sentetia augustine judgement dooth greatly moue like augustine determination judgemente touchinge mater againe ego omnium non solum aduersariorum sed etiam catholicorum receptas scholis redarguo sententias doo reproue iudgementes ruard tapper liriensis episcopus lusitanus onely aduersaries also catholiques allowed schooles cause ruardus tapper louaine liriensis portugale haue namely written againste pigghiusvovve simple solemne mutche yee desirous haue pointe noted wherein pigghius mutche misliketh augustine iudgemente petrus soto owne doctoure noteth thus pigghius de hoc male auditpetrus soto de natura gratia quasi peccata nobis originalia omnin inficietur pigghius il reported man vtterly denieth original sinne thus doctoures weigh augustine authoritie lighter heauier thei liste mater marriage vovve blowen awaie seely distinction vovve simple vovve double whiche yee commonly cal solemne vovve al substantially clearely proued promise deliuerie horse surely hardinge simple creature sommewhat inferioure horse would hardely tied sutche distinction better cleeringe hereof ye cal simple vovve made god alone double solemne made presence bishop abbate nowe plainely confessed owne doctours simple vovve neuer simple yet bindeth streitely god double pope coelestinus saithe extra qui clerici vouetes rursus votum simplex apud deum non minus ligat quam solenne simple vovve god bindeth lesse solemne touching promisse deliuerie horse iohannes scotus saith alia ratio estscotus senten dist qu quod vouens solenniter mittit possessionem illum cui vouet solenniter vouens autem priuate non sed quasi promittit sed haec ratio valet minus quam secunda quia omnia quae intrinseca sunt voto vt votum respicit actum voluntatis per quem obligat se vouendo transfert dominium suum alterum omnia inquam ista sunt aequalia hinc inde igitur non magi datio hic quam ibi nec promissio ibi quam hic reason vse maketh solemne vovve putteth voweth possession doothe maketh simple vovve onely geueth promisse reason woorse weaker seconde al thinges substance vovve vowe concerneth acte minde whereby minde bindeth selfe vowinge transposeth ownership selfe vnto al thinges saie like vveight equal either side therefore perfourmace promisse solemne vovve simple promise simple vovve solemne thus see hardinge greate trauaile mutche doo ye haue founde difference without difference caietan thom secund secundae quast arti cardinal caietan saithe eiusdem speciei est transgressio voti solennis simplicis et differunt solum secundum magi graue minus graue breakinge vovve simple vovve solemne one kinde nature difference onely greeuous lesse greeuous therefore thomas aquine selfe firste father appeareth distinction saithe thus thomas secund secundae quaest art august de bono viduitatis ca videtur quod ecclesia possit dispensare voto continentiae solemnizato per susceptionem sacri ordinis seemeth churche maie dispense vowe chastitie solemnized receiuinge holy order augustine saithe qui dicunt talium nuptias non esse nuptias sed potius adulteria mihi non videntur satis acute ac diligenter considerare quid dicant saie marriage sutche menne weemen haue vowed chastitie marriage al rather aduouterie seeme vnto consider discreetely aduisedly saie thus therefore hardinge notwithstandinge simple double vovve augustine saithe vnto yee speake vnaduisedly vndiscretely vnderstande saie whole mater wee haue entreated large apologie cap diuision also late put printe auncient father origen woorke vpon gospel iohn liber hodie extat circumfertur mutilus leaste quite whole sixthe chaptre wherein likely yea rather suertie saide origene written many thinges concerninge sacramente holy communion contrarie mennes mindes woulde rather put foorthe booke mangled ful perfite feare shoulde reproue parteners erroure cal ye trustinge antiquitie ye rente piece keepe backe maime burne auncient father hardinge wise man affirmeth nomore knoweth good man nomore standeth charitie learned matter weight nomore auouche euidenthereby hardinge saketh mutche credite ovvne learninge reason sure proufes sufficient auctorities defender charginge catholikes manglinge origen vpon iohns gospell though pourpose lefte sixth chaptre whiche imagineth conteine sacramentary doctrine contrary catholike faithe asmuche vncertaine hereof thereby noteth greate vntruthe setter foorthe woorke neither meanes able proue sheweth himselfe foole aslaunderer vnlearned man vvee like perceiue heare faultes knowe v sithe burthen v knowe pretende slender coniecture syr defender complaine leauinge chapter partes woorke well sixth chapterin prolog hom origenis lucam whereas origen wrote vpon iohn nine thirty tome hierome witnesseth latine translation printed venis hath lackinge seuen laste tome neither whole perfite many maymed mangled vvhat maner doctrine blessed sacramente hath vttered vpon sixthe chapter iohn catholike pointe appeareth diuerse woorkes haue cause belie neuer sawe truthe christes body sacrament testimony euidenthom exod credites sake recite couple one place saithe thus ye knowe whiche haue benne woonte present diuine mystery ye take body lorde ye keepe warenesse reuerence whit thereof fall downe nothinge consecrated gifte miscary ye beleue selues gilty right well doo ye beleeue negligence ought fall downe place writinge vpon centurion woordes spoken christehom diuerso euangelij locos matth vvhen saithe thou takest holy meate vncorrupte deintie thou enioiest breadde cuppe life thou eatest drinkest body bloudde lorde lorde entreth vnder roofe b sarisburie wee laie manglinge anciente father mater sufficient euidence onely greate coniecture corruption referringe iudgemente thereof vnto reader certainely hardinge wee haue good cause many way doubte dealinge nothinge handlinge fathersconcil aphrican cap ye remember wickedly pope zosimus better coloure ambition longe sithence corrupted nicene councel neither ye forgeate trifle fabulous vanity yee haue lately sente v abroade vnder olde smooky name abdias leontius amphilochius hippolytus clemens yee solemnely cal apostle felovve vncleanely conueiances wise man appeare simple meaninge notwithstandinge ye thought good policie deceiue worlde shifte shadowe anciente father origen thought woordes christe sixth chapter iohn origen leuiticum hom easy coniecture hath written otherwheres vpon leuiticus writeth thus est euangelio litera quae occidit si enim secundum literam sequaris illud quod dictum est nisi comederitis carnem filij hominis c ea litera occidit euen gospel letter killeth christe saithe onlesse ye eate fleashe sonne man c ye take accordinge letter letter killeth origen iudgemente sacramente day counted catholique ye replie origen exodum homi origen saithe ye take body lorde yee keepe al warinesse reuerence parte thereof fal downe againe thou takest holy meateorigen diuersos euangelij locos homi lorde entreth vnder thy roofe bothe place former replie fully answeared catholique doctrine hardinge ye pike woordes transubstantiation real presence accidentes vvithout subiecte ye wil saie origen calleth sacramente christes body doothe christe selfe doothe paule doo al anciente father bicause sacramente christes body owne glose saithe de consecra dist hoc est hath benne often alleged vocatur corpus christi id est significat corpus christi called body christe saie signifieth body christe people yee saie receiued warily reuerence doo nowe euen church moste mislike withal saithe thou receiuest holy meate lorde entreth vnder thy roofe greate mater thinke winne hereby euen place origen saith intrat etiam nunc dominus sub rectum credentium duplici figura vel euen nowe lorde entreth vnder roufe faitheful twoo manner sortes holy godly bishoppes enter house euen lorde entreth wil ye conclude hereof bishop transubstantiate christe christe really substantially dwellinge allegorie hardinge mystical kinde speache wherein knowe learned father mutche delited roofe meaneth material spiritual saie body man soule like also comminge entringe christe bodily onely spiritual augustine saithe augustin quaestionum euangeli li ca august de tempore sermo praedicant christum cum annuntiando venire faciunt exhausta fame viscera filij esurientis preache christe preachinge cause comme bowelles hungry childe wasted famine likewise againe saithe centurion tecto non recipiebat christum corde recipiebat quanto humilior tanto capacior tanto plenior receiued christe house receiued harte humble roome receiue chrysostom psalm fuller saithe chrysostome qui vocant dauid cum cythara intus christum per ipsum vocant cal dauid harpe meane cal christe chrysostom matth hom againe saithe christus aut suscipitur aut occiditur apud no si enim credimus verbis eius suscipimus eum generamus nobis christe either receiued slaine within v wee beleeue vvoorde wee receiue begeate within v hieronym ad paulam de obitu blesillae sutche sorte hierome writeth vnto paula ad talem clemens ingreditur iesus dicit quid ploras non est mortua puella sed dormit sutche one iesus entreth milde gracious saithe weepest thou thy damesel deade lieth asleepe manner speache saide spiritual mystical maie taken accordinge outwarde sounde letter image painted church saithe hierome secundum mysticos intellectus quotidie iesus ingreditur templum patris accordinge mystical vnderstandinge hieronym matth li ca origen matth tracta christe entreth dayly temple father sense origen saithe christe entreth house whiche phrase writinge vpon mathevve expresseth plainer manner tradunt eijciunt ab anima sua saluatorem verbum veritatis quod erat eis betraie throwe foorth saueour soulet doo al apostate renegates denie knowen truthe god betraie vvoorde truthe within apologie cap diuision worlde see welfauouredly towardly touching religion men agree father vse vaunte owne good olde councel eliberine made decree nothinge honoured people painted church hardinge woordes prouincial councel thought good paintinges chrucheeliber co cil ca woorshipped adored painted walles expresse prohition paintinge nought painted churche walles woorshipped adored maie seeme bothe presuppose former vse suche paintinges also allowe sorte image vvhether doo noit forceth greatly forceth greatly seuenth general councell assembled nice imagebreakers hath onely allowed thedeuoute vse image deuoute vse image comonly vsed church christen people also condened al throwe downe maineteine contrary opinio taught prouinciall councell ought geue place generall b sarisburie paintinge image churche walles forebidden councel holden eliberis granado spaine ergo saie sutche image vsed councel al maie wel graunted without preiudice yee see plainely forebidden councel one saithe ex mali moribus bonae leges ortae sunt il manner came good lawes menne vsed yee saie time painte image churche walles vse naught therefore councel decreed maie geathered woordes feare idolatrie saie seconde general nicene councel allowed wel deuoute vse image general councel ought take place prouincial general councel many bishoppes prouincial fewe thus see ye weigh religion truthe companie rule loose maie soone deceiue good christian reader let man beguile thee coloure councelles reade seconde nicene councel throughout yu hable thou wilt saie neuer assemblie christian bishoppes vaine peeuishe wicked blasphemous vnwoorthy al respectes called councel blessed bishoppes agreed togeather one consente image church onely allowed also deuoutely reuerently honoured honoure dewe god selfe one saithe venerandas imago recipio adoro id perpetuo docebo receiue woorship reuerende image concil nicenum actione wil teache liue saith sacras imago perfecte adoro qui vero secus consitentur eos anathematizo doo perfitely adoure holy image adouring image accurse al holde contrarie saithe concil nicenum actio non sant duae adorationes sed vna ipsius imaginis primo exemplaris cuius est imago twoo kindes adoration one dewe wel image paterne image holy councel ye saie decreed againste imagebreakers counsel god decreeth againste image vvoorshippers imagemakers augustine saithe august de consensu euangel lib cap sic omnino errare meruerunt qui christum apostolos eius non sanctis codicibus sed pictis parietibus quaesierunt nec mirum si pingentibus fingentes decepti sunt woorthy deceiued sought christe apostle bookes holy scripture painted walles neither maie wee marueile painers painter deceiued apologie cap diuision olde father epiphanius saithepiphan epistol ad iohan episcop hierosolymitan horrible wickednesse sinne suffered man set vp picture churche christian yea though picture christe selfe yet menne store al theire temple eche corner painted carued image though without religion nothinge woorthe hardinge ye pretende allege epiphanius saie first although minde make ofepiphanius one man saide reporte yet one man whose singular opinion preferred thevntruthe anciente father make mention image iudgemet al many excellent father determination whole churchevntruthe vvee report truely shal appeare nowe deede misreporte epiphanius saithe write calleth hauing image christe saincte churche horrible wickednesse sinne suffered hath sutch wordes secondly saie place maketh nothinge al againste vse image vntruthe vvoordes plaine imaginem quasi christi aut sancti cuiusdam speaketh neuer woorde againste image christe sainctes churche onely againste one particular image whiche founde hanginge churche dore village palestine called anablatha seing hea childishe vaine shifte epiphanius speaketh directly al image speaketh generally againste al image sutche noteth special word istiusmodi vela vailes sorte geueth v vnderstande misliked qualitie circumstance one image reproued thevntruthe image vvere commonly receiued churche common receiued custome churche hauing image due order circumstance dependeth many particularity whiche might happen either image parte moste like people parte inhabitant litle declared epiphanius place neither saie thinge determinately thereof ye bring sutche obscure vncertaine matter disproufe veritie alwaies wel churche acknowledged practised b sarisburie many howe prety shiftes diuised woulde healpe serue pourpose one late louanian cleregie sawe woordes cleare might auoided glose therefore thought wisest waie firste bringe authoritiecopus dialog pag copus pag credite hereof question saie2 epiphanius neuer wrote sutche epistle nexte saith epistle neuer translated hierome mutche sawe folie herein open easy controlled thirdely saithe image epiphanius rente image c epiphanius rente sunder3 image either christe christian saincte heathen image iuppiter hercules somma idole knoweth fourthly saithe saide holy father epiphanius heretique copus pag one called anthropomorphitae copus pag whose erroure god diuinitie whole shape proportion man folie far passeth al reste behoued heretiques moste al others defense erroure maineteine image yet seemeth vnciuile parte condemne reuerende godly father grosse heresie without prouse specially sutche father hath learnedly written againste al heresy fifthly saithecopus pag euen hardinge saithe5 epiphanius man one man iudgemente singulare therefore lesse esteemed laste alcopus pag saithe6 holy father epiphanius ievve beinge christian reuerende father christian bishop yet notwithstandinge maineteined religion iewes therefore rente sunder image christe simeon metaphrastes despite christe proufe hereof allegeth simeon metaphrastes doctoure wise selfe hardinge imagined shiftes vnsauery woulde hardly serue therefore hath diuised conueigh selfe somme waie firste saithe wee falsiste holy father allege woordes otherwise secondely saithe image christe epiphanius found painted vele somme prety thing knoweth lastely saithe epiphaniusr reproueth generally al sutche veles painted onely one vele founde trial hereof epiphanius ad iohan hierosolymitan apud hierony tom referre mee self ye original woordes thereof inueni ibi velum pendens foribus eiusdem ecclesiae tinctum atque depictum habens imaginem quasi christi aut sacti cuiusdam non enim satis memini cuius imago fuerit cum ergo hoc vidissem ecclesia christi contra authoritatem scripturarum hominis pendere imaginem scidi illud magi dedi consilium custodibus eiusdem locus vt pauperem mortuum eo obuoluerent efferrent c quaeso vt iubeas presbyteros eiudem locus praecipere ecclesia christi istiusmodi vela quae contra religionem nostram veniunt non appendi decet enim honestatem tuam hanc magi habere sollicitudinem vt crupulositatem tollat quae indigna est ecclesia christi populis qui tibi crediti sunt founde vele hanginge entrie churche stained painted hauinge image christe somme saincte whose picture deede doo remember therefore sawe image man hange churche christe contrarie commaundemente scripture tare sunder gaue counsel warden churche shoulde winde burie somme poore body c beseeche charge priestes place commaunde sutche veles contrarie religion hanged vp churche christe behooueth reuerence haue care hereof superstition vnmeete churche christe vnmeete people thee committed remoued nowe iudge hardinge wherein wee haue falsified learned father woordes saie speaketh one woorde againste image christe sainctes beseeche againste image speaketh habens imaginem quasi christi vel sancti cuiusdam epiphanius saithe plainely image vvere christe somme saincte saie founde faulte vele onely againe beseeche telle v image christe sainctes offended epiphanius image image christe maie suffered churche christe image maie suffered cause difference imagine veles allowed rather image church answeare vvee cannot saie thinge determinately thereof whereby appereth ye woulde faine saie somewhat ye wiste yet muste wee ouerruled al euery determination yea although selfe confesse ye determinately determine nothinge notwithstandinge anciente father churche haue longe sithence determinately lactant lib ca plainely iudged againste lactantius saithe plaine woordes non est dubium quin religio nulla sit vbicunque simulachrum est al doubte religion euer image tertullian saithe tertullian de idololatria idolum tam fieri quam coli deus prohibet quanto praecedit vt fiat quod coli possit tanto prius est ne fiat si coli non licet facio ait quidam sed non colo quasi ob aliquam causam colere non audeat nisi ob quam facere non debeat scilicet ob dei offensam vtrobi que imo tu colis qui facis vt coli possit god hath forebidden image idole wel made woorshipped farre makinge goeth woorshippinge far thinge made maie woorshipped somme man wil saie make woorship though durste woorship cause onely cause whiche ought make meane bothe way goddes displeasure nay rather thou woorshippest image geuest cause others woorship therefore augustine speakinge image god father august de fide symbolo ca saithe thus tale simulachrum deo fingere nefarium est diuise sutche image god abominable theodorus bishop ancyra saithe sanctorum imago specie ex materialibus coloribus formati minime decorum puramuscitatur concil nicen action manifestum enim est quod vana sit huiusmodi cogitatio diabolicae deceptionis inuentum wee thinke conueniente painte image sainctes material earthly colour euident vaine imagination procuremente deceitefulnesse diuel like yourpose writeth epiphanius estote memores dilecti filij ne ecclesias imago inferatis neque sanctorum coemiterijs ea statuatis sed perpetuo circumferte deum cordibus vestris quin etiam neque domo communi tolerentur non enim fa est christianum per oculos suspensum teneri sed per occupationem mentis deere child yee mindeful ye bringe image church yee erecte vp none burialles sainctes euermore carrie god harte nay suffer image priuate house lawful leade christian man eies rather studie exercise minde cause epiphanius saithe superstition image vnfitte churche christe apologie cap diuision olde father origene origen leui ca chrysostome exhorte people reade scripture chrysost matthae homil idem ioha buye bookes reason home bitwixte selues diuine mater vviues husbandes parentes child menne condemne scripture deade elementes asmutche euer maie barre people hardinge vntruthe vvhole hereof true parte false partely true partely false saie origen exhorteth resorte church holy daieshomil leuit cap heare woordes god thereof afterwarde thinke earnestly meditate lawe god exercise mindes daie night waie house bedde rise holde withall desirous ovaine excuse many people neuer heare sermon al liues people beare awaie true godly preacher teache churchereadinge scripture thinke put dayly practise life el serueth preachinge chrysostome hom math speaketh whiche contemned scripture saide monkes wiues child care householde though perteined maried men reade parte thereof monkes onely time people mighte induced reade holy scripture suche mindes suche cause suche intent purpose onely chrysostome requireth god forbid shoulde meanes staie therefromm hardinges fauourable opinion people consideringe maner time callinge due examination curiositie temeritie vnreuerence contempte holy thinges men may espie people thinke good admitted readinge scripture freely without limitation euer fellowes iudge v doubt accompt haue make meaninge lordes dredfull seate iudgemente conclude tell haue misreported bothe chrysostome specially origen euer speake readinge meditation scripture amendement life verely place quotedmanifeste vntruthe reade ansvveare exhorte people reason dispute diuine matter amonge selues specially husbandes wiues parentes child saie doo b sarisburie mutche ye saie parte hereof true parte false truste ye wil geeue u leaue freely vse truthe vntil ye shal finde selfe better hable proue falshedde seemeth greatly mislike people haue somme little libertie reade somme sutche parte scripture maie beste spare orderinge liues whereby appeareth quietinge conscience mater religion cause truthe yee thinke beste reade nothinge ye saie ye hable answeare dreadful seate goddes iudgemente touchinge truthe hereof saie mutche might saide woulde require greate waste time augustine saithe si desitaugust de ciuita li ca hieronym ad demetriad de virginita tuenda aut ignoretur qua eundum fit quid prodest nosse quo eundum fit ye haue know waie goe august de tempore sermo shal profite knowe whither goe hierome saithe vt maius est voluntatem domini facere quam nosse ita prius est nosse quam facere illud merito praecedit hoc ordine doo wil lorde knowe knowlege goeth dooinge goodnesse dooinge goeth order knowinge againe augustine saithe si scripturas diuinas aut non legimus ipsi aut legentes alios non libenter audimus ipsa nobis medicamenta conuertuntur vulnera inde habebimus iudicium vnde potuimus habere remedium either reade scripture selues desirous heare others reade medicine turned vvoundes vvhere vvee mighte haue remedie vvee shal haue iudgemente sutche saieinges common ordinarie chrysostome thus saithe chrysostom genesim hom librum diuinum accipiat aliquis manum conuocatis que proximis per diuina eloquia riget suam mentem conuenientium vt sic diabolicas insidias effugere valeamus let one take hande holy booke let cal neighbour aboute heauenly vvoordes let water refreashe bothe theire mindes chrysostom gene homil also owne againe saithe poterimus domi versantes ante post conuiuium acceptis manus diuinis libris vtilitatem inde capere spiritualem cibum animae praebere beinge home maie bothe meate take holy bookes hande thereof receiue greate profite chrysost gene homil minister spiritual foode vnto soule againe etiam domi vacemus diuinarum scripturarum lectioni euen wee home let v bestowe time readinge scripture origen saithe vtinam omnes faceremus illud quod scriptum est scrutamini scripturas vvoulde god wee woulde al doo accordingely written searche scripturesorigen esatam homil ye saie wee haue misreported bothe chrysostome origen exhorte people saie reason diuine mater emonge selues specially husbandes vviues c whether v bothe maketh truer reporte let v tried chrysostomechrysost iohan homil chrysostom matth homi thus saithe neque hoc tantum consessu sed domi quoque vir cum vxore pater cum filio inuicem de frequenter loquantur vltro citro que suam ferant inquirant sententiam velint que hanc probarissimam inducere consuetudinem hearken hereto onely churche also home let husbande wife let father childe talke togeather mater bothe fro let bothe enquire geeue theire iudgementes woulde god woulde beginne good custome haue hardinge husbande communinge diuine mater vvife father childe therefore vnaduisedly saie wee haue misreported holy father parte misreporte likewise hierome saithe hieronym episit ad coloss ca illud verbum dei habitet vobis hieronym psalm hic ostenditur verbum christi non suffiele ter sed abundanter etiam laicos habere debere docere se inuicem vel monere wee ought euen laie menue oughte haue vvoorde god onely sufficiently also obundantly one instructe warne againe saithe solent viri solent monachi solent mulierculae hoc inter se habere certamen vt plures ediscant scripturas bothe maried menne monkes wiues commonly haue contention emonge themselues vvho maie learne moste scripture conclude theodoretus de corrigen graecor affectib li theodoretus saithe thus passim videas nostra dogma non ab ijs solum teneri c ye maie commonly see doctrine knowen onely doctours churche maisters people also euen tailers smithes vveauers al artificer yea also vveemen onely learned also labouringe vveemen sevvsters seruantes handemaides neither onely citizensde diuina trinitate rerum que omnium creatione dissertantes also countriefolkes doo wel vnderstande yee maie finde yea euen dichers deluers covvheardes gardiner disputinge holy trinitie creation al thinges apologie cap diuision auncient fatherscypria epi lib cyprian epiphanius hierome saie one perchaunce hathe made vovve epiphan contra apostolicos haeres leade sole life afterwarde liueth vnchastely cannot quenche flame lustehieronym ad demetriadem august de bono viduita ca better marrie wife liue honestly wedlocke olde father augustine iudgeth selfe mariage good perfite ought broken againe menne man haue bounde selfe vovve though afterwarde burne keepe queanes defile selfe neuer sinful desperate life yet suffer persone marrie wife chaunce marrie allowe marriage commonly teache mutche better godly keepe concubine harlotte liue kinde marriage olde father augustine complained multitude vaine ceremony augustin ad ianuar epist wherewith euen sawe men mindes conscience ouercharged menne though god regarded nothinge el ceremony haue measure increased almoste none thinge leafte church place praier b sarisburie al hardinge hath saiein darte chapter diuision parte chap diuision hathe benne bothe alleged also fully answeared place conueniente apologie cap diuision againe olde father augustine denieth lawful monke spende time slouthfully idlenesse vnder pretensed countrefeite holinesse liue al vpon others thus liueth olde father apollonius likeneth theefe menne haue wote whether name droues heardes monkes al doo nothinge yet intende beare shewe holinesse yet liue onely vpon others also riot lauishly folkes laboures hardinge augustine calleth vvoorse idlenesse vvee doo mainteine monke shoulde liue idly wee reproue accountinge seruice god idlenesse neither thinge onely whiche ye alleage defence brother haue donne monastery country gospel proceedeth ye haue remoued onely suche monkes proued idle monkes generally would serue god accordinge vowe made vnder thea though christes rule vvere loste vvere sufficiente approued rule benedict augustine francis dominicke saie haue droues heardes monkes thereby signifieinge beastes rather men vvhereas augustine calleth seruos dei seruantes god woorke whiche alleage sith monkes meane religious men serued aulter appointed preach minister sacramentes bestowe time praier owne infirmity sinnes peoplevntruthe plaine contrarie augustine doctrine augustinede opere monachor cap ar bounde labour winge spirituall thinges behofe others may reape temporall thinges owne necessary sustenance b sarisburie monkes ye saie goddes seruantes monkes life seruice god herein ye vse sutche earnest talke august de opere monachor ca though whole generation monkes remoued god sit without seruice deede augustine shewinge v august de sermone domi monte good seruice monkes time vnto god eodem loco augustin de opere monachor ca saithe thus isti non deo seruiunt sed suo ventri monkes serue god serue belly againe saithe lactantia est periculosior quo sub nomine eruitutis dei decipit hypocrisie vountinge holinesse dangerous deceiueth v vnder name goddes seruice againe saithe fallit dolosa imagine sanctitatis deceiueth v deceiteful countenance image holinesse againe touchinge monkes saith non apparet vtrum ex proposito seruitutis dei venerint vita inopem laboriosam fugientes vacui pasci vestirl voluerint wee cannot tel whether became monkes pourpose serue god el beinge weary poore monkes goddes seruice paineful life rather desirous feadde clothed dooinge nothinge therefore calleth almouse thei geatte sumptus lucrosae egestatisaugustin de opere mona hor ca simulatae pretium sanctitatis charge gaineful pouertie price feined holinesse againe saithe venalem circumferunt hypocrisim carrie hypocrisie aboute sale hilarie speakinge kinde holy people augustin de opere monachor ca saith thus conuiuia sub obtentu religionis sumptuosa sectanturhilari psalmum apothecas suas inutili religiosoru obsequio defendunt de quibus scriptum est comedentes domos viduarum etiasi dominum se credant inuocare tamen audient quod est euangelio scimus quia peccatores deus non audit vnder colour holinesse seeke deinty costely fare maineteine stoarehouses vnprofitable seruice religious peoplematthae whome written deuoure vp poore vvidovves house although thei thinke serue god yet answeare shalbe made written gospel iohn vvee knovve god geeueth eare sinner vpon woordes gospelluke selle al thou haste geeue poore comme folovve meematthae ordinarie glose saithe thus bene operando non mendicando folovve vvel dooinge begginge wee graunte seruice god maie rightly called idlenesse bernarde saie monkesbernardus cantica cantl hieronym ad eustochium serui christi seruiunt antichristo pretende christes seruice serue antichriste god euer require doo sutche seruice hierome saithe statu seruili abiectionis esse abhorrent laborare recusant prae pigritia mendicare erubescunt validi quia nihil daretur eis lothe abiectes seruile state idlenesse wil laboure begge asbamed beinge valiaunt lusty people noman woulde geue thinge augustin de opere monachor ca likewise saithe augustine tanquam conseruatricem euangelij praedicant pigritiemaugustin eodem capite speake mutche idlenesse keepe castle gospel againe faithe contingit eis quod viduis iunioribus indisciplinatis cauendum apostolus dicit simul otiosae esse discunt non solum autem tiosae sed curiosae verbosae loquentes quae non oportet thinge happeneth vnto paule speaketh yonge widowes liuinge order learne idle onely idle also curtous ful woordes speakinge su che thinges meete thus yee see hardinge pretense coloure goddes seruice hathe oftentimes anciente father benne called idlenesse ye saie monkes serue aultare minister sacramentes therefore bounde bodily laboure faire coloure shadowe idlenesse euer hade monkes serue aultare gaue authoritie minister sacramentes doctour father anciente councel olde time lawful monke prieste gregorie saithe nemo potest ecclesiasticis officijs deseruire quaestion nemo monastica regula ordinate persistere man serue ecclesiastical office orderly keepe rule monkerie quaestion monachus hierome saithe16 quast alia causa monachus non docentis sed plangentis habet officium monkes office preache mourne glossa againe saithe alia causa est monachi alia clerici clerici oues pascunt ego pascor state monke one thinge state prieste priestes feede flocke beinge monke muste fedde whereupon glose saithe ego pascor sacramentis ipsorum fedde sacramentes priestes whereby euidente monke selfe authoritie minister sacramentes mutche priuately selfe touchinge bodily laboure hierome saithehieronymus ad rusticum et vita hilarionis holden lawe emonge monkes aegypte woulde laboure shoulde eate augustine saithe monkes bodily laboure alleged name nihil dei seruis peius est otiositateaugustin ad fratres eremo sermo augustin de opere monac oar ca operentur ergo nomine domini vnto seruantes god nothinge woorse idlenesse let woorke therefore name lorde sutche idle monkes augustine saith isti manus otiosas repositoria plenum habere volunt monkes wil haue idle handes ful cellers learned father woonte saie reporte socrates monke labo reth handes maie resembled vnto theefe bernarde saithe restat vt sint laboribus daemonum qui laboribus hominum non fuerunt muste needes trauailes diuels historia tripartita lib ca bernardus psalm augustin de opere monachor ca trauailes menne augustine saithe diabolus tam multos hypocritas sub habitu monachorum vsquequaque dispersit sutche number hypocrite hath diuel scattered abroade euery vnder coloure monkes firste suppressours monastery within realme memorie twoo deerest frendes cardinal vvoulsee doctoure fisher bishop rochestertheodoretus lib cap nonlatin alphabet either wel warranted thereto authoritie pope longe time godly learned bishop letoius ouerthrewe burnte messalians monastery saide dennes theeues theodoretus reporteth chased vvouues awaie folde late yeeres sundrie cardinalles rome emongest whome also cardinal poole beinge specially appointed commission pope paulus viewe disorder deformity churche returned answeare sorte concil tomo con delectorum cardinali pag alius abusus corrigendus est ordinibus religiosorum quod adeo multi deformati sunt vt magno sint scandalo saecularibus exemplo que plurimum noceant conuentuales ordines abolendos esse putamus omnes abuse reformed order monkes freers many vile shame vnto se lares example doo mutche il conuentual order vvee thinke good al abolished hardinge iudgemente owne frendes therefore ye haue lesse cause offended suppressinge abbies owne deere catholique father partely haue suppressed selues partely haue consented vnto sameconcil tom pag operis tripart li cap booke called opus tripartitum ioined vnto councel laterane written thus totus fere mundus obloquitur scandalizatur de tanta multitudine religiosorum pauperum qui introierunt mundum vvelneare whole worlde crieth againste offended greate multitude begginge monkes freeres entred vvorlde therefore decree published councel lateraneconcil lateran sub innocen ca ne nimia religiosorum diuersitas graue ecclesia dei offensionem inducat firmiter prohibemus ne quis de coetero nouam religionem inueniat leste ouer greate diuersitie religious folke bringe greate offense churche god wee doo earnestly forbidde hencefoorthe man diuise newe religion damasus speakinge order dist chorepiscopi called chorepiscopi saithe thus vnde iste tertius ordo processerit ignoramus quod ratione caret extirpare necesse est whence thirde order comme wee cannot tel thinge wanteth reason muste needes taken vp rootes apologie cap diuision olde councel rome decreedconcil rom ca man comme seruice saide prieste wel knowen keepe concubine menne let concubine ferme priestes yet constreigne men forcea prieste keepinge cocubine againste theire wil heare theire cursed paltry seruice hardinge vntruthe easy founde vve finde sutche canon olde romaine councelsdist ca nullus allegation noted margent false parte doctrine yet finde nicolaus alexander pope haue willed man heare masse prieste knoweth vndoubtedly kepe concubin sutche vvise menne proctours filthinesse wise men lawe thinke onely vndoubted knowledge either iudge hath open sentence published sutche man kepe concubine facte selfe notorious vntruthe notorious manifeste worlde b argentine hath florene yeere euery prieste keepeth concubine shee beare childe hathe foure vvhereas saie let concubine ferme priestes meete saie false slaunderousvntruthe reade ansvveare neither euer man daie driuen heare masse kepeth concubine wil take vpon proue prieste kepe concubine selfe non beinge infamous maie stande iudgemente certaine shal hearde cannot proue doubte order lawe prieste kepeth concubine therefore bounde christian people heare masse vntruthe pope hildebrande saithe benedictio eoru vertitur maledictionem concit roman sub nicolao concil pa anno zacharias pp epist ad bonifa dis non no glossa vvhiche sacrilege sacrilegious heart thinketh blasphemous tonge vttereth blessed holy sacrifice whiche christe made laste supper b sarisburie pleased better haue perused bookes ye mought soone haue found selfe woordes councel rome holden vnder pope nicolas first whiche although olde maie compared ancient father councelles yet elder somme partes braches newe religion like pourpose writeth pope zacharie quis sapiens iudicabit eos esse sacerdotes qui nec fornicationibus abstinent wise man wil recken priestes absteine mutche fornication wise man iudge priestes man wil authorize minister sacramentes nowe side hardinge consider common ordinarie practise churche rome firste touchinge pope selfe glose saithe facta papae excusantur vt adulterium jacob pope dooinges aduouteries excused aduouterie jacob againe communiter dicitur quod pro simplici fornicatione quis deponi non debet cum pauci sine illo vitio inueniantur commonly saide man maie deposed depriued simple fornication dist maximianus gloss dist nullus mutche fewe priestes founde without faulte againe whereas woordes decree nullus audiat missam presbyte quem scit concubinam indubitanter habere let noman heare masse neste vndoubtedly knoweth keepe concubine close vpon saithe thus hic canon quando que fuit latae sententiae sed hodie non est decree olde time stoode ruled case ideo licet notoria sit fornicatio tamen non est propter eam abstinendum ab officijs presbyterorum therefore although fornication notoriously knowen yet maie wee therefore refraine seruice prieste hereunto wel agreethe glose vpon othoes legantinesde concubinis clericor remouendis licet ad profligandum quid ergo si sacerdos mueniatur coire cum muliere respondeo adhuc dicitur occultu nec propter hoc debet cum vitare publico nisi aliter conuincatur man find prieste uoure woman answeare al notwithstandinge faulte pr e neither maie man therefore aouid priestes seruice onlesse otherwise co cted againe glose vpon woordes qui publice detinet concubinas noted thus glossa cudem titulum tu dic publice quando multitudini se patere non expauet secus ergo si secrete intra domum propriam vel alienam detineat hanc concubinam nam tunc poenam huius constitutionis non incurreta prieste keepinge cocubine dom u enim rem secretam non aut publicam denotat word openly vnderstand thou afraide leste world espie therefore otherwise keepe concubine secretely whether owne house somme mannes vvithin daunger lavve house betokeneth thinge secrete open fauourable gentle construction onlesse prieste keepe woman openly marketplace without al daunger lavves canon wee maie refraine heare seruice sacrilege saie blessed holy sacrifice hereto maie answeare woordes augustineaugusti de ciuitat li ca quae sunt sacrilegia si illa erant sacrum aut quae inquinatio si illa lauatio sacrilege sacrifice staininge wasshinge verily owne pope hildebrande hereof writeth thus dist si qui imperamus vobis ne eorum officia orationes cu tus audiatis quia benedictio orum vertitur maledictionem oratio peccatum testante domino per propheram maledicam benedictionibus vestris qui vero huic saluberrimo praecepto obedire noluerint idololatriae poena incurrent wee commaunde heare neither theire office thire praiers theire seruice theire blessinge turned cursinge theire praier sinne lorde selfe witnesseth prophete wil curse blessinges saithe lorde euer wil obeie wholesome commaundemente shal fal paine idolatrie iudge yee nowe hardinge whether sacrilege wee saie saie blessed holy sacrifice apologie cap diuision olde canon apostle commaunde bishop remoued office whiche wil bothe supplie place ciuil magistrate also ecclesiastical person menne al bothe doo wil needes serue bothe place nay rather one office whiche ought chiefely execute touche yet body commaundeth displaced hardinge ought sticke one certaine worldely businesvntruthe impudente aboue measure vvas vnsemely christes apostle married whiche maie seme vnsemely bishop priest base dignitie much hinderance vocation vndoubtedly mariage sorte1 cor vvhom maie better credite case paules paule speaketh thus priestes also euery priuate christian man without wife saith careful thinges lorde howe maie please god coupled wife careful thinges whiche worlde diuided fieashely minister busines fleashely worldly al altogeather spiritual bicause theire spirit wholly occupied therein b sarisburie christe thought litle hinderance marriage towardes preaching gospel ambro cor twelue apostle chose eleuen married ambrose saithe alleged apostoli omnes exceptis iohanne paulo vxores habuerunt al apostle wine sauinge onely iohn paule ye saie vvith fleashely minister businesse fleashely altogeather spiritual bicause theire sprite wholy occupied therein pitieth hardinge see vainely stowe spiritual cogitation matrimonie goddes ordinance matrimonie chaste pure god neuer ordeined man liue villanie filthinesse paule saithe hebrae matrimonie honourable al menne wel priestes others bedde vndefiled aduouterers fornicatours lorde selfe vvil iudgeroman againe writinge vnto married people rome saithe vos non estis carne sed spiritu fleashe sprite married liued lavves marriage yet paule saithe fleashe sprite augustine saithe august de bono coniugali ca origen epist ad rom ca sanctum sunt etiam corpus coniugatorum fidem sibi domino seruantium body married people keeping faith bothe selues lorde e cleane holy origen saith non solum virgines aut contine te offerunt copora sua hostiam sanctam onely virgin others liue single life also married folkes offer vp theire body holy sacrifice chrysostome saithe chrysostom ad hebrae hom sanctificationem paulus vocat pudicitiam temperantiam coniugalem honeste chastitie temperance bitweene man vvife paule calleth holinesse againe carent culpa nuptiae nec virtute quicquam prohibent marriage voide faulte hinderance vnto vertue hereof wee haue spoken large touchinge chaste life spiritual cleregie hardinge sundrie owne frendes haue recorded whole worlde wel hable iudge nothinge el spiritual filthinesse apologie cap diuision olde councel gangra commaundeth none shoulde make sutche difference bitweene vnmarried prieste married prieste thinke one holy single life sake menne put sutche difference bitweene streight waie thinke al theire holy seruice defiled donne good honest man hath wife hardinge pourpose sir vse true dealinge alleage woordes olde councel speake anvntruthe fonde peeui vvoorde external named al coucel external sacrificethe councel gangra neuer named masse whiche churche calleth masse behoued dissemblec leste ye bewraied cause woordes man make difference prieste hath benne married though sacrificeth man might communicate oblation accursed father speake euidently prieste hath sometime ben maried saie priesthodevntruthe impudente marueile hardinge reporte vvithout blussinge chrysost ad hebrae homil priesthode neuer bearde sithens time christe prieste might marie lawe either greeke latine churche vve therefore condemne mariages priestes whiche made takinge holy order saie good honeste man incestuous aduouterer marieth afterwarde b sarisburie answeare al trifle hardinge longe wee refuse name oblation sacrifice wee knowe holy ministration commonly called aunciente father chrysostome saith memorie remembrance samplare token one sacrifice christe offered body vpon crossehoc sacrificium exeplarilliusest magi recordationem sacrifici operamu howe reason hereof ye would seeme wreast greeke woorde nonlatin alphabet simple bewraieth either wante skil greate corruption beinge learned greeke tongue ye muste needes knowe nonlatin alphabet signifieth sacrificemariage priesthoode ministerie publike seruice plutarchus saithe thus lictores quasi litores dicebantur quod essent nonlatin alphabet hereby appeareth plutarchus romulo alexander ab alexandro pachymeres nonlatin alphabet roman actor chrysost acta homil common hangeman cittie called nonlatin alphabet office nonlatin alphabet whiche trowe hardinge yee would haue called sacrificer sacrifice pachymeres annotation vpon dionysius saith thus nonlatin alphabet appellat diaconos aut eos qui nunc hypodiaconi appellantur c lleth nonlatin alphabet called deacon subdeacon paule speaking kinges ciuile prince saith nonlatin alphabet aut ministri dei sun recken ye wil saie either deacon subdeacon kinges prince authoritie minister holy communion saie offer vp daily sacrifice luke saithe nonlatin alphabet ministrantibus illis chrysostome demaundeth question quid est ministrantibus nonlatin alphabet answeareth praedicantibus whereby appeareth apostle sacrificinge theire preachinge benne ouer mutche va itie note theis thinges vaine quarrel geuen occasion certainely mention said councel gangra either masse external sacrifice priesthood ye saie vvas neuer heard sithence time christe prieste might marrie lavve either greeke latine churche warrant vndoubtedly true euery woord gospel owne glose saie ground mother diuinitie stand saie ye warrante vnwisely mislike vnaduisedly ye knowe verily vpon pope owne decree ye shal finde noted thusdist aliter glossa nicephorus li nicephor li ca multi ex hac litera dixerunt qu orientales possunt contrahere sacris ordinibus woordes many haue geathered priestes easte churche maie marrie within holy order nicephorus saith eupsychius prieste cesaria cappadocia married wife litle martyred like seemeth write apollinaris elder beinge prieste married wife laodicea councel holden ancyra canon written thus diaconi quicun que ordinanturconcil ancyranum canon si ipsa ordinatione protestati sunt dixerunt velle se coniugio copulari quia sic manere non possunt hi si postmodum vxores duxerint ministerio maneant propterea qu episcopus licentiam dederit deacon receiue order time theire admiss make protestation saie wilbe married cannot otherwise contine aftervvarde marrie let remaine minist bishop hath already dispensed chrysostomechrys epist ad tim hom speaking marriage bishoppes saithe thus quamuis nup ae plurimum difficultatis se habeant ita tamen assumi possunt vt perfectiori vit pedimento non sint notwithstanding marriage haue mutche trouble yet maie taken shalbe hinderance perfite life saith marriage maie taken chosenerasmus contra bedam pag cornel agrippa contra louanien artic dist ci n prae ertio glo cat n speaketh namely marriage priestes bishoppes erasmus saithe priestes greeke churche daie notvvithstanding theire order marrie wiues like writeth cornelius agrippa louanians owne glose vpon decree haue alleged noteth thus dicunt qu olim sacerdotes poterant contrahere ante siriciu thei saie olde time pope siricius laweful priestes contracte matrimonie likewise cardinal cai tane saith nec ratione nec authoritate probari potest qu absolut loquendo sacerdos peccet contrahedo matrimonium cannot proued neither reason authoritie speakinge absolutely prieste offendeth god nge wife likewise saithe anselmus dialogue bitweene maister scholare touchinge mater defideramus certifica tua sotione super vulgari toto orbe quaestioneanselm dialog inquisitione prima quae ab omnibus pene quotidie ventilatur adhuc li indiscussa celatur scilicer liceat presbyteris post acceptum ordinem vxores ducere wee desirous answeare certified aboute common question nowe tossed worlde yet lieth vndiscussed meane vvhether prieste beinge vvithin order maie marrie vvife hereby appeareth time anselmus whiche aboue thousande yeeres christe mater laie question yet discussed ye knewe thinges hardinge ye blame dissemble ye knewe ye blame controlle doubt maie appeare fewe sithen e time christes resurrection sundrie priestes beinge within holy order haue married wiues onely greeke churche also churche rome apologie cap diuision auncient emperoure iustinian commaundedin nouel constit holy administration al thinges pronounced cleare lowde treatable voice people might receiue somme fruite thereby menne leste people vnderstand numble vp al theire seruice onely drowned hollow voice also strange barbarous tongue hardinge iustinian emperour willeth praiers holy oblation defender translate administration beinge ashamed theire owne authore holdevntruthe fonde peeuishe iustinia speaketh sacrifice mass againste sacrifice masse made silence audible voice meaninge though praiers made silence vnfruitful people men woulde make v beleue therefore corrupt woordes thinge corrupt commeth vnder theire handes saie iustinian made lawe vt fructus ex ea aliquis ad populum redire posset somme fruit might come thereof peoplein nouell constitut shoulde saie vntruthe augustine saithe quid prodest loquutionis integritas quam non sequitur intellectus audientis fruite like come praier made silence saithe iustinian woordes quo maiore exinde deuotione depromendis domini dei laudibus audientium animi efferantur thintent mindes hearer maie thereby deuotion lifted vp settinge forth praise lorde god saithe lowde voice helpeth deuotion saieth fruit deuotionvntruthe notorious contrarie theire ovvne principal position ignorance mother deuotion fruit alwaies euen secrete praier fruit sometime lowde praier two faultes committed rather two lie made iustinians woordes one oblation thei tourned administration whiche falsehede iewel vseth printed sermon reply cole vvhether also gilty fault deuotion put fruite third lie saie whisper al seruice latine albeit good lady liketh better terme mumblingevntruthe hard ovvne councelles expresse vvoordes insusurrare murmurare wene fewe haue sense hearing wil saie singinge psalmes hymmes epistle gospel grailes offertory preface sutche like seruice vsed catholike churche whisperinge numblinge fourth lie saie leste people shoulde vnderstande vsvntruthe glose contrarie bothe texte also cotinual practise churche graecia vve wishe al people vnderstoode al praiers thinke conuenient common prophane tongue vtter high mystery therefore wishe would learne themystical tongue mystical folie al folie mystical tongue gladly teache child dionyse areopagite scholer paule teacheth timothe al v communicare ea quae vim perficiendi habent cum ijs qui perficiunt communicate thinges whiche haue power make men perfite make men perfite saie publishe priestly office consecration nothinge maketh v perfite amonge onely priestes amonge others laste al fifth lie saiepraier strange tonge pronounce seruice mystery barbarous toguea paule saithe tongue barbarous knovven though latine tongue barbarous rather euery vulgare tongue tongue moste barbarous whiche moste vsed vulgare sorte moste priuate moste vnknowen respecte ala solemne decree vvithout sense vvhen englande commeth haue seruice theire owne tongue owne church hath churche theire owne beside whole haue loste theire parte catholike churche whereunto god restoare againe b sarisburie harding wee corrupte sutche thinges comme vnder handes worlde seethe ordinarie peculiare practise oures yee dubbe v bothe elswhere lie vpon lie sutche ciuilitie courtesie speache yet hitherto wee haue redubbed one lie sobrietie modestie rather becommeth speake god firste iustinian impe authen constit vvee commaunde al bishoppes priestes minister holy oblation c vnder silece lowd voice c harte hearer maie sturred deuotion c ye saie vvee haue corrupted iustinians woordes yet yee knowe wee alleged onely iustinians meaning otherwise one al woordes ye saie iustinian meante though praiers made silence vnfruiteful people somme fruite ye saie al way euen secrete vnknowen praier fruite howe mutche howe ye knowe assuere ye spare tel v yet augustine saithe quid prodest locutionis integritas quam non sequitur intellectus audientis cumloquendi omnino nulla fit causa si quod loquimur non intelligunt propter quos vt intelligant loquimur profite speache neuer perfite vnderstandinge hearer cannot attaine cause wee speake al vnderstande wee speake whoes sake speake maie vnderstande v againe saithe men mea sine fructu est hoc ait quando id quod dicitur non intelligitur minde without fruite apostle paule saithe thinge spoken perceiued againe si intellectum men remoueas nemo aedificatur audiendo quod non intelligit set aparte vnderstanding minde noman hath fruit profite thing perceiueth likewise againe saith quid opus est iubilare intelligere iubilatione vt vox nostra sola iubiletaugu de doctrina christiana lib ca cor non iubilet sonus enim cordis intellectus est needeth v singe wee vnderstande wee singe singe voice harte vnderstandinge sounde voice harte woordes august de trinitate li ca cor vvhisperinge mumblinge mislike mutche yet owne frendes intreatinge hereof haue often vsed woordes late councel colaine written thus vt presbyteri preces non tantum ore murmurentaugust genesia ad literam lib cap aug psal concil colonien cap anno regino concilio nannet sed etiam corde persoluant nunquam manibus eorum liber legis hoc est biblia deponatur priestes onely mumble vp theire praiers also pronouace theire harte let booke lavve saie bibl neuer saide theire handes likewise regino reporteth woordes councel nantes ridiculum est muris aut parietibus infusurrare ea quae ad populum pertinent preushe thinge vvhisper thinges walles pertei e vnto people notwithstandinge whether vvhisperinge mumblinge euer name el shal please cal good emperours commaundement meaninge ye shoulde vtter al thinges congregation distinctely authen constitu augu psal plainely lowde open voice people might vnderstande answeare amen therefore augustine saithe no qui ecclesia diuina eloquia cantare didicimus simul etiam instare debemus esse quod scriptum est beatus populus qui intelligit iubilationem proinde charissimi quod consona voce cantauimus sereno etiam corde nosse tenere debemus wee haue learned singe churche heauenly woordes god muste also endeuoure thing written blessed people vnderstandeth vvhat singe therefore dearely beloued wee haue songe togeather iuneable voice ought also knowe see pure harte ambrose declaringe ecclesiastical order time ambro hexamer li cap saith thus responsorijs psalmorum cantu virorum mulierum virginum paruulorum consonus vndarum fragor resultat answearinge psalmes singinge togeather menne wemen maides litle child churche soundeth vvere dasshinge sea like pourpose leo saithe leo de leiunio septimi mensis sermo totius ecclesiae vna est oratio vna confessio whole churche hath one praier one confession ye allege dionysius vaine childishe reste talke quite contrarie authours minde therefore woorthy answeared dionysius saith haue imagined harding prieste shoulde talke alone mystical vnknovven tongue ianglinge cymbal without sense rather telleth order prieste vvhole people shoulde singe togeather woordes percipiens ipse dionysius ca nonlatin alphabet alijs tradens diuinam communionem postremo desinit gratiarum actionem vna cum tota ecclesiae multitudine prieste bothe receiuinge selfe holy communion also deliueringe vnto others laste al endeth thankes geuinge togeather vvith al vvhole multitude companie churche ye saie vvee wisshe people woulde learne mystical latine tongue gladly doo wee teache theire child ye saie mystical latine tongue vaine man vaine vanitie selfe seeke fondely deceiue god people euer tongue thei maie wise allowed vnderstande parcel theire praiers lactantius lactan lib ca speakinge suttle practises policy heathen saithe thus hinc fida silentia instituta sunt ab hominibus callidis
