babylon mother abomination fornication eathe holy mystery latine tongue ye haue vsed maie wel iustely called mystical hierome saithe father olde time hieron epist ad phes cap hieronymus ad theodoram de domo dei secnam fecere populorum house god haue mode stage plaie people speakinge valentinian heretiques saith barbaro simplices quos que terrent sono vt quod non intelligunt plus mirentur barbarous vnknowen sounde wordes feare simple euer thei vnderstand thei maie esteme haue reuerence latine tongue ye saie barbarous therein woont ye haue noted woonderful great lie apologie yet vnto paule tongue seemeth barbarous vnknowen vnto hearer thus saithe nisi sciero vim vocis cor ero illi qui loquitur barbarus ille qui loquitur mihi barbarus onlesse vnderstande power meaninge woordes shalbe barbarous speaketh speaketh tongue euer speake shalbe barbarous vnto artic diui ludoui viues de traden disciplinis lib fol hereof occasion saie somewhat former replie augustine saithe mallet quis que cum cane suo versari quam cum homine ignotae lingua man woulde rather dwel dogge man vnknowen tongue conclude ye saie vvhen englande commeth haue seruice theire owne tongue theire owne church haue loste theire parte catholique churche hardinge litle reason woulde haue geuen somme credite woordes touchinge publique seruice churche beseeche euen owne time barbarous blindnesse seruice churche englande peculiare special selfe touchinge varietie tongue augustine saith augusti aduer iudeos oratio astitit regina dextris tuis vestitu deaurato circundata varietate vbi significatur linguarum varietas omnibus gentibus quarum tamen vna est intus simplex fides queene stoode thy right hand apparesled cloth goulde adourned varietie signified diuersitie tongue al nation faithe whereof lieth within one simple likewise againe saithe aug psal vestius reginae huius quis est et pretiosus varius est sacramenta doctrinae linguis omnibus varijs alia lingua aphricana alia syra alia graeca alia hebraea alia illa illa faciunt istae lingua varietatem vestis reginae huius quomodo autem omnis varietas vestis vnitate concordat sic omnes lingua ad vnam fidem veste varietas sit scissura non sit ecce varietatem intelleximus de diuersitate linguarum vestem intelleximus propter vnitatem queenes apparel pretious ful varietie mystery doctrine al sundrie tongue one tongue aphrica syria greeke hebrewe tongue make vp varietie queenes apparel al varietie colour apparel agreeth vnitie euen al tongue agree one faithe let varietie apparel rente cutte maie behold varietie wee vnderstande diuersitie tongue apparel wee vnderstande vnitie churcheaugu iohan tracta againe saith distant inter se lingua sed linguarum distantiae non sunt schismata tongue diuided one diuision tongue schisme diuision religion apologie cap diuision olde councel carthage commaunded nothing read christes congregation canonical scripture menne reade sutche thinges churchesconcil cartha selues knowe truthe starke lie fonde fable hardinge man better assure thee good reader make two newe bookes correcte one ful lie falsefied placesconcil cartha c apologie isvntruth old cou cel falsified vvas falsified tvvelue hundred yeeres agoe councel hippo olde councel carthage newely falsefied new cleregie wordes councel palcuit vt praeter scripturas canonicas nihil ecclesia legatur sub nomine diuinarum scripturatum scripture onely read church hath semed good vnto v besides canonical scripture nothinge read churche vnder name holy scripture leauinge foure woordes sub nomine diuinarum scripturarum vnder name diuine scripture woulde beare men hande councel willed nothinge read churche besides holy scripture trusty men ye may committe charge soules faith saluation foloweth decree liceat etiam legi passiones martyrum cum anniuersarij dy celebrantur let lawful also martyrdomes martyr read theire yerely festes kept yet dare onely saie nothing must read besides scripture also alleage place special lie whiche saithe contrary looke booke thy selfe good reader see falsely handle holy mattersvntruthe cofessed beste har ovvne side lie saie reade thinges churche whiche selues knowe starke lie funde fable vvhen cannot selues shewe haue sutche vaine lieing rhetorike saie doubt knowe selues truthe wonder blushe belieng v haue belied many scripture councels father b sarisburie standeth wel truthe hardinge often charge v lie falsehedde truste wil appeare ye great cause keepe great reuel vpon poore conqueste deede woordes founde thirde councel carthage yet founde councel hippo whiche abbridgemente thirde councel carthage appeareth title concilij hipponensis abbreuiationes factae concilio carthaginensi tertio woordes councel hippo mutche also thirde councel carthage concil hippo cap scripturae canonicae ecclesia legendae quae sunt praeter quas alia non legantur scripture canonical whiche read churche besides whiche nothinge el maie read haue hardinge plaine woordes councel hippo abberidged thirde councel carthage nothinge maie read churche onely canonical scripture iudge therefore howe iuste cause ye vnaduisedly vate saie vnlearnedly charge apologie lie falsehedde hereto maie wee adde like decree councel holden laodicea sabbatjs euangelia cum alijs scripturis legenda esse censemusconcil laodice cap wee agree gospel others scripture read vpon saboth daie woordes seeme sufficiente concil laodice cap foloweth councel non oportet libros qui sunt extra canonem legere nisi solo canonicos veteris noui testamenti maie reade bookes without canon onely canonical bookes olde nevve testamente like effecte chrysostome saith chrys matth homi ideo christus meusas nummulariorum euertit significans quod templo dei debent esse nummi nisi spirituales id est qui dei imaginem habent therefore christe ouerthrewe exchanger bakes meaninge thereby maie come churche onely spiritual saie chryso acta homil beareth image god againe saithe lectorum officium erat ecclesia sacrum legere ex scriptis vel prophetarum vel apostolorum reader office pronounce holy thinges vnto people either apostle prophetes erasmus saithe erasin hiero de eccle scriptarib efrem apparet non nisi apostolicas literas olim legi solitas templis aut certe vitorum apostolicae authoritatis appeareth olde time nothinge vsed read church onely apostle writinges leaste writinges sutche others scripture onely read church apostolical authoritie likewise saithe abbas ansigisus reportinge ecclesiastical decree frenche kinges levves charles templis tantum canonici libri id est sacrae literae legantur let read church onely canonical bookes ansigisus lib cap impressus parisijs anna saie holy scripture lie ye saie saie wee reade thinges churche whiche selues knowe starke lie fonde fable trial hereof wee shal neede trauaile far owne bookes legendes prouse sufficiente erasmus thereof saithe thus erasin annotation hieronym de ecclesiasticus scrip hodie quorumlibet somnia imo mulietcularum deliramenta leguntur inter diuinas scripturas nowe day euery fooles dreames yea wee mennes doctinge fansies read holy scripture likewise saithe polydore vergil multorum diuorum vitas recitant tametsi parum ad fidem scriptas polydor vergil oration dominicam reade many sainctes liues although written accordinge truthe ludouicus viues writtinge legenda aurea whiche mother al deuoute ecclesiastical story fable saithe thus nescio cur aurea dici debeat cum scripta sit ab homine ferrei oris plumbei cordis plenissima sit impudentissimis mendacijs see cause shoulde called goulden legende seeinge written man iron face ledden harte freight ful shamelesse lie ye knewe thinges hardinge frendes wil thinke ye knowe nothinge sutche truthes yee reade publishe deuoutly solemnely church yet maie wee neither saie thinke yee mocke people apologie cap diuision thinke aboue rehersed authority weake selender bicause thei decreed emperours certaine petite bishoppes ful perfite councelles takinge pleasure rather authoritie name pope let sutche one knowe pope iulius doothe e idently forebidde priest ministring communion dippe bread cuppe menne contrarie pope iulius decree diuide breade dippe wine hardinge ye maie sure many men thinke homely stuffe onely weake slender also corrupt venemous lothsome nowe like ye wil amende faulte surely going euil bad worse ye worse hitherto ye haue donne iulius pope saie ye doth euidently forbidde prieste ministringe communion shoulde dippe breade cuppe nowe verely former fault lieing wel amended ye best cast changed wordes whiche ye pretende alleage nowe ye make euery whit newe owne vvhere hath iulius woorde speake false alleaging place bookes margent forgeue puttinge cum enim nemo stede cum omne smal slipper faulies thei alone might wincked slipper merchates ye let v heare pope iulius saith alios quo que audiuimus intincta eucharistia populis pro complemeto comunionis porrigere vve haue hearde also others geue people euchariste dipped stiped makinge vp communion vnderstanded whereas christe gaue blessed sacrament aulier apostle gaue vnder kindes priestes country either lacke wine al time ready either somme priuate fansie vsed dippe stipe sacred body lord vnder forme breade consecrated bloudecommunion vnder one kinde geue people pope iulius findeth faulte therewith neither christe ordeined apostle lefte sutche order churche iulius meaneth nothinge el reproue reforme vse dippinge stiping one kind administration communion vnto people reade place listeth shal finde sense largely vttered litle sense make defender god name saie iulius forebiddeth prieste ne dum peragit mysteria panem immegat calicem ministringe communion lady tourneth shoulde dippe breade cuppe sutche word wholde decree iulius nameth eucharistiam cal breade iulius hatha fonde vanitie forbidde prieste dippe sacramente deliuer forebiddeth prieste dippe sacramente intinctam porrigere populis prieste geue sacrament dipped people leauing geuing people saie forbad prieste dippe leaue also chiefe cause whole whiche pro complemento communionis making vp communion ebiddeth geue vnto people onely cosecrated hoste dipped chalice though whole comunion nolesse bloude geuen aparte men saie contrary decree pope iulius diuide bread dippe wine vve masse breake hoste three partes withoutthese mystical signification mystical folie reade ansvveare signification mysterie two receiue aparte thirde put chalice receiue togeather bloude vvhal haue ye saie againste b sarisburie euery parte hereof largely answeard former replie hardinge true faulte iulius findeth dippinge ministring sacrament agreeth fully present disorder churche rome yet notwithstanding condemning one muste needes condemne ye saie wee leaue woordes intinctam porrigunt eucharistiam populis dippe sacramente deliuer vnto people againe woordes pro complemento communionis accomplishemente communion matter wee haue leafte haue wee conceled faultes mutche beholden v meante harding mention al woordes needed burthen selfe moe abuse mutche bewraie folie iulius saithe dipped sacramente cuppe deliuered vnto people dippe sacramente vnto people ye geeue nothinge iulius saithe meante dippinge make ful perfite communion contrariewise defraude people holy cuppe deliuer onely halfe communion therefore ye mutche blame woorthy euer iulius reproued offended onely simplicitie wilfulnesse touchinge matter selfe faulte wee finde faulte iulius founde others predecessours al one dippe breade cuppe brake christes institution doo therefore iulius saide vnto hoc quam sit apostolicae euangelicae doctrinae cotrarium consuetudini ecclesiasticae aduersum non difficile ab ipso fonte veritatis probatur quo ordinata ipsa sacramentorum mysteria processerunt howe far contrarie apostolical euangelical doctrine custome churche easy proue fountaine truthe mystery sacramentes ordeined firste proceeded ye thinke mater wel discharged ye deliuer sacramente dipped vnto people minister onely vnto selfe waie mater skil vnderstande authoritie either scripture councel doctoure maie appeare lawful prieste vse receiue sacramentecommunion vnder one kinde vnlawful people people maie safely lawfully receiue sacramente maie prieste wherefore woordes written masse bookes euen canon secretes masse haec sacrosancta commixtio corporis sanguinis domini nostri iesu christi fiat mihi omnibus sumentibus salus animae corporis holy minglinge body bloude lorde iesus christe vnto vnto al receiue health soule body verily woordes omnibus sumentibus cannot shifte possibly expounded one onely prieste muste needes extended vnto people yee woulde faine tel v certaine special mystery ye haue founde breakinge sacramente daniel senten lib dist ye wiste thei ye case somm time nabuchodonozor yee hable wel tel v dreame sammetime ye saie breade broken sommetime ye saie accidentes remaine alone miracle broken sommetime ye saie christes immortal impassible body selfe broken sommetime ye saie eies deceiued nothinge broken againe yee saie first peece signifieth chruche trauailing worlddurandus li cap seconde signifieth blessed sainctes heauen thirde signifieth soules purgatorie de conse dist triforme pope sergius father fantastes conueieth mystery waie firste portion saithe signifieth christes body resurrection seconde christes body vvalkinge earthe thirde christes body graue hardinge holy signification special mystery sutche folie mystical vanity ye mocke world olde time breade broken busie mennes heades significationsartic diui augu epist onely deliuered people former replie haue declared large augustine saith panis benedicitur sanctificatur ad distribuendum comminuitur bread blessed sanctified broken peeces ende maie deliuered apologie cap diuision pope clement saithe lawful bishop deale bothe swerdes thou vvilt haue bothe saith thou shalte deceiue bothe thee selfe obeie nowe day pope chalengeth selfe bothe swerdes vseth bothe wherefore ought seeme lesse marueile haue folowed whiche clemente saithe hath deceiued bothe selfe vvhiche haue geeuen eare vnto hardinge felowes sworne belie al worlde maintenance theire newe gospel woulde time leaste haue made true reporte clementes woordes clement speaketh two swordes palace truely alleaged hath thusthese vvordes partely clementes partely bernardes si mundialibus curis fueris occupatus teipsum decipies eos qui te audiunt thou occupied worldely care thou shalt bothe deceiue thy selfe listen thee authoure apologie hauinge spite church whiche christes folde pope heade shepherde enuieing auctoritie forgeth lie vpon clement making saie si vtrunque habere vi thou wilt haue bothe swordes thou shalt bothe deceiue thy selfe obeie theefonde child though bishop maie haue tempord aud xecute temporal office vvithout vvo ldly cates vvhereas clemente speaketh word two swordes worldly care bishop euer entangled shal saithe deceiue selfe others harken whiche cause defender coupled yoke fellowes pretensed wedlockebothe svveerdes one hande state wrappeth man worldly cares1 cor sutche onevvhat care haue thei keepe concubine careth thinges worlde howe please wife diuided paule saithe must needes folowe hauing taken office superintendentes charge soules vpon themeleuen tvvelue apostle many holy father bishoppes vvere married yet deceiued c haue deceiued selues dayly doo deceiue many heare folow false doctrine b sarisburie pleasante grace hardinge hath talke lie man woulde thinke somme good parte studie place twoo sundrie authority one clemens bernarde knowe erroure ioined one bothe alleged set foorthe vnder name onely clements graunte herein ouersight lie falshedde none woordes clemens bernard de co sideration li reporte woordes bernarde written vnto pope eugenius planum est apostolis interdici dominatum ergo tu tibi vsurpate aude aut dominans apostolatum aut apostolus dominatum plane ab alterurto prohiberis si vtrun que similiter habere velis perdes vtrun que plaine vnto apostle christe lordeship temporal princehoode forebidden goe thou thy waie therefore thus saithe pope dare thou vsurpe either apostleship beinge lorde lordeship beinge apostle one vndoubtedly thou arte forebidden thou vvilt indifferently haue bothe thou vvilt lose bothe sutche hieronym sophoniam ca hierome writeth thus militantes christo obligant se negotijs saecularibus eandem imaginem offerunt deo caesari beinge souldiers christe binde selues worldly affaire offer vp one image god caesar canon apostle written thus canon aposto canon mathae non oportet episcopum aut presbyterum se publicis administrationibus immittere sed vacare comodum se praebere vsibus ecclesiasticis nemo enim potest duobus dominis seruire bishop prieste maie entangle selfe worldly office reaste shewe selfe meete vse churche noman serue twoo maisters yet pope daie claimeth righte bothe svverdesde maiorita obedient vnam sanctam paralipomena vispergensis onely spiritual also temporal pope bonifacius greate iubilee open sighte worlde one daie shewed selfe pontificalibus apparelled procession bishop nexte daie put vpon emperours roabes maiestie emperial crovvne vpon heade sw rde naked glitteringe borne pope clemens canon easily shifted prety prouiso thus saithe glose touchinge extra de iureiurando etsi christus glossa cessante causa cessat effectus verbi causa prohibetur ne presbyteri gerant tutelas hac causa vt melius vacent diuinis officiis haec causa finalis est vnde cessante hac causa cessat effectus vnde si non vacent diuinis officiis poterunt gerere tutelas cause endinge effecte endeth example lawe commaundeth prieste shal charged vvith vvardeship childe nonage cause hereof maie better applie diuine seruice final cause cause remoued effecte geeueth place therefore prieste folowe diuine seruice maie haue wardeship childe euen pope doo office bishop maie temporal prince meanes commeth passe euen clemens saithe deceiueth bothe selfe also heare touchinge vaine obiection chargepart cap diuision part cap diuision care marriage fully answeared place conueniente apologie cap diuision pope leo saith upon one daie lawful saie one masse one churche menne saie daiely one churche commonly tenne mass twentie thirtie yea often time moe poore gafer scante tel whiche waie beste turne selfe pope gelasius saithe wicked deede subiecte sacrilege man diuide communion hath receiued one kinde absteine menne contrarie goddes vvoorde contrarie pope gelasius commaunde one kinde onely holy communion geeuen people dooinge make priestes gilty sacrilege hardinge solemne fansie muste needes vvise e vvil thinke small number men whiche moued suspecte apologie deuised catholike man intendinge mocke newe cleregie englande put quite estimation creditehere hard confesseth felovves sette foorthe lie ende innumerable companie lie seemeth pourpose set man hauinge fiue wittes woulde thinke good mainetenance owne parte affirme many thinges contrary whereof greate discredite shamein epist ad dioscorum alexandrinum searche easely foundevntruthe manifeste reade ansvveare articul diuision leo saithe cleane contrary name auouched euer newe multitude filleth churche canot present sacrifice oblation sacrifice without castinge doubte done againe b sarisburie beseeche thee gentle reader shortnesse sake thy better satisfaction herein consider answeare made hereunto former replie hardinge uerily leo speaketh one woorde either priuate masse sole receiuinge like superstitious yeeuishe vanitie onely general communion whole churche counsel therefore vnto dioscorus vpon occasion resorte multitude communicantes greate coulde haue conuenient coume churche receiue al togeather one communion prieste ministred vnto firste companie willed departe foorthe geeue place others sawe churche replenished againe newe companie aftercommers shoulde without feare remorse conscience beginne whole communion againe minister vnto donne vnto foremet oute leoes woordes cannot geathered apologie cap diuision wil saie al thinges woorne nowe vre nighe deade perteine nothinge presente time yet ende al folke maie vnderstande faithe geeuen menne vpon hope cal togeather general councelles let v see fewe woordes good heede take selfe thinges thei selues last yeres remembrance thereof yet newe freashe owne general councel order called haue decreed againe saithe summus sacerdos speakinge likewise one bishop vidisti summum sacerdotem interrogantemambros de ijs qui initiantur ca consecrantem thou sawest highest prieste examininge people baptized consecratinge water leaue sundrie like authority origen lactantius athanasius leo euagrius lib cap victor meltiades others euagrius calleth euphemius gregorius bishop antioche summos sacerdotes higheste priestes ruffinus lib cap ruffinus calleth athanasius bishop alexandria pontificem maximum greatest higheste bishop truste maie appeare title dignitie highest priestehoode general common al bishoppes onely closed vp mortesed onely pope bisides al augustin epi ye bringe v woorde yee saie greater sounde romana ecclesia semper viguit apostolicae cathedrae principatus romaine churche princehoode apostolike chaire hath alwaies florished deede princehoode apostolike ioily large woordes carrie greate sounde faine woulde yee haue bishop rome shoulde prince notwithstandinge councel aphrica decreed thus dist primae sedis primae sedis episcopus non appelletur princeps sacerdotum let bishop firste see called prince priestes sounde woordes weighe heauier former woorde princehoode nomore peculiare pope highest priesthoode paulinus writtinge vnto alypius greate bishop rome poore bishop remember tagasta saithe thus inter epistolas augustin epi deus ciuibus ciuitatis suae principalem te cum principibus populi sui sede apostolica collocauit god hath placed thee emongest citizen cittie apostolique see beinge principal chiefe bishoppes saie prince people haue founde princehoode see apostolique onely rome also poore cittie tagasta likewise chrysostome saithe chrysotom de orando deum li ad orandum no assidue prouocat paulus apostolorum princeps paule prince apostle calleth vpon v al way praieinge saithe gregorie paulus obtinuit totius ecclesiae principatum paule obteined princehoode whole churche gregor regum ca li ca saithe leo iuuenalis episcopus ad obtinendum palestinae prouinciae principatum c bishop iuuenal mighte obteine princehoode prouince palest e c briefely owne singulare doctoure amphilochius writeth thus leo epi amphilochius pope basile bishop caesarea additus est principibus sacerdotum magnus ipse princeps sacerdotum basile beinge deade laide bishoppes prince priestes beinge selfe greate prince priestes greate folie therefore hardinge title thus lieinge common encroche onely pope notwithstandinge ye saie thus nowe til verily pope selfe shal beginne consider weighe pleadinge wil saie vnskilful proctoure answeare restearticul diuisi remit firste replie apologie cap diuision whiche anciente father doctours euer saide bothe svverdes committed vnto hardinge let bernarde writinge pope answeare popevntruthe authoritie sufficient shal appeare sufficient witnesse vvhere selfe doo alleage muche pope lawe iustly refuse speaking popebothe svverdes spirituall swoorde denie trowe temporall swoorde belonginge also popebernard de considera lib thus saithe bernarde eugenius denieth swoorde thine seemeth consider sufficiently woorde lorde saieinge thus peter thy predecessour put vp thy svverde ergo pope hathe bothe svverdes simple argumente put vp thy swoorde scaberde also thine drawen foorthe perhaps thy becke though thy hande el belonged wise vnto thee apostle saide beholde twoo swoordes lorde woulde haue answeared ynough muche bothe church spirituall swoorde materiall exercised churche churche hade prieste souldier verily becke prieste commaundement emperoure thus touchinge pope bothe swoordes fully answered bernarde b sarisburie pope hath power claime authoritie without shame emongest others vnaduised dist omnes vaine woordes thus saith christus beato petro vitae aeternae clauigero terreni simul coelestis imperij iura commisit christe hathe committed vnto peter keiebearer euerlastinge life right bothe vvorldly also heauenly empiere saie pope emperoure bothe heauen paralipom vrspergensis earthe therefore pope bonifacius saide sight worlde ware crovvne emperial heade commaunded naked svverde borne proclamation made ecce duo gladij hic beholde twoo swerdes meane pope bonifacius written carion entred foxe reigned woulfe died dogge hereof written concilio vangionum vtrun que imperium pontificatumauentinus sicuti decij falsorum deorum cultores factitare cosueuerunt vsurpat pope wronge fully vsurpeth bothe togeather wel vvorldly empiere bishoprike decius woorshippers false goddes woonte doo yet bernarde saithe pope hath bothe svverdes bernardes authoritie case simple liued eleuen hudred yeeres christes ascension time kinge henry firste kinge englande middes pope route tyrannie touchinge iudgemente credite herein let v rather heare one owne doctours herueus therfore saithe thus herueus de potestate papae cap bernardus ponit quod papa habet gladium materialem nutu sed istud cum hoc quod non est magnae authoritatis magi est cotra eos quam pro eis bernarde saithe pope hath material temporal swerde commaundement saieinge bernardes bisides smal force maketh also againste herueus de potestate papae cap againe saithe vnum istorum gladiorum petrus non teugit scilicet saecularem qui suus non erat one tvvo svverdes peter neuer touched meane vvorldly temporal svverde swerde none likewise ye maie finde written owne decree vnder name dist quoniam idem cyprian christus actibus proprijs dignitatibus distinctis officia potestatis vtrius que discreuit christe hath committed bothe svverdes one mannes hand seueral dueties sundrie dignity hath seuered ye office either power whereupon owne glose saithe thus ergo est argumentum quod papa non habet vtrun que gladium therefore proufe pope hath bothe svverdes apologie cap diuision whiche anciente father euer saide haue authoritie righte calle councelles hardinge vvho hath authoritie commaunde partes bodyto calle coucelles headvntruth great manifest vvas yet neuer proued pope head amply declared ye hearde euen nowe vvhere aske whiche euer saide pope hath authoritie cal councelles knowe mutchevntruthe socrates saithe tel socrates writer ecclesiastical historie saithe speaking owne person reportinge olde rule churche woordeshisto triparti li cap sed ne que iulius interfuit maximae romae praesul ne que locum suum aliquem destinauit cum vtique regula ecclesiastica iubeat non oportere praeter sententiam romani pontificis vntruthe standing false translation reade ansvveare concilia celebrari neither iulius bishop greate rome present councel antiochia neither sent man place ecclesiastical rule commaundeth without aduise wil pope rome councels kepte socrates witnesseth calling councels doth sozomenus witnesse thinges doone themlib ca cum sacerdotali lege constitutum sit pro irritis haberi debere quae praeter sententiam episcopi romani geruntur vvhere saithe hath benne ordeined lawe bishoppes thinges doone councel besides thaduise wil bishop rome ought taken none voide wil see authoritie calling councels reade rescriptum iulij papae contra orientales epist athanasij aegyptiorum pontificum ad foelicem papam matter also fully answeared b sarisburie hath hardinge brought shewe greate authority withoute sense answeare whereof maie please thee gentle reader consider fourth article former repliearticulo diui notwithstanding emongest al wordes pope iulius socrates cassiodorus forged athanasius one woorde power authoritie calle councelles onely thus mutche saie nonlatin alphabet regula iuris decree maie passe councel without agreemente consente bishop rome one foure principal patriarkes oughte haue voice wel others principle ruled lawe quod omnes tangit ab omnibus debet approbari toucheth al muste allowed al leste shoulde thinke pope onely prerogatiue belonged none bisides socrates writeth like wordes wel bishop constantinople pope thus saithe et hoc feceruntsocra li ca nonlatin alphabet contemnentes legem qua cauetur ne quis eligatur praeter sententiam episcopi constantinopolitani thus regardinge decree whereby order taken bishop chosen without consente bishop constantinople yet maie hardinge conclude hereof therefore bishop constantinople authoritie calle councelles aeneas syluius afterwarde selfe pope named pius second writeth thus authoritatibus mirum modum putant se armatos qui negant concilia fieri posse sine consensu papae quorum sententia si vt ipsi volunt inuiolata persistat ruinam secum ecclesiae trahit saie councel maie keapte without consente pope thinke selues marueilously fensed authority aeneas syluius de concil basi lib theire saieinge holde take place woulde haue vvil dravve vvith decaie ruine churche foure first greate councelles nice ephesus chalcedon constantinople reste shal afterwarde largely appeare alwaies called emperours pope pope hadde yet whole worlde commaundemente sutche vniuersal authoritie calle councelles rather commaunded selfe bishoppes emperours authoritie comme councelles therefore woulde conclude thus pope head churchethe vvhole vvorlde pope diocese ergo authoritie calle councelles wee maie rather mutche better turne youre tale backewarde saie thus pope hadde authoritie calle councelles ergo vvas headde churche apologie cap diuision whiche auncient father doctours euer saide vvhole vvorlde diocese hardinge saide peterioan fede lambes fede shepegod knovveth sheepishe reason whiche lambes shepe al christen menne worlde b sarisburie canonistes saie pope page honoure haue doubted infeaffe maister possession al worlde one saithe thus extra de appellation vt debitus gloss extra de statu regularium periculoso gloss extra de poenis foelicis gloss extra de cocess praebendae ecclesiae non vaecantis quia diuersitatem abb ceremoniar li fran zarabella dominus papa est ordinarius omnium hominum oure lorde pope ordinarie bishop al menne saithe papa totius mundi obtinet principatum pope hath princehoode al worlde saithe papa est episcopus totius orbis pope bishop whole worlde saithe papa etiam cessante negligentia praelatorum potest conferre beneficia totius oribis quia ipse est ordinarius totius mundi though defaulte negligence bishop yet maie pope bestowe benefice al worlde bishop al worlde therefore chiefe deacon inuesteth enrobethe pope consecration saithe vnto ego inuestio te de papatu vt praesis vrbi orbi inueste thee popedome thou maiste rule bothe cittie worlde infinite ambition inordinate tyrannie manie good menne haue often complained franciscus zarabella beinge selfe cardinal rome saithe thus ex hoc infiniti sequuti sunt errores quia papa occupauit omnia iura inferiorum ecclesiarum et nisi deus succurrat statui ecclesiarum vniuersa ecclesia periclitatur hereof haue ensued infinite errours pope hathe inuaded right al inferiour church onlesse god healpe state church vniuersal churche ieoperdie anna historia graeca nonlatin alphabet histor ecclesiast lib cap learned lady anna daughter vnto emperoure alexius irene storie wrote greeke emonge many thinges like pourpose writeth thus papa est dominus totius mundi quemadmodum latini quidem putant praedicant est enim etiam haec par quaedam illorum insolentiae pope lorde al worlde latines thinke speake peece theire ambition hath benne late wanton claime pope canonistesathana ad solitariam vitam agentes otherwise ancient learned father haue euermore bounded limited pope within owne particular iurisdiction ruffinus saithe father councel nicesozomen lib ca nonlatin alphabet hieronymus ad euagrium appointed pope ouersee church ovvne suburbes vt romanus episcopus suburbicarum ecclesiarum sollicitudinem gerat athanasius saith rom est metropolis romanae ditionis rome mother churche al vniuersal worlde romaine particulare iurisdiction bishoppes councel rome write thus bishoppes illyricum par est omnes qui sunt orbe romano episcopos conuenire conuemente al bishoppes within iurisdiction rome shoulde accorde togeather hierome speakinge vsage order churche rome saithe thus al receiue pope fulnesse quid mihi profeis vnius vrbis consuetudinem allegeste thou custome one cittie mutche abbridgeth pope iurisdiction extendeth vnto listes endes al worlde restreineth limites one cittiehierony ad euagrium hieronymus aduersus vigilantium likewise againe speakinge bishop rome saithe thus non solum vnius vrbis sed etiam totius orbis errant episcopi onely bishop one towne whiche bishop rome also bishoppes al worlde deceiued thus therefore writeth gennadius togeather councel constantinople vnto bishop romegennadius ad omnes metropolitanos ad papam roman curet sanctitas tua vniuersas tuas custodias tibi que subiectos episcopos let youre holinesse see vnto al whole worlde al owne charge sutche bishoppes subiecte vnto fewe see bishop rome power vniuersal infinite ouer al church kingedomes worlde certaine limited within owne particulare iurisdiction reason yee vse proufe hereof marueile ye would euer trouble worlde childishe folie christe saide vnto peter feede sheepe ergo saie vvhole vvorlde pope diocese good sheepe woulde haue made better argument apologie cap diuision whiche holy ancient father euer saide al bishoppes haue receiued youre fulnesse hardinge besides others hatha simple authoritie bernarde saide booke de consideratione ad eugenium vvhere saithe called plenitudinem potestatis fulnes power b sarisburie folie vaine shift maie mainteined glose hardinge clemen li de haereti ad vestrum gloss petrus de palude de potestate papae written thus omnes subiecti sunt motioni papae sunt illo quasi membra de membro al men subiecte vnto pope wil mebers member saithe ecclesia non habet potestatem aliquam iurisdictionis nisi petro churche hath power iurisdiction onely peter againe petro post christum spiritualis gratia potestas deriuatur nexte christe spiritual grace power deriued peter therefore doctours saithe petrus de palude de potestate collata aposto durandus li de ministris ordinib augusti de trinita li ca omnes episcopi descendunt papa quasi mebra capite de eius plenitudine omnes accipiunt al bishoppes deriued pope member head al receiue fulnesse saie power power grace grace al vanity hardinge thinketh maie wel borne two bare woordes bernarde augustine many hundred yeeres bernarde borne wrote thus no quidem accipere possumus hoc donum pro modulo nostro fundere autem illud super alios non possumus sed vt hoc fiat deum super eos quo hoc efficitur inuocamus deede maie receiue gifte god accordinge portion poure vpon others able notwithstanding theire behalfe wee cal vpon god worker hereof wil doo apologie cap diuision whiche al ancient doctours euer saide al power geuen youal povver geeuen pope wel heauen earthe hardinge vntruthe vndiscrete impudent ancient doctour father euer vttered fonde vvoordes al whiche speake ministerial power whereby vnder christe militant churche gouerned meane absolutely youre woordes seeme sounde discrete catholike man euer saide thought b sarisburie prety distinction povver absolute povver absolute christe vicare set togeather parte tenure howe manner povver extra de translatione episcopi quato hostien concil lateran sub leone sessione pope claimeth owne proctours counsellers tel v beste cardinal hostiensis saithe excepto peccato papa potest quicquid deus ipse potest sinne onely excepted pope hath power doo euer god selfe doo stephanus bishop patraca youre late councel laterane rome saithe thus papa est omnis potestas supra omnes potestates tam coeli quam terrae al power pope aboue al power wel heauen earthe citatur eode concil lateran make mater plaine youre owne bernarde selfe saithe tibi data est omnis potestas qua qui totum dicit nihil excludit al manner power geeuen thee saithe al excepteth nothing extra de costitutionibus ca abbate panormitane saithe plenitudo potestatis superat omnem legem positiuam et sufficit quod papa sit pro ratione voluntas fulnesse power passeth al positiue lawe sufficiet pope wil stande instede reason power hardinge hathe closely conueied vnder cloude distinction baldus baldus experience sawe practise hereof saithe thus haec plenitudo potestatis est plenitudo tempestatis fulnesse power fulnesse tempeste youre doctoures saithe herueus de potesta papae ca bernardus nullam potestatem ponit papa quam non ponit praelatis inferioribus licet papa ponat summam bernarde alloweth povver vnto pope alloweth inferioure bishoppes notwithstandinge alloweth greatest povver vnto pope bernard de consideration li bernarde selfe saithe like pourpose sic factuando probatis vos habere plenitudinem potestatis sed iustitiae forte non ita thus dooinge dealinge yee shewe youre selfe haue fulnesse power perhaps likewise fulnesse iustice apologie cap diuision whiche ancient father euer saide neither kinge prince whole cleregie al people togeather hable iudges ouer hardinge vvorthy reason vvhat shepe shalbe iudges ouer shepherde father moste ancient councel sinuessa saide cause ofthis marcellinus pope committed open idolatrie making sacrifice nto diuelles marcellinus pope nemo vnquam iudicauit pontificem man euer iudged pope prelate highe prieste quoniam prima sedes non iudicabitur quoquam first see shal iudged body b sarisburie twoo pointes standeth pope garde truste keepe castel al power firste churche rome euer waie take neuer erre nexte pope euer doo maie neuer called reckening pope vvithout checke one doctours saithe thus omne factum sanctissimi patris interpretari debemus bonum et fiquidem fuerit furtum vel aliud ex se malum interpretari debemusiohan de parisijs de potesta regia papali quod diuino instinctu fiat wee muste expounde euery acte holy father beste thefte thinge selfe euil aduoutrie fornication muste thinke donne secrete inspiration god saithe si papa innumerabiles populos cateruatim secum ducat mancipio gehennae cum ipso plagis mulus aeternum vapulaturosdistinct si papa huius culpas arguere praesumat mortalium nullus pope drawe infinite company people heapes togeather self hel pounished many stripe euer yet let mortal man presume reproue faultes saith questi cunctae papa solutus est omni lege humana pope exempted al lawe man saithe sacrilegij instar esset disputare de facto papae facta papae excusantur vt homicidia samsonis vt furta haebraeorum vt adulterium iacobdist non no gloss sinne greate sacrilege churche robbinge reason pope dooinges actes excused samson murder ievves robbery aduouteries iacobpetrus de palude de potesta papae arti saithe nec totus clerus nec totus mundus potest papam iudicare aut deponere neither al cleregie al whole worlde maie either iudge depose pope againe papa nullo casu quamdiu est papaidem eode loco propter quodcun que crimen potest deponi nec concilio nec rota ecclesia nec toto mundo pope pope cannot case offense committed deposed neither general councel al churche whole worlde al wel hable proue good substantial authoritie scripture epistola nicolai papae inter decreta adriani papae dist inferior herueus de potest papae ca concil tomo purgatione sixti thus reason scholare aboue maister seruant aboue lorde againe axe boasteth selfe carpeter hevveth vvith ergo man maie accuse pope therefore youre doctours saithe iudicare de factis papae hoc aliqui dicunt esse tangere montem ponere o coelu iudge pope deedes somme menne saie touche holy mounte wherein god gaue lawe shewed selfe moses set face heauens pope selfe saithe sinne againste holy ghost whiche shal neuer forgeuen neither worlde worlde comme thus maie pope depose kinges prince trouble whole state worlde doo liste without controlmente yet maie man dare saie vnto sir vvhy doo ye therefore accuser pope symmachus saide presence king theodoricus papa iactat se vna cum docendi potestateennodius accepisse licentiam peccandi pope maketh boaste togeather power teachinge hathe receiued free libertie doo il pope marcellinus concil tomo marcellino whose name ye haue alleged councel sinuessa defence hereof apostata foresaken christe pope rome made sacrifice vnto diuels al notwithstandinge ye saie mortal man might accuse thus hath pope special prerogatiue premunire forsake christe committe open idolatrie geeue honour sacrifice vnto diuels without controlmente yet gala cyprian ad quirinum paule accused peter euen vnto face presence many cyprian saithe petrus se non vindicauit seu aliquid insolenter assumpsit vt diceret se primatum tenere obtemperari sibi nouellis posteris oportere peter thus checked openly paule neither reuenged selfe tooke thinge proudely vpon saie primacie others nouices nicephor li cap aftercommers paule ought obediente vnto mena bishop constantinople iudged excommunicated pope vigilius bishoppes easte churche iudged emperour receiueth povver pope excommunicated deposed pope iulius one youre doctoures saithe si papa committat crimen depositione dignum debet puniri ac si esset vnus rusticus pope committe offence fore shoulde iustly deposed ought pounished clowne countrie neighbour leodiumsozomenus li cap epistle againste pope paschalis write thus remoto romanae ambitionis typho cur de grauibus manifestis non reprehendantur corrigantur romani episcopifelinus repertorio dignitas qui reprehendi corrigi non vult pseudo est siue episcopus siue clericus settinge aparte pride romishe ambition crime beinge greate manifeste maie bishoppes rome bothe reproued concil tomo epist leodien contra paschalem pap nonlatin alphabet also corrected fleeth rebuke correction false man whether prieste bishop apologie cap diuision whiche ancient father euer saide kinges emperours christes wil commaundemente receiue authoritie handes hardinge vvhat answered heretothere maie finde nothinge proue nothinge maie gather alleaged bernard speaking bothe swordes b sarisburie euident recorde general consente al ancient writer pope hath neither possession foote landes house dwel name vniuersal bishop nicephor li cap chartar libertie iurisdictio hath receiued either french kinges emperours yet would beare world handecario bonif sabellicus phoca yt emperoure hath nothing neither landes honour power right swerd iurisdiction onely man doubte hereof bisides testimony antiquitie lette reade moste vaine childishe donation pope selfe hathe forged vnder name emperoure constantine ambrosi lucam li ca ambrose saithe si non vi esse obnoxius caesari noli habere quae sunt mundi si habes diuitias obnoxius e caesari thou wilte subiecte prince possesse thinges worlde thou worldly rich august iohannem citatur epist leodi n contra paschale concil tomo citatur ab illyrico inter testis veritatis pa arte thou subiecte vnto prince likewise augustine dice quid mihi regi quid tibi ergo possessioni per iura regum possessiones possidentur thou wilt saie haue doo prince haste thou doo landes possession holden pope righte right kinges prince charles frenche kinge neuewe charles greate wrote thus vnto pope adrian imperatores ius distinguendorum negotiorum episcopis sanctis iuxta diualia constituta permiserunt non autem episcoporum villici extiterunt emperoures commission vnder greate seales haue graunted vnto bishoppes authoritie heare cause selues neuer stewardes bailifes vnto bishoppes one owne late doctours saithe herueus de potest papae ca papa habet gladium ciuilem ex commissione permissione principis pope hathe temporal svverde ciuile iurisdiction commission sufferance prince therfore seemeth greate folie saie prince hath svverde iurisdiction onely commission pope youre owne barbarous glose saithe extra de maiorita obedt vnam sanctam gloss imperator temporalibus habet potestatem solo deo et imperium fuit antequam apostolatus esset emperoure temporal thinges hath authoritie pope god onely empiere apostle againe imperator non habet gladium papathe emperour receiueth povver pope sed imperium est solo deo emperoure hath swerde pope empiere onely god againe ex sola electione principum dico verum esse imperatorem antequam confirmetur papa saie emperoure righte perfite emperoure onely election prince dist cum ad verum gloss quae quaesitum yea confirmed pope shal neede moe witness youre ceremoniarie rome saithe thus hoc affirmamus ante carolum magnum neminem imperij romani coronam ex manu romani pontificis romae suscepisse thus saie emperoure charles greate space eight hundred yeeres christe man euer receiued crowne romaine empiere rome dist cum ad verum gloss ceremonia li section ca bernardus de considerat li handes bishop rome bernarde hereof thus writeth vnto pope esto vt alia quacun que ratione hoc tibi vendices non tamen apostolico iure nec illud tibi dare quod non habuit petrus potuit ye claime right somme meanes yet apostle right ye cannot claime neither coulde peter geeue right himselfe neuer badde emperoure ludouicus fourth saithe thus paralipomena vrspergen ludouico mea potestas non pendet papa sed deo immediate et vanum est quod dici solet papam non habere superiorem power hangeth pope immediatly god alone peeuishe vaine tale saie pope hath superioure iohannes maior saith iohan maior senten dist quae bonifacius octauus multum apparenter definiuit quod romanus pontifex est supra reges temporalibus quod tame oculatissimi theologi dicunt esse falsum pope bonifacius hath concluded greate shewe reason euen temporal cause pope aboue kinges maie tel vvisest diuines saie iohan de parisijs de potesta regia papali cap false tale iohannes de parisijs saithe temporalibus potestas saecularis maior est potestare spirituali nec quoadista est ei subiecta aliquo temporal cause temporal power greater spiritual power touchinge subiecte pointe herueus saithe si imperator habet potestatem suam immediate papa ergo imperator est minister papae emperoure receiue power immediately popeherueus de potesta papae ca emperoure pope seruante al authority notwithstandinge pope selfe saithe emperoure hath right authoritie onely touchinge laste obiection herueus ye emperoure pope seruant thinketh maie wel admitted without greate inconuenience thus saithe one priuie counseldist si imperator glos iste romanus imperator est procurator defensor romanae ecclesiae romaine emperoure nothinge el proctoure steward churche rome likewise saithe iohannes de parisijs dicunt quod solus papa est verus dominus temporaliumiohan de pari de potest regia papali ca ita vt possit auferre ab alio quod alias suum est tenet factum eius licet peccet sed praelati coeteri principe non sunt domini sed tutores procuratores dispensatores saie onely pope right lorde temporal possession maie put man fro owne although offende dooinge yet dooinge taketh place bishoppes prince lordes ouerseers bailifes stewardes therefore pope adrian namely thus auanced selfe aboue emperoure fredericus imperator per no imperat vnde haber imperium nisi nobisauentinus ecce potestate nostra est vt demus illud cui volumus propterea constituti sumus deo super gens regna vt destruamus euellamus aedificemus plantemus meane v emperoure emperour whence hath empiere v beholde hande bestowe empiere vpon whome liste ende placed god ouer nation kingdomes destroie plucke vp builde plante sutche proude vauntes pope maketh selfe without either shame worlde feare god apologie cap diuision whiche anciente learned fathersthe pope aboue emperoure precise mathematical limitation euer surueied determined seuentie seuen time greater mightiest kinges hardinge mery feloweclemes co aposto li cap nazianzen ad popul nazianzen de maiori obedien solitae othera pleasant mathematical diuinitie whiche thought might bolde speake mathematically kepte selfe within compasse without iuste reprehension spiritual power farre passeth temporal soule doth excelle body heauens surmounte earth clement saithe gregorie nazianzeneby reason euery simple poore parishe prieste seuentie seuen time greater emperoure shoulde greatly offended seuenty seuen time greater dignitie neede condemne heretike whiche woulde pleasaunt algorisme especially ioannes andreae place referring mater astronomer b sarisburie somme mery felovve vvarrante ye saie thus nowe mirthe nowe sadnesse ye haue longe time mockte worlde forced kinges emperours selauesiohan andreae clemens youre newe doctours iacke andrevve sir clement euermore cal apostle felovve weighe none otherwise worthy touching gregorie nazianzene true saith truthe might goddes worde infinitely passeth al wordly power maketh al pope walloweth onely temporalty worldly care wel preachinge goddes woorde ministring sacramentes also spiritual exercise farre inferioure meane prieste earth inferioure heauens howe maie appeare prety mirthe ye haue made herewith one youre owne felowes saithe thus herueus de potesta papae ca ecclesiastici debent iudicare per contemptibiles id est per laicos secundum tenorem debitum terreni iuris ecclesiastical officer bishoppes ought iudge vile contemptible saie laie magistrate according tenoure order temporal lavve mirthe pleasance comparison selues ye cal prince temporal magistrate vile contemptible againe herueus de potesta papae ca ye saie patet regnum siue regimen regale non esse acceptum deo sed ipsum solum permisit indignatus et magi esset acceptum deo quod per solum papam mundus omnibus regeretur plaine state kingedome kingely gouernement came god god onely suffered anger acceptable vnto god whole world al thinges gouerned pope alone good ye tel v whether ye speake onely mirthe game el earneste good sadnesse verily yee proudely compare pope sonne emperoure moone youre meaning moone hathe light onely sonne emperoure hathe authoritie onely receiueth pope isidorus glos genesim herueus de potesta papae ca notwithstandinge comparison isidorus youre owne doctour saithe yee sowly ouerseene thus writeth per solem intelligitur regnum per lunam intelligitur sacerdotium sonne meante kingely dignitie moone meante priesthoode therefore iacke andrevve youre mery man reckening maie caste youre coumptes backewarde saie emperoure folie al folie yet folie greate wordes countenance maie maineteined shameth bestowe woordes herein mutche saie case cleare doubte assure harding al innumerable louanian vanity concerning practise churche storie time one vanitie vainest leste man simplicitie ignoraunce shoulde deceiued vnderstanding mystery donation chartar iudgemet owne doctoursherueus de potestate papae cap meaninge thereof volunt aliqui quod ratione huius doni papa est imperator dominus mundi quod potest reges instituere destituere sicut imperator somme thinke force vertue donation pope emperoure lorde vvorlde hereby hath power bothe set vp also put downe kinges emperoure fable hereof peeuishe wiseste beste learned youre frendes platyna cardinal cusanus marsilius patauinus laurentius valla antoninus florentinus otho frisingensis hieronymus paulus catalanus volaterranus mullinaeus others haue openly reproued vnto worlde haue written againste mutche ashamed youre folie allege one steede many cardinal cusanus hereof hath written thus donationem constantini diligenter expendens reperi ex ipsamet scripture manifesta argumenta confictionis falsitatisconstantines donation aduisedly weighinge donation graunte constantinenicolaus cusanus de concordantia catholica lib cap ni cusa eodem loco whereby pope claimeth al temporal power euen penninge thereof finde manifeste token falsehed forgerie againe saithe sunt meo iudicio illa de constantino apocrypha sicut etiam fortassis quaedam alia longa magna scripta sanctis clementi anacleto papae ascripta ipsae enim epistolae applicatae ad tempus illorum sanctorum seipsas produnt iudgement chartars constatine forged perhaps also lo ge greate letter beare name clemente pope anacletus letter selues applied vnto time holy father betraie selues againe dist constantinus graunte constantine euen gratian pope owne register founde onely palea original allowed texte many olde bookes haue glose founde glose vpon noted thus palea ista non legitur scholis qua continetur priuilegiumglosa ode loco quod constantinus concessit romanae ecclesiae scilicet vt primatum inter omnes ecclesias obtineret patche read scholes wherin conteined priuilege constantinus emperour graunted churche rome saie saide churche haue soueraintie ouer al church pius dialog put mater oute doubte euen pope pius selfe thereof saithe thus dictum palea constantinus falsa est saide beginneth constantinus starke falsefelinus de maioritate obedien solitae colum whereunto felinus canoniste addeth woordes et inuehit contra miseros legistas qui laborant disputando valuerit id quod nunquam fuit pope pius rageth earnestly againste poore lavviers take sutche paine reason whether thinge maie good auailable lawe neuer made againe doctoures vita syluestri herueus de potesta papae ca woulde seeme moste frendely fauourably speake donation owne iudgemente doo quite condemne thus saie donatione illa audita est vox angelorum aere dicentium hodie venenum effusum est ecclesiam time confirminge passinge donation voice angelles hearde aire saieinge daie poison powred churche briefely touche somme parte contentes substance foolishe body forged simple knewe whether constantinople stoode aste rome northe whether byzance cittie countrie whether emperial diademe made silke goulde telleth tale patriarke constantinople oner buxom bishop rome yet time imagineth graunte made cittie constantinople builded sutche name yet knowen worlde yet marginal glose hereupon good substantial texte concil tomo pag texte saithe contradimus beato syluestro phrygium nostrum id est mitram wee deliuer vnto blessed syluester phrygium saie miter shal finde prety note margine notaphrygium quod phrygium factum est ex penni pauonum marke wel phrygium miter made pecockes taile doubte worthy gifte constantine donation shame shoulde ye bringe v one sely poore greeke witnesse whoes name yee neuer hearde testifie grauntes conueiances made rome youre pope finde neither councel doctour father writer likely recorde healpe greate case onely one poore raskal graecian knewe mater youre selues bewraiethe needinesse youre cause durste lewdely falsifie sutche graunte thereby intrude selfe possession empiere woulde blusshe falsifie somme beggerly witnesse auouche nowe yee woulde seeme saie foure patriarkes stoode euermore commaundemente bishop rome onely saide three patriarkes whiche neuer neither yeelded knewe sutche obedience also general practise worlde wil soone reproue nilus greke vvriter saithenilus de primatu romani pontificis nonlatin alphabet vt liquidi appareat papam non imperare alijs omnibus episcopis legatur sextus canon synodi nicenae quo diserte praecipitur vt alijs ecclesiis alexandrinus alijs romanus alijs antiochenus praesit vt non liceat alteri alterius prouinciam inuadere maie wel plainely appeare pope hathe povver gouernemente ouer al bishoppes reade sixthe canon nicene councel expressely commaunded bishop alexandria shal haue rule ouer certaine church bishop rome ouer certaine bishop antioche likewise ouer certaine shal laweful one inuade jurisdiction emperoure iustinian saithe ecclesia vrbis constantinopolitanae romae veteris praerogatiua laetaturcod de dignitatis praemia honorum iura title dignitie right honoure geeuen bishop rome bishop constantinople one equal likewise determined decree councel constantinople definimus sedi constantinopolitanae paria iuraconcil constant cap nonlatin alphabet priuilegia cum sede veteris romae wee decree see constantinople shal haue rightes priuileges equal see olde rome therefore saide gennadius togeather yea pope selfe case hathe rather offered obedience vnto bishoppes athanasius ad epi aphricanos epistola liberij ad athanasium thus writeth pope liberius vnto athanasius bishop alexandria quaeso vt huic confessioni subscribas vt ego securior efficiar tua mandata inhaesitanter obeam beseche thee subscribe confession maie doubte maie doo youre commaundementes vvithout grudginge yet nowe bishop rome mainteine title write right mutche foure principal patriarkes worlde haue forsaken appointeth foure ordinarie chaplens geeueth name foure patriarkes first constantinople seconde alexandria thirde antioche fourthe hierusalem thus hauing foure commaundemente pleasante fau e ruleth gouerneth whole worlde sutche solemne brauerie greate cham tartarie daie hath dined selfethe pope god soundeth trumpet geeueth al kinges emperours worlde leaue goe dinner imagination ioilitie continueth claime possession al worlde euen good right title doothe pope euer pope selfe owne personne openly solemnely saithe masse commaundeth gospel epistle bee readde greeke whereupon owne maister ceremony saithe thusceremonia li cap hanc consuetudinem hinc ortam puto vt appareat romanam ecclesiam se continere vtram que gentem hereof thinke custome firste proceeded hereby maie appeare churche rome conteineth bothe nation antoni summa par tit cap artic diui artic diui al notwithstading antoninus saithe hoc graeci non credunt al greekes beleue obiections iustinian councel sardica answeared former replie hardinge apologie cap diuision whiche anciente holy father euer called lorde god hardinge none wise speaketh absolutely neuerthelesse certaine sense sa vaine forgerie clement calleth euery bishop terrenum quendam deum certaine earthly god writtenthese vvordes spoken prince magistrate haue saide ye god c b sarisburie yee make pope absolute god ye thinke ye maie otherwise cal god safely without preiudice proper shifte mainteine vaine man ye possession godhed hierony daniel cap nonlatin alphabet suetonius domitiano suetonius pompon laetus athenaeus li chrysost de spi sancto august contra faustum li cap euse li ca sutche pleasant imaginatio antiochus sommetime king syria intituled selfe name god emperoure domitian vsed assigne proclamation dominus deus vester domitianus youre lorde god domitian emperoure caligula called selfe deum optimum maximum iouem latialem beste moste mighty god greate god iuppiter italie sapores great king persia called selfe fratrem solis lunae brother sonne moone peeuishe physician menecrates called selfe iuppiter nicostratus called selfe hercules nicagoras made selfe paire whinges would needes called god mercurius manichaeus heretique called selfe holy ghoste romaine olde time erected vp image honour simon magus sorcerer inscription posee simoni sancto deo honoure simon holy god youre handesome distinction hardinge god absolute god absolute see euery might wel safely haue maineteined title without blame certainely dist satis euidenter christopher marcel conc latera sess cardillus pro concil trident arrogante vanitie scarcely al euer comparable pope pope nicolas saithe constat summum pontificem pio principe constantino deum appellatum wel knowen pope godly prince constantine called god likewise pope wel content suffer one parasite saie vnto late councel laterane tu e alter deus terris thou arte god earthe likewise cardillus spaniard defence pope la e chapter trident oftentimes calleth pope late chapter tridente oftentimes calleth ye pope terrenu deum earthely god style right whereby holophernes sometime saide iudith nobuchodonosor est deus terrae nabuchodonosor god ye earth vpon pope owne clementine yee shal finde mater thus taken vp qualified greate indifferencie modestle thus specially noted marginethe pope neither god man lorde god pope papa nec deus est nec homo leaue like blasphemo fond stylesextrauag iohan cum inter glossa impress lugduni parisijs n thessalon gregor iob ca li ca anselmus thessalon like glose yee shal finde written thus credere dominum deum nostrum papam non potuisse statuere prout statuit haereticum censeretur beleeue lorde god pope might decree decreed mater heresie haue founde expresse plaine woordes euen pope owne authentical allowed booke lorde god pope thinges might seeme vncredible paule foretolde v man sinne sit temple god shewe selfe god gregorie writinge antichriste saithe thus cum sit damnatus homo nequaquam spiritus deum se esse mentitur whereas damned man spirite lieinge faineth selfe god anselmus saithe simulabit se religiosum vt sub specie decipiat pietatis imo se deum esse dicet se adorari faciet que regna coelorum promittet antichriste shal faine selfe holy yt maie deceiue menne vnder coloure holinesse yea shal cal selfe god shal cause selfe woorshipped shal promise ye kingdome heauen eusebius saith eusebius de praeparat li nonlatin alphabet hoc est argumentum eos odisse deum quod velint seipsos appellari deos token yt hate god yt wil haue selues called name god likewise saith ancient father irenaeus antichristus existens apostata latro quasi deus vult adorari cum sit seruus regem se vult praeconiari antichriste beinge renegate theefe yet wilbe woorshipped god beinge slaue yet wilbe proclaimed published kinge therefore although pope saie absolute god absolute christe yet without great inconueniece trowe maie wel absolute antichriste apologie cap diuision whiche anciente holy father euer saide mere natural man certaine substance made growen togeather god man hardinge bring facea fainte ercuse shall saie vnto warrant ster defender shal either reproued flattering proued vnderstade thena certaine diuine povver pope certaine diuine power aboue naturall state mena soare pounishemente open blasphemie warned circuspecte glosinge heretikes ready slaunder whole churche one priuate man affection b sacrisburie maie cal selfe lorde god maie easily claime selfe morein sexto de electione elect fundamenta glossa clemen prooe io glossa man ye pope owne decretalles noted thus margine papa est homo pope man glose vpon pope owne clementine allegeth woordes one allowed poetes papa stupor mundi pope woonder worlde againe nec deus e nec homo quasi neuter e inter vtrun que hou arte neither god man manner thou arte neither bothe rather meane bitweene bothe authoritie doctoure appeareth pope neither god man angel trowe creature ye maie make leaue consider apologie cap diuision whiche anciente father euer saide onely headspringe al lavves hardinge vvhsoeuer saithe speaketh without euident reason consideringe principall euery gouernement lawes belonginge deducted deriued b sarisburie haue ye brought v ful simple reason god knoweth haue brought v somme authoritie doctoure councel benne better apologie cap diuision whiche anciente father euer saide haue povver ouer purgatorie hardinge doubte vvere vvoorthy mater vvisely ye would firste beleue purgatorie shoulde ye vnderstande dispensation loosing bindinge committed vicare christeesai esaie saithe excepte ye beleue ye shal vnderstande consequent doctrine must needes obscure longe principall grounde thereof wickedly denied b sarisburie purgatorie fantasy wee haue sufficiently saide ye wishe wee woulde beleue purgatorie verily wee beleue constantly euer god hath willed v beleueroman paule saithe faithe commeth hearinge hearinge commeth vvoorde god thereby onely faithe directed folie mockery thei subiecte fansie faithe august de tempore sermon feria paschat august quaestiont veteris te quae augustine saith nemo de christo credat nisi quod de se credi voluit christus let man beleue christe christe hath commaunded beleeue christe againe saith constat fidem stultam non prodesse sed potius obesse certaine foolishe faithe doothe good rather burteth notwithstanding though al listes gaineful territory purgatorie fully graunted yet harde proue either scripture doctoure pope beareth greater authoritie swea commaunde pleasure simple priste al one allowed doctours saitheaugelus parisiensis purgatorium est peculium papae purgatorie peculiare possession pope apologie cap diuision whiche anciente father euer saide hable commaunde angel god ye liste selfe hardinge olde fathervntruthe manifeste shal appeare newe doctour euer shal tell beleue speaketh catholikely must make scruple suche matter b sarisburie laste hardinge shame yee faine yeelde doctoure ye saie euer thus saide neither olde nevve hereto ye haue laide special exception man haue saide saie ye euer spake catholikely yet againe ye tel v euer neuer scrupulous suche matter pope selfethe pope povver ouer angelles god father al father doctoure al doctours bothe newe olde haue blusshed saie maie wee saie saie pope selfe vvas catholique wee saie wil beleeue deede kinge xerxes greate kinge persia brought ouer huge armie graecia sente letter defiance vnto greate mounte athos herodotus macedonia commaunded stande stil st rre foote woorke pispleasure either selfe armie euen like authoritie good discretion pope hath vsed sende preceptes princely letter commaunde angel archangel al povvers heauen comme goe fetche carrie ready doo wil therefore better contente heare frendes tel thus tibi data est omnis potestas concil lateranen sub leo ne sess extra de constitutionib statuta canonum felin felinus eodem loco supra omues potestates tam coeli quam terrae qui totum dicit nihil excludit thee geeuen al maner power aboue al power wel heauen earthe saithe al excepteth nothinge felinus doctoure saith thus nedum circa coelestia terrestria infernalia papa gerit vicariatum christi sed etiam super angelos bonos malos pope hath christes lieutenantship onely ouer thinges heauen ouer thinges earthe ouer thinges hel also ouer angel bothe good badde innocentius pope selfe saithe vicario creatoris omnis creatura subiecta est vnto creatours lieutenante euery creature subiecte owne doctoure antoninusautonin sum par titu cap ante s archebishop florence saith potestas papae maior est omni alia potestate creata aliquo modo extedens se ad coelestia terrestria infernalia vt de ea verificari possit quod dictum est omnia subiecisti sub pedibus eius pope povver greater power god euer made sorte stretcheth selfe vnto thinges heauen thinges earth thinges hel povver woordes maie verified yt written prophete dauidagrippa de vanitate scientiarum thou haste made al thinges subiecte fecte camotensis saithe papa angelis praecipit potestatem habet mortuos pope commaundeth angel god hath power ouer deade gregorius haimburgensis saithe vt termiuis v ar suorum adulatorumgregor haimburgen appellatione sigismundi ducis austriae veselus agrippa de vanita scientia papa angelis habet imperare vse woordes platterers pope hath povver commaunde angelles therefore man happen die vpon ye waie passeth pilgremage rome pope clemente commaundeth angelles god hande carrie soule immediately heauen hereto al like hardinge saithe pope doctours father page parasite herein catholique notwithstandinge saithe pope fansie take sommewhat vpon sommetimes litle ouer bolde goddes angelles commaunde countremaunde pleasure sutche case ought ouer scrupulous apologie cap diuision whiche anciente father euer saide lorde lordes kinge kinges hardinge vseth cleane contrarie title callinge himselfe seruum seruorum dei seruante seruantes god yet largenesse iurisdiction haue number lordes kinges within foldein right good sense although himselfe dothe boast yet righte good sense title maie geuen b sarisburie notwithstandinge pope cal selfe kinge kinges pope kinge kinges lorde lordes extra de maiorit obedientia solitae dist si imperator glossa auentinus adriano notwithstading saie emperour far inferiour vnto moone inferioure vnto sonne notwithstandinge saie emperoure bailife stevvarde man notwithstandinge saie hath power set vp put downe kinges emperours pleasure yet saithe hardinge al maie spoken right good sense pope vseth cleane contrarie title calleth selfe seruum seruorum dei seruante goddes seruantes thus thinketh sufficient weighe matter onely title truthe al plaieinge vnder visarde diuel seldome theweth horne corinth rather changeth selfe angel lighte touching title pope calleth selfe seruante euen doothe emperoure likewise abase selfe name seruante ye doubt hereof reade owne glose vpon decretalles decretal grego prooemio glossa extra de preben dignitatib iohan execrabilis glossa herueus de potest papae ca woordes etiam imperator seipsum appellat seruum likewise againe glose saithe papa se seruum appellat imperator vocat se seruum vltimum ecclesiae pope calleth selfe seruante emperoure calleth selfe vilest seruante churche al nothinge el politique kinde dissimulation hypocris e seruantes praie whoe lordes herueus one owne doctours hereof saithe thus dicere quo talia dicum summi pontifex ex humilitate est omni perniciosum et hoc est ponere o coelum philosophus dicit hoc esse peccatum ironiae quod opponitur virtuti et addit tale humiles non esse virtuoso sed timidos blanditores et augustinus aitaugust de verbis apostoli cum humilitatis causa mentiris si era peccator antequam mentireris mentiendo peccator efficeris saie pope speake woordes humilitie hurteful set face heauens aristotle saithe nne dissimulation hypocrisie whiche contrarie vnto vertue saithe sutche humble menne vertuous feareful flatteringe augustine saithe euer thou speakest vntruthe vnder coloure humilitie thou sinner yet tellinge vntruthe thou arte made sinner good reader pul painted visarde vnder vaine title seruant seruantes thou shalt finde lorde lordes proufe hereof thus ye pope selfe saith neither emperoure kinge maie iudge popeepistola nicolat papae inter decreta adriant papae concil tomo purgatione sixti reason non est seruus supra dominum emperoure beinge seruante aboue pope lorde thus yee see humbly calleth selfe seruante seruantes ye touche anger wil suddainely change selfe kinge kinges lorde lordes woordes plainely expressely calleth emperoure seruante selfe lorde euer saide contrarie verily pope exposition muste needes authentical hardinges maketh emperoure holde stitope maketh emperoure leade bridle maketh emperoure kisse foote maketh emperoure lie downe grouelinge doct bonner praefa libel stephani gardineri de vera obedientia setteth foote necke yet stil calleth selfe seruante seruantes fewe good seruantes wilbe homely maisters doctoure bonner saithe thus notwithstandinde pope roueninge woulfe dressed sheepes clothinge yet calleth selfe seruante seruantes apologie cap diuision canne also goe like sorte one amongest whole numbre olde bishoppes father euer taught either saie priuate masse while people stared lifte vp sacramente ouer heade pointes consisteth nowe al religion el mangle christes sacramentes bereue people one parte contrarie christes institution plaine expresse woordes wee maie come ende one al father whiche hath taught distribute christes bloude holy martyr merites selle openly pardon al roomes lodginges purgatorie gaineful kinde marchandise hardinge obiections priuate masse liftinge vp blessed sacramente ministringe communion vnder one kinde common life beggar lie heretikes deede questios beggarly hereticall touching haue saidenote hardinge saide three article ansvveare ievvel hath publisshed threescoare nico greate vntruthes muche roy answeare iuell nearest frende chalenge rehearse againearticle needelesse maie seeke doctrine pardon iudge verily vnderstande oportunitie discusse full treatise requiringe longe processe maie wel time differredfol purgatorie haue saide deale matter wherein ignorant felow minister gladly shewe vile railinge scoffinge eloquence yet concerninge doctrine pardonsand al lesse nothinge least saie nothinge much haue thought good saie sacramente wel baptisme penaunce al bandes sinne loosed whole euerlastinge paine due sinne forgeuen baptisme temporall paine enioyned v christe moste freely bestoweth benefite death vpon v firste entrie churchea doctrine ful sondrie blasphemy afterwarde abuse mercie returninge againe filthy sinne christe would seconde thirde al reconciliation thence foorth due satisfaction dreadful angre whiche onely bloude sacrament penaunce due contrition confession deede vowe receiued able remoue satisfactio temporal paine mercifull iustice required bothe others beginninge andkinge dauid alleged proufe pardonnes namely kinge dauid reg whome confessinge faulte nathan saide lorde hath put way thy sinne thou shalte die beholde forgeuenesse mortal sinne euerlastinge paine due yet forgeuen withal transferred temporal satisfaction vvhat foloweth storie bicause dauid aduoutrie murther caused ennemies god blaspheme holy name childe borne wife vrias surely die came passe death sonne greuous punishment good father king dauid content praie faste lie groude afflicting selfe seuen day onely trie whether might exchaunge bie death sonne yet could obteine desire may certaine best frendes god sinning baptisme circuncision whiche olde lawe stode place thereof muste ordinary course sarisfie temporall affliction iuste iudgement merciful make redeemer farther grace founde waie satisfaction hath benne therefore iustly called thirde last parte penaunce vvhiche fulfilled life vndoubtedly shal straightly exacted worlde come fire purgatorie sinnes maye worlde forgeuen die deadly bondes themvntruthe auouched vpon christe see ansvveare sauiour hath geuen v vnderstandematth sayinge sinne holy ghost shal forgeuen neither worlde worlde come whereof appeareth somme sinnes may forgeuen worlde come vvell satisfaction may notwithstanding fulfilled one waie man beinge sacrament penauce iustly reconciled mystical body christe church wherein prophete saithe faithfull man made partaker al feare god keepe commaundementespsal haue bande peace suche vnitie spiriie communicated v al defect one may spirituall causesa folie passinge al folie supplied plenty others felowe membresgalat accordinge apostle saithea texte ful vvisely applied prooue pardonnes beare ye one others burden head whiche christe chiefe membre farre rest influence deriued throughout mysticall body euen death may well inwardely charitie outwardly another waie also applied v pardoninge temporal satisfactio sacrament penaunce lefte vnforgeuen authoritie christ gaue peter sayingmatth thee geue key kingedome heauen euer thou bindest earth shal bounde also heauen euer thouo fonde man christe saithe vvhat euer thou loosest earthe purgatorie loosest earth shall loosed also heauen lo euer peter looseth earth shall loosed sight god therefore pope succedeth peter iuste cause loose onely mortall sinne sacrament penaunce also bande temporall paine whiche remaineth yet due sinne vndoubted suche paine loosed sighte god cause loosinge must onely pope put authoritie builde destroy dispense lauishe reasonable change recompence substituted behalfe suche apperteineth honour god profite soules mainteininge warr fightinge infidel defence christendome recouery sepulchre christe succouringe widowes orphanes poore person buildinge mainteininge holy place visitinge prison martyr toumbes like deuout charitable deedes vvhiche while faithfull christian dothe obediently performe although otherwise thinge enioyned great may obteine remission also temporall satisfaction whiche left penaunce vnremitted kinde pardon paule gaue notorious sinner1 cor corinth father wife faulte separated churche god afflicted temporally fleashe corinthian informed paule earnest true repentance shewed owne fauour good willes towarde him2 cor apostle answeareth vvhome yee forgeue ought also forgeue also haue forgeuen haue forgeuen ought sake person christe haue forgeuen vvell assured apostle speaketh forgeuinge affliction partie reason deliuered defence holy church state deuillin cor hom chrysostome vpon place noteth pro solutione peccatorum payment sinnes might vexe wherein suche person beinge put penaunce vsed remaine certaine space moneths yeeres vntill penaunce done expired reconcilinge man yet hauing done due satisfaction ordinary time pardon vvhich apostle saithe dothe geue person christe hauinge auctoritie doo corinthian sake able holy praiers common sorowe whereof apostle speaketh make recompence whiche lacked behalfe owne satisfaction muche doo satisfie manand thus hardinge avvaked dreame desiringe fully resolued herein let resorte latine woorkes holy learned bishop rochester b sarisburie obiections ye saie pleasante homely comparison common v life vvith beggar yet remembrance neither priuate masse halfe communion euer touched whole apologie place liftinge vp shevvinge sacramente al ye shoulde haue weighed aduantages better hardinge ye thus bestowed lothesome quarrel thought deedethe pope pardones hardinge wil saie saie lovvsy beggerly poore simple stuffe ye shoulde hable mocke worde many fonde tale bothe felowes haue sent v ouer fonder tale tale pardonnes purgatory ye haue sente v none muste saie augustine sommetime saide iulianus pelagian heretique augustin contra iulianum lib cap necessitate compellitur talibus pannis indui duo tam magna etiam vestra superbia pride neuer greate euen poore neede beggerie faine couer selfe sutche soary clowtes beseche consider howe aduisedly reuerently ye vse goddes holy vvoorde2 regum matth thus saie nathan saide vnto dauid lorde hath put awaie thy sinne thou shalt die christe saithe sinne againste holy ghoste shal foregeuen neither worlde worlde comme marke saithe non habe remissionem aeternummarci galat matth sed reus erit aeterni delicti hath remission euer shalbe guilty euerlastinge sinne paule saithe beare ye one others burthen christe saithe peter thee wil geeue key kingedome heauen c paule said ye liued shameful inceste father wife corinth let sutche one geuen ouer satan scripture hereof ye ful discretely learnedly conclude thus ergo pope hath vvarrante sufficiente graunte pardonnes vvel deade quicke hardinge god mocked feare iudgementes abuse name woord vaine ful wel know neither dauid nathan christ paule pardomoungers saie greate countenance mutche doo saie nothinge let augustine briefely answeare al vanity thus saithe hoc quid est aliud nisi diligeter pro humana suspicione contendere augu de ciuit lib cap scripturas sanctas negligenter attendere thing el stoutely striue mannes fansie negligently consider goddes holy vvoorde prophete dauid vpon ye woulde seeme grounde folie answeareth thus narrauerunt mihi iniqui fabulationes sed non vt lex tua domine wicked haue tolde mee many foolishe tale psal lorde nothinge thy lawe augustine nowe aliue woulde saie saide predecessours vanitas vendens vanitatem vanitatem audituris vanis crediturisaugust li homili hom vanitie sellinge vanitie wil heare vanitie vaine wil beleue leo saithe hanc insipientiam cadunt qui cum ad cognoscendam veritatem aliquo impediuntur obscuroleo ad flauianum epist non ad propheticas vox non ad apostolicas literas nec ad euangelicas authoritates sed ad semetipsos recurrunt folie fal hindered darkenesse knowledge truthe goe voice prophetes writinges apostle authority gospelles onely haue recourse vnto selues somewhat saie particularely mater touching pardonnes owne doctoure syluester prierias maister pope palaice writeth thus indulgentiae authoritate scripturae non innotuere nobis sed authorirate ecclesiae romanaesyluester prierias contra luthe romanorum que pontificum quae maior est pardonnes knowen vnto v authoritie scripture authoritie churche ome pope whiche greater authoritie scripture therefore hardinge doctours iudgemente greate folie allege many scripture proufe pardonnes yee taught good sadnesse pardonnes neuer proued scripture benne mutche better haue alleged onely pope authoritie thatthe pope pardones syluester teacheth far passeth al authoritie scripture roffensis saithe roffensis contra lutcherum polydor de inuentorib lib cap ego respondeo non satis certo constare quo primum indulgentiae tradi coeperint apud priscos vel nulla vel certe quam rarissima fiebat mentio de purgatorio quam diu autem nulla esset cura de purgatorio nemo quaesiuit indulgentias nam ex illo pendet omnis indulgentiarum aestimatio si tollas purgatoriu quorsum indulgentijs opus erit coeperunt indulgentiae postquam ad purgatorij cruciatus aliquandiu trepidatum est thus answeare cannot wel appeare pardonnes first beganne emonge olde doctours father churche either talke al litle talke purgatorie longe purgatorie cared man sought pardonnes whole price pardonnes hangeth purgatorie take awaie purgatorie shal neede pardonnes pardonnes beganne folke alitle fraide paine purgatorie iohannes maior saithe iohan maior sent disi quaest de indulgentijs pauca dici possunt per certitudinem quia scriptura de illis expresse non loquitur nam quod ditur petro tibi dabo claues c certum est quod opor er intelligere illam
