authoritatem cum sale fatuae ergo superstitiosae sunt quaedam indulgentiae viginti millium annorum pardonnes little maie saide certainetie scripture expressely saith nothinge touchinge christe saith vnto peter vnto thee wil geeue key c muste vnderstande authoritie corne salte otherwise maie vnsauery therefore certaine pope pardonnes promise tvventie thousande yeeres foolishe superstitious schole doctoures selues woonte sommetime saie veselus inuentio indulgentiarum est pia frau dolus non malus quo populus officioso errore trahatur ad pietatem diuisinge pardonnes godly guile hurtelesse deceite intente deuoute kinde e oure people maie drawen godlinesse alphonsus de castro saithe alphons de castro li indulgentiae nulla re est quam minus aperte sacrae literae prodiderint de qua minus vetusti scriptores dixerint non est mentio vlla de indulgentijs nothing scripture haue lesse opened whereof olde learned father haue lesse written pardonnes pardonnes ye scripture doctoures mention shamelesse marchandise sale hereof many godly menne haue complained timoth petri ye haue turned godlinesse gaine peter saithe couetousnesse fained speache yee haue made martes markettes people one owne frendes saithe thus opus tripart coniunctum cum concil lateran lib cap multis breuibus continentur tot indulgentiae vt boni viri mirentur vnquam de conscientia papae vel alicuius boni viri potuisse illa procedere many theire bookes conteined many day yeeres pardonne good menne marueile thei coulde euer comme consente either pope god man conclude august epist iohan tracta wee wil saie augustine fratres iesum christum iustum habemus aduocatum apud patrem ipse est propitiatio pro peccatis nostris hoc qui tenuit haeresim non fecit hoc qui tenuit schisma non fecit vnde enim facta sunt schismata cum dicunt homines no iusti sumus no sanctificamus immundos no iustificamus impios no petimus no impetramus brethera wee haue iesus christe righteous aduocate father propitiation pardonne sinnes helde neuer made heresie helde neuer made schisme whereof doo schismes comme hereof comme menne saie pope saithe wee righteous wee doo make holy vnholy vvee doo iustifie wicked vvee doo praie doo obteine apologie cap diuision menne woonte speake mutche certaine secrete doctrine manifold sundrie readinges let therefore bringe foorth sommewhat thei maie appeare haue leaste readde doo knowe sommewhat haue often stoutely noised al corner wente al partes theire religion olde haue benne approued onely multitude also consente continual obseruation al nation time let therefore theire life theire antiquitie let make appeare eie thinges whereof thei make sutche doo haue taken long large encrease let declare al christia nation haue agreed consente theire religion nay nay turne theire backes haue said already flee theire owne decree haue cut abolished againe within ashorte space thinges whiche fewe yeeres selues established euermore foresooth continewe howe one truste father olde councelles woordes spoken god haue good lorde haue saie thinges whiche boaste haue thei haue antiquitie thei haue vniuersalitie haue consent neither al place al time though haue desire rather dissemble yet themselues ignorant hereof yea sommetime also thei let confesse openly cause saie ordinaunces olde councelles father sutche maie nowe altered sundrie diuers decree serue sundrie diuers time churche thus lurke vnder name churche beguile seely creature withe theire vaine glosinge merueiled either menne blinde thei see thei see patient lightly quietly beare hardinge mutche doo saie greate boste smal roste many wordes litle matter sense wordes deceiued resembleth iewels chalenging sprite like e resembleth sheepe vvhat bringe foorth saie notit good policie hath nothing shevve holde peace neither thinke wee necessary requeste shewe haue reade knowe bosting bragging shewes leaue require hath ben sufficiently declared wheres al thinges saide al time yet two lowde lie besides make wil bolde discouer decree late tridentine councel meane although yet al place moste exactely obserued yet repealed cut abolished againe saie trial hereof consider onely vvoordes roffensis maior alphonsus alleged former diuisio fowle lie saie selues acknowledge confesse openly faith doctrine whiche holde auncient vniuersal time place consente al vvhat el meane chalenge vnto v claime catholike faithe accustomed slender rhetorike proufes argumentes truthe faile vse figure impudent lieinge saie selues confesse true whiche impute vnto v vvhat euer saie place maie right retourne euer take c ought se yet synagog late beginninge like shortely haue endinge b sarisburie al woordes others moe vaine many one woord woorthe answearinge affiance hardinge frendes haue theire antiquitie maie appeare laste diuision apologie cap diuision whereas haue commaunded decree voide thinges nowe waxen olde haue loste theire grace perhaps haue prouided theire steede certaine better thinges profitable people common saieinge christe selfe apostle vvere aliue againe thei could neither better godly gouerne god churche presente gouerned haue put sommewhat theire steede deede chaffe steede vvheate hierem esai hieremie saith sutche thinges according esaies woordes god neuer required theire handes haue stopped vp saith al vaines cleare springing vvater haue digged vp people deceiuable puddlelike pit ful mire filth vvhiche neither haue hable holde pure vvater haue plucked awaie people holy communion vvoorde god whence al comforte shoulde bee taken true worshippinge god also right vse sacramentes praier haue geeuen v plaie withal meane salte water oile box spittle palmes bulles iubilees pardon cross sensinges endelesse rabble ceremony man might terme plautus prety game make sporte withal hardinge raile reuel while ye wil churche gouerned bybut pope vseth neither disciline christe himselfe apostle wee aliue againe worde saievntruthes vvithout either measure regarde shame doctrine belefe preached receiued catholike church neither shoulde altered coulde bettered taught selfe doubt accordinge promise hath sente holy ghoste enforme churche al truthemalach psal remember saide godo folie change god changed againe worde god remaineth euer beinge true euident haue sound weighty wheate whiche persecution tyraunces blasies heretikes contagion euil manner fiften hundred yeeres could either blowe floore lordes berne churche corrupt vve haue accordinge apostle counseldepositum tim kepte hath ben committed vnto v vve haue enioyed fountaine water life ye charge v soare haue plucked awaie people holy communion worde god true worshippinge god right vse sacramentes praier vvho euer taketh fiue awaie wherein chiefly standeth saluation samethe gospel mouthe antichrist vvere ye haue already done mutche v worlde maie take impudente liers would quietly beare greauous matter nowe ye haue tried selues false worde litle esteme railinge slaunder lastly concerninge praier hath ben ordeined holy forefathersvntruthe barbarous vnknovven pr iers time anciente lerned father vvere neuer knovven al ageschristes gouernement better pope directed sprite god maintenance encrease god honoure al fewe yeres instincte sathan promote kingedome ye haue vtterly abolished wicked violence brought people fromvntruthes ioined vvith open blasphemie deuotion carelesse idlenesse speaking god harte lippes spiritual dummesse praiers chapter holy thinkinge vnprofitable harkeninge ye abyde salte water oyle palme crosse incense c maruel deuil possesseth rideth owne wil driueth truthe christen religion al godlines vvere sprite coulde waie thinges agreeing sprite vntil ye geue place spirit god maie driue spiritie sathan looke heare better tidinges b sarisburie ye sommewhat angrie hardinge ye thus besturred selfe pitieth behalfe christe apostle yee saie neuer ruled churche better order nowe ruled pope cardinalles euen might haue saide turned house god caue theeues one frendes saithmatth latomus de vtra que specie iacobus andreae aduersus hosiu pag apostoloru temporibus rudis adhuc erat ecclesia time apostle churche yet rude barbarous order afterward reproued blasphemous speache answeared lewdly pleasance rudis indigesta que ue mole others saie christus coelo praesidet papa terris residet christe ruleth heauen pope earthe saithe dis sicomnes omnes sanctiones sedis apostolicae sic accipiendae sunt tanquam ipsius diuina voce petri firmatae al lawes apostolique see rome muste taken confirmed diuine voice peter selfe saith andreas barbatius siculus ad bessarionem polydor vergil de inuentorib lib cap ceremoniar li sect cap hierony prouerb sicut ostium regitur cardine ita ecclesia romana regitur consilio cardinalium doore ruled hooke churche rome ruled counsel cardinalles therefore pope selfe saithe thus vnto vos eritis senatores vrbis regum simile veri mundi cardines super quos militantis ostium ecclesiae voluendum regendum est ye shalbe senatours cittie like vnto kinges bookes stay worlde vpon doore churche militante muste turned ruled sutche hierome imagineth thus saie non est vir domo non est christus corporaliter ecclesia surgens enim mortuis ascendit coelum nobis que ministerium gubernandae ecclesiae suam videlicet domum reliquit husbande home saie christe nowe corporally churche beinge risen deade ascended heauen hath leafte vnto v gouernmente churche whole orderinge house true saie malach psal matth god one changed woorde endureth euer change god goddes woorde woorde life woorde woorde vanitie god father hath planted therefore shalbe plucked vp rootes god saithe prophete malachie lippes prieste shal keepe knowledge malach people shal require lawe mouthe angel lorde hostes vos autem recessistis de via c gonne backe vvaie haue offended many one lavve haue broken couenante leui saith lord hostes therefore haue made despised yee haue changed moste parte apostle doctrine al euer ordeined yee haue manner leafte nothinge standinge bernarde saithe owne churche rome readinge chapter planta pedis vsque ad verticem capitis non est sanitas vlla sole foote vnto crowne heade one whole place bernard conuersione pauli yet ye beare v strongely hande christe apostle neuer ruled churche better order nowe ruled pope cardinalles al reste emptie talke answeared sufficiently yet one pange eloquence maie wise leaue vntouched thus ye saie instincte satan ye haue brought people deuotion carelesse idlenesse speakinge god harte lippes spiritual doumbenesse praiers chapter holy thinking vnprofitable hearkeninge wel acquainted speache hardinge could thinke ye would vnaduisedly bestowe woordes doubte euen hereby shal soone appeare whether v hath wilfully broken apostle order refused godly example holy primitiue churche god yee telle v readinge scripture vnto people churche god spiritual doumbenesse thinge vnprofitable onely diuised selues saie instincte sathan neuer either knowen vsed catholique learned father yet aunciente father origen saithe origen iosua homil iudaicarum historiarum libri traditi sunt ab apostolis legendi ecclesijs bookes olde testament called story iewes deliuered apostle readde churchesdionylius eccle hierar cap nonlatin alphabet dionysius saithe deinde ordine habetur sacrorum librorum lectio warde folowe order lesson holy bookes iustinus martyr saithe die solis omnes qui oppidis vel agris morantur vnum locum conueniunt commentaria que apostolorum vel prophetarum scripta leguntur deinde qui praeest admone omnes horratur vt ea quae lecta sunt bona imitentur deinde surgimus omnes comprecamur vpon sondaie christian people dwel towne iustinus martyr apologia countrie meete togeather one place epistle apostle prophetes writinges pronounced vnto v afterward chiefe minister warneth exhorteth al reste wil folowe good thinges haue hearde readden donne wee rise vp al praie togeather cyprian saithe cyprian lib epist lector personat verba sublimia euangelium christi legit fratribus conspicitur cum gaudio fraternitatis auditur reader soundeth high heauenly woordes readeth gospel christe seene brother hearde ioie al brotherhoode father councel constantinople saie thus concil constantinopo actio tempore diptychorum cucurrit omnis multitudo cum magno silentio circum circa altare audiebant time readinge chapter al multitude people greate silence drewe runde anltare communion table gaue eare councel laodicea written thus concil laodice sabbatis euangelia cum alijs scripturis legi conuenit vpon ye sabboth daie conuenient ye gospelles scripture readde churche vnto people leo de resurrectione domini sermo leo saith solennitati sacratissimae lectionis subiungatur exhortatio sacerdotis solemne readinge moste holy lesson let folowe sermon exhortation prieste chrysostom acta homil chrysostome saithe sta minister communis minister alta voce clamat post illam vocem lector incipit prophetiam esaiae minister common minister standeth vp crieth lowde voice saieinge keepe silence geeue eare reader beginneth prophesie esaie ambrose saith ambros lib epist iohan non possum ego facere quicquam sicut audio iudico audistis lectum ego non accuso vos moses vos accusat audistis lectum christe saithe cannot doo thinge mee selfe heare iudge yee haue hearde readden accuse moses accuseth yee haue hearde readden augustine saithe readinge chapter audistis cum euangelium legeretur modo cum legeretur si intenti fuistis lectioni audistis audiuimus lectione quae lecta est fratres dilectissimiaug psal august homil hom august de tempore sermo ye hearde gospel readde ye hearde ere readde ye gaue eare readinge deerely beloued wee haue hearde lesson hath benne readde hereby thinke maie appeare readinge lesson chapter newe diusse churche god yet wil tel v hardinge al onely spiritual doumbenesse vnprofitable hearkeninge brought instincte sathan promote kingedome dare tel v muste wee beleeue verily isidor de eccles offic li ca isidorus saith lectio est non parua audientium aedificatio vnde oporter vt quando psallitur psallatur ab omnibus quando oratur oretur ab omnibus quando lectio legitur facto silentio aeque audiatur cunctis lesson church bringeth great profite hearer therefore singing let al singe togeather praier let al praie togeather vvhen lesson chapter readde let silence made let al heare togeather tertullian saith coimus ad literarum diuinarum commemorationemtertullian apologetico fidem sanctis vocibus pascimus spem erigimus fiduciam figimus comme togeather readinge holy scripture wee feede faithe heauenly voice wee raise vp affiance wee fosten hope againe saithe tertullian ad vxorem lib vbi fomenta fidei de scripturarum lectione feeding faithe commeth open pronouncinge readinge scripture origen saithe origen leuiticum homil non fuisset necessarium legi haec ecclesia nisi ex aedificatio aliqua audientibus praeberetur benne necessarie haue thinges readde churche onlesse thereof might growe somme profite hearer leo saith leo de passione domin serm sacram dominicae passionis historiam euangelica vt moris est narratione decursam ita omnium vestrum arbitror inhaesisse pectoribus vt vnicuique audientium ipsa lectio quaedam facta sit vitio thinke holy storie lordes passion whiche wee manner haue readde vnto fastened vnto al harte hearinge selfe vnto euery hearer kinde seeinge chrysostome saith manner euery sutche lesson chapter minister saie vnto people loude voice attendamus let v marke chrysost acta homil augustine saith epistolae apostolicae non tantum illis scriptae sunt qui tempore illoaugust contra cresconium li cap quo scribebantur audiebant sed etiam nobis non enim ob aliud ecclesia recitantur apostle epistle written onely hearde time written also v none pourpose readde openly churche therefore spiritual doumbenesse hardinge vnprofitable hearkeninge instincte vvoorke sathan augustine saithe vide formicam dei surgit quotidie currit ad ecclesiam dei orat audit lectionem aug psal hymnum cantat ruminat quod audit apud se cogitat recondit intus grana electa de area beholde goddes emote shee riseth daily shee renneth churche god shee praieth shee heareth lesson chapter shee fingeth psalme shee cheweth remembreth shee hathe hearde shee museth vpon within selfe within shee laieth vp cornes chosen floore church hardinge ful onely spiritual also corporal horrible doumbenesse al saide donne poor godly people knoweth nothinge augustine saithereadinge chapter si intellectum mentis remoueas nemo aedificatur audiendo quod non intelligit yee remoue vnderstandinge minde augu de genesi ad literam li cap man edified taketh profite hearinge cannot vnderstande chrysostome saithe perdiderunt audiendi laborem tempus nam qui non intelligit chrys matth homil quod audit perdit quod audit haue loste bothe theire laboure hearinge also time vnderstandeth heareth loseth thinge heareth therefore pope selfe pontifical geeueth special charge vnto readerin pontificali stude lectiones sacras distincte aperte proferre ad intelligentiam aedificationem fidelium endeuoure thee selfe pronounce holy lesson chapter distinctely plainely spiritual doumbenesse vnderstandinge profite faitheful touching praiers simple people maketh tongue vnknowen christe saithematth people honoureth theire lippes theire harte far mee apologie cap diuision thinges haue set al theire religion teachinge people god maie duely pacified spirites driuen awaie men conscience wel quieted hardinge vvhat shal saie al ye lie would saie manner sauing worshippes often vnshamefaste lieing hath quite taken awaie al opinion honestie al christes religion whiche professe consisteth thingesvntruthe hereby ye professe quiet mennes conscience reade ansvveare neither mennes conscience quieted certaine euil impure sprite driued awaie deede vvhich sundry aunciente recordes testimony woulde declare moste true wel yenough knowen daily experience whereas neither breade vvater crosse driueth awaie semeth ye worse coniured deuil himselfe many secte catholike prince haue founde stubborne could yet neuer ridde theire country coniuration fire b sarisburie yee saie yee ye neuer sought quiet mennes cosciences oile water palmes c therefore ye stande vp tipps toe familiare manner crie oute yee lie shorte trial hereof one example maie suffice steede many augustine steuchus augu steuchus librum numeror cap one special woorthy doctoures saithe thus aqua sale orationibus sanctificamus vt ad earum aspersum nostra deleatur delicta halowe vvater salte praiers sprinkelinge thereof sinnes maie foregeeuen sinnes foregeeuen holy vvater reade owne pontifical ye shal finde halowinge vvater asshes palmes candels c clause euermore ende vt sint nobis ad salutem animae corporis maie v saluation body soule whereas ende ye vaunte selfe crueltiein pontificali pleasantly make sporte bloude brethern take il answeare woordes salomon prouerb viscera impiorum crudelia bowelles wicked alwaies cruel therein hardinge standeth greateste puissance ye better armed fire svverde ye scripture doctoures wise man woulde greately feare force v wee maie answeare cyprian sommetime answeared heathen nobis ignominia non est pati fratribus quod passus est christuscyprian lib epist neque vobis gloria est facere quod fecit iudas shame v suffer brother violence christe suffered neither praise doo thinge iudas tertullian saith vnto fatherstertullian apologe ico crudelitas vestra gloria nostra est semen est sanguis christianorum crueltie glorie bloude christian seede gospel praie god al innocente bloude hath benne sheadde cause required handes daie wrathe declaration iuste iudgemente god rom apologie cap diuision lo oriente colour pretious sauours christian religion thinges dooth god looke vpon accepteth thankefully must come place honoured must put quite awaie institution christe apostle like time paste wicked kinge ieroboam taken people right seruing god brought woorship ye golden calues leste perchaunce thei might afterward change theire minde slippe awaie geatinge againe ierusalem temple god hee exhorted longe tale stedfast saieinge thus vnto israel calues thy goddes sorte commaunded god shoulde woorship shoulde wearisome troublous take vpon iourney farre yeerely goe vp ierusalem serue honoure god euen sorte menne made lawe god none effecte theire owne tradition fearinge people shoulde afterwarde open theire eies fal waie shoulde sommewhence el seeke surer meane theire saluation iesu howe often haue cried woorshippinge pleaseth god whiche hee straitely requireth v wherewith wil turned wrathe thinges conserued vnitie churche al sinnes cleansed conscience quieted departeth hath leafte vnto selfe hope euerlastinge saluation wearisome troublous saie people resorte christe apostle anciente father obserue continually theire wil commaundement ye maie see withdrawe people god weake elementes worlde leauen scribe phariseis tradition menne reason doubte christes commaundementes apostle remoued theire diuises might comme place iuste cause promise anciente longe allowed doctrine shoulde nowe abolished newe forme religion brought churche god hardinge shoulde haue becomme scoggin patche iolle harry pattenson vvil sommer haue tolde tale mutche better superintendentships ye woulde nedes haue plaied parte selues ben conuenient haue donne stage vnder vice cote booke set abrode worlde defence al newe englishe churche ye shal neuer make reasonoble man beleue scoffinge tale vve esteme litle railinge comparison spiteful woordes mutche deuilishe villany apologie cap diuision yet whatsoeuer menne crie stil nothing ought changed men mindes wel satisfied withal churche rome churche whiche cannot erre hath decreed thinges syluester prierias saith romishe churche squier rule truthe holy scripture hath receiued thence authoritie credite doctrine saith romaine churche infallible rule faithe vvhiche holy scripture taketh force indulgence pardonnes saithe made knovven v authoritie scripture knovven v authoritie romaine churche bishoppes rome vvhich greater scripture pigghius also letteth saie without licence romaine church ought beleue plaine scripture mutch like cannot speake pure cleane latine yet babble quickely readily litle somme sutche lawe latine serueth courte woulde needes holde al others ought also speake waie mammetrectus catholicon spake many yeeres agoe whiche themselues doo yet vse pleadinge courte maie vnderstoode sufficiently said mennes desire maie satisfied fondenesse nowe later ende trouble worlde newe kinde speakinge cal againe olde finenesse eloquence cicero caesar vsed theire day latine tongue mutche menne beholden folie darkenesse former timesc plinius many thinges one writeth estimation oftentimes bicause thei haue benne dedicate temple heathen goddes euen wee see daie many thinges allowed highly sette menne bicause iudge mutche woorthe onely bicause haue benne receiued custome sorte dedicate temple god hardinge ye haue neuer donne churche rome cannot blame long standeth without ye repente tourneso vvas christe taken phariseies ye shal neuer taken sutche ye schismatikes heretikes ala poore soules thinke ye ouerthrowe churche builded vpon rocke fundation churche god peter christe peter againste whiche hitherto neither tyrauntes heretikes farre passinge lerninge honestie common lifethe churche aboue goddes vvoord coulde euer preuaile trowe ye extinguishe faithe romaine churchevntruthe fo generally contrarie faithe whiche faithe peterluc christe praied neuer faile ye laboure vaine vvel may sathan winne churche whiche lorde praied shal neuer winne geue ouer therefore vaine wicked attemptes trust patch falsely ye allege canonistes gloses scholemen riminge poetes heretikes euer neuer bad ignorant person maye ye deceiue whose sinnes deserue vvhat syluester prierlat saieth minde discusseit easil founde booke lutherum neither saithe alleage haue thought good tel v lest perusinge place shoulde take lie haue almoste al allegation like sinceritie use alleaginge pighius vve binde selues neither wordes syluester pighius erre v let beare theire owne burthen tel truth beleue truthes sake otherwise leaue parte carpe syluester prierias saide pointes belefe doctrine romaine churche squire trie theire truthe samea comm rie biside texte beinge wel vnderstanded right true likewise pighius saie romaine churche sheweth vnto v approued vndoubted scripture whiche true selfe suppose wil yelde thereunto scripture receiued churche rome authoritie credite forcea proper glose meaninge exclude god lie syluesters sentence relation made v ought geue credite vnto itvanitie vanity scripture vvere knovven beleued vvas churche rome onlesse ben shewed holy scripture romaine church whiche true churche christe sense syluester el euer saithe true saieinge agreable augustinecontra epist fundamenti ca ego euangelio non crederem nisi catholicae ecclesiae commueret authoritas woulde beleue gospel except auctoritie catholike churche moued alleage touchinge indulgence truthe ful whole knowledge plainely opened vnto v expresse euident wordes scripture mysterie blessed trinitie baptizinge infantes many truthes rather doctrine romaine churche vvhere tel v pighius letteth saie without licence romishe churche word please selfe wel ought beleue plaine scripture harde mater finde reade ansvveare wil proclaime lyer vntil shewe v spake farre beside reason lerninge holy churche doth wil v staie belefe scripture vntil haue licence al way meanes inuiteth stirreth v beleue truthe scripture vttered b sarisburie greatest weight hereof vpon twoo doctoures syluester prierias albertus pigghius whoes credite notwithstandinge yee woulde faine otherwise saue vpright yet seemeth ye contente shame geeue ouer vve binde selues yee saie neither woordes syluester pigghius erre v shorte blunte answeare notwithstandinge seeme like wel yet perhaps prierias pigghius woulde like see greate cause contrarie either might wel renounce authoritie saie wee bounde neither hardinges woordes felowes yee doubte truthe allegation reade syluester prierias maister pope palace booke entituled syluester prierias contra lutherum contra praesumptuosas martini lutheri conclusiones de potestate papae wordes emongest others quicu que innititur doctrinae romanae ecclesiae ac romani polificis tanquam regulae dei infallibili qua etiam sacrum scriptura robur trahit authoritatem haereticus est euer leaneth doctrine romaine churche bishop rome vnto infallible rule god vvhiche doctrine holy scripture taketh force authoritie heretique againe saithe churche aboue goddes vvoord authoritas romanae ecclesiae romani que pontificis maior est c authoritie romaine churche bishop rome greater authoritie goddes woorde alleged pigghius sounde sense greatest parte common place de ecclesia whoes iudgemente herein caluine writeth thusalb pigghius locis communib de ecclesia pighius ait nullius scripturae authoritate quantum libet clarae nostro quidem iudicio euidentis aduersus claram consonantem que orthodoxorum patrum setentiam aduersus communem ecclesiae definitionem aliquid credere cuiquam licere pighius saithe noman maie lawfully beleeue thinge authoritie scripture iudgement neuer plaine euidente againste cleare agreeable iudgemente catholique father againste common determination churche whiche meaneth onely churche rome therefore hardinge maie please nowe litle spare voice staie proclamation mutche yee seeme litle esteeme twoo doctoures prierias pigghius beinge otherwise longe sithence chiefe leader captaines al bandes ye maie therefore ioine others better theire credite encrease companie mutche wee speake churche rome let v heare iudgement cardinal churche rome notwithstandinge otherwise alleged cardinal cusanus therefore hereof saithe thus nicol cusanus de authoritate ecclesiae co cilij supra contra scriptur haec est omnium sane intelligentium sententia qui scripturarum authoritatem intellectum ecclesiae approbatione fundant non e conuerso ecclesiae fundamentum scripturarum authoritate locant nulla sunt christi praecepta nisi quae per ecclesiam pro talibus accepta sunt sequuntur igitur scripturae ecclesia non e conuerso iudgemente al thinke rightly founde authoritie vnderstandinge scripture allowance churche contrariewise laie fundation churche authoritie scripture commaundementes christe sutch onely taken holden churche therefore scripture folovve churche contrarievvile churche folovveth scripturesiohan maria verractus editus est ann alb pigghius hierar li alb pigghius controuersijs de ecclesia likewise saithe iohannes maria verractus humiliter confitemur ecclesiae authoritatem esse supra euangelium doo humbly confesse authoritie churche aboue authoritie gospel likewise albertus pigghius saithe apostoli quaedam scripserunt non vt scripta illa praeessent fidei religioni nostrae sed potius vt subessent scripturae sunt muti iudices scripturae sunt veluti cereus na u apostle haue written certaine thinges theire saide writinges shoulde rule faithe religion rather vnder ruled faith scripture doumbe iudges scripture like nose vvaxe theise like vnreuerente godlesse speaches seeke leade poore simple deceiued people holy scripture voice god authoritie theire churche whiche churche vnderstande onely pope cardinalles yee saie priestes house leui pope iudge timedeuter cap heruaeus de potesta papae ca place lorde hath chosen somme others sale papa est tota ecclesia virtualiter pope power vertue whole churche euer shal happen saie wee maie swarue theire iudgemente neither right hand lefte hand whereupon hebrevve glose noteth thus nicol lyra deuter cap si dixerint tibi quod dextra sit sinistra aut quod sinistra sit dextra talis sententia tenenda est although tel thee thy right hande thy lefte hande thy lefte hande thy right hande yet sutche sentence muste holden good augustine churche aboue goddes vvoorde ye saie holdeth harde side saithe non crederem euangelio nisi ecclesiae catholicae authoritas commoueret woulde beleue gospel excepte authoritie catholique churche moued fewe poore woordes haue benne tossed parte wroonge pressed vttermosteaugustin contra epistolam fundamen cap yeelde neuer hereby yee would faine proue authoritie churche whereby yee euermore vnderstande churche rome none aboue authoritie goddes vvoorde saie creature aboue creatoure made heauen earthe augustine saithe beleue gospel bicause churche haue likewise saide beleue churche bicause gospel trowe yee muste turne tale saie gospel aboue churche woordes plaine august psalmum ex ore veritatis ecclesiam agnosco participem veritatis mouthe god truthe knowe churche partetaker trutheaugustin de vnitate ecclesiae ca againe saithe nolo humanis documentis sed diuinis oraculis ecclesiam sanctam demonstrari ecclesiam quaerere debemus verbis christi qui est veritas optim e nouit corpus suum ecclesiam sine vlla ambiguitate sanctum scriptura demonstrataugustin contra cresconi grammat li ca scripturis sanctis ecclesia manifeste cognoscitur ecclesiam sicut ipsum caput scripturis sanctis canonicis debemus agnoscere woulde churche shoulde shewed decree menne augustin de vnita ecclesiae ca heauenly oracle vvordes god vvee muste seeke churche vvoordes christe whiche truthe beste knoweth owne body holy scripture sheweth v churche without doubtinge holy scripture churche plainely knowen augustin eodem loco vvee muste knowe churche holy canonical scripture know christe heade likewise saithe chrysostomechrysostom matth hom nullo modo cognoscitur quae sit vera ecclesia nisi tantummodo per scripturas way knowen whiche true churche christe onely scripture thus mutche wee knowe bothe christe churche churche christe one geeuinge euidence reckeninge hardinge shiftinge turnes wee muste sometimes place christe aboue churche sommetimes churche aboue christe augustine minde commence action bitwene christe churche comparison theire dignity trial keepinge boundes teache v truthe god taketh authoritie churche onely shewe v churche witnesse goddes truthe certainely hath greate weight persuasion moue conscience man see many kingedomes country ioine togeather profession obedience one truthe doubte euen daie many thousandes sooner leadde humble selues vnto gospel christe see whole worlde saie whole churche god contented willingly humbly embrace dauid testifie truthe psalm roman psalm certainetie gospel saithe thus sounde apostle wente oute al barthe vvoordes endes al vvorlde turninge right hande god therefore augustine saithe vnto faustus heretique augustin contra faustum lib cur non potius euangelicae authoritati tam fundatae tam stabilitae tanta gloria diffamarae atque ab apostolorum temporibus cap vsque ad nostra tempora per successiones certissimas commendatae te non subdis vvhy doest thou rather submitte thee selfe vnto authoritie gospel beinge grounded stablished preached published greate glorie commended deliuered vnto v certaine succession time arostles vntil time likewise place alleged augustine saithe churche aboue goddes vvoor de ego non crederem euangelio nisi catholicae ecclesiae comoueret authoritas quibus ergo obtemperaui dicentibus credite euangelio cur eis non obtemperem dicentibus noli credere manichaeo woulde beleue gospel onlesse authoritie catholique churche moued meaugustin contra epist fundam ca seeinge therefore haue obeied saieinge beleeue gospel also obeie saieinge vnto beleeue manichee thus consente churche heareth witnesse gospel without whiche witnesse notwithstanding gospel neuerthelesse gospel stil therefore chrysostome saithe chrysostom matth hom si dixerint ipsis veris ecclesijs christum apparuisse nolite eis credere dicentibus ista deme quia non est digna diuinitatis meae notitia haec shal tel christe hath appeared yea euen true church yet beleue saieinge thus mee meete knowledge godhedde conclude hardinge wee wil saie augustine sommetime saide donatian heretiques auancinge onely churche aphrica euen nowe auance onely churche romeaugust de vnitate ecclesiae ca no post vocem pastoris nostri per os prophetarum per o proprium per os euangelistarum nobis aperrissime declaratam vox vestras non admittimus non credimus non accipimus voice shepehearde vttered moste plainely vnto v mouthes prophetes owne mouthe mouthes euangelistes ye bringe v owne voice wee allowe wee beleeue wee receiue apologie cap diuision churche saie thei cannot erre speake thinke lacedaemonians longe sithence vsed saie possible finde adulterer al common healthe whereas deede rather al adulterer certaintie marriage wiues common amongest al canonistes daie theire belly sake vse saie pope summa angelica dictione papa mutch lorde al benefice though selle monie bishoprikes monastery priesthoode spiritual promotionstheodoricus de schismate parte nothinge freely yet bicause counteth al owne cannot committe simonie though vvould neuer faine strongly agreably reason thing spoken wee yet hable perceiue excepte perchaunce menne haue plucked whinges truthe romaine olde time proineplutarchus pinion goddesse victorie gotten home ende whinges shoulde neuer able flee awaie againe hardinge towarde ende apologie syr defender euer pieced togeather doo trifle like stuffe spence litle saie haue saide already vvherefore craue pardon reader accordinge slendernesse matter obiected mythis good plaine dealinge deede ansvveare sclender confutation seeme also slender sir doo patche peeces togeather whiche haue gathered note bookes infar ed canonistes scoolemen greatest estimation al humanitie bookes wherein pretely seene seemeth chiefe profession diuinitie appeareth greate knowledge vvhat ye rehearse lacedemonians perteineth owne company lesse meane onely apostate monkes frier priestes nonnes finde greate faulte canonistes daie name margent summa angelica author whereof died many yeeres paste theodoricus euer canoniste offende belly sake speakinge pope sette teeth anedge pertaineth v defende catholike faithe saieinges euery canoniste beste seeinge make muche adoo article errours either write railinge booke yevvith hardinges good instruction easely doo sende one best learned superintendentes bononia open scoole disputation confute doubtlesse ye shal either conuerte whiche woorthy acte proue selues fooles whiche greate pitie answeare obiection saie firste alleage summa angelica falsely nothing founde soundinge burthen pope withall place quoted dict papa nexte whereas written summa angelica curia romana titulus de simonia non habet locum dict simonia syr defender either knowinge folowed malice abusinge place haue reported precisely saide without distinction vvhereas deede selfe summe vseth distinction saieingever vtrum actoritas verum est ijs quae sunt simoniaca de iure positiuo solum sed non ijs quae sunt simoniaca de iure diuino vvhereby meaneth pope vnder rule simonie concerningea vvoorthy distinction hereby pope maie selle bishoprikes benefice vvithout simonie suche lawes paine himselfe predecessours haue made behalfe haue made many thinges belonginge thereto may well knowe selfe pretely seene canon lawe may appeare often cunninge allegation whiche bringe gloses concerningethis kinde simonie standeth onely sellinge order sacramentes c simonie whiche properly called pope nolesse subiecte thereto true iudgement summa angelica vntruthe shamelesse shal appeare whiche haue shamefully belied man iest god blessed truthe alwaies remaininge holy churche prophanely resemble birde proined pinyoned flie waie though churche kepte truthe suche policie olde romaine fained haue kepte goddesse victorie vvell syr tell sadnesse assured truthe churche shall neuer departe thence ye call cuttinge away winges neuer flie churche wee graunte cut suche sorte shee shall keepe churche euer owne neast knowe telleth v euen god selfe saieinge prophete esaye christe churcheesai make couenaunt saithe lorde spirite whiche thee woordes whiche haue put thy moutheful discretely vvel applied vvoordes benne meante pope successours shall departe thy mouthe mouthe thy seede mouthe thy seedes seede saithe lorde time foorthe euermore againste truthe euer ye bringe reproufe pope liues withstandinge moste impudently ye belie vndiscrete saieinges flateries euer ye burthen canonistes tourneth nothinge truthe remaineth vnshaken spirite lieinge scoffinge malice thereby discyfred b sarisburie yee saie sir defender pretily seene humanitie yee saie seemeth chiefe profession verily hardinge wee wel pleased take sutche mutche learninge maie spare v wee contende onely truthe learninge euer learninge maie please god vse glorie shalbe sufficiente neuer litle somme good likinge owne learninge yee woulde vpon simple occasion haue vpbraided others touchinge pope cannot commit simonie sundrie doctours haue saide pope cannot commit simonie firste shalbe necessarie behalfe consider state practise churche rome bernarde writinge vnto pope eugenius saith limen apostolorum ambitio iam plum teritbernardus de consideratione li quam deuotio vocibus ambitionis vestrum toto die resultat palatium ambitio ecclesia per te regnare molitur apostle entry gate rome nowe worne ambition deuotion al daie longe palaice ringeth sounde ambition thy meanes ambition seeketh reigne churche god againe saith bernardus conuersione pauli sermo de ciuitate dei li cap viues sacri gradus dati sunt occasionem turpis lucri quaestu aestimant pietatem holy degree ecclesiastical roumes geeuen ouer occasion filthy gaine gaine coumpte holinesse ludouicus viues saith romae cum omnia prope vendantur emantur nihil tamen aga sine lege ac formula que euam sanctissimi iuris rome withstandinge al thinges boughte solde yet maie yee doo nothinge without fourme order holy religion owne glose saithe sexto de electione elect potest fundamenta glossa rom est caput auaritiae ideo omnia ibi venduntur rome heade couetousnesse therefore al thinges boughte solde also iohannes andreae greate canoniste noteth verse alludinge name rome rom manus rodit quos rodere non valet odit durandus saithe durandus de modo celebrandi concil ti simonie reigneth churche rome though deede vvere sinne shorte twoo veries commonly spreadde pope alexander vendit alexander claues altaria christum vendere iure potest emerat ipse priusmusculus iohan cap pope alexander maketh sale key aultares christe selfe vvel maie lesse thinges selfe paied wel notwithstanding ye doubte al prety soary distinction maie soone excused thus yee saie verum est ijs quae sunt simoniaca de lure posiiuo solum summa angeli simonia sed non ijs quae sunt simoniaca de lure diuino whereby ye saie authoure meaneth pope vnder rule simonie concerninge sutche lawes paine selfe predecessoures haue made prouided behalfe therefore modeste manner yee saie wee haue falsely alleged shamefully belied summa angelica doo better open seueral partes distinction doo ye better tea v vnderstande simonie lavve positiue simonie lavve god doo yee declare eche parte plaine example seeinge thus steale awaie darke wee haue somme cause doubte dealinge make matter plaine owne glose saith thus simoniaca desui naturaextra de officio iudicis delegati ex parte n clossa sunt quae nouo aut vereri testamento prohibita sunt vt emere vel vendere sacramenta simoniaca de iure positiuo sunt quae solum sunt spiritualia ex constitutione ecclesiae vt sunt tituli beneficiorum ecclesiasticorum c thinges simoniacal ovvne nature forebidden olde newe testamente buie selle sacramentes thinges simoniacal lavve positiue whiche spiritual onely ordinance churche sutche title al ecclesiastical benefice dignity ac bishoprikes deanries abbies archedeaconries c thus hardinge pope selle sacramentes whiche wil yeelde litle monie maie charged simoniethe pope cannot commit simonie selle bishoprikes deanries abbies archedeaconries prebendes personage neuer many yet shifte prety distinction noman maie charge al thinges spiritual onely pope ovvne positiue lavve saie ordinance churche thinke good distinction wel woorthe findinge oute one owne companie speakinge hereof saithe thus petreaureum speculum quantam animarum multitudinem cateruatim transmisit transmittit ad infernum haec superstitialis damnanda distinctio multis est occasio viam aperit ruinam damnationis aeternae peter peter howe many soules hath superstitious damnable distinction sente heapes yet doothe dayly sende hel occasion vnto many openeth waie vnto fal euerlastinge damnation make mater plaine ff de offi praeroris l barbarius colum baldus saithe simonia non cadit papam recipientem though pope take monie yet simonie touche like sorte saithe felowe bartolus papa non dicitur facere simoniam conferendo beneficiaff eod titulo ead l bartolus dignitates accepta pecunia pope saide commit simonie although take monie benefice dignity churche theodoricus saithe papa non potest committere simoniam sic tenent iuristaetheodoricus de schismate inter vrban clement lib ca quia simonia excusatur per authoritatem eius pope cannot commit simonie holde canonistes simonie authoritie excused felinus saithe ista glosa videtur dicere quod papa non committit simoniam recipiendo pecuniam pro collatione beneficiorum ex quo non ligatur proprijs constitutionibus tamen moderni tenent indistincte quod papa non inuoluatur crimine simoniaefelinus de officio iudicis delegati ex parte n et ita ego teneo et sic est seruanda communis opinio ergo papa potest dictam prohibitionem simoniae firmatam vniuersali ecclesia limitare respectu apostolicae sedis et si diceres requiritur talibus apparens causa dico hic esse causam apparentem nam cessante talus redditu qui maximus est attenta hodierna tyrannide sedes apostolica contemneretur glose seemeth saie pope committeth simonie receiuinge monie bestowinge benefice mutche pope bounde owne constitution yet nowe adaies lawiers holde without sutche distinctio lavve positiue lavve god pope cannot wise comme within daunger simonie mee selfe doo holde comon opinion must holden iuste reasonable cause wherefore pope maie selle bishoprikes deanries abbies c extra de simonia ca numero fol abb archidiacon tract de haeresi ver et quia tanta est therefore notwithstandinge lawe yt forebiddeth simonie take place whole vniuersal churche yet respecte apostolique see rome maie restrained thou wilte saie sutch case ought apparente cause telle cause apparente reuene simonie whiche greate beinge cutte consideringe tyrannie nowe apostolique see woulde despised authoritie appeareth pope able mainteine estate countenance saue al thinges vpright without simonie panormitane saithe etsi papa accipiat pecuniam pro collatione alicuius praelaturae aut beneficij tamen dominus cardinalis ait non committitur simonia notwithstandinge pope take monie bestoweinge bishoprike benefice yet lorde cardinal saithe committed simonie archidiaconus florentinus saithe papa recipiendo pecuniam non praesumitur animo vendendi recipere sed vt illa pecunia ad vsum suum conuertatur cum papa sit dominus rerum temporalium per illud dictum petri dabo tibi omnia regna mundithe diuels vvoordes alleged vnder name peter pope receiuing monie bishoprikes benefice thought take waie sale onely turne monie owne vse pope lorde al vvorldly goodes appeareth woordes peter whiche woo de notwithstandinge peter neuer spake spoken sathan vnto thee wil geeue al kingedomes vvorlde pope cannot commit simonie againe felinus saith quod datur papae datur sacrario petri nec est proprium papae sed prodest danti tanquam facienti opus pijssimum euer geeuen popefelinus de offi iudicus delega ex parte n bishoprike benefce waie simonie geeuen peter treasurie neither pope owne seueral goodes auaileable geeuer vnto one doothe moste godly deede sutche special grace hath pope moste diuelishe vice pope changeth vice vertue hable make moste godly vertue hostiensis saithe papa potest vendere titulum ecclesiasticum vt episcopatum abbatiam c pope maie selle ecclesiastical title dignitie bishoprike abbie without danger simonie butextra de simonia ca hostien speake wee pope cardinalles selues fauourable construction godly order likewise priuileged committe simonie safely freely without blame panormitane saith cardinalis pro palafreno nobili viro recepto extra de simnia eisi questiones non praesumitur committere simoniam cardinal receiuinge palfraie noble man benefice bishoprike thought commit simonie thus whereas christe draue buiers seller churche proper distinction haue receiued buiers seller thruste oute christehieronymus hierome saithe per nummularios significantur beneficij ecclesiastici venditores qui domum dei faciunt speluncam latronum exchanger signified seller ecclesiastical benefice whiche make house god denne theeues quaest eos qui owne decree written hus tolerabilior est macedonij haeresis qui asserit spiritum sanctum esse seruum patris filij nam isti faciunt spiritum sanctum seruum suum heresie macedonius saide holy ghoste seruante sclaue father sonne tolerable heresie simonistes menne make holy ghoste owne seruante yet yee saie yee wel assured truthe churche rome shal neuer departe thence notwithstandinge disorder faulte whatsoeuer committed proufe thereof yee allege yee saie woordes god selfe prophete esaie esaie al whole prophete one woorde expressely mentioned churche rome sutche fantasie appeareth sommetimes heretiques called manichee thus thei saideaugustin de natura boni ca principibus gentis tenebrarum lumen ne ab ijs aufugeret tenebatur prince nation darkenesse helde faste light leaste shoulde flee euen doothe pope cardinalles holde truthe prince power darkenesse helde lighte harde dealinge binde christe recognisance departe pope yee rather haue bounde pope departe christe hierome saithe hieronym michaeam ca prophetae hierusalem non habent ore prophetiam et domino requiescunt dicunt non venient super no mala quorum causa speculatoriu dei hostili aratro diuiditur et locus quondam pacis ruinis plenus fit templum domini vepres spinas que conuertitur est habitaculum bestiarum prophetes hierusalem haue neuer woorde prophesie mouthes yet reaste selues vpon lorde saie shal euil comme vpon v thene sake watche tower lorde turned vp enimies pleughe place peace ful ruine temple lorde turned breeres thornes becomme stable wilde beastes apologie cap diuision ieremie telle afore rehearsed lie prophete saie place selfe mennehieremi whoe ought keeper vineyarde haue brought nought destroied lordes vineyarde howe christe saie persones whoe chiefely ought haue care ouer temple matthae haue made lordes temple denne theeues b sarisburie come whatiffes whiche commonly vse rhetorike faileth vvee tell plainely without iffes thatlearnedly proued ieremie meante suche calleth whole newe fangled doctrine verba mendacij woordes lieinge earnestly geuinge warninge menne geue credite rebuke perteineth also vvhen euer suche theeues churche god yee apologie cap diuision churche rome cannot erre muste needes folowe good lucke thereof farre greater al mennes policie sutche life doctrine diligence al churche maie onely erre also vtterly spoiled perish doubte churche maie erre whiche hath departed goddes vvoorde christes commaundementes apostle ordinaunces primitiue church example olde father councelles order owne decree whiche wil bounde within compasse none neither olde newe owne folkes mannes lawe goddes lawe al question romishe churche hath onely power erre also hathe shamefully moste wickedly erred deede hardinge man would haue thought woulde haue brought substantiall argumente whereby prooue churche erreth neither make excuse speake romaine churchethe churche rome vvhole catholique churche accompte wee make difference betwene romaine churche churche proufes depende vpon iffes whiche beinge denied haue nomore saie doubte saie churche maie erre whiche hath departed goddes vvoorde christes commaundementes c hath erred deede syr man denie supposal staie firste vvhat haue prooue haue saide hitherto knowe litle force doubte saie churche maie erre hath departed goddes vvoorde c yea forsoothe iffes true heauen fell wee shoulde catche larkes bridge made betwene douer calys wee mighte goe boleine foote vvilliam somer tolde kinge henry true haue hearde saie b sarisburie nothinge el onely canonization poore vvilliam sommer bookes hardinge shal liue al sage sawes shal neuer die apologie cap diuision saie ye haue benne felovvship novve ye becomme foresakers profession haue departed v trewe haue departed dooinge bothe geeue thankes almighty god greatly reioice owne behalfe yet al primitiue churche apostle christe wee haue departed true wee brought vp menne darkenesse lacke knowledge god moses brought vp learning bosome egyptian vve haue benne companie tertull apologetico saithe tertullian confesse marueile al saith menne made borne christian hardinge vvee saie ye reporte ye haue benne felowship ye become apostate foresakers professionby vvhole discourse christ apostle maie condemned haue wickedly departed v name v meane one particular companie christes catholike churche vve saie ihon saide like1 ioan whome calleth antichristes ex nobis exierunt sed erant ex nobis nam si fuissent ex nobis permansissent vti que nobiscum departed v v benne v doubteles remained still v answeare hereunto desperate foolishe lieinge firste ye confesse thinge onely also thanke god greatly reioice therein ye folowe woorse sorte sinnersprouerb salomon saithe laetantur cum male fecerint exultant rebus pessimis glad haue donne euil reioice worste thinges ye haue diuided churche god ye haue rente lordes nette ye haue cut whole wouen cote wicked souldiers crucified could finde harte doo dionysius alexandrinus writinge nouatus greate heretike ye haue donne saithe thus vnto eusebius recitetheccles hisit lib ca graecis whereby yee maie esteeme greatnesse crime thou shouldest haue suffered euer churche god mighte diuided martyrdome suffered churche shoulde diuided lesse glorious suffered dooinge idolatrie yea mine opinion greater one martyred owne onely soule whole churche thus foloweth apostasie diuidinge goddes churche yee haue donne wickedlya good excuse idolatrie yee committed idolatrie yet saie primitiue churche apostle christe haue departed vvhat saide foolishly vvhy syrsyes verily euen house god caue theeues vvere al one temple matthae primitiue churche time one churche dothe holde togeather continuall succession till worldes ende vvhat hath christe moe church one primitiue churche quite donne muste beginne newe christe apostle true beleuers time place euer liue one mysticall body whereof head member christe one holy ghoste one one faithe one baptisme one vocation one god churche one whiche beganne firste man shall endure laste whereof liuinge parte earthe comminge christe fleashe sometime broughte small number comminge apostle preached spreadde gospell abroade number neither euer shalbe greate though sometime accompted small respect vnbeleuers vntil comminge againe sonne manluc time shall skantly finde faithe specially whiche woorketh charitie earth whiche time busely ye make preparation parte excuse forsakinge churche ye saie ye brought vp v darkenesse lacke knowledge god moses amonge aegyptians ye bringe tertullian helpeth nothinge praie syrs darkenesse meane ye speake ye sinne vvee excuse selues tooke ye beame owne eies yee espie mote eie well ye proued selues honest menne ye required v angel ye meane darkenesse ignorance peraduenture ye doo lacke knowledge god ye departed v haue set chaire chaire see cause saie aulter aulter better knowledge god haue ye haue euer haue doo know article belefe tell v whiche doo lacke life euerlastinge saithe sauiour gospell knowe thee god alone thou haste sente iesus christeioan matth farre god lightneth vnderstandinge supernaturallhere hardinge laieth heapes learninge light grace muche wee know peter sonne iona accompted blessed christe sinne full papistes god grace also knowe confesse commaundementes god knowe good euill whiche sinnes whiche vertues folowed shunned farre behoofull ignorant vvhat darkenesse whiche ye would needes gonne v woorthy knowledge ye haue wonne departure tell v maie bte bookes goe scoole truly without ye haue hidden secrete knowledge ye haue vttered worlde hitherto beleue ye haue beinge suche boaster ye see litle cause ye twite v ignorance bragge owne knowledge see full well runne away v side monkes frier tinker tapster coblers bodgers white blacke synagoges great rabbins ye superintendentes admitte minister preacher woorde tell doo well beleue lesse themselues people take suche knewe tooke suche degree many time good behauiour foregete holy ministerie christen common name whiche geuen fonte yet proueth either ignorance maruelous rare knowledge neither shall ye euer able proue man learninge iudgement liberall science righte knowledge scripture ye comparable learned menne catholike churche though fifty yeeres paste vpwarde space study eloquence tonges intermitted yet time smal number men profounde knowledge good artes specially holy letter reporte thomas vvalden learnedly confuted heresy greate graundfather iohn vvicklef alcuinus great charles time beda three english men anselme lanckfrancke bishop englande though stranger borne thomas aquine bernarde rupertus hundred moe whiche place recken vvere confession greate clerkes doo beste learned time obscure matter fetche light saie truthe comparison cleare light ill sauoringe snoffes maie scantly seeme yeelde darke smoke many talke painted sheath learned dede woulde soone perceiue neither freshe gaie sworde rusty beggerly met wiser parte worlde seetha learned vvorthy conclusion vvoe calle light darkenesse darkenesse lighte esai therefore ye shall well syrs speake darkenesse ignorance catholike churche boast lesse greate cunninge knowledge b sarisburie heade idle hardinge coulde easily yeelde v sutche idle talke yee thinke case lawful departe euer thei beare shewe countenance churche muste yee needes condemne apostle prophetes moste specially christe selfe let v consider companie wee departed maie cause departure better appeare pope selfe saithe nay vpon iuste consideration churche maie leaue churche romedeparting churche rome owne woordes nulli agere licet sine discretione iustitiae contra disciplinam romanae ecclesiae vvithout discretion justice lawful man doo thinge contrarie order churche rome pope owne decree dist non decit rubric vvith discretion iustice lawfull doo contrarie order churche rome shorte general viewe whole churche behalfe bernarde saithe thus bernardus synodo remensi parum est nostris pastoribus quod non seruant no nisi perdant non parcunt suis qui non parcunt sibi perimentes pariter pereuntes sufficient bishoppes saue v onlesse also doo destroie v sparinge selues spare people doo bothe perishe selues kille othersin eadem synod againe saithe non custodiunt hoc tempore sponsam sed perdunt non custodiunt gregem domini sed mactant deuorant keepe daie spouse god churche destroie keepe flocke kille deuoure writeth paralipomena vrspergensis storie councel constance saithe thus paralipom vrspergen pa spiritum extinguebant prophetias aspernabantur christum membris suis persequebantur erat que plane persequutrix ecclesia oppressed sprite god defied voice prophetes persequuted christe member deede churche geeuen woorke persequution aeneas siluiusaeneas sylui epist ad casparem schlickium paralipom vrspergen clemen afterwarde pope pius saithe refriguit charitas fides omnis interijt charitie waxen colde al faithe deade life pope clemens written thus hic fuit publicus fornicator ab eo tempore defecit omnis disciplina religio cardinalibus tres radix vitiorum superbia auaritia luxuria validissime dominatur pope open vvhoore maister time forewarde al kinde discipline religion decaied cardinalles three rootes vice pride auarice lecherie mightily bare swaie antonius marinariusin concil trid antonius marinarius late chapter tridente saithe thus churche rome si euangelica fides nostrae vitae regula esset ipsa christiani essemus nunc titulo ceremonijs vocamur christiani faithe gospel rule vnto life shoulde wee christian deede nowe title ceremony wee beare onely name christian chapter bishop bitonto saide thus haue reported concil trident episcopus bitontinus quibus turpitudinum monstris qua sordium coll ute qua peste non sunt foedati non corrupti ecclesia sanctum populus sacerdos sanctuario dei incipite si vllus iam pudor si vlla pudicitia si vlla superest bene viuendi vel spes vel ratio vvith monster filthinesse vilenesse pestilence corrupted defiled holy churche rome wel prieste people beginne euen sanctuarie god shame regarde honestie hope waie liue wel saithe francis zephyrus apologeticum tertulliani no miseros qui christiani dicimur genre agimus sub nomine christi miserable wee called christian vve liue heathen vnder name christe saithe lugenda rom quae nostris maioribus clara patrum lumen protulisti nostris temporibus monstrosas tenebrasarnulphus aut bernardus concil remen petrar rithmis italicis schola di errori e tempio di eresia futuro saeculo famosas offadisti miserable rome whiche time oure elder haste brought foorthe lightes woorthy father day haste broughte foorthe monstrous darkenesse shameful sclaunderous time comme petrarcha calleth rome schoole erroure temple heresie brigitta whose woordes prophesies yee haue reuerence saithe reuelations christus sumer benedictionem clero romano dabit eam alteri genri facienti voluntatem dominideparting churche ro christe shal take blessinge cleregie rome shal geue vnto people shal doo wil sewe wee maie conceiue whole state churche rome whiche onely churcheherma riddus aboue al others hardinge telleth v founded truthe neuer haue power deceiued wee haue departed therefore shepeheardes spoiled flocke bishoppes destroied churche oppressed sprite god defied voice prophetes persequuted christe member bothe perished selues killed others walowed monster filthinesse liued heathen vnder name christe voide charitie voide faithe voide discipline voide religion christian onely title ceremony christe vvithdravven blessinge shorte wee haue departed temple heresie schoole erroure hardinge bewtie face romaine cleregie blessed companie wee haue foresaken yet saie benne better haue died haue broken vnitie sutche churche frendes tel without obedience bishop romede maiorita obedient vnam sanctam subesse romano pontifici est de necessitate salutis hope saluation notwithstanding owne clemens ye commonly cal apostle felovve saithe thus schisma efficit non qui ab impijs secessionem facit sed qui pij maketh schisme diuision churche departeth wicked departeth godly therefore addeth laici cum ijs qui contraria sententiae dei dogma defendunt nolite societatem habere neque participes illorum impietatis fieri ait enim dominusclemens apostolicar consti lib cap recedite de medio horum hominum ne cum eis pereatis yee laie menne haue felowship partetakers vvickednesse defende doctrine contrarie doctrine god lorde saithe departe middes people leste yee perishe togeather pope piusaeneas syluius ad rector vniuersitate colonien paraliponena vrspergens pag saithe resistendum est quibuscun que faciem siue paulus siue petrus sit qui ad veritatem non ambulat euangelij vvee muste withstande man vnto face peter paule walke truthe gospel augustine saithe ne catholicis quidem episcopis consentiendum est sicubi forte falluntur contra canonicas scripturas aliquid sentiant vvee maie agree catholique bishoppes happen deceiued thinke thinge contrarie canonical scripture augustinus de vnitate ecclesi ca chrysostome saithe ex ipsis veris ecclesijs frequenter exeunt seductores propterea nec ipsis omnino credendum est nisi ca dicant vel faciant quae conuenientia sint scripturis chrysostom matth hom euen oute true church oftentimes comme deceiuers therefore wee maie wise beleeue notwithstandinge true church god onlesse speake doo sutche thinges agreeable scripture anselmusanselmus thessalon late vvriter expoundinge woordes paule tunc reuelabitur ille iniquus saithe thus romanus pontifex qui tenet nunc ecclesias teneat illas donec de medio fiat id est donec ab ipsa romana ecclesia quae est medium cor ecclesiarum fiat iniquitas ob quam ab ea multae discedant ecclesiae let bishop rome nowe holdeth church holde stil vntil taken awaie middes yt saie vntil wickednesse wought churche rome middest harte church vvhiche vvickednesse many church shal departe ambrose saithe ambros epist ad theodos v sent nullus pudor est ad meliora transire shame goe better augustine saithe vnto faustus heretique departing churche rome ille quondam de gremio tuo error excusserat expertus fugi quod experiri non debui erroure shooke thy bosome beinge taught proufe haue fledde thinge haue prouedaugust contra faustum lib cap ambrosius ansbertus one owne doctoures saithe per hieremiam prophetam dicitur exite de medio eius populus meus saluet vnusquis que animam suam ab ira faroris dominiambros ansber apocalyp li cap nequaqua enim hac vita de medio ciuitatis reprobae id est de medio malorum quos babylon illa significat electorum aliquis valet exire nisi detestado quod ab ipsis agitur agedo quod ab ipsis detestatur prophete hieremie saith people goe foorth fro middes saue euery man owne soule fro rage oure lordes furie none electe god life goe foorthe middes wicked cittie saie middes euil whiche babylon signifieth defieinge doo dooinge defie whereas yee would faine daste eies couer deformity name churche cyprian de lapsis sermo cyprian saithe non est pax sed bellum nec ecclesiae iungitur qui ab euangelio separatur peace vvarre neither ioined churche diuided gospel chrysostome saithe chrysostom ad populum vntioch n homi mihi ciuitas non habens pios ciues omni villa vilior est quacun que spelunca ignobilior cittie hathe godly citizen vnto viler village lothe caue saithe cittie antioche whiche expresse woordes esteemeth cittie rome wee graunte wee haue departed vpon sutche occasion sutche sor te moses sommetime departed oute aegypte augustine manichee deede naue rather departed v chrysostom matth hom chrysostome saithe sic de ista noua hierusalem id est de ecclesia qui spirituales christiani fuerunt relicta corporali ecclesia quam perfidi occupauerant violentia exierunt ab illis magi autem illi exierunt nobis sicut iohannes exponit non enim ille de ecclesia exire videtur qui corporaliter exit sed qui spiritualiter veritatis ecclesiasticae fundamenta reliquit no enim ab illis ex uimus corpore illi nobis animo no enim ab illis extuimus loco illi nobis fide no apud illos reliquimus fundamenta parietum illi apud no reliquerunt fundamenta scripturarum no ab illis egressi sumus secundum aspectum hominum illi autem nobis secundum iudicium dei relicta est autem deserta ex quo de illa corporali ecclesia spiritualis exiuit id est de populo suo qui videbatur christianus non erat populus iste exiuit qui non videbatur erat magi autem secundumquod diximus illi nobis exierunt quam no ab illis euen touchinge nevve hierusalem whiche c urche spiritu christian menne lecuinge bodily churche whiche wicked violence inuaded departed iohn expoundeth rather departed v seemeth deede departe churche bodily departeth spiritually leaueth fundations ecclesiastical truthe vve haue departed body haue departed v minde vve place v faithe vvee haue leafte fundations vvalles haue leafte v fundations scripture vvee departed foorthe sighte man departed v iudgemente god nowe spiritual churche gonne foorthe bodily churche leafte foresaken saie people seemed christian people people gonne foorthe seemed wardely dede notwithstandinge wee haue saide haue rather departed v ye saie churche fevve churche rome nowe primitiue churche al one churche euen moone bothe ful wane al one moone euen hierusalem wel vnder dauid vnder manass e al one cittie holy place whether ye maiestie god ye abomination desolation stande al one place primitiue churche saie churche rome novv al one churche therefore wee saie churche rome truthe religion ought agree primitiue churche whether churche maie brought fevve number wee occasion sommewhat saie anciente father irenaeus saithe quemadmodum ibi plurimis eorumirenaeus lib cap qui peccauerunt non bene sensit deus sic hic multi sunt vocati pauci vero electi olde testamente many offended god pleased euen nevve testamente many called fewe chosen consideration whereof hierome crieth agonie within selfe hieron esai lib cap fortalitium fidei lib tanta erit sanctorum paucitas smal shalbe number holy menne one owne doctours saithe alleged licet hoc bello daemonum cadat religiosi principe milites praelati ecclesiastici subditi semper tamen manent aliqui quibus seruatur veritas fidei iustificatio bonae conscientiae et si non nisi duo viri fideles remanerent mundo tamen illis saluaretur ecclesia quae est vnitas fidelium notwithstandinge warre diuelles bothe godly prince souldiers ecclesiastical prelate subiectes ouer throwne yet euermore remaine somme whome truthe faithe righteousnesse good conscience preserued notwithstandinge vvere tv voo faithful menne remaininge worlde yet euen churche god whiche vnitie faithful saued yt wee saie vvee vvere brought vp emonge darkenesse ignorance yee enter season needelesse discourse coparison learninge liberal science ye saie comparable learned menne side meaninge hardinge cal bright beames liberal learninge question appeareth yee woulde faine haue blased magnified vttermoste waie disgraced wee meante onely knowledge god open professio holy woorde comparison whiche knowledge al knowledge euer meere darknesse touchinge kinde liberal learned science great cause ye shoulde either highly rowse selfe owne opinion greately disdeigne othersde summa trinita linwoode ye maie remember prouincial constitution beginne woordes ignorantia sacerdotum greate maisterie charge chiefe doctoures side somme want learning ludouicus viues saith vt quid que ius superioribus saeculis minus tittum fuit studentium manibusludoui viues de causis corrupt artium lib ita purius ad no peruenit space certaine hundred yeeres paste lesse booke came learned studentes handes purer better came v meaninge thereby euery thinge woorse learned handelinge thomas scotus hugo others yee seeme make greate accoumpte owne frende catharinus saithe scholastici multa inerudite comminiscunturcatharinus aduerius petrum sold schole doctoures imagine many ters vnlearnedly erasmus saithe portenta quae nunc passim legimus commentarijs recention interpretum tam impudentia insulsa sunt vt videatur suibus ea scripsisseerasm scholijs hieronym ad mar ellam non hominibus monstrous folie yt wee commonly reade ye commentary late interpreter whereby meaneth croppe woorthieste al scholastical learned doctoures far without shame peeuishe benne vvritten svvine menne one doctoures saithe comparison learning apostolus dicitur ab apos quod est argumentum vel praeeminentia stolon quod est missio quasi praeeminenter missus saithe apocrisarij dicuntur nuntij domini papaeerasmus ad archiepisc toleta extra de elect electi potest signifi gloss manipul curat pag nam crisis dicitur secretum apos dicitur nuntius saithe cathedra est nomen graecum componitur cathos quod est fides edra quod est sponda saithe eleemosyna dicitur ab eleis quod est misereri mois quod est aqua peter crab late scholies vpon councelles saith thus mulieres nonlatin alphabet id est cohabitantes sacculos likewise againe saithe phrygium factum est ex penni pauonum liberal learned cleregie one saithe thus nec verba canonis intelligunt necinter decreta felicis pp conc tomo pag donatione constantini herma riddus hierony reg monacho ne ad risum provocentur angelici spiritus quae sint verba consecrationis sciunt vnderstand woordes theire canon neither knowe whiche woordes consecration therefore forged rule monkes vnder name hierome chargeth wise pronounce euery woorde distinctely wa ily leste theire foolishe vtterance shoulde make angelles falle laughinge fewe maie serue taste hereby hardinge maie appeare cleregie hath greate cause make sutche triumphe theire learninge howe wee vpraide herewith cause oure departure yee holde faithe learning churche religion enheritance christe hath praied peter therefore faithe learning neuer faile yet notwithstandinge late bookes freight many vnciuile vaine speaches often vntruthes wil saie nothing sauoure cholerhierony prouerb li ca learninge hierome saithe doctrina viri per patientiam noscitur quia tanto quis que minus oftenditur doctus quantoconuincitur minus patiens mannes learninge knowen patience lesse patiente manne sheweth selfe lesse sheweth learninge woulde god yee woulde humble knowledge make obediente knowledge godactor otherwise peter saide vnto simon magus moonie maie likewise saide vnto knowledge thy knovvledge vvith thee thy destruction cor esdr cor matth learninge crosse christe learninge wee make vauntes god called god truthe learninge paule saithe al kinde learninge shalbe abolished god make v al learned kingedome heauen apologie cap diuision wherefore praie haue themselues citizen dweller rome remoued comme downe seuen hilles whereupon rome sommetime stood dwel rather plaine called field mar wil saie peraduenture bicause conductes mater wherewithout menne cannot commodiously liue haue failed dried vp hilles wel lette geeue v like leaue seekinge water eternal life geeue selues seekinge water wel water verily failed amongest elder levves saith ieremie hiere sente theire litle one vvateringes thei findinge vvater beinge miserable case vtterly loste thirste brought home againe theire vessel emptie nedy poore folke esai saithe esaie sought aboute vvater vvhere founde theire tongue vvas euen vvithered vvith thirste euen menne haue broken peeces al pipe conduites haue stopped vp al springes choked vp fountaine liuinge water dyrte myre caligula many yeeres past locked vp faste al storehouse corne rome thereby brought general dearthe famine amongest people euen menne damminge vp al fountaines goddes vvoorde haue brought people pitiful thirst haue brought worldamos saithe prophete amos hungre thirste hunger breade thirste vvater hearinge vvoorde god greate distresse went scatteringe seekinge somme sparke heauenly light refreashe theire conscience withal light already thoroughly quenched coulde finde none rueful state lamentable forme goddes church miserie liue therein without gospel without light without al comforte hardinge vvel witteely reasoned foresoothe sir holesome vvater eternal life whiche ye thirste aftervntruthe vvee departed catholique churche ye woulde neuer haue departed high hil catholike church come downe valleis ye finde durty pudles fleashely pleasure deuil behemothiob iob saithe dormit iocis humentibus sleapeth woiste place al sterued hunger thirst water god vvorde therefore ye speake bothe slaunderously ignorantly diuines ye saie broken peeces al pipe conduites stopped vp al springes choked dawned vp al founteines liuinge vvater durte myre yet vnwares ignorantly cal faithles pagane state lamentable forme god churche whereas shoulde haue accoumpted churche al worde god light gospel al church vvithout multitude church without christe man christian deade man man thus malicious slaunderinge lerned reason theire owne affirmation apt allegation haue gone proue many hundred yeres churche hath erred thankes god al winde shaketh corne vvhen al hasty blastes blowne ouer churche god shal stand stil vnmoued vpon rocke christ builded appere glorious sted fastnes truth maugre gaine saieinge al heretikes shal appere terrible stronge armie set battaile rayecantic b sarisburie hardinge ye beginne season plaie allegory mystical fantasy catholique churche rome mounte worldly pleasure vale whiche comparison wee muste beleue pope cardinalles sittinge highe vpon mounte passe theire time onely fastinge praier al manner pouertie penurie straitou sse life haue vtterly abandoned al worldly pleasure notwithstanding somme haue saidparalipomen vrspergen clement cardinalibus superbia auaritia luxuria validissime dominantur cardinalles rome pride auarice lecherie theire greatest courage howe touchinge wel like folie conceminge churche wil saie ye keepe woonte muste needes saie yee doo trifle apologie cap diuision whereforedeparting churche rome though departinge trouble yet ought consider withal howe iuste cause departure hardinge deede charitie sutche confesse griefe vntovs see plaie part rebellious child vse presumption submission contempt obedience spite loue yet sith ye desperate incorrigible departing v church felt anguish trouble ye gone releued body eased purgation hath auoided euil humour nowe saie beste b sarisburie wee gonne churche god hardinge wee gonne onely haue vnreuerently abused churche ye feele good ease yee saie wel reliued departure vse homely comparison sick body reliued purgation god mercie graunt yee maie likewise purged al reste shal yee feele ease better reliued hierome saithe hierony ad fabiolam de mansionibus mansione hebraei dicunt quod ea nocte qua egressus est israel ex aegypto omnia aegypto templa destructa sunt siue terrae motu fiue ictu fulminum spiritualiter autem dicimus quod egredientibus nobis ex aegypto errorum idola corruant omnis peruersarum doctrinarum cultura quatiatur rabines hebrewe doctoures saie night israel departed egypte al idolatrous temple egypte destroied either earthquake lighteninge wee learne spiritual sense wee departe egypte saie companie idolater idolles erroure falle grounde al honoure false doctrine shaken downe sutche reliefe hardinge wee trust yee shal finde departure beda expoundinge woordes apocalyps comme foorthe herbeda apocal lib cap people partetakers sinnes saithe thus inducit discessionem quae est ruina babylonis cum enim loth discesserit sodomis sodomae funditus tollentur iohn speaketh departure whiche ruine fal balylon loth shal departe sodome shal sodome vtterly ouerthrowen againe saithe beda apocal lib cap post haec audiui vocem alleluia laus gloria virtu deo nostro haec nunc ex parte dicit ecclesia tunc autem perfecte dicet cum discessio facta fuerit hearde voice alleluia praise glorie power god songe churche parte singeth already shal shee deede perfitely singe departure shalbe made antichriste babylon apologie cap diuision saie wise lawful one leaue felowship wherein hathe benne brought vp maie aswel name vpon heades likewise condemne prophetes apostle christe selfe complaine also loth went quite waie sodome abraham chaldee example christe israelite egypte christe ievves paule phariseis excepte possible maie lawful cause departinge wee see reasone loth abraham israelite christe paule maie accused sectes sedition aswel others hardinge yet bringe ye nothing purpose proufes weake hange euil togeather maie wel tel whiche irenaeus obiected heretikes ye make rope sande vve saie wise lawful one leaue felowship wherein hath benne brought vp contrary wiseapocal thus mutche confessed sufficiente felowship naught wicked euery one bound eschewe depart babylon people ye partaker sinnes saith heauenly voice iohna suddaine conclusion therefore example ye bringe helpe nothinge cause loth went sodome abraham chaldea israelite egypte paule phariseis god special warninge vvhere ye saie christe went iewes onlesse ye referre steppinge aside ye shoulde rather haue saide iewes went christe whereto perteineth though ye malicious compare catholike churche sodome chaldea egypte iewes phariseis yet wene ye proude asa vaine folie good man maie folovve christe vvithout presumptuous comparison compare selues loth abraham god peculiar people paule christe himselfe departinges allowe god required blame god detesteth b sarisburie wee compare selues hardinge neither loth abraham paule leaste al christe selfe wee humbly submitte selues life doctrine guided theire example thus truste maie lawfully doo without iuste note presumption chrysostome saithechrysost matthae homil data est tibi potestas diuinitus imitandi christum vt possis illi similis fieri noli expauescere hoc audiens timedum enim tibi potius est si similis illi fieri negligas thou haste power geeuen god folowe christe thou maiste like vnto thou afraide heare thinge thou haste cause feare thou refuse like vnto likewise saithe anciente father origen si quem imitati volumus propositus est nobis christus ad imitandum origen ezechiel homil wee desire folowe man christe set v wee shoulde folowe provvde parte religion life folowe christe claimeth selfe christes authoritie calleth selfe euen name christe know written extra de traslatio episcopi quato hostien bernard de co sideratio lib papa potest quicquid christus ipse potest pope doo euer christe selfe doo yee knowe wel contented heare selfe thus saluted touchinge primacie thou art abel touchinge gouernemente thou art noe touchinge patriarkship thou art abraham touchinge order thou art melchisedech touchinge dignitie thou art aaron touchinge authoritie thou art moses touchinge iudgemente thou art samuel touchinge power thou art peter touchinge anointinge thou art christe woordes trowe harding maie sommewhat seeme sauoure pride apologie cap diuision menne wil needes condemne v heretiques bicause doo al thinges theire commaundemente goddes name kinde menne ought themselues taken whiche despise commaundemente christe apostle hardinge frailtie concerninge life accuse lamente commende selues god infinite mercie touchinge belefe necessarie doctrine faithe raile ye v neuer mutche neither despise thevntruthes notorious manifeste vnto vvorlde commaundementes christe tradition apostle apologie cap diuision schismatiques bicause haue leaft name shal thei called themselues whiche haue foresaken ye greekes vvhom firste receiued theire faithe foresaken primitiue churche foresaken christe himselfe apostle euen child shoulde foresake theire parentes hardinge vvho euer departe catholike churche schismatikes ye haue departed catholike churche ofhere harfreely yeldeth v first six hundred three score yeeres saie vvhole time apostle holy father churche nine hundred yeeres ergo ye schismatikes firste proposition ye wil denie seconde selues confesse conclusion muste nedes true saie blame v neither saie onely also ye heretikes vvhereby measure iniquitie increaced crime ye woulde impure vnto v ye wisie howe ye haue laie charge haue foresaken grekes ye shal offended world geue v title name estimation catholikes heretofore remember selues haue forsaken grekes greekes pointes
