haue forsaken v name v alwaies vnderstande catholike churche euen holy romaine churche whose faithe professe communicate reade ansvveare howe standeth lerninge receiued faithe first grekes ye saie haue forsaken primitiue churche yea christe himselfe apos le ye haue tolde v often take wordes course common blaste railing sprite romaine churche receiued faithe ierusalemvntruthe shal soone appeare grece reste world didesai according prophecie de sio exibit lex c land britaine natiue country faithe firste brought hither ioseph arimathaea felowes old tradition toldcertainely vve receiued faithe firste fro churche rome church first planted faithful iewes grekes beinge true maruel ye meane charge v forsaking grekes specially ye saie firste receiued faith vvhiche truer receiued englishe language b sarisburie shame hardinge confesse churche rome firste receiued faithe church graeciaaugu epist augu epist chrysosto ad popul antiochen homil neither vtterly voide learninge haue saide rather marueile learninge leade sate contrarie augustine saithe terra graecorum vnde vbi que destinata est fides land graecia whence faithe al place sente abroade againe saithe radix orientalium ecclesiarum vnde euangelium aphricam venittripar histor lib cap sozom li ca nonlatin alphabet roote easte church whence gospel came aphrica chrysostome saithe vnto people antioche christianorum nomen velut ex quodam fonte hinc incipiens omnem mundum inundauit name christian beginninge firste cittie antioche springe hath flowed ouer whole worlde bishoppes easte wrote thus vnto iulius bishop rome ad ecclesiam romana ab oriente praedicatores dogmatis aduenerut preacher christian doctrine came fro yt easte churche romethe faith brought rome oute graecia likewise basile saith gospel kingedome springing vp first church graecia fro thence published abroade al ye world eusebius saithe lucis virtu sacrae religionis lex beneficio dei quasi e sinu orientis profecta cunctum simul orbem sacro iubare illustrauit power light lawe holy religion goddes benefite springinge bosome easte basil epist ad epi per italiam galliam eusebi de vita constan orati cod de sacrosa ecclesiis l iubemus s scie te hath shined ouer whole worlde togeather blessed beame emperoure iustinian saithe constantinopolis religionis fidei mater perpetua constantinople euerlastinge mother faithe religion likewise againe sacrosancta costantinopolitanae ciuitatis ecclesia mater pietatis nostrae christianorum orthodoxae religionis omnium moste holy churche cittie constantinople mother oure holinesse mother al christian catholique faithe like sorte churche constantinople euen vntil daie intituleth selfecod eod titu decernimus epist eccle constantinop ad eccle pragen concil trident oratio episcopi bitontini nonlatin alphabet churche constantinople mother maistresse al catholique shorte ye wil beleue yet leaste yee maie beleue owne felowes bishop bitonto youre late chapter trident vttered woordes maie wel appeare lusty courage eia igitur graecia mater nostra cui id torum debet quod habet latina ecclesia therefore oure mother graecia vnto latine churche churche rome beholden al euer hath thinges hardinge beinge true wee marueile shoulde moue denie yee first receiued faithe churche graecia touchinge mater selfe opere triparti li ca concil written thus youre owne councelles si graeci per quandam scissuram diuiduntur latinis ita latini graecis et ideo videtur quod si graeci debent dici schismatici propter huiusmodi diuisionem eadem ratione latini praeterea graeci magi seruant antiquas consuetudines apostolorum discipulorum christi barbis c grekes certaine diuision sundred latines euen latines sundred greekes therefore seemeth greekes respecte diuision ought called schismatiques latines also ought called like case furthermore greekes doo duely keepe olde customes apostle christles disciple touchinge beardes c doo latines apologie cap diuision though greekes daie professe religion name christe haue many thinges corrupted amongest yet holde thei stil great number thinges whiche receiued apostle haue neither priuate mass mangled sacramentes purgatory pardones title highe bishoppes glorious name esteeme whosoeuer woulde take vpon woulde called either vniuersal bishop head vniuersal churche make doubte cal sutche one passinge proude man man woorketh despite againste al bishoppes brother plaine heretique hardinge ye haue oftentimes belied vsvntruthe shal plainely appeare nowe ye belie poore greekes little ye able saie somewhat therein saie truthe haue masse commonly without companie communicate prieste whiche ye cal priuate masse sovntruthe large manifeste al greece ouer asia syria assyria armenia euer religion christe professed amonge greekes venis selfe diuerse oure countrie menne haue seene commonly practized like wise praie al dead thinke relieued praiers oblation almose deedes charitie doone liuinge vvhiche minde opinion implieth faith vntruthe grecian neuer receiued fantasy purgatorie whiche churche holdeth purgatorie though saie ye greekes haue many thinges corrupted yet holde stil greate number thinges whiche receiued apostle wilt thou knowe reader forsoothe haue neither priuate mass mangled sacramentes purgatory pardon witte defender bee commended maketh man holde whiche hath noto merily plaieth vvith fansie greekes holde stil saithe vvhat holde mary haue newe kinde holdinge man holde hath holde stil haue stil haue saieth howe holde man maie rule newe logique thus reason turkes saracenes iewes infidel idolater yea shepe cottesholde also ye wil haue neither priuate mass communion vnder one kinde purgatory pardon ergo holde number thinges whiche receiued apostle antecedent true vvho euer denieth consequente must compte defender logique simple vvhat one shoulde make argumente defender hath neither good logique fine rhetorike profounde philosophie right knowledge diuinitie ergo holdeth many heresy though bothe antecedent consequent true yet argument naught like reason one might conclude honest vnlearned catholique man heretique whiche false iniurious sutche logique sutche topikes newe negatiue ablatiue diuinitie maie worthely cal negatiue respect blasphemous tongue denieing sundrie weightie pointes faithe ablatiue respecte wicked handes casting away throwinge downe taking away manie good thinges perteining maintenance christen religion goddes honour put negatiues ablatiues case shal stande b sarisburie ashamed worlde combred childishe folie defender witte ye saie bee commended maketh man holde neuer hadde holde saie mary haue newe kinde holdinge man holde hath holde stil haue stil haue howe holde nowe surely hardinge trowe wee shal haue holde mery man prety sporte yee canne make youre selfe hauinge holdinge great pitie yee shoulde euer otherwise occupied annibal carthage hadde hearde phormio oratoure talke pleasantly longe whyle togeathercicero de oratore beinge afterwarde demaunded thought eloquence made aunsweare homely sorte multos se vidisse delitos sene sed qui magi quam phormio deliraret vidisse neminem somme yelde vnto pleasance maie man holde neuer hadde wel lose neuer hadde learned gloses vpon youre decree dist concil gloss yee maie finde note emongest others nota quod aliquis dicitur perdere quod nunqua habuit marke wel man maie said lose neuer hadde yet ye saie comonly schooles priuatio semper praesupponit habitum losing thing alwaies pre supposeth hauing answeare plainer wyse maie man wel holde nothinge maie talke mutche yet saie nothing galene saide sommetime onegalenus spake sutche substantial manner speake nowe accipe nihil tene fideliter take nothinge holde faste leaue youre foliesthe greke churche seely toy hardinge youre turkes saracenes sheepe cotesholde wee saie greekes holde stil neuer hadde wee saie holde stil euer hadde youre priuate mass youre dimi communion holde hadde neuer holy vvhole communion bothe kindes holde stil sithence apostle time haue hadde euer praie also dead therein yee saie implied youre faithe purgatorie wil touche simplicitie youre rhetorique logique hardinge onely wishe haue better regarde youre diuinitie ought see praier deade youre fantasie purgatorie neuer straitely coupled togeather might wel easily goe sunder grecian praie deade doo praie apostle patriarkes prophetes blessed virgine oure ladie liturgia basilij liturgia chrysostomi maie soone perceiue basiles chrysostomes liturgie yet thinke yee woulde haue youre reader beleue article youre faithe apostle christe patriarkes prophetes blessed virgin christes mother stil purgatorie euer opinion grecian haue deade certaine coulde neuer yet brought beleue youre purgatorie roffensis polydor de inuentoribus li cap one greatest doctoures haue saide saith thus purgatorium graecis v que ad hunc diem non est creditum grecian vntil daie beleue purgatorie thus hardinge knowe whether youre logique youre diuinitie bothe marueilous yee woulde faine force youre poore greekes holde thinge neuer hadde proper pastime yee make youre selfe youre negatiues ablatiues wherefore harde telle sauinge see ye wel disposed wel became mery ancient learned father hauinge deale impudent heretiques defence erroures auouched iudgemente al olde bishoppes doctoures hadde benne general consente primitiue whole vniuersal churche good regarde truthe faithefully doo nowe better discouer shamelesse boldenesse nakednesse theire doctrine oftentimes likewise forced vse negatiue driue heretiques wee doo proue theire affirmatiues whiche thinge doe neuer possible anciente father irenaeus thus staied selfe wee dooirenaeus li ca negatiue hoc ne que prophetae praedicauerunt ne que dominus docuit ne que apostoli tradiderunt thinge neither prophetes publishe oure lorde teache chrysost de incomprehensi dei natura hom leo epist cap apostle deliuer like negatiue chrysostome saithe hanc arborem non paulus plantauit non apollo rigauit non deus auxit tree erroure neither paule planted apollo watered god encreased like sorte leo saithe quid opus est cor admittere quod lex non docuit quod prophetia non cecinit quod euangelij veritas non praedicauit quod apostolica doctrina non tradidit needeth beleue thing neither lawe hathe taught prophetes haue spoken gospel hathe preached apostle haue deliuered againe quomodo noua inducuntur quae nunquam nostri sensere maiores leo epist cap howe newe diuises brought oure father neuer knewe augustineaugust epist hauinge reckened vp greate number bishoppes rome general negatiue saithe thus hoc ordine successionis nullus donatista episcopus inuenitur al order succession bishoppes one bishop founde priuate masse greke churche donatiste gregorie beinge selfe bishop rome writinge againste title vniuersal bishop saith thus nemo decessorum meorum hoc tam prophano vocabulo vti consensit nullus romanorum pontificum hoc singularitatis nomen assumsitgregorius li epist none al predecessours euer consented vse vngodly title bishop rome euer tooke vpon name singularitie like negatiues holy father olde time mighte safely vse without controlmente doctoure louaine yet vp starte carpe quarrel diuinitie leaue childishe vnsauerie sportinge triflinge youre negatiues hardinge greate deale seemely man learninge grauitie youre pourpose proue youre affirmatiues haue priuate masse yee saie al graecia asia syria assyria armenia euer religion christe professed al wee muste needes beleue vpon youre woorde proufe yee offer make none notwithstandinge haue sutche priuate mass al country tel v beseeche authours maker mass yee wil saie iames chrysostome basile name mass yee haue tolde v many tale yet yee consider mater wel yee shal finde selfe mass communion nothinge like youre mass holy sacramentes contrarie youre newe diuises deliuered generally bothe kindes al people liturgia iacobi iames masse saithe thus diaconi tollunt disco calices ad impertiendum populo deacon take vp disshes cuppes minister sacramente vnto people chrysostome masse saithe thus liturgia chrysostomi post mysteria feruntur ad locum vbi populus debet communicare afterwarde holy mystery sacramentes brought vnto place people muste receiue togeather basile masse saithe thuslitur basilij no omnes de vno pane de vno calice participantes c cantores cantant communionem sic communicant omnes al wee receiuinge one breade one cuppe c quiere singeth communion communicate al togeather therefore hardinge yee muste needes confesse either grecian daie vse none mass theire mass youre mass oure communion whiche bothe contrarie youre selfe armenian liturgie georgius cassa der liturgijs written thus qui non sunt digni communicare hanc oblationem dei exeant foras ante fore ecclesiae ibi orent woorthy receiue oblation god let goe foorthe churche doore let praie grecian order behalfe youre greate special doctoure cardinal bessarion bessarion de sacrament eucharistiae beinge selfe greeke borne saithe thus hoc ipse ordo rerum poscebat primum consecrare deinde frangere postea distribuere quod no praesenti facimus order thinges required firste wee shoulde consecrate circa annum domini blesse breade nexte wee shoulde breake laste al wee shoulde diuide deliuer people vvhiche thinge vve grecian doo present daie thus see hardinge grecian daie consecrate breake diuide sacramente vnto people wee doo therefore vntrue saie haue daie youre priuate masse touching grecian liue nowe venice order thei vse cannot tellepriuate masse greke churche notwithstandinge haue hearde saie priuate masse haue haue liuinge vnder pope iurisdiction marueile certaine venice parte grecia matthias illyricusmatthi illyricus testibus veritatis pag beinge selfe borne dalmatia farre confines border grecia therefore maie thought better acquainted theire order saith thus ecclesia graeca ei que coniunctae asiatica macedonica mysica valachica rutenica moschouitica aphricana id est totus mundus vel certe eius maximum par nunquam primatum papae communi consensu concesserunt nunquam purgatorium probauerunt nunquam priuatas missas nunquam communionem sub vna specie churche grecia church asia macedonia mysia valachia russia moschouia aphrica ioined thereunto saie manner whole worlde leaste greateste parte thereof neuer graunted pope supremacie neuer allowed either purgatorie priuate mass communion vnder one kinde proeme entrie councel ferrariaconcil ferrari prooemio written thus proxima dominica quindecim graeci sacerdotes domi imperatoris iussu eius missam solenniter celebrarunt vbi etiam marchio cum suis ciuibus adfuit panem benedictum per patriarchae dextram graecorum accepit que libauit nexte sonnedaie fiftiene greeke priestes within emperours palaice commaundemente saide solemne masse communion marquese present cittizens manner grecian receiued tasted breade consecrate hande patriarke noted waie fiftiene priestes saide fiftiene seueral mass al togeather one onely massepetrus vrbeuetanus vita deusdedit pap one masse priuate ministration communion whereof petrus vrbeuetanus saithe thus tum ad instar graecorum non cantabatur vna ecclesia nisi forsan vna missa songe one churche sauinge perchaunce one onely masse manner grecian likewise saithe durandus offerebant magnum panem omnibus sufficientem quod adhuc graeci seruare dicuntur offered vp one greate loafe duradus rationali li might suffice al churche vvhiche order thei saie grecian keepe vntil daie fewe truste hardinge maie soone appeare whether v haue belied youre poore grecian apologie cap diuision nowe since manifeste al peraduenture menne fallen greekes whome thei receiued gospel thei receiued faith true religion churche selfe mater thei wil called home againe men theire originalles firste founder thei afraide take paterne apostle olde father time though thei al hadde benne voide vnderstandinge doo menne weene yee see sette churche god thei firste deliuered v thinges hardinge softe faire sir defender haue yet proued saie manifeste al peraduenture remember olde homely verse youre sophistrie neque negatiuis recte concludere si vi speake pourpose el woulde woulde make ende youre filly folly deede trifle saie nothinge worth answeared litle cause doo minister vnto vtter substantial stuffe vvhiche desire discrete reader consider mine excuse trifler doo also trifle b sarisburie hardinge youre owne confession yee doo trifle youre filly folly trowe youre substantial better stuffe yet ready apologie cap diuision deede haue renounced churche wherein wee could neither haue woorde god sincerely taught sacramentes rightly administred name god duely called vpon whiche churche also selues confesse bee faulty many pointes wherein nothinge hable staie wise man one hath consideration owne safetie hardinge haue ye renounced churche ye might suffered sette foorthe losse christen soules detestable heresy vvicklef luther zuinglius caluine youre false maisters whiche ye cal youre sincere woorde god youre schismatical heretical manner ye saie nothinge catholique churche hable staie wise man hath consideration safetie one youre impudent lie bothe wise menne churche greate multitude sutche hadde good regarde soule healthe alwaies deuil hadde sutche hande vpon luther reste youre newe apostle apostate apologie cap diuision conclude wee haue foresaken churche nowe olde time paste haue gonne daniel went lion denne three child furnesse saie truthe haue benne caste menne beinge cursed thei vse saie booke bel candel rather haue gonne awaie selues hardinge churche nowe churche olde time one quid obest homini si eum de illa tabula delere velit humana ignorantia quem de libro viuentium non delet iniqua conscientia man woorse ignorance man strike booke churche il conscience strike oute booke life case augustine saithe commeth sommetimes passe vt plurimae sint foris oues plurimi sint intus lupi many sheepe without churche many woulues within churche apologie cap diuision wee comme churche wherein thei selues cannot denie thei wil saie truely thei thinke owne conscience al thinges bee gouerned purely reuerently mutche wee possibly coulde neere order vsed olde time hardinge ye ignorance onely wee exhorte better satisfaction theire conscience reade scripture therein learne good wil god withstandinge ye maie allowe iudges yt saie discerne bitweene light god darkenesse yet yee might suffer pike vp somme smal crommes fal lordes table socrates saithapolog sacratis matth simple vnlearned people case truthe iudgeth oftentimes vprightly deepest philosopher likewise christe saithe thanke thee father thou hast hidde thinges wise politique hast opened littel babe ye wil saie scripture harde aboue reache people euen saide ye pelagian heretique iulianus therefore augustine thus reproueth augusti contra iulian li ca exaggeras quam sit difficilis paucis que conueniens erudiris sanctarum cognitio literarum yee enlarge laie many wordes harde mater knowledge scripture meete onely fewe learned men chrysostome saith scripturae seruochrysostom matth homil rustico viduae puero illi qui valde imprudens esse videatur faciles sunt ad intelligendum scripture easy sclaue husbandeman widovve childe maie seeme simple vnderstandinge augusti episc augustine saithe modus ipse dicendi quo sacrum scriptura cotexitur c quasi amicus familiaris sine fuco ad cor loquitur indoctorum que doctoru phrase maner speache wherein ye scripture writte c speaketh wtout coloure familiare frend vnto hart wel ye vnlearned learned cyril saithe cyrillus contra iulian lib scripturae vt omnibus essent notae paruis magnis vtiliter familiari sermone commendatae sunt ita vt nullius captum trascendant scripture might easy al menne wel smal greate profitably set abroade familiare speache ouerreache mannes capacitie augustine saith sunt quidam hominesaugu psal qui cum audierint quod debent esse humiles nihil volunt discere putantes quod si aliquid didicerint superbi erunt c ho reprehendit scriptura somme menne heare saie muste lowly wil learne nothing thinking learne thinge shalbe prowde reproued scripture likewise againe augustine saithe augu seten exceptis ex augustino pa ipsa ignorantia illis qui intelligere noluerunt sine dubitarione peccatum est eis autem qui non potuerunt est poena peccati ergo vtris que non est excusatio sed iusta damnatio ignorance woulde vnderstande without doubte sinne coulde vnderstande punishement sinne therefore neither bothe hath good excuse either hath iuste damnation apologie cap diuision desire haue cause knowen al worlde flee comme trial hardinge came ye thea vvoorthy councel fourtie bishop sutche vvere time paulus chiefe moste lauful consistorie worlde late general councel trent vvhat trial shoulde come vnto doctrine hath high teacher tried men nowe hath ben approued longe put daieinge day later ende worlde b sarisburie wee made appearance late chapter tridente ye haue already made excuse iourney loge taken vaine ye saie doctrine right wronge maie nowe tried put daieinge saide sommetimes olde donatiane heretiques vnto augustine disputare nolumus augu epist baptizare volumus dispute wee wil continewe erroure baptize wee wil apologie cap diuision leane vnto knowledge vnto ignorance truste vnto light vnto darkenesse hardinge ye leane fauoure secular prince flattery heresie ye may deceiue crake greate knowledgeesai light crieth lorde esaie saie good euil euil good put light darkenes darkenes light demeanour euil doctrine false tongue railinge take worde slaunder b sarisburie wee flatter prince hardinge nathan flattered kinge dauid iohn baptiste flattered herode ambrose flattered theodosius salte flattereth greene soare deede wee despise minister god sundrie felowes haue vsed doedorman pag stanislaus orichonius chimaera one doubteth saie pope heade kinges emperours feete saithe prieste farre aboue kinge man aboue beaste sutche woordes contempt villanie haue vsed wee yelde kinge dewe kinge wee yelde god dewe god wee saie princeambros lib epist ambrose sommetime saide emperoure valentinian noli te grauare imperator vt putes te ea quae diuina sunt imperiale aliquod ius habere trouble selfe flattering prince lorde thinke haue princely power ouer thinges perteine god flatterer humbly aduertise directe theire liege prince woorde god petr de palude de potestat pp non no glossa extrauag iohan um inter glossa hostien de traslaitone praelais quanto saie saie totus mundus non potest accusare papam nemo potest dicere papae domine cur ita facis sacrilegij instar esset disputare de facto papae dominus deus noster papa papapotest quicquid deus ipse potest whole world maie accuse pope maie saie pope sir doo yee thus sinne bodde sacrilege dispute pope doinges lorde god pope pope maie doo euer god selfe maie doo hardinge thousand like speaches maie seeme sommewhat smel flatterie apologie cap diuision reuerence becommeth v writinges apostle prophetes burne finally goddes cause desire stande goddes onely iudgemente wil stande onely theire owne hardinge vvhat euer ye pretende cause ye haue taken hande defende god cause neither stirrehosiuscontra brentu lib whiche ye make worlde christes sake uther himselfe disputation doctor eckius inflamed anger passinge boundes modestie admonished certaine mutche god cause treated handle matter soberly spirite softenes brake wordes non propter deu haecres caepta est nec propter deum finietur mater begone god sake neither god sake shal ended therefore speake v god cause cause ye moue doo ye doovntruthe sta dinge open vvilful corruption b sarisburie luther yee saie disputation enflamed anger passed boundes modestie doubte hardinge somme parte sobrietie modestie might haue donne greate deale better touchinge mater zelously moued iniquitie wicked wilfulnesse aduersaries vttered wordesiacobus andreae contra hosium pag selfe freere eckius disputed eckius felowes neuer beganne mater goddes sake goddes sake wil ende sawe begonne bente ende againste god beinge enflamed ambition malice procured hired pope euen hardinge maie wee also truely saie felowes haue begonne contentious vanity goddes sake goddes sake wil ende apologie cap diuision wherefore thei wil weigh al thinges quiet minde fully bente heare learne thei wil onely allowe determination whoe haue foresaken errours folowed christe apostle themselues also wil foresake owne selues ioine theire owne accorde side goe v endeth fifthe parte sixthe parte apologie cap diuision bvt peraduenture wil saie treason attempt mater without sacred general councel therein consisteth whole force churche christe hath promised wil euer presente assistant yet themselues without tarrienge general councel haue broken commaundementes god decree apostle wee said little aboue haue spoiled disanulled almoste al onely ordinaunces euen doctrine primitiue churche saie lawful make chaunge without councel gaue v lawes whence iniunction hardinge general councels continewe estimation auctoritie haue euer theire priuate conspiracy false conueiances corner like dasshed nowe pri keth foorth theire secretary thinketh self fresh souldier rhetorike geueth onsette vpon v blinde peraduenture sir euer imagine v saie touchinge general councel simple graunt whiche peraduenture semeth surmise v heretical moste vngodly matter whiche speake might without blame attempted licence councel sutche wicked change religion ye haue made neither lawful make councel without councel apologie cap diuision deede king agesilaus fondely determinate answeare made opinion wil mighty iuppiter woulde afterwarde bringe whole matter apollo knowe whether woulde allowe thereof father iuppiter donne yet shoulde wee doo mutche fondely heare god selfe plainely speake v holy scripture maie vnderstande wil meaninge wee would afterwarde though none effecte bring whole cause tried councel nothinge el aske whether menne would allowe god whether menne woulde confirme goddes commaundemente theire authoritie hardinge mutche scripture wherein god speaketh vnto v sundrie place moste open plaine tovaine folie vvhat haue humaine natural sens doo vvith sense god humaine sens many mistakinge deceiued wel done suretie better vnderstandinge ye goe meane matter concerninge religionto take counsel men folowe iudgemente catholike churche represented general councels yea saie boldely surer pointes faithe leane thethe expositios father seldome agree togeat er yet parte contrarie churche rome exposition father agreinge togeather folowe tradition churche trust selues letter scripture scanned onely owne wittes churche promised lead al truthe holy ghost ye cannot saie promise hath ben made particulare company therefore fondly done ye saie wisely saie ye tried examined doctrine ye pretende according vnto scripture thethe tradit novve vsed romaine churche co co trarie traditios anciente learned father therefore rule deceitetul rule ecclesiastical tradition chiefe rule trie euery doctrine b sarisburie wee neuer despised iudgemente learned holy father rather take embrace witness goddes truthe therein wee finde blame woorthy hardinge hauinge without cause renounced iudgemente order primitiue churche anciente father wise learned maie soone appeare yet neuerthelesse yee euermore make vaunte antiquitie fraie world visarde churche shewe olde father poore sommonere loste commission would serue citation vertue emptie bore thus haue ye set al vaine fantasy place goddes churche churche place god woordes witnesse owne felowes haue shewed largeparte ca diui nic cusanus de authoritate ecclisiae c hierem example cardinal cusanus saith nulla sunt christi praecepta nisi quae per ecclesiam pro talibus accepta sunt commaundementes christe commaundementes onlesse allowed churche thus yee leaue iuppiter renne apollo rather yee foresake god seeke man written prophete hieremie yee leaue fountaine water life rippe vp broken filthy cesternes holde water tertullian thus vpbraideth heathen tertullian apologetico clemens alexa drin oratione ad genie chryso epist ad galat ca apud vos de humano arbitratu diuinitas pensitatur emonge right god weighed iudgemente menne clemens alexandrinus saithe quoniam ipsum verbum ad no venit de coelo est nobis amplius eundum ad humanam doctrinam mutche worde selfe christe comme v heauen wee maie nowe seeke vnto doctrine man likewise chrysostome saithe fuisset extremae absurditatis eum qui edoctus fuerat deo postea cum hominibus communicate benne greate folie paule hauing receiued doctrine god selfe afterward conferre thereof menne saie peter iames others apologie cap diuision beseche except councel wil commaunde shal truthe truthe god god christe meante doo beginninge woulde preache teache nothinge without bishoppes consente referre al doctrine ouer anna caiphas shoulde nowe haue benne christian faithe time shoulde haue hearde gospel taught peter verily pope hath oftener mouthe reuerently vseth speake dooth iesus christe boldely stand holy councel saieing better obey god men paule entierely embraced gospel receiued menne man onely vvil god take aduise therein fleash bloude brought case kinnesmen brother wente foorthewith arabia preache goddes diuine mystery goddes onely authoritie hardinge occupie flute better reade shal geue ouer pipinge floutinge truthe truthe god god whether councel wil nil mary truthe god euery councel lawfully assembled hath wil againste truth god hath nil vvhen ye proue vnto v ye specially called paule haue special commissionvvee preache againste folie fantasy againste doctrine churche preache againste doctrine churche againste wicked iewes god name take aduise man forthwith preache crieout lowde ye liste ye goe arabia paule el euer ye wil euery good man would lothe england troubled apologie cap diuision yet truely doo despise councelles assembly conference bishoppes learned mene neither haue donne haue donne altogeather without bishoppes without councel matter hath benne treated open parlamente longe consultation notable synode conuocation hardinge either tonge agreeth harte el wil proue contrarie owne argumentes nexte paragraphe ye haue huddeled vp whereas matter ye ordinarily saie euident plaine scripture vvoorde god readen euery man without distinction limitation therefore ye firste al plaie fonde parte kinge agesilaus receiuinge answeare mighty iupiter woulde afterwarde bringe matter apollo yea furthermore ye mutche fondely ye maie heare god selfe speake plainely moste holy scripture ye woulde bringe whole cause tried councel howe saie ye nowe owne proper reason c foresaid worshipful reason c ye meane reason ye muste parlamentes later day firste al make moste yet open ye place al vvere ye admitted within dores ye thing assemblie cosider consult atio purpose concluded tarie many monethes bishopsvntruthe enclosed diuines solemne disputation vvas appointed vveasteminster presece state realme felovves fladde diuines moste lerned reason fro al libertie vvas authoritie vniuersal churche christe doctrine aunciente father considered ye saie latine plenis comitijs ful whole assemblie though none al resisted euery man yelded matter vvhat saie ye spiritual lordes greate parte parlamente without al doubt parte whiche muste chiefely onely regarded questio religion many gaue voice gospel yea al resist one alone muste confesse afterwarde made breake vnitie right good catholike bishop saide noble man one foole among v ye haue gotten vnto spiritual lordes ye none al except one litle woorthy name bishop lorde whose lerninge smal honoure thereby mutche steined temporal ye al ye also lower howse many wel learned speake againste let v consider notable conuocation whiche matter hath ben treated ye meane cleregie comminge togeather first parlament time whiche speake catholikes sacramentariesparlamente put vp bill againste procedinges farre confirminge ye meane since time whiche superintendentships mette togeather cause notable synode notable conuocation ye desperate lieinge crake full parlament notable synode regardinge meanes ye promote cause multitude saue selues reproche extreme folie otherwise ye whiche amplifie small obscure meetinges fewe caluintstes one litle iland would ye saie laste generall councell whiche nation assembled togeather shyres englande yeeres bestowed consultation weekes full parlamenta notable great copanie vvere onely fouretie poore bishoppes yet somme samevvere bishoppes bishoppes defined subscribed minister sortes notable synode many partes lastly needes haue matter seeme depende parlament let v blamed wee call parlament religion parlament gospell parlamente faithe b sarisburie wee wil discusse right interest parlamentes englande mutche concerneth goddes euerlastinge truthe wee holde parlamente god parlamentes vncertaine often contrarie wee haue seene goddes truthe one certaine neuer changeth thinges suddainely violently shaken downe late time queene marie goddes greate mercie oure moste noble gratious lady queene elizabeth aduisedly soberly reared vp againe thei maie firmely continewe stande better euer wante yee imagine parlamente mutche wee parte thereof truste wee maie easily excused scornefully disdeigninge whole state noble realme yee shal hardely winne opinion either sobrietie greate wisedome bishoppes yee saie withstoode v brother conuocation promoted bille againste oure doctrine know hardinge subscribed againste v handes whiche longe openly protested solemnely sworne againste pope whiche haue sithence receiued embraced whole religion vtter condemnation al folie onely one foole yee saie yee emongest bishoppes soone gotten comme v happy hardinge one foole greate companie somme louanian cleregie benne bishoppes thinke might haue benne sommewhat better stoared notwithstandinge wel donne parte vnciuilely calle brother foole al reste brother fewe excepted haue donne like yet fooles trowe yee wil calle lest happily owne wittes called question yee would seeme saie parlamente holden firste yeere queenes maiesties reigne parlamente bishoppes refused wilfully agree vnto godly lawes concluded ye seeme therein bewraie selfe somme wante skille wise learned coulde soone haue tolde parlamentes englande mater haue euermore vsed passe necessitie special consente archebishoppes bishoppes without statute might lawfully enacted onely parte voice yea although al archebishoppes bishoppes neuer earnestly bente againste statute passinge parlamente onely voice lordes temporal without consente agreemente lordes spiritual haue neuerthelesse alwaies benne confirmed ratified real assente prince haue benne enacted published vnder name lordes spiritual parlamente temporal reade statute kinge idwarde firste shal yee finde parlamente solemnely holden edmundes burie archebishoppes bishoppes quite shutte foorthe yet parlamente helde good wholesome lawes enacted departinge absence malice lordes spiritual notwithstandinge recordes thereof written thusan dom habito rex cum suis baronibus parlamento clero excuso statutum est c kinge keepinge parlamente baron cleregie saie archebishoppes bishoppes beinge shutte foorthe enacted c likewiseanno prouisione de martonae ca prouisione de martona time kinge henry thirde whereas mater moued bastardie touchinge ye legitimation bastardes borne marriage statute paste wholy lordes temporal whether lordes spiritual woulde yea contrarie expresse decreesextra qui filj sint legitimi canon churche rome like hereof enfourmed maie founde richardi ca case must confesse walke sommewhat without compasse touchinge iudgemente hereof referre mee selfe wholy vnto learned whereas ye calle doctrine christe goddes great mercie greate griefe vniuersally freely preached parlamente religion parlamente gospel sutche sobrietie becommeth wel maie stande steede learninge faileth yee mighte haue remembred christe selfe beginninge vniuersally receiued honoured realme assente parlamente without parlamente pope selfe neuer receiued laie time oueene marie yea euen holinesse clogged parlamente condition euer benne determined parlamente repealed neuer contrarie wil canon remaine stil inuiolable stande force otherwise holinesse gonne home againe sutche hardinge authoritie parlamente verily parlamentes realmes parlamentes wil pope pope therefore like sabrietie grauitie speache yee mighte haue saide oure father olde time parlamente christe late father brother parlamente faithe parlamente masse parlamente pope neither strange mater see ecclesiastical cause debated parlamente reade lawes kinge inas kinge elfrede kinge edvvarde kinge ethelstane leges canuti kinge edmunde kinge edgare kinge canute ye shal finde godly forefather prince peeres realme neuer vouchesaued entreate mater peace warre otherwise touchinge common state al controuersies religion cause ecclesiastical benne concluded kinge canute parlamente holden winchester vpon christemasse daie sundrie lawes order made touchinge faithe keepinge holy day publique praiers learninge lordes praier receiuinge communion thrise yeere manner fourme baptisme fastinge like mater religion ende thereof saithe thus sequitur institutio legum saecularium foloweth order temporal lavves thus wee see godly catholique prince olde time thought duetie al affaire common weale firste determine mater religion euen parlamentes realme parlamente holden kinge william conqueroure written thustridetine councel superintendentes rex quia vicarius summi regis est ad hoc constituitur vt regnum populum domini super omnia sanctam ecclesiam regar defendat c kinge mutche vicare highest kinge therefore appointed pourpose shoulde rule defende kingedome people lorde aboue al thinges holy churche c hereby appeareth kinges prince specially pourpose appointed god onely defende also gouerne rule holy churche wee geue god thankes truste owne name sake wil confirme hath begonne harte prince determination parlamentes hande thinge wante arme lorde shortened hable supplie yee magnifie mutche late chapter tridente concil trident sub carolo quinto whiche woulde faine haue called general councel many nation many bishoppes many yeeres consultation yet notwithstandinge al many many nation country maie please sit downe take accoumpte yee shal finde onely poore fourtie bishoppes certaine richarde pate bishop vvoorcester blinde sir roberte robert coecus vide concil trident sub paulo matthias plac illyricus protest contra concil trident pagin archebishop armach onely bare title bishoprikes deede bishoppes twoo others saide many notable learned holy bishoppes beinge saide woorthy coucel euen killed aduouterie one striken downe clubbe taken manoure husbande hanged necke greate lucane windowe streete cause henry frenche nge openly embassadoure protested againste councel presence al many many bishoppes saideio sle danu li anno vvas councel general priuate couente assemblie fevve certaine people summoned togeather gaines sake conuentus quorundam priuatus vtilitatis gratia institut e whereas hath pleased wel el sporte selfe superintendentes superintendentshippes refreashe wittes vaine fansie owne yee benne deepely traueiled doctoures nevve olde ye beare v hande yee mighte easily haue knowen superintendente anciente name signifieth none augustin de ciuit li ca augustin psalm bishop augustine saithe vocabulum episcopatus inde ductum est quod ille qui praeficitur eis quibus praeficitur superintendit ergo nonlatin alphabet latine dicere possumus superintendere againe saithe quod graece dicitur episcopus hoc latine superintentor interpretatur chrysostome saithe chrysostom ad timoth hom hieronym ad uagrium anselm ad philippen ca beda petri petrus de palude de potest colla apostolis arti episcopus ex eo dicitur quod omnes inspiciat hierome saithe nonlatin alphabet id est superintendentes anselimus saithe episcopus latine superintendens dicitur beda likewise saithe episcopus latine superintendens dicitur petrus de palude saithe episcopus dicitur superintendens et petrus fuit superintendens toti mundo peter superintendente whole worlde owne thomas aquine saith episcopi dicuntur ex eo quod superintendunt therefore hardinge modestie moue yet leaste grauities sake leaue plaieinge vaine childishe folie bishoppes englande haue daie onely name also roume authoritie iurisdiction bishoppes haue euer thom quae ar apologie cap diuision touchinge councel whiche nowe sommoned pope pius wherein menne lightly condemned beinge neither calledal soares salued councel tridente hearde seene easy gheasse maie looke hope hardinge generall councell trente length god speciall fauour concluded ended vvhat haue ye saie forbeare accustomed lyinge haue ye saie forvntruthes open vvithout example stevves courteghianes fornication vvere neuer touched matter faithe sounde true maners sore lacketh due salue discipline disorder hath holesome restrainctes punishmentes vvhat defectes prouidently considered supplied vvhat abuse required taken waie farre man wiste coulde deuise weakenesse presente age beare b sarisburie al mater fully answeared vvhat vvhat vvhat mater faithe vvhat manner vvhat disorder vvhat defectes vvhat abuse al vvhattes notwithstanding vvhat pope cardinalles cleregie whole disorder romaine churche many priestes keepinge concubine many non residentes many doumbe bishoppes many thousandes common harlottes case euen wil yee telle v neuerthelesse al soares sufficiently salued muste wee beleue keepinge concubine open stewes fornication c soares verily bernarde saithebernard cantica sermo hulcote lib sapien lectio bernard conuers pauli bapt mantuan fastor lib ad leonem concil trident alleged intestina insanabilis est plaga ecclesiae wounde churche bleedeth inwardely past cure againe planta pedis v que ad verticem capitis non est ea sanitas whole parte churche sole foote toppe heade baptista mantuanus saith aegrotatque fides iam proxima morti faithe romaine churche sicke almoste deade olde latine translation bible sundrie errours open grosse babe maie soone espie maie plainely appeare budaeus erasmus valla faber lindanus others yet notwithstandinge councel saithe precisely thus ne quis veterem vulgaram editionem reijcere quouis praetextu audeat vel praesumat lette man dare presume manner coloure refuse olde common translation bible councelles yourposely summoned mainteine errours yee wil wilfully deceiue v sensible mater maie wee truste mater faithe apologie cap diuision time past nazianzene sawe day menne sutche assembly blinde wilful carried affectionsnazian ad procopium laboured geate victorie truthe pronounced openly neuer seene good ende councel would saie nowe aliue daie vnderstoode heauinge shouinge menne time though matter laboured al side yet controuersies wel hearde open errours put cleane awaie general voice al partes menne wil neither haue case freely disputed yet many errours soeuer suffer changed common custome often shamelesly boaste churche cannot erre faulte muste geeue place v nothinge faulte yet muste tried bishoppes abbates onely bicause directours ruler mater churche god aristotle saithe cittie cannot consiste bastardes whether churche god maie consiste menne lette selues consider doubtelesse neither theire abbates abbates deede bishoppes natural right bishoppes hardinge gregorie nazianzene epistle procopius saithe thus refuse come whatsoeuer councell bishoppes coulde neuer yet daie see ende councell ende wed profite whiche thinges amisse rather made greuous healed nazianzene epistle spake ofvntruthe speaketh al manner councelles vvel general prouincial vvoordes prorsus decreui fugere omnem conuentum episcoporu prouinciall councelles specially holden troublesome time commonly heretikes fauour deceiued prince bare swea vvhiche matter faithe coulde hardely obteine credite amonge catholikes onlesse benne confirmed auctoritie bishop rome whiche sorte age fewe nazianzene experience albeit deede vtilitie nicence councell time saie within fewe yeeres holden yet thoroughly espied fully knowen abroade neither would aliue daie reproue holy generall councell trente ye doo shoulde lusty kinde diuinitie shamelesse ye require v yelde geue place vnto vvho made iudges ouer v vvho gaue commission vvhere warrant vvhat neede ye shewe malice muche bishoppes abbattes vvhiche hurteth haue ye prison custodyvntruthe committed onely appointemente prince appointement bishoppes england one apostata yet liuinge excepted sundry flightes changinge cote fledde tentes churche scattered troupe abbottes haue ye driuen awaie ye yet fraide shadowes aristotle cittie consiste bastardes nomore churche englande consiste suche bastarde bishoppes ye number abbottes ye haue lefte cloister suche number true bishoppes haue yee lefte church one muste still except true bishop consecration vnderstande though false man apostasie goinge faithe religion b sarisburie touchinge vnlucky successe councelles ancient father nazianzene saithe thusgregor nazianzenus ad procopium nonlatin alphabet equidem vt vere quod re est scribam prorsus decreui fugere omnem conuentum episcoporum nullius enim concilij bonum exitum vnquam vidi concilia enim non minuunt mala sed augent potius saie truthe vtterly determined neuer comme councel bishoppes neuer yet sawe good ende councel councelles abate il thinges rather increase woordes thus vttered whether vniuersally true otherwise wil reason maie seeme hereby learned father time experience founde true ought maie appeare contrarie notwithstandinge thinge conteined glose seemeth vtter wel general councelles prouincial certainely greate general councel nice arian heretiques waxed moe mighty euer benne emperours constantius valens wiues courtes became arians constantinus greate selfe also doubted arian successe councels monkes abbates liberius bishop rome hosius famous learned bishop spaine gaue handes vnto arians tenne seueral sundrie prouincial councelles gaue voice arians hierome saithe ingemuit totus orbis arianum se esse miratus est whole wordle beganne groane marueiled taken parte arians therefore nazianzene saithe neuer sawe councel sozomenus hieronym aduersus luciferianos prouincial general ended wel one saithe greater side oftentimes ouer vveigheth better euen saide frenche kinges embassadoure behalfe prince chapter tridente nostra patrumque nostrorum auorum memoria synodos indictas fuisse episcopos conuenisse tit liuius maior par vincit meliorem maximos germania que italia conuetus peractos esse scimus vix tamen vllus aut perexiguus inde fructus christianitati constirit wee knowe bothe grandfather father oure owne time councelles haue benne summoned oratio synodica legati regis franciae bishoppes haue mette togeather greate solemne assembly haue benne keapte wel germanie italie yet scarcely good al litle good came thereof state christendome concerninge abbates monastery wee haue saide wee haue many abbates englande daie either christe euer apostle notwithstandinge one learned felowes louaine good wil beareth religion copus fol telleth v apostle vvere monkes christe himselfe abbate abbates monkes olde time menne geuen studieaugust epist august epist learninge monastery learned menne taken schooles vniuersities rule gouernemente churche abbates nowe mutche like abbates churche like primitiue churche christe erasmus saithe erasm scholijs epistolam ad rusticum monachum haud scio nunc magi expediret ecclesiae christianae si pauciora essent monasteria esset que omnium idem cultus eaedem que preces eadem que vitae ratio knowe whether better churche christe fewer monastery al menne one seruice god one kinde praier one order life apologie cap diuision graunte churche let hearde speake councelles let alone haue authoritie geeue consente yet olde time churche god ye wil compare churche wel gouerned bothe elder deacon saithe cyprian certaine also common people called thereunto made acquainted ecclesiastical mater hardinge ah syrs woulde ye haue common people come generall councell vvhom meane ye praie tinker tapster fydlers pypers suche minister ala poore soules doo tinking tipplinge fidlinge pypinge may shutte vp bothe budget mouthes neither speake suche audience vnderstanded vnderstande spoken looke bookes better shall finde cyprian make litle purpose mater benne good might haue benne defended without lie beinge altogeather beside truthe reason colour mainetenance ye passe measure lieinge vvhere saithe cyprian certaine common people called ecclesiasticall councelles yea specially saithe he cyprian vvoordes plaine nihil sine consensu plebis c lib epist common people made iudges ecclesiasticall matterspriestes vnlearned hath latine whiche without guile lady interpreter commonly tourneth made acquainted eclcesiasticall matter meante true dealinge defender would haue quoted place knewe thereby falsehead shoulde haue benne espiedyour deceiueth place whiche meane doubtles seconde tome cyprian woorkes finde sentence bishoppes aphrike de haereticis baptizandis vvhiche proueth straunge saieinge fathered vpon holy martyr nothinge al woordes cum vnum carthagini conuenissent c vvhen many bishoppes firste daie september assembled together carthage prouince aphrike numidia mauritanta priestes deacon parte people also beinge presente c gather pourpose greate number people presente onely churche place bishoppes assembled certaine common people called councell suche woorde mentioned cyprian elsvntruthes boldely auouched reade ivveare neither priestes selues youthfull gentil woman interpreteth elder deacon called thither attended vpon bishoppes case hath benne accustomed sentence none might geue councell onely bishoppes howe muche lesse common people called councell specially sitte iudges ecclesiasticall matter mary woulde haue thinke well suche confusion mighte beste serue procure ouerthrowe good order whiche churche gouerned whiche maineteined duely disordered rebellious state soone confounded b sarisburie tinker tapster hardinge ashamed behalfe see folie poore seely iester winne dinner woulde lothe scoffe coldely certaine cleregie wante knowlege rhetorique logique philosophie hebrevve greeke latine tongue therefore yee calle tinker tapster sutche sobrietie modestie talke schoole tongue priestes hardinge parte neither speake latine reade englishe vnderstande article faithe portion scripture clovvdes without raine lanternes without lighte salte without sauoure blinde guide dombe dogges one saithe seeme haue soules geuen steede salte keepe stinkinge arte occupation hede con dist retulerunt iulius pp alphon lib cap baptized childe latine sorte nomine patria filia spirita sanctum skilful clerke pope iulius assigninge warrante steede fiat wrote fiatur owne doctour alphonsus de castro saith constat plures papa adeo illiteratos esse vt grammaticam penit u ignorent moste certaine many pope vnlearned vtterly ignorante grammar beinge vtterly ignorant grammare rule beseche profounde science logique philosophi felinus de rescriptis si quan yee praise doctoures saithe papa propter defectum literaturae non potest deponi pope maie deposed lacke learninge saie pope though neuer ignorante voide knowledge yet good pope beste doctours saith aureum speculum antilogia venalitate curia romanae inaniter praeficiuntur lenones coqui stabularij equorum pueri bribene courte rome baudes cooke hostler child placed office gouerne churche shal wee therefore saie saie al priestes fidlers piper tinker tapster somme certaine oure cleregie ignorante tongue ignorante knowledge corin woorste seeth lamenteth wilful ignorance priestes vnlearned augustine saithe multo minus malum est indoctum esseaugust contra academic li ca quam indocilem leasse hurte vnlearned wilful vnapte learne irenaeus saithe melius est vtilius idiotas parum scientes existereirenae lib ca per charitatem proximos deo fieri quam putare se multum scire multa expertos suum deum blasphemos inueniri better greate deale menne ignorante knowe litle loue drawe neare god thinke selues knowe mutche haue greate experience yet founde blasphemer againste god ambrose saithe ambros de fide li cap non dialectica complacuit deo saluum facere populum suum regnum enim dei simplicitate fidei est non contentione sermonis pleased god logique saue people kingedome god standeth contention talke ambros de incarnatione domini ca simplicitie faithe likewise saith verba philosophorum excludit simplex veritas piscatoru simple plaine faithe fisher confoundeth woordes learned philosopher ancient father origen saithe sapientes huius saeculiorigen cantica homili videntes ab que arte grammatica peritia philosophica consurgere muros euangelij v lut cum irrisione quadam dicunt perfacile hoc posse destrui calliditate sermonum per astutas fallacias argumeta dialectica wise menne world seeinge walles gospel rise vp without grammare profounde knowledge philosophie saie scornefully emongest selues al suttletie speache crafty shiftes logical argumentes maie ful easily shaken downe appeareth councelles carthage conci carthag et concil hippon hippo regius olde time child vnder fouretene yeeres age admitted reader churche notwithstandinge either theire age wante learninge people wel contented silence reuerence geue eare vnto chrysostome saithe chrysostom gene homi humanis negotijs quando rex diademate coronatus c euen worldly affaire kinge sendeth soorthe proclamation currer pourseuante oftentimes man smal accoumpte sommetime base neuer knewe owne father grandefather receiue proclamation haue regarde vnto brought notwithstandinge respecte kinges letter brought geue honoure silence reuerence geue attendance proclamation simple vnlearned one whome disdainefully despise shal rise vp daie lorde condemne al knowledge god hable make poore asse speake numer hieronym psalm controlle blinde balaams wilful pourposes hierome saithe paulus qui soloecismos facit loquendo christi crucem portat quasi triumphans omnes capit totum orbem subegit ab oceano vsque ad mare rubrum paule hable vtter minde congrue speache beareth croise christe taketh al menne prisoner triuphe occean vnto redde sea subdewed whole worlde likewise ambrose saithe non quaeroambrosi ad grattanum de fide lib ca quid loquantur philosophi requiro quid faciant solo suis gymnasijs remanserunt vide quam fides argumentis praeponderet illi quotidie suis consortibus deseruntur qui copiose disputant isti quotidie crescunt qui simpliciter credunt non creditur philosophis creditur piscatoribus demaunde greate learned philosopher saie doo foresaken leafte alone theire schooles beholde howe mutche weight faithe argumentes theire profounde reason daiely foresaken theire felowes simple faithe goe forewarde encrease daily menne beleeue learned philosopher beleeue vnlearned fisher priestes yee saie youtheful gentlevvooman interpreteth elder om hardinge litle needeth godly learned vertuous lady feare vumanly childishe toy yee benne either sagely studied ye pretende frendes thought havepriestes deacon laie menne coucelles yee might soone haue learned presbyter prieste nothinge el senior elder therefore whereas paule saithe aduersus presbyterum accusationem ne admiseris cyprian translatinge saith thus aduersus maiorem natu accusatione ne receperis owne doctoure thomas aquin saith presbyteri graeco dicuntur quasi seniores timoth nonlatin alphabet owne gratian saithe presbyter graece latine senior interpretatur hierome saith idem est presbyter qui episcopus twoo woordes nonlatin alphabet cypria ad quirinum li ca expounded latine natu maior natu maximus plutarchus saithe nonlatin alphabet olde tree nazianzene saithe nonlatin alphabet goeinge staffe olde menne vse doo thereforethomas secundae secundae quast arti hardinge benne grauitie haue spared youtheful folie yee saie priestes deacon waited onely vpon bishoppes sentence councel thei might geue none dist cl ro hieronym ad titum cap plutarch publicola tale true hardinge euery woorde gospel luke woulde haue tolde far otherwise speakinge first christian councel holden apostle time saith thus conuenerunt apostoli seniores vt dispicerent de hoc negotio apostle elder mette togeather take order touchinge mater againe conclusion placuit apostolisactorum nicephorus li cap senioribus cum tota ecclesia seemed good apostle elder togeather whole churche nicephorus saith athanasius inter diaconos alexandriae primarius minimum pa nicenae synodi athanasius beinge bishop one chiefe deacon alexandria least parte councel nicetertullian apologetico tertullian saith praesident probati qui que seniores honorem istu pretio sed testimonio adepti judge sutche ecclesiastical assembly beste allowed elder hauinge obteined honoure monie witnesse brother concil nicen actio seconde councel nice petrus protopresbyter petrus presbyter beinge bishoppes onely priestes sente thither adrianus bishop rome gaue assentes subscribed name al bishoppes touchinge cyprian yee saie grauitie modestie leadeth vvee lie without coloure passe measure lieinge menne doo goe gheasse answeare longe thei knowe yee finde place cyprian wee thought vpon affiance thereof yee blowe vp trumpe cal v liers wise menne thinke hasty iudge pronounceth knowe causecyprian lib epist cyprian saithe primordio episcopatus mei statui nihil sine consilio vestro sine consensu plebis mea priuatim sententia gerere firste entringe bishoprike haue determined doo nothinge mine owne authoritie without ad se priestes deacon without consente people dooinge contrarie hereof anciente father origen rebuketh bishoppes pride statelinesse thus saithe quis hodie corum origen exodum homil qui populis praesunt consilium dignatur inferioris saltem sacerdotis accipere ne dixerim laici vel getilis one adaies al bishoppes haue ouersighte people vouch saueth take councel inferioure prieste wil saie laie man heathen ambrose touchinge case faithe againste arians ambros lib epi saithe thus veniant si qui sunt ad ecclesiam audiant cum populo non vt quisquam iudex resideat sed vt vnusquisque de suo affectu habeat examen let comme churche let geue care hearken people man shal sitte iudge euery man maie haue examination ovvne minde conclude owne pope nicolas writinge vnto michael greeke emperoureepist nicolai pp ad imp michaelem saithe thus vbinam legistis imperatores antecessores vestros synodalibus conuentionibus interfuisse nisi forte quibusdam vbi de fide tractatum est quae vniuersalis est quae omnium communis est quae non solum ad clericos verumetiam ad laicos ad omnes omnino pertinet christianos maiestie euer reade predecessoures beinge emperoures euer presente assembly councelles onlesse question moued concerninge faithe faithe vniuersal common al menne belongeth onely priestes also laie menne generally al christian hereof wee shal haue occasion speake hereafter apologie cap diuision put case abbates bishoppes haue knowlege vnderstande nothinge religion howe ought thinke god put case pronouncinge ministringe lawe decaied priestes good counsel faile eldersmicheae prophete micheas saith night vnto steede vision darkenesse steede prophesienge psal esaias saithe vvhat al vvatchemen cittie become blinde vvhat salte haue loste propre strength sauerinessematth christe saithe good vse scante vvoorthe castinge dounghil hardinge worlde knoweth well yea heauen also greate woorthinesse father euery respect doo wronge praise fonde surmise seeke dispraise b sarisburie heauenmatthias flacius illyricus protestatione contra concil triden pag earthe knoweth hardinge twoo reuerende vvoorthy father notwithstandinge vertues al greate woorthinesse taken slaine aduouterie euen presente councel therefore yee doo selfe somme wronge respecte credite wastefully bestowe praise apologie cap diuision wel yet wil bringe al matter pope cannot erre saie firste madnesse thinke holy ghoste taketh flight general councel renne rome ende doubt sticke matter cannot expounde selfe maie take counsel somme sprite wote better learned selfe true needed many bishoppes greate charge farre iorneies haue assebled conuocation present tridente yt hadde benne wisedome better least benne mutche nearer handsommer waie haue brought al thinges rather pope haue comme streight foorthe haue asked counsel diuine breaste secondly also vnlawful dealinge tosse mater many bishoppes abbates bringe laste trial one onely man specially selfe appeached v hainous foule enormity hath yet put answeare hath also aforehande condemned v without iudgement order pronounced ere euer called iudged hardinge vve maie lesse wonder iestinge thinges sithe wee set scoffe ieste thinges touchinge god selfe syr set lighte holy ghostevve honour adoure holy ghoste god shamefully abuse name god thus vnreuerently talke flight runninge rome doubtinge stickinge vnablenesse declare doubtfull case askinge counsell spirite vvho euer vttered suche vile talke holy ghost vile caitife quite voide grace conceiue reasonably determination councels referred pope christes vicare earthe onlesse ye vtter suche vnreuerent prophane scoffes become wicked celsus porphyrius iulian thus talke rather christian hickescorner leste haue looked square cappe white rochet haue nothinge el woulde haue tolde suche prophane lightnesse became person concerninge pointe selfe touchevntruthes hudled togeather vvithout shame although pope haue priuiledge whiche christe praied father geuen vnto peterluke beinge peter successour faith faile confirme brother therefore assured iudge matter faithe yet notwithstandinge councels assembled togeather vaine father councell dooa sage kinde mockerie doothe pope confirme brother rather confirmed brother helpe faithe doctrine highest pastour vvherefore firste councell ierusalemact greate question rose peter saide iudgement propped testimonie holy scripture iames approued addinge thereto testimony prophetes god prouidence tendereth churche chiefeby diuinitie iames vvas member peter member though depende head yet defende healpe head vvherefore seda admonisheth discretelylib retra act apostolorum paule conferred gospel preached amongest gentile apostle seekinge warely resolued whether preached rightly ceassinge obseruances lawe doubted ought thereof himselfe saithe mindes doubte might confirmed auctoritie apostolike councell alleage secondly greate inconuenience wee tell forasmuch pope euery generall councell laufully assembled either person sundry pope haue benne legatesvvisely holy ghoste presente councel better aduise taketh cou sel pope neither vnlaufull dealinge suche tossinge terme matter maturely debated councell referred pope head councell muche newe triall finall confirmation father nicene councell besought syluestes ordeined would confirme ratifie leo thinges councell chalcedon decreed touchinge matter faithe saithe approueth councel selfe speakinge leo saithe thus decretis tuis nostrum honora iudicium vvith thy decree honour iudgement likewise father councels required constitution strengthened confirmation pope auctoritie sir finde faulte pope hath yet put answeare praie youthe vvhole vvorlde accuseth accused vvhere whereof laufull courte laufull iudge saie hath yet put answeare hicke hob han sectes haue impudently accused would ye haue bringe answere seate iudgmente consistorie ye cite christe appointeda foule vntruthe christe neuer gaue pope sutche commission supreme iudge churche sheepeherde flo ke know bringe answere vveshminster haull sterre chamber vvill ye haue appeare high commissioner longe chappell powles crindalles chamber thereby ye haue saide donne pleasure depriued many honest menne benefice ye rather haue come geneuathe sprite councelles zurich frankforde strasburg vvittenberg corner ye haue congregation iudged iacke gille pitie poore soules yee talke thus farre square woulde pope bringe answeare ye knowe hauinge neither iuste courte consistorie call vnto laufull iudge lawe passe vpon schismes heresy ye haue made selues churchelesse christlesse godlesse also courtlesse iudgelesse lawlesse compare better rebelles northfolke vnder captaine kete amongest mount surrey london oke elme commonly called tree reformation vvestminster halle suche prince dominion iudge consistorie ye complaine pope hath condemned without iudgement order pronounced yee euer called iudged true murderer theefe answeareth iudge barre saieinge gilty lorde ye haue benne sundry time called laufull consistory synodes councels alwaies either ye made appearance right safeconduct conueyed selues away without shewe obedience vpon promise amendement dimissed many legate nuncio haue sundry pope sente germanie prouinces conuent heare moue better minde call home mercifull meanes gather againe lappe churche may saye condemnationesai saide iewes iought haue donne toopen blasphemie churche pope vineyarde vineyarde whiche haue donne vaine hathe benne stubbournesse b sarisburie wee ieste goddes holy sprite hardinge wee know sprite vvisedome hath renewed face worlde discouered multitude folie wel maie wee ieste vnhandsome open legierdumaine vainely seeke blinde v painted shadowe sprite god yee pretende longe praiers mutche fastinge great conference doctours scripture vndoubted presence assistance goddes holy sprite al dooinges yet openly striue manifest vvoorde sprite god folowe onely owne sprite whiche wee maie truely calle sprite vanitie sprite meane nothinge el sprite rome whiche saie sprite truthe cannot erre one late councelles nicolaus de clauengijs holden rome yee singinge veni creator spiritus god sente downe owle toppe churche sitte emongest worlde might knowe sprite yee assembled elia regum prophete god iested thus priestes baal crie alowde god either occupied somme talke inne trauailinge vpon waie el perhaps sleepe yet neither elia hicke scorner iested goddes holy sprite thinge vnseemely personne councelles whether al euermore summoned sprite god maie wel doubted vniuersitie parise thus protested waie appeale appellatio vniuers parisien anno againste pope leo councel dominus leo papa decimus quodam coetu ciuitate romana nescimus qualiter non tamen spiritu domini congregato lorde pope leo certaine councel geathered cittie rome meane wee know surely sprite god touchinge late chapter conuenticle whiche ye cal councel trenteoratio synodica anno frenche kinges embassadoure beinge presence saide thus minus legitima minusue libera fuisse dicuntur illa concilia qui aderant ad voluntatem alterius semper loquebantur saieinge neither lavvful free councelles bishoppes spake alwaies spirite god euermore please somme whiche meante pope christe saith vnto peter confirmation coucelles haue praied thee paule wente vp hierusalem visite peter ergo ye saie pope hath authoritie confirme councelles hardinge logique louaine marueilous hasty yee force conclusion luc galat renne poste maketh either christes praier peter paules iourney arabia hierusalem confirmation councelles verily manner mention neither confirmation councel pope whereas christe praied namely peter augustine saithe hathe benne alleged august de quae noui testamen quaest nunquid pro petro rogabat pro iacobo iohanne non rogabat christe praie onely peter praie iames iohn againe saithe augu de verb domi euang secundum luca sermo hac nocte postulauit satanas vexare vos sicut triticum sed ego rogaui patrem pro vobis ne deficiat fides vestra might hath sathan desired threashe yee wheate haue praied father onely peter faithe maie faile touchinge paule wente vp hierusalem courtesie see peter sought thereby allowance doctrine mangalat otherwise stoode doubt whether long space fourtiene yeeres preached truth falsehedde rather found fault wt peter dissimulatio doctrine reproued openly euen vnto face hierome saith perrexit hierusalem non tam vt disceret aliquid ab apostolis hieronym epist ad gal ca quam cum eis euangelium quod docuerat collaturus paule went vp hierusalem mutche learne thinge apostle conferre touchinge gospel preached chrysostome saithe paulus nihil opus habebat petro nec illius egebat vocechrysost ad galat cap sed honore par erat illi nihil enim hic dicam amplius paule neede peter cause craue voice honoure woorthinesse equal wil saie concerninge confirmation councelles wee haue saide otherwhere large councelles confirmedin former replie artic diuision onely bishop rome also bishoppes patriarkes onely bishoppes also kinges emperours emperoure martianus saith sacro nostrae serenitatis edicto venerandam synodum confirmamus holy edicte maiestie wee confirme reuerende councelconcil chalced actio likewise bishoppes councel constantinople besought ye emperour theodosius rogamus clementiam tuamconcil constantinopolitan vt per literas tuae pietatis ratum esse iubeas confirmes que concilij decretum wee beseeche fauoure maiesties letter yee wil ratifie confirme decree councel touchinge councel apostle hierusalem owne doctoure saithe heruaeus de potestat pp ca postquam petrus dixisset iacobus authoritate pontificali protulit definitiuam sententiam peter saide minde iames episcopal authoritie pronounced definitiue sentence saie gaue confirmation whole conclude councelles haue benne allowed holden good whether bishop rome would liberatus saith anatolius consent councel chalcedon liberat cap obteined primacie bishop rome legate stoode theire gainesaieinge iudges bishoppes receiued notwithstandinge apostolique see rome euen hitherto stand againste yet decree councel authoritie mainteinance emperoure quodammodo sorte standeth stil force mutche pleasant sporte yee make v vvith puttinge pope ansvveare saie hicke hob han haue accused pope vvoulde ye haue appeare courte iudged iacke gil whole worlde hardinge hath longe time charged pope ambition iudge pope briberie simonie superstition idolatrie open corruption ordinance wil god disdeigne iudgemente many calle whole worlde hicke hob let marueile whole worlde disdeigne maie iudge partie maie make answeare onely selfe doubte shal haue good fauourable hearinge beseech parte cap diui good christian reader shortenesse sake consider haue written touchinge accusinge iudgeing pope shalte thou see ennodius q nemo ennodius saithe pope togeather power teaching hath receiued free libertie doo il without controlmente therefore saithe ne que ab augusto ne que ab omni clero ne que regibus ne que populo iudex iudicabitur pope iudge shalbe iudged neither emperoure vvhole cleregie kinges people sutche prerogatiue saithe athanasius athanasi cotra arianos oration sommetime claimed ariane heretiques cum ipsi sint rei ac iudicio obnoxij chryso matthae homil veluti caiaphas iudicandi munus inuadunt whereas selues guilty danger iudgement plaie parte caiphas take vpon iudges selues like manner chrysostome sathe figura ibi duntaxat iudicij erat autem ipsa erat latronum impetus onely face iudgemente deede biunte violence theeues yee saie furtheresai pope maie saie condemnation god saithe vnto iewes ought haue donne vinsyarde haue donne thus yee geue pope power callenge churche god owne euen nero wicked tyran wasted consumed cittie rome burnte called neuerthelesse owne name neronopolis neroes tovvne heruaeus de potestat papae one doctoures saithe huius communitatis non est dominus nisi christus vel papa lord common slate saie churche either christe pope christe pope iointepourchasers deede christe onely prince pastours1 pet august de verb domi euang secudum iohan sermo esai churche onely spouse pope augustine saithe vnto christe tu petro non dixisti palce oues tuas sed pasce oues meas thou saidste vnto peter feede thy sheepe feede mine peter belongeth vnto churche churche belongeth vnto peter churche pope vine vine lorde sabaoth shal sufficiente pope maie onely branche vine withered cutte throwen fiere augustine saith augu iohan tracta qui hoc animo pascunt oues christi vt suas velint esse non christi se conuincuntur amare non christum vel gloriandi vel dominandi vel acquirendi cupiditate feede sheepe christe ende woulde haue theire sheepe christes founde loue selues christe desire either glorie gouernemente gaine apologie cap diuision howe saie ye doo wee diuise tale course councelles day al thinges remoued whole holy councel brought pope alone thoughe nothinge benne donne pourpose indgementes consentes sutch number alone maie adde alter diminishe disanulle allowe remitte qualifie euer liste whose woordes haue bishoppes abbates laste councel tridente late concluded thus thende sauinge alvvaies authoritie see apostolique al thinges dooth pope paschale write proudely selfede election electi pote significasti though saithe vvere general councel hable prescribe lavve churche rome vvhereas al councelles haue benne made haue receiued force strength authoritie churche rome ordinaunces made councels euer plainely excepted authoritie romaine bishop wil haue thinges allowed good councelles called commaunde voide leafte theire bookes thinges allowable hardinge sir neeede bestowe mutche talke vaine reason thevvho made al faithful christ pope member member acknoweledge heade vvoulde member worke action without heade pope paschalis called proude preferringe churche rome councel haue councels euer ben thought lacke theire ful auctoritievntruthe plaine manifeste pope authoritie calle coucelles shal appeare whiche called confirmed bishop rome b sarisburie modestie sobrietie pope paschalis claime shal better appeare nexte diuision verily churche rome many yeeres maie seeme haue benne nothinge el moother falsehed schoole pride pope nicolas saithenicola pp ad imp michael concil lateran sub leone sessione de sedis apostolicae iudicio nemini licet iudicare lawful noman iudge pope iudgemente late yeeres pope leo saide papa habet authoritatem super omnia concilia pope hathe authoritie ouer al councelles al lawful councelles haue euermore benne summoned confirmed pope mauifest grosse vntruthe hereafter shalbe opened large ye saie reason member shoulde acknowledge theire heade shame hardinge credites sake leaue vanity pope parte goddes churche member heade faithful churche god christes member pope apologie cap diuision let bishop rome alone aboue al councelles saie let somme one parte greater whole let greatter power let wisedome al andhieron ad euagrium spite hieromes heade let authoritie one cittie greatter authoritie vvhole vvorlde hardinge common manner defender must needes graunt make shewe wordes though free gifte many time beggers wil seme gentilmen paiers debte wil seme geuers let bishop rome saithe alone aboue al coucelsvntruthe othervvise shevve v vvhat authoritie sir thake yet speake like liberal gentilman saie let one parte greater whole sirthe pope aboue general cou celles maugre scoffinge heade parte shal greater whole parte shal greater parteful vvisely pope vvere heade vvhole churche vvere body pope vvere maister churche familie right sense heade greater body bishop cleregy maister house familie neither councel whole pardy excepte mery witte deuise v whole body without heade let greater power saie let wisedome al vve saie maie councel hath learningethe councel hathe vvisedome learninge pope yet pope vvisedome learning aboue councel knowledge wisedome onely person albeit speake wisdome see apostolike whiche sure infallible cannot erre meane onely pope singular person heade pastoure bishop doth thinges whiche perteine chaire saie asmutche procedeth vpon owne priuate iudgementeo fonde folie simple creature longe leadde holy ghost neuer erre instincte holy ghoste promised christe vicare vvhere saie spite hieromes heade let authoritie one citie greater authoritie whole world tel speake spitefully learnedly hierome epistle euagrius speakethvntruthe vaine childish hierome speaketh plainely authoritie si authoritas quaeritur maior est orbis vrbe onely particular matter blaminge custome rome contrary custome whole world deacon certaine case preferred priestes whereof haue spoken b sarisburie sir defender ye saie speaketh like liberal gentleman againe yee saie sir maugre scoffinge heade like woordes hardinge sittinge seemely personne maie wel becomme mery witte wee saie let bishop rome greater povver general councel yee answeare v readily wee saie let vvisedome al bishoppes yee answeare againe wee saie yee woulde allowe pope authoritie power without wisedome yet wise menne haue saide povver vvithout vvisedome kingedome folie somme frendes haue saide si totus mundus sententiaret aliquo negotio contra papam videtur quod standum esset sententiae papae whole worlde shoulde geeue sentence mater againste pope seemeth wee ought rather stande pope iudgemente iudgemente al worlde albertus pigghi u saithe certius est iudicium papae quam iudicium generalis concilij aut totius orbis terrarum iudgemente pope certaine iudgement general councel el al whole worlde saithe papa virtualiter est tota ecclesia pope power whole vniuersal churche saith quaest nemo gloss potestas solius papae excedit potestatem residuae ecclesiae pope onely power excedeth power al churche bisidealb piggh eccl hiera li ca heruae de potesta pp cap petr de palude de potestat pp artic saithe papa non potest subijcere se concilio generali pope cannot submitte selfe general councel vpon woorthy fundatios yee haue built vp pope infinite vniuersal povver therefore yee saie sir defender woulde seeme graunte free gifte muste needes graunt perforce whether wil al withstandinge hardinge others indifferente doctoures would haue tolde tale bernarde saithe quae maior superbia esse potestextra de iudicijs cum venissent ioha andr berna citatur pico mirand quae papa sit supra concil picus mirandul eodem loco quam vt vnus homo toti congregationi iudicium suum praeferat tanquam solus habeat spiritum sanctum greatter pride one man esteeme owne iudgemente iudgemente al churche onely sprite god whereunto picus mirandula addeth woordes imo simplici potius rustico infanti aniculae magi quam pontifici maximo mille episcopis credendu est si isti contra euangelium illi pro euangelio faciant naie wee ought beleue simple plaine husbandeman childe olde wooman rather pope thousand bishoppes pope ye bishoppes speake againste gospel others speake gospel bishoppes councel ferraria saie thus quacunque facultate romana ecclesia praedita sit vniuersali tamen ecclesiae quam generalis synodus prae se fert inferior est euer power churche rome endewed yet inferioure vniuersal churcheconc ferrarion session represented general councel bishoppes councel basile saie thus concil basilien inter epistolas synodales etsi papa sit caput ministeriale ecclesiae non tame est maior tota ecclesia alioqui errante potifice quod saepe contingit contingere potest tota erraret ecclesia although pope ministerial heade churche yet greater al churche otherwise euer pope erreth whiche thing happeneth oftentimes maie wel happen whole churche shoulde likewise erre againe saie appendice conc basilien sacrosanctae generali nonnulli o suum ponenies coelum potestatem romani pontificis supra potestatem sacrorum generalium conciliorum contra iuris diuini humani veritatem sanctis patribus alias declaratam exaltare nituntur many menne settinge theire face againste heauen goe aboute exalte power bishop rome aboue power holy general councelles contrarie truthe law god man declared vnto v holy father againe saie eadem appe dice et primo ecclesia romana non est vniuersa sed est de vniuersirate corporis mystici id est ecclesiae et sic est membrum dicti corporis mystici vt pater per beatum gregorium igitur ex quo est membru dicti corporis non est nec esse potest caput illius cum differentia sit inter caput membra churche rome vniuersal parte vniuersal mystical body christe whiche churche member christes saide body mystical appeareth gregorie therefore mutche member saide body neither heade body difference bitweene heade body likewise againe saie eadem appe dice eod capite allegant papam impune posse tollere constitutionem concilij generalis contra prohibitionem ipsius concilij generalis supponentes papa else pastorem vniuersalis ecclesiae sed ipsorum suppositum est falsum co sequenter ipsorum assertio super eo fundata est falsa thei saie pope maie safely abolishe decree general councel notwithstandinge general councel haue decreed contrarie pope pastoure vntuersal churche supposinge pope bishop vniuersal churche theire supposal false consequentely false theire doctrine haue builte thereupon therefore hardinge parte booke emonge reste woulde aduisedly haue benne considered cole selfe notwithstanding otherwise wel enclined vnto faction yet pointe wel content geeue ouerd cole thus
