saithe selfe holde herein rather gerson councel aboue pope pope yee saie one respecte man owne singulare persone maie happen erre respecte heade pastoure chiefe bishop placed peter chaire cannot erre thus heathen olde time imagined theire centaurus halfe man halfe horse theire ianus haue twoo face one behinde euen haue imagined twoo pope one body one goeinge backewarde forewarde one bearinge light darkenesse one deceiued deceiued one speakinge truthe falsehedde yet pope incorporate togeather one persone geue v leaue therefore hardinge saie nowe whole vniuersitie parise saidappellatio vniuer parisien leon longe sithence vnto pope leo domino nostro papa iam non bene consulto appellamus wee appeale lorde pope beinge nowe wel aduised certainely hierony ad heliodorum de laude vitae solitariae hierome saith non est facile stare loco pauli tenere gradum petri iam cum christo regnantium ne forte veniat angelus qui scindat velum templi tui qui candelabrum tuum de loco moueat easy mater stande peter paules place nowe reigninge christe leste angel comme rente sunder vele thy temple remoue candesticke place place hierome euagrius parte ca diuisi answeared apologie cap diuision pope haue sene none thinges haue neuer read either scripture olde father yet owne councelles howe fauoure arians pope liberius haue wicked detestable opinion life comme immortalitie soule pope iohn fewe yeeres sithence encrease owne dignitie doo nowe corrupte councelles pope zosimus corrupted councel holden nice time paste doo saie thinges diuised appointed holy father whiche neuer came thought haue ful swaie authoritie doo wreaste scripture thing camotensis saith vsual custome pope howe haue renounced faithe christe become apostata lyranus saithe many pope haue benne yet al shal holy ghoste turninge hande knocke breaste euen whether wil yea wholy againste wil kindle light maie erre shal streight waie headespring al right shal al treasure wisdome vnderstanding found laide vp stoare thinges geeue right apte iudgemente weighty mater hable iudge woulde haue mater shoulde brought alone hardinge howe ifs ifs coulde sone make answeare contraryvvhat therfore aboue general councelles sir pope haue sene al thinges scripture father councels vvhat haue saie tale ende vvere matter good selfe wise woulde commonly vse weake kirde reasoning number ifs ifs reader sake put awaie al seruple geue answeare god wisedome scripture saithe disposeth al thinges sweetlysadly sagely mutche purpose one instant forseeth endesapien meanes necessary end promise man life euerlasting withal geueth grace also good dedesrom whereby obteine vvhom hath glorified saith paule hath iustified called whereas hath force praier made father promised petermatt luc safetie churchevntruthe fonde childishe christ praied nomore peter others euer made mention peter successours euery peter successour faithe shal faile therfore hath willed confirme brother remoue al doubtes errours assured wil geue sutche witte diligence learninge vnderstandinge firmnes infallibilitie faithe confirminge brother requireth shal stande doubte whether happeneth thinges supernatural whiche see thinges natural geueth ende geueth also thinges perteine atteininge ende god woulde promise v abundance corne nexte yeere comeo vvoorthy graue reason folish doubte saie like defender howe men wil til grounde seede doubtles shal reepe sowe neither shal reepe vve maie gather promise god shal haue onely faier ceasonable wether wherby fruites earth maie proue plentiful also husbandman shal emploie theire endeuour paine labour abundance corne promised shal geuen sutch til truail euen wheras christe hath promised thevntruthe christe neuer entred sutche couenate vvith peter successours successours peter firmnes faithe apostle theire successours spirite truthe likewise councels gathered name muste perswade selues nothinge shal wante necessary controuersies touchinge faithe decided saie liberius pope starke f lsevntruthe plainely reproued hierome neuer fauoured arians moste ye finde againste compelled greate persecution constantius emperoure subscribe arians neither aunciente writer ecclesiastical story constantly affirmed chiefe spoken moste occasion signifie ben denied mentioned true false rumoure bruted abroade himsozom lib cap lib de viris illustrib chronicis whiche rumour semeths hieromes authoritie refused man vvriting rashely knevve vvhat hierome deceiued remaininge easte farre place truth might certainely knowen true subscribed peter denied christ yet beinge donethe pope denieth christ lacke charitie lacke faithe lacke charitie erroure faith wel might facte slaunderous churche decre made fauour arians neither confirme heresie reporte pope iohn likewise moste false worste marsilius padua vvilliam ockam heretikes wrote flatter emperour lidouicus bauaria taught openlyvntruthe manifest see ansvveare whiche also referred time popevntruthe helde also soules vvicked shoulde pounisshed iudgemente soules iuste see god vntil daie iudgemente wicked detestable opinion immortalitie soule sutche opinion false slaunder whiche wicked detestable malice imagined deface churche specially auctoritie holy see apostolike storie estimation mentioneth firste opinion came pope much lesse gaue definitiue sentence matter contrariwise vntruthe co trarie hardinge said immediatly helde erroure time popedome prepared selfe goe definition question concerninge seeinge god whiche iuste soules haue daie iudgement benedictus theleuenth sua extrauagante saieth preuented death might belte zosimusvntruthe manifestely reproued cou cel aphrica corrupted councel nice signified bishop aphrike assembled councel carthage truthe concerninge canon nicene councel maie proued iulius first epistle ofthese vaine childishe forgery athinasius bishop egypt thebats libya written marcus pope original canon nicene councel remained safe custodie churche rome subscribed handes father councel present credite geuen contrary informatio twenty canon retourned bishop constantinople alexandriavntruthe vvithout sauoure vvitte learninge vvhy shoulde hardinge allege foolishe fable hereikes burned bookes whole number conteined lefte twenty al bookes nowe commonly haue shoulde alleage camotensis lyre woulde cal blacke garde set litle first v haue alleage iuel alleageth canotensis place kepeth selfe selfe likely proceded dealinge sutche false practise respecte maie seme credible albeit worshipful doctour ye meane camotensisif yee knovve maie beste blame ignorance knowe peraduenture ye meane carnotensis otherwise called iuo haue cause gesse yet foure bookes sundry printes bothe englishe latine haue sutche suppose obscure worth naminge b sarisburie yee saie sir howe pope haue seene al thinges scripture father councelles vvhether pope maie erre vvhat haue saie tale ende verily hardinge woulde desire god geue grace vse wel glorie notwithstandinge owne doctoures wil soone put al vvhattes vvhatifs question concerninge pope greate high learningalphons contra haeres li ca alphonsus de castro saith hath benne alleged constat plures papa adeo illiteratos fuisse vt grammatica penitus ignorarent certainely knowen sundrie pope haue benne vnskilful learninge thei neuer vnderstoode grammare christe hath praied peter made sure promise faithe neuer faile therefore pope wise pope learned pope catholique pope cannot erre al greate deale pope maie claime onely vertue christes praier therefore pope shoulde erre heresie might sue christe action couenante require perfourme promisemichae saithe prophete michaeas sacerdotes mercede docebant prophetae pecunia diuinabant super dominum requieseebant dicentes nonne est dominus medio nostrum priestes taught people hiere prophetes prophesied moonie yet rested selues vpon goddes promise saieinge lorde middes emongest v psalm hierem prophete saith euery man lier accursed trusteth man owne doctour alphonsus saith omnis homo errare potest fide etiamsi papa sit euery man maie erre faithe yea although pope concil tomo tertull contra praxeam vnlearned reader maie better consider safely maie geeue credite bare woorde whether pope maie deceiued faithe maie easily appeare fewe example listeth seeke maie finde moe pope marcellinus offred vp incense made sacrifice vnto diuelles beat rhenanus hieron praefatione de viris illustribus tertullian saithe episcopum romanum agnoscentem iam prophetias montani priscae maximillae c bishop rome wel likinge prophesies heresy montanus prisca maximilla c vpon whiche woordes beatus rhenanus noteth thus episcopus romanus montanizat bishop rome fauoureth heresie montanus pope liberius vvas arian heretiqueconcil nicenum action hereafter shal better appeare pope honorius condened heretique two general councellesconcil constantinop acti alphos li ca legenda hilarij councel constantinople woordes condemnation alleged thus synod romana fasciculo rerum sciendarum impresso coloniae anathematizari curauimus honorium qui fuerat papa antiquae romae quia omnibus metem sergij sequutus est impia dogma confirmauit wee haue caused honorius yt late pope olde rome accursed al thinges folowed minde sergius heretique confirmed wicked doctrine alphonsus de castro saithe anastasium papam fauisse nestorianis qui historias legerit non dubitat euer hath readde ye story course time cannot doubt pope anastasius fauoured nestorian heretiques legende hilarius mentioned pope leo arian heretique synode holden rome pope hildebrande written thus incendio tradidimus decreta eoru heretica wee haue burnte heretical decreesiohannes stella venetus pope syluester made pope necromancie recompense thereof episto hulderici ad nicolaum papam promised selfe body soule vnto diuel huldericus bishop augusta germanie expresseth restrainte priestes marriage woordes periculosum huius haeresis decretu dangerous decree heresie notwithstanding haue seene epistle vnto p nicolas erasm annotation epist ad galat cap faciem illi restiti togeather epistle like purpose written olde veleme ancient recorde vnder name volusianus bishop carthage neede wee touche al particulares doctoures great schole sorbona parise haue determined theire article peter self erred faith councel basile condemneth pope eugenius wordes eugenium contemptorem sacrorum canonumconcil basilien sessione pacis veritatis ecclesiae dei perturbatorem notorium vniuersalis ecclesiae scandalizatorem simoniacum periurum incorrigibilem schismaticum fide deuium pertinacem haereticum c wee condemne depose pope eugenius despiser holy canon disturber peace vnitie churche god notorious offendoure whole vniuersal church simoniste foresworne man man vncorrigible schismatique man fallen faithe vvilful heretique pope iohns heresie touching immortalitie soule q haeresis conc consta tien appendice ca primis quinimo idem iohan pp dixit et pertinaciter credidit animam hominis cum corpore humano mori extingui ad instar animalium brutorum wee shal speke hereafter hierome saithe qui scripturam intelligit aliter quam sensus spiritus sancti flagitat quo scripta est licet ab ecclesia non recesserit tamen haereticus appellari potest euer otherwise vnderstandeth scripture sense holy ghoste requireth written moste certaine pope infinite place bothe hath donne dothe although departed churche yet maie wel called heretique idolater montanistes arians monothelites nestorian denier immortalitie simonistes sorcerer maineteiners filthinesse obstinate wilful heretiques maie erre euer hardinge felowes shal saie contrarie easily seene pope maie erre verily councel basile saithe thus multi e summis pontificibus haereses errores lapsi esse dicuntur leguntur certum est papam errare posse concilium saepe condemnauit que deposuit papam tam ratione fidei quam morum reported readde many pope haue fallen errours heresy certaine pope maie erre councel hath oftentimes condened remoued pope respecte wel heresie faith lewdenesse life concil basilien inter epist synodales visellius q rectas glossa visellus saithe summorum pontificum quidam pestilenter errauerunt certaine bishoppes rome haue benne pestilente heresy owne glose saith certum est quod papa errare potest certaine pope maie erre doctoures saithe interdum possit aliquis esse qui esst sede remouendus vt si esset foemina vel hereticus sicut fuerunt aliqui ob hoc non numerantur catalogo paparum pope maie sommetimes sutche one maie seeme woorthy remoued iohan de parisijs de potesiat regia pap heruaeus de potesta pp cap gerson anliceat appellare pp hostien de concessione praebe dae proposuit extra de electione significasti abb vvooman heretique certaine sutch haue benne therefore thei reckened ye calendare pope saith aliqui papae inuenti sunt flagitiosi haeretici somme pope haue benne founde wicked menne heretiques saithe et papa episcopi sunt deuiabiles fide pope bishoppes maie wander faithe saith papa mandans aliquid fieri quod sonet haeresim turbat statum ecclesiae non est ei parendum pope commaundinge thing donne soundeth heresie troubleth state churche maie obeie saithe papa potest else haereticus de haeresi iudicari pope maie heretique heresie maie iudged al ye pope vndoubted fredes let v heare pope self pope pius otherwise called aeneas syluius saith thus quid si criminosus papa contraria fidei praedicet haereticis que dogmatibus imbuat subditos notorious vvicked pope teache thinges contrarie faithe heretical doctrine peruerte subiectes would stand long cleare case harding al notwithstandinge telleth v sadly biddeth v beleue vpon warrante pope vndoubtedly neuer erre stanislaus hosius ye greatest stickler side hosius confessione petricouion cap alphons contra haeres li ca blussheth saie thus numeretur omnes c recken al ye pope euer peter vntil iulius neuer sate chaire arian donatiste pelagian professed manner heresie yet neuerthelesse owne doctour alphonsus saithe non credo aliquem esse adeo impudentem papae assentatorem vt ei tribuere hoc velit vt nec errare nec interpretatione sacrarum literarum hallucinari possit beleue ther shamelesse flatterer pope wil graunte prerogatiue neuer erre deceiued expoundinge scripture hardinge owne principal doctoure alphonsus calleth al mainteine doctrine saie saie shamelesse flatterer pope certainely thinke maie safely said wil take viewe al christendome shal find many heretiques one see euer maie found see romefranc petrarch epist cause perhaps fraciscus petrarcha calleth rome asylu haeresum erroru sainctuarie errours heresy italian sonetres calleth schole erroure temple heresie nicolaus lyra yee doubte dealinge printer hath quoted place schola di errori e tempio di eresia maie please therefore peruse note vpon xvi chapter mathevve emonge ye shal finde woordes nicol lyra matthae cap ex hoc patet quod ecclesia non consistit hominibus ratione potestatis vel dignitatis ecclesiasticae vel saecularis quia multi principe summi pontifex inuenti sunt apostatasse fide hereby appeareth church standeth men consideration either theire power theire dignitie either ecclesiastical temporal many prince pope haue benne founde haue straied faithebaldus de offic praesid l saepe therefore baldus saithe cautela est quod quis dicat credo quod credit sanctum mater ecclesia non quod credit papa marked man many saie beleue churche beleueth beleue pope beleueth yee saie christe praied peter ergo pope cannot erre christes praier many heretiques pope rome wil yee saie christe praied arians nestorian montanistes monothelites simonistes idolater necromancer poisoner murtherers dame iohane vertue christes praier none could euer erre pope erroures must goe truthe heresy holden right religion onely bicause telle v euer saie cannot erre hardinge shewed christe praied onely peter also al reste disciple origen saithe alleged orig matth tractat num audebimus dicere quod aduersus vnum petrum non praeualiturae sint porrae inferorum aduersus coeteros apostolos praeualiturae sint shal wee dare san yt gate helle shal preuaile againste onely peter ye gate shal preuaile al apostle cyprian orationem dominicam cyprian saith rogabat pro delictis nostris sicut iple declarat cum dicit ad petrum ego rogaui pro te ne deficiat fides tua christe praied peter onely sinnes selfe declareth saieing vnto peter haue praied thee thy faith faile augustine expouding woordes aug de verbis domi secund lucam sern chryso matthae homil saithe thus ego rogaui patrem pro vobis ne deficiat fides vestra haue praied onely peter also yt faith shoulde faile chrysostome saithe omnis christianus qui suscipit verbum petri thronus fit petri petrus sedet co euery christian man receiueth word peter made peter chaire peter selfe sitteth otherwise hardinge al peter sitte place peter ambrose saithe ambros de poeniten li ca hierony sophontam cap pope liberius non habent haereditatem petri qui fidem petri non habent haue peter enheritance haue faithe peter hierome saith auferet dominus nomina vanae gloriae admirationis falsae quae versantur ecclesia god wil take waie name vaine glorie false ostetation vsed churche wee saie pope liberius fauoured arians ye saie starke false yethieron de eccl scriptorib fortunatiano yee knowe hierome reporter falsehed hierome ye saie vvas deceiued sutche reuerence regarde yee haue doctoures learned father churche yee beleue yee liste doubte hierome might better saie hardinge deceiued certainely alphonsus owne doctoure saith de liberio papa constat fuisse arianum touchinge pope liberiusalphons contra haeres li ca platy liberio antonin par tit ca iouerius wel knowen vvas arian platyna saith liberius vt quidam volunt rebus omnibus sensit cum haereticis pope liberius somme saie al pointes one iudgemente arian heretiques antoninus archebishop florence saith liberius papa consensit praeceptis augusti ariani vt vna cum haereticis communicaret pope liberius consented commaundementes arian emperoure communicated wt heretiquesherman gigas historta longobardica saithe louerius abbriedgement councelles saith hermannus gigas saith legende comonly called historia longobardica emong others erasmus saith ariana haeresis romanum pontifice inuoluiterasm annotationib hieronym contra lucifertan ipsos imperatores aria heresi entangled wrapt bothe pope emperoure pope namely meaneth liberius yet doubte saie hierome shamefully deceiued wrote ignorance knewe likewise yee saie wee reporte pope iohn moste false reporte ispope iohn pope iohn denied immortalitie soule thorowly altogeather onely saide vntil time laste iudgement soule lieth stil traunse doothe body vvithout sense ioie paine wherein onely withstoode expresse woorde god also vnwares quite ouerthrewe owne whole kingedome purgatorie greatest fairest al three crownes auaile pardones tretalles soule lie stil sleepe vntil daie iudgemet feele paine verily laste iudgement common consente shalbe purgatorie nowe place purgatorie neither laste iudgement maie wee wel conclude absolutely without doubte purgatorie firste authours erroureaugustin ad quoduultdeu gerson sermone paschali copus dialog pag augustine saithe heretiques called arabici touchinge pope iohns erroure gerson saithe thus iohannes papa decreuit c pope iohn decreed ye soules wicked pounished daie laste iudgemente whiche erroure vniuersitie parise condemned heresie caused pope recante one owne copanions louaine saith pope iohn keapte erroure secretely selfe neuer open consent churche rome better excuse hereof saithepag petrus non fidem christi sed christum salua fide negauit peter denied faith christe faith saued denied nomore christe prety shifte louanian diuinitie yee haue bothe christe without faithe also faithe without christe thus hardinge plaine owne doctoures felowes reporte pope iohn neither false sclaunder saiepope zosimus proceedeth detestable vvicked malice reste yee saie vvee belie pope zosimus corrupted councel nice artic diui concil aphric trial whereof referre mee selfe former replie vnto answeare certainely euer learned man wil stande denial hereof must needes want coloure face fraude notoriously found detected whole world ancient learned fathersan epistle forged vnder thename athanasi coucel nice corrupted cyrillus articus one patriarke alexandria antioche reproued published twoo hundred seuenteene bishoppes openly councel aphrica peeuishe forged epistle yee allege vnder name learned godly father athanasius fantastical burninge canon nice without fire like childishe vanity scarcely meete child plaie withal likewise answeared one owne louanian companie confessethin replie artic diui late councel florence greekes made open complainte bishop rome corrupted canon councel nice alypius bishop tagasta speakinge hereof councel carthage saith thus adhuc tamen mouet quoniam cum inspiceremus graeca exemplaria huius synodi nicenaecopus pag concil florent sessione ista ibi nescio qua ratione minime inuenimus yet thing moueth mee wee examined conferred originalles nicene councel vvritten greeke knowe concil carthaginen cap epist bonifacij ad eulalium meanes thiese thinges wee founde yet pope bonifacius saue credite see rome forced saie publishe openly saide alypius aurelius bishop carthage augustine bishop hippo two hundred fourteene bishoppes espied reueled falsehedde al enflamed leadde diuelcopus pag one owne suddaine doctoures louaine saithe haec omnia tanquam somnia taquam fabulae tanquam superflua abolita antiquata calcata sunt al decree councelles carthage aphrica abolished repealed trodden vnder foote dreames fable thinges superfluous hardinge weighinge councelles like expresse voice holy ghoste like dreames fable thinges superfluous camotensis iohan camotensis yee saie somme woorshipful doctour sutch owne iudgement might passe ye blacke garde yet bishop harding al respectes far better either leontius hippolytus newe founde clemens yee cal apostle felovve vaine fable amphilochius yee woulde seeme finde faulte name thinke wee haue written camotensis rather iuo carnotensis gheasse yee shewe v reason thereof yee shewe v none yee might wel haue saide fulbertus carnotensis beinge mutche consumed spente sicknesse learnedly noted emonge verity restoratiue suckte lady breaste vertue thereof made whole yee might likewise haue gheased benne io sarisburiensis hermann rid sarisburien polycratico corne agrippa de vanit scientiarum otherwise called somme rupertus carnotensis saithe ecclesia romana sedent scribae pharisaei churche rome sitte scribe phariseis deede writer name iohannes camotensis alleged cornelius agrippa woordes angelis praecipiunt potestatem habent mortuos vim faciunt scripturis vt habeant plenitudinem potestatis ipse papa iam factus est intolerabilis eius pompam fastum nullus tyrannorum vnquam ae quauit legati romanorum pontificum sic bacchantur prouincijs acsi ad flagellandam ecclesiam sathan egressus sit facie domini thei saie theire commaundementes vpon angel god haue power vpon deade thei wreast racke scripture maie haue fulnesse power pope selfe nowe becomme vntolerable tyran euer hable matche pompe pride pope legate keepe sutche reuel kindomes country sathan sente abroade face lorde scourge churche iuo carnotensis iohannes camotensis iudgemente churche rome apologie cap diuision wil ye saie pope aduocates abbates bishoppes dissemble mater shewe selues open enimies gospel though thei see yet wil see wrie scripture witingly knowingly corrupte countrefeite vvoorde god fouly wickedly applie pope al thinges whiche euidently properly spoken personne christe onely meanes applied otherhost cap quanto though saie pope al aboue al orabbas panor de elect ca venerabilis pope doo asmutche christe doo one iudgement place one coucel house serueth pope christe bothe togeather pope lighte cornelius episcopus concil tridentino vvhiche comme vvorlde whiche woordes christe spake selfe alone vvho euil doer hateth flieth lighte al bishoppes haue receiued pope fulnesse hardinge haue neuer donne ifs interpreter good gentil woman fauoureth pleasant diuinitie muche seemeth weary selfe shee tourneth quid si ye saie nowe syr doo demaunde v madame interpreter maketh speake saie forsooth alleage pope aduocates abbattes bishoppes saie moste parte false slaunderous somewhat maie taken truthe right sense aduocates minde aduocatehostiensis panormitanus neither haue neede helpe let answeare one hostiensis abbot panormitan hostiensis good sooth excellent men daie liuing thinke verely would doo honoure answere selues would vouchesaue doo muche doubt woulde make shorte woorke take vp roundly haltinge one woorde mentitis dasshinge allegation vvhich woorde diuinitie verbe commune thus leauinge hostiensis panormitan defence canonistes tellinge waie question diuinitie wee stande alwaies saieingescornelius episcopus bitontinus wee answeare behalfe cornelius bishop bitonto italie ye meane suppose puttinge margent name cornelius onely neuer saidevntruthe blasphemouse vnaduisedly defended vvoordes plaine papa lux venit mundum pope lighte whiche shoulde come worlde sense spoken christe hardely charged shewe saide wrote would founde lier many pointes founde already neuer wrote eloquent italian sermon set foorthe printe assured hath set foorth remaineth tell v saithe el confesse slaunderous lie b sarisburie yee saie hardinge thinke yee haue learned childe mentiris verbe common ye holde yee haue begonne ye wil shortely alter propertie therof selfe make hencefoorthe verbe priuate touchinge hostiensis panormitane wil saie nothinge onely referre place cornelius bishop bitonto mutche contrarie nature yee pleade ignorance saie yee cannot finde place reade therefore woordes oration openly pronounced late chapter tridente quis erit tam iniustus rerum aestimatorconcil trident sub paulo qui non dicat papa lux venit mundum sed dilexerunt homines tenebras magi quam lucem omnis qui male agitoratio cornelij episcopi bitontini odit lucem non venit ad lucem vt non arguantur opera eius quia mala sunt wil vniuslely weight thinges wil saie pope light comme vvorlde menne haue loued darkenesse pope lighte euer doothe euil hateth lighte commeth lighte leste woorkes discoured euil apologie cap diuision shortely though make decree expressely againste goddes vvoorde hucker mucker couertly openly face worlde muste needes yet gospel streight euer saie shal goddes holy armie wil christe hande amonge shal holy ghoste flowe theire tongue truthe saie wee holy ghoste haue thought hardinge greate meany foolishe false ifs conclude shortly vvhat make decree expressely againste goddes vvoorde openly face vvorlde hereto answeare requitinge saie vvhat learned holy father c apologie cap diuision deede peter asotus companion hosius sticke affirmehosius contra brentium lib councel wherein saueour iesus christe condemned die bothe sprite prophesieinge holy ghoste sprite truthe neither false triflinge saieinge bishoppes saide vvee haue lavve lavve ought die saieinge lighte vpon truthe iudgemente hosius woordes plainely iuste decree whereby pronounced christe woorthy die thinketh straunge menne hable speake selues defende owne cause thei muste also take parte anna caiphas wil cal lauful good councel wherein sonne god moste shamefully condemned die councel wil thei allowe false naughte yet al councelles saie truthe commonly necessitie compelled pronounce thinges councel holden anna caiphas hardinge suche vnhonest toy better become brentius shamelesse railinge heretike syr defender belie hosius brentius borowed belied reuerente father peter ae soto either haue readen place hosius haue haue blame saie mutche euill knowe haue readen place faulte plaine malice puttinge hosius contrary whereof finde place selfe alleaged leade v hande beholde consider owne dishonestie iuste cause haue reprehende hosius wrote againste brentius defence petrus soto touchinge councell whiche christe condemned caiphas shoulde beste appeare woulde reade whole place hosius treateth matter would haue rehearsed discoueringe false dealinge shamelesse lieing longethe sprite truthe anna caiphas firste truthe touchinge wholea discrete vvoorthy proctoure actes vvere naught sentence good sentence vvas christ die deathe actes priestes iewes synagog wicked contrary christe sentence though selues neuer euil onely true also mankinde profitable iohn gospell wi nesseth oracle god longe deliberation councell caiphas highe bishop president councell pronounced sentence whereunto reste almost gaue consenteioan expedient v one man die people nation perishe euangeliste thereto added verdite sayinge saide selfe whereas highe bishop yere prophecied therefore let true conclusion whole matter actes councell wicked sentence true good nowe hosius treateth matter learnedly substantially truely take aduantage woordes reprehende stateth selfe vpon scripture good grounde stande vpon vvhiche scripture referreth doubt full harde question priestes leuiticall order whome saide indicabunt tibi iudicij veritate truthe iudgemente vvas sonne god vvas blahpsemer de rued die shal shewe vnto thee truth iudgement iudgement saieth hosius though neuer wicked yet truthe iudgement might proueth brentius moste manifest argumentes vvhere ye impute hosius haue saide plainely iuste decreevntruthe thus saide caiphas iudgemente hosius defendeth true godly whereby pronounced christe woorthy die slaunderous lie hosius saieinge saieth cleane contrary sundry time wicked councell moste vniuste decree god forebidde christen man saie christe woorthy diechriste hosius iudgemente vvas guilty death saithe might haue benne truely pronounced caiphas gilty deathe sheweth religiously wisely admonishinge reader moste innocent deserued die thus syr may see take parte anna caiphas raile yet able god thanked defende true cause declare worlde false teacher therefore belie v b sarisburie good christian reader whole mater concerneth onely credite certainetie general councelles sotus hosius saie euer determined councel must taken vndoubted iudgemente vvoorde god hereunto godly learned father iohannes brentius replieth thus councelles sommetimes haue erred haue vtterly wanted sprite god maie appeare councel sonne god condemned iudged die deathe hosius answeareth anna caiphas sate presidentes coucel christe sonne god condened die yet neuerthelesse coucel assistance holy ghoste vndoubted sprite truthe hosius li contra brentium speakinge councel saithe thus vides brenti quemadmodum non defuerit sacerdotio leuitico spiritus propheticus spiritus sanctus spiritus veritatis yee see frende brentius leuitical priesthoode pronounced sentence deathe christe wanted sprite prophesie holy ghostepagi b sprite truthe againe saithe ex quo tempore primus pares noster de vento ligno gustauit factus est mortis reus christus dei c nec falsum fuit illudpagi quod dixerunt no legem habemus secundum legem hanc debet mori tune oure firste father tasted forebidden fruite christe sonne god became guilty deathe neither false iewes saide vvee haue lavve accordinge lavve ought die sprite trowe inspired wrote marginal note vpon decree iudaei mortaliter peccassentdist item margine nisi christum crucifixissent levves committed mortal sinne nailed christe vnto crosse againe hosius saithehosius contra brent pag b nulla esse potest tanta pontificum improbitas quae impedire queat quo minus vera sit illa dei promissio qui indicabunt tibi iudicij veritatem wickednesse bishoppes neuer greate neuer hinder promisse god shal euer true bishoppes shal shevve thee truthe iudgemente therefore hardinge doctoures meaninge sufficiente bishoppes onely meete councel god wil supplie al reste euer determine holy ghoste wil assist cannot erre al true hosius doctoure saithe anna caiphas coulde erre pronouncinge sentence deathe againste christe excuse hereof sommewhat salue festry mater yee tel v longe tedious tale without heade foote reader maie thinke yee saie somewhat ye crie alowde shamelesse railinge heretiques vvee belie hosius vvee belie sotus false dealinge shamelesse lieinge vvee impudente continevve lieinge hardinge proufes groundes doctrine moste sauerie fairest floures garlande substance tale actes councel christe condemned lewde wicked sentence deathe pronounced bishoppes christe iuste true thus dalliance darke woordes blinde distinction bitweene acte sentence yee seeke shiftes mocke worlde yee shoulde plainely haue tolde v sentence actes greate difference yee canne espie bitweene acte sentence euer yee hearde sentence iudgemente without acte perfite acte without sentence howe sentence iudge maie true acte false acte maie righte sentence wronge credites sake leaue toy hardinge yee haue vsed ouer longe childishe childe becomme grauitie deceiue simple deede easily beleeue neither sotus hosius euer wicked saie christe vvas rightly vvorthily donne deathe saithe sentence deathe pronounced councel againste christe vvas iuste true seemeth deede saie lesse case course doctrine vndoubtedly forced thus saie al coucelles good holy without exception muste also good holy councel assembled againste god againste christe hosius doctours hosius confessione petricouien ca make mater plaine saithe thus iudasne sit petrus paulus deus attendi vult sed solum hoc quod sedet cathedra petri quod apostolus quod christi legatus quod angelus est domini exercituum de cuius ore legem requirere iussus e hoc solum spectari vult si iudas est quandoquidem apostolus est nihil te moueat quod fur est god wil neuer haue thee consider whether pope iudas peter paule sufficiente onely sitteth peter chaire apostle christes embassadoure angel lorde hostes whose mouthe thou arte commounded require lawe thinge onely christe would haue thee consider iudas mutche apostle let moue thee though theefe caiphas saide good one man die people leste al people perishe ergo saie caiphas sprite god ala hardinge although litle passe diuinitie yet haue nomore regarde vnto logique euery childe knoweth paralogismus deceiteful kinde reasoninge called fallacia accidentis yee maie better espie ouersight like yee saie caiphas prophesied blindely selfe vnderstandinge saide ergo holy ghoste euen maie yee saie balaams asse reproued maister spake truthe caiphas ergo balaams asse holy ghoste paule saithe man saie lorde iesus sprite god hereof logique yee maie reason thus diuel saide vnto christe knowe thou arte christe sonne liuinge god corin ergo diuel sprite god pitieth hardinge see folie although caiphas vnwares wil enforcemente power god one onely time spake woordes truthe also balaams asse diuel yet foloweth wee therefore al time renne caiphas seeke truthe augustine saitheaugust epist quando deus voluit etiam mutum iumentum rationabiliter loquutum est nec ideo admoniti sunt homines deliberationibus suis etiam asinina expectare consilia vvhen pleased god balaams asse beinge doum beaste hable speake man yet menne therefore commaunded al consultation doubteful case seeke counsel asse lie shame sclaunders yee would liberally laie vpon v maie please take freely home againe yee ful freight haue stoare sufficiente owne yet maie diuide emonge poore louanian brother shalbe woorke supererogation yewisse thei haue owne yenough already conclude whole drifte herein force reader haue good opinion anna caiphas condemned christe die deathe hosius saithe sprite prophesie holy ghoste sprite truthe therefore coulde erre iudgemente apologie cap diuision wil menne saie refourme v churche beinge themselues bothe personnes guilty iudges wil abate owne ambition pride wil ouerthrowe owne cause geeue sentence againste selues must leaue vnlearned bishoppes slowbellies heapers togeather benefice taker vpon prince menne warre wil abbates pope deere darlinges iudge monke theefe whiche laboureth liuinge againste al lawe suffer sutche one liue founde either cittie countrie al mennes charge el monke ought lie grounde liue hardely hearbes peason studie earnestly argue praie woorke hande fully bende selfe come ministerie churche faithe soone wil phariseis scribe repaire againe temple god restore vnto v house praier steede denne theeues hardinge ye leape lighte skippe one thinge neither dwell ye longe one pointe lieinge ye saie bothe person giltie iudges also iudges doubtelesse vocation lawfull ye cannot disproue guilty also denie whereof fraile liuinge false teachinge commonly teache nothinge courte consciencevntruthe life notorious vvorlde courte man bothe councell councell godly order haue benne decreed holesome reformationmonkes freeres nunnes monckes ye maie looke nowe either gette liuing onely hand labour bounde harde discipline monkes liued twelue hundred yeres paste day manner suche great austeritie wondred wisshed whether religious menne time compelled thereto leaue wise consideration maie lawfull direct v suche spirituall case olde example externe prudencie thinketh discretion iacobs answeare brother esau woorth thought vvhen sau courteously offered brother iacob recourninge mesopotamia traine householde cattell goe keepe companie reste iourney remained place firste meetinge iacob full mildely saide syr know like lordshipgene haue tender babesm hardinge likeneth monkes droaues cattel ewe lambe kine calfe ouerlabour faste goeinge flockes die daie maye please lordship goe seruaunt folowe flocke fayer softe shal see litle one able beare like wise discrete moderation vsed al monckes rigorously driuen ausieritie life liued olde time greate loosenesse maners specially discipline religion beinge farre slaked comparison auncient seueritte feared wee shall rather see cloister foresaken whiche god graunte godly reformation procured whiche wil neuer ende paragraphe ye shewe selfe despaire amendement god geue grace doo partes maye haue good cause hope better whether amende faultes wise pertaineth stification newe gospell disproufe catholike faithe v defended k w good argumente moribus ad doctrinam vvho would hisse trampe schooles ye made fonde reason papis e liues fauliy ergo teachinge false head reason apologie effect maye reduced holde per locum topicum noui euangelij mali moribus hardinge compareth pope bishop vvith scr b phariseis dothe christe selfe confute suche feble reason satethmatth scribe phariseis sitte chayre moses euer saie doo ye woorkes doo ye b sarisburie yee saie monkes freeres shoulde forced keepe olde discipline seueritie fundations would rather breake closters leaue al togeather therefore fitte comparison yee resemble heauy droaues iacobs cattel whereby yee seeme secretely geeue v imagine monkes covvle alwaies holy wo de pretended hierome discribinge life order monkes time saith thus nihil arrogant sibi de continentia supercilij hieronym ad marcellam vt commigret bethlehem humilitatis inter omnes contentio est quicun que nouissimus fuerit hic primus putatur veste nulla discretio nulla admiratio vicunque placuerit incedere nec deiractionis est nec laudis leiunia neminem subleuant nec defertur inediae nec moderata saturitas condemnatur suo domino stat vnusquisque aut cadit nemo iudicat alterum ne domino iudicetur bragge theire sole single life al contention maie moste humble euer laste coumpted firste neither difference woonderinge apparel howe euer pleaseth man goe neither sclaundered commended noman euanced fastinge neither abstinence praised sobre refreassinge condemned eche man either standeth falleth lorde noman iudgeth leaste lorde selfe iudged yee saie monkes adaies waxen nice cranke sutche extreeme rigoure seueritie maie beare sutche holy menne sulpitius seuerus chronico whome sulpitius seuerus writeth sedentes munera expectant atque omne vitae decus mercede corruptum habent dum quasi venalem nalem prae se ferunt sanctimoniam freeres sitte stil looke monie haue al bewtie theire life corrupted hierehieronym ad eustochium de virginita seruanda settinge theire holinesse sale sutche holy nunnes hierome telleth v post coenam dubiam apostolos somniant haue wel filled belly dreame apostle like sorte writeth certaine monkes apud ho affectata sunt omnia laxae manicae caligae follicantes vestis crassior crebra suspiria visitatio virginu detractio clericorum et eadem episto ad eustochium si quando dy festus venerit saturantur ad vomitum emonge men al thinges countrefeite theire wide sleeues theire greate bootes theire course gowne theire often sighes theire visitinge virgines theire backebitinge priestes comme holy daie eate vntil faine perbreake doubte holinesse christe brought worlde youre life ye saie preiudice youre faithe howe euer liue yet youre doctrine right good catholique yee proue wordes christe matthae scribe phariseis sitte moses chaire euer saie doo yee theire woorkes doo yee beste claime ye holde suffer v hardinge saie christe sommetime saide whome ye confesse bee youre father woe bee vnto yee scribe eod capite phariseis yee hypocrite yee deuoure rauen vp poore vvidovves house vnder coloure longe praier outwardely yee seeme holy within yee ful hypocrisie wickednesse valentinian heretiques olde time vsed like case saie selues irenaeus li ca quemadmodum aurum coeno depositum non amittit decorem suum ita dicunt semeripsos quibuscun que materialibus operibus sint nihil noceri ne que amittere spiritualem substantiam goulde notwithstandinge laide dounge yet neuerthelesse keepeth bewtie stil saie selues euer corruptible woorkes liue yet neuer woorse lose spiritual substance theire faitheaugust de morib manichae li ca augustine saithe vnto olde heretiques called manichee dicitis non oportere omnino quaeri quales sunt homines qui vestram sectam profitentur sed qualis sit ipsa professio quid vobis fallacius quid infidiosius quid malitiosius dici aut inueniti potest yee saie maie examine menne bee professe secte onely theire profession thinge founde false deceiteful maliceous apologie cap diuision haue benne knowe certaine theire owne companion whiche haue founde faulte many errours churche pope adrian aeneas syluius cardinal poole pighius others afore said helde afterwardes councel trident self place nowe appointed assembled many bishoppes abbates others behoued matter alone selues euer body gainesaide hadde quite shutte barred side al manner assembly sate sixe yeres feeding folkes maruilous expectation doinges first sixe monethes though greatly needeful made many determination holy trinitie father sonne holy ghoste whiche godly thinges deede necessarie time let v see al many manifeste often confessed euident errours one erroure haue amendedthe freedome councel trident kinde idolatrie haue thei reclaimed people superstition haue thei taken away peece tyrannie pompe haue thei diminshed though al worlde maie nowe see conspiracie councel bishoppes whome pope hath nowe called togeather wholy sworne become bounde beare theire faithful allegiaunce wil doo manner thinge perceiue pleaseth healpeth auance power wil haue recken number mennes voice rather weight value might dooth oftentimes ouercomme right hardinge procede talke pleasure godly learned father assembled late councel trent waie manner droppe lie whiche one hadde quite shut barred youre side al manner assembliesvntruthe manifeste hereafter shal appeare whiche foule lie firste sixe monethes occupied selues makinge many determination holy trinitie also lie worlde hadde nede newe determination decree concerninge trinitie shal haue hereafter occasion youre chiefe maister iohna sclaunderous vntruthe caluine vvas euer enimie vnto arians caluines doctrine feared yet perceiued vvhere ye would faine see manie manifest often confessed themselfes euident errours one errour haue amended like satisfie longinge yet haue taken order amendementevntruthe impudente ovvne confessed knovven errours neuer touched many knowe neither point faithe thinges lesse weight exaggeration termes many manifest often confessed euident reporteth one sentence many manifest often confuted v euident lie vvhen folowe hote humour aske kinde idolatrie father tridentine councel haue reclaimed people go farre vvhat euer blasphemie ye vtter bookes sermon adoration blessed sacrament aulter knowe kinde idolatrie vsed churchevntruthe co fessed harding owne felovves reade ansvveare neither idolatrie committed v worshippinge sainctes praieinge reuerence exhibite image ye beare people handeo profounde diuinitie w l take heare lieing bearde wishe could plucke malice youre blasphemous harte b sarisburie whether learned menne oure side shut te right libertie youre councel parte diut parte ca diui cicero verrem actione concil triden anno maie soone appeare partly already saide partly shalbe saide hereafter verily pope premunire wil suffer bishop geeue voice councel lesse haue firste solemnely sworne see rome therefore al called creature cicero saithe verres hadde bribed spoiled whole ilelande sicilia thought good suffer name parte dooinges comme hazarde onely iudge arbiter owne therefore frenche kinges embassadoure saide protested thus openly euen saide councel minus legitima minus que libera dicuntur fuisse illa concilia qui aderant ad voluntatem alterius semper loquebantur councelles coumpted neither free laweful ought bee spake euermore please whiche meante pope cause emperoures maiestie embassadoure hurtadus mendoza solemnely protested againste assemblie councel woordes ego iacobus hurtadus mendoza uomine pientissimi inuictissimi domini mei carolus caesaris romani imperatoris ex illius speciali mandato ac nomine totius sacri romani imperij aliorum que regnorum ac dominiorum suorum protestoranno citatur ab illyrico protestatione contra co cil triden nullam posse esse authoritatem assetorum legatorum sanctitatis vestrae corum episcoporu qui sunt bononiae sanctitati vestrae maiori ex parte obnoxiorum que ab illius nutu omnino pendentium vt religionis morum reformationis causa c legem praescribant lama hurtado mendoza name ye godly mighty prince lord charles romaine emperour special comission ye name vvhole romaine empiere al others realmes dominion doo proteste authoritie pretensed legate youre holinesse sutche bishoppes nowe bononia vnto whiche towne councel trident adiourned moste parte bounde vnto youre holinesse wholy hanginge vpon youre becke force namely make lawes cause reformatio religion maners andparalipomen vrspergen aeneas syluius ad capitulum moguntinum iohan sleidanus anno li hoc enim esse colligare manus pontificis maie appeare obedience seruile subiection al bishoppes vnto pope aeneas syluius otherwise called pope pius seconde saith thus quod si episcopus papae contradicat etiam vera loquendo nihilominus peccat contra iufiorandum papae praestitum bishop speake pope yea although speake truthe yet neuerthelesse sinneth againste othe hath made vnto pope therefore late conference norenberg required prince state germanie al bishoppes comminge councel might bothe discharged theire othe made pope also sworne speake promote truthe pope legate made answeare greate disdeigne might bee pope handes bounde hereby hardinge blinde man maie easily see fourme freedome youre councelles bishoppes free saie truthe pope leafte bondage whether youre father chapter tridente sate sixe whole moonethes debatinge reasoning trinitie certaine knowledge cannot telle certainely thinge el either al timecassader co sultatione de co munione subvtra que specie praefatione anno longe hardely shewe v therefore mutche nothinge el appeareth theire dooinges wee must imagine thei sate mute muminerie saide nothinge notwithstandinge cassander saithe thei bestowed one whole sommer greate holy disputation aboute meaner mater trinitie meane onely communion cuppe martinus kemnitius saithe thei helde disputation kepte greate sturre seuen whole moonethes togeather iustification faith workesmarti remmitius examine concil triden pag yet end leaft worse thei founde saie selues haue espied mani disorder church rome plain bi ovvn confession recken al particular long haue partely touched heretofore albertus pigghius confesseth abuse masse alber pigghi controuer de missa priuata concil tridenti frenche king embassadour youre laie tridentine chapter saithe thus vel praefectorum ecclesiae incuria vel etiam ne quid grauius dicam praepostera pietate irrepsisse ecclesiam re nonnullas antiquatione abrogatione vel moderatione dignas fateamur necesse est wee must needes confesse either negligence bishoppes disordered opinion holinesse wil saie meaneth falsehedpicus miran ad leonem pp concil lateran mockerie wiltal auarice certaine thinges brought churche woorthy either put awaie abolished leaste qualified picus mirandula besoughte pope leo abate vaine multitude youre ceremony refourme youre praiers cut youre fable one youre owne louanian felovves saithecopus dialo pag euen nowe day many good menne mislike many appeales rome idolatrie churche rome somme others finde faulte pardonnes somme youre simonie youre stevves somme youre licenceous keepinge mainteininge concubine wil enlarge mater like thinges confessed youre selues greater mater wil touche case faith credites sake ye maie graunte manner erroure otherwise might thought yee haue neither faith life christian menne nowe therefore tel v hardinge one abuse al abuse masse one disorder deformitie many disorder deformity churche one vaine ceremonie one childishe fable appeale rome simonie pardonne stevves courteghianes concubine haue yee refourmed yee redresse grosse sensible abuse yee see youre eies howe wil yee redresse secrete mater perteine onely faithe seene ye wil refourme open stevves wil yee refourme churche god yee bolde assure v kinde idolatrie euer youre whole churche rome notwithstanding somme others youre beste learned frendes haue thought otherwise shal appeare firste epiphani li oratione de fide catholica nonlatin alphabet epiphanius saithe certaine persian named magusaei idola quidem detestantur tamen idolis cultum exhibent thei abhorre sight idolles yet thei fal downe woorship idolles againe reporteth certaine woordes paule vttered sprite prophesie erunt mortuis cultum diuinum praestantes quemadmodum etiam israel impie coluerunt thei shal geue godly honoure vnto deade menne like also thei israel opinion yee haue sainctes departed neede remember cardinal bembus epistle vnto emperour charles calleth blessed virgine epiphani contra collyridian bembus epi ad carolum lipomanus pag dominam deam nostram lady goddesse youre greate hercules lipomanus crieth marginal agonie ecce quam potentissima est sanctum dei genitrix quomodo nullus saluus fieri possit nisi per eam beholde howe mighty holy mother god howe noman maie saued seemeth erroure beganne springe longe sithence euen time olde father hereof faustus heretique tooke occasion thus charge catholiques august contra faustum li cap idola vertistis martyres yee haue changed heathen idolles youre martyr yee saie reuerence yee geeue vnto sainctes image idolatrie yet polydorus vergilius speaking hereof saithe thus quia sacerdotes populum non docent vulgo ex vsu suo tacere putanturpolydor virgil de inuentoribus rerum li cap idcirco eo insaniae deuentum est vt haec par pietatis parum differat ab impietare priestes iustructe people thought holde theire peace gaines sake mater brought sutche dotage parte deuotion differeth litle extreme wickednesse ludouicus viues saithe seeth greate difference bitweene many christian menne woorshipping imagesludo viues li de ciuita dei catharinus libello de imaginibus heathen man adouring idolles catharinus one greate doctours tridente saithe thus licet adorare imago ipsas illis cultu praebere sunt qui hoc omnino negent clament esse idololatriam videntur autem non futilibus argumentis moueri nec ab que maiorum imo etiam scripturarum authoritate whether lawful woorship image somme menne saie nay calle idolatrie thei seeme moued light argumentes without authoritie wel father scripture iacobus nanclantus saithe iacob nanclantus epist ad rom cap non solum fatendum est fideles ecclesia adorare coram imagine sed adorare imaginem fine quo volueris scrupulo quin illam venerari cultu quo prototypon eius propter quod si illud habet adorari latria illa habet adorari latria must graunte faithful people churche onely vvoorshippe image also vvorshippe image selfe without manner scruple conscience whatsoeuer thei vvorshippe image vvith selfe honoure vvherevvith thei vvoorshippe thinge selfe represented image thing selfe vvoorshipped vvith godly honoure muste image selfe likevvise vvoorshipped vvith godly honoure hereto agreeth one late writer iacobus payuaiacob payua li fortalitiu fidei rob holcote librum sapien lectione like doctours saithe vse practise churche rome robertus holcote saith kinde vvorshippinge plaine idolatrie yee wil saie yee knovve image god ye thinke excuse sufficiente likewise saide heathen theire idoles yet augustine saith thei idolater notwithstanding yee wil saie augu de verb domi secundum matt sermo augustin ad quodvult deum paul venet li cap image apostle christe god selfe therefore idolatrie augustine saithe marcellina colebat imaginem iesu pauli homeri pythagorae adorando incensum que ponendo marcellina woorshipped image iesus paule homere pythagoras kneelinge vnto burninge incense yet neuerthelesse idolater saracenes date make theire sacrifice mounte mecha diuels heathen goddes abraham isaac thomas yet ace thei therefore excused idolatrie gregor nyssen orat funebri de placilla gregorius bishop nyssa basiles brother saithe thus qui creaturam adorat etsi nomine christi id faciat tamen simulachrorum cultor est christi nomen simulachro imponens woorshipper creature notwithstandinge doo name christe yet woorshipper image geeuing name christe vnto image fewe harding maie soone appeare church voide al idolatrie apologie cap diuision therefore knowe diuers time many good men catholique bishoppes tarrie home would come sutche councelles called wherein menne apparently laboured serue faction take partes bicause thei knewe thei lose trauaile doo good seeinge wherevnto theire enimies mindes wholy bente athanasius denied comme called emperoure councel caesaria perceiuinge plainely come among enimies whiche deadly hated athanasius came afterwarde councel syrmium foresawe woulde ende reason outrage malice enimies packed vp cariage went away immediately iohn chrysostome although emperoure constantius histor tripari lib cap euseb li ca commaunded foure sundrie letter come arians councel yet keapte selfe home stil maximus bishop hierusalem sate councel palestine olde father paphnutius toke hand leadde doores saieinge lavvful v conferre mater vvith vvicked menne bishoppes easte woulde comme syrmian councel knewe athanasius gotten selfe thence againe cyril called menne backe letter councel whiche named patropassians paulinus bishop trier many others moe refused comme councel millaine vnderstoode sturre rule auxentius keapte sawe vaine goe thither reason faction shoulde preuaile folke contended truthe right iudgemente mater partialitie fauour al father sutche maliceous stiffe necked enimies yet thei comme thei haue free speache least councelles hardinge firstand vvhy vvel hard maie calle vvhole churche pope vineyarde pag b al bishop vvorlde pope sheepe pag b note falsehed lady enterpreter turneth latine speaking athanasius cum vocatus esset ab imperatore ad concilium caesariense vvhen called emperoure councel caesarca vvhere addinge worde owne worse shrewe vnder name goeth perswade heretiques doo councels accompted councels temporal prince bishoppes head bishop rome mutche nowe sir defender al example serue purpose denied case menne maie refuse comme councels example declare catholique bishop shunned come vnto vnlauful councels heretiques ye holdinge strange opinion condemned churche denie comme lauful councels catholike bishoppes vvhen ye haue proued v heretiques meane father late councel maie ye iustly alleage example athanasius chrysostome maximus paphnutius cyril paulinu sutche comminge councel b sarisburie shrewde sharpe witte hardinge good likinge yee coulde neuer haue made selfe greate sporte smal mater lady interpreter pitieth case wisheth litle discretion woulde mutche ashamed answeare folie councel speake emperoures councel mutche lesse pope councel day hereafter shalbe declared large councelles summoned emperoures pope reason haue shew v councel summoned emperoure might called emperoure councel wel pope admitted allowed emperoure might called emperoures prieste odoacerin concil romano sub symmacho pp third councel rome time pope symmachus saide thus miramur praetermissis nobis quicqua fuisse tentatu cum etia sacerdote nostro superstite nihil sine nobis debuisset affumi wee ueile thinge attempted without knowledge mutche prieste meaneth pope beinge aliue nothing maie donne without v liberat cap liberatus saithe flauianus episcopus eutychem ad concilium suum heretiques hilarius saithe congreger nunc auxentius quas volet synodos haereticum vt saepe iam fecit publico titulo proscribat nowe let auxentius arian heretique calle councelles liste open hierome saithe vnto marcus hieronym ad marcum presbyterum celedensem haereticus sum quid ad te quiesce iam dictu est heretique thee holde peace yee haue tolde tale like right christe selfe certaine anciente father called samaritane deceiuer people heretique maie please soberly aduisedly consider mater ye shal finde throughout whole body scripture people made euer greate crake churche thei deadly enimies churche none ready condeue others heresie thei deede selues greatest heretiques apologie cap diuision nowe sithence none v maie bee suffered mutche sitte seene mennes meetinges mutche lesse suffered speake freely minde seeinge pope legate patriarch archebishoppes bishoppes abbates al conspired togeather al linked togeather one kinde faulte al bounde one othe sitte alone selues haue power alone geeue consente last thei haue al donne though thei donne nothinge bringe al opinion iudged wil pleasure pope one man thende maie pronounce owne sentence selfe ought rather haue answeared complainte sithence also ancient christian libertie whiche al right shoulde specially bee christian councelles nowe vtterly taken away councel cause saie wise good menne ought marueile daie though doo ye alleage comming councel ye codemned already trial though matter aforehand dispatched agreed vpon dedevntruthe vvithout coloure honeste shame heresy part haue ben condemned thousand yeres past therefore thei nowe called vnto newe trial though churche vntil daie benne deceiued many father ouerseene notwithstanding maie ye wel saie touching point matter afore hand dispatched agreed vpon thei knowe ye saie see ye saie nothing onely stande wilfully stubbornly false opinion fleshly pleasure b sarisburie wee neuer suppressed bookes hardinge knowethe pope saueconducte wel contented see common stripte pontificalibus turned home againe minoribus allowed onely cardinal lenger pope yee maie remember cicero saithe qui multorum custodem se profiteatur eum sapientes sui primum capitis aiunt nachiantes bishop chioca simpred one halfe woorde truthe mislikinge legate faine renne rome crepe pope feete craue pardonne yee shamefully betraied cruelly murthered iohn husse hieronymus pragensis coucel costance neither protection emperoure pope saueconducte hable saue selues haue already ruled case said councel thus yee saie fides non est seruanda hereticis yee maie holde faithe vnto yee nation al true deede truthe discrieth youre open mockerie yee hadde seene instrumente ende thereof yee shoulde haue founde youre saide extension restrained onely themio fabritius recusatione co cil triden iohan sleidanus li anno woulde repente recante truthe god whiche calle erroure howe longe sithence bishoppes youre saide chapter tridente lothe allowe tolerable sauecondite al either germaines others yee saie wee hadde comme youre chapter hadde benne confounded doubtes youre firy argumentes sutche proufes muste healpe others faile gaie stuffe youre tridentine father theire nature deliberation calle twentie yeeres studie haue sente v lately worlde simple mocke child wee finde faulte hardinge youre bishoppes abbates agree togeather agree togeather herode pilate matt sadduceis phariseis againste christe neither maie wel vaunte youre selues youre greate agreementes yee maie remember twoo principal pillers youre chapter petrus soto catharinus petrus soto catharinus dissented euen openly shamefully greate pointes religion wrote one mightily againste one charginge erroure heresie coulde neuer bee reconciled notwithstandinge againste pointes goddes truthe bothe reste ioined stoutely togeather augustine saithe august psal concione tunc inter se concordant quando perniciem iusti conspirant non quia se amant sed quia eum qui amandus erat simul oderunt agree togeather conspire destroie iuste selues loue one bothe hate whome ought loue sutche kinde consente hierome although farre contrarie pourpose imagineth iouinian thus saie hieronym apolo etico ad domnionem quod damnant episcopi non est ratio sed conspiratio nolo mihi ille vel ille respondeat quorum authoritas opprimere potest docere non potest bishoppes condemne reason theire dooinges conspiracie would man man shoulde answeare mee whiche maie oppresse mee theire authoritie cannot teache mee whether bee conueniente pope beinge notoriously accused manifeste corruption goddes religion shoulde neuerthelesse whole onely iudge pronounce sentence selfe let indifferently considered wise lawe saitheff de iurisdict omniu iudicum nemo sibi debet ius dicere man maie bee owne iudge sutche authoritie yee saie kinges haue parlamentes hereof hable dispute prince right many time passeth composition therefore euermore one al place howe pope bishop kinge bishoppes subiectes brother youre fourthe obiection cauil yee saie yee mocke prince embassadours place nexte vnto youre legate sitte stil trowe telle clocke voice iudgemet ye allowe none thus ye proine authoritie allowe honoure notwithstandinge whether emperours prince embassadours maie sitte neare pope legate telthe placinge embassadours verily emperoure selfe maie bolde presse neare vnto pope thus ordered youre booke ceremony aduertendum est quod locus vbi sedet imperator non sit altior loco vbi tenet pes pontifex ceremoniarium roman li sect cap noted place emperoure sitteth general councel higher place pope setteth feete saie emperoure must sitte pope footestoole higher al partes oure religion whiche calle heresy yee saie already condemned iuste thousande yeeres paste hardinge woulde haue woonne somme good credite yee could haue tolde v general councel vnder emperoure doctours catholique learned father greate errours thus condemned nowe yee roaue onely large feede youre simple reader youre emptie calendares thousandes yeeres speake randonne hadde benne true yee woulde better haue shewed beinge moste vntrue knowe bee shame yee neuer haue saide apologie cap diuision neuerthelesse wee beare patiently quietly owne priuate wronges blamevvorthy negligente priestes prelate clergie ye speake spiteful surmise though god vtterly withdrawen holy spirite forasmuche christe assisteth churche alwaies shal neuer faile thinges necessary canonically punished offender priestly discipline redressed neither conuenient kinge come priestes consistoriesvntruthe reproued ancient practise churche shal appeare cal priestes owne seate iudgement spiritual temporal haue geeuen right bothe swerdes thus youre owne pope nicolas telleth stoutely owne behalfe christus petro dist omnes aeternae vitae clauigero terreni simul coelestis imperij iura co shal euermore prouide good gouernours thus youre negligence carelesse slouthfulnesse neuer greate bee youre liues neuer loose bee doumbe dogges hable barke bee lanternes without light bee salte without sauoure yet yee euermore dreame sweetely christes promise assure youre selues vndoubtedly assistance euen sommetime saide pan curer oues ouium que magistros woulde god youre bishoppes woulde doo dutie doo faithfully worlde shoulde haue lesse cause complaine notwithstandinge christe euermore mindeful promise seeth churche defaced laide waste raiseth vp faitheful magistrate godly prince doo againste selfe maie saie thus christe hath placed churche somme apostle somme prophetes somme euangelistes somme pastoures somme teacher pope cardinalles named apostle apostle twelue prophetes
