substantial sorte pope paulus longe sithence reasoned againste emperoure charles fifthe epistola pauli ad carolum en ego supra pastores meos beholde saithe god almighty wil pounishe priestes bishoppes negligence wickednesse ergo saithe pope paulus prince emperoure maie pounishe manner reasoning hardinge welneare many errours woordes firste ignoratio elenchi grossest fallax al reste secondly yee conclude without either moode figure childe maie easily see thirdely yee reason meris particularibus non distributo ad distributum fourthely woordes rule charge churche woordes double doubteful meaninge therefore syllogismus sutche must needes stande foure termes whiche erroure reasoninge simple childe touchinge woordes rule charge whiche saide double doubteful notwithstandinge wee saie bothe prince bishop haue charge churche yet prince bishop haue bothe one kinde charge bishoppes charge preache minister sacramentes order priestes excommunicate absolue c prince charge doo thinges selfe owne personne onely see donne orderly truely donne bishoppes graunte many special priuileges graunted vpon greate iuste consideration meere fauoure prince prieste founde neligente otherwise offendinge ministerie conuented pounished temporal ciuile magistrate discretion bishop prince magistrate maie lawfully calle prieste owne seate iudgemente many catholique godly prince haue donne donne lawfully moste vntrue emperoure iustinian selfe al others moste enlarged church priuileges cod li de epi clericis nullus saithe thus nullus episcopus inuitus ad ciuilem vel militarem iudicem qualibet causa produeatur vel exhibeatur nisi princeps iubeat let bishop brought presented againste wil captaine ciuile iudge euer cause onlesse prince shal commaunde emperoure martianus commaundeth cause criminal bishop conuented lieutenant vt coram praeside conueniatur pope innocentius selfe confesseth pope maie make laie man delegate hearecod de epi audi si qui ex consensu determine priestes cause like hereof yee maie finde owne glose papa laico delegat causam spiritualem pope committeth hearinge spiritual mater vnto laie man yea yee shal finde euen pope owne decree cod de epi clericis cum clericis pope hath committed spiritual mater cause simonie hearde ended vvooman brunichildis beinge vvooman vertue pope commission summoned bishop appeare solemnely make purgation herde maiorit obedient ca innocent notwithstandinge glose vpon noted thus fuit tamen hic nimium papaliter dispensatum pope popelike dispensation emperoure constantinus wrote thus vnto bishoppesil q clericum nullus benne councel tyrus cuncti quotquot synodum tyri compleuistis sine mora ad pietatis nostrae castra properate ac ipsa quam sincere ac recte iudicaueritis ostendatis2 qu mennam socrates lib cap id que coram quem sincerum esse dei ministrum ne vos quidem negabitis al yee haue benne councel tyrus comme without delaie vnto campe shewe plainely without coloure vprightly ye haue dealte judgemente euen selfe whome cannot denie true seruante god iustinian emperoure lavve maketh touching publike praiers churche saithe thus vvee commaunde al bishoppes priestes minister holy oblationauthen constitutione praier holy baptisme vnder silence sutche voice maie hearde faitheful people intente harte hearer maie sturred deuotion c afterwarde addeth let holy priestes vnderstande neglecte thinges shal make answeare therefore dreadeful judgement great god saueoure iesus christe yet neuerthelesse vve ourselues vnderstanding vvil passe ouer leaue vnpounished hereby wee see godly prince maie summone bishoppes appeare euen cause ecclesiastical receiue sutche pounishment haue deserued likewise emperoure constantinus letter vnto people nicomedia speakinge wilful errours heresy priestes bishoppes saithe thus illorum temeraria praesumptio theodoretus li ca augustin contra epist parmeniani li ca mea hoc est ministri christi manu coercebitur rashe attemptes shalbe repressed hande saie hande christes seruante likewise saithe augustine vnto donatistes forte de religione fa non est vt dicat imperator vel quos miserit imperator cur ergo ad imperatorem legati vestri venerunt lawful emperours emperours deputee pronounce case religion wherefore wente owne embassadoures emperoure speake wee priestes inferiour bishoppes pope selues notwithstandinge al vniuersal povver haue submitted selues made purgation kinges emperoure pope liberius made humble appearance emperoure constantius theodor lib cap pope sixtus accused made purgation emperoure valentinian pope leo quaest man dastis beinge accused paschalis campulus pleaded cause carolus magnus rome yet chosen emperoure pope iohn accused heresie quae auditum forced recante vnto philip frenche kinge pope leo sermone paschali quae no si wise humbly submitteth selfe vnto iudgemente levves emperoure no si incompetenter aliquid egimus subditis iustae legis tramitem non conseruauimus vestro admissorum nostrorum cuncta volumus emendare iudicio yf wee haue donne thinge oute order wee haue folowed right course lawe ouer subiectes vve vvil amende al faultes maiesties iudgemente owne glose saithe papa potest dare potestatem imperatori vt deponat ipsum sese omnibus illi subijcere pope maie geeue emperoure power depose selfe dist synodo gloss francis zarabella de schemate concil maie al thinges submit selfe vnto shorte franciscus zarabella saithe papa accusari potest coram imperatore de quolibet crimine notorio et imperator requirere potest papa rationem fidei pope maie accused emperoure notorious crime emperoure maie require pope yeelde accoumpte faithe therefore hardinge reporte owne indifferent iudgemente true yee saie conuenient kinge calle priestes owne seate iudgemente verily note yee might haue founde glosed owne decretalles extra de maiorita obedie ca margin quaeritur quis exemit clericum de iurisdictione imperatoris cum prius esset illi subiectus dicit laurentius quod papa de consensu principis question moued vvho hath exempted prieste jurisdiction emperoure whereas subiecte emperours courte laurence saithe pope hath exempted consente prince yee see therefore hardinge priestes abbates bishoppes haue theire priuileges exemption right goddes woorde onely pope policie special fauoure prince apologie cap diuision thei wil saie gheasse ciuile prince haue learned gouerne common wealthe order mater warre vnderstande secrete mystery religion pope praie daie monarch prince cardinalles whoe must none nowe prince kinges sonnes el patriarch moste parte archebishoppes bishoppes abbates el present pope kingedome worldely prince duke erles gorgeously accompanied bandes menne whither euer goe oftentimes also gayly araied chaines collar golde thei haue time certaine ornametes selues cross pillers hattes miter palles whiche pompe auncient bishoppes chrysostome augustine ambrose neuer settinge thing aside teache thei saie thei doo thei liue saie maie become bishop maie become christian man greate matter haue vaine title changinge garment onely haue name bishop hardinge duetie ciuil prince consisteth ciuil matter duetie bishoppes spiritual thinges serueth preseruation men person saluation soules euery high priest saieth paule taken amonge menheb ordeined men thinges apperteining god vntruthe manifeste vvee moue prince take vpon bishoppes office moue temporal prince take vpon office pope bishop though thinge indifferent common bishoppes negligent temporal men maie steede reason ende ye make slender wene fewe prince feare god wilbe greatly moued ad enter thinge muche subiecte reason thisbishoppes entangled vvorldly affaire consider cleregie ergo temporall maie beare office bishoppes antecedent false although bishoppes changinge garment onely saie yet defect shoulde late kinges queenes doo office false bishoppes catholike churche ordinated consecrated though pope haue princely dominion bishoppes christendome haue dukedomes erledomes though ride well otherwise becommeth vocation doo weare though haue ornamentes whiche grieueth muche comparison thevntruthe reason temporal prince saie maie meddle ecclesiastical cause pope saie vvee nothinge el teporal prince ergo iudgemente beggery maried estate yet imbarreth bishoppes though teache notthe pope maie meddle ecclesiastical cause though saie though doo though liue becommeth bishoppes neither becometh euen christen manvntruthe reade ansvveare raile notwithstanding yet bishoppes though euill bishoppes neither al may latefull take office vpon themo glorious thraso vvas apostle state mutch beggerly iudas apostle till rope choked neither wickednesse might streuen mathias disciple owne presumpt haue smepte r true railinge talke false whiche malice hath stirred vtter b sarisburie oui againe wee tel le hardinge wee confounde office notwithstandinge often lewd ly reporte v owne discredite linge b nardes prince neuer tooke vpon office bishoppes bishoppes haue taken vpon office prince bishoppes written owne councellesthe pope hardinge compared iudas ecce iam pe e nulla est acti quam non sacerdotes administrent beholde affaire priestes bishoppes aue hande sutche bishoppes chrysostome writeth thus citatur ab illyrico inter verit pag chrysostom matth hom hieronym contra qui non credunt iudicium dei nec timen abutentes primatu suo ecclesiastico saeculariter conuertunt eum saecularem neither beleeue feare judgemente god theire ecclesiastical dignitie seculare sorte turne seculare dignitie sutche bishoppes whome hierome saithe thus ipsi sibi laici sunt episcopi selues selues bothe laiemenne bishoppes againe adorant dominum melchom qui saecedo pariter domino putant se posse seruire duobus dominis satisfacere deo mammonae qui militantes christo obligant sese negotijs saecularibus candem imaginem offerunt deo caesari woorship lorde melchom bothe togeather thinkinge maie serue bothe woorlde hieronym sophontam ca concil trident sub paulo admonitio legator lorde satisfie twoo maisters god mammon fightinge vnder christe binde selues worldly affaire offer vp one image bothe god caesar yee wil beleeue none yet pope ovvne legate late chapter tridente speakinge priestelike apparel saie thus nihil laic praeterquam vestis genere ac ne hoc quidem differunt priestes differ nothinge laiemenne sauinge onely apparel naie deede differ mutche apparel yee saieauentinus le de ruperto christum omnium deorum esse pauperrimum bishoppes gaie gallante attended garded princelike route bothe behinde thereof yee make smal accoumpte specially respecte estate whiche calle beggerly sutche disdeigne heathen sommetime saide christe beggerliest poorest al goddes heauen ecclesiastical brauerie apparel bishoprikes sauinge certaine father haue shamefully spoiled nowe euen certainely poorest bishoprike englande reported better reuenewes theli somme three pope italian bishoprikes kingedome naples gospel christe standeth richesse truthe comparison one wee make smal reckeninge neuerthelesse wise godly haue euermore founde faulte ecclesiastical brauerie romaine cleregie bernard cantica sermo holcote sapien lectio bernard cantica sermo bernarde saithe inde est quem quotidie ides meretriceus nitor histrionicus habitus regius apparatus inde aurum frenis sellis calcaribus therehence commeth theire whoorelike finenesse theire plaiers vveede princely apparel therehence commeth goulde theire bridle saddels theire spurres againe saithe incedunt nitidi ornati circumamicti varietatibus tanquam sponsa procedens de thalamo suo nonne si quempiam talium eminus procedentem aspexeris sposam potids putabis quam sponsae custodem goe trimmely finely coloures spouse shoulde comme chamber thou shouldest suddainely see one lettinge farre wouldest thou rather thinke spouse keeper spouse pope bonifacius greate iubilee paralipomena vrspergen solemne procession wente apparelled emperours roabes crovvne emperial heade svverde maiestie borne emperoure spiritual ioilitie hardinge liketh wel notwithstandinge bernarde saithe bernard de consideratione ad eugenium lib daemonum magi quam ouium sunt haec pascua scilicet sic factitabat petrus sic paulus ludebat pastoures diuels sheepe doubte euen thus peter euen sutche pastime plaide paule yee telle v though teache though saie though doo though liue becommeth bishoppes becommeth christian man yet bee bishoppes withstandinge hereat wee wil greately striue vvoulfe geate sheepehooke cloke maie shephearde blindeman geate watche tower maie bee spie miserable poore sheepe fedde miserable poore castle watched augustine saithe quae qui episcopatum augustin episcopatus est nomen operis non honoris vt intelligat se non esse episcopum qui praeesse dilexerit non prodesse bishoppes office name laboure honoure loueth rule profite maie vnderstande selfe bishop againe saithe sutche one quae qui nec augustin canis impudicus dicendus est magi quam episcopus ought rather called shamelesse dogge bishop yee saie bishoppes duely ordinated consecrated augustine replieth august contra donatist li ipsum characterem multi lupi lupis imprimunt touchinge outwarde consecration bishop many geeue vvoulues vvoulues selues bernarde bernard de consideratione ad eugeni li speakinge priestes bishoppes saithe habitu milites quaestu clericos actu neutros exhibent nam neque vt milites pugnant neque vt clerici euangelizant cuius ergo ordinis sunt cum vtriusque esse cupiunt vtrunque deserunt vtrunque confundunt vnusquisque inquit suo ordine resurget quo isti qui sine ordine peccauerut sine ordine peribunt vereor alibi ordinandos quam vbi nullus ordo sed sempiternus horror inhabitat theire apparel souldiers gaines priestes bishoppe effecte deede neither bothe neither doo fighte fielde doo souldiers doo preache priestes bishoppes whether order therefore whereas would bothe order foresake bothe confounde bothe paule saithe euery man shal rise againe owne order1 corinth order shal rise whether mutche haue finned without order shal perishe without order feare shalbe ordered none otherwhere order disorder horroure euerlastinge thus plainely speake owne doctoures touchinge cleregie whiche plainenesse pleaseth hardinge calle false malicious railinge apologie cap diuision surely haue principal staie effecte al mater committed wholy mennes handes neither knowe wil knowe thinges yet set iote poincte religion saue whiche concerneth belly riot haue alone sitte iudges set vp ouerseers watche tower better blinde spy side haue christian prince good vnderstandinge right iudgemente stande stil like blocke stake suffred neither geeue voice shewe iudgemente onely waite menne shal wil commaunde one whiche neither eares eies witte harte whatsoeuer geeue charge allowe without exception blindely fulfilling commaundementes neuer blasphemous wicked yea although commaunde quite destroie al religion crucifie againe christe selfe surely bisides proude spiteful also beyonde al right reason endured christian wise prince praie maie caiphas anna vnderstande mater maie dauid ezechias doo lauful cardinal beinge man warre delitinge bloude haue place councel lauful christian emperoure kinge b sarisburie hereto hardinge saithe nothinge hath oftentimes saide apologie cap diuision verely wee graunte libertie magistrate knowe hath bothe benne geeuen vvoorde god also confirmed example beste gouerned common wealthes hardinge man shoulde aske woorde god maketh temporall prince supreme head parte churche hath gournement al ciuil matter sure bringe foorthevntruthe vvee allege many place bisides maie sooue appeare woorde god wherein peter1 pet rom paule willeth al menne obeie superiour power especially kinges vvhiche thinge written christian men while liued vnder heathen prince infidel claudius cesar nero suppose ye wil saie haue benne heades whole churche monarkes prince whole worldesupreme heade supreme gouernoure scripture whiche cannot proue nero beinge athen cannot pope heade churche hath persecuted church mutche nero persecutour christes churche haue ben heade wil proue prince supreme head churche semeth either make nero heade churche geue vnto word god wil beare example good comon weales shewe v one since christes ascension wherein luther time emperour christian prince attribute title vnto selfe wil saie speake common weales plural number make one lye case shew v one common weale hath done lie plural number yea daie common weales christendome onely catholike beste also lutherishe newfangled abhorre fro strange vnheard title ofmutche doo nothing prince hath title queene marie vsed title supreme heade many vvaies maie proued supreme head churche saie ye haue either worde god example approued common weales b sarisburie concerning title supreme head churche wee neede searche scripture excuse firste wee diuised secondly wee vse thirdly prince presente claime father harding firste entitled moste noble moste woorthy prince kinge henrie eighth vnused strange style maie wel thought rather bringe talke sclaunder worlde howe prince highest iudge gouernoure ouer al subiectes euer wel priestes laie menne without exception moste euidente hath benne already saide shal saide hereafter whole course scripture vndoubted practise primitiue churche verily prince shal afterwarde better appeare bothe table lavve god euermore committed charge wel firste perteineth religion also seconde perteineth ciuile gouernemente nowe hardinge man would aske vvoorde god priestes bishoppes haue exempted selues ye iudgement gouernement theire prince vvoord god prince hande restreined cleregie subiectes vvoorde god yee woulde stablishe tvvoo supreme gouernoures one realme marueile scripture yee woulde seeke finde owne doctoures glosers saie allegedextra de maiorita obedien ca margi quaeritur quis exemit clericum de iurisdictione imperatoris cum prius esset illi subiectus dicit laurentius quod papa de consensu principis question moued hath exempted prieste iurisdiction emperour whereas subiecte lauretius saith vvoorde god pope exempted consente prince hardinge beseeche vvoorde god pope claime self heade vniuersal churche god recorded written parte testamente newe olde lavve prophete epistle gospel headship vniuersal povver yee finde maie yee shewe cannot founde shoulde yee saie felowes haue alleged proufe hereof childish weake thinke yee cannot comme againe without blusshinge touchinge right wee saie belongeth vnto al christian prince hath benne inuestedepist eleutherij citatur inter leges edwardi primo planted beginninge leaue authority scripture pope eleutherius selfe wrote thus vnto lucius sommetime kinge realme englande vos estis vicarius dei regno iuxta prophetam regium goddes vicare vvithin ovvne realme according prophete dauid paule bishop apamea writeth thus vnto emperoure iustinian cause mere ecclesiastical touchinge religion transtulit ipsum dominus vt plenitudinem directionis vestrae custodiret serenitatiquintae synodi act io pijssimo lorde hath taken pope agapetus awaie might leaue fulnesse order concerninge heretiques dioscorus eutyches vnto maiestie tertullian saith tertullian ad scapulam colimus imperatorem vt hominem deo secundum solo deo minorem wee woorship emperoure man nexte vnto god inferioure onely vnto god nothwithstanding name heade churche belonge peculiarely onely vnto christe onely right enheritance churche body christe heade yet maie sommetimes also applied sober meaning good sense onely vnto prince also vnto others far inferiour vnto prince chrysostome saithe philippi likewise againe speaking emperoure saithe thus laesus est qui non habet parem vllum super terram summitas caput omnium super terram hominum wee haue offended earthe hath peere toppe heade al menne vvorlde heade al menne heade onely bishoppes cardinalles also pope selfe onlesse pope man conclude prince neede nomore claime lawful authoritie emperial righte exaple nero whereof yee haue moued mutche vntimely wanton talke pope needeth claime vsurped coloured power example anna caiphas apologie cap diuision besides christian prince hath charge bothe table committed god ende maie vnderstande temporal mater onely also religious ecclesiastical cause perteine office c hardinge wil proue ecclesiastical cause perteine kinges fice hath charge bothe table meane kinge bounde kepe bothe table lawe also euery priuate man yet priuate man supreme heade churche kepinge neither kinge proued thereby thea graue disputer ye conclude againste auouched supreme heade meane kinge ought see others kepe bothe table lawe maie either appointinge temporal paine transgressours executinge saide paine vpon transgressours cannot excommunicate man apperinge called iudge al cause lawe man sinne onely harte example murther aduoutrie kinge cannot haue yet true supreme heade church shal haue malicious sinful thoughtvntruthe fonde manifeste leadinge directely desperation shal neuer foregeuen excepte party come absolued theire successours christe saideiohan whose sinnes ye forgeue forgeuen whose sinnes ye reteine reteined committe murder harte sinne reteined vntil forgeuen vntruthe ioined vvith blasphemie reade answeare neither forgeuen vntil iudge keie discretion perceiue forgeuen vvhich cannot know vntil confessed contrite hart onely knoweth bounde tel absolution sake iudge see lawe kepte higher pointe beyond reache king surely king shal supreme head sith like god iudge inwarde conscience whereunto kinge reachethmatth buta fonde folie keie geeuen pope simple prieste onely minister christe spiritual kinge hath geuen key kingdome minister b sarisburie hardinge yee roa e wander without marke replie spoken marueile whereof yee spinne selfe sutch idle talke wee neither calle prince heades churche christe father inuention saie wee haue power either excommunicate binde loose haue wee leasure make sutche vaine conclusians thus wee saie prince put truste wel firste seconde table lavve god saie wel religion temporal gouernemente onely keepe perfourme contentes bothe table owne persone mutche euery priuate man bound doo also see al others subiectes wel priestes laiemenne eche man callinge doo dewly keepe priuate man hable dooaugust epist ad bonifac therefore augustine saithe hoc seruiunt domino reges quantum sunt reges cum ea faciunt ad seruiendum illi quae non possunt facere nisi reges herein kinges serue lorde kinges doo thinges serue noman doo onely kinges wee saie prince bound doo bishoppes deutie therefore greatter sol e parte hardinge obiecte often wise menne vse aduenture woordes vaine thus wee saie prince bounde see bishoppes doo theire deuties meante far season talke fondly priuie confession bindinge loosinge povver key saide wee saie prince maie either binde loose minister sacramentes preache gospel sitte downe heare confession therefore al greate adoo yee foine onely owne shadowe hit nothinge yee saie ful discretely yf man sinne onely harte kinge cannot haue doo cannot enter knowe secretes beseeche hardinge entrance hath pope knowe secretes harte perhaps yee wil saie pope maie knowe al worlde confession augustine saithe quid mihi est cum hominibusaugust confess lib cap vt audiant confessiones meas c vnde sciunt cum ipso de ipso audiunt verum dica quadoquidem nemo scit hominu quid agatur homine nisi spiritus hominis qui ipso est haue doo wt menne shoulde heare confession c howe knowe heare mee report mee selfe whether saie true noman knoweth man sprite man aug psal within againe saithe vnto people intrantes vos exeuntes possumus videre vsqueadeo autem non videmus quid cogitetis cordibus vestris vt neque quid agaris domibus vestris videre possimus wee maie see comminge goeinge foorth wee far seeinge thoughtes harte wee cannot see doo home house likewise againe saithe aug psal quid singulorum quorum que modo conscientiae dixerint ad aures meas quia homo sum peruenire non potuit ille qui absens est praesentia corporis sed praesens est vigore maiestatis audiuit vos euery conscience hath saide coulde enter eares mortal man notwithstandinge christe absente touchinge presence body presente power maiestie hath hearde wel pope god onely trieth reines searcheth harte yet yee saie true supreme heade churche shal haue doo sinneth onely secretely harte malitious sinful thought saie shal neuer foregeuen excepte partie comme absolued theire successours christe said vvhoes sinnes yee foregeue c hardinge supreme folie al others folie firste euer hearde pope would lonce vouchesaue heare confession woulde yet owne doctoures iudgemente pope hath nomore power binde loose poore simple prieste haue shewed alphonsus de castro saithe alphons de haeresib lib de absolutione origen matthae tractat quando absoluit simplex sacerdos tantum absoluit de culpa sicut papa simple prieste absolueth absolueth mutche touchinge faulte pope selfe origen saithe quae sequuntur velut ad petrum dictum sunt omnium communia c quod si no idem loquimur quod petrus loquutus est efficimur petrus woordes folowe spoken vnto peter common vnto al wee speake saine peter spake wee made peter euen pope owne glose vpon decretalles noted thus necessitate laicus potest audire confessiones absoluere case necessitie laieman maie bothe heare confession extra de fic iudicis ordina pastoralis gloss also geue absolution yet wil yee saie euery laieman peter successoure pourpose serueth al vaine talke hardinge true supreme head churche shal haue doo sinneth onely harte euery simple prieste hauinge keie goddes woorde entreth harte hath doo wel mutche pope respecte beinge iudge conscience aboue kinges prince nolesse yee saie malitious sinful thought shal neuer forgeuen except partie comme absolued theire successours christe said whoes sinnes yee foregeue c doctrine onely strange false also ful desperation owne gratian saith de poenit dist quis aliquado latentia peccata non probantur necessario sacerdoti confiteda proued sufficiet authoritie either scripture doctours secrete sinnes necessitie vttered confession vnto prieste againe saithe de poenit dis conuertimin eodem cap datur intelligi quod etiam ore tacente veniam consequi possumus geuen v vnderstand wee maie obteine pardone although wee vtter nothing mouth againe non sacerdotali iudicio sed largitate diuinae gratiae peccator emendatur sinner cleansed iudgemente prieste abundance goddes gracede poenit dis omnis qui againe saithe confessio sacerdoti offertur signum veniae non causam remissionis accipiendae confession made vnto priest token foregeuenesse already obteined cause foregeuenesse obteined glose saithe de poenit dis poeniten glossa apud graecos confessio non est necessaria quia non emanauit ad illos traditio talis emong christian graecia confession sinnes necessarie tradition neuer came emonge yet hardinge trowe yee wil saie theire sinnes maie foregeuen certainely chrysostome saithe chrysost de co fes poenit solus te deus confitentem videat let god onely see thee making confession thy sinnes mutche therefore hardinge assuredly precisely saie sinnes neuer foregeuen without priuie confession specially thereby proue vniuersal headeship pope apologie cap diuision bisides also god prophetes often earnestly commaundeth king cutte downe groues breake downe image aultars idoles write booke lavve selfthe prince iudgeth ecclesiastical cause bisides prophete esaias saith kinge ought patrone nurse churche c hardinge seconde argumente ecclesiastical power kinges god bad cut downe superstitious groues ouerthrowe idolsthe kinge priestes executioner though office executinge commaundemente rather decreeinge thinge authoritie discerne image christ idol deuil belongeth knowe image name art god idol name false woorshippinge whiche deuil image godly idol deuilishe vvhen prieste hath iudged idol euident kinge shal wel breake downeo vanitie vanity aaron bishop sette vp golden calfe cried vnto people thy god moses ciuile magistrate kinge saul despised keepe commaundement samuel high prieste vvhereas alleage kinges ecclesiastical power commaunded write booke lawe selfe lefte ye whiche foloweth immediately accipiens exemplar sacerdotibus leuiticae tribus deut kinge muste write booke deuteronomie example thereof must receiue priestes tribe leut spiritual matter kinge aboue priestesful discretely though kinges officer keepe theire recordes kepinge lawe owne handes vvhy muste take priestes rather priestes come sith inferiour taketh al right superiour priestes muste geue holy scripture vnto kinge verely muste take sutche geue meaning geue vnto notvntruthe vvee haue falsified parte hereof shal appeare falsefied meaninge god woorde leauinge halfe sentence place proued againste weyed ende kinge required haue reade holy booke verely take vpon parte iudge cause religion expressed thintent learne feare lorde goddeut kepe woordes ceremomonies lawe commaunded harte lifted vp pride aboue brother chere hard vvould faine saie sommevvhat vviste vvhat vvere reade ansvveare omitte reade librum legis whereas churche readeth deuteronomium longe enter disputation booke lawe signifieth whole law deuteronomie one fiue bookes vvhere esaie calleth kinge patrone churche haue founde called betokeneth shoulde defende churche worldly ennimies repellinge turkes expellinge heretikes sutche like kingely actes vvhiche proueth spiritual supremacie vnder god fealtie seruiceable power finde esaie saith et erunt reges nutricij tui reginae nutrices tuae cap kinges shal thy fosterers quenes thy nourses euery nourse fosterer aboue nourishedby prety conclusion kinge seruant prieste maister faitheful seruant oftentimes fostereth maister yet aboue maister besides hierome vnderstandeth kinges esaie nameth apostle accordinge whiche sense maketh nothinge purpose alleaged b sarisburie al christian prince mutche beholden harding yee make like polyphemus giante eies striken saie man mighty body greate boanes starke blinde waie hable guide selfe king yee saie maie take vpon iudge pronounce mater religion bee neuer cleare onely must hearken ready execute euer shalbe thought good commaunded bishoppes onely bishoppes man saithe holy father pope bonifacius gladius materialis exercendus est manu regum de maior obedien vnam sanctam militum sed ad nutum patientram sacerdotis material temporal swerde muste vsed hande kingesthe prince iudgeth ecclesiastical cause souldiers becke sufferance prieste prieste meaneth pope dauid saithe yee kinges haue vnderstanding learned yee iudge earthe psalm good kinges haue oftentimes refourmed religion haue lawfully controlled corrected deposed idle wicked bishoppes place conuenienteauthen constitu nonlatin alphabet largely proued emperoure iustinian threateneth bishop offended saieing publique seruice ministration sacramentes selfe woulde vse authoritie ouer see pounished franciscus zarabella saith crime notorious emperour maie summone pope appeare maiestie maie require yelde reckening faithe yet wil yee saie emperoure stil pope man fancis zarabell de schemate concil maie iudge nothinge cause religion without kinge yee saie hable iudge whether idole idole leadinge teachinge prieste wel yee wishe al christian prince instructed thei hable either see speake without priestes saie hath often happened god idole idole god esai actor iohan light darkenesse darkenesse light saie greate diana goddesse ephesus condemne innocente saie smometime saide christe onlesse man malefactoure wee woulde neuer haue brought thy hande yet muste prince neuerthelesse drawe swerde strike euer prieste biddeth blindely execute wicked wilm hardinge pag hardinge pag pag b deede hardinge saie precisely mater decreed spiritual apperteininge faithe prince ought obeie without question grudge likewise againe yee saie shalbe yenough doo successoures peter bid doo christe nowe requireth obeie peter paule obeie sitteth theire chaire euer saie true false doubte muste meaninge kinge bound write booke lavve yee saie proueth kinges superioritie ouer priestes verily hardinge neither alleged v pourpose neuerthelesse hereby appeareth god woulde haue kinge learned lavves kinge muste receiue booke prieste none therefore saie prieste aboue kinge mee thinketh hardinge euen credites sake yee shoulde looke better logique auaileth deliuerie booke ceremoniari lib sectio make prieste either higher lower pope consecration cardinal orderer deliuereth booke epistle gospelles wil ye thereof conclude saide cardinal aboue pope mary god forebidde goddes meaningpaul phagius deuter cap touching ceremonie kinges booke shoulde true fautlesse therefore god commaunded take copie thereof registrie recordes whiche thought voide al corruption euermore keapte temple vnder custodie priestes paulus phagius saithe euery priuate man commaunded haue one booke seuerally selfe kinge commaunded haue twoo mutche kinge publique persone therefore god willed take copie publique recordes temple owne hugo cardinalis saithe hugo deute cap accipiet exemplar sacerdotibus non quibussibet sed bonis vbi nihil fucatum est nihil corruptum shal take copie priestes euery prieste euer good copie nothing neither coloured corrupted al hardinge wil hardely proue strange conclusion prieste vvas superioure king deuteronomie copie double seemeth mutche better proue contrarie prieste vvas kinges inferioure subiecte clerke recordes beinge appointed keepe bookes augustine saitheaugusti contra faustum lib cap et psal et sape alibi ievves daie keepe true bookes scripture al theire owne vse onely therefore saithe superiours seruantes certainely concerninge kinges priestes olde lavve one owne frendes many cause yee maie wel refuse saithe thus veteri lege sacerdotium indignius erat potestate regia ei subiectum olde lavve priestes office inferioure prince iohan de paris de potesta reg et papali cap subiecte vnto yee saie prieste muste geeue holy scripture kinge verily muste take sutche geeue sutche meaninge geeue vnto yea trowe though teare theire roabes againste christe caiphas crie blasphemeth yet muste wee iudgemente euermore seeke sense meaninge scripture grounde fundation diuinitie scripture god hathe none sense shal please prieste geeue vnto chrysostome speakinge priestes bishoppes whome haue receiued selfe scripture saithe thuschrysosto genesim homil literae quidem legis apud illos sunt sensus autem apud no letter woordes scripture true meaninge v mutche disaduantage selfe yee saie omitte reade librum legis whereas churche readeth deuteronomium yee saie longe enter disputation therefore hardinge wil patiently abide leasure vnt il yee haue founde whole mysterie co sidered better meane season shal good ouer ranke commentary vntil yee better vnderstande texte certainely wise learned thinke herein yee mutche deceiued whereas woordes describet sibi deuteronomium legis huius thinke deuteronomium place put one certaine seueral booke fiue bookes moses otherwise commonly vsed rather copie draught whole lavve sense saie nonlatin alphabet none nonlatin alphabet saie copie double questo doppio le double italian translation hathe thus esso si scriuera questo doppio de la legge frenche translation hath le double leo iudas translateth thus describet sibi exemplum legis huius shal write selfe copie lawe somme proufe hereof thus written booke iosua afterwarde iosua readde woordes lavve bothe blessinges curse iosua accordinge euery thinge written booke lavve one woord al thinges moses commaunded josua readde whole congregation israel allege woordes prophete esai kinges shal thy fosterers queenes thy nurces yee saie euery nurce fosterer aboue nourished faitheful seruante oftentimes fostereth maister yet aboue maister lothe yee kinge shoulde superioure prieste thus hanc yee brought handsome conclusion priestes maisters kinges theire seruantes therefore discretely noted glose imperator romanus est procurator dis si imperator glossa siue defensor romanae ecclesiae emperoure rome stewarde bailife churche rome apologie cap diuision saiethe pope kinge moses prieste bisides al thinges see history example beste time good prince euer tooke administration ecclesiastical mater perteine theire duetie moses exod beinge ciuile magistrate chiefe guide people bothe receiued god deliuered people al order religion sacrifice gaue aaron bishop vehemente soare rebuke makinge golden calfe sufferinge corruption religion hardinge moses onely ciuile magistratevntruthe time vvas prieste also prieste officesvntruthe proueth cotrarie reade ansvveare proueth priest may haue cotrariwise king may haue greater may include lesse lesse include greatervntruth confessed h frendes time moses lavve prieste vvas inferiours prince office priest highest al substantial argumentes vvhereby proue pope kinge christe comming naturally kinges line dauid tribe iuda yet estemed honor nothinge respecte prieste according order melchisedech therefore melchisedech also beinge prieste kinge yet saide figure christe mutche concerninge kingedomepsal priesthoode dauid said christe thou art prieste euer order melchtsedech kingedome included priestes office therefore speake christes kingedome though euery respecte kinge dede al kingesiustinus dial aduersus typh exod pet lord al lordes yet assigne also haue ben vpon crosse vbiregnauit ligno deus god reigned woodde accordinge meaninge whereas people israel called regnum sacerdotale priestly kingedome peter writing christian tourned order wordes calling churche christ sacerdotium regale kingely priesthoode moses prieste ciuile gouernoure beinge figure christe ioined together makinge tribe iuda kingly also priestly therefore augustine vpon wordes dauid psal moses aaron number priestes concludeth moses muste nedes haue benne priestediscretely reasoned al perteineth vvel simple prieste pope saithe priest nunquid maior sacerdote esse potuit could greater prieste shoulde saie greater dignitie priesthoode seinge moses greatest dignitie ruled al consecrated aaro high bishop sonnes priestes therefore selfe muste nedes haue ben priestelouania logique moses consecrated aaron ergo pope kinge nowe moses bothe chiefe office priesthoode foloweth example pope maie rule temporally kinge maie rule spiritually haue gained nothinge example b sarisburie hardinge hath many greate woordes smal weight final conclusion summa summarum pope muste needes kinge proueth manner yonge vntiedy argumentes moses ciuile magistrate prince also priesthoode prieste ergo saithe pope beinge prieste muste haue also kingedome kinge thus peeceth mater handsomely togeather though euer moses ought necessitie also pope man shoulde desire proue argumente make good shewe v howe peeces maie framed togeather thinke would faine take daie firste whether moses prieste certaine thatpsal harding allegeth woordes dauid moses aaron sacerdotibus eius selfe wel knoweth hebrewe woorde doubteful signifieth wel prince prieste hierome saithe vnus legis pope kinge moses prieste alte sacerdotij regulam tenuit moses helde rule lawe aaron rule priesthoode againe saithe emisit ante faciem nostram mosen spiritualem legem aaron magnum sacerdotem god sente face moses prieste spiritual lawe hiero psal hierony micheam cap hugo psal aaron greate prieste euen hugo owne doctoure touching woordes saithe thus moses etsi c notwithstandinge moses vvere prieste yet bicause halowed people praiers c called prieste scripture greate noble menne called name prieste listeth knowe hereof let reade sanctes pagninus dauid kimchi nicolaus lyra c moses deede prieste yee shoulde doo wel hardinge resolue v fiest whether prieste borne el afterwarde made prieste prieste borne trowe yee wil saie yee saie afterwarde made prieste tel v bishop creature consecrate whoes handes receiued authoritie pourpose priestelike apparel euer ware office ministerie euer shewed self prieste hebrae paule saith prieste appointed offer vp oblation sacrifice sinne oblation sacrifice sinne yee tel v moses offered neither borne prieste made prieste euer knowen office prieste trowe strange prieste moses highest prieste head churche aaron likewise highest prieste mutche heade churche wel churche tvvoo highest bishoppes tvvoo heades bothe togeather whiche thinge monstrous onely speache also nature notwithstandinge whether moses one certaine time prieste mater woorthy striuinge certaine lavve written kinges prince beste borne enheritours wealthiest peoplehierony qu hebraici genesim euer priestes hierome saithe hebraei tradunt primogenitos functos officio sacerdotum habuisse vestimentum sacerdotale quo induti deo victimas offerebant antequam aaron sacerdotium eligeretur hebrevve rabbines saie firste borne child office priestes priestelike apparel wearing offered vp theire sacrifice vnto god vntil time hierony iob cap aaron chosen priestehoode againe saithe priuilegium offerendi primogenitis vel maxime regibus debebatur priuilege offering vp sacrifice dewe first borne child al vnto kinges heathen romaine emperours dist de capitulis gloss inter acta gelasij vespasianus traianus others encrease maiestie towardes subiectes biside state emprere woulde also called pontifex maximi therefore wee wil graunte harding seeinge hath taken mutch paine mater woorthy longe talke moses somme litle shorte time prieste exod yet neuerthelesse ordinarie priesthoode neither prieste space twoo three houres onely vntil consecrated aaron child lenger immediately afterward al greate priestehoode end one owne doctours hardinge saithe thusheruaeus de potestat pp ca non erant sacerdotes legales dignitate officio sicut aaron licet necessitate propter defectum sacerdotum aliquos actus sacerdotum fecerint vt quod moses inunxit aaron propter quod moses sacerdos dicitur psalmo firstborne priestes office dignitie aaron notwithstanding case necessitie lacke priestes somme parte priestes office moses anointed consecrated aaron whiche thinge moses psalme called prieste thisthe pope kinge hardinge fundation must needes beare burthen whole churche rome pope yee saie muste kinge bicause moses bothe prince priest yet felowes saie moses office dignitie vvas neuer prieste yee saie pope bishop maie kinge side king maie wise bishop thus either vnwitingely willingly yee seeme ouerthrowe owne position example yee grounde vpon aaron moses proueth quite contrarie moses prince also office bishop aaron beinge bishop neuer ye office prince therefore hereof yee might better conclude ye prince maie bishop bishop maie kinge streighten boltes therefore harding shaue better yee suddainely wil saie rudely shoote neuerthelesse yee saie priesthoode whiche maie conteine kingedome beinge lesse respecte troweextra de maiorita obedien solitae glossa glose said compareth pope sonne emperoure moone findeth substantially good geometrical proportion pope iust seuen fiftie time greater emperour owne doctours saie haue likewise shewed lavve moses iohan de paris de potestat regia pap ca prince greater prieste ye allege priesthoode kingedome christe serueth smal purpose beseche crovvne scepter svverde bare christe ecclesiastical priesthoode onely executed vpon crosse verily touching ciuile shewe outward office kinge iohan prieste said kingdome world might also haue said priesthoode vvorld otherwise bothe king priest power vertue apparetly outward office one felowes saithe thus heruaeus de potestat pp cap pater per sanctos expositores quod christus non habuit temporalibus authoritatem vel iudicium sed dare potuit dare habuit virtutis documentum appeareth holy expositours christe neither authoritie iudgemente thinges temporal coulde bothe geeue geeue instruction vertue twoo woordes s1 pet peter yee kingely priesthoode yee woulde haue alleged pourpose yee benne dreame thinke peter called whole body churche christe kingely priesthoode fansie pope togeather bothe priest kinge certainely churche god kingely priesthoode either churche rome churche pope rome pope yee haue somme care deale reuerently vvoorde god holy peter meaninge euery faithful christian man spiritual ghostly meaning onely prieste also king therefore calleth whole churche kingely priesthoode tertullian saithe thustertul exhorta ad castit apocal nonne laici sacerdotes sumus regnum quoq que no sacerdotes deo patri suo fecit wee laiemen wee priestes truly christe hath made euen v kingdome priestes vnto father augustine saithaug q euang lib cap hoc sacerdotio regali consecrantur omnes pertinentes ad corpus christi summi veri principis sacerdotum roial priesthoode al thei consecrate perteine body christe whiche high true prince priestes augu de ciuit dei li ca ambros luca lib ap againe saith omnes sunt sacerdotes quia membra sunt vnius sacerdotis al priestes thei member one prieste ambrose saith omnes filij ecclesiae sacerdotes sunt al child churche priestes hierome saithe genus sacerdotale regale sumus omnes qui baptizati christohierony malachi cap christi censemur nomine al priestely kingely kinred pope kinge kingely priestehoode beinge baptized christe called christian name christe chrysostome saith et tu baptismo rex efficeris sacerdos propheta euen thou thy baptisme art made king prieste prophete nowe hardinge let v take vlewe youre priestely conclusion moses one parte bishoppes officechrysost cor homil consecrate aaron child neuer time el neither christ rath spiritual priesthoode spiritual kingdome otherwise ordinarie priesthood earthely kingedome none peter calleth whole churche christe kingely priesthoode ergo saie pope beareth bothe office prieste also righte state earthly kinge dissemble al fonde weakenesse folie christe selfe saith pope matth al priestes bishoppes kinges nation rule ouer greate exercise authoritie ouer people shal emongest dist quoniam idem cyprian saithe alleged gratian christus actibus proprijs dignitatibus distinctis officia potestatis vtrius que discreuit christe seueral deuties distincte honoures hath set difference bitweene office bothe power whereupon owne glose saithe hic est argumentum quod papa non habet vtrun que gladium glossa good argument pope hath bothe swerdes bernarde saith thus vnto pope eugeniusbernar de considera lib planu est quod apostolis interdicitur dominatus ergo tu tibi vsurpare aude aut dominas apostolatum aut apostolicus dominatum plane ab alterutro prohiberis si vtrunque similiter habere vi perdes vtrun que alioqui ne te putes exceptum illorum numero de quibus conqueritur dominus dicens ipsi regnauerunt non ex plaine temporal dominion forebidden apostle nowe therefore thou pope dare vsurpe either apostleship beinge prince princehoode beinge successoure apostle doubtelesse one thou arte forebidden thou wilte indifferentely haue bothe thou shalte lose bothe otherwise thinke thou canste bee excepted mimber lorde complaineth thei haue made selues kinges mee concerninge place peter one companie saithe nothinge furthereth pope kingedome heruaeus de potestat pp ca thus saithe sacerdotium dicitur regale regno non huius mundi sed coeli peter calleth v kingely priesthoode kingedome heauen kingedome worlde yet selfe kingdome pope craueth authoritie peter notwithstandinge one companie hath sente v home lately newes louaine dorman fol woordes vos estis regale sacerdotium kingly priesthoode saie priesthoode kingly kinges ruled ouer priestes priesthoode kingely subiecte euen kinges themselues thus onlesse priestes maie rule kinges prince al world theire pleasure yee thinke thei haue kingly priesthoode councel conc macrense citatur ab illyrico inter testis verita pag holden macra france written thus solus dominus noster iesus christus vere fieri potuit rex sacerdos post incarnationem vero resurrectionem ascensionem eius coelum nec rex pontificis dignitatem nec pontifex regiam potestatem sibi vsurpare praesumpsit onely lorde iesus christe might truly bothe priest king sithence incarnation resurrection ascension heauen neither hath king presumed take vpon ye dignitie office bishop hath bishop presumed vsurpe power maiestie prince shorte hardinge wee saie often vntruly haue reported kinge maie wise execute bishoppes office thus saie bicause true therefore wee saie kinge maie lawfully correcteiosua chastice negligence falsehedde bishoppes dooinge dooth onely owne office bishoppes apologie cap diuision iosua alsoiosua cap though none ciuile magistrate yet sone chose god set ruler ouer people receiued commaundementes specially touching religion seruice god hardinge doubte iosue receiued commission commaundemente woorship god none rule priestes spiritual mattersnum ye rather commaunded go foorthe come voice worde eleazarus high prieste al child israel men proue matter handsomly b sarisburie iosua commaunded goe directed voice eleazarus high prieste therefore yee saie spiritual cause priestes maie controlled prince yee deliuer youre argumentes hardinge ready peeces would haue benne better tied togeather though prince commaunded heare prieste yet prieste negligente deceiue people maie ordinarie authoritie controlle prieste aaron high prieste consented makinge woorshippinge golden calfeexod moses beinge temporal prince rebuked sharpely vnto face dooinge bishoppes office onely owne touchinge iosua ye woulde faine haue restreined al ecclesiastical cause caused people circumcised caused aultars theire bloudy sacrifice erected caused priestes make theire sacrifice caused deuteronomie written stoanes caused bothe blessinges cur god pronounced spake openly people fraied idolatrie al case ciuile policieaugust contra cresconium li cap religion augustine saithe hoc reges deo seruiut sicut eis diuinitus praecipitur quatum sunt reges si suo regno bona iubeant mala prohibeant non solum quae pertinent ad humanam societatem verum etiam quae ad diuinam religionem herein kinges serue god commaunded aboue kinges within theire kingedome commaunde good thinges forebidde euil onely thinges perteininge humaine felovveship ciuile order also thinges perteining goddes religion yee maie see therefore hardinge howe handsomely euer wee proue mater parte hitherto thei vnhandsomely coursely answeared apologie cap diuision kinge dauid whole religion god altogeather brought frame wicked kinge saule paralip brought home againe arke god saie factes proue kinges constable iudges religion whiche goodezechias whiche euill4 reg reg whiche true whiche false therein theyvntruthe priestes nothinge againste vvilles reade ansvveare folow sarisburie kinge ezechias yee saie kinges folowed aduise iudgemente priestes prophetes tale hardinge onely vnlikely also vntrue yee knowe esaias elizaeus notwithstandinge thei prophetes god yet thei neither priestes bishoppes manner ordinarie ministration churche bishoppes priestes whome yee speake disordered wasted goddes whole religion holy place god fulle filthinesse gate temple shut vp2 paralip man might enter people turned awaie theire face tabernacle lorde incense sacrifice al thinges happened negligence wickednesse priestes paralip olde latine texte written thus sacerdotes leuitae tandem sanctificati obtulerunt holocausta priestes leuites laste mutche adoo sanctified offered vp sacrifice vpon whiche place later translation saithe thus sacerdotes leuitae pudore suffusi sanctificauerunt se priestes leuites euen shame sanctified selues ready thei calle vpon kinge godly pourpose helde backe coulde yelded nothinge mutche adoo shame nothinge kinges commaundemente made reckeninge dooinges perhaps yee wil discharge whole mater one ordinarie excuse tel v al temporal case apologie cap diuision kinge iehosaphat ouerthrew vtterly made awaie hille aultars paralip groaues whereby sawe goddes honoure hindered people holden backe priuate superstition ordinarie temple whiche ierusalem whereto ordre haue resorted yeerely euery parte realme hardinge yee put v minde consider selues priuate hille aulters darke groaues ye stoppe people common temple christendome catholike churche saluatio heade whereof sitteth peter chaire rome settinge order bothe matter common vveale temporall office put false preacher heretikes death neither belonge priestes onlesse haue also ciuill iurisdiction muche lesse dothe acte proue kinges supreme heades ouer churche ought iudges
