auctoritie priestes auctoritie kinges moses gaue ruledeut concerninge matter saithe thou perceiue harde doubtfull iudgement thee betweene bloude bloude cause cause lepre lepre seest woordes iudges within thy gate varie arise goe vp place whiche thy lorde god shall chosethe prince ludge ecclesiastical cause thou shalte come priestes stocke leui iudge shall time thou shalte demaunde shall shewe truthe iudgemente thee neither prieste place may medle iurisdiction whiche belonged temporall iudge neither iudge whiche spirituall belonginge onely prieste1 paral cause azarias priest bishop saide kinge ozias thy office ozias burne incense vnto lorde office priestes saie sonnes aaron vvho consecrated doo suche ministeries kinge mighte doo euen matter religionthe prince executioner prieste vvhen high priest geuen sentence might see execution thereof donne butvntruthe euident reade ansvveare otherwise euer kinge temporal iudge might doo owne person muche lesse mighte iudge whether well therein concerninge olde testament b sarisburie office kinge yee saie kinge henry eighth charles fifthe heathen prince iulius caesar alexander greate therefore yee saie christian prince office standeth onely mater temporal cause yee often calle mere laie temporal prince authoritie mutche better heathen magistrate euen harding pope bishop perhaps mutche lesse bishop anna caiphas neither prieste prieste prieste dagon baal difference standeth office onely truthe yet neuerthelesse yee knowe heathen prince euermore soueraine authoritie onely ouer theire priestes bishoppes also ouer al case religion aristotel foliticor li socrates lib prooemio nonlatin alphabet aristotle saithe nonlatin alphabet kinge lorde ruler thinges perteine vnto goddes therefore socrates storie saithe imperatores vna complexi sumus c wee haue also herein comprised emperours liues sithence emperours first christened affaire churche haue hanged greatest councelles bothe haue benne keapte theire aduise yee saie prince doubteful case commaunded take counsel highest prieste true wil yee conclude hereof highest prieste maie saie doo listeth without controlmente highe prieste woulde answeare thus answeared sommetime deede christe samaritane deceiuer people hath diuel teare owne roabes anger crie oute blasphemeth vvoorthy die yet muste emperoure needes geue eare vnto beleeue without exception certainely olde lavve bishop either benne negligente office malice ignorance answeared vntruthe euermore vnder general controlmente prince vvithin churche yee saie prince inferioure prieste notwithstandinge without churche temporal case aboue prieste thus yee fetche mater rounde within without rounde aboute al circumstance prince changeable selfe woulde without within deede prieste dothe office either openeth goddes vvil declareth threates rebuketh sinne excommunicateth cutteth deade member body farre foorthe prince neuer mighty infe iour vnto respecte prince infertoure onely pope bishop also simple prieste pope selfethe prince ludge ecclesiastical cause respecte inferioure confessoure neuer poore prieste emperoure constantinus woonte saie godly bishoppes bee bishoppes within churche wilbe bishop without bishop beene faulty either negligence falsehedde whether benne within churche quaest nemo gloss abb euseb de vita constant orat de maiorita obedient vnam sanctam abroade alwaies controlled prince yee saie vvhen highe prieste geeuen sentence prince mighte see execution thereof donne thus yee make emperoure pope man put sentence execution pope bonifacius telleth materialis gladius exercendus est manu regum militum sed ad nutum patientiam sacerdotis temporal swerde muste drawen hande kinges souldiers becke sufferance prieste beseehe whose becke kinge salomon depose abiathar highe prieste whose becke iosias godly prince whome wee haue saide redresse religion god whiche founde shamefully decaled whose becke rebuke carelesse negligence priestes verilyheruaeus de potestate papae cap augustin epist ad donatistas one owne doctours saithe veteri lege sacerdotes qui reges inungebant indubitanter regibus subdebantur olde lawe bishoppes ointed kinges doubte subiecte vnto kinges augustine saithe quando imperatores veritatem tenent ipsa veritate contra errotem iubent quisquis illud contempserit ipse sibi iudicium acquirit nam inter homines poenas iuit apud deum frontem non habebit qui hoc facere noluit quod ei per cor regis ipsa veritas iussit emperoure holdeth truthe force truthe geeueth lawes proclamation againste erroure euer despiseth procureth iudgemente againste selfe shalbe pounished menne god shal haue face refused doo thinge truthe selfe harte prince hathe commaunded apologie cap diuision christian emperours olde time appointed councelles bishoppes constantine called councel nice theodosius firste called councel constantinople theodosius seconde councel ephesus martian councel chalcedon hardinge callinge summoninge councelles maie donnea discrete distinction emperour receiued authoritie pope either waie auctoritie whiche caller himselfe hath waie auctoritie whiche taketh nother constantine two theodosians marcian called foure firste generall councelles auctoritie onely generall councelles neither coulde decree binde whole worlde although greate emperours yet whole christian worlde vnder therefore christian bishoppes liued persia ethiopia scotland scythia lande subiect emperour neither bounde come bounde obey lawes made superiours farre reason generall councell shoulde binde bishoppes christian also farre reason saie emperours called generall councelles owne onely auctoritie deede called assent bishop romevntruthe manifeste shal appeare vvho beinge generall shepeherde christes stocke therefore also bishoppes might commaundeal bishoppes througout vvhole vvorlde pope sheepe sheepe come togeather excepte reasonably excused bounde heare voice obey decree although ye proued emperours haue summoned called foure firste councels yet ye able proue itvntruthe emperoure maie summone councels vvhether pope vvil without assent bishoppes rome time sate peter chaire force assent deede must take effecte muche generally prooue vnto thatvntruthe syluester vvas dead longe summoninge councel syluester assented callinge firste councell nice considered onely hath auctoritie ratifie hath auctoritie commaunde geue assent strength beginninge none difference betweene commaundinge assentinge auctorizinge ratifying assentinge common al commaundinge thinge goeth facte auctorizinge makinge thinge good present agreeinge while donne ratifyinge allowinge donne shewe pope ratifie callinge generall councels auctorize shewe muche assented callinge auctorizinge proued reason sente legate euery asvntruthe vaine vnaduised neither vvas hosius syluesters legate vvas syluester aliue syluester sent osius cordubensis prouince spaine vnto nice victor vincentius pr estes citie rome last twoo beinge selues bishop yet legate chiefe bishop invntruthe impudente fourthe place councel subscribed eustathius firste place put vnto decree councell consent name writinge thus sorte pro venerabili vito papa episcopo nostro syluestro subscripsimus vve haue subscribed reuerent man pope bishop syluester veryvntruth onlesse dead man maie summone councelles time generall councell kepte nice syluester called councell rome whiche two hundred seuenty fiue bishop assembled expressely written councell syluester collegit vniuersam synodum episcoporum cum consilio augusti vel matris eius syluester gathered together whole synode bishoppes counsell theby counsel emperoure mother vvisely vvoteth vvhether yet emperours mother vvas dead sozom lib ca emperour mother vvhy counsell needeful appereth emperoure bare charge diete carriage counsell necessary chiefely religion rather supportation charge greate iourney neither bishop rome bishoppes endewed large possession afterwarde retourne councell nice emperour deede cause comming togeather aswel selfe persuaded meane concorde also liberally defraied charge yet called bishoppes owne head men might haue seene ecclesiasticall historielib ca marke ex sacerdotum sententia rufinus writeth tum ille ex sacerdotum sententia apud vrbem nicaeam episcopale concilium conuocat emperour calleth together councell bishoppes accordinge determination priestes accordinge seemed ful clerkely proued ruffinus saithe emperoure herein folovved aduise alexander bishop alexandria c pope tion good bishoppes shall thinke bishop rome none consented callinge ye verely chiefest al otherwise seeme decree madein summ nice cocil placuit vt haec omnia mitterentur ad episcopu vrbis romae syluestrum thought good actes decree sente tovntruthe sodly forged syluester vvas dead longe syluester bishop cittie rome last vewe confirminge thinges doubte voice great auctoritie callinge councell vvhat socrates ecclesiasticall historie witnesseth sayinge cum vtique regula ecclesiastica iubeat non oportere vntruth standinge plaine corruption vvoordes see ansvvear praeter sententiam romani pontisicis concilia celebrari vvhereas ecclesiasticall rule commaundeth councels ought kepte besides determinate consente bishop rome vve knowe saithe athanasius bishoppes aegypte assembled councell alexandria greate councell nice bishoppeshist trip li ca epistola aegyptior potificum ruf li cap hist trip li ca one accorde confirmed without determination bishop rome neither councels kept bishoppes condemned omitte thinge well knowen constantine emperour refused expresse woordes iudge ouer bishoppes saying god geuen power iudge much lesse arrogate selfe onely chiefly auctoritie summon councels iudge bishoply affaire saithe valentinian emperour asmuch one people lawful search suche matter speaketh heretikes doctrine let priestes whome charge belongeth gathered together within selues c concerninge seconde councell whiche firste kept constantinople may theodosius called constantine called firste nice auctoritie damasus bare appeareth partely hisso sundrie bishoppes legate partly also photius patriarke constantinople writeth epistle michael prince bulgaria vvhere hauinge declared comminge together patriarkes alexandria ierusalem saithe thusphotius lib de concilijs quibus haud mult post damasus episcopus romae eadem confirmans atque idem sentiens accessit whiche patriarkes alexandria ierusalem longe damasus bishop rome ioyned selfe confirmingeother bishop likevvise gaue cosentes confirmed c yet thei authoritie summone councelles determininge matter much saithe photius seconde councell confirmation whereof dothe attribute theodosius emperoure damasus pope theodosius man saie nothinge yea verely muche saide epistle phot u recordeth greate theodosius saithe deede woorthy great praise rule empire selfe also defender mainteiner godlinesse beholde emperours parte sitte iudgement matter religion andvntruthe manifeste theodosius emperoure expressely determined vvhat shoulde holden christian faithe determine whiche true faithe defende mainteine thou maist see reader plainely theodosius thought religion whome defender woulde make iudge cause religioncap aduise thee reade ninth booke tripartite historie appeare many greate argumentes owne faithe vvhiche publisheth worlde thessalonica publike lawe suche peter taught romainesvntruthe guilefully enclosed theodosius vvilled subiectes folovve vvel aithe sundrie bishoppes pope damasus succeded peter taught daie requiringe subiectes beleue required folow owne priuate faitheruf lib cap peter faith pope faithe whereas two bishoppes alexandria time one whose name peter holdinge bishop rome named lucius theodosius commaunded subiectes beleue peter folowed firste peter damasus bishop rome touchinge thirde generall councell kepte deede vnder theodosius yonger ephesus supreme head yea rather knoweth cyrillus selfe patriarke alexandria yet president ephesus bearinge steede person pope celestine cyrill steede bishop rome presidenta fonde folie bishop rome euermore firste place councelles yet vvas therefore heade churche maie doubt supreme head churche whose name president sate dothe president queenes maiesties counsell vse sitte counsell name inferiour person theodosius supreme chiefe sate cyrill name president seinge photius writethli c nicephorus also cyrill archebishop alexandria sate steede celestine pope rome ouer councel kepte ephesus vndoubtedly denied celestine supreme head well churche generall councell therefore onely considered theodosius sente abroade messenger summon father generall councell also consideredno doubte authoritie pope vvas emperoure onely pope man whose auctoritie donne time pleased emperoure ferdinande famouse memorie haue sente messenger kinges prince spaine fraunce englande hungarie bemelande pole estate duke italie germanie summon councell whiche pope thought good indict trente thinke verely pope woulde haue thanked emperoure selfe haue saued muche charge men experience know suche enterprise require sith pope hath owne sufficient beare charge suche affaire asketh emperoure suche expense olde time necessarie pourpose emperours allowed laste martian saie called fourthe generall councell chalcedon vve answeare called suche sorte ye meane witte supreme head ruler thereof one hable sende messenger bishoppes worlde susteine charge also willinge see peace concorde churche god vvho liste reade epistle pope leo pul eria emperesse martian himselfe theodosius flauianus archebishop constan nople synode firste assembled ephesus afterwarde certaine cause chalcedon epistle may see bothe cause councell whatvntruthe councel vvas summoned chalcedon quite contrarie pope vvil reade ansvveare conference thereof saide leo bishop rome sente firste ephesus iulianus bishop renatus prieste hilarius deaconthe summoninge councelles afterwarde chalcedon paschasinus lucentius bishoppes bonifacius prieste represente hius personne one saide epistle written seconde synode ephesusleo epist leo saithe thus religiosissima clementissimi principis fides c moste religious faithe moste element prince knowinge perteine chiefely within catholike churche branche errour springe hath deferred reuerence god ordinaunces vse auctoritie see apostolike achieue effect holy purpose though desirous moste blessed peter himselfe declared whiche confession praised whiche woordes plaine matter religion emperoure proceeded vpon owne head butvntruthe manifeste reade ansvveare directed see peter vvhat shal saie emperoure first christened pope let emperour superiour thinges godward pope christened emperour asvntruthe vvas christened eusebius bishop nicomedia longe syluester vvas dead syluester constantine let spirituall father degree rule aboue spirituall childe b sarisburie man coulde vtter many vntruthes togeather sutche assiance without somme cunninge firste hardinge yee beare v hande emperours worlde day summoned councelles owne authoritie authoritie warrante pope pope authoritie time benne many degree aboue emperoure notwithstandinge pope pius syluius epist knowe saithe thus ante nicenam synodum vnusquis que sibi vixit paruus respectus ad romanam ecclesiam habebatur councel nice eche bishop liued seuerally selfe little regarde churche rome inter pistolas augustin epi pope innocentius complaineth authoritie sufficient force pelagius beinge one man comme mutche lesse authoritie sufficient commaunde calle whole worlde pope leo bothe humble suiter himselfe vnto emperoure martianus would please maiestie commaunde councel also entreated bishoppes promote cause thus writeth humiliter ac sapienter exposciteleo ad clerum pleb constan epist vt pet tiom nostrae qua plenariam indici synodum postulamus clementissimus imperator dignetur annuere make suite discrete humble praier moste gracious emperoure woulde vouchesaue graunte oure requeste wee haue desired general councel likely pope leo woulde thus haue written owne authoritie benne sufficiente naie vnlikely emperoure shoulde herein time vse authoritie pope pope selfe neuer hable summone bishoppes hereafter shal appeare onely authoritie emperoure theodoret li cap nonlatin alphabet eusebius lib cap pope damasus commaunded bishoppes easte comme rome owne name benne warrante emperours special letter eusebius saith thus nonlatin alphabet exemplar regiarum literarum quibus iubet romae episcoporum concilium celebrari copie emperours vvrite whereby commaunded councel keapte rome pope notwithstandinge al vniuersal povver commaunded emperours summone presente councelles wel others councel chalcedon written thus eodem tenore pijssimis christianissimis imperatoribusconcil chalcedonen actio pag sanctissimus noster papa romanae ecclesiae praepositus leo vocatus est order vvrite oure moste holy pope leo ruler churche rome called councel moste godly moste christian emperours sozomenus saithe summoninge councelles constantinus scripsit ad omnes praesides ecclesiarum vt ad diem adessent ad episcopos apostolicarum sedium ad macarium hierosoly mitanum ad iulium romanum c emperoure constantinus sente letter vnto al ruler church lib cap theodoret lia cap nonlatin alphabet meete al nice vpon da e vnto bishoppes apostolike see vnto macarius bishop hierusalem vnto iulius bishop rome c sulius excused absence age otherwise obedience dewtie towardes emperoure mutche bounde haue made appearance reste brother yee saie emperoure shoulde haue summoned councel owne authoritie bishoppes persia scotlande whiche country vnder obedience romaine empiere woulde haue appeared vpon summone benne general councel cauil wanteth bothe truthe sauoure proufe whereof wil bringe foorthe selfe hardinge reprooue selfe yee soone haue foregotten owne decree specially conceiued published selfe booke thus saie owne woordes councel accoumpted general hardinge bicause bishoppes al country vnder heauen assembled bicause many assembled al lawfully called otherwise late chapter tridente woorthy number fourtie prelate whereof certaine onely maie bishoppes otherwise called nullatenses coulde neuer haue benne general councel certainely cannot appeare bishop either scotlande englande called britaine firste foure councelles either nice ephesus constantinople chalcedon yet councelles neuerthelesse called general touchinge reste emperoure onely monarke worldechrysost ad popul othe homi chrysostome calleth summitas caput omnium super terram hominum toppe heade al menne worlde doubte euer woulde haue refused emperours summone mutche woulde haue refused summone pope quali e mater yee sate emperoure thinges although pope vvarrante yet th leaste pope consente neuer otherwise likewise vntruthe emperoure commaunded councelles bothe woulde whither would whether pope woulde many time without manner regarde pleasure pope leo wrote thus vnto emperoure theodosius omnes nostrae ecclesiae eo ad seon pi omnes mansue udini vestrae cum gemitibus lachrymis supplicant sacerd e vt generalem synodum iubeatis intra italiam celebrari al church al priestes moste humbly beseeche maiestie sobbes teares yee wil commaunde general councel holden within italie like sorte caused cleregie onstantinople su ters vnto maiestie yet neuerthelesse emperoure continewed stil pourpose contrarie pope humble petition kepte councel italie chalcedon also saide pope leo selfe summoned appeare emperours commaundemente bishoppes sutche authoritie pope consente summoninge councelles humbly craued vpon knee sighes teares coulde geate hereof aeneas syluius whiche afterwarde pope pius saithe thus syluiu de l basilien lib ex hisce authoritatibus mirum modum se putant armatos qui concilia negant sieri posse sine consensu papae quorum sententia si vt ipsi volunt inuiolata persistat ruinam secum ecclesiae trahit quid enim remedij eritthe summoninge councelles si criminosus papa perturbet ecclesiam si anima perdat si anima peruertat malo exemplo populos si deni que contraria fidei praedicet haereticis que dogmatibus imbuat subditos sinemusne cum ipso cuncta ruere ego dum veteres lego historias dum actus perspicio apostolorum hunc equidem morem non inuenlo vt solo papae concilia conuocauerint nec post tempore constantini magni aliorum augustorum ad congreganda concilia quaesitus est magnopere romani consensus papae authority thinke selues armed saie councel maie keapte without consente pope whose iudgemente stande woulde haue woulde drawe decaie ruine churche remedie pope selfe vitious destroied soules ouerthrewe people euil example taught doctrine contrarie faithe filled subiectes ful heresy shoulde suffer al goe diuel verily reade olde story consider actes apostle finde sutche order day onely pope summone councelles afterwarde time coustantine greate emperours councelles shoulde called greate accoumpte made pope consente cusanus de concordia cathosica lib ca cardinal cusanus saith negligente aut contradicente papa imperator potest praeceptiue synodos indicere ad prouidendum fluctuanti ecclesiae pope negligente saie naie emperoure staie w ueringe state churche maie commaunde councelles ovvne authoritie thus ye emperoure sigismunde called councel constance notwithstandinge stoode pope iohn mutche vpon neuer yaelde consente vnto councel depriued pope made cardinal yee saie pope authoritie confirme councelles ergo mutche authoritie calle councelles yee tel v solemne tale co maudinge assentinge authorizinge ratifieinge benne somewhat pourpose reason holde must general coucelles haue many caller shal hereafter sufficietly prooue onely pope principal patriarkes also al bishoppes presente yea emperours kinges lieutenantes counsellers authoritie confirme councelles sozomen lib cap sozomenus saith nec romanus nec vicentinus nec alij confirmarunt councel confirmed neither bishop rome bishop vicentia reste bishoppes emperoure martianus saithconcil chalcedon actio pag sacrosancto nostrae serenitatis edicto venerandam synodum confirmamus wee confirme reuerende councel holy edicte oure maiestie yee saie pope syluester sente famous learned father hosius bishop corduba councel nice represente personne maie wel passe emonge reste truthes neither hosius pope behalfe owne pope syluester aliue hable sende duringe whole time nicene councel notwithsstandinge thinge fabulare peter crabbe hath saide contrarie hosius bishop corduba authoritie estimation al ecclesiastical assembly maie appeare woordes athanasius qua synodo dux ille athanasi apologia antesignanus non fuit quae ecclesia istius praesidentiae non pulcherrima monumenta retinet councel hath hosius benne chiefe presidente churche without somme notable remembrance gouernmente certainely hardinge seemeth greate deale good sente farre deade mannes errante notwithstandingesozomen lib cap iulius beinge bishop rome vnhable trauaile bicause age sente thither twoo priestes vitus vincentius supplie roume thus pride better absence maineteine state onely forced necessitie doo benne hable trauaile farrethe summoninge councelles benne forced goe thither selfe therefore pope agatho afterwarde thus excused absence vnto emperoure christianissimi domini filij secundum pijssimam iussionem mansuetudinis vestrae concil constantinopolitan actio ad heraclium tiberium imper pag athanasi ad antiochen pro obedientia quam debuimus praesentes confamulos nostros misimus moste christian lordes child accordinge moste godly commaundement maiesties accordinge obedience wee owe dewtie haue sente presente oure felowe seruantes bishoppes like case age infirmitie like example lucifer bishop sardinia sente herennius agapetus paulinus sente maximus calemerus councel nice steedes yee saie vitus vincentius pope legate therefore firste place subscription emonge bishoppes greate vntruthe theodoret lib cap theoderetus saithe firste chiefe al companie bothe place speache vitus vincentius pope legate eustathius patriarke antioche touchinge twoo pope legate sozomen lib cap athanasi apologia sozomenus placeth onely fourthe roume athanasius saithe subscripserunt hosius ab hispania iulius romanus per archidamum philoxenum presbyteros subscribed name councel hosius came spaine iulius bishop rome archidamus philoxenus priestes legate whiche woordes alloweth bishop rome legate seconde place subscription firste thus yee see hosius bishop corduba subscribeth iulius bishop rome councel aphrica concil aphric ca concil chalcedon actio sanctum philippus asellius pope legate laste place subscription al others councel chalcedon philippus one pope legate hundred seuen fiftie others subscribe father trowe woulde haue benne vnmannerly dealinge thei taken pope heade vvhole vniuersal churche sozom li ca athanas apologia theodoret lib cap micephor lib cap haue placed legate behinde many yee saie time general councel keapte nice syluester called councel rome trowe hardinge vntruthe onlesse yee haue power raise vp deade menne keepe councelles syluester dead longe sozomenus saith vitus vincentius sente nice pope syluester deade pope iulius seconde like maie easily appeare athanasius tabula hermani contracti syluester papa motitur marcus papa vixit octo menses iulius papa hoc tempore constant nu indixit nice um concilium anno domi theodoretus nicephorus others therefore hardinge muste needes diuise twoo councelles nice aboute one time two syluesters pope twoo vvriters one storie one true false otherwise fraile stuffe wil neuer holde yee ouer easy credite fable councel yee imagine holden rome pope syluester nothinge el heape childishe vanitises holy discrete learned father saie nemo presbyterorum chrisma conficiat quoniam christus chrismate vocatur praesul summus non iudicabitur quoquam quoniam scriptum est non est discipulus supra magistrum ne que ab augusto ne que ab omni clero ne que regibus ne que ab omni populo iudex iudicabiturco c rom ca ca ca prieste maie make halowe chrisme christe chrisme hath name higheste prelate pope iudged noma written scholar aboue maister iudge pope shal iudged neither emperoure al cleregie kinges prince whole people sutche like good stuffe haue councel rome notwithstandingethe summoninge councelles credite euer councel yet hardinge vtterly ouerthroweth whole pourpose euer sutche councel summoned rome summoned syluester deade pope authoritie emperour aliue eusebius writeth councel rome holden time pope meltiades said beforeeuseb li ca exemplar regiarum literarum c copie emperoures vvrite whereby hath commaunded councel bishoppes keapte rome likewise bishoppes assembled councel constantinople wrote vnto bishoppes councel rome theodoretus li cap cum indixissetis c yee called councel rome yee warned v also comme thither member owne body moste godly emperours vvrite appeareth sutche councel called rome called emperoure pope yee saie emperoure sutche affaire aduised euermore bishoppes vnlikely therefore easily maie graunted notwithstanding ought maie appeare aduised oftentimes somme bishoppes pope shal appeare eusebius touchinge emperoure constantinus writeth thus quasi communis quidam episcopus deo constitutus euseb devita constantini oratione ruffin li ca ministrorum dei synodos conuocauit benne one common bishop appointed god appointed councelles bishoppes assemble togeather ruffinus saithe emperoure aduised hereto alexander bishop alexandria bishoppes priestes egypte mention pope like case ecclesiastical affaire athanasius earnest suiter vnto emperoure constantius dioscorus vnto theodosius others vnto pope omnipotente consente without yee telle v emperoure maie summone councel noman maketh mention yee saie ought councel keapte without determinate consente bishop rome also vntruthes standing manifeste corruption wordes socrates former replie haue declared largearti diui socrat li ca nonlatin alphabet cassiodor lib cap regula iuris quod omnes tangit ab omnibus debet approbari woordes socrates non licet scribere ecclesiastica decreta praeter sententiam episcopi romani prouided ecclesiastical lavves made without consente bishop rome bishop rome one foure greate patriarkes whoes assentes al general councelles thought necessarie socrates meaneth sutche ecclesiastical lavves perteine whole churche god rule agreeable reason toucheth al muste allovved al nowe whereas yee haue exchanged allovveinge canon summoninge callinge councelles maie please remember allovveinge canon common al member councel specially foure principal patriarkes saide authoritie callinge councelles belonged onely emperoure yee allege athanasius vaine shamelesse forgerie haue otherwhere declared large sutche religion sutche doctours sutche folie woorthy answeare valentinian emperoure sozom li ca yee saie accoumpted selfe one people therefore saide lawful examine mater religion thus said either humilitie el wante time foretne enimies warres ciuile care filled heade thoughtes nicephorus imagineth thus saienicephor lib cap mihi negotijs occupatio reipublicae curis distento re huiusmodi inquirere non est facile beinge thus occupied businesse publique care summoninge councelles easy enquire sutche mater otherwise ecclesiastical cause bee within prince charge doubte hereafter shal wel appeare kinge odoacer saide vnto pope symmachus vnto cleregie romeconcil roman cap alleged miramur quicquam tenratum fuisse sine nobis nam viuente nostro presbytero sine nobis nihil tentari oportuit wee marueile thing attempted without v without v nothing haue benne donne longe prieste meaneth pope aliue yee fille house ful patriarkes constantinople patriarkes alexandria patriarkes hierusalem prince bulgaria like great stately person conclusion hereof pope damasus gaue consente councel constantinople al hardinge yee might soone haue obteined fauoure lesse doo howe yee maie hereof wel reason thus pope consented vnto councel ergo pope authoritie calle councel lest child woonder logique meane yee saie emperoure theodosius ruled empiere whereby yee gene v vnderstande charge ouer churche thus yee continewe stil enriche self heape reader wt vntruthes certainely bishoppes councel constantinople wrote thus humble wise vnto emperoure theodosius obsecramus clementiam tuampost conci ephesinum primum vt quemadmodum literis honorasti ecclesiam quibus no conuocasti ita finalem conclusionem nostrorum decretorum corroboves sententia tua sigillo wee beseeche maiestie ye haue honoured churche letter wherewith yee haue called v togeather maie please confirme final conclusion decree sentence seale appeareth owne allegation emperoure theodosius tooke vpon himthe emperoure limiteth catholique faithe bounde limite catholique faith euen body ciuile lavves whiche thing neither could haue donne without iudgemente woulde haue donne without authoritie yee ineane determination emperoure theodosius faithe onely shoulde taken catholique professed pope damasus afterwarde professed others succeding peter chaire haue yee secretely conueighed v vntruthe place selfe wil soone reproue youcod theodosian lib titu de fide catholic cunctos populos emperours woordes cunctos populos talus volumus religione versari quam diuinum petrum apostolum tradidisse romani religio v que nunc ab eo insinuata declarat quam que pontificem damasum sequi claret petrum alexandriae episcopum virum apostolicae sanctitatis wee wil el menne walke religion whiche holy peter apostle deliuered romaine faithe firste enkendled stil contine wed vntil daie dooth declare whiche religion also plaine pope damasus foloweth peter bishop alexandria man apostolique holinesse emperoure theodosius commaundeth subiectes folowe wel faithe peter bishop alexandria damasus bishop rome yet nexte title folowinge openeth owne meaning wise eramples cod theodosi li titu sozom li ca large episcopis tradi omnes ecclesias mox iubemus quos constabit vti communione nectarij episcopi constantinopolitanae ecclesiae timothei c wee commaunde foorthwith church restoared al bishoppes shal appeare communicate nestorius bishop constantinople timotheus sutche shal haue felowship agreemente faithe bishoppes alexandria egypte pelagius bishop laodicea diodorus bishop tarsus asia amphilochius bishop iconium optimus bishop antioche helladius bishop caesaria otreius bishop melite gregorius bishop nyssa terennius bishop scythia marmarius bishop martianopolis euery seueral bishoppes hardinge emperoures iudgemente trial catholique faithe greate authoritie weighte bishop rome pope coelestinus yee saie desired cyrillus bishop alexandria represente persone supplie rouine councel ephesus saie haue firste place councel firste place al ecclesiastical assembly alloted bishop romedis renoua te seconde bishop constantinople thirde bishop alexandria fourth bishop antioche fifthe bishop hierusalem packinge place therefore bitweene coelestinus cyrillus mysterie pourposely canuessed keepe bishop constantinople pope euermore enuied countenaunce policie bishop alexandria shoulde haue thirde place handsomely shifted firste bishop constantinople whiche bishop rome absence shoulde haue firste place remoued downe seconde howe auaileth al hardinge pourpose proue councelles summoned pope verily appeareth hitherto either coelestinus cyrillus bishop sutche power authoritie summone councelles yee shoulde haue proued firste seconde place wee moued question againe yee seeme saie pope righte euermore presidente al councelles yee knowe vntruthe yee knowe errouretheodoretus li cap plaine firste councel nice pope iulius presidente eustathius bishop antioche pope legate said beforeeuagri lib cap placed beneath fourthe roume fifthe councel constantinople menna bishop cittie president pope nicephor li cap second ephesine councel dioscorus bishop alexandria presidente seconde councel carthage seemeth gennedius presidente dignitie passed enheritanceconcil chalced acti dioscoro exactis conci carthag succession pope nowe woulde seeme claime either choise councel fauoure prince thus hosius bishop corduba spaine right placesozom li ca socra li ca athanas apologia woorthinesse persone appointed presidente councel sardica athanasius speaketh wise greate admiration cuius non fuit ille concilij princeps councel hath hosius benne presidente chiefe yee saie pope syluester christened emperoure constantinus therefore spiritual father maie passe emonge truthes pope theire omnipotente power maie minister sacramentes deade yet notwithstandinge al true hardinge yet cause thereby litle furthereo onlesse perhaps yee wil reason thus pope syluester christened emperoure ergo pope hathe authoritie calle councelles howe onlesse argumente better digested sophisters louaine wil hardely allowe deede whole tale touchinge christeninge emperoure constantine inter acta liberij cap euseb de vita constan orat nothing el peeuishe fable constantius emperours owne sonne vtterly denieth syluester euer baptized constantinus father eusebius saithe constantinus christened floorishing state age onely litle died rome nicomedia kingdome epirus corner presence many bishoppes hierome saithe pope syluester deade eusebius bishop nicomedia socra anno aetatis suae nonlatin alphabet proufe whereof ambrose saithe constantino vltimis constituto gratia baptismatis omnia peccata dimisit grace baptisme foregaue constantine al sinnes euen ending life therefore hardinge wee must needes saie either tale vntrue whiche strange el constantine twise baptized whiche vnlikely cardinal poole hieronym chronico seeinge mater passe cleare telleth v roundely one woorde eusebius constantius ariane heretiques therefore refuseth whole storie written eusebius ambro de obit theodosij touching christening constantine sommewhat soothe tale let fable stand truth let v graunt impossibilitiecardinal polus de baptismo co stantini pag constantine baptized pope syluester dead yet wil needes geather hereof emperour subiecte pope pope hath authoritie calle councelles wil saie emperoure baptized somme prieste bishop midvvife shal euery therefore require haue doo like muste wee beleeue sutche prieste bishop midvvife shal haue authoritie calle councelles deede good shorte waie geate supremacie might haue pleased remember cardinal ostia vseth alwaies office consecrat pope yet trow yee wil therefore place aboue pope elizaeus anointed king iehu yet therefore aboue kinge heruaeus de potestat pp ca owne doctoure saithe quod hoc argumentum non concludat patet quia veteri lege sacerdotes qui reges inungebant indubitanter regibus subdebantur appeareth argumente concludeth nothinge olde lavve priestes anointed kinges vndoubtedly subiecte kinges conclude right emperoures summoninge councelles fewe authority example folowinge maie soone appeare eusebius saith euseb de vita constan orat costantinus synodu oecumenica collegit episcopos vt vndi que accelerarent honorificis literis conuocauit pope constantine geathered general councel honorable writes called bishoppes al country repaire thither theodor lib cap theodoretus saithe greate holy councel geathered nice grace god pope godly emperoure sozomenus saithe sozom li ca pope emperoure constantine wrote vnto al ruler church shoulde nice daie bishoppes apostolique see macarius bishop hierusalem iulius bishop rome woordes also maie noted pope vnder emperours summone lesse others councel constantinople bishoppes wrote thus vnto emperoure ex madato tuae pietatis constantinopolim couenimusconcil constantinopoli wee comme constantinople pope authoritie maiesties commission athanasius saithe athana de synodis artmin seleuceen ab imperatore praefectis que literae sequentes omnem partem missae sunt eos qui illuc ituri essent conuocantes letter writes folowinge sente al place pope emperoure lieutenantes summoning comme vnto councel chrysostome saith chrysost epist ad innocentiu ambros concil aquileien wee wente humbly besought pope moste christian prince calle councel ambrose speakinge selfe bishoppes beinge councel aquileia saithe thus no conuenimus aquileiam iuxta praeceptum imperatoris mette togeather aquileia commaundemente emperoure pope hierome saithe orientis que occidentis episcopos ob quasdam ecclesiasticas dissensines romam imperiales literae contraxerunt staie certaine ecclesiastical dissension pope letter commaundemente emperours vvrites caused bishoppeshierony epitaphio paulae wel easte vveaste drawe rome pope leo wee haue saide beinge pope hardinge imagineth hable summone world becke thus writeth emperoure theodosiusleo epist ad theodosium imperatorem dignetur pieta vestra supplicationi nostrae annuere vt intra italiam haberi iubeatis episcopale concilium beseeche godly maiestie graunte vnto humble requeste maie please commaunde councel bishoppes holden within italie sozomenus saithe pope hubly desireth emperoure summone councel arians besought pope emperoure constantius commaunde councel holden antioche arians afterwarde besought pope emperoure constantius summone councel millaine againe sozomenus saithe catholique bishoppes sente hypatianus theire embassadoure entreate pope emperouresozom li ca socrat li ca theodoret li cap redresse certaine erroures might haue leaue meete togeather pope liberius saithe councel holden millaine authoritie commaundemente prince pope leo saithe greate councel chalcedon sommoned selfe trauaile martianus emperoureruffi li ca sozom li ca inter acta liberij emperoure constantius commaunded twoo seueral councelles keapte one time one seleucea isauria east ariminum italie vveaste socrates saith sithence emperours firste christened state churche hathe hanged greateste councelles haue benne leo ad anatoliu socra li ca socrates lib prooemio keapte theire aduise thus many anciente councelles wee hable shewe summoned emperours nowe shewe hardinge either emperoure al thinges authoritie pope emperoure onely pope summoner calle councel sutche many shoulde like holinesse commaunde pope euer sommone one ancient general councel owne onely right without commission emperoure wil wee saie yee haue saide somme thing al ye haue nowe said good soothe lesse nothinge apologie cap diuision rufine heretique alleged authoritie councel whiche thought make hierome aduersarie confute tel v quod hee vvhat emperoure commaunded councel called hierome againe epitaphe vpon paula maketh mention emperours letter whiche gaue commaundemente cal bishoppes italie graecia rome councel hardinge bisides yevntruthe prceding ignorance maie soone appeare doo strangely cal rufine heretike wee saie hierome might wel demaund emperoure summoned councel neuer summoned againe confesse emperours haue summoned latine greeke bishopsreade former ansvveare ye proue supreme heade iudge matter religion consent bishop rome haue declared b sarisburie stranger owne bookes harding yee would thinke strange mater heare ruffinus called heretique hierome doubted calle himhierony apologia contra ruffinum thus saith dum mihi inconstantiae crimen impingit se haereticu c ita verrit origene vt qui trinitate catholiquum legeret alijs haereticu non caueret ruffinus chargeth inconstancie proueth selfe heretique c ruffinus hath translated origen latine findeth catholique touchinge trinitie shoulde neuer suspecte thinge el heretique eadem apologia againe saith vnto solo haereticos non recipimus quos vos solo recipitis onely heretiques wee receiue house yet onely receiue anastasius bishop rome hath thus published iudgemente ruffinusanastasius ad episcopum hierosolymoru apud hieronym omni suspicione seposita ruffinum scito quod proptia mente origenis dictum latinu transtulit ac probauit nec dissimilis ab eo est qui alienis vitijs praestat assensum illud tamen scire te cupio ita haberi nostris partibus alienum vt quid agat vbi sit nec scire cupiamus al suspicio sette aparte knowe thou yt ruffinus hath translated origen heretiques woordes latine accordinge owne likinge vvel allovveth euer geueth consente vnto mannes faulte vnlike vnto notwithstandinge thus mutche woulde haue thee knowe ruffinus far felowship profession faithe wee desire knowe neither dooth vincentius saithe vincent speculo li ca hierome charged ruffinus pelagian heresie erasmus saith ruffinus non fuit alienus ab origenistarum haeresi ruffinus cleare origenians heresie againe speakinge heretiqueserasmus vita hieronymi saithe huius rei dux signifer aquileiensis ruffinus fuit againe notat nescio quem ipsum opinor ruffinum qui eam haeresim inductus est magistro quopiamerasm epist hieronym ad principiam schol c againe monet vt explosa factione origenistarum co etiam eijciat qui clam oblique essent origenistae ruffinum illius amicos captaine standarde bearer heresie vvas ruffinus aquileia c againe hierome noteth somme body knowe thinke ruffinus selfe brought heresie somme teacher erasm argumento epistolae theophili ad hieronym c againe warneth frende hauinge renounced origenian heretiques woulde likewise renounce priuily secrete origenian heretiques meaninge ruffinus frendes likewise againe saithe ruffinus grauissima suspicione premebatur quod esset origenista sub hoc enim titulo arianorum haeresis conata est repullulascere ruffinus greeuously supected origenian heretiqueerasm de libris origenis vnder name arian heresie beganne reuiue thus yee see hardinge greate heresie saie ruffinus heretique apologie cap diuision continually space fiue hundred yeeres emperour alone appointed ecclesiastical assembly called councelles bishoppes togeather nowe therefore marueile vnreasonable dealinge bishop rome knowinge emperours right churche wel ordered knowing also nowe common right al prince mutche kinges nowe fully possessed seueral partes whole empire doothe without consideration assigne office alone selfe taketh sufficient summoning general councel make man prince whole worlde otherwise partaker thereof woulde make owne seruaunte hardinge vvhere saie emperoure alone celebrated kepte helde councelles latine hardinges modestie reade ansvveare nexte goinge sauing one impudently faced without face without proufe without truthe thei celebrated holdenvntruthplaine euident many time pope legares vvere vnderlings inferiours vnto others pope legate patriarkes bishoppes emperours al emperours might themvntruthe emperoures embassadours sitting councel vvere called illustrissimi iudices iudges thei haue euer benne called episcopalia concilia notnomore vvere thei called co cilium papalia cratoria councelles bishoppes emperours diuerse councels accompted general kepte bishoppes emperour christened whiche kepte hierusalemactor mentioned actes aposties time victor pope palestina place concerning kepinge easier rome time pope fabian nouatian heresie antioche againste paulus samosatenus many others al whiche kepte onely without presence emperoures person vvere moste parte councelles keapte vvithout either presence povver authoritie pope also without power authoritie yet head churche coulde haue benne donne without saie christened answeare christianitie parte imperial power spiritual power whereby made sonne god maie thereby ruled christian bishop verely hath power geeuen whereby maie rule bishoppes folie folie emperours povver vvere either enceased empaired baptisme baptisme maketh man childe churche imposition handes consecratinge christian priesie bishop geueth rule ouer others sacramente baptisme therefore emperours holder kepers councelles firste fiue hundred yeares yea three hundred fully expired emperoure professed openly christian faithe mutche lesse maie marueile nowe bishop rome calleth kepeth councelles chiefely owne authoritiea substantial good reason vvhat ambrose saie succedeth iudas succedeth peter nero tooke authoritie christe imm diatly people rome emperoure christian christian bishop rome bythe pope christian man nature office nature bishoppes office onely alwaies christian man also chiefe prieste vvhere saie bishop rome summoning late councel besides good consideration made man prince whole world wise partaker thereof would make owne seruainte forgette selfe fouly seeme recke litle speake vtter malice whome cal prince whole worlde vvhat contradiction saide sentence kinges nowe fully possessed seueral partes whole empire howe cal ferdinandeit vvritten ovvn glose iura commentia decunt quod imperator est dominus mundi prince whole worlde vvel one common ornamentes rhetorique sir emperour ferdinande famous memorie abused pius fourth blessed man bishop rome day ye rather abuse emperours maiestie ye depose cleane seate ye finde faulte euer leo thirde made emperoure vveste ye complaine openly emperial maiestie continued stil constantinople bilike intent turke might nowe haue knowen suffer dominion al faithes religion whiche cause maie seeme ye fauer pope pius nowe deferred olde priuilege honoure vnto emperoure ferdinande without olde burthen olde timesvntruthes tvvo togeather nether vvas dothe socrates recorde councelles holden authoritie pope socrates witnesseth yet emperour bare charge calling bishoppes togeatherlib ca nowe pope selfe bare greate parte burthen communicated propose fully emperoure b sarisburie whether emperoure alone appointed ecclesiastical councelles maie appeare wee haue already saide pope alone assure youpererssuccessours maie emperoure saide proued oftentimes helde sutche assembly selfed listed whether pope would pope dutie onely appeare emongeste bishoppes called graunte sutche councelles theire name bishoppes called concilia episcopalia mater specially ordered discretion iudgement bishoppes wil therefore conclude councelles perteined nothing prince certainely emperoure constantinus commaunded al bishoppes appeare yelde reckeninge theire determinatios councel tenoure writesozomen li ca quotquot synodum tyri habitam compleuistis sine mora ad pietatis nostrae castra properetis ac ipsa quam sincere ac recte iudicaueritis ostendatis id que coram socrat li ca quem sincerum esse dei ministrum ne vos quidem ipsi negabitis many haue keapte councel tyrus repaire campe without desaie shewe deede howe sincerely rightly yee haue proceded euen yowe selues cannot denie bee sincere seruante god athanasius greatteste trauailer councel nice againste arians triparti histo li ca yet bishop onely deacon hereof wee haue sufficiently saide christianitie yee saie parte emperial povver yee might likewise haue saide christianitie parte papale povver verily wel appeare peter paule euer sutche christianitie emperours right neither encreased abated baptissne whether faithful vnfaithful minister god beareth swerde pounishe sinne yee saie pope succedeth peter nero therefore calleth keepeth councelles chiefely owne authoritie sutche proper argumentes hardinge wee marueile mutche though yee make stoare howe somme menne haue thought yee doo peter greate wronge appointinge sutche child heires many al theire dealinges haue resembled nero bernard de co sideratione li citatur ab illyrico inter test veritat pag erasmus adagio sileni alcibiadis peter bernarde saithe thus vnto pope eugenius successisti non petro sed constantino thinges yee haue succeded peter apostle emperoure constantine pope adrian fourth woonte saie succedimus non petro docendo sed romulo parricidio wee succeede peter teachinge romulus killinge brother erasmus saithe pontifex nunc sunt vicarij lulij caesaris alexandri magni croesi xerxis non christi non petri pope nowe vicares iulius caesar alexander greate croesus xerxes peter written sermon bearinge name ambrose qui debuerint esse vicarij apostolorumambro citatur ab illyrico inter test pag robert gallus cap factisunt socij iudae thei shoulde haue benne apostle vicares nowe becomme iudas felowes robertus gallus liued welneare three hundred yeeres past imagineth christe thus saie pope quis posuit idolum hoc sede mea vt imperaret gregi meo sette idole roume made ruler ouer flocke yetdis sic omnes gloss cardinal cusanus de autho eccle concilij supra contra scripturam saie pope alwaies onely christian man also chiefe prieste faithe nature office euen glose telleth papa sanctitatem recipit cathedra pope receiueth holinesse chaire saie nature office cardinal cosanus saithe veritas adhaeret cathedrae c veritas per christum cathedrae alligata est non personis ait enim super cathedram mosi sederunt scribae pharisaei truthe cleaueth faste pope chaire c christe hathe nailed truthe pope chaire persone saithe scribe phariseis placed moses chaire saithe dis non no gloss tameisi papa non sit bonus tamen semper praesumitur esse bonus papa si desint bona acquisita per meritum sufficiunt quae locus praedecessore praestantur notwithstandinge pope good parte hereof hathe benne touched yet euer presumed good pope lacke good vertues owne vertues peter predecessoure sufficiente neuer many heretiques one see haue benne see rome haue already sufficientely fully proued yet yee saie pope cannot erre neuer notorious example platyna calleth platyna benedict monster filthy life yet yee saie al holy father holde theire christianitie nature office howe youre doctoure alphonsus saithe alphonsus aduersus hare li ca quamuis credere teneamur ex fide verum petri successorem esse supremum pastorem totius ecclesiae non tamen tenemur eadem fide credere leonem aut clementem esse verum petri successorem although wee bounde beleue true successoure peter higheste pastoure al churche yet wee bounde like faithe beleue pope leo pope clemente true successoures petermatthae iohn baptiste saide rightly vnto phariseis likewise made vauntes theire succession neuer saie abraham father god hable euen stone raise vp child vnto abraham chrysostom opere imperficto homi dist multi gregori nazia sanctum lauacrum chrysostome saithe non locus sanctificat hominem sed homo locum nec cathedra facit sacerdotem sed sacerdos cathedram place sanctifieth man man sanctifieth place neither doothe chaire make prieste prieste maketh chaire nazianzene saithe non locorum est gratia sed spiritus grace god goeth place holy ghoste chrysostome saithe omnis christianus qui suscipit verbum petri fit thronus petri chrysost mat homi et petrus sedet eo euery christian man receiueth woorde peter made peter chaire peter reasteth haue founde foule contradiction woordes saie yee cal prince worlde pope hardinge leste yee shoulde happily deceiued notwithstandinge youre felowes haue often tolde vsin sexto li tituil ca vnica papa rotius orbis obtinet principatum pope hath princehoode al worlde emperoures maiestie wee finde oftentimes entitled name pope holinesse entitled wee finde neuer onlesse somme certaine late decree gloses owne al late haue mutche abated emperoures honoure haue made onely pope man thus yee saie imperator occidentis est procurator siue defensor romanae ecclesiae dist si imperator gloss emperoure weaste proctoure stewarde churche rome yet chrysostom ad popul antioche homi chrysostome saithe imperator est summitas caput omnium super terram hominu emperoure toppe heade al menne vpon earthe councel chalcedon emperoure called dominus vniuersi mundi concil chalce actio nomine lorde whole worlde perhaps ye wil saie state empiere nowe empouerished therefore emperoure hathe loste title yet owne doctours glosers coulde haue tolde extra de maiorita obedie vnam sanctam gloss iura communia dicunt quod imperator est dominus mundi notwithstading decaie empiere common lawes saie emperoure lorde worlde rob hol ote speakinge emperoure germanie saithe thus hic est rex regum cui omnes subditae sunt nationes populiholcote sapien lectio otho irisingesis c emperoure kinge kinges vnto al nation country subiection romaine late yeeres wrote thus vnto emperoure conradus excellentissimo praeclarissimo vrbis oibis totius mino c vnto page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate moste excellente emperour lorde vvorld moste noble emperoure lorde bothe cittie also al whole worlde therefore hardinge moue vaine quarrel without somme cause great folie councelles ye saie olde time holden authoritie pope proufe whereof yee allege socrates eight booke seconde chapter woorde sentence yee allege none howe great ouersight allege eighth booke socrates whereas socrates selfe neuer wrote seuen far ouerleape authoure notwithstandinge smal erroure maie wel dissembled emongest many touchinge thing selfe yee maie easily finde eighth booke socrates neuer written el deede emongeste al euer wrote thinge certainely allege wrote neuer apologie cap diuision ca diui although modestie mildenesse emperoure ferdinando greate beare wronge bicause peraduenture vnderstandeth wel pope packinge yet ought pope holinesse offer wronge claime man right owne hereto somme wil replie emperoure deede called councelles time yee speake bicause bishop rome yet growen greate nowe yet emperour sitte togeather bishoppes councel bare stroke authoritie theire consultation answeare nay witnesseth theodorete emperoure constantine sate onely togeather councel nice gaue also aduise bishoppes howe best trie mater apostle prophetes vvritinges appeareth owne woordes disputation saithe mater diuinitie vvee haue set v folovve doctrine holy ghoste euangelistes apostle vvoorkes prophetes saieinges shevve v sufficiently vvhat opinio vve ought haue vvil god hardinge sittinge emperoures councelles treate common place necessarie man euer denied emperoures maie sitte acknowledge two sortes settinge one assessours iudgevntruthe cusanus saith inuenio imperatores co cil iudicia fec sse reade ansvveare emperoure euer sate iudge councel many emperoures person lieutenauntes haue sitten ready assiste defende thatin vita co stant lib theodorit lib ca nonlatin alphabet whiche bishoppes iudged decreed vvhat maner seate greate constantine firste councel nice eusebius life theodoritus doth declare al bishoppes sette seates number came emperoure last smal companievntruthe enclosed lovve litle chaire vvas al beaten golde vvas lette highest place councel lowe litle chaire beinge sette middest would sitte downe bishoppes reuerently signified mutche vnto theodoritus writeth desired bishoppes permitte doo nowe thinke supreme head churche hauevaine folie prince neuer commeth parlament house lordes b sette comme last hane sittenvntruthe zomen saith thro u ille ximus salios omnes superaus beneath subiectes haue staied sitte vntil thei geuen leaue neither consulted bishoppesconstantine councel nice required consult mater thei came theodorite witnesseth neither spake generally reporte framed tale sorte fainevntruthe euident cassiodorus expou deth thus quid de diuina lege sapere debeamus vniuersally wil god godhed saieinge bookes gospel apostle oracle prophetes doo plainely teache v ought thinke godhed nonlatin alphabet cotrouersie whiche arians made mutche adoo touchinge equalitie godhed christe consubstantialitie god father wordes whiche vttered tooke vpon define iudge onely exhorte agree together one faithe amonge bishop certaine fauoured heresie arius suche example bringe defence parte make mutche delight making rodde selfe bicause haue better somwhat must needes saie lest stage plaie parte shoulde stande stil b sarisburie emperoures ye saie sate councelles assessours onely iudges saie thei sate bishoppes helde theirpeace tolde clocke saide nothinge yet youre doctours saie assessor episcopi non potest esse laicus assessoure bishop maie laieman de rescriptis statutum s assessorem geminianus euseb vita constant os touchinge mater selfe eusebius alwaies neare aboute emperoure constantine wrote life presente councel saithe thus constantinus quasi communis quidam episcopus deo constitutus ministrorum dei synodos conuocauit nec dedignatus est adesse considere medio illorum consors que fieri ipsorum c constantine benne common bishop appoited god called togeather councelles goddes minister disdeigned selfe sitte middes emongest partetaker theire dooinges nonlatin alphabet euseb eode loco againe constantinus selfe saithe thus ego intereram concilio tanquam vnus ex vobis presente councel emongeste one againe eusebius saithe vnus vnicus deus instituit constantinum ministrum suum doctorem pietatis omnibus terris one onely god hath appointed constantine minister doctoure true godlinesse vnto al nation theodoretus saithe laudatissimus rex apostolicas curas suscipiebat animo suotheodoret lib cap pontifex solum non ae dificare ecclesiam sed etia illus fundamenta labefactare conabantur good emperoure hadde apostolique care harte bishoppes onely builde vp churche god also ouerthrew fundations againe eusebius saithe euseb vita constanti os nicepho praefatione ad emmanuelem constantinus erat vocalissimus dei praeco quasi seruator ac medicus animarum constantine emperoure moste cleare preacher god saueoure physicion soules sorte nicephorus writeth vnto emperoure emmanuel palaeologus tu e dux professionis fidei nostrae c youre maiestie captaine profession faithe youre maiestie hath restored catholique vniuersal churche maiestie hath refourmed temple god marchantes exchaungers heauenly doctrine heretiques woorde truthe yee saie bishoppes sette came emperoure laste smal companie theodoret li cap nonlatin alphabet whereof yee would haue v geather came onely somme inferioure personne iudge howe theodoretus saithe constantinus iussit episcopos ingredi constantine commaunded bishoppes goe eusebius saithe sedit tota synodus reuerenter vt par fuit cum silentio expectans aduentum principis whole councel sate reuerent comely order quietely silence lookinge prince comminge good proufe hardinge emperoure councel inferioure bishoppes nay bishoppes commaunded take place sitte silence waite emperoures comminge subiectes againe saithe signo quo aduentus imperatoris indicatus est nonlatin alphabet dato omnibus exuergentibus ipse deinde ingressus est medius tanquam aliquis dei coelestis angelus watche woorde geuen emperoure comme bishoppes stoode vp place maiestie past along middes benne angel god emperoure yee saie sate vpon litle lowe stoole therein shewed selfe inferioure bishop yea hardinge eusebius saithe litle lowe stoole made whole beaten gould nonlatin alphabet therein trowe sommewhat aboue bishoppes yee saie sate alowe middes bishoppes hereof yee conclude theire inferioure iulius caesar notwithstandinge emperoure rome yet came college poetes wel contented placed lowest roume yet therefore thiere inferioure touching emperoure constantine place councel eusebius saithe thus nonlatin alphabet accessit ad summum gradum ordinum went vp highest rising al bench sozomenus saithe imperator peruenit ad caput concilij sedit throno quodam quem ipse sibi fecerat erat autem thronus ille maximus alios omnes superans emperoure went vp headde highest place councel sate downe throne estate prepared selfe throne greate farre passed al rest meane season pope legate sate saide neither first place seconde thirde fourthe hereby seemeth appeare plainely constantinus emperoure place councel aboue bishoppes notwithstandinge sithence time pope hathe determined muste nowe otherwise ceremoniarium li sect ca order hath benne alleaged sedes imperatoris parabitur c emperoures seate shalbe prepared nexte vnto pope seate shal haue twoo steppe ioined vnto neither broade longe bee pope shalbe apparelled clothe golde canopie euer heade shal haue noneet aduertendum quod locus vbi sedet imperator non sit altior loco vbi tenet pes pontifex howe thinge specially marked place whereupon emperoure sittethe maie higher place pope setteth feete thus wee see emperoure allowed sitte pope foote stoole case mounte higher emperoure yee saie stoode stil doubte cappe hande durste sitte downe without leaue thereby testified selfe inferioure bishoppes colde conclusion wil hardely serue traianus beinge emperoure rome contented selfe stande afoote honour sake commaunded consulles sitte downe yet therefore inferioure dignitie consulles helena empresse ruffinus li ca apparelled selfe like seruante ministred vnto holy virgines gaue water theire handes deede benne theire seruaunte yet shee therefore inferioure vnto virgines emperoure constantine time sermonseuseb vita constant os stoode vpright woulde sitte reuerence bare vvoorde god yet inferioure preacher good emperoures modestie humilitie hardinge dewtie wisedome prince take heede committe ouermutche youre handes euer yeelde meere courtesie streight waie ye claime youre owne howe touchinge emperoures sittinge councel farre otherwise reporte sozomenus saithe imperator resedit throno qui illi paratus fuerat synodus iussa est sedere emperoure sate downe chaire estate prouided sozome li ca nonlatin alphabet councel commaunded sitte downe hereby appeareth emperoure needed bishoppes leaue rather gaue leaue bishoppes doubte godly milde prince beeinge reuerende assemblie bare selfe mutche reuerence therfore eusebius saithe sate downeeuseb vita constanti os nonlatin alphabet bishoppes beckened vnto addeth withal post imperatorem idem fecerunt omnes emperoure sette sate downe al togeather hardinge sate firste councel heade churche seeme saie maie reason thus pope legate councel sate first ergo pope heade churche againe emperoure councel sate firste ergo youre owne conclusion emperoure heade churche certainely pope selfe saithe plainely emperoure constantine vvas president ruler nicene councel woordes theise constantinus praesidens sanctae synodo12 quae fitturam gregor quae apud nicaeam congregata est constantinus emperoure beinge presidente holy councel keapte nice woordes pope registred euen owne recordes therefore truste yee wil refuse geeue credite saie emperoure determined defined nothinge yet emperoure selfe euseb vita constant orat contrarie youre saieinge saithe thus ego suscepi perfeci re salutiferas persuasus verbo tuo lorde tooke hande broughte passe vvholesome thinges beinge persvvaded thy vvorde againe writinge hereof vnto bishoppes sundrie church saithe ego vobiscum interfui tanquam vnus ex vobis non enim negauerim conseruum vestrum esseeuseb vita constan orat qua de mihi maxime gratulor presente councel one cannot denie mee selfe bee youre felovve seruante whiche thinge moste reioise likewise againe saithe ego nicaeam contraxi magnum numerum episcoporumsocra li ca nonlatin alphabet cum quibus cum essem vnus ex vobis conseruus vester vehementer esse cuperem etiam ipse suscepi inquisitionem veritatis caused greate companie bishoppes come nice whome togeather tooke hande examination truthe beinge mee selfe one mutche desieringe therein youre felowe seruante likewise saithe eusebius imperator quasi iuculentam facem accendens ne quae occultae erroris reliquiae superessent euseb vita constan orat nonlatin alphabet oculo regio circumspexit emperoure hauing enkendled greate flame lookte wel aboute princely eie priuie remnantes erroure shoulde reaste behinde bishoppes nicene councel beinge variance emongeste selues offered vp theire bookes accusation vnto pope legate socrat li ca greate regarde vnto emperoure neither emperoure put ouer theire quarelles vnto pope iudgemente vnto iudgemente god againe emperoure constantine saithe bishop vvickedly offende hande goddes seruante saie hande shalbe pounished shorte theodoret lib cap cardinal cusanus saithe sciendum est quod vniuersalibus octo concilijs vbi imperatores interfuerunt non papa semper inuenio imperatores iudices suos cum senatu primatum habuisse cardinal cusae de praesidentia officium praesidentiae per interlocutiones ex consensu synodi sine madato conclusiones iudicia fecisse et non reperitur instantia octo concilijs praeter quam tertia actione concilij chalcedonensis wee muste knowe eight general councelles emperoures present pope euermore finde emperoures theire iudges senate gouernemente office presidence hearinge conferring mater made conclusion iudgementes consente councel without commission manner instance exception founde firste eight councelles sauinge onely thirde action councel chalcedon yee see plainely authoritie cardinal cusanus one youre owne special doctours eight firste general councelles emperoure presidente pope emperoure willed bishoppes conclude theire mater apostolical prophetical scripture speaketh saie generally wee reporte frameth tale sorte wee saine vniuersally vvil god godhedde nonlatin alphabet fansie signifieth apostolici libri erudiunt no quid de sacrum lege sapiamus bookes euangelistes apostle teache v wee ought thinke onely substance nature god also holy lavve therefore theodoretus addeth woordes accipiamus explicationes quaestionum nostrarum ex dictis sancti spiritustheodoret li cap nonlatin alphabet let v take resolution question woordes holy ghoste immediately saithe de rebus diuinis disputantes praescripram habemus doctrinam sancti spiritus disputation onely godhedde also godly mater wee haue laide v doctrine holy gospel like sense hilarie saithe non est relictus hominum eloquijs de dei rebus alius praeterquam dei sermohilari de trinitat li de rebus dei nonlatin alphabet omnia reliqua arcta conclusa impedita sunt obscura mater touchinge god speache leafte vnto menne onely woorde god al authority shorte narrowe darke troublesome beleue hencefoorth therefore hardinge tel nonlatin alphabet signifieth onely substance nature goddes diuinitie yee maie easily see glose vaine fighteth directely againste texte apologie cap diuision emperoure theodosius saithe socrates onely sitte amongest bishoppes also ordered whole argueinge cause tare peeces heretiques bookes allowed good iudgemente catholiques hardinge wonder see howe menne abuse ecclesiastical history vvhereas thei talke litle sitting emperours general councelles man would thinke also theodosius benne saide haue sitten among bishoppesas priuate councel vvere councel general councel sutche materhist tripar lib ca theodosius emperour conferred nectarius bishop constantinople howe al christen men might brought vnitie faithe nectarius lerned sisinnius greate clerke best way al heades eche heresie secte might induced iudged olde father doctours churche godly emperoure hearing aduise caused bothe heretikes catholiques also write eche sutche thinges eche saie belefe praier made reading ouer al writingesfonde folie though emperoure could condene heretiques allovve catholiques vvithout iudgemente reiected arians macedonian eunomians embracing onely thier sentence agreed vpon consubstantialitie sonne god saie defender theodosius onely sitte amongest bishoppes also ordered whole arguing cause tearing paper heretikes allowing iudgemente catholiques whiche obiection make answeare first theodosius tooke counsel nectarius bishop folowed secondely intended iudge whether opinion al sectes truera vvorthy reason emperoure sought meanes abandon heresy ergo iudged vvhether parte vvas truer onely sought howe ridde churche cotrouersies otherwise would onely haue taken counsel nectarius catholike bishop also arians macedonian eunomians right iudge calleth one side onely iudgemente ruled plaine emperoure onely consulted catholiques lesse plainevntruthe co trarie plaine storie sate iudge vpon catholiques vvhat verely entended execute iudgement whiche bishop pronounced nice therefore conferred onely menne side enstructed disputation good come chose way make al write opinios minded nowe lerne faithe writinges sith lerned longe professed baptisme sought way whereby put al heretiques silence therefore hauing read al writinges hauinge made praier god graceand hovve could make choise vvithout iudgemente chose better sideiacob cor whiche also made doubtinge faithe el infidel vnworthy iudge euen temporal matter among christian partely declared al goodnes asked godthus hardinge maketh emperoure dissemblinge hypocrite partely would heretiques vnderstande wont worke affection feare god thus hauing praied readen writinges executed iudgemente nicene councel reiected heretiques nowe retourne wordes apologie saie thei emperoure onely sate among bishoppes also causae disceptationi praefuit chiefe ruler moderatour reasoning debating mater thei cannot saie thus councel whereof thei talkea fonde cauil vvas priuate councel sundrie bishoppes iudgemente thereof vvas specially directed emperoure councel indicted onely pope neither emperoure archebishop priuate callinge together certaine heades eche secte solemne ordinarie councel councel bishoppes sittinge bishoppes sitting presidence al howe theodosius president iudge ecclesiastical cause shal reporte thinge truthe done whiche saieinge ambrose praised sure theodosius neuer meante intermedle ecclesiastical matersthus emperour becom bishoppes man otherwise execute bishoppes decree b sarisburie yee saie woonder see howe menne abuse ecclesiastical story priuate councel yee saie whereat theodosius present general poore healpe sufficiente salue mater priuate councel councel emperoure might sitte iudge priuate councelles general storie briefe theodosius emperoure theodosius iudgeth ecclestical cause better bringe church vnitie commaunded assemblie bishoppes beste learned appeare eche parte write seueral confession assiste holy sprite make hable iudge iustely perused considered eche confession sunder selfe allowed onely catholiques condemned confession written arians eunomians tare peeces true reporte storie hardinge whatsoeuer yee haue added hereunto manner owne nowe whether emperoure theodosius tooke vpon heare determine ecclesiastical cause religion reporte owne indifferente iudgemente yee wil saie emperoure presumed iudge thinge selfe wholy ruled bishoppes executoure willes hereof yee saie yee wel assured thus handlinge yee make prince onely bishop man strike blindely whomsoeuer bishop shal commaunde condemne depriue spoile kille owne subiectes iudgemente knowledge onely vpon doubteful credit pleasure bishop simple yee make godly emperoure dealing willed cogregation praie praied selfe condemned councel yee saie yee finde howe ee sought better yee might soone haue founde one owne frendes louaine saithe herein yee toomutche ouerseene woordes truely recorded councel videtur nobis iustum esse eidem poenae dioscorum reuerendum episcopum alexandriae c pu dialo pag iuuenalem reuerendum episcopum hierosolymorum thalassium reuerendum episcopum caesariae cappadociae subiacere concil reuerende bishop caesaria cappadocia shoulde put pounishemente holy councel accordinge canon shoulde remoued episcopal dignity euagrius li cap woordes yee might also haue founde fully reported euagrius likewise also saithe pope leo touchinge de nominibus dioscori iuuenalisleo epist ad anatolium eustachij vel potius thalassij ad sacrum altare non recitandis dilectionem tuam hoc decet custodire touchinge name dioscorus iuuenalis eustachius rather thalassius rehearsed holy aultar whiche communion table yee must keepe order yee saie notwithstanding bishoppes condemned councel yet ciuile laie iudges condemned ye saie onely see good order keepe peace hardinge owne onely idle gheaste without manner authoritie onely grounded vpon selfe certainely woordes councel plaine gloriosissimi iudices amplissimus senatus dixerunt moste noble iudges moste woorthy senate saide likewise saithe euagrius concil chalce actio euag li ca nonlatin alphabet lordes emperours councel decreed thinges neither ciuile iudges scrupulous thinke thei might deale case religion maie wel appeare theire woordes thus saie gloriosissimi sudices amplissimus senatus dixerunt de rectum catholica fideconcil chalce act pag perfectius sequenti die conuenienti concilio diligentiorem examinationem fieri opottere perspicimusdioscorus iuuenalis thalassius moste noble iudges moste vvoorthy senate saide wee see touchinge right catholique faithe nexte daie councel shal meete muste diligente examinatione mater concluded published bishoppes east brake fauourable shootes sorte iustum rectum iudiciu vita longa senatui multi anni imperatori iuste righte iudgemente longe life vnto senate many yeeres vnto emperoure al case wel ecclesiastical temporal emperoure iudge ouer al euer councel determined without emperoures consent force therefore bothe bishoppes temporal iudges councel vsed oftentimes suspende staie decree sorte videtur nobis iustumconcil chalced actio pag euag li ca nonlatin alphabet si placuerit diuinissimo pijssimo domino nostro vnto v seemeth right shal also like moste vertuous moste godly lorde emperoure ende thei conclude thus omnibus quae acta sunt ad sacrum apicem referendis al dooinges remitted emperoures maiestie al whiche woordes borowed recte ecclesiastical storie euagrius yee saie luuenalis thalassius might wel haue rebuke sittinge like iudges seconde councel ephesus without authoritie pope harding either yee mutche deceiued prefume speake yee knowe whiche great folie el yee speake directely knowledge conscience willingely seeke deceiue others whiche greate wickednesse verily ye might easily haue knowen three bishoppes condened intruding vpon pope authoritie ye haue imagined onely condemninge godly bishoppes wickedly without cause woordes councel plaine gloriosissimi iudices dixerunt vos quidem primitus docuistis quia per vim concil chalcedonen action necessitatem pura charta coacti estis subscribere ad damnationem sanctae memoriae flauiani orientales qui cum ipsis erant reuerendissimi episcopi clamauerunt omnes peccauimus omnes veniam postulamus moste nolse iud lande yee haue proued v yee driuen force violence anke paper subscribe name condemnation flauianus godly memorie bishoppes easte reuerende bishoppes cried vve haue al offended vve al desire pardone dede theire faulte hardinge al imagine vsurpinge pope authoritie fansie pope huge vniuersal authoritie whereby nowe clamen whole iurisdiction al worlde time knowen councel chalcedon maketh equal authoritie dignitie bishop constantinopleconcil chalced woordes sedi senioris romae propter imperium ciuitatis illius patres consequenter priuilegia reddiderunt et cadem intentione permoti centum quinquaginta deo amantissimi episcopi aequa sanctissimae sedi nouae romae priuilegia tribuerunt rationabiliter iudicantes imperio senatu vrbem ornatam aequis senioris regiae romae priuiulegijs frui ecclesiasticis sicut illa maiestatem habere negotijs vnto see olde rome consideration empiere cittie father haue accordingly geeuen priuileges vpon like consideration hundred fiftie godly bishoppes haue geeuen equal like priuileges cittie nevve rome whereby meante cittie constantinople thei thought reasonable cittie constantinople nowe adourned empiere senate shoulde also also haue priuileges equal vvith rome elder haue maiestie authoritie ecclesiastical affaire rome hathe thus yee see pope power peerelesse ouer al worlde made like euen equal al respectes one brother therefore bishop rome heade churche bishop constantinople likewise heade churche bishop rome povver vvere vniuersal bishop constantinople povver vniuersal wel councel alloweth mutche ecclesiastical authoritie one bishop nowe shortely consider whole substance talke firste yee saie three bishoppes dioscorus iuuenalis thalassius neuer condemned councel chalcedon yee see one vntruthe secondely yee saie ciuile magistrate neuer condemned vntruthe thirdely yee saie iuuenalis thalassius rebuked sitting iudges councel without pope authoritie tvvoo vntruthes neither pope sutche prerogatiue time cause theire condemnation yet ye woulde renne v ouer terroure woordes yee crie courrage vvhat impudencie licenceous lieing deceitful dealinge touchinge firy termes hardinge dare answeare plaine lieinge without difference ye knowe looke owne bookes ye cannot faile verily publishe vntruthes largely liberally haue donne onely vpon affiance simplicitie ignorance reader without regarde feare god man apologie cap diuision chirde councel constantinople constantine ciuile magistrate
