apperteined onely bishop apologie cap diuision seconde councel called arausi canum prince embassadours beinge noble men borne onely spake minde touchinge religion sette theire handes also wel bishoppes thus written later ende councel petrus marcellinus felix liberius noble men famous lieurenantes captaines fraunce also peeres realme haue geuen consent ser handes syagrius opilio pantagathus deodatus cariattho marcellus menne greate honoure haue subscribed hardinge vvhat al laiemen worlde subscribed worde consenting agreeing bishop decree eche one writinge thus case olde manner consentiens subscripsi vvhat thinge proued thereby thought necessarie allowe whiche bishop determinedthe temporal magistrate subscribeth coucel vvhiche wish ye woulde apologie cap diuision lieutenantes chiefe captaines peeres haue authoritie subscribe councel haue emperours kinges like authoritie hardinge kinges quenes onely might ought subscribe required b sarisburie hardinge yee driuen many shiftes somme saie prince embassadours ciuile magistrate right subscribe councel onely licence sufferance bishoppes somme others haue found certaine difference subscription bishop yee saie subscribed one fourme ciuile magistrate bishop thus definiens subscripsi geuing definitiue sentence haue subscribed laie magistrate thus consentiens subscripsi geuinge consente hereto haue subscribed thus haue found knotte russhe diuised diuersitie without difference certainely olde councelles appeareth onely one fourme subscription moe afterwarde two woordes definiens consenriens wherein imagine greate difference vsed indifferently wel bishoppesconsentiens subscripsi conci chalced actio pa conc parisien others eche man best affected sommetime bishop subscribed cosentiens sommetime laieman subscribed definiens without seruple councel chalcedon written thus ego dorotheus episcopus consensi subscripsi bishop dorothee haue consented subscribed likewise written councel parise ego probianus episcopus bituricesis consensi subscripsi probiane bishop bourges haue consentedmarius victorinus contra arianos lib definiens subscripsi euag li ca sozom li ca nonlatin alphabet aeneas syluiut de gestis concil constantien li subscribed marius victorinus saithe nicenae fidei multa episcoporum milium consenserunt many thousande bishoppes consented vnto nicene faithe side laie prince councel hath authoritie onely consente agree vnto others also define determine case religion many euidente example maie appeare euagrius saithe alleged nonlatin alphabet senate lordes ye councel determined thinges sozomenus saithe imperator constantinus iussit decem episcopos orientis totidem occidentis quos synodus designasser ad aulam suam venire sibi exponere decreta concilij vt ipse quoq que consideraret secundum scripturas inter se conuenissent de rebus agendis quae optimum viderentur determinaret emperour constantine commaunded tenne bishoppes easte tenne weaste chosen councel shoulde repaire courte open vnto decree councel maiestie might consider whether agreed accordinge scripture might onely consente agree also determine conclude beste donne aeneas syluius whiche afterwarde pope pius saithe thus visum est spiritui sancto nobis vnde apparet alios quam episcopos concilijs habuisse vocem decidentem seemeth good holy ghoste v hereby appeareth somme biside bishoppes voice definitiue councelles againe saithe nec ego cuiusuis episcopi mendaciumeodem loco quamuis ditissimi veritati praeponam pauperis presbyteri nec dedignari debet episcopus si aliquando ignarus rudis sequacem non habeat multitudine neither w l sette bishoppes lie neuer riche woulde sette priestes truthe neuer poore neither ignorante vnlearned bishop disdeigne see people va willinge folowe gerson saith iudicium conclusio fidei licet authoritatiue spectet ad praelatos doctores spectare tamen possunt ad alios quam theologos deliberatio sicut cognitio super quae fidem respiciunt ita vt ad laicos etiam hoc possit extendigerson quae veritates sint credendae plus aliquando quam ad multos clericorum notwithstandinge iudgemente conclusion faithe belonge authoritie vnto bishoppes doctours yet wel deliberation hereof also knovvledge iudgemente concerninge mater touche faithe maie belonge vnto others bisides diuines doctoures professours diuinitie yea sommetimes extended euen vnto laiemenne sommetimes vnto vnto many priestes emperoure iustinian ecclesiastical cause oftentimes vseth woordes authen collaet tit quomodo opor episcop definimus mandamus lubemus c wee determine wee conclude wee commaunde wee bidde touchinge bishoppes writeth thus definimus vt nullus deo amabilium episcoporum foris sua ecclesia plus quam per totum annum abesse audeat wee define determine none godly bishoppes shal dare absent church space one whole yeere yee see temporal prince ecclesiastical cause saithe definimus shorte pope nicolas selfe saithe writinge vnto emperoure michael vbinam legistisdis vbinam imperatores antecessores vestros synodalibus contentionibus interfuisse nisi forte quibusdam vbi de fide tractatum est quae vniuersalis est quae omnium communis est quae non solum ad clericos verum etiam ad laicos ad omnes omnino pertinet christianos vvhere haue readde predecessours emperours euer present disputation councelles onlesse happily vvere certaine case vvhereas mater vvas moued touchinge faithe faithe vniuersal common al perteineth onely vnto priestes also vnto laiemen generally thorovvly al christian thus yee see hardinge pope owne iudgemente case disputation faithe belonge wel temporal prince pope apologie cap diuision truely benne neede handle plaine mater many woordes lengthe wee doo menne desire haue striue winne maisterie vse course denie al thinges thei neuer cleare yea whiche presently see beholde theire owne eies hardinge matter ye speake cleare beginninge worlde daievntruthe euident sundrie example shal appeare secular prince named ordinary power prince without gifte prophecie special reuelation laudably intermeddle religion iudge ruler spiritual cause reason thereof cleare religion order diuine worshippinge belonginge god onely whereupon man hath power called thereto god called iudgemente men shewe callinge wardly consecration imposition handes priestes bishop called dispensatours mystery godmat consecration key knowledge discretion power blindinge loosinge geueno vaine mao vvhat pertein key general councelles euery poore prieste hath good right councel pope secular prince shewe key geuen howe dareth aduenture breake vp rather open clasped booke godthe prince maie deale ecclesiastical cause dore churche gate kingedome heauen vvherefore ambrose saide vnto valentinian quando audiuisti imperator causa fidei laicos de episcopo iudicasse li epi vvhen haste thou hearde emperoure layman haue ben iudges bishop cause faithe yet nowe menne thinke whiche ambrose neuer hearde onely haue ben vsed continually firste fiue hundred yeres christes birthe also cleare matter behelde eies b sarisburie temporal prince yee saie hath key kingdome heauen ergo maie iudge ecclesiastical cause geeue definitiue sentence general councel sely poore argumente hardinge hereafter shal appeare ambrose saithe vnto emperoure valentinian maiestie euer heare cause faithe laiemenne iudges ouer bishoppes hardinge waie amrbose geeueth vnderstande onlesse cause faithe laieman maie iudge ouer bishop whiche thinge contrarieparte cap diui onely former doctrine also whole course practise churche rome howe touchinge meaning woordes behoueth v knowe firste cause wherefore ambrose shunned fledde emperours iudgemente nexte iudges desired tried first emperoure valentinian time yonge wel age also faithe yet baptized knewe principle christes religio ambros lib epist mandatur deni que trade basilicam allegatur imperatori licere omnia arian heretique beleued godhedde christe bent al studie power mainteine arians woulde haue thruste christianes woulde haue possessed heretiques theire church ende raised power filled millaine ful souldiers saide lawful doo listed briefely whole dealinge ful force violence sutche hath benne seene somme country many yeeres sithence consideration hereof ambros li epist ad valentinian lib epist ambrose woorthily refused iudge therefore saide vnto tolle legem si vi esse cerramen take awaie rigoure lavve ye wil haue mater tried disputation againe noli te grauare imperator vt putes te ea quae diuina sunt imperiale aliquod ius habere noli te extollere esto deo subiectus scriptum est quae dei deo quae caesaris caesari lorde trouble selfe thinke haue princely power ouer thinges perteine god vaunte selfe subiecte vnto god written geue vnto god belongeth vnto god geue vnto caesar belongeth vnto caesar ambrose saithe emperoure hathe povver ouer goddes cause maie wee likewise truely saie pope hathe povver ouer goddes cause chrysostome saithe siquidem est causa fidei fuge illum euitachrysost ad hebrae homil non solum si homo fuerit verum etiam si angelus de coelo descenderit mater faith wherein seeketh abuse thee flee shunne onely man also angel comme heauen thus appeareth ambrose refused emperours povver authoritie iudgemente case ecclesiastical onely wilful ignorance tyrannie knewe ambros lib epist dicentes de pide ecclesia coram populo debere trae tari iudgemente corrupted indifferente cause saithe venissem imperator ad consistorium clementiae tuae c lorde woulde haue made mine appearance consistorie haue vttered thinges presence either bishoppes people woulde haue suffered thei tolde mater faith ought disputed churche openly people againe saithe veniant sane si qui sunt ecclesiam audiant cum populo vt quisqua resideat iudex sed vt vnusquis que de suo affectu habeat examen eligat quem sequatur let hardely comme churche let hearken togeather ye people man sitte iudge euery man mai minde examine mater chuse maie folow sutche tyrannie councelles athanasius likewise complaineth eadem episto athanas apolo poteramus quo iure co tra no synodum vllam constituere potuerunt aut qua fronte talem conuentum synodum appellare audent cui come praesedit vbi spiculator apparebat vbi commentariensis siue carcerarius pro diaconis ecclesiae aduentantes introducebat come imperio vtebatur no militibus ducebamur lawe coulde keepe councel againste v face coulde calle sutche assemblie name councel lorde lieutenante presidente hangeman apparitoure iailer presented suiters steede deacon churche lieutenante al thinges authoritie commaundement vvee taken souldiers carried prison therefore saithe fiat ecclesiastica synodus longe palatio vbi nec imperator praesto estathanas ad solitariam vitam agentes literas nec come se ingerit nec iudex minatur vbi solus timor dei ad omnia sufficit c let made ecclesiastical synode far emperours palaice neither emperoure present lieutenante thrusteth selfe iudge threates maketh menne afraide feare god al pourposes sufficiente cause ambrose refused tried emperoure valentinian saie rasshe yong man man vnbaptized therefore christian tyranne arian heretique vtterly denied godhedde christe otherwise athanasius selfe wel contented committe whole cause vnto emperoure thus saithe postulamus causam istam pientissimo imperatori reseruari athanas apol cum multas apud quem licebit iura ecclesiae nostra proponere plane enim confidimus eius pietatem cognitis nostris rationibus nequaquam no coudemnaturam esse vvee require emperoures moste godly moste religious maiestie maie haue hearinge mater maie open bothe church right also owne wee haue good hope godlinesse vnderstandinge reason wil neuer condemne v likewise augustine saithe vnto donatian hereriques forte de religione fa non estaugusti contra epist parme iani lib vt dicat imperator vel quos miserit imperator ergo ad imperatorem vestri venere legati cur eum fecerunt causae suae iudicem lawful emperoure deputee geue sentence mater religion vvherefore went embassadours emperoure made iudge cause thus hardinge appeareth defraudinge emperours kinges theire emperial princely right faine take parte donatian heretiques v wee claime right ecclesiastical cause vnto christian prince daie maie wel appeare hathe benne iustely vsed bothe constantinus emperoure also catholique godly prince emperoure theodosius wrote thus vnto councel chalcedon quoniam scimusliberatus ca magnificentissimum florentium patritium esse fidelem probatum rectum fide volumus eum interesse audientiae synodi quoniam sermo de fide est wee knowe moste noble florentius faitheful wel page duplicate page duplicate approued right faithe therefore wee wil presente hearing debatinge case councel mutche disputation faithe pope nicolas himselfe saithe alleged fides vniuersalis est fides omnium communis est fides solum ad clericos verum etiam ad laicosdis vbinam ad omnes omnino pertinet christianoshespeaketh question faith moued cou celles faithe vniuersal faithe common al faithe perteineth onely vnto priestes also vnto laiemenne generally al christian touching pope vniuersalitie povver ouer al councelles bishoppes wee maie rightly saie athanasius saithe constantius arian emperoure obtendit speciem episcoporum iudicium sed interim facitathanas ad solitariam vitam agentes quod ipsi libet quid opus est hominibus titulo episcopis maketh shew iudgementes determination bishoppes meane doothe listeth selfe vvhat wee neare menne beare onely name bishoppes sutche commonly pope prelate euer learninge haue bisides diuinitie commonly least parte theire studie therefore assembled councel maie wel iudge authoritie learninge verily luitprandus luitprandus saithe imperator vti experientia didicimus intelligit negotia dei facit amat ea tuetur omnibus viribus ecclesiasticas re ciuiles sed iohannes papa facit contra haec omnia wee see experience emperoure vnderstandeth goddes causesiohan fauoureth perfourmeth al power mainteineth bothe ecclesiastical temporal mater pope iohn dooth al contrarie apologie cap diuision emperoure iustinian made lawe correcte behaueour cleregie cutte shorte insolente iewdenesse priestes albeit hee christian catholique prince yet putte hee downe theire papal throne twoo pope syluerius vigilius notwithstandinge peter successours christes vicar hardinge iustinians lawe concerninge good order kepte amonge pristes morally good bound force reason made lawe touchinge matter religion pope ioannes beinge approued leste iustianianvntruthe conferre vvith pope touching lavves touchinge askinge allovvance ther appeareth nothinge asked approbation thereofvntruthe conferre vvith pope touching lavves touchinge askinge allovvance ther appeareth nothinge maie appeare owne epistle wherein confesseth facte selfe lawes could binde supernatural cause belonginge faithe except heade vniuersal churche confirme syluerius vigilius deposed rather theodora emperesse iustinian emperoure vntruthe vvas tyrannie iuste iudgemente iustinian gaue balisarius greate thankes dooinge ye wronge impute wicked tyrannie vnto himvntruthe vvas tyrannie iuste iudgemente iustinian gaue balisarius greate thankes dooinge burthened onlesse man countable wiues iniquity howe euer extraordinary violence tyrannie iustly alleaged defence false assertion neither woulde selfe haue mentioned ye coulde haue founde better matter hungrie dogges eate durty puddinges accordinge prouerbe cleane yenough sutche vncleane writer fowle matter defended fowle factes b sarisburie iustinian yee saie might wel make somme moral lawe keepe priestes bishoppes good order wherein neuerthelesse pope paule condemneth vtterly thus writeth reasoneth substantially emperoure charles fifthe ezechiel paulus epistola ad carol ecce ego super pastores meos beholde saithe almighty god mee selfe wil ouersee sheepheardes ergo saithe pope paulus emperoure maie deale manner priestes bishoppes emperours made lavves touchinge holy trinitie touchinge faithe touchinge baptisme touchinge holy communion touchinge publique praiers touchinge scripture touchinge keepinge holy day touchinge church chaples touchinge consecration bishoppes touchinge non residence touchinge periurie c mutche hardinge saie nowe yee woulde seeme saie al moral lawes cod de sacrosanct ecclesijs omni innouaetione perteined onely good order pope yee saie allowed emperours ecclesiastical lawes otherwise emperours owne authoritie force truthe hereof particulares maie soone appeare one emperours lavves prouided bishop constantinople shal haue equal povver liberatus ca imperatoris patrocinio prerogatiue bishop rome lavve pope coulde neuer brooke yet notwithstandinge liberatus saithe holdeth stil emperours authoritie whether pope wil nocod de sacrosanct ecclesiis omni innouatione againe prouided lavve church illyricum doubteful case shal appeale constantinople rome emperoure constantine saithe bishop moue trouble doctrine otherwise hande shalbe pounished hande hande goddes ministertheodoret li cap ministri dei hoc est meae manis coercebitur iustinian emperoure lavve commaundeth prieste bishop pronouncinge publique praiers ministration sacramentes lifte vp voice speake alowde people maie saie amen sturred deuotion againe saithe noted glose vpon authentiques papa temporalibus immiscere se non debet authen titul pope maie intermeddle temporal cause lawes authen colla quomodo oporteat episcopos emperoure iustinian saithe wee commounde moste holy archebishoppes patriarkes rome constantinople alexandria antioche hierusalem emperoure iustinian commaundeth al monkesauthen colla titu de sanctiss episcopis iubemus beatissimos archiepiscopos senioris romae c either driuen studie scripture el forced bodily laboure carolus magnus made lavve nothinge shoulde readde openly churche sauinge onely canonical bookes holy scripture faitheful people shoulde receiue holy communion euery sonnedaie leaue rehearsal infinite like example nowe hardinge wil saie maie wee beleue al like lavves allowed pope deede gloser saithe authen tit ansigisus lib cap ad quid intromittit se imperator de spiritualibus vel ecclesiasticis cum sciat ad se non pertinere vvherefore doothe emperoure thus busie selfe spiritual ecclesiastical mater seeinge knoweth parte chargecarolus magnus lib cap authen colla titu quomodo oporteat profounde question longe solemne studie diuiseth answeare dic quod authoritate papae hoc facit scie thou doothe pope authoritie whole mater discharged al wel notwithstandinge somme likelihoode hereof yee would seeme geather euen iustinians owne woordesgloss verbu sancimus thus saithe vnto pope although far otherwise haue forced saie omnia quae ad ecclesiarum statum pertinent approued right faithe prince maie deale ecclesiastical cause therefore wee wil presente hearing debatinge case councel mutche disputation faithe pope nicolas selfe saithe alleged fides vniuersalis est fides omnium communis est fides solum ad clericos verum etiam ad laicosdis vbinam ad omnes omnino pertinet christianoshe speaketh question faith moued cou celles faithe vniuersal faithe common al faithe perteineth onely vnto priestes also vnto laiemenne selfe spiritual ecclesiastical mater seeinge knoweth parte chargecarolus magnus lib cap authen colla titu quomodo oporteat profounde question longe solemne studie diuiseth answeare dic quod authoritate papae hoc facit scie thou doothe pope authoritie whole mater discharged al wel notwithstandinge somme likelihoode hereof yee would seeme geather euen iustinians owne woordesgloss verbu sanc mu thus saithe vnto pope although far otherwise haue forced saie omnia quae ad ecclesiarum statum pertinent festinauimus ad notitiam deferre vestrae sanctitatis necessarium ducimus vt ad notitiam vestrae sanctitatis peruenirent nec enim patimur quicquam quod ad ecclesiarum statum pertinet vt non etiam vestrae innotescat sanctitati quae caput est omnium sanctarum ecclesiarum euer thinges perteine state churchescod de summa trinita fide catho inter claras wee haue spedily brought knowledge holinesse vvee thought necessarie holinesse haue knowledge thereof vve suffer thing concerneth state church brought knowledge holinesse whiche heade chiefe al holy church emperoure willeth pope take knowledge lavves chiefe foure principal patriarkes respecte see greatest bishop al worlde whiche cause also calleth heade cod de veteri iure enucleando chrysostom ad romanos homi chiefe al church iustinian saithe rom est caput orbis terrarum rome heade al vvorlde chrysostome saithe caput prophetarum elia elia heade prophetes saithe prudentius sanctum bethlem caput est orbis holy towne bethlem heade vvorlde nazianzene calleth basileprudentius enchiridio nonlatin alphabet oculum orbis terrarum eie al earthe iustinian calleth bishop constantinople vniuersal patriarkenazianzenus epist ad basili epiphanio vniuersali patriarchae like woordes passe oftentimes fauoure title honoure importe alwaies vniuersal gouernemente authen colla vt determinatus infinite authoritie pope sithence hath imagined touchinge confirmation allowance emperours lavves woordes iustinian yee finde nothinge onlesse yee wil saie notitia latine allovvance peruenire latine confirme emperours pourpose plainely appeareth woordes al meanes bringe see rome credite thus saith properamuscod de summa trinita fide cath inter claras honorem authoritatem crescere sedis vestrae omnes sacerdotes vniuersi orientalis tractus subijcere vnire sedi vestrae sanctitatis properauimus plus ita vestrae sedis crescer authoritas vve laboure auance honoure authoritie see vvee laboure subdewe ioine al priestes ye easte parte vnto see holinesse thus shal authoritie see encrease notwithstandingegregor haloander et azo noted learned owne side epistle bitweene emperoure pope oldest allovved bookes founde therefore suspected sauoure somme romaine forgerie hereby easy vnderstande vntil time emperoure iustinian welneare six hundred yeeres christe bishoppes easte churche subiecte bishop rome longe time pope yet knowen heade vniuersal churche god one owne allowed doctours saithe thusheruae de potest papae ca dicere quod princeps non potest facere leges vel eis vti quousque fuerint approbatae per papam falsum est saie prince cannot either make vse lawes pope haue allowed plainely false abbate panormitane extra de constituti ecclesiae sanctae mariae numero qualifie mater saithe thus lex principis praeiudicialis ecclesijs non extenditur ad ecclesias nisi expresse approbetur per papam sed si fauet ecclesijs intelligitur approbata nisi expresse reprobetur prince lawe preiudicial hurteful churche extended vnto churche onlesse expressely allowed pope profitable churche wee muste thinke allowed onlesse expressely disallowed hardinge one thinge yee maie note waie notwithstandinge cannot finde shifte coloure whereof ye lacke stoare pope hath authoritie allovve emperours lavves yet side wee hable readily finde emperoure hath authoritie allovve pope lavves emperoure iustinian selfe saithe praecedentibus no imperatoribus nobis ipsis recte dictum est oportere sacras regulas pro legibus valere wel saide bothe emperours predecessours authen colla quomodo oporteat also v holy canon muste holden lawes likewise saithe pope honorius imperator iustinianus decreuit vt canones patrum vim legum habere oporteatextra de iuramen calum inhaerentes emperoure iustinian hath decreed canon father shal haue force lawes plaine iustinian hereof writeth selfe woordes authen de eccles diuersis capitulis nisi intra praescriptum tempus ad ecclesias suas redeant deponantur alij illorum locum surrogentur id que authoritate vi huius praesentis legis onlesse bishoppes priestes repaire againe vnto church daie appointed let depriued liuinges let others placed roumes authoritie pope nonlatin alphabet august epist cod de veteri iure enuclean l force authoritie presente lavve saithe augustine reges terris seruiunt christo faciendo leges pro christo kinges worlde serue christe make lawes christe likewise saithe iustinian legum authoritas diuinas humanas re bene disponit authoritie emperours lawes bothe heauenly worldly thinges wel ordered againe nullum genus rerum est quod non sit penitus quaerendum authoritate imperatoris enim recipit deo communem gubernationemauthen titu nonlatin alphabet principalitatem super omnes homines kinde thinge maie thorowly examined authoritie emperoure receiueth god general gouernemente principalitie ouer al menne wel cleregie ea laitie saithe paulus bishop apamea vnto emperoure iustinian vpon deathe agapetus bishop romeconcil constantinop actione transtulit ipsum dominus vt plenitudinem directionis vestrae custodiret serenitati lorde hath taken pope awaie mighte reserue whole f lnesse order vnto maiestie touchinge depriuation twoo pope syluerius vigilius yee saie donne onely theodora empresse emperoure iustinian therein yee thinke yee haue taken v somme greate aduantage notwithstandinge owne pontifical written thus concil tomo vita vigilij belisarium interrogauit imperator quomodo se haberet cum romani vel quomodo loco syluerij statuisset vigilium tunc gratias ei egerunt imperator augusta emperoure demaunded captaine belisarius howe donne romaine howe deposed pope syluerius placed vigilius steede vpon answeare bothe emperoure empresse gaue thankes nowe yee knowe ff regulis iuris rule lavve ratihabitio retrotrahitur mandato comparatur allovvance thinge donne good commission dooinge somme frendes haue saide petrus de palud de potesta papae arti eutropij appendix de syluerio totus mundus non potest deponere aut iudicare papam whole worlde cannot depose iudge pope yet eutropius saithe si quando imperialis legatus mitteretur principe vt romanus pontifex proficisceretur constantinopolim ad imperatorem omni neglecta occasione ibat etiamsi pro certo sciret se iturum exilium emperours embassadoure comaunded ye bishop rome appeare constantinople emperoure wente streight waie without excuse yea although certainely knevve shoulde bannished leaue sundrie example emperours authoritie haue deposed onely bishoppes also popesennodius inter decreta bonifacij example honorius deposed pope bonifacius theodoricus deposed pope symmachus otho deposed pope iohn henrie deposed pope benedictus recorded wilful might tyrannie imperiali canonica censura emperial ye canonical censure yea one owne frendes saith thus populus commendabiliter zelo fidei commotus constantinum papam qui erat ecclesiae scandalum priuauit oculis deposuit people rome moued zele faithe iohannes de parisijs de potest regia papali tooke pope constantine pulled eies deposed sclaunderous vnto churche deserued greate praise itidem eodem ioco yee saie twoo pope syluerius vigilius good menne godly father therefore remouinge violence tyrannie hereto yee apply vnsauerie similitude homely puddinges notwithstandinge vertue holinesse either menne maie soone appeare storie pope syluerius chosen pope corruptionconcil tom syluerio euagrius lib cap simonie contrarie wil cleregie pope vigilius accused treason woulde haue betraied cittie rome gotthians pope vigilius youre pontifical saithe false witnesse againste predecessoure pope syluerius sought vndewe meanes remoue place selfe keapte prison sterued hunger gaue greate somme monie procure popedome selfe killed owne notarie killed yonge man beinge widowes sonne crime accused emperoure sutche vertue sutche holinesse worlde founde therefore godly emperoure remouinge vsed neither extraordinarie violence saie iniurious tyrannie owne felowes saie heruaeus de potest papae ca si papa sit incorrigibilis nec cardinales possint per se amouere scandalum de ecclesia tunc subsidium iuris deberent supplicando inuocare brachium saeculare et tunc imperator requisitus cardinalibus deberet procedere contra papam pope vncorrigible cardinalles hable selues remoue offense churche ought aide lawe waie intreatie calle vpon seculare power emperoure beinge thus desired ought proceede orderly againste pope franciscus zarabella saithe alleged papa potest accusari coram imperatorefranc zarabella de schemate concilio de quolibet crimine notorio et imperator requirere potest papa rationem fidei pope notorious crime maie accused emperoure emperoure maie require pope yelde reckeninge faithe apologie cap diuision lette v see sutche menne haue authoritie ouer bishoppes sutche menne receiue god comaundementes co cerninge religion sutche bringe home againe arke god make holy hymnes ouersee priestes builde temple make oration touchinge diuine seruice cleanse temple destroie hil aultars burne idolles groues teache priestes duetie write preceptes liue kille wicked prophetes displace high priestes cal togeather councelles bishoppes sitte togeather bishoppes instructinge thei ought doo condemne pounishe heretical bishopes made acquainted mater religion pope povver supernatural whiche subscribe geeue sentence doo al thinges man commission owne name bothe vprightly godly shal saie perteineth sutche menne haue doo religion shal wee saie christian magistrate whiche dealeth amongest others mater doothe either naughtily presumptuously wickedly moste aunciente christian emperours kinges euer occupie selues mater yet neuer cause noted either wickednesse presumption hee canue finde either catholique prince notable example hardinge kinges emperoursvntruthes three togeather open manifeste reade ansvveare haue firste auctoritie positiue lawe nationsvntruthes three togeather open manifeste reade ansvveare supernaturall grace god priestes haue haue power people hathvntruthes three togeather open manifeste reade ansvveare whome take temporall iurisdiction vvho haue euervntruth confessed hardinges ovvne doctours benne annoincted blessed bishoppes euer blesseth beinge greater blessed shall wee saie suche kinges emperours haue auctoritie rule churcheand pope sonne church sonne god whose sonnes supreme head ouer whome ought kneele vnto absolution controll spirituall iudges whome sinne humaine frailtie theyvntruthe prince ought doo constantinus neuer saide dist omnes ought couer clokesvntruthe prince ought doo constantinus neuer saide dist omnes greate constatine saide degrade whome must baptized anoincted crowned buried b sarisburie nowe hardinge yee huddle vp hastily poore argumentes heapes togeather one twoo onely minde touche reste woorth sturringe firste yee saie pope power god prince power onely man one supernatural natural sutche sorte pope nicolas adourneth magnifieth owne chaire thus saith ioily courrage illud verbum quo constructum est coelum terra quo deni que omnia ficta sunt elementa romanam fundauit ecclesiam woorde god whereby heauen earthe made whereby al elementes fashioned woorde founded churche rome churche rome church al one fundation pope reteiners saithe papatus est summa virtu creata iohan de parisijs de potesta regia papali popedome highest vertue power euer god made saie popedome aboue angel archangel throne domination al povvers vnder aboue heauens saithe euen saie haue partely saide rex per hominem fit sacerdos autem proxime nascitur ex deo ipso quantum deus praestat sacerdoti stanislaus orichouius chimaera fo tantum sacerdos praestat regi kinge made man prieste immediately begotten god mutche god excelleth prieste mutche prieste excelleth kinge notwithstandinge al supernatural povver wel simplest prieste petrus de palude de potestate curator arti pope yet doctours saithe papa eligitur secundum ius diuinum alij vero episcopi secundum ius humanum pope chosen lavve god bishoppes chosen lawe man thus yee thinke coloure deere painte oute pope face make faire glorious prince power yee saie temporal natural onely beneathe onely man therefore greatter man maie geeue youre louanian diuinitie hardinge highely yee esteeme dignitie maiestie princeprouerb rom god selfe saithe per reges regnant kinges rule man paule saithe non est potestas nisi deo povver princehoode god likewise christe selfe said vnto pilateiohan thou couldest haue power ouer onlesse geuen thee man aboue like pourpose emperoure iustinian saith maximum omnibus sunt dona deiauthen colla quomodo oporteat episcopos maximum superna collata clementia sacerdotium imperium c ex vno codemque principio vtraque procedentia humanam exornant vitam priestehoode princehoode al thinges greattest giftes god geuen vnto v mercie aboue two floweinge one onely man god bothe one original doo adourne bewtifie life man vpon whiche woordes noted glose idem principium habent parum differuntglosa verbum vtra que priestehoode princehoode haue one original smal difference saithe saie oddes bitweene twoo greate bitweene natural supernatural bitweene heauen earthe bitweene god man saithe plainely priestehoode princehoode haue one original little oddes smal difference therefore doctours saithe supponunt quod potestas regalis sit corporalis non spiritualisheruaeus de potesta papae ca quod habeat curam corporum non animarum quod falsum est imagine prince povver onely bodily ghostely prince hath charge mennes body none soules starke false whereas highly extolle pope vniuersal povver supernatural heauenly came onely god doctours saitheiohan de parisijs de potesta regia papali ea quae sunt iurisdictionis papae non sunt supra naturam conditionem negotij nec supra conditionem hominum quia non est supra conditionem hominis quod homines praesint hominibus imo naturale est quodammodo sutche thinges belonge pope iurisdiction aboue nature aboue condition thinge selfe aboue capacitie man aboue nature man man rule ouer menne naie rather sorte natural nowe hardinge prince povver god wel pope pope povver concerninge iurisdiction natural wel prince flowe bothe one original haue smal difference meante odious comparison highly ambitiously auance one disdeignefully scornefully abase touchinge prince povver wee certainely assured goddes holy vvoorde god pope infinite vniuersal povver throughout whole scripture genesis vnto apocalyps onlesse povver darkenesse yee finde nothinge yee saie kinges haue euermore benne anointed blessed bishoppes fowle vntruthe might easily haue knowen ye christian kinges olde time neuer anointed heruaeus de potestae papae ca owne doctoure saith nouo testamento non legimus quod sacerdotes debeant inungere reges nec etiam nunc obseruatur omnibus regibus christianis vt patet regibus hispaniae wee reade newe testamente priestes bishoppes ought anointe kinges neither order daie vsed emongest al kinges christened appeareth kinges spaine againe yee saie yee bringe special good argumente side emperoure kneeleth prieste absolution ergo emperoure heade churche howe maie man answeare sutche folie better like folie pope selfe owne decree bounde confesse sinnes kneeleth simple prieste absolution canonistes saie papa tenetur confiteri peccata sua vni sacerdoti et simplex sacerdos potest illum ligare absoluere pope bounde confesse sinnes somme one prieste simple prieste maie bothe binde absolue ergo owne conclusion pope heade churche sutche handesome proctoure pope hathe gotten promote cause sutche prety stuffe hardinge yee thinke ouerrenne conquere worlde apologie cap diuision wherefore lawful doo thus beinge ciuile magistrate hauinge chiefe rule common vveales offence haue oure prince daie made whiche maie haue leaue doo like beinge like degree especial gifte learning iudgemente holinesse haue menne nowe contrarie custome al aunciente catholique bishoppes vsed conferre prince peeres concerninge religion doo nowe thus reiecte caste christian prince knowinge cause meetinges hardinge vvee answeare wasvntruthe maie easily appeare hath benne saide neuer lawfull temporall prince iudge cause religion vntruthe maie easily appeare hath benne saide neither prince time euer vse b sarisburie absolute truthes hardinge answeare whereofparte cap diuis maie please indifferently weighe haue written alitle touchinge apologie cap diuision wel thus dooing wisely warily prouide selues kingedome whiche otherwise see like shortly comme naught whome god hathe placed greatest dignitie see perceiue mennes practises christes commaundementes despised lighte gospel darkened quenched howe selues also subtilly beguiled mocked vnwares deluded waie kingedome heauen stopped vp doubte woulde neuer quietly suffer selues neither disdeined sutche prowde sorte despitefully scorned abused owne lacke vnderstandinge owne blindenesse menne haue faste yoked daunger hardinge bishoppesothervvise vvere kingedome darkenesse vpholde kingdome wronge doingevvhen espied waie pull downe therefore well assured schismaticall superintendentship stande though al power world bente holde vp wicked state planted god therefore shalbe rooted outaffiance darkenesse god ruleth god setteth vp putteth downe state christes churche hath continewed successour peter hath gouerned whereas groundlesse buildinge heretikes simon magus downewarde daie hath failed luther rotten newe founde religion decaied pope sitteth peter chaire shall successours ende ye woulde men beleue emperours kinges deceiued pope bishoppes praie cause prince espie deceites suche well ye selues lacke knowledge yet haue wise menne aboute dueties sake alleagiance would soone aduertise bishoppes subtilly beguiled mocked b sarisburie maineteinance kingedome hardinge christe saide vnto certaine forefather hoc est tempus vestrum potestas tenebrarum time luke matthae power darkenesse blinde guide blinde blinde leade blinde wil bothe falle diche lion wilde bulle neuer cruel greate courrage yet yee maie closely couer theire eies yee maie easily leade whither yee liste without resistance euen dooth pope hoodevvinke blindefolde prince world whiche donne maketh holde stirope leade horse kneele downe kisse shooe attende vpon pleasure knewe either selues would doo chrysostome saithe chrysost opere imperfecto homil noted haeretici sacerdotes claudunt ianuas veritatis sciunt enim si manifestara esset veritas quod ipsorum ecclesia esset relinquenda ipsi de sacerdotali dignitate ad humilitatem venirent popularem heretical bishoppes shut vp gate truthe thei know truthe laide open churche shalbe foresaken theire pontifical dignitie shalbe brought downe basenesse people petrus ferrariensispetrus ferrarien citatur ab illyrico inter testis veritatis consideration hereof complaineth thus miseros imperatores saeculares principe qui haec alia sustinetis vos seruos ecclesiae facitis et mundum per eos infinitis modis vsurpari videtis nec de remedio cogitatis quia prudentiae sapientiae non intenditis ala miserable yee emperours prince vvorlde abide like thinges ye pope handes make selues slaues vnto churche yee see worlde innumerable way miserably abused yet yee neuer bethinke selues remedie bicause yee applie mindes vvisedome knovvledge hieronym esaiam lib cap hierome saithe vt sagittent obscuro recto corde isti tantam sibi assumunt authoritatem vt siue dextra doceant seu sinistra id est siue bona siue mala olint discipulos ratione discutere sed se praecessores sequi tunc hi qui prius decipiebant nequaquam vltra ad eos valebunt accedere postquam se senserint intellectos strike darke simple harte menne challenge vnto selues sutche authoritie whether teache right hande leafte saie whether teache good thinges badde wil haue disciple hearer reason examine saieinges onely folowe beinge leader whiche deceiued people comme vnto perceiue espied apologie cap diuision verely partes haue saide haue donne nothinge alteringe religion vpon either rashnesse arrogancie nothinge good leasure greate consideration neither euer entended doo excepte bothe manifest assured vvil god opened v holy scripture regarde owne saluation euen constreined v thereunto though wee haue departed churche whiche menne cal catholike meanes geate v enuie amongest wante skil iudge yet yenough v ought yenough euery wise good man one maketh accompte euerlastinge life haue gonne churche whiche power erre whiche christe erre tolde longe shoulde erre whiche selues euidently see eies haue gonne olde holy father apostle christe selfe primitiue catholique churche god wee comme neare possibly coulde churche apostle olde catholike bishoppes father whiche churche know hathe hitherto benne sounde perfite tertullian termeth pure virgine spotted idolatrie foule shameful faulte haue directed accordinge theire customes ordinaunces onely doctrine also sacramentes fourme common praier hardinge ye haue treated hereof accustomed manner saie al vntruthe lie yee comme many gaie woordes vvhereto guilty conscience wardely yee saie yea thereto lieinge tongue wardely doo yee saie naie generation loose apostate incestuous vowbreakers sacrilegious churcherobbers despisers holinesse breaker deade mennes willes ouerthrowers aunciente order discipline signes miracle example rare vertue holinesse b sarisburie reste speache wee wil passe ouer talke course touchinge curious demaunde signes miracle pope leo maie answeare formatthae whereas certaine forefather olde time saide kinge israel lette comme downe crosse wee wil beleeue pope leo saithe thus vnto themleo sermon de passione domini non erat vestrae coecitatis arbitrio stulti scribae impij sacerdotes ostendenda potentia saluatoris yee foolishe scribe wicked priestes power saueour shewed discretion blindenesse god sheweth miracle whome wil chrysost matthae homi chrysostome saithe fine temporis concedenda est potestas diabolo vt faciat signa vtilia vt iam ministros christi non per hoc cognoscanius quia vtilia faciunt signa sed quia omnino haec signa non faciunt ende time power shalbe geuen diuel woorke profitable signes miracle wee cannot knowe minister christe woorke profitable miracle vvoorke miracle al augustin de vnitate ecclesiae ca augustine saithe non dicat ideo verum est quia illa vel illa mirabilia fecit vel iste vel ille aut quia homines ad memorias mortuorum nostrorum orant exaudiuntur aut quia illa vel illa ibi contingunt c remoueantur ista vel figmenta mendacium hominummiracles vel portenta fallacium spirituum lette man saie therefore true man man hath wrought miracle menne make praiers toumbes deade obteine desire miracle wrought c awaie thinges maie either iugglinges mockery deceiteful menne el illusion lieinge spriteschrysostom matth hom againe chrysostome saithe per signa cognoscebatur qui essent veri christiani qui falsi nunc autem signorum operatio omnino leuata est magi autem inuenitur apud eos qui falsi sunt christiani olde time knowen miracle true christian whoe false nowe woorkinge miracle taken quite awaie rather founde emonge false christian augustin iohan tracta therefore augustine saithe contra istos mirabiliarios cautum fecit deus meus dicendo nouissimis diebus exurgent pseudoprophetae facientes signa portenta vt inducant errorem si fieri possit etiam electos againste moungers miracle god hath armed matthae saieinge later day shal rise vp false prophetes woorkinge signes woonders deceiue electe god possible neither gospel christe preached daie vtterly without miracle blinde see doumbe speake idolles fallen greate babylon comme grounde hardinge haue eies see smal miracleschrysostom corin homil august de verbis domi secund matthae serm eodem loco chrysostome saith conuersion vvorlde miracle augustine saithe modo caro coeca non aperit oculos miraculo domini et cor coecum aperit oculos sermone domini nowe adaies blinde fleashe openeth eies miracle lorde put blinde harte openeth eies vvoorde lorde againe modo aures corporis surde non aperiuntur sed quam multi habent clausas aures cordis quae tamen verbo dei penetrante patescant nowe adaies deafe eares body opened yet many haue eares harte shut vp whiche eares withstandinge opened entringe vvoorde god therefore wee maie rightly saie woordes augustine quisquis adhuc prodigia augustin de ciuitate dei lib cap vt credat inquirit magnum est ipse prodigium qui mundo credente non credit euer yet requireth miracle bringe faithe selfe greate miracle worlde beleeuinge remaineth stil vnbeliefe phariseis saide christe lette nowe comme downe crossehieronym matthae wil beleue hierome saithe vnto etiamsi de cruce descenderet similiter non crederetis yea although shoulde comme downe crosse yet woulde ye beleeue worlde beholde glorious countenance miracle cross speake youre idolles goe image lighte owne lampes holy vvater hable calme sea chase awaie mise make barren wemen conceiue yee doubte hereof conferre cope copus dialog pag one owne louanian companie woorthy prelate bishop verona holy father lipomanus ashamed remember ashamed euen nowe day publishe writinge sutche religion sutche miracle hierome saithehieronymus ad algasiam mendacium antichristi christi veritas deuorabit truthe christe shal deucure consume falsehedde antichriste apologie cap diuision wee know bothe christe selfe al good menne heretofore haue donne haue called home againe original firste fundation religion whiche hathe benne fowly neglected vtterly corrupted menne wee thought meete thence take paterne refourminge religion whence grounde religion firste taken bicause one reasone saithe moste auncient father tertullian hathe greate force againste al heresy looke vvhat soeuer vvas firste trevve vvhat soeuer later corrupte irenaeus oftentimes appealed oldest church whiche benne nearest christes time whiche harde beleue benne erroure daie common regard consideration returne wee paterne olde church maie heare time amongest v saieinge whiche openly pronounced time paste councel nice many bishoppes catholique father body speakinge againste nonlatin alphabet holde stil olde customes hardinge ye saie muche owne commendation lie proufes ye haue called religion home againe original firste fundation ye saie ye haue quite ouerthrowen true religion fundation apishe noueltie ye haue taken paterne thereof satan auctour diuision auncient ennemie christe true religion vvee admitte saieinge tertullian though altogeather ye alleage reason hath greate force heresiescontra praxeam vvhat euer firste true euer latter corrupt blessed sacramente christe saide firste chere folovved sommevvhat touchinge sacramente sacrifice vvhiche mater othervvhere ansvveared large ye woulde seeme faine folowed aduise irenaeus vve contente harte irenaeus appeale tradition whiche apostle whiche saieth kepte church priesteslib ca succeded vvith irenaeus leauinge church whose succession bishoppes longe woorke rehearse require haue recourse triall faithe tradition doctrine romaine churche whiche termethlib ca greatest oldest best knowen al founded set vp twoo moste glorious apostle peter paule vve appeale faithe churche taught abrode world succession bishoppes brought downe vnto v churcheirenaeus neuer knevve disorder deformity novve churche rome saithe irenaeus must churche christe repaire euer chiefe tradition true doctrine apostle leaft behinde themvntruth novve al vnfaithefully peruerted faithfully kepte vvherefore ye would councell irenaeus resorte rome decision controuersies bet wixte v would tried sense doctrinevntruthe manifeste apparente al vvorlde hath continewed succession bishop euen peter pius fourth pope would stande auctoritie see apostolike al strife ended accorde haue litle hope ye folowe godly counsel irenaeus blessed martyr whose body brother huguenotes frauce vilanously burned lion anno dom rested thirten hundred yeeres b sarisburie preeminenceirenae li ca valde longum est omnit n ecclesiarum cnumerare successiones irenaeus geueth churche rome standeth consente vnitie agreemente doctrine superioritie gouernmente ouer al worlde proufe whereof yee maie vnderstande irenaeus place likewise specially noteth churche smyrna planted polycarpus churche ephesus planted iohn generally sundrie greate church paterne faithe planted menne apostolical dignitie vnto whiche willeth v like maner repaire onely churche rome emperoure theodsius willeth subiectes conforme selues doctrinecod theodosij li titul onely romaine bishop also either nectarius bishop constantinople timotheus bishop alexandria pelagius bishop laodicea diodorus bishop tharsus amphilochius bishop iconium optimus bishop antioche helladius bishop caesarea otreius bishop melite gregorius bishop nice terennius bishop scythia marmarius bishop martianopolis vnto al euery notable greate church emperoure willeth al inferioure church repaire sutche example father councel chalcedon contented directe faithe thus brake general shoote omnes ita credimus concil chalicedonen actio leo papa ita credit cyrillus ita credit leo anatolius ita credunt al wee beleue thus pope leo beleueth thus cyrillus bishop alexandria beleueth thus leo anatolius bishop constantiaople beleue thus saithe tertulliantertul contra marcion li videamus quod lac paulo corinthij hauserint ad quam regulam galathae sint recocti quid legant philippenses thessalonicenses ephesij quid etiam romani de proximo sonent quibus euangelium petrus paulus sanguine quo que suo signatum reliquerunt lette v see milke corinthian suckte paule paterne galathians refourmed philippian reade thessaloniens ephesiens sounde romaine geeue neare v vnto peter paule haue leafte gospel sealed confirmed bloude like sorte writeth gregorie nazianzene churche caesareanazianzen epistol cuiuslibet ecclesiae tanquam corporis christi habenda est ratio maxime vero nostrae caesariensis quae ab initio fuit nunc est mater prope omnium ecclesiarum eam christiana respublica velut centrum suum circulus vndi que obseruat non solum propter orthodoxam doctrinam vbi que ab initio praedicatam sed etiam propter conspicuam concordiae gratiam quam diuinitus accepit muste make greate accoumpte al church euen body christe specially churche caesarea hath benne fro beginninge stil manner mother al church whole christian common vveale beholdeth churche euery side euen circle beholdeth center onely catholique doctrine thence hath benne published euerywhere also notable grace concorde hath receiued aboue thus aunciente godly father willed faitheful haue recourse vnto euery church smyrna ephesus constantinople alexandria laodicea tharsus iconium antioche caesarea melite nice scythia martianopolis corinthus galatia philippi thessalonica ephesus rome secrete vnremoueable vertue conteined irenae li ca qua semper conseruata est ea quae est ab apostolis traditio onely irenaeus saith tradition doctrine apostle continewed stil without corruption therefore tertullian saith percurre ecclesias apostolicas apud quas ipsae adhuc cathedrae apostolorum suis locis praesidentur apud quas ipsae authenticae literae eorum recitantur sonantes vocem repraesentantes faciem vniuscuius que proxima est tibi achaia habes corinthum si non longe e macedonia habes philippos habes thessalonicensestertul de praescriptionib contra haereticos si pore asiam tendere habes ephesum si autem italiae adiaces liabes romam vnde nobis quo que authoritas praesto est renne ouer beholde apostolique church apostle chaires yet stil continewed authentical vvritinges apostle openly pronounced soundinge voicethe paterne faith representinge face eche one nexte countrie achaia haue churche corinthe yee macedonia haue yee churche philippi churche thessalonica yee maie goe ouer asia haue yee churche ephesus yee border neare italie haue yee churche rome whence wee also dwellinge aphrica maie speede receiue authoritie againe touchinge name churche apostolique whereby yee woulde euermore seeme vnderstande churche rome saithe thus tot ac tantae ecclesiaetertul de praescription contra haereticos vna est illa ab apostolis prima ex qua omnes sic omnes prime omnes apostolicae dum vnam omnes probat vnitatem many great church al one firste churche planted apostle whence issued al reste al firste church al apostolique al folowe one vnitie thus anciente father taught people refourme selues example doctrine onely churche rome also al notable apostolique church neither directed onely authoritie anciente church also authoritie certaine particulare vvoorthy menne resolution case doubte somme sente augustine somme hierome somme bishoppes france euseb li ca somme bishoppes rome somme others hierome thus writeth vnto augustine tu vt episcopus toto orbe notissimus august epist debes hanc promulgare sententiam assensum tuum omnes coepiscopos trahere thou moste notable bishop al worlde oughteste publishe decree drawe al thy felowbishoppes vnto thy iudgement yet augustine bishop hippo aphrica rome certainely wheresoeuer flame truthe learning maie appeare place euer breake foorthe men wil selues willingely greedily flee vnto damasus bishop rome wrote vnto hierome doubteful case knowe counseldamas hierony hieronymus ad algasiam hierome selfe saith filius meus apodemius de oceani littore que vltimis galliarum finibus rom praeterita quaesiuit bethlehem sonne apodemius comminge shoare ocean sea furtheste coaste france leauinge rome sought bethlehem dwelle conferre mee likewise ambrose saith post alexandrinae ecclesiae episcopi quoque romanae ecclesiae definitionemambros lib epist per literas plaeri que meam adhuc expectant sententiam resolution churche alexandria also bishop churche rome many menne yet write letter vnto woulde also vnderstande iudgemente pope liberius selfe writeth thus vnto athanasius bishop alexandriaapud athanasi tomo primo si mecum sentis quoeso subscribas quo certiores reddamur num eiusdem nobiscum suffragij si eadem que statuas de vera fide vt ego securior efficiar tua que mandata indesinenter obeam yee iudgemente beseeche subscribe name vnto article maie doubte whether thinke thinke touchinge true faithe maie better confirmed mee self maie euermore doo commaundementes without delaie see heade churche offereth selfe al vi vniuersal povver commaundemente inferioure bishop bernarde beinge abbate writeth thus vnto pope eugenius aiunt non vos esse papambernar epi sed et vndi que ad confluunt qui habent negotia saie pope euery side haue suite comme renninge vnto mee thus menne woonte seeke counsel hierony apologia aduers ruffin onely rome also euer might founde therefore origen called magister ecclesiarum paterne faith enformer maister church basile canon fidei rule faithe eusebius samosatensis regula veritatis standarde truthe nazian ad simpliciam nazian ad heronem athanasius orbis oculus eie worlde doubteful case diligently sought vpon pope waie woorthy mater consider somme profound learned resolution wee haue receiued see rome augustine italian monke somme haue called apostle england demaunded pope gregorie gregor lib indicti ca waie greate counsel whether woman childe might baptized howe longe afterwarde might lawful comme churche bonifacius apostle germanie demaunded like question pope zacharie inter decreta zachariae whether lay davves storkes beauers otter hare vvilde horse mannes meate order taken man horse hauinge fallinge sickenesse time yeere maie lawful wholesome folkes eate bacon man liste eate ravve howe old ought beinter decreta alexandri par ca si maculam oculo eate maie donne prieste haue blacke eie maie hallovve oile maie weare palle time place sorte ouer vnder openly secretely maie lawful weare like doubteful profounde question pope hath geuen answearesinter decreta gregor ad bonifacium sutch graue solemne sorte creature vnder heauen bisides holinesse hable vnderstande sutche highe mystery felle sommetime odious quarrel bitweene thomist augusti de ciuitate li cap viues scotistes whether blessed virgine conceiued sinne one side saide yea cried nay learned menne bothe side party grewe schooles enflamed worlde troubled conference doctoure councel hable quiet mater make frendes scotistes alleged selues councel basile thomistes cried councel basile disorderly summoned therefore vnlawful middes heate pope sixtus tooke vpon iudge bitweene determine bottome cause conclusion al worlde lookte resolued satisfied question pope commaunded bothe thomistes scotistes departe home dispute mater let al alone leafte doubteful founde greate contention fel bitweene ratispone germanie abbie denise france io caluinus de reliquijs whether whole body denise either parte saide bare worlde hande whole rome wente pope sate sadly iudgemente examined theire allegation grewe conclusion ende gaue aduised definitiue sentence either parte wel thei france also others germanie vvhole body denise euer woulde saie nay shoulde heretique sutche substance certainetie oracle see rome somme frendes haue saidecardi cusanus de authoritat ecclesi con supra contra scripturam veritas per christum cathedrae alligata est non personis christe hath fastened truthe pope personne chaire meaninge thereby pope euer decree saie sittinge peter chaire neuer erre thus doctours iudgemente wee taught geeue credite rather pope chaire pope yet neuerthelesse paterne faith irenaeus yee haue alleged openly reproued pope victor cyprian like wise reproued pope steuin thei thoughteuseb li ca cyprian ad pompeium notwithstandinge chaire erroure brasmus speaking answeare pope innocentius vnto councel carthage saith thus hac epistola dictionem ingenium eruditionem talus praesule dignam cogimur desiderareinter episto augu ep erasm ambros de sacram li ca epistle wee misse bothe eloquence witte learninge meete sutche prelate ambrose saithe omnibus cupio sequi ecclesiam romanam sed tamen no homines sensum habemus ideo quod alibi rectius seruatur no recte custodimus desire al thinges folowe churche rome howe wee selues wee menne haue vnderstandinge iudgemente therefore euer better keapte place wee doo wel keepe touchinge state rome nowe arnulphus saide openly councel remesarnulphus concil remensi cum hoc tempore romae nullus sit vt fama est qui sacras literas didicerit qua fronte aliquis illorum docere audebit quod non didicerit mutche nowe day reported none rome hath learned scripture face dareth teache v thinge selfe neuer learned sufficiente saie pope sitteth peter chaire antichriste maie sitte place christe maie iudas sitte place peter hierome saithe hierony osee lib cap bethel quae prius vocabatur domus dei postquam vituli ea positi sunt appellata est bethauen id est domus inutilis domus idoli bethel called house god yt hieroboams golde calues sette vp called bethauen saie house vnprofitable house idole therefore wee thinke better examine trie groundes religion vvoorde god one vniforme enduereth euer touche rome vncertaine mutable often hathe deceiued vscyprian ad pompeium cyprian saithe si ad diuinae traditionis caput originem reuertamur cessat error humanus wee returne heade original heauenly tradition vvoord god al humaine errour geueth place touching reste needelesse talke brother france pleasante manner yee cal huguenotes burnte body irenaeus knewe blessed martyr god body sommetime temple holy ghoste without reproche villanie either donne meante holy father burnte thinge whiche also maie wel doubted burnte onely idole vnreuerently sette vp againste glorie god chrysosto genesim homil chrysostome saithe ioseph moriens air os mea efferetis hinc vobiscum ne aegyptij memores beneficiorum eius corpus iusti haberent occasionem impietatis ioseph lieinge death bedde saide vnto child neuewes yee shal carrie bone foorthe egypte leste egyptian remembringe good thinges donne vse good mannes body occasion vvickednesse idolatrie saithe augustine augusti de mirabilib sacrae scripturae lib cap vltimo nemo conscius erat sepulchri mosis ne populus si cognouisset vbi esset adoraret noman made priuie moses graue leste people knowen body benne shoulde adoure obiection sacrifice otherwhere answeared large augustine saithe former replie artic augusti contra iudaeos cap augu psal nunc manibus non offerimus carnem sed corde ore offerimus laudem nowe wee offer vp fleashe handes harte mouth wee offer praise againe saithe intus habeo sacrificium quo flectam deum meum within mee selfe haue sacrifice maie pacifie god apologie cap diuision eldras went repaire ruines temple god sente ephesus although moste beautiful gorgeous temple diana whe purposed restore sacrifice ceremony god sente rome although peraduenture heard solemne sacrifice called hecatombae called solitaurilia lectisternia supplicationes numa pompilius ceremonial bookes manual portueses thought yenough let eies folowe paterne olde temple whiche salomon beginninge builded according god appointed also olde customes ceremony whiche god selfe written special woordes moses prophete aggaeus temple repaired againe esdras people mighte thinke iuste cause reioice theire owne behalfe greate benefite receiued almighty god yet made al burst teares bicause whiche yet aliue seene former buildinge temple babylonian destroied called minde howe far yet beautie excellencie whiche olde time past deede would thei haue thought temple woorthily repaired answeared anciente paterne maiestie firste temple paule bicause woulde amende abuse lordes supper whiche corinthian euen begonne corrupt set christes institution folowe saieinge haue deliuered vnto thinge firste receiued lorde christe confuted errour phariseis ye muste saithe retourne firste beginninge beginninge vvas thus found great fault priestes vncleanenesse life couetousnesse would cleanse temple al euil abuse house saith first beginning vvas house praier wherein al people might deuoutely sincerely praie togeather parte vse also daie builded ende denne theues likewise al good commendable prince mentioned scripture praised specially woordes walked way theire father dauid bicause retourned firste original fundation restoared religion euen perfection wherein dauid leaft therfore likewise saw al thinges quite trodde vnder foote men nothing remained temple god pitieful spoiles decay wee reckened wisest safeste waie sette eies church whiche knewe suertie neuer erred yet neuer neither priuate masse praiers strange barbarous language corruption sacramentes toy mutche desire haue temple lorde restored anew would seeke none fundation knewe longe agone laide apostle wite saueour iesus christ mutche wee hearde god selfe speakinge vnto v vvoorde sawe also notable example olde primitiue churche againe vncertaine mater waite general councel successe thereof woulde mutche vncertaine specially mutche moste ascertained goddes vvil therefore counted wickednesse careful ouercumbred iudgementes mortal menne wee coulde longer stande takinge aduise fleashe bloude rather thought good doo thinge bothe might rightly donne hath many time benne donne aswel good men also many catholique bishoppes remedie church prouincial synode thus wee knowe olde father vsed put mater experience thei came publique vniuersal councel remaine yet daie canon written councelles free citties carthage vnder cyprian ancyra neocesarea gangra whiche paphlagonia somme thinke name general councel nice euer hearde fashion olde time spedily meete cutte shorte heretiques pelagians donatistes home priuate disputation without general councel thus also emperour constantius euidently earnestly tooke parte auxentius bishop arians faction ambrose bishop christian appealed vnto general councel sawe good coulde donne reason emperours might greate laboure onely owne cleregie people saie prouincial synode thus decreed councel nice bishoppes shoulde assemble twise euery yeere councel carthage decreed bishoppes shoulde meete togeather eche prouinces leaste yeere whiche donne saithe councel chalcedon pourpose errours abuse happened springe vp might immediately firste entrie destroied euen firste began likewise secundus palladius reiected councel aquileia bicause general common councel ambrose bishop millaine made answeare man ought take newe straunge mater bishoppes vveast parte world calle togeather synodes make priuate assembly prouinces thing vsed weaste bishoppes seldome bishoppes graecia vsed oftentimes commonly donne charles greate beinge emperoure helde prouincial coucel germanie puttinge awaie image contrarie seconde councel nice neither pardy euen amongest v strange new trade wee haue ere nowe englande prouincial synodes haue gouerned church home made lavves shoulde one saie truthe euen greatest councelles moste assemblie people euer whereof menne vse make sutche exceedinge rekeninge compare al church whiche thoughout worlde acknowledge professe name christe el praie seeme bee certaine priuate councelles bishoppes prouincial synodes admitte peraduenture italie fraunce spaine englande germanie denmarke scotlande meete togeather wante asia graecia armenia persia medium mesopotamia egypte ethiopia india mauritania al whiche place bee bothe many christian menne also bishoppes howe man beinge right minde thinke sutche councel general councel many partes worlde doo lacke howe truely saie haue consente whole worlde manner councel weene laste tridente howe might bee termed general councel whereas al christian kingedomes nation came vnto onely fourtie bishoppes somme conninge might thought meete bee sente home againe learne theire grammare wel learned neuer studied diuinitie hardinge waitinge general councel vncertaine settinge foorthe apologie farre wel entred almost ended vvhat euer successe thereof folow ye ought haue refused itvntruthe many respectes vvas vnlavvful beinge al respectes lawful assurance god wil none common biewoorde hath alwaies benne heretikes ye ought haue shewed good euidence beinge sure god wil ye attempted greate dangerous change religion neither becommeth cal determination general councel iudgementes mortal men mutche concerneth declaration necessarie pointes faithe promptinge teachinge holy ghoste prouincial synode none synodes cannot keapte without bishop ye claime name synode packinge hudlinge togeather ye muste proue selues bishop whiche ye able doo vvhat euer ye saievntruthe many example soone reproued neuer good men catholike bishop kepte prouincial synodes contrarie approued lawful general councelsvntruthe synode moste agreeable olde councelles synode moste contrary neither ye pretend ye folowed olde father puttinge thinges experience comminge vniuersall councel councel prouincial holden germanie charles greate againste seconde nicene councel generala greate vntruthe maie soone appeare false forged matter booke againste image whiche one eli phili man moones sonne caluine illyricus heretikes haue fathered vpon moste godly catholike emperoure councel whiche meane godly catholike councel holden franck forde pope adrian charles greatevntruthe vvoordes plaine pseudosynodus pro adoradis imaginibus abdicata est ado againste wicked councel heretikes named imagebreakers whiche helde litle constantinople whiche heretikes called seuenth general catholikes pseudosynodus saie false forged councel bothe councels thus writeth abbas vrspergensis mutche commended melanchthonin praefat ad ducem bauariae councel whiche fewe yeeres assembled constantinople time irene constantine sonne called seuenth generall councel holden frankforde repealed put awaie consente al voide superfluous thence foorthe shoulde named neither seuenth ought el beleue witnes catholike writer beleue anselmus rid erneste professour owne newest gospellin catalogo annorum principum c bernae impresso anno additionib ad carion pantaleo vvho writeth adrian bishop rome kinge charles councel holden frankforde execrated accursed heretical councel empiere constantinople greekes whiche helde thabolishinge sainctes image woordes beleue peucerus philip melancthons sonne lawe writinge councel nice kepte common consente greeke emperoure charles seconde councel nice whiche altogeather image holden consente charles howe helde councel germanie puttinge awaie image againste councel nice beleue carion specially pantaleo zurich man owne moste euangelical religion vpon warrante thauthoritie regino writeth councel frank forde abrogated disanulled greekes councel againste woorship image briefely howe falsely sundrie secte haue herein belied woorthy prince charles greate maie easely appeare paulus aemylius writeth sente twelue bishop fraunce councel holden laterane rome whiche imagebreakers false named forged councel abrogated vvhere general councels ye make priuate prouincial synodes ye doo bisides learninge reason custome churche councel accompted general bicause bishop al country vnder heauen assembledby rule councel tridente vvas general bicause many assembled al lawfully called el time heresy raigne churche neuer haue necessarie remedie general councel alwaies heretikes woulde refuse come ye haue come late councel trente persia medium egypte mauritania wene ye finde fewe bishop daie many country whiche ye recken manner altogeather ignorant schismatikes yet patriarkes assyria syria orientalis armenia late yeres rome haue theire prouinces bothe subscribed councel trentevntruthe vvithoutshame measure receiued whole decree theire people reporte fourty bishop onely present councel trent slender lerning true doctrine contrary councel isvntruthe manifeste reade recordes subscription councel saie plaine termes starke false wel knowen late councel trent pope time wel neare two hundred bishop b sarisburie hope wee might conceiue late chapter tridente wee sufficiently warned former holden vnder pope paulus pope iulius wherein notwithstandinge many yeeres studie greate conference many learned excellente mutche doo yet end yee neuer hable neither suppresse open stewes auoide priestes concubine cause bishoppes residente vpon theire charge doo theire deuties resolue v whether pope aboue councel omnipotentis dei benignitaie apostolorum petri pauli authoritate freti ambros catharinus councel aboue pope summone firste entrie assemblie pope paule forgotten christe leafte quite companie supplied wante authoritie peter paule reuerende father maketh marie blessed virgine equal vvith christe calleth faithful felovve fidelissimam christi sociam companie telleth v pope light comme vvorlde papa lux venit mundum shorte whole issue conclusion al dooinges ful agreemente al fatherscornel episcop bitontinus sessione salua semper omnibus sedis apostolicae authoritate hangeth vpon pope onely pleasure doctrine pope maie controlled euer doo neither cleregie al whole worlde euer pope shal wil staie passe doctoures telle v onely wil muste stande lavve like cause bothe emperoure charles also francise frenche king qu nemo sleidan anno illyric protesta aduers conc trident pag august de vnitate eccles ca eodem lib ca biside sundrie christian prince made open protestatio said tridentine conuenticle remoued bononia said lawful general councel onely assemblie fewe certaine personnes serue one man affection seeke gaine sutche opinion owne prince haue assembly becommeth v yee saie calle determination general councelles iudgementes mortal menne yet became augustine calle concilia contendentium episcoporu councelles quarrelling bishoppes againe humanarum contentionum animosa perniciosa certamina bolde hurteful contention worldly quarrelles neede wee many woordes owne panormitane saith extra de consangui affin non debet leges summorum pontificum concilioru appellantur statuta humana fic stricte non possunt dici ius diuinum lawes determination pope councelles called determination lavves menne streite manner speache cannot called lavves god yee saie wee bishoppes therefore haue authoritie holde synode cor euen father olde time saide paule apostle basile hilarie bishoppes paule plaine shilar contra arianos auxentium hilarie saithe selfe auxentius de persona mea calumniatus est damnatum saturnino audiri vt episcopum non oportere heretique auxetius laith quarrel personne mutche saturninus heretique hath condemned saithe maie hearde bishop likewise arian heretiques vsed saie basile like learned catholique father time bishoppes basile thereof writeth thus coucelles general repealed prouincial calle councel catholique bishoppes councel vvicked menne neither wil vouchesaue name bishoppes leste seeme allowe decree haue made againste challenge bishoppes saie captaines wicked heresie like sorte writeth vnto patrophilus basil epist nonlatin alphabet basil epist nonlatin alphabet heretique eustathius taketh greate heede leste shoulde happily forced calle v bishoppes marc thus hardinge denieing v bishoppes cor yee doo none otherwise predecessours haue donne bishoppes prelate side wil saie nothinge owne frendes haue thought haue saide v shalbe sufficient wee onely voice crier wildernesse paule auouthe apostleship saide openly thus gratia dei sum id quod sum grace god yee saie prouincial councel maie repeale councel general authoritie councelles stoode onely number truthe howe simple truthe god shal ouerweigh falsehedde neuer general euen thus saide auxentius arian heretique againste hilarie woordes ego quidem pijssimi imperatores existimo non oportere sexcentorum episcoporum vnitatem post rantos labores ex contentione paucorum hominum refricari moste graceous lordes iudgemente meete greate paine taken contention striuinge fewe hazarde consente vnitie six hundred bishoppes thus heretique auxentius alleged greate multitude companion againste hilarie catholiques whiche saide fewe notwithstandinge harde mater shewe euidente example general councelles haue benne ouerruled particulares general councel nice determined saie al appeales al partes worlde shoulde lie rome yet particulare prouincial councel aphrica saithe si prouocandum putauerint non prouocent nisi ad aphricana conciliaepist auxentij apud hilarium concil aphrican ca sozom li ca concil carthaginense ca socra li ca ad transmarina autem qui putauerit appellandum nullo intra aphricam communionem recipiatur shal thinke good appeale let appeale onely coucelles shal holden within aphrica euer shal appeale beyonde sea saie rome let noman within aphrica receiue communion general councel nice durste dissolue priestes marriage particulare councel carthage dissolued vtterly order priuate auriculare confession whiche fantasie receiued generally throughout whole churche god notwithstandinge quite abolished churche constantinople onely particulare aduise nectarius blacke freers theire particulare chapter augu de ciuita li cap viues haue controlled cut general determination councel basile touchinge conceiuing lady original sinne albertus pigghius like particulare authoritie alber pigghius hierarchi telleth wel councel basile also councel constance beinge bothe general saide councel aboue pope decreed plainely againste nature againste manifeste scripture againste al antiquitie againste catholique faithe christe certainely truthe god bounde neither personne place euer either fewe many euermore catholique euen bicause truthe god councel constantinople written thus definierunt pariter vt si quid prouincia qualiber emergerethistoria triparti li ca prouinciae concilio finireturthe cou cel frankforde father agreed al togeather mater happen growe prouince councel prouince shoulde ended likewise saith isidorus manifestum est quod illa quae sunt per vnamquan que prouinciam ipsius prouinciae synodus dispenset sicut niceno constat decretum esse concilioisidorus praefatione concilia cleare mater happeninge euery prouince prouincial synode maie ordered concluded councel nice likewise ambrose saithe sciebant esse consuerudinemin concilio aquileien vt oriente orientalium esset concilium intra occidentem occidentalium knewe custome councel east bishoppes shoulde holden easte councel vveaste bishoppes aparte weaste augusti de baptismo contra donatist lib cap augustine saithe literas episcoporum per sermonem forte sapientiorem cuiuslibet ea peritioris licet reprehendi si quid eis forte veritate deuiatum est bishoppes letter swarue thinge truthe maie controlled discretion man hath skil mater like sorte abbate panormitane doctoure saith hath benne alleged extra de electi electi potest significasti abb concernentibus fidem etiam dictum vnius priuati esset praeferendum dicto papae fi ille moueretur mehoribus rationibus noui veteris testamenti mater concerning faithe saieinge one priuate man taken saieinge pope moued better reason olde nevve testamente pope howe wee haue prouincial councel remoued shaken authoritie one anciente general councel harding al anciente councelles haue benne touchinge case lie bitweene v controuersie yee yet hable allege one wee haue vpon good cause remoued vanity vnseemely folie haue restoared againe mutch v late decree canon anciente councelles hincmarus bishop remes hinemarus remensis cap saith thus cum duarum aut trium prouinciarum praesules vnum conueniunt si antiquorum canonum iustitutione muniti aliquid praedicationis aut dogmatis instituunt quod tamen ab antiquorum patrum dogmaribus non discrepet catholicum est quod faciunt fortasse dici potest vniuersale bishoppes twoo three prouinces meete togeather warrante olde councelles appointe mater preachinge doctrine disagree doctrine ancient father catholique yt thei doo perhaps maie called vniuersal credite emperoure charles booke reportinge decree councel frankfoorde touchinge adoration image leaue wholy indifferente discretion reader printed geneua surmise parise setter proueth forged many good likely reason anciente copie yet stil seene rome laterane eue pope owne librarie augustinus steuchus augu steuchus de donatione constan li ca eckius de imaginibus maister librarie reporteth emperour ludouicus sonne vnto charles wrote booke yet extante remaininge france like purpose freere eckius also beareth witnesse vnto booke emperoure charles although vntruely guilefully manner saith charles wrote four bookes defence image whereas deede bookes directely written againste image although yee thinke eli phili knowe maie easily charged corruption forgerie yet pope selfe shoulde corrupte forge owne booke owne librarie selfe harde shewe good reason councel frankforde yee saie godly catholique made decree againste imagebreakers behalfe image yet notwithstandinge auentinus saith councel general frankfordiensi concilio scita graecorum de adorandis imaginibus rescissa suntauen n fol councel frankford grecian decree adoration imagesregino quite abolished regino saithe pseudosynodus graecorum quam pro adorandis imaginibus fecerunt reiecta est false councel greekes whiche made adoration image repealed councel frankfordeado likewise ado saithe pseudosynodus quam graeci septimam vocant pro adorandis imaginibus abdicata est penitus false councel whiche greekes calle seuenthe wherein decree made adoration image vtterly put awaie hincmarus archebishop remes speakinge councel frankfordehincmar ca saith thus pseudolynodus graecorum destructa est penitus abdicata de cuius destructione non modicum volumen quod palatio adolescentulus legi ab eodem imperatore romam est per quosdam episcopos missum false councel greekes repealed vtterly ouerthro wen councel frankforde whereof yong man readde prety bigge booke pope palaice rome whiche booke sente thither certaine bishoppes saide emperoure charles certaine woordes saide levvde false councel greekes emongest others citantur libro carolus magni qui timet deum adorat imago vt filium dei qui adorat imaginem dicit hoc est christus non peccat peccat qui adorat imaginem qui non adorat imaginem est haereticus imago adoranda est eodom cultu quo sanctum trinitas feareth god adoureth image would adoure sonne god adoureth image saith christe offendeth offendeth adoureth image adoureth image heretique wee muste adoure image reuerence wherewith wee adoure holy trinitie nowe whether like woorthy saieinges sentence reproued maie please hardinge consider councel yee saie called general whereun al christian nation doo resorte deede whereunto al christian nation lawfully summoned answeare true denied late councel tridente maie wise called general lawful sommones sente pope pius either preter gian ethiopia bishoppes christian india europa onely whole excepted kingedome countrie worlde yee saie persia medium egypte mauritania country adioininge fewe christian daie founde yet authours nouus orbisnouus orbis discribing state world saie thus al country vvhither euer yee comme somme christian againe india many kinges prince professe christe againe armenia cilicia manner vvhole people christened onely subiecte cham tartarieeol priestes maried vvho vnmaried maie priest yee saie patriarkes assyria armenia neuer sawe neither one countrie rome yee knowe subscribed al article councel tridente hardinge yee grate greate credite open mockerie harde mater pope owne garde make sutche
