patriarkes yenough one hierusalem constantinople alexandria antioche sidon tyrus marueile somme patriarke one sodome gomorre poore holy hongry father contented al time yelde theire submission sette theire handes euer shalbe requiredthe number bishoppes tridete name country scareely ouer hearde confesse pope maister al al sutche daine shewes visa de pleaseth smoothe worlde yee doubte hereof yee maie easily finde one augustinus de rom late councel baule concil basilien petrus paluden patriar hierosolymitanus ceremontar li section hare name archebishop nazareth lurie likewise one petrus paludensis poore freere obsernante long sithence bare name patriarke hierusalem neede moe example ceremoniarie rome telleth thus consucueruni autiqui ponere patriarchas quatuor ecclesiarum principalium inter episcopos cardinales mixtim nostro tempore ponuntur immediate post cardinales sunt enim quodammodo titulares woonte olde time place patriarkes foure principal church togeather cardinal bishoppes one nowe adaies placed nexte beneathe al cardinalles manner haue nowe nothinge el name patriarkes moste certaine christian patriarkes bishoppes country wil neither communicate pope either sacramentes praiers wise yeeld authoritie geue manner honoure reuerence personne nomore machomete antichrist haue sufficiently shewed touchinge number bishoppes presente former assemblie tridente referre mee selfe recordes yee finde fourtie bishoppes cotent lose credite yet number blinde sir roberte scotland haue said pate england seely poore bishoppes god knoweth endewed onely bare name without bishoprikes flacius illyricus protestatione aduersus conci trident later assemblie twoo holy father staine presently aduouterie meane whiche misfortune number mutche abated greate woorthies worlde cornelius bitontinus one companie calleth starres church mighty armie goddes angelles haue power determine mater thei neuer vnderstoode authoritie onely knowledge alphonsus de castro alphansus aduersus haereses lib ca erasmus epistolam hieronymi ad eustochium haue shewed saithe thus certaine somme pope voide learninge vnderstande grammare rule erasmus speakinge sundrie greate learned side saithe thus sibi videntur semidei miro supercilio prae se despicientes grammaticos qui si grammaticae litassent non ad hunc modum se pueris deridendos propinarent thinke selues halfe goddes high lookes thei despise poore grammariens wel learned grammare thei woulde offer sutche occasion child babe scorne theire folie concerninge whole mater doctours sorbona parise haue concluded thus vt concilium legitime congregetur sufficit quod solennitas forma luris solenniter sit seruataarticul quia si quis trahere velit hoc disputationem vtrum praelati qui ibi sedent habeant rectam intentionem vtrum sint docti vtrum habeant scientiam sacrarum literarum animum obediendi sanae doctrinae esset processus infinitum councel lawfully assembled sufficient solemnitie fourme lawe solemnely obserued man would caste doubtes whether bishoppes sitte councel haue good meaninge whether learned whether skilful scripture whether haue minde obeie sounde doctrine wee neuer make ende hardinge yee woulde haue v geeue care euer thei saie euen secretary holy ghoste augustin contrae cresconi lib cap augustine saithe ecclesiae inter no agitur causa non mea ecclesia nullo homine spem ponere suo didicit redemptore church cause wee talke mine churche hath learned redeemer put truste man apologie cap diuision euer bee truthe gospel iesus christe dependeth vpon councelles paule saithe vpon iudgementes mortal creature whiche ought careful goddes churche wil wife slacke duetie harden harte againste god christe goeinge stil peruerte right way lorde god wil stirre vp stone make child babe cunninge maie euer somme confute mennes lie b sarisburie hereto hardinge answeareth nothinge el thus councel schoole truthe bishoppes cannot foreslowe dueties churche rome cannot erre whiche tale wee haue often without wearinesse hearde already petrus de paludepetrus de palude de potesta papae arti emongest doctours saithe non est credendum ecclesiam romanam errasse fide ipsa enim potest e contrario cum christo dicere ego testimonium perhibeo de meipsa testimonium meum verum est man maie beleue churche rome maie erre faithe contrarywise churche maie saie christe beare vvitnesse mee selfe vvitnesse iuste true therefore longe churche rome speake selfe doubte al wel apologie cap diuision god able onely without councelles also wil councelles nil councelles maintaine anaunce owne kingedome ful many thoughtes man harr saith salomon counsel lorde abideth stedfast vvisedome knovvledge counsel lordehilarius psal mum thinges endure saithe hilarius set vp vvith mannes vvorkemanship manner meanes muste churche god buiided preserued churche grounded vpon fundation apostle prophetes holden faste togeather one corner stone vvhiche christe iesus hardinge vvhere ye saie manner meanes churche god must builded preserued shewe v meanes must saie ye cunninge men correct saie magnificat christes owne ordinaunce gouernemente churche reckeninge appeareth god euer orderned pope car alles builde churche hath ordeined apostle prophetes euangelistes shepeherdes teacher mentioned aedificationem corporis christi buildinge vp bodie christe churche ye shall pardon v beleue paule vve see marke ye shoote atthe buildinge goddes churche lawfull successours apostle prophetes euangelistes lawfull shepeherdes doctours put buildinge christes body churche selues maie take woorke hande gouerne set harte reaste shal b sarisburie deede christe hath ordeined apostle prophetes euangelistes pastours teacher gouernmente churche notwithstandinge alwaies allowed sitte councelles alwaies knowen rochetes miter god prouided pastours feeder bisides prelate whole churche might sterue hunger paules woordes true idle construction vntrue wee finde faulte goddes ordinance wee reioice goddes mercie hath pleased visite people discouer multitude vanity wherewith haue longe vncourteously beguiled worlde therefore wee correcte magnificat hardinge saie rather wee humbly singe te deum laudamus reioice god saueoure right onely waie buildinge goddes house laie fundation thereof vpon euerlastinge vvoorde vvil god corin esai paule saithe fundation noman laie saide already whiche christe iesus prophete esaie saithe lavve god testimonie speake accordinge woorde shal haue morninge lighte therefore hilarie saithe alleged apologie aliter extruenda hilarius psalmum aliter custodienda ecclesia est fundamentum eius super prophetas apostolos collocandum est ecclesia ita deo id est doctrinis dei aedificata non concidet otherwise muste churche builte otherwise muste keapte fundation must saide vpon apostle prophetes churche beinge thus builte god saie doctrine god shal neuer false apologie cap diuision marueilous notable good pourpose day bee hieronym naum cap hieromes woordes vvhom euer saithe deuil hathe deceiued entised fal asleepe vvere vvith svveere deadely enchauntementes maremaides sirenes persones doothe goddes vvoorde avvake vp saieing vnto themephes arise thou sleapest lifte vp thee selfe christe shal geeue thee light therefore comminge christe goddes vvoorde ecclesiastical doctrine ful destruction niniue bevvtiful harlot shal people vvhiche heretofore hadde benne cast trauce vnder maisters raised vp shal make haste goe mountaines scripture shal thei find hilles imeanemoses losua sonne nun hilles also vvhiche prophetes hilles nevve testament vvhiche apostle euangelistes vvhen people shal flee succoure sutche hilles shal exercised readinge kinde moutaines though thei finde one teache haruest shal greate labourer fevv yet shal good desire people vvel accepted thei haue gotten sutche hilles negligence theire maisters shal bee openly reproued hieromes woordes plaine needeth interpretour agree iuste thinges see eies haue already comme passe wee maie verily thinke meante foretel spirite prophesie painte oure face vniuersal state oure time fal moste gorgeous harlot babylon repairinge againe goddes churche blindenesse slouthe bishoppes good wil forewardenesse people blinde seethe menne maisters whome people saithe hierome hath benne leadde erroure lulled sleepe seeth rome niniue whiche sometime painted fairest colour nowe vizarde beeinge pulled bothe better seene lesse sette seeth good menne beinge awaked deade sleepe lighte gospel voice god haue resorted hilles scripture waitinge al councelles sutche maisters hardinge ye wreste saieinge hierome purpose saie may seeme spoken churche wherein ye make prophete place mighte sounde clergy commendation people stirre reade scripture accustomed maner ye sticke adde owne one place take awaie litle doctour place alter woordes place vvho looketh narrowly trial secretarie thought maliciously wrote diligent conference apologie herome shall finde concerninge right sense place hieromes intent foretell paint face saie vniuersall state time tell declare meaninge prophete naliumvntruthe hierome place saithe haec consummatione mundi magi complentur c hucus que de mundi ruina signifiynge state time paste witte time christes firste comminge world woordes expressely speake thereof hieromes exposition niniue prophete meaneth worlde assyrian kinge deuill prophecieth ruine worlde deuill comminge christe hieromevntruthe speaketh oftentimes saithe plainly rome babylon speaketh neuer woorde harlotte babylon whereof ye vnlearned minister haue neuer donne bablinge meaning thereby holy romaine churche first sir defender penned geare haue plaide false parte diuidinge one member sentence twoo rather puttinge one woorde leauing sin comment nahum cap hierome hath thus et consummationis niniue speciosissimae quondam meretricis whereby meante vndoinge deuils power worlde saieas though sithence birthe christe neuer bene neither niniue babylon ignorance negligence cleregie comminge christe beautiful harlotte might geue occasion reproch romaine church falsefiynge doctours sense vnderstand niniue haue set forthe thus et consummationis niniue speciosissimae meretricis descant vpon though hierome written saie setteth face falle gorgeous harlot babylon whiche interpret rome corrupting hieromes sense make speake repairinge againe goddes churche though daie defaulte catholike clergie fallen downe set vp againe minister also blindenesse bishop time maisters whome people hath benne lead errour lulled asleepe hereto ye adde saithe hierome hierome saithe neither maisters christes first comminge deuil brought people asleepe whome vnderstandethno doubte credite sufficiente commentarie people liueth deceiued deuill vnder euill maisters comminge christe defender thinketh hath acquited selfe like clercke alleaginge place hierome catholike churche require al learned reade ouer hierome writeth vpon ende prophet nahum woordes textein nahum cap brucus irruit euolauit c foorth ende chapter diligently marke goeth immediatly place defender alleaged thee good reader vnderstandest latine tonge assure thee hierome speaketh woordesas though pope clerkes vvere heretiques teacher false doctrine heretikes teacher euil doctrine suche beare voice churche whiche sorte new english clergie discourse commendeth true beleuers onely hilles written scripture also doctrine churche thou seest allegation put apologie commendeth likewise latibula doctorum caues doctours faithfull people also flyinge hilles couche selues safe danger deuill stirrer heresy place well scanned allegation shall seeme haue made rodde whippe selues whole place beinge ouer longe recire sentence two specially meante suche maie suffise vae ita que c wo whiche teacher peruerse doctrine niniue signified worldepsalm aptly saide thy shepeherdes haue stepte haue geuen sleepe eies slomberinge eieleddes therefore haue founde place lorde atabernacle god iacob neither haue hearde ephrata saie frugifera ecclesia fruitefull churche haue founde churche thickettes woddes neither onely shepeherdes rifferaffe mixticij huius meaneth nonlatin alphabet whiche woorde seuenty translatours sortes people deceiued false teacher locuste capitaine heretikes whiche time froste sitteth hedge haue slepte kinge assyrian deuill haue ben lulled aslepe alwaies studie deuil may bringe asleepe waking soules thus hierome reporte haue eies see whether newe cleregy may serme whome deuill hath lulled asleepe gladly vse owne terme newe deuises owne liked conceites schismes heresy vniuste possession benefice bishoprikes yet liuinge whome right belongeth presumption office duely called vnto malice towarde churche continuall satisfiynge fleashly lustes vnlawfull lecherous embracinges let feare dreadfull sayinge hierome folowinge straight allegation non est sanitas contritioni tuae c health thy bruze thy woonde swelleth therefore rifferaffe niniue healed laieth downe pride woonde alwaies freshe daily woonded while deuill striketh commeth health bruze although seeme selfe hole yet soule broken crusshed bytle whole earth fownceth downe vpon healed continually lifted vp pride become humble submit selfe christepsalm contrite humble harte god despiseth thus describeth hierome menne neither let saie submitte selues christe whome whose gospell haue muche mouthes vntill folowe doctrine sayinge gouernours churche heareth youluc heareth despiseth despiseth muche answeare place hierome b sarisburie marueilous woorke sir defender singeth discante quiteth selfe like clerke altereth hieromes minde saithe hierome saithe hierome saith prowde niniue hath made churche rome diuel hath made antichriste bableth aboute babylon diuideth one sentence twoo putteth one woorde leaueth bulled sleepe scattereth rifferaffe doothe saithe knowe rome niuiue babylon euer shal please hardinge courtesie reporte touchinge heinous imagined corruption alteringe hieromes minde chrysost matthae homil chrysostome saith qui mendax est nemine putat verum dicere ne ipsum quidem deum selfe lier imagineth noman saithe truthe god selfe sutche corruption change woordes palladius lewde felowe thought selfe sommetime hable charge hierome hieromes woordes thereof hieronym ad pammach de optimo genere interpretandi concionatur esse falsarium verbum non expressisse de verbo pro honorabili dixisse charissimum tom haec huiusmodi nugae mea crimina sunt preacheth publisheth abroadein eadem epist falsarie haue precisely translated woorde woorde sleede woorke honorable haue written deerely beloued thinges sutche trifle laide charge folie hierome answeareth thus cum ipsa epistola doceat nihil mutatum esse de sensu nec re additas nec aliquod dogma confictum faciunt nae isti intelligendo vt nihil intelligant dum alienam imperitiam volunt coarguere produnt suam whereas epistle selfe declareth alteration made sense neither mater substance added doctrine imagined verily greate cunninge proue selues fooles seekinge reproue mennes vnskilfulnesse betraie theire owne yee saie hierome woordes spake nothinge neither churche christe cleregie rome trial whereof let hierome selfe hearde speake witnesse indifferet selfe first place saith thus place shal resorte afterward dicimus hieronym michaeam ca venient super no mala audiamus sententiam domini sion hierusale mon tepli speculatotium visio pacis templus christi consummatione fine saie shal hurte comme vpon v let v heare saieinge lorde sion hierusalem mounte watche tower temple sighte peace temple churche christe shalbe consumed brought ende woordes plaine onely haute lady niniue also churche temple beareth name christe shalbe consumed broughte ende likewise saithe hieronym sophoniam ca quos deus inseruit ex oleastro radicem bonae oliuae si illi immemores recesserint conditore suo adorauerint assyrium cur illos deus non euertat ad eandem sitim reducat qua prius fuerunt euen whome god hath graffed fro wilde oliue tree roote good oliuie saie child churche forgeate selues flee theire maker woorship kinge assyria saie antichriste creature god maie god ouerthrowe bringe thirste drouth againe saithe hierony matthae ca li abominatio desolationis intelligi potest omne dogma peruersum quod cum viderimus stare loco sancto id est ecclesia debemus fugere de iudaea ad monte abomination desolation maie taken vvicked doctrine whiche wee shal see standinge holy place saie churche christe wee muste flee iurie mountaines scripture againe likewise saithe paxillus auferetur de loco fideli hoc est de ecclesia per impietatem quotidie succrescentem qui super eum ante pependerant fide postea infidelitate frangentur cadent peribunt pinne barre whereby meaneth christe faitheful hange vpon house thinges hanged vp safely vpon pinne shalbe taken awaie place faitheful saie churche bicause wickednesse daiely groweth honge vpon faithe afterwarde infidelitie shalbe broken downerome babylon falle perishe euer glose yee shal geue woordes hierome certainely woordes plaine euidente wil easily receiue glose likewise gregorie speakinge firste comminge christe timegregor iob ca li ca discribed ende worlde saithe thus diebus illis ecclesia quasi quodam senio debilitata per praedicationem parere filio non valebit day churche beinge ouermutche weakened age shal hable preachinge beare child hieronym hieremi lib ca touchinge cleregie hierome selfe saithe ipsi quo que sacerdotes qui legem domini docere deberent subiectos sibi populos leonis furore defendere quodam stupore infatuati vertentur amentiam priestes selues ought teache lavve lorde defende people committed charge furie lion diuel beinge amazed berefte wittes shalbe turned madnesse againe saithe hieronym naum ca scit rex assyrius non posse se oues decipere nisi pastores ante consopierit semper diaboli studium est vigilante anima consopire kinge assyria diuel knoweth neuer deceiue sheepe onlesse firste caste sheepeheardes trauce euermore diuels policie laie watcheful soules asleepe therefore againe saithe hieronym sopboniam ca auferet dominus nomina vanae gloriae admirationis falsae quae versantur ecclesia sed nomina sacerdotum cum sacerdotibus qui frustra sibi applaudunt episcopali nomine presbyterij dignitate non opere god wil take awaie name vaine glorie false credite churche name priestes togeather priestes selues vainely boaste selues name bishoppes dignitie priestehoode doo nothinge aboute babylon yee saie yee neuer make ende bablinge bablinge hieronym catalogo scriptor eccle marco praie made hierome saide petrus prima epistola sub nomine babylonis romam significat peter firste epistle meante rome vnder name babylon augustine saithe rom est quasi secunda babylon rome seconde babylon august de genesi contra manichae li ca augustin psalm primasius apocalyp ca againe saithe ciues babyloniae no fecerunt dimisimus creatorem adorauimus creaturam dimisimus eum quo facti sumus adorauimus illud quod fecimus haue made v citizen babylon wee haue leafte oure creatoure haue woorshipped creature wee haue leafte made v haue adoured thinge wee made oure selues likewise saithe primasius tunc babylon cadet quando nouissime potestatem persequendi sanctos acceperit shal babylon comme grounde shal laste al take power persequute sainctes god againe idem caput vidi mulierem sedentem super vestem coccineam plenam nominibus blasphemiae habentem caput septem septem caput dicit septem monte romam quae super septem monte praesidet significans sawe vvooman sittinge vpon scarlet roabe fulle name blasphemie hauinge seuen heades seuen heades calleth seuen mountes vpon vvhiche rome vvas builte meaninge thereby rome sitteth vpon seuen hilles ludouicus vi esaugust de ciuitate dei lib ca viues ambrosius ansbertus apacalyp li owne frende saith thus hieronymus ad marcellam scribens non aliam existimat discribi c hierome writinge vnto marcella thinketh none babylon discribed iohn reuelations cittie rome ambrosius ansbertus saithe vbi est illa dudum super omnia regna exaltata inclyta rom babylon secunda vvhere noble rome euanced late aboue al kingedomes seconde babylon passe ouer beatus rhenanus people shal flee scripture auentinus petrarcha dante greate number youre owne doctours mentioned place conueniente al whome ye maie youre courtesie charge bablinge yee saie hierome meante state time onely state time nowe paste saie saide time christes firste comminge vvorlde margine yee cal right sense hierome truely reported howe youre reader hath eye see maie easily finde youre owne onely sense hardinge hieromes beseeche howe niniue fully destroied gospelles written hieronym naum ca true sense hieroms woordes firste comming christe vvorlde hieromes meaninge speache plaine people seconde comminge christe vvhiche shalbe glorie shal leaue theire negligente idle scholemaisters vvhiche haue longe time deceiued shal flee mountaines scripture al finde one teache yet shal theire desire endeuoure accepted god thei haue sought vnto mountaines negligence slouthefulnesse theire maisters shalbe reproued like pourpose chrysostom gene homi chrysostome saithe fieri non potest vt qui diuinis scripturis magno studio feruenti que desiderio vacat semper negligatur licet enim desit nobis hominis magisterium tamen ipse dominus superne intrans corda nostra illustrat mentem rationi iubar suum infundit detegit occulta doctor que fit eorum quae ignoramus tantum si no ea quae nobis sunt afferre velimus cannot possibly earneste studie feruente desire readeth scripture shoulde euermore foresaken although wee wante instruction man yet god selfe aboue entringe harte lighteneth minde poureth beames wittes openeth thinges hidden becommeth vnto v scholemaister wee knowe onely wee wil doo mutche v lieth saithe hierome postquam conuersi fuerint clarum christi lumen aspexerinthierony esai lib ca psalm pascent vijs semitis sanctarum scripturarum dicent dominus pascit nihil mihi deerit shalbe turned shal beholde cleare light christe shal feede pathes way holy scripture shal saie lorde feedeth shal vvante nothinge againe saithe circundabit sibi quasi murum firmissimum scripturarum doctrinam ne ad interiora eius possit hostis irrumperehieronym naum cap wil enclose selfe doctrine scripture stronge walle enimie maie enter harte againe saithe haec est via ambulate ca ne que ad dextram ne que ad sinistram tunc omnes erroreshierony esai lib cap idola similitudines veritatis comminnes que disperges ita iudicabis immunda vt menstruatae mulieris sordidissimo sanguini compare waie walke goe neither right hande leafte shalt breake scatter al errours idoles countrefeite likenesse truthe shalt iudge filthy thou shalt liken moste vile lothesome bloude mutche yee saie al woordes hierome perteiue vnto somme mater know vnto ouerthrowe babylon fal antichriste shalbe ende worlde notwithstandinge hieromes woordes selfe plaine yenough yet maie please consider woordes chrysostome chrysostom matt homi touchinge thus saithe tunc qui iudaea sunt fugiant ad monte id est qui sunt christianitate conferant se ad scripturas monte sunt scripturae apostolorum prophetarum c sciens dominus tantam confusionem rerum nouissimis diebus esse futuram ideo mandat vt christiani qui sunt christianitate volentes firmitatem accipere fidei verae ad nullam rem fugiant nisi ad scripturas alioqui si ad alias re respexerint scandalizabuntur peribunt non intelligentes quae sit vera ecclesia et per hoc incident abominationem desolationis let ievvrie flee vnto mountaines saie let christes profession flee scripture scripture apostle prophetes mountaines c lorde knowinge shoulde sutche confusion laste day therefore commaundeth christian menne beleue christe willinge haue assurance true faith shoulde haue recourse nothinge el vnto scripture otherwise haue regarde thinge shalbe offended perishe vnderstandinge true churche meane hereof shal falle abomination desolation hardinge glose wil serue certainely woordes spoken firste comminge christe worlde imagine kingedome antichriste ende consummation worlde hereof gregorie saithe thus gregori iob ca li ca ecclesia post eosdem dy quibus deprimitur tamen circa finem temporum grandi praedicationis virtute roborabitur churche day affliction shal afterwarde notwithstandinge strengthened greate power mighte preachinge apologie cap diuision youre fauoure somme wil saie thinges ought haue benne attempted without bishop rome commaundemente forsomutche onely knotte bande christian societie onely prieste leuies order god signified deuteronomie whome counsel mater weight true iudgemente ought sette obeieth iudgemente man ought bee killed sight brother mortal creature hathe authoritie iudge ouer pope whatsoeuer doo christe reigneth heauen pope earthe pope alone doo mutche christe god selfe doo bicause christe pope haue one consistorie without faithe hope churche goeth quite casteth awaie renounceth owne saluation sutche talke haue canonistes pope parasite smal discretion sobrenesse coulde scantly saie leaste coulde speake highly christ selfe hardinge vvhat somme wil saie wee knowe vvee tel change religion manifolde heresy ought haue benne attempted al neither without bishop rome commaundemente commaundemente touching bishop rome selfe haue neuer donne great blocke youre waie hath euer bene waie al heretikes yet could neuer remoued scoffes againste belieinge canonistes vttered idly repeted former answeare maie suffise apologie cap diuision v truely haue fallen bishop rome vpon manner worldly respect commoditie would christe behaued selfe falling away needed case stoode onlesse leafte wee coulde come christe neither wil nowe make league v sutche one1 reg nahas kinge ammonite woulde haue made time paste cittie iabes whiche put right eie eche one inhabitantes euen wil pope plucke v holy scripture gospel saluation al confidence whiche wee haue christe iesu vpon condition agree vpon peace v hardinge ye fallen bishop rome onely whiche damnable schisme ye fallen christes churche comparison pope kinge nahas agreable sir ye speake maliciously credibly ye good christen men conforme selues catholique faithe denie christe gospel also yee shoulde haue added warrant pope wil plucke neither scripture confidence christe iesu dooth v apologie cap diuision whereas somme vse make greate vaunte pope onely peter successour though thereby carried holy ghoste bosome cannot erre mater nothing trifelinge tale god grace promised good minde one feareth vnto see successios richesse saithe hierome maie make bishop might reste al bishoppes whosoeuer successours apostle place consecration onely sufficient manasses succeded dauid caiphas succeded aaron hath benne often seene idol hath benne placed temple god olde time archidamus lacedemonian boasted mutche selfe howe came bloud hercules one nicostratus wise abated pride nay quod thou seemest descende hercules hercules destroied euil menne thou makest good menne euil phariseis bragged linage howe kinred bloude abraham iohan ye saithe christe seeke kil manne vvhiche haue tolde truthe hearde god thus abraham neuer yee youre father diuel vvil needes obeie vvil hardinge pope succedeth peter auctoritie power whereas shepe christe continewe worldes ende wise thinketh christe haue made shepeherde temporarie time ouer perpetual flocke shepeherdly endoument lorde gaue firste shepeherde institution shepeherdely office churche vnderstanded haue geeuen ordinarely euery successourluke peter gaue obteined praier made father faithe faile againe gaue grace performe performance whereof required witte confirmed strengthened brother wherefore grace stedfastnesse faithe confirminge waueringe doubtful faithe euery pope obteineth holy ghoste benefite churche pope although maie erre personal erroure owne priuate iudgemente man particular doctour owne opinionvntruthe ioined vvith impudent flatterie extreme folie yet pope successour peter vicar christe earthe shepeherde vniuersal churche publique iudgemente deliberation definitiue sentence vntruthe ioined vvith impudent flatterie extreme folie neuer errethvntruthe ioined vvith impudent flatterie extreme folie neuer erred euer ordeineth determineth thinge highe bishoply auctoritie intendinge binde christen menne performe beleue alwaies gouerned holpen grace fauour holy ghoste catholique doctours certaintie though sutche doughty clerkes ye mater nothinge triflinge tale god grace one respecte promised bothe good minde one feareth god also respect successours peter hieromes saieinge euagrius whiche nowe haue alleaged three foure time wil handsomly serue diuerse pointes shipmans hose diuerse leggesthis place hierome ansvveared par ca diui againe tel thereby meaneth nothinge el greatnes rome ought geue auctoritie wronge priuat custome whiche deacon certaine case preferred priestes right generall custome worlde bishoppes successours apostle graunte yet pope successour peterpeter vvas shepeheard apostle sheepe vaine vntruthe vvithout auoure cyprian christus parem dedit apostolis omnibus potestatem shepeherde al christes lambes shepe therefore alsopeter vvas shepeheard apostle sheepe vaine vntruthe vvithout auoure cyprian christus parem dedit apostolis omnibus potestatem apostle selues hath higher auctoritie example archidamus boastingly fetched petigree hercules muste consider succession vertue alwaies foloweth succession bloude nowe wee acknowledge pope succession shepeherdly power euen sutche peterthe pope succedeth povver notin holinesse vvhiche power taken awaie lacke peter holines christe likewise answeare phariseis though affirmed succeded abraham loue truthe malice father deuil yet e denied came lineally abraham bloud though godlines sutche succession meane speakinge pope whose succession deriued peter succession power auctoritie andal maie called successio folie infallibilitie faithe iudgemente sentence definitiue b sarisburie wee haue founde one pope twoo capacity one respecte man respecte aboue man whether respecte angel archangel paste silence one waie succedeth peter waie succedeth knowe one waie maie erre waie though woulde neuer faine cannot erre bed table horsebacke el wee maie wel mistruste place maie deceiued wel others councel consistorie place iudgemente moste certaine yee saie cannot erre place hathe holy ghoste trowe commaundemente povver pastoral succession authoritie infallibilitie faithe place chaire consecration sallustius ciceronem sufficiente euer preserue erroure like pourpose salluste sommetime saide cicero aliud stans aliud sedens de republica sentit standeth vp hath one minde touching common state sitteth downe nicola cusanus de authoritate ecclesi c dis sic omnes glossa hath apolloes nonne sate mewed caue inspired prophesied gaue oracle shee came abroade shee wiser wemen thus doctours saie reported veritas adhaeret cathedrae papa sanctitatem recipit cathedra pope truthe fastened vnto chaire pope cannot erre pope chaire receiueth holinesse shameth mee hardinge see vainely occupied vanity yee maie wel liberal dealinge hereof coste litle onely owne scripture doctoures councels witnesse saieinges yee allege none declaration whole mater beseche thee good christian readerpar ca di consider shorte treatie haue written touchinge sundrie erroures euidente heresy haue benne notably founde pope alphonsus de castro one hardinges owne special doctours saithealphonsus de haeresib li ca non dubitamus haereticum esse papam esse coire vnum possint c non enim credo aliquem esse adeo impudentem papae assentatorem vt ei tribuere hoc velit vt nec errare nec interpretatione sacrarum literarum hallucinari possit wee doubte whether one man maie pope heretique bothe togeather beleue none shamelesse flatterer pope wil saie saie hardinge pope neuer erre deceiued exposition scripture likewise erasmus saithe si verum est quod quidam asseuerant romanum pontificem errore iudiciali errare non posseerasm annotationibus corin quid opus est generalibus concilijs quid opus est concilium accersere iurisconsultos ac theologos eruditos si papa pronuntians labi non potest cur datus est appellationi locus vel ad synodum vel ad eundem rectius edoctum quorsum attinet tot academia tractandis fidei quaestonibus distorqueri cum ex vno pontifice quod verum est audire liceat imo qui fit vt huius pontificis decreta cum illius pontificis decretis pugnent true somme menne saie bishop rome neuer errre erroure iudgemente neede wee many general councelles neede wee many lavviers learned diuines pope cannot erre geeuinge sentence wherefore lieth appeale pope either councel el pope selfe beinge better enfourmed neede wee trouble many vniuersities discussinge mater faithe whereas wee maie learne truthe pope alone naie howe commeth aboute one pope decree founde contrarie others bee certaine pope euer euer saie neuer erre yee speake peter succession vaine childishe suche folie athanasius saithe athana apologia secunda hieronymus ad euagrium persuasus est magnitudine vrbium religionem esse sitam wise man imagineth religion standeth greatenesse citties hierome saithe potentia diuitiarum paupertatis humilitas vel sublimiorem vel inferiorem episcopum non facit caeterum omnes apostolorum successores sunt wealthe richesse basenesse pouertie maketh bishop neither higher lower al bishoppes apostle successours apologie cap diuision yet notwithstandinge bicause wee wil graunte somme succession tel v hath pope alone succeded peter wherein praie religion office peece life hathe succeded one thing tel peter euer like vnto pope pope like vnto peter except peraduenture thei wil saie thus peter rome neuer taught gospel neuer fedde flocke toke away key kingdome heauen hid treasure lorde sat downe onely castle iohn laterane pointed finger al place purgatorie kindes pounishementes committinge somme poore soules tormented somme againe suddainely releasing thence pleasure takinge monie doinge gaue order saie priuate mass euery corner mumbled vp holy seruice lowe voice vnknowen language hanged vp sacrament euery temple euery aultar caried whither soeuer wente vpon amblinge iannet lightes belle consecrated holy breath oile vvaxe vvulle belle chalice church aultars solde iubilees grace liberty aduousons preuentions firste fruites palles vvearinge palles bulles indulgence pardon called selfe name head churche highest bishop bishop bishoppes alone moste holy vsurpation tooke vpon selfe right authoritie ouer bishoppes church exempted selfe power ciuil gouernemente mainteined warres set prince togeather variance sittinge chaire triple crovvne ful labelles sumptuous persianlike gorgiousnesse roial scepter diademe gould glitteringe stone caried vpon palfraie vpon shoulder noble menne thinges doubt peter rome time paste leafte charge successours would saie hand hande thing nowe day donne rome pope donne though nothing el ought donne hardinge pope alone hath succeded peter aske wherein religion office vvee tel succeded peter chaire whiche sate rome ruled churche christian religionvntruthe pope feedeth office whiche christe committed peter saide pasce oues meas fede sheepe whiche office neuer gaue greater like circumstance charge gaue peter alone saide fede sheepe vvhat aske ye v officer life aske thinge peter euer like vnto pope pope like vnto peter vve tel peter authoritie fide christes shepe like vnto pope pope hath authoritie fede christes shepe like vnto peterand vvel proued like power like commission gaue authoritie fede gaue also authoritie doo euer maie perteine feding b sarisburie yee telle v many faire tale peter succession wee demaunde wherein pope succedeth peter answeare succedeth chaire peter benne sommetime enstalled rome sate solemnely al daie triple crovvne pontificalibus chaire goulde thus hauing loste bothe religion doctrine yee thinke sufficient leaste holde chaire peter successoure souldier lost swerde would plaie man scaberde caiphas succeded aaron wicked manasses succeded dauid maie antichriste easily sitte peter chaire chrysostome saithe non cathedra facit sacerdotem sed sacerdos cathedram nec locus sanctificat hominemdis multi sed homo locum chaire maketh bishop bishop maketh chaire neither place halloweth man man halloweth place likewise hierome saith dis non est facile non sanctorum filij sunt qui tenet loca sanctorum theiare alwaies child holy menne sitte roum holy menne doothe greate wronge vnto peter placeth sutche one sutche chaire neither pope thinge like peter peter thinge like pope simeones sawe arsacius vnlearned vnvvorthy olde doatinge man nicepho li cap placed chrysostomes roume cried oute pro pudor quis cui shame soary hinde whose place haue wee sette euen maie wee iustely saie pope sittinge peter chaire pro pudor quis cui apologie cap diuision contrariwise peraduenture rather saie thus pope doothe nowe al thinges whiche wee knowe peter many daie agoe renneth vp downe euery countrie preache gospel onely openly abroade also priuately house house diligente applieth businesse season season due time due time doothe part euangeliste fulfilleth woorke ministerie christe watcheman house israel receiueth answeares wordes god mouthe euen receiueth deliuereth ouer people salte earthe light worlde doothe feede selfe flocke hee doothe entangle selfe worldly care life dooth vse sou raintie ouer lordes people seeketh haue menne minister vnto selfe rather ministreth vnto others taketh al bishoppes felowes equalles subiecte prince personnes sent god geeueth cesar whiche cesars olde bishoppes rome without contradiction calleth emperoure lorde onlesse therefore pope doo like nowe day peter thinges aforesaide cause al shoulde glorie mutche peter name succession hardinge pope nowe runneth vp downe euery countrie goeth openly priuatly house house euery alehouse ye would doo like one minister neither trowe ye maisters superintendentes selues thinke conuenient ye goe house house preache gospel date would ye pope abase selfe yee thinke becommeth selues hath meete fitte menne helpe beare burthea whereas one body suffiseth great many affaire coucel hath many head ouersight many eies eare many harte preachinge many tounges woorke many handes knowledge many eares expedition matter many feete great weight charge many shoulder briefly al necessary behoofeful case conuenient helpes like helpes would peter vse nowe liuinge b sarisburie speake pope renninge vp downe alehouse alehouse greate folie sufficiet would goe churche churche remember charge feede flocke preache gospel yee saie pope hath many heades many eies many harte many tongue many handes many eares many shoulder thus pope ye make monster many eies eares tongue harte others none owne wise man sommetime saide improbe facit titus liuius qui cum alienis oculis omnia ei agenda sint postulet aliorum vitas committi sibi lewdely donne man must ouersee al thinges mennes eies desiere haue liues others committed ouer charge god geeue eies see eares heare harte vnderstande maie knowe time goddes visitation apologie cap diuision mutche lesse cause haue thei complaine departinge calle v againe felowes frendes beleue thei beleue menne saie one cobilon lacedemonian whe sent embassadoure kinge persian treate league sounde chaunce courte plaieing dice returned streight way home againe leauinge message vndonne asked hadde slackte doo thinges whiche receiued publique commission doo made answere thought great reproche common wealthe make league dicer contente selues returne pope errours make couenaunt onely dicer also menne farre vngraceous wicked dicer bisides great blotte good name shoulde also dangerous mater bothe kendle goddes wrath v clogge condemne owne soules euer hardinge yee doo wel compare selues cobilon deedevvee flee vvicked companie ye doo yee sentvntruthe vvhere christe euer sende v b rome christe vicare peter successour fedde gouerned like shepe vnder shepeherde christe churche perfite body head true beleuers knitte togeather charitie member eche one order degree vine wee boughes branch rule pope leaft voide life diuided fro christe head vvhat member cutte bodie liueth boughe broken tree groweth euery suche member dieth bough withereth ye remaine catholike churche body christe yee drawe life heade yee haue parte spirite thence redoundeth euery member yee haue portion vitall iouysse issueth roote remaineth ye caste fire cause cyprian father often time haue saide besides churche saluation b sarisburie christe neuer tolde v neither vicare general rome laterane peter chaire willed v haue recourse bishop rome seueral bishop therefore harding muste recken emongest reste vntruthes true saie member diuided body cannot liue youre conclusion vntrue like rest rome body onely member body rome tree onely boughe rome heade onely springe therefore seeinge nowe diuided body seeinge broken tree seeing cut heade maruaile thoughe sterued thoughe wethered thoughe leafte drie without either sprite life daie appeareth eies al wil beholde apologie cap diuision truthe haue departed sawe blinded whole worlde many hundred yeere farre presumpteously woonte saie could erre euer mortal man power condemne neither kinges emperoures whole clergie yet al people worlde togeather thoughe shoulde carrie away thousande soules hel tooke vpon power commaunde onely menne euen angelles god goe returne leade soules purgatorie bringe backe againe liste selfe gregorie saithe without al doubte forerenner standerd bearer antichriste hath vtterly forsaken catholique faith also ringleader might maine resiste gospel truthe whiche thei knowe truthe haue ere departed euery one owne accorde good wil would euen also gladly departe againe note inconstancie shame owne estimation among people let vnto conclusion wee haue departed bounde nothinge laie selfe onely knowe vertue power place dwelleth continuance succession hardinge yee confesse youre departinge woulde god yee vnderstoode youre gylte reuerent father godly learned menne whose rome ye holde wrongfully liked interpreter cal ringleader resiste gospel suffer persecution gospel gospel saie vile heresy blaspemies worthely thei detes e newe trouth saie false wicked lie thei abhorre neither euer departed parte dutie catholique mennem hardinges reuerende father continued tvventie yeeres together hypocrifie owne accorde good wil ye saiem hardinges reuerende father continued tvventie yeeres together hypocrifie wherein slepte aside compelled sutche feare might happen right constant man meane terrour death whiche aristotle saithe al terrible thinges terrible nowe bicause yet finde terroure gilty conscience terrible death person thei entende god grace assisting neuer steppe aside againe rather suffer euer extremity vvhose bloude bloude god honour shal time permitt mitte drawepersequution whiche mutche ye thirst sone looke ye retourninge israelite againe texte beinge fulfilled complerae sunt iniquitates amorrhaeorum vvere thei wel assured trouthe moste certaine euer ye saie thei would make foolishe bargaine selues doo buye vaine estimation among people certaine losse soules b sarisburie certaine youre frendes yee cal reuerende father suffer imprisonement yee saie persequution gospel notwithstandinge longe sithence saide reuerende father selues burner persequutours gospel epiphanius nonlatin alphabet sutche complainte sommetime made arius wicked heretique thus writeth arius suffer persequution truthe euer preuaileth ruffinus notwithstandinge greate fauourer origenian heretiques yet saide euen saie nostra fides persequutionis haereticorum tempore cum sanctum alexandrina ecclesia degeremus carceribus exilijs hieronym aduersus ruffinum lib hiero eode loco quae pro fide inferebantur probata est wee liued holy churche alexandria time persequution heretiques faithe proued prisones banishementes whiche laide vpon v faithes sake vnto hierome pleasante manner answeareth thus miror qud non adiecerit vinctus iesu christi liberatus sum de ore leonis alexandriae ad bestias depugnaui cursum consummaui fidem seruaui superest mihi corona iustitiae maruaile mutche saide ruffinus prisoner iesus christe deliuered lion mouthe throwen amongeste wilde beastes alexandria haue paste course haue keapte faithe nowe remainethe mee crovvne righteousnesse thus woulfe restreined spoile rauen maie likewise complaine persequution hieronym ad apronium hierome writinge vnto apronius state easte church liued saithe thus hic quieta sunt omnia etsi enim venena pectoris non amiserint tamen o impietatis non audent aperire sed sunt sicut aspides surdae obturantes aures suas al thinges quiete al haue leafte poison theire bartes yet dare open theire wicked mouthes deafe serpentes shuttinge vp theire eares wil heare nothinge saide reuerende father nowe sitte firmely side longe agoe wel contented bothe mainetaine publisshe contrarie wel howe al saie good wil onely feare sutche feare maie happen vpon constant man saie mere hypocrisie dissimulation open flatteringe theire prince thus saue father beinge schismatiques yee wel contente make hypocritesstephan gardi de vera obedie thus saie youre saide reuerendes selues woulde haue tolde farre otherwise doctour gardiner selfe saith thus examineth mater vvith al sens discussing trial truthe easely contente selfe framed selfe benne askinge iudgemente al sens onlesse perceiued firste al hearde vvith mine eares smelled vvith nose savve vvith mine eieshe persvvaded vvoorkinge god grace felte vvith handes thought seene yenough againe saithe aduised consideration hathe pulled avvaie al scrupulous doubtes vvoorkinge goddes gracehe compelled povver truthe hathe conueighed brought lighte veritie againe deede tel vvorde compelled compelleth al menne euen mighty povver truthe likewise saithe doctour bonnertruthe preuaileth touchinge doctor bonner praefatione veram obedientiam mater vvas rashely taken hande vvith iudgemente vvisedome examined discussed againe saithe bishop vvinchester longe agoe thorovvely bulted mater euen vnto branne tale truehe examineth mater vttermoste hardinge youre tale moste vntrue certainely beinge directly contrarie make bothe true possible yee beginne fraie v youre prophetical threates wee beginne touche youre bloude yee saie louanian israel immediately afterwarde shalbe restoared thinke meane domus iacob de populo barbaro sutche blinde prognostication haue skil god oftentimes suffereth iniquitie falshedde preuaile season chasten vnkindenesse people let wil donne mercie shal seeme good eies yee preuaile againe yee shal preuaile owne confusion wel yee maie represse truthe god youre father haue often donne vtterly abolishe yee shal neuer hable sutche vaine hope ievves olde time recouer theire religion ceremony vtterly ouerthrowe ghospel christe conspired togeather gotte mason carpenter beganne caste fundatio repaire teple chrysostom oratio contra iudaeos immediately emperoure costantine raised power sette vpon put swerde rebelles traitours others spared aliue made slaues cutte somme theire tongue somme theire handes somme theire care somme theire nose somme burnte face sente abroade example towne towne throughout worlde afterwardeambrosius li epist wicked emperoure iulian despite christe geuen iewes leaue builde repaire saide prince power assistinge power seemed hable withstande theire pourpose god self heauen aboue encoutred earthequakes brake ouerthrewe theire buildinges lightninges fel downe burnte bothe tooles theire handes coates theire backes gospel christe bewtieful glorious euer benne gregorie saithe gregor primum regum cap li ca tulerunt dagon restituerunt eum locum suum hoc est templo vbi arca dei posita fuerat quid est ergo dagon locum suum restituere nisi idololatriae statu subtili cosideratione perquirere et quia quo subtilius idololatriae error aspicitur eo verius condemnatur subiunctu est rursus diluculo surgentes inuenerunt dagon iacentem super faciem coram arca domini took idole dagon restoared againe place saie temple god arke god placed restoare againe dagon place discretely aduisedly examine state idolatrie mutche better erroure idolatrie seene better condemned therefore foloweth risinge morninge founde dagon lieinge flat vpon face arke lorde euen hardinge yee rayse vp youre dagon againe againe shal comme grounde shal squatte handes feete vtterly dismembred falle shal lie grouelinge blocke presence arke god prouer counsel againste lorde noble prince iosua goddes commaundement destroied cittie ierichoiosua adiured al posteritie sorte accursed iehoua lorde shal stande vp restoare cittie hiericho deathe eldest sonne shal laie fundation deathe yongeste childe shal close gate theodoretus saithe persequution wicked shal hable preuaile againste godtheodoret eccle histor fol graeco nonlatin alphabet geate ouer hand yet shal comme downe againe written prophete esai draweing youre bloude yee neede greatly complaine gospel christe bloudy hath hitherto preuailed withoute one drop al bloude god geue grace repente lefte owne bloude vpon owne heade daie lorde fire swerde mercilesse crueltie onely instrumentes youre doctrine therefore yee seeme nowe saiegenesis youre blinde hope cursed esau sommetime saide brother jacob venient dy luctus patris mei occidam iacobum fratrem meum day shal comme father shal die wil kille brother iacob athanasius saithe athanasius ad solitariam vita agentes caedi christianorum proprium est caedere autem christianos pilati caiphae officia sunt parte christian suffer persecution persecute christian office pilate caiphas wee wil saie vnto augustineaugustin cotra epistola fundamenti cap illi vos saeuiant qui nesciunt quo cum labore verum inueniatur quam difficile caueantur errores let persecute vse crueltie ouer knowe laboure finde truthe howe harde beware erroure againe saithe nemo de praeteritis insultat erroribus nisi qui diuinam misericordiam expertus non est vt careret erroribus tantum id agamus vt errores aliquando finiantur man vpbraideth others erroures paste hathe felte goddes diuine mercie voide erroures let oure onely laboure erroures laste maie haue ende wee wil saie peter sommetime saide simon sorcerer people anger seeinge falsehedde woulde haue stoned deatheabdias tetro imo viuat regnum christi crescere videat vel inuitus naie naie let liue let see kingdome christe growe prosper euen wil apologie cap diuision v al others moste iustely haue leafte kinges yea euen thei whiche greatest reuerence folowe obeie authoritie faithe bishoppes rome haue longe since founde felte wel yenough yoke tyrannie pope kingdom bishop rome somtime tooke crowne heade kinge henry seconde compelled put aside al princely state maiestie like meere priuate man come vnto theire legate greate summission humilitie al subiectes might laugh scorne thei caused bishoppes monkes somme parte nobilitie fielde againste kinge iohn set al people libertie othes whereby thei ought allegeance kinge laste wickedly moste abominably bereeued kinge onely kingedome also life bisides thei excomunicated cursed kinge henry eighte moste famous prince stirred vp sommetime emperour sommetime frenche kinge mutche put realme hazarde haue benne praie spoile vnto enimie yet fooles madde menne thinke either mighty prince could feared bugges rattle el noble greate kingdome might easily euen one morsel deuoured swalowed vp hardinge concerninge case betweene three kinges englande bishop rome time beinge saie litle wel bishop euil haue rewarde punishemente f otherwise howe euer eche one god iudgemente shal haue deserued measure graunted al true ye saie though know part false vvhat though kinge henry seconde euil treated pope alexander murthering thomas archebishop cantorbury kinge iohn likewise zelous learned pope innocentius thirde c b sarisburie notwithstandinge pope manner hath benne raise commotion within realme arme subiectes againste theire soueraine pulle crovvne emperial heade yet doctrine euer dare speake prince right foole killeth selfe life saluation onely vnder frantike gouernement pope sutche obedience loialtie pope hathe taught towardes prince apologie cap diuision yet though al litle thei would needes haue made al realme tributarie exacted thece yeerely vniuste wrongeful tax deere coste v frendeship cittie rome wherefore haue gotten thinges v extortion theire fraude suttle sleightes see reason maie plucke awaie againe lawful way iuste meanes kinges darkenesse blindenesse former time gaue thinges theire owne accorde liberalitie religion sake beinge moued certaine opinion fained holinesse ignorance erroure spied maie kinges theire successours take awaie againe seinge haue authoritie kinges theire auncestours gifte voide excepte allowed wil geeuer cannot seme perfit wil whiche dimmed hindered erroure hardinge peterpens euer summes monie yeerely paide churche rome whiche extorcion suttil sleightes pope gotten ye slaunder freely discretely prince realmeno doubt cause hereof vvas auarice treacherie greate cause graunted thing mutche grieueth pope departure true faith churche dothe maie wel appere whiche happened queene mary raigne whiche time although pope acknowledged yet selfe neuer knowen haue demaunded peterpens yeerely paimentes againe schismes heresy healpethe nothinge answeare hainous crime apostasie liberalitie countrie see rome whiche mother al vveaste churchesthe pope exaction hath ben smal comparison certaine realmes honoure realme might seme finde selfe greued therewith yet ye sette gnatte elephante make greate adoo litle realme mutche enriched retaininge smal summe pope dishonored vndiscrete talke saueringe altogeather miserie niggardnes ye shoulde haue shewed better stuffe leaste thende booke laste acte fable rule poeterie shoulde beste ye haue done like foolishe poete making ende badde pope seeketh monie seketh seeketh safetie soulesbut remember olde verse curia romana non captat oue sine lana seeketh like good shepherde howe reduce streied shepe englande vnto folde christes churche god graunte maie see good intente happely acheued b sarisburie pope hathe enriched selfe gotten treasure world owne handes fraude guile saie onely free liberalitie kinges august de verbis domini secundum matth sermo prince yet augustine saithe non possumus dicere nemo no inuasores arguit violetiae nullus accusat quasi non maiorem interdum praedam viduabus blandimenta cliciant quam tormenta nec interest apud deum vtrum vi circumuentione quis re alienas occupet dummodo quoquo pacto teneat alienum wee cannot saie man chargeth v extorsion noman accuseth v violence oftentimes poore widowes man maie geate flatterie rackinge difference god whether man holde mannes goodes open violence guile thinge holdeth owne maie learninge hardinge called liberalitie prince liberal free bestowing tel v al temporal goodes vvorlde pope prince prince hath nothinge fauoure sufferance pope doctours wordes thesearchidiacon de haeresi ver et quia tanta fo matthae citatur felino de offic potest iudicis delega ex parte iohan de parisijs de potestat regia papali papa est dominus omnium temporalium secundum illud dictum petri dabo tibi omnia regna mundi pope lorde al temporal goodes accordinge saieinge peter peter neuer spake woordes diuel wil geue thee al kingdomes world doctours saithe thus dicunt quod solus papa est verus dominus temporalium ita quod potest auferre ab alio quod alias suum est sed praelati caeteri principe non sunt domini sed tutores procuratores dispensatores thei saie pope onely lorde temporal thinges maie take man prelate prince thei ouerseers fermours stewardes wordly thinges lordes matthias parisiensis saithe pope innocentius called kinge iohn kinge england vasallum suum saie feede man tenante meaning thereby realme england vvas pope kinges al true king england graunting thing pope counted liberalmatthias parisien iohanne verily easy kind liberalitie man geue thing owne pope yee saie setteth al reuenewes englande elephante gnat therefore whole time queene marie neuer demaunded v manner yeerely paimente wee must beare erroure herein hardinge yee neuer pope collectoure therefore mutche acquainted bookes otherwise yee might haue remebred cardinal poole pope onely legate messenger pope thousande poundes paide yeerely one bishoprike englande towardes prouision kitchin yee might haue remembred al bishoppes englande paide pope vvhole firste fruites al theire liuinges whiche common estimation amounted sommewhat gnatte although neuer neither skilful curious pope collection yet wel discouerie greate vntruthe also better satisfaction reader haue thought good briefely waie touche maie founde olde recordes good credite touchinge firste therefore archebishop canturburie paide vnto pope annates firste fruites euery vacation tenne thousande florenes bisides fiue thousande florenes vse right palle archebishop yorke paide likewise firste fruites tenne thousande florenes thought fiue thousand florenes palle bishop elie paide firste fruites seuen thousand florenes bishop london paide first fruites three thousande florenes bishop wincester paide first fruites xij thousande florenes bishop exceter paide firste fruites six thousande florenes bishop lincolne paide firste fruites fiue thousande florenes bishop lichefielde couentrie paide firste fruites three thousande florenes bishop herforde paide first fruites one thousande eight hundred florenes bishop sarisburie paide first fruites foure thousande fiue hundred florenes reaste eche man accordingly rate noted florene italian crowne valewe four shillinges six pense sterlinge thus mutche haue noted onely example discreete reader maie easily gheasse exaction paimentes bishoppes whole value pope firste fruites throughout europelegatio adriant papae excusae vvittenbergae finde one recorde although vnperfite lacketh sundrie great knowe notable bishoprikes durham carlile worcester norvviche bathe chichester whiche many moe archebishoprikes bishoprikes wel within dominion kinges englande also sundrie christian kingedomes country leafte vnreckened ariseth summe twoo thousande thousande foure hundred three scoare thousande eight hundred fouretie three florenes notwithstandinge yee make pope bigge elephante yet h reckeninges ouer huge reasonable proportion resembled gnatte leaue yeerely perquisite ye pope made election preuentions dispensation plurality trialities torquottes toleration bulles ale signature eatinge fleash egges white meate priestes concubine like marchandise knowe summe whereof withstandinge amounteth niene hundred thousand florenes smoke farthinges peter pense make reckeninge vile contemptuous reporte whereof ye shewe self onely ignorante vnskilful yee write argueth somme folie also iniurious vnto countrie reade matthias parisiensis yee shal find bothe tyrannie treacherie also mass intolerable summes monie pope minister haue caried realme popeanno saith beinge diseased vvith spiritual dropsie saie vnquencheable thirst monie shooke al priestes purse spoiled abbies al theire treasure againe anno pope made decree rome goodes monies al bishoppes priestes decessed within englande shoulde taken vse pope gaue straite commaundemente bishoppes england eodem anno al personnes vicares beinge resident vpon theire benefice shoulde paie yeerely vnto thirde parte al valewes theire saide benefice al parsonnes vicares beinge residente shoulde paie vnto yeerely one fusse halfe parte theire benefice al paiementes continewe duringe space three whole yeeres whiche amounteth least summe hundred three scoare x thousand poundes bishoppes england anno great forceable intreatie agreed togeather geue pope contribution eleuen thousande markes time poore prior wincester forced paie yeerely three hundred anno eodem threescoare fiue markes towardes furniture pope table pope made straite decreeeodem anno al bishoppes electe immediately trauaile englande rome attende vpon holinesse matthias saith vt romanorum loculos impregnaret ruinam regni angliae stuffe romaine purse decaie kingedome englande pope tenthes al spiritual liuinges englandematthae vvestmonasteriensis anno anno duringe space tenne whole yeeres rustandus pope legate exacted intolerable great paimentes cleregie englande synode holden london matthias saith per scripta papae plenum iniurijs iniquitate quae possent patientissimum cor virulenter sauciare al authorite pope letter ful iniurie iniquitie whiche hable moste cruellie wounde harte neuer patiente bishoppes london vvorcester answeared pope legate thei would rather lese theire liues woulde geeue theire consente open iniurie seruitude intolerable oppression churche kinge entred obligation paie vnto pope tvvoo hundred thousande markes bisides fiftie thousande pounde sterlinge paiement whereof bishop herforde beinge pope agente bounde bishoppes englande thei ware sutche like pretie gnattes pope straine kinges prince wil geue leaue ioh innes sarisburiensisiohan sarisburien li ca otherwise called rupertus carnotensis familiare talke pope adriane saide thus vnto ipse romanus pontifex omnibus fere est intolerabils lae atur spolijs ecclesiarum quaestum omnem reputat pietatem prouinciarum diripit spolia acsi thesauros croesi studeat reparare pope nowe becomme vntolerable almoste al worlde reioiseth ye spoile church al manner gaine counteth holinesse maketh sutche hauocke kingedomes prouinceslib cap acsi mittaturab inferis tesiphone vel megera anno anno intended repaire againe croesus treasurie againe legate rage rampe monie ye infernal fury sent fro helle goe libertie shal wee neede many wordes ambition auarice haue bottome matthias parisiensis saith romana curia omnia possunt pecuniae monie maie doo al thinges courte rome calleth vnsatiable prollinges pope quotidianas extorsiones daily extorsions againe saith king englande vpon friuolous fonde mater made true paiemente vnto pope alexander fourth quod est horribile cogitatu bonner praefatione libe l stephani gardineri de vera obedien anno niene hundred fiftie thousande markes vvhiche thing saith horrible abominable thought shorte yee maie better viewe bignesse quantitie gnatte doctoure boner hereof writeth thus pope praie englande greate came mutche almoste reuenewes crowne therefore matthias saithe imperator reprehendit regem angliae quod permitteret terram suam tam impudenter per papam depauperari emperour frendely reproued henry kinge englande suffered kingdome impudently compouerisshed pope againe saith king henrie third made open coplainte embassadour councel lion fraunce pope innumerable exaction likewise saith anno rex henricus repressit impetum legati propter violentiam denariorum kinge staied attemptes pope legate touchinge intolerable greedinesse prollinge monie yee see therefore harding neither gnatte litle scorneful comparison greate dishonoure noble realme yee woulde seeme make griefe complainte thereof newe yee beare v hande vvilihelmus malmesburien anno kinge canutus kinge englande almoste six hundred yeeres agoe beinge rome wrote home archebishoppes bishoppes state realme wise conquestus sum item coram domino papa mihi valde displicere dixi quod mei archiepiscopi tantum angariabatur immensitate pecuniarum quae ab eis expetebatur c also haue made complaint vnto pope told match sliketh mee archebishoppes shoulde vexed sutche vnreasonable summes monie required likewise matthias parisiensis writeth king vvilliam conquerouranno concipiens indignationem contra papam allegauit quod nullus archiepiscopus vel episcopus de regno suo ad curiam romanam vel ad papam haberet respectum kinge vvilliam vpon displeasure conceiued againste pope said archebishop bishop realme shoulde thencefoorth haue regarde either courte rome pope al notwithstading yee saie pope elephant al summes comparison treasure gnatte verily al far greater reckeninges realme england wel hable defraie neither make wee accoumpte monie deceitful extorting ye monie neither dishonorable ye realme represse lewde iniurious mockery preserue subiecte open spoile kinges country haue oftentimes donne ievves frenche king whomludouicus holinesse haue made saincte hereof complaineth thus exactiones impositas per romanam curiam quibus regnum nostru miserabiliter depauperatum est leuari aut colligi nullatenus volumus exaction paimentes monie laide vpon v courte rome meane whereof realme miserably empouerished wil wise leuied geathered gaines pelferies phariseis made people greate neuerthelesse christe saide vnto themmatth vvoe vnto yee scribe phariseis rauen vp poore vvidovves house vnder pretense longe praieinge rome yee saie mother churche al vveast therefore trow wee bounde paie euer paimentes shee shal require wee allowe sutche simple reason pope likewise bounde paie churche hierusalem euer paiementes shal require hierusale deede ye mother churche onely weaste also al whole worlde howe cruel mother deuoureth vp owne child paule saithe non debent filij parentibus thesaurizare corin lib cap sed parentes filijs child ought laie vp treasure theire parentes parentes theire child iohannes sarisburiensis polycraticon saithe rom nunc non tam matrem exhibet quam nouercam rome nowe sheweth selfe mutche natural mother stepmother shee spoileth deuoureth child defender yee saie makinge ende badde hath plained parte foolishe poete hardinge wee haue good cause thinke diuinitie waxen colde seeinge thus driuen pleade poetrie maie wee beleue churche rome growen holy monie nowe becomme vileste parte al plaie certainely pope lose monie al plaiers wil soone sit colde felin de offic et potest iudicis delegati ex parte one owne doctours saithe thus cessante talus redditu qui maximus est attenta hodierna tyrannide sedes apostolica contemneretur rente simonie whiche greate staide consideringe tyrannie prince novve apostolike see rome vvoulde despised whiche woordes thus mutche also noted waie euer prince wil suffer pope take listeth muste taken iudged tyranne therefore ioannes andreae one youre greattest canonistesin sexto de elect electi potest fundamenta gloss saithe thus rom fundata fuit praedonibus adhuc de primordijs retinet dictum rom quasi rodens manus vnde versus rom manus rodit quos rodere non valet odit firste fundation rome laide theeues hitherto shee sauoureth beginninge called rom quia rodit manus thereof commeth common verse rome bireth handes vvhom shee cannot bite shee hateth state romaine popedome spronge firste monie encreased monie standeth nowe neither truthe doctrine seueritie discipline praier holinesse ought el onely monie set monie aparte pope equal bishoppes codrus vrceus saithecodrus vrceus sermon pontifex maximus si non virtute tamen pecunia pope greatteste bishop although vertue yet leaste monie therefore wee maie saie pope cicero ad attic lib diphilus sommetime saide pompeius nostra miseria magnus e baptista mantuanus speakinge state rome saith thus venalia nobis templa secerdotes altaria sacrum corona ignis thura preces coelum est venale deus ue bmongeste v rome church priestes altar mass crovvnes fire incense praiers heauen set sale yee god selfe emongeste v maie monie budaeus saithe eudaeus pandectis sanctiones pontificiae non moribus regendis vsui sunt sed propemodum dixerim argentariae faciendae authoritatem videntur accommodare pope canon serue nowe guide mennes liues maie saie serue rather make banke geate monie bernarde clunice saithe thus rom dat omnibus omnia dantibusbernardus clun acen satyra omnia romae cum pretio rome geueth al thinges geue al thinges al thinges rome wil passe moniein sexto de elect electi potestat fundamenta margine euen pope decretales yee shal finde noted thus rom est caput auaritiae ideo omnia ibi venduntur rome heade al couetous treacherie therefore al thinges set sale yea thomas becket self litle yee called saincte wilful disobedience treason committed againste prince aide succoure fledde rome sawe nothinge would wrought without monie epist ad archi pi moguntinum thus wrote wrote thereof bishop menze mater rom facta est meretrix prostituta est pro mercede rome mother becomme harlot monie meede laiethe selfe sale shorte yee knowe father longe sithence woonte saie curia romana non captat ouem sine lana courte rome wil take sheepe without fliese therefore hardinge poete concluded good order went farre bisides rule monie bothe first middle laste acte al fable christe sommetime thruste sutche buiersmatth seller broker scorsers temple contrariwise yee haue receiued buiers seller thruste christe haue turned house god caue theeues paule saith thus vnto people ephesus actor argentum aurum nullius concupiui haue desired nomans gould syluer vpon whiche woordes glose noted thus per hoc lupi cognoscuntur qui talia concupiscunt hereby qu nunquam diuinatio desire sutche thinges knowen woulues hierome saithe quia prophetae pecuniam accipiebant prophetiae corum facta est diuinatio prophetes felle taking monie therefore propheste becomme soothe saieinge diuel god thus hardinge conclude euer faulte yee finde defender poetrie verily iudgement nearest frendes monie beste paare al fable recapitulation apologie thus thou seest good christian reader newe thinge though daie religion christe enterteined despite checkes lately restoared comminge vp againe anewe mutche like hath chaunced bothe christe selfe apostle yet neuerthelesse feare thou maiste suffer thee self leadde amisse seduced exclamation aduersaries wee haue declared large vnto thee whole manner religion faith god father onely sonne iesus christe holy ghoste churche sacramentes ministerie scripture ceremony euery parte christian beliefe wee haue saide wee abandon deteste plague poison al olde heresy whiche either sacred scripture anciente councelles haue vtterly condemned wee cal home againe asmutche v liethe right discipline churche whiche aduersaries haue quite brought poore weake case pounishe al licenceousnesse life vnrulinesse manner olde longe continued lawes mutche sharpenesse conueniente liethe power mainteine stil state kingedomes condition state honoure wherein found without diminishinge alteration reseruinge vnto prince maiestie worldly preeminence safe without empairinge possible power haue gotten selues awaie churche whiche made denne theeues wherein nothinge good frame like churche god owne confession erred many way euen lot time past gate sodome abraham chaidee vpon desire contention warninge god selfe haue searched holy bible sure cannot deceiue one sure fourme religion haue returned againe vnto primitiue churche anciente father apostle saie grounde beginninge thinges vnto undations headspringes christes churche truthe haue tarried mater authoritie consente tridentine councel wherein sawe nothinge donne vprightly good order also euery body sworne maintenaunce one man prince embassadours contemned one diuines coulde hearde partes takinge ambition openly earnestly procured wrought holy father former time predecessours haue commonly donne wee haue restored church prouincial conuocation haue cleane shaken duetie yoke tyrannie bishop rome wee bounde also manner thing lyke neither christe peter apostle yet like bishop al finally saie agree amogest selues touchinge whole iudgement chiefe substance christian religion one mouthe one spirite doo woorship god father lorde iesus christe wherefore christian godly reader mutche thou seeste reason cause bothe wee haue resto red religion haue foresaken menne thou oughtest marueile though haue chosen obeie maister christe rather menne paule hath geuen v warning wee suffer selues carried awaie sutche sundrie learninges flee theire company specially sutche woulde sowe debate varience cleane contrarie doctrine whiche receiued christe apostle longe sithence haue mennes craftes treachery decaied vanished fledde awaie sight light gospel euen owle doothe sonne risinge albeit trumperie builte vp reared highe skie yet euen momente selfe falleth downe againe grounde commeth naught muste thinke al thinges haue comme passe chauce aduenture hath benne god pleasure againste al mennes willes wel nigh gospel iesus christe spread abroade throughout whole worlde day therefore menne folowinge goddes commaundemente haue theire owne free wil resorted vnto doctrine iesus christe partes truely wee haue sought hereby neither glorie wealthe pleasure ease plentie al thinges aduersaries wee theire side enioied sutche worldly commodity mutche liberally bountifully wee doo neither doo wee esche concorde peace haue peace man wee wil warre god name peace sweete pleasante thinge saith hilarius yet beware saithe peace one thinge bondage shoulde seeke haue christe shoulde commaunded keepe silence truthe gospel shoulde betraied horrible errours shoulde cloked christian mennes eies shoulde bleared might suffred conspire openly againste god peace vngodly couenaunt seruitude peace saithe nazianzene vnprofitable againe discorde saithe profitable muste conditionally desire peace far lawful godmatth far maie conueniently otherwise christe selfe brought peace worlde swerde wherefore pope wil haue v reconciled duetie first reconciled god thence saithe cyprian springe schismes sectes bicause menne seeke heade haue recourse fountaine scripture keepe rule geuen heauenly teacher saithe peace vvarre neither ioined vnto churche vvhiche seuered gospel menne thei vse make marchendise name peace peace whiche aine would haue onely reast idle belly wee might easily brought atonemente touchinge al mater ambition gluttonie excesse doothe let hence commeth theire whyninge theire harte halfepennie doubte theire clamour stirres none ende mainteine shamefully naughtily il gotten goodes nowe day pardoner complaine v dataries pope collectours1 tim bawdes others whiche thinke gaine godlinesse serue iesus christe theire owne belly many daie agoe olde worlde woonderful greate aduantage grewe hereby kinde people recken al loste vnto christe gaineth pope selfe maketh greate complaint present charitie people waxen colde trow yee forsoothe bicause profites decaie cause dooth hale v hatred al euer maie laieinge lode vpon v despiteful railinges condemning v heretiques ende vnderstand meter maie thinke woorse menne vpon earthe wee notwithstanding meane season neuer ashamed al neither ought ashamed gospel sette glorie god wee doo estimation menne wee sure al true wee teache wee maie either goe againste owne conscience beare witnesse againste god denie parte gospel iesus christe menne side wil denie v father wil stil offended cannot endure christes doctrine sutche saie wee blinde leader blinde truthe neuerthelesse muste preached preferred aboue al wee muste patience waite goddes iudgemente let folke meane time take good heede thei doo let wel aduised theire owne saluation cease hate persecute gospel sonne god feare lest feele redresser reuenger owne cause god wil suffer selfe made mockinge stocke world espieth good agoe adooinge abroade flame keapte downe mutche greater force strengthe doothe breake flie abroade vnfaithfulnesse shal disapointe goddes faithful promisse shal refuse laie awaie theire hardenesse hart receiue gospel christe shal publicanes sinner goe kingedome heauen god father lorde iesus christe open eies al maie hable see blessed hope whereunto thei haue benne called maie altogeather one glorifie alone true god also iesus christe sente downe v heauen vnto father holy ghoste geeuen al honoure glorie euerlastingly finis maister hardinge appeareth hardinge yee haue lately sente v ouer specially vnpleasante verdure speache late replie hath sommewhat disordered quiete minde vvhiche thinge notwithstandinge mighte easily haue gheassed vnlikely comme passe specially beinge vtterly vnskilful affection yet neuer sought write thinge pourpose iustely mighte offende righte cause defence truthe euermore foreprised euen nowe righte soary see vnhable maister passion vnaduisedly make open vnto many greeue respecte credite haue thus discouered errours faulte mine yee made errours knowen shoulde neuer parte haue benne discouered knewe soary behalfe yee would impatientely offended misliketh haue alleged many doctours councelles saie haue ambitiously painted margine many authority bothe greeke latine yet parte haue spared ouer bisides twoo tongue painte margine surcharge woordes hebrewe bisides sutche rankes englishe scholies many thicke close togeather harde mater force one woorde truthe stande emongest courteous dealinge hardinge reproue others commonly doo selfe number doctours haue offended doo marueile cowardely chalenger woulde alwaies wisshe defendente comme vnarmed vnto fighte alleged either doctours al nothinge pourpose woonte commonly doo yee would haue borne greate deale better authority doctours councelles neuer many yet haue vsed fewe yenough whole number good skil three partes leafte vntouched deede wiseste waie child cannot reade thinke beste skippe ouer vvhereas examine laie abroade al partes branch argumentes shewe directly yee growe conclusion reader maie see weapon yee seeke maister saie kinde scoffinge yee telle racke alter abuse argumentes plaie shadowes mine owne hardinge yee wil haue argumentes passe smoothely without controlment learne hencefoorthe make better yee ouer tender yee looke speake yee liste yet heare nothinge likinge sende abroade sutche simple ware serue people yet maie suffer noman telle verily yee saie haue pourpose changed argumentes yee make otherwise haue made hauinge alwaies eie vnto conclusion yee shalbe forced make woorse touchinge scoffes wherewith yee finde selfe mutche agreeued doubtelesse grace maie wel appeare throughout al bookes might soone deserue called scoffer vvhere yee saie felowes haue espied thousande fowle greate lie writinges one benne greate father lie ye coulde neuer haue hitte readily vpon number sutche auditoure trowelaurent surius carthusian praefatione nauclerum founde v oute eleuen thousande lie sleidans storie multitude hereof hugenesse heape wraieth wel stomake indifferent iudgemente decaieth credite reckeninge man maie reasonably thinke possible finde twoo hundred fiftie vntruthes booke mine finde thousande verily neuer minded defende thinge euer writinges shalbe founde amisse see viewe accomptes harde mater eies finde vntruthes gospel euer saie neuer true yet like taste lie vvhatsoeuer allege translate corrupted euil lucke touche nothinge either mutche litle shorte longe blacke white one waie standeth awry hardinge reioinder fol b translate nonnulli sacerdotes sundrie priestes yee crie oute corrupter falsarie shoulde haue saide certaine priestes somme priestes shoulde wise haue saide sundrie translate nonlatin alphabet vna nutritos fedde togeather yee telle worlde falsehedde fowle corruption thus yee saie shoulde haue translated hardinge reioinder fol b eodem cibo alitos fedde vvith one kinde meate nonlatin alphabet greeke vna latine relation place deale herein frendes hardinge maie greeke reader wil allow sutch translation happen saie hard saithe thing vvee receiue sacramente breade hard reioind fol b yee crie alarma looke yee saie booke reader ievvel vntrue man taken vvith lie marke vvel saie breade saie breade breade yee saie breade yee saie many mile distance bitweene sutche like shameful vntruthes horrible lie felowes greate seekinge diligence haue espied thus man happen vse ensis gladius nam enim que et yee thinke cause sufficiente make tragedie doubte replie beinge longe ful necessarie allegation yee maie happen finde somme ouer sightes greatter importance acknowledginge refourminge yee shal finde sharpe eger selfe fewe example haue touched waie mighte appeare howe inquisitiue fierce yee seeke occasion reader maie see yee hunte wantonly renne riote open oftetimes without cause yet notwithstandinge yee telle v sadly manner iewel bringeth triflinge obiections trasshe pelfe nothinge pourpose without learninge without reason without witte racketh stretcheth wringeth wreasteth nippeth clippeth doctours councelles woordes whereby yee thought yee mighte beste vtter preaty fansies yee crie oute false partes false reportes false dealinges false marchantes false ballance false dise al false yee saie loe sir defender yee vvrangle yee trifle yee taken tardee yee haue proued nothinge yee haue nothinge ansvveare yee thus saie saie boldely shalbe sufficiente al safe frendes wil thinke yee haue saide sommewhat yee woulde neuer haue framed sutche countenance saie nothinge yee telle v ful often wee bishoppes trowe wee haue sworne obedience pope therefore yee geeue worlde vnderstande wee consecrate minister wee holde synodes canne
